197 
FXUS64 KMRX 312030
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EST WED DEC 31 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MID LEVEL MOISTURE HAS 
REMAINED ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA LONGER THAN EXPECTED. HOWEVER...CURRENT
VIS SAT DOES SHOW CLOUDS STARTING TO THIN. CLOUDS SHOULD CONTINUE TO
SLOWLY THIN INTO EARLY EVENING WHERE CLEAR SKIES WILL EVENTUALLY
TAKE OVER TONIGHT. CLEARING SKIES WILL ALLOW FOR A COLD NIGHT WITH
LOWS ANYWHERE FROM 6 TO 8 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL.
GENERALLY...TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER TEENS TO LOW AND MID 20S ARE
EXPECTED. TOMORROW STARTS OUT AS A NICE DAY BUT CLOUDS WILL ONCE
AGAIN BE ON THE INCREASE BY MID TO LATE AFTERNOON. LOOK FOR CLOUDS
TO SLOWLY INCREASE FROM SW TO NE AS THE DAY PROGRESSES AS OUR NEXT
WEATHER SYSTEM APPROACHES.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...RAINY WEEKEND 
STILL ON TAP AS A PROLONGED SW TAP OUT OF THE GULF WILL KEEP 
MOISTURE FLOW OVER AREA FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY. PEAK PRECIP PERIODS 
LOOK TO BE SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT IN WHICH THE HEAVIEST RAIN 
WILL FALL. ROUGHLY ONE TO ONE-AND-A-HALF INCHES OF RAIN WILL FALL 
THROUGH THE ENTIRE EVENT. 

AT THE ONSET THOUGH...LATE THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY MORNING...THERE MAY 
BE SOME TIME WHEN FREEZING RAIN OR SLEET WILL TEMPORARILY 
OCCUR...BUT WE WILL FIND OURSELVES IN A WARMING ENVIRONMENT OVERALL 
BEGINNING ON FRIDAY...THUS ACCUMULATIONS OF ANY ICE SHOULD BE LIGHT 
AND TEMPORARY.
 
A WEAK DISTURBANCE MID WEEK WILL BRING A FEW SNOW SHOWERS TO THE 
NORTHERN VALLEY AND MOUNTAINS. BELOW NORMAL TEMPS WILL DOMINATE THE 
LATTER PORTION OF THE EXTENDED...MON-WED.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

665 
FXUS64 KMRX 310808
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 AM EST WED DEC 31 2014

.SHORT TERM...TODAY AND TONIGHT...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WAS
CENTERED OVER NW MISSOURI/NE NEBRASKA. LIGHT NORTH TO NORTHEASTERLY
WINDS AND COLD TEMPERATURES NOTED EARLY THIS MORNING. 

A WEAK TROUGH WILL TRANSLATE ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES BY TONIGHT
HELPING KEEP THE COLD AIR IN THE REGION THROUGH TONIGHT. IN THE
MEANTIME...MID AND HIGH LEVEL VARIABLE CLOUDINESS WILL OCCUR THIS
MORNING AND BECOME MORE OPAQUE BY AFTERNOON. NEEDLESS TO SAY IT
WILL BE FILTERED SUNSHINE. DAYTIME HIGH TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE NEAR
40-45 DEGREES...RATHER COOL WHEN COMPARED TO PAST SEVERAL DAYS.

OVERNIGHT THE THIN CLOUDS WILL GIVE WAY TO MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS.
GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING EXPECTED TO DROP TEMPERATURES INTO THE
TEENS AND LOWER 20S FOR MOST LOCATIONS IN E TN...SW VA AND SW NC.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MAIN WEATHER OF INTEREST IS 
THURSDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING...WITH MODELS TRENDING 
TOWARD LESS LIKELY CHANCES OF FREEZING RAIN. THE NAM MOS POPS ARE 
HIGHER THAN GFS...BUT NAM ISENTROPIC LIFT FOR LATE THURSDAY NIGHT IS 
MORE FOCUSED TO OUR W AND SW THROUGH 12Z FRIDAY. NAM MODEL FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS ALSO SHOW A SUFFICIENT WARM NOSE ABOVE THE SURFACE TO 
INHIBIT WINTRY MIX FOR SMOKIES...AND FINALLY QPF FROM EVEN THE SREF 
AND/OR ENSEMBLES IS BARELY 0.01 OF AN INCH. 

MODEL CONSENSUS IS SUGGESTING NO PRECIPITATION ANYWHERE NORTH OF I-
40 UNTIL AROUND 15Z FRIDAY. MIN TEMPS MAY STILL DIP BELOW 32 DEGREES 
OVER NE TN AND SW VA...SO KEPT IN A BRIEF MENTION OF POSSIBLE ZR- IN 
THOSE AREAS THRU 15Z FRIDAY.

OTHERWISE...WETTEST PERIODS STILL LOOK TO BE FRIDAY NIGHT AND 
SATURDAY WITH A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS ON SATURDAY FOR ALL BUT NE 
TN AND SW VA. NUDGED POPS UP TO CATEGORICAL ACROSS THE BOARD BY 
SATURDAY. 

NO CHANGES MADE FOR SUNDAY-TUESDAY...AS FLOW BECOMES MORE ZONAL 
ACROSS THE NATION WITH LARGE SURFACE RIDGE BUILDING E AND SE FROM 
THE PLAINS STATES. DRIER LOOKING ECMWF DURING THIS PERIOD WAS 
FAVORED. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

105 
FXUS64 KMRX 302011
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 PM EST TUE DEC 30 2014

.SHORT TERM... (TODAY THROUGH TOMORROW NIGHT) CLOUDS ARE STUBBORN TO 
GET OUT OF THE AREA TODAY WHICH HAS LED TO TEMPS NOT BEING AS HIGH 
AS PREVIOUSLY FORECASTED. STILL THINK THAT THE CLOUDS SHOULD STILL 
CONTINUE TO SLOWLY MOVE OUT THIS EVENING AND TONIGHT. WITH THESE 
CLOUDS STICKING AROUND MOISTURE IS STILL PRESENT WHICH IS LEADING TO 
VERY ISOLATED LOCATIONS OF LIGHT RAIN ALONG AND NEAR THE EASTERN 
BORDER. OTHERWISE NOT EXPECTING MUCH IN THE WAY OF WEATHER AS WE 
MOVE TOWARDS MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES FOR TOMORROW.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...WEAK RIDGING SURFACE 
AND ALOFT WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY WILL GIVE WAY TO INCREASING 
SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT AS AN UPPER TROUGH OVER SOUTHWEST UNITED STATES 
BEGINS TO EJECT EAST INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. BY LATE THURSDAY 
NIGHT AND FRIDAY...CLOUDS WILL INCREASE AND ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL 
SPREAD PRECIPITATION INTO MAINLY THE SOUTHERN HALF OF TENNESSEE AND 
SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. SURFACE TEMPERATURES MAY BE COLD ENOUGH TO 
BEGIN THE PRECIPITATION AS LIGHT FREEZING RAIN. WILL NEED TO WATCH 
THIS DEVELOP FOR POSSIBLE DRIVING PROBLEMS.

SOUTHWEST UPPER TROUGH LIFTS EAST NORTHEAST AND PHASES WITH A 
NORTHERN STREAM SHORT-WAVE ACROSS THE MID-WEST/GREAT LAKES AREA. 
STRONG CYCLO-GENESIS DEVELOPS OVER THE GREAT LAKES WITH ASSOCIATED 
FRONTAL PASSAGE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY SATURDAY/SATURDAY 
EVENING. THE STRENGTHENING BOUNDARY LAYER JET ASSOCIATED WITH 
CYCLOGENESIS MAY PRODUCE STRONG/GUSTS WINDS OVER THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS SATURDAY. A BAND OF RAIN IS ANTICIPATED SATURDAY/SATURDAY 
NIGHT. LATEST FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW LIMITED INSTABILITY ALOFT...
SO WILL KEEP THUNDER OUT OF THE FORECAST.

FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY...FLOW BECOMES MORE ZONAL (WEST-NORTHWEST 
FLOW) ACROSS THE NATION WITH LARGE SURFACE RIDGE BUILDING INTO THE 
NATION. BESIDES SOME SHOWERS OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE EARLY SUNDAY...A RETURN OF MOSTLY DRY CONDITIONS 
ANTICIPATED THROUGH THE REST OF THE FORECAST.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

332 
FXUS64 KMRX 300848
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
348 AM EST TUE DEC 30 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LAST AREA OF LIGHT RAIN OR
DRIZZLE LINGERS OVER MAINLY NE TN AND SW VA THIS MORNING. TEMPS
HAVE CHILLED ENOUGH FOR PATCHY LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES OVER WISE AND
RUSSELL COUNTIES IN SW VA. HOWEVER...LOOKING AT FORECAST SOUNDINGS
FOR THE NRN AND SMOKY MTNS OF EAST TN...APPEARS THE MOISTURE IS TOO
SHALLOW FOR ANY SIGNIFICANT SNOW IN THOSE AREAS.

NORTHERLY FLOW IN THE LOWER LEVELS SHOULD LEAD TO DECREASING CLOUDS
WITH NAM MODEL SHOWING A STEADY DECREASE IN RH IN THE 900 TO 800
MB LAYER TODAY. ZONAL FLOW ALOFT MAY BRING SOME PATCHY MID AND HIGH
CLOUDS BACK INTO THE REGION TONIGHT.

FOR TEMPS...EVEN WITH BREAKS OF SUNSHINE THE COLD AIR ADVECTION
SHOULD KEEP MAXES A FEW DEGREES BELOW CLIMO...AND IN LINE WITH GFS
MOS. LIGHT NORTH WINDS TONIGHT COULD AFFECT MINS MORE SO THAN THE
FEW PASSING MID-HI CLOUDS...CLOSE TO A MOS BLEND LOOKED GOOD.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
CONTINUE TO BUILD ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY THROUGH THURSDAY UNDER 
ZONAL FLOW. COLD AND MOSTLY CLEAR NIGHTS WITH COOL DAYTIME 
TEMPERATURES CAN BE EXPECTED. 

THE NEXT SYSTEM TO AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA WILL DIG INTO THE FOUR 
CORNERS BY THURSDAY. RETURN SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL COMMENCE OVER THE SE 
U.S. BY THURSDAY NIGHT. PRECIPITATION WILL SPREAD NORTHEAST AND INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA BY FRIDAY. THE TROUGH AND THE ASSOCIATED COLD 
FRONT WILL TAKE ITS TIME MOVING EAST...THUS THE FIRST HALF OF THE 
WEEKEND WILL LIKELY BE WET WITH DIMINISHING RAIN CHANCES BY SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURE PROFILES INDICATE A SMALL WINDOW OF SNOW 
AND/OR ICE PELLETS THURSDAY NIGHT AND EARLY FRIDAY MORNING. HOWEVER 
THE SURGE OF LOW LEVEL WARM AIR MAY OVERCOME THE COOL AIR. THIS WILL 
BE SOMETHING TO KEEP AN EYE ON THE NEXT FEW DAYS. SATURDAY AND 
SATURDAY NIGHT THERE MAY BE A RUMBLE OF THUNDER WITH SOME OF THE 
HEAVIER SHOWERS. COOLER AND DRIER AIR WILL FILTER IN SUNDAY AND 
SUNDAY NIGHT WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR THE BEGINNING OF THE FIRST FULL 
WEEK OF THE NEW YEAR.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             49  28  44  28 /  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  44  27  40  26 /  20  10  10  10

478 
FXUS64 KMRX 292021
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
321 PM EST MON DEC 29 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TOMORROW NIGHT)... THICK CLOUDS UP TO
AROUND 700MB ARE STICKING AROUND THE AREA AND I EXPECT THEM TO
CONTINUE TO REMAIN SO THROUGH THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. OUR TEMPS TODAY
HAVE NOT CHANGED MUCH FROM THE OVERNIGHT LOW TEMPS THIS MORNING,
ONLY A HANDFUL OF DEGREES IN MOST SPOTS. THERE IS A CHANCE FOR SOME
FOG OVERNIGHT, BUT AT THIS TIME DON'T THINK IT WILL BE AS BAD AS
LAST NIGHT SINCE THE NORTH WINDS WE'VE SEEN ALL DAY SHOULD CONTINUE
INTO THE OVERNIGHT HOURS AND ADVECT IN SOME LOWER DEWPOINTS. THIS
COMBINED WITH THE FACT THAT CLOUDS SHOULD STICK AROUND OVERNIGHT
MEANS THAT HOPEFULLY TEMPS WON'T DROP DOWN AND MEET DEW POINTS
OVERNIGHT. TOMORROW SOME PLACES SHOULD FINALLY SEE SUNSHINE AS THE
LAST BIT OF MOISTURE MOVES OUT OF THE AREA AND WE START TO CLEAR
OUT FROM WEST TO EAST. STILL A CHANCE THAT REMNANT MOISTURE COULD
CAUSE SOME LIGHT RAIN AND VERY LIGHT SNOW IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS
BEFORE IT MOVES OUT, BUT NOT EXPECTING MUCH, IF ANY,IN THE WAY OF
ACCUMULATIONS.


.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...WANTED A NICE 
WEEKEND COMING UP? NOT IN LUCK AGAIN. NEXT WEATHER MAKER WILL MOVE 
INTO AREA LATE THURSDAY NIGHT...AND BRING GOOD CHANCES OF 
PRECIPITATION...MOSTLY RAIN...FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. 
IN FACT...EXPECT LIKELY POPS FRI NIGHT THROUGH SAT NIGHT. NOTE THAT 
SUBFREEZING TEMPERATURES FRIDAY MORNING MAY LET THE ONSET OF LIGHT 
PRECIP BEGIN A LITTLE ON THE WINTRY SIDE... BUT I REPEAT IT SHOULD 
BE LIGHT ON INTENSITY. TEMPS WILL WARM ABOVE FREEZING MOSTLY BY LATE 
MORNING FRI AND SWITCH OVER TO RAIN. LINGERING PRECIP ON SUNDAY 
TAPERS OFF FOR MONDAY WITH ONLY SLIGHT CHANCES IN SW VA...THEN NO 
PRECIP MONDAY NIGHT.

ACROSS EXTREME EASTERN PARTS OF NE TN AND SW VA TUESDAY
MORNING...OTHERWISE DRY AND COLD AIR MASS FROM THE NORTHERN ROCKIES
AND PLAINS TO MOVE SOUTHEAST INTO THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE DAY
TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. SKIES WILL BEGIN CLEARING BY EARLY
TUESDAY FROM THE SOUTHWEST AND BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR TUESDAY EVENING.
TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR AVERAGE TUESDAY. BUT TUESDAY AND
WEDNESDAY NIGHTS AS WELL AS WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY DAYS WILL BE BE
BELOW NORMAL AS COLD ARCTIC AIR MASS MOVES INTO THE REGION FROM THE
NW. MODELS STILL NOT SURE ON TIMING WITH NEXT SYSTEM. GFS AND
CANADIAN WANTS TO BRING MOISTURE IN LATE THURSDAY NIGHT WITH ECMWF
SLOWING SYSTEM TO MOISTEN ATMOSPHERE FRIDAY. SOME SNOW OR LIGHT
FREEZING RAIN COULD AFFECT THE AREA LATE THURSDAY NIGHT OR EARLY
FRIDAY. THE SLOWER ECMWF WOULD LIKELY START PRECIPITATION LATER
FRIDAY WHICH WOULD LIKELY ALLOW ENOUGH WARMING FOR IT TO BEGIN AS
RAIN. STRONG SW FLOW TO GET GOING FRIDAY OR FRIDAY NIGHT AS LOW
PRESSURE FROM THE TX GULF COAST MOVES NE TOWARDS THE TN VALLEY.
MOISTURE MOVING OVER THE FRONT WILL KEEP CLOUDS AND RAIN OVER THE
TN VALLEY SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY AS THE FRONT MOVES SLOWLY EAST
ACROSS THE SE STATES. TEMPERATURES STAY COOL FRIDAY AS SKIES BECOME
CLOUDY AND THEN WARM INTO THE 50S FOR THE WEEKEND AS WARMER AIR
MOVES UP FROM THE GULF COAST WITH THE FRONT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 PM EST SUN DEC 28 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...WEAK COLD FRONT ALONG CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE AREA THIS EVENING AND 
THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS OVERNIGHT. AREA OF RAIN HAS WAINED 
ACROSS THE AREA AS MID LEVEL SPEED MAX HAS MOVED OFF TO THE NE. 
ENTRANCE REGION OF UPPER LEVEL JET WILL KEEP RAIN GOING BEHIND COLD 
FRONT THROUGH TONIGHT. PRECIPITATION WILL WEAKEN SOME OVERNIGHT. 
POST FRONTAL COLD AIR VERY SHALLOW. BOUNDARY LAYER WILL REMAIN 
SATURATED THROUGH MONDAY MORNING. AREAS OF FOG WILL CONTINUE 
OVERNIGHT AND COULD BECOME DENSE WITH WEAK SURFACE FLOW. MID LEVEL 
DRIES OUT ON MONDAY WHILE LOW LEVELS REMAIN VERY HUMID. LIGHT RAIN 
OR DRIZZLE POSSIBLE INTO THE AFTERNOON HOURS. TEMPERATURES WILL 
REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL. 
 
.LONG TERM... SHOULD BE SOME REMNANT MOISTURE IN THE AREA OVERNIGHT 
MONDAY INTO TUESDAY AS SOME UPPER LEVEL ENERGY MOVES ACROSS NORTH OF 
THE AREA THAT COULD LEAD TO SOME ADDITIONAL LIGHT SHOWERS. WITH THE 
SECONDARY COLD FRONT TEMPS WILL DEFINITELY COOL DOWN ACROSS THE 
AREA. AFTER THE FRONT IS THROUGH THE AREA WE DRY OUT FOR A COUPLE OF 
DAYS WITH VERY LITTLE WARMING THROUGH THE END OF THE WORK WEEK. 

NEXT SYSTEM TO FOCUS ON WILL COME AFTER NEW YEARS DAY AS A LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES ACROSS NEW MEXICO BEFORE THE MODELS START TO 
DIVERGE IN WHAT TO DO WITH THE SYSTEM. GFS WANTS TO KICK OUT THE 
SYSTEM AS THE TROUGH GOES NEGATIVELY TILTED WEST OF US LEADING TO 
WARMER TEMPS AND A LATER ONSET OF PRECIP. WHILE THE ECMWF WANTS TO 
BE MUCH SLOWER AND FURTHER SOUTH WITH THE SYSTEM, HAVING THE CENTER 
OF THE LOW MOVE JUST NORTH OF THE AREA. TEMPS WILL BE COLD ENOUGH 
OVERNIGHT FRIDAY THAT THE SYSTEM COULD HAVE SOME SNOW MIXED IN WITH 
IT AS WELL. OF NOTE TO WATCH WITH THIS SYSTEM WILL BE A LOW LEVEL 
JET FROM THE SOUTH/SOUTHWEST ON FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY WHICH WILL 
BRING IN A VERY WARM LAYER OF AIR JUST ABOVE THE SURFACE. RIGHT NOW 
ALL THE MODELS AND GUIDANCE ARE COMING IN WITH TEMPS ABOVE FREEZING 
OVERNIGHT FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY...HOWEVER IF SYSTEM COMES IN STRONGER 
THAN ANTICIPATED, LEADING TO COLDER SURFACE TEMPS, AND THE LOW LEVEL 
JET IS STILL CRANKING, CAUSING A VERY WARM LAYER ABOVE THE SURFACE, 
THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME FREEZING RAIN WILL BE PRESENT. AT THIS POINT 
WILL NOT MENTION ANYTHING ABOUT FREEZING RAIN IN THE FORECAST AS ALL 
GUIDANCE IS SUGGESTING IT WON'T HAPPEN, BUT WILL HAVE TO KEEP THIS 
IN THE BACK OF OUR MINDS.

MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. WILL CONTINUE CURRENT FORECAST TREND
FOLLOWING THE DRIER GFS AND STILL HAVE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS EASTERN
SECTIONS THROUGH MONDAY EVENING. AIR MASS BEHIND THE INITIAL FRONT
TODAY IS NOT THAT COLD SO HIGHS MONDAY TO BE IN THE 50S. MONDAY
NIGHT AND TUESDAY SECONDARY FRONT WITH COLDER AIR MASS MOVES IN
WITH A CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE IN THE SW VA MOUNTAINS...BUT
MOSTLY RAIN SHOWERS ELSEWHERE. LARGE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE WITH COLD
AIR MASS OVER SOUTHERN CANADA AND THE NORTHERN PLAINS WILL MOVE IN
TUESDAY WITH SKIES CLEARING. SKIES WILL STAY MOSTLY CLEAR THROUGH
AT LEAST WEDNESDAY NIGHT OR THURSDAY. AN UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE
SYSTEM IN THE WEST DEEPENS AND LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS OVER TX
THURSDAY. THIS SYSTEM WILL INCREASE MOISTURE OVER THE MS VALLEY AND
SPREAD CLOUDS INTO THE TN VALLEY THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY.
PRECIPITATION SHOULD BEGIN THURSDAY NIGHT AS SNOW BUT THEN CHANGE
TO RAIN FRIDAY AS TEMPERATURES WARM. RAIN WILL CONTINUE THROUGH
SATURDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 272011
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST SAT DEC 27 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...LOW LEVEL RIDGE AXIS 
EXTENDS WEST INTO E TN VALLEY THIS EVENING. RELATIVELY DRY LOWER 
LAYERS HOLDING ON THIS AFTERNOON. PROLONGED AND GOOD ISENTROPIC IN 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT WILL ERODE LOWER DRY LAYER THIS EVENING. 
WIDESPREAD RAIN WILL OVERTAKE THE AREA AND CONTINUE THROUGH SUNDAY 
NIGHT. WARM CLOUD LAYER BECOMES VERY DEEP. PWAT VALUES RISE ABOVE 
1.00 TO NEAR 1.35 WHICH IS 2 STANDARD DEVIATIONS ABOVE NORMAL FOR 
THIS TIME OF YEAR. RAINFALL AMOUNTS THROUGH MONDAY MORNING WILL 
RANGE FROM NEAR ONE INCH IN THE NORTH TO NEAR TWO AND ONE HALF 
INCHES IN THE SOUTH. RAINFALL RATES WILL BECOME MODERATE AT TIMES 
BUT RATES SHOULD BE LIGHT ENOUGH TO AVOID AREAL FLOODING. LOCALIZED 
MINOR FLOODING IS POSSIBLE...ESPECIALLY ACROSS WESTERN AND SOUTHERN 
AREAS. WINDS WILL BE LIGHT IN ADVANCE OF APPROACHING COLD FRONT. 
COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON FOLLOWED BY UPPER 
SPEED MAX AXIS SUNDAY NIGHT WHICH WILL KEEP SOME POST FRONTAL 
PRECIPITATION GOING OVERNIGHT. TEMPERATURES WILL BE RELATIVELY MILD 
BUFFERED BY CLOUDS AND RAIN.  
 

.LONG TERM...MOST OF THE HEAVIEST PRECIP SHOULD BE OUT OF THE AREA 
BY MONDAY EVENING INTO MONDAY NIGHT. ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL MOVE 
THROUGH DURING THE DAY/EVENING ON TUESDAY, COULD MAKE TEMPS A BIT 
TRICKY DEPENDING ON WHEN THE FRONT ACTUALLY MOVES THROUGH. BUT 
REGARDLESS OF WHEN IT MOVES THROUGH TEMPS ACROSS THE AREA WILL BE ON 
AVERAGE 10 DEGREES COOLER ON OVERNIGHT TUESDAY AND DURING THE DAY ON 
WEDNESDAY. IF THERE IS ENOUGH MOISTURE LEFT OVER FROM WEEKEND STORMS 
THE FRONT COULD BE STRONG ENOUGH TO TRIGGER SOME LINGERING LIGHT 
SHOWERS, AND MAYBE EVEN A FEW BRIEF LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA.

AFTER THIS SYSTEM AND THE SECONDARY COLD FRONT HAVE MOVED EAST OF 
THE AREA NEARLY ZONAL FLOW SETS UP FOR A COUPLE OF DAYS. NEXT SYSTEM 
LOOKS TO BE A UPPER LEVEL LOW MOVING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN U.S. BUT 
THE MODELS ARE NOT IN AGREEMENT AT ALL WITH THE PATH AND SPEED OF 
THIS SYSTEM. ECMWF WANTS TO BRING IT FURTHER SOUTH AND SLOW IT DOWN 
ALLOWING A GOOD PORTION OF THE ENERGY AND PRECIP TO MOVE OVER OUR 
AREA LEADING TO ANOTHER ROUND OF MULTIPLE DAYS OF STEADY MODERATE 
PRECIP. WHILE ON THE OTHER HAND THE GFS WANTS TO MOVE IT SHALLOWER 
AND FASTER THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES REGION AND LEADING TO A QUICKER 
SYSTEM THAT DOESN'T BRING AS MUCH PRECIP. IT DOES LOOK LIKE A GOOD 
PORTION OF THE AREA WILL BE COLD ENOUGH TO SEE SOME SNOW MIXED IN 
WITH THE RAIN DURING THE OVERNIGHT HOURS AS THIS SYSTEM MOVES 
THROUGH.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
407 AM EST SAT DEC 27 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SOME ENHANCED RADAR RETURNS 
PASSING NE ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA EARLY THIS MORNING...BUT TEMP DEW 
POINT TEMP DEPRESSIONS REMAIN LARGE. THUS...LOOKS SAFE TO CARRY NO 
RAIN CHANCES UNTIL LATER TODAY FOR MAINLY THE WRN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. ISENTROPIC LIFT ON THE 295K LEVEL DOES REACH NE TN BY 
21Z TO 00Z...BUT MOS POPS ARE VERY LOW FOR NE TN AND SW VA WITH A 
FEW SPRINKLES AT BEST.

THE MID AND HIGH CLOUDS SHOULD ONLY GRADUALLY THICKEN TODAY...SO NE 
AREAS SHOULD HAVE POTENTIAL TO REACH AT LEAST A MOS BLEND. WRN AREAS 
STARTING OUT QUITE MILD THIS MORNING...SO 55 TO 60 FOR MAXES LOOKS 
REASONABLE. ACTUALLY HAD TO RAISE 07Z TEMPS IN THE GRIDS BY 3 TO 7 
DEGREES ACROSS THE BOARD DUE TO THE PASSING CLOUD COVER. 

OTHERWISE...NUDGED RAIN CHANCES UP TO THE HIGHER GFS MOS POPS AND 
ADDED SOME MODERATE RAINS FOR LATER TONIGHT. GFS MOS MINS WERE 
FAVORED OVER THE NAM MINS.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...STEADY RAIN SUNDAY AS COLD
FRONT APPROACHES FROM THE WEST AND SOUTHWEST. ONLY EXPECT ABOUT A
10 DEGREE RISE FROM MORNING LOWS. RAINFALL AMOUNTS COULD REACH
ABOUT ONE INCH FOR THE 24 HOUR PERIOD ENDING MONDAY MORNING AT 12Z.
ISOLATED LOCATIONS IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY...PLATEAU AND MOUNTAINS
COULD HAVE OVER 2 INCHES IN THE 48 HOUR PERIOD WHICH COULD CAUSE
ISOLATED FLOODING. COLD FRONT SHOULD BE EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA
BY SUNDAY EVENING. NAM IS FASTER WITH ENDING PRECIPITATION BUT GFS
AND ECMWF KEEP SOME WRAPAROUND PRECIPITATION BEHIND THE FRONT
MONDAY. GFS HAS SECONDARY LOW MOVE NE ALONG FRONT MONDAY WHICH
SLOWS IT DOWN. POPS MONDAY HOWEVER WILL BE LOWER THAN GUIDANCE
MAINLY IN THE LOW CHANCE TO SLIGHT CHANCE RANGE DECREASING TO A
SLIGHT CHANCE MONDAY NIGHT. DRIER AIR MASS MOVES IN TUESDAY WITH
HIGH PRESSURE. WEAK DRY COLD FRONT WEDNESDAY SHIFTS UPPER FLOW TO
NW AND COLDER TEMPERATURES. HIGHER PRESSURE SHIFTS EAST THURSDAY
NIGHT WITH MOISTURE RAPIDLY INCREASING FROM THE WEST. PRECIPITATION
TO MOVE IN OVERNIGHT AND INCREASE FRIDAY. THE PRECIPITATION WILL
LIKELY MIX WITH SNOW UNTIL TEMPERATURES WARM ENOUGH FRIDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EST FRI DEC 26 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
REMAIN OVER THE AREA TONIGHT THEN SLIDE EAST AND WEAKEN ON SATURDAY. 
HIGH CLOUDS WILL STREAM NORTHEAST ACROSS THE REGION TONIGHT. CLOUD 
DECKS WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE AND LOWER ON SATURDAY. ISENTROPIC 
LIFT INCREASES INTO THE AFTERNOON HOURS. LOWER LAYERS REMAIN FAIRLY 
DRY EARLY. LIGHT RAIN WILL EVENTUALLY WORK DOWN TO THE SURFACE 
ACROSS SW AREAS BY THE AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES WILL BE ABOVE 
NORMAL...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NE WHERE EVAPORATIVE COOLING WILL BE 
LIMITED. 

.LONG TERM...RAIN WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE IN FROM THE WEST AND SOUTH 
SATURDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT. STILL A VERY OUTSIDE CHANCE 
FOR A RUMBLE OF THUNDER NEAR CHATTANOOGA, BUT THINK THAT MOST, IF 
NOT ALL OF IT, SHOULD REMAIN CONFINED TO NEAR THE GULF OF MEXICO, 
AND AWAY FROM US SO WILL NOT MENTION IT IN THE FORECAST. RAIN SHOULD 
CONTINUE PRETTY STEADILY THROUGH EARLY MONDAY. GFS IS STILL AN 
OUTLIER AT THIS POINT AS IT PUSHES THE MOISTURE SOUTH OF THE AREA 
AND CLEARS OUT PRECIP MUCH FASTER THAN SOME OF THE OTHER MODELS. 
THINK THAT IT IS A LITTLE TOO AGGRESSIVE WITH THIS SLOW MOVING FRONT 
SO HAVE TRENDED TOWARDS THE WETTER EURO/CANADIAN/NAM. AS THE SYSTEM 
EXITS THERE IS A CHANCE FOR SOME VERY LIGHT SNOW IN THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS IN THE NORTH, AND AT THIS TIME LOOKS LIKE ACCUMULATIONS 
WILL BE VERY MINIMAL.

AS SOON AS THIS SYSTEM LEAVES A COLD FRONT WILL BE KNOCKING ON THE 
DOOR WHICH SHOULD MOVE THROUGH THE AREA ON TUESDAY AND CAUSE HIGHS 
TO BE ABOUT 10 DEGREES COOLER. AFTER THAT NEARLY ZONAL FLOW SETS UP 
UNTIL A UPPER LEVEL LOW WANTS TO KICK OUT WEST OF THE AREA. 
TIMING/STRENGTH/LOCATION IS STILL DIFFICULT TO PIN DOWN AT THE TIME, 
BUT WITH TEMPS STILL COLD AFTER THE FRONT ON TUESDAY MORE OF THE 
AREA COULD SEE SOME SNOW WITH THIS SYSTEM AS IT MOVES THROUGH.

AND TN VALLEYS SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY. THE FRONT IS FAIRLY SLOW 
WITH SURFACE LOW MOVING UP ALONG IT ON SUNDAY. BEST INSTABILITY 
STAYS SOUTH OF TN SUNDAY SO THINK THUNDER CHANCES TOO LOW TO MENTION 
SOUTH. STILL GOING WITH NAM/ECMWF HAVING A TRAILING LOW FROM THE SW 
RIDE UP ALONG THE FRONT LATE SUNDAY INTO MONDAY WITH RAIN 
CONTINUEING THROUGH MONDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE MILD SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY IN THE MID 50S TO LOWER 60S AND 50S TO NEAR 60 SUNDAY. A 
COOLING TREND THEN MONDAY INTO TUESDAY BEHIND COLD FRONT. AS 
PRECIPITATION MOVES OUT MONDAY EVENING IN THE NORTHEAST THERE COULD 
BE A LITTLE SNOW MIXED IN BUT AMOUNTS WILL NOT BE SIGNIFICANT. AIR 
MASSS DRIES OUT AS HIGH PRESSURE AND WEST TO EAST FLOW TAKES OVER 
TUESDAY. TUESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY WEDNESDAY A WEAK FRONT PASSES 
THROUGH BRINGING IN MUCH COLDER AIR MASS AS FLOW SWITCHES TO THE NW. 
HIGHS WILL BE BELOW NORMAL WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY IN THE UPPER 30S 
TO MID 40S WITH LOWS IN THE 20S.

OVERNIGHT SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY. CAN'T RULE OUT THE POSSIBILITY OF 
SOME LIGHTNING IN THE FAR SOUTHWEST, BUT AT THIS TIME THINK THE 
CHANCE IS LOW AND NO SEVERE WEATHER IS EXPECTED. MODELS REALLY START 
TO DIVERGE AT THIS POINT WITH WHAT TO DO WITH THE TAIL END OF THE 
SYSTEM. THE GFS WANTS TO CUT OFF THE MOISTURE OVERNIGHT LATE SUNDAY, 
WHILE THE GFS/CANADIAN/AND LIKELY NAM WANT TO KEEP THE MOISTURE AND 
PRECIPITATION AROUND THROUGH MONDAY EVENING. HAVE TRENDED TOWARDS 
THE MAJORITY HERE AND KEPT AT LEAST CHANCE POPS THROUGH MONDAY 
EVENING ACROSS THE AREA.

AFTER THAT NEARLY ZONAL FLOW SETS UP LEADING TO HIGHS IN THE 40'S 
AND LOWS IN THE 30'S TO UPPER 20'S. THEN LOOKS LIKE THE NEXT BEST 
CHANCE OF PRECIP COMES JUST BEYOND THE 7 DAY FORECAST AS A LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM STARTS TO MAKE ITS WAY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN U.S.

WILL EVENTUALLY SEE SKIES CLEARING FROM SOUTH TO NORTH DURING THE

DOMINATE THROUGH THE REST OF THE PERIOD FOR A QUIET AND BENIGN 
WEATHER PATTERN. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE IN 
CONTROL TO START. SHOULD BE DRY FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. BY SATURDAY 
THE NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES.  MODELS INDICATE A FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL 
MOVE INTO THE REGION AND WILL HANG AROUND THROUGH MONDAY.  A WEAK 
WAVE OF LOW PRESSURE MAY MOVE ALONG THE BOUNDARY SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
MONDAY.  WILL SEE RAIN MOVE INTO THE AREA SATURDAY...AND SHOULD 
CONTINUE TO SEE SOME RAIN AT TIMES THROUGH MONDAY.  IT SHOULD BE 
WARM ENOUGH FOR ALL THIS PRECIP TO BE LIQUID.  UNCERTAINTY HIGHER 
FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...GIVEN MODEL CONSISTENCY PROBLEMS.  
HOWEVER...IT APPEARS BEST MODEL SUPPORT IS FOR SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
EXTENDING INTO THE AREA ALONG WITH DRIER AIR...SO WILL GO WITH A  
PRECIP FREE FORECAST FOR TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
236 PM EST WED DEC 24 2014

.SHORT TERM (CHRISTMAS EVE NIGHT AND CHRISTMAS)...STRENGTHENING SW 
TO NE JET CORE IN ADVANCE OF APPROACHING UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE 
THROUGH E TN VALLEY THIS EVENING. SURFACE COLD FRONT CLOSELY 
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FEATURE. SCATTERED AND WEAKENING RAIN SHOWERS 
WILL MOVE THIS EVENING. WEST WINDS WILL BECOME BREEZY THIS EVENING 
BEHIND THE FRONT. LIGHT POST FRONTAL SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE OVERNIGHT 
ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS OF MRX CWA. SOME UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE 
LATE TONIGHT WITH LIMITED MOISTURE. LOW LEVEL CAP WILL KEEP CLOUD 
COVER IN PLACE OVERNIGHT. CLOUDS WILL BE SLOW TO ERODE FROM THE SW 
ON CHRISTMAS DAY. POST FRONTAL TEMPERATURE ADVECTION NOT VERY 
STRONG. 

.LONG TERM (CHRISTMAS NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...NEXT RAIN CHANCES 
MOVE IN THIS WEEKEND...WITH THE BEST POPS AND AMOUNTS EXPECTED ON 
SUNDAY. WE WILL REMAIN BENEATH A DISTURBED AND FAIRLY MOIST 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT...RESULTING IN CHANCE OR SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. MEANWHILE...COLDER AIR WILL SLOWLY SAG 
INTO AREA FROM NORTH SUCH THAT BY TUESDAY WE WILL START SEEING RAIN 
OR SNOW MIXES TUESDAY MORNING OVER THE NORTHERNMOST SECTIONS OF CWA 
AND THE MOUNTAINS...WITH COVERAGE OF SNOW EXPANDING FURTHER SOUTH BY 
WEDNESDAY MORNING TO COVER MUCH OF AREA. SAME FOR WED NIGHT. THIS 
PRECIP IS NOT EXPECTED TO BE OF NOTEWORTHY INTENSITY AT THIS 
TIME...AS POPS WILL BE ON THE ORDER OF 20-30 PCT...BUT INTERMITTENT 
LIGHT SNOWS MAY FLUTTER IN THE AIR FOR MUCH OF THE TUES-MORNING-TO-
WED-NIGHT TIME FRAME.

FORTUNATELY NONE OF THE PRECIP IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD LOOKS TO BE 
HEAVY AT THIS TIME...MAYBE AVERAGING HALF AN INCH ON SUNDAY...SO THE 
RIVERS ELEVATED BY LAST NIGHT/S RAIN SHOULD HAVE A STRETCH OF TIME 
TO RECEDE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 AM EST WED DEC 24 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WINDS HAVE DIMINISHED OVER THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS TONIGHT BUT STILL SEE A FEW GUSTS INTO THE 30 TO 
35 MPH RANGE SO WILL KEEP THE ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR NOW.  WINDS ARE 
ONCE AGAIN EXPECTED TO INCREASE THIS AFTERNOON AS A COLD FRONT MOVES 
THROUGH THE AREA.  WINDS MAY INCREASE TO NEAR BORDERLINE WIND 
ADVISORY LEVELS BUT EXPECT THEY WILL REMAIN BELOW CRITERIA...SO FOR 
NOW... WILL NOT ISSUE AN ADDITIONAL ADVISORY FOR THE AFTERNOON BUT 
WILL MONITOR CONDITIONS THROUGHOUT THE MORNING.  OTHERWISE...THE 
MAIN BAND OF RAIN HAS MOVED OUT OF THE AREA BUT WILL CONTINUE TO SEE 
SCATTERED SHOWERS DEVELOP AND MOVE THROUGH...ESPECIALLY DURING THE 
MORNING HOURS.  WILL THEREFORE KEEP POPS AT LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL 
FOR THE MORNING...AND LOWING POPS THROUGH THE DAY.  THE COLD FRONT 
WILL MOVE THROUGH MID DAY.  TONIGHT...AN UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE IN 
BEHIND THE EXITING FRONT.  THIS WILL BRING IN COOLER AIR AS WELL AS 
BRIEF UPSLOPE CONDITIONS.  ISOLATED SHOWERS WILL LINGER OVER THE 
REGION...ESPECIALLY OVER NORTHERN LOCATIONS.  ANY RESIDUAL SHOWERS 
WILL TRANSITION TO LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES.  THE NORTHERN VALLEY MAY 
SEE A FEW FLURRIES BY SUNRISE CHRISTMAS MORNING BUT NO ACCUMULATIONS 
ARE EXPECTED.  NORTHWEST FACING SLOPES OF THE APPALACHIANS COULD SEE 
MINOR SNOWFALL OF LESS THAN AN INCH. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...THERE MAY BE A FEW LINGERING 
SNOW SHOWERS OR RAIN SHOWERS SW VA AND NORTHEAST/CENTRAL MOUNTAINS 
EARLY THURSDAY...BUT UPPER RIDGING AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILD 
IN QUICKLY AND BRIEF SHOT OF COLD ADVECTION ENDS SO ANY PRECIP 
SHOULD DISSIPATE IN THE MORNING. CLOUDS MAY BE A BIT SLOWER TO CLEAR 
HOWEVER. SHOULD BE DRY THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...THEN 
MOISTURE IS FORECAST TO BEGIN INCREASING BY SATURDAY. MODELS NOT IN 
GREAT AGREEMENT ON THE DETAILS FOR THE LATTER PART OF THE PERIOD SO 
FORECAST CONFIDENCE NOT OVERLY HIGH. THERE IS FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT 
THAT THE WEEKEND WILL BE WET AS BROAD UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES AND 
FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL BE IN THE VICINITY.  APPEARS THIS PRECIP WILL BE 
ALL LIQUID.  ONCE THE COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH MONDAY...COLDER AIR 
IS FORECAST TO MOVE IN WHICH COULD ALLOW FOR RAIN SHOWERS TO MIX 
WITH OR CHANGE TO SNOW SHOWERS MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
338 PM EST TUE DEC 23 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...MAIN EVENT TONIGHT WITH A
LITTLE BIT OF EVERYTHING...BREEZY WINDS...THUNDERSTORMS...PSBL
LOCALLY HEAVY RAIN. NEAR 100 PCT CHANCE OF RAIN TONIGHT...THEN RAIN
ENDING FROM WEST TO EAST DURING THE DAY WEDNESDAY. NOT EXPECTING
FLOODING BUT ISOLATED FLASH FLOODING OR SMALL STREAM ADVISORY TYPE
OCCURRENCES UNDER LOCALIZED TRAINING OF RAINFALL. NOT EXPECTING
CONDITIONS TO BE FAVORABLE FOR MOUNTAIN WAVE WINDS...BUT STILL WILL
HAVE BREEZY CONDITIONS OF 15-25 MPH IN THE MOUNTAINS TONIGHT AND
WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE WEDNESDAY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...AT THE BEGINNING OF 
THIS PERIOD...THE COLD FRONT HAS JUST CLEARED THE AREA...AND THE 
UPPER TROUGH IS PASSING THROUGH THE AREA.  BY CHRISTMAS MORNING AT 
12Z...THE UPPER TROUGH HAS PASSED...AND RATHER THAN A SUPPORTING 
CLIPPER AS SO OFTEN HAPPENS...A SHORTWAVE RIDGE STARTS TO BUILD 
QUICKLY DURING THE DAY.  SO THINK THAT THE POST-FRONTAL INSTABILITY 
AND PRECIP WILL BE VERY LIMITED...WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO CHRISTMAS 
DAY.  WITH THAT BEING SAID...IT LOOKS LIKE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL 
BE TRAPPED FOR MUCH OF CHRISTMAS DAY...SO PLANNING TO GO ABOVE 
GUIDANCE ON SKY COVER.  NOT PLANNING TO BRING DOWN MAX TEMPS VERY 
MUCH...AS CLEARING IS POSSIBLE LATE IN THE DAY...BUT WILL DELAY 
WARMUP IN HOURLY TEMPERATURES.  

ALONG WITH THE QUICK RIDGING...MOISTURE SURGES BACK TOWARD THE AREA 
BY SATURDAY AND IT LOOKS LIKE WE WILL HAVE SOME POPS ACROSS AT LEAST 
PARTS OF THE AREA THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST...AS THE 
RIDGE MAINTAINS THIS PATTERN THROUGH MONDAY...THEN LIFT FROM THE 
NEXT APPROACHING TROUGH KEEPS ELEVATES POPS AGAIN.  THIS PRECIP 
LOOKS MOSTLY LIQUID...BUT POST-FRONTAL TEMPS TOWARD THE END OF THE 
FORECAST TREND TOWARD A MIX OF LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS FROM A CLIPPER.

&&

623 AM EST TUE DEC 23 2014

.AVIATION...A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL MOVE IN FROM THE SOUTHWEST.
SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL BE AROUND...THEN MORE WIDESPREAD RAIN
WILL MOVE IN FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST DURING THE
AFTERNOON/EVENING AND CONTINUE OVERNIGHT. ENOUGH ELEVATED
INSTABILITY THAT THERE COULD BE SOME RUMBLES OF THUNDER ESPECIALLY
SOUTH...BUT GIVEN TIMING UNCERTAINTIES WILL LEAVE OUT FOR NOW. LOW
LEVEL JET WILL BE FAIRLY STRONG...BUT STILL LOOKS BORDERLINE FOR
ANY LOW LEVEL WIND SHEAR SO NO MENTION IN TAFS AT THIS POINT. WILL
FORECAST CONDITIONS AS LOW AS IFR AT CHA AND TYS...MVFR AT TRI.

287 
FXUS64 KMRX 230751
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 AM EST TUE DEC 23 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL TRACK 
OUT OF THE WESTERN GULF TOWARD OUR AREA AS AN AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH 
DIGS INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND MISSISSIPPI VALLEY DURING THE 
SHORT TERM PERIOD.  STRONG SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL JET WILL FEED PLENTY 
OF MOISTURE INTO THE REGION...AND LIFT WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE FROM 
SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING.  MODELS INDICATE 
THERE WILL BE SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY...SO WILL MENTION THUNDER 
FOR SOUTH AND INTO CENTRAL AREAS. WILL CARRY CAT POPS BOTH TODAY AND 
TONIGHT. RAIN MAY BE HEAVY AT TIMES ESPECIALLY SOUTH...BUT WITH 6 
AND 12 HOUR FFG VALUES GENERALLY CLOSE TO OR HIGHER THAN 3 INCHES NO 
FLOOD WATCH APPEARS WARRANTED AT THIS TIME.  OTHER CONCERN IS WIND 
IN THE MOUNTAINS AND FOOTHILLS.  DEPTH OF STABLE LAYER LOOKS TOO 
SHALLOW TO FAVOR MOUNTAIN WAVES...AND WIND DIRECTION IS MARGINAL.  
MAY AT LEAST SEE WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA MET TONIGHT...BUT CONFIDENCE 
STILL NOT HIGH ENOUGH TO ISSUE SECOND PERIOD ADVISORY SO WILL 
MENTION IN HWO FOR NOW.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...A COLD FRONT WILL BE MOVING 
THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION DURING THE FIRST HALF OF 
WEDNESDAY.  ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND SUFFICIENT LIFT WILL 
PROVIDE LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS EARLY IN THE DAY.  ADDITIONALLY 
...WITH WEAK INSTABILITY DEVELOPING OVER PORTIONS OF THE 
AREA...MAINLY OVER SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL LOCATIONS...A STAY RUMBLE OF 
THUNDER IS POSSIBLE.  PRECIP WILL DECREASE FROM SOUTHWEST TO 
NORTHEAST LATE IN THE DAY.  WEDNESDAY NIGHT...A BRIEF BREAK IN 
PRECIP IS EXPECTED BEHIND THE FRONT AND AHEAD OF THE UPPER LOW AND 
ASSOCIATED WRAP AROUND MOISTURE MOVING IN.  HOWEVER...TIMING OF THIS 
IS DIFFICULT AND WILL ONLY LOWER POPS TO REFLECT THIS.  
OTHERWISE...COLDER AIR WILL MOVE IN BEHIND THE FRONT AND WRAP AROUND 
PRECIP WILL TRANSITION TO LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES ESPECIALLY OVER 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND FAVORED NORTHWEST FACING SLOPES WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT.  A FEW SHOWERS WILL LINGER OVER FAR NORTHWESTERN LOCATIONS 
INTO THURSDAY.  OVER THE REST OF THE AREA...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL BUILD IN AND WILL CONTROL AREA WEATHER THROUGH FRIDAY.  MODEL 
CONSISTENCY REMAINS POOR DURING THE LATTER PART OF THE EXTENDED.  
OVERALL...WILL MOVE INTO AN UNSETTLE WEATHER PATTERN WITH A FRONT 
PUSHING THROUGH AROUND THE SATURDAY TIME FRAME AND AN WET SHORT WAVE 
MOVING IN FROM THE SOUTH LATE SUNDAY INTO MONDAY


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             56  53  62  37 / 100 100  70  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  59  51  63  36 / 100 100  80  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       58  50  62  36 / 100 100  80  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              61  48  63  35 /  90 100  90  40

.AVIATION...

JUST RAIN AT THAT POINT. OVERNIGHT COULD SEE SOME FOG AND LOW
CLOUDS OVER THE AREA AS THE UPPER LEVEL STORM SYSTEM MOVES CLOSER
TO THE AREA. SHOULD SEE A BIT OF A BREAK FROM RAIN CHANCES TOMORROW
BEFORE MORE RAIN INVADES THE AREA NEAR THE END OF THE TAF CYCLE.

422 
FXUS64 KMRX 222024
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 PM EST MON DEC 22 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...INCREASING LOW-LEVEL JET
ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY IN RESPONSE TO AN UPPER WAVE MOVING
ACROSS THE AREA WILL ENHANCE THE ISENTROPIC LIFT. INCREASING
DYNAMICS IS ALREADY INCREASING CONVECTION OVER THE PLATEAU AND
ALABAMA. FORECAST SOUNDING SHOWS ELEVATED INSTABILITY...SO HAVE
INCLUDED THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE AREA.

PLENTY OF LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE PULLING INTO THE SOUTHERN VALLEY WILL
ALSO PRODUCE EXTENSIVE FOG AND DRIZZLE OVERNIGHT ACROSS THE CHA
AREA.

FOR TUESDAY...DOWNSLOPING WINDS WILL HELP CLEAR OUT THE CLOUDS OVER
THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE VALLEY WHILE THE SOUTHERN HALF STAYS
WITHIN LOW-CLOUDS AND MORNING FOG/DRIZZLE.

A STRONG JET OVER THE OHIO VALLEY AND JET ASSOCIATED WITH INCOMING
UPPER TROUGH WILL PRODUCE STRONG UPPER DIVERGENCE OVER THE AREA
LATE TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. AGAIN...GIVEN ELEVATED INSTABILITY
EXPECTED WIDE SPREAD SHOWERS AND CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. SOME OF
THE RAIN COULD BE HEAVY OVER THE AREA...ESPECIALLY PLATEAU AND
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE FOR TUESDAY NIGHT.

FOR WEDNESDAY...COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA PRODUCING
WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS. CONVECTION WILL END
FROM WEST TO EAST AS FRONTAL BOUNDARY MOVES ACROSS THE REGION.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...A BRIEF SHOT AT LIGHT 
SNOW STILL POSSIBLE LATE CHRISTMAS EVE INTO EARLY CHRISTMAS MORNING. 
NO ACCUMULATION EXPECTED EXCEPT FOR MAYBE UP TO AN INCH OR SO ACROSS 
THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS. THEN A WEEKEND SYSTEM APPROACHES THAT THE 
MODELS STILL AREN'T HANDLING WELL.

BY WEDNESDAY EVENING THE BULK OF THE PRECIPITATION WILL HAVE PASSED 
TO OUR EAST AS WE AWAIT THE PASSAGE OF THE COLD FRONT. THE GFS AND 
THE NAM BOTH SHOW A DRY SLOT BETWEEN THE FRONTAL PASSAGE AND THE 
FINAL PUSH OF PRECIP INTO THE AREA. THIS MEANS THERE WILL LIKELY BE 
A BREAK BETWEEN THE LIQUID PRECIP AND ANY SNOW THAT OCCURS. THE WRAP 
AROUND MOISTURE AND ASSOCIATED SHORTWAVE COMES IN CLOSE TO MIDNIGHT. 
AS OF NOW...IT LOOKS LIKE LOCATIONS NORTH OF 1-40 MAY BE THE ONLY 
ONES TO SEE ANY SNOW. THE LOWER ELEVATIONS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
VALLEY APPEAR TO BE TOO WARM FROM THE LATEST GUIDANCE. AREAS NORTH 
OF I-40 MAY SEE LIGHT SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS/FLURRIES AFTER MIDNIGHT 
AND INTO EARLY CHRISTMAS MORNING...THE BEST CHANCES WILL BE ACROSS 
NETN AND SWVA. PRECIP QUICKLY MOVES OFF TO THE NORTHEAST DURING THE 
MID TO LATE MORNING HOURS OF CHRISTMAS DAY AND SOME AREAS MAY EVEN 
SEE A CHANGE OVER BACK TO LIGHT RAIN/DRIZZLE BEFORE THE PRECIP 
COMPLETELY EXITS. AS THE DAY PROGRESSES THE CLOUDS SHOULD ERODE FROM 
SW TO NE...BRINING SUNSHINE TO MOST AREAS BY MID TO LATE AFTERNOON. 
WE SHOULD STAY DRY FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH MOST OF THE DAY 
FRIDAY WITH SUNSHINE BRIEFLY RETURNING.

BRING PRECIP BACK IN FRIDAY NIGHT AND KEEP IT INTO MONDAY. MODELS 
STILL DOING A VERY POOR JOB HANDLING THIS NEXT SYSTEM. THE ECMW 
LOOKS WET WITH A POTENT SHORTWAVE SWINGING THROUGH WHILE THE GFS IS 
MUCH DRIER WITH NOTHING MORE THAN A WEAK FRONT CRUISING THROUGH. 
WILL GO WITH A BLEND OF POPS BETWEEN THE GFS AND ECMW UNTIL THEY 
BETTER AGREE. DURING THIS TIME FRAME...IT MAY BE COLD ENOUGH TO SEE 
SOME LIGHT SNOW ACROSS ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             45  55  53  62 /  70  90 100  90 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  43  61  50  65 /  60  80 100 100 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       43  58  52  63 /  60  80 100  90 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              37  60  48  65 /  50  50  80 100 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

TONIGHT INCREASING ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER EAST TENNESSEE. OCCASIONAL 
SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY THUNDER AT CHA WILL INCREASE BETWEEN 22Z AND

INTENSITY OF THE CONVECTION AT TRI.

TONIGHT...BUT AT THIS POINT LOOKS BORDERLINE FOR ANY LOW LEVEL WIND

FXUS64 KMRX 221441

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
941 AM EST MON DEC 22 2014

.DISCUSSION...LARGE BREAK IN THE CLOUDS ACROSS PARTS OF NORTHEAST
TENNESSEE AND CENTRAL SECTIONS OF THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. MODELS SHOW
MORE SUNSHINE THROUGH MOST OF THE AFTERNOON...SO HAVE DECREASED
CLOUD COVER AND INCREASED MAX TEMPERATURES A DEGREE OR TWO FOR THE
REMAINDER OF THE DAY.

MODELS SHOW INCREASING BOUNDARY LAYER JET ACROSS THE TENNESSEE
VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATE TODAY AND TONIGHT. THE
INCREASED LOW-LEVEL JET WILL INCREASE THE ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE
AREA TONIGHT...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY. FORECAST
SOUNDINGS ALSO SHOW ELEVATED INSTABILITY...SO WILL LIKELY INCLUDE
THUNDER FOR AREAS ALONG AND SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40 FOR TONIGHT.

828 
FXUS64 KMRX 220900
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST MON DEC 22 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN 
TO OUR NORTHEAST...WHILE LOW PRESSURE IN THE PLAINS WILL TRACK 
TOWARD THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES. A COLD FRONT WILL BEGIN APPROACHING 
FROM THE WEST. WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT MAINLY NORTHEAST EARLY THIS 
MORNING WILL MOVE OUT.  SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL JET WILL STRENGTHEN 
TONIGHT...BRINGING INCREASING MOISTURE BUT FORCING STILL NOT 
IMPRESSIVE OVERNIGHT.  ANY MORNING LIGHT RAIN OR DRIZZLE NORTHEAST 
EXPECTED TO END. A SHOWER MAY MOVE INTO THE SOUTH THIS 
AFTERNOON...AND WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS ALL AREAS 
TONIGHT.  ALL LIQUID PRECIP IN THE SHORT TERM.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY 
LOOK REASONABLE SO WILL STAY CLOSE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...IT LOOKS LIKE IT WILL BE WET 
FOR THE FIRST COUPLE OF DAYS OF THE EXTENDED FORECAST AS THE 
ADVERTISED HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH LUMBERS SLOWLY EAST FROM 
THE PLAINS TO THE APPALACHIANS FROM 12Z TUESDAY THROUGH 12Z 
CHRISTMAS DAY. AS IT DOES SO THE UPPER SYSTEM WILL DEEPEN AS IT 
SHIFTS NORTHEAST FROM THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO THE EASTERN 
GREAT LAKES. WARM AND MOIST AIR WILL STREAM NORTH INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA AHEAD OF A FRONTAL BOUNDARY THAT WILL TAKE ITS SWEET TIME 
MAKING IT ONTO THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. SHOWERS SHOULD BE WIDESPREAD 
ACROSS THE PLATEAU THROUGH THE MORNING ON TUESDAY PROGRESSING EAST 
ACROSS MUCH OF THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA BY TUESDAY 
EVENING. STILL LOOKS LIKE THERE WILL BE AN AREA OF STRONG DOWNSLOPE 
FLOW ACROSS NORTHEAST TENNESSEE INTO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA SLOWING THE 
ONSET OF SHOWERS OR KEEPING THE CHARACTER OF RAIN RATHER SPOTTY AND 
LIGHT THROUGH MUCH OF THE DAY. IN ADDITION THE WARMING SHOULD BE 
REALIZED AT THE SURFACE WHICH SHOULD MAKE THIS LOCATION THE WARMEST 
SPOT IN THE FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY WITH HIGH TEMPERATURES IN THE 
LOW 60S. STILL LOOKS LIKE THERE COULD BE ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR THE 
DEVELOPMENT OF A FEW EMBEDDED THUNDERSTORMS IN THIS REGIME...BUT 
MAINLY LIMITED TO WESTERN AND SOUTHERN SECTIONS. THE COLD FRONT WILL 
BE A GOOD SIX HOURS SLOWER THAN PREVIOUS FORECAST THINKING WHICH 
WILL REALLY LIMIT THE POTENTIAL FOR MUCH IN THE WAY OF SNOW. THE 
RAIN SHOWERS SHOULD REALLY TAPER OFF FROM WEST TO EAST BEHIND THE 
FRONT AS THE DAY PROGRESSES ON WEDNESDAY WITH MODELS CONTINUING TO 
SHOW SUBSIDENCE ALONG WITH DECREASING DEPTH OF MOISTURE ACROSS THE 
REGION. AN AREA OF DEEPER MOISTURE SWINGS BACK EAST INTO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATER WEDNESDAY EVENING INTO CHRISTMAS MORNING 
BUT THE ARRIVAL OF THE COLDEST AIR FOR THE PRODUCTION OF SNOW WILL 
SLOWER THAN PREVIOUS MODEL DEPICTION. THEREFORE...THERE MAY BE A 
BRIEF PERIOD LATE CHRISTMAS EVE INTO EARLY CHRISTMAS MORNING WHERE 
THERE MAY BE A COUPLE FLURRIES OF SNOW IN THE GREAT VALLEY MAINLY 
NORTH OF I-40. EVEN THE HIGHER TERRAIN...ABOVE 3000 FEET...ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE MAY ONLY PICK UP AROUND 
AN INCH OF SNOW BEFORE THE SYSTEM IS ENTIRELY GONE BY ABOUT NOON ON 
CHRISTMAS DAY. WE SHOULD STAY DRY FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH MOST 
OF THE DAY FRIDAY WITH A FAIRLY DECENT CHANCE AT SEEING A LENGTHY 
PERIOD OF SUNSHINE ON FRIDAY. MODELS STILL NOT ENTIRELY ON THE SAME 
PAGE FOR THE END OF THE EXTENDED FORECAST WITH ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH 
AND COLD FRONT BRINGING A FEW MORE SHOWERS FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES MAY BE COLD ENOUGH FOR A CHANCE FOR SOME 
LIGHT SNOW...MAINLY HIGHER TERRAIN SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             53  46  56  51 /  20  50  90 100 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  54  43  59  48 /  10  30  70 100 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       55  43  57  48 /  10  30  80 100 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              52  38  60  45 /  20  20  50 100 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

056 
FXUS64 KMRX 220253
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
953 PM EST SUN DEC 21 2014

.DISCUSSION...
QUICK MINOR UPDATES TO A FEW GRIDS, BUT NOTHING MAJOR. MOST OF THE
PRECIP IS STAYING OF TO OUR SOUTH, BUT WE STILL HAVE A CHANCE TO
SEE AREAS OF DRIZZLE OVERNIGHT. HAVE ADJUSTED POPS, AND WEATHER
GRIDS TO REFLECT THIS LINE OF THINKING.

&&

921 
FXUS64 KMRX 212009
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
309 PM EST SUN DEC 21 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
THE NAM AND GFS CONTINUE TO SHOW DIFFERENT SCENARIOS FOR THE SHORT 
TERM...WITH THE GFS KEEPING MEASUREABLE PRECIP TO OUR EAST 
TONIGHT...WHILE THE NAM CONTINUES TO BE THE WETTER MODEL. HOWEVER 
THE NAM HAS BEEN TRENDING DRIER COMPARED TO YESTERDAY. IT SHOWS 
MOISTURE CONFINED TO A SHALLOW LAYER BELOW 700 MB AND ISENTROPIC 
LIFT AT THE 290-295K LEVELS...MORE OF A DRIZZLE PROFILE THAN MUCH 
MEASUREABLE RAIN. A WEAK DOWNSLOPE WIND COULD FURTHER REDUCE QPF IN 
THE TN VALLEY. THE GOING FORECAST LOOKS GOOD TO HANDLE THIS 
PATTERN...WITH CHANCE POPS EAST TAPERING TO ONLY DRIZZLE WEST...SO 
NO MAJOR CHANGES WILL BE MADE. THE ISENTROPIC LIFT SHOWN BY THE NAM 
LIFTS NORTH OF THE OUR AREA BETWEEN 12-15Z...SO WILL END ALL RAIN 
CHANCES BEFORE NOON. HOW MUCH CLOUD COVER LINGERS BEHIND IS VERY 
UNCERTAIN...BUT WILL LEAN ON THE PESSIMISTIC SIDE AND KEEP MOISTLY 
CLOUDY CONDITIONS FOR MOST OF THE DAY WITH TEMPERATURES ON THE COOL 
SIDE OF MOS GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
THE BEGINNING OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD REMAINS ACTIVE AND THEN A
QUIETER FINISH. STORMS...RAIN/WIND...AND SNOW STILL POSSIBLE. THIS
IS BECOMING A TRICKY FORECAST.
 
MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY FEATURE HEIGHTS QUICKLY BUILDING OUT AHEAD 
OF OUR IMPENDING STORM SYSTEM THAT WE HAVE BEEN DISCUSSING FOR 
A WHILE NOW. AS MENTIONED IN YESTERDAY'S DISCUSSION...THIS WILL
KEEP MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY UNSEASONABLE WARM AS DEEP SOUTHERLY
FLOW WILL BE IN PLACE. LOWS MONDAY NIGHT STILL LOOK TO BE 10 TO 12
DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. HIGHS ON TUESDAY WILL BE IN THE MID/UPPER 50S
AND NEAR 60 IN A FEW SPOTS...GENERALLY 5 TO 10 DEGREES ABOVE
NORMAL. START BRINGING IN RAIN CHANCES MONDAY NIGHT AND INCREASING
THEM THROUGH THE DAY ON TUESDAY FROM SOUTH TO NORTH. IT WILL TAKE A
WHILE FOR PORTIONS OF NEON AND SOFA TO SEE RAIN BECAUSE OF.
  
STORMS...LATE TUESDAYS AFTERNOON INTO EVENING LOOKS TRICKY TO ME 
REGARDING STORMS. THERE IS THE POTENTIAL FOR OUR EXTREME SOUTHERN 
AREAS TO SEE A FEW STRONG STORMS...IT DEPENDS ON SEVERAL FACTORS. 
HOW MUCH INFLUENCE/IMPACT WILL THE CONVECTION THAT DEVELOPS FURTHER 
SOUTH HAVE ACROSS OUR AREA...WHERE WILL THE WARM FRONT BE 
DRAPED...HOW MUCH INSTABILITY WILL THERE BE? THE CERTAINTIES 
ARE...STRONG LIFT PRESENT...HIGH SHEAR AND HELICITY VALUES AND 
PLENTY OF MOISTURE. WILL HAVE TO CONTINUE TO CLOSELY WATCH THIS TO 
SEE HOW IT FURTHER UNFOLDS. LEFT THUNDER IN FOR KNOXVILLE 
AND SOUTHWARD FOR TUESDAY AFTERNOON INTO EVENING.

FOR THE RAIN/WIND...IF THE CONVECTION TO OUR SOUTH REALLY BLOWS UP 
IT COULD LIMIT HOW MUCH PRECIP WE SEE. IT IS NOT UNCOMMON FOR STRONG 
CONVECTION TO OUR SOUTH TO INTERRUPT THE FLOW OF MOISTURE INTO OUR 
AREA. HAVING SAID THAT...I STILL THINK IT IS LIKELY WE SEE SOME 
DECENT RAINFALL ACROSS OUR SOUTHERN AREAS DUE TO THE EXISTING 
MOISTURE THAT WILL BE IN PLACE...THE PROXIMITY OF THE SURFACE LOW 
MOVING ACROSS...AND THE STRONG 850MB JET AXIS OVER OUR AREA. CURRENT 
GFS AND NAM SOUNDINGS CONTINUE TO SHOW PW VALUES RANGING FROM 1.40 
TO 1.20 INCHES FROM SOUTH TO NORTH. THIS PUTS US AT 2SD ABOVE NORMAL 
FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. I STILL DON'T THINK FLOODING WILL BE A 
CONCERN BECAUSE OF HOW QUICKLY THIS SYSTEM IS MOVING. HIGHEST 
RAINFALL AMOUNTS WILL LIKELY BE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY WITH 
AMOUNTS FROM HALF AN INCH TO ONE INCH POSSIBLE IN SOME LOCATIONS. 
GUSTY WINDS FROM 20 TO 30KTS WILL LIKELY OCCUR ACROSS THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY DUE TO THE 40 TO 
50KT 850MB JET. BREEZY CONDITIONS ACROSS THE LOWER ELEVATIONS 
EXPECTED ON WEDNESDAY AS THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH.

THE SNOW...FOR THE SNOW LOVERS IT IS NOT LOOKING TOO GOOD. FOR THE 
PAST FEW DAYS THE MODELS HAVE BEEN DELAYING THE ARRIVAL OF THE COLD 
AIR...AND THEY CONTINUE TO DO SO. THIS HAS TO DO WITH THE TRACK OF 
THE LOW. DUE TO THE DELAYED COLD AIR AND THE SPEED OF WHICH THE 
UPPER LOW RACES OFF TO THE NORTHEAST...THE SNOW POTENTIAL CONTINUES 
TO DECREASE. BY THE TIME THE COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH ON 
WEDNESDAY...CHRISTMAS EVE...IT LOOKS LIKE THERE WILL BE LITTLE 
MOISTURE LEFT. BECAUSE OF THE SPEED OF THE LOW THERE WON'T BE MUCH 
TIME TO FUNNEL WRAP AROUND MOISTURE INTO THE AREA. THOUGH THERE 
LIKELY WON'T BE ANY ACCUMULATION ACROSS LOWER ELEVATIONS...MOST 
AREAS WILL STILL PROBABLY SEE LIGHT SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS/FLURRIES 
ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH EARLY CHRISTMAS MORNING....WITH THE BEST 
CHANCES ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA. UPPER ELEVATIONS MAY STILL SEE
SOME MINOR ACCUMULATIONS OF AROUND AN INCH OR TWO.
 
MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW THIS SYSTEM QUICKLY EXITING ON 
THURSDAY...CHRISTMAS DAY...AS IT RACES OFF TO THE NORTHEAST. WE MAY 
EVEN SEE SOME SUNSHINE BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON ACROSS THE PLATEAU AND 
SOUTHERN AREAS. ANOTHER QUICK MOVING WEAKER SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH 
FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY...BUT MODELS AREN'T HANDLING IT TOO WELL. WILL 
CONTINUE WITH POPS THOUGH UNTIL THERE IS BETTER RESOLUTION. THE 
SYSTEM SHOULD BE EXITING THE AREA BY SUNDAY. 


&&

899 
FXUS64 KMRX 210906
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST SUN DEC 21 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL EXTEND 
INTO THE AREA TODAY.  EXPECT THE REMAINING CLOUD COVER TO BREAK UP 
ALLOWING DECENT AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE TODAY.  WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY 
WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION TONIGHT.  BETTER LIFT SHOULD STAY TO OUR 
SOUTH AND EAST.  MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED...AND RATHER SHALLOW...SO 
WILL JUST CARRY PATCHY DRIZZLE AND SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS FOR 
LIGHT RAIN.  THERMAL PROFILES SUGGEST ALL LIQUID PRECIP FOR TONIGHT. 
JUST MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO MAV TEMPS...INCLUDING TWEAKING MOST MIN 
TEMPS UP SLIGHTLY FOR TONIGHT GIVEN EXPECTED CLOUD COVER.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS STILL INDICATE SUNDAY 
NIGHT SHORT WAVE WILL BE IN THE PROCESS OF MOVING AWAY TO THE EAST 
ON MONDAY ALLOWING FOR A DRIER AFTERNOON WITH PERHAPS A BREAK OR TWO 
OF SUNSHINE HERE AND THERE ESPECIALLY WEST. WILL BE AWAITING THE 
STRENGTHENING MIDDLE AMERICA STORM SYSTEM MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY 
WHICH FEATURES A STRENGTHENING AND MOISTENING SOUTHERLY FLOW ACROSS 
THE EASTERN UNITED STATES. AS THIS OCCURS THE WIND FIELD WILL RAMP 
UP RATHER DECENTLY AS THE PRESSURE GRADIENT TIGHTENS. THIS 
STRENGTHENING SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL BRING A WARM FRONT ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION MONDAY NIGHT SO THERE COULD BE A FEW 
SHOWERS WITH THIS FEATURE MAINLY ACROSS WESTERN SECTIONS. THE STRONG 
WIND COMPONENT ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS WILL LEAD TO A NICE 
DOWNSLOPING PATTERN ACROSS MUCH OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...NORTHEAST 
AND PART OF CENTRAL EAST TENNESSEE WHERE THE CHANCE OF RAIN WILL BE 
LOWER DUE TO THE TYPICAL WARMING AND DRYING OF THE LOWER ATMOSPHERE 
DUE TO THE FORCED FLOW OVER THE TERRAIN. A SHARP COLD FRONT WILL 
FORM OUT ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ON TUESDAY AND THE FRONT WILL 
TAKE ITS SWEET TIME MAKING EASTWARD PROGRESS WHICH WILL KEEP THE 
FORECAST AREA IN THE SYSTEM'S WARM SECTOR TUESDAY THROUGH TUESDAY 
NIGHT. THE MODELS CONTINUE TO INDICATE SOME INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THE 
FRONT SO ADDED THE CHANCE FOR SOME THUNDERSTORMS TO FORM IN THE 
EXPECTED WIDESPREAD PATTERN OF SHOWERS AHEAD OF THE FRONT. THE FRONT 
MOVES SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TUESDAY NIGHT 
INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING AND WILL BE A LITTLE SLOWER THAN PREVIOUSLY 
EXPECTED. THEREFORE ANY TRANSITION TO SOME LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS ON THE 
BACK SIDE OF THE AMPLIFIED SYSTEM LOOKS LIKE IT WILL HOLD OFF UNTIL 
WEDNESDAY EVENING. FROM THIS VANTAGE POINT THE SNOW EVENT DOESN'T 
LOOK VERY IMPRESSIVE WITH A FEW LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES IN 
THE GREAT VALLEY WITH A LITTLE BETTER POSSIBILITY OF SNOWFALL IN THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN...MAINLY ABOVE 3000 FEET WHERE SOME MINOR 
ACCUMULATION MAY OCCUR WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THERE STILL MAY BE A FEW 
SNOW SHOWERS ONGOING THROUGH LATE MORNING ON CHRISTMAS DAY ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE BUT THE PRECIP SHOULD BE 
OVER IN THIS AREA BY EARLY AFTERNOON. AGAIN...STILL LOOKS LIKE THERE 
COULD BE SOME SUNSHINE RETURNING ACROSS WESTERN PARTS OF THE 
FORECAST AS THE DAY PROGRESSES. MODEL SOLUTIONS DIVERGE TO A CERTAIN 
DEGREE FOR THE END OF THE FORECAST ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY SO WE WILL 
HAVE TO WAIT ON FUTURE RUNS TO GET A BETTER IDEA FOR THIS PERIOD. 
FOR NOW ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH WILL BE ON THE APPROACH FRIDAY INTO 
SATURDAY WITH MOISTENING AND INCREASING LIFT WEIGHTED MORE TOWARD 
FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY AS AN ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT MOVES ACROSS 
THE REGION.

521 
FXUS64 KMRX 202022
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
322 PM EST SAT DEC 20 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...CLOUDS ARE SLOWLY ERODING
FROM THE WEST THIS AFTERNOON...AND MOST OF THE TN VALLEY SHOULD BE
CLEAR BEFORE MIDNIGHT IF THE TREND CONTINUES AND IF THE HRRR IS
ACCURATE. WITH THE EXPECTED CLEARING AND CALM WINDS...CONDITIONS
APPEAR FAVORABLE FOR FOG TONIGHT. CROSSOVER TEMPERATURES ARE
ESPECIALLY FAVORABLE NORTH...SO WILL MENTION PATCHY/AREAS OF FOG
THERE AS WELL AS SW NC. FOG SHOULD BE SLOW TO DISSIPATE DUE TO THE
LOW SUN ANGLE AND WEAK MIXING TOMORROW MORNING. THE REST OF THE DAY
SHOULD BE MOSTLY SUNNY...WITH HIGH CLOUDS INCREASING LATE IN THE
DAY.

A WEAK SHORTWAVE TROUGH IN THE SOUTHERN STREAM NOW OVER TX WILL BE 
LIFTING E-NE AND CROSSING OUR AREA SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. WITH THE 
JET POSITIONED FROM SOUTHERN AL TO THE NC COAST...THE MAJORITY OF 
LIFT AND DEEP MOISTURE APPEARS TO BE EAST OF OUR AREA. THE NAM
PULLS MORE MOISTURE INTO OUR AREA THAN THE GFS...BUT EVEN THE NAM
SHOWS THIS MOISTURE MAINLY BELOW THE -10C LEVEL...SUGGESTING THAT
DRIZZLE IS MORE LIKELY THAN MEASURABLE RAINFALL. AS A RESULT...WILL
CUT BACK POPS TO A CHANCE EAST TO NOTHING WEST...BUT MENTIONING
DRIZZLE EVERYWHERE. QPF WILL BE REDUCED AS WELL...TO NO MORE THAN A
TENTH IN THE MOUNTAINS. TEMPERATURE PROFILES IN ALL THE MODEL
SOUNDINGS INDICATE ALL LIQUID PRECIP. THE TROUGH PASSAGE SHOULD
BRING AN END TO ANY RAIN/DRIZZLE ON MONDAY AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...QUITE THE ACTIVE LONG 
TERM PERIOD WITH A HIGHLY AMPLIFIED SYSTEM COMING IN FOR CHRISTMAS THAT
WILL BRING...RAIN...MAYBE A FEW STORMS...WIND...AND PERHAPS SNOW.

MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY HEIGHTS WILL BE QUICKLY BUILDING OUT AHEAD 
OF A DEEP TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE CENTRAL U.S. AND SOUTHERN PLAINS. 
THIS WILL ALLOW FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY DAY TO BE UNSEASONABLE 
WARM. LOWS MONDAY NIGHT WILL BE 10 TO 12 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. HIGHS 
ON TUESDAY WILL BE IN THE MID TO UPPER 50S...5 TO 10 DEGREES ABOVE 
NORMAL. RAIN CHANCES INCREASE ON TUESDAY AS THIS HIGHLY AMPLIFIED 
AND DEEP TROUGH IS ON OUR DOORSTEP BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON. DID DECIDE 
TO INTRODUCE SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS FROM KNOXVILLE SOUTH 
TUESDAY AFTERNOON INTO TUESDAY NIGHT. CAPE IS VERY WEAK BUT SHEAR 
AND HELICITY ARE ROBUST...IN LARGE PART DUE TO A STRONG 850MB JET OF 
40 TO 50 KTS THAT WILL BE IN PLACE. BETTER INSTABILITY EXISTS 
FURTHER TO OUR SOUTH AND SOUTHWEST BUT DID WANT TO MENTION A STORM 
OR TWO POSSIBLE ACROSS OUR CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN AREAS. ABUNDANT 
MOISTURE AND STRONG LIFT WILL LEAD TO SOME DECENT RAINFALL ACROSS 
THE AREA FOR TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY...MORE SO ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN AREAS. CURRENT GFS SOUNDINGS SHOW PW VALUES RANGING FROM 
1.40 TO 1.20 INCHES FROM SOUTH TO NORTH. THIS PUTS US AT 2SD ABOVE 
NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. I DON'T THINK FLOODING WILL BE A 
CONCERN THOUGH BECAUSE OF HOW QUICKLY THIS SYSTEM IS MOVING. SO NOW 
THAT WE HAVE TALKED ABOUT RAIN AND STORMS...LET'S TALK ABOUT SNOW.

CHRISTMAS EVE IS LOOKING TO BE RATHER NASTY WITH THE DEEP TROUGH AND 
ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW MOVING ACROSS. LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN 
CONTINUES WEDNESDAY MORNING WITH STRONG COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH BY 
LATE AFTERNOON INTO EARLY EVENING. AS THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH EXPECT 
RAIN TO CHANGE TO SNOW ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA ALONG WITH BREEZY 
WINDS. THE MILLION DOLLAR QUESTION IS HOW MUCH MOISTURE WILL BE 
LEFT. MODELS HAVE BEEN CONSISTENT IN SHOWING THE HIGHLY AMPLIFIED 
SYSTEM FOR SEVERAL DAYS OUT BUT HAVE NOT BEEN WITH THE EXACT 
PLACEMENT OF THE LOW. THE LATEST FEW MODEL RUNS OF THE ECMW AND THE 
GFS ARE TRENDING THE LOW FURTHER TO OUR WEST. THIS MEANS THAT THE 
BULK OF THE MOISTURE WILL HAVE PASSED OFF TO OUR EAST BEFORE IT GETS 
COLD ENOUGH TO SNOW BACK BEHIND THE COLD FRONT. IT LOOKS LIKE OUR 
SNOW WILL BE IN THE FORM OF WRAP AROUND MOISTURE. THE CHANGEOVER TO 
SNOW LOOKS TO OCCUR SOMETIME ON WEDNESDAY EVENING WITH SNOW 
LINGERING THROUGH EARLY CHRISTMAS MORNING. MOST OF THE PRECIP DURING 
THIS TIME FRAME SHOULD BE IN THE FORM OF SCATTERED LIGHT SNOW 
SHOWERS. LITTLE TO NO ACCUMULATION EXPECTED AT THIS TIME FOR LOWER 
ELEVATIONS. HIGHER ELEVATIONS MAY GET AN INCH OR TWO. AGAIN...ALL OF 
THE ABOVE DEPENDS ON THE TRACK OF THE LOW...BUT THIS IS HOW IT'S 
LOOKING FOR NOW.

THIS SYSTEM QUICKLY EXITS ON THURSDAY...CHRISTMAS DAY...AS IT RACES 
OFF TO THE NORTHEAST. ANOTHER QUICK MOVING WEAKER SYSTEM MOVES 
THROUGH ON FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY THAT COULD BRING SOME LIGHT SHOWERS 
TO THE AREA.
 



&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             33  53  41  56 /   0  10  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  31  50  38  55 /   0  10  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       30  50  38  55 /   0   0  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              30  48  35  51 /   0  10  30  40

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1007 AM EST SAT DEC 20 2014

.DISCUSSION...
CLOUDS APPEAR TO BE HOLDING ON TIGHTER THAN EXPECTED SO FAR...AND
THE BACK EDGE OF THE CLOUDS IN THE PLATEAU IS MAKING VERY LITTLE
EASTWARD PROGRESS. TO SEE MUCH SUN TODAY...WE WILL NEED THE CLOUDS
TO MIX OUT. WITH NO STRONG INVERSION SEEN IN THE 12Z AREA SOUNDINGS
OR THE LATEST RAP...CLOUD DISSIPATION APPEARS LIKELY WITH SOME
MIXING THIS AFTERNOON...BUT IT MAY BE SLOW AS LOW LEVEL WINDS ARE
WEAK. WILL UPDATE TO SLOW DOWN THE RATE OF CLEARING...BUT WILL
CONTINUE TO HAVE SOME CLEARING BY LATE AFTERNOON...MAINLY WEST.
TEMPERATURES MAY NEED TO BE LOWERED SLIGHTLY IN THE NORTH TO
ACCOUNT FOR THE CLOUD COVER.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EST SAT DEC 20 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHORT WAVE ENERGY MOVING ACROSS 
THE AREA WILL EXIT EARLY TODAY.  ONLY SOME LIGHT RETURNS ON RADAR SO 
FAR...AND MUCH OF THAT NOT REACHING THE GROUND.  WILL CARRY SOME 
SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS ALL BUT SOUTHWEST/WEST ZONES EARLY 
TODAY FOR SOME LIGHT RAIN/SNOW...BUT LOOKS LIKE PRECIP AMOUNTS WILL 
BE QUITE LIGHT.  SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN FROM THE 
NORTHWEST AND NORTH LATER TODAY AND TONIGHT...ALONG WITH SOME 
DRYING. EXPECT CLOUDS TO DECREASE...ALTHOUGH CONFLICTING SIGNALS IN 
THE SHORT RANGE MODELS AND WEAK FLOW LEAD TO LOWER THAN NORMAL 
CONFIDENCE IN SKY FORECAST FOR THE SHORT TERM. JUST SOME MOSTLY 
MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO MAV TEMPS...MOSTLY TO TWEAK DOWN SOME HIGHS AND 
TWEAK UP SOME LOWS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...SUNDAY STARTS OUT DRY WITH SOME 
RIDGING ALTHOUGH ANOTHER WEAK SHORT WAVE WILL BE SWINGING NORTHEAST 
OUT OF THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY 
PRODUCING SOME LIGHT RAIN. THERE COULD BE A SNOW FLURRY IN THE 
HIGHEST TERRAIN ACROSS EXTREME NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA. THIS WAVE SHOULD BE MOVING AWAY TO THE NORTHEAST DURING 
THE DAY MONDAY ALLOWING FOR A RETURN TO SOME SUNSHINE MAINLY WESTERN 
AREAS. FOLLOWING THE DEPARTURE OF THIS SYSTEM THE UPPER LEVEL 
PATTERN WILL BE UNDERGOING SOME MAJOR LEAGUE AMPLIFICATION WITH A 
FULL LATITUDE TROUGH FORMING ACROSS THE PLAINS. THIS WILL KEEP THE 
WEATHER A LITTLE UNSETTLED MONDAY NIGHT WITH A STRENGTHENING MOIST 
SOUTHERLY FLOW COMPLETE WITH A COUPLE WEAK IMPULSES. THEREFORE KEPT 
A SMALL CHANCE FOR A SHOWER GOING THROUGH THIS PERIOD. TUESDAY INTO 
TUESDAY NIGHT THE PROBABILITY FOR SHOWERS...MAYBE EVEN A CLAP OF 
THUNDER WILL BE ON THE INCREASE AS A DEEPENING SURFACE LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM DRAGS A STRONG COLD FRONT TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. 
THE FRONT WILL MOVE RATHER SLOWLY EAST IN THE HIGHLY AMPLIFIED 
PATTERN AND SHOULD BE JUST EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA BY 12Z 
WEDNESDAY. DUE TO THE TIGHT CIRCULATION ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER 
LEVEL TROUGH...A LARGE AREA OF DEEP MOISTURE WILL WRAP AROUND THE 
BACK SIDE OF THE FEATURE AND THE MOIST AIR WILL BE ACCOMPANIED BY A 
TRAILING SHORT WAVE. MUCH COLDER AIR WILL BE SPREADING EAST BEHIND 
THE FRONT DURING THE DAY WEDNESDAY AND BY THE AFTERNOON THE RAIN 
WILL BE CHANGING TO SNOW IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS BUT MAINLY OUT 
WEST ON THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. BY WEDNESDAY EVENING TEMPERATURES 
WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SOME LIGHT SNOW ACROSS MUCH OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. AGAIN THE DEEPEST MOISTURE AND STRONGEST LIFT WILL BE OVER 
NORTHERN SECTIONS...MAINLY THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU...SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AS WELL AS THE 
SMOKY MOUNTAINS. A LITTLE TOO EARLY TO SAY BUT SOME OF THESE HIGHER 
TERRAIN AREAS COULD PICK UP AN INCH OR TWO OF SNOW WILL OROGRAPHIC 
SUPPORT. THE MODELS CONTINUE WITH A PROGRESSIVE MODE FOR THIS SYSTEM 
ON CHRISTMAS DAY ALLOWING DRIER AIR AND A RETURN TO SUNSHINE FOR 
MOST AREAS. THE UPPER FLOW FLATTENS OUT AGAIN CHRISTMAS EVENING IN 
TIME FOR THE ARRIVAL OF ANOTHER FAST MOVING UPPER TROUGH AND 
ASSOCIATED SURFACE COLD FRONT WHICH MAY BRING SOME LIGHT RAIN ON 
FRIDAY.

478 
FXUS64 KMRX 192016
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 PM EST FRI DEC 19 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
THERE REMAINS MUCH UNCERTAINTY IN THE SHORT TERM PERIOD DUE TO LARGE 
DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE NAM AND THE GFS. THE NAM IS THE WETTER AND 
COLDER OF THE TWO MODELS. THE PREFERENCE IS MORE TOWARD THE GFS DUE 
TO THE PRECIP/CONVECTION THAT IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP ALONG THE GULF 
COAST...PROVIDING A STABILIZING EFFECT UPSTREAM AND PREVENTING 
NORTHWARD MOISTURE ADVECTION. THE RAP APPEARS TO AGREE WITH THIS 
SCENARIO...AND THE LATEST SREF APPEARS TO BE TRENDING DOWNWARD IN 
POPS/QPF. 

AS A RESULT...WILL CONFINE LIKELY POPS TO EXTREME SOUTHERN PORTIONS 
OF THE AREA TONIGHT...FADING TO LOW CHANCE POPS NORTH. QPF WILL BE 
LIGHT...UP TO A TENTH OF AN INCH SOUTH AND IN THE MOUNTAINS. IN 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS...MAINLY ABOVE 2500 FT...THE PRECIP SHOULD BE 
MOSTLY SNOW...BUT WITH A SMALL WINDOW OF ADEQUATE MOISTURE DEPTH 
INTO THE DENDRITE GROWTH ZONE AND WEAK LIFT...NO MORE THAN ONE INCH 
IS EXPECTED TO ACCUMULATE. TRI-CITIES AND SW VA COULD SEE SOME SNOW 
IF THE COLDER NAM IS CORRECT...BUT THE WARMER GFS LOOKS LIKE ALL 
RAIN. WILL MENTION RAIN OR SNOW IN THAT AREA AS A COMPROMISE...WITH 
WITH NO ACCUMULATIONS. THE FASTER EXIT OF PRECIP SHOWN BY THE GFS 
WILL BE FOLLOWED...ENDING POPS IN THE EARLY AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
A WEAK SYSTEM WILL BE EXITING TO THE NE SATURDAY NIGHT WITH SKY
CONDITIONS IMPROVING TO PARTLY CLOUDY. UPPER FLOW IS ZONAL WITH
DRIER AIR MASS AND WEAK HIGH PRESSURE SETTLING OVER THE REGION.
THE SURFACE HIGH WILL BE OVERHEAD SUNDAY WITH SKIES PARTLY TO
MOSTLY SUNNY AND HIGH TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL IN THE
UPPER 40S TO MID 50S. ANOTHER SOUTHERN SYSTEM DEVELOPS ACROSS THE
GULF COAST SUNDAY AND BRINGS CLOUDS AND RAIN ACROSS THE FORECAST
AREA SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. AFTER A BRIEF BREAK IN THE STEADY
RAIN MONDAY NIGHT A MUCH STRONGER SYSTEM STILL LOOKS ON TRACK TO
MOVE INTO THE MS VALLEY MONDAY. A DEEP TROUGH OVER THE CENTRAL
STATES WILL MOVE INTO THE EASTERN STATES TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. A
STRONG COLD FRONT APPROACHES THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY NIGHT INTO
WEDNESDAY. A SURFACE LOW DEEPENS OVER OH WEDNESDAY. THE SYSTEM
FINALLY SHIFTS EAST OF THE AREA ON CHRISTMAS DAY. THERE COULD BE
SOME THUNDERSTORMS IF ENOUGH INSTABILITY DEVELOPS TUESDAY AFTERNOON
AND EVENING AHEAD OF THE FRONT. MUCH COLDER TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY
AND THURSDAY BEHIND THE FRONT. AS COLDER AIR MOVES IN LATE
WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT SOME MINOR SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS ARE
POSSIBLE IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EST FRI DEC 19 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A WEAK AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL EXTEND INTO THE AREA TODAY...WITH SOME SUNSHINE IN STORE.  SOME 
SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL SWING ACROSS THE REGION TONIGHT INTO 
SATURDAY. MODELS TREND HAS BEEN DRIER WITH THIS SYSTEM...AND FORCING 
AND MOISTURE LOOK LIMITED.  HOWEVER...THERE APPEARS TO BE ENOUGH TO 
WARRANT LIKELY POPS SOUTH MAINLY SOUTH TONIGHT AND CHANCE 
ELSEWHERE...WITH CHANCE POPS INTO EARLY SATURDAY BEFORE TAPERING 
OFF.  PRECIP TYPE IS PROBLEMATIC...WITH MODEL DISAGREEMENT ON WHAT 
THE THERMAL PROFILE WILL LOOK LIKE.  WILL LEAN TOWARD A COMPROMISE 
SOLUTION AT THIS POINT AND ALLOW RAIN OR SNOW FOR ALL BUT SOUTH 
WHERE WILL KEEP ALL RAIN.  PRECIP AMOUNTS LOOK QUITE LIGHT...SO ANY 
SNOW ACCUMULATION EXPECTED TO BE MINOR AND MORE LIKELY OVER THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN. NO WINTER WEATHER ADVISORIES AT THIS POINT...BUT 
WILL MENTION IN THE HWO.  WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM MAV TEMPS EXCEPT 
FOR SATURDAY...WHEN EXPECT CLOUD COVER WILL LIMIT TEMP RISE SO WILL 
UNDERCUT MAV TEMPS SIGNIFICANTLY.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS RELATIVELY 
CLOSE IN DEPICTION OF THE EXTENDED FORECAST FEATURING A DEPARTING 
TROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. COULD BE A COUPLE SNOWFLAKES STILL AROUND IN 
THE NORTHERN MOUNTAINS AT THIS TIME SO KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE GOING 
HERE. SHORTWAVE RIDGING ALLOWS FOR A BREAK IN THE ACTION ON SUNDAY. 
HOWEVER...NEXT UPPER WAVE SLIDES NORTHEAST OUT OF THE LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT GENERATING SOME LIGHT RAIN FOR THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. TEMPERATURES 
SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH WITH THIS SYSTEM FOR MOSTLY LIQUID 
PRECIPITATION BUT THERE MAY BE A FEW SNOWFLAKES IN THE HIGHEST PEAKS 
ACROSS EXTREME NORTHEAST TENNESSEE INTO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. DOESN'T 
APPEAR LIKE MUCH OF A PROBLEM HERE WTIH TEMPERATURES NOT DESCENDING 
INTO THE FREEZING ZONE UNTIL LATE SUNDAY NIGHT. HAD TO KEEP A SMALL 
CHANCE FOR SOME LIGHT RAIN GOING MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY WITH SOME 
MOISTENING AND THE POSSIBILITY OF A WEAK IMPULSE RIPPING NORTHEAST 
AHEAD OF A DEEPENING UPPER TROUGH ACROSS MIDDLE AMERICA. THIS TROUGH 
REALLY AMPLIFIES TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY DRIVING A STRONG COLD 
FRONT THROUGH THE VIEWING AREA FROM AROUND MIDNIGHT THROUGH 12Z 
WEDNESDAY. WARM AND MOIST AIR STREAMS NORTH AHEAD OF THE BOUNDARY 
AND THE STRENGTH OF A SYSTEM LIKE THIS WARRANTS THE USE OF LIKELY 
POPS ACROSS THE REGION FOR SHOWERS. AS COLDER AIR AND A TRAILING 
SHORT WAVELENGTH FEATURE DROPPING THROUGH THE BACK SIDE OF THE LONG 
WAVE CIRCULATION...SOME SNOW SHOWERS COULD BE IN THE WORKS FOR 
CHRISTMAS EVE. SOME OF THIS PRECIPITATION COULD HANG AROUND FOR A 
WHILE CHRISTMAS MORNING ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE BUT FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA DRIER AIR AND 
POSSIBLY SUNSHINE WILL BE ON THE INCREASE THROUGH CHRISTMAS DAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 PM EST THU DEC 18 2014

.SHORT TERM...RADAR SHOWS SOME PATCHY LIGHT RAIN OR DRIZZLE WILL
BE MOVING ACROSS THE AREA FOR THE NEXT FEW HOURS...BUT THIS SHOULD
EXIT BY 00Z AND WILL CARRY NO POPS AFTER THAT TIME. THE QUESTION
OVERNIGHT WILL BE WHETHER CLOUDS ARE ABLE TO ERODE AS MUCH AS THE
GFS SAYS THEY WILL...OR IF THEY WILL HANG IN THROUGH MOST OF THE
NIGHT AS SHOWN BY THE NAM. WILL LEAN TOWARD THE NAM AS UPSTREAM
SATELLITE DOES NOT LOOK PROMISING FOR CLEARING ANY TIME SOON...AND
THE RAP LOOKS CLOSER TO THE NAM. WILL ALSO LEAN TEMPS ON THE WARM
SIDE OF MOS TONIGHT. THERE SHOULD BE SOME SUN ACROSS MOST OF THE
AREA BY MORNING...THEN HIGH CLOUDS BEGIN TO INCREASE FROM THE SW
AHEAD OF SOUTHERN STREAM VORT MAX AND JET STREAK. HIGH TEMPS SHOULD
REACH A CATEGORY OR TWO HIGHER THAN TODAY. ANY PRECIP WITH THIS
SYSTEM SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL AFTER THE END OF THE SHORT TERM
PERIOD.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...A FAST MOVING SYSTEM 
THAT IS FORECAST TO FORM ALONG THE GULF COAST FRIDAY WILL MOVE FROM 
THE LOWER MS VALLEY INTO THE EASTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY OVERNIGHT 
FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY MORNING. THE BULK OF THE SYSTEM WILL BE
SOUTH OF TN AND AFFECT THE SOUTHEASTERN STATES INTO THE CAROLINAS.
TEMPERATURES WILL DROP INTO THE 30S FRIDAY EVENING AND AREAS TO THE
NORTH OF INTERSTATE 40...ESPECIALLY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS COULD
SEE SOME SNOW LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY. LOWS WILL ONLY
DROP TO NEAR FREEZING SO AMOUNTS ARE EXPECTED TO BE LIGHT...LESS
THAN ONE INCH. TEMPERATURES SATURDAY WILL WARM ABOVE FREEZING TO
THE 40S TO NEAR 50. WEAK HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS BACK IN SATURDAY
NIGHT AND SUNDAY WITH SKIES BECOMING PARTLY SUNNY.

SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE TUESDAY PATTERN CONTINUES TO BE UNSETTLED. 
UPPER TROUGH OVER THE CENTRAL STATES WILL HELP ANOTHER SYSTEM 
DEVELOP OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND A NEW SYSTEM ALSO DEVELOPS 
ALONG THE GULF COAST. THE SOUTHERN SYSTEM WILL AFFECT THE FORECAST 
AREA FIRST WITH A CHANCE OF RAIN SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. THIS 
SYSTEM PULLS OUT AND THEN THE STRONGER SECOND SYSTEM WILL MOVE
INTO THE OHIO AND TN VALLEYS MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. THIS SYSTEM
IS EXPECTED TO FORM AN UPPER LOW OVER THE MID MS VALLEY TUESDAY AND
THEN SLOWLY MOVE EAST INTO THE EASTERN GREAT LAKE STATES THROUGH
WEDNESDAY. COLDER AIR ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE SYSTEM WILL LOWER
TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. ALSO THE SYSTEM IS EXPECTED TO
DEEPEN MORE. SNOW SHOWERS WILL LIKELY AFFECT THE NORTHERN PARTS OF
THE AREA WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

FREEZING. SOME ADDITIONAL SPOTTY LIGHT RAIN/DRIZZLE IN MIDDLE TN
WILL MOVE EAST INTO OUR AREA IN THE NEXT FEW HOURS...BUT THE TREND
HAS BEEN FOR THIS AREA TO DIMINISH IN INTENSITY AND COVERAGE. WILL
CONTINUE TO HAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP THROUGH THE AFTERNOON...AND
ADD A MENTION OF DRIZZLE. THE LATEST GUIDANCE SHOWS TEMPS SLIGHTLY
COOLER THAN CURRENTLY FORECAST...WHICH SEEMS REASONABLE BASED ON
SATELLITE AND OBS...SO WILL ADJUST TEMPS DOWN SLIGHTLY IN MOST
SPOTS.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

993 
FXUS64 KMRX 180846
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
346 AM EST THU DEC 18 2014

.SHORT TERM... LITTLE BIT OF A TRICKY FORECAST FOR THE EARLY PART OF 
TODAY. WEAK RIPPLE OF ENERGY, COMBINED WITH JUST ENOUGH MOISTURE, 
AND TEMPS RIGHT AROUND FREEZING, IS LEADING TO THE POTENTIAL FOR 
SOME WINTRY MIX FOR THE WESTERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA. SEEING 
REPORTS OF LIGHT FREEZING RAIN, SLEET, SNOW, AND RAIN IN WESTERN AND 
CENTRAL TENNESSEE. THINK THAT AREAS ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND 
THE WESTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY HAVE A CHANCE TO SEE SOME OF THIS AS 
WELL. PRETTY GOOD LAYER OF WARM AIR ABOVE THE SURFACE THAT SHOULD 
LEAD TO LIQUID PRECIP BEFORE IT NEARS THE SURFACE WHERE TEMPS ARE AT 
OR BELOW FREEZING EARLY THIS MORNING. THINK THAT SNOW IS A 
POSSIBILITY IN THE NORTHERN AREAS, BUT MOISTURE IS RELATIVELY 
LIMITED IN THE DENDRITIC GROWTH ZONE, SO AT THIS TIME BELIEVE 
ANYTHING THAT FALLS WILL MOST LIKELY BE LIQUID OR FROZEN. DRY AIR 
ABOVE THE BOUNDARY LAYER WILL ALSO BE OF INTEREST AS IT COULD IMPEDE 
THE EASTWARD PROGRESS OF THE SYSTEM. HAVE ISSUED AN SPS TO ADVISE 
PEOPLE ON THEIR MORNING COMMUTE OF THE HAZARDS ASSOCIATED WITH 
FREEZING RAIN AND SLEET. SURFACE TEMPS SHOULD WARM UP ABOVE FREEZING 
ACROSS THE AREA BY MID MORNING AND ANY PRECIP THAT IS ABLE TO LINGER 
AROUND SHOULD REMAIN IN THE FORM OF RAIN.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
A WEAK RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL KEEP THINGS DRY FRIDAY...BUT A
FAST MOVING SYSTEM ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES WILL PULL THROUGH
THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING. MAIN DYNAMICS IS FROM
THE LEFT ENTERANCE REGION OF THE JET ALONG WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT.
TEMPERATURE PROFILE SUGGEST MAINLY RAIN...BUT ACROSS SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS...RAIN WILL MIX WITH OR
CHANGE TO SNOW. LITTLE ACCUMULATION EXPECTED.

WEAK SURFACE RIDGING AGAIN FOR SUNDAY...BUT THE SOUTHERN STREAM
WILL PULL MOISTURE BACK INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR SUNDAY
NIGHT AND MONDAY AHEAD OF A STRONG NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH. THE
NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH WILL DEVELOP A LONG-WAVE TROUGH OVER THE
EASTERN TWO-THIRDS OF THE NATION FOR MID-WEEK OR CHRISTMAS DAY.
RAIN INITIALLY TUESDAY NIGHT WILL CHANGE TO SNOW ON CHRISTMAS EVE.

NORTHWEST FLOW SNOWFALL POSSIBLE ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. SNOW
SHOWERS ARE POSSIBLE MOST LOCATIONS CHRISTMAS EVE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

801 
FXUS64 KMRX 172048
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
348 PM EST WED DEC 17 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
LOW CLOUDS ARE SLOWLY ERODING THIS AFTERNOON...AND THIS TREND IS 
EXPECTED TO CONTINUE THROUGH THE EVENING. MEANWHILE HIGH CLOUDS WILL 
BE ON THE INCREASE AHEAD OF THE MID/UPPER LEVEL LOW NOW OVER NM/TX. 
THE BEST FORCING WITH THIS SYSTEM ASSOCIATED WITH THE 500 MB VORT 
MAX AND DIVERGENCE IN THE JET EXIT REGION PASSES NORTH OF OUR AREA. 
AT THE SAME TIME LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IS CUT OFF AS THE 850 MB FLOW 
REMAINS WESTERLY. THUS WE MAY NOT SEE MUCH PRECIP REACHING THE 
GROUND TOMORROW AS PRECIP FALLS THROUGH A VERY DRY LAYER. WILL HAVE 
LOW CHANCE POPS ALONG THE PLATEAU COUNTIES IN THE MORNING...WITH 
SLIGHT CHANCES ELSEWHERE. IT COULD BEGIN AS A LITTLE SNOW IN HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS OF THE PLATEAU BEFORE CHANGING TO RAIN. ONLY A FEW 
HUNDRETHS OF AN INCH OF PRECIP IS EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...AT THE BEGINNING OF 
THIS PERIOD WE ARE UNDER A ZONAL FLOW ALOFT WITH SURFACE RIDGING 
OVER THE AREA...OVERALL QUIET.  AT THAT TIME TO THE WEST...OUR NEXT 
SYSTEM WILL BE MAKING ITS WAY THROUGH THE ROCKIES.  LOOKS LIKE ITS 
EFFECTS WILL START IN OUR AREA FRIDAY NIGHT.  THIS SYSTEM IS LOOKING 
FAIRLY WEAK NOW...AND IS EXPECTED TO PASS THROUGH THE AREA ON 
SATURDAY AS AN OPEN WAVE.  

THEN AFTER A COUPLE OF DRY OR LOW POP DAYS...THE NEXT SYSTEM
APPROACHES AND MAY SPREAD ORGANIZED PRECIP INTO THE AREA BY MONDAY
NIGHT OR TUESDAY. THIS SYSTEM LOOKS VERY STRONG...BUT THE MAIN
THREAT LOOKS LIKE IT WILL BE NORTH OF HERE...BUT STILL A CHANCE OF
LIGHT WINTERY PRECIP THEN.

FOR THE SYSTEM OVER THE WEEKEND...FREEZING LEVEL IS QUITE HIGH...SO 
ONLY HAVE A MENTION OF MIXES WITH SNOW OR SLEET IN THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. WENT CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS OVERALL.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
309 AM EST WED DEC 17 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH TOMORROW)
CURRENTLY LIGHT SHOWERS MOVING ACROSS PORTIONS OF SW VIRGINIA, WITH
OVERCAST CONDITIONS ACROSS THE REST OF THE FORECAST AREA.
RELATIVELY QUIET WEATHER TODAY WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY TO OVERCAST SKIES
EXPECTED ACROSS THE AREA. CHANCE FOR PRECIP IN THE SHORT TERM WILL
HAVE TO WAIT TILL TOMORROW WHEN MOISTURE FROM THE GULF COUPLED WITH
A WEAK RIPPLE OF ENERGY COULD GIVE A QUICK SHOT OF PRECIP TO THE
AREA. THIS ROUND OF PRECIP SHOULD MOVE THROUGH PRETTY FAST AND
DEPENDING ON THE TIMING COULD LEAD TO SOME LIGHT SNOW. AT THIS
POINT THINK EVERYWHERE SHOULD REMAIN BELOW A QUARTER INCH OF
LIQUID, SO EVEN IF IT DOES BRIEFELY FALL AS SNOW IT SHOULD BE VERY
LIGHT AND MOST LIKELY CONFINED TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...FAIRLY ZONAL FLOW 
STARTS THE EXTENDED WITH A JET STREAK MOVING ACROSS THE GULF COAST 
STATES FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY PLACING THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
UNDER THE FAVORED LEFT EXIT REGION OF THE JET. SYNOPTIC LIFT 
COMBINED WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL PRODUCE CATEGORICAL/LIKELY POPS 
FOR SATURDAY. COLD AIR IS LIMITED...SO EXPECT MAINLY RAIN.

AN INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH OVER THE AREA SUNDAY WILL KEEP SKIES 
MOSTLY CLOUDY. GFS AND ECMWF INDICATE A STRONG STORM SYSTEM 
DEVELOPING FOR CHRISTMAS EVE WITH A DEEP LONG-WAVE UPPER TROUGH
OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. RAIN INITIALLY WILL LIKELY
CHANGE TO SNOW OVER MOST OF THE AREA. WAY TOO EARLY FOR
AMOUNTS...BUT WATCH SYSTEM CLOSELY SINCE FAIRLY COLD AIR WILL BE
DRAWN SOUTHWARD INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS.

630 
FXUS64 KMRX 161933
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
227 PM EST TUE DEC 16 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...LOW LEVEL INSTABILITY WILL KEEP 
THE AREA UNDER ALMOST CONSTANT CLOUD COVER THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON. ANY SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS THAT COULD GET KICKED UP 
BEHIND THE FRONT WILL MOVE EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS BY WEDNESDAY 
MORNING. HIGH PRESSURE MOVES IN WEDNESDAY FOR SLOWLY CLEARING SKIES 
AND DRY WEATHER. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL RIDGE INTO THE TN VALLEY EARLY IN THE PERIOD. AN UPPER LEVEL 
IMPULSE WILL MOVE EAST THROUGH THE TN VALLEY ON THURSDAY. THIS 
FEATURE WILL BRING A RETURN TO LAYER MOISTURE AND PROVIDE ENOUGH 
LIFT FOR LIGHT PRECIPITATION TO MOVE ACROSS THE AREA FOR MUCH OF 
THURSDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL. 

RELATIVELY DRY CONDITIONS RETURN ON FRIDAY WITH A MILD WARM UP. HIGH 
CLOUDS BEGIN TO INVADE LATER IN THE DAY WITH THE APPROACH OF ANOTHER 
UPPER LEVEL FEATURE. 

AN UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE EAST INTO THE TN VALLEY ON SATURDAY. A SW 
TO NE SPEED MAX WILL RUN THROUGH THE SOUTH INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. THIS FEATURE WILL BRING A THICKENING CLOUD DECK AND 
THE ONSET OF RAIN ON FRIDAY NIGHT. WEAK SURFACE LOW PRESSURE WILL 
DEVELOP SE OF THE AREA WITH AN INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH EXTENDING 
INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON SATURDAY. A SECONDARY UPPER 
IMPULSE WILL SWING INTO THE UPPER TROUGH FROM THE CENTRAL U.S. 
KEEPING THE RAIN CHANCES GOING INTO SUNDAY MORNING. FREEZING LEVELS 
PROGGED TO HOLD UP WELL UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING WHEN LOW LEVEL 
COLD AIR ADVECTION BEGINS MOVING IN FROM THE NW. PRECIPITATION TYPE 
WILL LIKELY CHANCE TO SNOW EARLY SUNDAY...MAINLY ACROSS NORTHERN AND 
ELEVATED AREA. UPPER TROUGH AXIS WILL HAVE MOVED EAST AND MOISTURE 
WILL BE LIMITED BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON. LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES WILL BE 
TAPERING OFF WITH SUNDAY TEMPERATURES REMAIN WELL BELOW NORMAL. 

AREA IS BETWEEN SYSTEMS ON MONDAY. AN ELONGATED JET STREAK FROM THE 
PAC NW WILL DIVE INTO THE TN VALLEY ON TUESDAY BRINGING ANOTHER 
CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION.

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
