726 
FXUS64 KMRX 160845
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EST TUE DEC 16 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS
THE AREA BY 15Z. A FRONTO-GENETIC BAND OF SHOWERS WILL EXIT THE
AREA BY 13Z. MODELS...ESPECIALLY THE NAM...SHOW LOW-LEVEL CAPES
WILL STAY ELEVATED BETWEEN 80-150 J/KG...SO EXPECT ANOTHER ROUND OF
LIGHT SHOWERS TO MOVE ACROSS THE NORTHERN TWO-THIRDS OF THE AREA
TODAY AND THIS EVENING.

FOR TONIGHT...WEAK OROGRAPHIC FLOW WILL KEEP A CHANCE POPS FOR THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. RIDGING
WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA WEDNESDAY ENDING SHOWER CHANCE WITH LOW-
CLOUDS DISSIPATING.

SINCE EXPECT LOW-CLOUDS TO REMAIN ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA TONIGHT
INTO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING...WENT ON THE COOLER SIDE OF GUIDANCE
FOR HIGHS.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)... IN THE LONG TERM
THE FIRST CHANCE FOR PRECIP INVADES THE AREA THURSDAY AS A PLUME OF
GULF MOISTURE MAKES A RUN AT THE FORECAST AREA. PRECIP COULD START
AS SOON AS EARLY THURSDAY MORNING AND IF IT DOES THERE'S A SLIGHT
CHANCE IT COULD COME IN THE FORM OF SNOW FLURRIES. THINK THAT THE
MOISTURE WILL BE SO LIMITED THAT VERY LITTLE RAIN/SNOW SHOULD FALL
AND IF SNOW DOES FALL IT SHOULDN'T STICK TO MOST SURFACES. IT'S
EVEN POSSIBLE THAT THE MOISTURE IS SO LIMITED THAT IT ALL FALLS OUT
OVER WEST/CENTRAL TENNESSEE AND THE SYSTEM DRIES UP BEFORE THE
MOISTURE/LIFT IS IN PLACE OVER OUR AREA.

THE BETTER CHANCE FOR PRECIP WILL COME OVER THE WEEKEND AS A 
TROUGH/LOW PRESSURE CENTER MOVES OVER THE GREAT LAKES. THE LATEST 
ECMWF HAS MOVED THE LOW FURTHER NORTH (MORE IN LINE WITH THE GFS) 
AND WANTS TO KEEP MOST OF THE AREA (EXCEPT FOR THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS) AS A COLD RAIN. LOOKING AT FORECAST SOUNDINGS SEEMS LIKE 
THE BEST TIME FRAME TO POTENTIALLY SEE SNOW SHOULD BE EARLY SATURDAY 
AS THERE SHOULD BE PLENTY OF MOISTURE IN THE DENDRITIC GROWTH ZONE 
AT THAT TIME. AT THIS TIME FORECAST SOUNDINGS IN THE VALLEY SHOW 
TEMPS AROUND 850MB AND LOWER SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH TO MELT ANY SNOW. 
IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS LOOKS LIKE IT SHOULD STAY COLD ENOUGH TO 
SEE SNOW IN THE MOUNTAINS. MID LEVEL MOISTURE SEEMS TO DRY OUT 
OVERNIGHT SUNDAY AS THE SYSTEM EXISTS THE AREA. WHEN ALL IS SAID AND 
DONE THINK THAT MOST PLACES WILL SEE LESS THAN A HALF AN INCH OF 
PRECIP, HOWEVER SOME AREAS COULD SEE A BIT MORE THAN THIS.

WITH A RELATIVELY CLOUDY FORECAST TEMPS REMAIN A LITTLE BELOW 
AVERAGE THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST.

TOMORROW
...THE FRONT WILL PULL AWAY FROM THE AREA...WITH PRECIP CHANCES 
REMAINING MAINLY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF 
YEAR.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...AT THE BEGINNING OF
THIS PERIOD...THE UPPER TROUGH AND SURFACE COLD FRONT ARE EXITING
THE AREA AND HIGH PRESSURE IS BUILDING IN.

MODELS AGREE ON A VERY WEAK SYSTEM MOVING INTO THE AREA ON 
THURSDAY...ZIPPING ON THROUGH...WILL ONLY HAVE MINIMAL POPS WITH 
THIS SYSTEM...AND EVEN TAPERING OFF NORTH.  THEN A LARGE SYSTEM 
MOVES IN FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT.  MODELS DIVERGE ON THE TIMING OF 
ITS PLACEMENT...ESPECIALLY EXIT TIMING...BUT SHOULD BE LEAVING BY 
SUNDAY. WEATHER GRID WAS QUITE A CHALLENGE WITH THE MODELS SO 
DIFFERENT...BUT GENERALLY KEPT THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE VALLEY 
MOSTLY RAIN DURING THIS SYSTEM...WHEREAS FARTHER NORTH ALLOWING 
CHANCES OF RAIN OR SNOW.  EURO PLACEMENT LOOKS MORE THREATENING WITH 
SYSTEM DIVING FARTHER SOUTH...WHEREAS IF THE GFS IS CORRECT MOST OF 
THIS SYSTEM WILL STAY NORTH OF THE AREA.  KEPT TEMPS CLOSE TO 
GUIDANCE OVERALL.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
318 AM EST MON DEC 15 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SMALL DEWPOINT
DEPRESSIONS...CLEAR SKY AND CALM WINDS HAVE ALLOWED AREAS OF FOG TO
DEVELOP. SOME OF THE FOG WILL BE DENSE PRODUCING THICK FROST
DEVELOPMENT.

FOR TODAY...AFTER FOG/LOW CLOUDS DISSIPATE BY MID-
MORNING...GENERALLY MOSTLY SUNNY SKY UNTIL MID/LATE AFTERNOON.
INCREASING MOISTURE AHEAD OF FRONTAL BOUNDARY. MODELS SHOW STRONG
UPPER LEVEL JET MOVING ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES PLACING THE
FORECAST AREA UNDER THE FAVORED LEFT EXIT REGION. THE SYNOPTIC/
FRONTOGENETIC FORCING WILL PULL A BAND OF SHOWERS ACROSS THE AREA
WITH CATEGORICAL POPS ANTICIPATED TONIGHT. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW
ELEVATED INSTABILITY. HAVE INCLUDED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDER.

.LONG TERM /TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY/... LOW CLOUDS AND SOME LIGHT 
SCATTERED PRECIPITATION WILL LINGER ON TUESDAY AS A PASSING UPPER-
TROUGH SCOOTS ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY TO THE NORTH. BY THE 
EVENING...PRECIPITATION WILL BEGIN TO WANE EXCEPT FOR SOME ISOLATED 
ACTIVITY ALONG THE TERRAIN. ZONAL FLOW ALOFT AND EVEN SOME WEAK 
RIDGING ON WEDNESDAY WILL PROMOTE DRIER WEATHER...THOUGH SOUNDINGS 
INDICATE SOME LOW CLOUDS COULD LINGER OVER THE REGION FOR AT LEAST 
PART OF THE DAY. THE NEXT WEATHER FEATURE OF NOTE WILL BE AN UPPER-
TROUGH PASSING THRU THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. MODELS ARE SHOWING GOOD 
CONSENSUS WITH RESPECT TO PRECIPITATION BEING LIKELY DURING THIS 
PERIOD...BUT THERE ARE DIFFERENCES IN THE MAGNITUDE OF THIS SYSTEM. 
SPECIFICALLY...THE GFS TRACK IS MORE NORTHERLY AND A WEAKER OPEN 
WAVE. THIS WOULD PROMOTE A WARMER...MOSTLY RAIN EVENT. THE ECMWF 
SHOWS A DEEPER CLOSED LOW MOVING THRU THE AREA...WHICH WOULD BRING 
IN SOME COLDER AIR AND RESULT IN A POTENTIAL FOR SOME ACCUMULATING 
SNOWFALL ALONG THE MOUNTAINS OF NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
SATURDAY NIGHT. WILL CONTINUE TO MONTITOR THE LATEST MODEL 
TRENDS...BUT FOR NOW 6-7 DAYS OUT...WILL REMAIN CAUTIOUS WITH MAKING 
TOO MANY ADJUSTMENTS.

163 
FXUS64 KMRX 142007
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
307 PM EST SUN DEC 14 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUEDAY)...EROSION OF LOW CLOUDS THIS 
AFTERNOON HAS LEFT SOME LARGE AREAS OF CLEARING ACROSS MUCH OF SE TN 
AND ALSO OVER PARTS OF THE PLATEAU. APPEARS THAT THE REMAINDER OF NE 
TN AND EVEN SW VA MAY BRIEFLY CLEAR OUT. THE CHALLENGE IS HOW FAR 
SOUTH THESE LOW CLOUDS RE-DEVELOP OVERNIGHT. I OPTED TO SPREAD 
CLOUDS JUST A BIT FURTHER SOUTH THAN THE RAP/NAM MODELS SUGGEST... 
CLOSE TO ALONG I-40 AND I-81. KEPT IN THE PATCHY DENSE FOG OR 
FREEZING FOG FROM PREVIOUS FORECAST PACKAGE. CLOSE TO GFS MOS MINS 
OR A BLEND WHERE CLOUDS ARE LIKELY.

FOR MONDAY...A SWITCH TO SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW SHOULD HELP TO 
BREAK UP ANY LOW CLOUDS AROUND IN THE MORNING. COULD NOT FIND ANY 
MODEL SOLUTION THAT BRINGS SHOWERS INTO OUR WESTERN FORECAST AREAS 
THROUGH 16/00Z...SO SHAVED POPS BACK TO MAINLY SEQUATCHIE VALLEY.

SHOWERS SEEM MOST LIKELY MONDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT AND 
POPS WERE NUDGED UP TO LIKELY ACROSS THE BOARD. KEPT SCATTERED 
SHOWERS IN FOR NE TN AND SW VA TUESDAY MORNING THEN 30 PERCENT OR 
LESS POPS FOR THE REMAINDER OF TUESDAY. A FEW TWEAKS OFF THE GFS MOS 
MAXES MONDAY...THEN CLOSELY FOLLOWED THE SIMILAR MOS GUIDANCE FOR 
MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...EARLY WEEK SHORT WAVE 
MOVES AWAY TO THE EAST TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY GENERATING A FEW 
SHOWERS MAINLY NORTHERN SECTIONS WITH A COUPLE SNOW FLURRIES IN THE 
MOUNTAINS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. NEXT 
WAVE SWINGS OUT ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY SPREADING 
SOME LIGHT PRECIPITATION ACROSS THE REGION. TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
COLD ENOUGH FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME SNOW SHOWERS LATE THURSDAY 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY MORNING BEFORE LOW LEVEL WARMING GETS UNDERWAY. A 
MUCH BETTER CHANCE OF RAIN DEVELOPS FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY AS A MORE 
ROBUST SHORT WAVE BUILDS NORTHEAST FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS ACROSS 
THE MID SOUTH/OHIO VALLEY. KEPT HIGHER GOOD CHANCE AND LIKELY POPS 
GOING DURING THIS PART OF THE FORECAST WITH BETTER MODEL AGREEMENT 
WITH THE STRONGER WAVE. AGAIN HAD TO SPRINKLE SOME SNOW SHOWERS INTO 
THE MIX WITH COLDER LOW LEVEL NIGHTTIME TEMPERATURES BUT THE BEST 
CHANCE OF FROZEN PRECIPITATION WOULD BE IN THE COLDER AIR BEHIND THE 
DEPARTING SYSTEM SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. HOWEVER...MOISTURE 
DEPTH AND LIFT WILL BE ON THE DECREASE ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE 
PROGRESSIVE SYSTEM.

DIFFICULT TO MOVE IT OUT OF MUCH OF THE VALLEY TODAY. IF A TERMINAL

OTHERWISE...MVFR DECK COULD HANG AROUND ALL THE WAY THROUGH 14Z
MONDAY AT TRI AND POSSIBLY TYS. ALSO SOME MVFR FOG COULD DEVELOP
AGAIN AT TRI AND TYS. THE BEST CHANCE OF AN IFR CEILING TO FORM
LATE TONIGHT WILL BE AT TRI. TRI MAY ALSO HANG ONTO AN MVFR CEILING
THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

328 AM EST SUN DEC 14 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MAIN CONCERNS ARE EXTENT OF LOW-

CLOSE DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS...CLEAR SKY CALM WINDS HAVE ALLOWED

BELOW FREEZING WILL PRODUCE A GOOD DEAL OF FROST DEVELOPMENT.

FOG WILL DISSIPATE BY MID-MORNING...BUT LOW CLOUDS REMAIN...
MAINLY OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE PLATEAU COUNTIES.

FOR TONIGHT...ANOTHER ROUND OF FOG DEVELOPMENT ANTICIPATED.

.LONG TERM /MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY/... WINDS WILL VEER TO THE 
SOUTHWEST AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT. THESE WINDS...ALONG 
WITH MOSTLY TO PARTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS WILL ALLOW FOR AN EVEN WARMER 
DAY ONCE ANY LINGERING OVERNIGHT FOG/CLOUD COVER DISSIPATES...WITH 
HIGHS IN THE 55 TO 60 DEGREE RANGE IN MOST LOCATIONS. AS THE FRONT 
SLOWLY MOVES INTO THE AREA...CLOUDS WILL INCREASE AND SCATTERED 
SHOWERS WILL OVERSPREAD THE REGION OVER THE COURSE OF THE NIGHT AND 
INTO THE MORNING HOURS ON TUESDAY....BEFORE TAPERING OFF BY MIDDAY. 
HOWEVER...SOME WRAP AROUND MOISTURE AND A PERSISTENT INVERSION MAY 
KEEP LOW CLOUDS IN /PARTICULARLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
AREA/ THROUGH THE DAY ON TUESDAY AND EVEN INTO WEDNESDAY. AFTER A 
BRIEF BOUT OF RIDGING ON THURSDAY...ANOTHER BROAD UPPER-TROUGH WILL 
SWING FROM THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO THE AREA LATE FRIDAY 
INTO SATURDAY...BRINGING SOME DECENT CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION AND 
SOME COOLER TEMPERATURES HEADING INTO THIS WEEKEND.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1038 PM EST SAT DEC 13 2014

.DISCUSSION...CLOUDS HAVE BEEN SLOW TO INCREASE TONIGHT ACROSS
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND EAST TENNESSEE AND TEMPERATURES HAVE FALLEN
FASTER INTO THE MID 20S TO MID 30S ACROSS THE REGION. PATCHY FOG
HAS DEVELOPED IN A FEW SPOTS BUT THE MAIN CONCERN IS LIGHT DRIZZLE
OR FREEZING DRIZZLE DEVELOPING. WITH TEMPERATURES STILL IN THE MID
30S NORTHERN PLATEAU AND WARMER TEMPERATURES FARTHER NORTH IN KY
THIS AREA MAY NOT FALL ANYMORE AND MAY ONLY HAVE DRIZZLE.

FARTHER SOUTH TEMPERATURES ARE COLDER AS CLOUDS HAVE STAYED TO THE
WEST. NAM MODEL SHOWS 925 MB MOISTURE MOVING SOUTH TO ABOUT
INTERSTATE 40 AND ORIENTED EAST TO WEST. THE OTHER SHORT RANGE
MODELS ORIENT THE MOISTURE FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST AND THE
HIGHEST RH VALUES ONLY COVERS THE NORTHERN PLATEAU ANS SW VA. WILL
KEEP THREAT FOR DRIZZLE AND FREEZING DRIZZLE SW VA AND NE TN WHERE
TEMPERATURES ARE AT OR BELOW FREEZING AND ELSEWHERE CHANGED WORDING
TO BECOMING MOSTLY CLOUDY. TEMPERATURES IN MOST AREAS SHOULD BE
STEADY OR MAY EVEN RISE AS CLOUDS MOVE IN. NOT SURE IF FREEZING
DRIZZLE WILL AFFECT MANY AREAS SO WILL NOT ISSUE SPS BUT HAZARD IS
ADDRESSED IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK.

FXUS64 KMRX 132004
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
304 PM EST SAT DEC 13 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...FORECAST FOR TONIGHT AND
SUNDAY WILL BE HEAVILY INFLUENCED BY HOW FAR SE THE LOW CLOUD
LAYER MOVES AFTER SUNSET. THE NAM AND RAP MODELS DEPICTION OF 925
MB RH CLOSELY RESEMBLED SATELLITE PICS THIS AFTERNOON...AND WAS
CLOSELY FOLLOWED FOR GUIDANCE TONIGHT. ONLY MINOR TWEAKS IN GENERAL
AS PREVIOUS GRIDS TOOK THE BROKEN TO OVERCAST CLOUD LAYER TO ALL
BUT EXTREME SRN VALLEY COUNTIES OF SE TN AND SW NC. NO PATCHY FOG
NEAR LAKES AND STREAMS...BUT I DID ADD A VERY LOW POP FOR PATCHY
LIGHT RAIN...DRIZZLE OR FREEZING DRIZZLE TO SW VA AND PARTS OF NE
TN. THIS MESHES WELL WITH OUR NWS NEIGHBORS...AND WILL BE ADDED TO
THE AFTERNOON HWO PRODUCT.

THOSE CLOUDS SHOULD ERODE DURING THE LATE MORNING AND AFTERNOON
SUNDAY...BUT COULD LINGER AT LEAST PARTLY CLOUDY FOR SW VA AND NE
TN WELL INTO EARLY SUNDAY NIGHT. THESE CLOUDS EXIT MONDAY JUST
BEFORE CLOUDS ADVANCE FROM THE WEST WITH THE APPROACH OF THE
CENTRAL PLAINS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. GFS/ECMWF/SREF ALL INDICATE NOT
MUCH CHANCE OF ANY PRECIPITATION UNTIL VERY LATE MONDAY AFTERNOON
FOR OUR WRN MOST COUNTIES. THUS...I FAVORED THE MILDER GFS MAXES
MONDAY AS NAM MOS MAXES CONTINUE TO BE ON THE COOL SIDE WITH LITTLE
SUPPORT. 


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MID LATITUDE CYCLONE 
MOVES ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
TUESDAY NIGHT GENERATING SHOWERS. AS THE SYSTEM IS DEPARTING TUESDAY 
NIGHT ENOUGH COLD AIR WILL HAVE BUILT INTO THE FORECAST AREA FOR A 
COUPLE SNOW FLURRIES IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. THE RETURNING ZONAL CONFIGURATION ALLOWS 
FOR A DRY WEDNESDAY HOWEVER WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY SLIDING ACROSS 
THE MID SOUTH MAY LEAD TO THE POSSIBILITY OF A SHOWER ON THURSDAY. 
BETTER RAIN CHANCES WILL BE BACK IN THE PICTURE FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY 
WITH GOOD CHANCE TO LIKELY POPS. THERE ARE MODEL DIFFERENCES WITH 
THIS SYSTEM WITH THE ECMWF COLDER AND DEEPER WITH A LITTLE BETTER 
CHANCE OF SOME FROZEN PRECIPITATION WHILE THE GFS IS MORE 
PROGRESSIVE AND WARMER DURING THIS END OF WEEK PERIOD. WILL AWAIT 
FUTURE MODEL DEPICTION OF THIS PERIOD FOR FORECAST FINE TUNING.

FXUS64 KMRX 130825
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EST SAT DEC 13 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MAIN FORECAST CONCERN IS COVERAGE
OF LOW CLOUDS TODAY. NAM MODEL SEEMS TO HANDLE THE LOCATION AND
EXTENT OF THE CLOUDS INITIALLY. VERY STRONG LOW-LEVEL INVERSION
WILL KEEP CLOUDS FROM MIXING OUT AS IT MOVES SOUTHEAST INTO THE
NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. 

MAX TEMPERATURE FORECAST TODAY WILL BE VERY TRICKY AND DEPEND ON
HOW FAST CLOUDS MOVE INTO THE AREA. FOR THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE
AREA...GENERALLY TRENDED TOWARD THE COOLER NAM MOS. FOR TONIGHT
LOWS...GENERALLY WENT A DEGREE OR TWO MILDER DUE TO THE CLOUDS.

.LONG TERM /SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY/... MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW A STEEP 
INVERSION PERSISTING UNDERNEATH A HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE ON SUNDAY. 
THIS WILL LIKELY KEEP ANY LINGERING LOW STRATUS ACROSS THE NORTHERN 
HALF OF THE AREA THROUGH THE MORNING AND PERHAPS THROUGH MOST OF THE 
DAY AT KTRI AND POINTS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND ALONG THE 
KENTUCKY BORDER. THIS WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES A BIT LOWER IN THESE 
LOCATIONS IN THE LOWER TO PERHAPS MID 40S. HOWEVER...SOME EROSION OF 
THIS SHIELD WILL OCCUR ACROSS THE SOUTHERN/CENTRAL VALLEY AND ALLOW 
HEATING TO WARM TEMPERATURES INTO THE LOW TO MID 50S. 

WINDS WILL VEER TO THE SOUTHEAST SUNDAY NIGHT AS A COLD FRONT 
APPROACHES FROM THE WEST ON MONDAY. THESE WINDS WILL ALLOW FOR AN 
EVEN WARMER DAY AREAWIDE ON MONDAY WITH HIGHS IN THE 55 TO 60 DEGREE 
RANGE. SOME SCATTERED RAIN SHOWERS WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION MONDAY 
NIGHT INTO TUESDAY WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE...BUT LIMITED MOISTURE 
WILL PREVENT THINGS FROM BECOMING TOO WIDESPREAD. AFTER ANOTHER SHOT 
OF COOLER AIR...A RETURN TO ZONAL FLOW ALOFT AND EVEN SOME WEAK 
RIDGING BY THE END OF THE WEEK SHOULD PROMOTE A WARM-UP /ALONG WITH 
PARTLY SUNNY/DRY WEATHER FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. ANOTHER WEAK 
TROUGH PASSAGE LATE FRIDAY AFTERNOON INTO FRIDAY NIGHT WILL THEN 
BRING ANOTHER ROUND OF SCATTERED SHOWERS TO THE REGION TO BEGIN THE 
WEEKEND.

911 
FXUS64 KMRX 122003
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
303 PM EST FRI DEC 12 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TOMORROW)
QUIET WEATHER WILL BE THE STORY IN THE SHORT TERM. BIGGEST HICCUP
IN THE FORECAST WAS NAM GUIDANCE COMING IN MUCH COOLER THAN THE GFS
WHEN IT COMES TO HIGH TEMPS ON SATURDAY. THE NAM WANTS TO KEEP THE
BOUNDARY LAYER NEARLY SATURATED THROUGHOUT THE DAY AND WANTS TO
KEEP TEMPS DOWN DUE TO THIS. NAM TRIED TO DO SOMETHING SIMILAR
EARLY THIS WEEK WHEN IT LINGERED IN POPS MUCH LONGER THAN THEY
ACTUALLY OCCURRED. BELIEVE THE NAM IS WAY OFF DUE TO THE FACT THAT
THERE WONT BE ANY MOISTURE TO WORK WITH THAT WOULD ALLOW ANY POP
CHANCES OR EVEN LOW LEVEL CLOUDS ON SATURDAY. THEREFORE HAVE GONE
CLOSER TO THE WARMER AND SUNNIER GFS MOS GUIDANCE THROUGH SATURDAY.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER RIDGE PUSHES EAST 
TO ACROSS THE ERN 1/3RD OF THE NATION SUNDAY...BEFORE GIVING WAY TO 
THE CUTOFF GENERALLY WEAK UPPER LOW COMING OUT OF THE CENTRAL 
PLAINS. THE ASSOCIATED LARGE SURFACE RIDGE SHOULD HELP KEEP OUR 
WEATHER DRY THROUGH LATE MONDAY...CLOSE TO PREVIOUS TIMING IN GRIDS. 
STAYED BELOW LIKELY POPS FOR NOW SINCE THE UPPER LOW TRACKS QUITE 
FAR TO OUR NORTH. BEST CHANCE FOR POPS SHOULD BE MONDAY NIGHT...
ALTHO POPS REMAIN OUT TO TUESDAY EVENING.

THIS SYSTEM IS FOLLOWED BY MORE UPPER RIDGING OUT TO THURSDAY. ECMWF 
AND GFS START TO DIFFER SIGNIFICANTLY BY THURSDAY WITH SOME HINTS OF 
A SRN STREAM SHORTWAVE AND ISENTROPIC LIFT POSSIBLE BY THURSDAY 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. WENT WITH THE BLENDED POPS AND KEPT PCPN TYPE AS 
RAIN SHOWERS FOR NOW. 

SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS TO GRIDS WERE MOSTLY TO ADD A BIT MORE SKY COVER 
SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY...FOR MID AND HIGH CLOUDS WHICH MAY STAY 
TO OUR NORTH. OTHERWISE...FOR TEMPS WE FAVORED THE MILDER GFS MAXES 
FOR THE WEEKEND...WITH ONLY BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE EXPECTED WHICH 
SHOULD EASILY MIX OUT TO GIVE WAY TO PLENTY OF SUNSHINE. 850 MB 
TEMPS WARMING TO OUR WEST OVER MIDDLE TN SUNDAY SHOULD HELP CHA WARM 
WELL INTO THE 50S. DAYS 4-7 MOS BLENDED TEMPS LOOKED GOOD AND WERE
CLOSELY FOLLOWED. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

304 AM EST FRI DEC 12 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOW DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS ACROSS

EARLY THIS MORNING. PATCHY STEAM FOG IS POSSIBLE NEAR AREA
LAKES/STREAMS THROUGH 9 AM...SO WILL INCLUDE PATCHY FOG.

RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD
INTO THE AREA PRODUCING COLD NIGHTS AND MILDER DAYS. GENERALLY
FOLLOWED COLDER MINS AND COMPROMISE ON MAX TEMPERATURE.

.LONG TERM /SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY/... THE UPPER-LOW OVER THE 
NORTHEASTERN UNITED STATES WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE AWAY FROM THE 
AREA...RESULTING IN AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE AXIS MOVING OVER THE REGION 
FOR THE WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. THIS WILL PROMOTE MOSTLY TO 
PARTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS AND A WARMING TREND AS HIGHS CLIMB WELL INTO 
THE 50S. A NEGATIVELY-TITLED TROUGH WILL TRACK INTO THE OHIO VALLEY 
MONDAY EVENING...SENDING A WEAK COLD FRONT THROUGH THE REGION EARLY 
TUESDAY. MODELS CONTINUE TO INDICATE LIMITED MOISTURE WITH THIS 
FRONTAL PASSAGE...AND THUS ANY ASSOCIATED PRECIPITATION BEING MORE 
ALONG THE LINES OF ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SHOWER ACTIVITY. BEHIND 
THIS FRONTAL PASSAGE...A BRIEF BOUT OF COOLER AIR WILL MOVE INTO THE 
REGION FOR THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK. HOWEVER...A RETURN TO ZONAL FLOW 
ALOFT AND EVEN SOME WEAK RIDGING BY THE END OF THE WEEK SHOULD 
PROMOTE A WARM-UP /ALONG WITH MOSTLY SUNNY/DRY WEATHER TO CLOSE OUT 
THE FORECAST PERIOD/.

NEAR TO ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES. THIS COULD EVEN CONTINUE INTO 
MONDAY SO LEFT POPS RATHER LOW WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF A SHOWER 
DEVELOPING AHEAD OF THE NEXT SHORT WAVE WHICH IS DUE IN THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. POPS WERE FORECAST AT 
THEIR HIGHEST DURING THIS PERIOD WITH A GRADUAL DECREASE WITH THE 
DEPARTURE OF THE SYSTEM TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. THE REMAINDER 
OF WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY WAS LEFT DRY WHILE AWAITING WARM AND 
MOIST ADVECTION FROM A LATE WEEK SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE.

INITIALLY CUT OFF OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS...THEN SHOULD BEGIN TO
AFFECT THE SRN APPALACHIANS BY MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY.

KEPT THE HIGHEST POPS LOCKED IN FOR MONDAY NIGHT WITH SOLID CHANCE 
POPS AND SCATTERED WORDING FOR TUESDAY. KEPT SOME LOW POPS IN FOR 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...DUE TO CYCLONIC FLOW ALOFT AND NW LOW 
LEVEL FLOW WHICH SHOULD CAUSE SOME LINGERING LOW LEVEL MOISTURE. 

FOR TEMPS...A VERY LARGE SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE SHOULD KEEP 
OUR REGION UNDER WEAK N-NE SURFACE TO LOW LEVEL FLOW THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND...SO TEMPS WILL SEE JUST A GRADUAL WARM-UP. STRAYED JUST 
ABOVE THE MODEL BLEND FOR MONDAY WHICH WILL BE THE WARMEST DAY... 
POSSIBLY TOPPING THE 60 DEGREE MARK OVER SRN AREAS. A COOL DOWN BY 
WEDNESDAY ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE EXITING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
424 AM EST WED DEC 10 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SKIES HAVE REMAINED MOSTLY
CLOUDY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT. LOW CLOUDS ARE TRAPPED
NEAR THE SURFACE WITH NW FLOW BRINGING THEM DOWN FROM THE GREAT
LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY. SOME LIGHT DRIZZLE AND SNOW FLURRIES AND
SNOW SHOWERS ARE OCCURRING ACROSS NORTHERN TN AND SOUTHWEST VA THIS
MORNING. THERE IS ALSO SOME POSSIBLE FREEZING DRIZZLE OCCURRING AT
ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET IN THE MOUNTAINS. TEMPERATURES IN THE
LOWER ELEVATIONS DID NOT FALL AS LOW AS EXPECTED SO MAINLY DRIZZLE
AND LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS IS FALLING BELOW 2500 FEET. AREA RADARS ARE
SHOWING WEAK RETURNS MOVING SOUTH TO SOUTHEAST IN MEAN UPPER FLOW.
DEEP SURFACE LOW HAS MOVED OFF THE EAST COAST AND UPPER TROUGH IS
OVER THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE COUNTRY WITH A SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE
AREA CENTERED OVER THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES AND CANADA MOVING SOUTH
INTO THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY.

SHORT RANGE MODELS SHOW THIS PATTERN TO CONTINUE THIS MORNING WITH
SOME DRYING BY THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS SE TWO THIRDS OF THE FORECAST
AREA. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL STAY TRAPPED FROM ABOUT KNOXVILLE OR
MORRISTOWN NORTH AS SOUNDINGS SHOW INVERSION THROUGH MUCH OF THE
DAY. EXPECTING PRECIPITATION TO END THIS AFTERNOON BUT MAY CONTINUE
A LITTLE LONGER NE AND EASTERN TN MOUNTAINS. SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS
SHOULD BE VERY LIGHT. WILL UPDATE SPS TO TALK ABOUT THE CHANCE FOR
WINTER PRECIPITATION...SNOW SHOWERS AND FREEZING DRIZZLE BUT MOSTLY
ABOVE 2500 FEET AND EMPHASIZE THE LIGHT AMOUNTS THAT COULD STILL
AFFECT HIGHER ELEVATION ROADS. KEPT HIGH TEMPERATURES CLOSER TO MET
GUIDANCES LOWER NUMBERS. ELEVATIONS OF 2500 FEET AND HIGHER WILL
LIKELY STAY MID 30S OR COLDER WITH HIGHS ELSEWHERE UPPER 30S TO MID
40S. TONIGHT SKIES SHOULD CLEAR BUT MAY BE LATE NE SECTIONS DUE TO
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND INVERSION. LOWS DROP TO THE 20S TO NEAR
30...BUT TEENS HIGHEST ELEVATIONS.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE
INTO THE SOUTHEAST U.S. THROUGH THE WEEKEND. DRY CONDITIONS WITH
ABOVE NORMAL DAT TIME TEMPERATURES.

A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL MOVE INTO THE MID MS VALLEY ON MONDAY. 
THE LOW WILL TRACK THROUGH THE TN VALLEY ON TUESDAY. MODELS MAY BE A 
LITTLE FAST WITH THE SYSTEM. THE CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION BEGINS 
MONDAY EVENING AND CONTINUES THROUGH TUESDAY. A MILD COOL DOWN 
BEGINS ON WEDNESDAY.

PRODUCE VERY LIGHT SHOWERS/DRIZZLE OVER SOUTHEAST KENTUCKY. WILL
CONTINUE MENTION OF LIGHT SNOW/DRIZZLE/FREEZING DRIZZLE AND
POSSIBLY SLEET THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING ACROSS MUCH OF THE

PER GOING SPS.

LATEST NAM/GFS SHOW LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE REMAINING OVER THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS THROUGH THURSDAY. THE LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE IS TRAPPED
UNDER A FAIRLY STRONG INVERSION...SO SKIES WILL LIKELY REMAIN
CLOUDY OVER MOST OF THE AREA THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING.

HAVE A GOOD NIGHT.

&&


350 
FXUS64 KMRX 091930
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EST TUE DEC 9 2014

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY/...
THE BASE OF AN UPPER-TROUGH IS MOVING THROUGH THE REGION THIS
AFTERNOON...BRINGING CLOUD COVER...LIGHT PRECIPITATION AND A
COLDER AIR MASS INTO THE AREA. AS SYNOPTIC LIFT HAS INCREASED OVER
THE COURSE OF THE DAY...THESE LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS HAVE INCREASED IN
COVERAGE IN THE VALLEYS. DUE TO THE COLDER AIR ALOFT...LIGHT SNOW
AND PERHAPS EVEN SOME LIGHT SLEET IS FALLING OVER THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS OF THE GREAT SMOKY MOUNTAINS ABOVE 2500 FT. THIS
PRECIPITATION WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE AFTERNOON
AND EVENING...BEFORE GRADUALLY TAPERING OFF BY DAYBREAK AS LIFT
DECREASES. GIVEN THE SOMEWHAT LIMITED MOISTURE...AM NOT EXPECTING
ANY HIGH QPF TOTALS. MOST LOCATIONS ABOVE 2500 FT SHOULD ONLY
RECEIVE A DUSTING TO PERHAPS AN INCH OF SNOW BY WEDNESDAY /WITH THE
HIGHEST PEAKS ABOVE 5000 FT GETTING 2 OR 3 INCHES/.

HOWEVER...THE PRIMARY CONCERN WILL CONTINUE TO BE THE THREAT FOR
FREEZING DRIZZLE TO FALL LATER TONIGHT ON THE BACKSIDE OF THE LOW
AS COLD AIR FILTERS INTO THE SURFACE. MODEL SOUNDINGS AT KTRI LATE
TONIGHT BETWEEN 06-12Z SHOW CLOUD SEEDING OCCURRING AT AROUND -6C
WHICH WOULD INDICATE MORE OF A THREAT FOR FREEZING DRIZZLE THAN
SNOW. THIS PROFILE WILL BE COMMON ACROSS VALLEY LOCATIONS OF
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA /AND PERHAPS AS FAR
SOUTH AND WEST AS THE KNOXVILLE METRO/ LATE TONIGHT THRU WEDNESDAY
MORNING. GIVEN THE LIGHT QPF AMOUNTS...ANY ICING WOULD ONLY AMOUNT
TO A GLAZE...BUT EVEN A LITTLE BLACK ICE COULD STILL LEAD TO SOME
SLIPPERY ROADS DURING THE MORNING COMMUTE SHOULD THE SURFACE
TEMPERATURE SLIP BELOW FREEZING. GIVEN THIS...WILL ISSUE A SPECIAL
WEATHER STATEMENT FOR THE AFOREMENTIONED LOCATIONS AND THE HIGHER
TERRAIN FOR LATE TONIGHT.

OTHERWISE...PRECIPITATION WILL WANE AFTER SUNRISE AS THE SYSTEM
TRACKS EAST. HOWEVER...MODEL SOUNDINGS CONTINUE TO INDICATE THE LOW
STRATUS HANGING ON THROUGH THE EARLY AFTERNOON ACROSS MUCH OF THE
AREA /AND ALL DAY OVER THE NORTHEAST ZONES/. GIVEN THIS...ALONG
WITH THE NORTHWEST FLOW COLD AIR ADVECTION...LOWERED HIGH
TEMPERATURES A COUPLE OF DEGREES INTO THE UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S
AGAIN. DRY CONDITIONS WILL BE THE NORM BY THE AFTERNOON....WITH
SOME PARTIAL SUNSHINE OCCURRING IN THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY. 

.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY/...
A DRY FORECAST WILL BE CONTINUED FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH
MONDAY AS A HIGH AMPLITUDE RIDGE MOVES FROM THE PLAINS TO THE EAST
COAST. A GRADUAL WARMING TREND CAN BE EXPECTED EACH DAY...PEAKING
IN THE MID-UPPER 50S BY MONDAY. THERE IS A 500 MB VORT MAX THAT THE
MODELS TRACK ACROSS NRN AL/GA WEDNESDAY NIGHT...BUT THIS SHOULD
HAVE LITTLE IMPACT AS FORECAST SOUNDINGS ARE VERY DRY ALOFT.

THE NEXT CHANCE FOR PRECIP WILL BE MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. THE GFS 
HAS NOT BEEN CONSISTENT WITH THIS SYSTEM...SWITCHING FROM A CLOSED 
LOW TO AN OPEN WAVE...AND SO THE ECMWF SOLUTION OF MAINTAINING A 
SLOWER CLOSED LOW IS PREFERRED. IT TRACKS THE UPPER LOW FROM OK/AR
ON MONDAY DUE EAST TO DIRECTLY OVER OUR AREA ON TUESDAY. WILL
CONTINUE THE PREVIOUS FORECAST OF CHANCE POPS ARRIVING MONDAY
EVENING...AND CONTINUE THAT CHANCE INTO TUESDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             33  44  30  48 /  10   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  32  41  27  45 /  20  10   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       34  41  28  46 /  20  10   0   0

815 
FXUS64 KMRX 091505 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1005 AM EST TUE DEC 9 2014

.DISCUSSION...
THE BASE OF AN UPPER-TROUGH IS SWINGING THROUGH THE REGION LATE
THIS MORNING AND EARLY AFTERNOON...BRINGING WITH IT SOME COLDER AIR
INTO THE REGION. THE SYNOPTIC LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS
SYSTEM...COMBINED WITH THE MOISTURE IN PLACE HAVE GENERATED LIGHT
SHOWERS AND WIDESPREAD LOW CLOUD COVER ACROSS THE REGION THIS
MORNING. MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW THESE SHOWERS EXPANDING AS
SYNOPTIC LIFT INCREASES THIS AFTERNOON. AT THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS
/ESPECIALLY ABOVE 2500-3000 FT/...THIS RAIN WILL FALL AS LIGHT
SNOW. THOUGH AM NOT EXPECTING MUCH IN THE WAY OF ACCUMULATION .A
LIGHT DUSTING WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THESE AREAS THRU 00Z...AND
PERHAPS AROUND AN INCH AT THE VERY TOP OF THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS ABOVE
5000 FT. THE CLOUD COVER AND DEWPOINTS IN THE UPPER 30S WILL
PREVENT TEMPERATURES FROM CLIMBING MUCH...AND SO VALLEY LOCATIONS
WILL REMAIN IN THE 38-42 DEGREE RANGE FOR MOST OF THE DAY...
RESULTING IN JUST LIGHT RAIN FALLING. LATER IN THE EVENING BEHIND
THE WEAK FRONT...COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL BEGIN AND ALLOW FOR SOME
LIGHT RAIN/SNOW AND PREHAPS FREEZING DRIZZLE TO FALL IN THE VALLEYS
OVERNIGHT. A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT FOR BLACK ICE WILL LIKELY BE
NEEDED BY THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE OVERNIGHT/EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING
PERIOD.

&&

411 AM EST TUE DEC 9 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER TROUGH SWINGS THROUGH THE

AFTERNOON. H85 TEMPERATURES WILL FALL TO NEAR -5C AND FREEZING LEVEL 
DROPS TO NEAR 1500 FEET BY EARLY THIS EVENING. FREEZING TEMPERATURES 
AREAWIDE OVERNIGHT. AVAILABLE MOISTURE IS LIMITED TO BELOW H70. 
SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA FAVORING NORTHERN AREAS. 
PRECIPITATION TYPE WILL BE MAINLY LIQUID WITH MOISTURE CONFINED TO 
BELOW SNOW GROWTH REGION. RAIN MAY BECOME MIXED WITH SNOW WITH 
FREEZING DRIZZLE ALSO POSSIBLE.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...NW FLOW WITH DEPARTING
UPPER LOW WEDNESDAY PRODUCES A FEW SNOW SHOWERS IN THE NE AND
MOUNTAINS. COLD HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD SOUTH FROM THE NORTHERN MS
VALLEY KEEPING TEMPERATURES COOL TO COLD BUT ALLOWING SKIES TO
CLEAR. TEMPERATURES WILL DROP INTO THE 20S THURSDAY MORNING AS
SURFACE HIGH SETTLES OVERHEAD. THE COLDEST NIGHT WILL LIKELY BE
FRIDAY...IN THE 20S AGAIN AND THEN A SLOW WARMING TREND THROUGH
THE WEEKEND. RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT
CONTINUES THROUGH SUNDAY TO CONTINUE THE TREND OF MOSTLY CLEAR
SKIES. MONDAY SURFACE LOW MOVES OUT OF THE SOUTHERN PLAINS INTO
THE LOWER MS VALLEY. CLOUDS WILL INCREASE BUT RAIN SHOULD HOLD OFF
UNTIL MONDAY NIGHT AS A COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA
THEN.

965 
FXUS64 KMRX 081934
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
234 PM EST MON DEC 8 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...
MOST EXCITEMENT FOR THE SHORT TERM WILL START IN THE EARLY PARTS
OF TUESDAY MORNING. NORTHWEST FLOW SETS UP OVER THE AREA WHICH
USUALLY LEADS TO SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF
THE CWA. CURRENTLY THINK THE BEST TIME FOR THE ONSET OF SNOW SHOWERS
TO BE EARLY TOMORROW MORNING. LOOKING AT CROSS SECTIONS THE
MOISTURE IS CONFINED TO THE VERY LOW LEVELS SO AT THIS TIME DO NOT
THINK THAT ACCUMULATIONS WILL AMOUNT TO MUCH. SO AT THIS TIME WILL
NOT ISSUE ANY SORT OF ADVISORY SINCE SNOWFALL AMOUNTS SHOULD REMAIN
WELL BELOW ADVISORY LEVELS EVEN IN THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS. ALSO
SINCE IT IS A WEAK NORTHWEST FLOW EVENT HAVE ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE
POPS AS YOU MOVE IN TOWARDS THE VALLEY, IN ADDITION TEMPS SHOULD
REMAIN WARM ENOUGH IN THE VALLEY THAT IF ANYTHING DOES HAPPEN TO
FALL IT SHOULD REMAIN ALL LIQUID EVEN AFTER A COLD FRONT MOVES
THROUGH THE AREA ON TUESDAY AND KNOCKS BACK HIGH TEMPS ABOUT 5
DEGREES.


.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
SNOW SHOWERS GENERATED BY THE NORTHWEST FLOW AND SOME STEEP LOW
LEVEL LAPSE RATES MAY CONTINUE THROUGH WEDNESDAY. WITH
STABILIZATION AFTER SUNSET...ANY ACTIVITY SHOULD END IN THE
EVENING. WILL HAVE ONLY A FEW TENTHS OF AN INCH ACCUMULATION
THROUGH WEDNESDAY IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

THE REMAINDER OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD WILL BE DRY...WITH 
TEMPERATURES WARMING EACH DAY. A CLOSED LOW WILL BE PULLING AWAY 
OVER THE NORTHEAST WHILE A LARGE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE BUILDS IN FROM 
THE WEST. THE PERIOD WILL START OFF COLD WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 30S 
TO MID 40S WEDNESDAY...BUT BY THE WEEKEND HIGHS WILL BE WELL INTO 
THE 50S. THE GFS AND ECMWF BOTH SHOW A CLOSED LOW TRACKING ACROSS 
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND LOWER MS VALLEY ON MONDAY...BUT THE 12Z GFS 
HAS TRENDED SLOWER THAN PREVIOUS RUNS...SO ANY PRECIP APPEARS TO 
HOLD OFF UNTIL AFTER THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

&&

HIGH CLOUDS WILL INCREASE SUNDAY AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT APPROACHING
THE REGION.


.LONG TERM /MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY/...

ANOTHER WEAK SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA LATE MONDAY NIGHT 
INTO TUESDAY...BRINGING SOME CHANCES FOR SOME ISOLATED TO SCATTERED 
LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS ACROSS THE VALLEY DURING THE DAY. ANOTHER SHOT OF 
COLD AIR BEHIND A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE IN BY THE AFTERNOON AND  
EVENING...WHICH WILL RESULT IN SOME LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS ALONG THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN /ALONG WITH SUBFREEZING TEMPERATURES OVERNIGHT/. 
MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED...BUT SOME SYNOPTIC LIFT WILL ALLOW FOR 
SOME LIGHT QPF TOTALS ACROSS THE REGION. THE COOL AIR MASS WILL 
RESULT IN HIGH TEMPERATURES IN THE LOW TO MID 40S ON WEDNESDAY...BUT 
A BUILDING HIGH PRESSURE AREA SHOULD RESULT IN A WARMING TREND INTO 
THE 50S...AND PERHAPS CLOSE TO 60 DEGREES BY THE WEEKEND. THIS 
SHOULD ALSO BE A PROLONGED PERIOD OF MOSTLY SUNNY AND DRY 
WEATHER...WITH MINIMAL PRECIPITATION CHANCES THROUGH THE END OF THE 
UPCOMING WEEKEND.

TRANSITION TO LIGHT SNOW MAINLY OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN FOR THE REST OF THE EXTEND FOR A RETURN TO DRY CONDITIONS 
AND NEAR SEASONAL TEMPERATURES.

235 PM EST FRI DEC 5 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...SOUTHWESTERLY LOW LEVEL JET 
WILL INCREASE TONIGHT AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING WEAK COLD 
FRONT...BRINGING ADDITIONAL MOISTURE TO THE AREA. BEST FORCING WILL 
BE LATER TONIGHT AND FIRST HALF OF SATURDAY. RAIN WILL INCREASE FROM 
WEST TO EAST ACROSS THE AREA OVERNIGHT...WITH ALL AREAS EXPECTED TO 
HAVE RAIN BY LATE TONIGHT.  THE RAIN WILL BEGIN TO DIMINISH FROM 
WEST TO EAST SATURDAY AFTERNOON AS THE UPPER TROUGH DIGS IN AND THE 
COLD FRONT PUSHES THROUGH.  WILL HAVE POPS AT OR NEAR 100 PERCENT 
BOTH PERIODS. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL FOR THE SHORT 
TERM.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...BEHIND THE COLD
FRONT/UPPER-TROUGH THAT WILL SWING THROUGH THE REGION ON
SATURDAY...DRY AIR WILL QUICKLY FILTER IN FROM THE NORTH AND WEST
AS A SURFACE HIGH BRIEFLY MOVES IN. THIS WILL TAPER OFF
PRECIPIATION FROM WEST TO EAST OVER THE COURSE OF THE
EVENING...WITH ONLY ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SHOWERS LINGERING ALONG
THE MOUNTAINS AFTER MIDNIGHT. CLOUD COVER MAY LINGER THROUGH THE
MORNING ON SUNDAY...BUT BY MIDDAY CLEAR CONDITIONS WILL
PREVAIL...ALLOWING TEMPERATURES TO CLIMB BACK INTO THE LOWER 50S IN
MOST SPOTS. ANOTHER WEAK SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA LATE
MONDAY INTO MONDAY NIGHT...BRINGING SOME CHANCES FOR ISOALTED TO
SCATTERED SHOWERS MAINLY ALONG THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWEST
VA. MOISTURE HAS BEEN PROGGED TO BE SOMEWHAT LIMITED...BUT THE NAM
DOES INDICATE SOME SLIGHTLY DEEPER MOISTURE WHICH COULD ALLOW FOR
SOME BETTER COVERAGE INTO THE VALLEY MONDAY NIGHT...SO WILL
CONTINUE TO WATCH TO SEE IF THIS TREND CONTINUES. OTHERWISE...A
BROAD HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM LOOKS AS IF IT WILL BUILD INTO THE
REGION FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WORK WEEK /AND PREHAPS EVEN INTO
THE FOLLOWING WEEKEND/...PROMOTING MOSTLY SUNNY AND DRY CONDITIONS
WITH SEASONABLE HIGH TEMPERATURES.

FLOW SHOWER/SNOW SHOWER ACTIVITY ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN... BUT
LIMITED MOISTURE WILL KEEP POPS LOW. DRY WEATHER WILL LIKELY

OCCURRING ALOFT.

FOR SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY...WILL MAKE FEW CHANGES TO THESE 
PERIODS. THE GENERAL TREND OF THE GEFS MEAN SHOWING DRIER AND COOLER

CENTRAL STATES AND MOVES EAST INTO THE TN VALLEY. LIGHT RAIN AGAIN 
BECOMES LIKELY IN THE MOIST SW FLOW. RAINFALL AMOUNTS WILL BE LIGHT 
WITH MORE SIGNIFICANT RAIN TO THE WEST OVER THE MS VALLEY FRIDAY. AS 
SURFACE LOW AND FRONT SHIFT EAST FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY RAIN 
INCREASES. MAY HAVE ONE INCH OR MORE OF RAIN BETWEEN FRIDAY NIGHT 
AND SATURDAY. RAIN MOVES EAST SATURDAY NIGHT AND EARLY SUNDAY SO 
EXPECT A DRY SUNDAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE AND PARTLY SUNNY SKIES MOST 
OF THE DAY. TEMPERATURES THURSDAY NIGHT WILL STAY IN THE MILD 40S. 
HIGHS FRIDAY ONCE AGAIN REACH THE 50S TO LOWER 60S. FRIDAY NIGHT 
WARMER WITH MORE RAIN AND COOLER SATURDAY AS MORE STEADY RAIN 
SPREADS IN. SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY TEMPERATURES STAY MILD WITH 
LOWS IN THE 40S AND HIGHS IN THE 50S. 

A FAST MOVING FRONTAL SYSTEM DROPPING OUT OF THE NORTHERN PLAINS 
SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY WILL BRING MORE RAIN INTO THE TN VALLEY LATE 
MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY WILL SEE MUCH 
COOLER TEMPERATURES BEHIND THIS FRONT WITH WEDNESDAY DRY AND THE SUN 
RETURNING.

LIGHT RAIN OR DRIZZLE ACROSS THE REGION THIS MORNING BUT MODEL 
FORECASTS POSITION THIS LIFT MORE TOWARD THE EASTERN SOUTHEAST HALF 
OF THE FORECAST AREA BY AFTERNOON AS THE FRONT SLIPS FURTHER EAST 
TOWARD THE APPALACHIAN SPINE. PERHAPS ANY CHANCE OF RAIN BY LATE 
AFTERNOON INTO THE EARLY EVENING WILL JUST BE ALONG THE MOUNTAINS 
BEFORE ENDING. ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL BE ON THE INCREASE LATER TONIGHT 
AHEAD OF ANOTHER SYSTEM AND PLACED JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR RAIN IN 
ASSOCIATION WITH THIS FEATURE. MILD AIR SHOULD HOLD POSITION OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA AS THE AIR MASS SOURCE REGION CONTINUES OFF THE 
BEAUTIFUL BLUE PACIFIC WATERS. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)... THE MAIN CHANGE TO THE 
FORECAST WILL BE MADE ON THURSDAY. THE NAM AND GFS SHOW ISENTROPIC 
LIFT AND AN INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH OVER THE AREA...PRODUCING LIGHT 
PRECIP THROUGH THE DAY. WILL BRING POPS UP TO HIGH CHANCES 
NORTH...WITH SLIGHT CHANCES SOUTH. THE LIFT MOVES OUT BUT ABUNDANT 
MOISTURE REMAINS INTO THURSDAY NIGHT...SO WILL HAVE LOW TO SLIGHT 
CHANCES THAT PERIOD. SYNOPTIC LIFT INCREASES AGAIN FOR FRIDAY 
THROUGH SATURDAY AS A MORE AMPLIFIED SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVES INTO THE 
MS VALLEY REGION. THE BEST QG FORCING OCCURS SATURDAY...AND WILL 
CONTINUE TO HAVE LIKELY POPS WITH MODERATE RAIN THIS PERIOD. A COLD 
FRONT PASSAGE WILL BRING LOWERING POPS SATURDAY NIGHT. 

SUNDAY LOOKS TO BE DRY AS WE WILL HAVE A SHORTWAVE RIDGE CROSSING THE 
AREA AND SOME DRIER AIR BUILDING IN BEHIND THE FRONT. HOWEVER THIS 
APPEARS TO BE SHORT LIVED AS THE GFS AND ECMWF SHOW A DEEPENING 
UPPER TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN CONUS FOR MONDAY. THEIR DEPICTIONS OF 
THE DETAILS OF PRECIP PLACEMENT AND TIMING ARE DIFFERENT...SO 
CONFIDENCE IS FAIRLY LOW...BUT WILL HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR 
MONDAY...WITH DRIER AND COOLER CONDITIONS FOR TUESDAY.

&&

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...WET AND MILD PATTERN
CONTINUES ACROSS THE EASTERN TN VALLEY. A WEAK COLD FRONT OR
BOUNDARY LIES OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH A BUILDING HIGH JUST EAST

FRONT MOST OF THE DAY WITH LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS AFFECTING MUCH OF THE
AREA. TEMPERATURES HAVE BEEN IN THE 50S TO LOWER 60S AT MID
AFTERNOON EXCEPT 40S EASTERN PART OF SW VA AS COLD AIR DRAINAGE
GETS FUNNELED DOWNSLOPE TOWARDS TENNESSEE. TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY
MOIST PATTERN CONTINUES AS FRONT REMAINS STATIONARY AND MOISTURE
MOVING OVER IT WILL CREATE MORE SHOWERS AS WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY
TRAVELS ALONG IT. NOT MUCH CHANGE TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY WITH LOW
CHANCE POPS SOUTH AND HIGHER NORTHEAST. PATCHY FOG FORMING AGAIN
TONIGHT WITH MOIST ATMOSPHERE. MILD LOWS AGAIN TONIGHT WITH HIGHS
MID 50S TO LOWER 60S AGAIN WEDNESDAY ABOUT THE SAME AS TODAY.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...ZONAL FLOW ALOFT 
CONTINUES FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...THEN A MORE AMPLIFIED SHORT WAVE 
TROUGH WILL BE APPROACHING LATE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. HIGHER 
POPS ADJUSTED SLIGHTLY TO BE MORE IN LINE WITH THIS TIMING. HOWEVER 
PRIOR TO THIS SYSTEM...RAIN CHANCES LOOK QUITE LOW FOR WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT.

KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN FOR MOST AREAS FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY 
NIGHT...BUT UPPER AND SURFACE RIDGING BARELY SUPPORT OUR CURRENT 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS. THE ONLY FORM OF LIFT I COULD SEE DEVELOPING 
WOULD BE EASTERLY UPSLOPE FLOW AROUND THE SURFACE HIGH ACROSS THE 
GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY REGION. LATER SHIFTS MAY BE ABLE TO DROP 
THOSE POPS AND GO DRY...ALTHOUGH MOS POPS HAVE CONSISTENTLY RUN WELL 
ABOVE CLIMO. 

UPPER FLOW LOOKS TO BECOME W-NW FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY BUT ANY SHORT 
WAVE ENERGY COULD BE WELL NORTH OF THE TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. KEPT IN CONTINUITY WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR
MONDAY DUE TO A TRAILING WEAK SURFACE TROUGH OR COLD FRONT. DRY FOR
NOW ON TUESDAY IN LINE WITH THE ECMX MOS POPS AND BLENDED MODEL
GRIDS.

312 AM EST TUE DEC 2 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
THERE IS LITTLE CHANGE TO THE SYNOPTIC SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE 
SHORT TERM...WITH WEAK DISTURBANCES EMBEDDED IN A GENERALLY ZONAL 
FLOW PROVIDING AT LEAST A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN MOST PERIODS. 

TODAY...A FRONT REMAINS STATIONARY OVER SW VA AND THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU...AND THIS WILL PROVIDE SOME WEAK FORCING FOR PRECIP THROUGH 
THE DAY. WHILE RADAR SHOWS LITTLE PRECIP NOW IN THIS AREA...MODELS 
SHOW A LOW DEVELOPING ALONG THE FRONT TODAY THAT WILL BRING A 
RESURGENCE OF SHOWERS. WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS NORTH TODAY...WITH 
CHANCE POPS SOUTH. POPS DECREASE THIS EVENING AS THE LOW LEVEL 
CONVERGENCE WITH THE LOW DIES OUT AND THE BOUNDARY BECOMES MORE 
DIFFUSE. SHALLOW MOISTURE AND WEAK LIFT WILL MEAN LIGHT QPF AND 
LOW/SLIGHT CHANCE POPS CONTINUING THROUGH TONIGHT...WITH CHANCES 
INCREASING SLIGHTLY ON WEDNESDAY WITH THE PASSAGE OF A WEAK 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH. 

WEAK HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING EAST ACROSS KY SHOULD PUSH THE BOUNDARY 
TO OUR EAST AND BRING ENOUGH DRYING TO HAVE A DRY PERIOD WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT. INCREASING ISENTROPIC LIFT AND ANOTHER SERIES OF VORT MAXES 
APPROACHING THE AREA WILL BRING POPS BACK UP ON THURSDAY AND 
THURSDAY NIGHT. UNCERTAINTY REMAINS HIGH FOR THIS PERIOD AS FORCING 
FEATURES ARE SUBTLE AND THE MODELS ARE NOT IN AGREEMENT.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
SHOWERS WILL BE ON THE INCREASE AGAIN FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY WITH
ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH APPROACHING THROUGH THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.
MILD AND MOIST AIR WILL CONTINUE TO SPREAD NORTHEAST AHEAD OF THE
SYSTEM WHICH WILL FEATURE A SURFACE LOW AND FRONTAL BOUNDARY
PASSAGE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON SATURDAY. THEREFORE
POPS WILL BE HIGHEST FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY DUE TO CONVERGENCE
IN THE VICINITY OF THE LOW AND SURFACE COOL FRONT. FORECAST
CONFIDENCE DECREASES BY SUNDAY AND MONDAY WITH MODEL DIVERGENCE
LATE IN THE PERIOD. DROPPED POPS TO SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SUNDAY WITH
INDICATION OF SHORT WAVE RIDGING BEHIND THE DEPARTING UPPER TROUGH.
YET ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH AND SURFACE WAVE BUILD INTO THE EASTERN
STATES ON MONDAY SO TWEAKED THE POPS UP JUST A TAD FOR THE
POSSIBILITY OF A SHOWER HERE. THE GOOD NEWS IS THAT MAX
TEMPERATURES APPEAR TO STAY NEAR OR SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH
THE PERIOD WHILE MINS HOLD SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL WITH
TRAJECTORIES ORIGINATING OFF THE MILD PACIFIC WATERS. &&

UPPER 50S TO LOW 60S ELSEWHERE ACROSS THE CENTRAL/SOUTHERN VALLEYS

TO MOVE SPREAD INTO THE AREA FROM THE WEST. THIS ACTIVITY WILL
CONTINUE TO DO SO OVER THE COURSE OF THE EVENING...WITH THE
HIGHEST CONCENTRATION FAVORING THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE
AREA...ESPECIALLY AFTER 06Z. HAVE INCREASED POPS TO CATEGORICAL
ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA...WITH LIKELY VALUES PREVAILING ELSEWHERE
OVERNIGHT. LATE IN THE NIGHT...THIS PRECIPITATION SHOULD BEGIN TO
WANE /ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE PLATEAU/...BY AROUND 12Z...THOUGH
SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL PERSIST INTO THE DAY TOMORROW. LOW TEMPERATURES
WILL BE DEPENDENT ON HOW FAR SOUTH AND EAST THE FRONT MAKES IT.
BASED ON ITS CURRENT TRAJECTORY...THINK SOME OF THE COOLER AIR WILL
MAKE IT INTO THE PLATEAU...AND THUS LOW TO MID 40S LOWS ARE
WARRANTED THERE. ELSEWHERE TO THE SOUTH AND EAST...CLOUDS WILL HELP
TO KEEP TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY HIGHER IN THE UPPER 40S TO LOWER 50S
RANGE.

TIME.

PREVIOUS GRIDS AND ADJACENT NWS GRIDS...WITH JUST A SLIGHT TWEAK OR 
TWO TO POPS AND/OR TEMPS WHERE NEEDED. MONDAY...NEW DAY 7...WAS

MVFR CIGS ARE EXPECTED THROUGH THE MORNING AT ALL TAF SITES. CIGS
MAY LIFT IN THE AFTERNOON TO VFR...BUT WILL REMAIN BROKEN TO
OVERCAST AT THE VFR/MVFR MARGINS. A FRONT WILL APPROACH FROM THE
NORTHWEST...WHICH WILL BRING RAIN INTO TRI AND TYS TONIGHT. EXPECT
IFR CONDITIONS AT TRI TONIGHT...WITH MVFR AT TYS. CHA IS MORE
UNCERTAIN FOR TONIGHT AS RAIN CHANCES ARE LOWER...BUT WILL MAINTAIN
VFR CONDITIONS THERE FOR NOW.

541 
FXUS64 KMRX 010832
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
332 AM EST MON DEC 1 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
A COLD FRONT WILL BE APPROACHING FROM THE NORTHWEST TODAY...BUT 
STALL ACROSS THE NORTHERN AND WESTERN SECTIONS TONIGHT AS THE UPPER 
SHORTWAVE PASSES WELL NORTH AND THE FLOW ALOFT PARALLELS THE FRONT. 
THIS WILL KEEP THE MAJORITY OF PRECIP THROUGH THE PERIOD ACROSS OUR 
NORTHERN SECTIONS. TODAY...QPF IS EXPECTED TO BE LIGHT IN NORTHERN 
AREAS AS MOISTURE REMAINS QUITE SHALLOW AND LIFT IS WEAK. WILL KEEP 
POPS IN THE CHANCE RANGE UNTIL 00Z WHEN WE SEE MORE LOW LEVEL 
CONVERGENCE COMING IN WITH THE FRONTAL ZONE AND MOISTURE DEPTH 
REACHING ABOVE THE -10C LEVEL. WILL HAVE CATEGORICAL POPS NORTH WITH 
CHANCE POPS SOUTH. THIS CONTINUES INTO TUESDAY MORNING...THEN AN 
UPPER SHORTWAVE TROUGH PASSAGE BRINGS SOME MIDLEVEL DRYING AND LESS 
LIFT BY THE AFTERNOON...LOWERING POPS DOWN INTO THE CHANCE/SLIGHT 
CHANCE RANGE. TEMPERATURES TODAY AND TUESDAY APPEAR TO BE QUITE MILD 
AS WE WILL REMAIN IN THE WARM SECTOR...REACHING THE LOWER TO MID 60S 
IN MOST OF THE VALLEY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY...
THE SHORT VERSION OF THE LONG TERM FORECAST IS WARM, CLOUDY, AND
ON/OFF RAINY.

THE LONG VERSION... MOISTURE AND CHANCES FOR RAIN WILL LINGER AROUND 
ON TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. BOUNDARY THEN HANGS AROUND THE AREA 
THROUGH PRETTY MUCH THE REST OF THE WORK WEEK MAKING THE REMAINDER 
OF THE FORECAST A LITTLE TRICKY ON EXACT TIMING OF PRECIPITATION. 
MODELS ALL AGREE THAT THE BOUNDARY SHOULD BE OVER OR JUST NORTH OF 
US, BUT THE LOCATION OF THE MOISTURE AND BEST LIFT IS NOT WELL 
AGREED UPON. AT THIS POINT BELIEVE PLACES NORTH AND WEST OF OUR CWA 
STAND TO GET BETTER ISENTROPIC LIFT AND SHOULD SEE THE BULK OF THE 
PRECIP THROUGH THE WORK WEEK. IN THE LONG TERM BELIEVE OUR BEST 
CHANCE TO SEE WIDESPREAD MODERATE RAIN MIGHT COME ON SATURDAY ALONG 
THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. TEMPS COULD BE A BIT TRICKY THROUGH THE PERIOD 
WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES, RAIN, AND FRONTAL BOUNDARIES ALL FACTORING 
IN. WE SHOULD REMAIN AT OR ABOVE CLIMATOLOGY THROUGH THE WEEK INTO 
THE WEEKEND. THUNDER MIGHT BE POSSIBLE AT THE LATE PART OF THE WEEK 
INTO THE WEEKEND, BUT DUE TO LOW CONFIDENCE HAVE NOT BROUGHT MENTION 
OF THIS IN THE GRIDS AT THIS POINT.

&&

STILL IN THE MID 50S UNDERNEATH THE CLOUD COVER...WHILE READINGS IN
THE MID TO UPPER 40S ARE COMMON ALONG THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN
VALLEYS WHERE CLEAR CONDITIONS HAVE ALLOWED FOR MORE RADIATIONAL
COOLING. THESE CLOUDS WILL GRADUALLY OVERSPREAD THE AREA OVER THE
COURSE OF THE NIGHT. THOUGH ISENTROPIC LIFT IS WEAK...GIVEN THE
MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER LATE TONIGHT SOME LIGHT DRIZZLE AND FOG
DEVELOPMENT WILL BE POSSIBLE AROUND DAYBERAK. LOWS WILL BE
DEPENDENT ON CLOUD COVER AND RANGE FROM THE LOW 50S ACROSS THE
NORTHERN PLATEAU TO AROUND 40 DEGREES ACROSS FAR SOUTHWEST NORTH
CAROLINA.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 PM EST SUN NOV 30 2014

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT AND MONDAY...
GUSTY SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS UNDER DECREASING CLOUDS HAS BEEN
OCCURRING MUCH OF THE DAY. DAYTIME TEMPERATURES WARMED INTO THE MID
AND UPPER 60S TO NEAR 70 IN THE FOOTHILLS.

LOOK FOR REMAINING CLOUDS TO SLOWLY BREAK UP AND DISSIPATE WITH
WEAKENING WINDS BY SUNSET. HOWEVER CLOUDS WILL MOVE BACK INTO THE
REGION OVERNIGHT. 

MOIST SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL CONTINUE TO AID IN KEEPING MINIMUM
TEMPERATURES WARM. PREFERRED MET GUIDANCE TONIGHT. THE UPPER FLOW
WILL BE NEARLY PARALLEL TO THE SURFACE FLOW. THIS MEANS THE FRONT
WILL OOZE ACROSS MIDDLE TN AND ORIENT ITSELF IN A NE TO SW FASHION
MOVING EVER SO SLOWLY SOUTHEAST. ISENTROPIC UPGLIDE ALONG AND JUST
AHEAD IS WEAK...HOWEVER NEAR SATURATION IN THE LOWER LEVELS OF THE
ATMOSPHERE MAY ALLOW SOME SPRINKLES/DRIZZLE AND PATCHY FOG TO
DEVELOP LATE TONIGHT ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND EXTREME SW VA.
OTHER AREAS MAY SEE PATCHY FOG NEAR SUNRISE. LOOK FOR INCREASING
RAIN CHANCES THROUGH THE DAY ACROSS THE TN VALLEY ALONG THE FRONT.
THE BEST CHANCES FOR MONDAY WILL BE ACROSS SW VA...THE NORTHERN TN
VALLEY AND ALONG THE PLATEAU. DAYTIME TEMPERATURES LOOK TO BE
SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN TODAY DUE TO MORE CLOUD COVER THROUGH THE DAY
BUT OVERALL NOT TOO BAD FOR EARLY DECEMBER.

.LONG TERM...MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY...
THE TIMING OF THE FRONT LOOKS TO BE PUSHED BACK FROM EARLIER MODEL
RUNS. NOW THE MODELS ARE SHOWING EVEN MORE MOISTURE MOVING IN TO
THE AREA LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. THE FRONT WILL SLOWLY MOVE
AWAY BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT...AND THE NEXT DISTURBANCE MOVES THROUGH
LATE WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING. THIS LIFT IS
EXPECTED TO BE A LITTLE FARTHER NORTH...SO HIGHER RAINFALL AMOUNTS
IN THE FORECAST FOR AREAS NORTH OF I-40. AS THIS AREA OF PRECIP
MOVES NORTHEAST OF THE AREA FRIDAY MORNING...ANOTHER WIDESPREAD
AREA OF RAIN IS RIGHT ON ITS HEELS MOVING IN FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH
SATURDAY. MOISTURE LOOKS DECENT WITH EACH SYSTEM MOVING IN...BUT
THE INSTABILITIES AND WIND LOOK MILD. CONFIDENCE IS LOW ON
TIMING...AS MODELS SEEM TO PICK DIFFERENT DAYS FOR RAIN...BUT CAN
EXPECT SCATTERED LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS AND MOSTLY OVERCAST SKIES
THROUGH THE WEEK. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE
NORMAL THROUGH THE EXTENDED.

001 
FXUS64 KMRX 300819
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 AM EST SUN NOV 30 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A THIN AND SHALLOW LAYER OF MOISTURE AROUND 850 MB IS KEEPING A 
BROKEN TO OVERCAST CLOUD DECK OVER THE AREA. THE GFS IS QUICK TO 
ERODE THE CLOUDS THIS MORNING...WHILE THE NAM MAINTAINS IT THROUGH 
MOST OF THE DAY. THE RAP AND HRRR SHOW SOME PARTIAL CLEARING THIS 
AFTERNOON...ESPECIALLY SOUTH AND EAST...AND WILL GO WITH THIS 
SOLUTION. THIS WILL HAVE AN EFFECT ON TEMPERATURES...WITH THE 
COOLEST TEMPS IN THE PLATEAU (UPPER 50S) AND WARMEST IN THE 
FOOTHILLS (MID 60S). AS A COLD FRONT PUSHES TOWARD THE OHIO VALLEY 
TONIGHT...CLOUDS SHOULD BEGIN TO INCREASE AGAIN AFTER MIDNIGHT FROM 
THE NW. MOISTURE REMAINS TOO SHALLOW FOR PRECIP FOR MOST OF THE AREA 
TONIGHT...BUT WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE POP GOING NW IN CASE THE 
ARRIVAL OF PRECIP IS SIMILAR TO THE SREF...WHICH IS A BIT FASTER 
THAN SHOWN BY THE NAM AND GFS.

.LONG TERM...
RELATIVELY ZONAL FLOW WITH A FEW EMBEDDED WEAK SYSTEMS MOVING THROUGH 
THE AREA WILL BE THE STORY IN THE LONG TERM. THE WEAK NATURE OF 
THESE SYSTEMS AND THE MODELS DISCREPANCY IN HANDLING THEM HAS LED TO 
A SLIGHTLY BELOW AVERAGE CONFIDENCE FORECAST IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD, 
ESPECIALLY WHEN IT COMES TO RAIN CHANCES. 

FIRST AND MOST LIKELY BEST CHANCE FOR RAIN WILL COME WITH A COLD 
FRONT MOVING THROUGH...SHOULD ENTER THE NORTHERN PARTS OF THE CWA 
MONDAY EVENING WITH THE BEST CHANCE FOR PRECIP COLLOCATED WITH AND 
JUST NORTH OF THE BOUNDARY. MODELS BEGIN TO HAVE DIFFICULTY WITH 
THIS SYSTEM. SOME ARE HINTING AT SLOWING DOWN THE FRONT AND WASHING 
IT OUT AND HAVING THE AREA QUICKLY RETURN TO S/SW WINDS BY TUESDAY. 
WITH THESE WINDS FUNNELING THROUGH THE VALLEY SOME GUIDANCE WANTS TO 
BRING LOCATIONS IN THE SOUTH TO NEAR 70 DEGREES FOR A HIGH ON 
TUESDAY. HAVE NOT BIT OFF ON THIS SINCE I THINK MODELS MIGHT BE 
OVERDOING THE WARM AIR ADVECTION AND EXPECT INCREASED CLOUDS AND 
POTENTIAL RAIN TO PUT A BIT OF A DAMPER ON THE TEMPS FOR TUESDAY. 
BUT WILL DEFINITELY NEED TO KEEP AN EYE ON TUESDAYS HIGHS ESPECIALLY 
IN THE SOUTH. 

WITH DECENT INFLUXES OF MOISTURE OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE REMAINDER 
OF THE WEEK THERE WILL BE A CHANCE RAIN THROUGH NEARLY THE ENTIRE 
EXTENDED PERIODS OF THE FORECAST. A WEAK BOUNDARY WILL BE IN THE 
AREA ON WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY AND COULD LEAD TO RAIN WHEREVER IT 
DECIDES TO SET UP SHOP. THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A RUMBLE OF 
THUNDER IN THE VICINITY AT THE END OF THE WEEK, HOWEVER NO SEVERE 
WEATHER IS EXPECTED AT THIS TIME.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             63  47  63  46 /   0  10  30  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  62  44  60  44 /   0  10  30  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       60  47  59  44 /   0  10  50  60

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST SAT NOV 29 2014

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT AND SUNDAY... 
STRONG PRESSURE GRADIENT HAS SET UP ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WHICH
HAS CAUSED WINDS IN SOME AREAS TO GUST NEAR 30 MPH. HOWEVER...OTHER
LOCATIONS THAT HAVE THICKER CLOUD COVER HAVE HAD MUCH LOWER WIND
AND WIND GUSTS. LOOK FOR CLOUD COVER TO THIN A LITTLE BEFORE SUNSET
AND THEN FILL BACK IN OVERNIGHT. HIGHEST RH VALUES EXIST BETWEEN
THE BL AND AROUND 925MB...BUT DO NOT SHOW UP IN THE 850MB PROGS.
THE EXTRA CLOUD COVER WILL LIKELY KEEP OVERNIGHT LOW TEMPERATURES
ON THE WARMER SIDE. HAVE OPTED TO STAY CLOSER TO THE MET GUIDANCE
FOR THAT REASON. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SUPPORT CLOUDS LESSON THROUGH
THE DAY SUNDAY. LOW LEVEL WARM ADVECTION WILL PERSIST BRINGING
DAYTIME MAX TEMPERATURES INTO THE 60S. DRY CONDITIONS WILL PERSIST
THROUGH THE DAY SUN.

.LONG TERM...SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY...
CLOUDS AND PRECIP CHANCES WILL INCREASE SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY
MORNING AS A FRONT APPROACHES THE AREA. LIGHT SHOWERS COULD DEVELOP
MONDAY MORNING AHEAD OF THE FRONT MAINLY ALONG THE NORTHERN
PLATEAU...BUT WIDER AREA OF PRECIP LOOKS TO FILL IN THE REST OF THE
CWA MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH.
ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL SET UP BEHIND THE FRONT AS A HIGH PRESSURE
SYSTEM MAKES ITS WAY ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. THIS WILL KEEP
RAIN CHANCES OVER THE AREA FOR TUESDAY AND MOST OF WEDNESDAY. THERE
WILL BE A BREAK WITH THE PRECIP AROUND WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY
AS DRIER AIR MAKES ITS WAY INTO THE MIDLEVELS. BUT THURSDAY NIGHT
THROUGH THE REST OF THE PERIOD...HIGH PRESSURE IN THE GULF WILL
HELP KEEP THAT ISENTROPIC LIFT BRINGING MOISTURE AND PRECIP TO THE
AREA. TEMPERATURES WILL BRIEFLY DROP BEHIND THE FRONT ON
TUESDAY...THEN REMAIN FAIRLY STATIC THROUGH THE EXTENDED...WITH
HIGHS AND LOWS A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EST SAT NOV 29 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE ALONG THE ATLANTIC COASTLINE WHILE A LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES NE ACROSS THE UPPER MS VALLEY AND GREAT LAKES. 
THIS WILL PROVIDE A S-SW LOW LEVEL FLOW THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. THE 
NAM AND GFS SHOW ISENTROPIC LIFT AND MOISTURE ADVECTION SPREADING 
INTO THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON AROUND 850 MB...AND REMAINING IN PLACE 
OVERNIGHT. MEANWHILE THE RAP SHOWS VERY LITTLE MOISTURE THROUGH 
TODAY. THIS DRIER SOLUTION IS GENERALLY PREFERED AS SATELLITE SHOWS 
NO CLOUDS AT THIS LEVEL UPSTREAM. WILL BRING IN SOME CLOUDS IN THE 
PLATEAU THIS AFTERNOON...BUT CONFIDENCE IS LOW. IT WILL ALSO MAKE 
FOR A TRICKY TEMPERATURE FORECAST. WILL LEAN TOWARD THE WARMER GFS 
MOS FOR HIGHS...BUT CONFIDENCE IS LOW. A TIGHTENING PRESSURE 
GRADIENT THROUGH THE DAY WILL BRING WINDS UP TO 10-15 MPH WITH SOME 
GUSTS OF 20-25 POSSIBLE AT TIMES THIS AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...
ONLY SLIGHT TWEAKS AND CHANGES TO THE FORECAST IN THE LONG TERM...
SLIGHT RIDGING STAYS IN PLACE OVER THE AREA ON SUNDAY WHICH WILL
LIKELY BE THE WARMEST DAY FOR THE NEXT 7 DAYS FOR MOST LOCATIONS.
HIGH PRESSURE MOVES OFF TO THE EAST ON MONDAY AS A COLD FRONT
ENTERS THE MIX LATE IN THE DAY BRINGING DECENT CHANCES OF RAIN POST
FRONTAL PASSAGE. THINK THE BEST CHANCES FOR RAIN ALONG WITH THE
HIGHEST RAINFALL AMOUNTS WILL BE TIED CLOSELY WITH THE FRONT, BUT
CHANCES FOR RAIN WILL LINGER THROUGH MID WEEK AS MOISTURE AND POST
FRONTAL ISENTROPIC LIFT COULD COMBINE TO BRING LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS
ON AND OFF THROUGH THE FIRST PART OF THE WEEK. TAKE A BIT OF A
BREAK MID WEEK BEFORE ANOTHER SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH BRINGING IN
ABUNDANT MOISTURE FROM THE GULF AND ANOTHER COUPLE OF DAYS WITH
CHANCES OF RAIN.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             57  42  60  48 /   0   0   0  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  56  39  62  43 /   0   0  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       55  41  60  46 /   0  10  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              54  34  60  38 /   0   0  10  20

SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA SHOULD MOVE NORTH BY EARLY EVENING. MOSTLY CLEAR 
SKIES AND DRY WEATHER WILL REMAIN THROUGH THE PERIOD. TEMPERATURES 
WILL BE A COUPLE OF DEGREES BELOW NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...WEAK RIDGING OVER THE 
REGION WILL ALLOW FOR DRY AND WARM CONDITIONS FOR THE REST OF THE 
WEEKEND.  WILL TRANSITION INTO AN UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE 
REST OF THE EXTENDED AS A COUPLE OF WEAK COLD FRONTS MOVES THROUGH. 
THE FIRST FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH LATE MONDAY INTO MONDAY 
NIGHT...LINGERING OVER THE REGION INTO TUESDAY FOR OUR BEST CHANCE 
OF SHOWERS.  A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
WITH ZONAL FLOW ALOFT.  WILL BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS AROUND THE THURSDAY 
TIME FRAME WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS RETURNING BY THE END OF 
THE PERIOD IN ADVANCE OF THE NEXT SYSTEM.

029 
FXUS64 KMRX 280816
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 AM EST FRI NOV 28 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MAIN FORECAST CONCERN IS CLOUD
COVER. LOW-CLOUDS ARE SLOWLY ERODING FROM WEST TO EAST...BUT AN
AREA OF MID-LEVEL CLOUDS WILL MOVE THROUGHT HE NORTHERN HALF OF THE
AREA THIS MORNING-EARLY AFTERNOON. OCCASIONAL LIGHT FLURRIES CAN 
ALSO BE EXPECTED THROUGH MID-MORNING OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA..
NORTHERN TENNESSEE AND THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS.

FOR TONIGHT...SKY CLEARS ALLOWING TEMPERATURES TO DROP...ESPECIALLY
ACROSS THE VALLEYS.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)... WILL CONTINUE TO HAVE
RIDGING BUILDING IN BRINGING WITH IT WARMER TEMPS. SHOULD CONTINUE
THIS TREND THROUGH MOST OF THE WEEKEND BEFORE A COLD FRONT MOVES
THROUGH THE AREA ON MONDAY. ON SUNDAY AHEAD OF THE FRONT MODELS
WANT TO GENERATE VERY LIGHT QPF WITH SHALLOW MOISTURE AND WEAK
ISENTROPIC LIFT. HAVE BROUGHT MENTION OF THIS IN THE NORTHEAST
PORTIONS OF THE AREA ON SUNDAY BUT THINK IF ANYTHING DOES FALL IT
WILL BE VERY LIGHT AND ONLY AMOUNT TO A TRACE OR SLIGHTLY MORE.
BEST CHANCE OF RAIN HAPPENS WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE FRONT ON
MONDAY. COULD SEE MODERATE RAINFALL RATES DURING THE DAY ON MONDAY
WITH THE HIGHEST RAINFALL AMOUNTS EXPECTED TO BE IN OUR NORTHERN
AREAS. WILL HAVE TO WATCH TEMPS ON MONDAY AS FRONT COULD MAKE HIGH
TEMP FORECAST TRICKY ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTHWEST. FRONT SHOULD BE
THROUGH THE AREA BY OVERNIGHT CAUSING TEMPS TO COOL BY ABOUT 5 - 10
DEGREES ACROSS THE AREA. SLIGHT CHANCES FOR SHOWERS LINGER ACROSS
THE AREA THROUGH WEDNESDAY. WE WILL BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS AFTER THAT
THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE WORKWEEK, BEFORE THE NEXT BEST CHANCE
OF RAIN COMES WHEN ANOTHER SYSTEM MOVES ACROSS THE AREA JUST BEYOND
THE 7 DAY FORECAST.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO 
BUILD IN TO THE AREA TONIGHT. THERE IS STILL ENOUGH LIFT TO SEE A 
COUPLE OF FLURRIES IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF EAST TENNESSEE AND 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...BUT ANY KIND OF SHOWER ACTIVITY SHOULD BE VERY 
MINIMAL THIS EVENING. THE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IS REALLY HANGING IN 
OVER THE AREA. SHOULD SEE SLOW DRY AIR ADVECTION INTO THE AREA 
OVERNIGHT...WITH CLOUDS LIFTING AROUND MORNING. WITH THE CLOUD COVER 
TODAY...AS WELL AS NORTHWEST FLOW...WILL SEE LOWS SEVERAL DEGREES 
BELOW NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. FOR FRIDAY...HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
BE PRESENT...WITH CLEARING SKIES AND DRY WEATHER. HIGH TEMPERATURES 
ARE SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW NORMAL.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...WILL BE IN A DRY AND BENIGN 
WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE WEEKEND WITH WEAK RIDGING TO ZONAL FLOW 
ALOFT.  WILL KEEP LOW POPS IN PLACE SUNDAY NIGHT AT THE APPROACH OF 
A WEAK COLD FRONT.  MODELS SHOW A CHANCE OF RAIN SHOWERS MONDAY 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY AS THE COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH.  WILL BE BETWEEN 
SYSTEM THURSDAY FOR A DRY PERIOD.

820 
FXUS64 KMRX 270746
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
246 AM EST THU NOV 27 2014

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
A SHORTWAVE TROUGH IS CONTINUING TO MOVE THROUGH THE REGION EARLY
THIS MORNING...BRINGING SCATTERED TO WIDESPREAD SHOWER ACTIVITY TO
THE AREA. AS COLD AIR ADVECTION OCCURS ALOFT...SOME SNOW HAS BEGUN
TO MIX WITH RAIN AT THE LOWER LEVELS BELOW 1500 TO 2000 FT.
ELSEWHERE ALONG THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...A TRANSITION TO ALL SNOW
WILL CONTINUE OR HAS ALREADY OCCURRED AS TEMPERATURES CONTINUE TO
COOL ALOFT. AS A RESULT...ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL IS EXPECTED ACROSS
THE EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS...AND PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA
AND FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AS SYNOPTIC LIFT PEAKS BETWEEN 09-12Z.
ALONG THE MOUNTAINS...TOTALS BETWEEN 2 TO 3 INCHES WILL BE COMMON
ALONG THE HIGHEST PEAKS...WITH TOTALS CLOSER TO 1 INCH IN THE
LOWER ELEVATION VALLEY AREAS IN THE TRI-CITIES/ABINGDON METRO. A
WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL REMAIN IN EFFECT FOR THESE AREAS
THROUGH NOON TO ACCOUNT FOR THESE LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS.

BETWEEN 12Z TO 15Z...LIFT AND MOISTURE BEGINS TO WANE AS
PRECIPITATION TAPERS OFF FROM WEST TO EAST. STILL HAVE MENTIONABLE
POPS ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF EAST TN AND PORTIONS OF SW
VIRGINIA THROUGH MOST OF THE AFTERNOON AS WEAK OROGRAPHIC LIFT MAY
HELP MAINTAIN SOME LIGHT SNOW THERE. OTHERWISE...CLEARING WILL
OCCUR GRADUALLY FROM WEST TO EAST OVER THE COURSE OF THE DAY AND
EVENING. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR SOME GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING
OVERNIGHT AND A HARD FREEZE AS LOWS PLUNGE INTO THE LOWER 20S IN
MOST AREAS BY DAYBREAK FRIDAY MORNING.

.LONG TERM /FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
PERIODS OF ZONAL FLOW OR SOME DEGREE OF UPPER RIDGE AMPLIFICATION
THROUGH THE LONG TERM. MODELS GENERALLY CONSISTENT FROM EARLIER
RUNS AND SUPPORT A DRY FORECAST FROM FRIDAY THROUGH AT LEAST LATE
SUNDAY. STILL SEEING SOME VERY LIGHT QPF ADVERTISED JUST OFF TO OUR
WEST AND NORTHWEST FOR SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. HOWEVER...THIS
SHOULD BE ASSOCIATED WITH A WARM FRONT THAT MOVES FROM THE MID-MS
VALLEY TO OHIO VALLEY REGION...SO IT LOOKS WISE TO STAY DRY HERE
FOR THOSE PERIODS.

RAIN CHANCES DO APPEAR NEEDED FOR SUNDAY NIGHT OUT TO WEDNESDAY DUE  
TO A COUPLE OF WEAK COLD FRONTS...PLUS SOME POTENTIAL FOR WEAK E-SE 
UPLSOPE FLOW AS SURFACE RIDGING MOVES ACROSS THE NE STATES EARLY 
NEXT WEEK. WOULD BET ON MOST LIKELY PERIOD AROUND MONDAY TIMEFRAME 
FOR SHOWERS WHERE GRIDS WILL CARRY 40 TO 50 PERCENT POPS. LITTLE 
CHANGES MADE OVERALL.

STRAYED A BIT FROM THE COOL MOS MIN TEMPS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT WHEN WE 
SHOULD SEE STRENGTHENING SW LOW LEVEL FLOW AS THE SURFACE RIDGE 
SLIPS EAST TO ALONG THE SE ATLANTIC COAST. BLENDED GUIDANCE TEMPS 
LOOKED VERY GOOD FOR ALL BUT SUNDAY...WHERE I KEPT MAXES IN LINE 
WITH THE WARMER GFSX/ECMX MOS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             45  25  47  34 /  10   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  43  23  43  30 /  30   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       43  24  44  31 /  20   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              41  20  39  26 /  60  10   0   0 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

515 
FXUS64 KMRX 262012
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 PM EST WED NOV 26 2014

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT AND THANKSGIVING DAY...
AS THE SHORTWAVE THAT CAUSED ALL THE SNOW THIS MORNING MOVES
NORTHEAST...CLOUDS LINGER OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NE TN CAUSING TEMPS
TO RANGE FROM THE MID 30S TO LOWER 40S. MEANWHILE...FARTHER SOUTH
WHERE SUNSHINE HAS BEEN ABUNDANT TEMPERATURES HAVE RISEN INTO THE
LOWER 50S.

THE NEXT QUICK MOVING SYSTEM WAS LOCATED OVER NE AR/W TN. SOME LIGHT 
RAIN WAS ALREADY NOTED IN NE AR JUST SOUTH OF THE MO STATE LINE. 
FORECAST SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT THERE ARE DRIER LOW LEVELS TO 
OVERCOME BEFORE PRECIP ACTUALLY MAKES IT TO THE SURFACE. THIS SHOULD 
OCCUR AFTER 7PM ET...AND GRADUALLY SPREAD EAST. LOOK FOR LIGHT RAIN 
TO BEGIN FIRST AND THEN CHANGE OVER TO SNOW AS THE LOW LEVELS 
SATURATE AND WETBULB COOLING OCCURS. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH HIGHEST POPS AND QPF OCCURRING OVER NE TN AND SW VA. THE 
CHALLENGE COMES IN HOW THE GROUND TEMPS PLAY IN ACTUAL 
ACCUMULATIONS. THERE APPEARS TO BE THE POTENTIAL FOR BURSTS OF 
HEAVIER SNOWFALL AFTER MIDNIGHT GENERALLY NORTH OF I-40 AND E OF I-
75 WITH ABOUT A 6 TO 8 HOUR DURATION. THE HIGHER TERRAIN STILL LOOKS 
LIKE THE FAVORED SPOTS TO RECEIVE THE BULK OF SNOWFALL HOWEVER WITH 
HOLIDAY TRAVEL LIKELY AND SNOW...THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL 
CONTINUE FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT THROUGH NOON TOMORROW.

THE BULK OF PRECIPITATION WILL BEGIN TO WIND DOWN AFTER NOON HOWEVER 
THERE WILL STILL BE A FEW SPOTS WHERE RAIN AND SNOW WILL OCCUR IN SW 
VA AND THE TN MOUNTAINS. 

CLOUDS WILL PLAY AN IMPORTANT FACTOR IN DAYTIME TEMPERATURES FOR 
THANKSGIVING. ANTICIPATE AT LEAST A 5 DEGREE COOL-DOWN FROM TODAY/S 
TEMPS AS THE COOLER AIR ALOFT DESCENDS. /AC

.LONG TERM.../THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...OFFENDING MID
WEEK SHORT WAVE MOVES AWAY THURSDAY NIGHT BUT NOT BEFORE THE SMALL
POSSIBILITY OF A COUPLE MORE SNOW SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER.
SURFACE RIDGE CONTINUES SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE REGION WITH A ZONAL
FLOW ALOFT DEVELOPING FOR A DRY FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. BY SUNDAY
MODELS GENERATE A MORE ACTIVE FLOW COMPLETE WITH DEEPENING MOISTURE
ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY AS WARMER AIR RETURNS AHEAD OF A ANOTHER
FRONTAL SYSTEM. THEREFORE...SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS
WERE USED ON SUNDAY. THE MOIST COLUMN AND LIFT INCREASE SUNDAY
NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE FRONT WHICH
MOVES THROUGH THE REGION MONDAY NIGHT. HELD ONTO MORE SLIGHT AND
LOW CHANCE POPS TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY AS ANOTHER WEAK SHORT
WAVE APPEARS TO TRAVERSE THE MID SOUTH. STAYED CLOSE GUIDANCE MAX
AND MIN TEMPS WHICH ALLOW FOR A NICE WARMING TREND SATURDAY THROUGH
MONDAY.

&&

801 
FXUS64 KMRX 260831
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
331 AM EST WED NOV 26 2014

.SHORT TERM.../WEDNESDAY THROUGH THANKSGIVING DAY/...AN UPPER-
LEVEL TROUGH CONTINUES TO TRACK INTO THE AREA EARLY THIS MORNING...
SPREADING LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND THE
SMOKY MOUNTAIN FOOTHILLS. WHILE TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 30S TO
LOWER 40S ARE BEING MAINTAINED IN THE VALLEYS...COLDER AIR PRESENT
ALOFT IS PRODUCING SOME ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL ALONG THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS OF THE EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS /MAINLY ABOVE 2500
FEET/. MODELS HAVE CONTINUED INDICATE SOME DECENT SNOWFALL
PRODUCTION ACROSS OUR FAR NORTHEAST MOUNTAIN ZONES /WHERE MEAN
WINDS MAY ALSO HELP TO ENHANCES SOME OROGRAPHIC LIFT LOCALLY DUE TO
THE ORIENTATION OF THE MOUNTAINS THERE/. AS A RESULT...A WINTER
STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR JOHNSON...CARTER AND UNICOI
MOUNTAIN AREAS AS TOTALS OF 3 TO 5 INCHES WILL BE COMMON ALONG THE
HIGHEST AREAS/. ADVISORY-LEVEL SNOWFALL OF 1 TO 4 INCHES MORE
COMMON ELSEWHERE ACROSS ELEVATED AREAS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND
THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS.

PRECIPITATION WILL TAPER OFF BY MID TO LATE MORNING AS DRY AIR 
FILTERS IN AND THE SYSTEM QUICKLY SHIFTS EAST. LOW CLOUDS MAY LINGER 
FOR MOST OF THE DAY ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE...BUT SOME CLEARING SHOULD TAKE PLACE OVER MUCH OF THE 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY BY THE AFTERNOON...ALLOWING HIGHS TO 
CLIMB INTO THE LOWER 50S. ANOTHER RAPIDLY APPROACHING TROUGH WILL 
BRING CLOUD COVER AND PRECIPITATION BACK INTO THE REGION 
TONIGHT...ALONG WITH A SHOT OF COOLER AIR. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR 
ANOTHER ROUND OF SNOWFALL ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS LATE TONIGHT 
THROUGH MID-MORNING ON THANKSGIVING DAY. ACCUMULATIONS WILL 
GENERALLY BE CONFINED TO LOCATIONS ABOVE 2000 FEET...WITH TOTALS OF 
1 TO 3 INCHES POSSIBLE IN THESE AREAS ACROSS THE BLUE RIDGE/SMOKY 
MOUNTAINS OF EAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. IN THE 
VALLEY...SNOW WILL LIKELY MIX WITH RAIN AT TIMES LATE TONIGHT INTO 
THANKSGIVING MORNING. HOWEVER...SURFACE TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN 
JUST ABOVE FREEZING...RESULTING IN LITTLE TO NO ACCUMULATIONS IN 
MOST AREAS. 

ALTHOUGH SNOWFALL WILL BE RELATIVELY LIGHT...GIVEN THE HOLIDAY 
TRAVEL /AND THE PREVIOUS SNOWFALL FROM EARLIER TODAY/...THINK A 
WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS WARRANTED FROM MIDNIGHT THROUGH 18Z 
THURSDAY FOR THE FAR NORTHEAST/EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT THE KTRI SOUNDING SHOWS 
A PERIOD AROUND 12Z WHERE SOME LIGHT SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS OF UP TO 
AN INCH MAY BE POSSIBLE. GIVEN THIS...HAVE ALSO INCLUDED SULLIVAN 
AND WASHINGTON TN COUNTIES IN THE ADVISORY AS WELL AS SURFACE 
TEMPERATURES SHOULD FALL JUST BELOW FREEZING THANKSGIVING MORNING 
THERE. OTHERWISE...PRECIPITATION WILL QUICKLY WANE BY THE LATE 
MORNING AND AFTERNOON THURSDAY AS MOISTURE DROPS OFF SIGNIFICANTLY 
/RESULTING IN A COOLER BUT DRY END TO THE HOLIDAY/. 


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...FAST MOVING 
SHORTWAVE WILL BE JUST ABOUT TO EXIT THE REGION BY THE START OF THE 
LONG TERM GRIDS...BUT I KEPT CONTINUITY WITH A FEW HOURS OF FLURRIES 
OR STRAY SNOW SHOWERS FOR THE FAR NE COUNTIES. AFTERWARDS...ZONAL 
FLOW ALOFT FOR FRIDAY WITH A SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE MOVING 
INTO THE REGION...THEN ACTUALLY SLIPPING OFF TO THE SE COASTAL AREAS 
BY 06Z SATURDAY. 500 MB HEIGHTS RISE JUST SLIGHTLY OVER THE WEEKEND
KEEPING MAINLY A ZONAL FLOW ALOFT. 

THIS SHOULD EQUATE TO A FEW DRY DAYS BEFORE A WEAK COLD FRONT TRIES 
TO EASE SE TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY SUNDAY NIGHT INTO 
MONDAY. THE SUPER BLENDED GRIDS TOSSED IN LOW POPS AS EARLY AS 
SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY...BUT QPF FROM MODELS IS EXTREMELY LIGHT 
MAINLY TO OUR NW IN ASSOCIATION WITH A WARM FRONT. THUS...I OPTED TO 
KEEP POPS OUT OF THE FORECAST UNTIL SUNDAY NIGHT. NUDGED POPS UP TO 
LOW CHANCE FOR MONDAY WHEN THE COLD FRONT LOOKS TO BE PASSING NEAR 
OR ACROSS THE REGION. 

MOS POPS REMAIN BELOW CLIMO FOR TUESDAY...AND THE SUPER BLENDED POPS 
WERE EVEN LOWER...SO STAYING WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR TUESDAY FOR 
NOW. ABOVE CLIMO TEMPS FROM SUNDAY THROUGH PROBABLY WEDNESDAY SHOULD 
BE APPRECIATED BY MOST FOLKS.


&&

FXUS64 KMRX 260301 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1001 PM EST TUE NOV 25 2014

.DISCUSSION...
THE 00Z NAM CONTINUES TO SHOW MORE SNOW IN OUR NORTHERN AND EASTERN
AREAS THAN OTHER MODELS...BUT THE GFS AND RAP APPEAR TO BE TRENDING
TOWARD HIGHER AMOUNTS. OBS IN THE MOUNTAINS SHOW TEMPS IN THE MID
30S WITH DEWPOINTS AROUND 30...SO THESE AREAS SHOULD DROP TO AROUND
FREEZING ONCE PRECIP BEGINS. IN THE VALLEY...THERE IS NOTHING IN
THE LATEST OBS OR MODEL GUIDANCE TO INDICATE THAT TEMPS WILL FALL
LOW ENOUGH FOR ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL. 

A WINTER STORMS WARNING WILL BE ISSUED FOR JOHNSON...CARTER...AND
UNICOI MOUNTAIN AREAS...WITH AN EMPHASIS ON AREAS ABOVE 2500 FEET.
WILL MENTION PEAK ACCUMULATIONS UP TO 6 INCHES IN THE HIGHEST
TERRAIN...WITH 3 TO 5 BEING MORE COMMON.

NO OTHER SIGNIFICANT CHANGES WILL BE NEEDED FOR THE UPDATE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

608 PM EST TUE NOV 25 2014

.AVIATION...
A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM NEAR THE EAST COAST WILL PUT EAST
TN ON THE FRINGE OF THE SYSTEM...WHICH WILL BRING VERY DIFFERENT
CONDITIONS TO THE TERMINALS TONIGHT AND TOMORROW MORNING. CHA WILL
REMAIN VFR THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH ONLY LIGHT RAIN ARRIVING AFTER
MIDNIGHT AND ENDING BEFORE SUNRISE. AT TYS...RAIN SHOULD BE A BIT
HEAVIER AND PRODUCE MVFR VIS FOR A FEW HOURS BEFORE SUNRISE. TRI IS
EXPECTED TO GO LOWEST WITH THE MOST RAIN...WITH IFR VIS AND MVFR
CIGS EXPECTED LATE TONIGHT THROUGH MID-MORNING...WITH LOWER
CONDITIONS POSSIBLE AT TIMES. SOME SNOW CANNOT BE RULED OUT...BUT
IT SEEMS TOO UNLIKELY TO MENTION AS TEMPS ARE EXPECTED TO BE TOO
WARM. IMPROVEMENT TO VFR IS EXPECTED TO OCCUR IN THE AFTERNOON AT
TRI.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON EST 
     WEDNESDAY FOR BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS-COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS-
     JOHNSON-SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS-SOUTHEAST CARTER-SOUTHEAST 
     GREENE-UNICOI.

273 
FXUS64 KMRX 252010
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EST TUE NOV 25 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
DEVELOPING OVER FLORIDA WILL TRACK NORTHEAST ALONG THE COAST DURING 
THE PERIOD.  AN UPPER LEVEL SHORT WAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS OUR 
AREA LATE TONIGHT/EARLY WEDNESDAY. JET DYNAMICS OVER OUR AREA LOOK 
IMPRESSIVE ENOUGH WITH THIS SYSTEM TO HELP PULL SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE 
WEST OF THE MOUNTAINS. IT APPEARS THAT THE BOUNDARY LAYER IN MOST 
VALLEY LOCATIONS WILL BE WARM ENOUGH TO KEEP THE PRECIPITATION 
MAINLY RAIN...BUT HIGHER ELEVATIONS SHOULD SEE SIGNIFICANT SNOW.  
WILL ISSUE A SNOW ADVISORY FOR THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL MOUNTAINS AS 
WELL AS SW VA...FOR SOME MAINLY HIGH ELEVATIONS SNOW ACCUMULATIONS.  
PRECIPITATION SHOULD DIMINISH BY AROUND OR SHORTLY AFTER NOON. WILL 
MAKE MAINLY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO MAV TEMPS...MOSTLY MINOR TWEAKS 
DOWN.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...NAM WANTS TO
TRACK THE SECOND UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE/TROUGH JUST A BIT FURTHER
SOUTH AND THE ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW IS FORECASTED TO MOVE RIGHT
ACROSS THE MIDDLE OF THE CWA BRINING IN A LARGE AMOUNT OF
RAIN/SNOWFALL. ON THE OTHER HAND OTHER MODELS WANT TO KEEP THE
UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE/TROUGH FURTHER NORTH AND THE ASSOCIATED
SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TO MOVE ACROSS NORTH OF THE CWA. AT
THIS POINT AM LIKING TO SHY AWAY FROM THE NAM SOLUTION AS RUN TO
RUN CONSISTENCY HAS BEEN MUCH LOWER FOR THIS EVENT. NO MATTER WHICH
SOLUTION YOU BELIEVE MOS GUIDANCE IS COMING IN A COUPLE OF DEGREES
WARMER FOR WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY. THIS COULD INHIBIT SNOW GROWTH
IN NORTHEAST TENNESSEE/SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AS DAYTIME HIGHS RISE
INTO THE 30'S AND 40'S WHILE OVERNIGHT LOWS MAYBE GET INTO THE
UPPER 20'S. THE COLDEST TEMPS WON'T ARRIVE UNTIL THURSDAY NIGHT
WHEN WE GET CLEARING SKIES AND BETTER RADIATIVE COOLING. AT THIS
POINT THINK ONE OF THE BIGGEST FACTORS IN TEMPS/ACCUMULATIONS FOR
WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY WILL BE WHERE SNOWFALL OCCURS STARTING
TONIGHT INTO TOMORROW. IF SNOWFALL HAS OCCURRED OVER A LOCATION
TEMPS MIGHT COOL DOWN ENOUGH TO ALLOW ACCUMULATIONS...HOWEVER IF NO
SNOW FALLS GROUND TEMPS MIGHT STAY WARM ENOUGH TO MELT ANY SNOWFALL
WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY AND SNOW MIGHT ONLY STICK ON THE
GRASS AND LITTLE WILL ACCUMULATE ON THE ROADS. IF THE PREDOMINANT
PRECIPIATION TYPE IS RAIN IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WILL HAVE TO
WATCH TO SEE HOW MUCH OF IT EVAPORATES BEFORE TEMPS GET BELOW
FREEZING AGAIN, COULD LEAD TO SOME ISSUES OF WATER FREEZING ON THE
ROADS IF IT'S NOT EVAPORATED BY FRIDAY MORNING. WILL HAVE TO
MONITOR FIRST ROUND OF SNOW VERY CAREFULLY TO SEE WHAT THE IMPACTS
MIGHT BE ON THE SECOND ROUND. POTENTIALLY A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY
MIGHT BE NEEDED FOR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE/SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA THURSDAY
NIGHT INTO BLACK FRIDAY MORNING, BUT WILL NOT DO ANYTHING AT THIS
TIME AND TAKE A WAIT AND SEE APPROACH WITH WHAT HAPPENS TONIGHT
INTO TOMORROW. I HAVE TRENDED UP A FEW DEGREES WITH TEMPS
ESPECIALLY IN THE SOUTH WHERE LITTLE TO NO SNOW IS EXPECTED BUT
WENT A LITTLE COOLER THAN BLENDED GUIDANCE FURTHER NORTH AND IN
ELEVATED LOCATIONS WHERE SNOWFALL ACCUMULATION IS MORE LIKELY.

THE AREA CONTINUES TO WARM UP THROUGH THE WEEKEND TO WHERE WE SHOULD 
BE FLIRTING WITH 60'S FOR HIGHS ON SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. MODELS 
ARE STILL SUGGESTING A FRONT WILL WORK ITS WAY DOWN TOWARDS THE AREA 
OVER THE WEEKEND INTO NEXT WEEK, BUT ARE NOT IN GREAT AGREEMENT WITH 
WHAT TO DO WITH IT ONCE IT GETS HERE. WILL HAVE TO MONITOR THIS AS 
THE TIME FRAME GETS CLOSER BUT AT THIS MOMENT MOST OF THE MODELS 
THINK THE FRONT SHOULD HANG UP SOMEWHERE AROUND KENTUCKY LEADING TO 
MOST OF THE ASSOCIATED PRECIP TO REMAIN NORTH OF OUR AREA.


.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              36  45  32  42 / 100  80  50  60

234 
FXUS64 KMRX 250858
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
358 AM EST TUE NOV 25 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MAIN CHANGES MADE WERE TO
INCREASE POPS FOR LATE TONIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING...AS THE LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKS NE ALONG THE SC-NC COASTAL AREAS. THE LOW
TRACKS NE AWAY FROM THE SRN APPALACHIANS RATHER QUICKLY WEDNESDAY. 

MODELS ALL QUITE CONSISTENT WITH A SWATH OF PRECIPITATION WRAPPING
WESTWARD ACROSS OUR REGION...AND LIKELY FALLING IN THE FORM OF SNOW
FOR THE SMOKIES...NRN MTNS OF E TN AND MOST OF SW VA. THE BEST
PERIOD OF POTENTIAL SNOW ACCUMULATIONS LOOKS TO BE FROM ABOUT 08Z
TO 15Z WEDNESDAY...THEN THE DEPTH OF MOISTURE SHRINKS RAPIDLY AND
THERE IS NO REAL FORM OF LIFT FOR THE AFTERNOON HOURS.

ADDED SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS FOR THOSE MENTIONED AREAS IN
LINE WITH GUIDANCE AND ADJACENT NWS GRIDS...GENERALLY AROUND WINTER
WEATHER ADVISORY TOTALS. PLAN TO HIGHLIGHT THIS IN OUR HWO PRODUCT
AND ALSO A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT. 

OTHERWISE...JUST HIGH CLOUDINESS TODAY WHICH COULD BE DENSE ENOUGH
TO AFFECT MAX TEMPS...ALTHO I DID NUDGE HIGHS UP TO AT LEAST NEAR
THE COOLER NAM MOS MAXES. MOS BLEND FOR MINS TONIGHT AND CLOSE TO
GFS MOS FOR HIGHS WEDNESDAY...EXCEPT COOLER WHERE SOME SNOW MAY
OCCUR. 


.LONG TERM.../WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY/...A SECONDARY SHOT
OF COLDER AIR WILL PUSH INTO THE REGION WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY
THANKSGIVING MORNING. THIS WILL GENERATE SOME ADDITIONAL ISOLATED
TO SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS...PARTICULARLY ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN
OF EAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. GIVEN THE PREVAILING WNW
FLOW...THIS WILL NOT BE A TRUE UPSLOPE EVENT...BUT RATHER A
SYNOPTIC LIFT EVENT FROM THE PASSING UPPER- TROUGH. MOISTURE MAY BE
THE ONE LIMITING FACTOR FOR MOST OF THE REGION /PARTICULARLY LATER
IN THE DAY ON THURSDAY/. STILL...A GOOD WINDOW FOR PRECIPITATION
FROM 06Z TO 18Z THURSDAY MAY RESULT IN SOME ADDITIONAL SNOWFALL
ACCUMULATIONS OF AN INCH OR TWO ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN...AND
PERHAPS INTO SOME LOWER ELEVATIONS OF FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. PRECIPITATION WILL TAPER OFF BY THANKSGIVING
NIGHT AS HIGH PRESSURE SLOWLY BEGINS TO BUILD IN ON BLACK FRIDAY.

THIS WILL RESULT IN A MOSTLY DRY AND MILD FORECAST FOR THE
REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD...WITH HIGHS PEAKING IN THE UPPER 50S TO
LOWER 60S BY THE WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. A VERY BROAD TROUGH
MAY SEND A WEAK FRONT IN OUR DIRECTION BY SUNDAY AND MONDAY...BUT
ONLY ISOLATED TO PERHAPS WIDELY SCATTERED SHOWERS ARE EXPECTED AS
THE FRONT SHOULD HANG UP TO THE NORTH AND WEST OF THE FORECAST
AREA.
