476 
FXUS64 KMRX 242006
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
306 PM EST MON NOV 24 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...JUST SOME BRIEF COLD ADVECTION 
BEHIND THE EXITING COLD FRONT. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN 
TONIGHT AND TUESDAY.  SHOULD BE PRECIP FREE FOR THE SHORT TERM. 
SHOULD SEE ANY LINGERING LOWER CLOUDS IN THE COLD ADVECTION EXIT 
DURING THE NIGHT...BUT EXPECT SOME HIGH CLOUDS TO MOVE ACROSS LATER 
TONIGHT AND TUESDAY.  WINDS SHOULD CONTINUE TO DIMINISH THIS 
EVENING...SO WILL LET REMAINING WIND ADVISORY EXPIRE ON SCHEDULE.  
MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE SO WILL NOT STRAY FAR.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...AT THIS POINT THE
MOST EXCITEMENT FOR THE LONG TERM PERIODS WILL COME TUESDAY NIGHT
THROUGH THURSDAY AS A LOW PRESSURE CENTER IN THE ATLANTIC STARTS TO
MAKE IT'S WAY NORTH ALONG THE EAST COAST. IT SHOULD BE STRONG
ENOUGH TO HAVE MOISTURE WRAP AROUND AND INVADE THE AREA AS
OVERNIGHT TUESDAY. CURRENTLY THINK THE HIGHER ELEVATION AREAS HAVE
THE BEST CHANCES TO SEE SNOW. AREAS TOWARDS THE VALLEY WOULD LIKELY
SEE A COLD RAIN WITH TEMPS REMAINING ABOVE FREEZING DURING THE BEST
TIME FRAME FOR PRECIPITATION. AT THIS POINT HAVE SNOWFALL TOTALS
THROUGH THURSDAY BETWEEN A TRACE TO 2 INCHES IN THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS
AND HIGHER ELEVATION AREAS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA, WITH SOME OF THE
HIGHEST PEAKS GETTING AROUND 3 INCHES.

QUICK ON THE HEELS OF THE WRAP AROUND MOISTURE ANOTHER SHORTWAVE 
MOVES ACROSS AND CONTINUES TO BRING A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN/SNOW TO 
THE AREA. EARLY THURSDAY/LATE WEDNESDAY SOME OF THE MODELS WANT TO 
START TO DRY OUT THE MID LAYERS OF THE ATMOSPHERE WHILE OTHERS WANT 
TO KEEP IT MOIST. WILL HAVE TO KEEP AN EYE ON THIS AS THE TIME DRAWS 
CLOSER AS IT COULD HELP SOME LOCATIONS PICK UP ANOTHER QUICK BOUT OF 
SNOW IF THE DENDRITIC GROWTH ZONES ARE STILL MOIST COME THURSDAY 
MORNING.

WE TAKE A BREAK FOR A LITTLE WHILE AS TEMPS SLOWLY BEGIN TO CLIMB 
BEFORE OUR NEXT BEST SHOT AT PRECIP EARLY NEXT WEEK. MODELS WANT TO 
BRING IN A FRONT AND STALL IT OUT SOMEWHERE IN THE GENERAL VICINITY. 
HOWEVER AT THIS POINT THEY ARE STILL NOT IN GREAT AGREEMENT ON WHERE 
THIS COULD OCCUR. IF THIS DOES COME TO PASS PLACES NORTH OF THE 
FRONT COULD BE IN STORE FOR SOME STEADY RAIN TOWARDS THE BEGINNING 
OF NEXT WEEK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
359 AM EST MON NOV 24 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE 24/00Z UPPER AIR PLOTS AND 
LATEST VAD WIND PROFILES SHOW THAT THE LOW LEVEL JET HAS SHIFTED TO 
SW ACROSS THE REGION...AND GUSTS IN THE MTNS/FOOTHILLS SHOULD BE IN 
THE ADVISORY RANGE AT THIS TIME. THUS...OPTED TO DROP THE HIGH WIND 
WARNING AND REPLACE WITH A WIND ADVISORY ACROSS THE BOARD. TIMING 
THE END OF THE ADVISORY SHORTLY AFTER FRONTAL PASSAGE...AROUND 18Z 
IN WRN COUNTIES AND 21Z FOR EASTERN COUNTIES. 

OTHERWISE...RAIN CHANCES LOOK QUITE MINIMAL FOR TODAY...SO NO 
CHANGES MADE TO PREVIOUS SLIGHT CHANCE POPS. VERY MILD TEMPS THIS
MORNING IN THE 60S...GENERALLY CLOSE TO GFS MAXES. COOLER GFS MOS
MINS GOOD FOR TONIGHT IF WINDS DROP OFF. 

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...COLD FRONT WILL BE TO THE
EAST COAST TUESDAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN. TEMPERATURES
MUCH COOLER IN THE UPPER 40S TO MID 50S. LOW PRESSURE IN THE GULF
TO MOVE NE ALONG THE FRONT GFS/ECMWF STILL WANTING TO DEVELOP LOW
FROM GULF INTO THE ATLANTIC WITH COLD AIR ON THE BACK SIDE OF THIS
SYSTEM AND INCREASED MOISTURE FOR SOME LIGHT SNOW IN THE SMOKY
MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS. HAVE INCREASED AMOUNTS
THERE WITH MOSTLY TRACE AMOUNTS OF SNOW AND SOME COLD RAIN
ELSEWHERE LATE TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AS THE SYSTEM MOVES UP
THE EAST COAST. MAY NEED AN ADVISORY FOR THE EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS
WEDNESDAY. LOWS MONDAY NIGHT SHOULD BE NEAR FREEZING AND SLIGHTLY
COOLER MOUNTAINS. HIGHS MOUNTAINS WEDNESDAY 30S TO LOWER 40S BUT
WARMER TO THE WEST. ANY SNOW WILL BE BRIEF AND NOT AFFECT TRAVEL
OUTSIDE OF THE MOUNTAINS. WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY WEAK UPPER
LOW MOVING SOUTHEAST WITH SHORTWAVE PRODUCES A CHANCE OF LIGHT RAIN
AND SNOW AGAIN ACROSS NORTHEAST HALF OF REGION. PRECIPITATION
MOSTLY A LIGHT RAIN BUT LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

HIGHER PRESSURE THEN REGAINS CONTROL THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY.
HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN ANCHORED ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST FOR NEXT
WEEKEND BUT A NEW AREA OF LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
PLAINS AND MOISTURE IN SOUTHWEST FLOW MOVES INTO THE TN VALLEY BY
LATE SATURDAY AND CONTINUES THROUGH SUNDAY. THE COLD FRONT WILL
STAY TO THE NW. HIGHS SATURDAY AND SUNDAY WILL WARM INTO THE 50S.

008 
FXUS64 KMRX 231951
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 PM EST SUN NOV 23 2014

.SHORT TERM... (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...SURFACE WARM FRONT REMAINS
SOUTH OF THE AREA EARLY TONIGHT. MID LEVEL SHORT WAVE HAS BEEN SLOW
TO RELEASE THIS AFTERNOON AND WILL MOVE NE THROUGH THE AREA THIS
EVENING. RAIN CHANCE REMAINS HIGH THROUGH MIDNIGHT. STRONG
SOUTHEAST H85 WINDS CONTINUE INTO EARLY TONIGHT. MOUNTAIN WAVE
WINDS WILL LIKELY PERSIST THROUGH LATE NIGHT. STRENGTHENING SW-NE
UPPER JET TAKES SHAPE TONIGHT INTO MONDAY THROUGH THE TN VALLEY.
THE SURFACE WARM FRONT WILL MOVE NORTH THROUGH THE AREA TONIGHT
FOLLOWED BY A DECREASE IN PRECIPITATION. ISOLATED TO SCATTERED
SHOWERS REMAIN POSSIBLE ON MONDAY AHEAD OF A LATE DAY COLD FRONT.
WINDS WILL INCREASE BECOMING BREEZY FROM THE SOUTHWEST ON MONDAY.

.LONG TERM... (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)
NAM WANTS TO CONTINUE TO LINGER SOME LIGHT PRECIP THROUGH EARLY 
TUESDAY MORNING WHILE THE GFS/ECMWF WANT TO KEEP THE ENERGY OF THE 
SYSTEM FURTHER NORTH AND OUT OF OUR AREA. REGARDLESS OF WHICH 
SOLUTION YOU BELIEVE LIGHT PRECIP SHOULD BE OUT OF THE AREA BY 
TUESDAY MORNING. TUESDAY HIGHS WILL BE COOLER THAN MONDAY'S AND 
SLIGHTLY BELOW AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. NAM WANTS TO KEEP THE 
FRONT DOWN SOUTH OF US ALONG WITH ANY CHANCE OF CHANCE OF RAIN/SNOW 
FOR THE AREA. ON THE OTHER HAND OTHER MODELS SUCH AS THE GFS/ECMWF 
WANT TO GIN UP A LOW THAT SLIDES ALONG THE FRONT AND BRINGS IN 
ENOUGH MOISTURE TO ALLOW RAIN/SNOW SHOWERS ESPECIALLY IN THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS TO OUR NORTH EAST. HAVE TRENDED TOWARD THIS SOLUTION AND 
BROUGHT IN LIGHT SNOW ON WEDNESDAY. CURRENTLY HAVE THE SNOW STAYING 
IN THE HIGHER ELEVATION AREAS AS THEY HAVE THE BEST CHANCE OF PRECIP 
AND COOLER TEMPS TO SUPPORT SNOW, BUT AT THE MOMENT HAVE THOSE 
LOCATIONS RECEIVING AROUND AN INCH OR LESS.

TEMPS WILL SLOWLY WARM BACK UP THROUGH THE SECOND HALF OF THE WORK 
WEEK TILL HIGHS WILL BE NEAR 50 ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA NEXT 
WEEKEND. NEXT BEST CHANCE OF PRECIP WILL COME OVER THE WEEKEND AS A 
POTENTIAL BOUNDARY MOVES OVER THE AREA. HAVE LOW CONFIDENCE ON PRECIP 
CHANCES/TYPE AT THIS TIME AS MODELS ARE NOT IN GREAT AGREEMENT ON 
WHEN (OR IF) THIS MIGHT HAPPEN.

FXUS64 KMRX 230901
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
401 AM EST SUN NOV 23 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SOUTHERLY WINDS THIS MORNING WILL 
EVENTUALLY SPREAD SHOWERS INTO THE FORECAST AREA AS THE WARM FRONT 
APPROACHES. THE SE 850 JET...WHICH WILL INCREASE TO AROUND 50 TO 60 
KNOTS BY EARLY AFTERNOON...PLUS A STABLE LAYER SUPPORT UPGRADING THE 
HIGH WIND WATCH TO A HIGH WIND WARNING. THE DOWNSLOPE FLOW INTO THE 
CENTRAL AND SRN VALLEY WILL LIKELY DELAY THE ONSET OF MEASURABLE 
RAINS FOR THOSE AREAS...IN LINE WITH PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS.

SURFACE BASED INSTABILITY IS LACKING...BUT A BRIEF PERIOD OF 
ELEVATED INSTABILITY WITH THE WARM FRONT THIS EVENING...WAS WORTH 
ADDING A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS TO SE TN AND SW NC COUNTIES. 

THE SE FLOW SHIFTS TO SW BY 03Z MONDAY AND THE HIGHEST WIND SPEEDS 
MAY BE DECREASING BY THEN. HOWEVER...A TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT AHEAD 
OF THE COLD FRONT...COULD REQUIRE AT LEAST A WIND ADVISORY FOR 06Z 
TO 12Z MONDAY. THUS...OPTED TO KEEP THE HIGH WIND WARNING THROUGH 
12Z MONDAY FOR NOW. 

MAX TEMPS TODAY ARE CHALLENGING...GIVEN ABOUT A 20 DEGREE DIFFERENCE 
IN TEMPS EARLY THIS MORNING FROM 34 DEGS AT TRI TO 56 DEGS AT CHA. 
DOWNSLOPING EFFECT SHOULD ADD A FEW DEGREES FOR CENTRAL AND NRN 
VALLEY AREAS. THE GFS MOS MAX TEMPS LOOKED REASONABLE WITH A FEW 
ADJUSTMENTS TO ACCOUNT FOR DOWNSLOPE WARMING. MINS TONIGHT SHOULD BE 
QUITE MILD GIVEN THE STRONG SW WINDS AND NO FRONTAL PASSAGE UNTIL ON 
MONDAY. 

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS BRING IN MID LEVEL DRY 
SLOT MONDAY AHEAD OF COLD FRONT. WINDS STILL STRONG OUT OF THE SW 
AHEAD OF FRONT. WILL LIKELY NEED A WIND ADVISORY OR DOWNGRADE HIGH 
WIND WARNING DURING THE DAY THURSDAY. KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE 
POPS WITH NAM MODEL WETTER AND WARMER THAN GFS. TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
MILD AS WELL IN THE 60S. INITIAL FRONT TO PASS THROUGH MONDAY 
AFTERNOON...THEN SECONDARY FRONT TO FOLLOW IN THE EVENING. COLD AND 
DRY AIR MASS MOVES IN MONDAY NIGHT ENDING PRECIPITATION AND DROPPING 
TEMPERATURES DOWN TO NEAR FREEZING OR SLIGHTLY BELOW. TUESDAY AND 
MOST OF TUESDAY NIGHT ARE DRY AS COOL HIGH PRESSURE MOVES ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. LATE TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY LOW PRESSURE 
DEVELOPS ALONG OLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER FLORIDA. THIS SYSTEM WILL 
MOVE NORTHEAST MAINLY ALONG THE EAST COAST BUT MOISTURE WRAPPING 
AROUND THE SYSTEM TO THE EAST AND NORTHEAST WILL BRING CLOUDS AND 
PRECIPITATION BACK TO THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND DOWN INTO THE TN 
VALLEY WEDNESDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR LIGHT SNOW 
MOUNTAINS AND POSSIBLY EVEN IN THE VALLEY. AMOUNTS WILL BE 
LIGHT...PROBABLY LESS THAN ONE INCH. COLD UPPER TROUGH IS REINFORCED 
AS PRECIPITATION SHIFTS NORTHEAST WEDNESDAY. A WEAK SYSTEM IN NW 
FLOW CROSSES NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THURSDAY BUT AGAIN ONLY LIGHT PRECIPITATION. FRIDAY AND SATURDAY 
MORE COOL AND DRY WEATHER AS UPPER TROUGH STAYS OVER EASTERN US. 

&&

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
CONTINUES TO RIDGE INTO THE EAST TN VALLEY FROM THE EAST TONIGHT. 
MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS WILL INCREASE OVERNIGHT AS THE 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW INCREASES ALOFT. LIGHT PRECIPITATION IS ALSO 
POSSIBLE LATE ACROSS SOUTHERN AREAS. NEGATIVELY TILTED SHORT WAVE 
APPROACHES E TN VALLEY BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON. STRONG PRESSURE GRADIENT 
DEVELOPS ACROSS THE AREA AS BROAD SURFACE LOW PRESSURE DEEPENS 
ACROSS THE MID MS VALLEY THROUGH THE W GREAT LAKES. GOOD SE H85 
COMPONENT ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPS SHOULD LEAD TO MOUNTAIN WAVE 
EVENT ACROSS HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND ADJACENT FOOTHILLS. HIGH WIND 
WATCH REMAINS IN PLACE AND LOOKS REASONABLE. PRECIPITATION WILL 
INCREASE THROUGH THE DAY SUNDAY AS WARM FRONT MOVES NORTH ON SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON. IMPRESSIVE LAYER SHEAR BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON BUT INSTABILITY 
IS LACKING. THUNDERSTORM THREAT REMAINS LOW WITH STRONG GUSTY WINDS 
POSSIBLE WITH SHOWERS. SURFACE WARM FRONT AND SHORT WAVE MOVE NORTH 
OF THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT. SW TO NE UPPER JET EAST OF THE LONG WAVE 
TROUGH STRENGTHEN OVER THE TN VALLEY INTO MONDAY MORNING. MID LEVEL 
DRY SLOT BECOMES DOMINATE ACROSS E TN VALLEY BY MONDAY MORNING. 
NORTH/SOUTH ORIENTATED SURFACE COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH LATE MONDAY 
AFTERNOON FOLLOWED BY UPPER TROUGH AXIS LATE. SCATTERED INSTABILITY 
SHOWERS POSSIBLE MONDAY. TEMPERATURES REMAIN WARM WITH LATE DAY 
FROPA.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY) FRONT WILL HAVE PUSHED
WELL THROUGH THE AREA BY TUESDAY MORNING MAKING TUESDAY MORNING
LOWS/HIGHS ABOUT 10 TO 20 DEGREES COLDER COMPARED TO MONDAY.
ANOTHER SYSTEM WILL START TO TAKE SHAPE ACROSS TEXAS AND MOVE OVER
THE AREA TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY. AT THIS POINT LOOKS LIKE MOST OF
THE ASSOCIATED PRECIP WILL REMAIN EAST OF THE AREA, BUT WILL HAVE
MENTION OF LIGHT RAIN/SNOW SHOWERS IN THE FORECAST AS SOME OF THE
MOISTURE MIGHT BE ABLE TO MAKE IT INTO OUR AREA SOMETIME BETWEEN
WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY. ANOTHER FRONT WILL MAKE A RUN AT THE AREA
FROM THE NORTHWEST THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY. THIS ONE WILL HAVE A BIT
MORE OF A DIFFICULT TIME MAKING IT'S WAY SOUTH BUT COULD SPARK SOME
PRECIP IN THE AREA AT THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             42  60  52  65 /  60  90  50  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  40  59  50  65 /  30  90  60  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       39  58  51  64 /  40  90  50  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              34  57  45  63 /  10  90  70  20 

&&

NC...HIGH WIND WATCH FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY MORNING FOR 
     CHEROKEE-CLAY.

TN...HIGH WIND WATCH FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY MORNING FOR 
     BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS-COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS-EAST POLK-
     JOHNSON-NW BLOUNT-NORTH SEVIER-NORTHWEST CARTER-NORTHWEST 
     COCKE-NORTHWEST GREENE-NORTHWEST MONROE-SEVIER SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS-SOUTHEAST CARTER-SOUTHEAST GREENE-SOUTHEAST 
     MONROE-UNICOI-WASHINGTON TN-WEST POLK.

     RUSSELL-WASHINGTON.

.AVIATION...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS EAST OF THE AREA
OVERNIGHT. LIGHT WINDS AT THE TAF SITES TONIGHT. MID AND HIGH LEVEL

WILL MOVE N INTO THE AREA ON SUNDAY. LOW LEVEL WINDS WILL INCREASE
DRAMATICALLY BY LATE IN THE PERIOD. LOW LEVEL WIND SHEAR WILL
LIKELY BECOME A PROBLEM BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON. SHOWER ACTIVITY WILL
MOVE N INTO THE CHA AREA EARLY ON SUNDAY AND EVENTUALLY MOVE INTO
THE VCNTY TYS BY LATE IN THE PERIOD. CONDITIONS WILL LOWER TO MVFR
IN SHOWERS.



319 
FXUS64 KMRX 221606
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EST SAT NOV 22 2014

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
CENTERED OVER THE MID-ATLANTIC STATES...AND ZONAL FLOW ALOFT WILL 
PROVIDE WARMER TEMPERATURES...AS WELL AS MOSTLY DRY WEATHER FOR THE 
NEXT 24 HOURS. KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE POPS FOR MAINLY THE 
SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA FOR LATE TONIGHT.

OTHERWISE...TRANQUIL WEATHER IN GENERAL AS THE SOUTHERLY WINDS DON'T 
INCREASE UNTIL TOWARD SUNDAY AFTERNOON. MOS GUIDANCE WAS A COUPLE OF 
DEGREES TOO COOL ON FRIDAY'S MAX TEMPS...BUT THE WARMER GFS MOS 
MAXES DO LOOK REASONABLE FOR TODAY. I CLOSELY FOLLOWED THE SIMILAR 
NAM/GFS MOS MINS FOR TONIGHT. 

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...NOT MUCH CHANGE TO PREVIOUS 
FORECAST. STILL LOOKS GOOD FOR POSSIBLE MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON INTO THE OVERNIGHT. DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE AREA TO MOVE 
NORTHEAST FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS TOWARD THE GREAT LAKES AS STRONG 
HIGH PRESSURE IS ANCHORED ALONG THE SOUTHEAST US COAST. HEAVIEST 
RAINFALL SHOULD STAY ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE MOUNTAINS WITH STRONG 
SE FLOW. RAINFALL WILL BEGIN OVER SOUTHEAST SECTIONS SUNDAY MORNING 
AND ACROSS THE NORTHEAST BY LATE IN THE DAY. STEADY RAIN TO END 
AFTER MIDNIGHT WITH WINDS SHIFTING TO THE SOUTH AND THEN SW AHEAD OF 
COLD FRONT EARLY MONDAY. SCATTERED SHOWERS MONDAY WITH WARM 
TEMPERATURES. INSTABILITY FAIRLY LOW WITH WARM FRONT BUT ENOUGH TO 
MENTION SLIGHT CHANCE SUNDAY. BEHIND COLD FRONT MONDAY TEMPERATURES 
DROP DOWN INTO THE LOWER TO MID 30S OVERNIGHT WITH CLEARING SKIES.

THE REST OF THE FORECAST PERIOD IS DOMINATED BY A DEEPENING UPPER
TROUGH JUST TO THE WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA. HIGH PRESSURE WILL
KEEP SKIES SUNNY TUESDAY WITH MUCH COOLER HIGHS. LATE TUESDAY NIGHT
AND WEDNESDAY A DEVELOPING SURFACE LOW TO MOVE UP THE EAST COAST.
MOISTURE WRAPPED AROUND IT WILL SPREAD CLOUDS AND SOME LIGHT RAIN
AND SNOW ACROSS THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST. ANOTHER FAST
MOVING UPPER LOW DROPS SOUTH OUT OF THE GREAT LAKES WEDNESDAY NIGHT
AND THURSDAY INTO THE NORTHERN OHIO VALLEY AND NORTHEAST. CLOUDS
AND SOME POSSIBLE LIGHT RAIN AND SNOW WILL AFFECT AGAIN MAINLY
NORTHERN TN AND SW VA. FRIDAY COOL HIGH PRESSURE TO CLEAR SKIES AS
NW FLOW ALOFT CONTINUES. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             60  42  60  52 /  10  60  90  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  57  40  59  50 /  10  30  90  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       56  39  58  51 /  10  40  90  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              55  34  57  45 /  10  10  90  70 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...HIGH WIND WATCH FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY MORNING FOR 
     CHEROKEE-CLAY.

TN...HIGH WIND WATCH FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY MORNING FOR

     JOHNSON-NW BLOUNT-NORTH SEVIER-NORTHWEST CARTER-NORTHWEST

494 
FXUS64 KMRX 212003
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EST FRI NOV 21 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY) SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE 
CONTINUES ACROSS THE AREA TONIGHT AND SHIFTS EAST ON SATURDAY. DRY 
AIRMASS IN PLACE WITH ANOTHER NIGHT OF GOOD COOLING. LOWS COOLER 
THAN NORMAL ESPECIALLY ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA. MOSTLY SUNNY ON 
SATURDAY WITH SOME HIGH CLOUDS STREAMING INTO THE AREA FROM THE 
WEST. TEMPERATURES RISING TO NEAR NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY) SLIGHT RIDGING IS STILL 
BUILDING IN LEADING TO CONTINUED WARMING UP THAT SHOULD LAST THROUGH 
THE WEEKEND. MOST EXCITING PART OF THE FORECAST WILL COME ASSOCIATED 
WITH A AREA OF LOW PRESSURE THAT IS CURRENTLY SITTING SOUTH OF THE 4 
CORNERS REGION. SHOULD CONTINUE TO SLIDE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
PORTIONS OF THE U.S. BEFORE BECOMING NEGATIVELY TILTED AS IT MOVES 
JUST NORTH AND WEST OF THE AREA. POPS FROM PREVIOUS FORECAST LOOK 
NEARLY INTACT WITH THE BEST CHANCE OF RAIN COMING EARLY SUNDAY 
THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT AS PRECIP SPREADS IN FROM THE SOUTH AND WEST. 
HEAVY RAIN AND EVEN SOME POSSIBLE THUNDER WILL BE LIKELY, AND 
ALTHOUGH POTENTIAL FOR HEAVY RAIN IS PRESENT, THINK THE SYSTEM 
SHOULD MOVE THROUGH QUICK ENOUGH TO BELAY ANY FLOODING.

ALSO OF NOTE IS THE POTENTIAL TO SEE A MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT IN THE 
FOOTHILLS. DURING THE DAY ON SUNDAY AS 850 WINDS START TO VEER OUT 
OF THE SOUTHEAST AND PICK UP SPEED JUST NORTHWEST OF THE AREA, 
LEADING TO A FAVORABLE SET UP FOR MOUNTAIN WAVES. WILL HAVE TO 
MONITOR THE BOUNDARY LAYER TO MAKE SURE THERE IS A STABLE LAYER TO 
AID IN ITS FORMATION. WILL HOLD OF FOR NOW ON ANY SORT OF WIND 
PRODUCT AND LET A COUPLE OF RUNS OF HIGHER RES MODELS COME IN SINCE 
THEY CAN SAMPLE THE TERRAIN BETTER.

AFTER THE COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH TEMPS WILL TAKE A BIT OF A DIVE 
STARTING TUESDAY AND ONLY REACHING INTO THE 40'S AND MAYBE 50'S. A 
WEAK SYSTEM WILL THEN MOVE NEAR THE VICINITY OF THE AREA LATE IN THE 
FORECAST PERIOD BRINGING A CHANCE OF RAIN/SNOW.

MOULTON


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             36  59  42  58 /   0  10  60  90 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  30  56  40  60 /   0  10  30  80 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       31  56  39  58 /   0  10  40  80 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              24  53  34  59 /   0  10  10  90

FXUS64 KMRX 211510
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 AM EST FRI NOV 21 2014

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. MOST CLOUD COVER WILL STAY WEST OF 
THE AREA TODAY. TEMPERATURES RUNNING NEAR GFS LOOK GOOD. SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SCATTERED AREAS OF MID DECK 
CLOUDS MOVING ACROSS MIDDLE AND SE TN THIS MORNING. OTHERWISE... 
EXPECTING MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES FOR TODAY. SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE OVER THE OHIO VALLEY WILL BRING SLIGHTLY COOLER 850 MB 
TEMPS TODAY...THEN SHIFT EAST TO THE MID ATLANTIC STATES TONIGHT. 
SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW SHOULD DEVELOP ACROSS THE WRN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA...WHERE ALSO A GRADUAL INCREASE IN CLOUDS WILL OCCUR. 

NOT MANY CHANGES REQUIRED TO PREVIOUS GRIDS GIVEN THE TRANQUIL 
WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE SHORT TERM. GFS MOS TEMPS OR A BLEND IN A 
FEW SPOTS LOOKED GOOD.

LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGING 
CONTINUES SATURDAY WITH CLOUDS INCREASING AS LOW PRESSURE AREA 
DEVELOPS OVER TEXAS THEN MOVES INTO THE LOWER MS VALLEY SUNDAY AND 
MOVES RAPIDLY NE INTO THE GREAT LAKES SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. A 
WARM FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY. MODELS A 
LITTLE SLOWER THAN EARLIER RUNS. WINDS INCREASE SUNDAY WITH A STRONG 
LOW LEVEL JET AND A CONTINUED GOOD SETUP FOR MOUNTAIN WAVES. SOME 
HEAVY RAIN AND POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORMS SOUTHERN AREAS SUNDAY. THE 
TRAILING COLD FRONT SHOULD MOVE THROUGH MONDAY WITH RAIN DECREASING.

HIGHS SATURDAY WILL BE WARMER THAN TODAY IN THE 50S. EVEN WARMER 
SUNDAY AND MONDAY WITH WARM FRONT SUNDAY AND AHEAD OF COLD FRONT 
MONDAY. HIGHS MID 50S TO LOWER 60S SUNDAY AND LOWER TO MID 60S 
MONDAY. MUCH COLDER TUESDAY BEHIND COLD FRONT AND ESPECIALLY 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY AS UPPER TROUGH SETTLES OVER EASTERN PART OF 
THE COUNTRY. FAST MOVING SYSTEM MOVING SOUTHEAST IN NW FLOW TO BRING 
A CHANCE OF RAIN OR SNOW NORTHEAST PART OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
ANOTHER FAST MOVING SYSTEM TO AFFECT THE SAME AREA THURSDAY. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             55  36  59  43 /   0  10  10  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  51  30  56  40 /   0   0  10  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       49  31  56  40 /   0   0  10  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              44  24  53  34 /   0   0  10  10

MONDAY. MUCH COLDER TUESDAY BEHIND COLD FRONT AND ESPECIALLY 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY AS UPPER TROUGH SETTLES OVER EASTERN PART OF 
THE COUNTRY. FAST MOVING SYSTEM MOVING SOUTHEAST IN NW FLOW TO BRING 
A CHANCE OF RAIN OR SNOW NORTHEAST PART OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
ANOTHER FAST MOVING SYSTEM TO AFFECT THE SAME AREA THURSDAY. 

&&

763 
FXUS64 KMRX 202011
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EST THU NOV 20 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...COLD FRONT HAS MOVED SOUTHEAST 
THROUGH THE AREA. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING BACK INTO THE AREA 
FROM THE SOUTHWEST THROUGH FRIDAY. ANOTHER CHILLY NIGHT WITH 
TEMPERATURES CLIMBING CLOSER TO NORMAL ON FRIDAY. STAYED CLOSE TO A 
MODEL BLEND. SKIES WILL BE MOSTLY CLEAR. WESTERLY WINDS WILL 
DECREASE OVERNIGHT.  

.LONG TERM /FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY/... 

UPPER-LEVEL RIDGING WILL HELP PROMOTE DRY AND PARTLY SUNNY 
CONDITIONS ON SATURDAY...AND PUSH HIGHS INTO THE MID TO UPPER 50S BY 
THE AFTERNOON. CLOUDS AND PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL RAPIDLY 
INCREASE SATURDAY NIGHT AS A DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM SHIFTS 
FROM THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO GREAT LAKES ON SUNDAY. THIS 
WILL PUSH A WARM FRONT THROUGH THE REGION...BRINGING WIDESPREAD 
SHOWERS AND EVEN SOME SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS DURING DAY ON SUNDAY 
/ALONG WITH MILDER TEMPERATURES IN THE LOWER 60S/. THERE WILL BE A 
POSSIBILITY FOR SOME MINOR LOCALIZED FLOODING GIVEN THE HIGH 
PWATS...BUT THE PROGRESSIVE NATURE OF THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD LIMIT 
THIS THREAT SOMEWHAT. 
 
WITH A STRONG 70-80 KT 850 MB LLJ ROTATING OVER THE PLATEAU ON 
SUNDAY AND PREVAILING SE TO SSE FLOW OVER THE MOUNTAINS...A GOOD 
SETUP FOR MOUNTAIN WAVES WILL EXIST OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE 
EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND ADJACENT FOOTHILLS ON SUNDAY. SUSTAINED 
WINDS IN THE 30 TO 40 MPH RANGE...WITH HIGHER GUSTS LOOK AS THOUGH 
THEY WILL CERTAINLY BE POSSIBLE...SO WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR FOR 
THE NEED FOR A WIND ADVISORY AND/OR HIGH WIND WARNING FOR THESE 
AREAS AS THE WEEKEND APPROACHES. AFTER ANOTHER MILD DAY ON MONDAY... 
A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT...BRINGING IN 
SOME COOLER AIR /ALONG WITH SOME ADDITIONAL LIGHT SHOWER CHANCES/. 
THIS PREVAILING BROAD TROUGH WILL LINGER THROUGH WEDNESDAY... 
PROMOTING COOLER AIR AND THE THREAT FOR SOME ISOLATED TO SCATTERED 
SHOWERS /AND SNOW SHOWERS ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN/...BEFORE 
TAPERING OFF BY THANKSGIVING MORNING.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WEAK SYSTEM WILL MOVE THROUGH TO 
OUR NORTH THIS MORNING...BRINGING IN SOME LOW TO MID LEVEL CLOUDS 
AND POSSIBLY A FEW FLURRIES...MAINLY OVER NORTHEASTERN LOCATIONS.  
THIS SYSTEM WILL PULL OUT OF THE AREA BY MID MORNING WITH SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN FOR CLEARING SKIES DURING THE AFTERNOON. 
THE WARMING TREND CONTINUES TODAY AS TEMPERATURES CLIMB INTO THE 40S 
AND EVEN A FEW 50S SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON.  THE HIGH REMAINS IN 
CONTROL THROUGH THE NIGHT FOR CONTINUED DRY CONDITIONS.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT 
OVERALL...ALTHOUGH DIFFERENCES INCREASE A BIT LATE IN THE PERIOD. 
FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS ABOUT AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.  SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED TO OUR NORTH FRIDAY WILL SHIFT EAST AND 
SOUTHEAST INTO SATURDAY.  SHOULD BE DRY FRIDAY AND SATURDAY WITH A 
WARMING TREND.  A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL TRACK NORTHEAST OUT OF 
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS TO THE GREAT LAKES REGION SUNDAY AND SUNDAY 
NIGHT...BRINGING A WARM FRONT THROUGH OUR AREA SUNDAY AND A COLD 
FRONT MONDAY.  RAIN WILL MOVE IN SATURDAY NIGHT AND CONTINUE INTO 
SUNDAY. SOME THUNDER MAY OCCUR MAINLY SOUTH AND CENTRAL AREAS SUNDAY 
AS WELL.  THE LOW LEVEL JET WILL INCREASE AND IT LOOKS LIKE THE 
DIRECTION WILL BE SOUTH AND SOUTHEAST...WITH A POTENTIAL FOR A HIGH 
WIND EVENT DUE TO MOUNTAIN WAVES IN THE USUAL HIGHER ELEVATION AND 
FOOTHILLS LOCATIONS.  WILL MENTION THREAT IN HWO. UPPER TROUGH WILL 
MOVE INTO THE AREA TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...AND THERE MAY BE IMPULSES 
MOVING THROUGH THE FLOW WHICH WILL HELP TO BRING A FEW SHOWERS OR 
SNOW SHOWERS AT TIMES...ALTHOUGH THE DETAILS STILL HAZY THIS FAR 
OUT.  WILL JUST HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS MAINLY NORTH AND EAST ZONES 
TUE THROUGH WED.

336 
FXUS64 KMRX 192005
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EST WED NOV 19 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE HAS 
SHIFTED TO THE SOUTHEAST TODAY. MODEST WARM AIR ADVECTION HAS GOTTEN 
UNDERWAY WITH SOUTHWEST FLOW IN ADVANCE OF APPROACHING COLD FRONT. 
SEPARATE JET SEGMENTS WILL STRENGTHEN TONIGHT. ONE WILL MOVE THROUGH 
THE LOWER GREAT LAKES WHILE THE SOUTHERN STREAM WILL MOVE THROUGH 
THE LOWER TN VALLEY. THE EXIT REGION OF A H70-H50 SEGMENT WILL 
PROVIDE MEAGER LIFT COINCIDENT WITH A SLIGHT INCREASE IN MOISTURE 
AHEAD OF COLD FRONT. FLURRIES A GOOD BET ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA 
EARLY THURSDAY BUT MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION DOES NOT APPEAR LIKELY. 
TEMPERATURES REMAIN COOL WHILE MUCH CLOSER TO NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY/... 

AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE AXIS WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD INTO THE REGION 
LATE THIS WEEK...RESULTING IN CONTINUED FAIR/DRY WEATHER AND WARMER 
TEMPERATURES. THE COMBINATION OF ABOUNDANT SUNSHINE...SOUTHERLY FLOW 
AND INCREASED THICKNESS VALUES WHICH HELP PUSH HIGHS INTO THE 50S BY 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. CLOUDS AND PRECIPIATION CHANCES WILL RAPIDLY 
INCREASE SATURDAY NIGHT AS DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM SHIFTS FROM 
THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO GREAT LAKES ON SUNDAY. THIS WILL 
RESULT IN WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND EVEN SOME THUNDERSTORMS FOR 
SUNDAY...WITH MILD TEMPERATURES IN THE 60S. SOME STRONG SOUTHEAST 
WINDS ALONG THE EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS COULD RESULT IN LOCALIZED 
MOUNTAIN WAVE WINDS ALONG THE SMOKY MTN FOOTHILLS...SO MAY NEED TO 
MONITOR FOR A WIND ADVISORY ALONG THE MTNS LATER THIS WEEKEND. THE 
MILD WEATHER WILL CONTINUE INTO MONDAY AS ANOTHER SHORTWAVE KICKS 
OFF ANOTHER ROUND OF SCATTERED SHOWERS. A BROAD TROUGH WILL CONTINUE 
TO KICK OFF SUBTLE SHORTWAVES TUESDAY...AND THUS CHANCES FOR 
ADDITIONAL ISOLATED SHOWER CHANCES. THEN...TUESDAY NIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY A STRONGER FRONT AND PUSH OF COLDER AIR COULD RESULT IN 
SOME SLIGHT CHANCES FOR SNOW SHOWERS ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN AND 
EVEN INTO THE VALLEY...BEFORE TAPERING OFF BY THANKSGIVING MORNING.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

624 
FXUS64 KMRX 191555
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1050 AM EST WED NOV 19 2014

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WARMING TREND BEGINS TODAY.  WINDS 
WILL INCREASE AND BECOME SOUTHERLY THIS AFTERNOON...BRINGING WARMER 
AIR INTO THE REGION.  HIGHS SHOULD CLIMB INTO THE UPPER 30S AND 40S 
THROUGHOUT THE VALLEY TODAY.  THEN...A WEAK CLIPPER SYSTEM WILL 
TRACK THROUGH TO OUR NORTH TONIGHT AS IT MOVES ACROSS THE GREAT 
LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY AREAS.  THIS FEATURE WILL BRING IN A FEW 
CLOUDS...ALSO THERE IS A LOW CHANCE A FEW FLURRIES MAY FALL OVER THE 
FAR NORTHEASTERN LOCATIONS.  HOWEVER...WITH A VERY DRY AIR MASS IN 
PLACE...MOST ASSOCIATED PRECIP SHOULD STAY WELL TO OUR NORTH FOR A 
DRY AND WARMER NIGHT.  

LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT 
OVERALL AND RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY IS GOOD ENOUGH TO YIELD AVERAGE 
TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE AVERAGE FORECAST CONFIDENCE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. 
A WEAK AND MOISTURE STARVED COLD FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH ON 
THURSDAY.  MAY BE SOME FLURRIES OR SPRINKLES MAINLY NORTH IN THE 
MORNING.  HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE IN CONTROL FOR FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY. 
A STRONGER SYSTEM WILL AFFECT THE REGION BY SUNDAY AS A LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM LIFTS NORTHEAST AND PASSES BY TO OUR WEST...FOLLOWED BY AN 
UPPER TROUGH AND A SURGE OF COLDER AIR EARLY NEXT WEEK. LOOKS LIKE 
BEST CHANCE FOR RAIN WILL BE SUNDAY...AND THERE MAY BE ENOUGH 
INSTABILITY FOR A FEW RUMBLES OF THUNDER SUNDAY AT LEAST IN THE 
SOUTH.  WILL KEEP POSSIBILITY OF PRECIP IN FOR MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY...ALTHOUGH POPS WILL BE MUCH LOWER.  WILL HAVE A WARMING 
TREND FOR THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY AND MONDAY...TURNING COLDER 
TUESDAY.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             46  30  50  28 /   0   0   0   0

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

905 PM EST TUE NOV 18 2014

.DISCUSSION...TEMPS TUMBLING DOWNWARD UNDER THE CLEAR SKIES... 
ESPECIALLY WHERE WINDS HAD ALSO BECOME CALM. HOURLY TEMPS AND DEW 
POINT TEMPS RUNNING VERY CLOSE TO 02Z OBSERVATIONS...IN FACT RIGHT 
ON WHERE A LIGHT S-SW WIND CONTINUES.

PLAN TO PROBABLY TWEAK THE HOURLY GRIDS AROUND 10 PM EST...AND ANY 
AFFECTED WEB PRODUCTS. 

OTHERWISE...STAY WARM UNDER THIS BIG CHILL!

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
259 PM EST TUE NOV 18 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...SNOW SHOWERS HAVE ENDED THIS 
AFTERNOON ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH A FEW POSSIBLE FLURRIES NE. 
SKIES ARE NOW CLEAR SE TWO THIRDS WITH JUST A FEW CLOUDS OVER THE
NE. GUSTY NORTHWEST TO WEST WINDS HAVE MADE IT FEEL LIKE A RAW MID
WINTER DAY WITH WIND CHILLS IN THE SINGLE DIGITS TO MID 20S...NOT
MID NOVEMBER. TEMPERATURES HAVE ONLY MADE IT INTO THE 20S TO LOWER
30S AS OF MID AFTERNOON.

AS THE COLD UPPER TROUGH TO THE NORTH SHIFTS EAST AND VERY DRY
SURFACE HIGH MOVES IN TONIGHT SKIES WILL STAY CLEAR WITH WINDS
SUBSIDING AND TEMPERATURES DROPPING TO NEAR RECORD LOWS IN THE
TEENS TO NEAR 20. WEDNESDAY A FAST MOVING CLIPPER NOW OVER SOUTH
CENTRAL CANADA AND THE NORTHERN ROCKIES MOVES THROUGH THE UPPER MS
VALLEY AND GREAT LAKES. SOME CLOUDS WILL SINK INTO THE OHIO VALLEY
AND TN VALLEY BY LATE WEDNESDAY BUT THE AIR MASS WILL BE TOO DRY
FOR ANY PRECIPITATION. SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL INCREASE AHEAD OF THE
SYSTEM WHICH WILL HELP TEMPERATURES TO WARM INTO THE 40S...SOME
10 TO 15 DEGREES ABOVE TODAYS HIGH TEMPERATURES. HIGHS COULD BE A
AFFECTED SOME BY CLOUDS NE SECTIONS SO KEPT TEMPERATURES IN SW VA
MAINLY IN THE UPPER 30S.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...OVERALL THEME
WILL BE A GRADUAL WARMING TREND THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED WITH A
WEEKEND STORM SYSTEM THAT WILL BRING POTENTIALLY HEAVY RAIN AND A
FEW STORMS.
 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT WILL STILL BE BELOW AVERAGE BUT MUCH WARMER THAN 
TUESDAY NIGHT. TEMPS IN THE MID TO UPPER 20S...ROUGHLY 10 DEGREES 
BELOW AVERAGE. LONGWAVE TROUGH CONTINUES TO PUSH EAST OF OUR AREA 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND INTO THURSDAY. AS THAT HAPPENS THOUGH...A WEAK 
WAVE WILL PASS TO OUR NORTH PROVIDING A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SNOW 
SHOWERS ACROSS PORTIONS OF NETN AND SWVA. LITTLE TO NO ACCUMULATION 
EXPECTED ACROSS LOWER ELEVATIONS BESIDES A DUSTING. ELEVATIONS 
ABOVE 3000 FEET MAY SEE UP TO HALF AN INCH OF SNOW BY THURSDAY 
MORNING. THURSDAY HIGHS BACK NEAR 40 EXTREME NORTHERN AREAS...MID 
40S CENTRAL VALLEY...NEAR 50 SOUTHERN VALLEY. FRIDAY RIDGING 
CONTINUES TO BUILD OVER OUR AREA OUT AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING WEEKEND 
SYSTEM. A WEAK AND SUBTLE SHORTWAVE LIFTS TO THE NORTHWEST OF US ON 
FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT BUT KEPT THIS PERIOD DRY AS THERE IS LIMITED 
MOISTURE TO WORK WITH THIS FAR EAST. HIGH PRESSURE STILL CONTINUING 
TO BUILD ON SATURDAY AS A LOW PRESSURE CENTER ACROSS TEXAS WILL HELP 
TO AMPLIFY UPPER LEVEL FLOW ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. THIS WILL 
ALLOW SATURDAYS HIGHS TO CLIMB NEAR 50 AND MID AND UPPER 50S. DID 
INTRODUCE SLIGHT CHANCE POP ON SATURDAY AFTERNOON FOR THE PLATEAU 
AND PORTIONS OF THE SWVA COUNTIES. MODELS STILL IN AGREEMENT THAT 
THE BEST CHANCE FOR PRECIP STILL LOOKS TO BE LATE SATURDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING. MODERATE TO POTENTIAL PERIODS OF HEAVY 
RAINFALL LOOK POSSIBLE AS SOUTHERLY 850MB FLOW WILL ADVECT MOISTURE 
INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM. CURRENT GFS 
SOUNDINGS AT 12Z SUNDAY SHOW PW VALUES FOR CHA...TYS...AND TRI BEING 
BETWEEN 2SD ABOVE NORMAL AND THE 99TH PERCENTILE FOR MEAN PW 
CLIMATOLOGY. HOWEVER...THIS SYSTEM LOOKS LIKE IT WILL BE A FAST 
MOVER SO FLOODING DOES NOT LOOK LIKE IT WILL BE A THREAT AT THIS 
TIME. 

THERE COULD ALSO BE A FEW RUMBLES OF THUNDER WITH THIS SYSTEM. 
LIMITED INSTABILITY HOWEVER WILL KEEP THE BETTER CHANCES ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN VALLEY. THIS SYSTEM MOVES OUT DURING THE DAY ON SUNDAY WITH 
CLEARING CONDITIONS LATE. ANOTHER LESS POTENT SYSTEM MOVES IN ON 
MONDAY AND WILL BRING ANOTHER CHANCE FOR RAIN. THE NEXT LONGWAVE 
TROUGH BEGINS TO MOVE IN LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY AND WILL 
BRING YET AGAIN ANOTHER QUICK SHOT OF RAIN. THIS TROUGH WILL DROP 
TEMPERATURES FROM THE MID 60S ON MONDAY INTO THE UPPER 40S AND NEAR 
50 FOR TUESDAY.

325 PM EST MON NOV 17 2014

.SHORT TERM...(LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT)TERM...LOW PRESSURE
ASSOCIATED WITH ARCTIC COLD FRONT HAS NOW MOVED EAST OF THE
APPALACHIANS WITH MUCH COLDER AIR MASS FILTERING INTO THE FORECAST
AREA AND A SECONDARY PUSH OF EVEN COLDER AIR IS FOLLOWING THE FRONT
NOW AS IT MOVES INTO THE FORECAST AREA. LOW CLOUDS IN THE COLD AIR
MASS ARE WRINGING OUT SOME LIGHT RAIN...SNOW AND POSSIBLE SLEET
OVER SW VA AND NE TN WITH TEMPERATURES IN THE LOWER TO MID 30S. 
OVERALL AM ONLY EXPECTING TRACE AMOUNTS AT MOST LOCATIONS.

ELSEWHERE SKIES ARE CLOUDY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY AND IN THE 30S TO NEAR
40 WITH HIGHER ELEVATIONS ALREADY IN THE 20S. WILL ISSUE AN SPS TO
ADDRESS POSSIBLE ICE FORMING ON ROADS IN AREAS WHERE HEAVY RAIN
FELL AND SOME SNOW SHOWERS IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS OVERNIGHT. WIND
CHILLS WILL FALL TO 5 BELOW ZERO IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS. LOWS
TUESDAY MAY REACH NEAR RECORDS SINCE THEY ARE 22 IN 1997 AT THE
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT...KNOXVILLE AIRPORT IS 19 IN 1959 AND TRI
CITIES AIRPORT IS 16 IN 1997.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...COLD...COLD...COLD TO
START THE LONG TERM. THEN...THE LONGWAVE TROUGH REMAINS THROUGH
THURSDAY WITH A WARM-UP FOR THE WEEKEND AHEAD OF OUR NEXT BIG
SYSTEM.

ARCTIC AIR IN PLACE ON TUESDAY AS WE ARE FIRMLY ENTRENCHED WITHIN A 
DEEP LONGWAVE TROUGH. MOST AREAS WILL REMAIN BELOW FREEZING ON 
TUESDAY WITH MANY MINIMUM MAX TEMP RECORDS LIKELY BEING BROKEN. CHA 
MIN MAX RECORD IS 34 IN 1903...CURRENT FORECAST IS 33. TYS MIN MAX 
RECORD IS 33 IN 1951...CURRENT FORECAST IS 30. TRI MIN MAX RECORD IS 
31 IN 1951...CURRENT FORECAST IS 27. SOME LIGHT SNOW 
SHOWERS/FLURRIES POSSIBLE TUESDAY MORNING ACROSS PORTIONS OF NE TN
AND SW VA DUE TO UPSLOPE SNOW...A LIGHT DUSTING MAY OCCUR. NO
SURPRISE THAT MANY LOW TEMP RECORDS ON WEDNESDAY MORNING WILL ALSO
LIKELY BE BROKEN. CHA MIN RECORD IS 17 IN 1914...CURRENT FORECAST
IS 19. TYS MIN RECORD IS 17 IN 1914...CURRENT FORECAST IS 17. TRI
MIN RECORD IS 17 IN 2008...CURRENT FORECAST IS 12.
 
ANOTHER SHORTWAVE MOVES THROUGH ON WEDNESDAY BUT MOST OF THE 
MOISTURE SHOULD STAY NORTH...RESULTING IN A DRY DAY. THE BEGINNING 
OF A WARMING TREND IS ALSO EXPECTED ON WEDNESDAY WITH TEMPS 10 TO 15 
DEGREES WARMER THAN TUESDAY. AFTER WEDNESDAY...TEMPERATURES CONTINUE 
TO WARM AS HIGH PRESSURE SLOWLY STARTS TO BUILD IN AHEAD OF A 
WEEKEND STORM SYSTEM. MODELS STILL WANT TO BRING A WEAK SHORT WAVE 
INTO OUR REGION LATE THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY BRINGING SOME LIGHT 
PRECIPITATION TO THE AREA. SATURDAY...A LOW PRESSURE CENTER ADVANCES 
TOWARD US FROM OUT OF THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. THE AMPLIFIED UPPER LEVEL 
FLOW OUT AHEAD OF THE LOW WILL RESULT IN BOTH TEMPERATURE AND 
MOISTURE ADVECTION. TEMPS WARM INTO THE UPPER 40S AND LOW 50S WITH 
LIGHT PRECIP POSSIBLE SATURDAY AS A WARM FRONT ADVANCES NORTHWARD 
THROUGH THE AREA. MODELS INDICATE THAT THE BEST CHANCE OF PRECIP 
OCCURS ON SUNDAY AS A NEGATIVELY TILTED TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM SWINGS THROUGH. TEMPS ON SUNDAY WILL BE IN THE MID 
TO UPPER 50S WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE UPPER 40S TO LOW 50S. EVEN A FEW 
THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE AS THIS SYSTEM MOVES ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. ANOTHER SHOT OF LIGHT PRECIP ON MONDAY AS YET ANOTHER 
WEAK WAVE ROLLS THROUGH. TEMPS ON MONDAY LOOK TO BE THE WARMEST THEY 
HAVE BEEN SINCE EARLY/MID NOVEMBER WITH HIGHS IN THE LOW TO MID 
60S...SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.

LEVEL FLOW WILL BECOME AMPLIFIED AS SHORT WAVE ENERGY DROPS THROUGH 
THE BASE OF A WESTERN U.S. UPPER TROUGH. THIS WILL LEAD TO 
INCREASING MOISTURE AND TEMPERATURE ADVECTION WHICH MAY RESULT IN 
SOME LIGHT SHOWERS ON SATURDAY AS WARMER AIR ADVANCES NORTH.

THE CHANCE OF RAIN DURING THE DAY SUNDAY AS A STRONG STORM SYSTEM 
APPROACHES SUNDAY NIGHT.

955 PM EST SUN NOV 16 2014

.DISCUSSION...UPDATED TO INCLUDE CHANCE OF THUNDER FOR AREAS ALONG
AND SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40...AND HIGH WIND WARNING FOR THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS OF THE FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS.

VERY DYNAMIC SYSTEM WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND
SOUTHERN APPALACHAINS OVERNIGHT AND MONDAY MORNING. UPPER LEVEL
JET OVER THE OHIO VALLEY WILL PLACE THE AREA UNDER STRONG
DIVERGENCE ALOFT BETWEEN 06-12Z. THE DIRECT CIRCULATION AROUND THIS
JET WILL STRENGTHEN THE FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING OVER EAST TENNESSEE.
LATEST FORECAST SOUNDING SHOWS ELEVATED ABOVE 850MB...ESPECIALLY
AREAS ALONG AND SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40. WILL INCLUDE A CHANCE OF
THUNDER FOR EARLY MONDAY MORNING.

THE STRONG UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM WILL ALSO INTENSIFY THE BOUNDARY
LAYER JET WITH 850MB WINDS INCREASING TO 65-70 KTS BETWEEN 06-12Z.
WILL ISSUE A HIGH WIND WARNING FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS THROUGH
13Z. STRONG INVERSION BELOW 850MB WILL KEEP WINDS FROM MIXING TO
THE SURFACE.

393 
FXUS64 KMRX 162019
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 PM EST SUN NOV 16 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...
THE AREA OF RAIN AFFECTING THE CWA THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING IS 
ASSOCIATED MAINLY WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT...WHICH THE MODELS SHOW 
DECREASING AROUND MIDNIGHT. A BRIEF LULL IN THE PRECIP SHOULD OCCUR 
AROUND THAT TIME BEFORE Q-G FORCING ASSOCIATED WITH THE JET ENTRANCE 
REGION RAMPS UP PRECIP AGAIN LATE TONIGHT. LOW LEVEL WARM ADVECTION 
WITH A 40-50 KT LLJ MAY RESULT IN TEMPERATURES WARMING SLIGHTLY 
OVERNIGHT. HIGHER ELEVATIONS MAY APPROACH WIND ADVISORY
CRITERIA...BUT MOST SPOTS SHOULD STAY BELOW AND THUS WILL NOT ISSUE
AN ADVISORY AT THIS TIME. SW DIRECTION OF 850 MB WINDS IS NOT
FAVORABLE FOR MOUNTAIN WAVE DEVELOPMENT. QPF AMOUNTS OF 1 TO 2
INCHES ARE EXPECTED AREA WIDE...WITH SOUTHERN AREAS ON THE HIGHER
END OF THAT RANGE.

BY MONDAY MORNING WE WILL HAVE A COLD FRONT BEGINNING TO PUSH EAST 
INTO THE AREA...AND STRONG FORCING WILL EXIT TO THE EAST AND BRING 
CATEGORICAL PRECIP TO AN END. STRONG COLD ADVECTION BEHIND THE FRONT 
WILL BRING FALLING TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE DAY...AND A CHANGE TO 
SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS IN THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THE LACK OF 
DEEP MOISTURE INTO THE DENDRITE GROWTH ZONE SHOULD MEAN ONLY LIGHT
SNOW ACCUMULATIONS. STEEP LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES AND AN UPSPLOE WIND
OF 20-25 KTS COULD RESULT IN SOME HIGHER ELEVATIONS SEEING AROUND 1
INCH THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. LOWS MONDAY NIGHT ARE EXPECTED TO BE IN
THE TEENS TO AROUND 20 IN MOST SPOTS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
DEPARTING UPPER LEVEL SHORT WAVE COULD LINGER INTO TUESDAY MORNING
WITH SOME SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA BUT MAINLY THE
COLD DRY ARCTIC AIR MASS WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES BELOW FREEZING FROM
THE TEENS IN THE MOUNTAINS TO 20S TO LOWER 30S VALLEYS. ONLY A FEW
LOCATIONS IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEYS MAY REACH ABOVE FREEZING. RECORD
LOW MAXIMUMS WILL BE POSSIBLE. WEST WINDS 10 TO 15 MPH WILL ADD TO
THE CHILL. COLD UPPER TROUGH WILL REMAIN OVER THE FORECAST AREA
THROUGH WEDNESDAY WITH ANOTHER SYSTEM DROPPING INTO THE GREAT LAKES
WEDNESDAY. SKIES WILL BE MOSTLY CLEAR OVER THE TN VALLEY AND LOWS
TUESDAY NIGHT WILL BE THE COLDEST OF THE YEAR. MOST LOCATIONS AGAIN
COULD EXPERIENCE RECORD LOWS FOR THE DATE. THE GREAT LAKES SYSTEM
WEDNESDAY MAY SPREAD SOME CLOUDS ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE
REGION WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL THEN
MODERATE WITH LOWS IN THE 20S AND HIGHS IN THE 40S.

THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY GFS BRINGS A SYSTEM FROM THE LOWER MS 
VALLEY INTO THE TN VALLEY. HIGHER ELEVATIONS MAY GET SNOW BUT MOST 
LOWER ELEVATIONS WOULD HAVE A LITTLE LIGHT RAIN. THE BULK OF THE 
SYSTEM WILL STAY SOUTH OF TN AS IT MOVES RAPIDLY EAST. COLDER AND 
DRIER CONDITIONS RETURN FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. MEANWHILE A NEW 
TROUGH DEVELOPS OVER THE WESTERN STATES THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. LOW 
PRESSURE DEVELOPS OUT AHEAD OF THE TROUGH SATURDAY EAST OF THE 
ROCKIES. THEN THIS SYSTEM ORGANIZES AND SPREADS CLOUDS AND RAIN WITH 
POSSIBLE SNOW NE AND MOUNTAINS LATE SATURDAY NIGHT AND EARLY SUNDAY. 
THIS SYSTEM IS MUCH WARMER SO HIGHS SUNDAY SHOULD REACH THE 50S WITH 
ALL RAIN FOR THE FORECAST AREA.


&&

FXUS64 KMRX 160804
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EST SUN NOV 16 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER TROUGH WILL DIG IN TO OUR 
WEST AS A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKS FROM NEAR THE GULF 
COAST NORTHEAST INTO OUR AREA BY LATE TONIGHT.  RAIN WILL OVERSPREAD 
THE AREA TODAY...AND WILL AFFECT THE ENTIRE AREA TONIGHT.  WARMER 
AIR WILL ARRIVE AHEAD OF THE RAIN...KEEPING THE PRECIPITATION ALL 
LIQUID FOR THE SHORT TERM PERIOD.  WINDS WILL PICK UP OVER SOME OF 
THE HIGHER TERRAIN AS LOW LEVEL JET INCREASES...BUT AT THIS TIME THE 
LOW LEVEL WINDS LOOK TO HAVE ENOUGH OF A SOUTHWEST COMPONENT TO BE 
UNFAVORABLE FOR ANY MOUNTAIN WAVES...AND EXPECT WIND SPEEDS TO 
GENERALLY STAY BELOW WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA. WILL GENERALLY MAKE 
ONLY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO MAV TEMPS.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...ADVERTISED ARCTIC CHILL ON 
THE WAY LATE MONDAY INTO MONDAY NIGHT AS RAIN CHANGES TO LIGHT SNOW 
SHOWERS WITH MAIN IMPACT IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
AND ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. THE UPSLOPE FLOW MAY BE ABLE TO 
SQUEEZE OUT AN INCH OR SO IN THESE MOUNTAIN AREAS BY TUESDAY 
MORNING. MID 40 DEGREE MAX TEMPS ON MONDAY WILL DROP INTO THE LOWER 
20S BY TUESDAY MORNING WITH ONLY A FIVE TO TEN DEGREE RISE TO THE 
UPPER 20S AND LOWER 30S IN THE CHILLY AIR MASS DURING THE DAY 
TUESDAY. MODELS NOT ENTIRELY IN AGREEMENT THROUGH THE END OF THE 
FORECAST PERIOD FROM MID WEEK OUT THROUGH SATURDAY BUT STAYED A 
LITTLE CLOSER TO THE ECMWF WHICH BRINGS ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH THROUGH 
THE EASTERN STATES THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY WITH A MOISTURE STARVED 
FROPA THURSDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY FRIDAY. ENOUGH COLD AIR AROUND FOR 
SOME SNOW SHOWERS AT NIGHT WITH RAIN SHOWERS DURING THE DAYTIME 
PERIOD HERE.

771 
FXUS64 KMRX 152024
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 PM EST SAT NOV 15 2014

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT AND SUNDAY
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD OFF THE COAST OF VA/NC OVERNIGHT.
FARTHER WEST A DEEPENING SHORTWAVE OVER THE PLAINS/MIDWEST WILL
AID IN ALLOWING LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TO ADVANCE NORTHWARD WITH THE
STRENGTHENING SOUTHERLY WINDS. AS A RESULT...CLOUDS WILL THICKEN
PARTICULARLY AFTER MIDNIGHT ACROSS THE TN VALLEY. THE CLOUDS SHOULD
HELP KEEP THE SURFACE TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY WARMER THAN PREVIOUS
NIGHT/S. THERE WILL BE MENTION OF SLIGHT CHANCE /LOW CONFIDENCE/ MIX
PRECIP ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...HOWEVER THE LOWEST LEVELS OF
THE ATMOSPHERE WILL REMAIN TOO DRY FOR MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION TO
OCCUR UNTIL AFTER NOON ON SUNDAY. THIS HIGHER RAIN CHANCE ALSO
COINCIDES WITH THE BEST DYNAMICS OF THE UPPER TROUGH FOR THIS TIME
PERIOD. THEREFORE THE BULK OF PRECIPITATION WILL BEGIN SUNDAY
AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM...SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY
SURFACE LOW OVER THE SOUTHERN MS VALLEY SUNDAY EVENING SHIFTS
NORTHEAST TOWARD THE TN VALLEY OVERNIGHT WITH COPIUS GULF MOISTURE
STREAMING NE. RAINFALL WILL INCREASE AHEAD OF THIS FEATURE. AT THE
SAME TIME NEXT PUSH OF ARCTIC AIR WILL BE HEADED SOUTHEAST FROM THE
MID MS VALLEY AND OHIO VALLEYS. THE ARCTIC AIR NOW LOOKS LIKE IT
DOES NOT REACH THE NW SECTIONS UNTIL LATER MONDAY AFTER MOST OF THE
MOISTURE FROM THE SOUTHERN STREAM BEGINS TO MOVE OUT. TEMPERATURES
WILL LIKELY DROP DURING THE AFTERNOON ON THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND
ALONG THE KY/VA BORDER SO RAIN WILL MIX WITH AND CHANGE TO SNOW BY
EVENING. FARTHER EAST AND SOUTH THE CHANGEOVER WILL BE
LATER...MAYBE NOT UNTIL EVENING. SINCE DEEPER MOISTURE WILL HAVE
MOVED OUT SNOWFALL AMOUNTS WILL BE LIMITED MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY
MORNING. TEMPERATURES WILL STAY ABOVE FREEZING SUNDAY
NIGHT...MOSTLY IN THE LOWER 40S AND REMAIN IN THE 40S UNTIL
AFTERNOON MONDAY EXCEPT FALL OVER HIGHEST PLATEAU ELEVATIONS AND
NEAR KY BORDER OF SW VA TO NEAR FREEZING BEFORE MONDAY EVENING.
SOME LIGHT ACCUMULATION WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND OVER THE MOUNTAINS BORDERING NORTH
CAROLINA MONDAY NIGHT AS UPSLOPE NORTHWEST FLOW DEVELOPS.

THE ARCTIC COLD WILL SET IN MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY WITH MOST OF 
THE FORECAST AREA BELOW FREEZING. LOWS TUESDAY MORNING DROP TO THE 
MID TEENS TO MID 20S. HIGHS TUESDAY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WILL 
ONLY REACH THE LOWER TO MID 20S. TUESDAY NIGHT SHOULD BE THE COLDEST 
OF THE YEAR WITH LOWS IN THE TEENS TO NEAR 20 AND SINGLE DIGITS 
HIGHER MOUNTAINS. A WARMING TREND STARTS WEDNESDAY AND CONTINUES 
INTO SATURDAY. COLD UPPER TROUGH OVER THE EAST FLATTENS OUT THURSDAY 
BUT TEMPERATURES REMAIN BELOW NORMAL. ANOTHER SYSTEM MOVES INTO THE 
MS VALLEY THURSDAY. CLOUDS AND A CHANCE OF RAIN RETURN THURSDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR FREEZING AT 
NIGHT WITH SNOW POSSIBLE MAINLY HIGHER ELEVATIONS BUT HIGHS DURING 
THE DAY WILL STAY IN THE 40S.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             49  30  50  43 /   0   0  70  90 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  43  27  49  40 /   0   0  60  90 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       44  28  47  40 /   0  10  60  90

815 
FXUS64 KMRX 150821
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 AM EST SAT NOV 15 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE 
AREA WILL SHIFT EAST.  SHOULD BE PLENTY OF SUN TODAY...WITH WARMER 
BUT STILL BELOW NORMAL TEMPS.  MOISTURE WILL BEGIN TO RETURN TONIGHT 
AHEAD OF THE NEXT SYSTEM WITH INCREASING CLOUDS ACROSS THE AREA. ANY 
PRECIPITATION SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL AFTER 12Z AS LOWER LEVELS OF THE 
ATMOSPHERE WILL BE RATHER DRY. JUST SOME MINOR TWEAKS TO MAV TEMPS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...SHORT WAVE TROUGH SHIFTS EAST 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS ON SUNDAY GENERATING A SURFACE WAVE OVER 
THE WESTERN GULF COASTAL REGION. MOISTURE WILL BE ON THE INCREASE 
LIFTING ISENTROPICALLY OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION DURING 
THE DAY SUNDAY. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR LIGHT RAIN TO OVERSPREAD THE 
FORECAST AREA FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST THROUGH THE DAY. SURFACE 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE WARMING ABOVE FREEZING BY MID DAY BUT THERE IS 
A SMALL CHANCE FOR A FEW FLURRIES ON THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU DURING 
THE MORNING ON SUNDAY. DOESN'T LOOK LIKE THIS WILL BE MUCH OF A 
PROBLEM. WHILE THE SURFACE LOW SHIFTS NORTHEAST ACROSS THE DEEP 
SOUTH A DEEPENING UPPER TROUGH WILL BE BUILDING STEADILY EAST INTO 
THE MIDDLE OF THE NATION. THIS CIRCULATION WILL BE DRIVING THE 
SECOND ARCTIC AIR MASS OF THE COLD SEASON BACK INTO THE EASTERN U.S. 
ON MONDAY. A NICE INLFUX OF MOISTURE OFF THE GULF OF MEXICO WILL BE 
LIFTED AHEAD OF THIS MASS OF COLD AIR GENERATING WIDESPREAD RAINFALL 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. LATE IN THE DAY 
ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE PRECIPITATION SHIELD TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
DROPPING BELOW FREEZING ALLOWING THE LIGHT RAIN TO CHANGE TO SOME 
LIGHT SNOW. THE GOOD NEWS IS THAT MOISTURE AND LIFT WILL BE 
DIMINISHING FAIRLY QUICKLY IN THE POST FRONTAL AIR SO THERE SHOULD 
NOT BE A LENGTHY PERIOD OF SNOWFALL WHICH SHOULD KEEP AMOUNTS RATHER 
LIGHT. IT STILL APPEARS THE MAIN AREA WHERE THERE MAY BE SOME LIGHT 
ACCUMULATION WILL BE IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
AND OVER THE MOUNTAINS BORDERING NORTH CAROLINA MONDAY NIGHT AS AN 
UPSLOPE NORTHWESTERLY FLOW DEVELOPS. STILL LOOKS LIKE A BONE 
CHILLING COLD DAY ON TUESDAY WITH MAX TEMPS ABOUT 25-30 DEGREES 
BELOW NORMAL WITH LOWS BY WEDNESDAY MORNING ABOUT 20 DEGREES BELOW 
NORMAL. TEMPERATURES SLOWLY MODERATE THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE 
WORK WEEK BUT WILL STILL BE ABOUT 5-10 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL ON 
FRIDAY. MODEL SOLUTIONS DIVERGE TOWARD THE END OF THE FORECAST 
PERIOD WITH A DRIER APPEARANCE TO THE GFS AND WETTER ON THE ECMWF. 
WENT CLOSER TO THE MORE PESSIMISTIC EUROPEAN WITH ANOTHER FRONTAL 
SYSTEM BRINGING RAIN TO THE AREA THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY NIGHT.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             49  30  50  43 /   0   0  70  90 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  43  27  49  40 /   0   0  60  90 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       44  28  47  40 /   0  10  60  90

343 
FXUS64 KMRX 142042
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
342 PM EST FRI NOV 14 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...COLD AIR CONTINUES TO POUR
INTO THE REGION. STRATOCUMULUS CLOUDS PERSISTING OVER THE UPSLOPE
AREAS AND AIDED BY SOME SURFACE HEATING. THESE CLOUDS AREA STARTING
TO DIMINISH AS WE GET PAST THE MAX HEATING. THINK BY SUNSET MOST OF
THESE CLOUDS WILL DISSIPATE. WINDS WILL BE DIMINISHING OVERNIGHT AS
THE SURFACE RIDGE SETTLES INTO THE AREA...SETTING THE STAGE FOR A
VERY COLD NIGHT ACROSS THE AREA. SATURDAY WILL START TO WARM UP
SOMEWHAT AS THE RIDGE SLIDES TO THE EAST AND THE COLD AIR STARTS TO
RETREAT. WILL GO CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS. RH VALUES WILL BE QUITE
LOW SATURDAY AS THE AIR MASS STARTS TO WARM UP BUT THE DEW POINTS
REMAIN VERY LOW.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODERATING TEMPERATURES 
SATURDAY NIGHT AS CLOUDS INCREASE AHEAD OF NEXT WEATHER SYSTEM. 
UPPER FLOW THATS STARTS AS WESTERLY BECOMES SOUTHWESTERLY SUNDAY.THE 
MOISTURE INCREASES ESPECIALLY SUNDAY WITH LIGHT RAIN BEGINNING IN 
THE SOUTHWEST AND WEST. LOWS SUNDAY MAY COME EARLY SO THREAT FOR ANY 
SIGNIFICANT WINTER PRECIPITATION IS LOW. RAIN SPREADS IN FAIRLY SLOW 
SUNDAY MORNING AND THEN INCREASES BY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. INITIAL 
PRECIPITATION SHIELD MERGES WITH 2ND AREA AHEAD OF NEW UPPER TROUGH 
AND SHOT OF ARCTIC AIR LATE SUNDAY NIGHT AND EARLY MONDAY. THE COLD 
FRONT WITH THIS SYSTEM WILL BE RIGHT OVER THE EASTERN TN VALLEY 
MONDAY MORNING. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL LIKELY COME IN THE MORNING 
AND THEN START FALLING FROM LATE MORNING OR EARLY AFTERNOON ON. RAIN 
SHOULD CHANGE TO SNOW IN THE MOUNTAINS AS THE FREEZING LEVEL DROPS 
BUT ONLY LIGHT AMOUNTS EXPECTED. THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND SW VA 
MOUNTAINS NEAR KENTUCKY COULD SEE LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS. THE DEEPER 
MOISTURE MOVES OUT MONDAY EVENING BUT NW FLOW SNOWFALL WILL CONTINUE 
INTO TUESDAY MORNING. SNOWFALL AMOUNTS RIGHT NOW LOOK TO BE ONLY 
AROUND A TRACE LOWER ELEVATIONS TO A COUPLE INCHES HIGH MOUNTAINS 
AND WESTERN PARTS OF SW VIRGINIA BY TUESDAY MORNING. THE DRY ARCTIC 
AIR MASS SETTLES IN TUESDAY AND ONLY SLOWLY MODERATES WEDNESDAY. 
LOWS MONDAY NIGHT DROP TO THE TEENS AND 20S AND ONLY TEENS 
WEDNESDAY. HIGHS TUESDAY MOSTLY MID 20S TO MID 30S AND WEDNESDAY 30S 
TO LOWER 40S. RECORD LOWS AND LOW MAXIMUM TEMPERATURES FOR THE DATE 
MAY BE IN DANGER.

TEMPERATURES FINALLY BEGIN TO REBOUND THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WITH HIGHS 
INTO THE 40S AND 50S. ANOTHER SYSTEM WILL SPREAD SOME RAIN AND 
POSSIBLY A LITTLE WINTER PRECIPITATION INTO THE REGION THURSDAY 
NIGHT BEFORE TEMPERATURES WARM FRIDAY FOR ALL RAIN.

520 
FXUS64 KMRX 140825
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EST FRI NOV 14 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD 
IN TODAY AND WILL CONTINUE OVER THE AREA TONIGHT.  COLD ADVECTION 
THIS MORNING WILL GRADUALLY WANE THROUGH THE DAY. LOW CLOUDS OVER 
MAINLY NORTH AND CENTRAL AREAS WILL DIMINISH FROM SOUTHWEST TO 
NORTHEAST TODAY...WITH A MOSTLY CLEAR SKY TONIGHT.  IT WILL BE QUITE 
COLD FOR THE SHORT TERM. MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK A BIT HIGH FOR 
TODAY SO WILL MAKE SOME ADJUSTMENT THERE...BUT NOT MUCH ARGUMENT 
WITH MAV MINS FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...IF YOU ARE A WARM WEATHER 
FAN THE ATMOSPHERIC CONFIGURATION DURING THE EXTENDED FORECAST WILL 
NOT BE MUCH TO YOUR LIKING. THE HEMISPHERIC PATTERN FEATURES AN 
AMPLIFIED UPPER LEVEL RIDGE ALONG THE WESTERN COAST OF NORTH AMERICA 
EXTENDING WELL NORTH INTO THE ARCTIC CIRCLE. THE RIDGE JUST WON'T 
LET GO ALLOWING CROSS POLAR FLOW TO CONTINUE UNABATED INTO THE 
UNITED STATES. INITIALLY...THE FORECAST WILL FEATURE A BIT OF A 
REPRIEVE SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY WITH HIGHS IN THE "BALMY" LOW TO 
MID 40S ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE TO THE 
MIDDLE AND UPPER 40S ACROSS CENTRAL EAST...SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND 
SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. OF COURSE THESE NUMBERS ARE STILL TEN TO 
FIFTEEN DEGREES BELOW NORMAL FOR MID NOVEMBER. THE AIRMASS 
MODIFICATION WILL OCCUR SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY AS THE NEXT SHORT WAVE 
LENGTH UPPER TROUGH SWINGS SOUTHEAST FROM THE INTERMOUNTAIN WEST 
WHILE ANOTHER TRAILING WAVE DROPS SOUTH INTO THE NORTH CENTRAL U.S. 
SUNDAY INTO MONDAY. MOISTURE WILL BE RETURNING ON SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW 
ALOFT OVER THE TOP OF THE CHILLY LOW LEVEL AIR MASS. THE RESULTING 
ISENTROPIC LIFTING WILL GENERATE SOME LIGHT SHOWERS WHICH WILL 
SPREAD FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST ACROSS THE VIEWING AREA DURING 
THE DAY SUNDAY WITH DEEPENING MOISTURE AND LIFT AHEAD OF AN 
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. THERE WILL BE A 
SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A COUPLE SNOW SHOWERS EARLY SUNDAY AS THE MOISTURE 
STARTS TO BUILD INTO THE REGION BUT TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE WARMING 
ABOVE FREEZING FAIRLY QUICKLY TO ALLOW FOR A RAIN EVENT.

THE NEXT ARCTIC SURGE (WITH HIGH TEMPERATURES AROUND THE FREEZING 
MARK ON TUESDAY AND MID TO UPPER 30S ON WEDNESDAY) WILL BE FOLLOWING 
BEHIND THE SECOND UPPER TROUGH MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. TYPICAL 
TRAILING MOISTURE AND OROGRAPHIC LIFT BUILDING IN DURING THIS PERIOD 
WILL GENERATE SOME LIGHT SNOWFALL WITH THE USUAL EMPHASIS IN THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN. BY TUESDAY DRY ADVECTION WILL HAVE BROUGHT AN END TO 
THE PRECIP AND THE GOOD NEWS IS THAT WE MAY BE ABLE TO KEEP 
PRECIPITATION OUT OF THE FORECAST ALL THE WAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT 
BEFORE ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH BUILDS INTO THE CENTRAL U.S. 

&&

AND INTO THE TEENS IN THE MOUNTAINS.

THROUGH THE EXTENDED ALTHOUGH WITH WARMING TEMPERATURES SATURDAY 
INTO MONDAY. A SECOND SHOT OF COLD AIR MOVES IN MONDAY NIGHT AND 
CONTINUES THROUGH WEDNESDAY. LOWS SATURDAY MORNING WITH ARCTIC HIGH 
PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE TN AND OHIO VALLEYS WILL AGAIN BE VERY 
COLD...EVEN COLDER NE TN AND SW VA. THE SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SLIDES 
EAST ON SATURDAY AND TEMPERATURES DO WARM TO NEAR 40 ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN AREAS AND MID TO UPPER 40S SOUTH. AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH 
TROUGH APPROACHES THE REGION SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. MODELS ARE 
TRENDING FASTER NOW SO SOME SNOW MAY START LATE SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
EARLY SUNDAY BUT WARMING TEMPERATURES SHOULD CHANGE IT TO RAIN. MAIN 
PRECIP AREA WILL MOVE IN LATE SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY AND BE MOSTLY 
RAIN. WESTERN SECTIONS COULD GET A LITTLE SNOW BUT TEMPERATURES LOOK 
TO WARM FOR ACCUMULATIONS. THE REAL COLD AIR MOVES IN AFTER THE 
PRECIPITATION MOVES OUT MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE MOSTLY IN THE 20S OVERNIGHT BOTH NIGHTS AND 
UPPER 20S AND 30S TUESDAY WITH SOME SLIGHT WARMING WEDNESDAY. 
THURSDAY MORE SIGNIFICANT WARMING BACK INTO THE 40S AS ARCTIC HIGH 
SHIFTS EASTWARD.

LAST FEW HRRR RUNS. WILL LEAVE SOME LIGHT POPS IN THE NORTHEASTERN
SECTIONS FOR THIS AFTERNOON AS SOME LIGHT INSTABILITY WILL BE
PUSHING INTO THAT AREA DURING THE AFTERNOON. WILL HAVE AT LEAST THE
MENTION OF SPRINKLES FOLLOWED BY FLURRIES OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF
THE AREA. DRIER AIR WILL BE PUSHING INTO THE AREA AND SHOULD END
ANY REMAINING DRIZZLE. TEMPERATURE FORECAST IS ON TRACK.

112 
FXUS64 KMRX 130810
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EST THU NOV 13 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A
WEAK INVERTED TROUGH OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST
TENNESSEE. LOW-LEVEL ISENTROPIC LIFT AND SHALLOW MOISTURE ARE
HELPING TO LOWER CLOUD BASES AND PRODUCE AREAS OF FOG AND
DRIZZLE...MAINLY ALONG AND NORTH OF INTERSTATE 40. ENOUGH DRIZZLE
MAY PRODUCE SOME MEASURABLE AMOUNTS...SO WILL GO WITH 20-30 POPS.

INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH MOVES EAST OF THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON WITH
COLD AIR ADVECTION ALLOWING SOME OF THE LIGHT RAIN TO CHANGE TO
LIGHT SNOW OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE.

LOW CLOUDS WILL ONLY SLOWLY ERODE FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST
THROUGH THE PERIOD. GENERALLY WENT WITH THE COLDER NAM HIGHS FOR
TODAY DUE TO CLOUDS AND DRIZZLE. MOST LOCATIONS TODAY WILL SEE
TEMPERATURES REMAIN STEADY OR SLOWLY FALL DUE TO COLD AIR ADVECTION
THIS AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...THE COLD CONTINUES DURING 
THE LONG TERM WITH UNSEASONABLY COLD AIR IN PLACE. 

DUE TO AN ARCTIC SURFACE HIGH MOVING IN ON FRIDAY...IT WILL BE THE 
COLDEST DAY OF FALL THUS FAR. HIGH TEMPS ARE STILL ON TRACK TO BE 20 
TO 25 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL WITH HIGHS CLOSE TO WHAT THE NORMAL LOWS 
SHOULD BE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER 
OUR AREA BY SATURDAY BUT TEMPERATURES DO SLIGHTLY MODERATE. 
SATURDAYS HIGHS NEAR 40 ACROSS THE NORTHERN AREAS AND MID TO UPPER 
40S SOUTHERN. SURFACE HIGH PUSHES OFF TO OUR EAST SATURDAY NIGHT AS 
ANOTHER UPPER LEVEL TROUGH HEADS OUR WAY. MODELS ARE TRENDING A 
LITTLE SLOWER WITH THIS NEXT SYSTEM SO IT NOW LOOKS LIKE THE BEST 
CHANCES FOR PRECIP WILL BE LATE SUNDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING AND THROUGH 
MONDAY. THIS DELAY IN THE ARRIVAL OF THE TROUGH WILL ALLOW SUNDAYS 
TEMPS TO BE WARMER THAN PREVIOUSLY EXPECTED WITH HIGHS SIMILAR TO 
SATURDAY.
 
THEN LATE SUNDAY NIGHT AND INTO MONDAY...THE NEXT BOUT OF ARCTIC AIR 
ARRIVES AS ANOTHER COLD FRONT PUSHES INTO THE AREA. THIS WILL LIKELY 
RESULT IN MORNING HIGH TEMPS AS COLD AIR POURS IN THROUGH THE DAY. 
AS EVERYONE KNOWS...THINGS CAN CHANGE BUT SNOW POTENTIAL IS LOOKING 
LESS LIKELY...IN TERMS OF ACCUMULATION ACROSS THE LOWER ELEVATIONS. 
DUE TO THE TROUGH SLOWING DOWN...IT WILL TAKE LONGER FOR THE COLD 
AIR TO MOVE INTO OUR AREA. SO AS OF NOW IT LOOKS LIKE LATE SUNDAY 
NIGHT INTO EARLY MONDAY MORNING AREAS ALONG THE PLATEAU AND NORTH OF 
KNOXVILLE COULD CHANGE OVER TO SNOW FOR A BRIEF TIME. THEN...SNOW 
QUICKLY CHANGES BACK OVER TO RAIN LATER MONDAY MORNING AS THE COLDER 
AIR DOESN'T GET IN UNTIL LATER IN THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. RAIN 
BACK TO SNOW MONDAY EVENING AND OVERNIGHT...BUT BY THIS TIME MOST OF 
THE MOISTURE IS OFF TO OUR EAST THUS THE LESS LIKELY CHANCES FOR ANY 
ACCUMULATIONS. MONDAY EVENING INTO TUESDAY MORNING IS WHEN ALL AREAS 
COULD SEE SNOW SOME LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS...WITH LITTLE TO NO 
ACCUMULATION EXPECTED EXCEPT FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN. TUESDAY AND 
BEYOND LOOKS COLD AND DRY.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 122053
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
353 PM EST WED NOV 12 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...CLOUD COVER HOLDING SOLID IN 
MOST LOCATIONS...EXCEPT FOR DOWNSLOPE AREAS SUCH AS WRN NC AND SRN 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. EVEN THE SMOKY MTNS SEEM TO ONLY SEE AN 
OCCASIONAL BREAK OF SUNSHINE. MURPHY NC ENJOYING PLEASANT LOWER 60S
WHILE UPPER 30S TO MOSTLY 40S ELSEWHERE AT MID AFTERNOON.

MIN TEMPS TONIGHT WILL BE STRONGLY AFFECTED BY LIGHT WINDS AND 
LINGERING CLOUD COVER...AS THE BETTER COLD AIR ADVECTION OCCURS 
AFTER 12Z THURSDAY. THUS...I CHOSE TO GO A DEGREE OR SO ABOVE THE 
GFS MOS EXCEPT FOR THE FAR NRN AREAS SUCH AS NRN PLATEAU AND SW VA. 
NOT MUCH FORCING OTHER THAN WEAK UPSLOPE...BUT THE MOISTURE IS 
TRAPPED BELOW AN INVERSION...SO SPRINKLES OR DRIZZLE COULD FALL. 
ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR PARTS OF SW VA AND NRN MTNS OF E TN 
LATE TONIGHT. 

I DO FEEL THAT THE CLOUDS WILL BREAK IN THE AFTERNOON THURSDAY...IN 
LINE WITH PREVIOUS SKY COVER GRIDS...BUT THE CLOUDS WILL LIKELY BE 
SLUGGISH OVER NE TN AND SW VA AGAIN. THE MILDER GFS MOS MAXES ARE 
REACHABLE IN WRN AND SRN AREAS WHERE SOME AFTERNOON SUNSHINE COULD 
OFFSET THE STEADY FLOW OF COOLER AIR INTO THE LOWER LEVELS. 


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...AT THE BEGINNING OF 
THIS PERIOD THE UPPER TROUGH WILL BE OVER THE EASTERN CONUS...WITH 
SURFACE COLD HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUING TO BUILD INTO THE REGION.  BY 
SATURDAY MORNING THE SURFACE HIGH IS OVER THE AREA...THEN SLIDES 
EAST AND ALLOWS A BRIEF WARMING TO START THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF 
THE WEEKEND.  AFTER THAT...THE NEXT COLD SURGE SHOULD BE HITTING 
NEAR MONDAY WITH COLD AIR LOCKED INTO PLACE FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE 
PERIOD.

GOING TO HAVE SOME FLURRIES MENTIONED IN THE NORTHERN MOUNTAINS 
THURSDAY NIGHT.  MOISTURE LOOKS SLOW TO MOVE INTO OUR AREA...WILL 
HOLD OFF NEXT POPS UNTIL SUNDAY.   BIGGEST QUESTIONS ARE FOR THE 
PRECIP TYPE ON THE FRONT SIDE OF THIS SYSTEM...WILL COLD AIR BE IN 
PLACE SUNDAY MORNING.  LOOKS LIKE OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL LIKELY BE 
AROUND MIDNIGHT SATURDAY NIGHT...AND TEMPS WILL LEVEL OFF OR MIGHT 
EVEN RISE TOWARD DAYBREAK.  AT ANY RATE...BY THE TIME ANY PRECIP 
MOVES IN I THINK THE TEMPERATURES AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL BE 
WARMING QUICKLY ENOUGH TO BE JUST RAIN SHOWERS.  THEN LATE SUNDAY 
NIGHT AND INTO MONDAY...THE NEXT COLD FRONT SURGES INTO THE 
AREA...WILL LIKELY HAVE EARLY HIGH TEMPS AS THE COLD AIR POURS IN.  
PRECIP WILL BE TRYING TO CHANGE OVER TO SNOW...BUT IT WILL BE MOVING 
QUICKLY WITH THE AIR DRYING OUT QUICKLY...SO ONLY KEEPING SOME LOW 
POPS IN THE MOUNTAINS MONDAY NIGHT FOR UPSLOPE FLOWS.  STARTING 
TUESDAY...LOOKS COLD AND DRY.

627 
FXUS64 KMRX 120811
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 AM EST WED NOV 12 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A STRONG COLD FRONT IS
MOVING ACROSS THE AREA WITH SCATTERED SHOWERS. SHOWERS WILL END BY
15Z. NAM AND GFS VARY GREATLY ON EXTENT OF LOW-CLOUDS REMAINING
ACROSS THE REGION WITH THE NAM MOST AGRESSIVE. GIVEN THAT THE NAM
MODEL HAS A BETTER HANDLE OF CURRENT EXTENT OF LOW CLOUDS INTO THE
MID-WEST AND OHIO VALLEY AND TYPICALLY CLOUDS HANG-OUT OVER THE
AREA AFTER FROPA...WILL TREND TOWARD THE NAM.

FOR THE LATTER HALF OF TONIGHT AND THURSDAY MORNING...AN INVERTED
TROUGH DEVELOPS OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT
DEVELOPING. MOISTURE REMAINS SHALLOW...SO ANY PRECIPITATION (MIX OF
RAIN/SNOW) WILL BE LIGHT.

GENERALLY TRENDED DAYTIME HIGHS TOWARD COOLER NAM MOS DUE TO MORE
CLOUDS AND COLD AIR ADVECTION.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...OVERALL...A COLD LONG 
TERM IN STORE AS A COUPLE OF ROUNDS OF UNSEASONABLY COLD AIR OUT OF 
CANADA MAKES ITS WAY ALL THE DOWN INTO THE APPALACHIANS. 

THURSDAY NIGHT WE WILL BE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF A LARGE UPPER LEVEL 
TROUGH THAT WILL HELP TO CONTINUE TO PUSH UNSEASONABLY COLD AIR INTO 
THE REGION. SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN PLACE FOR LIGHT SNOW TO OCCUR OVER 
THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF E/NE TN AND SW VA AS A WEAK MOISTURE STARVED 
FRONT MOVES THROUGH...NO ACCUMULATION EXPECTED. LOWS THURSDAY NIGHT 
WILL BE AROUND 15 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL WITH LOWS FROM NEAR 20 TO MID 
20S. ON FRIDAY WE WILL BE FIRMLY ENTRENCHED IN COLD AIR DUE TO 
STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION FROM THE NORTH. HIGH TEMPS FRIDAY LOOK TO 
BE THE COLDEST OF THE SEASON WITH HIGHS ANYWHERE FROM 20 TO 25 
DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. HIGHS ON FRIDAY WILL ACTUALLY BE CLOSE TO WHAT 
THE NORMAL LOWS SHOULD BE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE STARTS TO BUILD IN FRIDAY AFTERNOON FROM THE WEST AND IS 
CENTERED OVER OUR AREA BY SATURDAY. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR SATURDAYS 
HIGHS TO WARM UP TO NEAR 40 ACROSS THE NORTHERN AREAS AND MID TO 
UPPER 40S SOUTHERN.

SURFACE HIGH PUSHES OFF TO OUR EAST SATURDAY NIGHT AS ANOTHER SYSTEM 
APPROACHES FROM OUT OF THE PLAINS. MODELS STILL AREN'T HANDLING THE 
OVERALL EVOLUTION OF THIS SYSTEM TOO WELL. THE TIMING HOWEVER STILL 
LOOKS PRETTY GOOD. THE BEST CHANCE FOR POPS WILL BE ON SUNDAY AND 
SUNDAY NIGHT..WILL START THEM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT AND RUN THROUGH 
MONDAY. DURING THIS TIME PERIOD THERE IS STILL THE POTENTIAL FOR 
SNOW ACROSS OUR ENTIRE AREA...AS THE SYSTEM DOES BRING IN ANOTHER 
LARGE TROUGH WITH REINFORCING COLD AIR. SNOW AMOUNTS ARE STILL 
UNCERTAIN DUE TO EVOLUTION INCONSISTENCIES NOTED ABOVE. AS OF NOW 
THOUGH...ANY ACCUMULATIONS LOOK TO BE LIGHT. WILL CONTINUE TO WATCH 
CLOSELY TO SEE HOW THINGS EVOLVE OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS. WITH THAT 
SAID...THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK LOOKS LIKE IT COULD BE 
UNSEASONABLY COLD AS WELL AS ANOTHER LARGE AND DEEP TROUGH WILL BE 
IN PLACE ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...CHILLY AIR IS ON THE WAY WITH

THE INCREASE AHEAD OF THE FRONT TONIGHT BUT MOISTURE IS LIMITED TO 
ABOUT 800 MB AND BELOW. THE CHANCE OF RAIN WILL BE QUITE LOW WITH

FEW SPRINKLES. SUPPOSE THE BEST CHANCE OF MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION 
WILL BE ON THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. THE FRONT MOVES ONTO THE PLATEAU 
AROUND 05-06Z AND ACROSS THE GREAT VALLEY BETWEEN 06-09Z. LOW CLOUDS 
WILL HANG AROUND THROUGH THE FIRST HALF OF THE MORNING FOR MOST 
LOCATIONS BUT MAY STILL BE IN PLACE AROUND THE APPALACHIAN SPINE 
AROUND NOON. HOWEVER...SUNSHINE WILL BE ON THE INCREASE AND SHOULD 
HELP TO BOOST MAX TEMPS INTO THE MIDDLE AND UPPER 50S ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...WENESDAY NIGHT AND 
THURSDAY WILL BE DRY...AS ANOTHER SHORTWAVE APPROACHES...BRINGING A 
SLIGHT CHANCE FOR PRECIP IN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA FOR THURSDAY NIGHT. 
MOISTURE IS LOW WITH THIS SHORTWAVE SO WILL JUST MENTION A SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF FLURRIES...WITH LITTLE TO NO ACCUMULATION.  LOW 
TEMPERATURES WILL DROP TO THE MID TO LOW 20S THROUGH THE REST OF THE 
WEEKEND AS NORTHWEST FLOW SETS UP OVER THE AREA...WITH HIGH 
TEMPERATURES REMAINING SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW NORMAL IN THE 40'S. 
HIGH PRESSURE AND MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES WILL THEN REMAIN FOR FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY. A COLD FRONT APPROACHES FOR SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY. MODELS 
SEEM TO WANT TO TREND WITH MORE MOISTURE FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING...SO HAVE LOW CONFIDENCE ON TIMING. TEMPERATURES WITH THIS 
FRONT HAVE THE POSSIBILITY TO BRING SNOW CHANCES TO THE ENTIRE AREA.

463 
FXUS64 KMRX 110830
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EST TUE NOV 11 2014

.SHORT TERM...A WEAKENING RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS WILL PRODUCE ANOTHER DRY AND UNSEASONABLY WARM DAY
TODAY. A STRONG COLD FRONT WILL MOVE QUICKLY ACROSS THE AREA
TONIGHT. MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW AIRMASS WILL BE FAIRLY MOISTURE
STARVED. MOST OF THE MOISTURE WILL BE SHALLOW A BELOW 700MB.
ALSO...UPPER DYNAMICS WILL BE QUITE LIMITED. IN RESULT...SHOWERS
CHANCES WILL BE LOW.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...BY THE BEGINNING OF THIS 
FORECAST PERIOD THE REMNANTS OF PRECIP ASSOCIATED WITH EARLIER FROPA 
WILL BEGIN TO DISSIPATE BY MIDDAY WED FOR THE MAJORITY OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...LIGHT RAIN MAY LINGER OVER SW NC AND SE TN 
INTO THE AFTERNOON. 

BY THURSDAY MORNING ANOTHER SHORTWAVE DIGS THE TROUGH FARTHER SOUTH 
INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. MUCH COOLER AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE REGION 
WITH DAYTIME HIGHS EXPECTED TO BE IN THE 40S. THERE WILL BE SLIGHT 
CHANCES FOR PRECIP TO OCCUR OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF E/NE TN AND 
SW VA THU AFTERNOON AND EVE. BY LATE AFTERNOON SOME LIQUID PRECIP 
WILL CHANGE OVER TO LIGHT SNOW MAINLY OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF SW 
VA. 

DRY CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL ON FRI AFTER A FRIGID MORNING WITH TEMPS 
IN THE 20S AND FEW TEENS OVER SW VA. LOOK FOR TEMPS TO REMAIN IN THE 
30S! CONTINUED DRY FOR FRI NIGHT AND SAT WITH ANOTHER COLD NIGHT IN 
STORE.

ANOTHER DEEP TROUGH WILL TRANSLATE ACROSS THE CENTRAL PLAINS SAT/SAT 
NIGHT. PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL INCREASE SAT NIGHT THROUGH MON 
WITH THE BEST CHANCES OCCURRING ON SUN/SUN NIGHT. SOME OF THAT 
PRECIPITATION WILL CHANGE FROM RAIN TO SNOW. SNOW MAY OCCUR AS FAR 
SOUTH AS CHATTANOOGA SUN NIGHT/MON MORNING. A TRICKY MONDAY MORNING 
COMMUTE MAY BE IN STORE FOR MUCH OF E TN/SW VA AND SW NC. STAY TUNED 
TO UPDATES OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS. NEEDLESS TO SAY...THE 
BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK WILL FEEL LIKE WINTER ARRIVED EARLY AS 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE WELL BELOW NORMAL.

PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND NE TO THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES
MARKED THE DIVIDING LINE FROM ARCTIC AIR MASS TO THE NORTH AND
MILDER AIR MASS TO THE SOUTH. OVERNIGHT TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE
TO FALL ABOUT 10 MORE DEGREES TO THE LOWER 30S NE VALLEYS TO LOWER
TO MID 40S HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE PLATEAU AND MOUNTAINS. FOGGY
AREAS SHOULD BE ISOLATED IN THE MORNING. UPDATED FORECAST SENT.
CHANGED SKY TO MOSTLY CLEAR FOR HIGH CLOUDS AND ADJUSTED HOURLY DEW
POINT AND TEMPERATURE GRIDS FOR CURRENT TRENDS.

415 
FXUS64 KMRX 102033
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EST MON NOV 10 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...EXCELLENT WEATHER WILL BE SLOW 
TO CHANGE DURING THE SHORT TERM AS A BROAD UPPER LEVEL TROUGH 
ENCOURAGES THE PROTECTIVE RIDGE TO SLIP EAST DURING THE DAY TUESDAY. 
MODELS KEEP MEAN RELATIVE HUMIDITY RIDICULOUSLY LOW THROUGH AT LEAST 
THE MID DAY TIME FRAME TUESDAY. AS THE AFTERNOON PROGRESSES THE 
CLOUD SHIELD ASSOCIATED WITH THE POLAR FRONT WILL BUILD STEADILY 
EAST TOWARD THE APPALACHIAN SPINE. STAYED PRETTY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE 
BLEND FOR TEMPERATURES TONIGHT AND VETERAN'S DAY. IT LOOKS LIKE 
PATCHY FOG COULD FORM AGAIN ALONG THE WATERWAYS TOWARD DAYBREAK BUT 
SHOULD BURN OFF A LITTLE FASTER THAN IT DID TODAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...OUR WELCOMED WARMUP 
STARTS TO COME TO A CLOSE AT THE START OF THE SHORT TERM. BEGINNING 
ON TUESDAY NIGHT RIDGING EXITS TO OUR EAST DUE TO AN APPROACHING 
WEAK SHORTWAVE AND FORTHCOMING UPPER LEVEL TROUGH. THE FIRST WAVE 
APPROACHES TUESDAY NIGHT IN A SOMEWHAT FLAT BUT BROAD UPPER LEVEL 
TROUGH AND LINGERS INTO WED MORNING. DURING THIS PERIOD IS WHEN WE 
COULD SEE SOME LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS...ALTHOUGH LIFT AND MOISTURE ARE 
UNIMPRESSIVE AS THE UPPER LOW IS WELL INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION. 
LIGHT SHOWERS EXIT BY LATE MORNING ACROSS MOST AREAS WITH CLEARING 
CONDITIONS THROUGH THE AFTERNOON AND INTO THE EVENING HOURS. 

OUR NEXT FEATURE APPROACHES LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND INTO THURSDAY. 
THIS TROUGH WILL BRING MUCH COLDER AIR INTO THE AREA AS A STRONG LOW 
PRESSURE CENTER DROPS DOWN INTO THE NORTHERN PLAINS. THIS LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL DEEPEN THE ONCE BROADER TROUGH AND ALLOW FOR 
STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION ACROSS OUR REGION. MOISTURE IS LACKING SO 
THURSDAY LOOKS DRY BUT MUCH COOLER WITH HIGHS IN THE LOWER TO MID 
40S FOR MOST AREAS WITH LOWS IN THE LOWER TO UPPER 20S THURSDAY 
NIGHT. DID INCLUDE SLIGHT CHANCE POP ACROSS THE SPINE OF THE 
APPALACHIANS AS THEY MIGHT GET SOME LIGHT PRECIP DUE TO UPSLOPE FLOW 
DURING THE DAY ON THURSDAY. THE TROUGH STARTS TO MOVE EAST ON FRIDAY 
BUT COLD AIR WILL STILL BE FIRMLY ENTRENCHED WITH HIGHS STRUGGLING 
TO GET OUT OF THE MID TO UPPER 30S FROM KNOXVILLE NORTH...AND LOWER 
40S KNOXVILLE SOUTH.

BRIEF ZONAL FLOW RETURNS FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. THIS WILL ALLOW 
MAX TEMPS TO WARM BY ABOUT 5 TO 8 DEGREES SATURDAY AFTERNOON. 
HOWEVER...ANOTHER TROUGH COMES SWINGING THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT 
INTO MONDAY. THIS WILL YET AGAIN BRING ANOTHER ROUND OF COLD AIR 
DOWN OUT OF CANADA AND INTO OUR AREA. THIS TROUGH...UNLIKE THE 
EARLIER ONE...WILL HAVE PLENTY OF MOISTURE TO WORK WITH SO POP 
CHANCES IN PLACE FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY. THE BEST 
CHANCE FOR PRECIP...HIGHEST POPS...LOOK TO BE SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH 
EVENING. IT DOES LOOK LIKE MOST AREAS COULD SEE SOME LIGHT SNOW LATE 
SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY MORNING...THEN AGAIN SUNDAY NIGHT INTO 
MONDAY MORNING AS TEMPS DIP BACK BELOW FREEZING. THIS SYSTEM IS WAY 
TOO FAR OUT TO PREDICT ANY AMOUNTS AT THIS TIME. WILL HAVE TO WAIT 
AND SEE HOW FUTURE MODEL RUNS HANDLE THIS SYSTEM. PRECIP BEGINS TO 
EXIT THROUGH THE DAY ON MONDAY WITH CLEARING CONDITIONS LATE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

588 
FXUS64 KMRX 100807
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
307 AM EST MON NOV 10 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE NEXT WEATHER MAKER FOR OUR
FORECAST AREA WAS THE DEEPENING LOW OVER WESTERN MONTANA. THE
ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW WILL DEVELOP/DEEPEN OVER WESTERN NEBRASKA
THIS MORNING. A WELL DEFINED COLD FRONT WILL BLAST SOUTHWARD INTO
THE OKLAHOMA/TX PANHANDLES BY LATE AFTERNOON/EARLY EVE. BY TUESDAY
MORNING THE FRONT WILL BE SLOWLY TRACKING ACROSS THE MS RIVER INTO
WEST TENNESSEE.

CURRENTLY CALM WINDS AND CLEAR SKIES WILL GIVE WAY TO PATCHY FOG
DEVELOPMENT OVER THE TN VALLEY BY SUNRISE. SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL
WINDS WILL USHER IN WARMER TEMPERATURES ALONG WITH HIGHER RELATIVE
HUMIDITIES. MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES WILL PREVAIL TODAY AND TONIGHT.
DAYTIME HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL BE SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE SEASONAL
NORMS AND WELL BELOW RECORDS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
SHIFT TO THE EAST OF THE AREA ON TUESDAY AS AN UPPER-LOW DEEPENS
OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS/GREAT LAKES AND SENDS A COLD FRONT TOWARD
THE REGION TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. AHEAD OF THIS BOUNDARY ON
TUESDAY...ANOTHER WARM DAY IS EXPECTED AS PARTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS
AND SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL HELP WARM MOST AREAS INTO THE MID 60S TO
AROUND 70 DEGREES. THEN... TUESDAY EVENING/NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY
MORNING...SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS WILL OVER SPREAD THE REGION FROM
WEST TO EAST AS THE FRONT PUSHES INTO THE AREA. BEHIND THE
FRONT...MUCH COOLER CANADIAN AIR WILL BEGIN TO FILER INTO THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AS HIGHS WILL DROP TO THE LOW TO MID 40S BY
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...WITH LOWS IN THE 20S BEING COMMON OVERNIGHT.
SOME LIGHT UPSLOPE RAIN/SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS ON THURSDAY...BUT OTHERWISE A DRY FORECAST IS EXPECTED
THROUGH THE END OF THE WORK WEEK. ANOTHER DEEP AREA OF LOW PRESSURE
WILL DIVE OUT OF CANADA INTO THE GREAT LAKES ON SUNDAY WHICH WILL
SEND ANOTHER STRONG COLD FRONT AND REINFORCING SHOT OF COLDER AIR
OUR WAY EARLY NEXT WEEK. ADDITIONALLY...SOME PRECIPITATION CHANCES
WILL EXIST WITH THIS SYSTEM PASSAGE...THOUGH UNCERTAINTY EXISTS
WITH THE EXACT TRACK/TIMING OF THIS STORM SYSTEM. ATTM...HAVE
CHANCES POPS AREAWIDE SATURDAY NIGHT AND EXPENDED THEM TO LIKELY ON
SUNDAY.

398 
FXUS64 KMRX 092017
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST SUN NOV 9 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...A CALM...CLEAR...AND COLD 
NIGHT IS EXPECTED AS COLDER AIR CONTINUES TO FILTER IN BEHIND A 
DEPARTED WEAK UPPER LEVEL TROUGH. PATCHY FOG EXPECTED ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA WITH PATCHY FREEZING FOG POSSIBLE ACROSS PORTIONS OF 
NETN WHERE TEMPERATURES ARE AT OR BELOW FREEZING. OVERNIGHT LOWS 
AROUND 6 TO 8 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL.

THINGS QUICKLY WARM UP TOMORROW AS WINDS TURN SOUTHERLY AND RIDGING 
BEGINS TO BUILD INTO THE AREA. HIGHS IN THE MID TO UPPER 60S 
EXPECTED BY TOMORROW AFTERNOON...WHICH IS A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL 
FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...BROAD UPPER TROUGH DROPS 
INTO THE NORTH CENTRAL U.S. DURING THE FIRST HALF OF THE PERIOD WITH 
AN INITIAL SHORT WAVE AND AN ASSOCIATED COLD FRONTAL SYSTEM. MODELS 
CONTINUE TO SHOW AN INCREMENTALLY SLOWER ADVANCE OF THE FRONT ON 
TUESDAY WITH LIMITED MOISTURE RESULTING IN LIGHT QPF. WITH THIS IN 
MIND MAINTAINED A TREND OF TRIMMING BACK POPS TO ALMOST NOTHING 
DURING THE DAY TUESDAY WITH SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE PROBABILITY 
TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. MODELS ARE ALSO TRENDING BACK ON POPS 
WITH A TRAILING...NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION...SHORT WAVE 
LATER WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY SO GLADLY DROPPED PRECIP INTO A 
SLIGHT CHANCE CATEGORY HERE. THE NEXT FEATURE TO BRING A CHANCE OF 
RAIN TO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WILL BE SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY 
WITH ANOTHER FRONTAL SYSTEM. THIS SYSTEM APPEARS TO HAVE A GREATER 
MOISTURE SUPPLY WITH DECENT FRONTAL LIFTING SO FORECAST 
PROBABILITIES ARE A LITTLE HIGHER DESPITE ITS ARRIVAL AT THE END OF 
THE EXTENDED. TEMPERATURES WILL BE RATHER PLEASANT ON THE FRONT SIDE 
OF THE FIRST FRONTAL SYSTEM WITH MAX TEMPS ABOUT TEN DEGREES ABOVE 
NORMAL FOR A NICE TUESDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE SLOWLY DROPPING BACK 
A LITTLE BELOW NORMAL BY WEDNESDAY WITH THE TRAILING OVERCAST SKY 
CONDITION BEHIND THE FRONT. THE REALLY CHILLY AIR STARTS OOZING INTO 
THE REGION WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND TAKES UP RESIDENCE THROUGH THE END OF 
THE FORECAST PERIOD AS THE LATE WEEKEND FRONTAL SYSTEM BUILDS EAST. 
IT APPEARS THAT MAX TEMPERATURES WILL BE ABOUT 15 TO 20 DEGREES 
BELOW NORMAL WHILE MINS WILL BE AT THEIR LOWEST AT ABOUT 10 DEGREES 
BELOW NORMAL THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY NIGHT.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
326 AM EST SUN NOV 9 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT) THE UPPER TROUGH MOVING THROUGH
THIS MORNING WILL BRING A SHOT OF COOLER AIR MAINLY ACROSS NE TN
AND SW VA ALONG WITH MORE CLOUDS THAN ELSEWHERE. LOOK FOR CLOUDS TO
CLEAR AROUND NOON. LOWER LEVEL WINDS SHIFT SOUTH LATE THIS
AFTERNOON AHEAD OF THE DEEPENING TROUGH OVER THE WESTERN US/PLAINS.
NOT ONLY WILL SURFACE TEMPERATURES BE ON THE RISE BUT MOISTURE
TOO. LOOK FOR PATCHY FOG TO DEVELOP PARTICULARLY IN THE TN VALLEY
BY LATE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY MORNING.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...AN UPPER-RIDGE AXIS WILL
BUILD INTO THE REGION ON MONDAY...PROMOTING A MOSTLY CLEAR SKY AND
SOUTHERLY WINDS. THIS WILL HELP PUSH HIGHS BACK INTO THE MID TO
UPPER 60S ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA. CLOUDS WILL INCREASE ON TUESDAY
AHEAD OF A TROUGH THAT WILL BRING SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS TO THE
AREA TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. HOWEVER...HIGHS IN THE 60S ARE
STILL EXPECTED ONCE AGAIN BEFORE COLDER AIR ARRIVES BEHIND OF THE
AFOREMENTIONED TROUGH/COLD FRONT. AS A RESULT...HIGHS WILL DROP
FROM THE 60S ON TUESDAY INTO THE LOW TO MID 40S BY THURSDAY AND
FRIDAY /WITH LOWS IN THE UPPER 20S AND LOWER 30S/. ADDITIONAL
SHORTWAVES WILL ROTATE AROUND THE PARENT LOW OVER THE GREAT LAKES
DURING THE LATER PART OF THE WEEK...REINFORCING THE COLDER AIR MASS
AND NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. SOME ADDITIONAL PRECIPITATION CHANCES
ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN WILL EXIST ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY /WITH
SOME SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE IN THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS/. THEN A
BETTER CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION WILL OCCUR SATURDAY NIGHT INTO
SUNDAY OF THE UPCOMING WEEKEND AS A STRONGER TROUGH/COLD FRONT
PUSHES INTO THE AREA.

316 PM EST SAT NOV 8 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...THICKENING MIO AND HIGH
