PREVIOUS MENTION OF A CHANCE OF SPRINKLES FOR NRN PLATEAU AND SW VA
AS THE WEAK COLD FRONT PASSES. THINKING THAT CLOUDS WILL DECREASE
ENOUGH OVERNIGHT TO ALLOW PATCHY FOG TO DEVELOP AGAIN...LOCALLY
DENSE AT PLACES LIKE TRI-CITIES AND MURPHY NC. 

A DRY FORECAST CONTINUES FOR SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY...COURTESY OF
ZONAL FLOW ALOFT AND SURFACE RIDGING. MAX TEMPS SUNDAY AND MIN
TEMPS SUNDAY NIGHT SHOULD RUN JUST BELOW SEASONAL NORMALS...WITH A
NICE WARM-UP FOR MONDAY. DID NOT SEE ANY REASON TO DIFFER MUCH FROM
THE WARMER GFS MOS...SO NUDGED THE PREVIOUS MAX TEMP GRID UP BY
SEVERAL DEGREES.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS HAVE SLOWED 
ARRIVAL OF THE UPPER TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT ON TUESDAY SO 
TWEAKED POPS BACK A BIT HERE WITH THE MAIN IMPACT TUESDAY NIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY. MOISTURE DEPTH NOT TOO IMPRESSIVE WITH THIS SYSTEM THUS 
POPS REMAIN IN THE CHANCE RANGE. UPPER FLOW STAYS WEST SOUTHWEST 
BEHIND THIS FEATURE AS NEXT SHORT WAVE DROPS SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE 
NORTH CENTRAL STATES HELD ONTO SLOWLY DECREASING POPS ON WEDNESDAY 
AND THEN USED MAINLY A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SOME LIGHT QPF ON 
THURSDAY WITH THIS TRAILING SHORT WAVE SHIFTING EAST ACROSS THE 
NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION. WHILE IT WILL BE A LITTLE WARMER 
THAN PREVIOUSLY THOUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY MORNING...LOW 
LEVEL TEMPERATURES MAY STILL DROP RIGHT AROUND THE FREEZING MARK OR 
A LITTLE BELOW DURING THIS PERIOD...MAINLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN SO 
HAD TO KEEP A LIGHT SNOW SHOWER GOING IN THE MOUNTAINS. ALSO APPLIED 
SOME LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY AS THE SECOND 
UPPER TROUGH EXITS. THE UPPER FLOW AMPLIFIES NICELY OUT WEST WITH A 
DEEPENING TROUGH LATER FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY WHICH MEANS THE EASTERN 
U.S. WILL HAVE A PLEASANT WARM UP WITH SOME SUNSHINE ON SATURDAY 
WHILE AWAITING MORE RAIN LATER IN THE WEEKEND WITH THE NEXT MID 
LATITUDE CYCLONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
349 AM EST SAT NOV 8 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)... SURFACE RIDGE NOW OVER THE AREA 
AND WINDS ARE JUST ABOUT CALM AREA-WIDE. AS THE NEXT FRONT 
APPROACHES SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST WINDS SHOULD PICKUP DURING THE DAY 
TODAY. FRONT LOOKS LIKE IT WILL SWEEPING THROUGH THE AREA THIS 
EVENING.  THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST CONTINUES TO GET DRIER AND 
DRIER...ONLY HAVE SPRINKLES MENTIONED IN THE EARLY EVENING IN OUR 
NORTHWESTERN AREAS. WENT CLOSE TO GUIDANCE ON MAX/MIN TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM /SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY/... 
CLEARING WILL TAKE PLACE ON SUNDAY AS AN UPPER-RIDGE BUILDS IN
BRIEFLY EARLY NEXT WEEK. THIS WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO WARM BACK
INTO THE 60S BY MONDAY AND TUESDAY BEFORE ANOTHER STRONGER COLD
FRONT SWEEPS THROUGH THE REGION TUESDAY EVENING/NIGHT INTO
WEDNESDAY. THIS FRONT WILL BRING SOME OPPORTUNITIES FOR ISOLATED TO
SCATTERED SHOWERS...BUT THE PRIMARY IMPACT WILL BE THE MUCH COOLER
AIR THAT WILL FILTER INTO THE REGION IN ITS WAKE. HIGHS WILL DROP
INTO THE UPPER 40S AND 50S ON WEDNESDAY...AND EVENTUALLY THE LOW TO
MID 40S BY FRIDAY AS ANOTHER SHOT OF COLDER AIR MOVES INTO THE
REGION LATE IN THE WORK WEEK WITH THE PASSAGE OF ANOTHER UPPER-
TROUGH. THIS SECONDARY TROUGH PASSAGE WILL ALSO YIELD SOME
OPPORTUNITIES FOR SCATTERED SHOWERS WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY..
AND PERHAPS INTO FRIDAY THANKS TO SOME CONTINUED UPSLOPE FLOW.
GIVEN THE COLDER AIR THAT IS PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE REGION...THIS
MAY ALSO LEAD TO SOME ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS ALONG THE
HIGHER TERRAIN OF EAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA DURING THIS
TIME PERIOD AS WELL. OVERALL...IT LOOKS LIKE A UNSEASONABLY COOL
END TO THE WORK WEEK...WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR SCATTERED
PRECIPITATION EACH DAY /PARTICULARLY ALONG THE MOUNTAINS AND IN SW
VIRGINIA/.

593 
FXUS64 KMRX 072001
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
301 PM EST FRI NOV 7 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE COMBINATION OF
SLUGGISH CLOUD COVER AND COLD AIR ADVECTION KEPT MAX TEMPS DOWN
TODAY. EXPECT SKIES TO CONTINUE TO CLEAR THIS EVENING WITH A FAIR
AMOUNT OF HIGH CLOUDS MOVING ACROSS TONIGHT. ADDED A FEW PATCHES
OF VALLEY FOG FOR LATE TONIGHT.

A WEAK AND MOSTLY DRY COLD FRONT APPROACHES SATURDAY...BUT WILL
SPREAD A BRIEF INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER. I KEPT THE MINIMAL POPS IN
FROM PREVIOUS GRIDS BUT MEASURABLE RAINS AT THE SURFACE SEEM VERY
UNLIKELY. OPTED TO KEEP MAXES A DEGREE OR TWO BELOW THE GFS MOS FOR
SATURDAY. MIN TEMPS NOT LOW ENOUGH AND RAIN CHANCES JUST TOO LOW TO
CARRY ANY MENTION OF SNOW SHOWERS FOR SATURDAY NIGHT. 

CLEARING SKIES AND SLIGHTLY WARMER SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY. NOT
MUCH ADJUSTMENTS NEEDED FOR PREVIOUS GRIDS FOR THOSE PERIODS. 


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE EXTENDED PERIOD 
STARTS OUT ON THE NICE SIDE WITH BUILDING HEIGHTS AND A 
STRENGTHENING SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW AHEAD OF THE NEXT UPPER TROUGH. 
SUNSHINE AND PLEASANT NEAR TO ABOVE NORMAL HIGH TEMPERATURES SHOULD 
BE THE NORM ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY. HOWEVER...CLOUDS WILL BE ON THE 
INCREASE DURING THE DAY TUESDAY WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS. THE BEST 
CHANCE OF SEEING SOME RAIN AREA WIDE WILL BE TUESDAY NIGHT AS A COLD 
FRONT BUILDS EAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION...ALTHOUGH 
THE CHANCE FOR A FEW SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE DURING THE DAY WEDNESDAY 
INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT IN AN AREA OF ISENTROPIC LIFTING. COLDER AIR 
WILL BE SPREADING SOUTHEAST FROM THE MIDWEST INTO THE MID SOUTH 
LATER IN THE DAY INTO THE OVERNIGHT HOURS INTO EARLY THURSDAY 
MORNING. TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE COLD ENOUGH FOR A FEW LIGHT SNOW 
SHOWERS OR FLURRIES DURING THIS PERIOD HOWEVER...SOME DRIER AIR WILL 
BE SPILLING INTO THE REGION SO IT LOOKS LIKE A TREND OF DECREASING 
PRECIPITATION PROBABILITY AT THIS TIME. MODEL AGREEMENT STARTS TO 
FALL APART LATE IN THE FORECAST PERIOD FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY SO 
POPS APPLIED WILL ONLY BE SLIGHT TO SMALL CHANCE RANGE HERE AS A 
SURFACE WAVE IS DEPICTED TO SHIFT NORTHEAST FROM THE CAROLINAS INTO 
THE WESTERN ATLANTIC LATE IN THE WORK WEEK. ENOUGH COLD AIR WILL BE 
OOZING FURTHER INTO THE SOUTHEASTERN PART OF THE COUNTRY DURING THIS 
PERIOD TO PULL TEMPERATURES A GOOD TEN TO FIFTEEN DEGREES BELOW 
NORMAL. THUS...WITH POPS IN THE FORECAST...THE OVERNIGHT PERIODS 
THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY NIGHT...WILL REQUIRE SOME LIGHT SNOW 
SHOWER WORDING.

FXUS64 KMRX 070907
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
407 AM EST FRI NOV 7 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
HIGH PRESSURE FILLING IN AT THE SURFACE...WINDS HAVE BEEN
GUSTY...AND WILL PROBABLY REMAIN SOMEWHAT GUSTY UNTIL THIS
AFTERNOON WHEN THE PRESSURE GRADIENT RELAXES. FOR POPS...WILL LEAVE
THE SLIGHT POPS WE HAVE IN OUR ELEVATED TERRAIN NORTH AND
EAST...BUT ONLY THROUGH MID MORNING. MODEL SOUNDINGS DO NOT LOOK TO
SUPPORT MUCH IN THE WAY OF PRECIP...SO KEEPING ALL OUR MOS STATIONS
DRY...EVEN THOUGH NAM MOS SHOWED SLIGHT POPS EVEN AT THE NORTHERN
SITES. CLOUDS SHOULD BE STUBBORN OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE
AREA...BUT DURING THE AFTERNOON THE SUN SHOULD START BURNING
THROUGH. THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE AREA SHOULD SEE THE SUN BURNING
THROUGH THIS MORNING. WENT WITH THE NAM MAX TEMPS FOR TODAY...AS
THE NORTHERN MAX TEMPS LOOKED BETTER...COOLER DUE TO CLOUD COVER.

.LONG TERM /SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY/... 
A WEAK SHORTWAVE TROUGH IS PROGGED TO PUSH THROUGH THE REGION ON
SATURDAY...BRINGING SOME CLOUD COVER AND A BRIEF SHOT OF COOLER AIR
INTO THE AREA. IN ADDITION... SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS MAY DEVELOP
DURING THE AFTERNOON/EVENING AND NIGHT /PRIMARILY ALONG THE PLATEAU
AND EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS/. A GRADUAL WARMING TREND WILL TAKE
PLACE EARLY NEXT WEEK AS WEAK RIDGING TAKES PLACE AND ALLOWS
TEMPERATURES TO CLIMB BACK INTO THE LOW TO MID 60S BY
MONDAY...ALONG WITH A MOSTLY CLEAR SKY. HOWEVER... ANOTHER LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE GREAT LAKES WILL SEND A STRONGER COLD
FRONT INTO THE REGION BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON INTO TUESDAY
NIGHT...GIVING A BETTER OPPORTUNITY FOR MORE WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND
A STRONGER PUSH OF COOLER AIR. THIS COOLING SHOULD ALLOW FOR SOME
SNOW SHOWERS ALONG THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND RESULT IN TEMPERATURES
DROPPING BELOW THE FREEZING MARK IN MOST AREAS BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT
AS PARTIAL CLEARING TAKES PLACE. MODELS THEN WANT TO DEVELOP AN
ADDITIONAL ROUND OF LIGHT PRECIPITATION LATER ON THURSDAY INTO
THURSDAY NIGHT AS A BROAD TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE OHIO AND
TENNESSEE VALLEYS. HAVE OPTED TO ADD A LOW-MENTION OF POPS
HERE...BUT DID NOT GET OVERLY AGGRESSIVE WITH IT FOR NOW AND WILL
WAIT FOR BETTER CONTINUITY WITH THE MODELS. THE OTHER MAIN STORY
HEADING INTO LATER PART OF NEXT WEEK WILL BE THE COOLER
TEMPERATURES AS HIGHS IN THE UPPER 40S TO 50S WILL BE COMMON.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       52  32  58  37 /   0   0  10  10

907 
FXUS64 KMRX 070556
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1256 AM EST FRI NOV 7 2014

.AVIATION...
POWERFUL LITTLE SHORTWAVE MOVING THROUGH THE AREA WITH GUSTY POST-
FRONTAL WINDS AND SOME SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS OVER THE NORTHERN
HALF OF THE AREA. HOWEVER...WE ARE PROBABLY STARTING THE DOWNHILL
SIDE OF THIS SYSTEM AS THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS IS GETTING PAST THE
AREA...PER WATER VAPOR SATELLITE LOOP. SO SHOWERS SHOULD BE EXITING
THE NORTHERN HALF IN THE NEXT TWO HOURS. WINDS WILL SLOWLY SUBSIDE
BOTH DUE TO A SLOW RELAXATION OF THE PRESSURE GRADIENT AND BY
GETTING DEEPER INTO THE NIGHT AND THE BOUNDARY LAYER AT LEAST
PARTIALLY DECOUPLING. WINDS WILL LIKELY PICKUP AFTER SUNRISE WITH
THE INITIAL POST-SUNRISE MIXING...BUT PRESSURE GRADIENT LOOSENS
NOTABLY DURING THE DAY...SO THE AFTERNOON HOURS SHOULD HAVE LIGHTER
WINDS. ALSO...CIGS SHOULD BREAK UP ACROSS THE SOUTHERN SECTIONS
DURING THE MORNING...BUT SHOULD HOLD ON FOR MUCH OF THE DAY ACROSS
THE NORTH.

&&

NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

.AVIATION...GUSTY WINDS WILL GRADUALLY DIMINISH DURING THE NIGHT AS

CONDITIONS AND SOME PATCHY FOG ARE POSSIBLE TOWARDS SUNRISE.  THE

614 
FXUS64 KMRX 061942
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
242 PM EST THU NOV 6 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...SHORT TERM CONCERNS WERE 
THE MILD TEMPS AHEAD OF THE COLD AIR (UPDATE ISSUED)...PLUS A CHANCE 
OF THUNDERSTORMS INTO THE EARLY EVENING ACROSS SW VA AND EXTREME NE 
TN. ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDER TO THOSE AREAS JUST BEYOND 
07/00Z. 

OTHERWISE...THE MOISTURE UPSTREAM IS STILL PROGGED TO BE VERY 
SHALLOW AND NOT THAT COLD AT THE TOP OF THE SATURATED COLUMN. THUS 
NOT SEEING A THREAT OF ANY SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL FOR OUR FAVORED 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SW VA AND EN TN. IN FACT...THE MOISTURE LOOKS 
TOO SHALLOW FROM BOTH GFS AND NAM TO SUPPORT A LOT OF CLOUDINESS FOR 
THE SMOKY MTNS. COORDINATED WITH NWS NEIGHBORS AND TRIMMED BACK OUR 
POPS FOR TONIGHT...ALSO THE AMOUNT OF SNOWFALL FROM PREVIOUS GRIDS.

GENERALLY LOOKING DRY FOR FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY WITH TEMPS TAKKING 
A BRIEF DIP BEFORE WARMING BACK TO SEASONAL NORMS BY SATURDAY. VERY
LITTLE ADJUSTMENTS NEEDED FOR GRIDS DURING THAT PERIOD.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...AN UPPER TROUGH AND 
YET ANOTHER COLD FRONT BUILD ACROSS THE REGION SATURDAY NIGHT INTO 
SUNDAY MORNING WITH LITTLE IMPACT DUE TO LIMITED MOISTURE. TRIMMED 
POPS BACK TO SLIGHT CHANCE HERE. DRY ADVECTION BEGINS BEHIND THIS 
SYSTEM AND WHILE THE UPPER FLOW GRADUALLY CHANGES FROM ZONAL TO 
SOUTHWESTERLY BY MONDAY NIGHT...PRECIPITATION WILL NOT BE BACK IN 
THE FORECAST UNTIL TUESDAY AFTERNOON AS ANOTHER MID LATITUDE CYCLONE 
SHIFTS NORTHEAST ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY. THIS SYSTEM HAS A LITTLE 
MORE AVAILABLE MOISTURE BUT STILL LOOKS LIKE A LIGHT RAIN EVENT WITH 
THE FRONT BUILDING THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS MAINLY TUESDAY 
NIGHT WITH SOME WRAP AROUND LIGHT QPF IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN FOR 
WEDNESDAY. LOOKS DRY AGAIN WITH ZONAL FLOW BACK OVER THE MID SOUTH 
ON THURSDAY. IN TERMS OF THE MAX/MIN TEMPERATURE FORECAST PRETTY 
MUCH UNDERCUT GUIDANCE THROUGH THE PERIOD.

FXUS64 KMRX 061407

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
907 AM EST THU NOV 6 2014

.DISCUSSION...MORNING RAINS EXITING TO OUR EAST WHILE SOME CLEARING 
WAS NOTED ACROSS MUCH OF THE PLATEAU AND VALLEY COUNTIES. SOME CLOUD 
COVER LINGERING ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA...WITH AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS 
EXPECTED SHORTLY. 

MODELS STILL SHOWING ANOTHER SURGE OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE...WITH 
LAPSE RATES STEEPENING IN THE AFTERNOON AS COLD AIR ADVECTION KICKS 
IN. THIS ALL SUPPORTS OUR CURRENT CHANCE POPS FOR RAIN SHOWERS. 

AIRMASS DOES NOT COOL SUFFICIENTLY FOR ANY SNOW SHOWER THREAT UNTIL 
THIS EVENING AND OVERNIGHT. HOWEVER...DON'T SEE MUCH SIGNIFICANT 
SNOW ACCUMULATIONS BASED ON TEMPS AND CONSISTENCY FROM 00Z TO 006Z 
MODEL RUNS. PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS NOT ONLY LOOK GOOD FOR TODAY BUT 
ALSO FOR TONIGHT WITH JUST A MINIMAL MENTION OF SNOW AMOUNTS.

004 
FXUS64 KMRX 060919
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
419 AM EST THU NOV 6 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WEAK COLD FRONT LIES OVER THE
EASTERN TN VALLEY THIS MORNING WITH RAIN SHOWERS CONTINUING AT
THIS HOUR OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. TEMPERATURES
ARE STILL IN THE 50S WITH 40S HIGHER ELEVATIONS. ANOTHER FRONT LIES
TO THE NW AN EXTENDS SW FROM A SURFACE LOW OVER LAKE MICHIGAN
MOVING INTO THE MID MS VALLEY. THE FIRST FRONT WAS NEARLY
STATIONARY AND WILL FINALLY MOVE EAST THIS MORNING. THE SECOND
FRONT WILL PUSH SOME DRIER AIR INTO THE REGION LATER THIS MORNING
AND AFTERNOON BUT A SHORTWAVE ASSOCIATED WITH THE SECOND FRONT WILL
MOVE SOUTHEAST OVER THE OHIO VALLEY LATE TODAY AND TONIGHT. EXPECT
HIGHS TO CLIMB TO THE MID 50S HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND LOWER TO MID
60S LOWER ELEVATIONS AS WE GET SOME CLEARING BEHIND FRONT AND WIND
INCREASE.

COLDER AIR ALOFT WILL BRING ANOTHER CHANCE OF SHOWERS TO THE
NORTHERN TWO THIRDS OF THE REGION AND LOWER FREEZING LEVELS
TONIGHT. THE SHOWERS WILL CHANGE TO SNOW LATE TONIGHT AND EARLY
FRIDAY. HAVE FOLLOWED THE NAM GUIDANCE HIGHER PRECIPITATION CHANCES
AND WARMER LOWS TONIGHT. WITH THAT IN MIND HAVE TRIMMED BACK
SNOWFALL AMOUNTS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. LOWS TONIGHT MOSTLY MID
30S TO NEAR 40 BUT NEAR 30 HIGHEST ELEVATIONS. ONLY THE HIGHEST
ELEVATIONS IN SW VA AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS SMOKY MOUNTAINS AND NE TN
MOUNTAINS WILL RECEIVE ANY MEASURABLE SNOWFALL. AMOUNTS MOSTLY
LESS THAN ONE INCH EXCEPT HIGHEST ELEVATIONS SMOKY MOUNTAINS. WINDS
WILL INCREASE ESPECIALLY HIGHER ELEVATIONS AS SYSTEM MOVES FROM THE
OHIO VALLEY INTO THE MID ATLANTIC LATE TODAY AND TONIGHT. STRONGEST
WINDS WILL BE 15 TO 25 MPH WITH GUSTS TO 35 MPH MOUNTAINS IN THE
EVENING.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A FEW SHOWERS LINGER ACROSS 
NE AREAS EARLY FRIDAY BEFORE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM THE WEST. 
FAIR CONDITIONS THROUGH SATURDAY AS THE RIDGE MOVES EAST THROUGH THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. A COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT 
WITH LIMITED MOISTURE AND SHOWER ACTIVITY. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS BACK 
IN FROM THE SOUTHWEST SUNDAY AND MONDAY. BROAD UPPER TROUGH DEVELOPS 
ACROSS NORTHERN U.S. WITH SURFACE ELONGATED SURFACE LOW MOVING FROM 
THE MID MS VALLEY TO THE GREAT LAKES BY TUE. COLD FRONT MOVES INTO E 
TN VALLEY BY LATE TUESDAY BRINGING ANOTHER ROUND OF PRECIPITATION. 
THIS WILL BE FOLLOWED BY COLD CONDITIONS INTO THE FOLLOWING
WEEKEND.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

940 PM EST WED NOV 5 2014

.DISCUSSION...
THE FORECAST APPEARS ON TRACK THIS EVENING AS A WIDE SWATH OF RAIN
ACROSS MIDDLE TN AND THE PLATEAU IS MAKING VERY SLOW EASTWARD
PROGRESS INTO THE AREA. FORCING FROM LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE IS SHOWN
BY THE NAM TO MOVE INTO OUR EASTERN SECTIONS BY 09Z...AND EXIT TO
THE EAST BY 12Z. THE HRRR AND RUC ARE IN AGREEMENT. THE CURRENT
POP/WX GRIDS REFLECT THIS TREND...SO NO BIG CHANGES ARE
NEEDED...JUST SOME SLIGHT TEMPERATURE TWEAKS.

744 
FXUS64 KMRX 052006
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
306 PM EST WED NOV 5 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...CENTRAL VALLEY...SMOKY MTNS 
INTO SE TN AND SW NC JUST STARTING TO MOISTEN UP AT MID AFTERNOON.
SPRINKLES OR A STEADY LIGHT RAIN NOTED ALREADY ACROSS THE REMAINDER 
OF THE FORECAST AREA. MODERATE SHOWERS OVER NRN PLATEAU SPREADING 
TOWARD SE KY AND SW VA AT THIS TIME. POPS WERE ADJUSTED UPWARDS FOR 
THE 21Z TO 00Z LEFT OVER GRIDS. TEMPS REALLY CAME TO A SCREECHING 
HALT WITH THE ONSET OF ANY RAIN...BUT LIKELY WON'T FALL MUCH EITHER
OVERNIGHT. THUS...I TRENDED QUITE CLOSE TO GFS MOS MINS. BUMPED POPS 
UP OVERNIGHT TO FALL BETWEEN 90 AND 100 PERCENT.

A FEW MORE CHANGES MADE TO THURSDAY'S WEATHER...TO KEEP MORE 
CLOUDINESS AND ALSO INCREASE RAIN CHANCES ACROSS THE NRN HALF OF E 
TN AND SW VA. THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY RAINS SHOULD BE SLIPPING ESE OF 
THE APPALACHIANS IN THE 12Z TO 15Z PERIOD...BUT SOME STRONG COLD AIR 
ADVECTION ALOFT WILL STEEPEN THE LAPSE RATES IN THE AFTERNOON HOURS. 
LOW LEVEL CAPES REACH AS HIGH AS 100 TO 150 J/KG OVER NE TN AND SW 
VA THURSDAY AFTERNOON. THIS SHOULD EQUATE TO SCATTERED RAIN SHOWERS 
AS THE AIRMASS IS NOT SHOWN TO COOL ENUFF FOR SNOW SHOWERS...BUT 
SOMETHING TO WATCH IN THE SMOKIES? OPTED FOR HIGH CHANCE POPS WITH 
SCATTERED WORDING FOR NOW. ALSO...THE CLOUDS...SHOWERS AND COLD AIR 
ADVECTION SUGGEST THAT THE MOS MAX TEMPS ARE RATHER OPTIMISTIC. I 
CHOSE TO UNDERCUT THE GFS MOS AND EVEN THE COOLER NAM MOS IN A FEW 
SPOTS. 


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...COLD AIR ALOFT AND 
LOW-LEVEL MOSITURE WRAPPING AROUND NORTHEAST UNITED STATES UPPER 
TROUGH WILL PRODUCE SCATTERED-BROKEN SHOWERS THURSDAY NIGHT. UPSLOPE 
WILL ALSO ENHANCE PRECIPITATION OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THERMAL 
PROFILE BECOMES COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN. LIGHT 
SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ANTICIPATED FOR THE HIGHEST TERRAIN...GENERALLY 
UP TO 1 INCH. LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES LINGER INTO THE 
NORTHEAST SECTIONS (INCLUDING SMOKY MOUNTAINS) FOR THE FIRST HALF OF 
FRIDAY. LOW-LEVEL CLOUDS SLOWLY ERODES FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST 
FRIDAY.

ANOTHER WEAK SHORT-WAVE MOVES ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN 
APPALACHAINS SATURDAY NIGHT. DYNAMICS AND MOISTURE VERY LIMITED...SO 
RAIN CHANCES LOW.

A FAIRLY ZONAL FLOW FOR SUNDAY...BUT MAIN INTEREST IS FIRST OF THE 
SEASON POLAR VORTEX MOVES ACROSS SOUTHERN CANADA THROUGH EARLY NEXT 
WEEK. THE GFS AND ECMWF VARY GREATLY ON THE EXTENT OF THE COLD 
ARCTIC-LIKE AIR MOVING SOUTH INTO THE REGION FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY. 
THE ECMWF IS FASTER AND MORE AGRESSIVE. WILL COMPROMISE FOR NOW AND 
GO A CAT OR TWO COLDER FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.DISCUSSION...SHOWERS TO OUR WEST WILL CONTINUE TO CREEP EASTWARD

SURFACE LOW MOVES TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA. UPPER LEVEL FLOW IS
ALMOST PARALLEL TO THE FRONT WHICH WILL SLOW THE FRONT DOWN AS WELL.
HIGH CLOUDS HAVE SPREAD ACROSS THE REGION WITH LOW CLOUDS BEGINNING

WESTERN PLATEAU SECTIONS AND 40S MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS. A FEW
LOCATIONS ARE IN THE UPPER 30S IN EASTERN VALLEYS. WILL KEEP
PROGRESSION OF SHOWERS EAST SLOW TODAY AND BELOW GUIDANCE FOR
THIS AFTERNOON WITH HIGHEST POPS CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND EXTREME
SW VA. TONIGHT THE FRONT MOVES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH

MID 50S.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER SPEED MAX
CONTINUES ACROSS TN VALLEY ON THURSDAY. LAYER MOISTURE DROPS
RAPIDLY ON THURSDAY AND PRECIPITATION WILL BE TAPERING OFF AS
TROUGH AXIS MOVES THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING. UPSLOPE ACTIVITY WILL
CONTINUE THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT WITH LIGHT SNOW ACROSS THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS OF SW VA AND EAST CENTRAL AND NE TN. HIGH PRESSURE AND
DRY CONDITIONS MOVE RAPIDLY EAST ACROSS THE AREA ON SATURDAY. UPPER
TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE TN VALLEY SAT NIGHT. MOISTURE RAMPS UP WITH
ANOTHER ROUND OF PRECIPITATION INTO SUNDAY WITH RAPID DRYING BY
SUNDAY AFTERNOON. HIGH PRESSURE AND DRY WEATHER RETURN AND PERSIST
THROUGH MONDAY. BROAD UPPER TROUGH DEVELOPS BY TUE ACROSS CENTRAL
NORTH AMERICA. ANOTHER FROPA AND ROUND OF PRECIPITATION ON TRACK
FOR TUE. PATTERN SHIFT SUPPORTS COLD TEMPERATURES BEYOND THE
FORECAST PERIOD.

952 
FXUS64 KMRX 041959
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
259 PM EST TUE NOV 4 2014

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY/...
THE UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE THAT HAS BEEN PROMOTING THE FAIR WEATHER 
ACROSS THE REGION THE PAST COUPLE OF DAYS IS FLATTENING AND IS 
SHIFTING OFF TO THE SOUTH AND EAST. THIS HAS ALLOWED SOME HIGH 
CLOUDS AHEAD OF AN UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS 
TO MOVE THROUGH THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON. HOWEVER...THESE CLOUDS 
HAVE DONE LITTLE TO SUPPRESS HEATING AS THE PARTLY TO MOSTLY SUNNY 
CONDITIONS HAVE ALLOWED HIGHS TO PEAK IN THE MID TO UPPER 60S IN 
MOST SPOTS AS OF MID-AFTERNOON. 

OVERNIGHT...THESE CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE AS THE COLD
FRONT/TROUGH NOSES TOWARD THE REGION. THIS WILL HELP KEEP LOWS 5 TO
10 DEGREES HIGH THAN LAST NIGHT...IN THE MID TO UPPER 40S. THE COLD
FRONT WILL GRADUALLY PUSH TOWARD THE AREA AFTER SUNRISE AS CLOUDS
CONTINUE TO INCREASE. SOME ISOLATED ACTIVITY WILL BE POSSIBLE ALONG
THE PLATEAU IN THE MORNING...AND WILL EVENTUALLY INCREASE ACROSS
THE REGION OVER THE COURSE OF THE AFTERNOON. HOWEVER...MODELS KEEP
MOST OF THE WIDESPREAD ACTIVITY WEST OF THE REGION UNTIL EVENING.
THUS...HAVE KEPT THE SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCES POPS FOR THE
AFTERNOON...BUT HAVE NOT GONE HIGHER ATTM. SOUTHWEST WINDS AHEAD OF
THE FRONT SHOULD HELP PUSH HIGHS INTO THE LOW TO PERHAPS MID 60S
DESPITE THE CLOUD COVER.

.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY/... 
ON WEDNESDAY EVENING...LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE WILL MOVE INTO THE
AREA TO PROVIDE GOOD FORCING FOR SHOWERS...AND WILL HAVE
CATEGORICAL POPS THROUGH THE NIGHT AS THIS FORCING MOVES EAST. THE
NAM AND GFS HAVE SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES WITH THE FRONTAL
PASSAGE...WITH THE GFS BEING THE FASTER OF THE TWO. THE ECMWF SIDES
MORE WITH THE GFS TIMING...AND SO WILL LEAN THE FORECAST TOWARD THE
FASTER SOLUTION...DROPPING POPS DOWN QUICKLY THROUGH THURSDAY.
NORTHERN AREAS WILL CONTINUE TO HAVE CHANCE POPS THURSDAY NIGHT AS
A POTENT VORT MAX ON THE SOUTHERN END OF A CLOSED UPPER LOW DROPS
INTO THE REGION. COLD MIDLEVEL TEMPS AND NW FLOW COULD PRODUCE SOME
SNOW SHOWERS IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY
MORNING...BUT MOISTURE IS RATHER LIMITED AND ONLY LIGHT
ACCUMULATIONS LOOK POSSIBLE AT THIS TIME.

ANOTHER DEEP TROUGH DEVELOPS OVER THE EASTERN CONUS...AND THE 
ASSOCIATED FRONTAL PASSAGE SHOULD BRING CHANCE POPS SATURDAY NIGHT 
AND SUNDAY MORNING. GFS AND ECMWF HAVE BEEN IN REASONABLY GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH EACH OTHER AND FAIRLY CONSISTENT FROM RUN TO RUN...SO 
WILL RAISE POPS A BIT HIGHER. A MORE ZONAL FLOW DEVELOPS ACROSS THE 
COUNTRY FOR THE REST OF THE FORECAST PERIOD...AND WILL HAVE DRY 
WEATHER WITH SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL TEMPS MONDAY AND TUESDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             47  65  55  66 /  10  30  90  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  45  64  53  63 /  10  30  90  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       47  62  53  62 /  10  40  90  30

.DISCUSSION...

UPPER 60S WILL BE COMMON BY LATE AFTERNOON FOR THIS ELECTION DAY.
MAIN CHANGES TO THE GRIDS WERE TO INCREASE CLOUD COVER ACROSS THE
WESTERN AND NORTHERN ZONES...BUT OTHERWISE JUST MINOR CHANGES WERE
NEEDED.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL

SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL BRING AN INCREASE IN CIRRUS CLOUD COVER.

MIX DOWN BRIEFLY THIS AFTERNOON ESPECIALLY ACROSS NE AREAS. 
 
.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...A FEW WEATHER SYSTEMS WILL 
MARK THE EXTENDED. FIRST...FROPA WITH RAIN SHOWERS WEDNESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WHICH WILL PROMOTE SNOW MELT IN THE MTNS. 
SECOND...A FOLLOW-UP COOL WRAPAROUND NW FLOW TYPE PRECIP...MOSTLY 
LIQUID THIS TIME...FOR THURS THROUGH FRIDAY. THIRD...A QUICK 
SHORTWAVE SPREADING SCATTERED SHOWERS OVER THE AREA SAT NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BOUNCE FROM MILD TO COOL BASED ON THESE 
EVENTS...AND THE STRENGTH AND POSITION OF THE BACK-SIDE H5 TROF ON 
THURS WILL PROBABLY MAKE MAX TEMP FORECASTS FOR THURS/FRI A BIT LOW 
ON CONFIDENCE. THE MODELS ARE ALSO A LITTLE DISCREPANT WITH THE WIND 
THURS AND THURS NIGHT...SO I HAVE BLENDED GFS AND ECMWF MOSTLY. 
RESULT IS ROUGHLY 10-15 MPH WEST WINDS THURS/THURS NIGHT BUT HIGHER 
OVER THE EASTERN MTNS.

449 
FXUS64 KMRX 031945
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EST MON NOV 3 2014

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND TUESDAY/...
A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN
UNITED STATES...PROMOTING FAIR WEATHER ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY
AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE ABUNDANT SUNSHINE AND SOUTHERLY
WINDS HAVE HELPED TO WARM THE BOUNDARY LAYER NICELY INTO THE UPPER
50S TO MID 60S AS OF MID-AFTERNOON. WITH A CLEAR SKY PREVAILING...
TEMPERATURES WILL DROP QUICKLY AFTER SUNSET TONIGHT...BUT WILL BE A
FEW DEGREES WARMER AND BOTTOM OUT ABOVE FREEZING IN THE MID TO
UPPER 30S IN MOST AREAS. WINDS WILL PICK UP SLIGHTLY TOMORROW AHEAD
OF A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. THIS...ALONG
WITH MOSTLY SUNNY/DRY CONDITIONS AND INCREASED THICKNESS VALUES
WILL ALLOW FOR SLIGHTLY WARMER HIGH TEMPERATURES FOR ELECTION DAY
TOMORROW...IN THE MID TO UPPER 60S IN MOST SPOTS.

.LONG TERM /TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY/...
A COLD FRONT AND POSITIVELY-TILTED MID/UPPER TROUGH WILL BE NEAR THE 
MS VALLEY REGION TO START THE PERIOD. A SURFACE LOW DEVELOPS ALONG 
THE FRONT OVER MIDDLE TN WEDNESDAY...SPREADING PRECIP INTO OUR 
PLATEAU COUNTIES BY THE AFTERNOON. WILL RAISE POPS TO LIKELY ACROSS 
THE BOARD WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS THE SURFACE FRONT PUSHES THROUGH. THE 
NAM DEPICTS THE FRONT STALLING ALONG THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS THURSDAY
WHILE THE GFS IS FASTER TO PUSH IT EAST. WILL KEEP SOME SLIGHT TO
LOW CHANCE POPS GOING INTO THURSDAY NORTH AND EAST. ON THURSDAY
NIGHT A TROUGH ROUNDING THE BASE OF A CLOSED LOW DIPS INTO OUR
NORTHERN SECTIONS...PROVIDING COLD MIDLEVEL TEMPS AND UPSLOPE
WINDS. MOISTURE IS LIMITED BY THIS TIME BUT THERE COULD BE
SCATTERED SHOWERS NORTH AND IN THE MOUNTAINS WITH THIS SYSTEM
THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING. TEMPERATURES LOOK MARGINAL FOR
SNOW...EVEN IN THE MOUNTAINS...WHICH SHOULD MEAN ONLY VERY LITTLE
ACCUMULATION...IF ANY. IT MOVES THROUGH QUICKLY...AND A DRY
FORECAST RETURNS BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON.

A FAST-MOVING TROUGH/FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. GFS AND 
ECMWF DIFFER IN THE AMOUNT OF MOISTURE THAT WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR 
THIS SYSTEM. WILL NOT CHANGE THE CURRENT FORECAST MUCH...KEEPING LOW 
TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING. TEMPERATURES APPEAR TO COOL 
CONSIDERABLY BEHIND THE SYSTEM FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             40  69  47  69 /   0   0  10  30

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE WARMING TREND CONTINUES 
INTO TUESDAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE DOMINATING AREA WEATHER.  THE RIDGE 
BEGINS TO SHIFT EASTWARD ON WEDNESDAY...ALLOWING A COLD FRONT TO 
APPROACH THE AREA.  AHEAD OF THE FRONT...A BAND OF SHOWERS WILL 
DEVELOP AND MOVE THROUGH.  A FEW SHOWERS MAY REACH IN ON WEDNESDAY 
BUT THE MAIN LINE SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL THE WEDNESDAY NIGHT/THURSDAY 
TIME FRAME.  MODEL CONSISTENCY POOR BEYOND THIS POINT AND CONFIDENCE 
QUITE LOW.  THE ASSOCIATED UPPER LOW IS EXPECTED TO DROP SOUTH BUT 
THE BIG QUESTION IS HOW FAR SOUTH THIS FEATURE WILL REACH.  CURRENT 
MODEL RUNS ARE KEEPING THE LOW FARTHER TO OUR NORTH...LIMITING THE 
PRECIP. HOWEVER...WILL LIGHTLY SEE SOME INFLUENCE FOR THIS FEATURE 
ON THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY WITH ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SHOWERS 
MOVING THROUGH...BEST CHANCE OVER NORTHERN LOCATIONS.  AS 
TEMPERATURES FALL THURSDAY NIGHT...SHOWERS OVER THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS MAY TRANSITION TO LIGHT SNOW.  WILL BE BRIEFLY BETWEEN 
SYSTEM ON SATURDAY WITH THE NEXT SYSTEM MOVING IN ON SUNDAY.

225 
FXUS64 KMRX 021948
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
248 PM EST SUN NOV 2 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...VERY QUIET SHORT TERM 
COMPARED TO THE LAST SEVERAL DAYS. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
CONTINUE TO BUILD INTO THE AREA FROM THE WEST NORTHWEST. CURRENT 
AIRMASS IS VERY DRY WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE LOWER TO MID 20S AREA 
WIDE. MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES...LOW DEWPOINTS...AND LIGHT WINDS WILL 
ALLOW FOR TEMPERATURES TO DIVE INTO THE UPPER 20S CENTRAL AND 
SOUTHERN VALLEY...AND LOW TO MID 20S ACROSS NETN AND SWVA. OVERNIGHT 
LOWS WILL BE ABOUT 15 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. ALSO...DUE TO A 
WIDESPREAD FREEZE LAST NIGHT...THE FALL FREEZE PROGRAM WILL BE 
ALLOWED TO END ACROSS THE AREA. THUS WE WILL NO LONGER ISSUE
FREEZE WARNINGS UNTIL SPRING OF 2015.

TEMPS REBOUND TOMORROW AS THE RIDGE CONTINUES BUILDING WITH WINDS 
SWITCHING FROM NORTH TO SOUTH BY TOMORROW AFTERNOON. EXPECT MOSTLY 
SUNNY SKIES WITH TEMPS NEAR 60 TO MID 60S.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...AMPLE SUNSHINE AND
SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL HELP TO WARM TEMPERATURES INTO THE MID TO
UPPER 60S IN MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS ON TUESDAY AS A HIGH PRESSURE
RIDGE REMAINS OVERHEAD. THIS RIDGE WILL SLIDE OFF TO THE EAST ON
WEDNESDAY AS AN UPPER-TROUGH/COLD FRONT SLOWLY MOVES EAST TOWARD
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. ATTM...MODELS ARE TRENDING SLIGHTLY
QUICKER...BUT ARE KEEPING THE MOST MEANINGFUL POPS WEST OF THE
REGION UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. THUS...HAVE ORIENTED THE
GRIDS THIS WAY...AND KEPT THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT
AND EARLY THURSDAY MORNING AS THE FRONT MOVES IN. SHOWERS WILL
TAPER OFF FROM WEST TO EAST ON THURSDAY...BUT MODELS ARE NOW
HINTING SOME WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE TRIGGERING SHOWERS AND CREATING
SOME ADDITIONAL CLOUD COVER THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY /ALONG WITH
SOME SNOW SHOWERS FOR THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS/. TEMPERATURES WILL
ALSO DROP IN WAKE OF THIS FRONT...WITH HIGHS IN THE MID 50S TO
AROUND 60 DEGREES BECOMING COMMON HEADING INTO THE WEEKEND. AN
ADDITIONAL SHORTWAVE MAY KICK OFF ANOTHER ROUND OF ISOLATED TO
SCATTERED SHOWERS FOR SATURDAY...SO HAVE ADDED A MENTION OF THIS TO
THE FORECAST AS WELL.

910 PM EDT SAT NOV 1 2014

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OFF THE NC
OUTERBANKS...WITH A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE
MS RIVER VALLEY. THIS HIGH PRESSURE AREA WILL CONTINUE TO BRING
UNSEASONABLY COLD AIR INTO THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT...WITH
TEMPS EXPECTED TO FALL BELOW FREEZING MOST EVERYWHERE. SINCE RADARS
REVEAL ONLY LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS OVER THE MOUNTAINS...HAVE ALREADY
CANCELLED THE WINTER STORM WARNING EARLY...SINCE ANY ADDITIONAL
SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS TONIGHT SHOULD BE MINIMAL. THESE FREEZING
TEMPS WILL LIKELY CREATE SOME AREAS OF BLACK ICE OVERNIGHT...
ESPECIALLY IN THOSE AREAS THAT RECEIVED EARLIER SNOWFALL
ACCUMULATIONS. THUS...HAVE ISSUED A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT TO
ADDRESS THIS ISSUE.

OTHERWISE...HAVE ALREADY UPDATED THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO REMOVE
THE WINTER STORM WARNING HEADLINES AND TO BE MORE PESSIMISTIC WITH
SKY COVER. WILL NOT PLAN TO UPDATE FURTHER THIS EVENING...SINCE THE
REST OF THE FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK.

WILL HELP TO GENERATE SOME SHOWERS LATE WEDNESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY
NIGHT...BEFORE TAPERING OFF FROM WEST TO EAST DURING THE DAY ON
THURSDAY. SOME SLIGHTLY COOLER AIR WILL FOLLOW THE FRONT TO CLOSE
OUT THE WEEK...BUT HIGHS IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S ARE STILL
EXPECTED...ALONG WITH MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS.

FXUS64 KMRX 010717
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
307 AM EDT SAT NOV 1 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LOW MOVING SOUTHEAST ACROSS 
E TN EARLY TODAY. MID LEVEL MOISTURE WILL WRAP BACK INTO THE AREA 
THROUGH MID DAY AS THE LOW MOVES THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. 
PRECIPITATION TYPE WILL BE MAINLY SNOW...WITH SOME MIX WITH RAIN 
ACROSS THE VALLEYS. FREEZING LEVEL IN THE VALLEYS RISES SOME TODAY 
TO NEAR 1200 FEET BEFORE FALLING TO THE SURFACE TONIGHT. LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE CONTINUE ACROSS MOST OF THE AREAS THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT
IN NORTHWEST FLOW. WINTER WARNINGS AND ADVISORIES REMAIN ON TRACK. 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS A SURE BET FOR HEAVY ACCUMULATIONS. LOWER LEVELS 
WILL SEE PLENTY OF MELTING WHILE SOME HAZARDOUS IMPACTS REMAIN 
POSSIBLE. FREEZING TEMPERATURES WILL OCCUR AREAWIDE TONIGHT. ZONES 
THAT REMAIN IN THE FREEZE PROGRAM HAVE A FREEZE WARNING FOR TONIGHT. 
THE GROWING SEASON WILL LIKELY END FOR THE YEAR TONIGHT.  

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A FEW PATCHES OF LIGHT SNOW 
SHOWERS/FLURRIES WILL LINGER OVER FAR NORTHEASTERN AREAS OF SUNDAY 
MORNING AS THE UPPER LOW PULLS AWAY FROM THE AREA.  BY AFTERNOON...A 
RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BEGINS TO MOVE IN FOR CLEARING SKIES.  THIS 
WILL ALLOW FOR GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING OVERNIGHT FOR ANOTHER NIGHT 
OF FREEZING TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE NORTHERN TWO THIRDS OF THE AREA 
MONDAY MORNING.  HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO BUILD IN FOR MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY FOR DRY CONDITIONS AND A WARMING TREND.  HIGHS WILL CLIMB 
BACK UP INTO THE 60S FOR MID WEEK.  THE NEXT SYSTEM OF CONCERN WILL 
BE A WEAK COLD FRONT.  MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW SOME TIMING 
DIFFERENCES BUT ASSOCIATED SHOWERS SHOULD MOVE THROUGH AROUND THE 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT/THURSDAY TIME FRAME.  DRY CONDITIONS RETURN FOR 
FRIDAY AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BEGINS TO BUILD IN.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
227 AM EDT SAT NOV 1 2014

.AVIATION...A COLD FRONT HAS MOVED EAST THROUGH THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA FROM
THE NORTHWEST THROUGH THDE PERIOD. NORTHWEST WINDS WILL BECOME
BREEZY TODAY BEFORE SHIFTING TO THE NORTH AND WEAKING SOME LATE IN
THE PERIOD. A POWERFUL UPPER LOW WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE
AREA EARLY IN THE PERIOD. AREAS OF RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS WILL
BECOME MOSTLY SNOW THIS MORNING. THE FREEZING LEVEL WILL FALL FROM
AROUND 1200 FEET TO NEAR THE SURFACE BY DAYBREAK. MVFR CIGS AND
VSBY WILL BE PREVAILING WITH PERIODS OF IFR CONDITIONS DURING
HEAVIER SHOWERS. THE PRECIPITATION SHOULD END THIS MORNING AT CHA
BUT CONTINUE MOST OF THE PERIOD AT TYS AND TRI.

FXUS64 KMRX 010100
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
900 PM EDT FRI OCT 31 2014

.DISCUSSION...TEMPERATURES ARE DROPPING A LITTLE FASTER THAN
FORECAST BEHIND THE COLD FRONT ADVANCING THROUGH THE REGION. THE
BOUNDARY IS NEARING A TRI-DNN LINE. COOLING IS OF COURSE MORE
SENSITIVE TO ELEVATION WITH MID 30 DEGREE READINGS NOTED ON THE
HIGHER CUMBERLAND PLATEAU TERRAIN WHERE SOME LIGHT SNOW WAS FALLING
SINCE EARLY EVENING. THE MAIN EVENT BEGINS LATER TONIGHT WITH
STRONGER LIFT AND VERY COLD TEMPERATURES ALOFT WITH THE UPPER LOW.
THE LOW IS CURRENTLY DROPPING SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY.
WINTER STORM WARNING/ADVISORY STILL ON TRACK WITH BEST SNOWFALL
ACCUMULATION IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND
THE MOUNTAINS ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER WHERE SEVERAL INCHES
OF SNOW SHOULD FALL. IT STILL APPEARS THAT MUCH OF THE GREAT VALLEY
IN TENNESSEE (LOWER TERRAIN AREAS) WILL SEE A PERIOD OF SNOW LATE
TONIGHT INTO SATURDAY MORNING WITH SOME DECENT MELTING DUE TO WARM
GROUND TEMPERATURES. THEREFORE...MUCH OF THE ACCUMULATION WILL BE
ON GRASS COVERED SURFACES. WILL TWEAK TEMPERATURE/DEWPOINT GRIDS TO
MATCH CURRENT READINGS.

598 
FXUS64 KMRX 312338
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
737 PM EDT FRI OCT 31 2014

.AVIATION...FIRST WAVE OF RAIN WORKING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
ALTHO MAY BE MOSTLY SNOW IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. BRIEF MVFR 
CONDITIONS POSSIBLE AT TAF SITES AS THE PRECIPITATION FALLS AS RAIN. 

EXPECT CEILINGS AND VISBYS TO LOWER INTO PERIODS OF IFR OVERNIGHT 
THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING...ESPECIALLY AT TRI AND TYS. PRECIPITATION 
WILL CHANGE OVER TO SNOW OR A MIX...EXCEPT AT CHA WHERE PRECIP IS 
LESS LIKELY. CONDITIONS GRADUALLY IMPROVE DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS 
SATURDAY...BUT MAY BE SLOW TO RISE OUT OF MVFR AT TRI. 

PREVIOUS AFD FOLLOWS BELOW DUE TO SIGNIFICANT WEATHER OCCURRING...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...AS WITH THE PAST 
FEW MODEL RUNS...MODELS REMAIN IN FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT ON SNOW 
POTENTIAL. HOWEVER...THERE ARE SOME CHANGES THAT HAVE BEEN MADE TO 
THE SNOW FORECAST. EXTENDING THE CURRENT ADVISORY FURTHER SOUTH INTO 
THE CENTRAL VALLEY TO INCLUDE ANDERSON...UNION...GRAINGER...AND 
COCKE. ALSO ADDING THE MOUNTAIN ZONE OF MONROE INTO THE WINTER STORM 
WARNING.

WILL HOLD OFF ON WIND ADVISORY AS CRITERIA AREN'T QUITE MET. 
NONETHELESS...WINDS WILL STILL BE BREEZY TONIGHT INTO
SATURDAY...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WHERE GUSTS UP
TO 30 MPH WILL BE POSSIBLE ON SATURDAY. WINDS IN THE LOWER
ELEVATIONS COULD GUST BETWEEN 15 AND 20 MPH.

A DEEP UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL BEGIN MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS EVENING AND CONTINUE TO DIG FURTHER SOUTH THROUGH SATURDAY 
MORNING. THE UPPER LEVEL LOW PASSES RIGHT OVER THE EAST TENNESSEE 
VALLEY AND MOVES INTO SC/NC BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON. DURING THIS TIME 
WE WILL EXPERIENCE STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION OUT OF THE NORTH ALONG 
WITH STRONG UPPER LEVEL FORCING AND PLENTY OF MOISTURE. STRONG COLD 
AIR ADVECTION WILL ALLOW FREEZING LEVELS TO BEGIN TO PLUMMET SHORTLY 
AFTER SUNSET AND BE DOWN TO AROUND 500 TO 1K FEET BY 
MIDNIGHT...LEVELS FURTHER FALL LATER INTO THE NIGHT WITH MOST AREAS 
NEAR FREEZING AT THE SURFACE BY AROUND 5/6AM EST. AGAIN...LITTLE 
QUESTION AS TO THE PRECIPITATION TYPE WITH THE WARM LAYER BECOMING 
SO SHALLOW. SOUNDINGS IN THE ADVISORY AND WARNING AREAS INDICATE 
GOOD SNOW GROWTH WITH MOISTURE ALL THE UP TO -20 DEG CELSIUS FOR 
SEVERAL HOURS. AREAS UP INTO SWVA AND EXTREME NETN EXPERIENCE GOOD 
MOISTURE AT -20 DEG C FROM ABOUT 06Z SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH ABOUT 
18Z SATURDAY AFTERNOON. DURING THIS TIME IS WHEN THE BULK OF THE 
SNOW WILL OCCUR.
 
MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOWFALL EXPECTED TONIGHT INTO SATURDAY ACROSS  
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. MODELS STILL INDICATING THAT THE SYNOPTIC 
SNOWFALLS SHOULD TAPER OFF EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON BUT UPSLOPE SNOW 
SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE DAY ON SATURDAY AND INTO SATURDAY 
EVENING. CONFIDENCE IN THE SNOWFALL ACCUMULATION FORECAST FOR THE 
MOUNTAINS IS HIGH. THE ADVISORY AREAS ARE WHERE THERE ARE STILL SOME 
QUESTIONS. SNOW WILL FALL IN THESE AREAS...SOME PLACES EVEN SEVERAL
INCHES. THE QUESTION IS HOW MUCH ACTUALLY STICKS TO THE GROUND DUE
TO WARM GROUND TEMPERATURES. FREEZE WATCH OUT FOR SATURDAY NIGHT
DUE TO EXPECTED SUBFREEZING TEMPS.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...LOW CLOUD COVER /AND PERHAPS 
A FEW LIGHT SHOWERS ALONG THE MTNS/ MAY LINGER THROUGH THE MORNING 
HOURS ON SUNDAY ON THE BACKSIDE OF THE DEPARTING LOW. HOWEVER... 
CLEARING WILL TAKE PLACE BY THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS A RIDGE OF 
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN. THESE CLEAR CONDITIONS WILL RESULT IN GOOD 
RADIATIONAL COOLING SUNDAY NIGHT AND RESULT IN ANOTHER FREEZE ACROSS 
SW VIRGINIA/NE TENNESSEE AND A NEAR FREEZE/FROST ELSEWHERE. 

HOWEVER...WITH WINDS INCREASING FROM THE SOUTH AND AMPLE SUNSHINE 
PREVAILING...A WARM-UP BACK INTO THE MID TO UPPER 60S THROUGH THE 
MIDDLE OF THE WEEK WILL OCCUR AS HIGHS CLIMB BACK INTO THE MID TO 
UPPER 60S BY TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. CLOUD COVER WILL INCREASE 
WEDNESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS A TROUGH/COLD FRONT SLOWLY 
APPROACHES FROM THE WEST. THIS WILL RESULT IN SOME SCATTERED RAIN 
CHANCES FOR LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY AS A WEAK FRONT MOVES 
INTO THE REGION. HOWEVER...THIS FRONT WILL ONLY BRING SLIGHTLY 
COOLER AIR...AND THE SKY SHOULD CLEAR OUT BY FRIDAY TO CLOSE OUT THE 
WORK WEEK. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              32  38  28  42 / 100 100  20  10

     JOHNSON-SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS-SOUTHEAST CARTER-SOUTHEAST

.AVIATION...
VFR CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON WILL QUICKLY BECOME REDUCED TO MVFR
CONDITIONS THIS EVENING AS RAIN SHOWERS REDUCE VIS/CIGS AT
KTRI/KTYS. AS COLDER AIR MOVES INTO THE REGION OVERNIGHT...THESE
-SHRA WILL TRANSITION TO -SN AS CIGS/VIS LOWER TO IFR LEVELS LATER
TONIGHT. THESE CONDITIONS WILL PERSIST AT KTYS/KTRI THROUGH MOST OF
THE MORNING BEFORE GRADUALLY LIFTING LATE IN THE PERIOD. ADDITIONALLY...
GUSTY NW WINDS WILL BE POSSIBLE LATE TONIGHT THROUGH THE DAY ON
SATURDAY.

299 
FXUS64 KMRX 311444
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1044 AM EDT FRI OCT 31 2014

.DISCUSSION...PREVIOUS FORECAST LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK. THE ONLY
SLIGHT CHANGE FOR THIS MORNING WAS TO INCREASE RAIN CHANCES ACROSS
THE EXTREME SOUTHERN VALLEY AND DOWN INTO SWNC FOR THE REST OF THE
AFTERNOON. CURRENT RADAR SHOWS LIGHT RETURNS ACROSS OUR WHOLE AREA
BUT MOST OF IT STILL ISN'T REACHING THE GROUND. THE LOWER LEVELS
SHOULD CONTINUE TO MOISTEN UP OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL HOURS AND THEN
WE SHOULD START TO SEE MORE PRECIP REACHING THE GROUND. DID TWEAK
HOURLY TEMPS AND DEWPOINTS TO MATCH UP WITH LATEST OBS. SENDING NEW
ZONES FOR THE POP INCREASE DISCUSSED ABOVE.


&&

405 AM EDT FRI OCT 31 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...MODELS REMAIN IN FAIRLY 
GOOD AGREEMENT. LITTLE CHANGE TO ONGOING WINTRY FORECAST. TRENDED 
TEMPERATURES COOLER. 

STRONG SPEED MAX DIGS SE THROUGH THE W TN VALLEY TONIGHT. UPPER LOW 
WITH VERY COLD CORE SLIDES THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. COLD 
AIR ADVECTION VERY STRONG BEGINNING LATER TODAY. FREEZING LEVEL 
FALLS TO BELOW 1500 FEET EARLY TONIGHT. LITTLE QUESTION AS TO  
PRECIPITATION TYPE WITH THE WARM LAYER BECOMING SO SHALLOW. MODERATE 
TO HEAVY SNOWFALL EXPECTED TONIGHT ACROSS AREAS NORTH OF KNOXVILLE 
FAVORING THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THE SYNOPTIC SNOWFALLS SHOULD TAPER 
OFF EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON WITH UPSLOPE SHOWERS CONTINUING IN THE 
MOUNTAINS. SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE VARIED ACROSS THE VALLEYS 
BUT CONFIDENCE IS HIGH IN THE MOUNTAINS. WIDESPREAD FREEZING 
TEMPERATURES SUNDAY MORNING. 
 
 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A FEW LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS OR 
FLURRIES WILL LINGER OVER FAR NORTHERN AND EASTERN HIGH TERRAIN 
EARLY SUNDAY MORNING.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN SUNDAY AFTERNOON FOR 
CLEARING SKIES AND AN END OF ALL SNOW.  COLD AIR WILL REMAIN IN 
PLACE SUNDAY NIGHT FOR FREEZING TEMPERATURES ACROSS AT LEAST THE 
NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA.  THE RIDGE CONTINUES TO BUILD IN MONDAY 
AND TUESDAY FOR A DRYING AND WARMING TREND. THERE REMAINS SOME 
DISCREPANCY WITH TIMING BUT THE NEXT SYSTEM...A COLD FRONT...IS 
PROGGED THROUGH THE AREA AROUND THE WEDNESDAY/WEDNESDAY NIGHT TIME 
FRAME AND LINGERING INTO THURSDAY FOR A CHANCE OF RAIN SHOWERS.

FXUS64 KMRX 310101 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
901 PM EDT THU OCT 30 2014

.DISCUSSION...THE LATEST MODEL RUNS OF THE NAM...GFS AND ECMWF
BRINGS UPPER LOW LATE FRIDAY...FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY A LITTLE
FARTHER WEST. HONESTLY...I HAVE NEVER SEEN A STRONG UPPER LEVEL
DROP NEARLY DUE SOUTH FROM THE GREAT LAKES INTO THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS. VERY UN-COMMON. THE FARTHER WEST TRACK BRINGS THE
COLDER UPPER LEVEL AIR (NEAR -30C AT 500MB) DIRECTLY OVER THE
REGION WITH BETTER DYNAMICS. DECIDED TO ISSUE A WINTER WEATHER
ADVISORY INTO THE TRI-CITIES AREA. MAIN QUESTION REMAINS...HOW
MUCH WILL THE SNOW STICK? SINCE THE SNOW WILL BE FALLING DURING THE
NIGHT-TIME AND MORNING HOURS...THERE MAY BE A LITTLE BETTER CHANCE
OF THE SNOW STICKING ON GRASSY SURFACES ACROSS THE TRI-CITIES.
STILL THINK THE ROADWAYS SHOULD BE GOOD GIVEN THE WARMTH OF THE
GROUND.

IF THIS SYSTEM OCCURRED DURING JANUARY...WOULD HAVE BEEN A MUCH
DIFFERENT SNOW POTENTIAL. HAVE MADE SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO
SNOW AMOUNTS AS WELL.

FOR TONIGHT...AN AREA OF MID-LEVEL CLOUDS OVER WESTERN TENNESSEE
WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EVER-SO SLOWLY INTO THE AREA AND HAVE CHANGED
SKY FORECAST WORDING FOR TONIGHT.

WILL HAVE NEW ZFP AND WINTER WEATHER PRODUCTS OUT SOON.

883 
FXUS64 KMRX 301845
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT THU OCT 30 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE LOWER OHIO 
AND TN RIVER VALLEYS...WITH A SEASONABLY MILD AIR MASS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA UNDER MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES. CLOUDS WILL INCREASE TONIGHT 
AS AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE SWINGS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY...AHEAD 
OF AN AMPLIFYING LONG WAVE UPPER-LEVEL PATTERN. THESE CLOUDS MAY 
EVENTUALLY INHIBIT MOST FOG FORMATION OVERNIGHT...BUT WILL CONTINUE 
TO MENTION PATCHY FOG EVERYWHERE DUE TO THE WARM WATER TEMPS 
POSSIBLY CREATING ANOTHER MORNING OF FOG ALONG THE WATERWAYS. THE 
MAIN STORY DURING THIS FORECAST PERIOD WILL BE THE AMPLIFYING UPPER-
LEVEL LONG WAVE TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION...WHICH 
WILL EVENTUALLY BECOME A CUT-OFF UPPER LOW MOVING SOUTHEASTWARD 
RIGHT OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS DEEP UPPER TROUGH WILL PUSH A 
STRONG COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY AFTERNOON...WITH 
TEMPS FALLING QUICKLY AS THE SUN SETS FRIDAY EVENING AND RAIN 
QUICKLY CHANGING TO SNOW OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WITH THE DEEP 
UPPER LOW EXPECTED TO MOVE RIGHT OVER THE FORECAST AREA AFTER 
MIDNIGHT ON FRIDAY NIGHT...LAPSE RATES WILL STEEPEN CONSIDERABLY 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH CONVECTIVE SNOWFALL (AND THUS HIGHER 
SNOWFALL INTENSITIES) POSSIBLE LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY 
MORNING. WHILE SNOW WILL LIKELY BE OBSERVED MOST EVERYWHERE (EVEN IN 
THE VALLEYS) LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING...SNOWFALL 
ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE VERY ELEVATION-DEPENDENT DUE TO THE WARM 
GROUND TEMPS IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS. IT STILL APPEARS THAT 4 TO 8 
INCHES WILL BE POSSIBLE OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET 
MSL...BUT A FOOT OR MORE OF SNOWFALL APPEARS POSSIBLE OVER THE 
HIGHEST PEAKS ABOVE 5000 FEET DUE TO THE DIRECT PASSAGE OF THE DEEP 
UPPER LOW AND ITS VERY COLD TEMPS ALOFT. SINCE THE MODELS HAVE BEEN 
CONSISTENT WITH THIS PATTERN FOR SEVERAL RUNS...WILL GO AHEAD AND 
UPGRADE THE WATCH TO A WINTER STORM WARNING. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND 
NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH SATURDAY 
NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM /SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY/...SOME LOW CLOUD COVER MAY
LINGER THROUGH THE MORNING HOURS ON SUNDAY ON THE BACKSIDE OF THE
DEPARTING LOW...BUT CLEARING WILL OCCUR BY THE AFTERNOON AND
EVENING AS HIGH PRESSURE BEGINS TO BUILD IN. ANOTHER FREEZE
/POSSIBLY A HARD ONE IN SW VA/ WILL BE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE NORTHERN
AND CENTRAL VALLEYS EARLY MONDAY MORNING. HOWEVER...WITH WINDS
INCREASING FROM THE SOUTH AND AMPLE SUNSHINE PREVAILING...A WARM-UP
BACK INTO THE MID TO UPPER 60S FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY HIGH
TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED...WITH LOWS IN THE UPPER 30S AND 40S IN
MOST SPOTS. ANOTHER TROUGH/COLD FRONT LOOKS TO APPROACH THE AREA
TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY...GIVING THE REGION ANOTHER SHOT AT
SOME PRECIPITATION FOR THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK. MODELS STILL DIFFER
IN THE EXACT TIMING...BUT IT APPEARS THE BEST WINDOW MAY BE
WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY EVENING...SO HAVE THE HIGHEST POPS DURING
THIS TIME PERIOD...BEFORE CLEARING THINGS OUT BY THURSDAY.
&&

813 
FXUS64 KMRX 300754
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT THU OCT 30 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RADIATION IN THE CLEAR SKY AND 
CALM WIND ENVIRONMENT ALONG WITH MOIST CONDITIONS AT THE SURFACE HAS 
ALLOWED SOME PATCHY FOG TO FORM. SOME OF THE FOG IS DENSE NEAR WATER 
BODIES AND WILL DISSIPATE A COUPLE HOURS AFTER SUNRISE SO ADDED A 
BIT OF THIS IN THE FORECAST. OTHERWISE...SHOULD BE A DRY DAY TODAY 
WITH LOTS OF SUNSHINE. UPPER TROUGH AMPLIFIES AS IT DROPS SOUTHEAST 
INTO THE EASTERN U.S. TONIGHT. A COLD FRONT WILL BE ON THE APPROACH 
AND WE MAY SEE A SPRINKLE OR TWO ON THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU 
JUST BEFORE 12Z. STAYED QUITE CLOSE TO THE MIDDLE OF MOS NUMBERS FOR 
MAX AND MIN TEMPS IN THE SHORT TERM.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...AN INITIAL SHORTWAVE TROUGH 
APPROACHING FROM THE NW WILL BEGIN TO SPREAD LIGHT RAIN INTO THE 
AREA FRIDAY MORNING...THEN THE MAIN CLOSED UPPER LOW WILL BEGIN TO 
HAVE AN IMPACT FRIDAY EVENING. PEAK QG FORCING AND FRONTAL PASSAGE 
OCCUR IN THE 00Z-06Z TIME FRAME...WHICH IS WHEN WE SHOULD SEE A 
CHANGE FROM RAIN TO SNOW IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS. A FAVORABLE NW FLOW 
SNOW PATTERN SETS UP FOR FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY...WITH 
UPSLOPE WINDS AROUND 25 KTS... STEEP LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES...AND 
ABUNDANT MOISTURE THROUGH THE DENDRITE GROWTH ZONE. SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE HIGHLY DEPENDENT ON LOCAL TERRAIN. DECREASING 
MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY SHOULD BRING LOWERING POPS AND QPF BY 
SATURDAY EVENING. 

A WINTER STORM WATCH WILL BE ISSUED FOR OUR TN MOUNTAIN ZONES AS 
WELL AS WISE...RUSSELL AND WASHINGTON COUNTIES IN VA WITH WORDING TO 
SPECIFY ELEVATIONS 2500 FT AND HIGHER. TOTAL SNOWFALL AMOUNTS ABOVE 
THAT LEVEL ARE EXPECTED TO BE BETWEEN 4 AND 8 INCHES...WITH AROUND A 
FOOT IN THE HIGHEST PEAKS OF THE SMOKIES. THIS IS A BIT BELOW THE 
NAM SNOWFALL AMOUNTS TO ACCOUNT FOR INITIAL MELTING WITH THE 
RELATIVELY WARM GROUND THIS TIME OF YEAR. 

FEW CHANGES ARE NEEDED TO THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. A 
LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE MOVING EAST ACROSS THE 
REGION...BRINGING DRY WEATHER AND WARMING TEMPERATURES THROUGH 
TUESDAY BEFORE AN APPROACHING TROUGH/FRONT BRINGS A CHANCE OF RAIN 
WEDNESDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             64  41  62  35 /   0   0  30  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  61  39  59  33 /   0  10  60  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       62  39  58  33 /   0  10  60  50

.AVIATION...DRIER AIR BUILDS IN BEHIND THE DEPARTING FRONTAL SYSTEM
ALLOWING VFR CONDITIONS THROUGH MOST OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.
HOWEVER...EARLY THIS MORNING THE NEAR SURFACE AIR MASS IS BECOMING
SATURATED WITH FOG FORMING NEAR WATERWAYS AND OTHER LOW LYING
AREAS. VLIFR CONDITIONS HAVE DEVELOPED AT TRI AND EXPECT THIS
TERMINAL TO HOLD IN AN VLIFR TO LIFR STATE THROUGH DAYBREAK. ALSO
TYS MAY DROP INTO MVFR CONDITIONS AS WILL THROUGH ABOUT 13Z.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
326 PM EDT WED OCT 29 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT OVER THE PIEDMONT REGION OF THE 
CAROLINAS...WITH COOLER AND DRIER AIR SLOWLY MOVING INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA. ALTHOUGH SKIES ARE EXPECTED TO CLEAR OVER A WET 
GROUND TONIGHT...WILL ONLY MENTION PATCHY FOG (AND PATCHY FROST
FOR SOUTHWEST VA...NORTHEAST TN...THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS...AND
SOUTHWEST NC) DEVELOPING AFTER MIDNIGHT SINCE TEMPS MAY NOT BE ABLE
TO COMPLETELY FALL TO THE DEWPOINTS EVERYWHERE. HIGH PRESSURE WILL
THEN SETTLE OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON THURSDAY...WITH ANOTHER
STRONGER COLD FRONT QUICKLY APPROACHING THE FORECAST AREA LATE
THURSDAY NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN
GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE
WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...CHANGES IN PATTERN FRIDAY AS 
COLD FRONT APPROACHES FROM THE WEST AND STRONG UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM 
DIVES SOUTH BEHIND THE FRONT LATE FRIDAY AND SATURDAY BEFORE MOVING 
NE OUT OF THE REGION SUNDAY. RAIN SHOWERS DEVELOP FRIDAY AHEAD OF 
THE FRONT AND THEN WILL CHANGE OVER TO SNOW SHOWERS AS THE FREEZING 
LEVEL DROPS WITH COLD AIR MASS BEHIND FRONT. SNOWFALL AMOUNTS WILL 
LIKELY REACH SEVERAL INCHES IN THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS NORTHWARD AND 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. AREAS TO THE WEST IN THE VALLEY AND 
PLATEAU ARE EXPECTED TO ONLY GET LIGHT AMOUNTS. HIGHS FRIDAY WILL BE 
IN THE 50S TO LOWER 60S. FRIDAY NIGHT LOWS WILL BE IN THE 30S AND 
MOSTLY ABOVE FREEZING BELOW 2500 FEET. HIGHER ELEVATIONS WILL DROP 
BELOW FREEZING AND MAY NOT GO ABOVE FREEZING UNTIL SUNDAY. SATURDAY 
WILL BE VERY COLD MOSTLY 30S AND 40S WITH CLOUDS AND LINGERING SNOW 
AND RAIN SHOWERS. MOST AREAS SATURDAY NIGHT WILL DROP TO NEAR 
FREEZING AND LOWER AS SKIES CLEAR FROM SW TO NE. A FREEZE WATCH WILL 
LIKELY BE NEEDED FOR SATURDAY NIGHT. A SLOW WARMING TREND SUNDAY 
WITH HIGHS IN THE 40S NE AND MOUNTAINS TO 50S SOUTH. MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY STILL BELOW NORMAL IN THE 50S TO MID 60S. TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY ANOTHER SYSTEM APPROACHES WITH SHOWERS POSSIBLE.

PERSISTENT WIND FLOW IS EXPECTED AT KCHA AND KTYS OVERNIGHT...WHICH 
MIGHT COMBINE WITH THE DRY AIR TO LIMIT MUCH FOG FORMATION. THUS... 
WILL JUST MENTION TEMPORARY MVFR VISIBILITIES FOR NOW AT KTYS. AT 
KTRI...WINDS SHOULD BECOME CALM OVERNIGHT WITH LOWER VISIBILITIES 
POSSIBLE AS TEMPS FALL TO THEIR DEWPOINTS. THUS...WILL MENTION

497 
FXUS64 KMRX 290712
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 AM EDT WED OCT 29 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
THE MAIN WEATHER ACTION TO OCCUR DURING THE FIRST HALF OF THE
FIRST PERIOD AS FROPA ACCOMPANIED BY RAIN SHOWERS WILL BRING RAIN
TO CWA...ENDING WEST TO EAST. ENDING OVER THE PLATEAU AROUND
12-14Z...EASTERN MOUNTAINS AROUND 21Z ROUGHLY. SEASONAL-TYPE TEMPS
TONIGHT AND THURSDAY WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES. MAYBE PATCHY FOG
THURSDAY MORNING NEAR LAKES.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
AN ANOMALOUSLY COLD PATTERN WILL BE SETTING UP ACROSS THE REGION AT 
THE START OF THE PERIOD. AN INITIAL SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL DROP SE 
OUT OF THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND BRING A CHANCE OF RAIN FRIDAY 
MORNING. BEHIND THIS A CLOSED LOW DROPS SOUTH FROM THE GREAT LAKES 
ON FRIDAY...WITH THE CORE OF THE LOW OVER THE APPALACHIANS FRIDAY 
NIGHT. A SURFACE FRONTAL PASSAGE AND QG FORCING WILL BRING 
INCREASING RAIN CHANCES THROUGH THE DAY FRIDAY...THEN WE SHIFT TO A 
NW FLOW PATTERN BEHIND THE FRONT AND 850 MB LOW FRIDAY NIGHT. THE 
RESULTING COLD ADVECTION AND INSTABILITY WILL CHANGE PRECIP TO SNOW 
BETWEEN 00Z AND 06Z IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND IN SW VA...WITH A 
CHANCE IN THE PLATEAU AND VALLEY COMING BETWEEN 06Z AND 12Z. POPS 
TAPER OFF THROUGH SATURDAY WITH STABILIZING MIDLEVEL TEMPS AND 
DECREASING MOISTURE DEPTH. IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS...TOTAL SNOWFALL 
AMOUNTS ABOVE WATCH CRITERIA APPEAR REASONABLE AT THIS TIME...BUT 
SINCE WE ARE STILL ABOUT 72 HOURS FROM THE START OF ANY 
SNOWFALL...WITH HOLD OFF ON A WATCH AND MENTION THE THREAT IN THE 
HWO. LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS MAY BE POSSIBLE IN THE VALLEY. A MORE 
EASTERN TRACK OF THE UPPER LOW SHOWN BY THE ECMWF AND GEFS MEAN 
WOULD RESULT IN LOWER AMOUNTS THAN THE MORE WESTERN TRACKS OF THE 
GFS AND NAM...SO THERE ARE STILL SOME MODEL DISPARITIES TO BE 
RESOLVED BEFORE CONFIDENCE CAN WARRANT A WATCH.

THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD WILL FEATURE A LARGE RIDGE MOVING EAST 
ACROSS THE REGION...RESULTING IN DRY CONDITIONS WITH GRADUALLY 
WARMING TEMPERATURES. NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES WILL BE MADE TO THE 
FORECAST SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

APPALACHIANS WITH CYCLO-GENESIS OVER CAROLINAS SATURDAY. END RESULT
WILL BE A GOOD DEAL OF PRECIPITATION DEVELOPING FRIDAY AFTERNOON
THROUGH SATURDAY. ALSO...STRONG NORTHWEST OROGRAPHIC FLOW WILL
ENHANCE PRECIPITATION OVER THE WEST/NORTHWEST FACING SLOPES. 

THE UPPER TROUGH BRINGS THE FIRSTS SHOT OF WINTER-LIKE COLD WITH
THE VERTICAL PROFILE BECOMING COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW...ESPECIALLY
OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. ACCUMULATING SNOW IS A DISTINT
POSSIBILITY FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...GENERALLY AT OR ABOVE 2500
FEET...OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS. 
SNOWFALL OF 3 TO 6 INCHES ARE POSSIBLE OVER THE HIGHEST
ELEVATIONS...PLACES LIKE THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS AND HIGH
KNOB...VIRGINIA.

A MIXTURE OF SNOW AND RAIN SHOWERS ARE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE TRI-
CITIES AND KNOXVILLE AS WELL.

DUE TO THE EXPECTED AMOUNT OF PRECIPITATION...CLOUDS AND COLD AIR
ADVECTION...LOWERED HIGH TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE REGION AS WELL FOR
SATURDAY. WILL UPDATE HWO TO INCLUDE SNOWFALL CHANCES AND EXPECTED
COLD WEATHER.

CONDITIONS AND COOLER AIR MOVING IN DURING THE AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MOST CHANGES WERE 
MADE FOR FRIDAY INTO THE WEEKEND...DUE TO THE UPPER TROUGH/LOW THAT 
DEVELOPS OVER THE SRN APPALACHIANS AND CAROLINAS BY 12Z SATURDAY. 
THE AIRMASS WILL BE COLDER WITH MORE MOISTURE AVAILABLE TO SUPPORT 
SCATTERED RAIN OR SNOW SHOWERS FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON. POPS WERE INCREASED ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST 
AREA AND TEMPS WERE LOWERED BASED ON MODELS TRENDING TO THIS 
SOLUTION.

THE DEEP CYCLONIC FLOW EASES OFF BY SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY... 
WITH SURFACE RIDGE SETTLING OVER THE REGION INTO MONDAY. A COLD 
FRONT MAY BE APPROACHING FROM THE WEST LATE TUESDAY...SO INTRODUCED 
A LOW CHANCE OF SHOWERS BY TUESDAY NIGHT. 

OTHERWISE...JUST MINOR TWEAKS MADE TO MIN/MAX TEMPS PRIOR TO AND 
AFTER THE WEEKEND...CLOSE TO SIMILAR GFSX AND ECMX MOS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT TUE OCT 28 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE 
SOUTHEAST WILL SHIFT OFFSHORE TODAY WHILE AN UPPER TROUGH AND 
SURFACE COLD FRONT PUSH EAST ACROSS THE MS VALLEY REGION. ANOTHER 
DAY OF MILD TEMPERATURES IS EXPECTED...BUT NOT AS WARM AS YESTERDAY 
WITH CLOUDS INCREASING THROUGH THE AFTERNOON.
 
PRECIP WILL BE MOVING INTO THE PLATEAU AROUND 00Z AS A PRE-FRONTAL 
TROUGH MOVES IN AND UPPER DIVERGENCE INCREASES. POPS WILL BE 
CATEGORICAL NORTH CLOSER TO THE UPPER JET...WITH LIKELY POPS SOUTH.  
INSTABILITY IS WEAK BUT WITH THE NAM SHOWING LI OF 
-2 AND K INDEX OF 35-40...WILL INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
THUNDERSTORMS TONIGHT. MODELS AGREE PRETTY WELL WITH COLD FRONT 
TIMING...BRINGING IT TO THE APPALACHIANS AROUND 12Z. SO WILL END 
POPS QUICKLY FROM WEST TO EAST WEDNESDAY MORNING BEHIND THE 
FRONT...WITH SKIES CLEARING THROUGH THE AFTERNOON.

A BROAD TROUGH WITH A W-NW FLOW ALOFT WILL LINGER OVER THE AREA 
THROUGH THURSDAY. DESPITE ABUNDANT SUNSHINE...THE COLD ADVECTION 
PATTERN WILL KEEP HIGH TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 50S TO MID 60S IN 
MOST SPOTS THURSDAY...WITH LOWS IN THE MID 30S TO LOWER 40S.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS IN GENERAL AGREEMENT 
THROUGH THE PERIOD ALTHOUGH THE ECMWF IS A LITTLE MORE ROBUST WITH 
THE DEEP UPPER TROUGH/CLOSED LOW DROPPING SOUTHEAST DROPPING 
SOUTHEAST OUT OF THE GREAT LAKES FRIDAY WITH EXIT OFF THE MIDDLE 
ATLANTIC COAST BY MID DAY SATURDAY. TOOK A MIDDLE OF THE ROAD 
APPROACH WITH THIS SYSTEM WHICH IS STILL DEPICTED TO BE SOMEWHAT 
MOISTURE STARVED SO KEPT THE SLIGHT CHANCE (LOW CHANCE POP SW VA 
MOUNTAINS) POPS GOING WITH LATE FRIDAY AFTERNOON ARRIVAL WITH BEST 
SHOT AT PRECIP EARLY FRIDAY EVENING. COLD ADVECTION STRENGTHENS 
FRIDAY EVENING WITH 85H TEMPS DROPPING BELOW FREEZING MID TO LATE 
EVENING SO ADDED A COUPLE SNOW SHOWERS TO THE MIX IN HIGHER TERRAIN 
AREAS. WENT WITH THE SAME FORECAST IDEA OF WRAPPING UP THE PRECIP 
PRIOR TO 12Z SATURDAY ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN PART OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. COOL NORTHWEST FLOW DOMINATES SATURDAY BEHIND THE DEPARTING 
TROUGH. A PLEASANT UPPER RIDGE APPROACHES ON SUNDAY WITH AXIS 
BUILDING ACROSS THE APPALACHIAN CHAIN BY MONDAY AFTERNOON. MODELS DO 
NOT SIGNIFICANTLY MOISTEN THE ATMOSPHERE AHEAD OF THE NEXT SYSTEM 
UNTIL TUESDAY SO WAS ABLE TO MAINTAIN A DRY FORECAST THROUGH THE END 
OF THE PERIOD. FOR TEMPERATURES USED NUMBERS IN THE MIDDLE OF THE 
COLDER ECM AND MILDER MEX.

IF ANY MOISTURE TO SUPPORT MORE THAN MINIMAL POPS FOR THE NE AREAS.

THE EAST COAST STATES BY MONDAY. THIS GENERALLY KEEPS OUR WEATHER 
DRY WITH TEMPS NEAR OR JUST BELOW SEASONAL NORMALS. THE COLDEST 
NIGHT LOOKS TO BE SATURDAY NIGHT WHEN MINS MAY BOTTOM OUT BELOW 32 
DEGREES IN NE AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EDT MON OCT 27 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...

OF THE AREA. A SW FLOW FROM THE SURFACE TO THE MIDLEVELS WILL 
PRODUCE SOME WEAK WARM ADVECTION...WHICH WILL CONTINUE THE WARMING 
TREND AND ALLOW HIGH TEMPS TO RISE INTO THE LOWER TO MID 80S IN 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY LOCATIONS...WITH UPPER 70S NORTH. THESE

THE UPPER 40S TO UPPER 50S.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
A FAIRLY QUIET EXTENDED TIME- FRAME. AN UPPER TROUGH MOVING ACROSS
THE GREAT LAKES WILL PULL A WEAK COLD FRONT ACROSS THE AREA TUESDAY
NIGHT/WEDNESDAY MORNING. CONTINUED RIDGING INTO THE GULF COAST
STATES AHEAD OF THIS BOUNDARY WILL LIMIT MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY
RETURN INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS..SO WILL
KEEP THUNDER OUT OF THE FORECAST. ALSO...UPPER DYNAMICS WILL WEAKEN
AS THE BOUNDARY APPROACHES THE AREA...SO WILL KEEP RAIN CHANCES
CONFINED WITH HIGH CHANCE/LIKELY.

RIDGING BUILDS INTO THE AREA FOR LATE WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY 
PRODUCING MAINLY DRY CONDITIONS.  

ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES INTO THE 
NORTHEAST UNITED STATES FOR FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. A STRONGER COLD 
FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA...BUT AGAIN GULF MOISTURE IS CLOSED OFF 
WITH LIMITED MOISTURE. NORTHWEST FLOW BEHIND FRONTAL PASSAGE WILL 
PRODUCE SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS FOR LATE FRIDAY AND FRIDAY EVENING 
OVER THE NORTHEAST MOUNTAINS. VERTICAL TEMPERATURE PROFILE COOLS OFF 
ENOUGH THAT SOME LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS/FLURRIES POSSIBLE OVER THE 
HIGHEST ELEVATIONS.

RIDGING BUILDS BACK INTO THE AREA FOR THE WEEKEND.

MONITOR THIS POTENTIAL OVERNIGHT FOR THE NEED FOR AN SPS IN THOSE

DISCREPANCIES WITH MAXES WHERE A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO SEEMS 
BEST.

FRONT ARE EXPECTED TO SLOWLY WEAKEN AND MOVE EAST OF THE AREA
THROUGH THE DAY ON WEDNESDAY. CLOUDS WILL SLOWLY CLEAR THROUGH THE
DAY...WITH HIGH PRESSURE MOVING IN TO THE AREA ONCE AGAIN FOR THE
END OF THE WORK WEEK. TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE END OF THE WORK WEEK
WILL BE JUST A FEW DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL
MOVE IN FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY...WITH BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES
AND VERY DRY AIR ADVECTED INTO THE AREA FOR THE BEGINNING OF NEXT
WEEKEND.

TO LOWER 50S.

GENETIC FORCING TO PRODUCE SCATTERED- BROKEN SHOWERS FOR MAINLY
TUESDAY NIGHT. INSTABILITY LIMITED AT BEST...SO WILL LEAVE THUNDER
OUT OF THE FORECAST.

WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...BUT ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE 
ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES/OHIO VALLEY FOR FRIDAY. THE GFS AND ECMWF 
AGREE WITH BRINGING IN A STRONGER COLD FRONT THROUGH FOR FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON/EVENING. INCREASING LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE FOR LATE FRIDAY 
THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING. WILL INCLUDE OROGRAPHIC SHOWERS. 
TEMPERATURE PROFILE BECOMES COLD ENOUGH FOR LIGHT SNOW 
SHOWERS/FLURRIES FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS FRIDAY NIGHT.

RIDGING BUILDS INTO THE AREA FOR THE NEXT WEEKEND. GENERALLY WENT 
CLOSE TO GFS GUIDANCE...EXCEPT FOR FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. WENT A 
COOLER THAN GUIDANCE FOR LATE WEEK.

260 
FXUS64 KMRX 260212
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1012 PM EDT SAT OCT 25 2014

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST GENERALLY ON TRACK WITH A WEAK COLD FRONT
APPROACHING THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY. THERE ARE A FEW CLOUDS ACROSS
THE EASTERN "HALF OF THE GREAT VALLEY" BANKED AGAINST THE
MOUNTAINS. THESE CLOUDS AND A SMALL GRADIENT IN SURFACE PRESSURE
HAVE SLOWED THE FALL IN TEMPERATURES THIS EVENING. THE CLOUDS
APPEAR TO BE GRADUALLY DISSIPATING OVER THE EASTERN VALLEY AND
EXPECT THEM TO BE LARGELY GONE BY AROUND 07-08Z. SURFACE WIND
SHOULD ALSO BECOME LIGHT AND VARIABLE OR CALM MOST AREAS LATER
TONIGHT. WITH DEWPOINT TEMPERATURES HOLDING STEADY OR RISING A BIT
AHEAD OF THE FRONT AND DECREASING SURFACE FLOW...SUPPOSE THERE
COULD BE SOME PATCHES OF FOG THAT BECOME DENSE FOR A COUPLE HOURS
AROUND SUNRISE. WILL STAY THE COURSE WITH CURRENT FORECAST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT SAT OCT 25 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE
ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE OVER MOST OF THE SOUTHEAST AND
CENTERED OVER THE NORTHWESTERN GULF COAST...WITH A WEAK COLD FRONT
OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY
APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...BUT WILL THEN BECOME
QUASI-STATIONARY AROUND NORTHEAST TN OVERNIGHT AS THE UPPER-LEVEL
FLOW BECOMES MORE ZONAL. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY SHOULD BRING JUST AN
INCREASE IN CLOUDS TONIGHT AND SUNDAY DUE TO LIMITED MOISTURE AND
STABLE MID LEVELS... WITH THIS BOUNDARY THEN MOVING NORTHWARD AS A
WARM FRONT BY SUNDAY NIGHT AS SOUTHERLY WINDS DEVELOP OVER THE TN
RIVER VALLEY. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN
GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY WARM
PATTERN EXPECTED. THERE ARE SOME DISCREPANCIES BETWEEN THE TWO SETS
OF GUIDANCE WITH MAXES ON MONDAY...AND WILL GENERALLY COMPROMISE
BETWEEN THE TWO.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...WARM AND DRY CONDITIONS WILL 
CONTINUE THROUGH TUESDAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL.  PATTERN 
CHANGE EXPECTED TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AS A COLD FRONT MOVES 
INTO THE AREA.  A LINE OF CONVECTION WILL DEVELOP AND MOVE THROUGH 
DURING THIS TIME FRAME FOR SCATTERED PRECIP.  ZONAL FLOW ALOFT AND 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE DOMINATES THURSDAY AND FRIDAY FOR A RETURN TO 
DRY CONDITIONS.  MODEL CONSISTENT POOR BY THE END OF THE PERIOD BUT 
TRENDS SHOW AN UPPER TROUGH MOVING IN FOR A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
OVER NORTHERN AREAS BY SATURDAY.

245 AM EDT SAT OCT 25 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
AFTER A SUNNY START TO THE DAY...CLOUDS ARE EXPECTED TO INCREASE
THIS AFTERNOON AS AN AREA OF HIGHER 850 MB THETA-E ADVECTS INTO THE
AREA FROM THE NW. CLOUDS SHOULD ARRIVE LATE ENOUGH IN THE DAY THAT
THE WARMING TREND OF THE PAST FEW DAYS WILL CONTINUE...REACHING THE
LOWER/MID 70S SOUTH AND CENTRAL TO MID/UPPER 60S NORTH. DEWPOINTS
WILL RISE THROUGH THE DAY WITH A SURFACE WARM FRONTAL
FEATURE...PEAKING IN THE EVENING BEFORE A WEAK COLD FRONT/DRY
BOUNDARY MOVES THROUGH TONIGHT. THE NAM WANTS TO PRODUCE SOME
PRECIP IN THE MOUNTAINS TONIGHT WITH THE UPSLOPE FLOW...BUT THIS
SEEMS OVERDONE WITH THE THIN MOIST LAYER AND LACK OF LIFT. TONIGHT
WILL BE MILDER WITH THE HIGHER DEWPOINTS AND MIXING FROM LIGHT
WINDS...MAINLY MID 40S TO LOWER 50S.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...
WARM WEATHER STILL ON TAP FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK WITH SOME 80S
POSSIBLE SUNDAY AND ESPECIALLY MONDAY IN THE SOUTHERN TN VALLEY.
RIDGE PATTERN WILL SHIFT EASTWARD... ALLOWING SHORTWAVE TO SPREAD
PRECIP OVER THE AREA DURING MIDWEEK. GFS AND ECMWF A BIT BETTER IN
LINE...SO BUMPED UP THE POPS TO INCLUDE SOME 40 AND 50 PERCENTS
WITH FROPA TUES NIGHT AND WED. TOSSED IN A BRIEF PERIOD OF
WRAPAROUND POPS UP IN THE NE PORTION OF THE FORECAST AREA FOR FRI.
BOTH MODELS HAVE COME INTO LINE WITH A COOL DOWN/REINFORCING FROPA
ON FRIDAY FOR A COOL BUT MOSTLY DRY TRICK OR TREATING
EVENING...WITH 5-10 MPH WINDS TOO.

918 PM EDT FRI OCT 24 2014

.DISCUSSION...

SHORTWAVE THAT PASSED THROUGH THE AREA EARLIER THIS AFTERNOON. IN
ITS WAKE...CLEAR CONDITIONS ARE PREVAILING WHICH HAS ALLOWED
TEMPERATURES TO DROP OFF QUICKLY INTO THE UPPER 40S TO MID 50S
GENERALLY AS OF 9 PM EDT. WITH DEWPOINTS STILL HOLDING IN THE LOW
TO MID 40S...AM NOT EXPECTING LOWS CRATER TOO MUCH TONIGHT...BUT
READINGS IN THE MID TO UPPER 30S ARE EXPECTED ALONG THE TN/NC
MOUNTAINS AND IN SOUTHWEST VA/NORTHEAST TN. ELSEWHERE...LOWS IN
THE LOWER 40S ARE LIKELY ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEYS.
THIS BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE WILL ALSO RESULT IN PATCHY FOG
DEVELOPMENT LATE TONIGHT ONCE AGAIN...AS WELL AS SOME PATCHY FROST
IN SHELTERED VALLEYS WHERE LOWS DROP INTO THE MID 30S.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE

CONDITIONS. A WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE FORECAST

RESULTING IN JUST A SLIGHT INCREASE IN CLOUDS. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS 
AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH MINS THROUGH 
SUNDAY NIGHT...BUT REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH MAXES. WILL 
GENERALLY COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO WHERE DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO WARM TO WELL ABOVE SEASONAL NORMS WITH 
HIGHS REACHING INTO THE UPPER 70S AND LOW 80S ACROSS THE VALLEY. THE
RIDGE WILL STAY OVER THE REGION INTO TUESDAY FOR CONTINUED WARM AND
DRY CONDITIONS. MAIN CONCERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED WILL BE A COLD
FRONT EXPECTED TO BEGIN AFFECTING THE AREA LATE TUESDAY NIGHT. THE
MAIN BAND OF CONVECTION SHOULD PUSH THROUGH AROUND THE WEDNESDAY
WEDNESDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME. SCATTERED SHOWERS MAY LINGER THROUGH
THURSDAY AS THE TROUGH AXIS SWINGS THROUGH. TIMING IS IN QUESTION
BUT CURRENT MODELS PULL THE SYSTEM AWAY FROM THE AREA FOR A DRY
FRIDAY.

AND MONDAY ESPECIALLY IN THE SOUTHERN TN VALLEY. RIDGE PATTERN WILL
SHIFT EASTWARD...ALLOWING SHORTWAVE TO SPREAD PRECIP OVER THE AREA
DURING MIDWEEK. BUT THIS COULD BE A WAIT-AND-SEE KIND OF PATTERN
CHANGE GIVEN THE ADVERTISED STRENGTH OF THE EARLY WEEK RIDGING...IT
MAY PERSIST A LITTLE LONGER AND HOLD OFF THE PRECIP CHANCES
LIKEWISE. SO...WHILE CHANCE-CATEGORY POPS WILL FILL THE FORECAST
FROM TUESDAY NIGHT UNTIL THURSDAY... EXPECT SOME REFINEMENT OF THAT
FORECAST OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS.

SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

DOMINATE AREA WEATHER THROUGH THE EARLY PART OF THE EXTENDED. SUNDAY 
THROUGH TUESDAY SHOULD BE SEASONALLY WARM AND DRY. A PATTERN CHANGE 
IS EXPECTED TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AS A COLD FRONT APPROACHES

IS EXPECTED TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AS A COLD FRONT APPROACHES
THE REGION. SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL INCREASE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND
WEAK LIFT AND INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING FRONT WILL
PROVIDE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 231350
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
950 AM EDT THU OCT 23 2014

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OFF THE
NORTHEAST COAST...WITH HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE GREAT LAKES
REGION EXTENDING SOUTHWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. SATELLITE
IMAGERY REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDS OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND
NORTHEAST TN THIS MORNING...WHICH WERE TRAPPED UNDER A STRONG MID
LEVEL INVERSION. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT THIS INVERSION WILL
LINGER THROUGH THE AFTERNOON HOURS...BUT DRIER AIR IS EXPECTED TO
GRADUALLY ADVECT INTO THE REGION. THUS...EXPECT THESE CLOUDS TO
SLOWLY ERODE THIS AFTERNOON...BUT WILL BE MORE PESSIMISTIC WITH
CLOUD COVER WORDING IN THE FORECAST.

OVERALL...HAVE ALREADY UPDATED THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO REMOVE
THE FROST ADVISORY AND TO MENTION DECREASING CLOUDINESS OVER
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. 
&&

707 
FXUS64 KMRX 230703
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
303 AM EDT THU OCT 23 2014

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
EARLY THIS MORNING...DENSE LOW STRATUS CLOUDS FROM THE LOW PRESSURE
SYSTEM THAT SKIRTED THE REGION YESTERDAY CONTINUES TO LINGER
BENEATH THE TEMPERATURE INVERSION. THIS HAS RESULTED IN CONTINUED
MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST
TENNESSEE. THIS CLOUD SHIELD HAS ACTUALLY EXPANDED INTO THE
NORTHERN PLATEAU AND PORTIONS OF THE CENTRAL VALLEY THIS MORNING.
AS A RESULT...TEMPERATURES HAVE REMAINED IN THE LOW TO MID 40S IN
THOSE AREAS...COMPLETELY DIMINISHING THE FROST THREAT. THUS...HAVE
CANCELLED THE FROST ADVISORY IN ALL BUT THE SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND
SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA COUNTIES WHERE CLEAR CONDITIONS HAVE
ALLOWED TEMPERATURES TO PLUNGE INTO THE MID TO UPPER 30S.

A 925 MB RH ANALYSIS INDICATES THESE LOW CLOUDS MAY LINGER THROUGH
MID TO LATE MORNING...BEFORE QUICKLY BREAKING UP BY MIDDAY INTO
EARLY AFTERNOON AS HEATING REALLY KICKS IN. WITH AN UPPER-RIDGE
AXIS MOVING IN AND AMPLE SUNSHINE EXPECTED...HIGHS IN THE 60S IN
MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS ARE ANTICIPATED...MAKING FOR A BEAUTIFUL
AUTUMN AFTERNOON. MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL LATER
TONIGHT...BUT HIGHER THICKNESS VALUES WILL ALLOW FOR LOWS IN THE
UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S...MAKING ANY FROST THREAT LOCALIZED ACROSS
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. THUS...WILL HOLD
OF ON AN ADVISORY FOR NOW AND WILL LET THE DAY SHIFT TAKE ANOTHER
LOOK AT IT.

.LONG TERM /FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
SOME DEGREE OF UPPER RIDGING GENERALLY THROUGH LATE TUESDAY...THEN
SOME TROUGHING TO OUR WEST WHICH LEADS TO A COLD FRONT APPROACHING
BY TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. SURFACE RIDGING DURING THE EARLY
PERIODS WILL GRADUALLY SHIFT EAST AND ALLOW SOME SOUTHERLY LOW
LEVEL FLOW TO DEVELOP BY TUESDAY...WHICH WOULD SUPPORT RAIN CHANCES
AS IN PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS. GFSX AND ECMX MOS POPS TRENDING
UPWARD FOR DAY 7 (WEDNESDAY) SO I NUDGED POPS UP AMD INTRODUCED LOW
CHANCE POPS FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WHICH KEEPS OUR GRIDS IN LINE
WITH NEIGHBORING NWS OFFICES.

THE SLIGHT FLUCTUATIONS IN GFSX MOS TEMPS FROM 12Z TO 00Z RUNS ARE 
KINDA PUZZLING. HOWEVER...I DID MAKE SLIGHT CHANGES FOR THE WEEKEND 
MAX TEMPS GIVEN THE DRY AIRMASS AND RIDGING. JUST MINOR TWEAKS 
OVERALL AS THE MONTH OF OCTOBER CLOSES OUT IN THE MORE TYPICAL DRY 
FASHION. ENJOY THE STRETCH OF GREAT FALL WEATHER DAYS...AND LESS 
CHILLY NIGHTS AS MIN TEMPS MODERATE.   


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             68  43  71  45 /   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  66  41  67  43 /   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       66  41  67  43 /   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              61  35  66  37 /   0   0   0   0

679 
FXUS64 KMRX 221835
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EDT WED OCT 22 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OFF THE MID ATLANTIC COAST... 
WITH HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION EXTENDING 
SOUTHWARD OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS AN 
EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDS OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN THIS 
AFTERNOON...ASSOCIATED WITH A DEEP UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE 
NORTHEAST. THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL SLOWLY DRIFT NORTHEASTWARD 
TONIGHT...BUT THE MODELS SUGGEST THAT THESE CLOUDS OVER SOUTHWEST
VA AND NORTHEAST TN MAY LINGER UNTIL SUNRISE THURSDAY MORNING. AS
A RESULT...THERE MAY NOT BE MUCH FROST FORMATION OVER THESE AREAS
TOWARDS SUNRISE...ALTHOUGH IT APPEARS THAT THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND
PLATEAU...SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC SHOULD HAVE CLEARING SKIES
AND GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS OVERNIGHT. FOR NOW...WILL
LET THE FROST ADVISORY CONTINUE FOR SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN
SINCE THERE STILL THE POSSIBILITY OF ENOUGH CLEARING TOWARDS
SUNRISE FOR SOME PATCHY FROST DEVELOPMENT. OTHERWISE...HIGH
PRESSURE LINGERS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...
WITH A WARMING TREND DEVELOPING ON FRIDAY AS TEMPS RISE BACK TO
ABOVE NORMAL LEVELS. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS
ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...AND WILL COMPROMISE
WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...COOL NORTHWEST FLOW WILL 
BE IN PLACE TO START OUT THE LONG TERM PERIOD. HOWEVER...THE WEEKEND 
WILL BE A DRY PERIOD ALBEIT WITH A FEW CLOUDS IN THE WAKE OF THE 
WEAK SHORT WAVE THAT MOVES THROUGH ON FRIDAY. THE DRY WEATHER MAY 
LAST ALL THE WAY THROUGH TUESDAY AS ANOTHER UPPER RIDGE BUILDS OVER 
THE EASTERN STATES SUNDAY INTO TUESDAY. MODELS FLATTEN OUT THE RIDGE 
BY MID WEEK WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF A WEAK FRONTAL PASSAGE ON 
WEDNESDAY. WITH THIS IN MIND...ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS
WITH SOME MOISTURE AND FRONTAL LIFT INDICATED IN THE PROGS. IN
TERMS OF THE TEMPERATURE FORECAST...STAYED BETWEEN THE COOLER ECM
AND MILDER MEX MOS NUMBERS. 
&&

OTHERWISE...A MOSTLY CLEAR SKY WILL BE PRESENT AREAWIDE BY THE
AFTERNOON ALONG WITH A NORTHERLY WIND. SOME LIGHT MVFR FOG COULD
RETURN TO KTRI LATE TONIGHT AS WELL....BUT OTHERWISE MOSTLY CLEAR
AND DRY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED.

893 
FXUS64 KMRX 220723 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
323 AM EDT WED OCT 22 2014

.UPDATE...
CORRECTED SENTENCE IN THE SECOND PARAGRAPH IN THE SHORT TERM
PORTION TO READ 08Z TO 13Z THURSDAY.

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
A CLOSED UPPER-LOW CONTINUES TO SCOOT TO THE SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE
CENTRAL APPALACHIANS EARLY THIS MORNING. THIS HAS PUSHED SOME BKN
TO OVC DECKS OF LOW STRATUS INTO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND FAR
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. THIS CLOUD COVER HAS DONE LITTLE TO KEEP
TEMPERATURES FROM FALLING HOWEVER AS NORTHERLY WINDS CONTINUED TO
BRING COOLER AIR INTO THE REGION...WITH READINGS IN THE LOW TO MID
40S NOTED THERE AS OF 3 AM EDT. THIS NORTHERLY FLOW WILL PERSIST
THROUGHOUT THE DAY...REINFORCING THIS COOLER AIR MASS. THUS DESPITE
THE AMPLE SUNSHINE...HIGHS IN THE UPPER 50S TO MID 60S ARE EXPECTED
ONCE AGAIN. THE AFOREMENTIONED CLOUDS WILL LINGER THROUGH THE
MORNING ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...BEFORE BEGINNING TO DIMINISH BY
THE AFTERNOON AS THE LOW DROPS INTO NORTH CAROLINA.

BY THE EVENING...MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS WILL BE PREVAILING IN MOST
LOCATIONS WHICH WILL ALLOW FOR GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING. THE
TIGHTER PRESSURE GRADIENT NOTED OVER THE AREA EARLIER IN THE DAY
WILL ALSO RELAX...WHICH WILL ALLOW WINDS TO WEAKEN AND EVEN
COMPLETELY DECOUPLE IN SOME SHELTERED VALLEYS. AS A RESULT...LOWS
WILL BE EVEN COOLER TONIGHT AND DROP INTO THE MID 30S ACROSS THE
NORTHERN PLATEAU...SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA...SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...
AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. THIS SHOULD ALLOW PATCHY FROST TO DEVELOP
/ESPECIALLY IN SHELTERED VALLEYS/ LATE TONIGHT. THUS...DECIDED TO
ISSUE A FROST ADVISORY FOR THOSE AREAS /AND THE EAST TN MTNS/ FROM
08Z TO 13Z THURSDAY. ADDITIONALLY...SOME PATCHY FOG MAY ALSO
DEVELOP LATE TONIGHT ALONG AREA RIVERS AND LAKES...SO HAVE
MAINTAINED THAT IN THE FORECAST AS WELL.

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY/...
REALLY A PROLONGED STRETCH OF SOME AWESOME FALL WEATHER DAYS AND
NIGHTS. ONLY ITEM OF ANY CONCERN IS THE EXCELLENT RADIATIONAL
COOLING THAT SETS UP AGAIN ON THURSDAY NIGHT. AIRMASS TRENDING VERY
DRY BY THEN WITH PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES GENERALLY DOWN TO 1/4
INCH OR LESS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. GROWING SEASON SHOULD BE
WINDING DOWN...BUT I FELT IT WAS PRUDENT TO MENTION AREAS OF FROST
(OUTSIDE OF NRN AND SMOKY MTNS WHERE A FREEZE OCCURRED ON 10/20).
THIS WILL ALSO BE NOTED IN OUR HAZARDOUS WEATHER PRODUCT (HWO).

OTHERWISE...REALLY NO RETURN OF ANY SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW UNTIL 
LATE MONDAY. NAM MOS WAS AT ODDS WITH GFS MOS FOR THURSDAY THRU 
FRIDAY MAX/MIN TEMPS. WENT CLOSER TO GFS MOS FOR NOW...SINCE COOLER 
MINS AND WARMER MAXES MAKE MORE SENSE GIVEN THE PATTERN.  

FINAL NOTE...12Z AND OOZ GFSX MOS GUIDANCE TRENDING AWAY FROM 
PREVIOUS MAX/MIN GRIDS FROM THE WEEKEND INTO TUESDAY. MADE A FEW 
ADJUSTMENTS TO ALSO BRING US MORE IN LINE WITH NEIGHBORING NWS 
GRIDS. 



&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             65  40  69  42 /   0   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  61  38  65  40 /  10   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       61  38  66  40 /  10   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              54  35  61  34 /  10   0   0   0 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...FROST ADVISORY FROM 4 AM TO 9 AM EDT THURSDAY FOR CHEROKEE-CLAY.

TN...FROST ADVISORY FROM 4 AM TO 9 AM EDT THURSDAY FOR BLOUNT SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS-CAMPBELL-CLAIBORNE-EAST POLK-HANCOCK-HAWKINS-
     MORGAN-NORTHWEST CARTER-NORTHWEST GREENE-SCOTT TN-SEVIER 
     SMOKY MOUNTAINS-SOUTHEAST MONROE-SULLIVAN-WASHINGTON TN.

VA...FROST ADVISORY FROM 4 AM TO 9 AM EDT THURSDAY FOR LEE-RUSSELL-
     SCOTT-WASHINGTON-WISE.

/ESPECIALLY IN SHELTERED VALLEYS/ LATE TONIGHT. THUS...DECIDED TO
ISSUE A FROST ADVISORY FOR THOSE AREAS /AND THE EAST TN MTNS/ FROM
08Z TO 13Z WEDNESDAY. ADDITIONALLY...SOME PATCHY FOG MAY ALSO
DEVELOP LATE TONIGHT ALONG AREA RIVERS AND LAKES...SO HAVE
MAINTAINED THAT IN THE FORECAST AS WELL.

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY/...
REALLY A PROLONGED STRETCH OF SOME AWESOME FALL WEATHER DAYS AND
NIGHTS. ONLY ITEM OF ANY CONCERN IS THE EXCELLENT RADIATIONAL
COOLING THAT SETS UP AGAIN ON THURSDAY NIGHT. AIRMASS TRENDING VERY
DRY BY THEN WITH PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES GENERALLY DOWN TO 1/4
INCH OR LESS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. GROWING SEASON SHOULD BE
WINDING DOWN...BUT I FELT IT WAS PRUDENT TO MENTION AREAS OF FROST
(OUTSIDE OF NRN AND SMOKY MTNS WHERE A FREEZE OCCURRED ON 10/20).
THIS WILL ALSO BE NOTED IN OUR HAZARDOUS WEATHER PRODUCT (HWO).

OTHERWISE...REALLY NO RETURN OF ANY SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW UNTIL 
LATE MONDAY. NAM MOS WAS AT ODDS WITH GFS MOS FOR THURSDAY THRU 
FRIDAY MAX/MIN TEMPS. WENT CLOSER TO GFS MOS FOR NOW...SINCE COOLER 
MINS AND WARMER MAXES MAKE MORE SENSE GIVEN THE PATTERN.  

FINAL NOTE...12Z AND OOZ GFSX MOS GUIDANCE TRENDING AWAY FROM 
PREVIOUS MAX/MIN GRIDS FROM THE WEEKEND INTO TUESDAY. MADE A FEW 
ADJUSTMENTS TO ALSO BRING US MORE IN LINE WITH NEIGHBORING NWS 
GRIDS. 

&&
