DISAGREEMENT ON HOW SIGNIFICANT THIS WILL BE. HOWEVER...IT DOES
APPEAR THAT MOISTURE WILL BE LACKING...SO WILL JUST HAVE SOME

SPRINKLES TO MUCH OF THE REST OF NE TN AND SMOKIES. 

THE LINGERING CLOUDS AND SOME COLD AIR ADVECTION LENDED MORE
SUPPORT TO THE COOLER MOS MAX TEMPS TODAY...BUT A BLEND FOR MOS
MINS TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM.../WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY/...AN UPPER-LOW OVER THE
MID-ATLANTIC WILL CONTINUE TO PROMOTE A COOL...NORTHWEST FLOW
ACROSS THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY...REINFORCING THE COOL AIR MASS AND
KEEPING HIGHS IN THE UPPER 50S TO MID 60S AREAWIDE. SOME DENSER
CLOUD COVER MAY ALSO BE PRESENT ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE INITIALLY...BUT WILL GRADUALLY GIVE WAY TO
MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS DRIER AIR FILTERS
INTO THE REGION. A BRIEF BOUT OF RIDGING ON THURSDAY WILL ALLOW FOR
A QUICK WARM-UP BEFORE ANOTHER DRY UPPER- TROUGH BRINGS DOWN
ANOTHER MINOR SHOT OF COOLER AIR ON FRIDAY. THEREAFTER...A MORE
PRONOUNCED UPPER-RIDGE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA THIS WEEKEND INTO
EARLY NEXT WEEK...ALLOWING FOR AMPLE SUNSHINE AND DRY CONDITIONS
THROUGH THE REMAINDER PERIOD. THIS WILL RESULT IN HIGHS REACHING
THE 70S ACROSS THE VALLEYS EACH DAY SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY.

TO BE A LITTLE BIT COOLER TUESDAY THAN TODAY. A BETTER COOL DOWN IS
EXPECTED WEDNESDAY...SEE BELOW.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT
AGREEMENT OVERALL AND SHOW A RATHER BENIGN WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE
LONG TERM PERIOD. FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS A BIT ABOVE AVERAGE FOR
THIS TIME OF YEAR. UPPER LOW TO OUR NORTHEAST EARLY IN THE PERIOD
WITH COLD ADVECTION OVER OUR AREA. SOME SHALLOW MOISTURE EXPECTED
TO LINGER ESPECIALLY NORTH...BUT DOES NOT LOOK DEEP ENOUGH FOR ANY
SIGNIFICANT PRECIP. WILL KEEP MORE CLOUDS NORTHEAST THAN SOUTHWEST
EARLY. MODELS SHOW A FAST MOVING UPPER LOW/TROUGH SWINGING ACROSS
THE AREA AROUND THE SATURDAY TIME FRAME. THIS LOOKS TO BE MOISTURE
STARVED SO NO PRECIP IN THE FORECAST WITH THIS SYSTEM. RIDGING
BUILDS ACROSS THE AREA AND OFF TO OUR EAST LATE. SHOULD BE DRY AND
A BIT WARMER. WILL GENERALLY NOT STRAY FAR FROM GFS MOS TEMPS.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THICKENING HIGH CLOUDS PASSING

AND NE TN. TIMING WAS TWEAKED A BIT IN LINE WITH THE 00Z NAM AND 
LATEST SREF...AS 00Z GFS MODEL AND MOS WERE DELAYED (ARRIVED JUST IN 
TIME FOR THE AFD).

TONIGHT...AND WERE CLOSELY FOLLOWED. 

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...NOT MUCH CHANGE IN CURRENT
FORECAST AS CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH SYSTEM OVER THE NE STATES
AFFECTS MAINLY SW VA AND NE TN TUESDAY AND THEN BEGINS TO MOVE AWAY
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. GFS MUCH DRIER WITH SYSTEM AS IT MOVES
SOUTHEAST INTO THE EASTERN LAKES...MID ATLANTIC AND NORTHEAST
TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY WITH ALMOST NO CHANCE OF SHOWERS JUST
CLOUDS. STILL PREFERRING THE NAM WHICH BRINGS IN A LITTLE MORE
MOISTURE FOR SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE SHOWERS TUESDAY INTO
WEDNESDAY. COLD FRONT TO MOVE THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING WITH MUCH
COLDER TEMPERATURES DUE TO CLOUDS OVER SW VA BUT COLDER AIR MASS
WITH NW FLOW TO LAG BEHIND SOUTHERN SECTIONS WHERE NO WEATHER IS
EXPECTED EXCEPT A WIND SHIFT. HIGHS TUESDAY ABOUT THE SAME SOUTHERN
HALF AND A FEW DEGREES COOLER AT TRI CITIES. COOLER DAYS WEDNESDAY
AND THURSDAY WITH NORTHERLY FLOW AND UPPER TROUGH OVER EASTERN
STATES. THEN AS THE EASTERN SYSTEM AND ASSOCIATED UPPER LOW FINALLY
MOVES EAST UPPER FLOW TURNS WESTERLY. GFS SHOWS A WEAK SYSTEM
APPROACH FRIDAY AND THEN RIDGING TAKES OVER AND BUILDS OVER THE
SOUTH CENTRAL STATES FOR THE WEEKEND. TEMPERATURES WILL WARM A FEW
DEGREES SATURDAY AND SUNDAY WITH NO RAIN EXPECTED.

COAST TROUGHING WHOSE WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE WILL DOG THE
NORTHEASTERN HALF-TO-QUARTER OF THE AREA WITH CLOUDS AND SCATTERED
LIGHT PRECIP MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY...WHICH WILL THEN MOVE
OFF TO THE EAST...LEAVING THAT REGION WITH DRY WEATHER WED NGT
THROUGH SUNDAY. IN CONTRAST...THE CHATTANOOGA VICINITY WILL LIKELY
BE DRY THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED...BEING TOO FAR AWAY FROM THE WRAP-
AROUND MOISTURE FIELD. FINALLY...FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST
AREA...UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL RETURN BY THE END OF THE WEEK AND
RESULT IN ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES AND A GREAT UPCOMING WEEKEND.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AXIS WAS

AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS. HOWEVER...MAY SEE MINS DIP AS LOW AS MID OR 
UPPER 30S IN A FEW SPOTS OF NE TN AND SW VA. THUS...I ADDED SOME 
PATCHY AREAS OF FROST.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER
THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE COUNTRY CONTINUES THROUGH MOST OF THE
WEEK. NW FLOW BRINGS SYSTEM SOUTHEAST INTO THE GREAT LAKES THEN
MOVES EAST ACROSS THE NE STATES. A REINFORCING SHOT OF COLDER AIR
WILL MOVE THROUGH WITH THIS SYSTEM AS IT DROPS A COLD FRONT THROUGH
THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY. SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS MONDAY NIGHT.
TUESDAY THE BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS WILL BE IN THE NE AS THE FRONT
PASSES THROUGH. THE SYSTEM WILL BE SLOW TO MOVE TO THE NE AS MODELS
TRY TO SHOW THE SYSTEM DEVELOPING A CLOSED LOW OVER THE MID
ATLANTIC AND NE STATES. AS MOISTURE ROTATES AROUND IT A FEW
SHOWERS WILL LINGER TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY IN THE NE SECTIONS.
THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY HIGHER PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM THE WEST
AS RIDGING REPLACES TROUGH THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 181846
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
246 PM EDT SAT OCT 18 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
CONTINUING TO BUILD ACROSS OUR AREA BUT ANOTHER RE-ENFORCING SHOT
OF COLD AIR WILL ARRIVE TONIGHT AS AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH SWINGS
THROUGH. ENOUGH MOISTURE AND LIFT LOOK TO TO BE PRESENT TO GENERATE
SOME LIGHT SHOWERS ACROSS NETN...SWVA...AND THE SMOKIES AS THIS
TROUGH MOVES THROUGH. SHOWERS WILL BE LIGHT THOUGH...WITH MOST
AREAS ONLY SEEING A FEW HUNDREDTHS OF AN INCH UP TO ONE TENTH OF
INCH. THIS SYSTEM WILL MOVE THROUGH RATHER QUICKLY WITH CLEARING
SKIES LATE TONIGHT. THIS WILL POSSIBLY ALLOW FOR SOME FOG OVERNIGHT
IN AREAS THAT DO RECEIVE RAIN...IF THE WINDS CAN SETTLE DOWN.
OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL BE QUITE A BIT COLDER COMPARED TO LAST
NIGHT...ROUGHLY 8 TO 10 DEGREES. 
 
HIGH PRESSURE FURTHER BUILDS INTO THE AREA TOMORROW WHICH SHOULD 
RESULT IN MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES AREA WIDE BY THE AFTERNOON HOURS. HIGH 
TEMPS WILL BE A FEW DEGREES COOLER...AGAIN...DUE TO THE COLD AIR
RE- ENFORCEMENT THAT WILL OCCUR TONIGHT. HIGHS WILL GENERALLY BE 5
TO 7 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. OVERALL...A NICE FALL DAY EXPECTED
TOMORROW.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...THERE IS ONLY SO 
MANY WAYS TO SAY IT...BUT REPETITIVE TROFFING ALOFT OVER THE EAST 
COAST WILL BE THE DRIVER OF THE WEATHER DURING THE EXTENDED PERIOD. 
THIS WILL RESULT IN CHANCES OF SHOWERS LATE MONDAY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY...MAINLY OVER THE NORTHEAST HALF TO THIRD OF THE AREA. 
EXPECTING THE BEST CHANCES TO OCCUR MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY OVER 
AND NEAR SW VA AND THE FAR NE TN MOUNTAINS. IN COMPARISON...THE 
CHATTANOOGA VICINITY IS EXPECTED TO STAY DRY THROUGH THE PERIOD... 
TOO FAR AWAY FROM THE MOISTURE BAND TO BE ASSOCIATED WITH THE 
TROUGH. AS THE UPPER TROUGH GRADUALLY MOVES INTO THE NORTH ATLANTIC 
LATE NEXT WEEK...RIDGING WILL BUILD IN OVER OUR REGION...WITH A 
CONSEQUENT WARM-UP EXPECTED FOR FRI-SAT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 AM EDT SAT OCT 18 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE STARTING TO 
BUILD INTO THE REGION NOW.  MAIN UPPER TROUGH IS STILL TO THE 
WEST...AND NORTHWEST FLOW LOOKS TO HAVE PRETTY SIGNIFICANT SPEEDMAX 
AND UPPER COLD POOL THAT WILL SWEEP ACROSS THE AREA TODAY...LATE 
AFTERNOON AND INTO THE EVENING.  THE COLD POOL INDUCES SURFACE-BASED 
INSTABILITY OF 50-100 J/KG OVER THE NORTHEASTERN SECTIONS.  THIS 
SETUP WILL MAKE THE POSSIBILITY OF LIGHT SHOWERS...BUT BETTER 
CHANCES WILL BE IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...WHERE UPSLOPE FLOW WILL 
ASSIST AS WELL. THIS SYSTEM SHOULD SPEED THROUGH THE AREA...SO MOST 
PRECIP WILL END BY 06Z...AND CERTAINLY BY 12Z.  WILL GO SLIGHTLY 
ABOVE GUIDANCE ON MAX TEMPS MAINLY BECAUSE OF HOW MILD THE TEMPS ARE 
ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA THIS MORNING...NEEDED TO GET THE MAX TEMPS 
TO HAVE MORE CUSHION ABOVE THESE CURRENT TEMPS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER TROUGH TO CONTINUE OVER 
EASTERN STATES SUNDAY WITH SURFACE HIGH BUILDING BACK IN BEHIND 
SHORTWAVE. SKIES WILL BE MOSTLY SUNNY. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL BE IN 
THE 60S. SUNDAY NIGHT SKIES STAY CLEAR WITH FROST POSSIBLE 
NORTHEAST. THE COLD TEMPERATURES DO NOT LAST AS CLOUDS INCREASE 
MONDAY AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT. TROUGHING TO PERSIST OVER 
THE NORTHEAST AND EASTERN PART OF THE COUNTRY FOR MUCH OF THE WEEK.
 
THE SYSTEM MONDAY SLOWS AND A WEAK UPPER LOW FORMS AND SPINS OVER 
THE NORTHEAST STATES THROUGH WEDNESDAY. INCREASED CHANCE OF RAIN 
LATE MONDAY NE TWO THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA. CONTINUED CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES NE HALF MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY. STACKED LOW FINALLY SHIFTS EAST WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THURSDAY AS SURFACE HIGH BUILDS SOUTH FROM THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO 
VALLEY. CONDITIONS IMPROVE NE WITH SKIES MOSTLY SUNNY TO PARTLY 
CLOUDY ENTIRE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. TEMPERATURES WARM 
AHEAD OF FRONT MONDAY THEN COOL SLIGHTLY TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. 
FRIDAY SLIGHTLY WARMER AGAIN AS NE TROUGH BEGINS TO SHIFT EAST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
242 PM EDT FRI OCT 17 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN
OVER THE AREA TODAY WITH CLEAR SKIES AND GUSTY WINDS. A COLD FRONT
WILL MOVE THROUGH OVERNIGHT AND EARLY TOMORROW MORNING. WINDS WILL
SHIFT TO OUT OF THE NORTHWEST...AND HIGH TEMPS WILL BE COOLER
TOMORROW BEHIND THIS FRONT. FOR SATURDAY...A SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE
THROUGH THE UPPER LEVEL LOW ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES. THIS COULD KICK
UP SOME RAIN SHOWERS MAINLY IN NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA IN THE AFTERNOON HOURS.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE TO THE
OVERALL PICTURE FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD. IT WILL FEATURE FAIRLY
PERSISTENT TROUGHING OVER THE EAST COAST...LOCATING US IN A NW FLOW
ALOFT FOR MOST OF THE PERIOD. THIS WILL RESULT IN NEAR NORMAL
TEMPERATURES AND FAIRLY DRY CONDITIONS...WITH SOME LOW POPS OVER
THE NORTHEASTERN THIRD OF THE AREA SATURDAY EVENING...AND AGAIN
TUES NGT AND WEDNESDAY. THE DIFFERENCE...HOWEVER...WILL BE A BIT
BETTER ORGANIZATION WITH A SYSTEM PASSAGE MONDAY NIGHT AND
TUESDAY...WHICH LOOKS TO PROVIDE CHANCES OF RAIN FOR THE WHOLE CWA.
SO...WILL CARRY 40-50 PCT POPS CENTRAL AND NORTH...20-30 PCT SOUTH
MON NGT/TUES. GFS MODEL CARRIES THE GREATEST QPF WITH THIS
SYSTEM...BUT SUGGESTS A HALF INCH OR LESS EVERYWHERE. CANADIAN
MODEL SUGGESTS LESS THAN A QUARTER OF AN INCH EVERYWHERE...ECMWF
LESS THAN A TENTH OF AN INCH. IN ALL...FAIRLY INSIGNIFICANT PRECIP
AMOUNTS EXPECTED.

FXUS64 KMRX 170748
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
348 AM EDT FRI OCT 17 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...STRATOCUMULUS CLOUDS HANGING IN 
OVER TRI-CITIES AREA.  MODELS SHOW SUBSIDENCE OVER THE AREA WITH 
DRIER AIR ABOVE...SO CLOUDS SHOULD EVENTUALLY ERODE FROM THE 
TOP...AS WELL AS SLOWLY ADVECT AWAY TO THE EAST.  SATELLITE SHOWING 
FOG STARTING TO FORM IN WESTERN AREAS...SUCH AS SEQUATCHIE 
VALLEY...A LITTLE SLOWER IN CENTRAL VALLEY...AND ALSO SOME HAS 
FORMED IN SOUTHWESTERN NC.   RADIATIONAL COOLING WILL CONTINUE 
ACROSS THE AREA...SO WILL INCLUDE PATCHY FOG FOR THIS MORNING.  DID 
NOT PUT FOG IN TONIGHT...POST FRONTAL WINDS SHOULD NOT ALLOW 
SIGNIFICANT RADIATIONAL SETUP.  HOWEVER...LOOKS LIKE MOIST UPSLOPE 
INTO THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL MOUNTAINS SHOULD GET CLOUDS TONIGHT. 
COULD GET SOME UPSLOPE FOG AS WELL...BUT WILL NOT MENTION FOG FOR 
TONIGHT AT THIS TIME.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...LOW PRESSURE TROUGH ALOFT 
PERSISTS OVER THE NE STATES THROUGH MUCH OF THE PERIOD. SATURDAY A 
WEAK SHORT WAVE MOVES THROUGH NW FLOW FROM THE GREAT LAKES INTO THE 
OHIO AND EASTERN TN VALLEYS. THIS WILL ALLOW ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
RAIN NE TN AND SW VA SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING BEFORE IT 
ROTATES EASTWARD. TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOLER AND USHER IN EVEN 
COLDER AIR MASS OVERNIGHT SATURDAY NIGHT BEHIND THE COLD FRONT WITH 
LOWS DROPPING INTO THE UPPER 30S NORTHEAST AND IN THE 
MOUNTAINS...WITH 40S ELSEWHERE. WEAK HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS BACK IN 
SUNDAY THROUGH MID MONDAY BEFORE ANOTHER WEAK SYSTEM DROPS SE TOWARD 
THE NE HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. ONCE AGAIN THERE WILL BE A CHANCE 
OF RAIN NE HALF LATE MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT WITH THE BEST CHANCE 
TUESDAY. RAIN CHANCES CONTINUE INTO WEDNESDAY AS THIS SYSTEM BECOMES 
QUITE WRAPPED UP AS IT MOVES SE TOWARDS THE MID ATLANTIC AND THEN 
FINALLY OFF THE EAST COAST THURSDAY NIGHT. THE SECOND SYSTEM WILL 
DROP TEMPERATURES AGAIN WEDNESDAY AS THERE WILL BE MORE CLOUDS AND A 
FEW SHOWERS.

CEILING STILL HOLDING ON AT KTRI...AND CEILING LOOKS LIKE IT TRYING
TO BUILD FARTHER TO THE WEST. HOWEVER...MORE AND MORE SUBSIDING DRY
AIR SHOULD BE WORKING INTO THE AREA ALOFT...AND SHOULD EVENTUALLY
ERODE THE REMAINING CLOUDS THAT DO NOT ADVECT OUT OF THE AREA.

AND FOG SHOULD BE FORMING. KCHA AND KTYS SHOULD GET SOME FOG AS
WELL. AFTER DAYBREAK...ONCE FOG STARTS TO MIX OUT...IT SHOULD DO SO
QUICKLY. SOUTHWEST WINDS SHOULD INCREASE DURING THE DAY AS THE FRONT
APPROACHES.

.DISCUSSION...

OVER THE NORTHERN GULF OF MEXICO...WHICH EXTENDS NORTHWARD OVER THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS A LARGE
CUT-OFF UPPER LOW CENTERED OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION...WHICH WAS
BRINGING AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDS OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE
FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING. THIS UPPER LOW WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE
NORTHEASTWARD TONIGHT...WITH CLOUDS CONTINUING TO DIMINISH FROM THE
SOUTHWEST. WITH THIS BEING THE FIRST NIGHT WITH CLEAR SKIES AFTER
A RAINY PERIOD...THINK THAT FOG WILL BE A GOOD BET OVER THE FORECAST
AREA AS THE WINDS CALM. THUS...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS
EVENING TO MENTION DECREASING CLOUDINESS AND AREAS OF FOG DEVELOPING
AFTER MIDNIGHT.

ALL THREE TAF SITES AFTER MIDNIGHT...ALTHOUGH FOG MAY BECOME MORE 
DENSE AT KCHA AND KTYS WHERE CLOUDS SHOULD DIMINISH FASTER THIS 
EVENING. OTHERWISE...BREEZY WINDS ARE EXPECTED ON FRIDAY AS THE COLD 
FRONT APPROACHES THE AREA.

SHOWERS OVER THE AREA THIS MORNING.  CONDITIONS WILL IMPROVE FROM

SPRINKLE MAY LINGER OVER FAR NORTHERN LOCATIONS THIS EVENING.  
OTHERWISE...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN TONIGHT WILL TRANSITION US TO 
A DRY WEATHER PATTERN WITH CLEARING SKIES AND COOL OVERNIGHT LOWS.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO BE IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT OVERALL...BUT THERE ARE SOME DIFFERENCES IN THE 
DETAILS AND RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY ISSUES.  FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS 
SLIGHTLY ABOUT AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.  THE LONG TERM PERIOD 
WILL BE DOMINATED BY UPPER LEVEL NORTHWEST FLOW...AND SOME UPPER 
LEVEL SHORT WAVES COMING DOWN WILL BRUSH THE AREA ESPECIALLY NORTH. 
A COUPLE OF WEAK COLD FRONTS WILL PUSH THROUGH DURING THE PERIOD AS 
WELL.  SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES...BUT LOOKS LIKE FIRST SHORT 
WAVE/WEAK COLD FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH IN THE SAT/SAT NIGHT TIME 
FRAME.  APPEARS MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED AND QUITE SHALLOW...SO FOR 
NOW WILL JUST BEEF CLOUDS UP BUT KEEP THINGS PRECIP FREE.  NEXT 
SHORT WAVE/WEAK COLD FRONT LOOKS TO BE AROUND MONDAY/MONDAY NIGHT.  
THIS SYSTEM LOOKS MOISTURE STARVED AS WELL...BUT WILL KEEP SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS IN MAINLY NORTH/CENTRAL FOR BOTH PERIODS.  WILL 
GENERALLY MAKE ONLY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO GFS MOS TEMPS.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...UPPER LOW MOVING EAST THROUGH 
OHIO VALLEY TONIGHT. TROUGHING EXTENDS THROUGH THE TN VALLEY. THE 
TROUGH WILL PIVOT THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TONIGHT. VERY 
COLD AIR TRAPPED IN UPPER CIRCULATION WITH H70 TEMPS NEAR -4C AND 
H50 TEMPS NEAR -16C. THE STEEP LAPSE RATES WILL AID IN SHOWER 
DEVELOPMENT AS THE TROUGH MOVES THROUGH OVERNIGHT. SMALL HAIL ALSO 
POSSIBLE WITH FREEZING LEVEL LOWERING TO BELOW 7000 FEET. PATTERN 
SUPPORTS LOW CHANCE OF COLD AIR FUNNEL CLOUD DEVELOPMENT. SOUTHWEST 
WINDS WILL SHIFT TO THE WNW ON THURSDAY AS SURFACE PRESSURE FALLS 
OCCUR NE OF THE AREA. STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL BECOME NEUTRAL 
BY LATE THURSDAY. SHOWER ACTIVITY WILL TAPER OFF SLOWLY TO THE NE 
DURING THE DAY THURSDAY. RAINFALL AMOUNTS WILL BE LIGHT.  
 

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY/... THE UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH THAT BROUGHT CLOUDS/RAIN TO AREA THIS WEEK WILL CONTINUE TO 
GRADUALLY EXIT THE REGION THURSDAY NIGHT...ALLOWING SOME DRIER AIR 
TO FILTER INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THIS WILL RESULT IN SOME 
CLEARING BY FRIDAY MORNING AS ZONAL FLOW PREVAILS ALOFT LATE THIS 
WEEK. THIS BOUT OF FAIR WEATHER AND SUNSHINE WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES 
TO CLIMB BACK INTO THE MID TO UPPER 70S ON FRIDAY ACROSS THE 
CENTRAL/SOUTHERN VALLEY. ANOTHER SHORTWAVE/DRY COLD FRONT WILL PUSH 
ANOTHER SHOT OF COOLER AIR INTO THE REGION FOR SATURDAY...DROPPING 
TEMPERATURES BACK INTO THE MID 60S TO AROUND 70 DEGREES FOR THE 
WEEKEND. YET ANOTHER TROUGH WILL DIVE SOUTHWARD FROM THE NORTHERN 
PLAINS ON MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT...BRINGING SOME ADDED CLOUD COVER 
AND SOME ISOLATED TO PERHAPS SCATTERED SHOWERS TO THE REGION. 
THEREAFTER...A BROAD RIDGE WILL BEGIN TO NOSE ITS WAY INTO THE AREA 
FOR THE LATER PART OF THE WEEK. HOWEVER...DESPITE THE SUNSHINE AND 
DRY CONDITIONS...THE INFLUENCE OF NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT WILL KEEP 
HIGHS IN THE 60S FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             51  64  47  77 /  40  10   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  49  62  45  74 /  80  30  10   0

158 
FXUS64 KMRX 150640
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 AM EDT WED OCT 15 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MAIN WEATHER FEATURE THROUGH THE 
SHORT TERM WILL BE A CUT OFF LOW DROPPING INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPLACHAIN REGION TODAY.  THIS LOW WILL PULL BANDS OF SCATTERED 
LIGHT SHOWERS INTO THE AREA FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND INTO TONIGHT.  
ONGOING CONCERN CONTINUES TO BE HIGH RIVER LEVELS.  THE TWO MAIN 
RIVERS OF CONCERN ARE THE EMORY RIVER AT OAKDATE AND THE SEQUETCHIE 
RIVER AT WHITWELL.  THE EMERY RIVER HAS CRESTED AND SHOULD DROP 
BELOW ACTION STAGE TODAY.  THE SEQUETCHIE SHOULD REMAIN BELOW FLODD 
STAGE AS IT CRESTS AROUND SUNRISE...THEN IS FORECAST TO FALL THROUGH 
THE DAY.  

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD OVERALL. SOME RUN TO RUN 
CONSISTENCY ISSUES MAINLY LATE IN THE PERIOD. FORECAST CONFIDENCE 
ABOVE AVERAGE EARLY IN THE PERIOD...ABOUT AVERAGE LATE. SOME LIGHT 
SHOWERS EXPECTED TO BE LINGERING INTO THURSDAY BEHIND THE RETREATING 
UPPER LOW...WITH BEST COVERAGE NORTH...WITH DRIER AIR MOVING IN FOR 
THURSDAY NIGHT.  A WEAK AND MOISTURE STARVED COLD FRONT FORECAST TO 
MOVE THROUGH FRIDAY/FRIDAY NIGHT. WILL KEEP FORECAST PRECIP FREE.  
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN FOR THE WEEKEND...THEN ANOTHER WEAK 
FRONT WITH LITTLE MOISTURE FORECAST TO MOVE THROUGH AROUND THE 
MONDAY TIME FRAME.  FOR NOW WILL KEEP THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR 
MONDAY FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME SHOWERS.  DRIER AIR MOVES IN 
BEHIND THE FRONT FOR TUESDAY.  GENERALLY JUST SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS 
TO GFS MOS TEMPS.

.DISCUSSION...THE COLD FRONT HAS PUSHED EAST THROUGH ALL BUT NE TN

TO DIMINISH. FORECAST GRIDS LOOK RIGHT ON TRACK IN DECREASING POPS 
FOR THE REST OF THE EVENING. WILL NEED TO ADJUST HOURLY TEMPS AND 
DEW POINT TEMPS WITH A GRID UPDATE SHORTLY. 

THE OTHER CONCERN IS FOR STRONG WINDS UNTIL THE FRONTAL PASSAGE 
OCCURS...WITH OBSERVATIONS GENERALLY SHOWING SPEEDS IN THE WARNING 
AREAS DROPPING OFF TO OR JUST BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA. A LATE GUST 
WAS JUST NOTED TO 63 MPH IN UNICOI COUNTY AT 3000 FEET. CAMP CREEK 
GUSTS (GREENE COUNTY) ARE DOWN TO AROUND 40 MPH AT THIS TIME. 

WILL MAKE A DECISION SHORTLY TO POSSIBLY REPLACE THE HIGH WIND 
WARNING WITH A WIND ADVISORY FOR A FEW MORE HOURS. THE WIND ADVISORY 
WILL BE ALLOWED TO EXPIRE AT 8 PM EDT.

343 
FXUS64 KMRX 141925
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EDT TUE OCT 14 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...COLD FRONT HAS NOW MOVED 
THROUGH MOST OF THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN VALLEY WITH SHOWERS ALONG 
FRONT THROUGH THE CENTRAL MOUNTAINS...VALLEY AND NORTHERN PLATEAU...
SOME CLEARING BEHIND FIRST AREA WHICH IS NOW JUST NE OF THE FORECAST
AREA ALLOWED ATMOSPHERE TO DESTABILIZE. GUSTY WINDS TO 35 MPH HAVE
OCCURRED WITH THE SHOWERS ALONG THE FRONT. HIGHER WINDS IN THE
FOOTHILLS HAVE CAUSED SOME DAMAGE AND WILL CONTINUE HIGH WIND
WARNING UNTIL 00Z FROM BLOUNT COUNTY NORTH. RAINFALL AMOUNTS WITH
THIS ACTIVITY HAVE BEEN ABOUT ONE HALF INCH PER HOUR AS IT RACES
NORTH. HEAVY RAINFALL POSSIBLE NEXT FEW HOURS FROM CENTRAL SECTIONS
NORTH AND TO MID EVENING NE BUT ONLY ISOLATED LOCATIONS EXPECTED TO
HAVE FLOODING...SO HAVE CANCELLED FLOOD WATCH. MODELS SHOW POSSIBLE
BRIEF BREAK IN CLOUDS BEHIND FRONT LATE THIS AFTERNOON OR EARLY
EVENING BUT UPPER LOW OVER IL MOVES SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE OHIO
VALLEY THROUGH WEDNESDAY WITH SHOWERS MOVING IN WEDNESDAY LATE
MORNING TO EARLY AFTERNOON. NAM MORE AGGRESSIVE THAN GFS...SO
INCREASED POPS TO LIKELY NW TO CHANCE SE SECTIONS. LOWS TONIGHT
MUCH COOLER IN THE LOWER TO MID 50S. HIGHS WEDNESDAY WILL ONLY
REACH NEAR 60 HIGHER ELEVATIONS NE AND PLATEAU TO MID 60S VALLEYS.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND REVEAL A CUT-OFF UPPER-LEVEL LOW OVER THE UPPER OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY WEDNESDAY NIGHT GRADUALLY MOVING NORTHEASTWARD INTO 
CANADA BY THURSDAY NIGHT. THIS UPPER LOW WILL HELP TO GENERATE 
SCATTERED SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
THURSDAY NIGHT...WITH THE GREATEST COVERAGE EXPECTED OVER THE 
NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. ANOTHER COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO 
MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT THE GFS AND ECMWF 
MODELS AGREE THAT THE MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH IT WILL BE LIMITED. 
HIGH PRESSURE THEN BUILDS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY FOR THE 
WEEKEND...RESULTING IN DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS. ANOTHER UPPER-
LEVEL TROUGH (BUT WEAKER THAN THE ONE TODAY) IS THEN PROGGED TO 
DEVELOP OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK... 
RESULTING IN ANOTHER SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS ON MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND A LITTLE COOLER THAN 
THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH IS 
IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

640 
FXUS64 KMRX 141540
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1140 AM EDT TUE OCT 14 2014

.DISCUSSION...DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WAS LOCATED OVER
CENTRAL IL WITH COLD FRONT NOW BEGINNING TO MOVE EAST ACROSS THE
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. LARGE AREA OF RAIN SHOWERS WAS LOCATED OVER
EASTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA IN THE PRE FRONTAL BAND WERE
PRODUCING SOME ISOLATED HEAVY RAINFALL AMOUNTS AND DROPPING
TEMPERATURES THAT HAD SPIKED INTO THE 70S IN THE EXTREME NE. SECOND
AREA OF SHOWERS WAS LOCATED OVER THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN VALLEY
AHEAD OF THE FRONT. SHORT RANGE MODELS SHOWING MORE ACTIVITY
DEVELOPING AHEAD OF THIS AREA AND FILL IN GAP WITH EASTERN AREA OF
PRECIPITATION THIS AFTERNOON. THIS APPEARS TO BE OCCURRING ALREADY
ACROSS SOUTHEAST PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA.

HIGH WINDS OCCURRED OVERNIGHT IN FAVORED MOUNTAIN WAVE AREAS AND
HAD PICKED UP AGAIN AT MID MORNING AT COVE MOUNTAIN WITH A GUST TO
67 MPH AROUND 1100 AM. OTHER SITES IN THE FOOTHILLS OF THE
APPALACHIANS WERE GETTING GUSTS FROM 40 TO 50 MPH THIS MORNING.
THIS SHOULD CONTINUE AS FRONT GETS CLOSER SO KEPT ADVISORY AND
WARNING IN EFFECT. RISK FOR SEVERE WEATHER LESSENED AS AIR MASS
HAS BEEN WORKED OVER. IF ANY CLEARING OCCURS AHEAD OF FRONT OVER NE
PART OF THE AREA SOME STRONGER WINDS COULD MIX DOWN FOR DAMAGE.
CONTINUED FLOOD WATCH AS COL FRONT JUST NOW MOVING ACROSS
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. MAY NEED TO DROP IT BY MID AFTERNOON IF SHOWERS
DO NOT INTENSIFY. TEMPERATURES SHOULD STAY STEADY OR BEGIN FALLING
BEHIND FRONT OVER PLATEAU COUNTIES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EDT TUE OCT 14 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A COLD FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH
THE AREA TODAY AND EARLY THIS EVENING AND THE UPPER LOW TO OUR
NORTHWEST WILL MOVE SLOWLY EAST AND SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE PERIOD.
BEST SUPPORT FOR PRECIP WILL BE IN THE BAND AHEAD OF THE
FRONT...AND THIS WILL PROGRESS SLOWLY EASTWARD THROUGH THE DAY AND
SHOULD EXIT OUR NORTHEAST COUNTIES THIS EVENING. DUE TO THE FAIRLY
SLOW MOVEMENT OF THIS BAND...WILL KEEP THE FLOOD WATCH FOR THE
AREA...BUT WILL END IT SOONER. STILL COULD BE SOME SEVERE STORMS
GIVEN SHEAR PROFILE...ALTHOUGH INSTABILITY MAY BE A LIMITING
FACTOR. LOOKS BORDERLINE FOR WIND WARNING AND ADVISORY...BUT WILL
KEEP THEM UP FOR NOW.  

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...UPPER LOW LIFTING OUT OF THE 
REGION ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY WILL CONTINUE TO ROTATE IN LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE AND WEAK IMPULSES.  THIS WILL KEEP A CHANCE OF SHOWERS OVER 
THE AREA EARLY IN THE EXTENDED.  THE LOW WILL BE OUT OF THE AREA BY 
FRIDAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN.  THIS WILL BRING US INTO A 
DRY WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE REST OF THE PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

848 PM EDT MON OCT 13 2014

.DISCUSSION...
THE LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS MIDDLE TN AND NORTHERN AL CONTINUE
TO SLOWLY MARCH EASTWARD. THIS LINE IS EXPECTED TO WEAKEN IN
INTENSITY AS IT MOVES FARTHER EAST...TOWARDS GA/E TN. THERE MAY BE
A FEW ISOLATED POCKETS OF WIND DAMAGE BUT SHOULD NOT BE WIDESPREAD. 
ADDITIONAL DEVELOPMENT OF STRONG/SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS IS EXPECTED
TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. SHOULD THE STORMS MOVE
SLOWLY THERE WILL BE A THREAT OF FLOODING/FLASH FLOODING THANKS TO
SATURATED GROUND FROM RECENT PAST RAINFALL. WILL FRESHEN UP
WATCH/WARNING PRODUCTS AS WELL AS TEMP/SKY/QPF/WIND GRIDS.

284 
FXUS64 KMRX 131920
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EDT MON OCT 13 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...SKIES HAVE BECOME 
PARTLY CLOUDY THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH TEMPS
REACHING INTO THE MID 70S TO LOWER 80S AT MOST LOCATIONS. SOUTHEAST
TO SOUTH FLOW HAS ALLOWED AIR MASS TO WARM AND DRY OUT ESPECIALLY
IN THE FAVORED NE AREA. BIG CHANGES BEGIN TONIGHT AS CLOUDS
INCREASE AHEAD OF DEVELOPING STORM SYSTEM MOVING INTO THE LOWER MS
VALLEY. A LINE OF STORMS FROM THE MID SOUTH AND LOWER MS VALLEY IS
SLOWLY MOVING EAST INTO THE TN AND OHIO VALLEYS THIS AFTERNOON. THE
SURFACE LOW WILL SLOWLY MOVE NE AND BECOME CO LOCATED WITH AN UPPER
LOW. GFS A LITTLE FASTER THAN THE NAM/ECMWF BUT EXPECT THE SHOWERS
AND ISOLATED STORMS TO REACH SW PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA AFTER
MIDNIGHT OR AROUND 6Z. THESE STORMS COULD BE STRONG OVER THE
PLATEAU LATE...BUT OTHERWISE ARE NOT EXPECTED TO BE SEVERE AS THEY
SHOULD BE WEAKENING. RAIN WILL INCREASE AROUND SUNRISE WEST AND
SPREAD NE SLOWLY DURING THE DAY TUESDAY. AM ISSUING A FLOOD WATCH
FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT...SINCE SOME PARTS OF THE AREA HAVE
HAD 4 TO 6 INCHES IN THE LAST FEW DAYS WITH ANOTHER 2 TO 4 INCHES
POSSIBLE BY WEDNESDAY MORNING.

AT 12Z TUESDAY...MODELS SHOW THAT A PRE-FRONTAL 50-70 KT 850 MB JET
WILL EXTEND FROM THE UPPER TENNESSEE VALLEY NORTH ACROSS THE LOWER
OHIO VALLEY...TOWARD THE GREAT LAKES REGION. THIS FEATURE SHOULD
WEAKEN AS IT SHIFTS EAST ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS BUT IT MAY BE SLOW
ENOUGH THAT WITH BOUNDARY LAYER DESTABILIZATION AND STRONG LOW-LEVEL
SHEAR AND FRONTAL FORCING THAT THUNDERSTORMS THAT FORM WILL BECOME
SEVERE WITH DAMAGING WIND GUSTS AND ISOLATED TORNADOES SEE DAY2
OUTLOOK. STORMS WILL END DURING TUESDAY EVENING WITH RAIN DECREASING
OVERNIGHT. WINDS SHOULD ALSO DECREASE DURING THE EVENING. TEMPS TO
STAY IN THE MILD 60S TONIGHT AS SOUTHERLY WINDS CONTINUE AND
INCREASE. WEDNESDAY HIGHS WILL CLIMB BACK TO THE 70S BEFORE THE
HEAVY RAIN. MUCH COOLER TUESDAY NIGHT AS COLD FRONT FINALLY MOVES
THROUGH DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND REVEAL A CUT-OFF UPPER-LEVEL LOW OVER THE MID WEST ON 
WEDNESDAY GRADUALLY MOVING NORTHEASTWARD INTO CANADA ON THURSDAY. 
THIS UPPER LOW WILL HELP TO GENERATE SCATTERED SHOWERS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...WITH THE GREATEST COVERAGE 
EXPECTED OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA. ANOTHER COLD FRONT IS 
PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY OR FRIDAY 
NIGHT...BUT THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS AGREE THAT THE MOISTURE 
ASSOCIATED WITH IT WILL BE LIMITED. HIGH PRESSURE THEN BUILDS OVER 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY FOR THE WEEKEND AND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK... 
RESULTING IN DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
GENERALLY TREND A LITTLE COOLER THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH IS IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH 
THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             67  75  54  65 /  90 100  30  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  65  76  55  66 /  50 100  60  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       65  74  54  65 /  70 100  50  30

     EAST POLK-HANCOCK-MARION-MORGAN-RHEA-ROANE-SCOTT TN-

MOSTLY DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING.

176 
FXUS64 KMRX 130747
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EDT MON OCT 13 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT IN 
IN THEIR HANDLING OF THE UPPER LOW THAT APPROACHES DURING THE SHORT 
TERM.  MAY BE A FEW LINGERING SHOWERS INTO THIS MORNING...BUT MUCH 
OF TODAY WILL BE DRY AS THERE WILL BE A BIT OF A PAUSE BEFORE THE 
NEXT ROUND OF PRECIP. BY LATE TODAY OR EARLY TONIGHT...SOME SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED TO BEGIN TO MOVE INTO WESTERN AREAS.  
WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE WESTERN ZONES LATE TODAY.  A BAND OF RAIN 
WITH EMBEDDED THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED TO PROGRESS SLOWLY EAST ACROSS 
THE AREA TONIGHT AND TUESDAY. HOW MUCH INSTABILITY WILL BE PRESENT 
IS STILL UNCERTAIN...BUT FOR NOW STILL APPEARS STRONG TO SEVERE 
STORMS MAY BE POSSIBLE ESPECIALLY LATER TONIGHT AND TUESDAY. WILL 
CONTINUE MENTION IN HWO.  WITH GOOD INFLUX OF MOISTURE AND THE SLOW 
PROGRESSION OF THE BAND OF PRECIP SOME FLOODING ALSO POSSIBLE LATER 
TONIGHT AND ESPECIALLY TUESDAY...ESPECIALLY GIVEN THE ALREADY WET 
GROUND. A FLOOD WATCH MAY NEED TO BE ISSUED LATER TODAY OR TONIGHT 
FOR THIS THREAT.  THE OTHER ISSUE IS THE POSSIBILITY OF STRONG WINDS 
AND MOUNTAIN WAVES.  FAIRLY STRONG LOW LEVEL JET OVER THE AREA 
TONIGHT AND TUESDAY IS FAVORABLE IN DIRECTION FOR MOUNTAIN WAVES.  
HOWEVER...RIGHT NOW SOUNDINGS LOOK A BIT LESS FAVORABLE AS THE 
BOUNDARY LAYER MAY NOT HAVE A SIGNIFICANT STABLE LAYER EXTENDING 
ABOVE MOUNTAIN TOP.  GIVEN THIS UNCERTAINTY...AM NOT CONFIDENT 
ENOUGH TO UPGRADE TO A HIGH WIND WARNING AT THIS POINT SO WILL LEAVE 
WATCH IN PLACE FOR NOW.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS GENERALLY STAY 
THE COURSE FROM PREVIOUS FORECAST IDEOLOGY WITH DEEP CLOSED LOW 
ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT WHILE 
GRADUALLY LIFTING NORTHEAST ACROSS THE EASTERN LAKES THURSDAY INTO 
FRIDAY. WIDESPREAD SHOWERS WITH SOME WEAKENING CONVECTION CONTINUES 
EAST AND OUT OF THE EASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY NIGHT 
ONLY TO BE REPLACED BY SCATTERED SHOWERS WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY AS 
ENERGETIC SHORT WAVELENGTH FEATURES CONTINUE TO PINWHEEL AROUND THE 
OHIO VALLEY UPPER LOW. STAYED WITH MEDIUM TO HIGH CHANCE POPS FOR 
SHOWERS WEDNESDAY DROPPING BACK TO LOW AND SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ON 
THURSDAY. IT STILL APPEARS THAT WE MAY BE ABLE TO KEEP PRECIPITATION 
OUT OF THE FORECAST FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY ALTHOUGH AN EASTERN U.S. 
LONG WAVE TROUGH DEVELOPS THROUGH THE PERIOD AS ANOTHER COUPLE SHORT 
WAVES DROP SOUTH OUT OF CANADA INTO THE PARENT PRESSURE SYSTEM 
CIRCULATION. OF COURSE THERE IS SOME UNCERTAINTY DURING THIS PERIOD 
WITH MODELS HINTING AT THE POSSIBILITY OF A COUPLE SHOWERS 
DEVELOPING FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY WITH THE INITIAL SHORT WAVE 
AND AN ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT.

&&

809 
FXUS64 KMRX 121940
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 PM EDT SUN OCT 12 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
RUC MESOANALYSIS SHOWS A RIDGE OF HIGHER CAPE VALUES EXTENDING NORTH 
ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. THE CONVECTION OVER NR AL MOVING NORTH 
MAY BE ABLE TO INTENSIFY A LITTLE OR AT LEAST SUSTAIN ITSELF AS IT 
MOVES THROUGH THIS AREA...SO THERE COULD BE SOME STRONG WINDS/SMALL 
HAIL IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY AND PLATEAU. THIS AREA OF CONVECTION 
SHOULD WEAKEN AS IT MOVES NE UP THE TN VALLEY...AND EXIT BY 
MIDNIGHT. MOS WAS WAY TOO COOL FOR LOWS LAST NIGHT...AND WILL GO A 
BIT ABOVE IT FOR LOWS TONIGHT WITH PLENTY OF CLOUD COVER EXPECTED.

AFTER MIDNIGHT...PRECIP CHANCES DROP OFF WITH STABILIZATION AND 
MOVEMENT OF THE UPPER JET STREAK TO THE NORTH. NO SIGNIFICANT VORT 
MAXES ARE SHOWN BY THE MODELS IN THE AREA TOMORROW...AND FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS SHOW A HEALTHY CAP. THUS MOST AREAS SHOULD BE DRY. SOME 
TERRAIN-INDUCED CONVECTION MAY BE POSSIBLE LATE IN THE AFTERNOON
IN THE MOUNTAINS AND PLATEAU. AFTER INITIAL MORNING CLOUDS...THERE
COULD BE QUITE A BIT OF SUN BY AFTERNOON...ALLOWING HIGHS TO REACH
THE LOWER 80S IN THE VALLEY.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...SLIGHT CHANGES TO
CURRENT FORECAST AS UPPER TROUGH AND DEVELOPING SYSTEM SLOWER NOW
THAN PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS. AREA OF SHOWERS AND STORMS OUT AHEAD OF
FRONT WILL AFFECT MAINLY WESTERN AND MIDDLE TN MONDAY NIGHT. SOUTH
TO SOUTHEAST WINDS DO INCREASE SO AM ISSUING A HIGH WIND WATCH
SHORTLY FOR THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND ADJACENT FOOTHILLS AS SETUP
LOOKS FAVORABLE FOR A MOUNTAIN WAVE PATTERN MONDAY NIGHT AND
TUESDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL STAY MILD MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. RISK
FOR SEVERE STORMS CONTINUES TUESDAY AHEAD OF FRONT AND HEAVY
RAINFALL ALSO A THREAT WITH PRE FRONTAL LINE OF STORMS. WILL
ADDRESS THIS IN SPS. RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF 2 TO 3 INCHES IS POSSIBLE
FROM EARLY TUESDAY TO WEDNESDAY MORNING. THE SYSTEM WILL BE SLOW TO
EXIT WITH WRAP AROUND CLOUDS AS AN UPPER LOW BEHIND SYSTEM MOVES
INTO OHIO VALLEY AND THEN FINALLY MOVES NE THURSDAY. SHOWERS
LINGERING WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. HAD TO INCREASE POPS AND
CLOUD COVER FOR THESE PERIODS. TEMPERATURES WILL BE MUCH COOLER
WITH COLD AIR WRAPPING AROUND A CLOSED UPPER LOW. HIGHER PRESSURE
FINALLY BUILDS IN FRIDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND. SOME WEAK SHORTWAVE
ENERGY MOVES THROUGH THE UPPER FLOW AND MAY BRING SOME CLOUDS BUT
AIR MASS APPEARS TO DRY FOR ANY RAINFALL.


&&

.AVIATION...

FXUS64 KMRX 121405 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1005 AM EDT SUN OCT 12 2014

.DISCUSSION...
THE HRRR SEEMS TO HAVE A PRETTY GOOD HANDLE ON THE MAIN AREAS OF
RAINFALL THIS MORNING. THE GENERAL TREND THROUGH THE EARLY
AFTERNOON WILL BE FOR THE AREA OF SHOWERS NOW BETWEEN TYS AND TRI
TO MOVE NE...WITH SCATTERED SHOWERS ELSEWHERE. LATER THIS
AFTERNOON...THE JET STREAK OVER TEXARKANA TO NRN MS WILL TRACK INTO
WEST AND MIDDLE TN...WHICH SHOULD RESULT IN INCREASED ACTIVITY IN
OUR WESTERN SECTIONS. SATELLITE IS SHOWING SOME BREAKS IN THE
CLOUDS SOUTH...SO DESTABILIZATION IN THAT AREA SHOULD LEAD TO MORE
TS. SEVERE POTENTIAL LOOKS LOW AT THIS TIME ALTHOUGH WITH GREATER
HEATING SOME STRONG TO MARGINALLY SEVERE STORMS MAY BE POSSIBLE.

THE FORECAST WILL BE UPDATED TO REFLECT THESE TRENDS...MENTIONING
NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND SCATTERED TS LATE THIS AFTERNOON SOUTH AND
WEST. TEMPERATURES APPEAR ON TRACK SO FAR.

307 
FXUS64 KMRX 120759
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT SUN OCT 12 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE NEARLY STATIONARY FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY JUST TO OUR SOUTH WILL REMAIN OVER THE REGION AND WEAKEN. 
PLENTY OF MOISTURE WILL LINGER OVER THE REGION...AND WEAK IMPULSES 
MOVING THROUGH WILL HELP TO TRIGGER SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS 
AT TIMES.  IT APPEARS THE ORIENTATION OF THE UPPER LEVEL JET WILL 
BECOME MORE FAVORABLE FOR SOME UPPER SUPPORT LATER TODAY INTO EARLY 
TONIGHT...WHICH SHOULD HELP TO ENHANCE PRECIP COVERAGE.  WHILE 
INSTABILITY LOOKS TO BE A LIMITING FACTOR...THERE MAY BE ENOUGH TO 
SUPPORT ISOLATED STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS ESPECIALLY WESTERN ZONES 
TODAY. WILL MENTION THREAT IN HWO. WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM MAV 
TEMPS...BUT WILL BUMP UP SOME MINS SLIGHTLY FOR TONIGHT GIVEN MOIST 
BOUNDARY LAYER AND EXPECTED CLOUD COVER.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...AS IS USUALLY THE CASE...THE 
ECMWF TURNED OUT TO BE THE BETTER MODEL WITH ITS DEEP...GO SLOW 
APPROACH FOR THE FIRST SEVERAL DAYS OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD. BACKED 
UP TIMING OF POPS FOR THE ONSET OF THE MAIN CONVECTION AHEAD OF THE 
STRONG COLD FRONT WHICH WILL MAKE VERY SLOW PROGRESS ONTO THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU BY MID DAY TUESDAY. MODELS STILL SHOW A 
STRENGTHENING SOUTHERLY FLOW ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN ALONG THE 
NORTH CAROLINA BORDER WHICH SHOULD KEEP MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA 
DRY DURING THE DAY MONDAY. BRING THE CATEGORICAL POPS FOR CONVECTION 
GRADUALLY EAST MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY MORNING. STRONG WIND FIELD 
STILL PROGGED DURING THIS PERIOD ALONG WITH ADEQUATE INSTABILITY. 
THEREFORE...SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS WITH DAMAGING WIND AND HAIL THREAT 
STILL POSSIBLE. AN ISOLATED TORNADO IS NOT OUT OF THE QUESTION 
EITHER STORM RELATIVE HELICITY VALUES BUMPING UP TO AROUND 150-200. 
THE MAIN CONVECTIVE LINE MOVES EAST INTO THE CAROLINAS LATER IN THE 
AFTERNOON TUESDAY INTO TUESDAY EVENING. DEEP UPPER LOW LUMBERS 
SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY 
WITH DEEP MOISTURE AND PLENTY OF SHORT WAVE ENERGY WRAPPING AROUND 
THE PRESSURE CIRCULATION FOR THE PRODUCTION OF POST FRONTAL SHOWERS 
DURING THIS PERIOD. THE UPPER LOW FINALLY LIFTS OUT THURSDAY NIGHT 
WITH A LITTLE DRIER WESTERLY FLOW DEVELOPING. HOWEVER...MODEL 
FORECASTS ARE REVEALING A COUPLE OF FAST MOVING SHORT WAVES BUILDING 
RAPIDLY EAST ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. FRIDAY NIGHT AND ANOTHER 
SATURDAY NIGHT. THE GOOD NEWS IS THAT THESE SYSTEMS APPEAR TO BE 
MOISTURE STARVED SO KEPT A DRY FORECAST GOING HERE.

408 
FXUS64 KMRX 111928
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
328 PM EDT SAT OCT 11 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)... THROUGH TONIGHT...HIGH 
PRESSURE MOVE EAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES REGION WILL PUSH A FRONT 
THAT HAS BEEN STATIONARY TO OUR NORTH TOWARD THE SOUTH. IT IS SHOWN 
BY THE NAM TO MAKE IT TO OUR SOUTHERN BORDER SUNDAY MORNING BEFORE 
LIFTING BACK TO THE NORTH THROUGH THE DAY. ALOFT...THERE APPEARS TO 
BE LITTLE FORCING FOR LIFT THROUGH TONIGHT...OTHER THAN SOME VORT 
MAXES THAT CROSS OUR NW SECTIONS. THE UPPER JET TO OUR WEST WILL 
BECOME MORE FAVORABLY POSITIONED TO ENHANCE DIVERGENCE ALOFT ON 
SUNDAY AFTERNOON. AROUND THIS TIME...850 MB WINDS TO BACK TO A MORE 
SOUTHERLY DIRECTION...AND ADVECT HIGHER THETA-E AIR INTO THE AREA. 
THERE MAY ALSO BE SOME BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS THAT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO 
DESTABILIZATION IN THE AFTERNOON...ESPECIALLY SOUTH. SOME STRONG 
STORMS TO BORDERLINE SEVERE MAY BE POSSIBLE IN SOUTHERN AREAS IF THE 
INSTABILITY IN THE NAM MATERIALIZES.

FOR THE FORECAST...WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS FOR THE EVENING BASED ON 
OBSERVED RADAR AND SATELLITE TRENDS...THEN LOWER POPS BACK TO 
SCATTERED AFTER MIDNIGHT. WILL BRING POPS BACK UP INTO THE LIKELY 
RANGE ON SUNDAY...WITH A MENTION OF SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS IN THE 
AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES WILL BE ON THE LOW SIDE OF MOS FOR 
HIGHS...AND ON THE HIGH SIDE OF MOS FOR LOWS.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...DEVELOPING STORM SYSTEM 
OVER THE PLAINS STATES MONDAY WILL ALLOW UPPER LEVEL RIDGE TO BUILD 
OVER THE SE COAST. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD SE OVER THE CAROLINAS 
AND WITH SE FLOW AROUND RIDGE A STRONG SE FLOW OVER THE MOUNTAINS 
SHOULD CAUSE SOME DRYING AND WARMING. KEPT POPS AT MOSTLY 20 PERCENT 
WITH SOME AREAS NOT SEEING ANY PRECIPITATION ESPECIALLY NE. AIR MASS 
BECOMES SOMEWHAT UNSTABLE WEST. MODELS ARE SOMEWHAT SLOWER WITH 
PROGRESSION OF UPPER TROUGH AND FRONT AS IT MOVES INTO THE TN AND 
OHIO VALLEYS AND OFF TO THE NE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY. WINDS 
INCREASE OUT OF THE SOUTH AND SOUTHEAST ESPECIALLY MOUNTAINS ANDS 
FOOTHILLS AHEAD OF PRECIPITATION WITH FRONT. A WIND ADVISORY WILL 
LIKELY BE NEEDED FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. TIMING OF PRE FRONTAL 
SHOWERS AND STORMS LOOK TO BE AFTER 06Z TUESDAY AND TAKE UNTIL 
AROUND 00Z WEDNESDAY TO BE THROUGH THE CWA. THREAT FOR SEVERE STORMS 
WITH DAMAGING WINDS AND ISOLATED TORNADOES TUESDAY. ECMWF STILL VERY 
SLOW WITH WRAP AROUND CLOUDS WITH UPPER LOW FORMING EARLY TUESDAY 
ACROSS THE CENTRAL PLAINS AND MID MS VALLEY WITH GFS PICKING UP ON 
IT TO. HAVE KEPT THUNDERSTORM CHANCES THROUGH TUESDAY AND SHOWERS IN 
THROUGH EARLY WEDNESDAY NIGHT. HIGH RAINFALL AMOUNTS TUESDAY MORNING 
AND AFTERNOON WHICH COULD CAUSE LOCALIZED FLOODING AND BRING RIVERS 
UP. 

HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN THURSDAY AND CONTINUES THROUGH SATURDAY. 
TEMPERATURES MUCH ABOVE NORMAL MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. MAY HAVE TO 
RAISE HIGHS EVEN MORE MONDAY IF ENOUGH CLEARING TAKES PLACE. 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY MUCH COOLER WITH LOWS POSSIBLY INTO THE UPPER 
30S WEDNESDAY NIGHT. TEMPERATURES BACK TO NEAR NORMAL FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY.

635 
FXUS64 KMRX 110824
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
424 AM EDT SAT OCT 11 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH TONIGHT)...TRIMMED BACK POPS FOR
EARLY THIS MORNING AS THE MAJORITY OF OUR CWA IS PRECIP FREE. THE
NEXT ROUND OF SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL APPROACH THE EXTREME SOUTHERN
VALLEY OVER THE NEXT HOUR OR SO. A WEAK LOW CONTINUES TO MOVE INTO
WV EARLY THIS MORNING BUT WILL ONLY ALLOW FOR MOSTLY LIGHT AND
SCATTERED SHOWERS ACROSS NETN AND SWVA. PATCHY DENSE FOG WILL ALSO
CONTINUE THROUGH EARLY MORNING ACROSS OUR AREA.

TODAY...A LOW PRESSURE CENTER WILL CONTINUE MOVING NE OUT OF 
ARKANSAS AND INTO WESTERN TN. A 500 MB VORT MAX ALSO ACCOMPANIES THIS 
LOW. A WEAK WARM FRONT WILL BE LIFTED FURTHER NORTH WITH THE LOW 
BECAUSE OF ITS NE MOVEMENT. THE LOW AND VORT MAX SHIFTING NORTH 
SHOULD ALLOW FOR BETTER PRECIP COVERAGE ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA. 
ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE FRONT WILL CONTINUE ALOFT...AND KEEP LIKELY 
POPS GOING IN THE FORECAST FOR MOST AREAS THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. 
WEAK INSTABILITY BUILDS INTO THE AREA TOMORROW AFTERNOON BUT LIFT 
WON'T BE OVERLY STRONG. LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES ARE FAIRLY HIGH BUT 
WEAKER MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES SHOULD HELP TO SUPPRESS ANY STRONGER 
STORM DEVELOPMENT ALONG WITH THE WEAK INSTABILITY ANTICIPATED. BUT 
BECAUSE WE CONTINUE TO HAVE HIGHER SHEAR VALUES OF 30 TO 40KTS AT 0-
6KM...A FEW STRONGER STORMS ARE POSSIBLE. OVERALL...IT WILL BE A WET 
AND CLOUDY SHORT TERM WITH SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS DISAGREE ON THE SPEED OF 
THE STRONG SYSTEM TO IMPACT THE REGION EARLY IN THE WEEK. WENT A 
LITTLE CLOSER TO THE FASTER GFS/CANADIAN SOLUTION. STILL LOOKS LIKE 
A DECENT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ON SUNDAY...DIMINISHING 
A BIT DURING THE AFTERNOON IN A MOISTURE AND ENERGY RICH SOUTHWEST 
FLOW REGIME. LATER SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY THE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE ON THE DECREASE AS MUCH OF THE DEEPER 
MOISTURE AND LIFT BECOME RE-POSITIONED OUT WEST ACROSS THE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE AMPLIFYING MID-AMERICA 
UPPER TROUGH. ADDITIONALLY...THE STRONG LOW LEVEL SOUTHERLY FLOW 
WILL LEAD TO TREMENDOUS DOWNSLOPING ACROSS THE APPALACHIAN SPINE. 
THIS SHOULD LEAD TO A MUCH REDUCED CHANCE OF RAIN DURING THE DAY 
MONDAY WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME SUNSHINE ACROSS MUCH OF THE 
GREAT VALLEY. THE STRONG STORM SYSTEM BUILDS INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY WITH A GOOD CHANCE FOR SEVERE THUNDERSTORM 
DEVELOPMENT ALONG THE SYSTEM COLD FRONT. GOING WITH THE MORE 
PROGRESSIVE GFS/CANADIAN SOLUTION THE CHANCE FOR RAIN SHOULD BE 
DECREASING INTO TUESDAY AFTERNOON. A FAIR AMOUNT OF SHORT WAVE 
ENERGY AND MOISTURE APPEARS TO WRAP IN ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE DEEP 
UPPER TROUGH TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY SO MAINTAINED THE CHANCE POPS 
FOR SHOWERS THROUGH THIS PERIOD. DRIER AIR AND UPPER RIDGING BUILD 
IN BEHIND THE DEPARTING TROUGH ALLOWING FOR A RETURN TO SOME 
SUNSHINE AND A WARMING TREND FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. 


&&

153 
FXUS64 KMRX 101919
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 PM EDT FRI OCT 10 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)... LOCALIZED FLOODING 
WILL BE THE MAIN CONCERN THROUGH THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS AS 
RADAR SHOWS CONVECTION ALIGNED PARALLEL TO THE STEERING FLOW. AREAS 
FROM BLEDSOE CO. TO OQT TO TRI WILL LIKELY HAVE THE HIGHEST THREAT 
OF SOME FLOODING. GUSTY WINDS ARE POSSIBLE TOO BUT PROBABLY BELOW 
SEVERE LEVELS. 

TONIGHT...A SURFACE LOW WILL TRACK ALONG THE FRONT TO OUR 
NORTH...WHICH WILL CONTINUE TO PROVIDE CATEGORICAL POPS ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN HALF. AS THE LOW MOVES TO WV EARLY SATURDAY MORNING...THE 
FRONT PUSHES SOUTHWARD. MEANWHILE A 500 MB VORT MAX MOVES ACROSS NRN 
AL. THIS SHOULD SHIFT THE MAIN PRECIP AXIS FARTHER SOUTH TOMORROW 
THAN WE HAVE SEEN TODAY. ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE FRONT WILL 
CONTINUE ALOFT...AND KEEP LIKELY POPS GOING IN THE FORECAST THROUGH 
SATURDAY NIGHT...ALTHOUGH WEAKER FORCING MAY MEAN LOWER QPF AMOUNTS 
AND LOWER THUNDERSTORM CHANCES. WILL CUT MOS TEMPERATURES BACK A 
LITTLE FOR TOMORROW GIVEN THE EXPECTED PRECIP AND CLOUD COVER.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...STATIONARY FRONT MAY PUSH JUST 
SOUTH OR EAST OF FORECAST AREA SUNDAY AS HIGHER PRESSURE DEVELOPS TO 
THE NORTH AND NORTHEAST OF FORECAST AREA. MOIST SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT 
WILL CONTINUE TO LIFT MOISTURE OVER THE FRONT AND A NEW WEAK
SURFACE LOW MAY FORM OVER WEST TN AND MOVE EAST OR NORTHEAST ALONG
THE FRONT. MORE SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE
ESPECIALLY IN THE MORNING NE AND THEN LATE IN THE DAY INTO
OVERNIGHT ALL AREAS. RAINFALL AMOUNTS ARE NOT EXPECTED TO BE
EXCESSIVE AT THIS TIME. ALSO SUNDAY A NEW UPPER TROUGH BEGINS TO
DROP SE THROUGH THE ROCKIES. A DEEPENING SURFACE LOW DEVELOPS OVER
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS SUNDAY NIGHT. MONDAY RIDGING BUILDS OUT AHEAD
OF THE PLAINS SYSTEM WITH ONLY SLIGHT CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND
STORMS. HIGHS SUNDAY MOSTLY IN THE 70S WITH LOWS SUNDAY NIGHT MID
50S TO LOWER 60S STILL ABOVE NORMAL. MONDAY TEMPERATURES ARE
EXPECTED TO BE SLIGHTLY WARMER WITH SOME FILTERED SUN POSSIBLE.
 
MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY PLAINS SYSTEM WRAPS UP EVEN MORE AND MOVES 
EAST. GFS IS FASTEST OF THE MODELS. WINDS WILL INCREASE OUT OF THE 
SOUTH TO SOUTHEAST AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM WITH POSSIBLE SEVERE WEATHER 
AHEAD OF IT WITH DAMAGING WINDS POSSIBLE AND A FEW TORNADOES. ALSO 
HIGH WINDS MAY DEVELOP IN THE FOOTHILLS OF THE APPALACHIANS. 
RAINFALL AMOUNTS MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY MAY REACH 2 TO 3 INCHES 
WHICH COULD CAUSE FLOODING. A FLOOD WATCH MAY NEED TO BE ISSUED IF 
THIS TREND CONTINUES AS WEEKEND RAINFALL SATURATES THE SOIL. KEPT 
TEMPERATURES MILD TUESDAY WITH THE FRONT MOVING THROUGH DURING THE 
DAY TUESDAY. THE FASTER GFS MAY BRING THE FRONT THROUGH SEVERAL 
HOURS EARLIER SO MAY HAVE TO LOWER HIGHS LATER. ECMWF MODEL IS 
SLOWEST OF THE MODELS AND KEEP SHOWERS BEHIND THE FRONT TUESDAY 
NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY SO FOLLOWED THIS TREND. 

SKIES BEGIN CLEARING WEDNESDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN AND KEEPS 
PATTERN QUIET THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK. TEMPERATURES WILL DROP 
BELOW NORMAL WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY AND THEN RISE FRIDAY AS HIGH 
PRESSURE SHIFTS EAST.


&&

FXUS64 KMRX 101439 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1039 AM EDT FRI OCT 10 2014

.DISCUSSION...
THE FORECAST IS ON TRACK AND ONLY MINOR TWEAKS WILL BE MADE TO
POP/WX GRIDS AND TEMPERATURES. A FRONT HAS STALLED ACROSS SE KY TO
SOUTHERN WV...AND AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE TAKING SHAPE OVER W TN
TODAY WILL RIDE ALONG THE BOUNDARY THROUGH TONIGHT. WHILE THE BEST
COVERAGE OF RAIN WILL BE IN THE NORTHERN HALF...CONVECTION HAS BEEN
DEVELOPING IN SOUTHERN MIDDLE TN THAT WILL AFFECT THE CENTRAL AND
SOUTHERN VALLEY AREAS...AND INSTABILITY SEEN IN THE 12Z FFC
SOUNDING AND SURFACE HEATING SHOULD SUPPORT ADDITIONAL
THUNDERSTORMS IN THIS AREA THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. WILL ALSO ADD A
MENTION OF LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 AM EDT FRI OCT 10 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FRONTAL BOUNDARY JUST TO OUR NORTH 
AND NORTHWEST IS NEARLY PARALLEL TO THE UPPER FLOW AND WILL NOT MAKE 
MUCH PROGRESS DURING THE SHORT TERM.  A WEAK DISTURBANCE IN THE 
UPPER FLOW WILL HELP TO ENHANCE PRECIP CHANCES BY THIS 
AFTERNOON/EVENING.  BEST CHANCES SHOULD BE NORTH CLOSER TO THE 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY...ALTHOUGH WILL STILL HAVE LIKELY POPS SOUTH.  
APPEARS THERE WILL BE ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR SOME THUNDER ESPECIALLY 
TODAY.  SOME UNCERTAINTY ABOUT HOW MUCH CONVECTIVE ENERGY WILL BE 
AVAILABLE...BUT GIVEN WIND SHEAR PROFILE CANNOT RULE OUT THE 
POSSIBILITY OF ISOLATED STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS TODAY...SO WILL 
MENTION IN HWO.  WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM MAV TEMPS FOR THE SHORT 
TERM.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS NOT ENTIRELY IN 
AGREEMENT AT TIMES DURING THE LONG TERM PERIOD WITH SEVERAL SHORT 
WAVE PASSAGES ACROSS THE MID SOUTH OVER THE WEEKEND. FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY WILL BE IN PLACE OVER TENNESSEE TO START THE WEEKEND BUT 
WILL BE ADVANCING BACK THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY AS THE UPPER LEVEL 
PATTERN REALLY CRANKS UP WITH AN AMPLIFYING WESTERN U.S. LONG WAVE  
TROUGH. LOOKS LIKE PLENTY OF MOISTURE FOR SHORT WAVE AND FRONTAL 
LIFTING ON SATURDAY FOR SOME RELATIVELY HIGH POPS FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS. WARM SECTOR PRESSES NORTH INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON 
SUNDAY WITH SOME RIPPLES IN THE STRENGTHENING SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW SO 
KEPT SOME MEDIUM CHANCE POPS GOING FOR CONVECTION HERE. WAS ABLE TO 
GRADUALLY DROP PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION BACK SUNDAY NIGHT INTO 
MONDAY AS A MAJOR LEAGUE UPPER TROUGH PUSHES STEADILY EAST TOWARD 
THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. IN THIS SCENARIO THERE MAY NOT BE VERY MUCH 
IN THE WAY OF RAIN ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH MUCH OF 
MONDAY...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE FAVORED DOWNSLOPE REGION OF NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE INTO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AS A STRONG SOUTHERLY FLOW FORMS 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. OF COURSE THE CHANCE OF RAIN 
WOULD BE HIGHER IN THE UPSLOPE REGION OF SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA 
DURING THE DAY MONDAY. MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY WILL BE A RATHER 
ACTIVE PERIOD AS A STRONG COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE FORECAST AREA. 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL FORM ALONG THE COLD FRONT AND THERE 
IS A GOOD CHANCE OF SEVERE STORMS WITH THIS EVENT AS MODEL PROGS 
INDICATE SUFFICIENT BUOYANCY AND STRONG SHEAR. THE GFS AND CANADIAN 
ARE PROGRESSIVE WITH THE DEEP TROUGH ALLOWING THIS FEATURE 
...AFTER PRODUCING A PERIOD OF WRAP AROUND SHOWERS TUESDAY NIGHT 
INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING...TO SWING EAST OF THE REGION DURING THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS ON  WEDNESDAY. THE ECMWF IS A LITTLE OUT ON THE EDGE 
WITH A CLOSED LOW EVENTUALLY FORMING OVER THE OHIO VALLEY KEEPING 
CLOUDS AND THE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS GOING WELL INTO THURSDAY. WENT 
CLOSER TO THE NON-ECMWF CONCEPT OF IMPROVING WEATHER WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
AND BEYOND AS A NICE AMPLIFIED UPPER RIDGE BUILDS IN FOR THURSDAY. 
GENERALLY STAYED UNDER GUIDANCE MAX TEMPS...ESPECIALLY IN THE COLD 
AIR ADVECTION PATTERN SETTING UP ON WEDNESDAY...WHILE STAYING CLOSE 
TO SUGGESTED MIN TEMPS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 PM EDT THU OCT 9 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...
ONGOING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ASSOCIATED WITH A MIDLEVEL VORT 
MAX ARE EXPECTED TO EXIT THE AREA BETWEEN 21-00Z. WE SHOULD SEE A 
LULL IN PRECIP FROM 00Z TO AROUND 08Z BEFORE THE NEXT DISTURBANCE 
APPROACHES LATE TONIGHT...ONE THAT IS CURRENTLY GENERATING 
THUNDERSTORMS OVER MO. THE LOW LEVEL RIDGE NEAR THE GA COAST WILL 
CONTINUE TO PUMP GULF MOISTURE INTO THE AREA THROUGH TONIGHT...AND 
WE WILL BE IN THE WARM SECTOR WITH AN UNSTABLE AIR MASS WITH A FRONT 
ACROSS KY/WV...PARALLEL TO THE MID/UPPER FLOW. THIS PATTERN BECOMES 
NEARLY STATIONARY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. NORTHERN AREAS WILL HAVE THE 
HIGHEST POPS NEAR THE FRONT AND CLOSER TO THE UPPER JET...GOING UP 
TO CATEGORICAL TOMORROW AND CONTINUING THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...AND 
THE HIGHEST QPF. WHILE AVERAGE PRECIP AMOUNTS IN NORTHERN AREAS WILL 
BE BETWEEN 0.5 AND 1 INCH...LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS ARE LIKELY WITH 
EMBEDDED THUNDERSTORMS.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...WET PATTERN CONTINUES
SATURDAY THROUGH EARLY WEDNESDAY. STATIONARY BOUNDARY NEAR TO OVER
THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY WILL BE A FOCUS FOR MORE SHOWERS AND A
FEW THUNDERSTORMS. LOW PRESSURE TO THE WEST OVER THE ARKLATEX MOVES
SLOWLY EAST ALONG THE FRONT SATURDAY AND SUNDAY WITH SHORTWAVES
CREATING PERIODS OF PRECIPITATION. RAINFALL AMOUNTS DO NOT LOOK
THAT HIGH BUT CLOUDS WILL BE PERSISTENT AND ANY THUNDERSTORMS MAY
PRODUCE LOCALLY HEAVY RAIN FOR SHORT PERIODS OF TIME. HIGH PRESSURE
RIDGING OVER FLORIDA AND EXTREME SOUTHEAST WILL STAY PUT AND SW
FLOW ALOFT WILL CONTINUE TO PUMP MOISTURE INTO THE TN VALLEY AND
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH DIGS SOUTH INTO THE
PLAINS SUNDAY WITH A NEW LOW PRESSURE AREA OVER THE PLAINS. THIS
STRONGER SYSTEM WILL ALLOW RIDGE TO STRENGTHEN SOUTHEAST RIDGE
SOMEWHAT SHOWER CHANCES SHOULD DECREASE MONDAY BUT INCREASE MONDAY
NIGHT AND TUESDAY AS THIS SYSTEM WINDS UP AND LOW DEEPENS AS IT
MOVES INTO THE GREAT LAKES AND SOUTHERN CANADA MONDAY NIGHT AND
TUESDAY. STRONG WINDS WILL LIKELY DEVELOP AND COULD BE POSSIBLE
STRONG STORMS MONDAY NIGHT OR TUESDAY. WRAP AROUND SHOWERS IN
COLDER AIR MASS WEDNESDAY WITH SKIES CLEARING LATER WEDNESDAY AND
THURSDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE A LITTLE ABOVE NORMAL DAYS AND
ESPECIALLY AT NIGHT WITH CLOUDS AND RAIN. MUCH COOLER TUESDAY NIGHT
THROUGH THURSDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 090743
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
343 AM EDT THU OCT 9 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FOR EARLY THIS MORNING...PATCHY 
DENSE FOG IS FORMING ACROSS THE AREA WITH CLEVELAND ALREADY DOWN TO
ONE-QUARTER MILE.

FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...INCREASING MOISTURE AND PERIODS OF
WEAK/MODERATE ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL HELP PRODUCE WIDELY SCATTERED TO
SCATTERED SHOWERS. INSTABILITY ALSO INCREASES ACROSS THE PLATEAU
AND SOUTHERN VALLEY...SO HAVE INCLUDED THUNDER AS WELL. GENERALLY
FOLLOWED GFS MOS TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE NOW IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK... 
AND REVEAL AN UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN THAT WILL BECOME MORE ACTIVE 
WITH TIME. A WEAK QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BE 
LINGERING AROUND THE TN RIVER VALLEY FROM FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY... 
WHICH WILL HELP TO TRIGGER SCATTERED CONVECTION AROUND THE FORECAST 
AREA EACH DAY. MODELS INDICATE ONLY A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS 
DEVELOPING THIS WEEKEND OVER THE FORECAST AREA...BUT A DECENT 
VEERING WIND PROFILE WILL BE PRESENT EACH DAY TO HELP ORGANIZE AND 
STRENGTHEN A FEW STORMS TO POSSIBLY BECOME STRONG OR SEVERE. AN 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL BEGIN TO DEVELOP OVER THE HIGH PLAINS ON 
SUNDAY...AND WILL BECOME HIGHLY AMPLIFIED BY MONDAY AND WILL DEVELOP 
A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ALONG A COLD FRONT OVER THE MID MS RIVER 
VALLEY BY MONDAY NIGHT. THIS HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
WILL CREATE A STRONG WIND FIELD ALONG AND AHEAD OF THIS COLD FRONT 
AS IT MOVES EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON TUESDAY. FOR 
MONDAY NIGHT...IT APPEARS THAT A HIGH END MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT AROUND 
THE MOUNTAINS AND THEIR ADJACENT FOOTHILLS WILL BE POSSIBLE...AS A 
STRONG SOUTH-SOUTHEASTERLY WIND FLOW AND A STABLE BOUNDARY LAYER 
DEVELOPS OVER THE MOUNTAINS WITH A VERY STRONG 850 MB JET (70 TO 75 
KT) DEVELOPING NORTHWEST OF THE MOUNTAINS. A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR 
MASS IS THEN PROGGED TO DEVELOP ON TUESDAY AS THE COLD FRONT SLOWLY 
APPROACHES THE FORECAST AREA WITH ITS STRONG WIND FIELD. AS A 
RESULT...IT APPEARS RIGHT NOW THAT THERE WILL BE A GOOD CHANCE FOR 
SEVERE STORMS OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY/TUESDAY NIGHT. AS 
FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT 
THE EXTENDED...WHICH ARE NOW IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE 
MEANS.

212 
FXUS64 KMRX 080715
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EDT WED OCT 8 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL MOVE
ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH 12-13 UTC THIS MORNING. A NEARLY SOLID LINE
OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE AREA.
INSTABILITY IS LIMITED WITH CAPES OF 100-250 J/KG...BUT SHEAR IS
HIGH WITH 0-1KM BULK SHEAR OF 40KTS AND 0-1KM SRH OF 300-400 M2/S2.
WILL WATCH FOR POTENTIAL OF BRIEF LOW-TOPPED SPIN-UPS EARLY THIS
MORNING...BUT CHANCES ARE LOW. MAIN CONCERN WILL BE ISOLATED
DAMAGING WINDS AND HAIL UP TO NICKEL SIZE. BEST CHANCE OF SEVERE
WILL BE ACROSS THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN HALF OF THE TENNESSEE
VALLEY.

AFTER FROPA...SURFACE RIDGING WILL BE THE MAIN PLAYER FOR REST OF 
TODAY AND TONIGHT WITH DRIER AIR. MOSTLY CLEAR SKY RETURNS FOR LATE 
MORNING/EARLY AFTERNOON. MOISTURE FROM DEVELOPING SYSTEM OVER THE 
PLAIN STATES WILL BE MAIN AFTER 12Z THURSDAY. FOLLOWED GUIDANCE 
TEMPERATURES CLOSELY.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE WEEKEND...BUT 
THEN REVEAL SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES EARLY NEXT WEEK WITH A HIGHLY 
AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AND ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT. A WEAK 
QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BE LINGERING AROUND THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY ON THURSDAY AND INTO THE WEEKEND...HELPING TO TRIGGER 
SCATTERED CONVECTION AROUND THE FORECAST AREA EACH DAY. MODELS 
INDICATE ONLY A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING EACH DAY 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA...BUT A DECENT VEERING WIND PROFILE WILL BE 
PRESENT EACH DAY WHICH MAY HELP TO ORGANIZE AND STRENGTHEN A FEW 
STORMS TO BECOME STRONG TO SEVERE. BY EARLY NEXT WEEK...MODELS 
INDICATE THAT A HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL DEVELOP 
OVER THE PLAINS ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY...WHICH WILL DEVELOP AN AREA OF 
LOW PRESSURE OVER THE MID MS RIVER AND LOWER OHIO RIVER VALLEYS BY 
MONDAY NIGHT. THIS UPPER TROUGH WILL PUSH A COLD FRONT WITH A STRONG 
WIND FIELD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY BY MONDAY NIGHT (GFS MODEL 
SOLUTION) OR TUESDAY (ECMWF MODEL SOLUTION). WITH A STRONG VEERING 
WIND PROFILE EXPECTED WITH THIS COLD FRONT...IT APPEARS THAT THERE 
COULD BE A GOOD CHANCE FOR SEVERE STORMS OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR 
EARLY NEXT WEEK. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND COOLER THAN THE GFS 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK...WHICH IS IS BETTER 
AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS...AND MAKES SENSE DUE TO THE 
EXPECTED CLOUD COVER AND SCATTERED CONVECTION EACH DAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             82  54  81  61 /  20  20  30  40

OAK RIDGE, TN                       80  49  80  60 /   0  10  30  50

WEAKENING AREA OF LIFT ALONG THE FRONT CONTINUES FARTHER SOUTH INTO 
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA AFTER MIDNIGHT. 
DRIER WEST NORTHWEST FLOW BUILDS IN BEHIND THIS SYSTEM ALLOWING A 
DRY WEDNESDAY COMPLETE WITH SOME SUNSHINE. STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE 
MINS TONIGHT BUT TRIMMED A COUPLE DEGREES OFF SUGGESTED WEDNSDAY MAX 
TEMPS.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
OVER THE AREA SHIFTS EAST EARLY IN THE PERIOD. SURFACE WARM FRONT 
MOVES NORTH THROUGH THE TN VALLEY BY THURSDAY. UPPER FLOW IS NEARLY 
ZONAL AND SHIFTS TO THE SW BY THE END OF THE WEEKEND. LAYER RH 
INCREASES WITH PWAT VALUES EXCEEDING 1.50 INCHES. LAYER THICKNESS 
VALUES ALSO RISE TO ABOVE NORMAL. WET AND WARM PERIOD CAN BE 
EXPECTED. TIMING OF IMPULSES IN THE UPPER FLOW WILL BE THE BIGGEST 
FACTOR FOR CONVECTIVE TIMING.

FXUS64 KMRX 070710

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EDT TUE OCT 7 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY 
WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION WILL CONTINUE TO PRODUCE 
SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER THE FORECAST AREA TODAY AND TONIGHT...WITH 
THE COLD FRONT SLOWLY MOVING INTO THE AREA TONIGHT. MODELS INDICATE 
THAT ONLY A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL DEVELOP OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...BUT A FAIRLY STRONG 
VEERING WIND PROFILE (HELICITY VALUES AROUND 400 M2/S2) MAY HELP TO 
ORGANIZE AND STRENGTHEN SOME STORMS ENOUGH TO PRODUCE DAMAGING 
WINDS...LARGE HAIL...AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM 
AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY MOVES 
EAST AND SOUTH OF THE AREA WEDNESDAY MORNING WITH SURFACE RIDGING 
FOR WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT KEEPING CONDITIONS DRY.  UPPER 
FLOW BECOMES MORE WEST SOUTHWESTERLY THROUGH THE EXTENDED WITH A 
SERIES OF UPPER LEVEL JET STREAKS PRODUCING CYCLO-GENESIS OVER THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS WITH FRONTO-GENESIS INTO THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY. 

INTERESTING FEATURE IS THAT MOISTURE FROM TROPICAL SYSTEM MOVING 
INTO BAJA CALIFORNIA WILL MOVE EAST INTO THE DEVELOPING FRONTO-
GENETIC BOUNDARY ENHANCING RAINFALL INTO THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY. 
THERE ARE SOME DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE GFS AND ECMWF IN WHERE THE 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY BECOMES QUASI-STATIONARY FOR LATE THIS WEEK INTO 
THE WEEKEND. WILL FOLLOW GFS CLOSELY FOR NOW WHICH KEEPS BOUNDARY  
NORTH OF THE AREA THROUGH THE WEEK...AND THEN PULLING SOUTH OVER THE 
AREA NEXT WEEKEND. PERIODS OF SHOWERS AND EMBEDDED THUNDERSTORMS CAN 
BE EXPECTED WITH THE GREATEST CHANCES OVER THE NORTHERN COUNTIES.

GENERALLY WENT A DEGREE OR TWO COOLER THAN GUIDANCE.

SHIELD.

UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL BE TRANSLATING  
EAST ACROSS E TN AND SW VA. HIGHEST PRECIP CHANCES WILL OCCUR OVER 
SW VA AND NE TN/HIGHER TERRAIN ALONG THE NC/TN STATE LINE. RAIN WILL 
MOVE EAST RATHER QUICKLY AND LEAVE A FAIRLY BEHIND A FAIRLY 
NICE...PRECIPITATION-FREE DAY. BY THURSDAY...RETURN SOUTHERLY FLOW 
WILL COMMENCE AHEAD OF THE NEXT SHORTWAVE PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE 
MID-MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY. THERE MAY BE JUST ENOUGH LIFT WITH THE 
SHORTWAVE TO PRODUCE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS BY LATE THURSDAY AFTERNOON 
INTO THURSDAY NIGHT. WILL HAVE TO AWAIT THE COLD FRONT TO MOVE 
ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY AND INTO TN/SW VA ON FRIDAY WHEN THE 
HIGHEST RAIN CHANCES ARE SET TO OCCUR. LOW END CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS WILL PERSIST THROUGH THE WEEKEND AND INTO 
EARLY NEXT WEEK. TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED TO BE NEAR OR SLIGHTLY 
ABOVE SEASONAL NORMALS THROUGH THIS TIME PERIOD.

FXUS64 KMRX 061751
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
151 PM EDT MON OCT 6 2014

.AVIATION...FIRST WAVE OF CONVECTION IS JUST MAKING ITS WAY INTO
TRI AREA BUT IN FAST FLOW PATTERN WENT AHEAD AND ENDED STORMS HERE
RELATIVELY QUICKLY. LOOKS LIKE SOME DOWNWARD MOTION BEHIND THIS
FEATURE ALLOWS FOR SOME VFR FLIGHT FOR A PERIOD THIS AFTERNOON
WHILE THE TERMINALS AWAIT A SECOND UPPER LEVEL FEATURE EXPECTED TO
FORM ACROSS WESTERN KENTUCKY AND WESTERN TENNESSEE. IF THIS
DEVELOPS ACCORDING TO MODEL DEPICTION...AN AREA OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS WOULD IMPACT THE TERMINALS FROM AROUND 23Z THROUGH
04Z TONIGHT SO WENT AHEAD AND PLACED THIS CONVECTION IN THE
FORECAST. EXPECT SOME FOG FORMATION IN THE WAKE OF THE DAY'S
RAINFALL BUT WITH THE ACTIVE PATTERN KEEPING A MID DECK AROUND
DON'T BELIEVE THERE WILL BE MUCH OF A DROP IN VSBY. MORE STORMS TO
BUILD IN ON TUESDAY BUT THEY MAY NOT MOVE INTO THE GREAT VALLEY
UNTIL AFTER THE VALID FORECAST PERIOD.

&&

NC...NONE.

FXUS64 KMRX 061341
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
941 AM EDT MON OCT 6 2014

.DISCUSSION...NICE LOOKING DISTURBANCE OVER WESTERN TENNESSEE RIPPING
RAPIDLY EAST IN THE UPPER LEVEL FLOW THIS MORNING. ALREADY AN AREA
OF CONVECTION FIRING AHEAD OF THE FEATURE. INSTABILITY A LITTLE
SUSPECT WITH MU CAPES STRUGGLING TO AROUND 700-800 J/KG.
HOWEVER...SHEAR IS DEFINITELY ADEQUATE RISING TO AROUND 45-50 KTS
SO SOME ORGANIZATION OF STORMS LIKELY. WILL STAY THE COURSE WITH
CURRENT FORECAST WITH LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS FOR SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS. LOOKS LIKE THIS FIRST WAVE IN FOR THE MID DAY INTO
EARLY AFTERNOON PERIOD WITH MORE ENHANCEMENT WITH A SECONDARY SURGE
LATE IN THE DAY INTO THE EARLY EVENING HOURS. STRENGTHENING LOW
LEVEL WARM ADVECTION SUFFICIENT TO PUSH TEMPERATURES CLOSE TO
FORECAST MAXES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
710 AM EDT MON OCT 6 2014

.AVIATION... 
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH A WARMER AND MORE MOIST AIR MASS 
(COMPARED TO YESTERDAY) OVER THE TAF SITES. A SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW 
OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY WILL CONTINUE TO BRING MORE MOISTURE INTO 
THE AREA TODAY...AS A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN HALF 
OF THE NATION AMPLIFIES SOME MORE OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. THIS 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL HELP TO TRIGGER SCATTERED CONVECTION AROUND 
THE TAF SITES...ESPECIALLY DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. 
SINCE THE EXACT TIMING AT THE TAF SITES REMAINS UNCERTAIN...WILL 
JUST MENTION VCTS THROUGHOUT THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS AT ALL 
THREE TAF SITES. OTHERWISE...VFR CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED OUTSIDE OF 
ANY CONVECTION.

031 
FXUS64 KMRX 060725
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EDT MON OCT 6 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH 
A WARMER AND MORE HUMID AIR MASS (COMPARED TO YESTERDAY) OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. A SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY WILL 
CONTINUE TO BRING MORE MOISTURE INTO THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...AS A 
BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION 
AMPLIFIES SOME MORE OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. THIS UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH WILL HELP TO TRIGGER SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY TODAY...ESPECIALLY DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS A 
MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPS. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE A 
FAIRLY STRONG VEERING WIND PROFILE UP THROUGH THE MID LEVELS...WITH 
WINDS INCREASING WITH HEIGHT THROUGHOUT THE TROPOSPHERE. THUS...THINK 
THAT SOME STORMS COULD BECOME STRONG TO SEVERE THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING...WITH THE MAIN THREATS BEING DAMAGING WINDS...LARGE HAIL... 
AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH MAXES FOR TODAY (DUE TO 
DIFFERENCES IN PRECIP COVERAGE)...BUT ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH 
MINS FOR TONIGHT. WILL GENERALLY COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO WHERE 
THE DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...ANOTHER UPPER-LEVEL
DISTURBANCE WILL ROTATE AROUND THE PARENT UPPER-LOW OVER THE GREAT
LAKES AND THROUGH THE OHIO/TENNESSEE VALLEYS ON TUESDAY. THIS FRONT
WILL TRIGGER YET ANOTHER ROUND OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. THOUGH
INSTABILITY MAY BE SLIGHTLY MORE LIMITED THAN ON MONDAY/MONDAY
EVENING...SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY COMBINED WITH SOME STRONG WIND
SHEAR PROFILES WILL GIVE THE POTENTIAL FOR STRONG/ORGANIZED STORMS
TO EXIST. THE COLD TEMPERATURES ALOFT WOULD SUPPORT A MARGINAL
SEVERE HAIL THREAT WITH THE STRONGEST/MORE ORGANIZED ACTIVITY ALONG
WITH LOCALIZED DAMAGING WINDS.

THE UPPER-PATTERN BECOMES MORE ZONAL ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY... 
WHICH SHOULD KEEP THE FORECAST MAINLY DRY. HOWEVER...A WEAK SHORT
WAVE MAY TRIGGER SOME ADDITIONAL SHOWERS AND STORMS THURSDAY
AFTERNOON/EVENING. THEN...THIS ACTIVITY WILL INCREASE IN COVERAGE
THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY AS THE PRIMARY FRONT SAGS SOUTH FROM THE
OHIO VALLEY. AS A RESULT...HAVE INCREASED POPS TO HIGH-END CHANCE
TO LIKELY ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE CWA FRIDAY AFTERNOON.
DEPENDING ON TIMING...SOME STRONG THUNDERSTORMS MAY BE POSSIBLE
WITH THIS ACTIVITY DURING THE LATER PART OF THE WORK WEEK. THE
FRONT WILL SAG SOUTH ON SATURDAY...WHICH MAY LIMIT PRECIPITATION
CHANCES FOR THE FIRST PART OF THE WEEKEND. HOWEVER...WITH MOISTURE
IN PLACE AND A PREDOMINANT TROUGH-PATTERN PREVAILING...THE
OPPORTUNITY FOR SCATTERED SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL EXIST SUNDAY AND
INTO THE EARLY PART OF NEXT WEEK. GIVEN THE EXPECTED CLOUD COVER
LATE IN THE WEEK...OPTED TO DROP HIGH TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES.
DO THINK A BRIEF WARM-UP INTO THE UPPER 70S/LOWER 80S IS STILL
POSSIBLE FOR WEDNESDAY/THURSDAY DUE SOME WEAK RIDGING.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             73  58  74  60 /  80  80  70  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  72  55  71  57 /  80  80  70  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       72  55  70  57 /  80  80  70  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              69  52  68  53 /  70  80  70  40 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
921 PM EDT SUN OCT 5 2014

.DISCUSSION...LOW PRESSURE OVER IL MOVING EAST NORTH OF THE OHIO
RIVER CONTRIBUTING TO STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION OVER THE TN VALLEY
TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES FALLING SLOWLY WITH DRY AIR MASS STILL OVER
THE FORECAST AREA. CURRENT TEMPERATURES LOWER 60S SOUTHWEST TO
UPPER 40S NORTHEAST. SKIES MOSTLY CLEAR AT THIS TIME AND WILL
INCREASE WITH CLOUDS AS THE NIGHT PROGRESSES AS MOISTURE INCREASES
AHEAD OF SHORT WAVE TROUGH WHICH WILL MOVE INTO THE EAST TN VALLEY
DURING THE DAY MONDAY. CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD SO NO UPDATE
PLANNED.

421 
FXUS64 KMRX 051903
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
303 PM EDT SUN OCT 5 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...THE CHILL IS GONE...AS 
TEMPS HAVE BOUNCED BACK INTO THE UPPER 50S TO MID 60S. THE 
RETREATING COOL AIRMASS WILL GIVE WAY TO SOME STRONG LOW LEVEL WARM 
AIR ADVECTION OVERNIGHT...EVEN IF CLOUDS DON'T INCREASE TO MORE THAN 
PARTLY CLOUDY. THIS SHOULD EQUATE TO NO COOLER THAN MID 40S FOR THE 
HIGHEST ELEVATIONS...STILL A LITTLE COOLER IN NRN VALLEYS. KEPT 
FORECAST GRIDS DRY FOR TONIGHT AS SHOWERS ARE NOT EXPECTED UNTIL 
LATE MONDAY MORNING.

SHOWERS POSSIBLE WITH THE WARM FRONT MONDAY...THEN MOISTURE 
INCREASES AHEAD OF A SERIES OF SHORTWAVES AND FINALLY A COLD FRONT 
ON TUESDAY. THUS...RAIN CHANCES LOOK QUITE HIGH LATE MONDAY THROUGH 
TUESDAY. POPS WERE INCREASED SLIGHTLY MONDAY NIGHT AND RAISED UP TO 
SOLID LIKELY FOR TUESDAY. A FEW STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS POSSIBLE 
MAINLY MONDAY EVENING FOR OUR PLATEAU COUNTIES...WHICH IS ALREADY
HIGHLIGHTED IN OUR HWO PRODUCT. 

FOR TEMPS...CLOSE TO GFS MOS FOR MINS TONIGHT AND MAXES MONDAY... 
THEN I FAVORED THE MILDER NAM MOS MINS MONDAY NIGHT. A LOT OF CLOUDS 
AND HIGH POPS TUESDAY MAKES A MOS MAX BLEND THE BEST CHOICE.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...ACTIVE PATTERN STILL IN 
THE WORKS WITH AN AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH SHIPPING OUT TO THE EAST 
EARLY IN THE PERIOD. HAD TO HAVE SOME MEDIUM CHANCE POPS GOING 
TUESDAY NIGHT WITH A WEAKENING FRONTAL BOUNDARY SLIPPING SOUTH 
ACROSS THE REGION BUT WAS ABLE TO KEEP WEDNESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT DRY WHILE MORE SHORT WAVE ENERGY RIDES BACK TOWARD THE EASTERN 
U.S. IN FAST WESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. A FAIR AMOUNT OF UNCERTAINTY IN 
TIMING OF BEST LIFT WITH THESE FAST MOVING DISTURBANCES RIP EAST SO 
HAD TO BROAD BRUSH SOME CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY. ECMWF/GFS INDICATE A COLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
WILL BE SLIPPING GRADUALLY SOUTH ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
AROUND FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY ALLOWING FOR A MEDIUM CHANCE POP REGIME 
AND THEN HAD TO CARRY ANOTHER PERIOD OF LOW CHANCE PROBABILITY FOR 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AGAIN ON SUNDAY MID AMERICA UPPER TROUGH 
UNDERGOES AMPLIFICATION LEADING TO STRENGTHENING SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW. 
MAINTAINED FORECAST MAXES WHICH BUMP ABOVE NORMAL MID TO LATE WORK 
WEEK AND THEN A LITTLE CLOSER...BUT STILL ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH THE 
END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
944 AM EDT SUN OCT 5 2014

.DISCUSSION...MIN TEMPS WERE MOSTLY LOWER TO MIDDLE 30S THIS MORNING 
WITH 30 DEGREES OR LOWER MAINLY IN THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS OF THE 
FREEZE WARNING AREAS. OUTSIDE OF THE FREEZE WARNING AREAS...THE 
LOWER 30S APPEAR TO HAVE OCCURRED FOR ONLY ABOUT 1 HOUR. FROST IN 
THE LOCAL MRX (LAKEWAY AREA) WAS QUITE PATCHY. 

WILL UPDATE THE GRIDS AND PRODUCTS BY 10 AM EDT TO DROP THE FROST 
AND FREEZE WORDING. THE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IS GONE TODAY AND NO COLD 
AIR ADVECTION TO STEEPEN LAPSE RATES...SO NOT EXPECTING ANY LOW 
CLOUD LAYER TO DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON.

658 
FXUS64 KMRX 050725
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EDT SUN OCT 5 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER 
VALLEY...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY COLD AND DRY AIR MASS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. THIS HIGH PRESSURE AREA WILL ONLY SLOWLY DRIFT 
EASTWARD OVER THE SOUTHEAST TODAY AND TONIGHT...WITH A LARGE UPPER-
LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION HELPING TO INCREASE 
CLOUDS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. TEMPS SHOULD QUICKLY WARM TONIGHT... 
AS A SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW INCREASES OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY AHEAD OF 
AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK 
REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)... A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL DOMINATE THE WEATHER ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH
AT LEAST THE MIDDLE OF THE UPCOMING WEEK...HELPING TO MAINTAIN
PRECIPITATION CHANCES EACH DAY. THE FIRST IN A SERIES OF SHORTWAVES
WILL PUSH THROUGH THE AREA ON MONDAY AND BRING SOME ISOLATED TO
SCATTERED SHOWERS...ESPECIALLY ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU BY THE
AFTERNOON. LATER MONDAY NIGHT...A STRONGER UPPER-LEVEL DISTURBANCE/
SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL SWEEP INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. ALONG AND
AHEAD OF THIS FRONT A COMPLEX OF STRONG TO POSSIBLY SEVERE STORMS
MAY DEVELOP ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND MOVE INTO THE EASTERN
TENNESSEE VALLEY BY LATE EVENING/OVERNIGHT. DUE TO THE ELEVATED
INSTABILITY COMBINED WITH SOME STRONG WIND SHEAR PROFILES...THIS
ORGANIZED ACTIVITY MAY LAST THROUGH THE NIGHT AND INTO THE MORNING
ON TUESDAY. THE COLD TEMPERATURES ALOFT WOULD SUPPORT A MARGINAL
SEVERE HAIL THREAT WITH THE STRONGEST/MORE ORGANIZED ACTIVITY ALONG
WITH LOCALIZED DAMAGING WINDS.
 
SOME ADDITIONAL SHORTWAVES WILL THEN PROVIDE THE NECESSARY LIFT FOR 
SOME ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SHOWERS TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY... 
BEFORE THE PARENT LOW OVER THE GREAT LAKES SHIFTS EAST. A BRIEF LULL 
IN PRECIPITATION CHANCES MAY OCCUR ON THURSDAY AS TEMPERATURES WARM 
CLOSE TO 80 IN MANY AREAS. ANOTHER STRONGER TROUGH WILL BEGIN TO DIG 
OUT OF THE SOUTHERN PLAINS THURSDAY NIGHT AND SHIFT TOWARD THE OHIO 
VALLEY FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY. THIS WILL SWEEP A COLD FRONT TOWARD THE 
REGION FRIDAY AFTERNOON/NIGHT INTO SATURDAY...AND PROVIDE A BETTER 
OPPORTUNITY FOR SOME WIDESPREAD THUNDERSTORMS /AND POSSIBLY SOME
ORGANIZED STRONG TO SEVERE ACTIVITY/. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             70  50  73  57 /   0   0  40  60 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  66  46  73  55 /   0  10  40  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       66  47  72  55 /   0  10  50  60 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              62  40  70  51 /   0  10  40  60 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...FREEZE WARNING UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR CHEROKEE-CLAY.

TN...FROST ADVISORY UNTIL 10 AM EDT /9 AM CDT/ THIS MORNING FOR 
     ANDERSON-BLEDSOE-CAMPBELL-CLAIBORNE-GRAINGER-HAMBLEN-
     HANCOCK-HAWKINS-JEFFERSON-MARION-MORGAN-NW BLOUNT-NORTH 
     SEVIER-NORTHWEST CARTER-NORTHWEST COCKE-NORTHWEST GREENE-
     NORTHWEST MONROE-SCOTT TN-SEQUATCHIE-SULLIVAN-UNION-
     WASHINGTON TN-WEST POLK.

     FREEZE WARNING UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR BLOUNT SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS-COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS-EAST POLK-JOHNSON-SEVIER 
     SMOKY MOUNTAINS-SOUTHEAST CARTER-SOUTHEAST GREENE-SOUTHEAST

729 
FXUS64 KMRX 050119
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
919 PM EDT SAT OCT 4 2014

.DISCUSSION...SKIES HAVE MOSTLY CLEARED ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
WITH THE EXCEPTION OF SW VA AND NE TN AND THE EASTERN TN MOUNTAINS.
PRESSURE GRADIENT BEGINNING TO RELAX IN THE WESTERN HALF.
TEMPERATURES VARY WIDELY WITH TEMPERATURES ALREADY IN THE 30S ABOVE
3000 FEET IN CLEARER AREAS OF THE MOUNTAINS TO LOWER TO MID 40S
PLATEAU AND UPPER 40S TO LOWER 50S LOWER ELEVATION VALLEYS.
ADJUSTED CURRENT TEMPERATURES AND DEW POINTS LOWERING SEVERAL TEMPS
WEST AND RAISED SOME DEW POINTS. ADDED PLATEAU COUNTIES AND THOSE
ADJACENT TO THE MOUNTAINS PLUS THOSE NORTH OF KNOXVILLE TO FROST
ADVISORY WHERE FORECAST LOWS ALREADY FORECASTED IN MID 30S. FROST
POSSIBLE MAINLY LOWER VALLEY AREAS DURING EARLY TO MID MORNING
HOURS. FORECAST ALREADY SENT.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...FREEZE WARNING FROM 4 AM TO 10 AM EDT SUNDAY FOR CHEROKEE-CLAY.

TN...FROST ADVISORY FROM 4 AM EDT /3 AM CDT/ TO 10 AM EDT /9 AM CDT/ 
     SUNDAY FOR ANDERSON-BLEDSOE-CAMPBELL-CLAIBORNE-GRAINGER-

223 
FXUS64 KMRX 041925
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EDT SAT OCT 4 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...COLD AIR ADVECTION STRATO
CUMULUS CLOUDS FORMED OVER THE NRN 2/3RDS OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS
AFTERNOON...WHICH KEPT MAX TEMPS DOWN A FEW DEGREES. THESE CLOUDS
SHOULD GRADUALLY DISSIPATE AND ALLOW SOME CLEARING. HOWEVER...WE
STILL HAVE SOME BRISK WESTERLY WINDS ALOFT WHICH MAY NOT DIE OFF
UNTIL AFTER MIDNIGHT. 12Z MOS MINS CAME IN CLOSE OR A DEGREE OR SO
ABOVE 00Z MOS...WHICH SEEMS REASONABLE TO ME GIVEN THESE CLOUDS AND
POSSIBILITY OF LIGHT WEST WINDS FOR SW VA AND NE TN. DEW POINT
TEMPS MAY ALSO NUDGE UP A FEW DEGREES.

FOR THE FREEZE WATCH...AFTER COORDINATION WITH NWS NEIGHBORS...I
OPTED TO ONLY ISSUE A FREEZE WARNING FOR OUR EASTERN MOST COUNTIES
ADJACENT TO WRN NC. POSTED A FROST ADVISORY FOR SW VA AND THE
REMAINDER OF THE NE TN COUNTIES PREVIOUSLY IN THE FREEZE WATCH.

SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT ON MONDAY
MAY ARRIVE A FEW HOURS FASTER...SO POPS WERE INCREASED BY 20 TO 30
PERCENT IN LINE WITH 12Z MOS AND NEIGHBORING FORECAST GRIDS. 

OTHERWISE...WARMING UP SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT CLOSE TO SIMILAR MOS
GUIDANCE.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...WITH THE CHANGING 
SEASONS THE POLAR JET STREAM WILL BE DISPLACED FURTHER SOUTH ACROSS 
THE EASTERN U.S. EARLY IN THE FORECAST PERIOD. A RELATIVELY 
SIGNIFICANT SHORT WAVE WILL DROP SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE BASE OF THE 
EASTERN TROUGH BRINGING DECENT CHANCE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. THE SYSTEM WILL BE MOVING AWAY TUESDAY 
NIGHT AS THE UPPER FLOW BECOMES ZONAL. HOWEVER...AT LEAST A COUPLE 
MORE ADDITIONAL WAVES WILL BE RIDING QUICKLY EAST IN TIME TO BRING A 
CHANCE FOR SHOWERS BACK INTO THE FORECAST ON THURSDAY. MORE ROBUST 
SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL ALLOW DEVELOPMENT OF A SURFACE LOW BY FRIDAY. 
THE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL INCREASE FRIDAY INTO 
SATURDAY AS MOIST LOW LEVEL FLOW IS LIFTED ALONG THE SYSTEM COLD 
FRONT.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              31  61  40  71 /   0   0  10  40

SOUNDINGS SUPPORT HIGHS IN THE 50S TO LOWER 60S ACROSS THE LOWER 
ELEVATIONS...AND ONLY IN THE 40S FOR HIGHER ELEVATIONS. 

MAIN FORECAST CONCERN IS THE FREEZE WATCH AREA AND I PLAN TO WAIT

LIKELY NEED TO UPGRADE THE FREEZE WATCH TO A WARNING WITH THE 
AFTERNOON PACKAGE...POSSIBLY EARLIER.

FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW AROUND 30 KNOT WESTERLY WINDS AT THE TOP OF 
THE MIXING LAYER...SO I MAY BUMP UP WIND SPEEDS JUST A BIT A LATE 
MORNING UPDATE.
