.AVIATION... 
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT ALONG THE EASTERN 
SEABOARD...WITH AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS. THE RESULTING PRESSURE GRADIENT BETWEEN THESE TWO SYSTEMS 
WILL PRODUCE GUSTY WESTERLY WINDS AT THE TAF SITES TODAY...BUT THESE 
WINDS SHOULD QUICKLY DIMINISH AFTER SUNSET THIS EVENING. 
OTHERWISE...VFR CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED AT ALL THREE TAF SITES 
THROUGHOUT THE TAF PERIOD...AS UNSEASONABLY COLD AND DRY AIR MOVES 
INTO THE REGION.

246 
FXUS64 KMRX 040753 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
353 AM EDT SAT OCT 4 2014

.UPDATE...FOR AN ADDITION TO THE LONG TERM DISCUSSION.

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A STRONG COLD FRONT ALONG THE
EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH THE LEADING
EDGE OF A MUCH COLDER AIR MASS OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. THIS
UNSEASONABLY COLD AIR MASS WILL CONTINUE TO ADVECT EASTWARD INTO
THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...WITH TEMPS EXPECTED TO BE BETWEEN TEN AND
FIFTEEN DEGREES BELOW NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. THE MAIN
CONCERN IN THE SHORT TERM IS THE POSSIBILITY OF THE FIRST FROST AND
FREEZE OF THE FALL SEASON LATE TONIGHT INTO SUNDAY MORNING. MODEL
GUIDANCE TEMPS HAVE BEEN TRENDING COOLER WITH EACH SUCCESSIVE MODEL
RUN...AND NOW INDICATE TEMPS CLOSE TO FREEZING ACROSS SOUTHWEST
VA...NORTHEAST TN...AND SOUTHWEST NC. WITH DEWPOINTS EXPECTED TO BE
FAIRLY LOW TONIGHT (MID 20 TO LOWER 30S) AS AN AREA OF HIGH
PRESSURE BECOMES CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHEAST...THINK THAT TEMPS
COULD EASILY TUMBLE TONIGHT (POSSIBLY LOWER THAN GUIDANCE) AS SKIES
CLEAR AND SURFACE WINDS DECOUPLE FROM THE WINDS ALOFT. SINCE THIS
SCENARIO IS THE KIND THAT CAN EASILY CREATE UNEXPECTEDLY COOLER
TEMPS THAN ORIGINALLY FORECASTED (AND IT IS STILL FAIRLY EARLY IN
THE FALL SEASON)... THINK IT IS PRUDENT TO ISSUE A FREEZE WATCH FOR
SOUTHWEST VA... NORTHEAST TN...EAST TN MOUNTAINS...AND SOUTHWEST NC
FOR LATE TONIGHT INTO SUNDAY MORNING. IN ADDITION...WILL MENTION
PATCHY FROST ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA.

.LONG TERM /SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY/...
A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL DOMINATE THE WEATHER
ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF THE UPCOMING WEEK...HELPING
TO MAINTAIN PRECIPITATION CHANCES AND SOME COOLER AUTUMN-LIKE
TEMPERATURES. 

AFTER A VERY CHILLY NIGHT...TEMPERATURES SHOULD WARM INTO THE 65
TO 70 DEGREE RANGE IN MOST SPOTS BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON. WITH A
SOUTHERLY WIND AND SOME INCREASING CLOUDS...WARMER LOWS IN THE
UPPER 30S TO 40S ARE EXPECTED FOR SUNDAY NIGHT. THE FIRST IN A
SERIES OF SHORTWAVES WILL PUSH THROUGH THE AREA ON MONDAY...
BRINGING ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SHOWERS AND PREHAPS A RUMBLE OF
THUNDER OR TWO...ALONG WITH SOME ADDED CLOUD COVER. THEN MONDAY
NIGHT INTO TUESDAY...A STRONGER UPPER-LEVEL DISTURBANCE WILL MOVE
THROUGH AREA AND PROVIDE BETTER LIFT FOR MORE WIDESPREAD SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS. SOME LOCALIZED STRONG STORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE
DURING THIS TIME PERIOD DUE TO THE MAINLY ELEVATED INSTABILITY
COMBINED WITH SOME STRONG SHEAR. THE COLD TEMPERATURES ALOFT WOULD
SUPPORT A MARGINAL SEVERE HAIL THREAT WITH THE STRONGEST/MORE
ORGANIZED ACTIVITY ALONG WITH LOCALIZED DAMAGING WINDS.
 
ADDITIONAL SUBTLE WAVES WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR MORE ISOLATED 
SHOWERS TUESDAY NIGHT BEFORE TAPERING OFF BY WEDNESDAY/THURSDAY AS 
RIDGING BEGINS TO BRIEFLY NOSE IN. BY FRIDAY...A STRONGER TROUGH AND 
FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND BRING SOME BETTER 
CHANCES FOR THUNDERSTORMS BY THE AFTERNOON AND OVERNIGHT HOURS. 
GIVEN THIS BETTER CONFIDENCE...HAVE INCREASED POPS TO 40 PERCENT IN 
THE DAY 7 GRIDS. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             64  37  71  50 /   0   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  62  36  66  49 /   0   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       62  36  67  49 /   0   0   0  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              58  29  61  41 /   0   0   0  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...FREEZE WATCH FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING FOR 
     CHEROKEE-CLAY.

TN...FREEZE WATCH FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING FOR BLOUNT 
     SMOKY MOUNTAINS-COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS-EAST POLK-HANCOCK-
     HAWKINS-JOHNSON-NORTHWEST CARTER-NORTHWEST GREENE-SEVIER 
     SMOKY MOUNTAINS-SOUTHEAST CARTER-SOUTHEAST GREENE-SOUTHEAST 
     MONROE-SULLIVAN-UNICOI-WASHINGTON TN.

VA...FREEZE WATCH FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING FOR LEE-
     RUSSELL-SCOTT-WASHINGTON-WISE.

354 
FXUS64 KMRX 031917
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
317 PM EDT FRI OCT 3 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...COLD FRONT HAS PASSED JUST
EAST OF BOWLING GREEN KY AND NASHVILLE TN...AS INITIAL BATCH OF
SHOWERS WAS JUST EXITING OUR NE TN AND SW VA COUTNIES.

COVERAGE OF SHOWERS AND PERHAPS AN ISOLATED THUNDERSTORM...SHOULD
BE LESS THAN 60 PERCENT OVERALL. HOWEVER...SOME DEVELOPMENT WITH
THE FRONT IS EXPECTED AND THE RAP/HRR MODELS BOTH SHOW A LITTLE
BETTER COVERAGE OVER SW VA/NE TN THIS EVENING. THIS IS LIKELY DUE
TO BEST UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE THOSE AREAS IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE
UPSTREAM SHORTWAVE TRACK. 

OTHERWISE...MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON THE CHILLY FALL AIRMASS
SETTLING IN SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY. I ADDED PATCHY AREAS OF FROST
TO NE AREAS AND SMOKIES FOR NOW WITH MINS IN THE 30S IN THOSE
LOCATIONS. SURFACE WINDS WOULD APPEAR TO FALL OFF SHARPLY SATURDAY
EVENING. WENT QUITE CLOSE TO GFS MOS FOR THE FORECAST PERIODS. 


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION WILL BE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF UPPER TROUGHING THROUGH AT 
LEAST THE FIRST HALF OF THE EXTENDED FORECAST WHICH KEEPS 
TEMPERATURES A LITTLE BELOW NORMAL THROUGH TUESDAY. A SHORTER 
WAVELENGTH FEATURE AND ASSOCIATED FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL DROP 
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE REGION LATER MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY 
GENERATING A FEW SHOWERS. HOWEVER...UPPER LEVEL HEIGHTS WILL BE 
BUILDING WEDNESDAY INTO FRIDAY IN A DRIER REGIME COMPLETE WITH A 
FAIR AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE. THE INSOLATION AND A STRENGTHENING 
SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL HELP BOOST TEMPERATURES BACK A FEW DEGREES ABOVE 
NORMAL DURING THIS LATTER PART OF THE WORK WEEK.

OF TYS AND TRI AROUND 00Z. FINALLY A STRONG TRAILING SHORT WAVE
IN PLACE OVER THE MIDWEST...WELL BEHIND THE SURFACE FRONT...COULD
PRODUCE A SHOWER AT TRI DEEP INTO THE EVENING. EXPECT THERE TO BE A
LOW CLOUD LAYER HANGING AROUND AT ABOUT 2500-3000 FEET OVER THE
TERMINALS AFTER MIDNIGHT. THIS LAYER SHOULD ERODE FROM WEST TO EAST
FROM AROUND 07-08Z AT CHA TO AS LATE AS MID MORNING AT TRI. AFTER
THIS SHOULD BE VFR FLIGHT WITH A HEALTHY WESTERLY WIND INTO MID DAY
SATURDAY.

FRONT WILL SLOWLY APPROACH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION LATE THIS

483 
FXUS64 KMRX 030710
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EDT FRI OCT 3 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION...WITH ITS 
ASSOCIATED WARM FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHEASTWARD ACROSS EASTERN KY AND 
THE TRI-CITIES AREA...AND ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT EXTENDING 
SOUTHWARD OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY AND OZARKS REGION. AREA 
RADARS REVEAL A PRE-FRONTAL SQUALL LINE OVER MIDDLE TN AND NORTHWEST 
AL...WHICH IS EXPECTED TO WEAKEN THIS MORNING AS IT MOVES INTO A 
MORE STABLE AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MOST OF THIS PRE-
FRONTAL ACTIVITY SHOULD MOVE EASTWARD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
AROUND SUNRISE THIS MORNING...WITH ADDITIONAL CONVECTIVE 
REDEVELOPMENT LIKELY LATE THIS AFTERNOON INTO EARLY EVENING AS THE 
COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS INDICATE THAT THE 
LOCAL AIR MASS WILL ONLY BE ABLE TO BECOME MARGINALLY UNSTABLE THIS 
AFTERNOON BEFORE FRONTAL PASSAGE...SO IT APPEARS THAT ONLY ISOLATED 
STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS WITH DAMAGING WINDS WILL BE POSSIBLE. AS FOR 
TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES
ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...IN WAKE OF THE COLD FRONT
THAT WILL SWEEP THROUGH THE REGION FRIDAY EVENING/NIGHT...A MUCH
COOLER CANADIAN AIR MASS WILL FILTER INTO THE AREA ON SATURDAY.
THIS COOL/DRY AIR /ACCOMPANIED BY SOME BREEZY WNW WINDS/...WILL
KNOCK HIGHS BACK INTO THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S ACROSS THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THIS WILL BE A VERY
NOTICEABLE CHANGE FROM THE 80S READINGS THE AREA HAD BEEN
EXPERIENCING TO END SEPTEMBER/START OCTOBER. A VERY CHILLY NIGHT
WILL FOLLOW THE COOL DAY AS LOW TEMPERATURES WILL PLUNGE INTO THE
MID TO UPPER 30S UNDER A CLEAR SKY EARLY SUNDAY MORNING. AS A
RESULT...A FROST ADVISORY WILL LIKELY BE NEEDED OVER A GOOD PORTION
OF THE REGION... PARTICULARLY ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA.
WILL STILL MONITOR THE POTENTIAL FOR A LIGHT FREEZE OVER SHELTERED
VALLEYS IN SOUTHWEST VA...THROUGH THINK TEMPS SHOULD STAY JUST
ABOVE THE FREEZING MARK AT THE MOMENT.

THEREAFTER...A SLIGHT WARMING TREND WILL OCCUR THROUGHOUT THE 
WEEK...BUT THE REGION WILL REMAIN UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF A BROAD 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE GREAT LAKES. THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR SENDING A SERIES A SHORTWAVE TROUGHS 
THROUGH THE AREA EARLY THIS WEEK. AS A RESULT...SOME CHANCES FOR 
SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL EXIST ON MONDAY AND ESPECIALLY MONDAY NIGHT 
AND TUESDAY...BEFORE BECOMING MORE ISOLATED AGAIN BY WEDNESDAY. HIGH 
TEMPERATURES AS MENTIONED WILL RECOVER BACK INTO THE 70S BY EARLY 
NEXT WEEK...AND MAY EVENTUALLY APPROACH THE 80 DEGREE MARK BY 
THURSDAY THANKS TO SOME WEAK RIDGING/SUNSHINE. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             80  48  63  39 / 100  30   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  79  46  60  38 /  90  40   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       79  46  60  37 / 100  40   0   0

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
322 PM EDT THU OCT 2 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MAIN WEATHER EVENT
OCCURS FRIDAY AS A STRONG UPPER TROUGH AND COLD FRONT MOVE EAST
THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY FRIDAY NIGHT. PREVIOUS

TWEAKS. SEVERE STORMS UNLIKELY...BUT SHEAR OF 30 KTS OR MORE WITH
SUFFICIENT INSTABILITY AS STRONG FORCING OCCURS THROUGH THE DAY.
THIS SHOULD RESULT IN AT LEAST SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS WITH
ISOLATED STRONG TO MINIMALLY SEVERE STORMS POSSIBLE IN THE
AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING. 

MUCH COOLER TEMPS FOR THE WEEKEND AS ADVERTISED...BUT THE MOISTURE
DRIES OUT VERY QUICKLY ON SATURDAY SUCH THAT I ONLY ADDED A FEW
AREAS OF SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SW VA ON SATURDAY. 

OTHERWISE...12Z MOS GUIDANCE IN GOOD AGREEMENT AND ALSO IN LINE
WITH PREVIOUS MIN/MAX TEMP GRIDS. IF THE WINDS DIE DOWN ON SATURDAY
NIGHT...THEN PATCHY AREAS OF FROST ARE CERTAINLY POSSIBLE ON SUNDAY
MORNING ACROSS SW VA AND PARTS OF NE TN. THIS WAS HIGHLIGHTED IN
OUR HWO PRODUCT. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER TROUGH 
AMPLIFIES AND CLOSES OFF OVER SOUTH CENTRAL CANADA AND THE GREAT 
LAKES REGION WITH SEVERAL SHORTER WAVELENGTH FEATURES ROTATING 
AROUND THE CLOSED LOW THROUGH ABOUT TUESDAY. THE MODELS INDICATE THE 
MOST SIGNIFICANT OF THESE PRESSURE TROUGHS WILL IMPACT THE FORECAST 
AREA BEGINNING EARLY MONDAY WITH THE BEST LIFT AND HIGHEST MEAN RH 
IN PLACE ABOUT MONDAY NIGHT INTO MID DAY TUESDAY. TIMING AND 
LOCATION OF BEST LIFT STILL NOT DEALT WITH SIMILARLY BY 
GFS/ECMWF/CMC SO TWEAKED POPS UP A TAD FOR THIS PERIOD OF THE 
FORECAST AWAITING BETTER MODEL AGREEMENT. FOLLOWING THIS SEGMENT OF 
INCLEMENT WEATHER IT APPEARS HIGHER PRESSURES AND DRIER AIR WILL 
BUILD INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ALLOWING A PLEASANT 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.

AT TRI CITIES. CLOUDS INCREASE TONIGHT AS HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS EAST
AND MOISTURE IS ADVECTED FROM THE GULF. AIR MASS STILL MOSTLY

NE JET SEGMENT WILL MOVE INTO THE MID TN VALLEY EARLY FRIDAY. 
DEEPENING SURFACE LOW RACING NORTHWARD THROUGH GREAT LAKES.  
DEVELOPING CONVECTION IN MS WILL MOVE INTO THE E TN VALLEY EARLY 
FRIDAY. INSTABILITY PARAMETERS LOOKING SLIGHTLY BETTER IN 02/00Z 
MODEL RUNS WHILE REMAINING BELOW MODERATE LEVELS. HELICITY VALUES 
ALSO INCHING UPWARD. BULK SHEAR REMAINS NEAR 40 KTS. DAMAGING WINDS 
REMAINS MAIN THREAT WITH MORNING CONVECTION FAVORING S HALF OF MRX 
CWA. BEGINNING TO LIKE NAM SOLUTION OF EARLY ROUND OF CONVECTION 
FOLLOWED BY A LATER ROUND ASSOCIATED WITH THE COLD FRONT. TIMING OF 
COLD FRONT LOOKS A BIT SLOWER ARRIVING LATE IN THE DAY. BACK SIDE 
STRONG JET SEGMENT CARVING UPPER TROUGH WILL BE MOVING INTO MIDDLE 
TN IN THE AFTERNOON HOURS. ADDITIONAL LIFT WILL LIKELY PROLONG 
CONVECTION ALONG FRONT AS THIS ROUND MOVES INTO THE AREA IN THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS AND CONTINUES INTO THE EVENING. UPPER TROUGH AXIS 
MOVES THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY FOLLOWED BY STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION. 
LOWERING FREEZING LEVEL AND SUB 0C H85 TEMPERATURES DEPICTED NE OF 
KNOXVILLE. WIDESPREAD TEMPERATURES FROM 35 TO 40 A GOOD POSSIBILITY 
FOR SUNDAY MORNING WITH FREEZING TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. TRENDING MAX TEMPERATURES DOWN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD. UPPER TROUGH RELAXES INTO EARLY MONDAY BUT DEEPENS ONCE 
AGAIN THROUGH WEDNESDAY. LOW CHANCE OF SHOWERS EARLY NEXT WEEK IN 
ADVANCE OF APPROACHING TROUGH.

MVFR FOG AT TRI AS THE NEARBY LAKE MAY AID FOG DEVELOPMENT THERE.

FXUS64 KMRX 011905
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EDT WED OCT 1 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...QUITE A NICE AFTERNOON AFTER 
SOME PESKY MORNING FOG DISSIPATED...WITH TEMPS RUNNING QUITE MILD IN 
THE 70S TO MID 80S. ANOTHER MOSTLY CLEAR NIGHT WITH AREAS OF FOG
LIKELY TO DEVELOP IN THE VALLEYS...AND MAY BE LOCALLY DENSE AGAIN
NEAR BODIES OF WATER. PLACED THE FOG IN THE GRIDS MAINLY IN
ASSOCIATION WITH AREA LAKES WITH 1/4 MILE VISBY POSSIBLE. THE FOG
AND LOW CLOUD DEVELOPMENT LED ME TO GO CLOSER TO THE SLIGHTLY
MILDER NAM MOS MINS FOR TONIGHT.

FOG GIVES WAY TO SUNNY SKIES AGAIN ON THURSDAY. SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL 
FLOW SHOULD DEVELOP OVER WRN PARTS AND HIGHER TERRAIN BY THURSDAY 
AFTERNOON. THIS SHOULD SEND MAX TEMPS UP TO NEAR THE GFS MOS
VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WILL PULLING A FAIRLY STRONG COLD FRONT ACROSS THE AREA 
FRIDAY. DEEPENING UPPER TROUGH OVER THE MID-SECTION OF THE NATION 
SUPPORTED BY A TROPOPAUSE FOLD HELPING TO RAPIDLY INTENSIFYING CYCLO-
GENESIS WHICH RIDES QUICLY NORTHEAST INTO THE GREAT LAKES. STRONG 
UPPER JET WILL PLACE THE REGION UNDER THE FAVORED RIGHT ENTRANCE 
REGION OF THE JET WITH DIVERGENCE ALOFT OVER THE AREA FRIDAY 
MORNING. 

THE DIRECT CIRCULATION WITH THE JET WILL AID IN STRENGTHENING THE 
FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING WITH THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY FOR FRIDAY. 
INSTABILITY IS MARGINAL WITH CAPES NEAR 1000 J/KG...BUT WITH STRONG 
WINDS ALOFT AND FAVORABLE SHEAR...SOME OF THESE STORMS COULD BECOME 
SEVERE WITH THE MAIN THREAT BEING DAMAGING WINDS.

BEHIND UPPER JET/TROUGH AXIS...STRONG DRYING EXPECTED WITH A SHARP 
END OF THE CONVECTION AND CLOUDS FOR LATE FRIDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING.

ANOTHER ASPECT OF THE SYSTEM IS THE COLD AIR MOVING INTO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WITH 850MB TEMPERATURES DROPPING TO -1 TO -2 
DEGREES C FOR SATURDAY MORNING. FREEZING TEMPERATURES EXPECTED 
ACROSS THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS SATURDAY MORNING WITH PATCHY FROST 
POSSIBLE NORTHEAST AREAS AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS SUNDAY MORNING.

FOR THE MEDIMUM RANGE...GFS AND ECMWF HAVING A HARD TIME WITH TIMING 
AND STRENGTH OF WAVES MOVING DOWN IN WEST NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. WILL 
MAINTAIN LOW CHANCE POPS FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
403 AM EDT WED OCT 1 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...QUIET WEATHER PATTERN CONTINUES

OF HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES OVER THE EASTERN STATES WITH A WEAK
STATIONARY FRONT OVER THE NORTHEAST GULF AND ANOTHER WEAK FRONTAL
BOUNDARY OVER SOUTHEAST KY. SOME FOG HAS FORMED NEAR THIS FRONT IN
LEE COUNTY VA AND ALSO SOME IN SW NC AND THE SOUTHERN TN VALLEY...BUT
OVERALL DRIER AIR MASS EARLY TODAY. THE WEAK FRONT IS EXPECTED TO
STAY NEAR THE TN/KY BORDER TODAY THEN SLOWLY WASHOUT TONIGHT AS A
DEVELOPING FRONTAL SYSTEM TO THE WEST MOVES INTO THE NORTHERN MS
VALLEY AND SOUTHERN PLAINS. WITH DRY AIR MASS IN PLACE AND SUNNY
SKIES TEMPERATURES SHOULD WARM BACK INTO THE LOWER TO MID
80S...POSSIBLY A COUPLE DEGREES WARMER THAN TUESDAYS HIGHS.
FOLLOWED CLOSE TO THE MET/NAM GUIDANCE. TONIGHT...GOOD RADIATIONAL
COOLING WITH DRY AIR MASS STILL IN PLACE SO LOWERED MIN TEMPS FROM
CURRENT FORECAST AND AGAIN FOLLOWED CLOSE TO NAM/MET GUIDANCE. SOME
PATCHY DENSE FOG WILL FORM AGAIN...MAINLY NEAR BODIES OF WATER.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...ACTIVE PATTERN IN THE 
EXTENDED. VERY WARM TEMPERATURES CONTINUE THURSDAY...OCT 2 RECORD 
MAX AT TRI IS 85 IN 1986 AND WILL LIKELY BE MATCHED OR EXCEEDED. 
STRONG UPPER JET DIVES DOWN ROCKIES AND CATCHES UP WITH SOUTHERN 
SHORT WAVE EARLY FRIDAY. STRENGTHENING JET EAST OF THE TROUGH 
EXTENDS THROUGH THE TN VALLEY INTO THE GREAT LAKES. STRONGER DIGGING 
JET SWINGS THROUGH WESTERN TN VALLEY INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. NATION 
SPANNING N-S SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL BE NEAR NASHVILLE AROUND 03/12Z 
FRIDAY MORNING. ONGOING CONVECTION AHEAD OF THE FRONT WILL MOVE INTO 
THE MRX CWA THURSDAY NIGHT AND CONTINUE TO MOVE THROUGH THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS ON FRIDAY. CONVECTIVE PARAMETERS WHICH ARE FAVORABLE 
WEST OF THE AREA THURSDAY NIGHT ARE LESS IMPRESSIVE THIS FAR EAST AS 
CONVECTION ARRIVES. WIND SHEAR IS MODERATE AND STRONG GUSTY WINDS 
AND HEAVY DOWNPOURS LIKELY. ISOLATED SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE 
BUT THREAT IS LOW AT THIS TIME. MODELS TRENDING TOWARD STRONG CAA 
BEHIND FRONT THROUGH THE WEEKEND. UPPER TROUGH DIGS DEEPLY THROUGH 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND TILTS NEGATIVELY OFF THE MID ATLANTIC 
COAST BY SUNDAY. SUNDAY MORNING TEMPERATURES WILL BE WELL BELOW 
NORMAL WITH POCKETS OF UPPER 30S POSSIBLE ACROSS NE AREAS. NEAR 
FREEZING ACROSS THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS NOT OUT OF THE QUESTION. AN 
IMPULSE IN THE MEAN TROUGH APPROACHES FROM THE NW ON MONDAY AND 
RECARVES THE UPPER TROUGH BACK TOWARD THE APPALACHIANS. ISOLATED 
SHOWERS ARE POSSIBLE THROUGH TUESDAY.

TO RIDE OVER UPPER LEVEL RIDGING INFLUENCES. LATEST 12Z GUIDANCE
SUGGESTING MORNING FORECAST PACKAGE OVERNIGHT LOWS FOR TONIGHT
STILL IN LINE AND WILL LEAN ACCORDINGLY. CONTINUANCE OF UPPER LEVEL
RIDGING INFLUENCES WED THRU WED NIGHT WILL PROVIDE FOR MOCLR SKIES.
HIGHS ON WED WILL BE IN THE UPPER 70S SW VA TO MID 80S LOWER TN
VALLEY REGION. LOWS WED NIGHT WILL RANGE FROM THE MID TO UPPER 50S
SW VA TO LOWER 60S LOWER TN VALLEY REGION. EXPECT A GRADUAL INCREASE
IN CLOUDINESS AS THE DAY PROGRESSES ON THU AS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM
OVER S CNTRL CANADA DEEPENS WITH A COLD FRONT EXTENDING SWD TO A
SFC LOW ACROSS THE SRN PLAINS...WHICH IS EXPECTED TO MOVE SLOWLY
EWD. THIS WILL CONTINUE TO PUT THE TN VALLEY REGION IN A WAA PATTERN
WITH HIGHS ACROSS THE AREA MAINLY IN THE LOW TO MID 80S. SYSTEM MIGHT
BE A LITTLE SLOWER MOVING IN THAN PREVIOUSLY ANTICIPATED...AND HAVE
TAILORED WX AND EXPECTED POPS ACCORDINGLY WITH LOWS GENERALLY SPANNING
THE 60S.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...LOOKS LIKE THE BRUNT OF SHWR
AND SCT TSTM ACTIVITY WILL OCCUR ON FRI AS FRONTAL SYSTEM PUSHES
ACROSS THE TN VALLEY REGION WITH TEMPS MORE IN THE LINE WITH
SEASONABLE NORMAL VALUES. MAYBE SOME EVENING CONVECTION ACROSS THE
TN VALLEY ON FRI NIGHT...OTHERWISE EXPECT GENERALLY DRY NWLY FLOW
ALOFT WITH SFC RIDGING INFLUENCES FROM THE ROCKIES BUILDING INTO
THE MID STATE THRU THE WEEKEND. A WEAK SYSTEM LOOKS TO APPROACH THE
TN RIVER VALLEY ON MON BRINGING A CHANCE OF SHWRS AGAIN TO THE AREA
WITH RIDGING INFLUENCES AGAIN BUILDING INTO THE VALLEY BY THE MID
PORTION OF NEXT WEEK. TEMPS WILL CONTINUE TO TREND TOWARD SEASONABLE
NORMAL VALUES FROM THE WEEKEND THRU THE FIRST PART OF NEXT WEEK.

TERMINAL. FLIGHT CONDITIONS MAY EVEN DROP INTO AN VLIFR CATEGORY AT
TRI AROUND 08-12Z. WITH LIGHT WIND IN A HIGH PRESSURE ENVIRONMENT
TUESDAY MORNING...THE FOG MAY TAKE A COUPLE HOURS AFTER SUNRISE TO
LIFT OUT OF THE MVFR RANGE.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

552 
FXUS64 KMRX 291844
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
244 PM EDT MON SEP 29 2014

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND TUESDAY/...
CLOUDS ARE SLOWLY BEGINNING TO BREAK UP FROM WEST TO EAST AS A
WEAK UPPER-LEVEL DISTURBANCE CLEARS THE AREA. AS OF MID-AFTERNOON
ALL BUT FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND THE EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS
AND FOOTHILLS HAVE BECOME MOSTLY TO PARTLY SUNNY. THIS HAS ALLOWED
THE MERCURY TO CLIMB UP INTO THE UPPER 70S TO AROUND 80 DEGREES
ALONG THE PLATEAU AND PORTIONS OF THE SOUTHERN/CENTRAL VALLEYS.
THIS CLEARING WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE LATE AFTERNOON AND
EVENING...RESULTING IN A MOSTLY CLEAR SKY FOR THE FORECAST AREA
LATER TONIGHT. THOUGH MOST LOCATIONS DID NOT RECEIVE MUCH IN THE
WAY OF RAINFALL...A MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER COMBINED WITH THE
CLEAR/CALM CONDITIONS WILL RESULT IN WIDESPREAD PATCHY FOG
DEVELOPMENT /SOME PERHAPS LOCALLY DENSE AROUND DAYBREAK/. AS
SUCH...HAVE MAINTAINED THIS IN THE ZONES...AND MAY NEED TO MONITOR
THE POSSIBILITY OF A DENSE FOG ADVISORY LATER THIS EVENING SHOULD
CONDITIONS BECOME APPARENT THAT IS IT WARRANTED.

FOR TUESDAY...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BEGIN TO BUILD IN AND PROMOTE
MOSTLY SUNNY AND DRY CONDITIONS. THIS ABUNDANT SUNSHINE ALONG WITH
INCREASED THICKNESS VALUES/TEMPERATURES ALOFT WILL ALLOW FOR
WIDESPREAD HIGHS IN THE LOWER 80S BY THE LATE AFTERNOON ACROSS THE
CENTRAL/SOUTHERN VALLEYS...WITH UPPER 70S EXPECTED OVER SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA.

.LONG TERM /TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY/...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE OVER THE SOUTHEAST CONUS TO START THE 
PERIOD...THEN THE HIGH WILL SHIFT EASTWARD TO THE COAST ON THURSDAY. 
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS CAN BE EXPECTED BOTH DAYS UNDER MOSTLY SUNNY 
SKIES. 

A S-SW FLOW WILL ADVECT MOISTURE INTO THE AREA BEGINNING 
THURSDAY...WITH PRECIP DEVELOPING NRN AL/GA IN THE AFTERNOON. STRONG 
LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER JET ENTRANCE REGION AND POTENT 500 MB 
VORT MAX WILL BRING LIKELY POPS AND A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS LATE 
THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY MORNING. WHILE FORCING SHOWN BY THE GFS 
LOOKS STRONG...OVERNIGHT TIMING AND LACK OF INSTABILITY SHOULD 
PROBABLY MEAN A LOW THREAT OF SEVERE. THE ECMWF IS A BIT FASTER THAN 
THE GFS TO MOVE OUT PRECIP...AND THE LATEST GFS CONTINUES TO TREND 
FASTER FROM PREVIOUS RUNS...SO WILL TREND POPS DOWNWARD A LITTLE 
FASTER THAN PREVIOUSLY FORECAST...ENDING FRIDAY NIGHT. 

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND A BROAD UPPER TROUGH WILL PROVIDE A COOL 
AND DRY AIR MASS FOR THE WEEKEND...WITH HIGHS IN THE 60S TO LOWER 
70S AND LOWS IN THE 40S TO LOWER 50S. THE GFS BRINGS A WEAK 
DISTURBANCE IN THE NW FLOW NEAR OUR NORTHERN SECTIONS ON 
MONDAY...BUT CONFIDENCE IS LOW THAT THIS WILL ACTUALLY OCCUR...SO 
WILL GO DRY ON MONDAY WITH TEMPS REBOUNDING TO NEAR NORMAL.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             59  84  59  84 /  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  58  82  57  82 /  10  10   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       58  83  56  82 /  10  10   0   0

.DISCUSSION...
A BROAD UPPER-TROUGH IS SWEEPING THROUGH THE REGION THIS
MORNING...AND WILL USHER OUT THE LAST OF THE ISOLATED TO SCATTERED
LIGHT SHOWERS ALONG THE FOOTHILLS AND MOUNTAINS BY EARLY THIS
AFTERNOON. IN ITS WAKE...DRIER AIR IS QUICKLY MOVING INTO THE
REGION...ALLOWING FOR SOME PARTIAL CLEARING AND THE EROSION OF THE
LOW STRATUS SHIELD PRESENTLY IN PLACE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY.
THINK THAT THIS CLEARING WILL BE GRADUAL AND OCCUR THROUGHOUT THE
DAY FROM WEST TO EAST...SO HAVE BEEN CAUTIOUS IN THE UPDATE TO MOVE
THINGS ALONG TOO QUICKLY. HOWEVER...DO THINK THAT PARTLY/MOSTLY
SUNNY CONDITIONS OVER A GOOD PORTION OF THE AREA SEEM LIKELY BY
21Z...AND POSSIBLY SOONER OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND PORTIONS
OF THE SOUTHERN/CENTRAL VALLEY. THIS MAY ALLOW HIGH TEMPERATURES TO
CREEP A DEGREE OR TWO HIGHER THAN PREVIOUS THOUGHT...SO HAVE BUMPED
THEN UP SLIGHTLY IN THOSE AREAS AS WELL. THE OTHER CHANGE WAS TO
PULL POPS BACK AS WELL...AND TAPER THEM OFF FROM WEST TO EAST BY
MIDDAY THROUGH THE AFTERNOON.

REST OF TONIGHT...BUT WILL KEEP LIKELY POPS GOING FOR THE MOUNTAIN
ZONES. OTHERWISE...THE REST OF THE FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO
BE ON TRACK...AND WILL MAINLY JUST REMOVE ANY EVENING PRECIP WORDING.

.AVIATION...AN UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE EAST FROM THE GREAT
LAKES/MIDWEST TO THE APPALACHIAN SPINE THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD.
AT THE SAME TIME...A MOISTURE LADEN DISTURBANCE BUILDS EAST
NORTHEAST OUT OF THE GULF OF MEXICO ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST ATLANTIC
STATES. THE MODELS INDICATE THE PRESENCE OF A LOW LEVEL TROUGH
WHICH EXTENDS ACROSS THE GREAT VALLEY AT THE START OF THE FORECAST
PERIOD EXTENDING UNTIL AROUND 18Z MONDAY. DUE TO THE SOUTHERN ROUTE
OF THE THE GULF DISTURBANCE AND THE EASTERLY FLOW WITHIN THE WEAK
INVERTED LOW LEVEL TROUGH...IT APPEARS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL BE
IN SHORT SUPPLY...ESPECIALLY AT TYS AND TRI. THEREFORE...FLIGHT
CONDITION SHOULD REMAIN VFR AT THESE TERMINALS WITH A POSSIBILITY
FOR A COUPLE DROPS OF RAIN AROUND TYS AROUND 12-17Z MONDAY. THERE
WILL BE A LITTLE BETTER CHANCE FOR SOME MEASURABLE RAINFALL AROUND
09-15Z AT CHA BUT PROBABILITY STILL LOW ENOUGH TO KEEP THIS ACTION
IN THE VICINITY OF THE TERMINAL. AFTER THE SOUTHEAST FEATURE MOVES
AWAY ON MONDAY...WOULD EXPECT LOWER CEILINGS TO IMPROVE FOR THE
LAST SIX TO EIGHT HOURS OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

216 
FXUS64 KMRX 281914
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 PM EDT SUN SEP 28 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...THE BIG STORY THROUGH 
THE SHORT TERM IS THE DWINDLING CHANCES FOR ANY SUBSTANTIAL PRECIP. 
THINGS KEEP TRENDING DRIER WITH EACH PASSING MODEL RUN. WE STILL 
HAVE THE INCOMING UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OUT OF THE NW AND THE LOW 
COMING NORTH UP OUT OF THE GULF. HOWEVER...IT SEEMS LIKE THE TROUGH 
WILL HELP TO STEER THE LOW TO THE SE OF US FOR THE MOST PART...THUS 
LIMITING THE CHANCES FOR ANY SIGNIFICANT PRECIP. 

THE BEST CHANCES FOR RAIN NOW LOOK TO START LATE TONIGHT INTO 
TOMORROW MORNING AND CONTINUE INTO THE AFTERNOON HOURS AS THE UPPER 
LEVEL TROUGH SWINGS THROUGH ARE AREA. ACCOMPANYING THE TROUGH IS A 
60 TO 70KT 300MB JET THAT WILL HELP TO GENERATE SHOWERS DUE TO UPPER 
LEVEL DIVERGENCE THAT WILL SPREAD ACROSS THE AREA. ALSO PUT IN A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS TOMORROW AFTERNOON DUE TO A COUPLE 
HUNDRED J/KG CAPE SHOWING UP IN THE NAM SOUNDINGS.

PRECIP TOTALS THROUGH THE SHORT TERM LOOK UNIMPRESSIVE COMPARED TO 
WHAT THE MODELS WERE PREVIOUSLY SHOWING ACROSS PARTS OF OUR AREA. 
HIGHEST PRECIP TOTALS SHOULD BE ALONG THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS 
AND DOWN INTO SWNC BUT STILL THESE LOCATIONS WILL ONLY SEE AMOUNTS 
OF THREE TO FOUR TENTHS OF INCH OR LESS. OTHER LOCATIONS ACROSS THE 
CWA MAY SEE A TENTH OR TWO. OVERNIGHT LOWS TONIGHT SHOULD BE A FEW 
DEGREES WARMER DUE TO INCREASED CLOUD COVER. TOMORROWS TEMPS WILL BE 
SIMILAR TO TODAYS.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A FAIRLY BENIGN FORECAST 
FOR THE EARLY TO MIDDLE PART OF NEXT WEEK AS AN UPPER-RIDGE AXIS
BEGINS TO BUILD INTO THE REGION MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY...AND
WILL PERSIST THROUGH THURSDAY. MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER CONDITIONS WILL
LIKELY RESULT IN SOME WIDESPREAD PATCHY FOG LATE MONDAY NIGHT.
BUT...WITH THE RIDGE BUILDING IN MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS WILL
PREVAIL BY MID-MORNING ON TUESDAY ONCE DAYTIME HEATING COMMENCES.
THE MOSTLY SUNNY/DRY CONDITIONS WILL ALLOW HIGH TEMPERATURES TO
RECOVER BACK INTO THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S THROUGH THURSDAY. LATE
THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY ANOTHER MORE POTENT FAST- MOVING UPPER-
LEVEL TROUGH/COLD FRONT WILL SWING THROUGH THE AREA...BRINGING A
GOOD CHANCE FOR SOME SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. HOWEVER...MORE
SIGNIFICANTLY...MUCH COOLER AIR WILL FOLLOW AS HIGHS IN THE UPPER
60S AND LOWER 70S WILL BE COMMON THIS WEEKEND AS THIS COOL/DRY
AUTUMN AIR MASS MOVES INTO THE REGION IN ITS WAKE.


&&

901 
FXUS64 KMRX 271922
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
322 PM EDT SAT SEP 27 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...STILL EXPECTING A QUIET
SHORT TERM BUT CHANGES ON THE WAY. OUR HIGH PRESSURE THAT HAS
IMPACTED OUR WEATHER OVER THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS FINALLY MOVES OFF
TO OUR NE OVERNIGHT. THIS WILL RESULT IN MID AND LOW LEVEL FLOW
SHIFTING TO THE SOUTH SOUTHEAST OUT AHEAD OF A WEAK APPROACHING
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH FROM THE NW AND A WEAK LOW COMING NORTH OUT OF
THE GULF ON SUNDAY.

THE SOUTH SOUTHEAST FLOW WILL HELP TO INCREASE MOISTURE ACROSS OUR 
AREA AND SLOWLY BEGIN TO ERODE THE DRY AIR OBSERVED IN THE 
SOUNDINGS. THIS WILL TAKE SOME TIME THOUGH SO IT LOOKS LIKE WE WILL 
STAY DRY THROUGH MOST OF THE SHORT TERM BUT WITH RAIN CHANCES
INCREASING THROUGH OUT THE DAY ON SUNDAY FROM SOUTH TO NORTH AS THE
LOW APPROACHES FROM THE SOUTH.
 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE ABOVE NORMAL TONIGHT AND NEAR NORMAL TOMORROW.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...AN UPPER-LEVEL 
DISTURBANCE WILL MOVE THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT
INTO MONDAY...BRINGING THE AREA A GOOD CHANCE FOR WIDESPREAD
PRECIPITATION IN WELL OVER A WEEK. STILL SOME QUESTION WITH THE
LOCATION OF THE BEST LIFT AND THUS HEAVIEST PRECIPITATION BANDS.
THE NAM IS NOW TRENDING A LITTLE MORE TO THE SOUTH AND EAST WITH
THE EARLIER RUNS OF THE GFS...AND IS REALLY FAVORING THE SOUTHERN
VALLEY...AND EAST TENNESSEE/WEST NORTH CAROLINA MOUNTAINS.
THUS...HAVE THE CATEGORICAL POPS ORIENTED THIS WAY LATE SUNDAY
NIGHT INTO MONDAY MORNING...BEFORE TAPERING THEM OFF WEST TO EAST
MONDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING. AS THE PRECIPITATION ENDS MONDAY
NIGHT...CLEARING WILL OCCUR BY TUESDAY AND AN UPPER-RIDGE AXIS WILL
BUILD IN BRIEFLY THROUGH THURSDAY. THE SUNSHINE/DRY CONDITIONS WILL
ALLOW HIGH TEMPERATURES TO RECOVER BACK INTO THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER
80S. ANOTHER MORE POTENT UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM WILL THEN TRACK
TOWARD THE OHIO VALLEY LATE IN THE WEEK...WHICH MAY BRING A
STRONGER FRONT AND MORE CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND STORMS HEADING INTO
A FRIDAY...FOLLOWED BY MUCH COOLER AIRS AS HIGHS IN THE UPPER 60S
MAY BE COMMON BY NEXT WEEKEND.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             65  79  63  77 /  10  40  70  60 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  62  78  63  74 /  10  20  80  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       61  79  61  74 /  10  20  70  60 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              55  78  58  70 /  10  20  80  70

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EDT SAT SEP 27 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS IN 
PLACE DOWN THE APPALACHIANS. UPPER LEVEL SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW 
INCREASES TONIGHT. HIGH CLOUDINESS WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE E TN 
VALLEY. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
SLIDING ALONG SOUTHERN EDGE OF SURFACE RIDGE COULD TRIGGER A FEW 
LIGHT SHOWERS NEAR THE GA BORDER. EXPECTED COVERAGE IS TOO LOW FOR 
ZONE FORECAST MENTION.  
 
.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MAIN FOCUS OF THE EXTENDED WILL 
BE A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVING IN FROM THE GULF EARLY IN THE 
EXTENDED. MOISTURE WILL PUSH IN ON SUNDAY WITH A LARGE BAND OF 
SHOWERS NUDGING INTO SOUTHERN AREAS LATE IN THE DAY.  A FEW 
THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE...MAINLY OVER SOUTHERN LOCATIONS INTO 
SUNDAY EVENING.  PRECIP WILL SPREAD NORTHWARD SUNDAY NIGHT FOR 
LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS.  RAIN MAY BE HEAVY AT TIMES.  SHOWERS 
WILL CONTINUE INTO MONDAY...SLOWLY PULLING AWAY MONDAY AFTERNOON 
INTO THE EVENING.  GFS HINTING AT PULLING IN ANOTHER LOBE OF 
MOISTURE THROUGH ON TUESDAY.  CONFIDENCE LOW ON THIS BUT WILL ADD 
SOME LOW POPS OVER MUCH OF THE REGION INTO TUESDAY.  WILL BE BETWEEN 
SYSTEMS WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...HOWEVER...MODELS DO HOLD IN SOME 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE.  FOR NOW WILL LEAVE THE AREA DRY...BUT WILL 
MONITOR AND MAY EVENTUALLY NEED TO ADD SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS.  THE 
NEXT SYSTEM...A COLD FRONT MOVING IN FROM THE WEST...IS PROGGED INTO 
THE REGION ON FRIDAY FOR ANOTHER ROUND OF CONVECTION.

709 
FXUS64 KMRX 261909
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
309 PM EDT FRI SEP 26 2014

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND SATURDAY/...
NOT MUCH CHANGE FROM PREVIOUS FORECAST. HIGH PRESSURE STILL IN
CONTROL TONIGHT BUT WILL START SHIFTING NORTHEAST OUT OF THE AREA
ON SATURDAY. AS THE HIGH MOVES NORTHEAST...MID AND LOW LEVEL FLOW
ACROSS OUR AREA WILL START TO SHIFT TO THE SOUTH SOUTHEAST. LOWS
OVERNIGHT WILL BE A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES
AGAIN TOMORROW WITH HIGH TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL.

.LONG TERM /SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY/...
AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE WILL LIFT OUT OF THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI
VALLEY AND MERGE WITH ANOTHER BROAD TROUGH SWINGING THROUGH THE
OHIO VALLEY ON SUNDAY. THIS WILL BRING NORTH GULF MOISTURE AND GIVE
THE AREA THE FIRST CHANCE AT WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION IN MORE THAN
A WEEK. THERE ARE STILL DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE MODELS ON THE
TIMING AND TRACK OF THE BANDS OF PRECIPITATION ASSOCIATED WITH THIS
STORM SYSTEM. THE GFS STILL FAVORS A MORE SOUTHEASTERLY TRACK WHICH
WOULD PLACE A BULK OF THE HEAVIEST PRECIPITATION ALONG THE FAR
SOUTHERN ZONES AND ALONG AND EAST OF THE GREAT SMOKY MOUNTAINS
SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. THE NAM STILL MAINTAINS A SLIGHTLY
EARLIER AND MORE NORTHERLY TRACK. THIS PLACES MORE WIDESPREAD
LOCALLY HEAVY PRECIPITATION ACROSS THE REGION SUNDAY EVENING/NIGHT
THROUGH MIDDAY MONDAY...BEFORE TAPERING OFF THAT AFTERNOON/EVENING.

AT ANY RATE...THINK THE MOST FAVORED AREAS FOR RAINFALL WILL BE THE
SOUTHERN/CENTRAL VALLEYS AND THE EAST TENNESSEE/WEST NORTH CAROLINA
MOUNTAINS. HAVE DONE A BLEND OF THE MODELS...AND ORIENTED THE POPS
AS SUCH /WITH THE HIGHEST POPS SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH 18Z MONDAY/.
GIVEN THE AFOREMENTIONED MODEL DIFFERENCES THOUGH...HAVE HELD OFF
ON ANYTHING HIGHER THAN LIKELY TO HIGH-END CHANCE FOR NOW. AS THE
PRECIPITATION TAPERS OFF MONDAY NIGHT...CLEARING WILL OCCUR BY
TUESDAY AND THE AMPLE SUNSHINE SHOULD ALLOW FOR SOME DRYING AND
HIGH TEMPERATURES TO RECOVER BACK INTO THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S
THROUGH THURSDAY AS A RIDGE BUILDS IN. ANOTHER MORE POTENT UPPER-
LEVEL STORM SYSTEM WILL THEN TRACK TOWARD THE OHIO VALLEY LATE IN
THE WEEK...WHICH MAY BRING A STRONGER FRONT AND MORE CHANCES FOR
SHOWERS AND STORMS HEADING INTO A FRIDAY/SATURDAY TIME FRAME.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
247 PM EDT THU SEP 25 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL BE CENTERED TO OUR NORTH AND NORTHEAST.  A WEAK INVERTED 
SURFACE TROUGH WILL LINGER OVER OUR AREA...BUT NOT MUCH MOISTURE OR

TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE FOR THE MOST PART...SO JUST SOME MINOR TWEAKS. 

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...AFTER ANOTHER
MOSTLY SUNNY AND WARM/DRY SATURDAY...A BROAD AREA OF LOW PRESSURE
WILL DIG OUT OF THE SOUTHWESTERN GULF COAST SATURDAY NIGHT. THIS
WILL INCREASE MOISTURE ACROSS THE REGION AND GIVE THE AREA THE
FIRST CHANCE AT WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION IN MORE THAN A WEEK THIS
SUNDAY. THOUGH THERE ARE DIFFERENCES IN TIMING/COVERAGE WITH THE
MODEL GUIDANCE...THE MOST FAVORED AREAS WILL BE THE CENTRAL AND
SOUTHERN VALLEYS...ALONG WITH SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. THIS
ACTIVITY IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY OVERSPREAD THE REGION SUNDAY
AFTERNOON AND INCREASE/CONTINUE OVERNIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING.
ALONG WITH THE MOISTURE/PRECIPITATION...THIS BROAD TROUGH WILL
BRING IN SOME COOLER AIR WHICH WILL DROP HIGH TEMPERATURES BACK
INTO THE LOWER 70S. AS THE SYSTEM PULLS AWAY FROM THE AREA MONDAY
NIGHT... CLEARING/DRYING WILL BEGIN TO OCCUR...AND BY TUESDAY A
WEAK UPPER- RIDGE WILL START TO MOVE BACK IN. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR
MOSTLY FAIR WEATHER TUESDAY-THURSDAY WITH A SLIGHT WARMING TREND
BACK INTO THE UPPER 70S/LOWER 80S.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT THU SEP 25 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ONCE AGAIN TODAY ALL THE ACTION 
WILL BE EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS WITH RELATIVELY DRY AND STABLE AIR 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA COMPLIMENTS OF SUBSIDENCE WITHIN A RIDGE OF 
HIGH PRESSURE AND DOWNSLOPING EASTERLY FLOW CROSSING THE MOUNTAINS. 
SPEAKING OF THE MOUNTAINS THERE MAY BE A SPRINKLE OVER THE RIDGES 
ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER WITH ATLANTIC MOISTURE BENEFITING 
FROM OROGRAPHIC LIFT. SUNSHINE SHOULD BOOST HIGH TEMPERATURES 
ANOTHER DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE WEDNESDAY MAXES WITH 70S ACROSS MUCH OF 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND LOWER 80S COMMON ACROSS MUCH OF THE REMAINDER 
OF THE FORECAST AREA.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...THE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE OVER 
THE GREAT LAKES THAT WILL PROVIDE DRY AND MILD CONDITIONS THROUGH 
THE END OF THE WEEK WILL SLOWLY DRIFT EAST...WHILE LOW PRESSURE 
DEVELOPS OVER THE LOWER MS VALLEY REGION. THE RESULTING S-SE FLOW 
THROUGH A DEEP LAYER WILL ADVECT MOISTURE INTO SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF 
THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT. THE LOW WILL TRACK SLOWLY NE...MOVING INTO 
THE TN VALLEY REGION BY SUNDAY NIGHT. THE NAM REMAINS FASTER THAN 
THE GFS TO BRING IN PRECIP...BUT IT APPEARS TO BE TRENDING A LITTLE 
SLOWER THAN PREVIOUS RUNS...SO WILL KEEP TIMING PRETTY CLOSE TO WHAT 
WAS PREVIOUSLY FORECAST. HIGHEST POPS...UP TO LIKELY IN SOUTHERN 
AREAS...WILL BE IN THE SUNDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME WHEN JET POSITIONING 
BECOMES MOST FAVORABLE FOR UPPER DIVERGENCE. WILL ALSO ADD A SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF TSTMS SOUTH GIVEN THE GOOD DIVERGENCE ALOFT AND 850 THETA-
E ADVECTION. THE GFS AND ECMWF ARE IN BETTER AGREEMENT NOW WITH THE 
SLOW EXIT OF THE SYSTEM MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY...AND WILL HAVE 
POPS TAPERING DOWN TO A SLIGHT CHANCE THROUGH TUESDAY. WE SHOULD 
HAVE A RIDGE BUILDING OVER THE AREA TO PROVIDE DRY WEATHER AGAIN BY 
WEDNESDAY.

SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN THESE AREAS.  WEAK UPPER LOW WILL PULL AWAY 
THURSDAY...WITH MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS FOR MUCH OF THE AREA.  MAV 
TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE SO WILL STAY CLOSE. 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE AT 
THE SURFACE TO CONTINUE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY BUT MODELS 
STILL HINTING AT WEAK UPPER TROUGH EAST COAST TO CAUSE EASTERLY FLOW 
EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS AND POSSIBLY SOME CLOUDS. NAM MODEL TRIES 
TO BRING MOISTURE WITH SHOWERS NORTHWEST FROM THE ATLANTIC ALL THE 
WAY TO THE MOUNTAINS THURSDAY NIGHT AND EVEN INTO THE SOUTHERN 
VALLEY BY FRIDAY MORNING. THEN EVEN MORE MOISTURE AND SHOWERS FRIDAY 
NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. THINK ITS OVERDONE WITH MAV/ECMWF MODELS 
KEEPING DEEPER MOISTURE FARTHER EAST AND MORE REPRESENTATIVE WITH 
DRIER AIR MASS AND HIGH PRESSURE WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY. NEXT MAJOR SYSTEM TO BEGIN TO AFFECT THE REGION LATE 
SATURDAY NIGHT OR SUNDAY. ECMWF TO BRING SURFACE LOW OUT OF CENTRAL 
GULF AND SOUTHERLY FLOW TO INCREASE CLOUDS OVER FORECAST AREA SUNDAY 
WITH CHANCE OF SHOWERS SPREADING NORTH BY LATE IN DAY AND OVERNIGHT. 
MONDAY THIS SYSTEM BEGINS TO MOVE NORTHEAST OVER SE STATES WITH 
LARGE SHIELD OF CLOUDS AND SHOWERS TO AFFECT THE TN VALLEY AND 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE SYSTEM SHOULD MOVE SLOWLY ACROSS THE 
REGION MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY AND THEN EAST WEDNESDAY WITH 
IMPROVING CONDITIONS. ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE THUNDER FOR AFTERNOON AND 
EARLY EVENING MONDAY AND TUESDAY. FOLLOWED COOLER MAV LOWS THURSDAY 
NIGHT AND FRIDAY NIGHT. HIGHS ABOVE AVERAGE FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY 
COOLING SOME SUNDAY WITH MORE CLOUDS. STILL WARM MONDAY AND TUESDAY 
AND SLIGHTLY COOLER WEDNESDAY AS SYSTEM PULLS OUT TO THE NORTHEAST.

FXUS64 KMRX 240720
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EDT WED SEP 24 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE MIGRATES 
NORTH ACROSS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH LITTLE 
IMPACT ON THE FORECAST AREA DUE TO MORE THAN ADEQUATE RIDGING AND 
SUBSIDENCE OVER THE MID SOUTH. IN ADDITION...PREVAILING LOWER LEVEL 
EASTERLY FLOW ARGUES AGAINST MUCH IN THE WAY OF CLOUD COVER BELOW 
700 MB. MODELS DO GENERATE SOME SCT TO EVEN BKN AC JUST WEST OF THE 
APPALACHIAN SPINE. THIS WOULD IMPACT MAINLY SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE LATER IN THE DAY INTO THE OVERNIGHT PERIOD AS 
THE LOW PRESSURE CENTER DRIFTS NORTH. AM SKEPTICAL ABOUT THE 
POSSIBILITY OF PRECIP LATER TONIGHT BUT HELD ONTO A SLIGHT CHANCE 
FOR A SHOWER OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN ALONG THE APPALACHIAN BORDER 
COUNTRY WHERE THERE WILL BE SOME OROGRAPHIC LIFT. STAYED CLOSE TO 
GUIDANCE BLEND FOR MAX AND MIN TEMPS.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...SOME SHOWERS MAY LINGER INTO 
THURSDAY IN EXTREME NORTHEAST PORTIONS OF THE AREA AS LOW PRESSURE 
TRACKS UP THE ATLANTIC SEABOARD...AND WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE POP 
IN THAT AREA THROUGH THE DAY. OTHERWISE...THE END OF THE WEEK LOOKS 
DRY WITH A WARMING TREND CONTINUING...WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 70S TO 
MID 80S FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.

SOME SIGNIFICANT MODEL DIFFERENCES DEVELOP BETWEEN THE 
GFS...NAM...AND ECMWF BEGINNING SATURDAY NIGHT. ALL SHOW A CLOSED 
LOW DEVELOPING OVER THE PLAINS...BUT THE NAM IS VERY QUICK TO SPREAD 
GULF MOISTURE INTO OUR AREA AS EARLY AS SATURDAY. THE GFS BRINGS 
PRECIP INTO SOUTHERN AREAS LATE SUNDAY...WITH THE ECMWF DOING THE 
SAME SUNDAY NIGHT. WILL FOLLOW THIS SLOWER SOLUTION...WHICH IS MORE 
IN LINE WITH MOST ENSEMBLE MEMBERS. THIS CLOSED LOW IS SLOW TO MOVE 
EAST AS IT BECOMES AN OPEN WAVE...WHICH WILL KEEP POPS IN THE AREA 
THROUGH MONDAY. THE SLOWER ECMWF KEEPS PRECIP INTO TUESDAY...BUT 
WILL TREND DOWN TO A SLIGHT CHANCE BASED ON THE DRIER GEFS MEAN 
SOLUTION. CLOUDS AND PRECIP SHOULD BRING AN END TO THE WARMING 
TREND...WITH HIGHS RETURNING TO THE 70S.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

379 
FXUS64 KMRX 230719
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 AM EDT TUE SEP 23 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
DRY AND CLEAR CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE AREA TODAY AS HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL BE POSITIONED OVER THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY. 
MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER THE CAROLINAS WILL 
STAY EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS. HIGH TEMPS TODAY UNDER FULL SUN SHOULD 
BE CLOSE TO YESTERDAY'S HIGHS...PERHAPS A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER...IN 
THE 70S IN MOST SPOTS OUTSIDE THE MOUNTAINS. COOL TEMPS IN THE 
UPPER 40S TO LOWER 50S CAN BE EXPECTED AGAIN TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...LOOKS LIKE AN EXTENDED DRY 
SPELL.  PICKING UP THE LONG TERM FORECAST STARTING 
WEDNESDAY...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE DOMINATING THE EASTERN 
U.S. CONTINUING THE FALL WEATHER.  USUALLY A HIGH WILL STAY OVER THE 
AREA FOR 2-3 DAYS...THEN AS IT MOVES EAST...THE SOUTHERLY RETURN 
FLOW BRINGS MOISTURE FROM THE GULF...BUT THIS TIME A LOW/TROUGH 
MOVING UP THE EAST COAST WILL WILL HAVE ITS COUNTERCLOCKWISE FLOW 
PUSHING NORTHEASTERLY WINDS FROM NY/PA AREA INTO OUR AREA...THAT 
REBUILDS THE HIGH PRESSURE AND KEEPS IT DRY HERE THROUGH THE END OF 
THE WEEK. LOOKS LIKE SUNDAY AT THE EARLIEST BEFORE WE CAN GET A 
CHANCE AT GETTING SOME LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TO START HEADING TOWARD 
THE AREA...AND SOME ENSEMBLE MEMBERS DON'T START THE RETURN FLOW 
UNTIL RIGHT ABOUT THE END OF THIS FORECAST PERIOD.  

WILL CONTINUE THE MENTION OF LOCALIZED FOG IN THE LATE NIGHT AND 
EARLY MORNING...DUE TO STEAM FOG BEING PRODUCED AS THE COLD AIR 
RIDES OVER THE WARM LAKES.

FOR TEMPS...WENT ON THE LOW SIDE OF GUIDANCE FOR MOST OF THE MAX 
TEMPS...MINS LOOKED GOOD OVERALL...BUMPED UP THE MIN NEXT MONDAY 
NIGHT AS DECENT CHANCES OF MOISTURE AND AN INCREASE IN BLANKETING 
CLOUDS ACROSS THE AREA SHOULD LIMIT RADIATIONAL COOLING.  FOR DEW 
POINTS...WENT ON THE DRY SIDE OVERALL...LOOKS LIKE WE WILL HAVE A 
DRY FETCH FOR MOST OF THE WEEK...DIDN'T SEE ANY REASON FOR THE 
MOISTURE TO REBOUND AS MUCH AS THE MODELS/MOS SUGGEST.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

859 PM EDT MON SEP 22 2014

.DISCUSSION...
IN THE WAKE OF A COLD FRONT THAT DROPPED THROUGH THE REGION EARLY
THIS MORNING...MUCH COOLER/DRIER AIR HAS FILTERED INTO THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND TENNESSEE VALLEY. WITH A DOME OF HIGH
PRESSURE BUILDING IN...A CLEAR SKY HAS PROMOTED GOOD RADIATIONAL
COOLING THIS EVENING...AS TEMPS HAVE FALLEN WELL INTO THE MID 50S
TO LOWER 60S AS OF 9 PM EDT. WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE MID TO UPPER
40S...LOWS SHOULD HAVE NO PROBLEM BOTTOMING OUT IN THE MID 40S TO
LOWER 50S ACROSS MOST OF THE VALLEY LOCATIONS BY EARLY TUESDAY
MORNING. IN ADDITION...THE CLEAR CONDITIONS ALONG WITH THE COOLER
AIR TEMPS AND WARM WATER TEMPS WILL ALLOW FOR A GOOD SETUP FOR FOG
DEVELOPMENT ALONG AREA LAKES/RIVERS TONIGHT. THUS...HAVE ADDED THIS
TO THE ZONES...THOUGH THINK NORTHERLY WINDS WILL BE JUST PERSISTENT
ENOUGH FROM MAKING THIS FOG DEVELOPMENT TOO WIDESPREAD.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
239 AM EDT MON SEP 22 2014

.SHORT TERM...

EVENING. FALLING TEMPS AT 500 MB UNDER THE TROUGH COULD RESULT IN
SOME INSTABILITY AND CU DEVELOPMENT TODAY...MAINLY NORTH...BUT NO
PRECIP IS EXPECTED. AT THE SURFACE...DRY AND COOLER AIR WILL
CONTINUE TO FILTER IN FROM THE NORTH. HIGHS WILL RANGE FROM THE
UPPER 70S SOUTH WHERE SUN WILL BE MORE ABUNDANT...TO LOWER 70S
NORTH WHERE MORE CLOUDS ARE EXPECTED. TONIGHT WILL BE CLEAR AND
NEARLY CALM WITH HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE OHIO VALLEY...ALLOWING LOW
TEMPS TO FALL INTO THE 40S AND LOWER 50S.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN THROUGH THE END OF THE WORK WEEK. MOSTLY
CLEAR SKIES AND DRY WEATHER WILL BE PRESENT EACH DAY...WITH
TEMPERATURES SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THIS TIME. ONLY
FEATURE TO NOTE IS INCREASED CLOUD COVER AND RAIN CHANCES BY THE
WEEKEND...MAINLY IN THE SOUTHERN FORECAST AREA...BEGINNING WITH
WRAP AROUND MOISTURE FROM THE HIGH PRESSURE THAT MOVES OFF TO THE
EAST COAST BY SUNDAY. WINDS WILL SHIFT TO THE SOUTH AND SOUTHWEST
DUE TO A DISTURBANCE DEVELOPING OVER THE EASTERN PLAINS...WHICH
WILL ALSO BRING INCREASED MOISTURE ADVECTION AND LIFT TO THE AREA.
MODELS SEEM TO WANT TO SLOW DOWN THE HIGH PRESSURE AND WIND
DIRECTION SHIFT...SO CONFIDENCE IS LOW ON TIMING OF THIS INCREASED
MOISTURE ADVECTION.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 211845
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT SUN SEP 21 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT STILL WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA OVER CENTRAL KY AND 
MIDDLE TN...GENERALLY ALONG A CINCINNATI TO NASHVILLE LINE. THIS 
COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA 
DURING THE EARLY EVENING HOURS AROUND SUNSET...WITH ADDITIONAL 
SCATTERED CONVECTION EXPECTED TO DEVELOP ALONG AND BEHIND IT. WINDS 
MAY REMAIN PERSISTENT ENOUGH OVERNIGHT TO INHIBIT ANY FOG 
DEVELOPMENT...BUT SINCE WATER TEMPS REMAIN WARM...WILL CONTINUE TO 
MENTION PATCHY FOG DEVELOPING TOWARDS SUNRISE...BUT MAINLY ALONG THE 
WATERWAYS. HIGH PRESSURE THEN BUILDS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON 
MONDAY...WITH COOLER AND DRIER AIR MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA. AS 
FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES 
WITH MINS FOR TONIGHT...AND WILL GENERALLY COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE 
TWO. ON MONDAY...BOTH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH MAXES AND LOOK 
REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...SAME STORY AS YESTERDAY...
VERY QUIET EXTENDED PERIOD.
 
MONDAY NIGHT...HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES BUILDING BEHIND THE FRONTAL 
PASSAGE. CLEAR SKIES ALONG WITH DRIER AND COOLER AIR WILL LEAD TO 
OVERNIGHT LOWS 8 TO 10 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES 
THROUGH THE WEEK WITH TEMPERATURES GRADUALLY WARMING TO NEAR NORMAL 
BY THURSDAY. OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL ALSO SLOWLY WARM BUT WILL REMAIN 
BELOW NORMAL. FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY THE HIGH PRESSURE CENTER THAT HAS 
BEEN TO OUR NORTH ALL WEEK STARTS MOVING FURTHER EAST...THIS WILL 
ALLOW FOR MOISTURE TO SLOWLY BUILD BACK IN ACROSS THE AREA.
 
WILL ADJUST SATURDAYS POPS DOWN FROM CHANCE TO SLIGHT CHANCE AS IT IS 
GOING TO TAKE SOME TIME TO BUILD BACK IN OUR MOISTURE. SUNDAY IS THE 
BEST CHANCE OF RAIN THROUGH THE EXTENDED. ONLY HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE IN 
NOW BUT POPS MAY HAVE TO BE RAISED IN FUTURE FORECASTS. AGAIN...
EXPECT SEVERAL MORNINGS AND EVENINGS TO HAVE A FALL-LIKE FEEL TO THEM
AS WE START THE LONG TERM.
&&

TO 1/2 INCH SIZE HAIL THIS AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING.

FRONT MOVES SOUTH AND EAST OF THE AREA BY 01-03Z THIS EVENING WITH
DRIER AND COOLER AIR ADVECTING INTO THE REGION.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...OVERALL VERY QUIET FOR THE 
EXTENDED. HIGH PRESSURE DEVELOPS OVER THE EASTERN U.S...WITH MOSTLY 
CLEAR SKIES AND DRY WEATHER THE MAIN FEATURES THROUGH THE END OF THE 
WORK WEEK. THE FLOW WILL BE FROM THE NORTH AND NORTHWEST...BRINGING 
MUCH COOLER AIR THAN THE AREA HAS SEEN THIS FALL. TEMPERATURES WILL 
BE SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW NORMAL DURING THIS TIME. AS THE HIGH 
PRESSURE MOVES OFF THE EAST COAST...MOISTURE WILL WRAP AROUND THIS 
HIGH AND ADVECT INTO THE REGION. BY THE END OF THE WORK 
WEEK...EXPECTING AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS AND THE CHANCE FOR RAIN 
SHOWERS FOR MAINLY OUR SOUTHERN AREAS.

EVENING AND HAS RESULTED IN A MOSTLY CLEAR SKY. THIS HAS ALLOWED
FOR GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING ONCE AGAIN AS TEMPERATURES HAVE FALLEN
WELL INTO THE 70S THIS EVENING...AND WILL EVENTUALLY BOTTOM OUT IN
THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S IN MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS BY DAYBREAK.
GIVEN THE CLEAR AND CALM CONDITIONS...COMBINED WITH THE WARM
LAKE/RIVER WATER TEMPS...A GOOD SET UP FOR PATCHY FOG ALONG BODIES
OF WATER WILL EXIST LATE TONIGHT ONCE AGAIN...AS WELL AS IN
SHELTERED AREAS WHERE WINDS COMPLETELY DECOUPLE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             64  85  59  75 /   0  40  30  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  62  83  58  72 /   0  40  30  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       62  84  57  72 /   0  40  30  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              56  82  55  70 /   0  50  40  10

116 
FXUS64 KMRX 201850
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EDT SAT SEP 20 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDING OVER THE 
APPALACHIANS...WITH A COLD FRONT OVER THE UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY. 
THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA 
DURING THE EVENING HOURS ON SUNDAY...WITH SCATTERED CONVECTION 
DEVELOPING AHEAD AND BEHIND IT. GFS AND NAM MODELS REVEAL SOME 
DISCREPANCIES WITH THE AMOUNT OF MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS COLD 
FRONT...AND WILL GENERALLY COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO BY KEEPING 
POPS IN THE SCATTERED CATEGORY. GFS MODEL INDICATES SOME MARGINAL 
INSTABILITY DEVELOPING OVER THE FORECAST AREA AHEAD OF THIS FRONT ON 
SUNDAY AFTERNOON...BUT THE NAM MODEL INDICATES THE POSSIBILITY OF A 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS. THUS...IT APPEARS THAT A FEW STRONG TO 
SEVERE TSTORMS MAY BE POSSIBLE ON SUNDAY AFTERNOON. AS FOR TEMPS... 
GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH MINS FOR 
TONIGHT AND SUNDAY NIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE. WILL COMPROMISE 
BETWEEN THE TWO SETS OF GUIDANCE IN REGARDS TO MAXES ON SUNDAY.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...VERY QUIET EXTENDED PERIOD 
FOLLOWING THE SHORT TERMS FRONTAL PASSAGE. 
 
BY MONDAY MORNING...THE COLD FRONT SHOULD BE WELL SOUTH OF OUR
AREA WITH THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH CONTINUING TO FURTHER MOVE OFF TO
OUR NE OVER THE COURSE OF THE DAY. EXPECT MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES BY
LATE MORNING/EARLY AFTERNOON WITH BREEZY WINDS OUT OF THE NORTH DUE
TO THE TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT OF THE TROUGH. THE POST FRONTAL
AIR MASS WILL ALLOW FOR MUCH DRIER AIR ALONG WITH COOLER
TEMPERATURES. WITH CLEAR SKIES MONDAY NIGHT...OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL
BE 8 TO 10 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL.

BY TUESDAY...HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS AND CONTINUES THROUGH THE END
OF THE EXTENDED. AS THE HIGH PRESSURE CENTER SLOWLY SHIFTS EASTWARD
THROUGH THE WEEK...MOISTURE STARTS TO SLOWLY BUILD BACK IN ACROSS
THE AREA BY FRIDAY AND INTO SATURDAY. WILL INCLUDE SLIGHT CHANCE
POPS FOR SATURDAY ACROSS CENTRAL VALLEY AND CHANCE ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN VALLEY AND SW NC.
 
TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THE EXTENDED...BUT 
OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL GRADUAL WARM THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD TO NEAR NORMAL
BY DAY 7. EXPECT SEVERAL MORNINGS AND EVENINGS TO HAVE A FALL-LIKE
FEEL TO THEM AT THE START OF THE LONG TERM. 
&&

898 
FXUS64 KMRX 200704
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
304 AM EDT SAT SEP 20 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL
REMAIN ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TODAY AND TONIGHT. MAIN
CONCERN WILL BE COVERAGE OF FOG THIS MORNING AND TONIGHT. EXPECT
FOG TO BE MAINLY CONFINED TO AREA LAKES AND STREAMS. FOLLOWED MOS
GUIDANCE CLOSELY.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH 
SUNDAY EVENING INTO THE NIGHT...WITH SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
POSSIBLE AHEAD OF THIS FRONT SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THE EARLY 
NIGHT. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THE MAIN AREA OF PRECIP 
WILL MOVE IN BETWEEN 2 AND 4 SUNDAY AFTERNOON. GFS IS MUCH MORE 
STABLE WITH THIS LINE MOVING IN...WITH NAM SHOWING ALMOST 2000 J/KG 
CAPE VALUES. WINDS ARE UNIFORM THROUGHOUT THE ATMOSPHERE...WITH SOME 
SHEAR IN THE LOW LEVELS. THE NAM ALSO SHOWS DECENT DRY AIR IN THE 
MIDLEVELS IN THE EARLY AFTEROON WHICH COULD ENHANCE DOWNBURST AND 
WIND THREATS. THE FRONT SEEMS TO BE A BIT SEPARATE IN TIMING FROM 
THE UPPER LEVEL DYNAMICS...WITH THE MAIN AREA OF DIVERGENCE FOR OUR 
AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT...BUT DUE TO THE STRONG FORCING OF THE 
CONVECTION UPSTREAM...AND THE FACT THAT THE STORMS NOW LOOK TO MOVE 
IN EARLIER AND TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THAT DAYTIME HEATING...COULD SEE 
MODERATE TO STRONG STORMS WITH A FEW ISOLATED SEVERE SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. MAIN THREATS WITH THESE STORMS IS EXPECTED TO 
BE MODERATE HAIL...STRONG WINDS...AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. 

BEHIND THIS FRONT...HIGH PRESSURE DEVELOPS OVER THE EASTERN US. DRY 
CONDITIONS AND MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES WILL QUICKLY TAKE OVER FOR 
MONDAY...LASTING THROUGH THE END OF THE WORK WEEK. AS THE HIGH 
PRESSURE MOVES OFF THE EASTERN COAST AROUND FRIDAY...WRAPAROUND 
MOISTURE WILL BE ADVECTED TOWARDS OUR AREA. COULD SEE THE CHANCE FOR 
INCREASING CLOUDS AND PRECIP MAINLY IN SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA...BUT THIS IS TOO FAR OUT TO SAY WITH MUCH CONFIDENCE. 
TEMPERATURES BEHIND THIS FRONT WILL BE SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. 
AS THE TROUGH MOVES EAST...NORTH TO NORTHWEST FLOW WILL BE PRESENT 
BRINGING DOWN AIR FROM THE NORTH.

&&

747 
FXUS64 KMRX 191855
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EDT FRI SEP 19 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE NORTHEAST...WHICH 
EXTENDS SOUTHWARD ACROSS MOST OF THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. 
THIS HIGH WILL BRING DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA TONIGHT AND SATURDAY...WITH PATCHY FOG EXPECTED TO DEVELOP 
AGAIN OVERNIGHT...MAINLY AROUND THE WATERWAYS. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS 
AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH MINS FOR 
TONIGHT...BUT WILL TREND CLOSER TO THE COOLER NAM NUMBERS WHICH HAVE 
VERIFIED BETTER LATELY. ALSO...WILL TREND COOLER THAN BOTH SETS OF 
GUIDANCE WITH MAXES ON SATURDAY (WHICH HAS BEEN THE TREND LATELY).

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...COLD FRONT BRINGING 
SHOWERS AND STORMS SUNDAY EVENING THEN PLEASANT CONDITIONS THROUGH 
THE REST OF THE EXTENDED.

SATURDAY NIGHT WE HAVE AN APPROACHING UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND 
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT TO OUR NW. CONDITIONS OVER OUR AREA WILL 
REMAINING CALM WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND OVERNIGHT LOWS NEAR OR A 
DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE NORMAL. THE FIRST HALF OF SUNDAY SHOULD BE NICE 
BUT CLOUDS WILL INCREASE FROM NW TO SE DURING THE MID TO LATE 
AFTERNOON HOURS AS THE COLD FRONT APPROACHES. CURRENT NAM AND GFS 
ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT AS FAR AS TIMING AND SUGGEST THAT SHOWERS AND 
STORMS WILL ARRIVE ON THE PLATEAU BETWEEN 19 TO 21Z AND THEN SPREAD 
INTO THE CENTRAL VALLEY BY AROUND 00Z. THE NAM AND GFS DO DIFFER ON 
THE AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY HOWEVER. AT 00Z SUNDAY THE NAM SHOWS 1500 
TO 2000 J/KG OF CAPE ACROSS THE AREA WHILE THE GFS ONLY SHOWS 500 TO 
1000 J/KG. OBVIOUSLY IF THE NAM IS CORRECT THEN WE COULD SEE A FEW 
STRONGER STORMS ACROSS THE AREA. THE STRONGEST STORMS THOUGH SHOULD 
STAY TO OUR NORTH WHERE THE BEST SHEAR IS...AS THERE IS A TIGHT 
SHEAR GRADIENT ALONG THE KY/TN STATE LINE. NONETHELESS...IF WE DO 
HAVE THE INSTABILITY THAT THE NAM SUGGESTS THEN A FEW STRONGER 
STORMS COULD DRIFT DOWN OUT OF KY INTO TN. 
 
AFTER SUNDAY NIGHTS CONVECTION THE REST OF THE EXTENDED LOOKS DRY. 
SOME CLOUDS MAY LINGER BEHIND THE FRONT SUNDAY NIGHT BUT SKIES 
SHOULD QUICKLY CLEAR WITH SUNSHINE RETURNING BY LATE MORNING/EARLY 
AFTERNOON ON MONDAY. COOLER AIR BEHIND THE FRONT WILL KEEP MAX TEMPS 
IN THE LOW 70S ACROSS SW VA/NE TN...MID 70S CENTRAL VALLEY...AND
UPPER 70S SOUTHERN VALLEY ON MONDAY. THE TROUGH PUSHES FURTHER NE
ON MONDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE SLOWLY BEGINS TO BUILD BACK IN ACROSS
THE AREA. WITH HIGH PRESSURE SLOWLY BUILDING EXPECT A GRADUAL
WARMING TREND THROUGH THE WORK WEEK. MOISTURE LOOKS TO RETURN BY
FRIDAY/FRIDAY NIGHT ACROSS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY AND SW NC BUT KEPT
PRECIP OUT FOR NOW. OVERALL...IT SHOULD BE A VERY PLEASANT EXTENDED
PERIOD AFTER THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             63  83  62  83 /   0   0   0  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  61  81  62  81 /   0   0   0  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       60  81  60  81 /   0   0   0  30

SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. CLOUDS WILL INCREASE THROUGH THE DAY
SUNDAY...AND THE MAIN AREA OF RAIN LOOKS TO MOVE IN LATE AFTERNOON
INTO EVENING SUNDAY. INSTABILITIES AND WIND PROFILE ARE WEAK WITH
THIS FRONT...WITH LOW PW VALUES THROUGH THE NIGHT. LOOKING AT
ISOLATED TO SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS AND AN OCCASIONAL THUNDERSTORM.
THE RAIN CHANCES WILL QUICKLY MOVE OUT OF THE AREA MONDAY AND SKIES
WILL CLEAR BEHIND THE FRONT. MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND DRY WEATHER
WILL REMAIN THROUGH MOST OF THE WEEK. HIGH PRESSURE DEVELOPS AND
MOVES OFF THE EAST COAST AND WITH THE WRAPAROUND MOISTURE FROM
THIS...COULD SEE INCREASE IN CLOUDS AND MOISTURE AT THE END OF THE
WORK WEEK. WILL WAIT FOR FURTHER MODEL RUNS TO ADD MUCH DETAIL TO
THE FORECAST. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL SATURDAY AND
SUNDAY...AND AS THE FRONTAL PASSAGE MOVES THROUGH...TEMPS WILL DROP
TO SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. A DEEP TROUGH SETS UP OVER THE
EASTERN US BRINGING MUCH COLDER AIR TO THE ARE THROUGH MUCH OF NEXT
WORK WEEK.

986 
FXUS64 KMRX 181850
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EDT THU SEP 18 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WHICH 
IS EXPECTED TO DISSIPATE BEFORE REACHING THE FORECAST AREA. RADAR 
AND SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEAL A CONVECTIVE COMPLEX OVER THE WESTERN 
TN RIVER VALLEY MOVING SOUTHEASTWARD...BUT ITS ASSOCIATED HIGH 
CLOUDS WILL LIKELY CONTINUE TO MOVE EASTWARD ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA TONIGHT. THESE CLOUDS SHOULD LIMIT THE COVERAGE OF FOG TO 
MAINLY AROUND THE WATERWAYS...AND WILL THUS MENTION PATCHY FOG 
DEVELOPING AFTER MIDNIGHT. A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE...CURRENTLY
CENTERED OVER SOUTHERN CANADA...WILL SLOWLY DRIFT EASTWARD ACROSS
THE NORTHEAST ON FRIDAY...WHICH WILL PRODUCE AN EASTERLY FLOW OVER
THE CAROLINAS. THIS EASTERLY UPSLOPE FLOW MAY CREATE SOME ISOLATED
SHOWERS ON FRIDAY OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...AND POSSIBLY
OVER NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA AS WELL. THUS...WILL INCLUDE A
SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN THESE AREAS. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH MAXES THROUGH
SATURDAY...BUT SHOW SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH MINS ON FRIDAY NIGHT
AND SATURDAY NIGHT. WILL COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO WITH MINS...AND
WILL TREND COOLER THAN BOTH WITH MAXES (WHICH HAS BEEN THE TREND
LATELY).

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MAIN SYSTEM AND ONLY SYSTEM OF 
CONCERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED WILL BE A WEAK COLD FRONT SLIDING IN 
EARLY IN THE PERIOD.  MODELS TRENDING A BIT FASTER WITH THE SYSTEM 
AND WILL HAVE HIGHEST POPS SUNDAY EVENING.  FRONT HAS MINIMAL 
MOISTURE AND WEAK LIFT AND COVERAGE SHOULD BE LIMITED...SO WILL KEEP 
POPS AROUND 30.  BEHIND THE FRONT...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN 
AND SHOULD DOMINATE AREA WEATHER THROUGH THE REST OF THE EXTENDED 
FOR DRY CONDITIONS AND SEASONAL TEMPERATURES.

086 
FXUS64 KMRX 180646
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
246 AM EDT THU SEP 18 2014

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
AN AREA OF BKN/OVC HIGH CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO PASS OVER THE
REGION EARLY THIS MORNING. THIS CLOUD COVER HAS LIKELY PREVENTED
ANY WIDESPREAD FOG FROM FORMING ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN
VALLEYS. HOWEVER...MOSTLY CLEAR AND CALM CONDITIONS OVER SW
VIRGINIA AND NE TENNESSEE HAS PROMOTED SOME PATCHY FOG WHICH WILL
LIKELY PERSIST THROUGH DAYBREAK. THIS CLOUD COVER WILL GRADUALLY
DISSIPATE ONCE HEATING BEGINS AND THE DAYTIME BOUNDARY LAYER BEGINS
TO TAKE SHAPE. A NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL HELP TO REINFORCE THE
SOMEWHAT COOLER AIR MASS IN PLACE...BUT AMPLE SUNSHINE WILL ALLOW
TEMPERATURES TO REACH THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S BY THE LATE
AFTERNOON. A CLEAR AND CALM NIGHT WILL ONCE AGAIN ALLOW FOR PATCHY
FOG DEVELOPMENT AFTER MIDNIGHT...LIKELY MORE WIDESPREAD THAN THE
PREVIOUS FEW NIGHTS WITH LESS CLOUD COVER EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM /FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
VERY NICE WEATHER FOR THE 
EXTENDED PERIODS WITH JUST ONE WEAK SYSTEM SUNDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY 
MONDAY. SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVING EAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO 
VALLEY WILL DRAG A WEAK COLD FRONT THROUGH THE SRN APPALACHIANS BY 
EARLY MONDAY. GFS AND ECMWF SIMILIAR ON TIMING AND CONSISTENT FROM 
12Z RUN...SO CHANCE POPS STILL LOOK GOOD FOR SUNDAY NIGHT INTO 
MONDAY MORNING. I DID LOWER THE POPS A BIT FASTER AT 18Z MONDAY. 

OTHERWISE...00Z GFSX MOS CAME IN SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN THE 12Z MOS... 
AND ACTUALLY CLOSER TO THE LATEST ECMWF MOS. SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS MADE 
TO INCREASE MAX TEMPS ON DAYS WHEN THE SFC-850 MB FLOW SHIFTS TO 
WEAK SOUTHERLY. MAX AND MIN TEMPS RUN GENERALLY CLOSE TO SEASONAL 
VALUES THROUGH THE PERIOD.

019 
FXUS64 KMRX 171850
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EDT WED SEP 17 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE DEEP 
SOUTH...WITH AN INVERTED TROUGH EXTENDING NORTH OF IT OVER THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. RADAR AND SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEAL A 
MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE SYSTEM OVER THE OZARKS...WHICH WAS MOVING 
SOUTHWARD BUT ITS ASSOCIATED HIGH CLOUDS WERE MOVING SOUTHEASTWARD 
ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. ADDITIONAL MOISTURE OVER THE MID MS 
RIVER VALLEY WILL MOVE TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA LATER TONIGHT...SO 
THINK THAT ANY FOG DEVELOPMENT LATER TONIGHT SHOULD BE PATCHY AND 
MAINLY NEAR AREA WATERWAYS. AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE MID 
WEST THIS AFTERNOON IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT EASTWARD INTO THE 
NORTHEAST BY FRIDAY...WHICH WILL PRODUCE AN EASTERLY FLOW OVER THE 
CAROLINAS. MODELS INDICATE THAT THIS EASTERLY UPSLOPE FLOW WILL 
TRIGGER ISOLATED CONVECTION OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS 
ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AFTERNOONS...SO WILL INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE 
POP IN THESE ZONES. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE 
IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE 
BETWEEN THE TWO WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...THE PERIOD STARTS OUT DRY 
ON SATURDAY AS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION AWAITS ANOTHER 
AMPLIFYING UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT. MODEL 
FORECASTS HAVE SLOWED THIS FEATURE DOWN WITH THE BRUNT OF THE SYSTEM 
NOT ARRIVING UNTIL SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY...SO TWEAKED POPS BACK
A BIT ON THE FRONT END. STILL NOT A GREAT DEAL OF LOW LEVEL
MOISTURE BECOMES ENTRAINED IN THIS SYSTEM...WITH LOW LEVEL RIDGING
REFUSING TO BREAK DOWN TO LARGE DEGREE AHEAD OF THE LOW LEVEL
TROUGH/SURFACE FRONT. SO NOT MUCH MOISTURE AND LIMITED CONVERGENCE
AT THIS TIME ARGUES FOR THE PROBABILITY OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
TO REMAIN IN THE CHANCE CATEGORY. WENT WITH A GO SLOW APPROACH TO
THE DEPARTURE OF THIS SYSTEM ON MONDAY...WITH SOME TRAILING
MOISTURE AN ENERGY BUILDING INTO THE BACK SIDE OF THE DEPARTING
UPPER TROUGH. KEPT TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY DRY. HOWEVER...MODELS ARE
MOVING IN THE DIRECTION OF THE DEVELOPMENT OF AN INVERTED SURFACE
TROUGH OVER THE MID SOUTH ABOUT TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY...WITH
INCREASING ATLANTIC MOISTURE AROUND THE BASE OF THE EASTERN U.S.
RIDGE. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             58  83  60  85 /   0   0   0   0

766 
FXUS64 KMRX 170629
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
229 AM EDT WED SEP 17 2014

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
A QUIET NIGHT ACROSS THE REGION...WITH HIGH PRESSURE SLOWLY
BUILDING EAST INTO THE MID-MISSISSIPPI AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS. THE
FRONT THAT HAS BEEN DRAPED ACROSS THE AREA FOR THE PAST COUPLE OF
DAYS HAS PUSHED WELL TO THE SOUTH. HOWEVER...ABUNDANT BOUNDARY
LAYER MOISTURE HAS ONCE AGAIN LED TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF LOW
STRATUS AND PATCHY FOG ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...MOUNTAINS AND
PARTS OF THE CENTRAL/SOUTHERN VALLEY. THIS FOG/CLOUD COVER WILL
LINGER UNTIL MID-MORNING...BEFORE DISSIPATING AS DAYTIME
HEATING/MIXING BEGINS. WITH THE FRONT WELL TO THE SOUTH AND
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT...A DRY FORECAST IS IN STORE WITH THE
CONTINUED COOLER...POSTFRONTAL AIR MASS PROMOTING HIGHS IN THE MID
70S TO LOWER 80S. TONIGHT...THE MOISTURE IN PLACE MAY RESULT IN THE
DEVELOPMENT OF SOME CLOUD COVER/FOG ONCE AGAIN AFTER MIDNIGHT...
WITH LOWS COMFORTABLY IN THE 50S.

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY/...
TRANQUIL WEATHER PATTERN SETTING UP AND VERY MUCH IN LINE WITH 12Z
MODEL RUNS. NW FLOW ALOFT AND ANOTHER WEAK COLD FRONT (DRY) EASES
THROUGH ON THURSDAY.

THE UPPER RIDGE TO OUR WEST SETTLES OVER THE CENTRAL AND SRN PLAINS 
FRIDAY...FLEXING NE INTO THE LOWER MS VALLEY REGION SATURDAY...THEN  
SHORTWAVE ENERGY DROPS SE ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY. 
THIS CARVES OUT AN UPPER TROUGH TO AFFECT OUR WEATHER GENERALLY FROM 
LATE SUNDAY INTO TUESDAY. THE LATEST ECMWF AND TO SOME DEGREE THE 
00Z GFS...SUPPORT CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY...FOLLOWED 
BY DRY AND SLIGHTLY COOLER WEATHER MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. 

FORECAST GRIDS CHANGED VERY LITTLE...OTHER THAN A FEW MAX/MIN TEMP 
AJUSTMENTS. NUDGED MAX TEMPS UP ON THE WARMER DAYS...BUT STAYED JUST 
BELOW GFSX MOS ON DAYS FOLLOWING A FRONTAL PASSAGE. GAVE A BIT MORE 
RANGE IN MINS FROM CHA TO TRI ON A FEW NIGHTS...DUE TO DRY AIRMASS. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED

.AVIATION...
MVFR/IFR FOG WILL DEVELOP LATE TONIGHT AT EACH TERMINAL...AND
PERSIST THROUGH THE EARLY MORNING HOURS. AT KTRI...THIS FOG IS
COULD BECOME LOCALLY DENSE AND LOWER CIGS/VIS TO LIFR LEVELS

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY
THE COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE ITS SLOW MOVEMENT THROUGH THE FORECAST

THICK THROUGH AT LEAST SUNSET. LOOK FOR SOME CLEARING TO TAKE PLACE

WAS OTHERWISE CLEAR. WILL CONTINUE WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS
MAINLY OVER THE TN AND VA MOUNTAINS OVERNIGHT.

WEDNESDAY EXPECT FOG...WHERE IT DEVELOPS...TO CLEAR BY MID MORNING.
IT SHOULD BE A SPECTACULAR LATE SUMMER DAY WITH LIGHT NORTHERLY
WINDS AND BELOW SEASONAL TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...DRY CONDITIONS AND 
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES WILL REMAIN THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE WORK 
WEEK AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN TO THE AREA. FLOW WILL BE FROM THE 
NORTH NORTHWEST, AND WITH A RIDGE OVER THE GREAT PLAINS DURING THIS 
TIME...WILL HAVE COOLER THAN NORMAL TEMPERATURES. WENT A COUPLE OF 
DEGREES BELOW GUIDANCE FOR THE LOW TEMPERATURES...WITH THE SKY COVER 
AND TEMP ADVECTION...BUT STAYED WITH GUIDANCE FOR THE HIGHS. BY THE 
WEEKEND...A LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND MOVES 
TOWARDS THE GREAT LAKES. A COLD FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH THAT LOW WILL 
THEN MOVE THROUGH THE AREA SUNDAY EVENING INTO THE MONDAY MORNING. 
MODELS HAVE DISAGREED TO THE STRENGTH OF THIS SYSTEM...BUT THE 
TIMING HAS BEEN FAIRLY CONSISTENT THROUGH THE PAST COUPLE OF MODEL 
RUNS. BEHIND THIS FRONT...A DEEP TROUGH WILL THEN SET UP WITH MUCH 
COLDER AIR MOVING INTO THE AREA. HAVE LOWERED TEMPS SEVERAL DEGREES 
BELOW NORMAL AT THE END OF THE PERIOD TO REFLECT THIS.

337 AM EDT TUE SEP 16 2014

AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING WEAK COLD FRONT. DEW POINT TEMPS REMAIN
QUITE HIGH ACROSS THE SRN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA (NEAR 70 DEGS
AT CHA)...SO I ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE
AFTERNOON HOURS.

A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS THIS EVENING OVER FAR ERN COUNTIES...
THEN DECREASING CLOUDS. BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE MAY BE SUFFICIENT
FOR AT LEAST PATCHY FOG ACROSS THE VALLEYS LATE TONIGHT. LOWERED

OR JUST BELOW THE MOS BLEND. GFS MOS MINS WERE CONSISTENT FROM 12Z
DATA AND CLOSELY FOLLOWED.


.LONG TERM.../WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY/...
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL PREVAIL ALOFT WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY...
BEFORE AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BEGINS TO BUILD IN FOR
THE WEEKEND. INITIALLY...THIS DRY BUT COOL NORTHERLY FLOW /ALONG
WITH SOME VERY SUBTLE SHORTWAVES PASSING THROUGH THE AREA/ WILL
HELP TO REINFORCE THE COOLER AUTUMN-LIKE AIR MASS IN PLACE OVER THE
REGION. THIS SHOULD HELP TO KEEP TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES LOWER
THAN THEY NORMALLY MIGHT HAVE BEEN...AND SLIGHTLY BELOW GUIDANCE.
HOWEVER...GIVEN THE EXPECTED DRY CONDITIONS WITH A MOSTLY TO PARTLY
SUNNY SKY...DID NOT GET TOO CARRIED AWAY LOWERING THEM AND HAVE
MOST LOCATIONS REACHING THE MID 70S TO THE LOWER 80S. BY THE
WEEKEND... RIDGING AND THUS INCREASED THICKNESS VALUES/TEMPERATURES
ALOFT ALONG WITH CONTINUED DRY CONDITIONS WILL PROMOTE WARMER
TEMPERATURES AS WINDS VEER TO THE SOUTH AND EAST...PUSHING HIGHS IN
THE LOWER 80S IN MUCH OF THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. THE NEXT UPPER-
TROUGH AND COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE REGION SUNDAY
AFTERNOON...BRINGING THE ONLY SHOT FOR MEANINGFUL PRECIPITATION IN
OVER A WEEK. THERE ARE STILL SOME DIFFERENCES IN TIMING BETWEEN THE
MODELS...SO DID NOT GET OVERALLY SPECIFIC YET. HOWEVER...THE BEST
WINDOW LOOKS AS IF IT MAY BE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY ATTM.

THE WEEK. A LOW PRESSURE OFF THE EASTERN COAST WILL CAUSE MOISTURE
AND LIFTING ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE MOUNTAINS. FOR THIS, HAVE
INCLUDED A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR LIGHT PRECIP...MAINLY IN THE MOUNTAINS
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE A COUPLE OF
DEGREES BELOW NORMAL DURING THIS TIME. NEXT BIG WEATHER ITEM TO
AFFECT THE AREA IS A COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH LATE SUNDAY EVENING
IN TO MONDAY. MODELS IN FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT FOR NOW...BUT STILL
EARLY IN THE GAME TO HAVE MUCH CONFIDENCE WITH THE TIMING. CLOUDS
WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE AHEAD OF THIS FRONT...AS WILL
TEMPERATURES...THROUGH NEXT WEEKEND.

006 
FXUS64 KMRX 151508
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1108 AM EDT MON SEP 15 2014

.DISCUSSION...
COOL AND MOIST AIR MASS CONTINUES ACROSS THE AREA THIS MORNING AS
ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE TOP OF THE OLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY KEEPS A
STEADY FLOW OF CONDENSING MOISTURE...IN THE LOWEST 1000-2000 FEET.
SO CONDITIONS WILL BE SLOW TO IMPROVE. HOWEVER...CONDITIONS SHOULD
IMRPOVE THIS AFTERNOON AS A SHORTWAVE TROUGH PUSHES INTO THE
AREA...THAT SHOULD CAUSE SOME WEAK LIFT THAT WILL HELP TO COOL THE
TRAPPING INVERSION. THIS SHOULD ALLOW MORE VERTICAL MIXING AND HELP
DISPERSE THE MOISTURE THAT IS TRAPPED NEAR THE GROUND.
ADDITIONALLY...VEERING WINDS NEAR THE SURFACE SHOULD BEGIN TO BRING
IN WARMER AIR AT THE SURFACE. KEEPING THE SAME MAX TEMPERATURES
TODAY...BUT HAVE SIGNIFICANTLY SLOWED THE HOURLY WARMUP.

WITH THIS SHORTWAVE...WE SHOULD ALSO SEE SHOWERS FORMING DURING THE
AFTERNOON...WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDER ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
AREAS. HAVE A MENTION OF SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDER AS FAR NORTH AS
KNOXVILLE.

COLD FRONT THAT IS HEADED THIS WAY IS STILL FAR TO THE
WEST...STRETCHING FROM NEAR GREEN BAY...TO KANSAS CITY...TO THE
OKLAHOMA PANHANDLE. BY SUNSET THE FRONT WILL ONLY BE APPROACHING
THE OHIO VALLEY...SO IT WILL NOT BE A PLAYER IN THE THUNDERSTORM
THREAT THIS AFTERNOON...BUT THE SHORTWAVE WILL OFFER SOME LIFT AS
MENTIONED BEFORE. STORMS WILL HAVE SOME SHEAR TO WORK WITH...BUT
VERY WEAK INSTABILITY. SHOWERS/STORMS WILL BE MOVING PRETTY
QUICKLY AS WELL...AS THE MID LEVEL WINDS INCREASE WITH THIS
SHORTWAVE.

SHOWERS AND ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR A FEW THUNDERSTORM TUESDAY.

LOCATED. IN THE WAKE OF THIS INITIAL WAVE NORTHWEST FLOW WILL
COMMENCE ALONG WITH WEAK COLD ADVECTION/HIGH PRESSURE. THE TROUGH
OVER THE EASTERN U.S. WILL DEEPEN THROUGH THE WEEK. SEVERAL
EMBEDDED SHORTWAVES IN THE NW FLOW WILL CAUSE ADDITIONAL SHOWERS TO

DIFFER WITH THE SPEED OF THE NEXT FRONTAL BOUNDARY...BUT IT APPEARS
IT MAY BE MOVING INTO E TN LATE NEXT SUNDAY AFTERNOON.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
416 AM EDT SUN SEP 14 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...NORTHEAST LOW LEVEL FLOW AND SW 
FLOW ALOFT CONTINUES TO KEEP A LAYER OF CLOUDS IN PLACE ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. TEMPS HAVE FALLEN NICELY OVERNIGHT RESULTING IN SOME 
VERY PLEASANT TEMPS IN THE 50S NORTH TO MID 60S SOUTH. FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS SUGGEST THESE CLOUDS WILL BE HARD TO SHAKE TODAY...SO I 
OPTED TO UNDERCUT THE WARMER GFS MOS MAXES AND STAY NEAR OR SLIGHTLY 
BELOW THE COOLER NAM MOS MAXES. 

MUCH DRIER PERIOD GETTING UNDERWAY...WITH THE ONLY FORCING EXPECTED 
TO BE WEAK E-SE LOW LEVEL UPSLOPE FLOW INTO THE ERN MTNS AND SW NC. 
SAW NO REASON TO DROP OUR SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT 
IN THOSE LIMITED AREAS. NUDGED SKY COVER BACK FOR THE PRE-DAWN HOURS 
AND ALSO FOR TONIGHT. WENT QUITE CLOSE TO THE REASONABLE GFS MOS 
MINS. 

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...DRY WEST TO NW FLOW STARTS
THIS PERIOD BUT QUICK MOISTENING AS INVERTED TROUGH DEVELOPS WEST
OF THE APPALACHIANS WITH WEAK RETURN FLOW AND WEAK INSTABILITY.
MAJOR SHORTWAVE MOVING INTO EASTERN US UPPER TROUGH AND RETURN
FLOW TO TRIGGER PRECIPITATION THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO
VALLEY. SECONDARY SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS TN LATE MONDAY AND
MAINLY TUESDAY MORNING. SHOWERS AND SOME THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP
LATE MONDAY INTO TUESDAY OVER THE TN VALLEY. THEN SURFACE HIGH TO
BUILD SE OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MOIST UPSLOPE FLOW EAST OF THE
APPALACHIANS WILL CONTINUE WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY WITH A FEW
SHOWERS IN THE MOUNTAINS POSSIBLE...BUT MOSTLY SUNNY ELSEWHERE.
EXPECT WARMER TEMPERATURES MONDAY WITH SOUTHWEST FLOW AND HIGH DEW
POINTS. TUESDAY DRIER AIR MASS WITH MORE SUNSHINE BUT STILL
WARM...THEN COOLING TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY THROUGH THE END OF THE
WEEK AS UPPER TROUGH SETTLES OVER THE EASTERN STATES AND DRIER NW
FLOW DOMINATES. LOWS WILL BE MOSTLY IN THE 50S TO NEAR 60 AND HIGHS
IN THE 70S TO NEAR 80 WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY.

889 
FXUS64 KMRX 131934
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
334 PM EDT SAT SEP 13 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...THE LOW PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE
TO MOVE EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS THROUGH THE PERIOD. AN INVERTED
TROUGH LOCATED OVER THE AREA WILL KEEP MOISTURE IN THE LOW
LEVELS...AND CLOUD COVER MOSTLY OVERCAST THROUGH THE REST OF THE
AFTERNOON. WITH AN INVERSION IN PLACE...AND NO STRONG LIFTING
MECHANISM...HAVE LEFT ANY MENTION OF PRECIP OUT OF THE
GRIDS...EXCEPT IN THE MOUNTAINS WHERE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF LIGHT
SHOWERS ARE POSSIBLE. HAVE GONE WITH A BLEND OF GUIDANCE FOR
TEMPERATURES TONIGHT...WHICH SEEMS TO HANDLE THE CLOUD COVER WELL.
ENOUGH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE REMAINS FOR PATCHY FOG OVERNIGHT...AND
OVERCAST SKIES TO BEGIN THE DAY AGAIN ON SUNDAY. A SLIGHT CHANCE
FOR PRECIP WILL BE POSSIBLE TOMORROW...MAINLY WITH THE MOUNTAINS
USED FOR LIFTING. ONLY RAIN SHOWERS EXPECTED AS INSTABILITIES ARE
VERY LOW. WENT A DEGREE OR TWO UNDER GUIDANCE FOR SUNDAY TO ACCOUNT
FOR THIS CONTINUED CLOUD COVER.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...THIS PERIOD BEGINS
SUNDAY EVENING WITH THE AREA AT THE SOUTH END OF A ZONAL
FLOW...SOUTH OF THE GREAT LAKES LOW AND JUST NORTH OF A SUBTROPICAL
RIDGE ALONG THE GULF COAST. WE CONTINUE ON THE COOL SIDE OF THE
FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO THE NORTH. HOWEVER...AS THE SURFACE HIGH
PRESSURE BUILDS ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE APPALACHIANS...AN INVERTED
TROUGH IS INDUCED THAT STARTS A WEAK RETURN FLOW ON MONDAY. STILL
LOOKS LIKE A RISK OF THUNDER ON MONDAY...MORESO SOUTH...AS THE WEAK
RETURN FLOW COMES UP THE VALLEY. THE INSTABILITY LOOKS WEAK...BUT
MODELS AGREE ON 30-40 KNOTS OF SHEAR MONDAY AFTERNOON...AS A QUICK
SHORTWAVE RACES THROUGH. SO COULD HAVE A FEW STRONGER
STORMS...SOUTH...WHEREAS INSTABILITY MAY BE TOO WEAK NORTH ...JUST
DEPENDS ON HOW FAR NORTH THE MOISTURE CAN PUSH ON A WEAK SWLY LOW
LEVEL FLOW.

THE INVERTED TROUGH QUICKLY FADES AS A STRONGER LEE TROUGH FORMS ON 
TUESDAY EAST OF THE APPS.  THE NEXT COLD FRONT WASHES THROUGH THE 
AREA LATE MONDAY NIGHT OR EARLY TUESDAY AS WELL...WITH LITTLE TO NO 
FORCING ALONG IT.  ONCE THIS FRONT GOES THROUGH DRIER AIR STARTS TO 
PUSH INTO THE AREA. 

FOR THE REST OF THE PERIOD THE AREA IS UNDER A NORTHWEST FLOW...BUT 
THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY STAYS SOUTH OF THE AREA...MOISTURE STAYS SOUTH 
OR WEST...AND ANY DISTURBANCES IN THE FLOW LOOK VERY WEAK RIGHT 
NOW...SO KEEPING THE REST OF THE PERIOD DRY EXCEPT FOR SLIGHT 
CHANCES FOR SHOWERS IN THE EASTERN AND NORTHEASTERN MOUNTAINS.  WENT 
ON THE LOW SIDE OF THE MAX TEMPS FROM TUESDAY ONWARD...CONSIDERING 
SOME ADDITIONAL COOL SHOTS DURING THIS TIME.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             62  81  67  85 /  10  20  20  30

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
431 AM EDT SAT SEP 13 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS WOULD 
PLACE AN INVERTED TROUGH AXIS ACROSS SW NC TO NE TN/SW VA...WITH 
WEAK SURFACE LOW PRESSURE OVER NRN GA. THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT 
APPEARS TO LIE JUST SOUTH OF OUR FORECAST AREA. RADAR TRENDS THIS 
MORNING HAVE BEEN FOR A GRADUAL INCREASE IN SHOWERS OVER NE TN AND 
SW VA...WHILE A MORE SOLID AREA OF SHOWERS CONTINUES TO MOVE EAST 
AWAY FROM THE APPALACHIANS. 

THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM SHOULD BE MOVING EAST AND NORTHEAST LATER 
TODAY...WHICH SHOULD LIMIT SHOWERS (SLIGHT CHANCE OF TSRA AFTERNOON) 
TO THIS MORNING IN GENERAL. POP AND WEATHER FROM PREVIOUS GRIDS WERE 
ADJUSTED SLIGHTLY TO LOWER RAIN CHANCES OVER WRN PARTS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA FOR TODAY...AND THEN TO SHOW A FASTER DECREASE FOR
TONIGHT. CLOUDS MAY NOT CLEAR OUT COMPLETELY WITH A GOOD
POSSIBILITY OF LOWER CLOUDS LINGERING OR RE-DEVELOPING.

OTHERWISE...WENT JUST BELOW THE MILDER GFS MOS MAX TEMPS FOR TODAY 
GIVEN THE CLOUDINESS EARLY AND THEN SLIGHT COOLING BEHIND THE COLD 
FRONT BY THIS AFTERNOON. NUDGED UP SKY COVER FOR MOST AREAS TONIGHT
WHICH SUPPORTS THE SLIGHTLY WARMER 00Z MOS MINS.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A NEARLY STATIONARY FRONT
SHOULD BE TO THE SOUTH WITH A WEAK INVERTED TROUGH STILL LYING OVER
THE EAST TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TRAPPING LOW LEVEL
MOISTURE OVER EAST TN SUNDAY. NAM MODEL WANTS TO KEEP THE MOISTURE
OVER AT LEAST THE EASTERN AREAS SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT WITH THE
GFS AND ECMWF SOMEWHAT DRIER. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE JUST TO THE NW
OVER THE OHIO AND WEST TN VALLEYS. WEAK SHORTWAVE ENERGY IN
WESTERLY FLOW COULD TRIGGER A FEW SHOWERS SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT
MAINLY EAST. MONDAY ANOTHER SURGE OF MOISTURE RIDES UP AND OVER THE
FRONT AS LOW PRESSURE MOVES NORTHEAST ALONG THE FRONT. THIS COULD
TRIGGER MORE SHOWERS AND POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORMS. ANOTHER WEAK FRONT
SHIFTS SOUTHEAST FROM THE CENTRAL US LATE MONDAY INTO THE TN VALLEY
EARLY TUESDAY AND WEAKENS. WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT KEPT
EASTERN AREAS WITH BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS...CONTINUING WEDNESDAY
NIGHT. KEPT THURSDAYS POPS EXTREME EAST AND DRY THURSDAY NIGHT AND
FRIDAY. TEMPERATURES STAY NEAR NORMAL THROUGH TUESDAY THEN SLIGHTLY
COOLER WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY AS UPPER TROUGH DIGS SOUTH OVER THE
FORECAST AREA.
