AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EDT FRI SEP 12 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...COLD FRONT SLIDING SOUTHEAST 
INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TONIGHT. THE FRONT WILL BECOME 
STATIONARY ON SATURDAY. SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL DEVELOP ALONG AND 
SOUTHEAST OF THE FRONT INTO THE EVENING HOURS. SHOWER ACTIVITY MAY 
CONTINUE TO DEVELOP OVERNIGHT AS AN UPPER SHORT WAVE TROUGH MOVES 
EAST THROUGH THE OHIO AND TN VALLEYS TONIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY. 
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE AREA FROM THE NW ON SATURDAY USHERING 
IN A DRIER AIRMASS. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN WARM TONIGHT WITH 
READING NEAR NORMAL ON SATURDAY. LATE NIGHT AND MORNING FOG WILL 
LIKELY DEVELOP ACROSS THE REGION.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THIS PERIOD WILL BE 
MARGINALLY UNSETTLED...WITH NO BIG SYSTEMS TO ORGANIZE AND CAUSE 
WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION ON THE FRONT END...FOLLOWED BY COMPLETE 
CLEARING AFTERWARDS...ESPECIALLY WHEN CONSIDERING MOS GUIDANCE.  
OPERATIONAL MODELS HINT AT A COUPLE OF GOOD PUSHES OF FRONTAL 
SYSTEMS...BUT MOS AND ENSEMBLES ARE NOT IN CONCERT AT TIMES...AND WE 
REMAIN IN A BUSY NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT THROUGH MIDWEEK. THERE ARE A 
FEW DRY PERIODS INTERSPERSED WITH SOME POPS THROUGHOUT THESE SEVERAL 
DAYS.  HOWEVER...GOING MOSTLY DRY TOWARD THE END OF THE PERIOD AS A 
FRONT PUSHES THROUGH...AND THE UPPER TROUGH FINALLY PUSHES EAST.  

FOR TEMPS...WENT CLOSE TO GUIDANCE...ALTHOUGH MAX TEMPS SEEMED TOO 
WARM NEXT WEEK...SO CUT THEM BY GENERALLY 1-3 DEGREES.  THE BEST 
CHANCES FOR ORGANIZE STORMS LOOKS TO BE MONDAY AFTERNOON...AS A 
QUICK RETURN FLOW GETS DEW POINTS BACK INTO THE 60S AND THE SHEAR 
PICKS UP A LITTLE.

066 
FXUS64 KMRX 111857
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
257 PM EDT THU SEP 11 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL
CONTINUE TO OVERSPREAD THE FORECAST AREA LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND
EVENING ALONG AND AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT PRESENTLY STRETCHING FROM
SOUTHEAST KENTUCKY INTO WEST TENNESSEE. THE PARTIAL CLEARING THAT
HAS OCCURRED OVER MUCH OF THE PLATEAU AND CENTRAL/SOUTHERN VALLEY
HAS ALLOWED FOR AN INSTABILITY AXIS TO DEVELOP. THIS MAY SUPPORT
SOME LOCALIZED STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH
SUNSET AS CAPE VALUES HAVE INCREASED TO AROUND 2000 J/KG. THIS
COMBINED WITH SOME DECENT SHEAR COULD LEAD TO SOME MODEST
CLUSTERS/LINE SEGMENTS WITH THIS ACTIVITY. AN ISOLATED DAMAGING
WIND THREAT WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THESE AREAS ESPECIALLY THROUGH
SUNSET. HOWEVER...THE PRIMARY CONCERN WITH THIS ACTIVITY CONTINUES
TO BE LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND PERHAPS THE THREAT FOR LOCALIZED
FLASH FLOODING.

DEWPOINTS IN THE EARLY TO MID AFTERNOON ARE IN THE LOW TO MID 
70S...AND PWATS IN THE 2.0 TO 2.25 INCH RANGE /ABOUT 2 TO 3 STANDARD 
DEVIATIONS ABOVE NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR/. ADDITIONALLY... WITH 
SOUNDING PROFILES EXHIBITING TALL/SKINNY CAPES...A DEEP WARM CLOUD 
AND MEAN FLOW MOVING PARALLEL TO THE SLOW MOVING FRONTAL BOUNDARY... 
A SET-UP FOR TRAINING CELLS AND THUS A LOCALIZED FLOODING/HEAVY 
RAINFALL WILL EXIST THROUGH THE EVENING AND PART OF THE OVERNIGHT 
HOURS. IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT THE 850 MB INFLOW INTO THE BOUNDARY 
IS MUCH STRONGER TO THE SOUTH AND WEST...AND SO THE THREAT OF 
FLOODING WILL BE LOCALIZED. THUS...WILL HOLD OFF ON A WATCH BUT WILL 
MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF FLOODING IN THE HWO. 

THE FRONT WILL SAG SOUTH INTO THE REGION OVERNIGHT INTO THE DAY ON 
FRIDAY AND WASH OUT SOMEWHAT. STILL...MODELS DO INDICATE 
PRECIPITATION DEVELOPMENT OCCURRING ALONG THE BOUNDARY WHICH SHOULD 
BE ORIENTED ALONG THE MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHERN VALLEY FOR MUCH OF THE 
DAY. HOWEVER...HOW FAR NORTH AND WEST THESE SHOWERS AND ISOLATED 
STORMS WILL GO REMAINS IN QUESTION. FOR NOW...HAVE LIKELY POPS 
CLOSEST TO THE BOUNDARY AND SOLID CHANCE POPS FURTHER TO THE NORTH 
AND WEST. WITH THE CLOUD COVER IN PLACE...HIGHS IN THE UPPER 70S TO 
LOWER 80S SEEMS PLAUSIBLE THOUGH IT WILL FEEL VERY HUMID ONCE AGAIN 
GIVEN THE MOISTURE RICH ATMOSPHERE. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)... FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND 
SATURDAY MORNING...AN INVERTED TROUGH WILL BE LOCATED ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS PRODUCING LIKELY CHANCE OF RAIN NEAR THE NORTH 
CAROLINA=TENNESSEE STATE-LINE WITH LESSER CHANCES TOWARD THE 
PLATEAU. THIS INVERTED TROUGH IS ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER JET 
PLACING MOVING ACROSS THE AREA INVOKING PRESSURE FALLS OVER THE AREA.

A ZONAL FLOW IS EXPECTED FOR MOST OF THE WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT 
WEEK UNTIL A SHORT-WAVE MOVING ACROSS THE GREAT A LAKES LATE 
MONDAY/TUESDAY. A SERIES OF WEAK SHORT-WAVES WILL MOVE ACROSS THE 
AREA UNDER THE FAST FLOW HELPING TO KEEP A WEAK SURFACE TROUGH OVER 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. WILL MAINTAIN SLIGHT CHANCE/CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS/POSSIBLY THUNDERSTORMS WITH BEST CHANCES OVER THE EASTERN 
SECTIONS.

UPPER FLOW WILL BECOME NORTHWEST AS A MORE SUBSTANTIAL SHORT-WAVE 
MOVES ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES BY TUESDAY.  AS FOR TEMPERATURES...WILL 
GO A DEGREE OR TWO LOWER THAN GUIDANCE HIGHS AND CLOSE TO MINS GIVEN 
PAST PERFORMANCE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

048 
FXUS64 KMRX 111431 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1031 AM EDT THU SEP 11 2014

.DISCUSSION...
A COLD FRONT DRAPED FROM SOUTHEAST KENTUCKY BACK INTO WESTERN
TENNESSEE WILL CONTINUE TO GRADUALLY MARCH TOWARD THE TENNESSEE
VALLEY TODAY. AHEAD OF THE FRONT...A VERY MOISTURE LADEN
ATMOSPHERE IS IN PLACE...WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE LOWER 70S AND PWAT
VALUES PROGGED TO INCREASE 2 TO 2.25 INCHES BY THIS AFTERNOON. SOME
LOW CLOUDS ARE LINGERING ACROSS THE REGION THIS MORNING...AND COULD
PERSIST THROUGH MOST OF THE DAY. HOWEVER...SOME BREAKS ARE
EXPECTED TO OCCUR BY EARLY TO MID AFTERNOON WHICH WILL ALLOW
TEMPERATURES TO RISE INTO THE LOW TO MIDDLE 80S AND HELP TO
INCREASE INSTABILITY ACROSS THE REGION. A BULK OF THE PRECIPITATION
IS STILL OFF TO OUR WEST OVER MIDDLE TENNESSEE IN THE FORM OF A
BROAD SHIELD OF RAIN. THIS IS PROGGED TO BREAK UP AS IT APPROACHES
THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU EARLY AFTERNOON. HOWEVER...SHOULD THE
ATMOSPHERE DESTABILIZE AS PROGGED BY THE MODELS SOME CONVECTION
WILL DEVELOP...BOTH ALONG THE FRONT OVER SW VIRGINIA AND NE
TENNESSEE AND DIURNALLY ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEYS.

MESOSCALE MODELS IN PARTICULAR ARE SHOWING SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS /SOME ORGANIZED/ TO DEVELOP BY EARLY
AFTERNOON. WITH CAPE VALUES ON THE KCHA/KTYS NAM SOUNDING SHOWN TO
BE AOA 1000-1500 J/KG...SOME STORM ORGANIZATION AND THUS AN
ISOLATED DAMAGING WIND THREAT WILL BE POSSIBLE. HOWEVER...THE
PRIMARY CONCERN WITH THIS ACTIVITY WILL BE LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL
AND LOCALIZED FLOODING GIVEN THE AFOREMENTIONED HIGH PWAT VALUES
WHICH ARE CLIMATOLOGICALLY HIGH. COMBINE THIS WITH SOUNDING
PROFILES EXHIBITING TALL/SKINNY CAPES...A DEEP WARM CLOUD AND MEAN
FLOW MOVING PARALLEL TO THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY...AND A SET-UP FOR
TRAINING CELLS AND THUS FLOODING/HEAVY RAINFALL WILL BE POSSIBLE.
THUS...WILL MONITOR THE POTENTIAL FOR THE NEED OF A FLASH FLOOD
WATCH FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND ESPECIALLY THIS EVENING AS THE FRONT
MOVES INTO THE REGION.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             86  72  87  68 /  70  80  60  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  83  68  84  66 /  70  80  60  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       83  68  83  65 /  70  70  60  50

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
249 AM EDT THU SEP 11 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MAIN CONCERN THROUGH THE SHORT 
TERM WILL BE THE PASSAGE OF A COLD FRONT LATE IN THE PERIOD.  AHEAD 
OF THE FRONT...A LINE OF CONVECTION WILL MOVE THROUGH DURING THE 
LATE AFTERNOON TO EARLY EVENING. HAVE UPPED POPS TO CATEGORICAL.  
PRECIPITABLE WATER INCREASES TO OVER 2.00 AHEAD OF THE FRONTAL 
PASSAGE AND WITH DEEP...MOIST AIR MASS DEVELOPING OVER THE 
AREA...EXPECT THE CONVECTION TO GENERATE HEAVY RAINFALL.  
ADDITIONALLY...WEAK TO BORDERLINE MODERATE INSTABILITY FORMS OVER 
THE AREA...ALLOWING THE POTENTIAL FOR OCCASIONAL STRONG 
THUNDERSTORMS WITH STRONG WINDS THE MAIN THREAT.  THE FRONT STALLS 
OVER THE AREA TONIGHT...CONTINUING THE CHANCE OF SCATTERED SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS THROUGHOUT THE NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODEL AGREEMENT AND RUN TO 
RUN CONSISTENCY DECENT EARLY IN THE LONG TERM PERIOD...BUT SUFFERS A 
BIT LATER IN THE PERIOD.  FORECAST CONFIDENCE STARTS OUT AVERAGE BUT 
ENDS UP A BIT BELOW AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. THE FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY WILL LINGER OVER THE REGION FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. AN UPPER 
LEVEL TROUGH WILL SWING BY TO OUR NORTH...HELPING TO KEEP PRECIP IN 
THE FORECAST THROUGH SATURDAY.  MAY BE ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR SOME 
THUNDER FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY EVENING...THEN JUST SHOWERS SATURDAY.  
THE FRONT WILL PUSH FURTHER TO THE SOUTHEAST BY SUNDAY. MAY STILL BE 
A FEW SHOWERS LINGERING OVER THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS...BUT SHOULD BE 
MAINLY DRY SUNDAY.  ANOTHER SHORT WAVE IS FORECAST TO AFFECT THE 
AREA MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT...PERHAPS INTO TUESDAY...THEN DRIER AIR 
SHOULD MOVE IN AGAIN BY WEDNESDAY.  WILL GENERALLY STAY FAIRLY CLOSE 
TO GFS MOS TEMPS FOR MINS...BUT WILL UNDERCUT MOST MAX 
TEMPS...LEANING TOWARD COOLER ENSEMBLE MEANS/WPC TEMPS.

HIGH CLOUDS WERE PRESENTLY OCCURRING OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS
EVENING...WITH ADDITIONAL HIGH CLOUDS FROM THE CONVECTION OVER THE
MID WEST EXPECTED TO INCREASE OVER THE FORECAST AREA AFTER
MIDNIGHT. OUTFLOW FROM THIS CONVECTION MAY ALSO TRIGGER SOME
ISOLATED CONVECTION OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU BEFORE SUNRISE.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT
WILL UPDATE THIS EVENING TO MENTION INCREASING CLOUDINESS. WILL NOT
PLAN TO MENTION ANY FOG OVERNIGHT DUE TO THE EXPECTED INCREASE IN
CLOUD COVER.

401 
FXUS64 KMRX 101913
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT WED SEP 10 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN 
OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TONIGHT WITH A COLD FRONT APPRAOCHING 
FROM THE NW LATE ON THURSDAY. THE COLD FRONT WILL BE PUSHED ALONG BY 
A WESTERLY JET SEGEMNT ACROSS THE LOWER OH VALLEY. WARM TEMPERATURES 
AGAIN TONIGHT WITH A SLIGHT RISE IN THICKNESS VALUES. WARM 
TEMPERATURES ON THURSDAY WILL BE MODERATED BY INCREASING CLOUD COVER 
AND THE ARRIVAL OF PRECIPITATION BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON. PWAT VALUES 
ARE HIGH INCREASING TO NEAR 2.00. THE WARM LAYER IS ALSO DEEP SO 
HEAVY RAINFALL WILL BE THE MAIN THREAT WITH THE IMPENDING 
CONVECTION. INSTABILITY AND LIFT ARE LOW TO MODERATURE SO STRONG 
GUSTY WINDS ARE POSSIBLE WITH THE AFTERNOON CONVECTION. 

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY/... A COLD FRONT WILL 
CONTINUE TO PUSH INTO THE REGION THURSDAY NIGHT... BRINGING 
SCATTERED TO WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA. SOME OF THE THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY COULD BE STRONG TO LOCALLY 
SEVERE INITIALLY AS IT PUSHES INTO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND FAR 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AROUND 00Z. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE LIMITED 
INSTABILITY AND SYNOPTIC LIFT...THE PRIMARY IMPACT FROM THIS 
ACTIVITY MAY SIMPLY BE LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL /WHICH WILL BE AIDED 
BY THE ABUNDANT MOISTURE/HIGH PWATS IN PLACE/. OVERNIGHT...THIS 
ACTIVITY WILL BEGIN TO GRADUALLY WEAKEN AND DISSIPATE AS THE FRONT  
SLOWLY SINKS SOUTH AND BEGINS TO WASH OUT. HOWEVER...WITH THIS WEAK 
BOUNDARY IN PLACE...SCATTERED AFTERNOON CONVECTION WILL BE POSSIBLE 
AGAIN ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...THOUGH COVERAGE WILL BE MORE LIMITED 
GIVEN THE DIFFUSE NATURE OF THE FRONT. THE PRIMARY SYNOPTIC WAVE/ 
TROUGH WILL PUSH THROUGH ON SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT...WHICH WILL 
USHER IN A STRONGER COLD FRONT AND A COOLER EARLY-AUTUMN AIR MASS 
INTO THE REGION. TEMPERATURES NEXT WEEK WILL BE NOTABLY COOLER AND 
PEAK INTO THE MID 70S TO LOWER 80S BY THE END OF THE PERIOD. SOME 
ADDITIONAL SHORTWAVES MAY ALSO BRING SOME SLIGHT CHANCES FOR 
PRECIPITATION TOWARD THE MIDDLE OF THE NEW WORK WEEK...BUT A COOLER 
AND MOSTLY DRY FORECAST SEEMS TO BE THE PRIMARY WEATHER FOR THE 
EARLY TO MIDDLE PART OF THE NEXT WEEK. 

&&

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK RIDGING OVER THE REGION TODAY

EVENING WITH BEST CHANCES OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  FOR THE MOST PART... 
WILL BE DRY OVERNIGHT...HOWEVER...TOWARDS MORNING ISOLATED 
CONVECTION MAY POSSIBLY REACH INTO THE NORTHWESTERN AREAS IN ADVANCE 
OF AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT.  AS FOR TEMPERATURES...SHOULD BE A 
COUPLE DEGREES WARMER BOTH TODAY AND TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODEL AGREEMENT AND RUN TO 
RUN CONSISTENCY DECENT EARLY IN THE LONG TERM PERIOD...BUT BECOMES 
MUCH POORER LATE.  FORECAST CONFIDENCE STARTS OUT AVERAGE BUT ENDS 
UP BELOW AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.  GOOD MODEL AGREEMENT THAT A 
COLD FRONT WILL SWING INTO THE AREA ON THURSDAY. EXPECT GOOD 
COVERAGE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AHEAD OF THE FRONT...AND SOME 
OF THESE STORMS MAY BECOME STRONG TO SEVERE.  WILL CONTINUE MENTION 
IN HWO.  THE FRONT WILL BE SLOW TO EXIT AS IT BECOMES NEARLY 
PARALLEL TO THE UPPER FLOW...KEEPING SHOWERS AND PERHAPS SOME 
THUNDER IN THE FORECAST THROUGH FRIDAY.  AN UPPER TROUGH MOVING EAST 
WILL HELP TO TRIGGER ADDITIONAL SHOWERS SATURDAY...AND BEHIND THIS 
FEATURE IT APPEARS THERE WILL BE SOME DRYING...ALTHOUGH MODEL 
AGREEMENT LACKING ON THIS.  WILL KEEP SUNDAY DRY FOR NOW...AND THEN 
INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS MONDAY AS A SHORT WAVE FEATURE 
MAY AFFECT THE AREA.  DRY TUESDAY FOR NOW.  WILL GO CLOSE TO MOS 
GUIDANCE TEMPS EARLY ON...BUT WILL UNDERCUT MEX HIGH TEMPS FOR MUCH 
OF THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD...WHICH AGREES BETTER WITH ENSEMBLE 
MEANS.

255 PM EDT TUE SEP 9 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...PATTERN SIMILAR TODAY AS

THE FORECAST AREA INTO THE AFTERNOON. THIS DELAYED WARMING WITH

WITH A COUPLE MORE HOURS OF HEATING STORMS MAY INCREASE A LITTLE IN

ANY STORMS BUT COVERAGE WILL NOT BE HIGH ENOUGH TO BE MORE THAN AN
ISOLATED THREAT. EXPECT LOWS TONIGHT ABOUT THE SAME AS THIS
MORNING...LOWER 60S NE TN AND SW VA TO UPPER 60S TO NEAR 70 CENTRAL
AND SOUTH. FOR WEDNESDAY MORE OF THE SAME AS TODAY. ISOLATED
SHOWERS AND STORMS...MAINLY IN THE AFTERNOON. LOWERED HIGHS A
COUPLE DEGREES WITH THE CHANCE FOR MORE LOW CLOUDS RETARDING
HEATING AGAIN BUT HIGHS SHOULD BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN TODAY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...WITH THE MAIN FEATURE BEING THE PASSAGE OF A STRONG COLD 
FRONT DURING THURSDAY AND FRIDAY TIME FRAME. BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF 
MODELS SHOW THIS COLD FRONT MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY
AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WITH A GOOD COVERAGE OF CONVECTION EXPECTED
TO DEVELOP AHEAD OF IT AS A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPS
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS COLD FRONT WILL LIKELY BE SLOW TO MOVE
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY...AS THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW
BECOMES NEARLY PARALLEL TO THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY WITH A BROAD UPPER
TROUGH DEVELOPING OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY. THUS...EXPECT SCATTERED
CONVECTION TO LINGER OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY... WITH THE
UPPER TROUGH TRIGGERING ADDITIONAL SCATTERED CONVECTION ON SATURDAY.
HIGH PRESSURE THEN BUILDS OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR EARLY NEXT
WEEK...WITH TEMPS COOLING BACK DOWN TO NEAR NORMAL LEVELS FOR THIS
TIME OF YEAR. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND COOLER THAN THE GFS
GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH IS IN
BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

WILL HAVE THE HIGHEST POPS THURSDAY AFTERNOON INTO THURSDAY NIGHT 
AND LEAVE CHANCE POPS IN PLACE FRIDAY AND SLIGHT CHANCE FOR 
SATURDAY.  SURFACE HIGH BUILDS IN FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY FOR COOLER 
AND DRIER CONDITIONS.

807 
FXUS64 KMRX 081902
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
302 PM EDT MON SEP 8 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE MAP SHOWS AN 
INVERTED TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY WITH HIGH PRESSURE 
TO THE NORTHEAST AND A SURFACE LOW ALONG THE SE COAST FROM GA INTO 
SC. ACROSS NORTHEAST SECTIONS EASTERLY FLOW WAS BRINGING IN SLIGHTLY 
DRIER AIR MASS WITH DEW POINTS IN THE LOWER TO MID 60S. LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE WAS SLOW TO CLEAR OUT FROM CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEYS. 
SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS WERE DEVELOPING MAINLY ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHERN PLATEAU. LIKE YESTERDAY EXPECT A 
LITTLE MORE COVERAGE LATE AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS. ADDED PATCHY FOG FOR FORECAST AREA TO LATE NIGHT HOURS AS 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE REMAINS HIGH. TONIGHT STORMS SHOULD DIE DOWN 
QUICKLY AFTER 00Z SO KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE. TUESDAY DRIER AIR MASS 
SETTLES OVER REGION. KEPT DAY DRY THROUGH 18Z AND AFTERNOON 
CONVECTION MAINLY PLATEAU AND MOUNTAINS WITH VALLEYS DRY. MAV 
GUIDANCE LOOKS TOO LOW TONIGHT EXCEPT NORTH SO WENT FOR MAV/MET 
BLEND CENTRAL AND SOUTH WITH POSSIBLE LOW CLOUDS LATE. FOR HIGHS 
TUESDAY PREFER HIGHER MAV HIGHS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...WITH THE MAIN FEATURE BEING THE PASSAGE OF A STRONG COLD 
FRONT ON THURSDAY. ISOLATED DIURNAL CONVECTION WILL BE POSSIBLE 
AGAIN ON WEDNESDAY...AS A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPS OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA. BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS THEN SHOW A STRONG 
COLD FRONT MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING...WITH A GOOD COVERAGE OF CONVECTION DEVELOPING AHEAD OF IT 
AS A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. 
THIS COLD FRONT WILL LIKELY BE SLOW TO MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST 
AREA ON FRIDAY...AS THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW BECOMES NEARLY PARALLEL TO 
THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. THUS...WILL LEAVE SOME LOW CHANCE POPS IN THE 
FORECAST ON FRIDAY...AND AGAIN ON SATURDAY AS AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT 
WAVE SWINGS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. HIGH PRESSURE THEN BUILDS OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA FOR THE WEEKEND AND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...WITH 
TEMPS COOLING BACK DOWN TO NEAR NORMAL LEVELS FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. 
AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS
THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH
THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

FXUS64 KMRX 080752
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EDT MON SEP 8 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WEAK INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH 
OVER THE AREA WILL PERSIST FOR MUCH OF THE SHORT TERM PERIOD.  WHILE 
FORCING LOOKS WEAK...IT APPEARS THERE WILL BE SUFFICIENT INSTABILITY 
TO WARRANT CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ALL ZONES FOR 
TODAY. WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE POPS INTO THE EVENING 
HOURS...THEN DRY LATER TONIGHT. MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE...SO WILL NOT STRAY FAR.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE TREND TOWARD A PERIOD OF 
DRIER WEATHER WITH UPPER RIDGING GRADUALLY BUILDING INTO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION CONTINUES AND THEREFORE WAS ABLE TO 
CONTINUE TO PULL BACK ON PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION BOTH TUESDAY 
AND WEDNESDAY...LIMITING THE POSSIBILITY OF RAIN TO AN ISOLATED 
SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND THE MOUNTAINS 
BORDERING NORTH CAROLINA. FOR THURSDAY THE MODELS ARE CONVERGING ON 
AN AFTERNOON ARRIVAL OF CONVECTION WITH THE SIGNIFICANT COLD FRONT 
WHICH WILL BRING COOLER...MORE SEASONAL TEMPERATURES FOR MID 
SEPTEMBER TO THE REGION THROUGH THE WEEKEND. TRIED TO ADJUST LIKELY 
POPS FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WITH THE FRONT TO A 2 PM THROUGH 
8 PM PERIOD FOLLOWED BY A RATHER LENGTHY PERIOD OF CHANCE POPS FOR 
SHOWERS WELL INTO FRIDAY EVENING WITH THE ECMWF AND CANADIAN HINTING 
AT A SLOWING OF THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY AS UPPER LEVEL ENERGY BUILDS 
BACK INTO THE CENTER OF THE NATION FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY. THE GFS HAS 
BEEN GRADUALLY MOVING IN THIS DIRECTION DURING THE PAST COUPLE DAYS 
BUT STILL IS MORE PROGRESSIVE WITH THE LATE WEEK ACTION AND HAS LESS 
AMPLIFICATION WITH THE MID AMERICA SHORT WAVE. MAINTAINED THE PAST 
COUPLE DAYS FORECAST IDEOLOGY FOLLOWING THE CONCEPT OF PESSIMISM 
WITH A FEW MORE CLOUDS AND CHANCE POPS FOR A FEW SHOWERS THROUGH 
FRIDAY NIGHT. FORECAST CONFIDENCE SOMEWHAT LOWER THAN USUAL FOR THE 
WEEKEND WITH MODELS INDICATING THERE COULD BE YET ANOTHER SHORT WAVE 
ENTERING THE PICTURE WITH DEVELOPMENT OF AN INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. FOR NOW WILL KEEP AN OPTIMISTIC 
FORECAST GOING WITH DRY WEATHER ALONG WITH SOME SUNSHINE SATURDAY 
AND SUNDAY AWAITING BETTER FOCUS IN FUTURE MODEL RUNS. STAYED A FEW 
DEGREES BELOW MOS GUIDANCE FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY WITH THE ARRIVAL OF 
COOLER CANADIAN AIR.

134 
FXUS64 KMRX 071829
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
229 PM EDT SUN SEP 7 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
THE WEAK FRONT TO OUR NORTH AND WEST TODAY MAY MAKE SLIGHT SOUTHWARD 
PROGRESS TONIGHT. CLOUDS NEAR THE FRONT THIS AFTERNOON WILL LIKELY 
STAY IN PLACE THROUGH THE NIGHT IN SW VA AND THE NORTHERN 
PLATEAU...BUT THE SHALLOW LAYER OF MOISTURE SHOULD NOT RESULT IN 
PRECIP. CLEARING TO THE SOUTH OF THE CLOUDS SHOULD RESULT IN SOME 
FOG DEVELOPMENT. TOMORROW THE FRONT IS MORE DIFFUSE...AND THE NAM 
DEVELOPS SOME AFTERNOON SHOWERS ALONG THE PLATEAU AND MOUNTAINS. 
THERE IS SOME WEAK INSTABILITY BUT VERY LITTLE FORCING TO ENHANCE 
LIFT. WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS IN THE TERRAIN AREAS WITH A SLIGHT 
CHANCE IN THE VALLEY. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
MOISTURE ADVECTION WILL REMAIN THROUGH THE REST OF THE WEEK AS A
COLD FRONT APPROACHES THE AREA AT THE END OF THE WORK WEEK. A
SLIGHT CHANCE OF DIURNAL SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE
ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING...MAINLY ALONG THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. A BUILDING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL BRING THE
FRONT TO THE AREA BY THURSDAY. MODELS HAVE BEEN IN STRONG AGREEMENT
FOR THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS THAT THE FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THURSDAY
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. CONFIDENCE IS HIGH ON RAIN CHANCES THURSDAY.
HOWEVER...MODELS STILL IN DISAGREEMENT ON WHEN RAIN WILL EXIT THE
AREA. GFS IS STILL HANGING ON TO THE CHANCE OF RAIN FRIDAY...WHILE
ECMWF IS JUST TOO EXCITED ABOUT RAIN THROUGH THE REST OF THE
WEEKEND AND INTO THE NEXT WORK WEEK. HAVE GONE WITH THE GFS SINCE
IT HAS BEEN THE MOST CONSISTENT...BUT STAYED PESSIMISTIC AND KEPT
SLIGHT CHANCE IN THROUGH THE EVENING FRIDAY. THE WIND PROFILE WITH
THIS FRONT THURSDAY IS A BIT WEAK...AND INSTABILITIES ARE LOW.
LOOKS LIKE THE BIGGEST THREAT WITH THIS FRONT IS HEAVY RAIN WITH
THE HIGH PW VALUES EXPECTED. TEMPERATURES LOOK TO BE NEAR NORMAL
THROUGH THE WORK WEEK...AND DROP TO A COUPLE OF DEGREES BELOW
NORMAL BEHIND THE FRONT.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

WILL GENERALLY TRIM MAV TEMPS SLIGHTLY FOR MAX TEMPS TODAY...GIVEN

THE SHORT TERM PERIOD.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...STILL A CHANCE FOR A FEW 
SHOWERS AND MAYBE A THUNDERSTORM ON MONDAY AND TO A LESSER EXTENT ON 
TUESDAY AS RELATIVELY DEEP MOISTURE WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR LIFTING AS 
A COUPLE OF SHORT WAVE FEATURES BUILD EAST ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY. 
BACKED OFF A BIT ON POPS FOR WEDNESDAY LEAVING JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE 
FOR A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM OVER THE PLATEAU AND MOUNTAINS 
BORDERING NORTH CAROLINA WITH ANY ORGANIZED FOCUS FOR PRECIPITATION 
LACKING. BY THURSDAY A STRONGER STORM SYSTEM WILL BE MOVING INTO THE 
SOUTHEASTERN U.S. MODELS GENERALLY AGREE THAT A COLD FRONT WILL BE 
DROPPING SOUTHEAST INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THURSDAY INTO 
THURSDAY NIGHT. THERE ARE STILL SOME MINOR TIMING ISSUES BUT IT 
APPEARS THE BEST CHANCE OF RAIN WILL BE THURSDAY AFTERNOON INTO 
THURSDAY EVENING FOR THE MRX FORECAST AREA. THE STRONGER WIND FIELD 
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM COULD ALLOW FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF 
SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS. STILL HAD TO HOLD ONTO CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS 
ON FRIDAY AS THE UPPER LEVEL STEERING PARALLELS THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
WHICH COULD SLOW THE BOUNDARY DOWN. KEPT ANY PRECIP OUT OF THE 
FORECAST ON SATURDAY AS DRIER AIR SHOULD BE IN PLACE BY THAT TIME.

528 
FXUS64 KMRX 061828
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
228 PM EDT SAT SEP 6 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
A LINE OF SHOWERS HAS DEVELOPED ALONG A PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH ACROSS 
MIDDLE TN AND ERN KY. THE BEST UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT AND INSTABILITY 
IS JUST NORTH OF OUR AREA...SO IT IS EXPECTED THAT THE LINE OF 
STORMS WILL BE BEST MAINTAINED ACROSS NORTHERN PORTIONS OF OUR AREA 
THROUGH THE EVENING...AND WEAKEN IN SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL PORTIONS 
WHERE OBSERVED SURFACE WINDS ARE DIFFLUENT. DYNAMIC FORCING IS
WEAK WITH THE TROUGH IN OUR AREA...LIKELY TOO WEAK TO MAINTAIN
SHOWERS AFTER MIDNIGHT AFTER DAYTIME HEATING IS LOST...SO WILL DROP
POPS BACK SHARPLY AFTER THAT TIME. THE COLD FRONT ITSELF WILL PUSH
SOUTHEASTWARD THROUGH THE AREA ON SUNDAY. SOME SHOWERS COULD
DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE FRONT ACROSS SOUTHERN AND EASTERN
PORTIONS...MAINLY IN THE AFTERNOON...BUT EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER THAT
IS EXPECTED IN THE MORNING WILL PREVENT MUCH DESTABILIZATION...AND
A N-NW FLOW THROUGH THE LOW LEVELS WILL NOT BE CONDUCIVE TO
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT...AT LEAST OUTSIDE THE MOUNTAINS. WILL HAVE
JUST LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS EAST AND SOUTH TOMORROW...WITH
TEMPERATURES A LITTLE COOLER THAN MOS GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
BEHIND THE FRONT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING...A SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE
THROUGH THE AREA BRINGING A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS...MAINLY ALONG THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. TUESDAY HAS A
HIGHER PRESSURE IN STORE WITH PRECIP CHANCES LIMITED. WEDNESDAY IS
EXPECTED TO HAVE ENOUGH MOISTURE ADVECTION AND INSTABILITY FOR
INCREASED CHANCES OF DIURNAL SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ALONG THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THEN MARKS THE ARRIVAL OF THE NEXT COLD FRONT TO
MOVE THROUGH THE AREA. A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL DEVELOP
AND SLOWLY MOVE NORTHEAST THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES THROUGH THE END
OF THE WORK WEEK. MODELS STILL IN AGREEMENT FOR THE MAIN FRONTAL
BOUNDARY TO MOVE THROUGH THE REGION THURSDAY EVENING...WITH SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING AHEAD OF THIS FRONT. GFS IS STILL
QUICK TO MOVE EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS...WITH THE ECMWF WANTING TO
STAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. HAVE AGAIN TRENDED MORE TOWARDS GFS WITH
ITS CONSISTENT THEME. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL THROUGH THE
WORK WEEK...AND BEHIND THE FRONT TEMPS WILL DROP TO BELOW NORMAL AS
A DEEP TROUGH SETTLES OVER THE EASTERN CONUS BRINGING NORTHERN AIR
TO THE FORECAST AREA.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             71  85  67  83 /  40  30  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  69  82  65  82 /  50  20  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       70  80  65  82 /  50  20  10  20

248 
FXUS64 KMRX 060807
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT SAT SEP 6 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE OHIO 
VALLEY THIS MORNING WILL MOVE INTO THE CWA LATER TODAY. EXPECT 
CONVECTION TO DEVELOP ALONG AND AHEAD OF THE FRONT ESPECIALLY AFTER 
18Z...PERSISTING TIL AROUND 03Z BEFORE DIURNALLY DIMINISHING 
OVERNIGHT TONIGHT. A WARM AND HUMID DAY TODAY WITH VALLEY HIGHS IN 
THE MID TO UPPER 80S WITH DEWPOINTS AROUND 70. WITH COMPRESSIONAL 
HEATING AHEAD OF THE FRONT...ANY VALLEY AREAS THAT MAY EEK OUT SOME 
PERSISTENT AFTERNOON SUNSHINE MAY SQUIRT UP TO LOWER 90S. NOT 
EXPECTING MUCH IN THE WAY OF SEVERE WEATHER AT THIS TIME BEYOND THE 
SEASONAL ISOLATED VARIETY...AS DYNAMICS FOR ORGANIZATION IS PUSHED 
UP TOWARD THE NORTHEAST PART OF THE COUNTRY.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...EVEN THOUGH THE CALENDAR SAY'S 
IT IS SEPTEMBER...TYPICALLY ONE OF THE DRIEST MONTHS OF THE 
YEAR...IT LOOKS LIKE THERE WON'T BE ANY EXTENDED DRY SPELLS IN THIS 
FORECAST. THE JET STREAM STAYS GENERALLY ACTIVE SUNDAY INTO MONDAY 
WITH A HINT OF CONTINUED ACTION ON TUESDAY. SATURDAY'S COLD FRONT 
SLIPS SOUTH OF THE REGION BY SUNDAY MORNING BUT A SHORT WAVE TROUGH 
INDUCES A WAVE OF LOW PRESSURE ALONG THE BOUNDARY SLOWING ITS 
PROGRESS WHILE ANOTHER SHORT WAVE RIDES ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY ON 
MONDAY . THE MODELS SUGGEST THE MRX FORECAST AREA WILL BE ON THE 
EDGE OF DEEPER MOISTURE OVER THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC STATES DURING THIS 
PERIOD. THESE UPPER TROFS WILL PROVIDE THE NECESSARY LIFT TO 
GENERATE A FEW SHOWERS AND EVEN A THUNDERSTORM OR TWO...MAINLY OVER 
THE HIGHER TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER CLOSER TO THE 
DEEPER MOISTURE. TRIED TO BACK OFF ON PRECIP CHANCES TUESDAY INTO 
WEDNESDAY AS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION AWAITS THE ARRIVAL OF A 
STRONGER STORM SYSTEM DUE IN THE REGION SOMETIME LATER THURSDAY INTO 
FRIDAY. MODEL FORECASTS INDICATE A RATHER AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH AND 
STRONGER COLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY BUILDS THROUGH THE REGION DURING THIS 
LATE PORTION OF THE EXTENDED FORECAST GENERATING WIDESPREAD SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS. TWEAKED POPS UP A BIT FOR THIS SYSTEM WITH THE 
ECMWF AND GFS EACH AGREEING ON THE STRENGTH OF THE STORM SYSTEM. 
TIMING IS A LITTLE OFF BETWEEN THE MODELS BUT SHOULD COME INTO 
BETTER FOCUS IN SUBSEQUENT FORECASTS.

619 
FXUS64 KMRX 051840
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT FRI SEP 5 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
A PATTERN CHANGE WILL FINALLY ARRIVE BY LATE IN THE PERIOD AS AN 
UPPER TROUGH/JET MOVE INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION...PUSHING A COLD 
FRONT TOWARD OUR AREA. UNTIL THEN...A MOIST AIR MASS WILL LINGER 
THROUGH TONIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING...AND A PERSISTENCE FORECAST 
WILL BE FOLLOWED FOR THE MOST PART. DIURNAL CONVECTION HAS DEVELOPED 
IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN THIS AFTERNOON...AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL 
WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH THE SLOW MOVEMENT OF THE STORMS. AS WE HAVE 
SEEN THE PAST FEW DAYS...ACTIVITY SHOULD DISSIPATE BY MIDNIGHT. FOG 
AND LOW STRATUS WILL LIKELY FOLLOW TOWARD SUNRISE. WENT ABOVE MOS 
GUIDANCE FOR LOW TEMPS...CLOSER TO LAST NIGHT'S OBSERVED LOWS. THE 
NAM DEPICTS SHOWERS/STORMS DEVELOPING ALONG A PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH 
EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON TO OUR NW...AND MOVING SE. WILL FOLLOW THIS 
TREND AND HAVE LIKELY POPS NORTH WITH CHANCES SOUTH AND CENTRAL. 
INSTABILITY APPEARS TOO WEAK AND UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT IS LACKING FOR 
ANY THREAT OF ORGANIZED SEVERE STORMS. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
RAIN CHANCES WILL SLOWLY DECREASE THROUGH THE NIGHT SATURDAY AS
THE COLD FRONT MOVES EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS. WEST TO NORTHWEST
FLOW SETS UP FOR SUNDAY...WITH SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE
AROUND THE MOUNTAINS AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS. SOUTHWEST FLOW IS THEN
EXPECTED THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF THE WORK WEEK...WITH ENOUGH
INSTABILITY AND MOISTURE ADVECTION FOR DIURNAL SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS EACH AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL
THROUGH MID WORK WEEK. A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE PLAINS WILL
GRADUALLY STRENGTHEN AND MOVE NORTHEAST...WITH AN ASSOCIATED COLD
FRONT PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE AREA THROUGH THE END OF THE WORK
WEEK. MODELS IN FAIRLY DECENT AGREEMENT FOR TIMING OF THE FRONT
MOVING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING...BUT DIFFER ON THE
SPEED OF THE FRONT EXITING THE REGION. HAVE GONE WITH THE MORE
CONSISTENT GFS SHOWING THE FRONT MOVING THROUGH BY FRIDAY MORNING.
WITH A MORE NORTHWEST FLOW PATTERN BEHIND THE FRONT...HAVE AGREED
WITH MODELS AND LOWERED TEMPERATURES TO A FEW DEGREES BELOW NORMAL.


&&

FXUS64 KMRX 050754
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
351 AM EDT FRI SEP 5 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE ATMOSPHERE WILL REMAIN QUITE 
MOIST FOR THE SHORT TERM AS THE PATTERN STAYS RATHER STAGNANT.  
ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR SCATTERED CONVECTION ESPECIALLY IN THE 
AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING...ALTHOUGH MODEL CAPE VALUES NOT IMPRESSIVE. 
WEAK FLOW WILL LEAD TO SLOW MOVING STORMS AND LOCALIZED VERY HEAVY 
RAINFALL. WILL GENERALLY UNDERCUT MAV TEMPS A BIT FOR MAX TEMPS AS 
THEY LOOK ON THE HIGH SIDE AGAIN.  LESS ARGUMENT WITH MAV MIN TEMPS 
TONIGHT BUT WILL TWEAK A FEW UP SLIGHTLY.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...AN UPPER TROUGH PRESSES 
EAST ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. ON SATURDAY WHILE DRAGGING A COLD 
FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT. THIS WILL LEAD TO A 
MODERATELY HIGH PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION IN THE FORM OF SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS...MAINLY LATER SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND SATURDAY 
NIGHT. MORE SHORT WAVE ENERGY RIDES ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY ON SUNDAY 
KEEPING THE CHANCE FOR CONVECTION ALIVE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION. BY MONDAY THERE WILL ONLY BE A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR 
A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM AS MOST OF THE DEEPER MOISTURE AND BETTER 
INSTABILITY WILL BE OVER THE EASTERN SEABOARD. WINDS GRADUALLY SHIFT 
BACK TO A MORE SOUTHERLY DIRECTION ON TUESDAY ALLOWING FOR SOME 
MOISTENING WHICH LATE SUMMER INSOLATION MAY WORK ON TO GENERATE 
WIDELY SCATTERED SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A THUNDERSTORM. TOWARD THE END 
OF THE LONG TERM...MODELS NOT QUITE IN AGREEMENT WITH TIMING OF A 
RELATIVELY SIGNIFICANT UPPER TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM 
BUT APPEAR TO TARGET A WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT TIME 
FRAME FOR THE NEXT DECENT SHOT AT RAIN WITH MORE SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS IN STORE.

FXUS64 KMRX 041835
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EDT THU SEP 4 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
A MOIST AIR MASS AND MIDLEVEL SHEAR ZONE BETWEEN TWO RIDGES WILL 
REMAIN OVER THE REGION THROUGH FRIDAY. WITH LITTLE PATTERN 
CHANGE...WILL FOLLOW MAINLY A PERSISTENCE FORECAST. THE NAM SEEMS TO 
BE PERFORMING PRETTY WELL WITH THE PATTERN...AND THE HRRR HAS BEEN 
RELIABLE IN DEPICTING AREAS OF AND TIMING OF CONVECTION. IT SHOWS 
ONGOING PRECIP LINGERING IN NE SECTIONS UNTIL DISSIPATING AROUND 
MIDNIGHT...AND WILL FOLLOW THAT SOLUTION FOR TONIGHT. AS WE SAW THIS 
MORNING...PATCHY FOG AND LOW CLOUDS CAN BE EXPECTED TO START THE DAY 
IN MOST SPOTS. THE ONE DIFFERENCE IN THE NAM TOMORROW APPEARS TO BE 
THAT THE 700 MB DEFORMATION/SHEAR ZONE SHIFTS SLIGHTLY TO THE SOUTH 
AND EAST...WHICH MAY LEAD TO SOUTHERN AND EASTERN AREAS BEING A BIT 
MORE FAVORED FOR AFTERNOON CONVECTION THAN NORTHERN AND WESTERN 
AREAS. STILL...WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS EVERYWHERE TOMORROW AFTERNOON. 
GFS MOS HIGH TEMPS APPEAR TOO WARM TOMORROW...AND HAVE VERIFIED TOO 
WARM THE PAST FEW DAYS...SO WILL UNDERCUT THEM BY SEVERAL DEGREES. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA SATURDAY EVENING...WITH
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING THROUGH THE DAY SATURDAY AHEAD
OF THIS FRONT. INSTABILITY AND SHEAR ARE UNIMPRESSIVE...SO LOOKING
AT MAIN THREAT OF HEAVY RAIN WITH THESE STORMS. NEAR ZONAL FLOW WIL
SET UP OVER THE AREA BEHIND THIS FRONT. THE AIRMASS DOES NOT YEILD
MUCH CHANGE IN THE WAY OF COOLER TEMPERATURES SUNDAY THROUGH THE
END OF THE PERIOD. BUT DOES HAVE DRIER AIR ADVECTED IN THE
MIDLEVELS. THIS ALONG WITH THE AFTERNOON HEATING...EXPECTING TO SEE
DIURNAL THUNDERSTORMS EACH DAY. UPPER LEVEL MOISTURE WILL CONTINUE
TO INCREASE THROUGH THIS PERIOD...SO WILL ONLY SEE PARTLY CLOUDY
SKIES FOR A DAY OR TWO AT THE BEGINNING OF THE WORK WEEK. THE NEXT
BIG FEATURE MOVING INTO THE AREA IS ANOTHER COLD FRONT SET TO MOVE
IN TOWARDS THE END OF NEXT WEEK. MODELS DIFFER ON TIMING AND
STRENGTH OF THIS SYSTEM...SO SETTLED FOR CHANCE POPS THURSDAY AND
FRIDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE A COUPLE OF DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL FOR
THIS TIME OF YEAR.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             70  89  69  87 /  20  50  20  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  69  87  68  86 /  20  40  20  60

FXUS64 KMRX 040716
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 AM EDT THU SEP 4 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FOR THIS MORNING...ENOUGH BREAKS
IN THE MID-LEVEL CLOUDS...CALM WINDS AND WET GROUND WILL ALLOW
PATCHY DENSE FOG TO DEVELOP.

A WEAK SHEAR AXIS WILL REMAIN ACROSS THE AREA TODAY WITH THE MAIN
STORY BEING PERSISTENT PLUME OF TROPICAL MOISTURE OVER THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS. GFS AND NAM SHOW WEAK BOUNDARY LAYER CONVERGENCE OVER
EAST TENNESSEE/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TODAY WHICH WILL HELP FOCUS
THE RICH MOISTURE.

ENOUGH BREAKS TODAY TO ALLOW FOR MARGINAL INSTABILITY TO PRODUCE
SCATTERED TO BROKEN AREAS OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. MAIN
CONCERN WILL BE THE LOCAL TORRENTIAL RAINS WITH LOCALIZED FLASH
FLOODING POSSIBLE. WILL HIGHLIGHT IN THE HWO.

CONVECTION WILL BE MAINLY DIURNAL IN NATURE WITH COVERAGE AND
INTENSITY OF STORMS DIMINISHING QUICKLY AFTER SUNSET.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WITH 
THE ONLY SIGNIFICANT FEATURE AFFECTING THE FORECAST AREA BEING A 
WEAK COLD FRONT ON SATURDAY. AN UNSEASONABLY WARM AND HUMID AIR MASS 
WILL LINGER OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY...WITH SCATTERED 
CONVECTION DEVELOPING AGAIN...ESPECIALLY DURING THE AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING HOURS. BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS THEN REVEAL A BROAD AND 
FAIRLY FLAT UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH DEVELOPING OVER THE GREAT LAKES 
REGION BY FRIDAY NIGHT...WHICH WILL HELP PUSH A WEAK COLD FRONT INTO 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON SATURDAY. THIS COLD FRONT SHOULD GENERATE A 
BETTER COVERAGE OF CONVECTION OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY... 
AS A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPS AHEAD OF IT. TEMPS AND 
DEWPOINTS ARE EXPECTED TO ONLY SLIGHTLY DECREASE BEHIND THIS FRONTAL 
PASSAGE ON SUNDAY...WITH UNSEASONABLY WARM CONDITIONS LINGERING 
THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. ISOLATED CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE 
TO POSSIBLE EACH DAY AFTER THE FRONTAL PASSAGE...AS A MARGINALLY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS CONTINUES TO DEVELOP EACH AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 
AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND A LITTLE COOLER THAN THE GFS 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH IS IN BETTER 
AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

603 
FXUS64 KMRX 031843
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
243 PM EDT WED SEP 3 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
THE APPALACHIAN REGION WILL CONTINUE TO BE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF A 
MOIST AIR MASS PINCHED BETWEEN AN OFFSHORE RIDGE AND A RIDGE OVER 
THE OZARK REGION. STORMS HAVE BEGUN TO DEVELOP NEAR THE GA 
BORDER...AND WITH SLOW MOVEMENT IN THE MOIST AIR MASS...LOCALLY 
HEAVY RAIN WILL BE POSSIBLE. MOST ACTIVITY SHOULD REMAIN SOUTH OF 
KNOXVILLE WHERE THERMODYNAMIC PARAMETERS SHOW BETTER INSTABILITY 
TROUGH THE AFTERNOON/EVENING. STORMS SHOULD DISSIPATE BY MIDNIGHT AS 
DAYTIME HEATING IS LOST. SOME FOG AND LOW CLOUDS CAN BE EXPECTED 
AGAIN TONIGHT. A MIDLEVEL DEFORMATION ZONE OVER OUR AREA WILL MEAN 
ANOTHER DAY OF NUMEROUS TO SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ON 
THURSDAY. THE BEST CHANCES APPEAR IN EAST AREAS...PARTICULARLY SW NC 
DUE TO THE SE LOW LEVEL FLOW. WHILE INSTABILITY AND SHEAR APPEAR TOO 
WEAK FOR ANY THREAT OF SEVERE STORMS...HIGH PW VALUES AND DEEP CAPE 
SUGGEST SOME LOCALLY HEAVY RAIN POTENTIAL AGAIN.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
SUMMER TIME TEMPS AND MOISTURE AVAILABLE THROUGH THE PERIOD...SO
HARD TO RULE OUT DIURNAL CONVECTION EACH AFTERNOON AND EVENING.
HOWEVER...MODELS DO CONTINUE TO AGREE ON THE BEST THREAT OF
CONVECTION ON SATURDAY INTO SATURDAY NIGHT...AS A COLD FRONT
APPROACHES FROM THE NW. KEPT POPS IN THE 20 TO 40 PERCENT RANGE
PRIOR TO SATURDAY AS IN PREVIOUS GRIDS.

FAVORING THE SLIGHTLY DRIER ECMWF FOR THE LATER PERIODS...AS THE 
ECMWF PUSHES THE COLD FRONT JUST SOUTH AND EAST OF OUR FORECAST AREA 
BY SUNDAY...PERHAPS HANGING UP OVER NE GA AND WRN NC. BASED ON THIS 
SENSIBLE SCENARIO...I LOWERED POPS BY 10 TO 20 PERCENT ACROSS WRN 
AND NRN PARTS OF OUR REGION...AWAY FROM THE ERN MTNS AND SW NC 
COUNTIES FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY. 

WEAK SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW MAY RETURN BY TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY 
AHEAD OF THE NEXT FRONT/SYSTEM...BUT I DON'T SEE A FOCUS FOR 
CONVECTION OTHER THAN DAYTIME HEATING AND OROGRAPHIC LIFT. OPTED FOR 
A BROAD BRUSH OF SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NOW THAT FAR OUT IN TIME.

MOS TEMPS WERE CLOSE MOST PERIODS WITH GFS/GFSX MOS CONSISTENT FROM 
00Z TO 12Z MODEL RUNS. THE ONE OUTLIER WAS THE UNUSUALLY COOL NAM 
MOS MAX TEMPS FOR FRIDAY...WHICH I CHOSE TO DISREGARD AND STAY CLOSE 
TO PREVIOUS GRIDS AND NWS NEIGHBORS. 

&&

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
155 PM EDT TUE SEP 2 2014

.AVIATION...CONVECTION A LITTLE TIMID TO GET FIRED UP JUST YET BUT
STARTING TO SEE A NICE AREA OF SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS CELLS POPPING
OVER NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI WITH MORE DEVELOPMENT ALONG THE MAIN
OUTFLOW BOUNDARY ACROSS WESTERN KENTUCKY AND WESTERN TENNESSEE.
PUSHED BACK TIMING OF CONVECTION AGAIN FOR THE TERMINALS TO AROUND
22Z WITH VICINITY REMARKS AND THEN FROM AROUND 00-05Z FOR THE MAIN
ACTION WITH THE PRE-FRONTAL BOUNDARY. ALLOWED FOR SOME FOG AT TRI
BUT TYS AND CHA COULD SEE SOME FOG DEPENDING ON HOW MUCH RAIN
FALLS. LOOKS LIKE VFR CONDITIONS FROM AROUND 13Z ONWARD AT THE
AIRPORTS WITH ANY ISOLATED CONVECTION OCCURRING MAINLY DURING THE
AFTERNOON.

NORTHWESTERN PART OF THE FORECAST AREA AROUND 17-19Z. PLENTY OF
INSTABILITY AVAILABLE FOR STORMS BUT SHEAR IS NOT IMPRESSIVE. MAX
TEMPERATURE FORECAST ON TRACK.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
720 AM EDT TUE SEP 2 2014

.AVIATION... 
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A VERY MOIST AIR MASS LINGERING OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA...WITH A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE MID MS RIVER 
VALLEY AND A FAIRLY EXTENSIVE LINE OF CONVECTION AHEAD OF IT. THIS 
COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY APPROACH THE TN RIVER VALLEY LATE 
THIS AFTERNOON...WITH A MODERATELY TO POSSIBLY VERY UNSTABLE AIR 
MASS DEVELOPING AHEAD OF IT. THUS...EXPECT A GOOD COVERAGE OF 
CONVECTION TO DEVELOP LATE THIS AFTERNOON...AND WILL MENTION SOME 
TSTORMS AT THE TAF SITES BETWEEN 22 AND 24 UTC. OUTSIDE OF THIS LATE 
AFTERNOON CONVECTION...VFR CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED FOR MOST OF THE 
TAF PERIOD AT ALL THREE TAF SITES.

430 
FXUS64 KMRX 020715
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EDT TUE SEP 2 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WARM AND VERY MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH A WEAK
COLD FRONT OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY WHERE A LARGE MCS WAS
OCCURRING AHEAD OF IT. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY
APPROACH THE TN RIVER VALLEY LATE THIS AFTERNOON...WITH A
MODERATELY TO POSSIBLY VERY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING AHEAD OF
IT OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MODEL SOUNDINGS FOR THIS AFTERNOON
REVEAL A FAIRLY STEEP LAPSE RATE UP TO AROUND 700 MB...WITH NOT
MUCH CONVECTIVE INHIBITION ABOVE THAT. THUS...THE POTENTIAL FOR
SEVERE STORMS APPEARS TO BE BETTER TODAY WITH CAPE VALUES IN THE
2000 TO 2500 J/KG RANGE...A DECENT MID LEVEL WIND FLOW AROUND 25
KT...AND AN INVERTED-V PROFILE BELOW 850 MB WHERE DRY AIR MAY HELP
TO ENCOURAGE STRONG DOWNDRAFTS. THE COLD FRONT SHOULD THEN SLOWLY
DRIFT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...WITH CONVECTION GRADUALLY
WEAKENING AFTER MIDNIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND ARE
ESSENTIALLY A PERSISTENCE FORECAST.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...A FAIRLY ZONAL UPPER FLOW 
ACROSS THE UNITED STATES...EXCEPT FOR A SHORT-WAVE TROUGH MOVING 
THROUGH SOUTHERN CANADA/NORTHERN GREAT LAKES FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. 
THIS FAST MOVING TROUGH WILL PULL A FRONT INTO THE AREA FOR SATURDAY.

FOR WEDNESDAY...A STATIONARY FRONT WILL BE LOCATED NEAR THE 
TENNESSEE/GEORGIA STATE-LINE WITH UPSLOPE FLOW INTO THE MOUNTAINS. 
BEST CHANCES OF CONVECTION WILL BE ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST AND FAR 
EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS. THIS BOUNDARY LIFTS NORTH OVER THE AREA 
THURSDAY PULLING MOISTURE/INSTABILITY BACK INTO THE REGION. MAIN 
FORCING FOR STORMS THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WILL MAINLY BE THE LOCAL 
TERRAIN.

FOR SATURDAY...COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE AREA BEFORE STALLING AS 
BOUNDARY BECOMES PARALLEL WITH THE UPPER FLOW. THIS BOUNDARY REMAINS 
OVER THE AREA FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY. HIGH CHANCE/LIKELY POPS 
EXPECTED SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY...ESPECIALLY OVER THE HIGH TERRAIN.

MAIN CONCERN THROUGH THE PERIOD WILL BE LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS...BUT 
ISOLATED TO STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE...ESPECIALLY FOR 
SATURDAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             92  71  92  70 /  50  40  30  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  89  69  90  68 /  60  40  30  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       89  69  91  67 /  60  40  30  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              88  67  88  61 /  60  50  20  20 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
145 AM EDT TUE SEP 2 2014

.AVIATION... 
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A VERY MOIST AIR MASS LINGERING OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA...WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE 65 TO 70 DEGREE RANGE. 
WILL PLAN TO MENTION SOME MVFR VISIBILITIES DUE TO FOG AT ALL THREE 
TAF SITES THIS MORNING...BUT THINK THAT HIGH CLOUDS FROM CONVECTION 
OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY MAY KEEP THIS FOG FROM BECOMING TOO 
DENSE TOWARDS SUNRISE. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT A 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL DEVELOP OVER THE TAF SITES DURING 
THE AFTERNOON HOURS...AS A COLD FRONT SLOWLY APPROACHES THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY. THUS...A GOOD COVERAGE OF CONVECTION SHOULD DEVELOP AROUND 
THE TAF SITES THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...BUT FOR NOW...WILL ONLY 
MENTION VCTS IN THE TAFS SINCE THE EXACT TIMING AT THE TAF SITES 
REMAINS A BIT UNCERTAIN. OUTSIDE OF SOME FOG THIS MORNING AND 
CONVECTION IN THE AFTERNOON...VFR CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED FOR MOST 
OF THE TAF PERIOD AT ALL THREE TAF SITES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT MON SEP 1 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...ATMOSPHERE A BIT CAPPED OFF THIS 
AFTERNOON WITH A SUPPRESSED APPEARANCE NOTED IN SATELLITE IMAGERY. 
IT APPEARS STORMS ARE FIRING ON THE TERRAIN BUT WEAKEN LACKING 
OROGRAPHIC SUPPORT IN THE VALLEY. STAYED WITH ISOLATED PROBABILITY 
INTO THE EVENING MOST SPOTS AS SOME OF THE STORMS DRIFT INTO THE 
VALLEY BEFORE WEAKENING. PERHAPS A LITTLE BETTER CHANCE FOR A SHOWER 
OR THUNDERSTORM ON TUESDAY AS NORTH CENTRAL AMERICA UPPER TROUGHING 
CONTINUES TO GRADUALLY WORK ITS WAY EAST ACROSS THE UPPER MIDWEST. 
AS THIS OCCURS A WEAK COOL FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL DROP SOUTH INTO THE 
NORTHERN REACHES OF THE FORECAST AREA ENHANCING CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL 
MAINLY NORTH OF I-40. STAYED VERY NEAR GUIDANCE BLEND FOR MINS/MAXES.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...WEAK RIDGING ALOFT WILL 
BE THE DOMINANT FEATURE THROUGH THE PERIOD. THE WARMTH ASSOCIATED 
WITH THE RIDGE WILL WORK UPON LOW LEVEL MOISTURE THAT WILL REMAIN IN 
PLACE...TO PROMOTE DIURNAL CONVECTION EACH DAY. BUT A WEAK FRONTAL 
PASSAGE EARLY THIS COMING WEEKEND WILL PROBABLY BRING A BIT BETTER 
COVERAGE OF CONVECTION AROUND SATURDAY.

426 
FXUS64 KMRX 010730
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT MON SEP 1 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WARM AND VERY MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH DEWPOINTS 
NEAR 70 OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THAT THE COVERAGE OF CONVECTION OVER THE FORECAST AREA WILL BE LESS 
TODAY THAN IN PREVIOUS DAYS...DUE TO A LACK OF CONVECTIVE TRIGGERING 
MECHANISMS. HOWEVER...WITH A MARGINALLY TO POTENTIALLY MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WILL PLAN 
TO MENTION ISOLATED CONVECTION EVERYWHERE. MODEL SOUNDINGS EVEN 
REVEAL AN INVERTED-V PROFILE THIS AFTERNOON IN THE LOWER LEVELS 
WHERE DRY AIR MAY HELP TO ENCOURAGE STRONG DOWNDRAFTS WITH ANY 
CONVECTION. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE 
SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL DROP
SOUTH OUT OF THE OHIO VALLEY ON TUESDAY...WHICH WILL PUSH SOME
CONVECTION TOWARD THE REGION DURING THE LATE AFTERNOON/EVENING...
AND INTO THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. THE FRONT ITSELF HOWEVER SHOULD STALL
AND WASH OUT TO THE NORTH OF THE AREA ALONG THE NORTHERN PERIPHERY
OF A BROAD/FLATTENED SUBTROPICAL RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE. THIS RIDGE
WILL BEGIN TO AMPLIFY SLIGHTLY OVER THE AREA WEDNESDAY AND
THURSDAY...PROMOTING CONTINUED HOT AND HUMID CONDITIONS. WITH THE
ABUNDANT GULF MOISTURE UNDERNEATH THIS RIDGE...GOOD CHANCES FOR
SCATTERED DIURNALLY DRIVEN CONVECTION WILL EXIST EACH DAY THROUGH
THE REMAINDER OF THE WORK WEEK AND EVEN INTO THE WEEKEND. A 30 TO
40 POP SEEMED WARRANTED MOST DAYS...WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 80S TO
LOWER 90S DEPENDING ON STORM/CLOUD COVERAGE. THE RIDGE WILL SLOWLY
RETROGRADE WEST HEADING TOWARD THE WEEKEND...WHICH WOULD PLACE THE
REGION IN NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT AND PERHAPS ENHANCE PRECIPITATION
CHANCES AT THE TAIL END OF THE PERIOD. HOWEVER...CONFIDENCE IS LOW
ATTM REGARDING WHICH DAY WOULD BE MORE FAVORED FOR COVERAGE...SO
HAVE MAINTAINED SCATTERED/CHANCE POPS EACH DAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             91  72  92  70 /  20  20  30  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  91  70  90  69 /  20  20  30  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       91  71  90  68 /  20  20  40  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              89  66  89  63 /  20  20  50  40 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

FXUS64 KMRX 010036
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
836 PM EDT SUN AUG 31 2014

.DISCUSSION...HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES AT THE SURFACE. DEEP MOISTURE
THAT HAS BEEN OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH SCATTERED SHOWERS AND
STORMS DURING THE AFTERNOON HAS BEGUN TO MOVE OUT WITH ONLY
ISOLATED SHOWERS AND ALMOST NO LIGHTNING EARLY THIS EVENING. GUSTY
WINDS TO AROUND 40 MPH OCCURRED WITH A FEW STORMS EARLIER. CURRENT
RADAR SHOWING DECREASING ACTIVITY. NEARLY CONTINUOUS STREAM OF
HIGH CLOUDS EXTENDS FROM THE FORECAST AREA SOUTHWEST TO TEXAS AND
WILL CONTINUE OVERNIGHT. FOR THE REST OF THE NIGHT ISOLATED SHOWERS
AND STORMS AND MOSTLY CLOUDY. UPDATED TO DROP RAIN CHANCES DOWN TO
SLIGHT CHANCE REST OF NIGHT AND ADJUST CURRENT TEMPERATURES DOWN
WHERE RAIN HAS OCCURRED. UPDATE SENT.

&&

825 
FXUS64 KMRX 311851
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 PM EDT SUN AUG 31 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...AIR MASS WAS SLUGGISH TO
DE-STABILIZE THIS AFTERNOON DUE TO EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER. HOWEVER
STARTING TO SEE SCATTERED CONVECTION (SOMEWHAT STRONG) DEVELOP
OVER NE AL AND SRN PLATEAU...WHERE MESO PAGE SHOWS 30 KTS OF SHEAR.
BASED ON THIS NEW ACTIVITY WENT IN LINE WITH LATEST HRRR AND RAP
MODELS. THUS...KEPT A SLIVER OF LIKELY POPS FOR LATE AFTERNOON
ACROSS SEQUATCHIE VALLEY AND NRN PLATEAU COUNTIES.

OTHERWISE...FOR THIS EVENING...CARRIED CHANCE POPS FROM W TO E
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH HIGHER CHANCES WEST. DROPPED BACK TO
MOSTLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS AFTER MIDNIGHT AND ALLOWED FOR PATCHY FOG
AREAWIDE LATE.

RIDGING IS NOTED BRIEFLY ACROSS THE REGION FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY
NIGHT...BEFORE MODELS ADVERTISE ANOTHER APPROACHING SHORTWAVE FOR
TUESDAY. LOWERED POPS A BIT MORE FOR MONDAY AND CARRIED JUST
MINIMAL POPS IN HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS FOR MONDAY EVENING. CHANCE
POPS FOR NOW ON TUESDAY...MORE LIKELY IN THE AFTERNOON. I THINK
FOG COULD BE MORE OF AN ISSUE MONDAY NIGHT GIVEN AN APPARENT LACK
OF CONVECTIVE DEBRIS CLOUDS.

FOR TEMPS...MOS MINS CLOSE AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED. FAVORED THE
WARMER MAXES MONDAY AND STAYED A BIT BELOW THE WARMER GFS MAXES ON
TUESDAY.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
IS PROGGED TO DROP SOUTH ACROSS THE VIEWING AREA WEDNESDAY INTO 
THURSDAY GENERATING A LITTLE BETTER CHANCE FOR SOME SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE REGION. THE MODELS DON'T SHOW MUCH DRYING 
AND STABILIZING BEHIND THIS WEAK FEATURE SO KEPT CHANCE POPS FOR 
CONVECTION GOING AREA WIDE ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. ANOTHER LOW 
AMPLITUDE UPPER TROUGH PASSAGE ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF 
THE COUNTRY HAS BEEN MODELED FOR LATE IN THE WEEKEND SO RAISED POPS 
IN THE CHANCE CATEGORY FOR SUNDAY AS A SURFACE COOL FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
ACCOMPANIES THE UPPER FEATURE. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             69  93  71  92 /  30  20  10  30

.DISCUSSION...CHALLENGE FOR FORECAST THIS MORNING IS HOW FAR EAST 
THE STEADY STREAM OF SHOWERS AND TSRA SPREAD...AS THE SHORTWAVE 
TROUGH TO OUR NORTH TRACKS ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY. 
THE SHORT RANGE MODELS...MAINLY THE HRRR AND RAP...SEEM MORE 
REASONABLE IN KEEPING THE BEST COVERAGE ACROSS OUR WRN COUNIES.  
FORECAST GRIDS GENERALLY IN LINE WITH THIS SCENARIO...BUT WILL 
MONITOR RADAR DEVELOPMENTS FOR THE REST OF THE MORNING.

EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER COULD HINDER MAX TEMPS THIS AFTERNOON...ALTHO 
MIN TEMPS WERE VERY MILD...SO REACHING 80S TO NEAR 90 DEGREES IS 
QUITE POSSIBLE. 

FORECAST GRIDS AND PRODUCTS LOOK GOOD WITH NO UPDATES NEEDED UNLESS 
THE SHOWERS WORK FURTHER EAST OF I-75 AND I-81...WHERE SCATTERED 
WORDING AND HIGH CHANCE POPS ARE FORECAST.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             88  70  93  71 /  50  30  20  10

626 
FXUS64 KMRX 310715
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EDT SUN AUG 31 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH A LINE OF 
CONVECTION MOVING NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST 
VA. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THE COVERAGE OF CONVECTION 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA TODAY WILL BE SCATTERED (LESS THAN PREVIOUSLY 
THOUGHT)...AS AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY 
WEAKENS. WITH ONLY A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS PROGGED TO DEVELOP 
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WILL PLAN TO LOWER POPS INTO THE CHANCE 
RANGE FOR MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA...BUT WILL KEEP LIKELY POPS 
GOING OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WHERE A POTENTIALLY MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS MAY DEVELOP. THE COVERAGE OF CONVECTION SHOULD 
THEN FURTHER DECREASE AS THE SUN SETS THIS EVENING. AS FOR TEMPS... 
GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A FLATTENED UPPER-LEVEL
RIDGE WILL BEGIN TO MOVE BACK INTO THE SOUTHERN UNITED STATES FOR
THE LABOR DAY HOLIDAY AND MUCH OF THE UPCOMING WORK WEEK. THIS WILL
PROMOTE CONTINUE HOT AND HUMID CONDITIONS TO KICK OFF THE MONTH OF
SEPTEMBER. ADDITIONALLY...DIURNALLY DRIVEN CONVECTION CAN BE
EXPECTED EACH DAY...PARTICULARLY IN THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING AND
FAVORING THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND MOUNTAINS. MOST OF THIS ACTIVITY
WILL BE SCATTERED IN NATURE...BUT THE BEST DAYS FOR COVERAGE MAY BE
TUESDAY/TUESDAY NIGHT AS A WEAK FRONT APPROACHES THE REGION FROM
THE OHIO VALLEY BEFORE WASHING OUT ALONG THE KY/TN BORDER. ISOLATED
TO SCATTERED CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE THROUGHOUT THE REST OF THE
WORK WEEK...WITH A 20 TO 30 POP WARRANTED EACH DAY THROUGH FRIDAY
/WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S/. THE RIDGE WILL SLOWLY
RETROGRADE WEST HEADING TOWARD THE WEEKEND WHICH WOULD PLACE THE
REGION IN NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT AND PERHAPS ENHANCE PRECIPITATION
CHANCES AT THE TAIL END OF THE PERIOD. 
&&

.DISCUSSION...TROPICAL MOISTURE STREAMING NORTH FROM THE GULF INTO

OVERNIGHT. SOME AREAS MAY GET LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. UPDATED
FORECAST TO RAISE POPS WEST AND CENTRAL AREAS. EASTERN AREAS WILL
BE DRIER. CONVECTION SHOULD DECREASE SOME BY LATE EVENING BUT THE
THREAT SHOULD CONTINUE ALL NIGHT...ESPECIALLY WEST. UPDATED DEW
POINTS AND TEMPERATURES AS RAIN AS COOLED TEMPERATURES WESTERN
SECTIONS. LOCALLY HEAVY RAIN POSSIBLE TOO WITH RAINFALL 1 TO 2
INCHES PER HOUR MAY CAUSE SOME LOCALIZED RURAL OR URBAN FLOODING.
UPDATE OUT SOON.

FXUS64 KMRX 301849
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
249 PM EDT SAT AUG 30 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...GULF MOISTURE CONTINUES TO
STREAM NORTHWARD FROM THE WESTERN GULF OF MEXICO THIS AFTERNOON.
AIR MASS IS BECOMING SLIGHTLY TO MODERATELY UNSTABLE WITH SPOTTY
CONVECTION POPPING OVER SE TN...AND MORE SO TO OUR SW OVER NE AL. 
I ADJUSTED THE SHORT TERM GRIDS FOR LATE AFTERNOON AND THIS EVENING
IN LINE WITH THE SIMILAR HRRR AND RAP MODELS...WHICH SUPPORTS
LIKELY POPS OVER WRN AREAS. THE SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVES EAST ACROSS
THE WRN GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY REGION OVERNIGHT...WHICH SHOULD
KEEP HIGHER POPS IN ORDER AFTER MIDNIGHT ACROSS OUR NRN PLATEAU AND
EXTREME WRN SW VA COUNTIES. 

FOR SUNDAY...STAYED WITH OUR LOW END OF LIKELY POPS...WHICH ARE
HIGHER THAN 12Z MOS GUIDANCE...SINCE THE SRN END OF THE UPPER
TROUGH WILL BE PASSING EAST ACROSS THE TN VALLEY AND SRN
APPALACHIANS DURING PEAK HEATING. LOWERED POPS FROM THE WEST
SUNDAY NIGHT WITH PASSAGE OF THE TROUGH AXIS. MONDAY ALSO SHAPING
UP DRIER THAN PREVIOUS GRIDS...SO CUT POPS BACK TO 20 TO 30
PERCENT...AND PUSHED MAX TEMPS BACK UP TO THE SIMILAR UPR 80S TO
LWR 90S FROM 12Z MOS. OTHERWISE...12Z NAM AND GFS MOS TEMPS WERE IN
GENERAL AGREEMENT AND CLOSELY FOLLOWED.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...NOT MUCH FOCUS FOR 
CONVECTION THROUGHOUT THE LONG TERM PERIOD OTHER THAN INTENSE SOLAR 
HEATING AND OROGRAPHIC LIFT ON THE MAJOR TERRAIN FEATURES. 
HOWEVER...THERE WILL BE SOME WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY MAKING ITS WAY 
ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION LATER TUESDAY INTO 
WEDNESDAY AND THIS CONFIGURATION MAY COAX A WEAK COOL FRONT INTO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. THIS BOUNDARY 
MAY ALLOW FOR A SLIGHT INCREASE IN PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION 
MAINLY ON WEDNESDAY IF IT CAN MAKE IT FAR ENOUGH SOUTH. OTHERWISE 
GENERALLY KEPT POPS AROUND 20-25 PERCENT AS UPPER RIDGING HANGS 
AROUND THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. TRENDED MAX TEMPS A LITTLE CLOSER TO 
SUGGESTED HIGHS FOR THE UPCOMING WEEK AS THE ANNUAL LATE SUMMER LAG 
IN HEATING DUE TO LONG WAVE RE-RADIATION FINALLY CATCHES UP TO US. 
STAYED PRETTY CLOSE TO MINS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

&&

DEVELOPING BY THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. IN ADDITION...A WEAK UPPER-

INSTABILITY TO TRIGGER SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER THE FORECAST AREA

.LONG TERM /SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY/...A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL DISTURBANCE
WILL TRACK THROUGH THE REGION SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT...GIVING THE
REGION A GOOD CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION. SCATTERED SHOWERS/STORMS
WILL INCREASE THROUGHOUT THE DAY ON SUNDAY...WITH ANOTHER ROUND
EXPECTED ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU DURING THE EVENING HOURS
/BEFORE THINGS SLOWLY BEGIN TO TAPER OFF AFTER MIDNIGHT/.
REASONABLE CHANCE POPS WILL EXIST ON MONDAY GIVEN THE ABUNDANT
MOISTURE IN PLACE BUT...STARTING NEXT WEEK THIS ACTIVITY WILL BE
MUCH MORE DIURNALLY DRIVEN AS THE CENTER OF THE RIDGE WILL THEN
BUILDS BACK INTO THE SOUTHERN U.S. THE ONE EXCEPTION COULD BE EARLY
NEXT WEEK AS ANOTHER WEAK FRONT MAY APPROACH THE REGION ON
TUESDAY...WHICH MAY PROMOTE SOME SLIGHTLY BETTER PRECIPITATION
CHANCES. HOWEVER...DO NOT THINK IT WILL MAKE FAR ENOUGH SOUTH TO
MAKE MUCH OF A DIFFERENCE...SO STILL HAVE A 30 POP FOR TUESDAY.
OTHERWISE...ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION WILL BE THE NORM EACH
DAY THROUGH THE WORK WEEK WITH HIGHS GENERALLY IN THE UPPER 80S TO
LOWER 90S.

MOISTURE INCREASING FROM SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...BUT LIFT WILL BE
GRADUAL AS THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS OVER THE MID-UPR MS VALLEY REGION
LIFTS NE INTO THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY REGIONS. HIGH POPS
NEEDED ESPECIALLY FOR WRN AREAS BY SATURDAY NIGHT...THEN AREA-WIDE
BY SUNDAY. HOWEVER...I CHOSE THE SLIGHTLY SLOWER TIMING FROM THE
GFS...ECMWF AND SREF...OVER THE FASTER NAM MODEL FOR NOW.

OTHERWISE...MOS GUIDANCE GENERALLY CLOSE FOR TONIGHT THROUGH
SATURDAY NIGHT...AND I FAVORED UNDERCUTTING THE GUIDANCE FOR MAX
TEMPS ON SUNDAY DUE TO HIGH POPS. 


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE WEAK SHORT WAVE 
TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS SUNDAY NIGHT INTO 
MONDAY SO HELD ONTO RELATIVELY HIGH CHANCE CATEGORY POPS FOR 
CONVECTION DURING THIS PERIOD WHILE TAPERING BACK TO LOWER CHANCE 
PROBABILITY FOR TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY WITH NO INDICATION OF 
ORGANIZED LIFT OTHER THAN AFTERNOON HEATING WITH SOME TERRAIN 
INFLUENCE. IN FACT MODELS TREND TOWARD THE CONCEPT OF A BUILDING 
RIDGE TOWARD THE END OF THE WORK WEEK WHICH WOULD SUPPRESS 
THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT TO SOME DEGREE. STAYED A DEGREE OR TWO 
UNDER MAX TEMP GUIDANCE WHILE STAYING NEAR TO JUST ABOVE SUGGESTED 
MINS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

942 AM EDT FRI AUG 29 2014

.DISCUSSION...NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES GENERALLY FROM YESTERDAY...EVEN

IN SE TN AND ALSO A FEW OTHER LAKES OR STREAMS. THE WEAK FRONTAL

NOT SURE HOW MUCH OF A FACTOR THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BE FOR THIS 
AFTERNOON...BUT PROBABLY CAN COUNT ON WEAK LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE IN 
THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF NE TN AND SW VA. SPOTTY SHOWERS OR TSRA SHOULD 
BE ABLE TO POP ONCE WE OVERCONME SOME WEAK CAPPING...(NOTED ON 12Z 
OHX AND RNK SOUNDINGS).
 
FORECAST GRIDS AND PRODUCTS LOOK ON TRACK THIS MORNING...BUT MIGHT 
NEED TO TWEAK HOURLY GRIDS. LOOKING AHEAD...SEEING A TREND IN THE 
MODELS TO SLOW DOWN THE EASTWARD SPREAD OF PRECIPITATION SATURDAY 
NIGHT. MAY ADJUST POPS DOWN SOME FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AFTER VIEWING 
12Z MODEL RUNS.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EDT FRI AUG 29 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A
WEST-TO-EAST ORIENTED QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER
EASTERN KY AND SOUTHERN WV...WITH A MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST
AREA WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE MID 60S TO LOWER 70S. THIS FRONTAL
BOUNDARY IS PROGGED TO DRIFT SOUTHWARD ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND
NORTHEAST TN LATER TODAY...BEFORE LIFTING BACK TO THE NORTH AS A
WARM FRONT TONIGHT AS SOUTHERLY WINDS INCREASE OVER THE REGION.
MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS
NEAR THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL HELP TO PRODUCE SCATTERED CONVECTION
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN.
THUS...WILL RAISE POPS A LITTLE FOR THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE
FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN
GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL TREND A LITTLE
WARMER THAN GUIDANCE WITH MINS TONIGHT SINCE DEWPOINTS ARE ALREADY
FAIRLY HIGH.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...THE UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE
THAT HAS BEEN SITTING OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR THE PAST SEVERAL
DAYS WILL SHIFT OFF THE EAST AND FLATTEN. THIS WILL WILL ALLOW FOR
A WEAK COLD FRONT TO APPROACH THE REGION AS AN UPPER-TROUGH MOVES
ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY...TRIGGERING OFF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.
THIS ACTIVITY WILL INITIALLY BE SCATTERED IN NATURE AS IT MOVES
INTO THE AREA FORM THE WEST SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING...BEFORE
BECOMING MORE WIDESPREAD LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY. THIS
CENTER OF THE RIDGE WILL THEN BUILD BACK INTO THE SOUTHERN U.S.
EARLY NEXT WEEK...BUT SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL CONTINUE TO PROMOTE A
DEEP MOISTURE FLUX FROM THE GULF. WITH A WEAKER CAP...SCATTERED
DIURNAL CONVECTION SEEMS LIKELY EACH DAY...WITH THE BEST CHANCES
FAVORING THE HIGHER TERRAIN. TEMPERATURES WILL GRADUALLY CLIMB FROM
THE MID TO UPPER 80S THIS WEEKEND BACK INTO THE LOWER 90S NEXT WEEK
AS THICKNESSES INCREASE ALOFT.

BACK TO SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY WHILE THE 
FORECAST AREA AWAITS ANOTHER SHORT WAVE AND POSSIBLE SURFACE FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY BY WEDNESDAY. RAISE PROBABILITY OF PRECIP TO MEDIUM CHANCE 
FOR THE MID WEEK PERIOD FOR THIS POSSIBILITY. STAYED A COUPLE 
DEGREES UNDER MEX MOS MAXES WHILE TRENDING QUITE CLOSE TO SUGGESTED 
MINS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
341 AM EDT THU AUG 28 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DECIDED TO ADD PATCHY FOG TO
FORECAST FOR EARLY THIS MORNING FOR PORTIONS OF CENTRAL AND
NORTHERN PLATEAU AS LATEST OBS INDICATE AN AREA OF HIGHER
DEWPOINTS. ALSO ADDED IN SOME CLOUDS TO THE NORTHERN PORTION OF OUR
VA COUNTIES AS SHOWERS HAVE BEEN DISSIPATING OVER THE PAST FEW
HOURS JUST TO THE NORTH BUT CLOUD COVER WILL CONTINUE TO ADVANCE
SOUTHWARD.

REGARDING THE REST OF TODAY...NOT MUCH CHANGE FROM PREVIOUS 
FORECAST. A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY ASSOCIATED WITH A TROUGH OVER NEW 
ENGLAND WILL BE APPROACHING THE KY/TN LINE BY AROUND 12Z THIS 
MORNING AND WILL MOVE FURTHER DOWN INTO THE CENTRAL/NORTHERN VALLEY 
BY THIS AFTERNOON. MODELS STILL SHOWING ISOLATED CONVECTION MAY 
DEVELOP ALONG THIS BOUNDARY DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS. SOUNDINGS 
NOT OVERLY MOIST BUT ENOUGH MOISTURE PRESENT TO SUPPORT CONVECTION. 
CAPES WILL BE MORE THAN SUFFICIENT WITH VALUES ROUGHLY AROUND 2000 
J/KG BY THIS AFTERNOON. WIND PROFILES QUITE WEAK FOR TODAY SO THIS
SHOULD PREVENT ANY ORGANIZED STORMS. ANY STORMS THAT DEVELOP WILL
HAVE A SLOW STORM MOTION DUE TO WEAK WIND PROFILES. MOVEMENT SHOULD
BE IN THE 5 TO 10 MPH RANGE.
 
HAVING SAID ALL THAT...WILL STILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN PLACE 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN VALLEY AND HIGH TERRAIN AREAS. AGAIN...BEST 
CHANCE OF SEEING AN ISOLATED STORM WILL BE ALONG THE BOUNDARY AND 
ALSO ACROSS THE TERRAIN....BECAUSE OF DIURNAL HEATING AND OROGRAPHIC 
LIFT. AREAS FROM KNOXVILLE AND SOUTH SHOULD STAY DRY...ESPECIALLY 
DOWN TOWARD CHATTANOOGA.
 
FOR TEMPS...CONTINUED TO STAY CLOSER TO THE SLIGHTLY LOWER NAM MOS 
FOR MAX TEMPS TODAY.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...THE MAIN CHALLENGE THIS
FORECAST PERIOD WILL BE DETERMINING HOW STRONG THE RIDGE ALONG THE
EAST COAST REMAINS THROUGH THE WEEKEND. TONIGHT/S MODEL RUNS
INDICATE THAT SHORTWAVES WILL BE FARTHER WEST AFFECTING MIDDLE TN
MORE THAN E TN. HOWEVER...LOW LEVEL SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW SHOULD
INDUCE SOME OROGRAPHIC SHOWERS AND STORMS TO DEVELOP OVER SW
VA...NORTHERN TN PLATEAU FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND A LITTLE MORE
SCATTERED ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA ON SATURDAY. THE WEAKNESS IN THE
RIDGE BY SUNDAY SHOULD BE ENOUGH TO BRING THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO THE FORECAST AREA...DIMINISHING
SOMEWHAT BY MID EVE. LOWER CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
WILL CONTINUE INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK.

CLOSER TO THE SLIGHTLY LOWER NAM MOS FOR MAX TEMPS THURSDAY. NOTING 
THAT I HAD TO LOWER 18Z TEMPS A DEGREE OR TWO TODAY FROM FORECAST 
GRID VALUES. 


.LONG TERM.../THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...AT THE BEGINNING OF 
THIS PERIOD THE WESTERN EDGE OF AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE IS STILL IN 
PLACE OVER THE AREA.  BY FRIDAY THE RIDGE IS GETTING SHOVED TO THE 
EAST AS A LONGWAVE TROUGH APPROACHES THE AREA FROM THE WEST.  
HOWEVER...BY SATURDAY THE RIDGE HOLDS FIRM ALONG THE CAROLINA COAST 
AND DEFLECTS/WEAKENS MUCH OF THE TROUGH AS IT TRIES TO MOVE THROUGH 
THE AREA.  STILL THE UPPER TROUGH INTRUDES ENOUGH TO GET US IN THE 
SOUTHERN EDGE OF WESTERLY FLOW AND ALLOW SOME SHORTWAVES TO MOVE 
THROUGH THE AREA. OVER THE WEEKEND AND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK.  THIS 
SITUATION WILL KEEP THE WEATHER PATTERN FOR THOSE DAYS FAIRLY 
UNSETTLED.  BY THE END OF THE PERIOD A COLD FRONT SHOULD BE SAGGING 
SOUTHWARD FROM THE NORTH AND SHOULD BE CLOSE TO THE AREA BY 
WEDNESDAY.  FOR TEMPERATURES...STARTING WHEN THE MOISTURE GETS 
DEEPER THIS WEEKEND AND THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD...WENT 1-2 
DEGREES COOLER ON THE MAX TEMPS...FOR DEEP MOISTURE AND PERIODS OF 
LIFT...THESE TEMPERATURES SEEMED TOO WARM.

A SLIGHT DECREASE IN PRECIPITABLE WATER (PW)...WHILE THE 12Z RNK 
SOUNDING HAD LESS THAN 1/2 INCH OF PW. DEW POINT TEMPS HOLDING IN 
THE 50S ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN. FORECAST GRIDS LOOK ON TRACK WITH NO 
UPDATES PLANNED AT THIS TIME.

THE WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY SAGGING SOUTHWARD LATE TONIGHT AND 
THURSDAY MAY BE HARD PRESSED TO PRODUCE ANY PRECIPITATION...EXCEPT 
FOR PERHAPS SPOTTY SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS. MORE ON THIS 
IN THE AFTERNOON FORECAST PACKAGE.
 
&&

357 
FXUS64 KMRX 270733
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
333 AM EDT WED AUG 27 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER RIDGE HOLDS STRONG ACROSS 
THE EASTERN TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ONE MORE DAY WITH NOT 
MUCH CHANGE IN THE AIR MASS. TEMPERATURES THIS MORNING ABOUT THE 
SAME AS YESTERDAY IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S NE SECTIONS AND 
MOUNTAINS AND MID TO UPPER 60S CENTRAL AND SOUTH LOWER ELEVATIONS. 
CHATTANOOGA IS THE EXCEPTION AS TEMPERATURES STILL AROUND 70. HIGHS 
TUESDAY ONLY REACHED THE MID TO UPPER 80S WHICH WAS ABOUT THE SAME 
AS MONDAY. DRIER AIR MASS AND LOWER DEW POINTS SHOULD CONTINUE ONE 
MORE DAY AND NIGHT BEFORE RISING THURSDAY. ADJUSTED HIGHS DOWN A FEW 
DEGREES BUT STILL SLIGHTLY WARMER THAN TUESDAY WHERE NAM GUIDANCE 
WAS CLOSER TO ACTUAL HIGHS. WEDNESDAY NIGHT LOWS CREEP UP A FEW 
DEGREES. ALSO COULD BE MORE CLOUDS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AS WEAK 
FRONT SINKS SOUTH OVERNIGHT FROM OHIO VALLEY. NAM MODEL PUTS SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF RAIN OVER SW VA TONIGHT WITH APPROACH OF FRONT BUT OTHER 
MODELS KEEP IT DRY. PREFER TO KEEP THINGS DRY. 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...BY THURSDAY THE
UPPER RIDGE BREAKS DOWN AND A RATHER DIFFUSE WEAK BOUNDARY SETS UP
ACROSS THE REGION. WEAK SURFACE FLOW...SOUTHERLY IN THE SOUTH AND
WEAK NORTHEASTERLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA
SHOULD LEAD TO OROGRAPHICALLY DRIVEN AFTERNOON ISOLATED SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS. THESE STORMS WILL GENERALLY BE DIURNAL SO THEY ARE
EXPECTED TO END AROUND SUNSET.

FOCUS SHIFTS TO THE SHORTWAVE TROUGH TRANSLATING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS ON FRIDAY. WHILE THE MAIN ENERGY FROM THIS SYSTEM WILL TRACK 
TOWARDS THE GREAT LAKES...WE SHOULD WATCH THE SERIES OF SHORTWAVES 
THAT DEVELOP OVER THE LA COAST. THESE WILL TRACK ACROSS MS/AL AND 
EVENTUALLY INTO TN ESPECIALLY BY SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY. SO 
EXPECT INCREASINGLY MUGGY CONDITIONS AS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE MOVES 
BACK INTO THE TN VALLEY. HAVE INCREASED POPS FOR SUNDAY AS THE 
STRONGEST SHORTWAVE IS PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE AREA BY MID DAY WITH 
MODEL CONSENSUS. 

ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL REMAIN IN THE REGION EARLY NEXT 
WEEK. AS SUCH...WILL CONTINUE WITH SLIGHT CHANCE/CHANCE POPS THROUGH 
TUESDAY. OVERALL MAV MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS IN THE NEAR-TERM APPEAR TOO 
WARM AND PREFERRED THE SLIGHTLY COOLER MET MOS.

&&

940 
FXUS64 KMRX 261941
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
341 PM EDT TUE AUG 26 2014

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY/...
A DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE ALOFT AND AT THE SURFACE WILL CONTINUE TO 
REMAIN THE DOMINANT FEATURE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. ANY CLOUD 
COVER THAT DEVELOPED DURING THE AFTERNOON WILL QUICKLY DIMINISH WITH 
THE LOSS OF SOLAR HEATING...RESULTING IN A MOSTLY CLEAR SKY AND THUS 
GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING AFTER SUNSET. TEMPERATURES WILL QUICKLY 
DROP INTO THE 70S TO UPPER 60S BY LATE EVENING AND EVENTUALLY 
BOTTOM OUT IN THE UPPER 50S ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA TO THE LOW TO 
MID 60S ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. SOME PATCHY FOG MAY ALSO BE 
POSSIBLE ALONG AREA LAKES/RIVERS ONCE AGAIN...BUT A DRIER BOUNDARY 
LAYER SHOULD LIMIT ITS TO DEVELOPMENT TO THOSE USUAL PRONE AREAS. 
ABUNDANT SUNSHINE WILL BRING HIGHER TEMPERATURES ON TUESDAY...IN 
THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S BY THE AFTERNOON...AND A STRONG CAP 
ALOFT WILL PREVENT ANY CONVECTION FROM FIRING...SO HAVE A 
KEPT A DRY FORECAST AS WELL. 

.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY/...
AT THE BEGINNING OF THIS PERIOD THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE IS STILL IN 
PLACE...AND THIS RIDGE LOOKS LIKE IT WILL BE THE DOMINATING 
INFLUENCE IN THE EARLY PART OF THE FORECAST...THROUGH THE END OF THE 
WEEK.  OVER THE WEEKEND...THE RIDGE GETS SHOVED TO THE EAST AS A 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH PUSHES TOWARD THE AREA FROM THE WEST.  THIS SHOULD 
INCREASE THE CHANCES FOR PRECIP...BUT THE POSITIVE TILT TO THE 
TROUGH LEADS TO A CONFLUENT FLOW ACROSS THE AREA...THAT SHOULD TEND 
TO LIMIT THE AMOUNT OF LIFT AND OVERALL RAINFALL AMOUNTS. THE WEAK 
TROUGH AXIS SHOULD BE EAST OF THE AREA BY AROUND MONDAY...AND ALLOW 
THE RIDGE TO START BUILDING AGAIN TOWARD THE END OF THIS FORECAST.  

STILL LOOKS LIKE PRECIP THAT IS FORECAST IN THE NORTHEASTERN AREAS 
FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING IS OVERDONE BY THE MODELS...THE 
MAJORITY OF THE ENSEMBLE MOS KEEPS KTRI BELOW MENTIONABLE POPS.  MOS 
TEMPS LOOKED GOOD OVERALL...SO HAVE KEPT PRETTY CLOSE TO THEM.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1049 AM EDT TUE AUG 26 2014

.DISCUSSION...
AN UPPER-LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE CONTINUES TO REMAIN ENTRENCHED
ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY TODAY. THIS HAS RESULTED IN A MOSTLY
SUNNY DAY ACROSS THE REGION...WITH SOME SCT MID TO HIGH CLOUD
MOVING ACROSS THE CENTRAL/SOUTHERN VALLEYS AND THE PLATEAU.
HOWEVER...AN INTERESTING FEATURE JUST TO OUR WEST IS A LOW-STRATUS
SHIELD CURRENTLY IN PLACE OVER MUCH OF MIDDLE TENNESSEE. ITS
CURRENT MOTION IS PUSHING IT AWAY FROM OUR PLATEAU COUNTIES AND IT
WILL CONTINUE TO DISSIPATE OVERTIME WITH DAYTIME HEATING. THUS...
HAVE KEPT THE SKY GRIDS MOSTLY CLEAR ALONG THE PLATEAU THIS
MORNING. WITH THE MOISTURE UNDERNEATH THE RIDGE...LIGHT EAST TO
NORTHEAST FLOW AND SOME CLOUD COVER...THINK HIGHS IN THE 85 TO 90
DEGREE RANGE ARE A GOOD BET /ABOUT A DEGREE OR SO HIGHER THAN
YESTERDAY/. GIVEN THE STRENGTHENING CAP DEVELOPING ALOFT THOUGH...A
DRY FORECAST IS EXPECTED WITH NO DIURNAL CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON.

548 
FXUS64 KMRX 251915
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT MON AUG 25 2014

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND TUESDAY/...
A DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE ALOFT WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD IN OVER THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY TONIGHT...WHICH WILL PROMOTE A CLEARING SKY WITH 
THE DRIER AIR THAT WILL BEGIN TO TAKE HOLD. LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND  
EVENING...THE CLOUD COVER CURRENTLY PRESENT ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND 
SOUTHERN VALLEYS WILL GRADUALLY BEGIN TO DISSIPATE...ALONG WITH AN
ISOLATED SHOWERS ALONG THE PLATEAU. AS A RESULT OF THE MOSTLY
CLEAR/CALM CONDITIONS LATE TONIGHT...AND THE DRIER AIR IN PLACE...
TEMPERATURES WILL BE A BIT COOLER TONIGHT AND BOTTOM OUT IN THE LOW
TO MID 60S. SOME PATCHY FOG WILL ALSO BE POSSIBLE ALONG AREA
LAKES/RIVERS...SO HAVE INCLUDED A MENTION OF THIS IN THE FORECAST
AFTER 06Z. ABUNDANT SUNSHINE WILL BRING HIGHER TEMPERATURES ON
TUESDAY...IN THE 85 TO 90 DEGREE RANGE BY THE AFTERNOON. A STRONG
CAP ALOFT WILL ALSO PREVENT ANY CONVECTION FROM FIRING...SO HAVE A
KEPT A DRY FORECAST AS WELL.

.LONG TERM /TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY/...
AT THE BEGINNING OF THIS PERIOD AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE IS ESTABLISHED 
OVER THE AREA AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE HAS ALSO BUILT INTO THE
AREA...MAKING FOR QUIET WEATHER. LOOKS LIKE THIS PATTERN IS SLOW TO
CHANGE...BUT FINALLY LATE IN THE WEEK...AS THE SURFACE RIDGE SLIDES
TO THE EAST...MOIST AIR FROM THE GULF SURGES NORTHWARD AHEAD OF THE
NEXT FRONT. THE BEST CHANCES FOR PRECIP LOOK TO ROUGHLY BE SATURDAY
NIGHT...SUNDAY...AND INTO SUNDAY NIGHT. TIMING IS A LITTLE
IFFY...MODELS AGREE THAT THE MOISTURE WILL SURGE NORTHWARD...BUT
WHEN THE MOIST AXIS WILL BE OVER THE AREA ALONG WITH THE LIFT IS
NOT WELL-AGREED UPON. NOT LOOKING LIKE SEVERE STORMS AS THE
DYNAMICS IS VERY WEAK WITH THIS SYSTEM. FOR QPF IN THESE
PERIODS...HELD OFF ON THURSDAY FOR ANY QPF...DEEPER MOISTURE IS NOT
IN THE AREA YET...AND MOST ENSEMBLE MEMBERS KEPT THE AREA DRY.

FOR TEMPS...LOOKS LIKE IT WILL BE HEATING UP PRETTY WELL UNDER THE 
RIDGE THIS WEEK...THEN COOLING DOWN SOME OVER THE WEEKEND DUE TO 
CLOUDS AND WETTER CONDITIONS.

PARTLY SUNNY DAY ACROSS THE REGION. GIVEN THE STRONGER CAP
DEVELOPING ALOFT...AM NOT EXPECTING MUCH IN THE WAY OF CONVECTION
THIS AFTERNOON. BUT...THE HRRR IN PARTICULAR DOES HINT AT SOME
ISOLATED SHOWERS/STORMS DEVELOPING AFTER 18Z ALONG THE PLATEAU...
SO HAVE ADDED A SOME LOW-END MENTIONABLE POPS IN THIS AREA THIS
AFTERNOON. HIGHS WILL BE SLIGHTLY COOLER TODAY WITH THE CLOUD
COVER...BUT WILL STILL REACH THE MID TO UPPER 80S TODAY.

SHOWERS EARLY THIS MORNING. THIS CONVERGENCE PUSHES SW THROUGH THE 
AREA THIS MORNING. THE H70-H50 DRIES OUT SIGNIFICANTLY THROUGH THE 
PERIOD. CONVECTION WILL HAVE A HARD TIME INITIATING AND WITH NE 
STEERING FLOW PRECIPITATION CHANCES TOO LOW FOR MENTION. 
TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN SLIGHTLY WARM TODAY THEN COOLING TO BELOW 
NORMAL TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...STRONG UPPER RIDGE WILL BE 
OVER THE REGION TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY FOR WARM AND DRY CONDITIONS.  
THE RIDGE DAMPENS A BIT ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY ALLOWING DIURNAL 
CONVECTION TO DEVELOP WITH BEST CHANCES OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  
MAIN SYSTEM OF CONCERN THROUGH THE PERIOD WILL BE A COLD FRONT 
MOVING IN DURING THE WEEKEND.  MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW DIFFERENCES 
IN TIMING...THOUGH THE GFS IS TRENDING SLOWER...COMING MORE IN LINE 
WITH THE ECMWF.  WITH CONFIDENCE SO LOW ON TIMING...FOR NOW...WILL 
KEEP POPS AT 20 TO 30 THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             88  67  91  66 /  10   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  87  65  88  64 /  10   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       87  66  89  64 /  10   0   0  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
238 PM EDT SUN AUG 24 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE TO OUR 
NORTHEAST WILL EXTEND INTO THE AREA...AND LOW LEVEL NORTHEAST FLOW

MONDAY...BUT ACROSS SOUTH AND WEST ZONES THE CAP MAY BE WEAK ENOUGH 
FOR SOME LIMITED AFTERNOON CONVECTION...SO WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS THERE MONDAY AFTERNOON. MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE SO 
WILL STAY CLOSE.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...AN UPPER-LEVEL HIGH
PRESSURE RIDGE WILL BECOME CENTERED OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY
THROUGH THE MIDDLE PART OF THE WEEK...PROMOTING MOSTLY SUNNY...WARM
AND DRY CONDITIONS THANKS TO STRONGER CAP THAT WILL SUPPRESS
DIURNAL CONVECTION THROUGH WEDNESDAY. THE CENTER OF THE RIDGE WILL
BRIEFLY RETROGRADE TO THE WEST ON THURSDAY WHICH COULD ALLOW FOR
SOME CONVECTION TO DROP SOUTH INTO THE AREA FORM THE OHIO VALLEY
DURING THE LATE AFTERNOON/EVENING HOURS. HOWEVER...THE RIDGE WILL
THEN BUILD BACK INTO THE REGION FOR AT FRIDAY AND POSSIBLY THE
FIRST HALF OF THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND...BEFORE A BROAD TROUGH SWEEPS A
COLD FRONT INTO THE AREA AND GIVES THE REGION ITS BEST SHOT AT
RAINFALL IN OVER A WEEK. MODELS STILL DIFFER ON THE TIMING OF THIS
SYSTEM...SO HAVE REMAINED CAUTIOUS WITH POPS FOR DAYS 6 AND 7.
BUT...GIVEN THAT THE GFS CONTINUES TO TREND SLOWER AND CLOSER TO
THE ECMWF SOLUTION...CONTINUED TO SLOWLY TREND TOWARD THAT.
ALSO...GIVEN THE DRY CONDITIONS AND GOOD HEATING EXPECTED UNDER THE
RIDGE...HAVE BUMPED TEMPS UP A DEGREE OR TWO FOR MOST OF THE WORK
WEEK.
