FXUS64 KMRX 231843 
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
243 PM EDT SAT AUG 23 2014

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND SUNDAY/...
TONIGHT AND SUNDAY THIS AFTERNOON SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS
DEVELOPED. SHOWERS AND STORMS SHOULD SUBSIDE A LITTLE AFTER
SUNRISE. HOWEVER VERY WEAK UPPER LEVEL DYNAMICS AND LITTLE SURFACE
BOUNDARY FOCI MAKE THIS FORECAST DIFFICULT. WEAK AND GENERALLY
VARIABLE FLOW THROUGH THE ENTIRE TROP. CERTAINLY SEE ELEVATED
INSTABILITY ALONG WITH ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WHICH MAKES IT
TOUGH TO DISCOUNT SOME CHANCES FOR THUNDERSTORMS OVERNIGHT. SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL PROBABLY BE DRIVEN BY THE TERRAIN. AS
SUCH...HAVE PLAYED UP SLIGHT HIGHER CHANCES FOR THE PLATEAU AND
PARTS OF SW VA AND NE TN IN THE MOUNTAINS. AREAS OF FOG WILL LIKELY
DEVELOP EARLY THIS EVENING AND PERSIST INTO EARLY MORNING TOMORROW
PARTICULARLY FOR NE TN AND SW VA.

HOT AND MUGGY CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE OVERNIGHT AND INTO SUNDAY. 
DAYTIME TEMPERATURES WILL LIKELY BE HINDERED A LITTLE BY WHERE 
THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOP. CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL 
REMAIN IN THE FORECAST THROUGH THE DAY SUNDAY.

.LONG TERM /SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY/...
AN UPPER-LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE WILL REMAIN THE DOMINANT WEATHER 
FEATURE ACROSS THE REGION FOR MUCH OF THE UPCOMING WEEK...PROMOTING
CONTINUED VERY WARM AND HUMID CONDITIONS ACROSS THE AREA. AS THIS
RIDGE BECOMES MORE CENTERED OVER THE REGION DURING THE MIDDLE OF
THE WEEK...PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL BEGIN TO WANE AS DIURNAL
CONVECTION BECOMES MUCH MORE ISOLATED IN NATURE BY MONDAY EVENING...
AND BELOW MENTIONABLE LEVELS IN THE FORECAST BY TUESDAY AND
WEDNESDAY AS A CAPPING INVERSION STRENGTHS ALOFT. HIGHS WILL REMAIN
IN THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S DURING THIS TIME PERIOD AS ABUNDANTSUNSHINE
AND DRY WEATHER PREVAILS. BY THURSDAY...A RETURN OF SOME ISOLATED
TO DIURNAL CONVECTION WILL OCCUR AS THE RIDGE BEGINS TO FLATTEN AND
SHIFT OFF TO THE SOUTH AND EAST. A BROAD UPPER-TROUGH THEN WILL
APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA LATE IN THE WEEK...THOUGH THE MODEL
GUIDANCE DIFFERS ON WHEN THIS...AND ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT/RAIN
CHANCES WILL OCCUR. THE GFS IS MORE BULLISH AND SHOWS A FRIDAY INTO
SATURDAY TIME-FRAME...WHILE THE ECMWF INDICATES CLOSER TO A
SUNDAY/MONDAY TIME FRAME. HAVE LOW-END MENTIONABLE POPS GOING FOR
NOW...FOR DAYS 6 AND 7 AND WILL WAIT FOR BETTER MODEL CONSENSUS.

SOUTH. EXPECT THIS AREA TO CONTINUE TO WEAKEN TO SOME DEGREE AS IT
DRIFTS SOUTH BUT MODELS GENERALLY AGREE THAT SOME OF THIS ACTION
WILL HOLD TOGETHER AS IT MOVES INTO THE FORECAST AREA FROM AROUND
04-07Z. TWEAKED POPS ACCORDING TO THIS SCENARIO FOR THE REMAINDER
OF THE NIGHT. TEMPERATURES APPEAR TO BE ON TRACK.

243 PM EDT FRI AUG 22 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...THE AXIS OF THE UPPER RIDGE 
WILL CONTINUE TO BE CENTERED TO OUR WEST...AND THE RIDGE WILL 
SHARPEN A BIT TURNING UPPER FLOW MORE NORTHERLY DURING THE PERIOD. 
IT APPEARS THE NEXT WEAK IMPULSE TO AFFECT THE AREA WILL SLIDE DOWN 
THE EAST SIDE OF THE RIDGE LATE THIS AFTERNOON/EARLY TONIGHT...WITH 
THE POSSIBILITY OF AN MCS AFFECTING AT LEAST NORTHEAST ZONES. WILL 
CARRY LIKELY POPS FOR NORTHEAST...TAPERING OFF TO THE SOUTHWEST.  ON 
SATURDAY...APPEARS INSTABILITY WILL BE WEAKER BUT MAY ALSO HAVE MORE 
MOISTURE TO WORK WITH ESPECIALLY SOUTH AND CENTRAL AND LESS 
CAPPING...SO WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS ALL ZONES EXCEPT SLIGHT CHANCE 
FAR SOUTHWEST. STILL LOOKS LIKE BEST CHANCE FOR ANY SEVERE STORMS 
WILL BE WITH THE POTENTIAL MCS THIS EVENING...WILL KEEP THE MENTION 
IN THE HWO.   WILL NOT ARGUE MUCH WITH MAV TEMPS FOR TONIGHT...BUT 
WILL GENERALLY TRIM A BIT OFF MAX TEMPS FOR TOMORROW GIVEN RECENT 
TRENDS AND EXPECTED CLOUDS/CONVECTION.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...AN UPPER-LEVEL HIGH
PRESSURE RIDGE WILL REMAIN THE DOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE ACROSS THE
REGION AT LEAST INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...PROMOTING CONTINUED VERY
WARM AND HUMID CONDITIONS. WITH THE RIDGE MORE CLOSELY CENTERED
OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY THROUGH AT LEAST THE MIDDLE OF THE
WEEK...ANY CONVECTION THAT FIRES WILL BE MAINLY DIURNAL IN NATURE
AND MUCH MORE CONFINED TO THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE MOUNTAINS AND
PLATEAU. HAVE A SOLID CHANCE POP FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY
EVENING...BUT BY MONDAY AND ESPECIALLY TUESDAY...THINK THIS
ACTIVITY WILL BE MUCH MORE ISOLATED IN NATURE THANKS TO A STRONGER
CAP. HIGHS WILLS REMAIN IN THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S DURING THIS
TIME PERIOD...WITH AMBLE SUNSHINE BY THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK. MODELS
THEN DIFFER FOR THE LATER HALF OF THE WEEK. THE GFS WANTS TO BRING
A BROAD TROUGH INTO THE OHIO VALLEY AND COLD FRONT THROUGH THE
REGION ON THURSDAY...WHILE THE ECMWF CONTINUES TO SHOW RIDGING
THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. HAVE LOW-END CHANCE POPS GOING
FOR NOW... AND WILL WAIT FOR BETTER MODEL CONSENSUS. OTHERWISE...BY
FRIDAY THE BROAD SUBTROPICAL RIDGE SHOULD BUILD BACK INTO THE
AREA...AND KEEP THINGS MOSTLY ON THE DRY SIDE ONCE AGAIN TO CLOSE
OUT THE WORK WEEK.

RIDGE WILL ALLOW DAYTIME TEMPERATURES TO WARM WELL INTO THE 90S

DOMINANT FEATURE THROUGH MOST OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD. WITH THE 850-
500 MB HIGH BEING CENTERED OVER THE LOWER MS REGION THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND...EAST TN WILL BE ON THE PERIPHERY OF THE RIDGE...AND UPPER 
LEVEL DISTURBANCES IN THE N-NW FLOW WILL CROSS THE AREA. THE NAM

HIGHEST POPS IN THIS TIME FRAME...AND NAM SOUNDINGS SHOW ENOUGH 
INSTABILITY IN NORTHERN AREAS FOR SOME POTENTIAL FOR STRONG TO 
SEVERE STORMS. 

FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...CONFIDENCE OF TIMING DISTURBANCES IN THE 
FLOW DROPS...AND WILL GO WITH A MORE DIURNAL PATTERN FOR SCATTERED 
TO ISOLATED CONVECTION. ACCORDING TO THE GFS...THE RIDGE BEGINS TO 
SHIFT TOWARD THE OHIO VALLEY FOR THE BEGINNING OF THE WORK 
WEEK...SUGGESTING LOWERING PRECIP CHANCES. BUT THE ECMWF KEEPS THE 
RIDGE WELL TO THE WEST. GIVEN UNCERTAINTIES THIS FAR OUT...WILL 
CONTINUE TO HAVE LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS EACH AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING.

60S NORTH...NEAR 70 CENTRAL...AND LOWER 70S ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
VALLEY. THE BEST CHANCES OF RAIN AFTER MIDNIGHT APPEAR TO ACROSS
NETN AND SWVA AS THEY WILL STILL BE FIRMLY IN A NW FLOW PATTERN AND
WILL BE SUSCEPTIBLE TO THESE LITTLE IMPULSES COMING DOWN OUT OF THE
NW AND GENERATING SHOWERS AND STORMS.

TOMORROW THE RIDGE CONTINUES TO BUILD AND MOVES FURTHER EAST AND 
INTO OUR AREA. THE BEST CHANCES FOR RAIN AND STORMS TOMORROW WILL 
ONCE AGAIN BE ACROSS NETN AND SWVA AS THEY STILL HANG ON TO THE NW 
FLOW. AFTER A FEW SHOWERS AND STORMS TOMORROW MORNING...SPOTTY 
AFTERNOON CONVECTION LOOKS TO ONCE AGAIN DEVELOP IN THE HEAT OF THE 
DAY ACROSS THESE AREAS. AS THE RIDGE BUILDS OVER OUR AREA SO WILL THE 
TEMPS. TOMORROWS TEMPS WILL BE IN THE LOW TO MID 90S FOR THE 
SOUTHERN VALLEY...NEAR 90 CENTRAL...AND MID TO UPPER 80S FOR NETN 
AND SWVA.

.LONG TERM...(THURDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER RIDGE OVER
CENTRAL STATES IS NOSING INTO WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA
FRIDAY AND THROUGH THIS WEEKEND BUT SHORTWAVES MOVING AROUND RIDGE
WILL AFFECT THE NE SECTIONS FRIDAY BUT THEN MOVING FARTHER WEST
THROUGH TIME INTO NEXT WEEK. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL BE ABOVE
NORMAL WITH HOTTEST TEMPERATURES TO THE SOUTHWEST. HIGHS WILL REACH 
THE MID 90S IN SE TN THE WARMEST TEMPERATURES OF THE SUMMER. LOWS
WILL STAY WARM AS WELL IN THE UPPER 60S TO THWE LOWER 70.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MODELS PROG RELATIVELY DECENT

THE BEST CHANCE FOR CONVECTION WILL BE GENERALLY NORTH OF THE I-40 
CORRIDOR...IMPACTING SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. 
THIS IS AS AREA WHERE SLIGHTLY DEEPER MOISTURE AND LIFT WILL RESIDE 
DUE TO THE INFLUENCE OF SHORT WAVELENGTH FEATURES DROPPING SOUTHEAST 
IN THE PREVAILING NORTHWEST FLOW AROUND THE BASE OF THE EASTERN 
LAKES AND UPPER OHIO VALLEY LONG WAVE TROUGH. WENT JUST A LITTLE 
CLOSER TO CONSISTENTLY BETTER...AND COOLER...MET MOS MAXES TODAY 
WHILE STAYING CLOSE TO MOS MIN BLEND TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A STRONG RIDGE WILL BE 
PLANTED OVER THE LOWER MS REGION THROUGH MOST OF THE PERIOD...WITH A 
SLIGHT EASTWARD DRIFT EARLY NEXT WEEK. THE RESULTING NW FLOW OVER 
OUR AREA WILL BRING UPSTREAM DISTURBANCES ACROSS OUR NE SECTIONS 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND...WHILE SOUTHERN SECTIONS UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF 
THE RIDGE SHOULD REMAIN DRY AND HOT. WITH THE STAGNANT 
PATTERN...WILL FOLLOW A PERSISTENCE FORECAST FOR THURSDAY THROUGH 
SUNDAY...WITH CHANCE POPS NE EACH AFTERNOON AND EVENING. AS THE 
RIDGE SHIFTS SLIGHTLY EAST...POPS LOWER TO A SLIGHT CHANCE MONDAY 
AND TUESDAY...AND MAINLY FAVOR TERRAIN AREAS. TEMPERATURES THROUGH 
THE PERIOD WILL BE ABOUT AS WARM AS WE HAVE SEEN THIS 
SUMMER...RANGING FROM THE UPPER 80S NORTH TO MID 90S SOUTH EACH DAY.

285 
FXUS64 KMRX 191911
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 PM EDT TUE AUG 19 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TOMORROW)...
TONIGHT...THERE MAY BE A FEW ONGOING ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS FROM THIS AFTERNOONS ACTIVITY TO START THE TONIGHT 
PERIOD. THIS ACTIVITY WILL LINGER AROUND THROUGH PART OF THE NIGHT 
AS WE STAY RELATIVELY UNSTABLE AND CONTINUE TO HAVE A MOIST 
ENVIRONMENT. MOST OF THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD STAY IN SHOWER FORM AS 
WARMER AIR IN THE MIDLEVELS SHOULD PREVENT ANY STRONGER UPDRAFTS 
FROM DEVELOPING THUS ONLY ALLOWING FOR A STRAY LIGHTNING STRIKE HERE 
AND THERE.

THE BIG QUESTION DURING THIS PERIOD IS REGARDING TOMORROW MORNINGS 
POTENTIAL ACTIVITY. A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE GREAT LAKES IS 
SUPPOSED TO GENERATE A LINE OF SHOWERS AND STORMS LATER THIS 
AFTERNOON ACROSS ILLINOIS AND INDIANA...AND CONTINUE TO PROGRESS SE 
TOWARD OUR AREA OVERNIGHT. THE NAM SHOWS THIS ACTIVITY FIZZLING OUT 
BEFORE IT REACHES OUR AREA TOMORROW MORNING BUT THEN REDEVELOPS 
SHOWERS AND STORMS BY AROUND 15Z ALONG THE FRONT. THE GFS IS A BIT 
MORE BULLISH AND DOES BRING THE INITIAL ACTIVITY ALL THE WAY INTO 
OUR AREA. HOWEVER IT UNFOLDS THOUGH...IT DOES LOOK LIKE THERE WILL 
BE SHOWERS AND STORMS AROUND TOMORROW MORNING...WHETHER IT IS FROM 
THE INITIAL LINE OR FROM REDEVELOPMENT. MEANWHILE...500MB HEIGHTS 
ARE QUICKLY BUILDING OVER THE PLAINS AS HIGH PRESSURE IS BEGINNING 
TO TAKE A STRONG HOLD. THESE BUILDING HEIGHTS WILL FORCE US INTO A 
NW FLOW PATTERN BY WED AFTERNOON. SHOWERS AND STORMS CONTINUE 
THROUGH THE AFTERNOON TOMORROW AS THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH. 

SLIGHTLY COOLER OVERNIGHT LOWS NORTH DUE TO LESS CLOUD COVER BUT 
STILL WARM. TEMPS IN THE MID TO UPPER 60S NORTH TO NEAR 70 SOUTH. 
DID INCLUDE PATCHY 2SM MILE FOG AGAIN FOR THE NORTHERN AREAS AND 
INTO SWVA. WARMER TOMORROW WITH SOUTHERN AREAS LOW 90S...CENTRAL 
NEAR 90 AND NETN AND SWVA LOW TO MID 80S.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...THE UPPER LOW OVER 
THE NE STATES...ASSOCIATED FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND DAYTIME HEATING WILL 
WARRANT MORE WIDESPREAD POPS EARLY IN THE LONG TERM PERIODS. KEPT 
THE 40 TO 50 PERCENT CHANCES NORTH DOWN TO 15 TO 20 PERCENT SOUTH.

LET RAIN CHANCES DECREASE BY SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY AS THE UPPER 
RIDGE AMPLIFIES FROM THE SE STATES NORTH TO THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. 
MODEL FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW STEEP LAPSE RATES WITH NOT MUCH OF A 
CAPPING INVERSION DURING THIS PART OF THE LONG TERM. THUS...CAN'T 
RULE OUT DIURNAL CONVECTION FOR THOSE DAYS...MAINLY IN THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN AREAS. 

FOR TEMPS...WENT CLOSER TO GFS MOS OR A BLEND WITH NAM FOR WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT TO THURSDAY NIGHT. ADJUSTED MAX TEMPS UP FOR THE WEEKEND TO 
TUESDAY...IN LINE WITH THE GFSX MOS AND SIMILAR ECMX MOS...GIVEN THE 
RISING HEIGHTS ALOFT. 

&&

964 
FXUS64 KMRX 190727
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
327 AM EDT TUE AUG 19 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
TODAY...A MOIST ENVIRONMENT WILL REMAIN OVER THE AREA. SHORT TERM 
MODELS SHOW SOME CONVECTION DEVELOPING DURING THE MORNING IN 
RESPONSE TO A 500 MB VORT MAX...WITH A LITTLE BETTER COVERAGE IN THE 
AFTERNOON ONCE WE GET BETTER DESTABILIZATION. WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS 
AREA WIDE THROUGH THE DAY. MLCAPE VALUES IN THE 1800-2200 J/KG RANGE 
AND STEEP LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES COULD RESULT IN SOME STRONG STORMS 
WITH GUSTY WINDS THIS AFTERNOON. TONIGHT...BETTER RAIN CHANCES SHIFT 
TO NORTHERN AREAS AS UPSTREAM CONVECTION THAT IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP 
THIS AFTERNOON OVER IL/IN TRACKS SE ACROSS KY. THE NAM IS PRETTY 
AGGRESSIVE IN MAINTAINING THE CONVECTION AS IT MOVES INTO OUR AREA 
LATE TONIGHT/WED MORNING. IT MAY BE A BIT OVERDONE...BUT WILL RAISE 
POPS TO HIGH CHANCES NORTH LATE TONIGHT. LINGERING OUTFLOW 
BOUNDARIES AND GOOD INSTABILITY WILL KEEP A CHANCE OF TSTMS GOING 
THROUGH THE DAY WEDNESDAY. 

THE RIDGE OVER MS/AL WILL BUILD NORTHWARD THROUGH THURSDAY...WHICH 
WILL SHIFT THE AREA OF CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT FARTHER NORTH AND EAST 
TOWARD THE GREAT LAKES/OHIO VALLEY. WITH THE MIDLEVEL STEERING FLOW 
BECOMING NE...MOST OF THIS UPSTREAM CONVECTION WILL MOVE EAST OF OUR 
AREA...BUT COULD CLIP OUR NE SECTIONS. WILL KEEP SOME CHANCE POPS IN 
SW VA/NE TN...BUT SOUTHERN AREAS WILL LIKELY BE CAPPED UNDER THE 
INFLUENCE OF THE STRONG RIDGE. TEMPERATURES WILL ALSO BE WARMING 
INTO THE LOWER AND MIDDLE 90S IN THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY ON 
THURSDAY.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
THE BIG NEWS IS THAT IT APPEARS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION
MAY ACTUALLY SEE AN UPPER RIDGE GRADUALLY BUILD OVER THE REGION
FROM WEST THROUGH EAST ABOUT SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY. THIS SCENARIO
WOULD HEAT UP THE FORECAST AREA AND LEAD TO A DRIER REGIME AS
SUBSIDENCE DRIES OUT THE ATMOSPHERE...LEAVING ONLY A SLIGHT
POSSIBILITY OF CONVECTION ON THE MAJOR TERRAIN FEATURES. PRIOR TO
THIS THOUGH...ON FRIDAY...A LONG WAVE TROUGH WILL BE DROPPING
SOUTHEAST FROM THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES INTO THE NORTHEASTERN
ATLANTIC BY SATURDAY. MODEL FORECASTS SHOW THERE WILL BE A MEDIUM
CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE IN AN AXIS OF DEEPER MOISTURE ALONG A WEAK
AIRMASS BOUNDARY WITH SLIGHTLY COOLER AND DRIER AIR EAST AND WARMER
AND MORE HUMID AIR TO THE WEST. TWO OR THREE WEAK IMPULSES MAY AID
LIFT AS THEY ROUND THE BASE OF THE EASTERN U.S. UPPER TROUGH. KEPT
LOWER POPS FOR CENTRAL EAST AND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE THROUGH THE
PERIOD DUE TO FARTHER PROXIMITY FROM THE "RING OF FIRE". STAYED
UNDER MEX MOS MAXES AND A LITTLE ABOVE MINS.


&&

FXUS64 KMRX 190047 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
847 PM EDT MON AUG 18 2014

.DISCUSSION...
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE GRADUALLY DIMINISHING THIS
EVENING AS AN UPPER-LEVEL DISTURBANCE MOVES ACROSS THE LOWER
TENNESSEE VALLEY. THIS ACTIVITY WILL CONTINUE TO TRACK EAST AND
WANE AFTER 03-06Z OR SO...BUT GIVEN THE MOISTURE IN PLACE SOME
SCATTERED SHOWERS COULD LINGER THROUGH THE OVERNIGHT HOURS
/ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY AND SOUTHWEST NORTH
CAROLINA/. THE VERY MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER COULD ALSO RESULT IN SOME
PATCHY FOG DEVELOPMENT DESPITE SOME OF THE CLOUD COVER...ESPECIALLY ACROSS
IN THE USUAL FOG PRONE SHELTERED AREAS AND LOCATIONS ALONG RIVERS
AND LAKES. THE CLOUD COVER TONIGHT...ALONG WITH THE MOIST
ENVIRONMENT WILL KEEP LOWS IN THE UPPER 60S TO THE LOWER 70S ONCE
MORE.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 PM EDT MON AUG 18 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...ANOTHER SHORTWAVE MOVES IN
TONIGHT FROM OUT OF MISSISSIPPI AND ALABAMA. THIS WILL BRING THE
NEXT ROUND OF POTENTIALLY HEAVY SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS
PORTIONS OF THE EXTREME SOUTHERN VALLEY AND SWNC. THE BEST CHANCES
FOR PRECIP APPEAR TO BE FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH MIDNIGHT.
SOUNDINGS SHOW PWS FROM 1.5 TO 2 INCHES ACROSS THE FORECAST
AREA....THIS COMBINED WITH DEEP WARM LAYER CLOUD DEPTHS WILL
PROMOTE AN EFFICIENT RAINFALL PROCESS. UNIDIRECTIONAL WESTERLY FLOW
MAY ALSO CAUSE TRAINING OF STORMS. WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR MARION
COUNTY FOR POSSIBLE FLOODING AS WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE COUNTY
RECEIVED 2 TO 3 INCHES OF RAIN THIS MORNING WITH A FEW AREAS SEEING
UP TO 4 INCHES.
 
AFTER MIDNIGHT RAIN CHANCES START DECREASING AS THE SHORTWAVE MOVES 
FURTHER TO OUR EAST. WITH A VERY MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER AND A FEW 
CLOUD BREAKS TOWARD MORNING...WILL INCLUDE PATCHY 6SM FOG IN 
FORECAST AREA WIDE AFTER MIDNIGHT AND 2SM PATCHY FOG UP INTO NETN 
AND SWVA. BY TOMORROW MORNING THE WAVE SHOULD ALMOST BE INTO SOUTH 
CAROLINA. THERE MAY BE A FEW LIGHT SHOWERS LINGERING AROUND
TOMORROW MORNING BUT IT DOESN'T LOOK LIKE ANYTHING SIGNIFICANT.
TOMORROW AFTERNOON ANOTHER ROUND OF SHOWERS AND STORMS LOOK TO
DEVELOP BUT IT APPEARS TO BE DIURNALLY DRIVEN AS THERE IS NO
SIGNIFICANT FORCING PRESENT. SO TYPICAL SUMMER TIME AFTERNOON
THUNDERSTORMS. THE EXACT TIMING OF TOMORROWS CONVECTION DEPENDS ON
HOW QUICKLY WE CAN GET RID OF THE EARLY MORNING CLOUD COVER. SOME
OF THE STORMS COULD BE STRONG AS SOUNDINGS SHOW CAPES ROUGHLY
AROUND 2000 J/KG BY TOMORROW AFTERNOON. LOWS WILL BE MILD TONIGHT
DUE TO CLOUD COVER WITH TEMPS IN THE UPPER 60S NORTH TO NEAR 70
SOUTH.
 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...THERE WILL BE RAIN 
CHANCES AREAWIDE FOR THE EARLY PARTS OF THE EXTENDED...AS AN UPPER 
LOW LINGERS TO OUR NORTH OVER THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY. 
SHORTWAVE ENERGY...DAYTIME HEATING AND OROGRAPHIC LIFT SHOULD EQUATE 
TO SOLID CHANCE POPS AND PERHAPS LIKELY IN A FEW SPOTS. 

BY FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY...UPPER RIDGING DOMINATES THE SOUTHERN 
STATES NORTH INTO THE OHIO VALLEY...WHILE UPPER TROUGHS ARE 
POSITIONED ACROSS THE ROCKIES AND NORTHEASTERN STATES. HOWEVER... 
WILL CONTINUE TO CARRY CHANCE POPS ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN...DUE TO A 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND AN OCCASIONAL SHORTWAVE ON THE SOUTHERN SIDE OF 
THE UPPER LOW. TAPERING POPS TO LESS THAN 15 PERCENT OR SLIGHT 
CHANCE FOR SE TN AND SW NC...WHERE I KEPT MAX TEMPS SLIGHTLY CLOSER 
TO THE LOWER TO MID 90S AS ADVERTISED BY GFSX AND ECMX MOS. HIGHS 
MOSTLY IN THE 80S DURING THIS PERIOD FOR OUR NRN COUNTIES...WITH 
LOWS EACH NIGHT ALSO RUNNING MUCH CLOSER TO SEASONAL NORMALS THERE 
AS WELL.

RADAR INDICATE A LARGE AREA OF 1 TO 2 INCHES OF RAIN HAS ALREADY

BOARDER FRANKLIN COUNTY HAVE SEEN 2 TO 3 INCHES WITH ISOLATED AREAS

IN EFFECT THROUGH 845 AM EDT BUT THAT WAS ALLOWED TO EXPIRE AS 
MARION COUNTY DISPATCH REPORTED NO PROBLEMS ACROSS THE AREA AND AS 
THE HEAVIEST RAIN HAS MOVED OUT. WILL HAVE TO CLOSELY WATCH MARION 
COUNTY LATER TODAY FOR POTENTIAL FLOODING PROBLEMS IN CASE ANY MORE 
HEAVY RAINFALL MOVES ACROSS. 

ANOTHER SHORTWAVE THAT IS CURRENTLY LOCATED OVER SOUTHERN AK IS SET 
TO MOVE INTO NORTHERN ALABAMA AND SOUTHERN MIDDLE TN LATER THIS 
AFTERNOON. THIS SHORTWAVE WILL BRING ANOTHER ROUND OF POTENTIALLY 
HEAVY RAIN AS PWS OF 1.5 TO 2 INCHES ARE IN PLACE ACROSS THE ENTIRE 
FORECAST AREA...ALONG WITH DEEP WARM CLOUD LAYERS IN EXCESS OF 12K 
FEET. 

INCREASED POPS ACROSS THE EXTREME SOUTHERN VALLEY FOR THE NEXT FEW 
HOURS TO CATEGORICAL THEN LEFT CATEGORICAL IN PLACE ACROSS PORTIONS 
OF THE SOUTHERN VALLEY OVER TO SWNC UP UNTIL 2PM. LOWERED MAX TEMPS 
BY A DEGREE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY DUE TO EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER 
ACROSS THE AREA. MAX TEMP AT CHA LOWERED TO 86. WILL ALSO TWEAK 
HOURLY TEMPS AND DEWPOINTS AS SOME AREAS ARE SLOWER TO WARM THAN 
OTHERS DUE TO CLOUDS.

NEW ZONES OUT SOON.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...

TO GET RAIN GOING...SO LIKELY POPS APPEAR WARRANTED AREA WIDE TODAY.

REMAIN IN PLACE WITH ONLY SOME SLIGHT MIDLEVEL DRYING COMING LATE

RANGE...WITH BEST CHANCES NORTHEAST.

GREAT LAKES/OHIO VALLEY WITH A SERIES OF SHORT-WAVES MOVING THROUGH
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. PERIODS OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS CAN BE
EXPECTED.

FOR THURSDAY INTO THE WEEKEND...LONG-WAVE UPPER TROUGH WILL 
ESTABLISH ITSELF ACROSS THE NORTHEAST UNITED STATES WITH AN UPPER 
RIDGE OVER THE MID-SECTION OF THE NATION. A BATTLE GROUND BETWEEN 
AIR-MASSES WILL SETUP OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST TENNESSEE 
WITH DAILY SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED THROGUH SATURDAY.

FEEL THAT GFS IS UNDER-ESTIMATING THE CAPE VALUES GIVEN THE EXPECTED 
HOT/VERY HUMID AIR ANTICIPATED OVER TENNESSEE. SOME OF THESE STORMS 
COULD BE SEVERE WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY WITH THE MAIN CONCERN 
BEING DAMAGING WINDS AND TORRENTIAL RAINS. WILL CONTINUE TO INCLUDE 
THIS POTENTIAL IN THE HWO.

GENERALLY WENT A DEGREE OR TWO COOLER THAN MOS HIGHS DUE TO RECENT 
PERFORMANCE...AND CLOSE TO GUIDANCE FOR LOWS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EDT SUN AUG 17 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK AND DIFFUSE FRONTAL BOUNDARY STRETCHING FROM 
NORTHWEST TO SOUTHEAST OVER CENTRAL EAST TN...WITH AREA RADARS 
REVEALING AN EXTENSIVE LINE OF CONVECTION OVER THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU OCCURRING IN ASSOCIATION WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE. 
THIS SHORT WAVE WILL SLOWLY DRIFT EASTWARD TONIGHT...SPREADING A 
FAIRLY EXTENSIVE AREA OF CONVECTION OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THE 
QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE FORECAST AREA IS EXPECTED 
TO LINGER THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...AS A WEAK AREA OF LOW PRESSURE 
DRIFTS EASTWARD ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. DUE TO THE SLOW 
MOVEMENT OF THESE SYSTEMS...WILL CONTINUE WITH LIKELY POPS AREA WIDE 
THROUGH MONDAY. CONVECTIVE COVERAGE SHOULD DECREASE A LITTLE ON 
MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY IN THE WAKE OF THE SHORT WAVE PASSAGE... 
BEFORE INCREASING AGAIN ON TUESDAY NIGHT AS ANOTHER UPPER-LEVEL 
SHORT WAVE MOVES SOUTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH MINS 
THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...BUT REVEAL DISCREPANCIES WITH MAXES. WILL 
TREND TOWARDS THE COOLER NAM MAXES FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY...SINCE 
THEY HAVE BEEN VERIFYING BETTER LATELY AND HIGH DEWPOINTS COMBINED 
WITH EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER SHOULD LIMIT DAYTIME HEATING.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A WEAK DISTURBANCE WILL MOVE 
THROUGH ON WEDNESDAY...AS AN UPPER TROUGH SLOWLY BEGINS TO PULL
OUT OF THE REGION. THIS WILL GENERATE ISOLATED TO SCATTERED
CONVECTION. AN UPPER RIDGE WILL THEN BUILD OVER THE CENTRAL U.S ON
THURSDAY...AND STRENGTHEN THROUGH THE REST OF THE EXTENDED. THIS
PLACES THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION UNDER NORTHWEST FLOW...AS A
SERIES OF IMPULSES MOVES THROUGH. THIS WILL KEEP US IN AN UNSETTLED
WEATHER PATTERN THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED WITH THE BEST CHANCE OF
CONVECTION OVER NORTHERN AREAS. 
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 170710

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EDT SUN AUG 17 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
THE SHORTWAVE TROUGH OVER MO/IL OVERNIGHT WILL SLOWLY PROGRESS E-SE 
ACROSS KY THROUGH TODAY AND TONIGHT. A WEAK VORT MAX AHEAD OF THE 
SYSTEM WILL BRING SOME ISOLATED LIGHT SHOWERS TO SW VA...BUT 
PROBABLY NOT MUCH OF IT WILL BE MEASUREABLE. FORECAST SOUNDINGS LOOK 
PRETTY DRY IN THE LOW LEVELS...WITH MOST OF THE MOISTURE ABOVE 
500MB...WHICH SHOULD ALSO KEEP BROKEN HIGH CLOUDS OVERHEAD. BASED ON 
THIS...WILL UNDERCUT MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS TODAY BY A DEGREE OR TWO.  
CHANCES OF MEASUREABLE PRECIP INCREASE FROM THE WEST THIS AFTERNOON 
WHEN BETTER MOISTURE ADVECTION ARRIVES. STILL...THE NAM AND GFS SHOW 
THAT THE BEST Q-G FORCING DOES NOT ARRIVE UNTIL AFTER MIDNIGHT 
TONIGHT...AND WILL RAISE POPS INTO THE LIKELY RANGE IN NORTHERN 
AREAS AFTER THAT TIME. SOME HEAVY RAIN POTENTIAL INTO MONDAY WILL
BE MENTIONED IN THE HWO AS THE SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH RATHER SLOWLY.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...
MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW AN UNSETTLED EXTENDED PERIOD. A SERIES OF
SHORT-WAVES MOVING ACROSS THE OHIO/TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR
MONDAY/MONDAY NIGHT AND GREAT LAKES/OHIO VALLEY FOR
TUESDAY/WEDNESDAY. FIRST WAVE WILL BRING LIKELY CHANCE OF SHOWERS
AND EMBEDDED THUNDERSTORMS FOR MONDAY.

FOR TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY...MODELS SHOW GREAT LAKES LOW 
DEVELOPING A CONVECTIVE COMPLEX OVER LOWER OHIO VALLEY LATE 
TUESDAY...AND THEN MOVING SOUTHEAST INTO THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY MORNING.

FOR THE LATTER HALF OF THE WEEK...GFS/ECMWF AGREE WITH UPPER RIDGE  
BUILDING OVER THE MID-SECTION OF THE NATION WITH A UPPER TROUGH OFF 
THE NORTHEAST UNITED STATES PRODUCING NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. THE 
UPPER FLOW WILL PLACE THE NORTHEAST HALF OF THE AREA UNDER THE GUN 
FOR PERIODS OF THUNDERSTORMS. SOME OF THESE STORMS COULD BE STRONG 
WITH HEAVY RAINS...GUSTY WINDS AND FREQUENT LIGHTNING THE MAIN 
CONCERN. LOCALIZED FLASH FLOODING POSSIBLE.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...CONTINUE TO TREND SEVERAL DEGREES COOLER FOR 
HIGHS DUE TO PAST PERFORMANCE AND CLOSE TO GUIDANCE LOWS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             88  71  87  71 /  40  50  60  60

OAK RIDGE, TN                       85  71  83  70 /  40  60  60  70

THE FOG POTENTIAL LATE TONIGHT...BUT GIVEN SOME BOUNDARY LAYER

635 
FXUS64 KMRX 161845
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT SAT AUG 16 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK AND DIFFUSE FRONTAL BOUNDARY STRETCHING FROM 
NORTHWEST TO SOUTHEAST OVER CENTRAL EAST TN...WITH SATELLITE IMAGERY 
REVEALING AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF HIGH CLOUDS MOVING SOUTHEASTWARD 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS PROGGED TO REMAIN 
QUASI-STATIONARY OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...WITH 
AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY SLOWLY MOVING 
EASTWARD ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT. THIS LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM WILL HELP TO CREATE A SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA BY SUNDAY...RESULTING IN A GRADUAL INCREASE IN MOISTURE AND 
INSTABILITY. IN FACT...A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS IS PROGGED TO 
DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY AFTERNOON...AND AGAIN ON 
MONDAY AFTERNOON. AS A RESULT...CONVECTION IS EXPECTED TO BECOME 
MORE NUMEROUS BY SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY...AS THE LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM AND ITS ASSOCIATED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH APPROACHES THE FORECAST 
AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH MINS THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...BUT REVEAL DISCREPANCIES 
WITH MAXES. WILL TREND TOWARDS THE COOLER NAM NUMBERS ON SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY...SINCE THEY HAVE BEEN VERIFYING BETTER LATELY AND A GRADUAL 
INCREASE IN MOISTURE AND CLOUDS IS EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...WILL BE IN AN UNSETTLED 
WEATHER PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED...AS A SERIES OF DISTURBANCES
MOVES THROUGH THE UPPER FLOW. TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...A WEAK TROUGH
OVER THE REGION WILL ALLOW LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TO RETURN TO THE
AREA. THIS COMBINED WITH DIURNAL HEATING...WEAK INSTABILITY AND
LIFT FROM THE PASSING DISTURBANCE WILL ALLOW ISOLATED TO SCATTERED
CONVECTION TO DEVELOP AND MOVE THROUGH EACH DAY. THROUGH THE REST
OF THE PERIOD...AN UPPER RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE CENTRAL U.S. PLACING
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION UNDER NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT.
DISTURBANCES CONTINUE TO RIDE THROUGH THIS FLOW AND WITH A MOIST
AND MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS IN PLACE...CONTINUE TO PROVIDE
ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION WITH BEST CHANCE MAINLY OVER
HIGHER TERRAIN AND ACROSS NORTHERN LOCATIONS. 
&&

APPEAR STABLE AND A LOW LEVEL RIDGE SITS OVER THE REGION. SOME MID 
TO HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS WILL BE MOVING OVERHEAD THROUGH THE DAY AS A

VERIFYING A BIT TOO WARM. TONIGHT LOOKS DRY AS WELL WITH PRECIP

AN ACTIVE EXTENDED TIME-FRAME WITH A SERIES OF SHORT-WAVE TROUGH
MOVING ACROSS THE OHIO/TENNESSEE VALLEYS SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.
THESE WAVES WILL PULL BOUNDARY LAYER WINDS TO THE SOUTH TO
SOUTHWEST ALLOWING MOISTURE/INSTABILITY TO RETURN INTO THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. PERIODS OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED WITH THE BEST CHANCES SUNDAY NIGHT AND
MONDAY.

ALSO...BEST CHANCES FOR THE SECOND SHORT-WAVE FOR MID-WEEK WILL BE 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST TENNESSEE DUE TO CLOSER 
PROXMITY TO THE UPPER DYNAMICS.

FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...AN UPPER RIDGE STRENGTHENS OVER THE 
MID-SECTION OF THE NATION WITH UPPER FLOW BECOMING MORE NORTHWEST. 
GFS/ECMWF HINT AT A MCS DEVELOPING OVER THE MID-WEST...AND THEN 
MOVING SOUTHEAST INTO THE AREA FOR THURSDAY. PLENTY OF BOUNDARIES 
WILL REMAIN THROUGH FRIDAY WORKING OFF INSTABILITY EACH DAY. 
GREATEST CHANCES WILL REMAIN OVER THE NORTHERN/EASTERN HALF OF THE 
AREA.

.DISCUSSION...

VALLEYS. THIS IS AHEAD OF A SHORTWAVE UPPER-LEVEL DISTURBANCE OVER
THE LOWER MISSOURI VALLEY THAT WILL TRACK TOWARD THE REGION THIS
WEEKEND. FOR TONIGHT...FAIRLY DRY WEATHER IS EXPECTED AS THE
ISOLATED ACTIVITY THAT WAS PRESENT EARLIER OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA
HAS SINCE DIMINISHED WITH THE LOSS OF HEATING. THUS...HAVE REMOVED
MENTIONABLE POPS FROM THE FORECAST TONIGHT. SOME DECENT RADIATIONAL
COOLING WILL TAKE PLACE THIS EVENING...ESPECIALLY OVER THE SOUTHERN
VALLEY WHERE CLOUD COVER WILL NOT BE AS DENSE. HOWEVER...THE
PRESENCE OF A SOME CLOUD COVER COULD HELP TO KEEP LOWS A DEGREE OR
TWO HIGHER ACROSS NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA.
ADDITIONALLY...WITH MOISTURE PRESENT IN THE BOUNDARY LAYER...THINK
THAT PATCHY FOG WILL ONCE AGAIN BE POSSIBLE AFTER MIDNIGHT...ESPECIALLY
NEAR BODIES OF WATER AND IN THE USUAL FOG PRONE SHELTERED AREAS.

MOVES THROUGH THE UPPER FLOW. THE STRONGEST OF THE WAVES MOVES IN
ON MONDAY. THE MAIN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE WILL TRACK TO OUR NORTH...
BUT IT WILL PULL A BOUNDARY THROUGH THE MRX CWA...WHILE INCREASING
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND PROVIDE OUR BEST CHANCE OF ORGANIZED
CONVECTION. OTHER WEAKER WAVES MOVE THROUGH PRETTY MUCH EACH DAY
TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...KEEPING UNSETTLED CONDITIONS IN PLACE.
CONFIDENCE LOW BY FRIDAY...BUT MODELS HINTING AS A RIDGE BEGINNING
TO NUDGE INTO THE REGION AND WILL KEEP POPS LOW FOR NOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EDT FRI AUG 15 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
SOME CLOUDS ARE MOVING ACROSS NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA THIS 
MORNING IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE NOSE OF AN UPPER JET STREAK AND WEAK 
500 MB VORT MAX. THE NAM CONTINUES TO SHOW SOME PRECIP IN NORTHERN

SIGNIFICANT UPSTREAM VORT MAXES OF NOTE IN WV IMAGERY AND A FORECAST 
SOUNDING THAT APPEARS TO BE WELL CAPPED. THE GFS AND RAP ARE 
DRIER...AND WILL GO IN THAT DIRECTION FOR TODAY. A WARMING TREND 
WILL CONTINUE AS THE 850 MB RIDGE BUILDS IN FROM THE WEST...WITH 
HIGHS IN THE MID TO UPPER 80S IN MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS. SOME THIN 
HIGH CLOUDS MAY MOVE IN TONIGHT IN THE NW FLOW ALOFT.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
A SERIES OF SHORT-WAVE TROUGHS WILL MOVE FROM THE NORTHERN PLAINS
INTO THE GREAT LAKES/OHIO VALLEY SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. THESE
WAVES WILL HELP PULL MOISTURE/INSTABILITY BACK INTO THE TENNESSEE
VALLEY KEEPING THE WEATHER UNSETTLED AS WELL AS PULLING OUTFLOW
BOUNDARIES INTO THE AREA. WILL CALL FOR CHANCE POPS BEGINNING
SUNDAY AFTERNOON. BEST CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE
ACROSS THE SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND NORTHERN
PLATEAU DUE TO PROXIMITY TO UPPER DYNAMICS.

EVEN THOUGH SHORT-WAVES HAVE EXITED BY WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY... 
PLENTY OF MOISTURE/INSTABILITY REMAINS WITH MAINLY DIURNAL TERRAIN 
FORCED CONVECTION EXPECTED EACH DAY.

DUE TO PERFORMANCE...WENT A COUPLE OF DEGREES COOLER THAN GFX MOS 
HIGHS...ESPECIALLY AT CHA. GENERALLY FOLLOWED MOS MINS THROUGH THE 
PERIOD.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             88  64  90  67 /   0   0   0  10

FXUS64 KMRX 141845
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT THU AUG 14 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH 
RADARS INDICATING SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION DEVELOPING AHEAD OF IT 
OVER NORTHERN KY AND SOUTHERN WV. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO 
SLOWLY DRIFT TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...AND ULTIMATELY 
BECOME MORE DIFFUSE AS IT NEARS SOUTHWEST VA. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL 
A SLIGHT INCREASE IN MOISTURE AROUND 850 MB THIS EVENING...BUT A MID-
LEVEL STABLE LAYER OVER THE FORECAST AREA SHOULD HELP TO INHIBIT 
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT AS THIS COLD FRONT APPROACHES SOUTHWEST VA. 
THUS...WILL INCREASE CLOUD COVER OVER SOUTHWEST VA...BUT WILL LEAVE 
THE FORECAST DRY FOR NOW SINCE THE CURRENT CONVECTION IS EXPECTED TO 
DISSIPATE SHORTLY AFTER SUNSET. A LARGE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS 
PROGGED TO LINGER OVER THE NORTHEAST THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH 
NORTHWEST FLOW LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA UNTIL A ZONAL 
PATTERN DEVELOPS ON SATURDAY. MODEL SOUNDINGS ARE NOW INDICATING 
THAT THE MID-LEVEL STABLE LAYER OVER THE FORECAST AREA WILL WEAKEN 
AND RISE TO AROUND 500 MB ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. THIS WEAKER AND 
HIGHER STABLE LAYER MAY ALLOW FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF SOME ISOLATED 
CONVECTION DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS OVER THE NORTHERN 
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. THUS...WILL INTRODUCE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
FOR THESE TWO DAYS...AND MAINLY NORTH OF INTERSTATE 40. AS FOR
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT
THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT
DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...WILL TRANSITION INTO A MORE
ACTIVE WEATHER PATTERN EARLY IN THE EXTENDED. ON SUNDAY...AS WEAK
RIDGING MOVES TO OUR EAST...THE NEXT SYSTEM WILL APPROACH FROM THE
WEST. CLOUDS BEGIN TO INCREASE AND ISOLATED CONVECTION COULD REACH
INTO THE AREA LATE IN THE DAY SUNDAY. PRECIP CHANCE INCREASE SUNDAY
NIGHT INTO MONDAY AS THE FIRST IN A SERIES OF DISTURBANCES MOVES
IN. WILL REMAIN IN THIS PATTERN WITH A DISTURBANCE MOVING THROUGH
PRETTY MUCH EACH DAY THROUGH THE REST OF THE PERIOD.

370 
FXUS64 KMRX 140621
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
221 AM EDT THU AUG 14 2014

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
MOSTLY CLEAR AND CALM CONDITIONS ARE PREVAILING ONCE AGAIN ACROSS
THE REGION AS A WEAK SURFACE HIGH REMAINS IN PLACE...ALLOWING
TEMPERATURES TO DROP INTO THE 50S IN MANY AREAS EARLY THIS MORNING.
AMPLE SUNSHINE AND DRY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED ONCE AGAIN TODAY...
THOUGH HIGHS SHOULD RUN ABOUT FIVE DEGREES OR SO HIGHER THAN
YESTERDAY. MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS WILL REACH THE LOW T0 MID
80S...AND THE MERCURY WILL POTENTIALLY CLIMB INTO THE UPPER 80S IN
SOME SPOTS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY.

A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL DROP OUT OF THE OHIO VALLEY TOWARD THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATER TONIGHT IN RESPONSE
TO A SHORTWAVE ROTATING AROUND THE PARENT LOW OVER SOUTHERN
ONTARIO. HOWEVER...THIS FRONT IS WEAK AND WITH LITTLE MOISTURE TO
WORK WITH IT SHOULD WASH OUT ACROSS SOUTHERN KENTUCKY...ALONG WITH
ANY CONVECTION IT MAY HAVE TRIGGERED EARLIER. AS SUCH...HAVE KEPT
POPS SILENT OVERNIGHT. HOWEVER...THE CLEAR AND CALM CONDITIONS WILL
ALLOW FOR SOME PATCHY FOG TO DEVELOP IN THE USUAL PRONE AREAS AND
NEAR BODIES OF WATER AFTER MIDNIGHT...SO HAVE ADDED THIS TO THE
FORECAST AFTER 06Z.

.LONG TERM /FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
MODELS QUITE CONSISTENT AND IN GENERAL AGREEMENT AS DRY WEATHER
LOOKS TO HOLD AT LEAST THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. ENSEMBLES...GFS AND
ECMWF OFFER SIMILAR TIMING OF A SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVING EAST ACROSS
THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY ON MONDAY. SOUTHWEST FLOW IS ESTABLISHED IN
THE LOWER LEVELS BY SUNDAY NIGHT... SO SHOULD BE SUFFICIENT
MOISTURE FOR A GOOD CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MONDAY
AFTERNOON. NUDGED POPS UP TO JUST BELOW 50 PERCENT WITH SCATTERED
WORDING ON MONDAY.

ADDITIONAL SHORTWAVES SEEM TO LINE UP TO AFFECT THE REGION'S WEATHER 
RIGHT INTO MID WEEK...SO STAYED THE COURSE WITH POPS ALL PERIODS 
FROM MONDAY NIGHT OUT TO WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THE GFSX 00Z MOS WAS VERY 
CLOSE TO THE 12Z MOS AS WELL AS LATEST ECMX MOS. JUST SOME MINOR 
TWEAKS TO ALLOW A GREATER RANGE IN MINS ON THE COOLER NIGHTS 
DOMINATED BY SURFACE RIDGING...AND ALSO SLIGHTLY RAISED MINS FOR WRN 
AREAS WITH THE RETURN OF S-SW LOW LEVEL FLOW FROM SUNDAY TO 
WEDNESDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
302 AM EDT WED AUG 13 2014

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
IN WAKE OF THE COLD FRONT THAT MOVED THROUGH THE REGION ON 
TUESDAY... A NORTHERLY FLOW CONTINUES TO PUSH A COOLER/DRIER AIR 
MASS INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. A FEW 
REMNANT LOW CLOUDS ARE LINGERING ALONG THE MOUNTAINS OF EAST 
TENNESSEE...BUT OTHERWISE MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS ARE PREVAILING 
AREAWIDE EARLY THIS MORNING. SOME MOISTURE IN THE LOW-LEVEL BOUNDARY 
LAYER COULD RESULT IN SOME POCKETS OF FOG AROUND DAYBREAK...BUT IT 
WILL QUICKLY DISSIPATE WITH THE RISING SUN. THIS WILL RESULT IN A 
MOSTLY SUNNY BUT COOLER DAY THANKS TO THE NORTHERLY FLOW...WITH 
HIGHS PEAKING IN THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S. THE CLEAR/DRY 
CONDITIONS WILL PERSIST INTO THE OVERNIGHT HOURS AND RESULT IN GOOD 
RADIATIONAL COOLING THIS EVENING AND A TASTE OF EARLY FALL WITH 
HIGHS IN THE MID TO UPPER 50S IN MANY AREAS ACROSS THE NORTHERN AND 
CENTRAL VALLEY. 

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY/...
REBUILDING THE GRIDDED DATABASE THIS MORNING AFTER UPGRADE TO
AWIPS 14.1.1. AM GRIDS PUBLISHED AND SHOULD BE REACHING NDFD.

FORECAST MODELS STILL SUPPORTING A DRY FORECAST AT LEAST THROUGH 
SATURDAY NIGHT. ANOTHER COOL NIGHT IN STORE FOR THURSDAY NIGHT...AS 
WEAK SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW DOES NOT RETURN UNTIL QUITE LATE 
FRIDAY NIGHT TO WESTERN MOST AREAS. MIN TEMPS MODERATE BACK UP TO 
SLIGHTLY ABOVE CLIMO BY SATURDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. 

GFS MODEL IS TRENDING WETTER FOR SUNDAY AS A SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVES 
ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY AND CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. THE ECMWF LOOKS 
MORE MOISTURE STARVED AND SHOWS MUCH LESS QPF. THUS...I KEPT 
CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS OF JUST LOW CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY 
AND SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SUNDAY NIGHT. NO CHANGES FOR MONDAY WITH AGAIN 
ONLY MINIMAL POPS.

MODELS ADVERTISE A DEEPER TROUGH BY TUESDAY OVER THE CENTRAL 
PLAINS...WITH PERHAPS A DECENT INFLUX OF GULF MOISTURE FOR OUR 
REGION BY LATE TUESDAY. TOO SOON TO ACCEPT THIS TIMING JUST YET
SO I CONTINUED LOW CHANCE POPS FOR NOW ON DAY 7.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
ISSUED BY NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE NASHVILLE TN
752 PM EDT TUE AUG 12 2014

.UPDATE...FOR 00Z AVIATION DISCUSSION.
&&

.AVIATION...00Z AVIATION DISCUSSION.
EXPECTING STRONG SFC RIDGING INFLUENCES TO BUILD ACROSS THE REGION
THRU 13/24Z. WITH CONVECTION GENERALLY MOVING E OF TRI AS APPROACHING
00Z...DID NOT INCLUDE MENTION OF ANY CONVECTION AT TRI AT TAF ISSUANCE
TIME. OTHERWISE...DRY AIR SFC/DRY NWLY FLOW AIR ALOFT WILL BUILD 
INTO THE AREA PROVIDING A TRANSITION TO VFR/SKC CONDITIONS BY AROUND 
13/13Z ALL AREAS. HOWEVER...WITH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE POOLING POTENTIAL...
LIGHT WINDS...AND CLRING SKIES EXPECTED...MVFR FOG FORMATION POSSIBLE...
ESPECIALLY TRI...13/06Z-13/13Z.    
&&

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION.../ISSUED AT 250 PM EDT TUE AUG 12 2014/

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...CURRENT REGIONAL RADAR/VIS 
SATELLITE SHOWS SCATTERED SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A STORM OR TWO 
DEVELOPING ALONG AND AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT CURRENTLY APPROACHING OUR 
WESTERN CWA BORDER. CURRENT LAPS SOUNDING SHOWS DECENT INSTABILITY 
OVERALL...WITH WEAK LAPSE RATES ALOFT FROM WARMING IN THE 
MID-LEVELS. A FEW STORMS THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING COULD BE STRONG 
WITH WIND GUSTS FROM 40-50 MPH POSSIBLE. OVERALL THOUGH...NOT 
EXPECTING ANY SEVERE WEATHER. HAVE HIGH CHC TO LIKELY POPS THROUGH 
THE REST OF THE AFTERNOON...TAPERING OFF TO A SLIGHT CHC OF 
LINGERING STORMS JUST AFTER 00Z OVER THE EAST.

COLD FRONT SHOULD FULLY PASS THROUGH BY 03Z TONIGHT WITH ALL PRECIP 
ENDING. HOWEVER...WITH MOISTURE LINGERING AND HIGH PRESSURE STARTING 
TO NOSE IN TONIGHT FROM THE WEST...FOG SHOULD FORM IN MANY LOW-LYING 
AREAS ESPECIALLY FOR THOSE AREAS THAT RECEIVE RAIN. PUT PATCHY FOG 
IN ALL AREAS AFTER MIDNIGHT TOWARDS DAWN FOR NOW. OVERNIGHT LOWS 
WILL BE IN THE LOW 60S MOST AREAS WITH THE HIGHER TERRAIN SEEING 
DOWN TO MID 50S. WEDNESDAY SHOULD BE VERY NICE FOR MID-AUGUST...WITH 
HIGHS IN THE UPPER 70S TO AROUND 80 FOR THE LOWER TERRAIN...AND DOWN 
TO THE MID-UPPER 60S IN THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL CONTINUE TO DOMINATE AND KEEP THE WEATHER DRY THROUGH THE FIRST 
PART OF THE WEEKEND...WITH PLEASANT TEMPS CONTINUING AND LEADING TO 
A WARM UP BY THE WEEKEND. OTHER THAN INCREASED CLOUDINESS THURSDAY 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE CWA FROM A WEAK 
UPPER DISTURBANCE...CONTINUED WITH NO PRECIP THROUGH SATURDAY. BY 
SUNDAY...MOISTURE WILL INCREASE AHEAD OF THE NEXT UPPER LEVEL 
SHORTWAVE EJECTING OUT OF THE ROCKIES AS A MORE ACTIVE/ZONAL FLOW 
SETS IN. WILL CONTINUE THE MENTION OF SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS 
BEGINNING SUNDAY...WITH THE BEST CHANCE OCCURRING MONDAY. A SMALL 
REPRIEVE MAY TAKE PLACE MONDAY NIGHT BEFORE ANOTHER QUICK-MOVING 
SYSTEM IN THIS ACTIVE FLOW PATTERN APPROACHES...BRINGING ANOTHER 
ROUND OF SHOWERS AND STORMS LATE TUESDAY. UNDERCUT GFS MOS TEMPS A 
BIT MONDAY-TUESDAY GIVEN THE CHANCES FOR RAIN AND AT LEAST INCREASED 
CLOUDINESS. 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

057 
FXUS64 KMRX 120740
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EDT TUE AUG 12 2014

.SHORT TERM.../TODAY AND TONIGHT/...ACTIVE WEATHER PATTERN ENDS
EARLY TONIGHT. AREA RADARS FINALLY BECOMING NEARLY ECHO FREE.
HOWEVER...THE COLD FRONT REMAINS WELL TO OUR WEST ACROSS WRN TN AND
WRN KY AT 07Z. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW PLENTY OF INSTABILITY AND
MOISTURE AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT TODAY...WITH INCREASING
FRONTOGENETIC FORCING NOTED FROM NAM MODEL AS THE FRONT MOVES
THROUGH REGION FROM MID AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING HOURS. 

COORDINATED WITH NEIGHBORING NWS OFFICES AND OPTED TO BUMP POPS UP
TO SOLID CHANCE WITH A FEW AREAS OF LOW LIKELY POPS. LESSER CHANCES
STILL LOOK GOOD FOR SE TN COUNTIES. FRONT DOES NOT CLEAR THE TN-NC
LINE UNTIL AROUND 06Z WEDNESDAY...SO CARRIED CHANCE POPS FOR THOSE
AREAS A BIT LONGER THAN PREVIOUS GRIDS. MAY MENTION ISOLATED STRONG
STORMS...BUT THE MAIN CONCERN WILL BE ADDITIONAL LOCALLY HEAVY
RAINS IN ANY SPOTS THAT GOT SOAKED MONDAY EVENING. 

FOR TEMPS...TRENDED MORE IN LINE WITH NAM MOS AND ADJACENT GRIDS
FOR MAX TEMPS TODAY...WHILE SIMILAR MOS MINS LOOKED IN LINE FOR
TONIGHT.


.LONG TERM.../WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY/...FAIRLY QUIET FORECAST
IN THE EXTENDED AS A DRY/COOL NORTHWEST FLOW FILTERS INTO THE
REGION ON WEDNESDAY...KNOCKING HIGHS BACK INTO THE UPPER 70S AND
LOWER 80S THROUGH THURSDAY. A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE
REGION LATE THURSDAY...BUT WITH LITTLE LIFT AND MOISTURE WITH IT AM
EXPECTING A DRY FORECAST TO PREVAIL THROUGH AT LEAST THE END OF THE
WORK WEEK. MOISTURE WILL EVENTUALLY BE ON THE INCREASE THIS WEEKEND
AS AN UPPER-RIDGE AXIS MOVES OVER THE REGION AND THE FLOW VEERS TO
THE SOUTH. THIS WILL RESULT IN A SLIGHTLY BETTER CHANCE FOR SHOWERS
AND STORMS...ALONG WITH A WARMUP INTO THE MID/UPPER 80S TO THE
LOWER 90S BY SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. AN UPPER- LEVEL SHORTWAVE SLOWLY
APPROACHING FROM THE WEST MAY BE ABLE TO PROVIDE THE NECESSARY LIFT
TO TAP INTO THIS MOISTURE AND PRODUCE SOME MORE WIDESPREAD
CONVECTION ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY. AS SUCH...HAVE GONE WITH A 30 POP
FOR NOW IN DAYS 6 AND 7...AND MAY BE ABLE TO SHOW BETTER CONFIDENCE
IN FUTURE FORECASTS SHOULD MODELS CONTINUE TO TREND THIS WAY.

667 
FXUS64 KMRX 111916
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 PM EDT MON AUG 11 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS STILL 
OVER THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON...WITH PRECIPITABLE WATER AMOUNTS 
APPROACHING 2 INCHES.  THUNDERSTORMS LIKELY TO HAVE TORRENTIAL 
RAINS...AND SOME OF THE CELLS ARE TRAINING ON THE NORTHERN PLATEAU.  
WEAK SHORT WAVE MOVING THROUGH THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND THIS 
EVENING.  AS THE BACKSIDE OF THIS SHORT WAVE MOVES THROUGH...THE 
TRAINING CELLS SHOULD BE LESS COMMON...AND THE DEEPER MOISTURE 
SHOULD BE MOVING OFF TO THE EAST LATER TONIGHT...THEREBY REDUCING 
ANY FLOODING THREAT.  

FOR LATER TONIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY...GOING WITH MOSTLY SHOWERS 
RATHER THAN STORMS.  TUESDAY AFTERNOON A WEAK COLD FRONT MOVES 
THROUGH THE AREA...COULD HAVE A LINE OF STORMS AHEAD OF THE 
FRONT...BUT NOT A GREAT FOCUS ALONG THE FRONT AS ALL WINDS VEER AS A 
SURFACE LEE TROUGH DEVELOPS IN THE CAROLINAS.  STORMS TUESDAY COULD 
HAVE GUSTY OUTFLOW WINDS AS MID AND UPPER LEVELS DRY OUT.   FRONT 
SHOULD BE THROUGH THE AREA BY SUNSET TUESDAY EVENING.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD...AND FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS A 
TICK ABOVE AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD. 
MAY BE A LINGERING SHOWER INTO TUESDAY NIGHT...SO WILL CARRY SLIGHT 
CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE POPS. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN 
PROVIDING A DRIER PERIOD BEHIND THE FRONT WEDNESDAY INTO AT LEAST 
THE FIRST PART OF THE WEEKEND...WITH COOLER THAN NORMAL TEMPS EARLY 
FOLLOWED BY SOME GRADUAL WARMING.  A SECONDARY COLD FRONT IS 
FORECAST TO PUSH TOWARD THE AREA THURSDAY/THURSDAY NIGHT...BUT 
APPEARS THIS FRONT WILL BE DISSIPATING AS IT APPROACHES SO WILL NOT 
CARRY ANY PRECIP WITH THIS FEATURE. BY SUNDAY AND/OR 
MONDAY...MOISTURE IS FORECAST TO BE ON THE INCREASE AND THE NEXT 
UPPER LEVEL SHORT WAVE MAY BE APPROACHING...SO WILL CARRY LOW POPS 
FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS BOTH DAYS. WILL UNDERCUT GFS 
MOS TEMPS A BIT FOR QUITE A FEW HIGHS...WITH GENERALLY MORE MINOR 
TWEAKS TO GFS MOS MIN TEMPS.

&&

076 
FXUS64 KMRX 110807
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
407 AM EDT MON AUG 11 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SPOTTY RANDOM CONVECTION LINGERS 
THIS MORNING NORTH OF I-40 AND I-81. HOWEVER...I FINALLY HAVE SOME 
CONFIDENCE IN SHORT RANGE MODELS HIGH POPS...DUE TO THE WARM FRONT 
WHICH WILL BE LIFTING NE TODAY AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT OVER W TN. A 
SPEED MAX...AT THE BASE OF THE SHORTWAVE TROUGH...WILL MOVE ACROSS 
THE MID MS VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON AND PROVIDE SOME UPPER LEVEL 
DIVERGENCE INTO THIS EVENING. NOT OVERLY IMPRESSIVE AND MOSTLY 
ACROSS NRN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA. 

POP AND WEATHER GRIDS WERE GENERALLY ON TRACK FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT 
ALTHO I DID NEED TO LOWER POPS JUST A BIT FOR EARLY AND MID MORNING 
TODAY. THE THREAT OF SEVERE STORMS LOOKS MINIMAL. WIND PROFILES ARE 
UNI-DIRECTIONAL WITH WIND SHEAR LESS THAN 20 KNOTS. PRECIPITABLE 
WATER VALUES REMAIN QUITE HIGH...BUT STORM MOVEMENT SHOULD BE 
SUFFICIENT ENOUGH TO ONLY POSE A THREAT OF JUST LOCALLY HEAVY 
RAINFALL. MAY MENTION A FEW STRONG STORMS WITH GUSTY WINDS IN THE 
HWO PRODUCT.

THE HIGHER POPS AND CLOUDINESS DID NOT FAVOR THE WARMER GFS MOS 
MAXES...WHILE MINS TONIGHT COULD BE A DEGREE OR TWO HIGHER THAN THE 
GFS MOS MINS...BASED ON TIMING OF COLD FRONT LATER ON TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...COLD FRONT ACROSS MIDDLE TN
WITH SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS SHOWERS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA EARLY
TUESDAY. SHOWERS AND STORMS MORE NUMEROUS NORTH AND NORTHEAST.
MODELS HAVE SPED UP SYSTEM NOW WITH FRONT MOVING TO THE EASTERN
BORDER AROUND THE 00Z TO 06Z TIMEFRAME. THERE COULD BE ENOUGH
DESTABILIZATION AHEAD OF THE FRONT FOR A FEW STRONG STORMS OVER NE
TN AND SW VA IN THE AFTERNOON OTHERWISE PRECIPITATION WILL END FROM
SW TO NE LATE IN THE DAY TUESDAY INTO TUESDAY NIGHT AS FRONT MOVES
EAST. FORECAST HIGHS A DEGREE OR SO BELOW GUIDANCE TUESDAY. TUESDAY
NIGHT SHOWERS END WITH SKIES CLEARING. UPPER TROUGH BEHIND FRONT
WEDNESDAY WILL DRY OUT ATMOSPHERE AND LOWER DEW POINTS INTO THE
50S. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING SOUTHEAST FROM CANADA AND THE NORTHERN
PLAINS WILL KEEP SKIES MOSTLY SUNNY TO MOSTLY CLEAR THROUGH AT
LEAST FRIDAY. THE COLD FRONT TUESDAY WILL MOVE SOUTH TO NEAR THE
GULF COAST THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AND THEN START MOVING BACK NORTH
AS A WARM FRONT SATURDAY. AS HIGH SHIFTS EAST SATURDAY SOME
UPSLOPE FLOW WILL START ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE APPALACHIANS LATE
SATURDAY. AS AIR MASS MOISTENS SUNDAY WITH HIGH CENTERED TO THE
EAST A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL RETURN. TEMPERATURES WILL
BE MOSTLY BELOW NORMAL WITH LOWS IN THE 50S THURSDAY THROUGH
SATURDAY MORNINGS.

PRESSURE BUILDING INTO THE FORECAST AREA. WELL BELOW NORMAL 
OVERNIGHT TEMPERATURES WILL LIKELY OCCUR TOWARD THE LATTER PART OF 
THE WORK WEEK. BY THE WEEKEND...CONFIDENCE DROPS OFF IN REGARDS TO 
RAIN CHANCES SO SLIGHT CHANCE CREEPS INTO THE FORECAST FOR NEXT

420 AM EDT SUN AUG 10 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MODELS CONTINUE TO OVERDO THE 
AMOUNT OF CONVECTION EACH DAY...WITH GFS ONLY USEFUL FOR TEMPERATURE 
GUIDANCE. SEEMS TO ME THAT ONCE AGAIN THE MAIN FOCUS FOR DEVELOPMENT 
WILL BE DAYTIME HEATING AND OROGRAPHIC CONVERGENCE. THERE IS A WEAK 
SURFACE LOW OVER NRN MIDDLE TN AND WRN KY WITH A DEW POINT TEMP 
DISCONTINUITY ACROSS WRN PARTS OF EAST TN THIS MORNING. UPPER 
RIDGING STILL INDICATED SO DON'T SEE MUCH IN THE WAY OF UPPER LEVEL 
SUPPORT. LATEST RAP MODEL RUN DEVELOPS A GREAT DEAL OF CONVECTION 
LATER THIS MORNING IN THE VICINITY OF THIS BOUNDARY...WHILE HRRR 
SHOWS JUST RANDOM ACTIVITY FOR TODAY. 

BASED ON POOR MODEL PERFORMANCE...TAKING A PERSISTENCE APPROACH AND 
TRIMMING BACK POPS FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT. KEPT LIKELY POPS THIS 
AFTERNOON ACROSS MAINLY WRN HALF OF OUR FORECAST AREA...DOWN TO 
CHANCE WITH SCATTERED WORDING ELSEWHERE. RADAR TRENDS SUPPORT JUST 
SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE POPS FOR THIS MORNING. TOSSED IN SOME 
PATCHY FOG FOR LATE TONIGHT...WITH NO MENTION OF FOG REQUIRED FOR 
EARLY TODAY.

WARMER GFS MAX TEMPS ONLY GOOD IF JUST MINIMAL CONVECTION OCCURS 
TODAY...SO I OPTED FOR A MOS BLEND. GFS MINS OR A DEGREE WARMER 
LOOKED GOOD FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MONDAY SURFACE LOW HAS
ONLY MOVED NORTH SLIGHTLY INTO THE OHIO VALLEY WITH A STATIONARY
FRONT ACROSS MIDDLE TN AND DRAPED SOUTHEAST ACROSS GA. HIGH
PRESSURE REMAINS ALONG NE US COAST. ANOTHER FRONT LIES BEHIND THE
LEAD SYSTEM OVER THE NORTHERN MS VALLEY. CURRENT FORECAST BRINGS
INCREASING SHOWERS AND STORMS MONDAY INTO TUESDAY AS SURFACE LOW
MOVES THROUGH OHIO VALLEY AND COLD FRONT TO THE NW CATCHES UP WITH
STATIONARY FRONT. SHORTWAVE ENERGY MOVING THROUGH OHIO AND TN
VALLEYS WILL SET OFF SHOWERS AND STORMS MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY
NIGHT AND EARLY WEDNESDAY. SKIES CONTINUE PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY
WITH HIGHEST RAIN CHANCES MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. TUESDAY
AND TUESDAY NIGHT STILL CHANCE POPS AS SECONDARY FRONT APPROACHES.
NW FLOW OF COOLER AND DRIER AIR MASS WILL PREVAIL FROM WEDNESDAY
AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY. MORNING LOWS DROP INTO THE 50S TO
LOWER 60S FOR THIS PERIOD WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY AND THEN SLOWLY WARMING INTO THE 80S FRIDAY
AND SATURDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
309 PM EDT SAT AUG 9 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...SURFACE WARM FRONT WILL EXTEND 
NORTH THROUGH E TN VALLEY TO WEAK LOW PRESSURE TO THE NW. MID LEVEL 
FLOW NEARLY ZONAL WITH WEAK DIVERGENCE DEVELOPING ACROSS NORTHERN 
AREAS. VERY MOIST AIRMASS REMAINS IN PLACE. CONVECTIVE TRIGGERS 
LIMITED TO MAINLY DAYTIME HEATING. ACTIVITY THAT DOES DEVELOP WILL 
BE SLOW MOVING STORMS PRODUCING HEAVY RAINFALL. TEMPERATURE RANGE 
INSIDE CLIMO WITH HUMID AND CLOUDY CONDITIONS. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...THE END OF OUR 
RAINY STRETCH IS IN SIGHT...THEN DRIER AIR AND PLEASANT CONDITIONS 
RETURN WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY BEFORE OUR NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES ON 
SATURDAY. MAX TEMPS STILL REMAIN SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW GUIDANCE. 

BY SUNDAY NIGHT OUR SLOW MOVING SHORTWAVE WILL FINALLY BE MAKING ITS 
DEPARTURE FROM THE AREA AS ANOTHER SHORTWAVE MOVES DOWN FROM THE NW 
AND INTO THE TN VALLEY. ONCE AGAIN...ONGOING SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL 
BE LIKELY TO START THE PERIOD ON SUNDAY NIGHT. THESE EVENING SHOWERS 
AND STORMS WILL GIVE WAY TO A BREAK IN RAIN OVER NIGHT AND INTO THE 
EARLY MORNING HOURS OF MONDAY BEFORE THE NEXT WAVE MOVES IN. BETTER 
COVERAGE OF SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL EXIST DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS 
AS INSTABILITY BUILDS THROUGH THE DAY. SHOWERS AND STORMS SHOULD 
WANE ONCE AGAIN ON MONDAY NIGHT AS WE LOSE OUR DAY TIME 
HEATING...AND AS DRIER AIR STARTS TO BUILD IN. TUESDAY 
AFTERNOON/EVENING A COLD FRONT WILL BEGIN TO MOVE THROUGH OUR REGION 
AND WILL SPARK ADDITIONAL SCATTERED SHOWERS AND STORMS. 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES THEN LOWER TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AS THE 
COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH. 

DRIER AIR FOR WEDNESDAY BUT WILL STILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE IN FOR AN 
ISOLATED SHOWER ACROSS NETN AND SWVA WED MORNING THEN DRY EVERYWHERE 
BY AFTERNOON. EVEN DRIER AIR FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY BEHIND THE 
FRONT AS HIGH PRESSURE TO STARTS BUILDING BACK INTO THE REGION. 
MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES EXPECTED ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WITH DEWPOINTS IN 
THE UPPER 50S TO MID 60S MAKING FOR VERY NICE CONDITIONS. SATURDAY 
LOOKS MOSTLY DRY BUT THERE DOES LOOK TO BE A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR 
SHOWERS AND STORMS OUT AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING TROUGH ACROSS THE 
CENTRAL PLAINS

967 
FXUS64 KMRX 091500
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EDT SAT AUG 9 2014

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. MINOR UPDATE TO DEW POINTS AND 
HUMIDITY. VERY MOIST AIRMASS IN PLACE. CONVECTION EXPECTED TO 
INCREASE IN THE AFTERNOON HOURS. SLOW MOVING CELLS WILL PRODUCE HEAY 
RAINFALL. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION: 

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHORTWAVE RIDGING IN PLACE PLUS 
THE TYPICAL STABILIZATION OVERNIGHT...HAS LED TO VERY SPARSE 
CONVECTION THIS MORNING. THIS RIDGING ALOFT FLATTENS LATER TODAY AND 
THE WARM FRONT FROM NRN PLATEAU TO SE TN SHOULD AID IN INCREASED 
CONVECTION BY THIS AFTERNOON. HOWEVER...ONLY THE POORLY PERFORMING 
GFS MODEL IS VERY AGGRESSIVE IN HOW MUCH CONVECTION OCCURS EVEN THIS 
AFTERNOON. THE RAP AND HRRR MODELS REALLY DON'T ADVERTISE MORE THAN 
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND TSRA. HAD NO CHOICE BUT TO DOWNPLAY POPS FOR 
THE MORNING HOURS...THEN BLEND INTO SIMILAR HIGHER POPS FOR THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS.

EXPECT CONVECTION TO DIMINISH AFTER MIDNIGHT...WHICH WAS GENERALLY 
THE TREND IN PREVIOUS POP GRIDS. ADDED SOME PATCHY FOG LATE TONIGHT 
WHICH HAS A BETTER CHANCE TO DEVELOP THAN THIS MORNING. 

A FEW STRONG TO MARGINALLY SEVERE STORMS COULD OCCUR THIS AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING. AIR MASS WILL BE AT LEAST MODERATELY UNSTABLE
TODAY... BUT FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW LESS SHEAR TODAY THAN
YESTERDAY. SO MIGHT JUST SEE ISOLATED PULSE TYPE STRONG STORMS.
WILL MENTION THIS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS IN OUR HAZARDOUS WEATHER
PRODUCT.

OTHERWISE...AIR MASS LOOKS TOO MOIST TO GO ANY HIGHER THAN NAM MOS
MAXES. GFS MOS MAXES PROBABLY TOO WARM BUT LOOKED GREAT FOR
TONIGHT'S MINS.

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...WET PERIOD CONTINUES SUNDAY 
THROUGH TUESDAY. SLOW MOVING SHORTWAVE WILL BE MOVING SLOWLY EAST 
SUNDAY MORNING AND AFTERNOON. HIGHEST RAIN CHANCES EASTERN AND 
NORTHERN AREAS. WEAK SURFACE LOW PRESSURE REMAINS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. EVENING SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL GIVE WAY TO A BREAK IN 
RAIN...THEN ANOTHER SHORTWAVE MOVES INTO TN VALLEY WITH BROAD UPPER 
TROUGH OVER REGION MONDAY. WITH DAY TIME HEATING SHOWERS AND STORMS 
LIKELY NORTHEAST SECTIONS. DRYING OUT MONDAY NIGHT. ON TUESDAY 
SURFACE LOW DEEPENS TO THE NORTH AND A COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE TN 
VALLEY. SHOWERS AND STORMS INCREASE OUT AHEAD OF THE FRONT AND NEXT 
SHORTWAVE. PRECIPITATION CHANCES THEN LOWER TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY AS COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH. DRIER NW FLOW LATER WEDNESDAY 
THROUGH FRIDAY WITH NO RAIN EXPECTED. BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES 
ENTIRE FORECAST PERIOD. HIGHS IN THE MID TO UPPER 70S MOUNTAINS AND 
PARTS OF SW VA TO THE LOWER TO MID 80S LOWER ELEVATIONS. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 090804
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
404 AM EDT SAT AUG 9 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHORTWAVE RIDGING IN PLACE
PLUS THE TYPICAL STABILIZATION OVERNIGHT...HAS LED TO VERY SPARSE
CONVECTION THIS MORNING. THIS RIDGING ALOFT FLATTENS LATER TODAY
AND THE WARM FRONT FROM NRN PLATEAU TO SE TN SHOULD AID IN
INCREASED CONVECTION BY THIS AFTERNOON. HOWEVER...ONLY THE POORLY
PERFORMING GFS MODEL IS VERY AGGRESSIVE IN HOW MUCH CONVECTION
OCCURS EVEN THIS AFTERNOON. THE RAP AND HRRR MODELS REALLY DON'T
ADVERTISE MORE THAN SCATTERED SHOWERS AND TSRA. HAD NO CHOICE BUT
TO DOWNPLAY POPS FOR THE MORNING HOURS...THEN BLEND INTO SIMILAR
HIGHER POPS FOR THE AFTERNOON HOURS.

EXPECT CONVECTION TO DIMINISH AFTER MIDNIGHT...WHICH WAS GENERALLY 
THE TREND IN PREVIOUS POP GRIDS. ADDED SOME PATCHY FOG LATE TONIGHT 
WHICH HAS A BETTER CHANCE TO DEVELOP THAN THIS MORNING. 

A FEW STRONG TO MARGINALLY SEVERE STORMS COULD OCCUR THIS AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING. AIR MASS WILL BE AT LEAST MODERATELY UNSTABLE
TODAY... BUT FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW LESS SHEAR TODAY THAN
YESTERDAY. SO MIGHT JUST SEE ISOLATED PULSE TYPE STRONG STORMS.
WILL MENTION THIS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS IN OUR HAZARDOUS WEATHER
PRODUCT.

OTHERWISE...AIR MASS LOOKS TOO MOIST TO GO ANY HIGHER THAN NAM MOS
MAXES. GFS MOS MAXES PROBABLY TOO WARM BUT LOOKED GREAT FOR
TONIGHT'S MINS.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...WET PERIOD CONTINUES SUNDAY
THROUGH TUESDAY. SLOW MOVING SHORTWAVE WILL BE MOVING SLOWLY EAST
SUNDAY MORNING AND AFTERNOON. HIGHEST RAIN CHANCES EASTERN AND
NORTHERN AREAS. WEAK SURFACE LOW PRESSURE REMAINS OVER THE FORECAST
AREA. EVENING SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL GIVE WAY TO A BREAK IN
RAIN...THEN ANOTHER SHORTWAVE MOVES INTO TN VALLEY WITH BROAD UPPER
TROUGH OVER REGION MONDAY. WITH DAY TIME HEATING SHOWERS AND
STORMS LIKELY NORTHEAST SECTIONS. DRYING OUT MONDAY NIGHT. ON
TUESDAY SURFACE LOW DEEPENS TO THE NORTH AND A COLD FRONT MOVES
INTO THE TN VALLEY. SHOWERS AND STORMS INCREASE OUT AHEAD OF THE
FRONT AND NEXT SHORTWAVE. PRECIPITATION CHANCES THEN LOWER TUESDAY
NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AS COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH. DRIER NW FLOW
LATER WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY WITH NO RAIN EXPECTED. BELOW NORMAL
TEMPERATURES ENTIRE FORECAST PERIOD. HIGHS IN THE MID TO UPPER 70S
MOUNTAINS AND PARTS OF SW VA TO THE LOWER TO MID 80S LOWER
ELEVATIONS.

676 
FXUS64 KMRX 081924
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EDT FRI AUG 8 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...SURFACE WARM FRONT EXTENDS NE 
THROUGH SOUTHEAST TN AND CONTINUES THROUGH N MIDDLE TN. A SHORT WAVE 
WILL MOVE SLOWLY INTO MIDDLE TN THROUGH THE PERIOD. SURFACE LOW 
PRESSURE WILL ACCOMPANY THE FRONT. WARM AND MOST AIRMASS IN PLACE. 
PWAT VALUES NEAR 2.00 AND DEEP WARM CLOUD LAYER WILL MAKE CONDITIONS 
FOR HEAVY RAINFALL AND LOCALIZED FLOODING POSSIBLE. TIMING AND 
PLACEMENT OF EXTENDED PERIODS OF RAINFALL REMAIN UNCERTAIN WITH 
RELATIVELY WEAK SYNOPTIC FEATURES. MOST FAVORABLE AREAS ARE ACROSS 
NE TN AND SW VA MAINLY DUE TO STORM MOTION AND LOCATION NORTH OF 
WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE CONFINED INSIDE CLIMO 
DUE TO DEEP MOISTURE.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...OVERALL...LONGTERM 
PERIOD STILL LOOKS FAIRLY WET WITH MAX TEMPS SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW 
GUIDANCE DUE TO CLOUD COVER AND RAIN. AS WITH YESTERDAY...MODELS 
STILL LOOK TO BE IN PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE OVERALL PATTERN. 
DRIER AIR STILL PROGGED TO RETURN BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY.

SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD BE ONGOING TO START THE PERIOD ON 
SATURDAY NIGHT AS AN UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE CONTINUES MOVING THROUGH. 
INGREDIENTS STILL IN PLACE TO WHERE WILL HAVE TO CONTINUE TO MONITOR 
THE POTENTIAL FOR A FLOODING THREAT DURING THIS TIME. IT REALLY 
DEPENDS ON HOW MUCH PRECIP ACTUALLY FALLS THROUGH THE REST OF THE 
DAY TODAY (FRIDAY) AND UP UNTIL THE START OF THE LONGTERM. 
ALSO...WITHOUT A DISTINCT FOCUSING MECHANISM IN PLACE...IT IS VERY 
DIFFICULT TO PINPOINT WHICH AREAS WILL SEE THE GREATEST RAINFALL 
SINCE THE SHOWERS AND STORMS ARE MORE SCATTERED IN NATURE. UPPER 
LEVEL SHORTWAVE STILL MOVING THROUGH ON SUNDAY. SO FROM SATURDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY...SEVERAL ROUNDS OF SHOWERS AND STORMS SHOULD 
CONTINUE AS SOUNDINGS ARE STILL VERY SATURATED WITH ELEVATED PWS 
RANGING FROM NEAR 1.75 TO 2 INCHES. PRECIP EFFICIENCY DURING THIS 
TIME WILL REMAIN HIGH DUE TO WARM LAYER DEPTHS REMAINING BETWEEN 11 
AND 12K FEET ALONG WITH MARGINAL CAPE AND WEAK SHEAR.

SUNDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY MONDAY ANOTHER SHORTWAVE ADVANCES DOWN OUT 
OF THE NW. THIS ADVANCING WAVE WILL HELP TO PUSH THIS SLOW MOVING 
LOW OFF TO OUR NE. FOR THIS REASON...IT LOOKS LIKE THERE SHOULD BE A 
BREAK IN THE PRECIP FROM SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH EARLY MONDAY WHILE 
IN BETWEEN THESE TWO FEATURES. BY MONDAY AFTERNOON MODELS SHOW NEW 
CONVECTION AND SHOWERS DEVELOPING WITH THE ARRIVAL OF THE 
AFOREMENTIONED SHORTWAVE. THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD PERSIST INTO THE 
OVERNIGHT HOURS OF MONDAY AND EARLY TUESDAY MORNING. 

THEN WE MAY HAVE YET ANOTHER BREAK IN PRECIP FROM LATE TUESDAY 
MORNING THROUGH AFTERNOON AS SOMEWHAT DRIER AIR STARTS TO WORK ITS 
WAY IN...BUT THEN WE HAVE THE WEAK COLD FRONT TO DEAL WITH. THE 
FRONT BEGINS TO MOVE IN BY TUESDAY EVENING INTO 
WEDNESDAY...ISOLATED SHOWERS AND STORMS ARE EXPECTED WITH THE 
ARRIVAL OF THE FRONT. WILL CONTINUE ISOLATED SHOWERS AND STORMS ON 
WEDNESDAY AS THE FRONT CONTINUES TO PUSH THROUGH THE AREA. 

FINALLY BY THURSDAY...AND MORE SO ON FRIDAY...DRIER AIR LOOKS TO 
FILTER IN BEHIND THE FRONT WITH A DRY END TO THE WORK WEEK.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 071925
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EDT THU AUG 7 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...SHALLOW LOW LEVEL RIDGE WEAKENS 
OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH FRIDAY. MID LEVEL RIDGE OVER 
THE AREA WILL MOVE EAST EARLY TONIGHT. H70-H50 FLOW BECOMES WSW AND 
INCREASES SLIGHTLY. LAYER MOISTURE INCREASES WITH TIME WITH PWAT 
VALUES APPROACHES 1.90 BY LATE FRIDAY. ISENTROPIC LIFT INCREASES 
TONIGHT BRINGING AN INCREASED CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION OVERNIGHT AND 
RAMPING UP THROUGH FRIDAY. WESTERN AREAS WILL BE FAVORED FOR 
PRECIPITATION. MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH MAINLY LIGHT 
PRECIPITATION BUT MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS APPEAR TOO HIGH FOR SYNOPTIC 
PATTERN. UNDERCUT THESE NUMBERS ESPECIALLY TONIGHT. RAINFALL AMOUNTS 
WILL GENERALLY BE LIGHT WITH ISOLATED AREAS OF CONVECTION MAINLY ON 
FRIDAY. LIGHT HAZE AND MORNING FOG WILL CONTINUE IN LIGHT SURFACE 
WIND FLOW. WARM TEMPERATURES TONIGHT AND NEAR NORMAL HIGHS ON 
FRIDAY.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...NOT MUCH CHANGE
FROM PREVIOUS FORECAST DISCUSSION. MODELS STILL LOOK TO BE IN
PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE OVERALL PATTERN. GENERALLY...AN
UNSETTLED AND WET LONGTERM LOOK TO BE IN STORE WITH DRIER AIR NOT
RETURNING UNTIL A WEAK FRONT MAKES ITS WAY THROUGH ON WEDNESDAY
NIGHT/THURSDAY.

FRIDAY NIGHT...SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS LOOK TO BE ONGOING AS THE 
REMNANTS OF AN UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL BE SLOWLY 
TRAVERSING ACROSS OUR AREA DUE TO LITTLE STEERING FLOW. WHILE THIS 
SYSTEM IS MOVING ACROSS OVER THE WEEKEND...A FEW UPPER LEVEL 
SHORTWAVES WILL ALSO BE MOVING DOWN INTO OUR AREA FROM OUT OF THE 
NORTHWEST...THUS FURTHER REINFORCING CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS. SOUNDINGS REMAIN VERY SATURATED FROM FRIDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH SATURDAY WITH PWS RANGING FROM 1.5 TO 2 INCHES. THESE PW 
VALUES ARE ABOVE THE 75 PERCENTILE BUT BELOW 2 STANDARD DEVIATIONS 
FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. SO PWS NOT NEAR MAX VALUES...BUT STILL HIGH 
ENOUGH TO MAKE FOR A VERY MOIST ATMOSPHERE FOR EARLY/MID AUGUST. 
SHEAR VALUES REMAIN QUITE WEAK THROUGH THIS TIME SO NOT MUCH 
CONVECTIVE ORGANIZATION IS EXPECTED. GENERALLY JUST GARDEN VARIETY 
STORMS WITH PERIODS OF POTENTIALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. 

THE LAST OF THESE SHORTWAVES MOVES IN SUNDAY NIGHT INTO 
MONDAY...THIS LAST WAVE WILL HELP PUSH THE AFOREMENTIONED LOW OFF TO 
THE NORTHEAST AND OUT OF OUR AREA. THIS LAST UPPER LEVEL WAVE WILL 
ALSO BRING MORE SHOWERS AND STORMS THROUGH TUESDAY. BEHIND THIS 
WAVE...A WEAK COLD FRONT MOVES DOWN OUT OF THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY 
INTO OUR REGION ON WEDNESDAY PROVIDING ANOTHER SHOT OF SOME SHOWERS 
AND STORMS. MODELS STILL NOT COMPLETELY AGREEING ON THE TIMING OF 
THIS FRONT AS THE ECMW HAS IT OUT OF OUR AREA BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON 
WHILE THE GFS DOESN'T PUSH IT THROUGH UNTIL WEDNESDAY NIGHT. WHEN 
THE FRONT DOES FINALLY MOVE OUT...MUCH DRIER AIR AND LOWER DEWPOINTS 
WILL FILTER IN BEHIND IT. THURSDAY LOOKS TO BE THE ONLY DRY DAY AT 
THIS POINT THROUGH THE LONGTERM BEHIND THE FRONTAL PASSAGE.
 
CONTINUED THE TREND OF STAYING SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW THE MAX TEMPS 
GIVEN EXPECTED CLOUD COVER AND PRECIP.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

SHOULD STAY TO THE S AND WEST. LIGHT HAZE IS IN PLACE. LIGHT FOG IS
POSSIBLE MAINLY AT TRI OVERNIGHT WHERE CLOUD COVER WILL BE THINNER.
PRECIPITATION COVERAGE IS EXPECTED TO INCREASE SHORTLY AFTER TAF
PERIOD.

PATTERN AS THE NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES THE AREA.  CLOUDS WILL 
INCREASE THROUGH THE NIGHT BUT ASSOCIATED PRECIP SHOULD HOLD OFF

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK RIDGING OVER THE AREA TODAY

SEE SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION DEVELOP OVER HIGHER TERRAIN WITH MOST

THIS WILL BRING IN CLOUDS OVERNIGHT WITH A CHANCE THAT 
SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS COULD REACH INTO THE AREA AS EARLY AS 09Z TO 
12Z.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT WITH THE OVERALL PATTERN DURING THE LONG TERM PERIOD 
ALTHOUGH SOME DIFFERENCES IN THE DETAILS ESPECIALLY LATE IN THE 
PERIOD.  FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS CLOSE TO AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF 
YEAR. LOOKS FAIRLY UNSETTLED FOR MUCH OF THE PERIOD.  A WARM FRONT 
WILL PUSH INTO THE AREA ON FRIDAY...AND THIS WEAK BOUNDARY WILL 
REMAIN OVER THE REGION INTO AT LEAST MONDAY.  SOME UPPER LEVEL SHORT 
WAVE ENERGY WILL BE COMING DOWN IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT AT TIMES 
DURING THE PERIOD AS WELL...WHICH WILL ENHANCE CHANCES FOR SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS. WILL CARRY LIKELY POPS MUCH OF THE AREA FRIDAY 
THROUGH SATURDAY...WITH CHANCE POPS AFTER THAT THROUGH TUESDAY.  A 
WEAK COLD FRONT IS FORECAST TO PUSH THROUGH BY WEDNESDAY...ALLOWING 
FOR SOME DRYING.  WILL JUST CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS WEDNESDAY. WILL 
GENERALLY NOT STRAY TOO FAR FROM GFS MOS TEMPS FOR MINS...BUT WILL 
TRIM SEVERAL DEGREES OFF THE MAX TEMPS GIVEN EXPECTED CLOUD 
COVER...PRECIP...AND WET GROUND.

667 
FXUS64 KMRX 061856
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
226 PM EDT WED AUG 6 2014

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND THURSDAY/...

WEAK ENTRANCE REGION OF UPPER JET WILL SLIDE SE INTO THE AREA THIS 
EVENING. THIS FEATURE WILL AID IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF SCATTERED 
CONVECTION THROUGH SUNSET. SHORT WAVE UPPER RIDGING MOVES EAST 
ACROSS THE AREA ON THURSDAY WITH A DRIER AIRMASS FILTERING INTO THE 
REGION. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
FROM THE OHIO VALLEY. LOW LEVELS WILL BECOME LIGHTLY HAZY. LOW LEVEL 
THICKNESS VALUES RISE ACROSS SOUTHERN AREAS AS A MILD WARM UP 
CONTINUES. 
 
.LONG TERM /THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...

A WEAK SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL TRACK THROUGH THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE 
VALLEYS FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY...PUSHING A WEAK COLD FRONT INTO THE 
REGION WHICH WILL SERVE AS A FOCUS FOR SOME SCATTERED TO PERHAPS /AT 
TIMES/ MORE WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DURING THE END OF 
THE WEEK. A SUBTROPICAL RIDGE OVER THE NORTHERN GULF OF MEXICO WILL 
CONTINUE TO NOSE ITS WAY NORTH WHICH WOULD SUPPORT A MORE DIURNALLY 
DRIVEN CONVECTION PATTERN FOR SUNDAY INTO THE NEW WORK WEEK. 
HOWEVER...A COUPLE OF MODEL SOLUTIONS WANT TO BRING A BROAD TROUGH 
INTO THE REGION ON MONDAY WHICH WOULD FAVOR SOME SLIGHTLY BETTER 
STORM CHANCES ALONG WITH SLIGHTLY COOLER CONDITIONS INTO NEXT WEEK. 
REGARDLESS...THINK A 30 TO 40 POP FOR DIURNAL CONVECTION SEEMS 
PLAUSIBLE FOR NOW...WITH HIGHS SEASONABLE IN THE 85 TO 90 DEGREE 
RANGE IN MOST LOCATIONS EACH DAY.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL BRING A

AREAS DRY OVERNIGHT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT WITH THE OVERALL PATTERN DURING THE LONG TERM PERIOD...AND 
FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS ABOUT AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.  THE 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY SHOULD BE NEAR OUR SOUTHERN BORDER THURSDAY 
MORNING...WITH SOMEWHAT DRIER AIR BEHIND IT.  NORTHERN AREAS SHOULD 
BE PRECIP FREE...BUT WILL CARRY A SLIGHT CHANCE OF CONVECTION CLOSER 
TO THE FRONT. MODELS INDICATE THERE MAY BE SOME UPPER LEVEL SHORT 
WAVES COMING DOWN IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW IN THE FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY 
TIME FRAME...ALTHOUGH DETAILS OF TIMING/STRENGTH OF THESE FEATURES 
STILL A BIT MURKY.  WILL CARRY CHANCE TO LOW LIKELY POPS FOR SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS DURING EACH PERIOD. SOME DRYING INDICATED BY THE 
GFS BY TUESDAY...BUT GIVEN UNCERTAINTY FOR NOW WILL CONTINUE TO 
CARRY LOW CHANCE POPS. WILL GENERALLY NOT STRAY TOO FAR FROM GFS MOS 
TEMPS FOR MINS...BUT WILL TRIM SEVERAL DEGREES OFF THE MAX TEMPS 
ESPECIALLY FROM SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY GIVEN EXPECTED CLOUD 
COVER...PRECIP...AND WET GROUND.

182 
FXUS64 KMRX 051903
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
303 PM EDT TUE AUG 5 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...ONE MORE FAIR NIGHT...AND
THEN WE WILL BEGIN TO SEE THE GRADUAL RETURN OF RAIN CHANCES
WEDNESDAY. MOSTLY 30 POPS NORTH WITH 20S ELSEWHERE WED AFTERNOON.
THE NAM WAS EARLIEST AND MOST AGGRESSIVE WITH RAIN IN THE AREA ON
WED...BUT GFS AND ECMWF ARE SIMILAR TO EACH OTHER AND LESS
AGGRESSIVE. BUT WOULDN/T BE SURPRISED IF THE POPS IN THE NORTH NEED
A LITTLE BIT OF AN UPWARD BUMP FROM THE MID-SHIFT.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND REVEAL A WEAK FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY SLOWLY DRIFTING SOUTHWARD INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY BY THE 
MIDDLE OF THE WEEK AND BECOMING QUASI-STATIONARY THROUGH EARLY NEXT 
WEEK. A MARGINALLY TO MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS IS PROGGED TO 
DEVELOP AROUND THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY EACH DAY...WHICH WILL RESULT IN 
SCATTERED CONVECTION DEVELOPING OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD. ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...A COUPLE OF UPPER-LEVEL 
SHORT WAVES (POSSIBLY GENERATING ORGANIZED MCS ACTIVITY) ARE PROGGED 
TO MOVE SOUTHEASTWARD FROM THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY INTO THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY WITHIN THE NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. THUS...WILL HAVE THE HIGHEST 
POPS DURING THE EXTENDED PERIOD ON THESE TWO DAYS. AS FOR TEMPS... 
WILL TREND COOLER THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...DUE TO THE RELATIVELY HIGH GROUND MOISTURE (FOR 
THIS TIME OF YEAR) AND THE EXPECTED INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER AND 
CONVECTION AS THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY SETTLES AROUND THE FORECAST
AREA.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             65  92  69  90 /   0  20  20  30

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A BROAD UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL 
LINGER OVER THE EASTERN US. THE ATMOSPHERE WILL REMAIN ON THE DRY 
AND STABLE SIDE OVER OUR AREA FOR THE MOST PART...BUT THERE MAY BE 
ENOUGH MOISTURE/INSTABILITY AGAIN OVER THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS FOR 
SOME ISOLATED AFTERNOON CONVECTION.  WILL INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE 
POP IN THESE AREAS.  OTHERWISE...SHOULD BE QUITE A BIT OF SUNSHINE 
TODAY...WITH A MOSTLY CLEAR/PARTLY CLOUDY SKY TONIGHT.  WILL NOT 
ARGUE MUCH WITH MAV TEMPS.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...WILL BE IN A NORMAL 
SUMMERTIME CONVECTIVE PATTERN ON WEDNESDAY WITH ISOLATED TO 
SCATTERED CONVECTION EXPECTED ACROSS THE REGION AND BEST COVERAGE 
OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  WILL THEN MOVE INTO AN UNSETTLED WEATHER 
PATTERN FOR FRIDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND AS A BROAD...WEAK BOUNDARY 
SETTLES INTO THE REGION AND A SERIES OF WEAK DISTURBANCES TRACK 
THROUGH.  THIS WILL INCREASE COVERAGE OF SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS TO 
HIGH CHANCE FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY.  CHANCE OF CONVECTION WILL 
DECREASE BY MONDAY AS THE BOUNDARY MOVES EAST OF THE AREA.


&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EDT MON AUG 4 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...WEAK SHORTWAVE MOVING PAST
PRESENTLY WILL BE UNEVENTFUL...THOUGH IT MAY HELP INCREASE THE
CURRENT MOUNTAIN CONVECTION ON THE NC SIDE. FAIR AND MOSTLY QUIET
WEATHER IN THE SHORT TERM...WITH ONLY ISOLATED MOUNTAIN CONVECTION
POSSIBLE THROUGH THIS EVENING...AND THEN AGAIN TUESDAY AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND REVEAL A WEAK COLD 
FRONT SLOWLY DRIFTING SOUTHWARD INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY BY THE 
MIDDLE OF THE WEEK AND THEN BECOMING QUASI-STATIONARY THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND. A MARGINALLY TO MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS IS PROGGED TO 
DEVELOP AROUND THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY EACH DAY...WHICH WILL RESULT IN 
SCATTERED CONVECTION DEVELOPING THROUGH THE PERIOD. A COUPLE OF 
UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVES ARE PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY DURING THE EXTENDED PERIOD...BUT THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS 
REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH THE EXACT TIMING OF THESE SHORT WAVES 
AND THE AMOUNT OF CONVECTIVE COVERAGE WITH EACH SHORT WAVE. THUS FOR 
NOW...WILL KEEP POPS IN THE HIGH CHANCE CATEGORY FOR THE END OF THE 
WEEK. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND COOLER THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...DUE TO THE EXPECTED INCREASE IN 
CLOUD COVER AND CONVECTION.

&&

.AVIATION...VFR WILL PREDOMINATE...EXCEPT FOR VSBYS 1-4SM AT TRI
BETWEEN 05/08Z-05/13Z WITH LOCAL BR.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
354 AM EDT MON AUG 4 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A BROAD UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL 
LINGER OVER THE REGION...BUT BETTER MOISTURE WILL BE EAST OF THE 
MOUNTAINS. THE ATMOSPHERE IS EXPECTED TO BE FAIRLY STABLE FROM THE 
VALLEY WEST...BUT THERE MAY BE ENOUGH MOISTURE/INSTABILITY OVER THE 
EASTERN MOUNTAINS FOR SOME ISOLATED AFTERNOON/EVENING CONVECTION.  
WILL INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN THESE AREAS.  OTHERWISE...SHOULD 
BE QUITE A BIT OF SUNSHINE TODAY...WITH A MOSTLY CLEAR SKY TONIGHT.  
WILL NOT ARGUE MUCH WITH MAV TEMPS FOR TODAY...BUT WILL GO A BIT 
HIGHER THAN MAV TEMPS FOR MINS TONIGHT ESPECIALLY SOUTH AND CENTRAL.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...FORECAST CONTINUITY PERSISTS 
THROUGH THE LONG TERM AS THE MODELS CONTINUE TO POINT TOWARD MINIMAL 
CONVECTIVE ACTION TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY WITH RELATIVELY DRY 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. IN THIS REGIME THERE IS JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE 
FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVER SOME OF THE MAJOR TERRAIN 
FEATURES. WITH GRADUAL AMPLIFICATION OF AN UPPER TROUGH OVER THE 
NORTHEASTERN U.S. A COLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL HAVE MADE PROGRESS 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY THURSDAY REQUIRING AN INCREASE IN 
PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION DUE TO CONVERGENCE ALONG THE FRONT. THE 
FRONT REMAINS IN THE AREA ON FRIDAY KEEPING MEDIUM CHANCE POPS GOING 
THROUGH THE END OF THE WORK WEEK BUT THE BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING AREA WIDE OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION MAY BE ON SATURDAY AS THE MODELS GENERALLY AGREE ON PASSAGE 
OF A RATHER SIGNIFICANT SHORT WAVE. MOIST...BUOYANT AIR WILL BE 
AVAILABLE AHEAD OF THE FRONTAL WAVE FOR CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT ON 
SATURDAY SO ADJUSTED POPS INTO THE GOOD CHANCE CATEGORY HERE WHILE 
TWEAKING BACK A BIT ON SUNDAY AS THE UPPER TROUGH MAKES ITS WAY EAST 
TOWARD THE ATLANTIC SEABOARD.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
306 PM EDT SUN AUG 3 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
A DRIER PATTERN HAS SETTLED OVER THE AREA TODAY...AND THAT WILL 
CONTINUE THROUGH MONDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE MOVES EAST INTO THE OHIO 
VALLEY. A BROAD UPPER TROUGH WILL STILL LINGER OVER THE REGION...BUT 
MOST MOISTURE REMAINS EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS. A FEW ISOLATED 
SHOWERS MAY BE POSSIBLE TOMORROW AFTERNOON IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF 
THE SMOKIES AND SW NC...BUT MOVEMENT WILL BE S-SE AND AWAY FROM THE 
VALLEY. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE TO TREND WARMER...IN THE 
UPPER 80S IN MOST OF THE VALLEY WITH MID 80S NORTH. LOWER DEWPOINTS 
THIS AFTERNOON AND LESS RAINFALL SHOULD MEAN LESS DENSE FOG 
POTENTIAL THAN WE SAW LAST NIGHT.
DDHHMM
WRKGDC

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
STILL NO SUBSTANTIAL CHANGES TO THE THINKING OF THE PAST SEVERAL
DAYS. UPPER TROUGH SLOWLY DEPARTS TO THE EAST AND ZONAL PATTERN
REPLACES IT. A WEAK LATE-WEEK DISTURBANCE IN THE FLOW MAY BE THE
FOCUS FOR THE BEST PRECIP CHANCES...PERHAPS FRI EVENING. FOR THE
NUMBERS...WARM AND MOSTLY DRY TUESDAY...THEN RAIN CHANCES START
CREEPING UP FOR THE SECOND HALF OF THE WEEK...AND TEMPS RESPOND BY
DROPPING A LITTLE. THE UNSETTLED PATTERN FOR LATE WEEK AND WEEKEND
WILL HAVE US KEEP THE CHANCE-TYPE POPS IN FOR THURS-SUNDAY.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...GENERALLY LEFT THE PREVIOUS 
FORECAST IN PLACE WITH A FEW TWEAKS HERE AND THERE. THE SAME 
SCENARIO APPLIES WITH WEAK...MAINLY OROGRAPHIC LIFT WITH MARGINAL 
INSTABILITY GENERATING A COUPLE SHOWERS AND A THUNDERSTORM OR TWO 
ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY. BY WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY THE PREVAILING EASTERN U.S. UPPER 
TROUGH RELOADS WITH SHORT WAVE ENERGY DRIVING SOUTHEAST AROUND THE 
BASE OF THE TROUGH THROUGH THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY. AS THIS OCCURS 
ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL BE PRESSING SLOWLY SOUTH TOWARD THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. THEREFORE KEPT CHANCE POPS FOR CONVECTION A LITTLE 
HIGHER ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS THROUGH THURSDAY WHILE ADJUSTING 
POPS TOWARD THE HIGHER END OF THE CHANCE RANGE FRIDAY AND SATURDAY 
AS THE SYNOPTIC BOUNDARY IS PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
AT THIS TIME.

NO SUBSTANTIAL CHANGES TO THE THINKING OF THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS.
WARMING TEMPERATURES WITH FAIRLY MINIMAL PRECIP THROUGH
WEDNESDAY...THEN AS LATTER HALF OF THE WEEK ROLLS IN THE MODELS
STRUGGLE TO AGREE. AS OPPOSED TO YESTERDAY...NOW THE GFS IS THE
DRIER SOLUTION AND THE ECMWF THE WETTER. THUS WE WILL CONTINUE TO
EMPHASIZE CHANCE POPS FOR LATE WEEK...AND AT THIS MOMENT IT LOOKS
LIKE THE PEAK CHANCES WILL OCCUR FRIDAY.

&&

ECMWF/CANADIAN SOLUTION FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD WITH THE GFS THE ODD 
MAN OUT. WEAK UPPER TROUGH HOLDS POSITION ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. 
WITH DEEPEST MOISTURE PROGGED IN THE VICINITY OF THE APPALACHIAN 
CHAIN AND POINTS EASTWARD THROUGH TUESDAY. LITTLE IN THE WAY OF 
ORGANIZED LIFT DURING THIS PERIOD SO STAYED WITH SLIGHT AND SMALL 
CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS WITH SOME 
OROGRAPHICS IN PROXIMITY OF THE BETTER MOISTURE SUPPLY. THUS KEPT 
SOME POPS ON THE MOUNTAINS BORDERING NORTH CAROLINA. THE CANADIAN 
AND ECMWF HAVE SYNCHRONIZED TIMING ON AMPLIFICATION OF THE EASTERN 
U.S. UPPER TROUGH FROM WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY ALONG WITH DECENT 
TIMING ON ANOTHER SYNOPTIC COLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY DROPPING SOUTH INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA ABOUT THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY. HELD ONTO THE GRADUAL 
INCREASE IN PROBABILITY FOR CONVECTION THEME GOING AT THE END OF THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD TO ACCOUNT FOR MORE ACTION ALONG THIS BOUNDARY. 
STAYED JUST UNDER SUGGESTED MAX TEMP GUIDANCE WHILE FOLLOWING MINS A 
LITTLE CLOSER FOR THIS FORECAST.

654 
FXUS64 KMRX 011844
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
244 PM EDT FRI AUG 1 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS ARE DEVELOPING OVER THE TERRAIN AREAS THIS 
AFTERNOON. WITH WEAK STEERING FLOW ALOFT...THERE SHOULD NOT BE MUCH 
ACTIVITY MOVING INTO THE VALLEY...EXCEPT MAYBE SOUTH. A LACK OF 
SYNOPTIC FORCING SHOULD RESULT IN SHOWERS DISSIPATING AFTER SUNSET. 
WILL HAVE A MENTION OF PATCHY FOG LATE TONIGHT AS ALL GUIDANCE 
POINTS IN THAT DIRECTION...AND WE SHOULD BE MOSTLY CLEAR AND CALM.
 
THROUGH SATURDAY...WE WILL CONTINUE TO BE UNDER ABROAD UPPER TROUGH 
PATTERN...BUT MOST OF THE MID/UPPER ENERGY WILL PASS TO OUR 
NORTH...WITH THE DEEP MOISTURE TO OUR EAST. AS A RESULT...SCATTERED 
AFTERNOON SHOWERS ARE EXPECTED ONCE AGAIN TO DEVELOP OVER THE 
PLATEAU AND MOUNTAINS...WITH A FEW POSSIBLY DRIFTING INTO THE 
VALLEY. WILL HAVE POPS IN THE LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE RANGE...LOWER 
THAN PREVIOUSLY FORECAST. WILL ALSO RAISE TEMPERATURES...BUT STILL 
STAY BELOW THE WARM GFS MOS.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
PERSISTENT TROUGHING WILL CONTINUE TO PERSIST...BUT AT LEAST
DURING THE EXTENDED PERIOD WE WILL FIND OURSELVES ON THE WEST SIDE
OF THE TROUGH AXIS...CUT OFF FROM THE GULF MOISTURE FEED. BUT IF
YOU SEE THE GLASS AS HALF FULL...THAT MEANS WE COME TO FIND
OURSELVES ON THE APPROACHING SIDE OF UPPER RIDGING. EITHER
WAY...THE RESULT WILL BE DIMINISHED RAIN CHANCES SUNDAY THROUGH
WEDNESDAY WITH TEMPERATURES WARMING BACK TO NORMALISH FOR EARLY
AUGUST. MODELS SUGGEST IMPROVED RAIN CHANCES FOR THURSDAY...BUT GFS
KEEPS THOSE CHANCES IN THROUGH SUNDAY WHILE THE ECMWF CUTS THEM
BACK AGAIN BEFORE THE WEEKEND. WILL CARRY 30 PCT THURSDAY AND
FRIDAY AREAWIDE UNTIL MORE CONSENSUS CAN BE FOUND.

&&

MOUNTAINS ETC. LOOKS ENOUGH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND SURFACE HEATING
