WILL ALSO INCLUDE ISOLATED THUNDER. TONIGHT...STILL SLIGHTLY
UNSETTLED AS UPPER TROUGH HAS YET TO PASS...AND MODELS SHOW SEVERAL

CLOSE TO GUIDANCE OVERALL.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...EASTERN U.S. LONG 
WAVE TROUGH HOLDS ITS POSITION INTO THE WEEKEND AS SEVERAL SHORT 
WAVE IMPULSES SWING EAST ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE 
NATION. PERHAPS THE BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE 
SATURDAY INTO SATURDAY NIGHT AS MODEL FORECASTS AGREE SHORT WAVE 
LIFT IN CONCERT WITH SUFFICIENTLY DEEP MOISTURE COULD ALLOW FOR 
DEVELOPMENT. FOLLOWING THIS SYSTEM ANOTHER COUPLE SHORT WAVELENGTH 
FEATURES BUILD ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY BUT MODELS INDICATE POPS WILL BE A BIT LOWER WITH THE HIGHER 
DEWPOINT AIRMASS FARTHER SOUTHEAST OF THE FORECAST AREA. BY TUESDAY 
AND WEDNESDAY HEIGHTS START TO BUILD IN THE WAKE OF THE DEPARTING 
UPPER TROUGH ALLOWING WARMER...AND DRIER AIR TO RETURN TO THE MID 
SOUTH. THEREFORE...MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA COULD BE FREE FROM THE 
THREAT OF A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM AT MID WEEK. ATMOSPHERIC MOISTURE 
AND INSTABILITY WILL BE ON THE INCREASE BY THURSDAY WITH THE 
POSSIBILITY OF SHORT WAVE LIFT RIDING IN AHEAD OF ANOTHER FRONTAL 
SYSTEM. WITH THIS IN MIND MAINTAINED THE RETURN TO AREA WIDE CHANCE 
POPS FOR CONVECTION ON THURSDAY. MET MOS TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE 
APPEARED TO HAVE A BETTER HANDLE ON EXPECTED CONDITIONS IN THE 
ANOMALOUS EASTERN U.S. WEATHER PATTERN THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. THROUGH 
THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD UNDERCUT MOS MAX TEMPS WHILE STAYING 
ABOVE SUGGESTED MINS.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...

SPREAD NORTH INTO NE TN AND SW VA LATE TONIGHT AND TOMOROW MORNING. 
WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS IN THIS AREA AFTER 06Z...CONTINUING THROUGH 
18Z. FRI. EASTERLY UPSLOPE WINDS SHOULD KEEP HEAVIEST QPF AMOUNTS TO 
OUR EAST. POPS DECREASE THROUGH THE AFTERNOON AS LIFT EXITS THE 
AREA...BUT WE WILL STILL HAVE A PRETTY MOIST COLUMN IN PLACE THROUGH 
FRIDAY NIGHT...AND THE MAIN MID/UPPER TROUGH AXIS WILL STILL BE TO 
OUR WEST. WILL KEEP A LOW CHANCE POP ACROSS THE AREA FRIDAY 
NIGHT...WITH LIGHT QPF.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
PERSISTENT TROUGHING WILL GIVE WAY TO MORE OF A ZONAL FLOW BY NEXT
WEDNESDAY. THIS MEANS THAT TEMPS WILL BE GRADUALLY CREEPING UPWARDS
DURING THE PERIOD...WHILE RAIN CHANCES GRADUALLY DIMINISH. SO
EXPECT SCATTERED PRECIP THIS WEEKEND WITH HIGHS IN THE LOW TO MID
80S...DECREASING DOWN TO ONLY ISOLATED COVERAGE BY WEDNESDAY WITH
HIGHS IN THE MID 80S TO NEAR 90. LATE IN THE PERIOD /THURSDAY/ WE
MAY BE SEEING THE NEXT WEATHER SYSTEM APPROACH FROM THE WEST...SO
HAVE REINTRODUCED SCATTERED COVERAGE OF PRECIP UNTIL THE TIMING
BECOMES A BIT MORE CLEAR.

CHANCE OF SHOWERS AT TYS AND CHA...CHANCES APPEAR TOO LOW AT THIS
TIME TO WARRANT A MENTION IN THE TAFS.

.DISCUSSION...

EXPECTED TO CHANGE AT THE COLUMN MOISTENS AND MODELS SHOW PRECIP
INTENSITY PICKING UP THIS AFTERNOON. MOST ACTIVITY WILL BE ALONG AN
INVERTED TROUGH ALONG THE MOUNTAINS...WITH A DOWNSLOPE 850 MB WIND
PREVENTING MUCH PRECIP IN THE VALLEY. POPS WILL BE ADJUSTED
SLIGHTLY FOR THE UPDATE...BUT THE GENERAL PATTERN OF SLIGHT/LOW
CHANCES EAST WILL BE KEPT. TEMPERATURES WILL BE LOWERED A
BIT...MAINLY SOUTH AND CENTRAL WHERE CLOUD COVER IS EXPECTED TO BE
BROKEN TO OVERCAST THROUGH THE DAY.

405 
FXUS64 KMRX 310719
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 AM EDT THU JUL 31 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AN UPPER JET WILL MOVE ACROSS THE
OHIO VALLEY/CENTRAL APPALACHIANS LATE TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY. THE
RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE JET WILL BE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS. PRESSURE FALLS ASSOCIATED WITH THE JET WILL HELP PULL
SURFACE RIDGE NORTHEAST OF THE AREA. AS SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH
PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LIFTS NORTHEAST...EASTERLY
WINDS WILL INCREASE INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. UPSLOPE FLOW
INTO THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND SYNOPTIC LIFT WILL PRODUCE
WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS. BEST CHANCES OF RAIN
WILL BE ACROSS THE EASTERN/NORTHERN COUNTIES WHERE LIFT IS BEST.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...BUT 
DIFFER SOME ON THE AMOUNT OF MOISTURE AND RESULTING CONVECTIVE 
COVERAGE OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY AN SATURDAY. AN 
UNSEASONABLY STRONG UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL LINGER OVER THE EASTERN 
HALF OF THE NATION THROUGH THE WEEKEND...WITH A SHORT WAVE TROUGH 
AMPLIFYING OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY WITHIN 
THE LONG WAVE UPPER-LEVEL PATTERN. THIS SHORT WAVE TROUGH WILL PULL 
SOME ATLANTIC MOISTURE NORTHWESTWARD OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...RESULTING IN A GOOD COVERAGE OF CONVECTION 
EACH OF THESE DAYS. THE LONG WAVE UPPER-LEVEL PATTERN IS PROGGED TO 
WEAKEN BY SUNDAY...BUT WILL CONTINUE TO LINGER OVER THE EASTERN HALF 
OF THE NATION THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK WITH A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR 
MASS LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AS A RESULT...ISOLATED 
CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE TO POSSIBLE EACH DAY THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF 
NEXT WEEK...ESPECIALLY AROUND THE MOUNTAINS. AS FOR TEMPS... WILL 
TREND COOLER THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...WHICH IS IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

550 
FXUS64 KMRX 301849
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
249 PM EDT WED JUL 30 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS ARE EXPECTED TO INCREASE OVERNIGHT AS A 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH NOW OVER KS/OK WILL APPROACH THE AREA. IN
RESPONSE TO THE APPROACHING LOW...850-700 MB WINDS WILL BECOME
S-SE...ADVECTING MOISTURE INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TOMORROW.
THE NAM AND GFS AGREE THAT THE MOST CLOUDS AND BEST PRECIP CHANCES
APPEAR TO BE IN THE MOUNTAINS AND SW NC TOMORROW AFTERNOON. A
DOWNSLOPE WIND COMPONENT SHOULD PREVENT PRECIP FROM COMING INTO THE
VALLEY. LIFT IS FAIRLY WEAK HOWEVER...AND APPEARS TO BE ASSOCIATED
WITH A 500 MB VORT MAX AND ISENTROPIC LIFT. THUS POPS WILL STAY IN
THE LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE RANGE...AND ANY RAINFALL AMOUNTS SHOULD BE
LIGHT...LESS THAN A TENTH OF AN INCH.

TRI APPEARS LIKELY TO SEE ANOTHER RECORD LOW TONIGHT (RECORD IS 56) 
AS NORTHERN AREAS SHOULD REMAIN CLEAR OVERNIGHT WITH CALM WINDS.
TYS WILL BE CLOSE (58)...AND THE CHA RECORD SHOULD BE SAFE (58)
WHERE HIGH/MID CLOUDS SHOULD BE THICKER.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
AN UPPER TROUGH WILL REMAIN OVER THE EASTERN U.S. FOR MUCH OF THE
EXTENDED. THE TROUGH AXIS WILL SHIFT TO OUR WEST EARLY IN THE
PERIOD...PLACING US UNDER SOUTHWEST FLOW. THIS WILL AID THE RETURN
OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TO THE AREA. A DISTURBANCE TRACKING ALONG THE
UPPER FLOW FRIDAY AND SATURDAY WILL ALSO BRING WEAK DYNAMICS AND
WEAK INSTABILITY. THIS WILL ADD TO NORMAL DIURNAL CONVECTION AND
PROVIDE A CHANCE OF CONVECTION TO DEVELOP EACH PERIOD...ESPECIALLY
OVER THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS DURING THE LATE AFTERNOON AND EVENING.
THE DISTURBANCE PULLS AWAY FROM THE AREA ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY AND
ASSOCIATED CONVECTION SHOULD DIMINISH TO ISOLATED CONVECTION. A
RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BEGINS TO BUILD IN BY WEDNESDAY.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       58  82  62  81 /   0  10  20  50

WEATHER CUMULUS TO FORM DURING THE DAY. STAYED JUST UNDER MAX TEMP 
GUIDANCE FOR WEDNESDAY WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 70S AND LOWER 80S 
NORTH. SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE MAY WARM INTO THE MID 80S.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...THE LONGER TERM 
TEMPERATURE FORECAST WILL GENERALLY REMAIN BELOW NORMAL AS THE 
EASTERN U.S. WILL BE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF A DEEP UPPER TROUGH. 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT WILL BE DRY BUT BY THURSDAY NIGHT RAIN CHANCES WILL 
INCREASE AS LOW LEVEL FLOW BECOMES SOUTHWEST. THE MAJORITY OF 
RAINFALL WILL BE ENHANCED BY TOPOGRAPHY AND ALSO BY A FEW EMBEDDED 
SHORTWAVES THROUGH THE TROUGH. 

THE TROUGH WILL REMAIN IN THE AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND KEEPING 
TEMPERATURES WELL BELOW NORMAL AND INCREASED RAIN CHANCES THROUGH AT 
LEAST NEXT MONDAY. LOOKING FURTHER INTO THE MODEL RUNS IT APPEARS 
THE TROUGH WEAKENS AND THE AXIS MOVES EAST OF THE FORECAST 
AREA...WHICH SHOULD TAKE RAIN CHANCES WITH IT PERHAPS AS EARLY AS 
TUESDAY.

236 
FXUS64 KMRX 290701
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
301 AM EDT TUE JUL 29 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A
LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS...WITH
A STRONG COLD FRONT OFF THE CAROLINA COAST. THIS SURFACE HIGH WILL
BRING DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY TODAY
AND TONIGHT...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY STRONG UPPER- LEVEL TROUGH
LINGERING OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. THIS UPPER TROUGH
SHOULD MAINLY JUST CREATE AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS OVER THE NORTHERN
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...WITH THE LOCAL ATMOSPHERE CAPPED
IN THE MID LEVELS. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE
IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...AN UPPER TROUGH OVER THE GREAT
LAKES AND OHIO/TENNESSEE VALLEYS WILL BE THE MAIN WEATHER FEATURE
FOR MOST OF THE EXTENDED. A SERIES OF UPPER JETS WILL ROTATE AROUND
THE BASE OF THE TROUGH FOR THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. THESE JETS WILL
THE BOUNDARY LAYER FLOW TO BECOME SOUTHERLY PULLING MOISTURE BACK
INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WITH UPSLOPE FLOW INTO THE
MOUNTAINS.

UNSEASONABLY COOL MID-LEVEL TEMPERATURES COMBINED WITH INCREASED 
MOISTURE AND DAYTIME HEATING WILL PRODUCE SCATTERED TO BROKEN MAINLY 
DIURNAL CONVECTION FOR THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. MAIN LOW-LEVEL 
FOCUSING WILL BE TERRAIN AND AN INVERTED TROUGH OVER THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY.

FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY...THE UPPER TROUGH BEGINS TO LIFTS EAST/
NORTHEAST OF THE AREA WITH SURFACE TROUGH MOVING EAST OF THE SPINE OF
THE APPALACHIANS. BEST CHANCES OF CONVECTION WILL BE ACROSS THE FAR
EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA. 
&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
355 AM EDT MON JUL 28 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A
STRONG COLD FRONT ALONG THE CUMBERLAND MOUNTAINS AND NORTHERN
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...WITH A PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH ALONG THE SOUTHERN
TN BORDER. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE COMPLETELY THROUGH THE
FORECAST AREA AROUND SUNRISE...WITH A DRIER AIR MASS MOVING INTO THE
REGION. AN UNSEASONABLY STRONG UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL CONTINUE TO
AMPLIFY OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION TODAY...WITH AN UPPER-
LEVEL SHORT WAVE ROTATING OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THIS LONG
WAVE TROUGH. MODELS AGREE THAT THIS SHORT WAVE WILL TRIGGER SOME
ISOLATED SHOWERS OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS
AFTERNOON INTO TONIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS
ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A BROAD UPPER-TROUGH WILL BE THE
DOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE THIS PERIOD...WHICH WILL SET UP THE FORECAST
PATTERN FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK ACROSS THE EASTERN CONUS. THIS
AUTUMN-TYPE TROUGH WILL PROMOTE ABNORMALLY LOW TEMPERATURES OF UP TO
10 TO PERHAPS 15 DEGREES BELOW THAN NORMAL AS THE THE MERCURY IS
PROGGED TO ONLY REACH THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S FOR MOST OF THE
PERIOD. ADDITIONALLY...A PREVAILING NORTHERLY FLOW WILL HELP TO
KEEP THE REGION FAIRLY DRY FOR MOST OF THE WORK WEEK...WITH ONLY
SPOTTY ISOLATED SHOWERS AND STORMS POSSIBLE THROUGH THURSDAY...AND
MAINLY ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE MOUNTAINS. ANOTHER AREA OF
LOW PRESSURE WILL ROTATE AROUND THAT PARENT LOW ON FRIDAY...SENDING
ANOTHER WEAK COLD FRONT TOWARD THE REGION. THIS WILL PUSH ANOTHER
SHOT OF COOLER AUTUMN-LIKE AIR INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND PROVIDE
THE NECESSARY LIFT FOR SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
THIS WEEKEND. GIVEN THE BETTER CONFIDENCE IN THIS...HAVE INCREASED
POPS SLIGHTLY IN DAYS 6 AND 7 TO A SOLID CHANCE. 
&&

NAM MOS.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE FORECAST AREA SHOULD 
CONTINUE TO ENJOY A BREAK IN THE PRECIPITATION TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
MUCH OF THURSDAY AS DRIER NORTHWEST FLOW REMAINS IN PLACE. MOISTURE 
WILL VERY SLOWLY RETURN TO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION LATER 
THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY AS THE EASTERN U.S. UPPER TROUGH STRENGTHENS. 
SHORT WAVE FEATURES WILL BE ROTATING THROUGH THE BASE OF THE EASTERN 
TROUGH ENHANCING PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION IN THE FORM OF SHOWERS 
WITH THUNDER MORE LIKELY DURING THE DAYTIME HOURS WITH SUFFICIENTLY 
WARM SURFACE THROUGH LOW LEVEL TEMPERATURES OVERLAIN BY CHILLY UPPER 
LEVEL AIR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF THE UPPER TROUGH. PERHAPS BEST 
CHANCE OF RAIN WOULD BE FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY WITH A SLIGHT DECREASE 
IN PROBABILITY BY SUNDAY AS THE OFFENDING TROUGH WEAKENS A BIT. 
GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES ARE GETTING A LITTLE BETTER BUT STILL HAD TO 
UNDERCUT BY SEVERAL DEGREES IN THE COOL PATTERN IN STORE THIS WEEK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 AM EDT SUN JUL 27 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WARM FRONT OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY AND CENTRAL APPALACHIANS...WITH
A VERY WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. A COLD FRONT
OVER THE MID WEST THIS MORNING WILL MOVE SOUTHEASTWARD TODAY...AS AN
UNSEASONABLY STRONG UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE EASTERN
HALF OF THE NATION. THIS UPPER TROUGH IS PROGGED TO CREATE A MODERATELY
TO POTENTIALLY HIGHLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS AND STRONG WIND FIELD OVER THE
FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. LAPSE RATES APPEAR TO BECOME
FAIRLY STEEP THROUGHOUT THE TROPOSPHERE OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS
AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WITH DECENT 0-3 KM HELICITY VALUES (AROUND
300 M2/S2) AND LOW LCL HEIGHTS CONDUCIVE FOR TORNADO DEVELOPMENT.
OVERALL...IT APPEARS THAT THERE WILL BE THE POSSIBILITY FOR WIDESPREAD
DAMAGING WINDS...VERY LARGE HAIL...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL...AND
ISOLATED TORNADOES THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND
NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH MAXES FOR TODAY...
BUT ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH MINS FOR TONIGHT. WILL GENERALLY TREND
TOWARDS THE COOLER NAM MAXES FOR TODAY...SINCE AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF
HIGH CLOUDS AND SCATTERED CONVECTION ARE EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...IN WAKE OF A STRONG COLD FRONT
THAT IS PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT...ANY REMNANT
STORM/SHOWER ACTIVITY FROM THE EARLIER SQUALL LINE/MCS WILL QUICKLY
DISSIPATE AND SHIFT OFF THE EAST AS SOME PARTIAL CLEARING BEGINS TO
OCCUR WITH DRIER AND COOLER AIR FILTERING INTO THE AREA. THIS WILL
SET UP THE FORECAST PATTERN FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK AS A STALLED
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL REMAIN IN PLACE OVER THE EASTERN CONUS THROUGH
THE END OF THE WORK WEEK. THIS WILL PROMOTE ABNORMALLY LOW TEMPERATURES
OF UP TO 10 TO PERHAPS 15 DEGREES LOWER THAN NORMAL /WITH THE MERCURY
PEAKING IN THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S FOR MOST OF THE WEEK/. THOUGH
THIS COOL/DRY NORTHWESTERLY FLOW SHOULD LIMIT PRECIPITATION CHANCES
SIGNIFICANTLY...SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE
ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE EAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA
MOUNTAINS EACH DAY. LATER IN THE WEEK...ANOTHER BROAD LONGWAVE TROUGH
WILL SWING OUT OF THE GREAT LAKES AROUND THE BASE OF THE PARENT CLOSED
LOW...PUSHING ANOTHER FRONT TOWARD THE REGION WHICH WILL GIVE THE
AREA ANOTHER SOT OF UNSEASONABLY COLDER AIR. THIS UPPER-TROUGH WILL
ALSO RESULT IN SOME ADDITIONAL MORE ORGANIZED CONVECTION LATER ON IN
THE WEEK AS ANOTHER PUSHES TOWARD THE REGION.

DEVELOPING THIS MORNING AT THE TAF SITES. SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL 
INCREASE AFTER SUNRISE AND BECOME GUSTY THIS AFTERNOON...AS A COLD 
FRONT SLOWLY APPROACHES THE REGION. SCATTERED CONVECTION IS EXPECTED 
TO BEGIN DEVELOPING AROUND KTRI AND KTYS THIS AFTERNOON...AND THEN 
AROUND KCHA BY THIS EVENING. FOR NOW...WILL MENTION VCTS SINCE THE 
EXACT TIMING AT THE TAF SITES REMAINS PROBLEMATIC. OVERALL...VFR 
CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED OUTSIDE OF ANY CONVECTION THROUGHOUT MOST OF 
THE TAF PERIOD. 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

THUNDERSTORMS WAS ALSO MOVING SOUTHEAST AROUND THE EDGE OF THE
UPPER HIGH INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. THE STORMS ARE NOW CROSSING THE
OHIO RIVER WEST OF LOUISVILLE AND SHOULD REACH THE FORECAST AREA
AROUND 6Z-9Z SUNDAY. STRONG WINDS ALOFT AND INSTABILITY FROM HOT
TEMPERATURES EARLIER TODAY TO OUR NW WILL FUEL THESE STORMS FOR
SEVERAL MORE HOURS WITH DAMAGING WINDS AND POSSIBLE HAIL LATER
TONIGHT ACROSS THE NORTHERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA. THERE IS
SOME QUESTION OF HOW FAR THE STORMS WILL GET BEFORE DECREASING IN
INTENSITY. HAVE SLOWED THE TIMING SOME BUT KEPT CHANCE POPS
NORTHERN SECTIONS. I WILL ADJUST HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK TO
REFLECT CHANCE OF STORMS FARTHER WEST IN THE OVERNIGHT PERIOD.

396 
FXUS64 KMRX 261910
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT SAT JUL 26 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...QUIET WEATHER SHOULD
LAST FOR MOST THE NIGHT...EXCEPT FOR SW VA LATE WHERE AN MCS COULD
HOLD TOGETHER AND CLIP THAT AREA TOWARD DAYBREAK. THE STRONG WIND
FIELDS AND SEVERAL FAVORABLE SEVERE WEATHER PARAMETERS FOR SUNDAY
INTO SUNDAY NIGHT...MAKE ONE QUESTION THE LOW MOS PROBABILITIES FOR
THOSE 2 PERIODS. THE GFS MODEL SOLUTION SEEMED QUITE REASONABLE TO
ME...BUT EVEN THE GFS MOS POPS WERE LESS THAN 50 PERCENT FOR THIS
EVENT. I OPTED TO KEEP SOME SWATHS OF LIKELY POPS GOING...ALTHO THE
INITIAL LATE NIGHT CONVECTION SHOULD DISSIPATE...LEAVING A FEW
HOURS FOR STRONG CONVECTION TO DEVELOP AT LEAST BY NOON OVER THE
NRN PLATEAU AND SW VA. DON'T SEE WHY THIS NEW CONVECTION WOULDN'T
THEN SWEEP ESE ACROSS THE BULK OF THE FORECAST AREA INTO SUNDAY
EVENING. ACTUAL TIMING AND COVERAGE MAY ALSO BE AFFECTED BY
POTENTIAL OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES FROM THE EARLY MORNING CONVECTION.

MINOR CHANGES MADE TO THE POP AND WEATHER GRIDS TO BE MORE IN LINE
WITH GFS MODEL SOLUTION...AS WELL AS TO MESH WITH NEIGHBORING NWS
GRIDS. CLOSELY FOLLOWED THE GFS MOS MINS FOR BOTH NIGHTS...BUT THE
HOT MAX TEMPS FROM GFS MOS FOR SUNDAY LOOKED SUSPECT. 

SEVERE WEATHER THREAT LOOKS FAVORABLE...AS ADVERTISED EARLIER.
MIGHT SEE MORE HAIL THAN USUAL GIVEN THE COOLING MID LEVEL TEMPS
AND OTHER SEVERE PARAMETERS. SHEAR AND HELICITY INCREASE AS
WELL...SO CAN'T RULE ISOLATED TO A FEW TORNADOES. WEBINAR TODAY
WITH GRAPHICS POSTED TO HIGHLIGHT THIS SEVERE THREAT...AND ALSO
CONTINUED A MENTION OF SEVERE THREATS IN THE ZFP PRODUCT.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MUCH OF THE EXTENDED FORECAST 
ACTUALLY LOOKS MORE LIKE A WINTER TYPE PATTERN WITH A PERSISTENT 
EASTERN U.S. UPPER TROUGH WITH NEVER ENDING NORTHWEST FLOW AND 
PLENTY OF MOISTURE FOR THE PRODUCTION OF PRECIPITATION. THE PERIOD 
STARTS OUT ON MONDAY WITH THE EARLY DEPARTURE OF THE SYNOPTIC COLD 
FRONT POSSIBLY BRINGING A SHOWER TO SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND 
SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA EARLY IN THE DAY. MOISTURE WRAPS BACK INTO 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION DURING THE DAY MONDAY AND THIS TREND 
CONTINUES INTO TUESDAY WITH TWO TO THREE WEAK SHORT WAVELENGTH 
FEATURES BUILDING SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. KEPT SOME SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS AND A 
THUNDERSTORM GOING THROUGH TUESDAY...MAINLY FOR HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS 
OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND EASTERN TENNESSEE. WEDNESDAY AND MUCH OF 
THE AREA WILL REMAIN DRY ON THURSDAY. HOWEVER...HAD TO KEEP THE 
CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ALIVE FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY 
AS THE LONG WAVE TROUGH HOLDS ITS POSITION ACROSS THE EASTERN STATES 
AS A COUPLE OF RELATIVELY SIGNIFICANT SHORT WAVES BUILD THROUGH THE 
BASE OF THE TROUGH INTO THE FIRST HALF OF THE WEEKEND. OF COURSE 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE WELL BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THE EXTENDED. IT WILL 
BE SO COOL THAT IT WILL FEEL MORE LIKE EARLY FALL RATHER THAN THE 
PEAK OF SUMMER WARMTH.


&&

295 
FXUS64 KMRX 260735
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 AM EDT SAT JUL 26 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS
SHOWS AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE CENTRAL
APPALACHIANS...WITH A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER CENTRAL
GA AND THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THIS
BOUNDARY IS PROGGED TO MOVE NORTHWARD AS A WARM FRONT ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA TODAY...BUT MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE A CAPPED ATMOSPHERE
OVER THE FORECAST AREA WHICH SHOULD SUPPRESS ANY POSSIBLE CONVECTIVE
DEVELOPMENT ALONG THIS FRONT. A COLD FRONT OVER THE UPPER MS RIVER
VALLEY THIS MORNING WILL MOVE SOUTHEASTWARD TODAY...AND IS EXPECTED TO
TRIGGER AN MCS OVER THE MID WEST BY THIS EVENING. THIS MCS SHOULD THEN
MOVE EAST-SOUTHEASTWARD OVER THE UPPER OHIO RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT...AND
MAY AFFECT SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN BEFORE AND SHORTLY AFTER
SUNRISE ON SUNDAY MORNING. AS A RESULT...SOME STRONG TO SEVERE
CONVECTION MAY BE POSSIBLE OVER THESE AREAS ON SUNDAY MORNING...WITH
THE POSSIBILITY OF DAMAGING WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL.

MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT AN UNSEASONABLY STRONG UPPER-LEVEL
TROUGH WILL AMPLIFY OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION ON SUNDAY
BEHIND THIS COLD FRONT...WHICH WILL HELP TO CREATE A MODERATELY
UNSTABLE AIR MASS AND STRONG WIND FIELD OVER THE FORECAST AREA BY
SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. LAPSE RATES APPEAR TO BECOME FAIRLY
STEEP THROUGHOUT THE TROPOSPHERE OVER THE FORECAST AREA BY SUNDAY
AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WITH 0-3 KM HELICITY VALUES CONDUCIVE FOR
TORNADO DEVELOPMENT (AROUND 300 M2/S2). THUS...IT APPEARS THAT THERE
WILL LIKELY BE A GOOD COVERAGE OF SEVERE CONVECTION OVER THE FORECAST
AREA SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF WIDESPREAD
DAMAGING WINDS...VERY LARGE HAIL...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL...AND
ISOLATED TORNADOES. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE
IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH MINS FOR TONIGHT AND SUNDAY NIGHT...BUT
REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH MAXES FOR TODAY AND SUNDAY. WILL
GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS THE COOLER NAM MAXES SINCE THIS HAS BEEN
THE TREND LATELY...AND AN EXPECTED INCREASE IN MOISTURE AND CONVECTIVE
ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE THIS TREND.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...PERSISTENT TROUGHING WILL KEEP
COOLER THAN NORMAL CONDITIONS THROUGH THE NEW WORK WEEK. SHOULDN/T
SEE MUCH IN THE WAY OF ORGANIZED OR SIGNIFICANT PRECIP AFTER THE
MONDAY MORNING FRONTAL PASSAGE...BUT SOME LOW POPS WILL BE POSSIBLE
AT TIMES. BEYOND THE VALID PERIOD...MAY ACTUALLY GET A BROAD CLOSED
LOW OVER THE OHIO VALLEY NEXT WEEKEND...WHICH MAY MAKE US A LITTLE
MORE SHOWERY. STAY TUNED.
&&

FROM THE SEVERAL POST-FRONTAL DAYS OF TEMPERATURES 5-10 DEGREES BELOW
NORMAL (TUES-THURS). THE FRONTAL PASSAGE ON MONDAY WILL BRING THE
BEST RAIN CHANCES FOR THE WEEK DURING SUNDAY NIGHT/MONDAY MORNING.

WITH COOLER AND DRIER AIR MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA. WITH CLEAR 
SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS...FOG FORMATION APPEARS LIKELY AT KTRI AND 
KTYS THIS MORNING SINCE SOME RAINFALL WAS OBSERVED AT THESE SITES 
YESTERDAY. HOWEVER...THE DRIER AIR MASS OVER THE REGION SHOULD HELP 
TO DELAY THE ONSET OF THIS FOG AND ITS SEVERITY...BUT WILL STILL 
MENTION DENSE FOG WITH VLIFR VISIBILITIES AT KTRI...AND LIGHTER FOG 
WITH IFR VISIBILITIES AT KTYS. AFTER THIS MORNING'S FOG...VFR 
CONDITIONS AND LIGHT WINDS SHOULD BE THE RULE THROUGHOUT THE TAF 
PERIOD AT ALL THREE TAF SITES. 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

SHOULD ENJOY A DRY START TO THE WEEKEND ON SATURDAY BUT THE WEATHER
BECOMES UNSETTLED BY SUNDAY AS ANOTHER STRONG SHORT WAVE TROUGH
DROPS SOUTHEAST OUT OF CANADA. RISING MOIST AIR AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM
WILL LEAD TO INCREASING POPS FOR CONVECTION SUNDAY INTO SUNDAY
NIGHT AS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ERUPT ALONG THE PRE-FRONTAL
TROUGH. ADDITIONAL SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY SOME THUNDER WILL PUSH
THROUGH JUST AHEAD OF THE ACTUAL COLD FRONT MONDAY MORNING. HELD
ONTO SOME CHANCE POPS FOR A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM LATER MONDAY
INTO MONDAY NIGHT AS MODELS INDICATE SOME TRAILING MOISTURE AND
ENERGY BUILDS INTO THE BACK SIDE OF THE AMPLIFIED EASTERN U.S.
TROUGH. WAS ABLE TO KEEP TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY DRY AS COOL
NORTHWEST FLOW SETS UP ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. THE
MODELS INDICATE MORE SHORT WAVE ENERGY DIVES DEEP ACROSS THE
SOUTHEASTERN U.S. BY THURSDAY WITH MORE THAN SUFFICIENT MOISTURE
FOR THE PRODUCTION OF A COUPLE SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A THUNDERSTORM.
HAD TO UNDERCUT GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES THROUGH MOST OF THE LONG TERM
PERIOD.

EASTWARD THROUGH THE OH VALLEY. WARMING TREND INTO SUNDAY. UPPER JET 
SLIDES SOUTH INTO THE TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON MONDAY. 
SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE SE THROUGH THE AREA AND THROUGH THE 
SMOKIES BY MONDAY AFTERNOON. GOOD LIFT AND PRE FRONTAL INSTABILITY
WILL BE IN PLACE AS FRONT MOVES IN SUNDAY NIGHT. LIMITING FACTOR
WILL BE AVAILABLE MOISTURE SO CONVECTIVE COVERAGE AND QPF ARE IN
QUESTION WHILE FRONT MOVES THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON. THIS IS
FOLLOWED BY A DRY AND COOL AIR MASS AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE
SETTLES IN THROUGH THE MID WEEK. MORNING LOWS WILL BECOME SEVERAL
DEGREES BELOW NORMAL.

FXUS64 KMRX 231903
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
303 PM EDT WED JUL 23 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...MORNING CONVECTION WORKED 
SOUTHEAST AND GENERALLY DISSIPATED...WHILE NEW ACTIVITY HAS BEEN 
DEVELOPING MAINLY DUE TO OROGRAPHIC FORCING ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU AND WRN NC. SHORT RANGE MODELS IN CLOSE AGREEMENT ON AT 
LEAST SCATTERED CONVECTION OVERNIGHT...AS THE COLD FRONT MOVES SE 
AND THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH APPROACHES. NOT SURE IF THE FAR EASTERN 
AND FAR SOUTHERN AREAS WILL GET 60 PERCENT COVERAGE...BUT SOME 
CATEGORICAL POPS LOOKED LIKE A GOOD BET FOR SW VA AND NRN PARTS OF 
THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. KEPT FAR SRN VALLEY AND SW NC POPS AROUND 50 
PERCENT FOR NOW.

PREVIOUS WEATHER AND POP GRIDS FOR THURSDAY STILL LOOKED ON TRACK... 
SO NO CHANGES MADE. HARD TO FIND ANY MODEL THAT DOES NOT MOVE THE 
RAIN OUT OF THE FORECAST AREA BY EARLY THURSDAY EVENING. WENT QUITE 
CLOSE TO THE GFS MOS MINS FOR TONIGHT...BUT TRENDED MUCH CLOSER TO 
THE COOLER NAM MOS HIGHS FOR THURSDAY. THIS WAS ALSO IN LINE WITH 
PREVIOUS MAX TEMP GRID AND ADJACENT NWS OFFICES. 


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS IN FAIRLY 
GOOD AGREEMENT FOR THIS PERIOD. A FEW LINGERING SHOWERS WILL BE 
POSSIBLE ALONG THE MOUNTAINS IN E TN AND SW VA WITH THE EXITING 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY. FRIDAY AND SATURDAY LOOK LIKE OUTSTANDING DAYS 
WITH DAYTIME TEMPERATURES IN THE 80S ON FRIDAY AND A FEW DEGREES 
WARMER ON SATURDAY. FRIDAY MORNING LOW TEMPERATURES MAY DIP INTO THE 
UPPER 50S IN SOME AREAS AND LOWER TO MID 50S IN THE MOUNTAINS. 
UNFORTUNATELY THIS PLEASANT WEATHER WILL NOT STICK AROUND LONG 
ENOUGH. MODELS SUGGEST A STRONGER SHORTWAVE MOVING IN THE NW FLOW 
AND AHEAD OF THE NEXT FRONT WILL PRODUCE CHANCES FOR SHOWERS ON 
SUNDAY WITH THE BETTER BET BEING IN THE AFTERNOON. OVERNIGHT SUNDAY 
THE FRONT WILL SLOWLY SWEEP ACROSS THE STATE OF TN BRINGING RAIN 
CHANCES INTO MONDAY. ANOTHER SHOT OF COOL AIR WILL INFILTRATE THE 
REGION ON TUESDAY BRINGING MORE UNSEASONABLY COOL CONDITIONS. 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL LIMIT PRECIPTIATION CHANCES THROUGH AT 
LEAST WEDNESDAY.

AIR MASS FOR FRIDAY. SOME MODERATION WILL OCCUR SATURDAY WHEN THE 
HIGH MOVES EAST...WITH HIGH TEMPERATURES CLOSER TO NORMAL. A 
CLOSED LOW DROPS INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION FOR SUNDAY...PRODUCING 
FALLING HEIGHTS ALOFT AND PUSHING ANOTHER FRONT TOWARD THE AREA FROM 
THE NW. THE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE SE THROUGH THE AREA ON MONDAY. 
SHOWER ACTIVITY WILL RAMP UP ON SUNDAY IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT AND 
CONTINUE INTO MONDAY. THE TROUGH AXIS SHOULD BE EAST OF OUR AREA 
TUESDAY...WITH COOL AND DRY HIGH DROPPING OUT OF CANADA PROVIDING 
BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES.

298 
FXUS64 KMRX 221911
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 PM EDT TUE JUL 22 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...UPPER LOW OVER SOUTHERN 
ALABAMA STILL THE DOMINANT FEATURE FOR OUR AREA...ALTHOUGH THE UPPER 
RIDGE OFF THE FLA COAST IS ACTUALLY GAINING MORE INFLUENCE OVER OUR 
NORTHERN SECTIONS.  THIS MAY EXPLAIN WHY IT HAS BEEN RELATIVELY 
QUIET OVER THE NORTHERN PARTS OF OUR REGION.  WILL HAVE LOWER POPS 
TONIGHT AS THIS SYSTEM FOR THE LAST 24 HOURS HAS LOOKED DIURNAL WITH 
RESPECT TO CONVECTION.  STILL GOING WITH DECENT POPS FOR 
WEDNESDAY...AS FRONT GETS CLOSER WOULD EXPECT INCREASING 
ORGANIZATION WITH WIND STRUCTURE AS WELL AS THE START OF SOME 
COOLING ALOFT.  GFS MOS GUIDANCE LOOKS VERY GOOD OVERALL FOR THESE 
TWO PERIODS...ONLY WENT ABOUT 1 DEG COOLER FOR WEDNESDAY MAX TEMP.


.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
MODELS CONTINUE TO TREND FASTER WITH THE APPROACH OF A MID/UPPER 
LEVEL SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND SURFACE COLD FRONT...WITH THE BEST QG 
FORCING COMING WEDNESDAY NIGHT. WITH PLENTY OF MOISTURE IN 
PLACE...PWAT VALUES WILL BE AROUND 1.75 INCHES...WILL HAVE LIKELY 
POPS FOR THAT PERIOD. THE NAM AND GFS AGREE ON SOME PRECIP LINGERING 
IN EASTERN SECTIONS THU MORNING AS THE SURFACE FRONT MOVES 
THROUGH...BUT WE SHOULD HAVE THE POST-FRONTAL AIR MASS BUILDING IN 
BY THE EVENING. WILL REMOVE ALL POPS FROM THURSDAY NIGHT. 

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE ORIGINATING FROM CENTRAL CANADA AND A NW FLOW 
ALOFT WILL PROVIDE AN UNSEASONABLY DRY AND COOL AIR MASS FOR FRIDAY. 
LOWS WILL BE IN THE UPPER 50S TO MID 60S...WITH HIGHS FRIDAY 
BETWEEN 80 AND 85 IN MOST SPOTS. SOME MODERATION WILL OCCUR SATURDAY 
WHEN THE HIGH MOVES EAST...WITH HIGHS CLOSER TO NORMAL BUT BELOW THE 
GFS MOS NUMBERS...WHICH SEEM WAY TOO WARM.  

A CLOSED LOW DROPS INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION FOR 
SUNDAY...PRODUCING FALLING HEIGHTS ALOFT AND PUSHING ANOTHER FRONT 
TOWARD THE AREA FROM THE NW. GFS AND ECMWF AGREE FAIRLY WELL WITH 
THE GENERAL PATTERN...SO WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS SUNDAY AND MONDAY. 
THE TROUGH AXIS SHOULD BE EAST OF OUR AREA TUESDAY...WITH YET 
ANOTHER COOL AND DRY HIGH DROPPING OUT OF CANADA PROVIDING BELOW 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             70  89  71  86 /  20  50  60  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  70  88  70  84 /  10  50  60  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       70  88  70  84 /  10  50  70  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              66  87  66  81 /  10  50  70  50

FXUS64 KMRX 220809
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
409 AM EDT TUE JUL 22 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD 
INTO THE AREA FROM THE NE TODAY. UPPER LOW OVER SE AL WILL CONTINUE 
TO DRIFT TO THE SW. CYCLONIC LOW TO MID LEVEL FLOW WILL PERSIST INTO 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WILL A EASTERLY COMPONENT ACROSS SOUTHERN 
HALF OF MRX CWA TODAY. LAYER MOISTURE REMAINS HIGH WITH PWAT VALUES 
NEARING 2.00 ACROSS TN/GA BORDER. LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE AND 
OROGRAPHIC LIFT WILL AID IN CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT TODAY. THESE 
STORMS WILL DRIFT SLOWLY WEST MAINLY ACROSS AREAS SOUTH OF 
KNOXVILLE. ELSEWHERE...DIURNALLY DRIVEN PULSE STORMS ARE POSSIBLE 
MAINLY THIS AFTERNOON. CONVECTIVE COVERAGE WILL WANE TONIGHT WITH 
LOSS OF HEATING AND LESS FAVORABLE STEERING FLOW. NEAR NORMAL 
AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES FOLLOWED BY SLIGHTLY WARM OVERNIGHT READINGS.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...STRONG UPPER RIDGE
CONTINUES TO DOMINATE THE WESTERN STATES WITH BROAD TROUGH OVER NE
PART OF COUNTRY. ALSO A WEAK SURFACE LOW OVER THE LOWER MS VALLEY
WITH EASTERLY FLOW OVER THE MOUNTAINS ENHANCING PRECIPITATION
THERE. COLD FRONT OVER OHIO VALLEY WEDNESDAY MORNING TO MOVE INTO
THE FORECAST AREA BY EVENING. GFS AND NAM DIFFER WITH AMOUNT OF
PRECIPITATION THAT FRONT PRODUCES AND TIMING. NAM DRIER THAN GFS.
HOWEVER BOTH MODELS WANT TO BRING SHOWERS AND STORMS IN EARLIER.
WILL KEEP GOOD CHANCE SHOWERS AND STORMS LATER WEDNESDAY AND
WEDNESDAY NIGHT TAPERING OFF THURSDAY. MODELS PUSH FRONT THROUGH
DURING DAY THURSDAY WITH DRYING THURSDAY NIGHT AND THEN COOLER AND
DRIER THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT AS AIR MASS FROM CANADA
MOVES SOUTH INTO THE TN VALLEY. SATURDAY FRONT LOOKS TO MOVE BACK
NORTH AS A WARM FRONT. AIR MASS BECOMES MORE MOIST AND UNSTABLE
WITH SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS. THIS PATTERN CONTINUES SUNDAY AND
MONDAY WITH YET ANOTHER FRONT APPROACHING MONDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL
BE NEAR NORMAL WEDNESDAY AND SATURDAY AND MOSTLY BELOW NORMAL DAYS
AND NIGHTS THE OTHER DAYS OF THE EXTENDED.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

620 
FXUS64 KMRX 211904
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
304 PM EDT MON JUL 21 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...THE AIR MASS OVER THE REGION 
CONTINUES TO MOISTEN THIS AFTERNOON AND SHOULD CONTINUE THROUGH 
TUESDAY AS A LOBE OF DEEPER MOISTURE MOVES OVER THE AREA ON TUESDAY. 
PRECIPITABLE WATER AMOUNTS APPROACH 2 INCHES OVER MUCH OF THE AREA 
DURING THE AFTERNOON.  THIS WILL LIKELY ELEVATE RAINFALL 
AMOUNTS...ALTHOUGH THERE IS NOT A LOT OF LIFT OR FOCUS EXPECTED TO 
ACCOMPANY THIS MOISTURE.  IMPACTS SHOULD BE MINIMAL...JUST LOCALIZED 
STREET FLOODING IN SOME OF THE MORE INTENSE DOWNPOURS.  THIS 
MOISTURE SHOULD MUTE THE OVERALL WARMING TUESDAY AS WELL...WENT ON 
THE COOL SIDE OF GUIDANCE FOR MAX TEMPS TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
A MOIST ENVIRONMENT WITH A BROAD TROUGH OVERHEAD WILL CONTINUE TO 
KEEP UNSETTLED WEATHER OVER THE AREA THROUGH THURSDAY. ORGANIZED 
SYNOPTIC FORCING FOR LIFT REMAINS WEAK TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY...SO 
SHOWERS/TSTMS SHOULD BE MAINLY DIURNALLY DRIVEN. BETTER LIFT COMES 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT WHEN A SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND UPPER JET APPROACH FROM 
THE NW. THIS TIMING IS SIMILAR IN THE NAM AND GFS...AND FASTER THAN 
PREVIOUS RUNS OF BOTH MODELS. WILL MOVE LIKELY POPS INTO WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT...THEN LOWER TO CHANCES THROUGH THURSDAY AS THE TROUGH EXITS. 
THE SURFACE FRONT IS DELAYED BEHIND THE TROUGH...SO WILL KEEP JUST A 
SLIGHT CHANCE UNTIL MIDNIGHT THURSDAY NIGHT. DRY AIR ALOFT WILL 
BRING AND END TO POPS AFTER MIDNIGHT. TEMPERATURES WILL BE BELOW 
NORMAL AND BELOW GFS MOS GUIDANCE CONSIDERING CLOUD COVER AND 
EXPECTED PRECIP. 

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA THURSDAY NIGHT...PROVIDING 
SUNNY SKIES FOR FRIDAY. TEMPS LOOK TO REMAIN BELOW NORMAL DESPITE 
AMPLE SUNSHINE AS THE AIR MASS ORIGINATES FROM CNTRL CANADA AND THE 
MID/UPPER TROUGH IS QUITE DEEP TO OUR EAST. THE GFS AND ECMWF 
INDICATE SOME DISTURBANCES COMING OUR WAY IN THE NW FLOW FOR SUNDAY 
AND MONDAY...SO WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS THOSE DAYS...THOUGH THERE IS 
CONSIDERABLE SPREAD IN THE PRECIP DEPICTIONS OF THE GEFS MEMBERS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             70  83  71  88 /  30  40  30  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  69  83  69  86 /  30  50  20  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       69  84  69  86 /  20  40  20  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              64  84  66  85 /  20  50  20  50

.DISCUSSION...
AIR MASS CONTINUING TO GET MORE AND MORE MOIST AGAIN WITH
PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES EXPECTED TO GROW SOUTHEAST TO NORTHWEST
IN THE UPPER FLOW AROUND THE WEAK CUTOFF LOW SOUTH OF HERE...NEAR
THE NORTHERN GA/AL BORDER. ROUND OF STORMS WITH VERY HEAVY RAIN
OVER THE SOUTHERN PARTS OF THE AREA THIS MORNING...NOW IS MOVING
WEST OF THE AREA AND WEAKENING. EXPECTING MORE DEVELOPMENT THIS
AFTERNOON...WITH BEST CHANCES OVER THE SOUTH AGAIN...AS WELL AS THE
MOUNTAINS...AND TO A LESSER EXTENT ON THE PLATEAU. WEAK EASTERLY
FLOW SHOULD TRY TO BRING MOUNTAIN STORMS INTO THE VALLEY...SO
KEEPING SOME POPS IN THE VALLEY AS WELL. SHAVED OFF 1-2 DEGREES
FROM MAX TEMPS TODAY...MORESO SOUTH...AS DEBRIS CLOUDS AND
RELATIVELY LOW CONVECTIVE TEMPERATURES LIMIT HEATING.

FXUS64 KMRX 210658
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
242 AM EDT MON JUL 21 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE WARM FRONT NEAR SE TN 
BORDER IS SHUNTED SOUTH AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS DOWN THE 
APPALACHIANS. UPPER LOW SLOWLY DEVELOPS OVER GA. WRAP AROUND 
MOISTURE WILL CONTINUE TO ADVANCE INTO THE AREA FROM THE SE. 
LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE AND SOME OROGRAPHIC LIFT WILL AID IN 
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT TODAY AND MAINLY THIS AFTERNOON. STORMS WILL 
BE SLOW MOVING. ACTIVITY WILL CONTINUE TONIGHT BUT WITH LESS 
COVERAGE AND FAVORING THE SOUTH. TEMPERATURES NEAR NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...EARLY IN THE EXTENDED...A LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE GULF COAST AREA WILL CARRY LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION...WITH WEAK DYNAMICS 
REACHING IN AS WELL.  THIS COMBINED WITH NORMAL DIURNAL CONVECTIVE 
PATTERN WILL ALLOW ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP 
EACH PERIOD TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  MAIN CONCERN DURING 
THE EXTENDED WILL BE A COLD FRONT PROGGED TO MOVE IN ON THURSDAY.  
MODELS HAVE BEEN FAIRLY CONSISTENT WITH THIS OVERALL PATTERN BUT 
THERE HAS BEEN SOME DIFFERENCES WITH THE DETAILS...ESPECIALLY IN 
TIMING AND MOISTURE AVAILABLE.  AS THIS BOUNDARY MOVES THROUGH...IT 
WILL BRING THE BEST CHANCE OF ORGANIZED CONVECTION TO THE AREA FOR 
LIKELY TO HIGH CHANCE POPS THURSDAY.  A FEW SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS 
MAY LINGER INTO FRIDAY.  WILL TRANSITION BACK TO THE NORMAL 
SUMMERTIME DIURNAL CONVECTION PATTERN FOR THE WEEKEND.

&&

255 
FXUS64 KMRX 201833
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
233 PM EDT SUN JUL 20 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE 
AREA WILL GRADUALLY SHIFT EAST.  CONSIDERABLE MOISTURE WILL LINGER 
OVER THE AREA. WHILE NOT MUCH IN THE WAY OF ORGANIZED FORCING IS 
EXPECTED...STILL MAY SEE A FEW SHOWERS AROUND AT ANY TIME. IN 
ADDITION...ENOUGH INSTABILITY EXPECTED DURING MONDAY AFTERNOON TO 
WARRANT THUNDERSTORMS IN THE FORECAST.  WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE TO 
CHANCE POPS TONIGHT...CHANCE ALL ZONES MONDAY.  WILL CONTINUE TO GO 
A BIT LOWER THAN MAV FOR MAX TEMPS MONDAY...BUT NOT MUCH ARGUMENT 
WITH MIN TEMPS TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...FAIRLY UNSETTLED WEATHER 
WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD. A WEAKNESS IN THE UPPER 
RIDGE WILL REMAIN OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY WITH MAINLY DIURNAL CONVECTION ANTICIPATED WITH THE MAIN 
FORCING BEING OROGRAPHIC LIFT.

FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...AN UPPER TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE 
GREAT LAKES/NORTHEAST UNITED STATES WILL PULL A COLD FRONT INTO THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY. FAIRLY WIDESPREAD CONVECTION ANTICIPATED FOR 
THURSDAY WITH HIGH CHANCE/LIKELY POPS AREA-WIDE. THIS BOUNDARY MOVES 
SLOWLY SOUTH AND EAST OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR THURSDAY 
NIGHT AND FRIDAY. WILL MAINTAIN CHANCE OF STORMS OVER THE FAR 
EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS/SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA FOR FRIDAY.

FOR SATURDAY BOUNDARY STALLS JUST SOUTH AND EAST OF THE AREA WITH 
UPSLOPE FLOW INTO THE WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA. MOUNTAINS WILL 
CONTINUE WITH LOW CHANCE OF CONVECTION FOR THE FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE 
MOUNTAINS.

FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT...LATEST GFS CONTINUES TO SHOW ANOTHER 
FAIRLY SIGNIFICANT UPPER TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES. 
PRESSURE FALLS ASSOCIATED WITH THE TROUGH SHIFTS WINDS BACK FROM THE 
SOUTH PULLING MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. 
CONFIDENCE WITH TIMING AND EVOLUTION OF UPPER TROUGH LOW...SO WILL 
ONLY CALL FOR LOW-CHANCE POPS.


&&

SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL.

WILL DOMINATE OVER THE GREAT PLAINS WHILE AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE 
ROTATES AROUND THE GA/CAROLINAS REGION.  THIS PATTERN WILL ALLOW LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE TO RETURN TO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION AND 
PROVIDE FAVORABLE CONDITIONS FOR SCATTERED CONVECTION TO DEVELOP 
MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.  DIURNALLY DRIVEN CONVECTION WILL ADD TO 
THE MIX...ESPECIALLY OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  A WEAKENING COLD FRONT 
WILL MOVE IN AROUND THURSDAY PROVIDING OUR BEST CHANCE OF ORGANIZED 
CONVECTION.  A DRIER AND QUIETER WEATHER PATTERN MOVES IN FOR FRIDAY 
AND SATURDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 191852
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
252 PM EDT SAT JUL 19 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...THE UPPER TROUGH WILL REMAIN 
OVER THE AREA DURING THE SHORT TERM PERIOD...ALTHOUGH THE PRIMARY 
FORCING IS MOVING OUT.  CONSIDERABLE MOISTURE WILL LINGER OVER THE 
AREA. APPEARS THERE MAY BE ENOUGH DRYING TO ALLOW SOME SUN ON 
SUNDAY. WILL KEEP A CHANCE OF SHOWERS OVER THE AREA FOR TONIGHT INTO 
EARLY SUNDAY...THEN WITH AT LEAST SOME SUNSHINE EXPECT ENOUGH 
INSTABILITY FOR SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS SUNDAY AFTERNOON. WILL 
GENERALLY UNDERCUT MAV MAX TEMPS A BIT FOR SUNDAY GIVEN EXPECTED 
SIGNIFICANT CLOUD COVER AND VERY WET GROUND...BUT NOT MUCH ARGUMENT 
WITH MAV MIN TEMPS FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...AN UPPER-RIDGE
AXIS OVER THE GREAT PLAINS WILL BEGIN TO NUDGE ITS WAY INTO THE
REGION EARLY NEXT WEEK...AND HELP TO PROMOTE SOME CLEARING AND
SOMEWHAT DRIER WEATHER. HOWEVER...WITH ABOUNDANT GULF MOISTURE
STILL IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION...A FAVORABLE SOUTHERLY FLOW...AND
ANOTHER AREA OF LOW PRESSURE JUST TO THE SOUTHEAST OVER THE
CAROLINAS...REASONABLE CHANCES FOR SCATTERED SHOWERS AND STORMS
WILL EXIST THROUGHOUT THE WEEK. MOST OF THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD BE
DIURNALLY DRIVEN...AND FAVOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN. HOWEVER...
ADDITIONAL CLOUD COVER/PRECIPIATION WILL FORM OVER THE CAROLINAS
AND COULD MOVE INTO THE AREA TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY ON TOP OF THE
DIURNAL ACTIVITY THAT FORMS.

WEDNESDAY NIGHT...ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE GREAT LAKES 
WILL PUSH A COLD FRONT INTO THE OHIO VALLEY AND EVENTUALLY THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY THURSDAY. MORE ORGANIZED SHOWERS AND STORMS 
WILL BE POSSIBLE DURING THIS TIME PERIOD...WITH GREATER COVERAGE 
EXPECTED. THUS...HAVE INCREASED POPS ACCORDINGLY. DRIER AIR WILL 
THEN FILTER INTO THE AREA BY FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY WHICH WILL ALLOW 
FOR MORE SUNSHINE HEADING INTO NEXT WEEKEND AND A BRIEF WARMING 
TREND. OVERALL THOUGH...HIGHS THIS PERIOD SHOULD BE CLOSE TO 
SEASONABLE LEVELS IN THE MID TO UPPER 80S MOST DAYS.

THIS MORNING. LIFT WILL WEAKEN THIS AFTERNOON AS MID LEVEL FLOW 
BECOME MORE WESTERLY WITH PASSAGE OF SHORT WAVE BUT RAINFALL SHOULD 
PERSIST MUCH OF TODAY. WEAK SURFACE TROUGH WILL REMAIN OVER THE AREA 
INTO SUNDAY MORNING. LIFT WILL NOT BE AS IMPRESSIVE BUT LAYER 
MOISTURE WILL REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL WITH CONTINUED PRECIPITATION 
CHANCES CONTINUING INTO SUNDAY AFTERNOON. COOL TEMPERATURES WILL 
LINGER TODAY. LOW LEVEL THICKNESS VALUES RISE SOME ON SUNDAY WHICH 
WILL AID IN DESTABILIZATION AND THE CHANCE FOR THUNDERSTORMS. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE EARLY PART OF THE 
EXTENDED WILL SEE AN UPPER RIDGE BUILDING OVER THE CENTRAL U.S 
HOWEVER...THE MAIN WEATHER FEATURE TO EFFECT THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION WILL BE AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE MOVING THROUGH GA 
AND INTO THE CAROLINAS...ALLOWING LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND WEAK 
DYNAMICS INTO THE REGION.  THIS COMBINED WITH THE NORMAL SUMMERTIME 
DIURNAL PATTERN WILL BRING ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION SUNDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY.  MODELS SHOW DIFFERENCES IN TIMING BUT THE 
MAIN SYSTEM OF THE EXTENDED WILL BE A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY MOVING 
IN AROUND THE THURSDAY TIME FRAME FOR OUR BEST CHANCE OF ORGANIZED 
CONVECTION.  DRY AIR SHOULD FILTER IN BEHIND THIS SYSTEM FOR FRIDAY.

862 
FXUS64 KMRX 181900
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT FRI JUL 18 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...THE UPPER TROUGH TO OUR WEST 
WILL SHIFT EAST INTO THE AREA...WITH A NEARLY STATIONARY FRONT WELL 
TO OUR SOUTH. SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL CONTINUE TO PULL MOISTURE INTO THE 
AREA DURING THE SHORT TERM...ESPECIALLY TONIGHT AND THE FIRST PART 
OF SATURDAY. ALL AREAS SHOULD SEE SIGNIFICANT RAIN...SO WILL CARRY 
CAT POPS BOTH TONIGHT AND SATURDAY. WHILE LOCALIZED FLOODING IS
POSSIBLE...THE RISK FOR MORE WIDESPREAD FLOODING DOES NOT LOOK
HIGH ENOUGH TO WARRANT A FLOOD WATCH AT THIS TIME. NO THUNDER
MENTIONED FOR TONIGHT...BUT INSTABILITY MAY INCREASE A BIT ON
SATURDAY...BUT EXPECTED TO REMAIN WEAK. WILL MENTION SLIGHT CHANCE
OF THUNDER ON SATURDAY.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...

AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL DEPART THE REGION ON SUNDAY NIGHT 
ALLOWING FOR AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE TO GRADUALLY BUILD INTO THE AREA 
FROM THE WEST. BEFORE THAT OCCURS THOUGH...AN ADDITIONAL ROUND OF 
PRECIPITATION IS EXPECTED /ESPECIALLY ALONG THE MOUNTAINS/ SATURDAY 
NIGHT INTO SUNDAY MORNING. THE PRIMARY CHANGE FROM THE PREVIOUS 
FORECAST HAS BEEN THE DRIER MODEL SOLUTIONS SHOWN...ESPECIALLY BY 
THE NAM ON SUNDAY AS THE BEST LIFT WILL BE DISPLACED TO THE SOUTH 
AND EAST OF THE AREA.  AS A RESULT...ONLY SCATTERED SHOWERS FAVORING 
THE HIGHER TERRAIN MAY OCCUR ON SUNDAY...BEFORE COMPLETELY TAPERING 
OFF BY SUNDAY NIGHT.

HOWEVER...WITH A SOUTHEASTERLY FLOW IN PLACE GULF MOISTURE WILL 
REMAIN IN ENTRENCHED OVER THE REGION. THIS WILL PROVIDE A SOLID 
CHANCE FOR SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION AND CLOUD COVER EACH DAY FOR 
MOST OF THE WEEK AHEAD. STILL...WITH DECENT SUNSHINE/HEATING 
OCCURRING...TEMPERATURES WILL RETURN TO NEAR NORMAL LEVELS IN THE 85 
TO 90 DEGREE RANGE. LATER IN THE WEEK...ANOTHER DISTURBANCE OVER THE 
GREAT LAKES WILL DROP A FRONT SOUTHWARD INTO THE AREA...GIVING A 
SLIGHTLY BETTER CHANCE FOR MORE ORGANIZED SHOWERS AND STORMS BY 
THURSDAY. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             65  79  69  84 / 100  90  50  30

FXUS64 KMRX 180703
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EDT FRI JUL 18 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS 
OVER MUCH OF THE EASTERN U.S. RIDGING DOWN THE APPALACHIANS. WARM 
FRONT WELL SOUTH NEAR THE GULF COAST. BROAD UPPER TROUGH PARKED OVER 
THE NATIONS MID SECTION WILL SLOWLY MOVE EAST INTO THE TN VALLEY 
THROUGH THE PERIOD. SOUTHWESTERLY MID LEVEL FLOW WILL INCREASE TODAY 
EAST OF THE TROUGH. MOISTURE WILL INCREASE FAIRLY RAPIDLY ACROSS THE 
EAST TN VALLEY THROUGH SATURDAY. CURRENT PWAT VALUES NEAR 1.00 WILL 
JUMP TO NEAR 2.00 BY TONIGHT. INSTABILITY IS WEAK BUT LIFT WILL BE 
VERY GOOD LATER TODAY AND ESPECIALLY TONIGHT. SHORT WAVE ENERGY AND 
LIFT SLOWLY WEAKEN AND MOVE NE ON SATURDAY. SOME MID LEVEL DRYING 
WILL OCCUR. AIRMASS BECOMES MORE UNSTABLE WITH BETTER CHANCE FOR 
THUNDERSTORMS ON SATURDAY. THE LAYER IS DRIER ON SUNDAY. ABOVE 
NORMAL CHANCE FOR CONVECTION CONTINUES FAVORING THE EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS. GRADUAL WARMING TREND WILL BE MODERATED BY CLOUD COVER 
AND PRECIPITATION. 
 
.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...AN UPPER RIDGE BUILDS 
INTO THE CENTRAL U.S. EARLY IN THE EXTENDED.  THIS PLACES THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION UNDER NORTHWEST FLOW WITH THE LOWER 
LEVELS BECOMING MORE SOUTHERLY WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE TO OUR 
EAST.  THIS WILL ALLOW LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TO RETURN TO THE REGION 
AND BRING US IN A MORE NORMAL SUMMERTIME PATTERN WITH WARMING 
TEMPERATURES AND DIURNAL CONVECTION...FAVORING HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  
THIS PATTERN WILL DOMINATE THROUGH MUCH OF THE EXTENDED.  HOWEVER... 
A WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLIDE IN ON THURSDAY FOR OUR BEST 
CHANCE OF ORGANIZED CONVECTION.

242 
FXUS64 KMRX 171901
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
301 PM EDT THU JUL 17 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...A SLOW MOVING UPPER LEVEL 
TROUGH WILL APPROACH DURING THE PERIOD.  LOW LEVEL FLOW WILL TURN 
MORE SOUTHERLY AND INCREASE...BRINGING INCREASING MOISTURE TO THE 
AREA STARTING TONIGHT. SHOWERS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP OVERNIGHT 
ESPECIALLY CENTRAL AREAS...AND AFFECT ALL AREAS ON FRIDAY. 
INSTABILITY LOOKS LIMITED...BUT MAY BE ENOUGH FOR AT LEAST SOME 
THUNDER SO WILL CARRY LIKELY POPS MOST ZONES WITH A CHANCE OF 
THUNDER ALL ZONES FRIDAY. ONLY SOME MINOR TWEAKS TO MAV TEMPS.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...A WET/UNSETTLED
PATTERN CONTINUES THIS WEEKEND AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH TRACKS
THROUGH THE MID-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. THE COMBINATION OF THIS UPPER-LEVEL
SUPPORT...ISENTROPIC LIFT AND THE ABUNDANT MOISTURE IN PLACE WILL
GENERATE MULTIPLE ROUNDS OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FRIDAY
EVENING INTO SATURDAY...AND AGAIN SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH AT LEAST
SUNDAY EVENING. THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD BE MORE SCATTERED IN NATURE
FRIDAY EVENING AND THEN BECOME MORE WIDESPREAD THROUGH THE NIGHT
INTO SATURDAY AS THE AFOREMENTIONED LIFT INCREASES. THEN...AS THE
BASE OF THE TROUGH ROTATES THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT INTO
SUNDAY...ADDITIONAL ROUNDS OF SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL
OCCUR...BEFORE TAPERING OFF SUNDAY NIGHT. AS A RESULT...HAVE
INCREASED POPS TO LIKELY FRIDAY NIGHT AND LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL ON
SATURDAY.

THOUGH SOME DEEPER CONVECTION WILL OCCUR...MOST OF THE THUNDER 
ACTIVITY WILL REMAIN UNORGANIZED...SO AM EXPECTING LOCALLY HEAVY 
RAINFALL TO BE THE PRIMARY IMPACT FROM THE PERSISTENT RAINFALL /DUE 
TO TRAINING AND AN ENVIRONMENT THAT WILL BE EFFICIENT FOR HEAVY RAIN 
PRODUCING CELLS/. THE THREAT FOR SOME LOCALIZED FLOODING WILL NEED 
TO BE EXAMINED...ESPECIALLY SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY SHOULD THE 
HEAVIEST PRECIPITATION LINGER. IN ADDITION TO THE HIGH PRECIPITATION 
CHANCES...COOLER MORE FALL-LIKE DAYTIME TEMPERATURES IN THE 70S TO 
AROUND 80 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED THROUGH THE WEEKEND. 

THEREAFTER...A HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE TO THE EAST WILL BEGIN TO BUILD 
INTO THE AREA...BUT UNDERNEATH THE INFLUENCE OF SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW 
THE CHANCE FOR SCATTERED CONVECTION AND CLOUD COVER WILL LINGER 
THROUGH MUCH OF THE WEEK AHEAD. TEMPERATURES WILL RETURN TO NEAR 
NORMAL LEVELS IN THE 85-90 DEGREE RANGE. LATER IN THE WEEK...ANOTHER 
DISTURBANCE OVER THE GREAT LAKES WILL DROP A FRONT SOUTHWARD INTO 
THE AREA...GIVING A SOLID CHANCE FOR MORE ORGANIZED SHOWERS AND 
STORMS WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY. 


&&

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ONE FINAL DAY FREE FROM RAIN TODAY

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...THE SHORTWAVE TROUGH NOW 
OVER THE ROCKIES WILL DROP SE AND AMPLIFY TODAY...WITH MOISTURE 
AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM SPREADING NORTHWARD INTO OUR AREA ON FRIDAY. IT 
WILL BE VERY SLOW TO MOVE EAST...SO DEEP MOISTURE WILL REMAIN IN 
PLACE THROUGH SUNDAY. MODELS HAVE SOME BIG DIFFERENCES IN QPF 
AMOUNTS THROUGH THIS PERIOD...WITH THE GFS BEING A DRY OUTLIER. WILL 
LEAN TOWARD THE WETTER NAM/SREF/ECMWF SOLUTION...AND HAVE LIKELY 
POPS SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT WHEN THE NAM SHOWS THE A 500 MB 
TROUGH/VORT MAX CROSSING MIDDLE AND EAST TN. HIGH CHANCES CONTINUE 
INTO SUNDAY AS THE NAM SHOWS A CONVECTIVE LINE DEVELOPING WITH A 850-
700 MB CONVERGENCE ZONE...WITH POPS DECREASING SUNDAY NIGHT.

THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD WILL FEATURE A BROAD UPPER 
TROUGH ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST. THIS WILL KEEP POPS IN THE FORECAST 
EACH DAY...BUT WITH A LACK OF SYNOPTIC FORCING FOR ORGANIZED 
LIFT...WILL HAVE POPS MAINLY DIURNALLY  BASED WITH CHANCES DURING THE 
DAY AND SLIGHT CHANCES AT NIGHT. WE SHOULD ALSO SEE A SLOW WARMING 
TREND AS THE AIR MASS MODERATES...BUT WILL STILL HAVE TEMPERATURES A 
FEW DEGREES BELOW NORMAL EACH DAY BENEATH THE TROUGH...AND WELL 
BELOW GFS MOS WHICH IS ON THE HIGH END OF THE RANGE OF ENSEMBLE 
MEMBERS.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE

PATTERN WILL BEGIN TO CHANGE AS A SHORTWAVE TROUGH OVER THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS/LOWER MS VALLEY MOVES INTO THE TN VALLEY BY FRIDAY MORNING. 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE BEGINS TO INCREASE THURSDAY NIGHT. AS A RESULT 
TEMPERATURES SHOULD RISE A FEW DEGREES. A SECONDARY SHORTWAVE TROUGH 
APPROACHES FROM THE WEST FRIDAY. MODELS ARE STILL VARYING IN THE 
AMOUNT OF QPF WITH THIS TROUGH. INSTABILITY INCREASES SO SHOWERS AND 
A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE MAINLY DURING THE PEAK 
HEATING HOURS. THE NAM HAS HIGH RAIN CHANCES AS COMPARED TO THE GFS 
WITH THE NEW ECMWF IN THE MIDDLE. MODELS THEN BRING EVEN MORE 
MOISTURE IN FRIDAY NIGHT AND ESPECIALLY SATURDAY. WILL ONLY SLOWLY 
INCREASE RAIN CHANCES FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT. SATURDAY STILL HAVE 
HIGH CHANCES. INSTABILITY INCREASES AS WELL SO MORE THUNDERSTORM 
ACTIVITY WITH HEAVY RAINFALL A THREAT AND POSSIBLE STRONG STORMS 
AHEAD OF A WEAK COLD FRONT. THIS FRONT DISSIPATES OVER THE REGION 
SUNDAY BUT A BROAD TROUGH REMAINS KEEPING SKIES PARTLY TO MOSTLY 
CLOUDY AND GOOD CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND STORMS. THE ECMWF EVEN TRIES 
TO SHOW A WEAK UPPER LOW FORMING OVER THE SOUTHEAST STATES AND TN 
VALLEY EARLY TO MID WEEK. PATTERN SUGGESTS CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND 
STORMS EACH AFTERNOON AND EVENING DECREASING OVERNIGHT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL STAY NEAR TO SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL AS 
WELL.

989 
FXUS64 KMRX 160743
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EDT WED JUL 16 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...NORTHWESTERLY WINDS ON THE BACK 
SIDE OF AN UPPER TROUGH IN PLACE ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. WILL 
CONTINUE TO BRING FRESH...COOL CANADIAN AIR INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION. THE DRY...STABLE AIR WILL KEEP THE CU RATHER 
FLAT TODAY AS WELL. DESPITE A FAIR AMOUNT OF MID JULY 
SUNSHINE...HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL BE SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW NORMAL 
TOPPING OUT IN THE 70S ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA 
WITH LOWER 80S OVER THE SOUTH. THE SURFACE MAY RADIATE EFFICIENTLY 
TONIGHT IN THE DRY AIR AND LIGHT WIND ENVIRONMENT WHICH MAY LEAD TO 
THE FORMATION OF FOG IN SOME OF THE SHELTERED VALLEYS AND ALONG 
WATERWAYS SO KEPT THIS IDEA GOING FOR THE OVERNIGHT PERIOD.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)... THE MID/UPPER LONGWAVE 
TROUGH AXIS WILL BE EAST OF THE AREA ON THURSDAY. A SECONDARY 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH APPROACHES FROM THE WEST ON FRIDAY. MODEL QPF 
DEPICTIONS WITH THIS TROUGH VARY WIDELY...WITH THE ECMWF BEING QUITE 
WET AS EARLY AS FRIDAY...WHILE THE NAM STAYS DRY UNTIL SATURDAY. 
GIVEN THE LOW CONFIDENCE...WILL KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE RANGE FRIDAY 
AND FRIDAY NIGHT...RISING TO LIKELY SATURDAY WHEN THERE IS BETTER 
CONSENSUS AMONG THE MODELS AND AMONG GFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS. 

A BROAD AND WEAK TROUGH LINGERS OVER THE REGION FOR THE REST OF THE 
FORECAST PERIOD. THERE APPEARS TO BE LITTLE IN THE WAY OF FORCING 
FOR LIFT...SO CONFIDENCE IS LOW. PRECIP CHANCES WILL LIKELY DEPEND 
ON DIURNAL HEATING. THUS WILL HAVE LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS EACH 
DAY...AND STAY MAINLY DRY AT NIGHT. WILL HAVE A GENERAL WARMING 
TREND EACH DAY...BUT WILL STAY BELOW THE GFS MOS GUIDANCE WHICH 
SEEMS TOO WARM.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...THE LINE OF CONVECTION MOVING

AND HIGHS ON WEDNESDAY WILL ONLY REACH INTO THE UPPER 70S OT LOW 80S.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...PASSAGE OF TODAY'S 
COLD FRONT WILL BRING IN THE ADVERTISED PLEASANT RATHER UNLIKE JULY 
WEATHER INTO THURSDAY EVENING. MODELS STILL AGREE IN GENERAL ON A 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH DEVELOPING IN THE CENTRAL PLAINS ON THURSDAY... 
THEN MOVING SE INTO THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY REGION BY FRIDAY. 
THERE ARE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES IN THE TIMING AND STRENGTH...SUCH THAT 
I THINK DIURNAL CONVECTION WITH THIS FEATURE MAY END TO OUR WEST 
THURSDAY NIGHT. THE SHORTWAVE TROUGH WOULD APPEAR TO TRACK NE LATE 
FRIDAY...SO INCREASING RAIN CHANCES WOULD OCCUR FRIDAY NIGHT INTO 
SATURDAY. MADE A FEW ADJUSTMENTS TO THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY GRIDS 
TO REFLECT THIS SCENARIO.

UPPER PATTERN KEEPS RIDGING IN THE WESTERN STATES AND SOME DEGREE OF 
TROUGHING EAST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK.  
THUS...I HAD TO ALLOW FOR AT LEAST DIURNAL CONVECTION FROM SUNDAY 
THROUGH TUESDAY. CHANCE POPS DAYTIME AND SLIGHT CHANCE NIGHTTIME 
LOOKED REASONABLE FOR NOW. CLOSELY FOLLOWED THE 12Z GFSX MOS TEMPS 
WHICH WERE CLOSER TO THE LATEST 00Z ECMX TEMPS THAN THE WARMER 00Z 
GFSX MOS TEMPS.

BE IN PLACE THROUGH THE REST OF THE PERIOD. TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
WELL BELOW NORMAL...AND WILL UNDERCUT MOS BY A FEW DEGREES GIVEN THE 
ANOMOLOUSLY COOL AIR MASS FOR MID JULY. HIGHS WED AND THU WILL BE 
INTHE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S IN MOST SPOTS...WITH LOWS IN THE MID TO 
UPPER 50S.

RANGE FRIDAY AND ADJUSTING INTO THE LIKELY CATEGORY FRIDAY NIGHT
INTO SATURDAY AS MODEL FORECASTS INDICATE ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH
WORKS ITS WAY INTO THE EASTERN U.S. THE TROUGH WILL BE WEAKENING
INTO THE BEGINNING OF THE NEW WEEK BUT STILL MAINTAINS POSITION
OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. WENT AHEAD AND KEPT THE LOW
THROUGH MEDIUM RANGE POPS FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH
MONDAY WITH A SUFFICIENTLY MOIST AND UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE IN PLACE.
CONCERNING TEMPERATURES...KEPT THE TREND OF UNDERCUTTING MOS BY A
FEW DEGREES.

157 
FXUS64 KMRX 150018 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
818 PM EDT MON JUL 14 2014

.DISCUSSION...
COMPLEX FORECAST THIS EVENING AS AN UPPER-TROUGH PUSHES A SLOW
MOVING COLD FRONT INTO THE REGION...GENERATING SCATTERED SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. RADAR COVERAGE HAS BEEN
MUCH LOWER THAN ANTICIPATED TODAY...PARTLY BECAUSE WARM
TEMPERATURES ALOFT HAVE REINFORCED A CAPPING INVERSION AHEAD OF
THE FRONT...LIMITING DIURNAL CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON. THIS
EVENING AS THE INVERSION WEAKENS...SOME ADDITIONAL STRONG STORMS
SHOULD CONTINUE TO DEVELOP OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS WHILE
INSTABILITY VALUES WILL STILL BE APPRECIABLE. MOST OF THIS
ACTIVITY WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE INTO THE REGION FROM MIDDLE
TENNESSEE/CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND TRACK ALONG AND NORTH OF THE I-40
CORRIDOR.

LATER ON TONIGHT...THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD BEGIN TO INCREASE IN
COVERAGE AS THE FRONT PUSHES SOUTH AND SERVES AS A FOCUS FOR THE
ABUNDANT GULF MOISTURE IN PLACE. HOWEVER...THE HRRR IN PARTICULAR
IS STILL VERY PESSIMISTIC ON THE WIDESPREAD HEAVIER PRECIPITATION
CHANCES TONIGHT...AND SHOWS THE COMPLEX OVER WESTERN/MIDDLE
TENNESSEE MOVING SOUTH INTO ALABAMA AND NOT FILLING IN BACK NORTH
AND EAST. THE NAM IS A BIT MORE OPTIMISTIC ON PRECIPITATION
CHANCES...BUT DOES NOT SHOW ANY ROBUST QPF SIGNALS UNTIL LATER
TONIGHT INTO TUESDAY MORNING ALONG THE FRONT ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS
AND SOUTHERN VALLEY. WITH PWATS BETWEEN 1.5 TO 1.8 INCHES AND A
SOLID BOUNDARY IN PLACE TO FOCUS THE MOISTURE...STILL FEEL THAT
LIKELY POPS WERE WARRANTED OVER MUCH OF THE AREA THIS EVENING AND
LOW-END CATEGORICAL ALONG THE SOUTHERN ZONES LATE TONIGHT.
HOWEVER... GIVEN THE RECENT TRENDS HAVE LOWERED POPS CONSIDERABLY
AREAWIDE IN THE EVENING AND ACROSS THE NORTHERN ZONES LATER
TONIGHT. 

SHOULD COVERAGE INCREASE LATE TONIGHT THERE WILL BE A FAVORABLE
SET-UP FOR LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL GIVEN THE HIGH PWAT VALUES...
BOUNDARY...AND A DEEP WARM CLOUD LAYER. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE LACK
OF STORM COVERAGE TO THIS POINT THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...DO NOT
EXPECT ANY WIDESPREAD FLOODING ISSUES ATTM. BUT...WILL CONTINUE TO
MONITOR SHOWER/STORM COVERAGE AND PRECIPITATION TRENDS OVERNIGHT.

451 
FXUS64 KMRX 141849
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
249 PM EDT MON JUL 14 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...A LINE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING IN ADVANCE OF AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT.  THE AIR MASS IS 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE AND CAPES ARE APPROACHING 2500 J/KG.  
ADDITIONALLY...ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IS IN PLACE WITH PWS 1.5 
TO 2 INCHES.  WITH ALL THIS...A FEW STORMS ANY BECOME STRONG TO 
SEVERE.  THE MAIN THREAT WILL BE STRONG AND DAMAGING WINDS BUT 
MARGINAL HAIL IS ALSO POSSIBLE.  ALSO...HEAVY RAIN MAY CAUSE 
LOCALIZED FLOODING.  ADDITIONAL BANDS OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
ARE EXPECTED TO MOVE THROUGH DURING THE OVERNIGHT HOURS.  850MB JET 
DYNAMICS IMPROVES OVERNIGHT BUT AIR MASS WILL BE STABILIZING AND 
EXPECT THE MAIN THREAT FROM THE OVERNIGHT CONVECTION TO BE HEAVY 
RAIN AND THE POTENTIAL FOR FLOODING.  THE SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS WILL 
SLOWLY EXIT THE AREA ON TUESDAY WITH DRIER AND COOLER AIR SLOWLY 
FILTERING IN LATE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...DRIER AND COOLER WEATHER 
TO START OUT THE LONG TERM BEHIND THE COLD FRONT. THIS LEADS TO A 
COUPLE OF VERY NICE DAYS FOR BOTH WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...WITH LOWS 
IN THE 50S AND HIGHS MOSTLY IN THE 70S TO LOWER 80S.

HOWEVER...AN UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN QUICKLY SETS UP FOR FRDIAY 
INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...AS A TROUGH DEVELOPS OVER THE MID MS VALLEY 
FRIDAY THEN MOVES SLOWLY EAST TOWARD THE OHIO AND TN VALLEYS OVER 
THE WEEKEND.

RAIN CHANCES WERE REQUIRED FOR JUST ABOUT EVERY PERIOD FOR FRIDAY 
THROUGH MONDAY...BUT MY CONFIDENCE WAS TOO LOW TO GO LIKEY ON POPS 
JUST YET. MODELS CONSISTENT IN ADVERTISING BEST RAIN CHANCES FOR 
FRIDAY OR SATURDAY...BUT PREFER TO WAIT ANOTHER MODEL RUN OR TWO 
BEFORE CHOOSING THE BETTER DAY FOR LIKELY POPS. 

KEPT MAX TEMPS CLOSER TO PREVIOUS GRIDS AND ECMX...WHICH IS ABOUT 1 
TO 3 DEGREES BELOW THE WARMER GFSX NUMBERS.


&&

460 
FXUS64 KMRX 140714
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 AM EDT MON JUL 14 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
ONGOING CONVECTION ACROSS KY WILL SLOWLY MAKE ITS WAY SOUTH TODAY. 
ACTIVITY IN OUR CWA IS EXPECTED TO BLOSSOM AROUND OR SHORTLY AFTER 
18Z. NAM FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW MLCAPE VALUES AROUND 2500 J/KG...SO 
THERE WILL BE A THREAT OF SEVERE STORMS. WITH A LARGE SURFACE-TO-
MIDLEVEL THETA-E DIFFERENCE...DOWNBURST WINDS APPEAR TO BE THE
BIGGEST THREAT. MARGINAL HAIL MAY BE POSSIBLE GIVEN THE HIGH
CAPE...THOUGH FREEZING LEVEL HEIGHTS ARE QUITE HIGH. THE HIGHEST
THREAT AREA THIS AFTERNOON WILL BE THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND SW
VA...THEN SHIFT SOUTHWARD IN THE EVENING. THE BEST SYNOPTIC FORCING
OCCURS OVERNIGHT WHEN UPPER DIVERGENCE IS ENHANCED BY THE JET AND
THE SURFACE FRONT DRAWS NEAR. WITH PW VALUES NEARING 2
INCHES...HEAVY RAIN IS EXPECTED WITH LOCALIZED FLOODING POSSIBLE.
POPS WILL BE CATEGORICAL ALL NIGHT GIVEN THE SLOW MOVEMENT OF THE
SYSTEM.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
UNSETTLED DURING THE EXTENDED FORECAST. FOR TUESDAY...COLD FRONT
AND UPPER FORCING DUE TO RIGHT ENTRACE REGION OF THE JET WILL MOVE
EAST WITH WIDESPREAD MORNING SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS DIMINISHING
DURING THE AFTERNOON/EVENING HOURS MAIN CONCERN WILL BE POTENTIAL
OF LOCALIZED FLASH FLOODING ISSUES AS 2 TO 3 INCH RAINFALL
POSSIBLE.

UNSEASONALLY STRONG FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA WITH PLEASANTLY 
COOL AND DRIER AIR ANTICIPATED FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. ANOTHER 
UPPER TROUGH MOVES INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. UPPER FORCING DUE TO ANOTHER JET WILL PULL 
SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS BACK INTO THE AREA. INITIALLY INSTABILITY IS 
LACKING...BUT WILL INCREASE BY SATURDAY. UNCERTAIN ON AMOUNT OF 
MOISTURE/INSTABILITY AVAILABLE FOR POTENTIAL OF SEVERE WEATHER FOR 
SATURDAY...BUT CONCERN IS THERE AS ANOTHER FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH 
THE AREA.

GENEALLY WENT COOLER THAN GFS MOS HIGHS...BUT WENT CLOSE TO GUIDANCE 
LOWS.

FXUS64 KMRX 140136 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
936 PM EDT SUN JUL 13 2014

.DISCUSSION...
A QUIET EVENING CONTINUES ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AS HIGH
PRESSURE HAS GENERALLY SUPPRESSED ANY AFTERNOON CONVECTION...
RESULTING IN A MOSTLY DRY DAY ACROSS THE REGION. THERE ARE A FEW
SCATTERED SHOWERS ACROSS NORTHERN MIDDLE TENNESSEE THAT COULD MOVE
INTO THE NORTHERN PLATEAU BEFORE MIDNIGHT...BUT GENERALLY SPEAKING
THE WEATHER WILL REMAIN DRY FOR MOST OF THE NIGHT. TO THE NORTH...A
SLOW MOVING COLD FRONT HAS KICKED OFF A LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS ALONG
THE OHIO RIVER. THIS ACTIVITY WILL CONTINUE TO GRADUALLY PUSH
SOUTH TOWARD THE KENTUCKY/VIRGINIA/TENNESSEE STATE BORDERS LATE
TONIGHT...AND CREATE THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS AND
STORMS MOVING INTO THE NORTHERN ZONES AROUND DAYBREAK. GIVEN THE
LATEST SPEED AND TRAJECTORY OF THIS ACTIVITY...THINK THAT IT WILL
MOSTLY STAY OUT OF THE REGION UNTIL AFTER 12Z...BUT HAVE A SOLID
CHANCE POPS ALONG THE NORTHERN ZONES TO ACCOUNT FOR THE POTENTIAL
OF THIS ACTIVITY ARRIVING EARLIER. ADDITIONALLY...HAVE REMOVED
MENTIONABLE POPS FROM THE FAR SOUTHERN PLATEAU/VALLEY AND SOUTHWEST
NORTH CAROLINA AS THINK THAT ANY PRECIPITATION WILL REMAIN WELL TO
THE NORTH UNTIL AFTER DAYBREAK.

FXUS64 KMRX 131845
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT SUN JUL 13 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS
SHOWS A WEAK AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE CAROLINAS...WITH
A COLD FRONT OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY AND ANOTHER STRONGER ONE
FARTHER NORTH OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION. AREA RADARS REVEAL SOME
ISOLATED CONVECTION DEVELOPING AROUND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU THIS
AFTERNOON...WHICH SHOULD GRADUALLY DIMINISH AFTER THE SUN SETS.
HOWEVER...WILL KEEP A MENTION OF CONVECTION THROUGHOUT THE NIGHT...
SINCE THE OUTFLOW FROM THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY CONVECTION MAY EVENTUALLY
TRIGGER SOME ADDITIONAL CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT OVER THE FORECAST AREA
LATER TONIGHT. AN UNSEASONABLY STRONG UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS PROGGED
TO AMPLIFY OVER THE EASTERN HALF THE NATION TONIGHT INTO MONDAY...
WHICH WILL PUSH THE STRONGER COLD FRONT TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA
ON MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS IS PROGGED
TO DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA BY MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING...
ALONG WITH FAIRLY STRONG (FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR) UPPER-LEVEL WINDS.
THUS...IT APPEARS THAT STRONG TO SEVERE TSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE
OVER THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WITH DAMAGING
WINDS...LARGE HAIL...AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL BEING THE MAIN
THREATS. THE FORECAST AREA WILL ALSO BECOME LOCATED UNDER THE RIGHT
ENTRANCE REGION OF A FAIRLY STRONG 250 MB JET MONDAY NIGHT...WITH
THESE FAVORABLE UPPER- LEVEL JET DYNAMICS INCREASING THE SYNOPTIC-
SCALE LIFT OVER THE FORECAST AREA...AND CREATING THE POTENTIAL FOR
AN INCH OR TWO OF WIDESPREAD RAINFALL MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY.
THE COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY
MORNING...WITH UNSEASONABLY COOL AIR MOVING INTO THE REGION TUESDAY
AFTERNOON AND TUESDAY NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH MINS THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...AND
LOOK REASONABLE. WILL PLAN TO COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO IN REGARDS
TO MAXES THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...COOLER...DRIER AIR WILL MOVE
INTO THE REGION BEHIND TUESDAY/S COLD FRONT AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE
SETTLES IN. THIS WILL PROVIDE SEASONALLY MILD CONDITIONS. WEDNESDAY
WILL BE DRY...BUT COULD SEE HIGHER ELEVATION CONVECTION DEVELOP ON
THURSDAY. ANOTHER SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY PROVIDING
OUR BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE EXTENDED. 
&&

450 
FXUS64 KMRX 130654
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
254 AM EDT SUN JUL 13 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
MOISTURE WILL BE INCREASING ACROSS THE AREA TODAY AS LOW PRESSURE 
MOVES ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND THE RIDGE OVER THE DEEP SOUTH 
WEAKENS. FORECAST SOUNDINGS TODAY SHOW BETTER INSTABILITY THAN WE 
HAVE SEEN THE PAST FEW DAYS...ALTHOUGH DYNAMIC FORCING FOR LIFT IS 
STILL LACKING TODAY. THUS EXPECT TO SEE ISOLATED TO SCATTERED 
COVERAGE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TODAY...WITH THE BEST CHANCES 
IN HIGHER TERRAIN. CHANCE POPS WILL CONTINUE OVERNIGHT IN NORTHERN 
SECTIONS AS WE WILL SEEING FALLING MIDLEVEL HEIGHTS AND BETTER UPPER 
DIVERGENCE...HELPING TO SUSTAIN SOME CONVECTION OVERNIGHT. SOME 
CLOUD COVER MOVING IN FROM THE NORTH TODAY SHOULD HELP LIMIT HIGHS 
TO THE MID-UPPER 80S NORTH...WITH LOWER 90S SOUTH.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...
AN ACTIVE EXTENDED TIME-FRAME WITH AN USUALLY STRONG UPPER TROUGH
MOVING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES MONDAY AND TUESDAY. STRONG UPPER
LEVEL JET WILL MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY PLACING THE TENNESSEE
VALLEY UNDER FAVORED RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION FOR LATE MONDAY THROUGH
TUESDAY. FOR MONDAY...PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH AND/OR CONVECTIVE COMPLEX
INITALLY OVER THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY WILL LIKELY BE A FOCUS FOR
THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT DURING THE AFTERNOON/EVENING. SOME OF
THESE STORMS WILL LIKELY BE SEVERE DUE TO MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOWING
MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIRMASS...INCREASING BOUNDARY FLOW AND MID-
LEVEL DRY AIR. ALSO...FAVORABLE HAIL CAPE AND WET-BULB ZERO HEIGHTS
TO PRODUCE MARGINAL SEVERE HAIL.

DUE TO PRO-LONG RIGHT ENTRACE REGION PRODUCING DIVERGENCE ALOFT OVER 
THE AREA...INCREASING PWS TO 1.8 INCHES AND POTENTIAL OF TRAINING 
STORMS OVER THE AREA...HEAVY RAINFALL IS EXPECTED FROM LATE MONDAY 
INTO TUESDAY. WEATHER PREDICTION CENTER IS DEPICTING BETWEEN 1 1/2 
AND 2 INCHES OVER MOST OF THE AREA WITH LOCALLY HEAVIER 
AMOUNTS ANTICIPATED. LOCALIZED FLASH FLOODING IS POSSIBLE.

FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...UNSEASONALLY COOL AIR WILL MOVE INTO 
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WITH MAINLY DRY CONDITIONS. FOR FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY...ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH IS EXPECTED TO MOVE TOWARD THE AREA 
WITH RETURN FLOW OF MOISTURE INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. WILL 
SPREAD CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY THUNDERSTORMS BACK INTO THE 
AREA.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
247 PM EDT SAT JUL 12 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS
SHOWS A WEAK AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS...WITH A WARM AND HUMID AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA.
AREA RADARS REVEAL SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION DEVELOPING AROUND THE
APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS AND CUMBERLAND PLATEAU THIS AFTERNOON...WHICH
SHOULD GRADUALLY DIMINISH AFTER THE SUN SETS. CONVECTION IS EXPECTED
TO DEVELOP AGAIN BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON...BUT WITH INSTABILITY PROGGED
TO INCREASE A LITTLE MORE ON SUNDAY...THINK THAT THE CONVECTIVE
COVERAGE WILL BE A LITTLE BETTER OVER THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. AN
UNSEASONABLY STRONG UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS THEN PROGGED TO AMPLIFY
OVER THE EASTERN HALF THE NATION BY SUNDAY NIGHT...WHICH WILL PUSH
A COLD FRONT TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY. MODELS INDICATE
THAT A VERY UNSTABLE AIR MASS COULD DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA
BY MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING...ALONG WITH FAIRLY STRONG (FOR THIS
TIME OF YEAR) UPPER- LEVEL WINDS. THUS...IT APPEARS THAT AN FAIRLY
EXTENSIVE LINE OF STRONG TO SEVERE TSTORMS WILL DEVELOP OVER THE OHIO
RIVER VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT...AND WILL THEN EVENTUALLY BRING DAMAGING
WINDS...LARGE HAIL...AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL ACROSS THE FORECAST
AREA BY MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...AND
WILL COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE
NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A STRONG COLD FRONT WILL MOVE 
ACROSS THE AREA ON TUESDAY.  HOWEVER...BEFORE IT PULLS THROUGH LATE 
IN THE DAY...WILL CONTINUE TO SEE SCATTERED CONVECTION ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ESPECIALLY DURING THE MORNING HOURS.  
BEHIND THE FRONT...SEASONALLY COOL AND DRY AIR WILL MOVE IN.  ONLY 
CONCERN WILL BE THE EXITING FRONT.  IT IS EXPECTED TO PUSH THROUGH 
THE MRX CWA AND STALL TO OUR SOUTH EARLY IN THE EXTENDED.  A SERIES 
OF WEAK DISTURBANCES WILL MOVE ALONG IT...TRACKING JUST TO OUR SOUTH 
AND EAST.  SCATTERED CONVECTION ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FEATURE MAY 
MOVE INTO THE AREA...ESPECIALLY NEAR THE TN/GA BORDER AND ALONG THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS.

ASSOCIATED RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION.

THE NAM SHOWS FAIRLY STRONG UPPER DIVERGENCE OVER THE AREA FOR 
MONDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING. AIRMASS AHEAD OF THE BOUNDARY WILL BECOME 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE. INCREASING LOW-LEVEL JET DUE TO THE PRESENCE OF 
THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND SOME MID-LEVEL DRY AIR WILL SET THE STAGE 
FOR POTENTIAL OF DAMAGING WINDS FOR LATE MONDAY. ALSO...ENOUGH HAIL 
CAPE AND FAVORABLE WBZ HEIGHTS FOR LARGE HAIL. WILL CONTINUE TO 
HIGHLIGHT THE POTENTIAL OF SEVERE WEATHER MONDAY AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING.

FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED...AN UPPER TROUGH WILL DOMINATE WITH 
PLEASANT AIRMASS FOR JULY OVER THE AREA. RETURN MOISTURE/INSTABILITY 
FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY TO INCLUDE A CHANCE OF MAINLY 
AFTERNOON/EVENING STORMS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             92  71  93  72 /  10  10  20  20

909 PM EDT FRI JUL 11 2014

.DISCUSSION...
AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO BUILD INTO THE
REGION FROM THE WEST THIS EVENING...PROMOTING MOSTLY CLEAR AND DRY
CONDITIONS IN ALL BUT FAR SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA WHERE A ROGUE
SHOWER PERSISTS. THIS ACTIVITY WILL DISSIPATE WITH THE SETTING
SUN...RESULTING IN A QUIET NIGHT WEATHER-WISE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS AND TENNESSEE VALLEY. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR GOOD
RADIATIONAL COOLING AS TEMPERATURES WILL QUICKLY DROP OFF THIS
EVENING AND BOTTOM OFF IN THE LOW TO MID 60S IN MANY SPOTS. THE
CLEAR AND CALM CONDITIONS WILL ALSO PROMOTE THE DEVELOPMENT OF
PATCHY FOG ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA LATE TONIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY
MORNING...ESPECIALLY NEAR AREA LAKES AND RIVERS.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT FRI JUL 11 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS
SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT STRETCHING GENERALLY ALONG THE EASTERN
FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH A DRIER AIR MASS OVER
THE FORECAST AREA (COMPARED TO YESTERDAY). AREA RADARS REVEAL SOME
ISOLATED CONVECTION DEVELOPING OVER WESTERN NC AND NORTHEAST GA THIS
AFTERNOON...AND THINK THIS CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY SHOULD STAY CONFINED
TO THE NC SIDE OF THE MOUNTAINS THIS EVENING. ISOLATED DIURNAL
CONVECTION IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP AGAIN OVER THE MOUNTAINS AND
SOUTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU ON SATURDAY...AS A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE
AIR MASS DEVELOPS DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. INSTABILITY
IS PROGGED TO INCREASE SOME MORE ON SUNDAY...AS MOISTURE SLOWLY
INCREASES OVER THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL
A MID-LEVEL STABLE LAYER BETWEEN 700 AND 500 MB...WHICH SHOULD HELP
TO LIMIT THE COVERAGE OF CONVECTION. THUS...FOR NOW WILL ONLY MENTION
ISOLATED CONVECTION ON SUNDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE
NUMBERS REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH MINS FOR TONIGHT (WHERE A
COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO SEEMS BEST)...BUT BOTH ARE THEN IN GOOD
AGREEMENT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING COLD 
FRONT...WILL SEE A LINE OF CONVECTION DEVELOP AND MOVE THROUGH THE 
AREA LATE ON MONDAY INTO MONDAY NIGHT...AND EVEN CONTINUE INTO TUESDAY
FOR HIGH CHANCE/LIKELY POPS. THE AIR MASS WILL BE MOIST...AND WEAK TO
MODERATELY UNSTABLE. THIS COMBINED WITH A 850MB JET WILL ALLOW A
LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP AND MOVE THROUGH THE AREA. SOME OF
THESE STORMS MAY BECOME STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS. A FEW SHOWERS MAY
LINGER OVER THE EASTERN AREAS INTO TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...BUT
OVERALL...WILL SEE A DRIER AND COOLER AIR MASS MOVE IN FOR THE REST
OF THE EXTENDED WITH ONLY ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE OVER
HIGHER TERRAIN THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AFTERNOON. 
&&

MOISTURE/INSTABILITY. ONLY FORCING FOR CONVECTION WITH BE
OROGRAPHIC..SO WILL HAVE POPS MAINLY OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY...AN UNUSUALLY STRONG UPPER LOW WILL DROP 
ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES REGION. STRONG UPPER TROUGHING WILL BE OVER 
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WITH A COLD FRONT PASSAGE 
FOR LATE MONDAY NIGHT/TUESDAY. INCREASING INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THE 
BOUNDARY WILL INCREASE THE COVERAGE OF STORMS FOR MONDAY/MONDAY 
NIGHT AND TUESDAY. DUE TO THE STRENGTH OF THE FRONT FOR JULY AND 
DECENT INSTABILITY...I AM CONCERNED FOR STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS FOR 
MONDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING. MAIN CONCERN WILL BE DAMAGING WINDS.

WILL CALL FOR HIGH CHANCE/LIKELY POPS FOR MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH 
TUESDAY. AS TIMING OF FROPA AND POTENTIAL OF PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH 
BECOMES MORE CLEAR...CATEGORICAL POPS WILL LIKELY BE NEEDED.

AN UNSEASONABLY COOL AIRMASS SPILLS INTO THE AREA FOR WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY WITH MAINLY DRY CONDITIONS. GENERALLY WENT A DEGREE OR TWO 
COOLER THAN GFS MEX HIGHS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
301 AM EDT THU JUL 10 2014

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
A WEAK COLD FRONT CONTINUES TO SLOWLY EASE ITS WAY INTO THE REGION
THIS MORNING...AND HAS ALLOWED FOR A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS ALONG
THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. THIS ACTIVITY WILL
LINGER THROUGH DAYBREAK AND THEN BRIEFLY DISSIPATE AS THE FRONT
MIXES OUT FURTHER TO THE SOUTH DURING THE DAY. HOWEVER...WITH THIS
REMNANT BOUNDARY IN PLACE SOME ADDITIONAL SCATTERED CONVECTION IS
EXPECTED LATE THIS MORNING THROUGH THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THE
MOST FAVORED AREAS FOR THIS ACTIVITY WILL BE ALONG TN/NC MOUNTAINS
AND SOUTHWEST VA THANKS TO OROGRAPHIC LIFT AND DAYTIME
HEATING...BUT SOME AT LEAST A SLIGHT CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION WILL
BE POSSIBLE AREAWIDE ONCE AGAIN. AS DRIER AIR FILTERS INTO THE
REGION...CLOUDS AND STORM COVERAGE WILL BE LESS WHICH WILL ALLOW
FOR MORE HEATING AND HIGHS RETURNING TO THE MID TO UPPER 80S ONCE
MORE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. CLEARING WILL BEGIN
OVERNIGHT...WHICH WILL ALLOW LOWS TO DROP INTO THE LOWER 60S IN
MANY AREAS...ALONG WITH PATCHY FOG DEVELOPMENT NEAR BODIES OF
WATER.

.LONG TERM /FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
UPPER HEIGHTS RISING EARLY IN THE LONG TERM PERIOD...SO KEEPING
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY DRY FOR MOST AREAS. SOME DIURNAL CONVECTION
LOOKS POSSIBLE BY SUNDAY...AS THE UPPER RIDGE AXIS SHIFTS WESTWARD
WITH THE UPPER LOW/TROUGH DEVELOPING OVER THE GREAT LAKES INTO
EASTERN CANADA. HOWEVER...POPS IN THE 20 TO 30 PERCENT RANGE SHOULD
BE SUFFICIENT.

NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT NOTED BY MONDAY WITH A COLD FRONT ALSO 
APPROACHING. LONG RANGE MODELS DIFFER SLIGHTLY ON TIMING THESE 
FEATURES...WHICH COULD LEAD TO HIGHEST RAIN CHANCES ON EITHER MONDAY 
OR TUESDAY. MOS TRENDING A BIT HIGHER ON TUESDAY POPS...SO NUDGED 
RAIN CHANCES UP BY AROUND 10 PERCENT. A LITTLE DRIER AND COOLER FOR 
WEDNESDAY. 

FOR TEMPS...GFSX AND ECMX MOS TEMPS SIMILAR THROUGH THE LONG TE

OVERNIGHT...SO IT IS NOT EXPECTED TO SAG TOO MUCH FURTHER SOUTH BY
SUNRISE. CONVECTION HAS DIMINISHED IN COVERAGE...BUT WITH THE
BOUNDARY IN THE VICINITY WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING OVERNIGHT.
NO REAL BIG CHANGES FOR TONIGHT...BUT WILL MAKE SOME ADJUSTMENTS TO
SKY...POPS...HOURLY TEMPS...AND DEW POINTS. UPDATE OUT SOON. 


&&

005 
FXUS64 KMRX 091900
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT WED JUL 9 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS
SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER CENTRAL KY...STRETCHING GENERALLY ALONG
A LINE FROM CLARKSVILLE TN TO LEXINGTON KY TO HUNTINGTON WV. A WARM
AND HUMID AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA WILL HELP TO CREATE A
MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS AHEAD OF THIS COLD FRONT...AS IT SLOWLY
DRIFTS THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA LATER TONIGHT INTO THURSDAY AND
LIKELY STALLS ALONG THE MOUNTAINS BY THURSDAY NIGHT. AS A RESULT...
SCATTERED CONVECTION IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA
TONIGHT AND THURSDAY...WITH CONVECTION BECOMING MORE ISOLATED AND
CONFINED TO THE MOUNTAINS BY THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT.
AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL SOME SMALL
DISCREPANCIES THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...AND WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS
A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...THE EASTERN U.S. UPPER
TROUGH WILL HAVE LIFTED OUT THROUGH THE CANADIAN MARITIMES BY THE
WEEKEND WITH SLIGHTLY DRIER AIR AND SUBSIDENCE WITH HIGHER PRESSURE
IN PLACE. GRADUALLY SUNDAY INTO MONDAY THE HIGH RETROGRADES BACK
THROUGH THE WESTERN STATES WHILE ANOTHER LONG WAVE TROUGH PREPARES
TO TAKE UP RESIDENCE OVER THE MUCH OF THE EASTERN U.S. MOISTURE AND
INSTABILITY WILL INCREMENTALLY INCREASE SUNDAY FOR SOME DIURNAL
CONVECTION SO KEPT POPS IN A LOW CHANCE RANGE WHILE ADJUSTING
PROBABILITIES A LITTLE HIGHER MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT AS MODELS BRING
A SHORT WAVE ACROSS THE REGION ENHANCING THE POSSIBILITY OF CONVECTION.
TAPERED POPS BACK ONLY SLIGHTLY ON TUESDAY AS A COOL FRONT WILL BE
MAKING ITS WAY SOUTH TOWARD THE REGION AND THIS BOUNDARY COULD
SPARK SOME SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. TRIED TO KEEP JUST A SLIGHT
CHANCE FOR CONVECTION GOING ON WEDNESDAY AS MODELS HINT AT THE
POSSIBILITY OF THE COOL FRONT BEING SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA.
STAYED UNDER MAX TEMP GUIDANCE BY A FEW DEGREES WHILE HOLDING
RELATIVELY CLOSE TO SUGGESTED MINS. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
