AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 AM EDT WED JUL 9 2014

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE OHIO RIVER
VALLEY...WITH A WARM AND HUMID AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS
COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT SOUTHWARD INTO THE FORECAST AREA
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WITH A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS
DEVELOPING AHEAD OF IT. AS A RESULT...SCATTERED CONVECTION IS EXPECTED
TO DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH A FEW STORMS POSSIBLY
BECOMING SEVERE WITH DAMAGING WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TODAY APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT
HAVE UPDATED THIS MORNING TO TWEAK POPS AND TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING
TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

169 
FXUS64 KMRX 090646 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
246 AM EDT WED JUL 9 2014

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
A COLD FRONT LOCATED OVER CENTRAL KENTUCKY WILL CONTINUE TO
GRADUALLY DROP SOUTH TOWARD THE REGION EARLY THIS MORNING...AND
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THROUGHOUT THE DAY TODAY. AHEAD OF THIS
BOUNDARY...SCATTERED SHOWERS CONTINUE TO PERSIST ACROSS SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA...NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND THE MOUNTAINS. THIS ACTIVITY
WILL LINGER THROUGH DAYBREAK...BEFORE THE FRONT DIPS SOUTH INTO THE
AREA...SETTING THE STAGE FOR SOME ADDITIONAL SHOWERS AND STORMS
LATER TODAY. THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD BE SCATTERED IN NATURE INITIALLY AND
MAY ORGANIZE INTO SOMETHING MORE WIDESPREAD ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND
SOUTHERN VALLEY LATER ON THIS AFTERNOON. AS A RESULT...HAVE
INCREASED POPS TO LIKELY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY AFTER 18Z THIS
AFTERNOON. THERE WILL BE SOME MODEST INSTABILITY IN PLACE WHICH
COULD ALLOW FOR SOME STORMS TO BECOME STRONG TO SEVERE...THOUGH
THINK THE THREAT WILL BE LOWER THAN YESTERDAY ATTM. POPS WILL BEGIN
TO WANE AFTER 00Z...AND WILL BE MUCH MORE ISOLATED IN NATURE. GIVEN
THE CLOUD COVER TODAY...TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOLER AND PEAK IN THE
LOW TO MID 80S IN THE VALLEYS. THE COOLER AIR BEHIND THE FRONT WILL
DROP LOWS INTO THE LOW TO MID 60S LATER TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY/...
EXTENDED PERIODS START OUT 
DRIER AS WEAK COLD FRONT SAGS SOUTH OF THE REGION AND HEIGHTS RISE 
INTO SATURDAY. HOWEVER...CAN'T TAKE OUT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR 
THURSDAY DUE TO UPPER TROUGH AXIS STILL TO MOVE ACROSS. ALSO...KEPT 
IN SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SATURDAY AFTERNOON WITH TEMPS REACHING 
WELL INTO THE 80S TO LOWER 90S. SLIGHTLY AN OUTLIER FROM ADJACENT 
NWS GRIDS...BUT PREFER TO KEEP SATURDAY NIGHT DRY FOR NOW. 

WEATHER PATTERN SHIFTS BACK TO A POTENTIALLY WET ONE BY SUNDAY 
THROUGH TUESDAY...AS THE UPPER RIDGE SHIFTS WESTWARD AND A DEEP 
TROUGH DEVELOPS OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. CHANCE POPS AS 
IN PREVIOUS GRIDS AND LATEST GFSX MOS LOOK GOOD...WITH SOME SIGNS 
THAT LIKELY OR HIGHER POPS MAY BE NEEDED ON MONDAY. NUDGED MONDAY 
POPS UP TO HIGH CHANCE VALUES. 

FOR TEMPS...MORE CLOSELY FOLLOWED THE GFSX MOS MINS...BUT PREFERRED 
TO STAY ABOUT 1 TO 3 DEGREES BELOW GFSX MOS MAXES. THIS IS 
CONSISTENT WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS AND MORE IN LINE WITH THE LATEST ECMX 
MOS.

$$

975 
FXUS64 KMRX 081855
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EDT TUE JUL 8 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...FRONTAL SYSTEM STILL SAGGING 
SOUTHWARD TOWARD THE AREA...AND DEEPER MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY 
MOVING IN AS WELL.  LOOKING LIKE A FAIRLY WET NEXT COUPLE OF PERIODS 
AS THE AXIS OF THIS SYSTEM MAKE ITS WAY INTO THE AREA. ALTHOUGH 
MENTIONED "WET" ABOVE...FLOODING THREAT NOT LOOKING THAT GREAT AS 
PROGRESSIVE INITIAL PARTS OF SYSTEM WILL SWEEP THROUGH...THEN AS 
FRONT SAGS INTO AREA RICHER MOISTURE WILL BE SOUTH OR EAST OF THE 
AREA.  SO A COUPLE OF CHANCES FOR PRECIP...THIS AFTERNOON AND THIS 
EVENING WITH ADVANCING STRONG STORMS THAT MARCH ACROSS TO THE 
EAST...THEN ALSO ANOTHER CHANCE TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AS THE MAIN 
AXIS OF THE SYSTEM MOVE THROUGH THE AREA FROM THE NORTH/NORTHWEST. 

DEEP CONVECTION STRUGGLING FINALLY GETTING STARTED.  MLCAPE VALUES
GETTING PRETTY HIGH...SO STILL THINK SEVERE THREAT EXISTS. ALSO
WONDERING ABOUT HOW STRONG ANY STORMS THAT DEVELOP CLOSER TO THE
FRONT MIGHT BE IF THEY MAKE THEIR WAY CLOSER TONIGHT...THINKING THE
STORMS THIS AFTERNOON ARE OUR BEST CHANCE FOR SEVERE OVERALL.

FOR TEMPERATURES KEEPING PRETTY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE FOR MINS TONIGHT 
AND ON THE COOL SIDE OF MAXES FOR WEDNESDAY...CONSIDERING THE 
LIMITED SUNSHINE...ESPECIALLY SOUTH.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO 
BE IN FAIR AGREEMENT OVERALL WITH DECENT RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY. 
HOWEVER...GIVEN UNCERTAINTIES IN MODEL HANDLING OF POSSIBLE WEAK 
IMPULSES IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS AT BEST 
AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. THE FRONT SHOULD FINALLY EXIT THE 
AREA EARLY THURSDAY...BUT A WEAK IMPULSE STILL COULD HELP TO TRIGGER 
SOME ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION INTO THURSDAY AFTERNOON.  
DRIER AIR SHOULD KEEP THINGS PRECIP FREE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
FRIDAY NIGHT...THEN MOISTURE WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE AGAIN DURING THE 
WEEKEND.  WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS SATURDAY AND CHANCE POPS 
SUNDAY.  ANOTHER FRONTAL SYSTEM IS FORECAST TO AFFECT THE AREA EARLY 
IN THE WEEK...SO CHANCE POPS BOTH MONDAY AND TUESDAY.

&&

.DISCUSSION...
WEAK CONVECTION OVER MIDDLE TN CONTINUING TO FURTHER WEAKEN.
LOOKING MORE AND MORE LIKE THIS TREND WILL CONTINUE FOR THIS LINE
AND THEN NEW CONVECTION EXPECTED TO DEVELOP ON OR NEAR THE PLATEAU

MASS WILL BE IN PLACE AS THE STORMS MOVE INTO THE AREA. BEST WIND
PROFILE WILL BE NORTH OF THE AREA...SO STORMS WILL LIKELY BE MOSTLY
ONLY MODERATELY ORGANIZED MULTICELL SEVERE. STILL GOOD CHANCE OF
DAMAGING OUTFLOW WINDS FROM STRONGER CELLS...ALONG WITH SEVERE
HAIL...ROUGHLY UP TO 1 OR 1.5 INCH. FLOODING THREAT NOW SEEMS LESS
THAN EARLIER...AS SYSTEM IS LOOKING MORE PROGRESSIVE. TORNADO
THREAT SEEMS VERY LOW...WOULD LIKELY NEED A BOUNDARY INTERSECTION
TO ENHANCE ROTATION.

MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY ON THE RISE...WHICH SHOULD YIELD POSTIVE
CAPES OF AT LEAST 1500 TO 2000 J/KG. WIND SHEAR IS MINIMAL IN
GENERAL...BUT POSSIBLY GREATER THAN 25 KNOTS OVER NRN PARTS OF E TN
AS WELL AS SW VA. SLIGHT RISK OF SEVERE STORMS OVER THE BULK OF
THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WITH DAMAGING WINDS
AND LARGE HAIL THE MAIN THREATS.

SHORT TERM MODELS (INCLUDING SREF) SHOW GOOD CONTINUITY AND SUPPORT
LIKELY POPS OR BETTER LATE TODAY FOR NRN AREAS...WITH THIS SWATH OF
HIGH POPS SPREADING SE THIS EVENING. DEFINITELY A FEW DEGREES
COOLER THIS AFTERNOON FOR SW VA AND NE TN...WITH A MOS BLEND
CLOSELY FOLLOWED.


.LONG TERM.../WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY/...
A WEAK COLD FRONT IN ASSOCIATION WITH A BROAD UPPER-TROUGH OVER THE 
GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY WILL CONTINUE TO SAG INTO THE REGION ON 
WEDNESDAY...BRINGING ANOTHER SOLID CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND STORMS 
AREAWIDE. AS A RESULT...HAVE INCREASED POPS TO LIKELY DURING THIS 
PERIOD GIVEN THIS BOUNDARY AND THE ABUNDANT MOISTURE IN PLACE... 
ALONG WITH GOOD MODEL CONFIDENCE. THIS ACTIVITY WILL GRADUALLY SAG 
SOUTH OF THE REGION AND DISSIPATE BY WEDNESDAY EVENING/NIGHT WITH 
THE FRONT BEFORE ANOTHER ROUND OF SCATTERED ACTIVITY MAY BE POSSIBLE 
ON THURSDAY WITH ANOTHER WEAK IMPULSE MOVING THROUGH THE REGION. IN 
ADDITION TO THE PRECIPITATION CHANCES...CLOUD COVER WILL ALSO LIMIT 
HEATING AND RESULT IN SOME SLIGHTLY COOLER HIGHS WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY. 

A SLIGHT WARMING AND CLEARING TREND WILL BE IN STORE FOR FRIDAY AND 
THE WEEKEND AS DRY AIR INITIALLY FILTERS IN ALOFT AND AN UPPER RIDGE 
BUILDS IN FROM THE WEST. THIS WILL ALLOW HIGHS TO ONCE AGAIN REACH 
THE UPPER 80S AND LOWER 90S...WITH A MAINLY QUIET POP FORECAST 
THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. MOISTURE WILL GRADUALLY WORK ITS WAY BACK 
INTO THE REGION SUNDAY AND ESPECIALLY INTO MONDAY...ALLOWING FOR THE 
POTENTIAL FOR ADDITIONAL SCATTERED STORMS TO DEVELOP...AS WELL AS 
SOME OTHER ACTIVITY WHICH MAY MOVE IN FROM THE OHIO VALLEY THANKS TO 
NORTHWEST STEERING FLOW ALOFT.


&&

333 
FXUS64 KMRX 071907
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
307 PM EDT MON JUL 7 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...TONIGHT SHOULD BE RELATIVELY 
CALM. THERE MIGHT BE A STRAY SHOWER OR STORM LINGER ACROSS SWNC BUT 
THEY SHOULD DISSIPATE AFTER SUNSET. LOOK FOR CLOUDS TO SLOWLY BE ON 
THE INCREASE OVERNIGHT INTO TOMORROW MORNING FROM N TO S OUT AHEAD
OF OUR NEXT SYSTEM. TEMPS WILL BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER TONIGHT AREA
WIDE.

THE MAIN FOCUS OF THE SHORT TERM WILL BE ON TOMORROW. HIGH
PRESSURE HAS FINALLY MOVED OFF TO OUR EAST AS A BROAD UPPER LEVEL
TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT APPROACHES FROM THE NW. CURRENT
MODELS ARE A LITTLE SLOWER WITH THE ARRIVAL OF THE FRONT SO WILL
TRIM BACK POPS FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE NIGHT TO ONLY INCLUDE OUR
NORTHERN AREAS INSTEAD OF THE WHOLE CENTRAL VALLEY. MIDLEVEL FLOW
REVEALS A SUBTLE SHORTWAVE OUT AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT THAT WILL BE
THE REASON FOR THE ONSET OF SLIGHT CHANCE POPS LATE TONIGHT INTO
EARLY TUESDAY MORNING.

MODELS ARE INDICATING THAT THERE COULD BE A DECAYING MCS ACROSS THE 
OHIO RIVER VALLEY DOWN INTO CENTRAL KY BY TOMORROW MORNING. HOW FAR 
SOUTH THIS ACTIVITY MOVES COULD EFFECT OUR STORMS TOMORROW 
AFTERNOON. MODELS SHOW THAT THIS DECAYING MCS COULD YIELD SOME 
SHOWERS AND A FEW STORMS TOMORROW MORNING AND EARLY AFTERNOON WITH 
THE MAIN ACTIVITY TO FOLLOW LATER. MODELS THEN SHOW A REGENERATION 
OF CONVECTION THAT SHOULD ARRIVE TUESDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING FROM OUT 
OF THE NW JUST AHEAD OF THE FRONT. THIS NEW DEVELOPMENT LOOKS TO 
TAKE PLACE SOMEWHERE ACROSS CENTRAL KY AND WILL MOVE SOUTH INTO OUR 
AREA FROM THERE. THEREFORE...POP CHANCES WILL INCREASE STARTING 
TUESDAY MORNING AND CONTINUE TO DO SO THROUGH THE DAY AS WE AWAIT 
THE NEW AFTERNOON DEVELOPMENT. DEPENDING ON YOUR MODEL OF 
CHOICE...CAPE FIELDS SHOULD BE IN THE 1500 TO 2000 J/KG RANGE BY 
TOMORROW AFTERNOON.

HAVING SAID ALL THAT...THE BEST DYNAMICS APPEAR TO BE JUST TO OUR 
NORTH AS FAR AS MID/UPPER LEVEL FLOW AS WELL AS SHEAR AND HELICITY 
FIELDS...SO THE BEST CHANCE OF SEVERE STORMS APPEARS TO BE JUST TO 
OUR NORTH. HOWEVER...BEING RIGHT ON THE EXTREME SOUTHERN FRINGE OF 
THESE DYNAMICS WILL STILL BEAR KEEPING AN EYE ON AS SOME STRONG TO 
SEVERE STORMS COULD STILL OCCUR ACROSS PARTS OF OUR AREA. BASED ON
THE AFOREMENTIONED SETUP....THE NORTHERN PLATEAU...NORTHERN
VALLEY...AND NETN AND SWVA LOOK TO HAVE BETTER CHANCES OF SEEING
STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS THAN THE REST OF OUR CWA. AS OF NOW...THE
MAIN THREATS WITH TOMORROWS STORMS APPEAR TO BE DAMAGING STRAIGHT
LINE WINDS AND HAIL. SPC HAS AREAS FROM KNOXVILLE NORTHWARD
INCLUDED IN THEIR SLIGHT RISK AREA FOR TOMORROW.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT EARLY ON...WITH MORE DISAGREEMENT TOWARD THE END OF THE 
PERIOD.  FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS ABOUT AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. 
THE COLD FRONT APPROACHING TUESDAY NIGHT IS FORECAST TO PUSH THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY/WED NIGHT. EXPECT SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS AHEAD OF THIS FRONT. DRIER AIR EXPECTED TO PUSH IN 
BEHIND THE FRONT...AND WILL GO WITH A PRECIP FREE FORECAST FOR 
THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. ENOUGH MOISTURE/INSTABILITY MAY 
RETURN BY SATURDAY TO WARRANT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS...AT LEAST IN THE 
MOUNTAINS...AND ALL ZONES BY SUNDAY.  ECMWF HAS ANOTHER FRONT 
SAGGING TOWARD THE AREA BY MONDAY...ALTHOUGH GFS KEEPING IT FURTHER 
NORTH.  GIVEN UNCERTAINTY THAT FAR OUT WILL LEAN TOWARD A COMPROMISE 
AND JUST GO WITH CHANCE POPS MONDAY.


&&

SIMILAR TO THE WEEKEND WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND SEASONAL 
TEMPERATURES. AIR MASS BECOMES SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE THIS AFTERNOON...

TODAY...SO I ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THOSE AREAS. DRY
ELSEWHERE WITH TEMPS WARMING BY ABOUT 1 TO 2 DEGREES ABOVE SUNDAY
MAXES.

FOR TONIGHT...KEPT FORECAST DRY FOR THE EVENING HOURS WITH SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS LATE FOR ALL BUT EXTREME SE TN AND SW NC. MOS MINS CLOSE 
TO SEASONAL VALUES AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED. 

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...LOW PRESSURE OVER GREAT
LAKES EARLY TUESDAY WITH A COLD FRONT EXTENDING TO THE SOUTHWEST
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. SHOWERS AND STORMS OUT AHEAD OF THIS
ACTIVITY WILL LIKELY BE MOVING TOWARDS THE OHIO VALLEY. HIGH
PRESSURE WILL BE CENTERED SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. AS HEATING
WILL BE STRONG AND MOISTURE INCREASES NEW STORMS WILL FORM IN THE
AFTERNOON AND EVENING TO THE NORTH AND WEST IN KY AND CENTRAL TN.
AN AREA OR LINE OF STORMS SHOULD MAKE IT INTO NORTHERN SECTIONS BY
EVENING AND MOVE INTO THE REST OF THE REGION OVERNIGHT TUESDAY INTO
WEDNESDAY. A FEW SEVERE STORMS ARE POSSIBLE WITH DAMAGING WINDS THE
MAIN THREAT. MODELS BRING THE COLD FRONT INTO THE TN VALLEY
WEDNESDAY AND THEN TO JUST SOUTH OF TN THURSDAY. SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE NUMEROUS WEDNESDAY AND THEN DECREASE FROM THE
NORTH WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY AS FRONT MOVES JUST SOUTH OF TN.
HIGHER PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY
THURSDAY INTO SUNDAY. WILL STILL HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
STORMS MAINLY HIGHER ELEVATIONS LATE AFTERNOON AND EVENINGS DUE TO
HEATING. ECMWF AND GFS BRING ANOTHER WEAK SYSTEM INTO THE REGION
SUNDAY SO RAIN CHANCES MAY EVENTUALLY BE HIGHER SUNDAY. TUESDAY
TEMPERATURES UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S THAN COOLER WEDNESDAY WITH GOOD
CHANCE OF RAIN. THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY TEMPERATURES NEAR NORMAL.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
309 PM EDT SUN JUL 6 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...THIS WILL BE OUR LAST QUIET 
SHORT TERM PERIOD AS A CHANGE IN THE WEATHER IS COMING DUE TO OUR 
SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE SLOWLY MOVING OFF TO THE EAST 
OVERNIGHT AND INTO MONDAY. SOUNDINGS SHOW A LITTLE BIT OF MOISTURE 
CONTINUING TO HANG AROUND THE 850MB LAYER. THIS SHOULD KEEP SOME 
CLOUDS AROUND AGAIN TONIGHT...WHICH LEADS ME TO THINK OVERNIGHT 
TEMPS SHOULD BE FAIRLY CLOSE TO LAST NIGHT AS A VERY SIMILAR SETUP 
TOOK PLACE.

TOMORROW SHOULD BE A PLEASANT DAY OVERALL. TEMPS WILL CONTINUE TO 
SLIGHTLY WARM WITH HIGHS JUST AT OR A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE NORMAL. 
HIGHS ARE EXPECTED TO BE IN THE UPPER 80S TO NEAR 90...ALONG WITH 
INCREASING DEWPOINTS THROUGH THE DAY. THE FIRST HALF OF MONDAY 
SHOULD REMAIN MOSTLY SUNNY...BEFORE AN INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER 
ARRIVES LATER IN THE DAY AS SOUNDING PROFILES BEGIN SLOWLY 
SATURATING AS THE DAY GOES ON. THE MOISTURE INCREASE IS DUE TO A 
BROAD UPPER TROUGH AND COLD FRONT APPROACHING FROM THE NORTHWEST. 
THIS FEATURE SHOULD STAY JUST OFF TO OUR NW ON MONDAY AND WILL 
THEREFORE KEEP MONDAY DRY. WILL STAY CLOSER TO MEX GUIDANCE FOR 
HIGH TEMPS TOMORROW.
 

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...NOT MUCH CHANGE FROM THE 
PREVIOUS THINKING...BUT THERE IS MORE CONFIDENCE IN THE POSSIBILITY 
OF NICE WEATHER FOR FRIDAY-SUNDAY. AS YOU RECALL...A WEAK FRONT WILL 
MOVE INTO THE AREA FOR THE MIDWEEK PERIOD...KEEPING OUR AREA UNDER 
SCATTERED CONVECTION TUES-THURS...BUT PEAKING TUESDAY NIGHT-WED. MAX 
TEMPS DURING THE EXTENDED SHOULD BE NEAR OR SLGTLY ABOVE NORMAL... 
WITH WET WEDNESDAY LIKELY BEING THE DAY WITH THE LEAST HEAT.

CHANGE AS COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE OHIO VALLEY MONDAY. SURFACE
HIGH MOVES EAST INTO THE GULF AND WARMER MOIST AIR MASS MORE
TYPICAL OF SUMMER REPLACES IT. MAV TEMPERATURES MUCH WARMER THAN
MET MONDAY. WILL FORECAST HIGHS UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S. DEW POINTS
RISE INTO THE LOWER TO MID 60S WITH THE GREATEST INCREASE IN
MOISTURE NORTHEAST. HAVE REMOVED RAIN CHANCES MONDAY NIGHT AS FRONT
WILL ONLY SLOWLY APPROACH FORECAST AREA AND NOT AFFECT REGION
UNTIL TUESDAY AT THE EARLIEST.

LOW PRESSURE AREA TO MOVE INTO GREAT LAKES TUESDAY AND THEN INTO
NE CANADA WEDNESDAY. THIS SYSTEM WILL DRAG A COLD FRONT INTO WEST
TN AND EASTERN KY BY WEDNESDAY. LOW RAIN CHANCES TUESDAY BUT BECOME
LIKELY MOST AREAS WEDNESDAY. AN UPPER TROUGH DIGS SOUTH ACROSS THE
EASTERN STATES THURSDAY WHICH MAY BE ENOUGH TO PUSH THE FRONT
THROUGH BY THURSDAY NIGHT WITH A DRY PERIOD THURSDAY NIGHT INTO
FRIDAY NIGHT. WILL HAVE ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FRIDAY. SATURDAY
UNCERTAIN IF FRONT MOVES BACK NORTH OR ANOTHER FRONT MAY MOVE SOUTH
AS UPPER TROUGH STAYS OVER EASTERN STATES. KEPT 20 PERCENT CHANCE
OF SHOWERS AND STORMS BECAUSE OF THIS UNCERTAINTY. TEMPERATURES
WILL STAY COOLER WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY WITH GOOD CHANCE OF
PRECIPITATION WEDNESDAY AND THEN WITH DRIER AND COOLER AIR MASS
BEHIND FRONT AND WITH UPPER TROUGH AT END OF FORECAST PERIOD.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             88  66  91  69 /   0   0  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  87  65  89  68 /   0   0  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       88  65  89  68 /   0   0  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              86  58  88  63 /   0   0  10  10

MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES OVERALL.

ANOTHER BEAUTIFUL DAY TOMORROW WITH TEMPS CLIMBING A LITTLE
HIGHER...CLOSER TO NORMAL WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...NOT MUCH CHANGE FROM 
THE PREVIOUS THINKING. GENERALLY SEASONAL TEMPERATURES DURING THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...WITH SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED 
FROM TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. A FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BE A FOCAL 
POINT FOR PRECIP DEVELOPMENT TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...ALTHOUGH THERE 
IS STILL THE POTENTIAL THAT A REINFORCING PUSH OF DRIER AIR MAY 
SHOVE THE PRECIP SOUTHWARD TOWARD THE GA STATE LINE BY THE END OF 
THE WEEK. SO AS LUCK HAS IT...NEXT WEEKEND MAY TURN OUT TO BE FAIRLY 
DRY...WILL CARRY POPS OF ONLY 20 PCT FOR NOW.

OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY.

NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT AND PERSISTENT SURFACE RIDGE ACROSS THE EASTERN 
STATES WILL PROVIDE A CONTINUATION OF PLEASANT WEATHER BEYOND THE 
SHORT TERM. MAX AND MIN TEMPS TWEAKED SLIGHTLY TO GIVE MORE OF A 
RANGE IN A FEW SPOTS. CLOSELY FOLLOWED GFS MOS TEMPS.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WITH DRIER AIR
MASS CONTINUES ONE MORE DAY. TEMPERATURES WARM A FEW MORE DEGREES
SUNDAY. COLD FRONT MOVES INTO OHIO VALLEY SUNDAY BUT DOES NOT
PROGRESS MUCH TO THE SOUTH. HIGH PRESSURE STAYS OVER THE FORECAST
AREA SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. DRY CONDITIONS CONTINUE THROUGH
MONDAY. MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY HIGH PRESSURE FINALLY BREAKS
DOWN. GFS SHOWS INCREASED MOISTURE MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA
TUESDAY WITH LEAD SHORT WAVE. CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND STORMS TUESDAY
INTO TUESDAY EVENING. ECMWF MODEL SHOWS SHORTWAVE JUST BUSHING NE
SECTIONS TUESDAY WITH MAIN FRONT APPROACHING WEDNESDAY. MODELS
WEAKEN COLD FRONT AS IT MOVES INTO TN VALLEY WEDNESDAY. LOOKS LIKE
THE BEST RAIN CHANCES WILL BE WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY AS THE
FRONT BECOMES NEARLY STATIONARY OVER THE TN VALLEY. FRIDAY FRONT
STILL NEAR SOUTHERN BORDER WITH CONTINUED RAIN CHANCES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

1145 PM EDT FRI JUL 4 2014

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION: 
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...STILL A FEW 
CLOUDS IN THE N-NW LOW LEVEL FLOW MAINLY ACROSS SW VA AND EXTREME NE 
TN...WITH JUST A FEW HIGH CLOUDS ELSEWHERE. PLEASANT TEMPS NOTED AT 
07Z...ALTHO NORTHERLY WINDS WERE KEEPING MIN TEMPS UP ABOUT 1 TO 3 
DEGREES ABOVE HOURLY GRIDS. 

VERY LITTLE CHANGES NEEDED OR MADE TO THE FORECAST GRIDS FOR TODAY 
AND TONIGHT...AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS ACROSS THE EASTERN STATES. 
KEPT SKIES MOSTLY CLEAR FOR TONIGHT SINCE LOW LEVEL FLOW DOES NOT 
TURN SE TO S UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING. GFS MOS TEMPS LOOKED GOOD AND 
WERE CLOSELY FOLLOWED.

HARD TO IMAGINE ANY BETTER WEATHER FOR THE FOURTH OF JULY!

LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
REBOUNDING SATURDAY CLOSER TO NORMAL AS DRY AIR MASS AND MORE 
RIDGING BUILDS NE FROM THE SW STATES AND HURRICANE ARTHUR MOVES 
THROUGH THE NE STATES. HIGHS ABOUT 5 DEGREES WARMER THAN TODAY. 
SKIES WILL CONTINUE MOSTLY SUNNY THROUGH THE WEEKEND AS SURFACE HIGH 
SHIFTS SLOWLY EAST. LOWS EARLY SUNDAY AND MONDAY WARMING A FEW 
DEGREES EACH DAY BUT STILL BELOW NORMAL. PATTERN CHANGES BEGIN 
MONDAY INTO TUESDAY AS COLD FRONT SLIPS SOUTH INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. 
THIS INCREASES CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. ONLY SLIGHT 
CHANCE MONDAY NIGHT. BETTER CHANCE OF STORMS TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY. 
FRONT GETS HUNG UP OVER THE OHIO VALLEY JUST NORTH OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. ABUNDANT MOISTURE AND LIFT WITH THE FRONT CLOSE BY WILL BRING 
A GOOD CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS LAST 2 DAYS OF THE 
FORECAST. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL FOR THE PERIOD TUESDAY 
THROUGH THURSDAY.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 PM EDT FRI JUL 4 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH THE PERIOD. LOW LEVEL 
THICKNESS CONTINUE TO LOWER THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY. TONIGHT LOOKS TO 
BE THE COOLEST NIGHT WITH WIDESPREAD TEMPERATURES IN THE 50S. A 
SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE SE THROUGH OH VALLEY ON SATURDAY AND INTO THE 
CENTRAL APPALACHIANS ON SUNDAY. THIS FEATURE WILL INFLUENCE A VERY 
WEAK RETURN FLOW AND REBOUND IN THE H85 TEMPERATURES. A FEW CLOUDS 
MAY BE ASSOCIATED WITH THE SHORT WAVE AND AFFECT NORTHERN 
AREAS...OTHERWISE MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...GENERALLY SEASONAL TEMPERATURES 
DURING THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WITH SCATTERED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED FROM TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. CHIEF CULPRIT 
WILL BE FRONTAL BOUNDARY THAT WILL DROP IN FOR AN EXTENDED VISIT 
TUES TO THURS...BEFORE MAYBE GETTING A SECOND PUSH SOUTHWARD OUT OF 
THE AREA DURING FRIDAY.

&&

.AVIATION...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA THROUGH 
THE PERIOD. NORTHERLY WINDS WILL WEAKEN AND BECOME MORE NORTHEAST 
ON SATURDAY. DRY AIRMASS WILL MAINTAIN VFR CONDITIONS.

WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA FROM THE N. THE HIGH PRESSURE WILL USHER IN 
A DRY AIRMASS. SURFACE DEW POINTS WILL DROP TO THE LOWER 50S AND 
LAYER MOISTURE WILL ALSO LOWER TO PWATS VALUES OF 0.50. TEMPERATURES 
WILL COOL TO BELOW NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...THE AREA WILL BE UNDER 
THE INFLUENCE OF WEAK UPPER LEVEL TROUGHING FOR MOST OF THE PERIOD. 
THAT TROF WILL CARRY ARTHUR UP THE EASTERN SEABOARD...WHILE KEEPING 
US DRY WITH BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES INTO THE WEEKEND...GREAT 
WEATHER FOR JULY 4TH EVENING ACTIVITIES. 

MOISTURE WILL GRADUALLY RETURN TO THE AREA...AND A FRONTAL SYSTEM 
WILL PRODUCE AT LEAST SCATTERED CONVECTION FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND 
TUES. AFTERWARD...DISTURBANCES IN THE NW FLOW ALOFT COMING INTO THE 
BASE OF THE PERSISTENT TROF WILL LIKELY BRING ROUNDS OF 
CONVECTION...BUT MODELS WILL STRUGGLE WITH DETAILS THAT FAR OUT. 
WILL CARRY 20-30 PCT POPS FOR DAYS 6 AND 7. TEMPERATURES COULD BE 
FLOPPING BACK TO THE WARM SIDE FOR THE NEW WEEK AFTER THE PLEASANT 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             60  85  59  88 /   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  59  83  58  86 /   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       59  83  57  87 /   0   0   0   0

TEENS POSSIBLE.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT FOR MUCH OF THE PERIOD...ALTHOUGH MORE DIFFERENCES IN THE 
DETAILS SHOW UP LATE. FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS A BIT ABOVE NORMAL FOR 
THIS TIME OF YEAR.  SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE TO OUR NORTHWEST WILL 
SLIDE EAST AND SOUTHEAST FRIDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND.  COOLER AND 
DRIER AIR WILL BE IN CONTROL TO START THE PERIOD. SHOULD BE QUITE 
PLEASANT FOR INDEPENDENCE DAY...WITH A GRADUAL WARMING TREND 
STARTING SATURDAY.  WILL GO WITH A PRECIP FREE FORECAST THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND...THEN MOISTURE MAY INCREASE ENOUGH FOR SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
BY MONDAY. FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY A COLD FRONT WILL SAG SOUTH 
TOWARD THE REGION BUT SHOULD STALL OUT TO OUR NORTH.  WILL CARRY 
CHANCE POPS...HIGHEST NORTH CLOSER TO THE FRONT.  MAINLY MINOR 
ADJUSTMENTS TO GFS TEMPS FOR THE LONG TERM...WITH MOST SIGNIFICANT 
CHANGES BEING TO LOWER SOME MAX TEMPS A BIT LATER IN THE PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT WED JUL 2 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...SURFACE TROUGH MOVING EAST 
THROUGH MRX CWA AND WILL GET EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS THIS EVENING. 
THIS WILL RESULT IN A PREFRONTAL WESTERLY WIND SHIFT IN ADVANCE OF 
APPROACHING COLD FRONT. UPPER TROUGH...WITH RELATIVELY STRONG JET 
SEGMENT SWINGING THROUGH...WILL MOVE INTO MIDDLE TN TONIGHT PUSHING 
SURFACE COLD FRONT INTO E TN BY EARLY THU. AVAILABLE MOISTURE NOT 
VERY WELL PHASED WITH THESE FEATURES HINDERING ORGANIZED CONVECTIVE 
DEVELOPMENT. ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION POSSIBLE AND FAVORING 
NORTHERN AREAS THIS EVENING AND TONIGHT. DRIER AIRMASS BUILDS INTO 
THE AREA ON THURSDAY WITH DEW POINTS FALLING INTO THE 50S. 
TEMPERATURES NEAR NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY/... 

A WEAK FRONT AND SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL CLEAR THE REGION THURSDAY 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY...RESULTING IN A BEAUTIFUL SET-UP FOR INDEPENDENCE 
DAY WEEKEND. A COOLER AND DRIER POST FRONTAL AIR MASS WILL FILTER 
INTO THE REGION IN WAKE OF THIS BOUNDARY...AND RESULT IN CLEAR/SUNNY 
CONDITIONS WITH HIGHS IN THE 80 TO 85 DEGREE RANGE AND RH VALUES AT 
A VERY COMFORTABLE 30 TO 40 PERCENT IN THE AFTERNOON. THE WEATHER 
WILL BE PERFECT FOR OUTDOOR FAMILY ACTIVITIES AND FOR VIEWING 
FIREWORKS LATER ON IN THE EVENING...A VAST IMPROVEMENT FROM THE 
GLOOMY, COOL AND RAINY CONDITIONS WE EXPERIENCED LAST YEAR ON THE 
4TH! THESE CONDITIONS WILL PERSIST INTO SATURDAY...BEFORE A WEAK 
HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE INITIATES A RETURN FLOW FROM THE GULF... 
INCREASING MOISTURE ACROSS THE REGION...AND ALLOWING FOR A SLIGHT 
WARMING TREND INTO THE UPPER 80S/LOWER 90S. HOWEVER...WITH A WEAK 
TROUGH AND FRONT STALLED OUT ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY FOR SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY...THE MAINLY DRY CONDITIONS WILL PERSIST INTO EARLY NEXT 
WEEK. EVENTUALLY THOUGH...THIS UPPER-WAVE WILL KICK THE FRONT SOUTH 
INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY...INITIATING SOME DECENT SCATTERED 
CONVECTION CHANCES EACH DAY TO CLOSE OUT THE PERIOD...ALONG WITH 
SEASONABLE TEMPERATURES AROUND 85 TO 90 DEGREES.

THROUGH THE AREA.  THE FRONTAL DYNAMICS IS RATHER WEAK BUT THE AIR 
MASS HAS GOOD LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND WILL BE WEAK TO MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE AND COULD SEE A STRAY STRONG TO SEVERE STORM DEVELOP.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT FOR MUCH OF THE PERIOD...ALTHOUGH MORE SOLUTION DIVERGENCE 
SHOWS UP LATE.  FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS A BIT ABOVE NORMAL FOR THIS

CONTINUES TO DIG IN.  MAY STILL BE SOME LINGERING CONVECTION MAINLY 
NORTHEAST ZONES ESPECIALLY EARLY IN THE DAY.  COOLER AND DRIER AIR 
WILL MOVE IN BEHIND THE FRONT AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN.  SHOULD BE 
QUITE PLEASANT FOR INDEPENDENCE DAY...WITH A GRADUAL WARMING TREND 
STARTING SATURDAY.  WILL GO WITH A PRECIP FREE FORECAST THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND...THEN MOISTURE WILL INCREASE ENOUGH FOR SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
BY MONDAY. BY TUESDAY ECMWF IS FASTER BRINGING THE NEXT UPPER TROUGH 
IN WITH A BETTER CHANCE FOR PRECIP...BUT GIVEN UNCERTAINTY THAT FAR 
OUT AND MODEL DISAGREEMENT WILL JUST KEEP THE CURRENT FORECAST OF 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS TUESDAY.  WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM GFS MOS TEMPS.

ON WEDNESDAY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND REVEAL A FAIRLY AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH DEVELOPING 
OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY. 
THIS UPPER TROUGH WILL PUSH A WEAK COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST 
AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT...AND WILL ALSO PUSH TROPICAL STORM ARTHUR AWAY 
FROM THE FORECAST AREA. SCATTERED CONVECTION IS EXPECTED AHEAD OF 
THE COLD FRONT ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY MORNING...WITH COOLER 
AIR MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY BEHIND THE FRONT. HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL THEN SETTLE OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION FOR 
THE WEEKEND...WITH ISOLATED DIURNAL CONVECTION RETURNING BY EARLY 
NEXT WEEK AS SOUTHERLY WINDS DEVELOP ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE DEPARTING
HIGH (WHICH WILL INCREASE MOISTURE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA). AS FOR
TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH
THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE
MEANS. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1024 AM EDT TUE JUL 1 2014

.DISCUSSION...A VERY MILD START THIS MORNING WITH A WARM AND HUMID
AIR MASS. TEMPERATURES WERE IN THE MID 70S WITH DEW POINTS IN THE
LOWER 70S IN MOST LOCATIONS. ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL CLOUDINESS HAS
LINGERED OVER THE FORECAST AREA SINCE SUNRISE. CLOUDS ARE STARTING
TO DECREASE AS WARMER AND DRIER AIR MOVES IN FROM THE WEST AND
SOUTHWEST AT THE 850 TO 700 MB LEVEL. RAISED HIGHS A DEGREE IN
KNOXVILLE AND BRISTOL AND A FEW OTHER LOCATIONS. INCREASED SURFACE
WINDS A FEW MPH TO WITH MOST LOCATIONS SW 5 TO 10 MPH. ISOLATED
STORMS LOOK POSSIBLE LATE THIS AFTERNOON. LOCAL WRF SOUNDINGS SHOW
THE CAP BREAKING LATE THIS AFTERNOON...BUT NAM SHOWS IT HOLDING.
CAPE VALUES ARE 2500 TO 3000 J/KG AND WITH INTENSE HEATING DO NOT
WANT TO TAKE OUT PRECIPITATION THIS AFTERNOON. WEAK COLD FRONT WILL
MOVE INTO THE OHIO VALLEY BY THIS EVENING SO THE BEST CHANCE OF
STORMS LATE TODAY AND TONIGHT WILL BE ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA.

SLOWLY TRANSITION INTO A NORMAL SUMMERTIME PATTERN WITH DIURNAL 
CONVECTION DEVELOPING DURING THE AFTERNOON WITH BEST CHANCE OVER

FXUS64 KMRX 301910
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT MON JUN 30 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...SKIES ARE STILL FOR THE MOST PART
MOSTLY CLOUDY OVER THE FORECAST AREA AS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
MOSTLY SCATTERED DEVELOP AROUND THE BORDER OF A BROAD UPPER RIDGE
CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHWEST AND SOUTH CENTRAL STATES. SHORT WAVE
ENERGY KEEPS MOVING SOUTHEAST FROM THE PLATEAU INTO THE SOUTHERN
VALLEY AND NC. ONE COMPLEX OF STORMS FORMED JUST BEFORE SUNRISE ON
THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND MOVED ACROSS SE TN AND SW NC THIS MORNING.
THE NEXT AREA FORMED OVER THE NORTHERN PLATEAU LATE THIS MORNING AND
MOVED INTO THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY IN THE LAST HOUR OR SO.
HEAVY RAINFALL IS POSSIBLE IN SOME OF THE STORMS AS THEY MOVE SLOWLY
SOUTHEAST TOWARD GA AND NC IN THE NEXT COUPLE HOURS. THIS SHORT WAVE
MOVES OUT OF THE FORECAST AREA EARLY TONIGHT WHICH WILL BRING A QUICK
END TO THE SHOWERS AND STORMS. LOCALLY DENSE FOG LIKELY TO FORM LATE
TONIGHT AS SKIES CLEAR AND THE MOISTURE FROM THE GROUND RISES. UPPER
LEVEL RIDGING STRENGTHENS OVER AREA TUESDAY. AIR MASS WILL REMAIN
MOIST AND UNSTABLE. SOUTHWEST FLOW WILL BRING IN WARMER AIR FROM THE
WEST AND SOUTHWEST. ISOLATED STORMS POSSIBLE WITH SOME STRONG TO
POSSIBLY SEVERE...MAINLY AROUND PEAK HEATING IN LATE AFTERNOON AND
EARLY EVENING. HIGHS MUCH WARMER MOSTLY LOWER TO MID 90S LOWER
ELEVATIONS...AND 80S HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND REVEAL A FAIRLY AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH DEVELOPING 
OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION DURING THE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
THURSDAY NIGHT TIME PERIOD. THIS UPPER TROUGH WILL PUSH A WEAK COLD 
FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT OR THURSDAY 
MORNING...AND SHOULD ALSO KEEP ANY TROPICAL STORM DEVELOPMENT OVER 
THE WESTERN ATLANTIC AWAY FROM THE FORECAST AREA. A VERY UNSTABLE 
AIR MASS IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP AHEAD OF THIS COLD FRONT...DUE TO THE 
VERY MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER ALREADY IN PLACE AND COLD UPPER-LEVEL 
TEMPS ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER TROUGH. AS A RESULT...EXPECT 
SCATTERED CONVECTION AHEAD OF THIS COLD FRONT DURING THE TUESDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY TIME PERIOD...WITH SOME STRONG TO SEVERE 
STORMS POSSIBLE EACH DAY WITH DAMAGING WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY 
RAINFALL. HIGH PRESSURE WILL THEN SETTLE OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF 
THE NATION FOR THE WEEKEND AND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...WITH ISOLATED 
DIURNAL CONVECTION EXPECTED TO RETURN FOR THE WEEKEND AND INTO EARLY 
NEXT WEEK AS MOISTURE SLOWLY INCREASES ACROSS THE REGION. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE 
ENSEMBLE MEANS.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
242 AM EDT MON JUN 30 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DISSIPATING SHORT WAVE TROUGH 
OVER THE AREA WILL EXIT TODAY...AND AT LEAST SOME DEEP LAYER DRYING 
EXPECTED LATER TODAY AND TONIGHT.  FORCING STILL SHOULD BE WEAK 
TODAY...BUT WITH PLENTY OF MOISTURE AND WEAK TO MODERATE INSTABILITY 
SHOULD STILL WARRANT 40 TO 50 POPS.  WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW 
CHANCE POPS INTO EVENING HOURS...THEN DRY AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT.  
SOME FOG MAY DEVELOP ESPECIALLY SINCE CLOUD COVER EXPECTED TO BE 
MORE LIMITED...SO WILL INCLUDE PATCHY FOG IN FORECAST.  WILL 
GENERALLY UNDERCUT MAV TEMPS SLIGHTLY FOR TODAY...BUT NOT MUCH 
ARGUMENT WITH MINS FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...SOME LIGHT RIDGING WILL
TAKE PLACE THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK AS AN UPPER-HIGH SITUATED
TO THE SOUTH AND EAST OF THE AREA NOSES ITS WAY NORTH AND EAST INTO
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. THOUGH THERE WILL BE SUFFICIENT GULF MOISTURE
IN PLACE TO SUPPORT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ON TUESDAY...THIS
ACTIVITY WILL BE MORE ISOLATED TO PERHAPS SCATTERED IN NATURE AND
FAVOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE MOUNTAINS AS WARMER TEMPS ALOFT AND
DRIER WEATHER ENSUE. THIS WILL ALLOW HIGHS WILL BE A BIT WARMER AND
REACH THE LOW TO MID 90S IN MANY AREAS ACROSS THE VALLEY.

BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON...THE RIDGE WILL SLIDE OFF TO THE EAST A 
BROAD UPPER-TROUGH SWINGS INTO THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEY. 
ANOTHER VERY WARM DAY IN THE LOWER 90S IS STILL EXPECTED IN MOST 
SPOTS...BUT MODELS DO INDICATE AN INCREASED POTENTIAL FOR ORGANIZED 
CONVECTION LATER IN THE EVENING AND OVERNIGHT. THUS...HAVE INCREASED 
POPS TO 40 PERCENT DURING THIS TIME PERIOD...BUT MAY NEED TO GO 
HIGHER SHOULD TRENDS CONTINUE SHOULD MODEL TRENDS CONTINUE. AFTER 
ANOTHER ROUND OF SHOWERS AND STORMS FOR THURSDAY...THE MAIN UPPER- 
TROUGH WILL BEGIN TO CLEAR THE AREA BY FRIDAY MORNING...JUST IN TIME 
FOR INDEPENDENCE DAY CELEBRATIONS. NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL PREVAIL 
ON FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY...PROMOTING A MAINLY DRY FORECAST...WITH 
SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPERATURES IN THE 80S FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. A 
WARMING TREND WILL THEN OCCUR BY SUNDAY AS ANOTHER UPPER-RIDGE AXIS 
BEGINS TO NOSE IN FROM THE WEST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EDT SUN JUN 29 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
ONGOING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE PRODUCING HEAVY RAINFALL 
ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA THROUGH THE REST OF THE AFTERNOON AND INTO 
THE EVENING. WHILE THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD DECREASE AFTER 
SUNSET...EXPECT THAT SCATTERED COVERAGE WILL PERSIST OVERNIGHT DUE 
TO THE APPROACH OF A CONVECTIVELY-INDUCED VORT MAX NOW OVER WEST TN. 
IT WILL MOVE SLOWLY EAST...MOVING ACROSS OUR AREA TOMORROW. WITH THE 
MOIST AIR MASS REMAINING IN PLACE...SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS SHOWERS
AND SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED ONCE AGAIN TOMORROW.
EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA WILL LIKELY BE FAVORED FOR PRECIP.
WENT ABOVE GFS MOS GUIDANCE FOR POPS...AND BELOW FOR TEMPERATURES
TOMORROW.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)... 
AS BROAD UPPER-TROUGH OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS TRACKS NORTHEAST
INTO THE GREAT LAKES EARLY THIS WEEK IT WILL BE REPLACED WITH ZONAL
FLOW ALOFT MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY AS RIDGING FROM UPPER LEVEL
RIDGE TO THE SOUTH AND EAST SPREADS NORTHEAST. RICH GULF MOISTURE
WILL BE IN PLACE FOR SOME SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY BUT MORE
WIDESPREAD DRY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED WITH HIGHER TEMPERATURES
ALOFT. ACTIVITY THAT FORMS WILL BE MORE ISOLATED AND FAVOR THE
HIGHER TERRAIN. HIGHS WILL BE WARMER TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY AND
REACH THE LOW TO MID 90S IN MANY AREAS ACROSS THE VALLEY.

WEDNESDAY NEW BROAD TROUGH APPROACHES WITH GOOD CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
AND STORMS DURING THE DAY AND EARLY EVENING. COLD FRONT ASSOCIATED 
WITH THIS TROUGH MOVES SLOWLY THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA 
THURSDAY...THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. MORE SHOWERS AND STORMS 
ACCOMPANY THE FRONT AS IT MOVES SOUTH AND EAST. INCREASED RAIN 
CHANCES MORE THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT. THE TROUGH AND FRONT 
FINALLY EXIT THE REGION LATE FRIDAY. AS TIMING IS SLOWER THAN 
YESTERDAY...HAVE ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE STORMS EASTERN MOUNTAINS FOR 
FRIDAY DAY PERIOD. FRONT MAY GET HUNG UP ALONG EASTERN BORDER 
SATURDAY SO CONTINUE LOW POPS THERE EASTERN MOUNTAINS. AS DRIER NW 
FLOW SETS UP FOR THE END OF THE WEEK AND WEEKEND TEMPERATURES WILL 
BE COOLER...MAINLY HIGHS IN THE 80S AND LOWS IN THE 60S WITH LOWER 
RELATIVE HUMIDITIES.

186 
FXUS64 KMRX 290645
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 AM EDT SUN JUN 29 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE ATMOSPHERE WILL REMAIN VERY 
MOIST THROUGH THE SHORT TERM PERIOD. A WEAKENING UPPER TROUGH TO OUR 
WEST WILL SHIFT EAST OVER THE AREA TODAY...ALTHOUGH FORCING WILL BE 
WEAK. WILL CARRY HIGH CHANCE POPS ALL ZONES TODAY...WITH CHANCE POPS 
CONTINUING INTO EARLY TONIGHT BEFORE TAPERING TO SLIGHT CHANCE. 
INSTABILITY MAY BE A BIT BETTER THAN YESTERDAY BUT STILL LOOKS 
LIMITED. VERY HEAVY RAIN WILL BE POSSIBLE AND LOCALIZED FLOODING MAY 
OCCUR...WILL MENTION THREAT IN HWO.  WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM MAV 
TEMPS.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A BROAD UPPER-TROUGH
OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS WILL FLATTEN AS IT TRACKS OFF THE NORTHEAST
INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION EARLY THIS WEEK. THIS WILL LEAD TO
ZONAL FLOW ALOFT AND EVEN SOME LIGHT RIDGING ACROSS THE REGION WITH
AN UPPER-HIGH SITUATED TO THE SOUTH AND EAST OF THE AREA. THOUGH
THERE WILL BE SUFFICIENT GULF MOISTURE IN PLACE TO SUPPORT SHOWER
AND THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY...MORE WIDESPREAD DRIER CONDITIONS ARE
EXPECTED GIVEN THE HIGHER TEMPERATURES ALOFT EARLY IN THE WEEK. ANY
ACTIIVTY THAT FORMS SHOULD BE ISOLATED TO PREHAPS SCATTERED IN
NATURE AND FAVOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE MOUNTAINS. HIGHS WILL BE
A BIT WARMER THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK AND REACH THE LOW TO
MID 90S IN MANY AREAS ACROSS THE VALLEY.

BY WEDNESDAY...THE RIDGE WILL SLIDE OFF TO THE EAST A BROAD UPPER-
TROUGH SWINGS INTO THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEY. THIS SHOULD 
INCREASE STORM COVERAGE QUITE A BIT BY WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY 
AFTERNOON...AND RESULT IN SOME DECENT RAIN CHANCES AREAWIDE. 
THUS...HAVE INCREASED POPS TO THE 40-50 PERCENT RANGE FOR NOW...AND 
MAY NEED TO GO HIGHER SHOULD TRENDS CONTINUE. THIS TROUGH WILL SWING 
THOUGH THE REGION AND CLEAR THE AREA BY FRIDAY MORNING...JUST IN 
TIME FOR INDEPENDENCE DAY CELEBRATIONS. THERE MAY BE A FEW STRAY 
SHOWERS ON THE 4TH AND 5TH OF JULY TO CLOSE OUT THE PERIOD...BUT 
WITH A NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT...AM EXPECTING DRIER AND SLIGHTLY COOLER 
CONDITIONS FOR THE UPCOMING WEEKEND.

629 
FXUS64 KMRX 281908
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 PM EDT SAT JUN 28 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
A MOIST ENVIRONMENT WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH THE SHORT 
TERM PERIOD. THE ONGOING SHOWER ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BEING TO 
DIMINISH AFTER SUNSET AS THE MIDLEVEL TROUGH EXITS AND DAYTIME 
INSTABILITY IS LOST. HOWEVER...THE MODELS CONTINUE TO INDICATE SOME 
LIGHT QPF AMOUNTS OVERNIGHT...SO WILL KEEP A MENTION OF ISOLATED 
SHOWERS AFTER MIDNIGHT. SOME PATCHY FOG MAY OCCUR TONIGHT WHERE IT 
RAINS TODAY...BUT MIDLEVEL CLOUDS THAT ARE EXPECTED TO BE BROKEN 
WILL WORK AGAINST DENSE FOG DEVELOPMENT. 

TOMORROW...A 500 MB SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL BE APPROACHING THE AREA 
FROM THE WEST. ALTHOUGH FORCING IS WEAK WITH THE TROUGH...IT WILL 
NOT TAKE MUCH LIFT TO GET SHOWERS GOING IN THE MOIST 
ENVIRONMENT...SO WILL HAVE HIGH CHANCE POPS FOR THE AFTERNOON. HEAVY 
RAIN WILL ONCE AGAIN BE THE MAIN FACTOR WITH THE SHOWERS/STORMS AS 
PW VALUES REMAIN IN THE 1.7 INCH RANGE. TEMPS MAY BE A LITTLE WARMER 
WITH A BIT LESS CLOUD COVER EXPECTED THAN TODAY...BUT WILL STAY 
BELOW GFS MOS WHICH HAS BEEN TOO WARM OF LATE.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)... 
SHORWAVE TROUGH FLATTENS OUT AS IT MOVES TO THE EAST SUNDAY NIGHT.
VERY MOIST AIR MASS WILL REMAIN OVER THE REGION SO AFTERNOON SHOWER
AND THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY WILL CONTINUE WELL INTO THE EVENING.
RIDGING TO THE SOUTH AND SOUTHWEST IN THE UPPER LEVELS TRIES TO
BUILD NORTH MONDAY BUT MOIST AIR MASS COMBINED WITH HEATING WILL
STILL CAUSE SCATTERED SHOWERS AND STORMS TO DEVELOP. LOWEST CHANCES
SOUTHWEST...HIGHEST NORTHEAST. MODELS SHOW RIDGING STRONGER MONDAY
NIGHT AND TUESDAY AS COLD FRONT APPROACHES IN THE OHIO VALLEY.
LOWER POPS TUESDAY WITH ONLY ISOLATED STORMS EXPECTED LOWER
ELEVATIONS. LOWS MID 60S TO LOWER 70S SUNDAY AND MONDAY NIGHTS.
HIGHS SLIGHTLY WARMER MONDAY IN THE MID 80S TO NEAR 90 MOST
LOCATIONS AND THEN EVEN WARMER TUESDAY IN THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER
90S LOWER ELEVATIONS. COOLER MOUNTAINS BOTH DAYS WITH MORE CLOUD
COVER. TUESDAY EVENING A LITTLE BETTER CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION AS
COLD FRONT APPROACHES. BEST RAIN CHANCES IN EXTENDED STILL LOOK
LIKE WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY AS SIGNIFICANT COLD FRONT MOVES OUT
OF THE OHIO AND MS VALLEYS TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS TRYING
TO SLOW SYSTEM DOWN WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE POSSIBLY NOT UNTIL LATE
THURSDAY. KEPT FORECAST WETTER WEDNESDAY WITH LOWER POPS THURSDAY
THEN CLEARING THURSDAY NIGHT. LATER SHIFTS MAY HAVE TO INCREASE
RAIN CHANCES THURSDAY IF SLOWING OF FRONT CONTINUES. FRIDAY AND
SATURDAY LOOK DRY WITH LOWER DEW POINTS. TEMPERATURES A LITTLE
BELOW NORMAL AT NIGHT AND NEAR NORMAL DAYTIMES WITH LESS CLOUD
COVER.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE ATMOSPHERE WILL REMAIN VERY

INSTABILITY AND SLOW STORM MOVEMENT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO VERY HEAVY 
RAINS IN SOME LOCATIONS.  PLAN TO MENTION POSSIBILITY OF LOCALIZED 
FLOODING IN THE HWO.  WILL CARRY LIKELY POPS FOR THE AFTERNOON HOURS 
DURING THE TIME OF MAX HEATING...AND WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS THROUGH 
THE REMAINDER OF THE SHORT TERM PERIOD AS ANY WEAK IMPULSE IN THE 
FLOW WILL BE ABLE TO GENERATE SHOWERS AND PERHAPS THUNDER GIVEN 
MOIST ENVIRONMENT. WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM MAV TEMPS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE PERIOD STARTS OUT WITH 
RELATIVELY HIGH POPS NORTH HALF AS WEAKENING SHORT WAVE PRESSES 
NORTHEAST THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY. SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW KEEPS A MOIST 
AND UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE IN PLACE AS NEXT SHORT WAVELENGTH SYSTEM 
BUILDS EAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. AGAIN KEPT POPS HIGHER 
NORTH CLOSER TO THE STRONGER LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THE SHORT WAVE. 
TUESDAY MAY BE A DAY WITH A RELATIVE MIN IN PROBABILITY OF 
PRECIPITATION AS THE FORECAST AREA COULD BE IN BETWEEN WEATHER 
SYSTEMS. MODELS BASICALLY IN THE SAME BALLPARK WITH THE PERIOD 
WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY AS A LONG WAVE TROUGH AMPLIFIES AS IT SHIFTS 
FROM MID AMERICA INTO THE EASTERN UNITED STATES BY THURSDAY. 
ALTHOUGH MODELS DIFFER SLIGHTLY ON TIMING...TRIED TO CRANK UP POPS 
FOR CONVECTION ON WEDNESDAY AS A SYNOPTIC COLD FRONT SHIFTS SLOWLY 
SOUTHWARD INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. UNCERTAINTY ABOUNDS 
CONCERNING HOW FAST THE FRONT MOVES SO HELD ONTO SOME CHANCE POPS 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND EVEN KEPT SOME SLIGHT CHANCE PROBABILITIES ON 
THURSDAY FOR THIS REASON. BY FRIDAY MODELS GENERALLY AGREE THAT MOST 
OF THE HIGHER DEWPOINT AIR WILL HAVE BEEN SWEPT SOUTH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA AND THEREFORE WENT WITH AN OPTIMISTIC 4TH OF JULY 
COMPLETE WITH SUNSHINE AND SEASONABLY WARM TEMPERATURES. SPEAKING OF 
TEMPERATURE...GUIDANCE MAXES LOOKED A LITTLE TOASTY TOWARD THE END 
OF THE PERIOD SO CUT BACK A FEW DEGREES HERE. ALSO...MINS MAY BE A 
BIT TOO COOL ABOUT WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY NIGHT BEHIND THE 
FRONT SO ADDED A DEGREE OR TWO TO GUIDANCE NUMBERS.

956 
FXUS64 KMRX 271921
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
321 PM EDT FRI JUN 27 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
A MOIST AIR MASS WILL REMAIN IN PLACE OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE 
SHORT TERM PERIOD. BEST SHOWER COVERAGE THROUGH THE EVENING WILL BE 
IN SOUTHERN SECTIONS...WITH DECREASING ACTIVITY AFTER SUNSET. THE 
SLOW-MOVING STORMS WILL NEED TO BE MONITORED FOR LOCALIZED FLOODING 
THROUGH THE EVENING. 

THERE IS LITTLE FORCING FOR LIFT OVERNIGHT...BUT A CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
CONTINUES AS EVEN THE SLIGHTEST FORCING COULD PRODUCE A SHOWER IN 
THE MOIST ENVIRONMENT. PRECIP CHANCES RISE TO LIKELY TOMORROW AS THE 
MODELS SHOW A 500 MB VORT MAX NOW IN THE WESTERN GULF LIFTING NE AND 
AFFECTING THE TN VALLEY TOMORROW AFTERNOON. PW VALUES TOMORROW WILL 
BE AROUND 1.7 INCHES WITH TALL/SKINNY CAPE PROFILES IN FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS...SO HEAVY RAIN AND LOCALIZED FLOODING WILL BE THE MAIN 
THREATS. WITH GREATER CLOUD COVER EXPECTED TOMORROW...HIGHS SHOULD 
BE A FEW DEGREES COOLER THAN WHAT WE ARE SEEING TODAY.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
OVERALL...CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EXIST EACH DAY
THROUGH MOST OF THE EXTENDED WITH A DRIER PATTERN IN STORE TOWARD
THE END. IT IS LOOKING LIKE THE FOURTH OF JULY IS SHAPING UP TO BE
A DRY AND PLEASANT ONE WITH A LITTLE LOWER HUMIDITY VALUES DUE TO A
FRONTAL PASSAGE ON WED/THURSDAY.

SATURDAY NIGHT...UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE WILL CONTINUE TO LIFT NORTH 
OF OUR AREA PROVIDING A GOOD CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. 
AS THE NIGHT PROGRESSES...SHOWERS AND STORMS SHOULD BEGIN TO 
DISSIPATE. A FEW SHOWERS AND STORMS MAY LINGER THROUGH THE NIGHT. 
WITH HIGH PRESSURE STILL IN PLACE ON SUNDAY...AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH 
WILL APPROACH FROM THE WEST AND BECOME EXTREMELY NEGATIVELY TILTED 
THE CLOSER IT GETS TO OUR AREA. OUT AHEAD OF THIS FEATURE...SHOWERS 
AND STORMS ARE POSSIBLE SUNDAY AFTERNOON. THE WEAK ASSOCIATED 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY MOVES THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. THE HIGH 
PRESSURE THAT WAS OVER US DURING THE WEEKEND STARTS SHIFTING EAST ON 
MONDAY WITH AGAIN MORE DIURNAL CONVECTION MONDAY AFTERNOON. LITTLE 
IF ANY LIFT PRESENT WITH THE PASSING FRONTAL BOUNDARY...SO SHOWERS 
AND STORMS WILL MAINLY BE DIURNAL. 

BY TUESDAY A DEEPER TROUGH IS APPROACHING THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY AND 
WILL SWING THROUGH OUR REGION ON TUES NIGHT INTO THURSDAY. TUESDAY 
AFTERNOON LOOKS DRY BUT BY TUESDAY EVENING A COLD FRONT ASSOCIATED 
WITH THE DEEPER TROUGH MOVES INTO OUR AREA TRIGGERING SHOWERS AND 
STORMS. THERE IS SOME MODEL DISAGREEMENT ON HOW FAST THE FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY MOVES THROUGH. THE GFS HANGS THE FRONT UP ACROSS OUR AREA 
ON WEDNESDAY...PROVIDING A TRIGGER FOR MORE SHOWERS AND STORMS 
BEFORE MOVING THE BOUNDARY OUT BY THURSDAY MORNING. WHEREAS THE 
ECMWF HAS THE BOUNDARY TO OUR SOUTH AND EAST BY WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON...THUS KEEPING US MORE DRY. WILL COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE 
TWO MODELS AND KEEP SOME CHANCE OF POPS IN FOR WEDNESDAY UNTIL THE 
MODELS CAN BETTER RESOLVE THE TIMING.

THURSDAY...MUCH DRIER AIR FILTERS IN BEHIND THE FRONT ALLOWING FOR A 
MOSTLY PRECIP FREE DAY...WILL STILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN BUT 
POPS MAY BE ABLE TO BE DROPPED WITH FUTURE FORECAST ISSUANCES. 
FRIDAY...THE 4TH OF JULY...APPEARS TO BE DRY AS WELL AS DRIER AIR IS 
STILL IN PLACE...WITH HIGH PRESSURE STARTING TO BUILD BACK IN. 

TEMPERATURES NEAR NORMAL THR0UGH MOST OF THE EXTENDED WITH A SLIGHT 
COOL DOWN ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY BEHIND THE FRONTAL PASSAGE WITH 
LOWER DEWPOINTS AS WELL.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             69  87  69  89 /  50  60  40  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  68  85  68  87 /  40  60  40  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       67  85  68  87 /  40  60  40  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              66  84  65  85 /  30  60  50  50 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

.AVIATION...
SHOWERS ARE POPPING UP AROUND THE AREA...WITH CURRENT RADAR SHOWING

INCLUDED AT ALL SITES. BETTER INSTABILITY NEAR CHA COULD PRODUCE

LOW CLOUDS FOR NOW. ANOTHER UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCE COULD BRING

SOUTHERN AREAS WILL LIKELY TO SEE THE BEST COVERAGE BASED ON THE
REDUCING CLOUD COVER SEEN IN SATELLITE AND ON THE LATEST HRRR AND
RAP RUNS. THE TREND OF DECREASING CLOUDS AREA WIDE SHOULD ALLOW
TEMPS TO RISE TO NEAR FORECAST HIGHS IN THE MID TO UPPER 80S. WEAK
WINDS ALOFT AND TALL SKINNY CAPE PROFILE SUGGEST SOME LOCALIZED
FLOODING WILL POSSIBLE WITH SOME STORMS.

FXUS64 KMRX 270642
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
242 AM EDT FRI JUN 27 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CONSIDERABLE MOISTURE OVER THE 
AREA DURING THE SHORT TERM...ALTHOUGH INSTABILITY MAY BE SOMEWHAT 
LIMITED GIVEN EXPECTED CLOUD COVER. WILL GENERALLY GO ABOVE MAV POPS 
TODAY...WITH POPS RANGING FROM 30 NORTH TO 50 SOUTH.  WILL KEEP 
CHANCE POPS ALL ZONES THROUGH THE NIGHT...AS SOME WEAK SHORT WAVE 
ENERGY IS FORECAST TO APPROACH. WILL GENERALLY GO BELOW MAV TEMPS
FOR TODAY GIVEN EXPECTED CLOUDS...BUT NOT MUCH ARGUMENT WITH LOWS
FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE SLOWLY 
BUILDS INTO THE AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND...WITH DIURNAL CONVECTION 
DEVELOPING EACH DAY. THE ATMOSPHERE IS VERY MOIST BUT INSTABILITY IS 
LOW. THROUGH THE BEGINNING OF THE WORK WEEK...AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH 
WILL MOVE EAST OVER THE GREAT LAKES...ALLOWING SEVERAL SHORT WAVES 
AND A FRONT TO MOVE THROUGH THE REGION. MID AND LOW LEVEL DRY AIR 
ADVECT WITH A STRENGTHENING OF THE WINDS THROUGH THE ATMOSPHERE FOR 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY. INSTABILITY LOOKS A BIT STRONGER...BUT A BIT OF 
A CAP PRESENT AS WELL. THE FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT 
INTO WEDNESDAY...WITH AMPLE DRY AIR THROUGHOUT THE ATMOSPHERE BEHIND 
THIS FRONT. INSTABILITIES ARE VERY LIMITED THROUGH THE REST OF THE 
WORK WEEK...BUT COULD SEE JUST ENOUGH LIFT FOR ISOLATED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP EACH AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN 
NEAR NORMAL THROUGH THE EXTENDED.

435 
FXUS64 KMRX 270208
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1008 PM EDT THU JUN 26 2014

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
THE GENERAL TREND FOR THE NEXT 12-24 HOURS WILL BE INCREASING 
MOISTURE AS PW VALUES RISE FROM AROUND 1.5 TODAY TO AROUND 1.8 BY 
LATE TOMORROW AFTERNOON. MODELS INDICATE A NUMBER OF WEAK VORT MAXES 
APPROACHING THE AREA FROM THE SW. THESE DISTURBANCES SHOULD BE
ENOUGH TO SUPPORT SHOWERS AT ANY TIME TONIGHT AND TOMORROW IN THE
MOIST ENVIRONMENT. WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS SOUTH TONIGHT WITH SLIGHT
CHANCE POPS NORTH AND CENTRAL...INCREASING TO LIKELY SOUTH AND
CENTRAL/CHANCE NORTH TOMORROW. WILL LEAN ON THE COOL SIDE OF MOS
GUIDANCE FOR HIGH TEMPS TOMORROW GIVEN EXPECTED CLOUD COVER AND
PRECIP.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
NOT MUCH CHANGE FROM THE PREVIOUS FORECAST. TYPICAL SUMMERTIME
PATTERN IN STORE OVER OUR REGION THROUGH THE EXTENDED WITH UPPER
LEVEL RIDGING BUILDING ACROSS THE AREA...ALONG WITH TWO WEAK
FRONTAL PASSAGES THAT WILL MOVE THROUGH.

FRIDAY NIGHT...UPPER LEVEL RIDGING BEGINS BUILDING AND CONTINUES 
THROUGH SUNDAY. POP-UP CONVECTION ON FRIDAY SHOULD BEGIN TO WEAKEN 
AND DISSIPATE FRIDAY NIGHT AS WE LOSE OUR DAYTIME HEATING...BUT A 
FEW SHOWERS AND STORMS MAY LINGER THROUGH A GOOD PORTION OF THE 
NIGHT. SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY THE DIURNAL CONVECTION CONTINUES AS 
WE HEAT UP EACH DAY...WITH AGAIN SHOWERS ANS STORMS SLOWLY 
DISSIPATING AFTER SUNSET. THE BEST CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND STORMS 
OVER THE WEEKEND LOOKS TO BE ON SATURDAY DUE TO HIGH PRESSURE JUST 
TO OUR SOUTHEAST PROVIDING MOISTURE TO STREAM INTO OUR AREA FROM THE 
GULF...SOUNDINGS LOOK PRETTY SATURATED.

SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY A WEAK FRONT MOVES THROUGH. THIS FRONT WILL 
BRIEFLY PUT US BACK INTO A MORE ZONAL FLOW. FORCING IS MINIMAL WITH 
THIS FEATURE SO WILL ONLY SLIGHTLY INCREASE PRECIP CHANCES AS IT 
MOVES THROUGH. TUESDAY LOOKS DRIER IN THE WAKE OF THE FRONTAL 
PASSAGE BUT PRECIP CHANCES STILL EXIST FOR THE AFTERNOON DUE TO 
DIURNAL CONVECTION. PRECIP CHANCES START TO INCREASE AGAIN ON 
WEDNESDAY AS A SOMEWHAT MORE ROBUST UPPER LEVEL TROUGH BEGINS TO 
SWING THROUGH THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. AN ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL 
MAKE ITS WAY ACROSS OUR AREA WEDNESDAY/WED NIGHT. THE FRONT SHOULD 
DRIFT SOUTH OF OUR AREA SOMETIME ON THURSDAY. THE SILVER LINING IS 
THAT A LITTLE BIT OF COOLER AND DRIER AIR WILL BE BRIEFLY IN STORE 
BEHIND THIS FRONTAL PASSAGE. 

AS WITH THE PREVIOUS FORECAST...A PERSISTENCE FORECAST ON TEMPS 
SEEMS BEST THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...SINCE A STAGNANT PATTERN 
WILL BE LINGERING OVER THE SOUTHEAST.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             70  85  68  87 /  40  60  40  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  67  86  68  86 /  20  60  40  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       66  86  67  86 /  20  60  40  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              65  86  64  85 /  20  40  30  50

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

PORTION OF FORECAST BELOW.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND REVEAL A STAGNANT PATTERN WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE 
BUILDING OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. GFS AND ECMWF MODELS 
HAVE SOME DIFFERENCES WITH THE AMOUNT OF MOISTURE EXPECTED OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA...AND THUS...THE RESULTING COVERAGE OF CONVECTIVE 
DEVELOPMENT EACH DAY. WILL GENERALLY COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO 
SOLUTIONS BY MENTIONING 30 TO 50 POPS FOR MOST OF THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD. CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO LESSEN SOMEWHAT BY EARLY 
NEXT WEEK...BUT SHOULD THEN INCREASE AGAIN BY THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK 
AS A WEAK COLD FRONT SLOWLY APPROACHES THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON 
WEDNESDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...A PERSISTENCE FORECAST SEEMS BEST 
THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...SINCE A STAGNANT PATTERN WILL BE 
LINGERING OVER THE SOUTHEAST.

067 
FXUS64 KMRX 251850
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EDT WED JUN 25 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
ISOLATED DIURNALLY-DRIVEN SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE UNTIL AROUND SUNSET. 
WITH AFTERNOON DEWPOINTS RUNNING IN THE 65 TO 70 RANGE IN MOST 
SPOTS...AND MOIST GROUND FROM EARLIER RAINFALL...PATCHY FOG APPEARS 
TO BE LIKELY ENOUGH TO MENTION IN ALL ZONES LATE TONIGHT. 

TOMORROW WILL SEE A RATHER NON-DESCRIPT W-NW FLOW OVER THE AREA WITH 
LITTLE FORCING FOR ORGANIZED SHOWERS/STORMS. A TROUGH OVER TX AND 
THE LOWER MS REGION WILL BE MOVING EAST...AND MOISTURE WILL INCREASE 
FROM THE SW BEHIND THE RETREATING 850-700 MB RIDGE AXIS. THUS 
SOUTHERN SECTIONS WILL HAVE THE BEST CHANCES OF AFTERNOON DIURNAL 
CONVECTION...WITH JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE CENTRAL AND NORTH. EARLY 
MORNING FOG AND CLOUDS SHOULD HOLD TEMPERATURES BACK A BIT...COOLER 
THAN THE GFS MOS GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
WILL REMAIN IN A STAGNANT WEATHER PATTERN THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED
WITH AN UPPER RIDGE OVER THE EAST COAST OF THE U.S. THIS PLACES THE
MRX CWA IN SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST FLOW WHICH WILL ALLOW FOR STRONG
AFTERNOON HEATING AND CARRY LOW LEVEL MOISTURE INTO THE REGION.
THEREFORE...EXPECT DEVELOPMENT OF ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION
EACH PERIOD. THE DIURNAL HEATING WILL ADD TO THE INSTABILITY...AND
PLACE US IN A NORMAL SUMMERTIME PATTERN FOR THE BEST CHANCE OF
CONVECTION DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING AND OVER HIGHER
ELEVATIONS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             69  87  68  89 /  20  40  20  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  68  87  65  88 /  20  20  20  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       68  87  65  88 /  20  20  20  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              65  85  62  86 /  20  20  20  30

UNDERWAY BEGINNING THURSDAY.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND 
GENERALLY REVEAL A STAGNANT PATTERN (TYPICAL OF SUMMER) AS AN UPPER-
LEVEL RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION AND A SURFACE 
'BERMUDA' HIGH DEVELOPS OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC. GFS AND ECMWF 
MODELS HAVE SOME DIFFERENCES IN REGARDS TO THE AMOUNT OF MOISTURE 
EXPECTED AND THE RESULTING COVERAGE OF CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT EACH 
DAY. FOR NOW...WILL COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO SOLUTIONS BY 
MENTIONING 30 POPS FOR MOST OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD. AS FOR TEMPS...A 
PERSISTENCE FORECAST SEEMS BEST THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD... 
SINCE A STAGNANT PATTERN WILL BE LINGERING OVER THE SOUTHEAST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT TUE JUN 24 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...SHOWERS AND A FEW 
THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE TO BUILD IN THE WEAKLY UNSTABLE BUT VERY 
MOIST AIRMASS ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. AS THE UPPER TROUGH OVER THE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ADVANCES EAST TONIGHT THE WEAK CONVECTIVE ACTION 
SHOULD CONTINUE DEEP INTO THE NIGHT. MODELS INDICATE THE UPPER 
TROUGH AND A WEAK SURFACE FRONT WILL PRESS EAST ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA EARLY IN THE DAY ON WEDNESDAY THUS ALLOWING POPS TO BE LOWERED 
FROM WEST TO EAST THROUGH THE DAYTIME PERIOD. MODEL SOUNDINGS ARE 
NOT VERY IMPRESSIVE LATE TONIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY WITH A SATURATED 
COLUMN AND THEN WARMING ALOFT BUILDING INTO THE REGION. THEREFORE 
TRIED TO USE SHOWERS AS THE MAIN FORECAST ELEMENT WITH A CHANCE OF 
THUNDERSTORMS. TRENDED MINS UP A DEGREE OFF GUIDANCE TONIGHT WHILE 
STAYING IN THE MIDDLE OF SUGGESTED MAX TEMPS FOR WEDNESDAY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS GENERALLY 
AGREE ON SOME DRYING FOR WED NIGHT AND THURSDAY BEHIND A DEPARTING 
WEAK FRONT.  WILL CARRY NO MORE THAN SLIGHT CHANCE POPS WED NIGHT 
THROUGH THU NIGHT.  REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD LOOKS LIKE A TYPICAL 
SUMMER PATTERN WITH SCATTERED CONVECTION ESPECIALLY IN THE 
AFTERNOON/EVENING.  MAY BE ENHANCED PRECIP CHANCES AT TIMES BUT 
THOSE LIKELY DUE TO SMALLER SCALE FEATURES UNLIKELY TO BE RESOLVED 
WELL BY MODELS AT THESE TIME RANGES. WILL GO NO HIGHER THAN CHANCE 
POPS FOR SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY.  WILL MAKE MAINLY MINOR 
ADJUSTMENTS TO GFS MOS TEMPS.

WHICH SHOULD HELP TO CONTINUE TRIGGERING A GOOD COVERAGE OF CONVECTION
AREA WIDE. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD
AGREEMENT WITH MINS FOR TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT...AND WILL PLAN
TO COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO WITH MAXES.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...TEMPERATURES WILL GENERALLY 
RUN A LITTLE ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH HIGH PRESSURE IN 
CONTROL. BUT THE RIDGING WILL BE A BIT MOIST ALOFT...AS WELL AS 
HAVING DEWPOINTS IN THE 60S AT THE SURFACE. THUS DIURNAL CONVECTION 
IS EXPECTED FOR EACH DAY...GENERALLY IN THE 20-40 PERCENT POP RANGE.

WARM AND VERY HUMID AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH SATELLITE

MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WITH SCATTERED CONVECTION EXPECTED 
TO DEVELOP...ESPECIALLY OVER SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC WHERE 
INSTABILITY WILL BE GREATER. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL 
COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE WILL
CONTINUE TO FLATTEN AND SHIFT SOUTH AND EAST AS A BROAD TROUGH
SWINGS INTO THE UPPER GREAT LAKES AND OHIO RIVER VALLEY. THIS WILL
DRAG A WEAK FRONT TOWARD/INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY TUESDAY INTO
WEDNESDAY. DUE TO THE ENHANCED LIFT FROM THIS TROUGH AND BOUNDARY...
MORE WIDESPREAD CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION ARE EXPECTED FOR THE
REMAINDER OF THE WEEK...ESPECIALLY ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. AS A
RESULT...HAVE LIKELY POPS ON TUESDAY AFTERNOON...AND AGAIN ON
WEDNESDAY AS MODELS /ESPECIALLY THE NAM/ ARE HINTING AT AN ADDITIONAL
ORGANIZED COMPLEX OF STORMS MOVING THROUGH THE REGION AS THE BASE
OF THE TROUGH SWINGS THROUGH.

MODELS DIFFER LATER ON IN THE WEEK INTO THE WEEKEND...WITH THE GFS 
SUPPORTING A WETTER SET-UP WITH SEVERAL LITTLE SHORTWAVES MOVING 
ANOTHER THE NORTHERN EDGE OF THE RIDGE. THE ECMWF INDICATES A MORE 
ESTABLISHED RIDGE AND A DRIER SOLUTION WITH A MORE DIURNALLY DRIVEN 
CONVECTION POTENTIAL. REGARDLESS...THINK COVERAGE WILL BE AROUND 30 
TO PERHAPS 40 PERCENT MOST DAYS THROUGH THE END OF THE WORK WEEK...
SO HAVE REFLECTED THIS IN THE GRIDS. GIVEN THE MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY
IN PLACE...THESE STORMS WILL HAVE THE POTENTIAL FOR PRODUCING LOCALIZED
GUSTY/DAMAGING WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. TEMPERATURES DURING
THIS TIME PERIOD WILL BE COOLER DUE TO THE LOWER THICKNESS 
VALUES/TEMPERATURES ALOFT AND CLOUD COVER...AND PEAK IN THE MID 80S
DURING THE LATER HALF OF THE WORK WEEK...BEFORE CLIMBING TO THE
UPPER 80S/90 DEGREES BY THE WEEKEND. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             91  70  87  69 /  40  40  70  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  89  69  85  68 /  40  40  60  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       89  69  85  68 /  30  30  60  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              87  64  83  66 /  30  30  60  60

FXUS64 KMRX 221908
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT SUN JUN 22 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL CONTINUE 
TO INCREASE THROUGH THE BEGINNING OF THE WORK WEEK. A SMALL CAP WILL 
BE PRESENT OVER THE AREA FOR THE AFTERNOON AND EARLY 
EVENING...LIMITING CONVECTION AND STRENGTH OF ANY THUNDERSTORMS. 
THIS CONVECTION WILL BE DIURNAL IN NATURE...WEAKENING AROUND SUNSET. 
THE INCREASE IN LOW LEVEL MOISTURE OVERNIGHT WILL CAUSE FOG 
DEVELOPMENT AGAIN FOR THE EARLY MORNING HOURS MONDAY. 

FOR MONDAY...A SHORT WAVE IS EXPECTED TO PROGRESS THROUGH THE 
REGION...CAUSING ANOTHER ROUND OF CONVECTION IN THE AFTERNOON. 
COVERAGE SHOULD BE ISOLATED TO SCATTERED...WITH MODELS IN BETTER 
AGREEMENT ON TIMING. THERE IS DECENT AMOUNTS OF CAPE PRESENT IN THE 
ATMOSPHERE FOR THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING...BUT ANOTHER CAP PRESENT. 
WINDS ARE WEAK WITH WEAK SHEAR THROUGHOUT THE ATMOSPHERE AS WELL. 
CLOUDS WILL SLOWLY INCREASE IN COVERAGE MONDAY...AND TEMPERATURES 
WILL BE NEAR NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGHER PRESSURE WILL BE 
GRADUALLY REPLACED BY LOWER PRESSURE IN THE UPPER ATMOSPHERE WHICH 
MEANS AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL BE PRESSING ITS WAY INTO THE 
EASTERN UNTIED STATES. MODELS CONTINUE TO CLUSTER AROUND A SOLUTION 
WHICH SHOWS INCREASING MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY COINCIDENT WITH A 
FEW SHORT WAVELENGTH PRESSURE TROUGH PASSAGES THROUGH THE PERIOD. 
STAYED WITH HIGHEST POPS FOR TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS AND THEN GRADUALLY TAPER POPS FOR CONVECTION BACK TO 
LOW AND EVEN SLIGHT CHANCE BY THE WEEKEND. STAYED A LITTLE UNDER MAX 
TEMP GUIDANCE THROUGH THE PERIOD WHILE ADDING A DEGREE HERE AND 
THERE TO MINS THROUGH THE LONG TERM.

&&

084 
FXUS64 KMRX 220725
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EDT SUN JUN 22 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WARM AND VERY HUMID AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH SATELLITE 
IMAGERY REVEALING QUITE A BIT OF CLOUDS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. A 
MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING...BUT MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL A WARM STABLE LAYER AROUND 
500 MB AND A DRIER VERTICAL MOISTURE PROFILE (COMPARED TO YESTERDAY).
WHILE THIS MID-LEVEL STABLE LAYER MAY NOT FULLY INHIBIT CONVECTIVE
DEVELOPMENT TODAY...IT SHOULD HELP TO DECREASE THE AREAL COVERAGE
OF CONVECTION. THUS...EXPECT ONLY AN ISOLATED COVERAGE OF CONVECTION
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH MAXES FOR TODAY...BUT REVEAL SOME
DISCREPANCIES WITH MINS FOR TONIGHT. WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS A
PERSISTENCE FORECAST FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE WILL
GRADUALLY SLIDE TO THE EAST ON MONDAY...ALLOWING FOR MORE GULF
MOISTURE TO CONTINUE TO WORK ITS WAY INTO THE REGION. THIS WILL LEAD
TO MORE WIDESPREAD DIURNAL CONVECTION THROUGHOUT THE DAY...ESPECIALLY
ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE MOUNTAINS AND PLATEAU. THE STORM MODE
WILL GENERALLY BE MULTICELL CLUSTERS...AND THEY COULD BECOME STRONG
TO PERHAPS LOCALLY SEVERE. GIVEN THE ABUNDANT GULF MOISTURE IN PLACE...
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND FLOODING WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH THE
STRONGEST ACTIVITY...ALONG WITH A DAMAGING CONVECTIVE WIND THREAT.

TUESDAY THROUGH THE REST OF THE WEEK...THE RIDGE WILL CONTINUE TO 
FLATTEN AND SHIFT SOUTH AND EAST AS A BROAD TROUGH SWINGS INTO THE 
UPPER GREAT LAKES. DUE TO THE ENHANCED LIFT PROVIDED BY THE 
AFOREMENTIONED UPPER-TROUGH...AND A SERIES OF ADDITIONAL SHORTWAVE
DISTURBANCES THAT WILL TRACK ALONG THE NORTHERN EDGE OF THE RIDGE
ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY...MORE WIDESPREAD COVERAGE IS EXPECTED DURING
THIS PERIOD. GIVEN THE MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY IN PLACE...THESE
STORMS WILL HAVE THE POTENTIAL FOR PRODUCING LOCALIZED GUSTY/DAMAGING
WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. AS A RESULT...HAVE INCREASED POPS
TO A SOLID 40-50 PERCENT DURING THE DAY-PERIODS THROUGH THURSDAY.
TEMPERATURES DURING THIS TIME PERIOD WILL BE COOLER DUE TO THE LOWER
THICKNESS VALUES/TEMPERATURES ALOFT AND CLOUD COVER...AND PEAK IN THE
MID 80S DURING THE LATER HALF OF THE WEEK. THE UPPER- RIDGE LOOKS
TO BUILD BACK IN FOR THE WEEKEND...BUT MOISTURE UNDERNEATH IT SHOULD
RESULT IN SCATTERED CONVECTION EACH DAY...WITH PERHAPS A SLIGHT
WARMING TREND. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             93  69  91  71 /  20  20  50  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  90  68  90  70 /  20  20  40  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       90  67  90  70 /  20  20  40  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              88  62  88  65 /  20  20  30  30

THE FORECAST APPEARS TO BE UNSETTLED WITH POSSIBILITIES FOR

WAVE FEATURES WHICH WOULD ENHANCE CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL DURING THE 
MID WEEK PERIOD AROUND TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY. THEREFORE...KEPT A 
LIKELY THROUGH HIGH CHANCE PROBABILITY FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
GOING AT THIS TIME WHILE TAPERING BACK TO SLIGHT AND LOWER CHANCE 
POPS AROUND FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY WHEN UPPER RIDGING TRIES TO RE-
ESTABLISH ITSELF OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S.

995 
FXUS64 KMRX 210707
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
307 AM EDT SAT JUN 21 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH 
A WARM AND VERY HUMID AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. A MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING...BUT MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE A WARMER STABLE LAYER BETWEEN 
700 TO 500 MB THAN IN PREVIOUS DAYS. WHILE THIS MID-LEVEL STABLE LAYER
MAY NOT FULLY INHIBIT CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT TODAY...IT SHOULD HELP TO
DECREASE THE AREAL COVERAGE OF CONVECTION. THUS...WILL KEEP POPS A
LITTLE LOWER TODAY (COMPARED TO YESTERDAY). HOWEVER...ONE POTENTIAL
"FLY IN THE OINTMENT" INVOLVES THE EVOLUTION OF AN MCS OVER THE MID
MS RIVER VALLEY TODAY. GFS AND NAM MODELS SHOW THIS MCS WEAKENING
TODAY (LIKELY DUE TO THE MID-LEVEL STABLE LAYER OVER THE TN RIVER
VALLEY) AS IT MOVES SOUTHEASTWARD IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. BUT
WITH A NORTHWEST-TO-SOUTHEAST ORIENTED INSTABILITY AXIS EXPECTED TO
DEVELOP AHEAD OF IT (AND STRETCHING INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY)...THINK
THIS MCS MAY HAVE SOME EFFECT ON THE FORECAST AREA (WHETHER DIRECTLY
OR INDIRECTLY WITH ITS OUTFLOW). AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE
NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL
TREND TOWARDS A PERSISTENCE FORECAST.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE WILL MOVE
BACK INTO THE REGION FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY. MOSTLY TO PARTLY SUNNY
CONDITIONS WILL ALLOW FOR HIGHS TO REACH THE UPPER 80S AND LOWER 90S
BY THE AFTERNOON...BUT THE ABUNDANT MOISTURE UNDERNEATH THIS RIDGE
WILL ALSO ALLOW FOR DIURNAL CONVECTION. THIS ACTIVITY WILL FAVOR THE
HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE MOUNTAINS AND PLATEAU...AND COULD BECOME STRONG
TO PERHAPS LOCALLY SEVERE. GIVEN THE ABUNDANT GULF MOISTURE IN
PLACE...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND FLOODING WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH THE
STRONGEST ACTIVITY...ALONG WITH THE USUAL DAMAGING CONVECTIVE WIND
THREAT.

TUESDAY THROUGH THE REST OF THE WEEK...THIS RIDGE WILL THEN FLATTEN 
ONCE AGAIN AS A BROAD TROUGH SWINGS INTO THE UPPER GREAT LAKES. DUE 
TO THE ENHANCED LIFT PROVIDED BY THE AFOREMENTIONED UPPER-TROUGH... 
AND A SERIES OF ADDITIONAL SHORTWAVE DISTURBANCES MORE WIDESPREAD 
COVERAGE IS EXPECTED DURING THIS PERIOD. GIVEN THE MOISTURE AND  
INSTABILITY IN PLACE...THESE STORMS WILL HAVE THE POTENTIAL FOR 
PRODUCING LOCALIZED GUSTY/DAMAGING WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. 
TEMPERATURES DURING THIS TIME PERIOD WILL BE COOLER DUE TO THE LOWER 
THICKNESS VALUES/TEMPERATURES ALOFT AND CLOUD COVER...AND PEAK IN 
THE MID 80S DURING THE LATER HALF OF THE WEEK.
&&

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
252 PM EDT FRI JUN 20 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...AIRMASS WAS VERY UNSTABLE 
ACROSS PLATEAU COUNTIES NE INTO ERN KY AND SW VA THIS AFTERNOON. 
COVERAGE AND INTENSITY OF THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUES TO INCREASE WITH 
MOVEMENT E OR SE AT AROUND 20 MPH. ALL OF THIS ACTIVIVTY IS POISED 
TO SWEEP ACROSS OUR FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...MUCH IN LINE WITH 
RAP MODEL OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS...WITH NAM SHOWING A BIT MORE 
COVERAGE THAN RAP OR HRR. THINK NAM MAY BE OVERDOING CONVECTION OVER 
SE TN AND SW NC...SO STUCK WITH 30 TO 40 PERCENT POPS FOR THOSE 
AREAS. STORMS COULD BRIEFLY INTENSIFY TO MARGINALLY SEVERE WITH 
STRONG WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS. GFS MOS MINS WERE CLOSE TO 
PERSISTENCE AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED.

BETTER COVERAGE OF SHOWERS AND STORMS ON SATURDAY WILL BE EARLY...
FOLLOWED BY A DECREASING TREND IN POPS FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY. SHOULD BE DRY AFTER SUNSET SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING
WITH AREAS OF FOG LIKELY AGAIN. DROPPED POPS EARLIER IN GRIDS FOR 
SATURDAY NIGHT AND LIMITED POPS FOR SUNDAY TO THE AFTERNOON HOURS.

LOW LEVEL FLOW BECOMES LIGHT NORTHERLY SATURDAY NIGHT SO A TAD 
COOLER BUT STILL AROUND SEASONAL NORMS. FAVORED A BLEND OF SIMILAR 
MOS MAXES EACH DAY.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...ATMOSPHERE BECOMES A 
LITTLE MORE CONDUCIVE TO CONVECTION AROUND THE TUESDAY THROUGH 
THURSDAY PERIOD AS A LONG WAVE TROUGH BUILDS INTO THE EASTERN U.S. A 
COOL FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BUILD INTO THE REGION DURING THIS TIME 
FRAME ADDING A BIT OF A FOCUS FOR STORM DEVELOPMENT IN THE WARM AND 
HUMID AIRMASS WHICH WILL RESIDE OVER THE MID SOUTH. STAYED VERY 
CLOSE TO SUGGESTED MIN TEMP MOS WHILE ADJUSTING MAX TEMPS ABOUT A 
COUPLE OF DEGREES BELOW MAX TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE.

FXUS64 KMRX 200713
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
313 AM EDT FRI JUN 20 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
NORTHWEST-TO-SOUTHEAST ORIENTED FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER EASTERN KY AND 
SOUTHWEST VA...WITH SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALING QUITE A BIT OF CLOUDS
OCCURRING ALONG IT. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS EXPECTED TO REMAIN QUASI-
STATIONARY AROUND THE TRI-CITIES THROUGH TONIGHT...WITH A MODERATELY
UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. AS A RESULT...
EXPECT SCATTERED STRONG CONVECTION TO DEVELOP... ESPECIALLY NEAR THE
FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. AS FOR TEMPS...
GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND
TONIGHT...WHICH IS ESSENTIALLY A PERSISTENCE FORECAST.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...THE UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE THAT
PROMOTED THE VERY WARM AND FAIRLY DRY CONDITIONS EARLIER IN THE
WEEK WILL CONTINUE TO FLATTEN AND RETROGRADE BACK TO THE SOUTHWEST
ON SATURDAY. THIS WILL PROMOTE A MORE NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT...AND
ALLOW FOR A SHORTWAVE/WEAK FRONT TO DROP THROUGH THE REGION. SCATTERED
STRONG TO PERHAPS LOCALLY SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE
FROM THE MID/LATE MORNING THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. THE MOST FAVORED
AREA LOOKS TO BE NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA WHERE
MODELS ARE HINTING AT THE POTENTIAL FOR THE DEEPEST CONVECTION.
GIVEN THE ABUNDANT GULF MOISTURE IN PLACE...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL
AND FLOODING WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH THE STRONGEST ACTIVITY...ALONG
WITH THE USUAL DAMAGING CONVECTIVE WIND THREAT.

SUNDAY INTO NEXT WEEK...THE RIDGE WILL GRADUALLY BUILD BACK INTO THE 
REGION AND THEN FLATTEN ONCE AGAIN AS A BROAD TROUGH SWINGS INTO THE 
UPPER GREAT LAKES BY MIDWEEK. INITIALLY...THE MOISTURE UNDERNEATH 
THIS RIDGE AND A WEAKER CAP WILL ALLOW FOR ISOLATED TO SCATTERED 
CONVECTION /ESPECIALLY ALONG THE MOUNTAINS AND PLATEAU/ EARLY IN THE 
WEEK. THEN...AS ADDITIONAL LIFT IS PROVIDED BY THE AFOREMENTIONED 
UPPER-TROUGH...MORE WIDESPREAD COVERAGE IS EXPECTED BY TUESDAY AND 
ESPECIALLY WEDNESDAY. THESE STORMS WILL HAVE THE POTENTIAL FOR 
PRODUCING LOCALIZED GUSTY/DAMAGING WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. 
TEMPERATURES DURING THIS TIME PERIOD WILL BE NEAR/AT NORMAL VALUES 
IN THE 85 TO 90 DEGREE RANGE IN MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS.

408 
FXUS64 KMRX 190749
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
349 AM EDT THU JUN 19 2014

.SHORT TERM...(THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT)...COLD FRONT OVER OHIO 
VALLEY TODAY WILL MOVE SOUTH AND EAST BY TONIGHT TO REACH THE MID 
ATLANTIC AND CENTRAL APPALACHIANS JUST NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
RING OF SHOWERS AND STORMS NOW OVER OHIO AND MID ATLANTIC COAST AND 
THEIR OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES SLOWLY SLIP SOUTH. AS A RESULT THERE WILL 
BE A LITTLE MORE COVERAGE NORTHEAST SECTIONS AS STORMS FORM OFF OF 
THE BOUNDARIES THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. AS AIR MASS BECOMES 
UNSTABLE SOME STORMS MAY BECOME STRONG WITH ISOLATED DAMAGING WINDS 
AND LARGE HAIL SIMILAR TO WEDNESDAY. THE EXCEPTION WILL BE A LITTLE 
BETTER CHANCE IN NORTHERN SECTIONS THAN IN THE SOUTH. FARTHER SOUTH 
COVERAGE WILL BE ISOLATED IN THE VALLEYS AND CHANCE MOUNTAINS AND 
PLATEAU. HIGHS SIMILAR TODAY BUT SLIGHTLY COOLER NORTHEAST. TONIGHT 
FOLLOWED CLOSER TO MET LOWS. SHOWERS AND STORMS SHOULD DECREASE AS 
SUN SETS WITH PATCHY FOG WHERE RAIN HAS FALLEN.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A LONG-WAVE UPPER TROUGH
OVER SOUTHEAST CANADA WILL HELP PULL A FRONT INTO THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHAINS FOR THIS WEEKEND AND WEAKENING UPPER RIDGE OVER THE
AREA. END RESULT WILL BE INCREASING COVERAGE OF MAINLY AFTERNOON
AND EVENING CONVECTION. AIRMASS WILL REMAIN MOIST AND UNSTABLE
THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH HIGH PW VALUES FOR SATURDAY...NEARLY 2
INCHES. FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS ARE
POSSIBLE WITH THE MAIN CONCERN BEING DAMAGING DOWNBURSTS WINDS...
TORRENTIAL RAINS AND FREQUENT LIGHTNING. LOCALIZED FLASH FLOODING
IS POSSIBLE.

QUASI-STATIONARY BOUNDARY WILL BE OVER THE AREA FOR SUNDAY AND
MONDAY BEFORE RETREATING NORTH. BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF SHOW ANOTHER
WAVE MOVING ACROSS THE MIDDLE OF THE NATION HELPING TO PULL
BOUNDARY BACK NORTH. HOWEVER...ANOTHER FRONTAL BOUNDARY MOVES INTO
THE AREA LATE TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. MEDIUM RANGE MODELS DIFFER
ON HOW FAR SOUTH BOUNDARY GOES. ANOTHER THREAT OF SEVERE WEATHER
POSSIBLE FOR TUESDAY AS FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND UPPER TROUGH MOVES
ACROSS THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS.

FXUS64 KMRX 181904
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
304 PM EDT WED JUN 18 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...DIURNAL THUNDERSTORMS
FORMED AS EXPECTED OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS...AND A COUPLE OF
STORMS BRIEFLY INTENSIFIED NEAR OAK RIDGE TN AND ALSO OVER CHEROKEE
COUNTY NC WITH SMALL HAIL AT MARBLE NC AROUND 215 PM.

THE STORMS ARE WEAKENING AND SMOKY MTN STORMS WILL BE MOVING
SLOWLY EAST AWAY FROM OUR AREA. HOWEVER...CUMBERLAND PLATEAU STORMS
HAD DRIFTED EAST PUSHING AN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY TOWARD THE SMOKY MTN
CONVECTION. GIVEN THE FEW MORE HOURS OF HEAT AND THESE OUTFLOW
BOUNDARIES...I OPTED TO CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE EVENING
HOURS OVER ALL BUT THE SRN VALLEY COUNTIES OF E TN. 

OTHERWISE...NO CHANGES MADE OVERALL FOR TONIGHT WITH PATCHY FOG
LATE. COVERAGE OF SHOWERS AND STORMS TOMORROW SHOULD BE SLIGHTLY
GREATER OVER SW VA AND EXTREME NRN PARTS OF EAST TN...AS THE OHIO
RIVER VALLY FRONTAL BOUNDARY SAGS SOUTH A BIT CLOSER.

MOS MINS CLOSELY FOLLOWED FOR TONIGHT. I DID NUDGE THURSDAY MAX
TEMPS DOWN A COUPLE OF DEGREES OR SO...ESPECIALLY OVER SW VA AND
NE TN WHERE MORE CONVECTIVE CLOUDINESS IS LIKELY.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SUMMER REGIME SEEMS 
TO BE IN PLACE. THE UPPER RIDGE OVER THE EASTERN U.S. WILL 
TRANSITION FARTHER WEST AS SHORTWAVE TROUGHS MOVE ACROSS THE GREAT 
LAKES REGION/OHIO VALLEY. LOOK FOR DIURNAL CONVECTION TO SLOWLY 
DISSIPATE THURSDAY AFTERNOON WITH A FEW LINGERING INTO THE OVERNIGHT 
HOURS PERHAPS ACROSS SW VA. TOUGH TO FORECAST THE MOVEMENT/LOCATION 
OF THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY FRIDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND. HOWEVER 
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE OVER THE 
WEEKEND WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES OCCURRING ON SATURDAY AFTERNOON 
PARTICULARLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF SW VA AND NE TN. CONFIDENCE IS 
LOW ON THE EXACT LOCATION SINCE FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS NOT WELL HANDLED 
BY THE MODELS. SCATTERED AFTERNOON CONVECTION LOOKS LIKE A GOOD BET 
THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK AS THE UPPER RIDGE FLATTENS OUT BY 
THE WEEKEND.

TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. LOOK 
FOR SOME BRIEF RELIEF OVER THE WEEKEND IF STORMS MATERIALIZE SINCE 
THICKER CLOUD COVER SHOULD INHIBIT TOO MUCH WARMING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EDT WED JUN 18 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SKIES ARE MOSTLY CLEAR TONIGHT 
WITH TEMPERATURES IN THE MID TO UPPER 60S MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST TO 
THE LOWER TO MID 70S CENTRAL AND SOUTH. SOME PATCHY FOG HAD FORMED 
BUT WAS NOT WIDESPREAD. SURFACE HIGH TO REMAIN OVER THE REGION 
TODAY...WITH A MOSTLY SUNNY DAY AGAIN. TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE VERY 
SIMILAR TO TUESDAY LOWER TO MID 90S LOWER ELEVATIONS SOUTH AND NEAR 
90 TO LOWER 90S NORTH LOWER ELEVATIONS. DID NOT CHANGE EITHER HIGHS 
TODAY OR LOWS TONIGHT MUCH AS MAV GUIDANCE LOOKS ABOUT RIGHT. A FEW 
ISOLATED STORMS MAY DEVELOP ACROSS WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA...HIGHER 
EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND CUMBERLAND PLATEAU IN TENNESSEE LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY COMBINE WITH  
OROGRAPHIC LIFT. A FEW STORMS MAY BE COME STRONG WITH HIGH WINDS AND 
HAIL. STORMS EXPECTED TO DIE DOWN EARLY EVENING WITH MOSTLY CLEAR 
CONDITIONS TONIGHT AS CLOUD COVER DISSIPATES. CLEAR CONDITIONS WILL 
ALSO ALLOW FOR SOME PATCHY FOG ALONG LAKES. ADDED FOG AGAIN TO THE 
ZONES LATE TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...
A LONG-WAVE UPPER TROUGH WILL DEEPEN ACROSS SOUTHEAST CANADA/
NORTHEAST UNITED STATES. THIS TROUGH WILL PULL A FRONT SOUTH INTO
THE CENTRAL/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WITH THE BOUNDARY NEAR/OVER
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. WILL HAVE GREATER CHANCES OF CONVECTION ACROSS
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST TENNESSEE.

PERSISTENT UPPER RIDGING WILL CONTINUE TO SURPRESS CONVECTIVE
DEVELOPMENT CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN KEEPING CHANCES OF THUNDERSTORMS
LOW.

FOR THIS WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK...ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH MOVES
ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES PULLING A FRONT SOUTH TOWARD THE AREA AND
WEAKENING UPPER RIDGE OVER THE AREA. HIGH CHANCE POPS AREA-WIDE.

FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW A FAIRLY UNSTABLE AIRMASS FOR SATURDAY
THROUGH MONDAY...SO MORE ORGANIZED STRONG TO POSSIBLE SEVERE STORMS
ARE POSSIBLE. MAIN CONCERN BEING DAMAGING DOWNBURSTS WINDS...
HEAVY RAINS AND FREQUENT LIGHTNING.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...FOLLOWED MOS CLOSELY FOR THURSDAY AND
FRIDAY...BUT WENT A DEGREE OR TWO COOLER THAN MAXIMUM TEMPERATURE
GUIDANCE DUE TO EXPECTED INCREASE COVERAGE OF STORMS AND CLOUDS.
