390 
FXUS64 KMRX 171833
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
233 PM EDT TUE JUN 17 2014

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY/...
A SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE REMAINS ENTRENCHED OVER THE REGION
JUST OVER THE NORTH CAROLINA/GEORGIA BORDER...WHICH HAS PROMOTED A
MOSTLY SUNNY DAY ONCE AGAIN. TEMPERATURES ARE RUNNING A COUPLE OF
DEGREES WARMER THAN THEY WERE YESTERDAY AT THIS TIME AT 2 PM EDT
AND SHOULD CLIMB INTO THE 90 TO 95 DEGREE RANGE ACROSS THE ENTIRE
VALLEY REGION BY LATE THIS AFTERNOON. THESE WARMER TEMPERATURES
ALOFT HAVE HELPED TO STRENGTH THE CAP...AND AS A RESULT CONVECTION
HAS BEEN MUCH SLOWER TO DEVELOP TODAY...WITH MOSTLY SCT
SHALLOW/FLAT CU ACROSS THE REGION. A FEW ISOLATED STORMS MAY STILL
DEVELOP ACROSS WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA AND THE MOUNTAINS LATE THIS
AFTERNOON AND EVENING...THANKS TO SOME OROGRAPHIC LIFT AND THE
MOISTURE IN PLACE...BUT THEY WILL BE VERY UNORGANIZED AND REMAIN
OVER THE TERRAIN.

MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS SHOULD PREVAIL TONIGHT AS CLOUD COVER
DISSIPATES...BUT THE CALM/CLEAR CONDITIONS WILL ALSO ALLOW FOR SOME
PATCHY FOG ALONG THE LAKES ONCE AGAIN...SO HAVE ADDED THIS TO THE
ZONES LATE TONIGHT. WEDNESDAY WILL GENERALLY BE A CARBON COPY OF
TODAY AS THE RIDGE FURTHER BECOMES ENTRENCHED OVER THE REGION AND
THICKNESS VALUES AND TEMPERATURES ALOFT REMAIN STEADY. THIS WILL
RESULT IN ANOTHER MOSTLY SUNNY DAY WITH TEMPERATURES RUNNING
REACHING THE 90 TO 95 DEGREE PLATEAU ONCE AGAIN. THUS...CONVECTION
WILL BE LIMITED TO BEING MOSTLY ISOLATED IN NATURE AND CONFINED TO
THE MOUNTAINS AND PLATEAU.

.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY/...
THE TREND OVER THE LONG TERM PERIOD WILL BE FOR THE RIDGE OVER THE 
SE CONUS TO BREAK DOWN AND RETROGRADE...WHICH WILL ALLOW FOR 
DISTURBANCES IN THE WESTERLY FLOW ALOFT TO AFFECT THE AREA. WE 
SHOULD ALSO BE A GRADUAL COOLING TREND TO TEMPERATURES AS WELL 
THROUGH THE PERIOD. 

WITH THE RIDGE REMAINING IN PLACE...CHANCES OF SHOWERS/TSTMS SHOULD 
BE MAINLY DIURNALLY-DRIVEN ON THURSDAY. BY FRIDAY THE RETREATING 
RIDGE AND THE RESULTING NW MIDLEVEL FLOW WILL BRING UPSTREAM VORT 
MAXES TO CROSS NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA...SUPPORTING OVERNIGHT 
CHANCE POPS NORTH. THE CONTINUED SUPPRESSION OF THE RIDGE WILL 
EXPAND CHANCE POPS SOUTHWARD...COVERING THE ENTIRE AREA BY SATURDAY. 
PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES RISE TO AROUND THE 1.5 INCH MARK...WITH 
VERY LITTLE IN THE WAY OF CAPPING. THERE COULD BE SOME POTENTIAL FOR 
ISOLATED FLOODING...BUT THE THREAT OF ORGANIZED SEVERE STORMS LOOKS 
LOW. THIS PATTERN WILL CONTINUE INTO TUESDAY. FINER DETAILS OF 
UPSTREAM MCVS ARE UNCLEAR THIS FAR OUT...BUT THERE WILL BE THE 
POTENTIAL FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EACH DAY AND NIGHT.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             71  94  70  93 /  10  10  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  68  93  69  92 /  10  10  10  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       69  93  68  93 /  10  10  10  30

INVERSION. AS A RESULT...DO NOT EXCEPT MUCH IN THE WAY OF

HIGHER EASTERN MOUNTAINS AS MAIN FORCING IS OROGRAPHIC.  THURSDAY 
THROUGH SATURDAY CHANCE OF STORMS HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE EASTERN

ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS POSSIBLE EACH DAY WITH THE MAIN CONCERN BEING 
HIGH WINDS...AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS. 

BY SATURDAY AND ESPECIALLY SUNDAY UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES THE GREAT 
LAKES WHICH SUPPRESSES THE UPPER RIDGE. A BETTER CHANCE OF STORMS 
WILL OCCUR SUNDAY INTO MONDAY AS A COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE OHIO 
VALLEY SUNDAY AND THEN GETS CLOSE TO THE TN VALLEY MONDAY. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE ABOVE NORMAL IN THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER TO

846 
FXUS64 KMRX 161853
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 PM EDT MON JUN 16 2014

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND TUESDAY/...
A SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE REMAINS IN PLACE...JUST TO THE EAST OF 
THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON...WHICH HAS PROMOTED A MOSTLY SUNNY DAY 
WITH EVEN WARMER TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S IN SOME 
SPOTS AS OF 2:30 PM CDT. THE WEAK SOUTHWEST FLOW HAS ALSO ALLOWED 
FOR SOME GULF MOISTURE TO GET UNDERNEATH THIS RIDGE WHICH WILL ALLOW 
FOR SOME ISOLATED TO PERHAPS SCATTERED STORMS ALONG THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. MOST OF THIS ACTIVITY SO 
FAR HAS DEVELOPED EAST OF THE MOUNTAIN IN NORTHERN GEORGIA AND 
WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA...AND WITH THE WEAK STEERING FLOW BEING FROM 
THE SOUTHWEST...AM NOT EXPECTING THIS ACTIVITY TO CROSS THE 
MOUNTAINS INTO EAST TENNESSEE. STILL SOME DEVELOPMENT MAY OCCUR WEST 
OF THE MOUNTAINS...SO HAVE LOW-END CHANCE POPS FOR OUR MOUNTAIN 
ZONES THROUGH 00Z THIS EVENING. SOME ISOLATED STRONG STORMS WILL BE 
POSSIBLE AND MAINLY BE CAPABLE OF PRODUCING SOME BRIEF GUSTY WINDS 
AND HEAVY DOWNPOURS. 

TUESDAY WILL GENERALLY BE A CARBON COPY OF TODAY AS THE RIDGE 
FURTHER BECOMES ENTRENCHED OVER THE REGION AND THICKNESS VALUES AND 
TEMPERATURES ALOFT INCREASE SLIGHTLY. THIS WILL RESULT IN ANOTHER 
MOSTLY SUNNY DAY WITH TEMEPRATURES RUNNING A DEGREE OR SO HIGHER 
THAN TODAY IN THE LOWER 90S ACROSS NEARLY ALL OF THE EAST TENNESSEE 
VALLEY. THE CAP MAY ACTUALLY BE A LITTLE STRONGER TOMORROW WHICH 
WILL LIMIT CONVECTION TO BEING MOSTLY ISOLATED IN NATURE AND 
CONFINED TO THE MOUNTAINS AND PLATEAU ONCE AGAIN. HOWEVER...GIVEN 
THE MOISTURE IN PLACE...FELT CHANCE POPS WAS WARRANTED FOR THE 
TERRAIN ONCE AGAIN GIVEN THE ENHANCED OROGRAPHIC LIFT THERE. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...A RIDGE OF HIGH
PRESSURE BOTH SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL REMAIN THROUGH FRIDAY. AIRMASS
WILL CONTINUE TO BE MOIST AND UNSTABLE WITH MAINLY AFTERNOON AND
EVENING CONVECTION EXPECTED EACH DAY. MAIN FORCING WILL BE
OROGRAPHIC...SO MAINLY ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. SOUNDING SHOW
STRONG TO ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS POSSIBLE EACH DAY WITH THE MAIN
CONCERN BEING PULSE SEVERE DOWNBURSTS WINDS...HAIL UP TO QUARTER
SIZE...LOCALLY HEAVY RAIN AND FREQUENT LIGHTNING.

FOR THIS WEEKEND...AN UPPER TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES
HELPING TO FLATTEN THE UPPER RIDGE OVER THE AREA. THE FLATTEN RIDGE
WILL ALLOW FOR A BETTER CHANCE OF STORMS AND GREATER COVERAGE.
FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION EARLY NEXT WEEK.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             69  93  70  93 /  10  10  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  67  92  68  91 /  10  10  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       66  92  68  92 /  10  10  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              64  90  64  90 /  20  20  10  10

760 
FXUS64 KMRX 161355 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
955 AM EDT MON JUN 16 2014

.DISCUSSION...
AN UPPER-LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE REMAINS IN PLACE DIRECTLY OVER
THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...AND WILL PROMOTE MOSTLY TO PARTLY SUNNY
CONDITIONS...AND EVEN WARMER TEMPERATURES. HIGHER THICKNESS VALUES
AND 850/700 MB TEMPS RUNNING ABOUT 1 DEGREE CELSIUS WARMER THAN
YESTERDAY WILL ALLOW HIGHS TO CLIMB INTO THE UPPER 80S TO AROUND 90
DEGREES ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...AND THE LOW TO MID 90S OVER A
GOOD PORTION OF THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN TENNESSEE VALLEY TODAY.
HOWEVER...WITH THE MOISTURE UNDERNEATH THIS RIDGE...SCATTERED CLOUD
COVER WILL DEVELOP BY THE AFTERNOON...AND ESPECIALLY ALONG THE
MOUNTAINS. CONVECTION WILL BEGIN TO INITIATE ALONG THE TERRAIN OF
THE EAST TENNESSEE/WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA MOUNTAINS LATER THIS
AFTERNOON...AND LINGER INTO THE EVENING HOURS. HOWEVER...MOST MODEL
GUIDANCE /INCLUDING THE HRRR/ INDICATE ISOLATED TO WIDELY SCATTERED
ACTIVITY...AND WILL MAINLY BE CONFINED TO THE TERRAIN OF THE
PLATEAU AND MOUNTAINS. AS A RESULT...MOST AREAS WILL REMAIN DRY
ONCE AGAIN. BUT...HAVE INCREASED POPS TO LOW-END CHANCE ALONG THE
TERRAIN THIS AFTERNOON TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS COVERAGE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

315 AM EDT MON JUN 16 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WARMER DAY TODAY WITH DEWPOINTS

PRESENTLY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...STRONG RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL BE CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN U.S. TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY.  
THIS WILL BRING SOUTHERLY WINDS AND WARM AIR INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION.  EXPECT HOT SUMMERLIKE LIKE TEMPERATURES EARLY 
IN THE EXTENDED AS HIGHS CLIMB INTO THE UPPER 80S AND 90S ACROSS 
MUCH OF THE TN VALLEY. THE SOUTH WINDS WILL ALSO CARRY IN LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE WHICH WILL AID DEVELOPMENT OF DIURNAL CONVECTION.  MUCH OF 
THIS ACTIVITY WILL DEVELOP DURING THE LATE AFTERNOON AND EVENING 
HOURS AND BE CONFINED TO HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  THE RIDGE WILL DAMPEN A 
BIT AND SHIFT WEST LATE IN THE PERIOD PUTTING US UNDER WEAK 
NORTHWEST FLOW.  THIS MAY ALLOW FOR VERY SLIGHTLY COOLER 
TEMPERATURES BUT WILL ALSO PROVIDE AN INCREASE IN COVERAGE AND 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AND MAY SEE SOME ORGANIZED 
CONVECTION.

.AVIATION...MOSTLY VFR CONDITIONS TO PREVAIL. VCTS IN AT TRI THIS
AFTERNOON.

556 
FXUS64 KMRX 151853
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 PM EDT SUN JUN 15 2014

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY/...HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN
OVER THE REGION WITH LOW LEVEL FLOW FROM THE SOUTH. PLENTY OF
MOISTURE WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA THROUGH THE WEEK...WITH DIURNAL
CONVECTION POSSIBLE EACH DAY. EXPECTING THE MAIN DEVELOPMENT ALONG
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS IN THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND
PLATEAU...WITH MOVEMENT INTO THE VALLEY IN THE LATE AFTERNOON.
TEMPERATURES WILL FOLLOW A GRADUAL WARMING TREND...WITH HIGHS A FEW
DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.

.LONG TERM /MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY/...

AN UPPER-RIDGE WILL REMAIN THE DOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE ACROSS THE 
REGION FOR THIS WEEK...PROMOTING MOSTLY TO PARTY SUNNY AND WARM 
TYPICAL SUMMER-LIKE CONDITIONS. THIS RIDGE WILL CONTINUE BUILDING 
DIRECTLY OVERHEAD FOR TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...WHICH WILL INCREASE 
THICKNESS VALUES/TEMPERATURES ALOFT. AS A RESULT...HIGHS IN THE 
LOWER 90S WILL BE COMMON AREAWIDE THROUGH THURSDAY...WITH SOME 
LOCATIONS OVER THE SOUTHERN VALLEY REACHING THE MID 90S. MOISTURE 
UNDERNEATH THIS RIDGE WILL ALSO ALLOW FOR ISOLATED TO PERHAPS 
SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING EACH 
DAY. HOWEVER...THE WARM TEMPS ALOFT/CAPPING INVERSION WILL HELP TO 
LIMIT THIS DEVELOPMENT SOMEWHAT AND PRIMARILY KEEP THEM CONFINED TO 
THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU. 

LATE IN THE WEEK THE CENTER OF THE HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL SINK TO 
THE SOUTH AND WEST WHICH WILL ALLOW FOR SOME SLIGHTLY COOLER 
TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S...AS WELL AS A BETTER 
SHOT FOR SOME MORE WIDESPREAD DIURNAL CONVECTION. THUS...HAVE 
SCATTERED/CHANCE POPS AREAWIDE DURING IN THIS TIME PERIOD IN THE 
AFTERNOON/EVENING. ALSO...THIS WEEKEND SOME ADDITIONAL ACTIVITY 
ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY COULD MOVE SOUTH INTO THE REGION /ESPECIALLY  
INTO THE NORTHEAST ZONES/ AS NORTHWEST ALOFT ALOFT BEGINS TO TAKE 
SHAPE ALONG THE NORTHEASTERN EDGE OF THIS RIDGE. THE UNORGANIZED 
NATURE OF THIS CONVECTION WILL NOT WARRANT MUCH IN THE WAY OF SEVERE 
WEATHER CONCERNS...THOUGH THE INSTABILITY/MOISTURE PRESENT WILL 
ALLOW FOR SOME STRONG MULTICELL CLUSTERS CAPABLE OF GUSTY WINDS AND 
HEAVY RAINFALL. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             68  91  68  92 /  20  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  67  89  66  91 /  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       67  89  66  91 /  10  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              63  87  64  89 /  10  20  10  10

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WE ARE RIDGED IN AND AS A RESULT

THE PLATEAU. OTHERWISE...SOME PATCHY FOG NEAR LAKES THIS MORNING IS
POSSIBLE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...AN UPPER RIDGE WILL DOMINATE 
AREA WEATHER THROUGH MUCH OF THE EXTENDED.  THIS WILL BRING 
SUMMERLIKE LIKE TEMPERATURES AS HIGHS REACH INTO THE UPPER 80S AND 
90S ACROSS MUCH OF THE TN VALLEY.  ADDITIONALLY...SOUTHERLY WINDS 
WILL CARRY MOISTURE INTO THE REGION.  THIS COMBINED WITH THE STRONG 
DIURNAL HEATING WILL GENERATE ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION... 
MAINLY DURING THE LATE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS AND MAINLY OVER 
HIGHER TERRAIN.  THIS PATTERN WILL CONTINUE THROUGH AT LEAST 
THURSDAY.  THE RIDGE AXIS SHIFTS WEST AROUND THE FRIDAY/SATURDAY 
TIME FRAME.  THIS WILL ALLOW FOR INCREASED COVERAGE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS AND THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME ORGANIZED CONVECTION.

DEW POINT NOW DROPPING INTO THE MID 40S. THINK THE WIND WILL BE
DEAD OVERNIGHT...SO LITTLE IN THE WAY OF SURFACE MOIST
ADVECTION...SO TAKING OUT THE 5SM BR THAT HAD BEEN IN PREVIOUSLY.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

954 
FXUS64 KMRX 141909
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
309 PM EDT SAT JUN 14 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL
REMAIN ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHAINS. MODELS DO SHOW A GRADUAL
INCREASE IN BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY. RADAR IS
SHOWING SOME WEAK SHOWERS TRY TO DEVELOP OVER SOUTHWEST NORTH
CAROLINA. THIS ACTIVITY WILL CONTINUE TO DEVELOP/INCREASE THIS
AFTERNOON...THEN DIMINISH LATE THIS EVENING.

CALM WINDS AND MOSTLY CLEAR SKY WILL ALLOW FOR GOOD RADATIONAL
COOLING OVERNIGHT WITH PATCHY FOG DEVELOPING...MAINLY NEAR AREA
LAKES AND STREAM AND OVER SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA.

FOR SUNDAY...OVERALL MOSTLY SUNNY/WARMER FOR THE VALLEY...BUT
OROGRAPHIC LIFT AND INCREASING INSTABILITY WILL ALLOW WIDELY
SCATTERED/SCATTERED STORMS TO DEVELOP OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

.LONG TERM /SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY/...

AN UPPER-RIDGE WILL REMAIN THE DOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE ACROSS THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR MOST OF THE WEEK 
AHEAD...PROMOTING MOSTLY TO PARTY SUNNY AND WARM TYPICAL SUMMER-LIKE 
CONDITIONS FOR MID-JUNE. THIS RIDGE WILL BUILD DIRECTLY OVERHEAD 
THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK...WHICH WILL INCREASE THICKNESS 
VALUES/TEMEPRATURES ALOFT. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL CLIMB INTO THE LOW 
90S IN MANY LOCATIONS...AND PREHAPS THE MID 90S OVER PORTIONS OF THE 
SOUTHERN VALLEY FOR A COUPLE OF DAYS. SOME MOISTURE WILL EXIST 
UNDERNEATH THIS RIDGE WHICH WILL ALLOW FOR SOME ISOLATED TO PREHAPS 
SCATTERED CONVECTION DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING EACH DAY. 
HOWEVER...GIVEN THE WARM TEMPERATURES/STRONG CAP ALOFT... THIS 
ACTIVITY SHOULD MAINLY STAY CONFINED TO THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE 
EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS/PLATEAU...WITH MANY VALLEY AREAS STAYING 
DRY. 

LATER ON IN THE WEEK...THE CENTER OF THE RIDGE WILL RETROGRADE 
WEST WHICH WILL PLACE THE AREA UNDER A MORE NORTHWESTERLY FLOW 
ALOFT. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR A GREATER COVERAGE OF DIURNAL 
CONVECTION...AS WELL AS SOME ADDITIONAL ACTIVITY ACROSS THE OHIO 
VALLEY TO MOVE SOUTH INTO THE REGION /ESPECAILLY INTO THE NORTHEAST 
ZONES/. GIVEN THIS...HAVE CHANCE POPS AREAWIDE FOR THE LATER HALF OF 
THE WEEK. THE UNORGANIZED NATURE OF THIS CONVECTION WILL ALSO NOT 
WARRENT MUCH IN THE WAY OF SEVERE WEATHER CONCERNS...THOUGH THE 
INSTABLITY/MOISTURE PRESENT WILL ALLOW FOR SOME STRONG MULTICELL 
CLUSTERS CAPABLE OF GUSTY WINDS AND HEAVY RAINFALL. LATE IN THE 
PERIOD...A DEEPER UPPER-TROUGH WILL APPROACH THE GREAT LAKES/OHIO 
VALLEY AND PERHAPS GIVE THE REGION A BETTER SHOT OF ORGANIZED STORMS 
AND PRECIPITATION CHANCES HEADING INTO THE WEEKEND. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             64  90  68  91 /  10  20  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  62  88  67  90 /  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       60  89  67  90 /  10  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              54  88  64  87 /   0  10  10  10 

&&

MOISTURE.  THIS COMBINED WITH STRONG DIURNAL HEATING WILL ALLOW FOR 
LATE DAY DIURNAL CONVECTION TO DEVELOP...CONVECTION SHOULD REMAIN 
ISOLATED WITH BEST CHANCES OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  THE WEATHER PATTERN 
WILL CHANGE LITTLE THROUGH THE PERIOD...THOUGH THE RIDGE DOES DAMPEN 
AND BROADEN AT TIMES ACROSS THE REGION.  THIS WILL ALLOW MOISTURE TO 
CONTINUE TO BE PULLED IN...WEAKLY DESTABILIZED THE AIR MASS AND 
ALLOWING DIURNAL DRIVEN CONVECTION TO DEVELOP EACH DAY.  AN 
APPROACHING COLD FRONT MAY HELP ORGANIZE CONVECTION OVER THE AREA BY 
FRIDAY.  AS FOR TEMPERATURES...IT WILL BE A WARM WEEK WITH HIGHS 
REACHING INTO THE UPPER 80S AND 90S ACROSS MANY VALLEY LOCATIONS.

FXUS64 KMRX 131852
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
252 PM EDT FRI JUN 13 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS
A WEAK COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE WESTERN SLOPES OF THE CUMBERLAND
PLATEAU...WITH SCATTERED CONVECTION OCCURRING AHEAD OF IT OVER THE
FORECAST AREA. AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL HELP TO PUSH THIS FRONTAL
BOUNDARY THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...WITH MOST OF THE
CONVECTION EXPECTED TO DISSIPATE SHORTLY AFTER SUNSET. WITH CLEAR
SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS DEVELOPING BEHIND THE FRONTAL PASSAGE...EXPECT
AREAS OF FOG TO DEVELOP OVER THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA LATER TONIGHT.
MODELS INDICATE THAT A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL DEVELOP
OVER THE SMOKIES AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA DURING THE AFTERNOON
ON SATURDAY...SO WILL MENTION ISOLATED CONVECTION IN THESE AREAS. AS
FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR
TONIGHT AND SATURDAY...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...SOME UPPER-RIDGING WILL
CONTINUE TO BUILD INTO THE REGION FOR SUNDAY INTO MOST OF NEXT WEEK...
WHICH WILL PROMOTE MOSTLY TO PARTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS AND A WARMING
TREND THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK. HIGHS WILL CLIMB FROM THE MID TO
UPPER 80S ON SUNDAY TO THE LOWER 90S IN MANY AREAS BY TUESDAY AND
WEDNESDAY...THANKS TO INCREASED THICKNESS VALUES/TEMPERATURES ALOFT...
AS THE RIDGE BUILDS IN DIRECTLY OVER EAST TENNESSEE. DURING THIS
TIME...SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT WILL HELP TO TRANSPORT GULF MOISTURE
INTO THE AREA AS WELL. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR SOME OPPORTUNITIES FOR
SOME ISOLATED TO SCATTERED DIURNALLY DRIVEN CONVECTION ACROSS THE
REGION EACH DAY NEXT WEEK...PARTICULARLY ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN
OF THE EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. AS SUCH...
HAVE INCREASED POPS IN THOSE AREAS TO CHANCE...BUT HAVE KEPT VALLEY
LOCATIONS ISOLATED. AS IS USUALLY THE CASE...THIS CONVECTION WILL
BE UNORGANIZED. SO...OTHER THAN SOME LOCALIZED GUSTY WINDS...AM NOT
EXPERIENCING ANY SEVERE WEATHER THREAT ATTM. LATE IN THE PERIOD...A
DEEPER UPPER-TROUGH WILL APPROACH THE GREAT LAKES/OHIO VALLEY AND
PERHAPS GIVE THE REGION A BETTER SHOT OF ORGANIZED STORMS AND
PRECIPITATION CHANCES LATE IN THE WORK WEEK.

WILL DAMPEN AND BROADEN OVER THE AREA EARLY IN THE WEEK AND CONTINUE 
TO ALLOW LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TO RETURN AND PROVIDE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ON MONDAY.  REMNANTS OF A WEAKENING COLD 
FRONT WILL SLIDE IN ON TUESDAY...INCREASING CONVECTION TO SCATTERED 
COVERAGE.  THE UPPER RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE CENTRAL U.S. ON WEDNESDAY 
BRINGING A WEAK BOUNDARY STRETCHED TO OUR NORTH FOR BETTER CHANCE OF 
THUNDERSTORMS NORTH.  CONTINUED UNSETTLE PATTERN THROUGH THURSDAY 
WITH ANOTHER CHANGE OF THUNDERSTORMS.

&&

PATCHY BR THIS MORNING. RAIN EXPECTED TO MOVE IN FROM THE WEST
DURING THE FIRST HALF OF THE DAY...MOVE OUT THIS EVENING. TAFS

FXUS64 KMRX 121847
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
247 PM EDT THU JUN 12 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE 
AREA WILL EXIT TO THE EAST TONIGHT. A SHORT WAVE TROUGH AND SURFACE 
COLD FRONT WILL PUSH ACROSS THE AREA DURING FRIDAY.  CONVECTION 
SHOULD WANE THIS EVENING...BUT ADDITIONAL CONVECTION EXPECTED TO 
MOVE IN DURING FRIDAY...PERHAPS EVEN LATE TONIGHT OVER WESTERN 
ZONES.  GIVEN TIME OF DAY OF ARRIVAL OF CONVECTION AS WELL AS THE 
LACK OF FAVORABLE WIND FIELDS...SEVERE THREAT DOES NOT LOOK HIGH AT 
THIS POINT WITH THESE STORMS. WILL CARRY LIKELY POPS ALL BUT 
NORTHEAST ZONES FOR FRIDAY...WITH DIMINISHING POPS BY LATE 
AFTERNOON. MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE OVERALL SO WILL STAY CLOSE.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)... A SECONDARY UPPER-
SHORTWAVE WILL PUSH EAST OF THE REGION FRIDAY NIGHT...BRINGING IN A
BRIEF BOUT OF SLIGHTLY COOLER AND DRIER AIR FOR SATURDAY. SOME
UPPER-RIDGING WILL ALSO BEGIN TO OCCUR WHICH WILL PROMOTE MOSTLY
SUNNY CONDITIONS IN MANY AREAS FOR THE WEEKEND...WITH A WARMING
TREND BY SUNDAY AS HIGHS PUSH INTO THE MID 80S TO AROUND 90 DEGREES
IN MOST LOCATIONS. PRECIPITATION WILL BE ISOLATED AND DIURNAL IN
NATURE...AND GENERALLY FAVOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE EAST
TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. THIS RIDGE AXIS WILL
REMAIN JUST TO THE EAST OF THE REGION FOR MOST OF THE WEEK
AHEAD...ALLOWING FOR SOME GULF MOISTURE TO ADVECT BACK INTO THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY. THIS WILL INCREASE THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME
SCATTERED DIURNALLY GIVEN THUNDERSTORMS EACH DAY...ALONG WITH
TYPICAL EARLY SUMMER-LIKE TEMPERATURES IN THE MID TO UPPER 80S EACH
AFTERNOON...WITH PARTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS. AS IS USUALLY THE
CASE...THIS CONVECTION WILL BE UNORGANIZED. SO...OTHER THAN SOME
LOCALIZED GUSTY WINDS...AM NOT EXPERIENCING ANY SEVERE WEATHER
THREAT ATTM. LATE IN THE PERIOD...A DEEPER UPPER-TROUGH WILL
APPROACH THE GREAT LAKES/OHIO VALLEY AND PERHAPS GIVEN THE REGION A
BETTER SHOT OF ORGANIZED STORMS AND PRECIPITATION CHANCES LATE IN
THE WORK WEEK.

334 
FXUS64 KMRX 120734
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 AM EDT THU JUN 12 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...EASTERN STATES TROUGH CONTINUES TO 
SHIFT VERY SLOWLY EAST BUT WILL STILL BE A MAJOR PLAYER IN TODAY'S 
WEATHER FOR THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. TROPICAL MOISTURE WILL 
CONTINUE TO STREAM ACROSS THE REGION TODAY. MODELS PROG SUFFICIENT 
INSTABILITY TO KEEP MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS IN THE FORECAST. 
CONVECTION SHOULD REMAIN NON-SEVERE ACROSS THE REGION TODAY ALTHOUGH 
SLOW MOVING SHOWERS OR STORMS HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO PRODUCE HEAVY 
DOWNPOURS DUE TO RELATIVELY SLOW MOVEMENT IN DEEP MOIST ENVIRONMENT. 
STAYED CLOSE TO A GUIDANCE BLEND FOR MAX TEMPS TODAY WITH EASTERN 
SECTIONS REMAINING A DEGREE OR TWO COOLER ON AVERAGE UNDER MORE 
PERSISTENT CLOUD COVER WHILE WESTERN SECTIONS ENJOY A LITTLE MORE IN 
THE WAY OF INSOLATION. WENT ABOUT ONE TO TWO DEGREES ABOVE SUGGESTED 
MINS WHICH LOOKED OPTIMISTICALLY COOL IN THE RATHER HUMID AIRMASS 
PRESENT OVER THE REGION.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...AT THE BEGINNING OF THIS 
PERIOD THE UPPER TROUGH IS STILL IN THE AREA BUT SWEEPING 
EASTWARD...AND A COLD FRONT SHOULD BE APPROACHING THE AREA.  DURING 
THE DAY ON FRIDAY...THE COLD FRONT AND AN UPPER SHORT WAVE WILL BE 
SWEEPING THROUGH THE AREA...WOULD THINK THERE WOULD BE A DECENT 
CHANCE AT A LINE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO MARCH THROUGH THE 
AREA...BUT DEVELOPING LEE TROUGH EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS WILL BE 
INDUCING MORE OF A WESTERLY PRE-FRONTAL WIND OVER OUR AREA...THEREBY 
REDUCING THE FOCUS ALONG THE FRONT...SO KEEPING POPS MAINLY IN 
CHANCE CATEGORY. 
 
BY SATURDAY...FRONT IS THROUGH THE AREA...THE UPPER TROUGH HAS MOVE 
AWAY TO THE EAST AND THE UPPER RIDGE IS BUILDING IN...SO KEEPING 
SATURDAY DRY.  ALSO KEEPING DRY FOR SATURDAY NIGHT...THEN LETTING 
SOME POPS BACK INTO THE EASTERN AND SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA AS 
THE SYSTEM ALONG THE GULF BEGINS TO SPREAD MOISTURE BACK TOWARD THE 
AREA FROM THE SOUTHEAST.  BY MONDAY MOISTURE IS BACK IN THE 
AREA...BUT NO ORGANIZED LIFT WILL BE IN THE AREA...WILL ONLY GO WITH 
SLIGHT POPS FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT.  BY TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY...LOOKS LIKE DEEPER MOISTURE AND SOME WEAK LIFT WILL BE 
MOVING IN...SO PUMPING UP POPS TO CHANCE CATEGORY FOR DAY...AND 
SLIGHT CHANCE AT NIGHT AS DIURNAL HEATING GETS BETTER COVERAGE OF 
SHOWERS/STORMS.  FOR TEMPERATURES...WENT CLOSE TO GUIDANCE IN MOST 
PERIODS...BUT TRIMMED BACK FAIRLY HOT MAX TEMPS BY 2-3 DEG TOWARD 
THE END OF THE PERIOD WHEN THE MOISTURE GETS DEEPER.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EDT WED JUN 11 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A RIVER OF MOIST AIR WILL CONTINUE 
TO FLOW NORTH FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO TODAY AND TONIGHT DUE TO THE 
POSITION OF AN UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER THE MIDWEST. A COUPLE OF SHORTER 
WAVELENGTH FEATURES WILL RIDE NORTHEAST INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS GENERATING SCATTERED SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS 
MAINLY TODAY. HOWEVER THERE WILL STILL BE A FEW SHOWERS EXITING 
ACROSS THE EASTERN PART OF THE VIEWING AREA TONIGHT. STAYED CLOSER 
TO THE LOWER MET MOS MAXES TODAY WHILE EDGING ABOUT A DEGREE ABOVE 
THE MILDEST GUIDANCE FOR MINS TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...THE SLOW-MOVING MID/UPPER 
LEVEL TROUGH AXIS WILL BE DIRECTLY OVER THE AREA TO START THE 
PERIOD. THIS WILL PLACE HIGHEST RAIN CHANCES...IN THE LIKELY 
RANGE...FOR THE EASTERN HALF OF THE AREA. A WEAK RIDGE BETWEEN 
SYSTEMS MOVES THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT...LOWERING POPS TO LOW TO 
SLIGHT CHANCES BEFORE RISING AGAIN ON FRIDAY IN ASSOCIATION WITH AN 
APPROACHING COLD FRONT AND LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM THAT DEVELOPS ON THE 
FRONT TO OUR SW. MODELS DIFFER ON THE POSITION OF THE FRONT THROUGH 
THE WEEKEND...SO CONFIDENCE BEYOND FRIDAY IS LOW. WITH THE FRONT 
EXPECTED TO BE SOMEWHERE IN THE VICINITY...WILL KEEP AT LEAST SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS THROUGH SATURDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL STAY CLOSE TO CLIMO.

SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY WILL FEATURE A LOW LEVEL SW FLOW DOMINATED BY 
THE ATLANTIC RIDGE...AND A MID/UPPER RIDGE POSITIONED OVER TX AND 
THE LOWER MS REGION. ORGANIZED FORCING FOR PRECIP APPEARS TO BE 
LACKING IN THIS PATTERN...BUT THERE WILL PROBABLY BE ENOUGH LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE SUPPLY TO HAVE AT LEAST A SLIGHT CHANCE OF DIURNALLY-
DRIVEN SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EACH DAY. BETTER CHANCES WILL 
DEPEND ON CONVECTIVELY-INDUCED UPSTREAM DISTURBANCES THAT THE MODELS 
CANNOT RESOLVE THIS FAR OUT. WILL HAVE A GENERAL WARMING TREND 
THROUGH THE BEGINNING OF THE WEEK.

&&

600 
FXUS64 KMRX 100139 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
939 PM EDT MON JUN 9 2014

.DISCUSSION...
AFTER ANOTHER FAIR WEATHER DAY...MOSTLY CLEAR AND CALM CONDITIONS
ARE PREVAILING FOR NOW ACROSS THE EASTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY AND THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. TO THE SOUTH AND WEST...ALONG THE BORDER OF
ALABAMA...GEORGIA AND TENNESSEE A WEAK THETA-E AXIS/STATIONARY
FRONT REMAINS FIXED. TO THE SOUTHWEST OF THIS BOUNDARY...A
MODERATELY UNSTABLE ENVIRONMENT STILL EXISTS WHICH HAS ALLOWED
ANOTHER MCS TO FORM/HOLD TOGETHER ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH INTO THE
SOUTHERN TENNESSEE VALLEY. TO THE NORTHEAST AND EAST...A MUCH MORE
STABLE ENVIRONMENT EXISTS...WHICH WILL PROHIBIT MUCH IN THE WAY OF
THUNDER ACTIVITY ONCE THE AFOREMENTIONED SQUALL LINE APPROACHES
THE CENTRAL VALLEY LATER TONIGHT. THE LATEST RUN OF THE
HRRR INDICATES A LINE OF STRONG/SEVERE CONVECTION MAINTAINING
ITSELF WELL INTO SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND EVEN INTO SOUTHWEST NORTH
CAROLINA LATER TONIGHT BETWEEN 03-06Z...BEFORE IT SPREADS NORTHWARD
INTO THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY AND BEGINS TO DISSIPATE
BETWEEN 06-12Z.

THUS FOR THE FORECAST...HAVE INCREASED POPS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
PLATEAU AND VALLEY TO LIKELY BETWEEN 03-09Z AND HIGH-END CHANCE
AREAWIDE AFTER 06Z. THINK THAT THE INTENSITY OF THESE STORMS AND
HOW LONG THEY CAN KEEP GOING WILL BE TIED TO A FAIRLY STOUT 850-700
MB JET WHICH IS ACCELERATING THE LINE TOWARD THE I-65 CORRIDOR AS
OF 9:30 PM EDT. WHILE SOME WEAKENING IS EXPECTED WITH THE LOSS OF
HEATING AND SLIGHTLY WEAKER INSTABILITY...THINK THAT THE THREAT FOR
STRONG TO ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND
VALLEY WILL BE POSSIBLE THROUGH 06Z OR SO. THE PRIMARY IMPACT WILL
BE GUSTY CONVECTIVE THUNDERSTORM WINDS AND SOME LOCALLY HEAVY
RAINFALL WITH THE LINE...AS WELL AS SOME GUSTY WINDS FOR AN HOUR OR
SO IN WAKE OF THE LINE. THUS...WILL ADD A MENTION OF THIS TO THE
HWO.

LOCATIONS ACROSS NORTHEAST TENNESSEE WILL LIKELY JUST EXPERIENCE
SOME SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS AROUND DAYBREAK AS THIS ACTIVITY
CONTINUES TO WANE. OTHERWISE...CLOUDS WILL EXPAND QUICKLY OVER THE
ENTIRE AREA BETWEEN 03-06Z WHICH WILL HELP MAINTAIN TEMPERATURES IN
THE 60S OVERNIGHT.

FXUS64 KMRX 091904
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
304 PM EDT MON JUN 9 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...BROAD...DIFFUSES BOUNDARY WILL 
CONTINUE TO SLOWLY LIFT NORTH ACROSS THE AREA THIS EVENING.  A STRAY 
SHOWER/THUNDERSTORM WILL BE POSSIBLE AS THIS BOUNDARY MOVES THROUGH. 
WE WILL SEE A BETTER CHANCE OF CONVECTION DEVELOP OVER THE AREA ON 
TUESDAY AS SHORT WAVE OUT AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING UPPER LOW MOVES IN 
FROM THE WEST. INSTABILITY IS RATHER WEAK BUT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IS 
SUFFICIENT AND LIFT FROM THE SHORT WAVE SHOULD ALLOW FOR THE 
DEVELOPMENT OF SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS.  HOWEVER...THERE IS A 
QUESTION AS TO THE TIMING OF THIS DEVELOPMENT.  EXPECT ISOLATED TO 
SCATTERED CONVECTION TO DEVELOP AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM BUT THE MAIN 
BAND MAY NOT MOVE INTO UNTIL LATE AFTERNOON OR EVENING.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...ECMWF AND GFS SIMILAR 
WITH WEATHER PATTERN OVERALL...ESPECIALLY THROUGH MID TO LATE WEEK. 
RAIN CHANCES LOOK TO RUN 50 PERCENT OR BETTER FOR MUCH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...POSSIBLY INTO THURSDAY. 
THE UPPER LOW TO OUR WEST LIFTING NE...THEN TRACKING EASTWARD 
THROUGH THE APPALACHIANS...SHOULD PROVIDE UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT TO 
INCREASE COVERAGE. RAISED POPS SLIGHTLY FOR THOSE PERIODS BELOW 
CATEGORICAL VALUES. 

GFS MODEL CREATES HEAVIER RAINS AND MORE WIDESPREAD CONVECTION FOR 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY THAN THE ECMWF...AS ANOTHER UPPER LOW OR TROUGH 
DROPS IN BEHIND THE MID WEEK SYSTEM. FOLLOWED ECMWF SOLUTION FOR NOW 
AND KEPT POPS JUST IN THE SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE CATEGORY THROUGH 
THE WEEKEND. ALSO...FAVORED THE SLIGHTLY COOLER MAX TEMPS FROM ECMX 
MOS OVER THE GFSX MOS FOR FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY PERIODS. INTRODUCED 
MONDAY (NEW DAY 7) AS PARTLY CLOUDY AND 20 PERCENT CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS...WHICH IS SLIGHTLY BELOW CLIMO FOR MID JUNE.

714 
FXUS64 KMRX 090718
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
318 AM EDT MON JUN 9 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
THE POOR PERFORMANCE OF THE MODELS OVER THE PAST FEW DAYS AND THE 
LACK OF ANY WELL-DEFINED FORCING MECHANISMS TODAY AND TONIGHT RESULT 
IN A LOW CONFIDENCE FORECAST FOR THE SHORT TERM PERIOD. THE 
CONVECTION OVER W TN IS EXPECTED TO WEAKEN BY THE TIME IT REACHES 
OUR AREA AS IT ENCOUNTERS A LOW LEVEL RIDGE AND MORE STABLE AIR. 
STILL...SOME SHOWERS COULD MOVE ACROSS WESTERN AND SOUTHERN PORTIONS 
OF THE AREA THIS MORNING...AND WILL INCLUDE CHANCE POPS IN THOSE 
AREAS. THE CLOSED LOW OVER THE PLAINS DIRFTS SLOWLY EAST TO THE 
OZARKS BY TONIGHT. THERE MAY BE SOME WEAK VORT MAXES INDUCED BY 
UPSTREAM CONVECTION THAT COULD BRING SOME ISOLATED TO SCATTERED 
SHOWERS AND STORMS...BUT FORCING REMAINS WEAK. GIVEN THE TREND OF 
MODELS TO BE TOO WET LATELY...WITH UNDERCUT MOS POPS TONIGHT AND 
STAY IN THE CHANCE TO SLIGHT CHANCE RANGE. INCREASING MOISTURE TODAY 
SHOULD PROVIDE BROKEN CLOUD COVER MOST OF THE DAY...AND WILL LEAN 
TOWARD THE COOLER SIDE OF MOS GUIDANCE FOR HIGHS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
PER NCEP DISCUSSION...WILL TREND THE EXTENDED FORECAST TO THE
ECMWF MODEL. MAIN WEATHER FEATURE WILL BE UPPER TROUGH THAT MOVES
ACROSS THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY BEFORE
LIFTING NORTHEAST INTO THE GREAT LAKES FOR THURSDAY IN RESPONSE TO
ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS. IN RESULT WILL BE A
GOOD DEAL OF SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY FOR TUESDAY THROUGH
THURSDAY.

MODELS SHOW DECENT UPPER LEVEL JET DYNAMICS OVER THE 
PLATEAU/SOUTHEAST FOR WEDNESDAY. WOULD NOT BE SUPRISED TO SEE 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL FOR MID-WEEK WITH LOCALIZED FLASH FLOOD 
PROBLEMS.

EVEN THOUGH UPPER TROUGH MOVES NORTH OF THE AREA WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT/THURSDAY...A GOOD DEAL OF MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY WILL REMAIN 
FOR SCATTERED STORMS. FOR FRIDAY...ANOTHER FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL 
PULL INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS PRODUCING SCATTERED 
THUNDERSTORMS. THIS BOUNDARY WILL PULL JUST SOUTH OF THE AREA FOR 
SATURDAY...THEN MOVE BACK NORTH FOR SUNDAY. TRENDED CLOSELY WITH GFS 
MAX/MIN MOS VALUES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
958 PM EDT SUN JUN 8 2014

.DISCUSSION...
A QUIET NIGHT IS EXPECTED ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS
EVENING...AS CONVECTION REMAINS WELL TO THE SOUTH ACROSS
MISSISSIPPI AND ALABAMA AND UPPER-RIDGING HAS NOSED INTO THE AREA.
THIS HAS RESULTED IN A...CALM AND MOSTLY CLEAR EVENING OVER MUCH
OF THE REGION. A WEAK UPPER-DISTURBANCE WILL PUSH NORTHEAST OF THE
REGION TOWARD THE OHIO VALLEY OVERNIGHT AS THIS RIDGE HEADS
EAST...WHICH WILL EXPAND HIGH CLOUD COVERAGE LATE TONIGHT.
HOWEVER...THIS WILL DO FAIRLY LITTLE TO LIMIT COOLING
OVERNIGHT...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NORTHEAST ZONES WHERE GOOD
RADIATIONAL COOLING HAS TAKEN PLACE THIS EVENING. THIS WILL RESULT
IN LOWS BOTTOMING OUT IN THE UPPER 50S TO AROUND 60 DEGREES IN
THOSE AREAS...AND IN THE LOW TO MID 60S ELSEWHERE TO THE SOUTH AND
WEST. SOME PATCHY FOG WILL ALSO BE POSSIBLE AFTER MIDNIGHT SHOULD
GIVEN PARTLY CLEAR/CALM CONDITIONS...ESPECIALLY AROUND DAYBREAK.
THUS...HAVE A MENTION OF THIS IN THE ZONES.

FXUS64 KMRX 081840
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT SUN JUN 8 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS
SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED OVER SOUTHERN OHIO...WITH ITS
ASSOCIATED WARM FRONT EXTENDING SOUTH OF IT ACROSS THE TRI-CITIES AREA
AND ITS COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHWEST OF IT ACROSS MIDDLE TN. THIS
WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO CONTINUE MOVING EASTWARD INTO THE
FORECAST AREA BEFORE SUNSET...WITH SCATTERED CONVECTION POSSIBLY
DEVELOPING ALONG IT BEFORE IT EXITS THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING.
NAM MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE A CAPPING STABLE LAYER ABOVE 850 MB...
WHICH IS LIKELY HELPING TO INHIBIT MUCH CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT THIS
AFTERNOON OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THUS...WILL KEEP POPS IN THE LOW
CHANCE CATEGORY THROUGH THE EVENING HOURS. MODELS CONTINUE TO INDICATE
AN AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH DEVELOPING OVER THE PLAINS TONIGHT
INTO MONDAY...BUT NOW REVEAL QUITE A BIT OF CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT
OCCURRING AHEAD OF IT (MORE AGGRESSIVE THAN PREVIOUS RUNS) AS THIS
UPPER TROUGH SLOWLY DRIFTS EASTWARD TOWARDS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. A
SURFACE LOW IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE OZARKS REGION BY MONDAY
NIGHT...AND THEN MOVE NORTHEASTWARD INTO THE LOWER OHIO RIVER VALLEY
ON TUESDAY. AS A RESULT...THE COVERAGE OF CONVECTION IS EXPECTED TO
INCREASE OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON TUESDAY...ESPECIALLY DURING THE
AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. WITH THE MODELS HAVING A DIFFICULT TIME
WITH RUN-TO- RUN CONSISTENCY AND AMONGST THEMSELVES...WILL KEEP POPS
ONLY IN THE SCATTERED CATEGORY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT (WILL NOT MENTION
ANYTHING GREATER THAN 50 PERCENT FOR NOW). AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND
NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT WITH
MINS...WHICH LOOK REASONABLE. AS FOR MAXES...WILL GENERALLY TREND
TOWARDS THE WARMER GFS NUMBERS...WHICH ARE CLOSER IN LINE WITH THE
LATEST TRENDS OF THE PAST FEW DAYS.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS CONSISTENT WITH
BRINGING A DEEP UPPER TROUGH INTO THE EASTERN U.S. WEDNESDAY AND
THURSDAY...THOUGH THERE CONTINUES TO BE RUN TO RUN DIFFERENCES WITH
DETAILS. HOWEVER...THIS PATTERN WILL CONTINUE ONGOING FORECAST OF
SCATTERED CONVECTION EACH PERIOD. BRIEF RIDGING WILL MOVE THROUGH
AROUND FRIDAY...BUT WITH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IN PLACE AND WEAK RIPPLES
IN THE UPPER FLOW...EXPECTED LESS COVERAGE BUT SHOULD STILL SEE
ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION. MODEL CONSISTENCY LESSENS THIS
FAR OUT BUT THEY NOW BRING A LOW THROUGH THE AREA FOR THE WEEKEND...
KEEPING UNSETTLED CONDITIONS IN PLACE FOR THIS PERIOD AS WELL.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
323 AM EDT SUN JUN 8 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
LOW PRESSURE WILL BE MOVING EAST JUST NORTH OF THE OHIO RIVER 
TODAY...WITH A TRAILING FRONT/TROUGH MOVING ACROSS OUR AREA THIS 
AFTERNOON. MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW CONFLICTING SIGNALS REGARDING 
SHORT TERM CONVECTIVE TRENDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT. THE NAM AND 
RAP SHOW PRECIP DEVELOPING IN ERN KY AND SW VA LATER THIS 
MORNING...WHILE THE HRRR SHOWS NOTHING. SREF PLUMES OF QPF SHOW A 
WIDE SPREAD BETWEEN MEMBERS TODAY. WILL LEAN TOWARD THE MEAN AND 
HAVE POPS RISING TO HIGH CHANCES NORTH AFTER 12Z...THEN DECREASING 
AFTER 18Z. THERE ARE ALSO BIG DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE NAM AND GFS 
REGARDING HOW UNSTABLE IT WILL BE TODAY. WITH QUITE A BIT OF HIGH 
CLOUD COVER TO START THE DAY...INSTABILITY AND THUS SEVERE POTENTIAL 
WILL LIKELY BE LOW. STAYED ON THE COOL SIDE OF MOS GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES TODAY. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE BUILDING INTO THE AREA 
FROM THE NW TONIGHT...WITH DRIER AND MORE STABLE AIR ALOFT ENDING 
ANY PRECIP CHANCES BEFORE MIDNIGHT.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...
MAIN WEATHER FEATURE FOR THE EXTENDED IS AN UPPER TROUGH INITIALLY
OVER THE MID-SECTION OF THE COUNTY. THE MEDIUM RANGE MODELS DO HAVE
SOME MINOR DISAGREEMENTS AND WILL BASE THE FORECAST ALONG WITH A
COMPROMISE OF THE GFS AND ECMWF.

FOR MONDAY...FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BE SOUTH OF THE AREA WITH MOST OF 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS DRY. BOUNDARY LIFTS NORTHEAST FOR TUESDAY 
AS BOUNDARY LAYER WINDS BECOME SOUTHERLY. 

FOR TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...UPPER TROUGH LIFTS NORTHEAST TOWARD 
THE GREAT LAKES WITH STREAM OF MOIST AND UNSTABLE AIR OVER THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. SCATTERED-BROKEN 
COVERAGE OF STORMS ANTICIPATED. SOME OF THESE THUNDERSTORMS COULD BE 
STRONG TO ISOLATED SEVERE.

FOR FRIDAY...UPPER TROUGH HAS EXITED THE GREAT LAKES...BUT PLENTY OF 
MOISTURE REMAINS WITH FRONTAL BOUNDARY NEAR THE AREA...SO WILL 
CONTINUE WITH CHANCE OF STORMS. FOR SATURDAY...FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
LOOKS TO BE ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE...BUT CONFIDENCE QUITE LOW ON 
LOCATION OF BOUNDARY.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFX MOS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

TROUGH MOVES THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON.

FXUS64 KMRX 080140 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
940 PM EDT SAT JUN 7 2014

.DISCUSSION...
AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORTWAVE WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE THROUGH THE REGION
TONIGHT...BRINGING A DECENT CHANCE FOR SOME LIGHT PRECIPITATION TO
THE FORECAST AREA. TO THE WEST ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE...SCT BANDS
OF STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS ARE SLOWLY CONTINUING TO DRIFT
EASTWARD. THIS ACTIVITY IS LARGELY UNORGANIZED DUE TO THE WEAK
WIND SHEAR AND IS IN THE MODE OF MULTICELL CLUSTERS. A THETA-E
AXIS/STATIONARY FRONT IS DRAPED ROUGHLY ALONG A LINE FROM
MADISONVILLE TO HARRIMAN...WHICH SEPARATES A MODERATELY UNSTABLE
ATMOSPHERE FROM A MOSTLY STABLE ENVIRONMENT TO THE NORTH AND EAST.
IN ADDITION...THE INSTABILITY THAT DOES EXIST TO THE SOUTH AND WEST
IS BEGINNING TO WANE WITH THE LOSS OF SOLAR HEATING. STILL...THINK
THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME LOCALLY STRONG STORMS WILL EXIST ACROSS THE
PLATEAU AND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE THROUGH MIDNIGHT OR SO GIVEN THE
MODEST INSTABILITY IN PLACE. THOUGH THESE SHOWERS WILL ALSO BEGIN
TO DISSIPATE IN COVERAGE AS THEY MOVE INTO EAST TENNESSEE
OVERNIGHT...STILL THINK A 50-60 POP IS WARRANTED ACROSS THE ENTIRE
AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT AS THESE SPOTTY SHOWERS WILL LINGER THROUGH
DAYBREAK DUE TO THE UPPER-LEVEL SUPPORT. INCREASED CLOUD COVER AND
POPS BEFORE MIDNIGHT AS WELL ACROSS THE WESTERN HALF OF THE REGION
AS MOSTLY CLOUDY TO CLOUDY CONDITIONS AND LIKELY POPS ARE VALID
THERE ATTM.

&&

299 
FXUS64 KMRX 071850
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EDT SAT JUN 7 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS
SHOWS A WEAK NORTHWEST-TO-SOUTHEAST ORIENTED FRONTAL BOUNDARY BISECTING
THE FORECAST AREA...GENERALLY ALONG A CROSSVILLE TO KNOXVILLE TO
ANDREWS NC LINE. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH SCATTERED
CONVECTION BEGINNING TO REDEVELOP OVER THE OZARKS REGION AHEAD OF ITS
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT. BOTH THE NAM AND HRRR MODELS INDICATE THAT THIS
CONVECTION WILL CONGEAL INTO AN MCS LATER THIS AFTERNOON...AND WILL
MOVE EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS EVENING. THIS MCS SHOULD
WEAKEN TOWARDS MIDNIGHT AS IT MOVES INTO A MORE STABLE AIR MASS OVER
EAST TN. THUS...WILL MENTION LIKELY POPS FOR THE WESTERN SECTIONS OF
THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT... BUT WILL ONLY MENTION SCATTERED CONVECTION
FOR THE EASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. WITH THIS OVERNIGHT
CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY LIKELY STABILIZING THE LOCAL AIR MASS...WILL LOWER
POPS FOR SUNDAY INTO THE CHANCE CATEGORY AS THE WEAK COLD FRONT SLOWLY
MOVES THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE MORNING HOURS. A MARGINALLY
TO POTENTIALLY MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP AGAIN
ON MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING...SO EXPECT ISOLATED TO SCATTERED
CONVECTION TO DEVELOP WITH THE GREATEST COVERAGE OVER SOUTHEAST TN AND
SOUTHWEST NC WHERE THE GREATEST INSTABILITY SHOULD DEVELOP. ANOTHER
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS BY
SUNDAY NIGHT...WHICH WILL TRIGGER ADDITIONAL CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT
OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY ON MONDAY. THIS ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO
MOVE EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON MONDAY NIGHT...SO WILL
MENTION SLIGHTLY HIGHER POPS AREA WIDE. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...BUT
WILL COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE
NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...WILL STAY IN AN UNSETTLED 
WEATHER PATTERN THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED. MAIN FEATURE THROUGH THE
PERIOD WILL BE AN UPPER TROUGH THAT DROPS INTO THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIAN REGION TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. THIS WILL CREATE A
CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EACH PERIOD. THE TROUGH WILL
PULL AWAY FROM THE AREA LATE THURSDAY WITH A COLD FRONT MOVING IN
FRIDAY OR SATURDAY...CONTINUING THE CHANCE OF CONVECTION.
&&

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EDT SAT JUN 7 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
CURRENT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVER MIDDLE TN MAY CLIP OUR SW 
COUNTIES LATER THIS MORNING. RESIDUAL OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES MAY HELP 
INITIATE MORE SHOWERS THIS AFTERNOON IN SOUTHERN AREAS...OTHERWISE 
THERE WILL BE LITTLE IN THE WAY OF FORCING FOR CONVECTIVE 
DEVELOPMENT TODAY. AS WAS THE CASE YESTERDAY...THE GREATER 
INSTABILITY IS IN SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA...AND WILL HAVE 
CHANCE POPS IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY WITH NO POPS FROM KNOXVILLE 
NORTH. WENT BELOW THE GFS MOS GUIDANCE FOR HIGH TEMPS DUE TO ITS 
WARM BIAS THE PAST FEW DAYS. 

THE MODELS PROJECT THAT THE REMNANTS OF UPSTREAM MCS ACTIVITY WILL 
MOVE INTO OUR AREA TONIGHT...THOUGH IN A MUCH WEAKENED STATE. THE 
RIDGE AXIS TO OUR WEST THAT HAS STEERED MOST UPSTREAM CONVECTION TO 
OUR SOUTH THE PAST FEW DAYS WILL MOVE EAST...ALLOWING THE MIDLEVEL 
MCV TO MOVE ACROSS THE AREA. WILL HAVE INCREASING POPS 
OVERNIGHT...WITH HIGH CHANCES AFTER MIDNIGHT IN WESTERN SECTIONS. 
WITH THE LACK OF HEATING TO PROVIDE GOOD INSTABILITY AND WEAK 
SHEAR...THE POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE STORMS TONIGHT LOOKS LOW.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...
THE 00Z ECMWF AND GFS ARE IN PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH EVOLUTION
OF SHORT-WAVES MOVING ACROSS THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS THROUGH
THE EXTENDED WITH A FRONTAL BOUNDARY PULLING BACK-AND-FORTH ACROSS
THE AREA. THESE SYSTEMS WILL KEEP CHANCE-LIKELY POPS GOING EACH DAY
WITH THE BEST CHANCES DURING THE AFTERNOON-EVENING DUE BETTER
INSTABILITY. STRONG TO ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS POSSIBLE ALMOST EACH
DAY...BUT BEST CHANCE FOR ORGANIZED SEVERE WITH MORE SUBSTANTIAL
UPPER TROUGH FOR MID-WEEK.

GENERALLY WENT A DEGREE OR TWO COOLER THAN GFS MEX HIGHS DUE TO 
CLOUD AND RAIN ASSOCIATED WITH CONVECTION. FOLLOWED GFS LOWS CLOSELY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1028 PM EDT FRI JUN 6 2014

.DISCUSSION...
FAIR WEATHER CONTINUES LATE THIS EVENING ACROSS THE REGION AS THE
STATIONARY FRONT AND ASSOCIATED CONVECTION/MCS ACTIVITY REMAINS
DISPLACED TO THE SOUTH AND WEST ACROSS WESTERN TENNESSEE AND
NORTHERN ALABAMA. THIS ACTIVITY HAS BEGUN TO WANE WITH THE LOSS OF
SOLAR HEATING AND ANY REMNANT ACTIVITY WILL FIZZLE BEFORE IT
APPROACHES THE WESTERN FRINGES OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU OF THE
CWA. HOWEVER...SOME OF THE LEFTOVER CLOUD COVER WILL STILL
INFILTRATE THE REGION ACROSS THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY
TONIGHT...WITH LOCATIONS OVER NORTHEAST TENNESSEE/SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA REMAINING MOSTLY CLEAR. AS A RESULT...TEMPERATURES WILL BE
COOLER DUE TO MORE RADIATIONAL COOLING ACROSS THE NORTHEAST
ZONES...DROPPING OFF INTO THE MID TO UPPER 50S...WITH LOWS IN THE
LOW TO MID 60S COMMON ELSEWHERE TO THE SOUTH AND WEST DUE TO THE
EXPANDED CLOUD COVER AND HIGHER DEWPOINTS.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS
SHOWS TWO WEST-TO-EAST ORIENTED BOUNDARIES OVER THE FORECAST AREA...
WITH THE FIRST ONE LOCATED BETWEEN KNOXVILLE AND THE TRI-CITIES WITH
DEWPOINTS IN THE LOWER 50S OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. THE
SECOND BOUNDARY WAS LOCATED CLOSER TO THE SOUTHERN TN BORDER...WITH
SCATTERED CONVECTION DEVELOPING SOUTH OF IT OVER NORTHERN AL AND
NORTHERN GA. MOST OF THIS CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY SHOULD STAY SOUTH OF THE
TN BORDER THIS EVENING...BUT A FEW STORMS COULD STILL DEVELOP IN THE
UNSTABLE AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA SOUTH OF THE FIRST
BOUNDARY THIS EVENING. THESE TWO BOUNDARIES ARE EXPECTED TO LINGER
AROUND THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY...WITH A MARGINALLY TO POTENTIALLY
MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS PROGGED TO AGAIN DEVELOP ON SATURDAY
AFTERNOON. THUS...EXPECT ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION TO REDEVELOP
OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH THE GREATEST COVERAGE OVER SOUTHEAST
TN AND SOUTHWEST NC WHERE THE GREATEST INSTABILITY WILL DEVELOP. AN
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS THEN PROGGED TO MOVE EASTWARD FROM THE PLAINS
ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON SUNDAY...WHICH SHOULD HELP TO INCREASE
THE COVERAGE OF CONVECTION OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS
AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH SUNDAY
NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO WHERE SOME SLIGHT
DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH
KEEPING THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION IN AN UNSETTLED WEATHER
PATTERN THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED. HOWEVER...MODELS DO HAVE SOME
DISAGREEMENT WITH THE DETAILS. BASIC PATTERN SHOWS THE REMNANTS OF AN
OLD BOUNDARY MOVING THROUGH THE AREA ON MONDAY...THEN AN UPPER TROUGH
COMES IN AND LIFTS THROUGH THE REGION TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...THEN
ANOTHER BOUNDARY MOVES THROUGH AROUND THE FRIDAY TIME FRAME. WHAT THIS
ALL TRANSLATE TO IS THE AREA WILL SEE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS
EACH PERIOD WITH BEST CHANCES DURING LATE AFTERNOON HOURS WITH THE
ADDED DIURNAL INGREDIENT. AS FOR TEMPERATURES...WILL BE WARM THROUGH
THE PERIOD WITH HIGHS GENERALLY IN THE 80S ACROSS THE VALLEY LOCATIONS.

NAM AND LOCAL WRF SHOWING VERY LITTLE...AND THE RUC AND HRRR SHOWING 
QUITE A BIT OF COVERAGE IN SOUTHERN AREAS. WILL HAVE HIGHEST POPS 
SOUTH...BUT STAY IN THE CHANCE RANGE. MCS ACTIVITY OVER THE OZARKS 
THIS MORNING IS EXPECTED TO MAINLY STAY SOUTH OF THE AREA...WHICH IS 
ALSO WHERE THE THREAT FOR SEVERE WEATHER THREAT WILL BE. THUS MOST
CONVECTION IN OUR AREA SHOULD BE DIURNALLY DRIVEN...AND WILL DROP
POPS BACK AFTER SUNSET.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THUSRDAY)... WEAK BOUNDARY WILL BE 
QUASI-STATIONARY ACROSS FAR SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE FOR SATURDAY WITH 
UPSLOPE FLOW INTO THE WESTERN CAROLINAS. WILL CONTINUE TO CALL FOR 
CHANCE POPS NEAR BOUNDARY AND FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE 
MOUNTAINS/SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA.

FOR SUNDAY...GFS SHOWS A SHORT-WAVE AND CYCLO-GENESIS MOVING INTO 
THE OHIO VALLEY WITH BOUNDARY PULLING BACK NORTH. NAM/ECMWF DOES NOT 
SHOW THIS SURFACE REFLECTION. WILL CALL FOR INCREASING 
MOISTURE/INSTABILITY WITH BEST CHANCES OF CONVECTION ACROSS THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

FOR MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...PLENTY OF MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY 
OVER THE AREA WITH A QUASI-STATIONARY BOUNDARY OVER THE LOWER OHIO 
AND NORTHERN TENNESSEE VALLEY. MODELS DO SHOW AN UPPER TROUGH WEST 
OF THE AREA. WILL CONTINUE WITH CHANCE POPS...EXCEPT FOR LIKELY POPS 
FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS DUE TO OROGRAPHIC FORCING. ISOLATED STRONG 
TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE EACH DAY WITH THE MAIN CONCERN 
BEING DAMAGING DOWNBURST WINDS...LOCALL HEAVY RAINFALL AND MARGINAL 
SEVERE HAIL.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS OR WENT A DEGREE OR TWO COOLER THAN HIGHS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

996 
FXUS64 KMRX 051917
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
317 PM EDT THU JUN 5 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS
A WEAK COLD FRONT ALONG THE NORTHERN TN BORDER...WITH AN OUTFLOW
BOUNDARY FROM LAST NIGHT'S CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY EXTENDING FARTHER
SOUTH ACROSS NORTHERN AL AND NORTHERN GA. SATELLITE AND RADAR
IMAGERY REVEAL SOME SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER MIDDLE AND EAST TN...
WITH A LARGE MCS OVER THE MID SOUTH MOVING EAST-SOUTHEAST TOWARDS
SOUTHERN MIDDLE TN AND NORTHERN AL. THE NORTHERN EXTENT OF THIS MCS
MAY AFFECT SOUTHEAST TN AND EXTREME SOUTHWEST NC BEFORE SUNSET...SO
WILL KEEP LIKELY POPS IN THESE AREAS UNTIL SUNSET. THE FRONTAL
BOUNDARY IN THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA IS EXPECTED
TO DRIFT FURTHER SOUTH TONIGHT...AND REMAIN QUASI-STATIONARY OVER
THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY. THUS...WILL KEEP SOME CHANCE POPS FOR
FRIDAY...WITH THE HIGHEST POPS OVER SOUTHEAST TN AND EXTREME
SOUTHWEST NC WHERE THE HIGHEST AMOUNTS OF INSTABILITY SHOULD BE
DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TONIGHT...BUT THEN
REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES FOR FRIDAY. WILL PLAN TO COMPROMISE
BETWEEN THE TWO ON FRIDAY...SINCE CLOUDS FROM CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY
SHOULD HELP TO KEEP TEMPS A LITTLE COOLER THAN PREVIOUS DAYS.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...NOTHING SIGNIFICANT 
GOING ON DURING THE LONG TERM. OVERALL....IT SEEMS LIKE THERE WILL BE 
AT LEAST A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND STORMS EACH DAY WITH BETTER 
CHANCES BEGINNING ON SUNDAY AND CONTINUING THROUGH THE REST OF THE 
FORECAST PERIOD.

NOT MUCH HAS CHANGED FROM THE PREVIOUS FORECAST DISCUSSION. A 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL CONTINUE TO REMAIN SOMEWHAT STATIONARY ACROSS 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND TENNESSEE VALLEY THROUGH AT LEAST 
SUNDAY. BEING ABLE TO DISCERN EXACTLY WHERE THE BOUNDARY WILL 
MIGRATE TO IS THE DIFFICULT PART. GENERALLY ALONG THIS BOUNDARY 
SHOULD THE BETTER CHANCES FOR SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT 
EXIST. 

SATURDAY...MODELS ARE HINTING AT WEAK AND BRIEF RIDGING OVER THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AS HEIGHTS GETS PINCHED AND FORCED NORTHWARD 
DUE TO BEING IN BETWEEN THE APPROACHING SHORTWAVE TROUGH TO OUR WEST 
AND TROUGH TO OUR NORTHEAST. IF THIS RIDGING DEVELOPS AS MODELS SHOW 
THIS SHOULD HELP TO SUPPRESS CONVECTION...ALTHOUGH SOME SPOTTY 
DIURNAL CONVECTION STILL MAY OCCUR. ALSO...POP CHANCES WILL DEPEND 
ON THE LOCATION OF THE THE OLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY. SATURDAY MAY END UP 
BEING THE NICEST DAY DURING THE WHOLE LONG TERM PERIOD.
 
THE NAM AND GFS BOTH SHOW A SHORTWAVE COMING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING 
THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. THIS FEATURE WILL ENHANCE PRECIP CHANCES 
THROUGH THIS TIME FRAME. POPS MAY NEED TO BE RAISED TO LIKELY SOON 
BUT WILL KEEP CHANCE FOR NOW. MORE SHOWERS AND STORMS ARE EXPECTED 
MONDAY OUT AHEAD OF THE NEXT APPROACHING TROUGH AND UPPER LEVEL LOW.
 
ON TUESDAY BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF SHOW A MORE ROBUST TROUGH AND 
UPPER LEVEL LOW JUST TO OUR WEST. PREVIOUS RUNS WERE SHOWING THIS 
UPPER LEVEL LOW BECOMING CUT OFF FROM THE MAIN FLOW AND HANGING OUT 
OVER OUR AREA FOR A FEW DAYS WITH NO WHERE TO GO. IF THIS IS THE 
CASE...TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY COULD BE A WET PERIOD AS THIS AREA 
OF LOW PRESSURE SITS AND SPINS ACROSS THE APPALACHIA'S. LATEST RUNS 
SUGGEST THAT IT WON'T BECOME CUT OFF BUT SLOWLY MEANDER EASTWARD AND 
BE OFF TO OUR EAST BY LATE THURSDAY. STILL MUCH UNCERTAINTY WITH 
THIS FEATURE REGARDING THE EVOLUTION AND PLACEMENT OF THE LOW. WILL 
POPS CHANCE FOR NOW UNTIL MODELS CAN FURTHER AGREE. 

GENERALLY STAYED BELOW GUIDANCE ON MAX TEMPS AS THERE WILL BE QUITE 
A BIT OF CLOUD COVER THROUGH THE LONG TERM AND FOR THIS REASON 
TRENDED A BIT WARMER ON OVERNIGHT LOWS. 
&&

UPDATE THIS MORNING TO REMOVE ANY MENTION OF MORNING PRECIP AND TO
TWEAK TEMPS AND POPS A LITTLE. WILL ALSO UPDATE THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER
OUTLOOK TO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS THIS
AFTERNOON AND EVENING.

346 AM EDT THU JUN 5 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THUNDERSTORM COMPLEX STILL

NE TN. REMOVED THE SEVERE WORDING WITH THE EARLIER UPDATE TO DROP
THE TORNADO WATCH. DON'T SEE A THREAT OF STRONG OR SEVERE STORMS
AFTER 12Z TODAY.

PREVIOUS GRIDS LOOKED GOOD FOR TONIGHT...BUT I DID LOWER POPS AND
DECREASE SKY COVER A BIT QUICKER OVER NRN AREAS. A BLEND OF MOS
LOOKED BETTER FOR BOTH TODAY'S HIGHS AND TONIGHT'S LOWS.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...AN UNSETTLED PATTERN
STILL ADVERTISED FOR THE LONG TERM WITH IMPROVEMENTS TO PREVIOUS
GRIDS MINIMAL AT BEST. MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY INCREASES OVER THE
WEEKEND WITH SOME ORGANIZED CONVECTION LIKELY BY SUNDAY OR SUNDAY
NIGHT. ECMWF JUST DOES NOT TOTALLY SUPPORT LIKELY OR HIGHER POPS
JUST YET FOR THOSE PERIDOS...SO STAYED WITH HIGH CHANCE POPS FOR
NOW. 

SEEMED PRUDENT TO CONTINUE CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY
NIGHT...AS WELL AS SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ON TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.
THE MUCH WARMER GFSX MOS MAX TEMPS LOOKED SUSPECT UNTIL TUESDAY
AND WEDNESDAY...SO STAYED CLOSE TO THE COOLER ECMX MAXES. MIN TEMP
GRID MOST DAYS WERE ADJUSTED CLOSER TO THE 05/00Z GFSX MOS AND
ADJACENT NWS GRIDS.

919 
FXUS64 KMRX 041835
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EDT WED JUN 4 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS
SHOWS A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY JUST NORTH OF THE OHIO RIVER...WITH A
VERY WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE AND
RADAR IMAGERY REVEAL SOME CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY BEGINNING TO REDEVELOP
OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY...WHICH SHOULD THEN MOVE SOUTHEASTWARD
INTO A VERY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING THIS AFTERNOON OVER THE TN
RIVER VALLEY. WITH A FAIRLY STRONG MID LEVEL WIND FLOW (AROUND 40
TO 45 KT)...EXPECT THIS CONVECTION TO ORGANIZE INTO AN MCS WITH THE
POTENTIAL FOR WIDESPREAD DAMAGING WINDS...AS WELL AS LARGE HAIL...
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL...AND AN ISOLATED TORNADO. RIGHT NOW...IT
APPEARS THAT THIS POTENTIAL MCS SHOULD BEGIN TO AFFECT THE CUMBERLAND
PLATEAU AROUND 00Z (8 PM EDT)...AND THEN THE REST OF THE FORECAST
AREA AFTER SUNSET.

MODELS THEN INDICATE THAT THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL SLOWLY DRIFT 
SOUTHWARD THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY...WITH ANOTHER MCS 
POSSIBLY FORMING AROUND THE OZARKS REGION THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND 
THEN MOVING SOUTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. WHILE THE 
MODELS INDICATE THAT THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL MOVE AS FAR SOUTH AS 
THE SOUTHERN TN BORDER...THINK THAT IT WILL LIKELY BECOME QUASI- 
STATIONARY SOMEWHERE AROUND THE MIDDLE OF THE FORECAST AREA SINCE 
THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW APPEARS TO BECOME PARALLEL TO THE BOUNDARY. 
THUS...WILL KEEP A MENTION OF SCATTERED CONVECTION FOR MOST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT 
WILL TREND TOWARDS THE SLIGHTLY WARMER NAM NUMBERS SINCE THE FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY IS EXPECTED TO REMAIN FARTHER NORTH THAN THE MODELS WOULD 
SUGGEST.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL 
REMAIN STATIONARY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND TENNESSEE 
VALLEY THROUGH MUCH OF THE PERIOD. THE ATMOSPHERE SHOULD BE ABLE TO 
PRODUCE THE NECESSARY AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY FOR SCATTERED SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS EACH DAY ACROSS THE REGION. THERE IS A POSSIBILITY 
THAT THE CONVECTION COULD BE A LITTLE MORE ORGANIZED AROUND THE 
SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY TIME FRAME AS THE MODELS SHOW A SLIGHTLY MORE 
AMPLIFIED UPPER LEVEL TROUGH BUILDING ACROSS THE REGION. THEREFORE 
PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION MAY NEED TO BE ADJUSTED A LITTLE HIGHER 
EARLY IN THE NEW WEEK. TRIMMED A COUPLE DEGREES OFF SUGGESTED HIGH 
TEMPERATURES DURING THE LONG TERM PERIOD.

1020 AM EDT WED JUN 4 2014

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT JUST NORTH OF THE
OHIO RIVER...WITH A VERY WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST
AREA. SATELLITE AND RADAR IMAGERY REVEAL A LARGE AREA OF CONVECTION
OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY OCCURRING ALONG THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY.
MODELS INDICATE THAT A MODERATELY TO POSSIBLY VERY UNSTABLE AIR MASS
DEVELOPING THIS AFTERNOON OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY AHEAD OF THIS
FRONTAL BOUNDARY. AS A RESULT...THIS CONVECTION OVER THE OHIO RIVER
VALLEY SHOULD STRENGTHEN AS IT MOVES SOUTHEASTWARD TOWARDS THE FORECAST
AREA. WITH A FAIRLY STRONG (AROUND 40 TO 50 KT) MID LEVEL WIND FLOW...
THIS CONVECTION SHOULD ORGANIZE INTO AN MCS WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR
WIDESPREAD DAMAGING WINDS...AND WITH LARGE HAIL AND AN ISOLATED
TORNADO ALSO POSSIBLE. WILL PLAN TO KEEP A MENTION OF THE POSSIBILITY
OF SCATTERED CONVECTION DEVELOPING THIS AFTERNOON AHEAD OF THIS
POTENTIAL MCS...BUT THE MAIN STORY SHOULD BE THE MCS EXPECTED TONIGHT.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TODAY APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL
UPDATE THIS MORNING TO TWEAK TEMPS AND POPS A LITTLE FOR THIS
AFTERNOON...AND TO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF SEVERE STORMS FOR
TONIGHT. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

419 
FXUS64 KMRX 040727
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
327 AM EDT WED JUN 4 2014

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH ROTATING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES WILL DRAG A 
WEAK COLD FRONT INTO THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS LATE THIS
EVENING AND OVERNIGHT. THIS WILL BRING THE REGION ITS BEST
OPERTUNITY FOR WIDESPREAD MEANINGFUL PRECIPIATION IN QUITE SOME
TIME...AS WELL AS THE THREAT FOR STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS.
THE LATEST RUN OF THE NAM...ALONG WITH THE GFS IS SHOWING SOME
CONVECTION FIRING ALONG THE KENTUCKY/TENNESSEE BORDER INTO
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA DURING THE LATE AFTERNOON AND EVENING
HOURS...WITH A BULK OF THE ACTIIVTY MOVING IN LATE EVENING AND
OVERNIGHT WITH THE MAIN MCS/STORM COMPLEX FEATURE THAT WILL DEEVLOP
OVER THE OHIO VALLEY EARILER IN THE DAY. 

HAVE INCREASED POPS TO LIKELY DURING THIS TIME PERIOD ALONG
NORTHERN/NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AS FEEL MORE
CONFIDENT ABOUT THIS ACTIVITY MOVING IN LATER ON TONIGHT GIVEN THE
BETTER MODEL CONTINUITY. HOWEVER...SHOULD THIS ACTIIVTY BE SLOWER
IN ITS PROGRESSION AND BEGIN TO FIZZLE OUT...THE SOUTHERN PART OF
THE AREA MAY MISS OUT ON PRECIPIATION AGAIN ALL TOGETHER. THUS FOR
NOW...HAVE BEEN SOMEWHAT CAUTIOUS WITH POPS AND HAVE KEPT THE
NORTHERN ZONES BELOW CATEGORICAL. STILL THINK THE POTENTIAL FOR
SOME SUPERCELL STRUCTURES WILL EXIST...ESPECAILLY IF SOME DISCRETE
ACTIVITY CAN DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE MAIN LINE EARILER ON IN THE
EVENING. MODEL SOUDINGS AT KTRI/KTYS SUPPORT THIS AND EXHIBIT
CURVED HODOGRAPHS AND A STRONG SHEAR PROFILE...WHICH WOULD SUPPORT
ROTATING UPDRAFTS. HOWEVER...STILL THINK THAT THE PRIMARY STORM
MODE WILL BE LINEAR IN NATURE AS THIS ACTIVITY CONGEALS ALONG THE
OHIO VALLEY EARLIER IN THE EVENING AND MOVES INTO NORTHERN
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA LATER ON IN THE NIGHT. AS
MENTIONED...THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME ROTATING UPDRAFTS IN SOME OF THE
SUPERCELL/BOOK-END STRUCTURES WILL WARRANT AN ISOLATED TORNADO
THREAT...BUT THE PRIMARY IMPACT WILL BE DAMAGING STRAIGHT-LINE
WINDS AND HAIL. AS MENTIONED...THE MOST FAVORED AREAS WILL ROUGHLY
BE THE NORTEHRN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA...WITH LOCATIONS ALONG
AND SOUTH OF I-40 HAVING A LOWER SEVERE WEATHER THREAT.
HOWEVER...SHOULD THIS ACTIVITY MOVE IN FASTER THAN EXPECTED...A
DAMAGING WIND THREAT WILL EXIST WELL INTO THE SOUTHERN VALLEY
COUNTIES.
 
.LONG TERM /THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY/...
BANKING ON CONVECTION 
MOVING INTO OUR FORECAST AREA EARLY THURSDAY ASSOCIATED WITH MCS 
ACTIVITY...SO 12Z TO 18Z THURSDAY LOOKS LIKE BEST BET FOR SOME 
BENEFICIAL RAINS. HOWEVER...MODELS DO DIFFER ON TIMING AND POTENTIAL 
STRENGTH OF THIS CONVECTION. THIS MCS COULD WEAKEN...LEAVING OUTFLOW 
BOUNDARIES FOR LATER DEVELOPMENT...WHICH WOULD CLEARLY SHIFT THE 
TIMING AND LOCATION OF MORE WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.

THE THUNDERSTORM COMPLEX SHOULD MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY 
THURSDAY EVENING...BUT RAIN CHANCES CERTAINLY REMAIN IN THE FORECAST 
JUST ABOUT EVERYDAY. THE UPPER RIDGE TO OUR WEST IS SHOWN TO HAVE 
SEVERAL RIPPLES OF NEW CONVECTION TRACKING OUR WAY. GOOD MODEL 
CONSENSUS FOR INCREASED COVERAGE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS BY 
SUNDAY INTO SUNDAY NIGHT...BUT HESITATED TO GO LIKELY JUST YET.

A SLIGHTLY MORE AMPLIFIED SHORTWAVE TROUGH IS BEING ADVERTISED BY 
BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS...MOVING ACROSS THE MID MS VALLEY 
REGION EARLY MONDAY. ADDED LOW CHANCE POPS ACROSS OUR FORECAST AREA 
BASED ON THIS FOR MONDAY...BUT KEPT MONDAY NIGHT GRIDS DRY FOR NOW. 

OTHERWISE...SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ALSO ADDED FOR TUESDAY IN LINE WITH 
GFSX MOS TRENDS...PLUS OUR DRY GRIDS WERE AN OUTLIER FROM ADJACENT 
NWS GRIDS. 

FOR TEMPS...UNDERCUT THURSDAY M0S MAXES GIVEN THE EXPECTED ORGANIZED 
CONVECTION. GFSX MOS CONTINUES TO ADVERTISE HIGHS REACHING INTO THE 
UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S DURING THE LONG TERM...WHICH IS QUESTIONABLE 
GIVEN THE CLOUDINESS AND PERSISTENT RAIN CHANCES THROUGH THE PERIOD. 
MOS MINS WERE REASONABLE...CLOSE TO PREVIOUS GRIDS...AND GENEARLLY 
FOLLOWED.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
238 PM EDT TUE JUN 3 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...FORECAST MODELS AS OF LATE
HAVE BEEN TOO WET. OVERNIGHT THE NAM BREAKS OUT CONVECTION OVER
CENTRAL KY AND KEEPS IT TOGETHER INTO SW VA. MEANWHILE THE GFS IS
DRY AND THE SREF SHOWS SOME POSSIBILITY OF THIS OCCURRING. AS SUCH
HAVE OPTED FOR A MENTION OF SLIGHT CHANCE. FOG DEVELOPMENT
OVERNIGHT WILL PROBABLY BE THE BIGGER STORY. LOOK FOR VISIBILITY
RESTRICTIONS AT KTRI ESPECIALLY IF THE CLOUDS BREAK UP OVERNIGHT.
FOG WILL HAVE THE EASIEST TIME DEVELOPING WHERE IT DID RAIN
EARLIER. 

LOOKING AT WEDNESDAY...PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL BE SLIGHTLY
HIGHER OVER SW VA WITH ANY CONVECTION THAT DOES HOLD TOGETHER
OVERNIGHT AND INTO THE MORNING. IN GENERAL PRECIPITATION...IF IT
OCCURS WILL OCCUR NORTH OF I-40 GRADUALLY INCREASING CHANCES FARTHER
NORTH.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO 
SHOW AT LEAST FAIR AGREEMENT AND CONSISTENCY FOR THE LONG TERM 
PERIOD...AND FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS AGAIN ABOUT AVERAGE FOR THIS 
TIME OF YEAR. MODELS CONTINUE TO HINT OF A POSSIBLE MCS MOVING IN 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS A COLD FRONT SAGS TOWARD THE AREA. WIND FIELDS 
AND SOUNDINGS STILL LOOK SUPPORTIVE OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SEVERE 
STORMS WED NIGHT AS MENTIONED IN THE HWO. THE FRONT WILL PUSH 
THROUGH THURSDAY...WITH ADDITIONAL SHOWERS AND STORMS. DRIER AIR 
EXPECTED TO FILTER IN BEHIND THE FRONT FOR FRIDAY INTO  
SATURDAY...ALTHOUGH MOISTURE MAY BEGIN TO RETURN DURING SATURDAY AND 
CONTINUE INTO SUNDAY AS ANOTHER FRONT APPROACHES. WILL CARRY SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS ALL BUT NORTH SATURDAY AND CHANCE POPS SUNDAY ALL ZONES. 
THE FRONT IS EXPECTED TO MOVE THROUGH MONDAY...WITH DRIER AIR MOVING 
IN FOR TUESDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

1039 AM EDT TUE JUN 3 2014

.DISCUSSION...
MORNING RAINFALL COVERAGE HAS NOT BEEN AS HIGH AS PREVIOUSLY
THOUGHT. THE ENHANCED CLOUDINESS AND LACK OF FORCING HAS CAUSED THE
UPDATE TO LOWER RAIN CHANCES ACROSS THE BOARD WITH THE EXCEPTION OF
THE ONGOING SHOWERS OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. THESE SHOWERS WILL
LIKELY LAST UNTIL ABOUT 1 PM OR SO. ANOTHER BATCH OF RAIN IS
MOVING SOUTHEAST OUT OF SOUTHERN MIDDLE TN WILL MOVE INTO MARION
AND PERHAPS HAMILTON COUNTY OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS. UNFORTUNATELY
RAINFALL AMOUNTS WILL BE LESS THAN ONE TENTH INCH. OVERALL THE
TEMPERATURE FORECAST LOOKS FINE WITH ONLY A FEW MINOR ADJUSTMENTS
MADE TO SOME HOURLY GRIDS.

062 
FXUS64 KMRX 030722
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
322 AM EDT TUE JUN 3 2014

.SHORT TERM.../TODAY AND TONIGHT/...CONVECTION ASSOCIATED WITH THE
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND WEAK COLD FRONT CONTINUES TO WEAKEN NOW OVER
MIDDLE TN NE INTO ERN KY. SHORT RANGE MODELS DIFFER CONSIDERABLY ON
TIMING AND COVERAGE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS LATER TODAY...BUT
EXPECT THIS INITIAL CONVECTION WILL MOVE INTO NRN PLATEAU AND SW VA
THIS MORNING...WEAKENING BEFORE DEVELOPING AGAIN INTO THE AFTERNOON
HOURS AND WORKING SE THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF OUR FORECAST AREA. 

FORECAST GRIDS ADJUSTED TO REFLECT THIS MOST LIKELY SCENARIO...
ALLOWING FOR RAIN CHANCES TO DIMINISH FROM THE NORTH DURING THE
DAY. STAYED BELOW THE LIKELY POPS FROM NAM MOS FOR NOW DUE TO MODEL
DIFFERENCES.  

EVENING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD BE CONFINED TO SRN
AREAS...THEN SHOWERS FROM A WEAKENING MCS MAY REACH SW VA AND NE TN
BETWEEN 06Z AND 12Z WEDNESDAY. MOS GUIDANCE SUGGESTS AREAS OF FOG
DEVELOPING TONIGHT...BUT HELD OFF ON ADDING THIS TO WEATHER GRIDS
DUE TO UNCERTAINTY AND POSSIBLE LINGERING CLOUDS. 

FOR TEMPS...MAX TEMPS TODAY MORE CHALLENGING THAN TONIGHT'S MINS
AND WILL BE AFFECTED BY TIMING OF CONVECTION. STAYED CLOSE TO A MOS
BLEND AND ADJACENT NWS GRIDS.


.LONG TERM.../WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY/...
AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH ROTATING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES WILL DRAG A 
WEAK COLD FRONT INTO THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
INTO THURSDAY. AHEAD OF THIS FRONT...A COMPLEX OF STORMS WILL 
DEVELOP ACROSS THE CENTRAL PLAINS AND EVENTUALLY TRACK INTO THE OHIO 
VALLEY LATER IN THE EVENING AND OVERNIGHT HOURS. THERE IS STILL SOME 
UNCERTAINTY REGARDING THE TIMING AND MAGNITUDE OF THIS EVENT THIS 
FAR TO THE SOUTH. THE NAM-12 IS MUCH MORE PESSIMISTIC REGARDING 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES AND SHOWS A BULK OF THE ACTIVITY WELL TO THE 
NORTH ALONG THE OHIO RIVER. THE GFS MEANWHILE MAINTAINS THE FRONT 
AND ASSOCIATED MCS/STORM COMPLEX DROPPING SOUTH INTO THE REGION 
DURING THE LATE EVENING AND PUSHING INTO THE MOUNTAINS AND EVEN 
PARTS OF THE SOUTHERN VALLEY LATE IN THE NIGHT/EARLY MORNING.

AS A RESULT...POPS WERE TRICKY...BUT DID LEAN SLIGHTLY TOWARD THE 
GFS SOLUTION AND HAVE BUMPED POPS ALONG THE TENNESSEE/KENTUCKY 
BORDER AND IN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA TO LIKELY AS HAVE A MUCH HIGHER 
CONFIDENCE THAT THOSE AREAS WILL EXPERIENCE THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING. THE LATEST SOUNDING 
DATA AT KTRI/KTYS INDICATES THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME SUPERCELLS GIVEN 
THE CURVED HODOGRAPHS AND STRONG SHEAR...WHICH WOULD SUPPORT 
ROTATING UPDRAFTS. HOWEVER...THINK THAT THE PRIMARY STORM MODE WILL 
BE LINEAR IN NATURE AS THIS ACTIVITY CONGEALS ALONG THE OHIO VALLEY 
EARLIER IN THE EVENING AND CLIPS NORTHERN TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA LATER ON IN THE NIGHT. AS MENTIONED...THE POTENTIAL FOR 
SOME ROTATING UPDRAFTS AND SOME DISCRETE ACTIVITY WILL WARRANT AN 
ISOLATED TORNADO THREAT...BUT THE PRIMARY IMPACT WILL BE DAMAGING  
STRAIGHT-LINE WINDS AND HAIL. AS MENTIONED...THE MOST FAVORED AREAS 
WILL BE THE NORTHERN AND NORTHEASTERN ZONES...WITH LOCATIONS ALONG 
AND SOUTH OF I-40 HAVING A LOWER SEVERE WEATHER THREAT.

THEREAFTER...AN UPPER-RIDGE WILL BUILD BACK INTO THE REGION ON 
FRIDAY INTO THE WEEKEND...RESULTING IN CONTINUED WARM AND HUMID 
WEATHER...WITH ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION EXPECTED EACH DAY. 
ANOTHER WEAK FRONT SUNDAY NIGHT MAY RESULT IN A MORE ORGANIZED 
THUNDER THREAT...BUT DO NOT HAVE A GREAT DEAL OF CONFIDENCE IN THIS 
ATTM. HIGHS IN THE MID TO UPPER 80S WILL BE COMMON EACH DAY. 


&&

592 
FXUS64 KMRX 021923
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
323 PM EDT MON JUN 2 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS TO OUR 
EAST AND IS KEEPING DRIER AIR IN PLACE ACROSS OUR AREA COMPARED TO 
JUST TO OUR WEST. GENERALLY...WE HAVE DEWPOINTS IN THE 50S TO NEAR 
60 WHILE MIDDLE TN IS IN THE MID TO UPPER 60S. THIS DRIER AIR
SHOULD PREVENT SHOWERS ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA FOR THE REST OF THE
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN PLACE FOR A
SHOWER AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORM ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE PLATEAU AND
SWVA.

LATER TONIGHT A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BEGIN TO APPROACH OUR 
AREA OUT OF THE NORTHWEST. SLOWLY STARTED INCREASING POPS AFTER
MIDNIGHT ON TUESDAY. POPS CONTINUE TO INCREASE THROUGH THE NIGHT
BUT IT LOOKS LIKE THE BEST CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
WILL BE BETWEEN 15 AND 18 UTC ON TUESDAY. THERE IS A BIT OF
COVERAGE DIFFERENCE IN PRECIP BETWEEN THE NAM AND GFS. THE NAM
WANTS TO HAVE A CLEAN LINE OF SHOWERS AND STORMS EXITING BY 18 TO
21Z WHILE THE GFS KEEPS SCATTERED SHOWERS AND STORMS AROUND ALL
DAY. WILL TREND CLOSER TO THE GFS AS THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY WON'T
HAVE MUCH PUSH BEHIND IT THEREFORE BEING SLOWER TO EXIT. ROUGHLY
800 TO 12OO J/KG CAPE WILL BE PRESENT BY TOMORROW AFTERNOON SO
THERE COULD BE A FEW STRONG STORMS AROUND WITH LOCALLY GUSTY WINDS
AND PEA SIZED HAIL. HOWEVER...MID AND UPPER LEVEL WINDS WILL BE
QUITE WEAK SO NOT EXPECTING MUCH IN THE WAY OF SEVERE.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS IN REASONABLE 
AGREEMENT OVERALL FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD...ALTHOUGH EARLY IN THE 
PERIOD THE NAM IS AN OUTLIER IN HOW STRONG IT HAS THE LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM MOVING BY TO OUR NORTH...WHICH HAS IMPLICATIONS ABOUT HOW 
QUICK/HOW FAR SOUTH THE FRONT SURGES.  WILL GENERALLY LEAN TOWARD A 
GFS/ECMWF SOLUTION THERE.  FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS ABOUT AVERAGE FOR 
THIS TIME OF YEAR.  FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BE TO OUR NORTH TUESDAY 
NIGHT/WEDNESDAY...AND SOME WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY MAY HELP TO 
TRIGGER CONVECTION ESPECIALLY NORTH CLOSER TO THE FRONT.  WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AND THURSDAY EXPECTED TO BE MORE ACTIVE WITH CONVECTION AS 
COLD FRONT PUSHES IN. THE FRONT WILL LIKELY STALL NEAR OUR SOUTHERN 
BORDER...WITH SOME DRIER AIR FILTERING IN MAINLY NORTH. WILL GO DRY 
NORTH/SLIGHT CHANCE POPS SOUTH FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.  MOISTURE MAY 
RETURN BY SUNDAY AND MONDAY WITH ANOTHER FRONT APPROACHING...ALONG 
WITH BETTER CHANCES FOR CONVECTION.  GFS MOS TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE 
FOR THE MOST PART SO WILL GENERALLY STAY CLOSE.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

304 
FXUS64 KMRX 020744
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
344 AM EDT MON JUN 2 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RAIN FREE ACROSS THE REGION THIS 
MORNING WITH LOW CLOUD DECK ADVECTING NORTHWARD FROM NE AL AND NRN 
GA. MOST OF NE TN AND SW VA UNDER MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES...ALTHO TEMP 
AND DEW POINT TEMP SPREADS LARGE ENOUGH TO INHIBIT ANY FOG SO FAR.

SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM CHANCES LOOK QUITE LOW FOR TODAY...BUT KEPT 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR OUR PLATEAU COUNTIES AND LEE/WISE COUNTIES OF 
SW VA. MODELS A BIT SLOWER IN SPREADING ANY CONVECTION SE INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...BUT I CAN'T RULE OUT SOME ISOLATED 
CONVECTION OVERNIGHT...SO KEPT CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS AND 
NWS NEIGHBORS FOR NOW.

SOUNDINGS AND TIME HEIGHT SECTIONS SHOW INCREASING MID AND HIGH 
CLOUDS THIS AFTERNOON...SO KEPT MAX TEMPS CLOSE TO A BLEND OF MOS. 
THIS SHOULD MEAN HIGHS QUITE CLOSE TO SUNDAY MAXES. WENT CLOSE TO 
THE SLIGHTLY MILDER GFS MOS MINS FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT IN
SHIFTING SURFACE HIGH EAST TUESDAY WITH WEAK FRONT MOVING INTO THE
OHIO VALLEY. INCREASED MOISTURE MOVES UP FROM THE SOUTH AND DOWN
FROM THE NW. A SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVING SE WILL TRIGGER SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS...MAINLY IN THE AFTERNOON. NAM MODEL MOVES SHORTWAVE
THROUGH RAPIDLY DRYING OUT ATMOSPHERE TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.
ECMWF ALSO FAST WITH SHORTWAVE BUT LEAVES SOME RESIDUAL MOISTURE
AND SHORTWAVE ENERGY TUESDAY NIGHT. GFS A LITTLE SLOWER WITH RAIN
CHANCES CONTINUING OVERNIGHT. WILL HAVE HIGHEST POPS TUESDAY BUT
LEAVE SOME RESIDUAL RAIN CHANCES TUESDAY EVENING. UPPER RIDGE TO
THE WEST BUILDS EAST WEDNESDAY. NAM MODEL KEEPS IT DRY WHILE
GFS/ECMWF STILL KEEPS CHANCE OF RAIN OVER REGION. THINK LINGERING
MOISTURE AND HEATING WILL ALLOW CONVECTION TO REFORM WEDNESDAY BUT
NOT BE AS WIDESPREAD. HEIGHTS RISE WITH TEMPERATURES SEVERAL
DEGREES WARMER WEDNESDAY.

THE COLD FRONT IN THE OHIO VALLEY WILL THEN MOVE SLOWLY SOUTH
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT OR THURSDAY AND REMAIN IN
THE VICINITY THROUGH FRIDAY. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL ALLOW
SHOWERS AND STORMS TO DEVELOP WITH THE HEATING OF THE DAY AND
CONTINUE INTO THE EVENING. THERE MAY BE A DRIER DAY SATURDAY BUT
ANOTHER SURFACE LOW THAT FORMS IN THE SOUTHERN PLAINS ALONG THE OLD
FRONT MOVES EAST ALONG THE FRONT AND REDEVELOPS CONVECTION ALONG
THE FRONT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY INCREASING RAIN CHANCES.
TEMPERATURES STAY NEAR TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL WITH HIGHS IN THE
MID TO UPPER 80S AND LOWS ABOVE NORMAL IN THE LOWER TO MID 60S
NORTH AND THE MID TO UPPER 60S SOUTH.

GENERALLY ACROSS THE PLATEAU COUNTIES AND MAYBE PORTIONS OF 
SOUTHWEST VA. BY TUESDAY THIS SYSTEM WILL TRACK ACROSS E TN AND INTO 
SW NC BRINGING THE HIGHEST CHANCES OF PRECIPITATION THIS WEEK. LOOK 
FOR A BRIEF DRYING PERIOD BEFORE THE WARM AND HUMID ATMOSPHERE 
PRODUCES ADDITIONAL LOW END SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM CHANCES THROUGH 
AT LEAST WEDNESDAY NIGHT. BY THURSDAY THE RIDGE WEAKENS OVER THE 
OHIO VALLEY AND ANOTHER FRONT WILL SKIRT THE FORECAST AREA ALONG 
WITH RESPECTABLE INSTABILITY. SO WE ANTICIPATE ANOTHER INCREASED 
SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM CHANCES WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. CURRENT 
MODELS ARE IN AGREEMENT FOR A MOSTLY DRY SATURDAY BUT SUNDAY COULD 
PROVE TO BRING CHANCES OF SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY WHEN A 
WARM FRONT MOVES OUT OF GEORGIA AHEAD OF A DEEP TROUGH MOVING OUT OF 
THE PLAINS STATES.

TONIGHT...SO I STAYED CLOSE TO PREVIOUS MIN TEMPS. 

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...DRIER AIR MASS WITH
SURFACE HIGH CENTERED ALONG EAST COAST WILL KEEP FORECAST AREA
DRIER AS DEEP MOISTURE STAYS TO THE WEST THROUGH MUCH OF THE DAY
MONDAY. HOWEVER BOTH GFS AND NAM SHOW CONSIDERABLE MID AND HIGH
CLOUD COVER MOVING OVER THE EASTERN TN VALLEY WHICH MAY HOLD
TEMPERATURES DOWN A COUPLE DEGREES. SOUTHERLY FLOW THEN INCREASES
TUESDAY AS COLD FRONT MOVES INTO OHIO VALLEY AND MAJOR SHORTWAVE
MOVES WITH FRONT ACROSS OHIO VALLEY. KEPT HIGH POPS NORTH AND 50
PERCENT CHANCE SOUTH DURING THE DAY. RAIN CHANCES DECREASE WITH
SUNSET TUESDAY NIGHT. THEN UPPER RIDGING OVER THE SW STATES NOSES
EASTWARD WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. TEMPERATURES RISE A FEW
DEGREES AND LOWERED POPS TO 20 TO 30 PERCENT. THE RIDGE THEN
WEAKENS AGAIN WITH FRONT DROPPING INTO OHIO VALLEY. SHOWERS AND
STORMS BECOME SCATTERED AGAIN THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD.
TEMPERATURES COOLER MONDAY AND TUESDAY DUE TO CLOUDS AND HIGHER
RAIN CHANCES THEN A FEW DEGREES WARMER WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY.

PLACE FOR SUNDAY NIGHT SHOULD LIMIT CONVECTIVE COVERAGE WITH THE 
EXCEPTION OF EARLY SUNDAY EVENING. BY MONDAY SLIGHTLY MORE UNSTABLE 
AIR WILL INFILTRATE MORE OF THE REGION BRINGING THE BETTER CHANCES 
OF SCATTERED STORMS OVER THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AREAS. 
AFTER SUNSET EXPECT STORM DEVELOPMENT TO WANE MONDAY NIGHT. ALL 
MODELS INDICATE BEST CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ON 
TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT AS A SHORTWAVE TROUGH TRANSLATES ACROSS 
THE OHIO VALLEY. BY WEDNESDAY IT APPEARS THAT THE NOSE OF THE RIDGE 
CENTERED NEAR THE TEXAS BIG BEND REGION WILL BUILD NORTHEASTWARD. 
THIS SHOULD LIMIT RAINFALL ACTIVITY FOR ALL BUT PERHAPS SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA. AS THE RIDGE WEAKENS ITS HOLD LOOK FOR SCATTERED ACTIVITY 
ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. 
TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN AT OR ABOVE SEASONAL NORMALS THROUGH THE 
PERIOD.

&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
436 AM EDT SAT MAY 31 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WIND SHIFT AND SLIGHTLY LOWER 
DEW POINT TEMPS ACROSS SW VA AND EXTREME NE TN...WHILE AIR MASS 
REMAINS HOMOGENEOUS ACROSS THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA. THE 
WEAK UPPER LOW HAS BEEN SHUNTED FURTHER SW WITH RIDGING ALOFT FROM 
THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY TO THE TN VALLEY REGION. PATCHY AREAS OF FOG 
THIS MORNING...MAINLY WHERE THE BETTER RAINS OCCURRED YESTERDAY. 

PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS LOOKED ON TRACK WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR NRN 
AREAS TO AROUND 50 PERCENT FOR SE TN AND SW NC...ASSOCIATED WITH THE 
LINGERING FRONTAL BOUNDARY. WEAK SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW FOR 
TONIGHT...SO KEEPING SLIGHT CHANCE POPS SRN AREAS AND MOSTLY CLEAR 
NRN AREAS. CLOUDS CREEP BACK INTO SE TN AND SW NC...SO NUDGED MIN 
TEMPS UP A COUPLE OF DEGREES IN THOSE AREAS. MAX TEMPS QUITE CLOSE 
TO PAST FEW DAYS.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE RIDGING DOWN
THE EAST COAST WILL KEEP SLIGHTLY COOLER LESS HUMID AIR MASS ACROSS
MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY. ALONG OR NEAR THE SOUTHERN
BORDER WHERE WEAK FRONT IS EXPECTED TO BE TODAY THE FLOW WILL STAY
FROM THE SOUTHEAST...BRINGING IN MORE MOIST HUMID AIR MASS. A
CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND STORMS SOUTHEAST. STILL EXPECT NORTHEAST
SECTIONS TO BE DRY AND ONLY ISOLATED CONVECTION NEAR KNOXVILLE AND
OAK RIDGE IN THE CENTRAL VALLEY AND SMOKIES. HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS
SLIGHTLY EAST SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY AND GULF MOISTURE INCREASES
MONDAY INTO TUESDAY AS A LOW PRESSURE AREA MOVES INTO THE GREAT
LAKES AND COLD FRONT MOVES TOWARD THE MS VALLEY. RAIN CHANCES
INCREASE MONDAY INTO TUESDAY. THIS COLD FRONT THEN PASSES MAINLY TO
THE NORTH OF THE REGION AS HIGH PRESSURE HANGS ON OVER THE
SOUTHEAST STATES. WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT UPPER RIDGE TO THE
WEST SHIFTS EAST ACROSS THE TN VALLEY. THIS WILL SUPPRESS
CONVECTION SOMEWHAT. THEN THURSDAY A COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE OHIO
VALLEY AND TRIES TO MOVE SOUTH THROUGH THE TN VALLEY BY FRIDAY.
THE GFS MOVES THE FRONT THROUGH THURSDAY AND THE ECMWF IS SOMEWHAT
SLOWER. BASIC FORECAST CHANGES LITTLE FOR THE MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY
PERIOD WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND STORMS EACH DAY WITH THE BEST
CHANCE NORTH ON TUESDAY. TEMPERATURES NEAR AVERAGE WITH SLIGHTLY
COOLER NIGHTTIME TEMPERATURES SUNDAY NIGHT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
411 AM EDT FRI MAY 30 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...VERY QUIET OVER THE EARLY
MORNING HOURS WITH AREA RADARS NEARLY ECHO FREE AT THIS TIME.
ENOUGH CONVECTIVE DEBRIS CLOUDS TO LIMIT FOG DEVELOPMENT SO
FAR...BUT I EXPECT THAT PATCHY AREAS OF FOG MAY BE ENCOUNTERED
BETWEEN SURFACE OBSERVATION SITES...MAINLY WHERE THOSE SPOTTY
MODERATE TO HEAVY RAINS OCCURRED YESTERDAY.

LATEST SURFACE MAP DOES NOT INDICATE MUCH DIFFERENCE IN DEW POINT 
TEMPS FROM NORTH TO SOUTH...WITH THE WEAK COLD FRONT LIKELY STILL TO 
OUR NORTH EARLY TODAY. MODELS SAG THIS WEAK BOUNDARY INTO SW VA AND 
NE TN COUNTIES IN THE AFTERNOON...AND ALSO FAVOR THE ERN MTNS AND 
SRN AREAS FOR BETTER DEVELOPMENT LATER TODAY. THUS...I LOWERED POPS 
FOR THIS MORNING AND NUDGED POPS UP TO HIGHER CHANCES OR LIKELY IN 
THOSE FAVORED LOCATIONS BY THE AFTERNOON HOURS. 

CONVECTION SHOULD BE ON THE DECREASE AFTER THIS EVENING AS THE WEAK 
UPPER LOW SLIPS SLIGHTLY FURTHER SW OF THE REGION. BOTH THE UPPER 
LOW AND FRONTAL BOUNDARY BECOME QUITE WEAK BY TONIGHT. DAY SHIFT MAY 
NEED TO ADD AREAS OF FOG FOR LATE TONIGHT...DEPENDING ON THE AMOUNT 
OF CLEARING AND EXACTLY HOW MUCH RAIN OCCURS TODAY. 

OTHERWISE...GFS MOS MAX TEMPS HAVE BEEN GENERALLY ON THE MARK AND 
WERE CLOSELY FOLLOWED. TRENDED TOWARD THE BLEND OF VERY SIMILAR MOS 
MINS FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...SLIGHTLY COOLER AND DRIER 
AIR BEHIND WASHED OUT WEAK FRONT WILL BE OVER NORTHEAST TWO THIRDS 
OF THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY MORNING. SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND THE
SOUTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WILL STILL BE QUITE MOIST AND UNSTABLE
SO STILL CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND STORMS THERE. SUNDAY HIGH PRESSURE
TO THE NORTHEAST MODIFIES MORE AND MOISTURE FROM THE SOUTH MOVES
BACK NORTH WITH SHOWERS AND STORMS POSSIBLE ACROSS CENTRAL
SECTIONS. MONDAY SURFACE HIGH BEGINS TO SHIFT EAST AS WEAK FRONT
MOVES INTO GREAT LAKES AND MID MS VALLEY. THIS WILL INCREASE RAIN
CHANCES SLIGHTLY OVER THE FORECAST AREA. TUESDAY THE FRONT MOVES
INTO THE OHIO VALLEY AND GIVES THE FORECAST AREA AN EVEN BETTER
CHANCE. WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY FRONT MOVES BACK NORTH BUT SCATTERED
SHOWERS AND STORMS CONTINUE. TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY COOLER NORTHEAST
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY THEN WARM BACK TO THE MID AND UPPER 80S.
