OF THE BACK DOOR FRONTAL BOUNDARY. DEVELOPMENT WILL TEND TO FAVOR
TYS AND CHA LATER IN THE AFTERNOON AS THE BOUNDARY EDGES SOUTHWARD.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
237 PM EDT THU MAY 29 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...INSTABILITY SHOWERS 
UNDERWAY AND WILL CONTINUE INTO THE EVENING HOURS. SLOW MOVING 
STORMS WILL PRODUCE HOURLY RAINFALL RATES NEAR ONE INCH. SMALL HAIL 
IS ALSO POSSIBLE. HIGH THICKNESS VALUES AND HUMIDITY CONTINUES ON 
FRIDAY WITH SIMILAR CONVECTIVE COVERAGE. BACK DOOR FRONT MOVES INTO 
THE AREA FROM THE NE LATE ON FRIDAY. INCREASED UPPER NW FLOW WILL 
OCCUR ACROSS NE AREAS THROUGH SATURDAY. A DRIER AIRMASS WILL BUILD 
IN BEHIND THE FRONT WILL WILL WORK S TO NEAR TYS ON SATURDAY. 
SCATTERED CONVECTION REMAIN POSSIBLE ALONG AND SW OF FRONT ON 
SATURDAY. LITTLE TEMPERATURE CONTRAST ACROSS FRONTAL BOUNDARY.   
 
.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...THE WEAK FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY MOVING INTO THE SOUTHERN TN VALLEY LOSES ITS IDENTITY BY 
SUNDAY MORNING. CONFIDENCE IS LOW FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
OVERNIGHT GENERALLY FOR SOUTHERN AREAS BUT THIS WOULD BE THE BEST 
PLACE FOR ANY CONVECTION TO SPARK UP. AS PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS HAVE 
OVERDONE PRECIPITATION...THE TREND CONTINUES. DIURNAL SCATTERED 
CONVECTION IS POSSIBLE EACH AFTERNOON. BEST CHANCE OCCUR ON TUESDAY 
WHEN THE RIDGE BREAKS DOWN OVER THE SE AND A SHORTWAVE TRANSLATES 
ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES REGION. THIS SHOULD HELP SET UP A NORTHWEST 
FLOW PATTERN BRINGING THUNDERSTORMS FROM CENTRAL KY INTO E TN DURING 
THE DAY ON TUESDAY. BY WEDNESDAY THE WEAK RIDGE BUILDS EAST AND 
CONFIDENCE IS LOW AGAIN WHEN IT COMES TO THE CONVECTION COVERAGE. 
MODELS ARE VERY AGGRESSIVE WITH PRECIPITATION. 

NO DOUBT THE TEMPERATURES WILL BE ON THE RISE EARLY NEXT WEEK. THE 
HOTTEST DAYS SHOULD BE TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY OF NEXT WEEK WITH 
TEMPERATURES APPROACHING 90 DEGREES FOR SEVERAL LOCATIONS.

TO INFLUENCE OUR WEATHER THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD. WILL MAKE

FOR THE MOST PART.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 PM EDT WED MAY 28 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...WEAK SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL REMAIN OVER THE AREA INTO FRIDAY. A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL 
BACKDOOR INTO THE AREA BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON. WEAKENING UPPER LOW 
REMAINS SOUTHWEST OF THE AREA. SURFACE DEW POINTS IN THE 60S AND 
ABOVE NORMAL LAYER MOISTURE WILL CONTINUE OVER THE AREA UNTIL DRIER 
AIR BUILDS IN FROM THE NORTHEAST ON FRIDAY AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES 
WILL CONTINUE ABOVE NORMAL. STRAY THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE ANY 
TIME BUT DAY TIME HEATING AND OROGRAPHIC LIFT WILL BE THE BEST 
TRIGGERS FOR DEVELOPING THUNDERSTORMS. SLOW MOVING STORMS COULD 
PRODUCE BRIEF LOCALIZED FLOODING. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...AT THE BEGINNING OF 
THIS PERIOD...IN THE UPPER LEVELS WE WILL BE UNDER A WEAK RIDGE THAT 
IS SANDWICHED BETWEEN THE WEAK GULF OF MEXICO LOW AND A VERY STRONG 
LOW IN EASTERN CANADA.  AT THE SURFACE...A BACK-DOOR COLD FRONT WILL 
BE MOVING EITHER THROUGH THE AREA ALREADY OR WILL BE MOVING THROUGH 
FRIDAY EVENING...DEPENDING ON THE MODEL.  FOR SATURDAY...MOST MODELS 
AND ENSEMBLE MEMBERS HAVE THE FRONT S AND W OF OUR AREA AND KEEP US 
DRY...BUT BY SUNDAY THE RETURN FLOW HAS BEGUN TO OUR WEST AND PRECIP 
CHANCES MAY BE SOMEWHAT CLOSE. HOWEVER...INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...THE 
AREA REMAINS UNDER THE SAME BASIC SCENARIO...UNDER A WEAK UPPER 
RIDGE...ALTHOUGH CHANGES ARE OCCURRING ELSEWHERE...AND THIS COULD 
CONTINUE INTO THE END OF THIS PERIOD ON WEDNESDAY.  

WITH THE RIDGE WINNING-OUT FOR THE MOST PART...AM LEANING ON THE 
HIGH SIDE OF MAX TEMPS...AND FIGURING ON MORE EVAPORATION THAN 
PRECIPITATION...SO WILL KEEP DEW POINTS ON THE DRY SIDE NEXT WEEK.

AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL SAG SOUTH INTO

LIKELY POPS ALL BUT SOUTH THURSDAY AND CHANCE POPS ALL ZONES 
THURSDAY NIGHT AS THE FRONT SAGS INTO THE AREA.  SOME LIMITED DRYING 
EXPECTED TO FILTER IN BY SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT...SO WILL GO 
PRECIP FREE EXCEPT SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH SAT AND DRY ALL ZONES SAT 
NIGHT.  MOISTURE WILL BEGIN TO RETURN BY SUNDAY...SO PRECIP CHANCES 
START TO INCREASE AGAIN FOR THE LATTER PART OF THE WEEKEND INTO 
EARLY NEXT WEEK. WILL MAKE MOSTLY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO GFS MOS

320 PM EDT TUE MAY 27 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SCATTERED SHOWERS AND

THE SURFACE WITH UPPER RIDGING ALOFT OVER THE SE CORNER OF THE 
UNITED STATES. AN UPPER LEVEL LOW TO THE SW IS STILL MOVING SLOWLY 
EAST TODAY TOWARDS THE LOWER MS VALLEY. ANOTHER MORE CONCENTRATED 
AREA OF SHOWERS AND STORMS WAS DEVELOPING IN THE OHIO VALLEY OUT 
AHEAD OF A FRONT MOVING SOUTH THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES AND UPPER 
MIDWEST. NOT MUCH CHANGE IN CURRENT PATTERN THROUGH WEDNESDAY. 
SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL SLOWLY DECREASE THROUGH EARLY EVENING. BUT 
ISOLATED ACTIVITY POSSIBLE OVERNIGHT. THERE MAY BE A LITTLE MORE 
MOISTURE IN THE WEST AS THE UPPER LOW SLIDES FARTHER EAST AND ALSO 
POSSIBLY OVER SW VA AS MOISTURE POOLS AHEAD OF FRONT AS IT APPROACHES
THE OHIO VALLEY AS SHOWN BY NAM MODEL. THE GFS WANTS TO BRING MORE
SHOWERS DOWN INTO SW VA WEDNESDAY FROM ACTIVITY IN OHIO VALLEY. NAM
MODEL PUTS POPS AT 50 TO 60 PERCENT OVER THE AREA AND GFS ONLY 20
PERCENT. WILL COMPROMISE AND SLOWLY INCREASE POPS FROM 20 TO 40
PERCENT DURING THE DAY WEDNESDAY. LOWS TONIGHT LOOK SIMILAR TO THIS
MORNING...NEAR 60 NE TO UPPER 60S SOUTH. WEDNESDAY HIGHS A BLEND OF
BOTH MODELS LOOKS BEST...UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S NORTHEAST AND MID
80S CENTRAL AND SOUTHWEST.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL A STAGNANT PATTERN LINGERING THROUGH 
EARLY NEXT WEEK. A WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT 
SOUTHWARD INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY THURSDAY...AND BECOME QUASI-
STATIONARY AROUND THE FORECAST AREA AS THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW WEAKENS. 
AN UNSTABLE AIR MASS IS EXPECTED TO LINGER OVER THE FORECAST AREA... 
ESPECIALLY DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS...WITH SCATTERED 
CONVECTION CONTINUING EACH DAY THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK. MODELS 
INDICATE THAT THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL EVENTUALLY DRIFT SOUTH AND 
WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY...BUT WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION 
AT LEAST ISOLATED CONVECTION AFTER SATURDAY SINCE A MARGINALLY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS IS PROGGED TO LINGER OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AS 
FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO A PERSISTENCE FORECAST THROUGHOUT

PERIOD WILL BE IN A RATHER UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN WITH A CUTOFF 
LOW DROPPING SOUTH TOWARDS THE GULF AND STALLING OVER LA.  DEW 
POINTS IN THE 60S AND A WEAK TO OCCASIONALLY MODERATE UNSTABLE AIR 
MASS IN PLACE WILL CREATE SCATTERED MOSTLY DIURNAL CONVECTION 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.  A BROAD...WEAKENING FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL 
SLIDE THROUGH ON FRIDAY WHICH SHOULD PROVIDE OUR BEST CHANCE AT 
ORGANIZED CONVECTION THROUGH THE PERIOD.  AIR MASS BECOMES MORE 
STABLE BEHIND THE FRONT.  HOWEVER...THE BOUNDARY WILL STALL JUST TO 
OUR SOUTH DURING THE WEEKEND AND CONVECTION SHOULD BECOME MORE 
ISOLATED WITH BEST CHANCES OF PRECIP OVER SOUTHERN LOCATIONS.  THE 
BOUNDARY IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY MOVE BACK INTO THE REGION EARLY IN THE 
UPCOMING WEEK.

736 
FXUS64 KMRX 261916
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 PM EDT MON MAY 26 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...A MOSTLY SUNNY TO PARTLY CLOUDY 
MEMORIAL DAY WITH SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FIRING OVER 
THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL PLATEAU COUNTIES AHEAD OF WEAK SHORT WAVE 
ENERGY MOVING SLOWLY EAST ACROSS MIDDLE AND EAST TN. MUCH LESS 
COVERAGE ELSEWHERE AT THIS HOUR BUT A FEW STORMS OVER SW VA AND IN 
THE SMOKIES. DO EXPECT A LITTLE MORE COVERAGE FROM MID TO LATE 
AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY EVENING AS ACTIVITY DEVELOPS IN THE VALLEYS 
EITHER FROM HEATING OR OFF OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES FROM PLATEAU ACTIVITY. 
TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE LOWER TO MID 80S EXCEPT WHERE SHOWERS AND 
STORMS ARE OCCURRING.

THE CONVECTION SHOULD CONTINUE TO MOVE SLOWLY EAST OR NORTHEAST. 
RAINFALL AMOUNTS COULD BE LOCALLY HEAVY IN STORMS...ABOUT ONE TO TWO 
INCHES BUT OUTSIDE OF THUNDERSTORMS AROUND ONE QUARTER INCH OR LESS. 
WARM AND HUMID TONIGHT WITH A FEW DEGREES WARMER FROM KNOXVILLE 
NORTH AND ABOUT THE SAME IN THE SOUTH. WEATHER PATTERN DOES NOT SHOW 
MUCH CHANGE TUESDAY. SURFACE HIGH OVER SOUTHEAST STATES WITH UPPER 
LEVEL RIDGING CLOSE BY TODAY. AN UPPER LOW OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS 
THAT MOVES EAST TOWARDS THE MS VALLEY TUESDAY. MODELS SHOW A LITTLE 
MORE MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY OVER THE EASTERN TN VALLEY TUESDAY SO 
KEPT HIGHER POPS OF 40 TO 50 PERCENT REGION WIDE FOR MID AFTERNOON
TO EARLY EVENING. HIGH TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE SIMILAR TO TODAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL A STAGNANT PATTERN LINGERING INTO 
EARLY NEXT WEEK. A WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY MOVE INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA ON WEDNESDAY...AND BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY FOR 
SEVERAL DAYS AROUND THE FORECAST AREA. WITH A MODERATELY UNSTABLE 
AIR MASS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP EACH DAY OVER THE FORECAST AREA... 
MAINLY DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING...SCATTERED CONVECTION WILL 
CONTINUE TO DEVELOP EACH DAY. MODELS INDICATE THAT THIS FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY WILL EVENTUALLY DRIFT SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA BY THE 
WEEKEND...BUT WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION AL LEAST ISOLATED CONVECTION 
SINCE A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL LINGER OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA BEHIND THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO 
THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH IS 
ESSENTIALLY A PERSISTENCE FORECAST.
&&

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CONSIDERABLE MOISTURE WILL LINGER

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...IT LOOKS LIKE THIS PERIOD WILL 
BE A BIT MORE ACTIVE IN TERMS OF THE POSSIBILITY OF CONVECTION 
THROUGH THE END OF THE WORK WEEK. THE CONFIGURATION OF A TROUGH OVER 
THE MID SECTION OF THE NATION AND A RIDGE OVER THE EASTERN U.S. WILL 
KEEP THE PREVAILING FLOW ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION 
SOUTHERLY AND THUS RATHER MOIST. THE HUMID ATMOSPHERE WILL ALSO 
BECOME UNSTABLE WITH SUFFICIENT SUMMER LIKE HEATING AND LIFT COULD 
BECOME ENHANCED ON TUESDAY AS MODELS GENERALLY AGREE THAT A WEAK 
SHORT WAVE WILL RIDE NORTHEAST OUT OF THE DEEP SOUTH INTO MIDDLE 
TENNESSEE. THEREFORE...TRIED TO TREND CHANCE POPS JUST A LITTLE 
HIGHER OVER MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH EMPHASIS ON THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. MAINTAINED MEDIUM CHANCE POPS ON WEDNESDAY BUT 
BY THURSDAY AND FRIDAY TWEAKED POPS UP A BIT FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WITH LONG TERM MODELS HOLDING ONTO A SCENARIO WHICH 
INCLUDES THE AMPLIFYING NORTHEASTERN U.S. UPPER TROUGH AND 
ASSOCIATED COOL FRONTAL PUSH SOUTH ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. 
AS THE SLIGHTLY COOLER AND MAINLY DRIER AIRMASS PUSHES SOUTH ACROSS 
THE MRX FORECAST AREA PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION WILL BE MUCH 
LOWER IN THE MORE STABLE AIR NORTH OF THE BOUNDARY. BY SUNDAY...MOST 
OF THE GREAT VALLEY WILL BE STABLE ENOUGH FOR NO MENTION OF 
CONVECTION WITH JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE ON THE MAJOR TERRAIN FEATURES. 
ONCE AGAIN...TRENDED MAX TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES BELOW GUIDANCE 
WHILE ADJUSTING MINS A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE SUGGESTED LOWS DUE TO 
RECENT TRENDS.

258 
FXUS64 KMRX 251923 CCA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN 
320 PM EDT SUN MAY 25 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...DIFFUSE BOUNDARY STRETCHING
FROM MIDDLE TN ACROSS SOUTHERN E TN AND SW NC HAS CAUSED SCATTERED
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MUCH OF THE DAY PARTICULARLY ALONG AND
SOUTH OF I-40 FOR THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE PLATEAU. THE RAINFALL IS
WELCOMED HOWEVER SOME OUTDOOR HOLIDAY ACTIVITIES HAVE BEEN AFFECTED. 
EXPECT THE RAIN TO END SHORTLY AFTER SUNSET. ANOTHER BATCH OF LIGHT 
RAIN WITH MINIMAL CHANCES OF THUNDER WILL OCCUR IN ASSOCIATION WITH 
ISENTROPIC LIFT EARLY MORNING PRIMARILY FOR AREAS AROUND KNOXVILLE 
NORTHEAST TOWARD TRI-CITIES. EXPECT THE LIGHT RAIN TO SHIFT TOWARD 
NE TN AND SW VA AFTER SUNRISE. THIS BATCH OF RAIN SHOULD END BY 
NOON. 

CHANCES OF AFTERNOON SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL OCCUR AGAIN ON
THE MONDAY HOLIDAY. SINCE THE BOUNDARY HAS BECOME RATHER DIFFUSE
THERE IS LITTLE FOCUS ACCORDING TO THE MODEL RESOLUTIONS...HOWEVER
GIVEN THAT RISING MOISTURE LEVELS WILL COMMENCE WITH SOUTHWESTERLY
LOW LEVEL FLOW WE ANTICIPATE ANOTHER UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE. LOOK FOR
OCCASIONALLY BREEZY CONDITIONS IN THE AFTERNOON AS THE WINDS SHIFT
TO THE SOUTHWEST NEAR 10 MPH.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...THIS PERIOD STARTS WITH 
A WEAK UPPER RIDGE OVER THE REGION...BUT THE RIDGE SLIDES EAST AND 
BY TUESDAY THE TROUGH TO THE WEST IS GAINING INFLUENCE OVER THE 
AREA.  SUMMER PATTERN OVERALL FOR MOST OF THIS WEEK...WITH DAYTIME 
AND EVENING SCATTERED SHOWERS AND STORMS.  BEST CHANCES LOOK TO BE 
ON TUESDAY WHEN A WEAK TROUGH MOVES THROUGH THE AREA...AND ON FRIDAY 
WHEN A COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH.  FINALLY IN THE DRIER POST-FRONTAL 
AIR MASS...POPS GET DRY/LOW BY SAT/SUN.  

NOT EXPECTING MUCH IN THE WAY OF SEVERE STORM THREAT THIS WEEK.  
WENT CLOSE TO GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS...ALTHOUGH UNDERCUT THE HIGHS IN 
THE NORTH ON FRI/SAT.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             65  85  65  86 /  30  30  20  30

OAK RIDGE, TN                       60  84  64  87 /  30  20  20  50

AFFECTED. EXPECT THE RAIN TO END SHORTLY AFTER SUNRISE. ANOTHER
BATCH OF LIGHT RAIN WITH MINIMAL CHANCES OF THUNDER WILL OCCUR
IN ASSOCIATION WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT EARLY MORNING PRIMARILY FOR
AREAS AROUND KNOXVILLE NORTHEAST TOWARD TRI-CITIES. EXPECT THE
LIGHT RAIN TO SHIFT TOWARD NE TN AND SW VA AFTER SUNRISE. THIS
BATCH OF RAIN SHOULD END BY NOON. 

CHANCES OF AFTERNOON SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL OCCUR AGAIN ON
THE MONDAY HOLIDAY. SINCE THE BOUNDARY HAS BECOME RATHER DIFFUSE
THERE IS LITTLE FOCUS ACCORDING TO THE MODEL RESOLUTIONS...HOWEVER
GIVEN THAT RISING MOISTURE LEVELS WILL COMMENCE WITH SOUTHWESTERLY
LOW LEVEL FLOW WE ANTICIPATE ANOTHER UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE. LOOK FOR
OCCASIONALLY BREEZY CONDITIONS IN THE AFTERNOON AS THE WINDS SHIFT
TO THE SOUTHWEST NEAR 10 MPH.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...THIS PERIOD STARTS WITH 
A WEAK UPPER RIDGE OVER THE REGION...BUT THE RIDGE SLIDES EAST AND 
BY TUESDAY THE TROUGH TO THE WEST IS GAINING INFLUENCE OVER THE 
AREA.  SUMMER PATTERN OVERALL FOR MOST OF THIS WEEK...WITH DAYTIME 
AND EVENING SCATTERED SHOWERS AND STORMS.  BEST CHANCES LOOK TO BE 
ON TUESDAY WHEN A WEAK TROUGH MOVES THROUGH THE AREA...AND ON FRIDAY 
WHEN A COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH.  FINALLY IN THE DRIER POST-FRONTAL 
AIR MASS...POPS GET DRY/LOW BY SAT/SUN.  

NOT EXPECTING MUCH IN THE WAY OF SEVERE STORM THREAT THIS WEEK.  
WENT CLOSE TO GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS...ALTHOUGH UNDERCUT THE HIGHS IN 
THE NORTH ON FRI/SAT.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             65  85  65  86 /  30  30  20  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  61  83  64  86 /  30  20  20  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       60  84  64  87 /  30  20  20  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              53  83  63  85 /  20  30  20  50

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EDT SUN MAY 25 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
NEAR THE SOUTHERN TENNESSEE BORDER WILL NUDGE SLOWLY NORTH AS A WARM 
FRONT DURING THE SHORT TERM PERIOD. MORE SIGNIFICANT INSTABILITY 
INDICATED FOR TODAY THAN YESTERDAY MAINLY SOUTHERN ZONES...AND 
EXPECT SOME SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP IN THE VICINITY OF 
THE FRONT TODAY AND CONTINUE INTO AT LEAST THE FIRST PART OF 
TONIGHT.  WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS SOUTHERN HALF OF THE AREA 
BOTH PERIODS. WILL MAKE MAINLY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO MAV 
TEMPS...MAINLY DOWN ON HIGHS AND UP ON LOWS.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION 
WILL GRADUALLY INCREASE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE WORK 
WEEK AS A SOUTHERLY COMPONENT TO THE FLOW KEEPS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS SUFFICIENTLY MOIST AND UNSTABLE FOR CONVECTION. LITTLE 
TO FOCUS DEVELOPMENT OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EARLY IN THE 
PERIOD OTHER THAN SOME OROGRAPHIC LIFT. ALTHOUGH THE MODELS BRING 
OCCASIONAL WEAK IMPULSES ACROSS THE REGION IN A NORTHWESTERLY 
STEERING FLOW FORMED BY THE PRESENCE OF AN UPPER LOW OVER THE SOUTH 
CENTRAL U.S. AND AN AMPLIFYING TROUGH OVER THE NORTHEASTERN STATES. 
THE INCREASING PROBABILITIES SLIP INTO THE WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY 
TIMEFRAME AS A SYNOPTIC FRONTAL BOUNDARY PRESSES SOUTHWEST TOWARD 
THE FORECAST AREA DUE TO THE STRENGTHENING EASTERN TROUGH. 
CONVERGENCE ALONG THE FRONT WOULD HELP TO FOCUS THUNDERSTORM 
DEVELOPMENT OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE 
WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY AND THEN FARTHER SOUTH ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION LATER THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT COINCIDENT WITH 
THE SLOWLY MOVING FRONTAL BOUNDARY. CONCERNING TEMPERATURES NOTICED 
A TREND IN WHICH GUIDANCE (MAINLY THE MAV) HAS BEEN A LITTLE TOO 
WARM. WITH INCREASING HUMIDITY DURING THE LONG TERM PERIOD ALONG 
WITH SCATTERED CONVECTION...WOULD EXPECT MAXES TO BE SUPPRESSED TO 
SOME DEGREE SO UNDERCUT MAXES THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD WHILE STAYING 
CLOSER TO SUGGESTED MINS.

089 
FXUS64 KMRX 241842
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
242 PM EDT SAT MAY 24 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY SITUATED 
ROUGHLY FROM SOUTHWEST NC TO NASHVILLE MAY HELP FOCUS A FEW ISOLATED 
SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY SOME THUNDER BEFORE SUNSET. AFTER SUNSET 
THICKER HIGH CLOUDS WILL FLOW OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST 
AREA WHILE NORTHERN AREAS WILL EXPERIENCE CLEAR SKIES. THE FRONT 
WILL SLOWLY LIFT NORTHWARD ON SUNDAY AND PROVIDE THE FOCUS FOR 
ADDITIONAL ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP IN THE 
AFTERNOON...ALBEIT LOW CHANCES. THE BETTER INSTABILITY RESIDES ALONG 
AND SOUTH OF A LINE FROM WARTBURG TO KNOXVILLE TO NEWPORT. 

OVERNIGHT TEMPERATURES WILL BE CLOSE TO THIS MORNING/S READINGS BUT 
SLIGHTLY COOLER WHERE ITS CLEAR. SUNDAYS MAX TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE 
AT LEAST A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER THAN TODAY/S. WINDS WILL SHIFT TO 
THE SOUTHWEST SOUTH OF THE FRONT BUT OVERALL WINDS ARE EXPECTED TO 
REMAIN BELOW 10 MPH FOR MOST AREAS. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...OVERALL...SUMMER
TIME PATTERN REMAINS THROUGH THE LONG TERM WITH WARM AND HUMID
CONDITIONS IN PLACE AS WELL AS SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM POTENTIAL
SLOWLY INCREASING THROUGH TIME. A CUT OFF UPPER LEVEL LOW AND UPPER
LEVEL RIDGE WILL BE THE PRIMARY INFLUENCES OF OUR WEATHER DURING
THIS TIME PERIOD.

A CUT OFF UPPER LEVEL LOW IS IN PLACE OVER THE FOUR CORNERS STATES 
ON SUNDAY NIGHT AND WILL SLOWLY MEANDER EAST TOWARD OUR REGION 
THROUGH THE REST OF THE LONG TERM.  SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
STORMS ON MONDAY AREA WIDE WITH THE TYPICALLY SUMMER TIME CHANCE 
POPS ACROSS OUR FAVORED HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS...WHICH INCLUDE PARTS 
OF THE PLATEAU AND SMOKIES. BY TUESDAY THE CUT OFF LOW LOOKS TO BE 
LOCATED OVER TX/OK. GOING BACK TO SUNDAY...A STRONG SOUTHERLY 850MB 
FLOW WILL HAVE STREAMED GULF MOISTURE UP TO THE APEX OF THE RIDGE 
CENTERED TO OUR WEST. THEN...NORTHWEST FLOW ON TUESDAY BEGINS TO 
CARRY THAT MOISTURE DOWN INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THIS EXTRA 
MOISTURE WILL INCREASE CHANCES OF AFTERNOON SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS NE TN AND INTO SWVA. ON WEDNESDAY...A 
DEVELOPING RIDGE SURGES OUT OF THE PACIFIC SOUTHWEST AND UP INTO THE 
NORTHERN PLAINS. MODELS SUGGEST THAT THIS NEWLY DEVELOPING RIDGE 
FORCES THE CUT OFF LOW DOWN TOWARD THE GULF COAST STATES WHERE IT 
EVENTUALLY PETERS OUT DUE TO THE AFOREMENTIONED STRENGTHENING RIDGE 
ACROSS THE PLAINS. FOR OUR AREA...WE STILL REMAIN IN A NORTHWEST 
FLOW AND INCREASED MOISTURE CONTENT WILL ALLOW FOR CHANCE SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS. 

NORTHWEST FLOW BEGINS TO GIVE WAY ON THURSDAY...BUT STRONG RIDGING 
OVER THE CENTRAL U.S. WILL FORCE AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH ACROSS THE 
NORTHEASTERN STATES DOWN INTO THE COASTAL CAROLINAS BEGINNING 
THURSDAY AND THROUGH FRIDAY. AS WITH THE PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...THIS 
COULD ALLOW A BACKDOOR COLD FRONT INTO OUR AREA WHICH WOULD SERVE AS 
A FOCUSING MECHANISM FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. AT THIS 
TIME...IT APPEARS THAT THIS COLD FRONT MAY MOVE THROUGH THURSDAY 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. CHANCE POPS IN PLACE DURING THIS TIME. BY 
SATURDAY WE ARE UNDER THE RIDGE AXIS THAT WAS ONCE OVER THE CENTRAL 
PLAINS. BEING UNDER THE CENTER OF THE RIDGE SHOULD LIMIT ANY 
CONVECTION TO THE HIGHER TERRAIN. TEMPERATURES WILL GENERALLY BY IN 
THE LOW TO UPPER 80S DURING THE LONG TERM WITH A BRIEF COOL DOWN 
INTO THE UPPER 70S AND LOW 80S ON FRIDAY WITH THE BACKDOOR FRONT.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             61  86  62  87 /  20  20  20  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  57  84  61  85 /  10  10  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       56  84  60  86 /  10  10  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              47  81  53  83 /   0   0   0  20

.DISCUSSION...
JUST A QUICK UPDATE TO TWEAK MAX TEMPERATURES AND EXTEND RAIN

NOTED OVER MIDDLE TN ALONG THIS BOUNDARY. BY LATER THIS AFTERNOON

POSSIBLE FOR THE SOUTHERN TN VALLEY. ANY SHOWERS/STORMS THAT
DEVELOP WILL WEAKEN BY SUNSET AND DISSIPATE QUICKLY THEREAFTER.
SOME OF THESE MAY MOVE INTO SW NC BEFORE ITS ALL SAID AND DONE.
COVERAGE LOOKS SCATTERED AT BEST AND MAY BE MORE ISOLATED IN
NATURE...THEREFORE CONTINUED WITH SLIGHT CHANCE MENTION.

WITH THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN AREAS...LAMP GUIDANCE
SUGGESTS THAT DAYTIME TEMPERATURES FOR NORTHERN AREAS MAY BE
SLIGHT COOLER. ADJUSTED MAX TEMPS ONLY SLIGHTLY DOWNWARD AND
UPDATED WIND FORECAST FOR THE AFTERNOON.

926 
FXUS64 KMRX 231816
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
216 PM EDT FRI MAY 23 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
THE COLD FRONT IS POSITIONED E-W ALONG THE NORTHERN TN 
BORDER...EVIDENCED BY A TEMP/DEWPT GRADIENT...BUT A PRE-FRONTAL 
TROUGH IS LOCATED FROM NEAR NASHVILLE TO CROSSVILLE TO NEAR ANDREWS 
NC...WHICH FORMS THE BACK EDGE OF TEH CU FIELD. ALONG AND SOUTH OF 
THIS BOUNDARY IS WHERE THE CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL EXISTS THROUGH THE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THERE IS SOME INSTABILITY WITH MLCAPE AROUND 
2000 J/KG...BUT FORCING BOTH ALOFT AND AT THE SURFACE IS WEAK. SOME 
STRONG TO BORDERLINE SEVERE STORMS MAY BE POSSIBLE...BUT COVERAGE 
SHOULD BE SCATTERED AT BEST. ANY ACTIVITY SHOULD END BY MIDNIGHT 
WITH THE LOSS OF HEATING. THE COLD FRONT WILL BE SOUTH OF THE AREA 
BY TOMORROW MORNING...AND A DRIER...MORE STABLE...AND SLIGHTLY
COOLER AIR MASS WILL BUILD IN FROM THE NORTH. HIGHS WILL BE IN THE
UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S IN MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
RIDGING WILL BE PRESENT THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEKEND. WEAK
INSTABILITIES WITH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE COULD PROVIDE ISOLATED
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SUNDAY AFTERNOON. A COUPLE OF SHORTWAVES
MOVE THROUGH THE AREA THROUGH THE BEGINNING OF THE WORK WEEK.
OVERALL INSTABILITY AND SHEAR LOOK VERY WEAK TO SUPPORT ANY SEVERE
STORMS DEVELOPING MONDAY AND TUESDAY. A LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS
AROUND THE GREAT LAKES AND A COLD FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH THAT LOW
WILL SWING DOWN OVER THE AREA FOR WEDNESDAY. INSTABILITIES A LITTLE
STRONGER WITH MORE ORGANIZED WIND PROFILE...COULD SEE STRONG STORMS
WITH A LOW CHANCE FOR ANYTHING SEVERE. RAIN CHANCES WILL CONTINUE
THROUGH THURSDAY AS A LOW PRESSURE BEGINS TO STRENGTHEN OVER THE
LOWER MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY. INSTABILITIES AND MOISTURE LOOK TO
BE SUFFICIENT FOR STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS...BUT WILL HAVE TO KEEP
AN EYE ON FURTHER UPDATES. TEMPERATURES WILL BE A FEW DEGREES ABOVE
NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.


&&

FRONTAL BOUNDARY MOVES SOUTH OF THE AREA FOR TONIGHT WITH DRIER AIR
AND END TO CONVECTION.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...THE FORECAST AREA ENJOYS A 
PERIOD OF RIDGING TO START THE LONG TERM PERIOD WITH JUST ENOUGH 
MOISTURE AND THE NEEDED INSTABILITY FOR JUST THE SLIGHTEST CHANCE OF 
A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST 
NORTH CAROLINA ON SUNDAY AFTERNOON. BY MONDAY THE RIDGE BEGINS TO 
LOSE INFLUENCE AS AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH MAKES A MOVE INTO THE 
EASTERN LAKES AND NEW ENGLAND AND BY MID WEEK BOTH THE ECMWF AND THE 
GFS INDICATE AMPLIFICATION OF THIS ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER 
OF THE NATION. IN THIS CONFIGURATION PIECES OF UPPER LEVEL ENERGY 
WILL DROP THROUGH THE BACK SIDE OF THE TROUGH ENHANCING LIFT FOR 
CONVECTIVE EPISODES IN THE VICINITY OF SYNOPTIC FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
THAT WILL BE DROPPING SOUTH INTO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS BY 
WEDNESDAY. MAINTAINED CHANCE POPS FOR CONVECTION TUESDAY THROUGH 
THURSDAY IN WHAT APPEARS TO BE A VERY WARM AND HUMID...SUMMER LIKE 
PATTERN NEXT WEEK. STAYED WITH THE ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES THROUGH 
MUCH OF THE LONG TERM.

252 
FXUS64 KMRX 221856
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 PM EDT THU MAY 22 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
SO FAR THE CAP HAS BEEN EFFECTIVE IN SUPPRESSING DEEP CONVECTION 
ACROSS THE REGION. SHOWERS HAVE DEVELOPED IN SRN KY...ALTHOUGH NOT
YET TO THE EXTENT THAT THE HRRR AND RUC HAVE BEEN DEPICTING. ANY
STORMS THAT DEVELOP WILL MOVE SE AND ENCOUNTER PLENTY OF CAPE...SO
THE SEVERE THREAT OF LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS
REMAINS...ALTHOUGH COVERAGE OF TSTMS MAY NOT BE MORE THAN
SCATTERED. WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS INTO THE EVENING IN THE PLATEAU
AND CENTRAL VALLEY.

THE RIDGE NEAR THE GULF COAST TODAY WILL SHIFT SOUTHWARD 
TOMORROW...AND THE AXIS OF MAX THETA-E AT 850 MB SHIFTS SOUTH AS 
WELL. MOST TSTM ACTIVITY TOMORROW WILL BE IN THE SOUTHERN 
VALLEY...HOWEVER WITH THE CONTINUED LACK OF UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT AND 
LIMITED MOISTURE...POPS WILL REMAIN IN THE CHANCE RANGE. THE CAP 
LOOKS WEAKER IN FORECAST SOUNDINGS TOMRROW COMPARED TO TODAY. MLCAPE 
WILL AGAIN BE PLENTIFUL...IN THE 3000-3500 J/KG RANGE...SO ANY 
STORMS THAT CAN DEVELOP WILL HAVE A LARGE HAIL/DAMAGING WIND 
POTENTIAL.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
BY FRIDAY NIGHT THE FRONT IS PROGGED TO SHIFT SOUTHWARD INTO
GEORGIA...SOUTH CAROLINA AND ALABAMA WHICH WILL ALLOW MORE STABLE
AIR TO FILTER INTO AREAS NORTH OF THE BOUNDARY. THUS RAIN CHANCES
DIMINISH FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. THE FRONT WILL BEGIN MOVING
SLOWLY BACK TO THE NORTH ON SUNDAY AND THE SOUTHERN TN AND
SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA COULD SEE THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOP. THE FRONT
WILL CONTINUE MOVING NORTH OVERNIGHT SUNDAY INTO MONDAY AND BRING
CHANCES FOR THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA EACH
AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY.

TEMPERATURES ON SATURDAY WILL WILL GENERALLY RANGE FROM THE MID AND 
UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S. SUNDAY MORNING WILL BE RATHER COOL WITH 
TEMPERATURES IN THE 40S AND 50S. THIS WILL BE THE COOLEST PERIOD FOR 
THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEKEND INTO NEXT WEEK WHEN OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL 
RANGE FROM THE MID 50S TO LOWER 60S AND HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL PUSH 
NEAR 90 DEGREES BY WEDNESDAY GENERALLY SOUTH OF I-40. MAX 
TEMPERATURES COOL SLIGHTLY BY THURSDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 221434 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1034 AM EDT THU MAY 22 2014

.DISCUSSION...
THE 12Z OHX SOUNDING SHOWS A STRONG CAP...AND RUC FORECAST
SOUNDINGS SHOW THIS CAP REMAINING IN PLACE THROUGH THE AFTERNOON.
IT IS STRONGEST IN SOUTHERN AREAS AND WEAKEST NORTH. THE QUESTION
IS WHETHER THERE WILL BE ENOUGH FORCING TO OVERCOME THE CAP. THE
RUC AND NAM SHOW NO UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT COMING...SO ANY CONVECTION
THAT DEVELOPS WILL NEED LOW LEVEL FORCING AND BOUNDARIES TO
DEVELOP. WE DO HAVE BOUNDARIES IN THE AREA FROM THE OVERNIGHT
SHOWERS...AND CONVECTION THAT IS EXPECTED TO INITIATE IN CNTRL KY
WILL MOVE SE..PROVIDING ADDITIONAL BOUNDARIES FOR CONVECTIVE
INITIATION. RUC AND HRRR HAVE MOST ACTIVITY IN THE PLATEAU AND
CENTRAL VALLEY.

ANY STORMS THAT FORM WILL HAVE ABUNDANT ENERGY AVAILABLE FOR
GROWTH. MLCAPE VALUES WILL APPROACH 2500 J/KG IN THE PLATEAU. THUS
LARGE HAIL APPEARS TO BE THE MAIN THREAT...WITH DAMAGING WINDS A
THREAT AS WELL AS FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW AN INVERTED-V PROFILE.
WHILE DEEP SHEAR VALUES WILL SUPPORT SOME SUPERCELLS...WEAK LOW
LEVEL SHEAR AND HIGH LCLS DO NOT FAVOR TORNADOES.

FOR THE UPDATE...POPS/WX/CLOUDS/QPF WILL BE ADJUSTED TO BETTER
MATCH FAVORED PRECIP AREAS...AND TO ADD A MENTION OF THE LARGE
HAIL/DAMAGING WIND THREAT. TEMPERATURES APPEAR ON TRACK.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...NEAR TERM...A COMPLEX OF

FOR MORNING POPS.

BOUNDARY AS WELL AS BOUNDARY FROM KENTUCKY CONVECTION WILL LIKELY
BE MAIN FOCUS FOR AFTERNOON RE-DEVELOPMENT. AIRMASS MOST OF THE

HAIL CAPES WITH FAVORABLE WET BULB ZERO HEIGHTS FOR LARGE HAIL...
UP TO GOLFBALL SIZE. ALSO...FAVORABLE THERMODYNAMICS AND SOME WINDS
ALOFT FOR DAMAGING WINDS AS WELL...FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING.

A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE SOUTH ACROSS THE AREA TONIGHT AND FRIDAY
WITH ANOTHER ROUND OF ISOLATED STRONG CONVECTION AGAIN FOR THE
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA.

DISSIPATES BY SUNDAY. SOME MOISTURE RETURN FOR SUNDAY TO INCLUDE
SLIGHT POPS FOR THE SOUTHERN AREAS DURING THE AFTERNOON/EVENING.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED THE GFS MOS...EXCEPT FOR THE NORTHERN HALF OF
THE AREA TODAY. WENT A COUPLE DEGREES COOLER DUE TO EXPECTED
CONVECTION AND CLOUDS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN FOR NEXT WEEK...AND REVEAL 
AN UNSEASONABLY WARM AND HUMID AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH 
A WEAKENING UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH APPROACHING FROM THE PLAINS. ISOLATED 
CONVECTION IS EXPECTED ON SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY...WITH THE 
APPROACHING UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH HELPING TO INCREASE THE AREAL 
COVERAGE OF CONVECTION BY TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY. AS FOR TEMPS... 
WILL GENERALLY TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR NEXT 
WEEK...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)... SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
ARE EXPECTED TO DEVELOP NORTH OF OUR AREA IN THE NEXT FEW

TN AFTER MIDNIGHT. MUCAPE IN THE 1500-2000 J/KG RANGE AND 0-6 KM 
SHEAR AROUND 35-40 KTS WILL MEAN A CHANCE OF SOME STORMS REACHING 
SEVERE LEVELS. ACTIVITY SHOULD DIMINISH AFTER 06Z. BEHIND THE 
EXITING VORT MAX. 

ANOTHER DISTURBANCE IN THE NW FLOW ALOFT WILL MOVE THROUGH TOMORROW 
AFTERNOON. THE CAP TOMORROW AFTERNOON IS WEAKER IN SOUTHERN 
AREAS...AND LINGERING BOUNDARIES FROM OVERNIGHT CONVECTION MAY AID 
DEVELOPMENT IN THE CENTRAL VALLEY. MLCAPE VALUES WILL BE VERY HIGH 
CENTRAL AND SOUTH...UP TO 3500 J/KG ACCORDING TO THE NAM...WITH GOOD 
0-6 KM SHEAR. AGAIN...WITH LIMITED MOISTURE...COVERAGE MAY NOT BE 
MORE THAN SCATTERED AND POPS WILL STAY IN THE CHANCE RANGE...BUT 
WHAT STORMS DO FORM COULD BE STRONG TO SEVERE WITH LARGE HAIL THE 
MAIN THREAT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...WEAKENING FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY WILL SLOWLY DROP SOUTH ACROSS THE REGION THURSDAY NIGHT AND 
FRIDAY FOR CONTINUED SCATTERED TO ISOLATED CONVECTION.  AIR MASS 
WILL BE UNSTABLE AND A 850 JET MOVING THROUGH WILL ALLOW FOR THE 
CHANCE OF AN OCCASIONAL STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORM TO BE 
POSSIBLE.  UPPER RIDGE BUILDS TO OUR WEST DURING THE WEEKEND PUTTING 
THE MRX CWA IN A DRY NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT FOR DRY CONDITIONS 
SATURDAY.  LOW LEVEL MOISTURE BEGINS TO MOVE BACK INTO SOUTHERN ARES 
LATE SUNDAY AND COULD SEE A FEW ISOLATED STORMS DEVELOP LATE IN THE 
DAY.  THE RIDGE SHIFTS EAST INTO THE AREA ON MONDAY ALLOWING LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE TO PUSH INTO THE REST OF THE AREA.  THIS COMBINED 
WITH STRONG DAYTIME HEATING WILL PROVIDE INGREDIENTS FOR ISOLATED 
DIURNAL CONVECTION THROUGH THE REST OF THE EXTENDED. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             62  88  66  87 /  10  20  20  30

OAK RIDGE, TN                       63  85  62  82 /  20  50  20  20

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EDT WED MAY 21 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WILL WEAKEN TODAY AND TONIGHT AS AN UPPER
TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY. A FRONTAL
BOUNDARY WILL MOVE SOUTH ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY WITH INCREASING
CHANCES OF THUNDERSTORMS OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST LATE
TODAY AND AREAS NORTH OF INTERSTATE 40 TONIGHT. AIRMASS INITIALLY
IS CAPPED OFF...BUT TRI SOUNDING SHOWS INCREASING MOISTURE AND
INSTABILITY TODAY AND TRI AND TYS TONIGHT AS UPPER RIDGE WEAKENS.

SOME OF THE STORMS COULD BECOME STRONG TO POSSIBLY SEVERE FOR
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST TENNESSEE TONIGHT WITH THE MAIN
CONCERN BEING MARGINAL HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL A COLD FRONT SLOWLY MOVING THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE 
BUILDING OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY FOR THE WEEKEND AND INTO EARLY 
NEXT WEEK. NAM AND GFS MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT A VERY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS AND A FAIRLY STRONG MID-LEVEL WIND FLOW WILL 
DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING 
COLD FRONT...AND THEN AGAIN DEVELOP OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY. THUS...IT APPEARS THAT STRONG TO SEVERE 
CONVECTION WILL BE A GOOD POSSIBILITY ON BOTH THURSDAY AND FRIDAY... 
WITH LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS BEING THE MAIN THREATS. THIS COLD 
FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA BY THE 
WEEKEND...AS AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS OVER THE APPALACHIANS 
ON SATURDAY. MOISTURE WILL GRADUALLY INCREASE AGAIN OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY...AS SOUTHERLY WINDS DEVELOP ON 
THE BACK SIDE OF THE DEPARTING HIGH. IN ADDITION...A WEAKENING UPPER-
LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE PLAINS WILL SLOWLY DRIFT TOWARDS THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY FOR THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. THIS SCENARIO WILL RESULT IN 
INCREASING CHANCES FOR CONVECTION TOWARDS THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. 
AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

OVER THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY AND SHIFT SOUTHEAST DURING THE DAY. MUCH 
OF THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA SHOULD REMAIN DRY ON 
WEDNESDAY. A HEALTHY SOUTHWEST FLOW AND ADEQUATE INSOLATION SHOULD 
HELP BOOST HIGH TEMPERATURES SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL FOR LATE 
MAY WITH MAXES EXPECTED TO REACH THE LOWER AND MIDDLE 80S. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE TO 
ONGOING FORECAST. SHORT-WAVE MOVING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES WEDNESDAY 
AND THURSDAY WILL PULL A COLD FRONT INTO TENNESSEE FOR THURSDAY. AIR 
MASS ALONG AND AHEAD OF THE FRONT WILL BECOME FAIRLY UNSTABLE WITH 
CAPES INCREASING TO 2000-2500 J/KG. MODEL DEPICTED QPF AND MOS POPS 
NUMBERS FOR PATTERN BUT MAY BE REFLECTING DRY MID LEVELS. POTENTIAL 
OF MARGINAL SEVERE HAIL AND ISOLATED DAMAGING WINDS 
POSSIBLE...MAINLY FOR THURSDAY. HIGHLIGHTED THIS POTENTIAL IN THE 
HWO. THE FRONT WILL MOVE SOUTH OF THE AREA THU NIGHT AS HIGH 
PRESSURE SETTLES INTO THE APPALACHIANS FOR THE WEEKEND. POPS WILL 
REMAIN BELOW CLIMO FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST. TEMPERATURES 
ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH THE PERIOD.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...PROTECTIVE RIDGE STILL HOLDS

APPROACHES FROM THE NORTH ON WEDNESDAY. THICKNESS VALUES ARE PACKED

.DISCUSSION...SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS THE RESULT OF AN OVERNIGHT
PERIOD IN A CLEAR SKY...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE REGIME WITH NO WIND
AND AN INVERTED TEMPERATURE PROFILE. RELATIVELY DEEP MOISTURE (UP
TO 2000 FEET) EVIDENT AS THE LOW LEVEL AIRMASS BECAME SATURATED
OVER PART OF THE GREAT VALLEY FROM AROUND TYS TO CHA. SOUTHWEST
NORTH CAROLINA AND PART OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU IS ALSO AFFECTED
BY THE SATURATED NEAR SURFACE AIR THIS MORNING. THE FOG IS ONLY
SLOWLY LIFTING IN THESE AREAS BUT IS NO LONGER DENSE. IT LOOKS LIKE
THE AIR IS STARTING TO MOVE AROUND A BIT AND THUS SOME DRYING CAN
BEGIN. WILL PULL OUT THE FOG WORDING OUT OF THE ZONES AND ADD SOME
TRENDING TO SKY CONDITION. AM NOT CONVINCED THE MORNING LOW CLOUD
LAYER WILL SIGNIFICANTLY IMPACT AFTERNOON HIGH TEMPERATURES SO WILL
LEAVE ALONE FOR NOW.

664 
FXUS64 KMRX 190655
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 AM EDT MON MAY 19 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN
AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE UPPER OHIO RIVER VALLEY...
WITH A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE DEEP SOUTH.
SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES OVER THE TN RIVER
VALLEY...WHICH HAS ALLOWED SOME DENSE FOG TO DEVELOP OVER SOUTHEAST
TN AND EXTREME SOUTHWEST NC WHERE A DECENT RAINFALL WAS OBSERVED
YESTERDAY. THIS FOG SHOULD BURN OFF SHORTLY AFTER SUNRISE...WITH
ONLY A FEW HIGH CLOUDS MOVING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. A WEAK UPPER-
LEVEL SHORT WAVE IS PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
TONIGHT...BUT WITH LIMITED MOISTURE AVAILABLE...IT SHOULD PRODUCE
MAINLY AN INCREASE IN HIGH CLOUDS. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT
WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...THIS PERIOD BEGINS WITH THE 
UPPER RIDGE IS INFLUENCING THE REGION WITH TEMPERATURES RISING.  
HOWEVER...THE RIDGE STAYS CENTERED TO OUR SW...AND KEEPS OUR AREA IN 
A NW FLOW.  OF COURSE IN OUR SW COUNTIES THE RIDGE WILL HAVE MORE OF 
AN EFFECT BY PROXIMITY...BUT IN OUR NE COUNTIES...ROUGHLY 200 MILES 
AWAY...THE NW FLOW IS MORE DOMINANT.  SO POPS START UP IN SW VA 
TUESDAY...WHERE AS THE SW CORNER HOLDS OFF POPS FOR A FULL 2 DAYS. 

SO FOR TUESDAY...DEVELOPMENT WILL LIKELY BE IN THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN...BUT RESTRICTED TO THE NERN AREAS.  WILL KEEP POPS FAIRLY 
LOW OVER THAT AREA BECAUSE THE NW FLOW WILL QUICKLY TAKE THE 
SHOWERS/STORMS OUT OF THE AREA...THAT DEVELOP IN THE HIGHEST TERRAIN 
IN THE APPALACHIAN CHAIN.  HAVE LOWER POPS IN THE SMALLER MOUNTAINS 
TO THE WEST ALONG THE KY LINE AND HIGH KNOB ETC...BUT ANYTHING THAT 
DEVELOPS THERE WILL QUICKLY ADVECT OVER THE VALLEY TO THE ESE...SO 
WILL NEED POPS IN THE VALLEY LOCATIONS AS WELL.

FOR THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS...THE PRECIP CHANCES WILL PENETRATE MORE 
AND MORE INTO THE AREA AS THE ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM SAGS SWD.  
THEN BY FRIDAY IT LOOKS LIKE THE FRONT WILL BE ABOUT TO EXIT THE 
AREA TO THE SOUTH...SO ONLY HAVE ABOUT THE SOUTHERN 1/3 OF THE AREA 
WITH POPS.
 
STILL LOOKS LIKE THERE IS A RISK OF SEVERE STORMS WEDNESDAY THROUGH 
THURSDAY AS INSTABILITY AND SHEAR COMBINE NEAR THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
AS IT SAGS SOUTH.
&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
246 PM EDT SUN MAY 18 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...RADAR AND SURFACE OBSERVATIONS 
INDICATE THE LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS HAVE MOVED JUST SOUTH OF OUR SE TN 
AND SW NC COUNTIES. SOME AMOUNT OF CLOUDINESS LINGERS OVER SRN 1/3RD 
BUT I EXPECT THESE CLOUDS TO THIN OUT DURING THE EVENING.

PROBLEM FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE PATCHY AREAS OF DENSE FOG...MAINLY 
ACROSS SE TN AND SW NC...WHERE RADAR PRODUCTS SHOW A SWATH OF 1/2 TO 
1 INCH RAINFALL OCCURRED OVER THE PAST 24 HOURS. THESE AREAS COULD 
GET DOWN TO 1/4 MILE VISBY OR LESS LATE TONIGHT. FURTHER NORTH... 
RAIN WAS GENERALLY ABSENT AND THE BOUNDARY LAYER LOOKS TO BE TOO DRY 
FOR ANYTHING OTHER THAN PATCHY FOG. 

SOME CHATTING AMONGST NRN AND ERN NEIGHBORS ON POSSIBLE PATCHY FROST 
TONIGHT...AND I DID NUDGE MIN TEMP GRID DOWN TO INCLUDE A FEW SPOTS 
OF UPPER 30S FOR MINS. HOWEVER...WILL JUST MENTION THE POSSIBILITY
OF PATCHY FROST IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK FOR NOW.

A NICE DAY FOR THE REGION MONDAY...WITH PLENTY OF SUNSHINE AND TEMPS 
STARTING A RECOVERY TOWARDS SEASONAL NORMALS BY MID WEEK.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...RIDGING OVER THE
MID-SOUTH TO GULF COAST...AND AN UPPER TROUGH OVER THE EAST
COAST...WILL RESULT IN NW FLOW OVER THE CWA FOR MUCH OF THE
EXTENDED PERIOD. THIS MEANS THAT [SLIGHT] PRECIP CHANCES IN AND
NEAR SW VA WILL BEGIN MONDAY NIGHT. THESE CHANCES WILL SPREAD
SOUTHWARD ACROSS THE REST OF THE CWA THROUGH FRIDAY. CONDITIONS MAY
BE IN PLACE WED/THURS TO SUPPORT SOME SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS.

THEN THE AMPLITUDE OF THE EASTERN TROF STRENGTHENS ENOUGH TO 
SCOUR OUT THE MOISTURE STREAM...THUS LOOKING AT DRY WEATHER BY 
NEXT WEEKEND. 

DAYTIME TEMPS WILL BE FAIRLY WARM [MID 80S IN THE VALLEY] FOR 
TUES/WED...BEFORE THE NW/N FLOW ALOFT DRAWS DOWN COOLER TEMPS 
LATE WEEK INTO NEXT WEEKEND. FAIR SKIES AND HIGHS NEAR 80 IN 
THE VALLEY NEXT WEEKEND.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EDT SUN MAY 18 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN
AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH A
QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE DEEP SOUTH. AREA RADARS
REVEAL A LINE OF SHOWERS OCCURRING ALONG THE SOUTHERN TN BORDER IN
ASSOCIATION WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE MOVING EASTWARD ACROSS
THE TN RIVER VALLEY. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT SHOWERS WILL
MAINLY AFFECT SOUTHEAST TN THIS MORNING...WITH A GRADUAL DECREASE IN
SHOWERS AND CLOUDS THIS AFTERNOON AS THE SHORT WAVE EXITS THE REGION.
WITH SKIES CLEARING TONIGHT AND DEWPOINTS GRADUALLY RISING...WILL
PLAN TO MENTION PATCHY FOG DEVELOPING AFTER MIDNIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...
GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY...BUT
REVEAL LARGE DIFFERENCES TONIGHT MAINLY DUE TO THEIR DIFFERENCES IN
DEWPOINTS. WILL PLAN TO TREND TOWARDS THE WARMER NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS
FOR TONIGHT...SINCE DEWPOINTS ARE ALREADY FAIRLY HIGH OVER THE
FORECAST AREA.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...THIS PERIOD BEGINS WITH THE 
UPPER RIDGE BEGINNING TO TAKE CONTROL...AS THE ACTIVE TROUGH 
CONTINUES TO EXIT TO OUR EAST. HOWEVER...THE RIDGE NEVER COMPLETELY
CENTERS OVER THE AREA...SO WE ARE PARTLY LEFT IN A NORTHWEST FLOW
SCHEME DURING THE WEEK.

BY WEDNESDAY THERE MIGHT BE ENOUGH MOISTURE TO GET A FEW STORMS...BUT
THE MAIN THREAT LOOKS TO BE NORTH OF HERE NEAR A WEAK FRONTAL
BOUNDARY...AS AN MCS DEVELOPS OVER THE PLAINS/MIDWEST. BY THURSDAY
THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY SHOULD BE GETTING VERY CLOSE TO THE AREA AS
THE PREVIOUS MCS HELPS TO NUDGE THE BOUNDARY SOUTHWARD. THERE IS
ENOUGH SHEAR AND INSTABILITY TO GET ANOTHER MCS GOING AS WELL AS IT
LOOKS LIKE THERE COULD BE A SEVERE THREAT...IN OUR NORTHERN COUNTIES
AS THE RIDGE KEEPS OUR SOUTHERN COUNTIES DRY. FRIDAY...THE BOUNDARY
SLIDES FARTHER SOUTH AND MAY-WELL BE IN OUR CWA. SEVERE PARAMETERS
WANE A BIT...BUT STILL POSSIBLE...THEN BY SATURDAY...THE FRONT MAY
BE SOUTH OF HERE AS IT CONTINUES TO SLIDE SOUTHWARD...SO TRIMMED
THE POPS BACK ACROSS OUR NORTHERN AREAS ON SATURDAY. SO HAVE POPS
IN AT LEAST SOME PART OF THE CWA WED-SAT.

FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE LOOKED GOOD OVERALL. TRIMMED BACK MAX TEMP 1-3
DEGREES OVER THE AREAS WHERE CLOUDS WILL BE THICKER ALONG WITH
HIGHER POPS WED-SAT.

FXUS64 KMRX 171936

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 PM EDT SAT MAY 17 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...AN ACTIVE FIRST HALF OF THE 
SHORT TERM FINALLY GIVES WAY TO IMPROVING CONDITIONS LATE SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON INTO SUNDAY NIGHT AFTER A COOL AND DAMP SPELL OVER THE 
PAST FEW DAYS. AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORTWAVE WILL CONTINUE MOVING ACROSS 
THE EXTREME SOUTHERN AREAS THE REST OF THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY 
EVENING GENERATING SHOWERS ALONG THE WAY. THIS FEATURE SHOULD EXIT 
OFF TO OUR EAST BY AROUND 00Z. THE NEXT WAVE THEN BEGINS TO MOVE IN 
BY AROUND THE 06Z HOUR. MODELS HANDLING THIS NEXT FEATURE FAIRLY 
WELL BUT STILL SOME DIFFERENCES ON HOW LONG OF A BREAK IN THE 
PRECIPITATION BETWEEN THE AFTERNOON WAVE AND THE 06Z WAVE. THE NAM 
DOESN'T SHOW MUCH OF A BREAK WHILE THE GFS...RAP...AND HRR DO. WILL 
TREND TOWARD THE SOLUTION OF A BREAK IN THE PRECIP.

THE SECOND WAVE MOVES IN TONIGHT AND CONTINUES INTO SUNDAY AND WILL 
BE VERY SIMILAR TO THIS AFTERNOONS IN THAT IT WILL MAINLY AFFECT THE 
SOUTHERN VALLEY AND SWNC. WILL INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
FOR THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY AS WELL AS NETN FOR SUNDAY BUT 
SHOWERS SHOULD GENERALLY STAY SOUTH OF I-40...WITH AGAIN THE BEST 
CHANCES ACROSS THE EXTREME SOUTHERN AREAS. BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON 
SOUNDINGS DO SHOW MINOR AMOUNTS OF INSTABILITY FROM KNOXVILLE 
SOUTH...SO WILL THEREFORE INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS 
DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS SOUTH OF KNXOVILLE. CONDITIONS BEGIN TO 
SLOWLY IMPROVE LATE SUNDAY AFTERNOON AS THIS PROLONGED TROUGH 
FINALLY BEGINS TO LIFT OUT OF OUR AREA FOR GOOD. PRECIP LOOKS TO END 
AROUND 00Z MONDAY ACROSS SWNC WITH CLEARING SKIES LATE SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON INTO SUNDAY NIGHT. 

MONDAY MORNING WILL BE ANOTHER CHILLY MORNING DUE TO THE CLEAR SKIES 
ON SUNDAY NIGHT. LOWS WILL GENERALLY BE IN THE LOW TO MID 40S WITH A 
FEW UPPER 30S ACROSS NETN AND SWVA. A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE STARTS 
TO BUILD INTO OUR AREA SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. MONDAY LOOKS SUNNY 
WITH HIGHS BACK IN THE MID AND UPPER 70S WHICH IS NORMAL FOR THIS 
TIME OF YEAR.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY LITTLE TO NO CHANCE FOR RAIN AS AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL 
HAVE FULLY REPLACED THE EASTERN STATES TROUGH. THE RIDGE WILL 
RETROGRADE SOUTHWEST OVER THE GULF COASTAL REGION DURING THE 
REMAINDER OF THE LONG TERM AS AN UPPER LOW BUILDS SLOWLY SOUTHEAST 
ACROSS SOUTHEAST CANADA AND THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. IN THIS PATTERN A 
WAVE TRAIN OF MESO SCALE CONVECTIVE SYSTEMS WILL TRACK SOUTHEAST 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION THREATENING MAINLY SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE WHERE A LITTLE HIGHER CHANCE POPS 
WERE APPLIED WITH SLIGHT CHANCE PROBABILITIES FARTHER SOUTH ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA. TEMPERATURES WILL SPRING BACK ABOVE NORMAL 
THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             50  67  47  78 /  60  60  10   0

OAK RIDGE, TN                       47  68  44  77 /  30  40   0   0

657 
FXUS64 KMRX 170800
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT SAT MAY 17 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS
A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE CAROLINAS AND THE DEEP SOUTH...
WITH AN UNSEASONABLY COLD AND DRY AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA.
MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT TWO UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVES WILL
SWING ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY TODAY AND AGAIN ON SUNDAY...BRINGING
A GOOD CHANCE OF RAIN...ESPECIALLY OVER SOUTHEAST TN. MODEL SOUNDINGS
REVEAL A MORE STABLE AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR TODAY AND
SUNDAY...SO WILL MENTION ONLY SHOWERS AS THE PREDOMINATE PRECIP TYPE.
WITH A LARGE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH REMAINING OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF
THE NATION THIS WEEKEND...WILL STAY ON THE PESSIMISTIC SIDE WITH CLOUD
COVER THROUGH SUNDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE
IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.
DIFFERENCES ARISE BY SUNDAY...WHEN A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO SEEMS
BEST.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THIS PERIOD BEGINS WITH 
THE UPPER TROUGH EXITING THE AREA AND AN UPPER RIDGE MOVING INTO THE 
REGION.  WITH THE RIDGE'S HIGH PRESSURE CENTER ANCHORED OVER THE 
LOWER MISS VALLEY...THERE WILL LIKELY BE SOMEWHAT OF A GRADIENT OF 
THE RIDGE'S INFLUENCE (OR SUBSIDENCE) OVER OUR AREA...WITH MORE 
INFLUENCE SW AND LEAST INFLUENCE OVER OUR NERN AREAS.  ADDED INTO 
THIS EQUATION IS WHETHER A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL SETTLE INTO THE 
REGION.  LOOKS LIKE GOOD SETUP FOR MCS SCENARIO WITH WNW-ESE 
ORIENTATION OF FRONTAL BOUNDARY.  WITH A COUPLE OF DAYS OF 
OPPORTUNITY FOR MCS DEVELOPMENT TO OUR NORTH...AND ASSOCIATED COLD 
POOL PROPAGATION OF FRONTAL BOUNDARY...THINK IT IS QUITE LIKELY THAT 
THE FRONT WILL INDEED SETTLE INTO THE AREA--AT LEAST INTO THE 
NORTHEAST--POSSIBLY BY THURSDAY AND LIKELY BY FRIDAY. HOWEVER...WIND
PROFILE CERTAINLY NOT TEXTBOOK FOR MCS MAINTENANCE IN OUR AREA WITH
LEE TROUGH INDUCING LOW LEVEL WINDS WITH SIGNIFICANT WESTERLY
COMPONENT. SO LOOKS LIKE MCS WOULD DEVELOP IN THE PLAINS...WHERE
SETUP IS BETTER...THEN MCS WOULD BE WEAKENING AS IT MOVES TOWARD
THE APPALACHIANS. SO ALTHOUGH AIRMASS WILL BE UNSTABLE...THIS SETUP
WILL LIKELY LIMIT SEVERE THREAT AND HEAVY RAIN THREAT. STILL MAY BE
SOME SEVERE THREAT...BUT NOT NEARLY AS MUCH AS IF THE LOW LEVEL
WIND HAD A STRONG SOUTH COMPONENT. WENT A LITTLE ABOVE GUIDANCE ON
POPS IN THE NORTHEAST DURING THIS TIME PERIOD.

FOR TEMPS...KEPT CLOSE TO GUIDANCE THE FIRST FEW DAYS...THEN FOR MAX 
TEMPS ON THU AND FRI...UNDERCUT GUIDANCE IN NORTHEASTERN 1/2 OF THE 
AREA BY 1-2 CATEGORIES. LESS ADJUSTMENTS TO MIN TEMPS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       64  47  69  44 /  60  20  50   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              62  42  67  37 /  40  20  20   0

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
901 PM EDT FRI MAY 16 2014

.DISCUSSION...
SHOWERS HAVE ENDED ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH SUNSET AND CLOUDS
HAVE DECREASED CONSIDERABLY DURING THE EVENING AS HEATING AS ENDED
FOR THE DAY. TEMPERATURES HAVE BEEN MUCH COLDER IN THE NORTHEAST
AREAS WHERE SHOWERS WERE MORE NUMEROUS. GUSTY WINDS TO 30 MPH AND
SMALL HAIL AND A FEW LIGHTNING STRIKES ACCOMPANIED THESE SHOWERS.

THE NEXT SHORTWAVE WAS MOVING SOUTHEAST FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS
TOWARDS THE LOWER MS AND WESTERN TN VALLEY THIS EVENING WITH
CONSIDERABLE CLOUD COVER WEST OF THE MS RIVER AT THIS TIME. AM A
LITTLE CONCERNED THAT TEMPERATURES MAY DROP LOW ENOUGH IN THE
EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND SHELTERED VALLEYS LATER TONIGHT BEFORE
THICKER CLOUDS MOVE IN AROUND SUNRISE SATURDAY. ADDED PATCHY FROST
TO THE NORTHEAST AND EASTERN MOUNTAINS WHERE TEMPERATURES COULD
DROP BELOW 40. ELSEWHERE WINDS AND OR INCREASING CLOUDS SHOULD KEEP
LOWS IN THE LOWER TO MID 40S. TEMPERATURES SHOULD STEADY OUT IN THE
SOUTHERN VALLEY AND PLATEAU AFTER MIDNIGHT AS CLOUDS INCREASE.
DROPPED POPS FOR REST OF THE NIGHT EXCEPT SOUTHERN PLATEAU LATE
WHERE SOME LIGHT SHOWERS COULD MOVE IN BEFORE 12Z. UPDATED FORECAST
ALREADY SENT.

FXUS64 KMRX 161909
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
309 PM EDT FRI MAY 16 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...DEEP NEGATIVELY TILTED 
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE THROUGH OUR AREA THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING. SHOWERS SHOULD BE CONFINED TO NETN AND 
SWVA BY LATE AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING AS THE TROUGH STARTS TO 
LIFT OFF TO OUR NORTHEAST. A FEW ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS AND SMALL 
HAIL WILL ALSO BE POSSIBLE DUE TO STEEP LAPSE RATES BECAUSE OF VERY 
COLD AIR ALOFT FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. DROPPED POPS TONIGHT DUE TO 
TROUGH LIFTING OUT OF OUR AREA BUT RAIN RETURNS FOR SATURDAY. NEAR 
RECORD BREAKING TEMPS TOMORROW MORNING WITH CURRENT FORECAST TEMPS 
AND RECORD LOWS AT CHA 45/42...TYS 42/39...TRI 39/34. ALTHOUGH IT
APPEARS THAT NO RECORDS WILL BE TIED OR BROKEN...IT WILL STILL BE
VERY CHILLY FOR MID MAY TOMORROW MORNING.

ANOTHER WAVE OF ENERGY MOVES THROUGH THE TROUGH BASE TOMORROW 
AND WILL APPROACH OUR WESTERN AREAS BY TOMORROW MORNING AND WILL
BRING ANOTHER ROUND OF SHOWERS THROUGH THE DAY. LAPSE RATES AREN'T
NEARLY AS STEEP AS THEY WERE TODAY AND SOUNDINGS ALSO INDICATE A
MID LEVEL STABLE LAYER. THEREFORE...WILL NOT INCLUDE THUNDER WITH
TOMORROWS SHOWERS. TOMORROWS HIGH TEMPS WILL BE SIMILAR TO TODAYS
WITH TEMPS IN THE LOW TO MID 60S.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...WEAK SHORT WAVE 
ENERGY MOVING THROUGH THE EASTERN UPPER TROUGH EXPECTED TO BRING 
SOME SHOWERS SATURDAY NIGHT ESPECIALLY SOUTH. INSTABILITY WEAK SO NO 
THUNDER MENTION FOR NOW.  MAY BE A LINGERING SHOWER MAINLY SOUTH 
SUNDAY MORNING...THEN DECREASING CLOUDS.  UPPER RIDGE TO BUILD OVER 
THE AREA MONDAY AND TUESDAY...AND EXPECT DRY WEATHER WITH A WARMING 
TREND.  MODELS DISAGREE A BIT ON LATTER PERIOD ABOUT HOW FAR SOUTH 
ANY ACTIVITY ROUNDING THE NORTHERN PORTION OF THE RIDGE WILL MAKE 
IT. GFS KEEPING IT TO OUR NORTH UNTIL THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...WHILE 
ECMWF WANTS TO PUSH IT FURTHER SOUTH BY WEDNESDAY.  FOR NOW WILL 
LEAN TOWARD CURRENT FORECAST IDEA AND DRIER GFS...BUT WILL STILL 
CARRY LOW POPS AS EARLY AS WEDNESDAY FOR NORTHERN ZONES. FORECAST 
CONFIDENCE AVERAGE FOR EARLY PERIODS BUT DIPS A BIT BELOW AVERAGE 
FOR THE LATTER PERIODS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS
SHOWS A STRONG COLD FRONT OVER THE CAROLINAS...WITH ANOTHER
SECONDARY COLD FRONT OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY ASSOCIATED WITH AN
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE MID WEST. THIS SECONDARY COLD FRONT

AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH SLOWLY ROTATES OVER THE EASTERN HALF
OF THE NATION. THIS UPPER TROUGH WILL HELP TO TRIGGER SCATTERED
SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST AREA TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY. MODEL
SOUNDINGS SHOW A LITTLE BIT OF INSTABILITY OVER THE FORECAST AREA
TODAY...WITH A MID-LEVEL STABLE LAYER DEVELOPING BY TONIGHT AND
STRENGTHENING INTO SATURDAY. THUS...WILL MENTION SHOWERS AS THE
PREDOMINATE PRECIP TYPE THROUGH SATURDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND

AND LOOK REASONABLE. DIFFERENCES ARISE BY SATURDAY...WHEN A
COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO SEEMS BEST.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...THIS PERIOD BEGINS
WITH A LARGE UPPER TROUGH DOMINATING THE EASTERN U.S. AND THE
TROUGH AXIS ALMOST OVER OUR AREA. MODELS SHOW A COUPLE MORE SHORT
WAVES ARE DUE TO RACE THROUGH THE AREA...THEN BY ABOUT TUESDAY THE
TROUGH HAS MOVED EAST AND A RIDGE IS BUILDING INTO THE AREA THAT
WILL PERSIST THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THIS PERIOD.

MEX MOS HAS SOME POPS TOWARD THE END OF THE PERIOD...BUT THINK THIS 
MAY BE CLIMATE INFLUENCE...AS MODELS SHOW RIDGE HOLDING STRONG 
DURING MOST OF THIS PERIOD...HOWEVER THERE IS ALSO AGREEMENT THAT 
THE RIDGE RECEDES SOME IN THE LAST 24 HOURS...SO WILL HAVE SOME LOW 
POPS IN THE NORTHEASTERN SECTIONS WHERE THE RIDGE WILL HAVE THE 
LEAST INFLUENCE. THERE WILL BE SOME INSTABILITY AS WELL...SO FOR 
THIS PRECIP WILL INCLUDE THUNDER.  ALTHOUGH MODELS SHOW SHEAR CLOSE 
TO AREA...AND EURO SHOWS IT OVER MUCH OF THE AREA...THIS SEEMS 
OVERDONE WHEN CONSIDERING CLOSE PROXIMITY OF UPPER HIGH...SO WILL 
NOT INCLUDE SEVERE IN HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK...THINK BETTER 
CHANCE OF SHEAR/ORGANIZED STORMS FARTHER TO NORTH.

AIR MASS MIGHT BE COLD ENOUGH ON SUNDAY MORNING TO MIX WITH SNOW IN 
THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS OF THE SMOKIES.  WILL NOT MENTION SNOW MIX IN 
THOSE MOUNTAIN ZONES YET...WILL SEE IF MODELS KEEP THE AIR MASS THIS 
COLD...STILL A COUPLE OF DAYS AWAY.

WENT A LITTLE ABOVE GUIDANCE ON MAX TEMPS ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...
AS WELL AS SOUTHERN HALF OF AREA ON THURSDAY. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             66  45  66  52 /  20  40  50  30

FXUS64 KMRX 151923
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
323 PM EDT THU MAY 15 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...IT APPEARS THAT WE WILL 
HAVE A BREAK IN THE PRECIP FOR MOST OF TONIGHT AS THE COLD FRONT IS 
NOW JUST OFF TO OUR EAST...EXCEPT FOR A FEW LINGERING SHOWERS ACROSS 
EXTREME NETN AND INTO SWVA UNTIL MIDNIGHT OR SO. PRECIP CHANCES 
RETURN FRIDAY MORNING AS THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AXIS APPROACHES OUR 
REGION. WITH THE BASE OF THIS TROUGH...ANOTHER LOBE OF ENERGY 
ROTATES THROUGH ENHANCING LIFT AND BRINGING THE BEST CHANCES OF RAIN 
FROM KNOXVILLE NORTH WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES ACROSS SWVA. FROM 
KNOXVILLE SOUTH THERE WILL BE LESS LIKELY CHANCES OF RAIN BUT STILL 
WILL INCLUDE SLIGHT CHANCE DOWN INTO THE SOUTHERN VALLEY. INCLUDED 
MENTION OF ISOLATED THUNDER FROM KNOXVILLE NORTH AS THERE WILL BE A 
SLIGHT AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY...NOTHING NOTE WORTHY THOUGH WITH JUST 
A COUPLE HUNDRED JOULES OF CAPE PRESENT. ALSO...WITH THE TROUGH BASE 
ROTATING THROUGH EXPECT WINDS TO BE BREEZY TOMORROW DUE TO A TIGHTER 
PRESSURE GRADIENT.

RINSE WASH REPEAT...THERE WILL BE ANOTHER BREAK IN PRECIP FOR FRIDAY 
NIGHT BEFORE YET ANOTHER WAVE OF ENERGY MOVES IN SATURDAY MORNING 
BRINING ANOTHER ROUND OF PRECIP. THIS TIME...THE MAJORITY OF OUR CWA 
SHOULD SEE PRECIP AS THE WAVE MOVES IN THROUGH FROM NORTHWEST AND 
THROUGH THE TROUGH BASE. THE BIGGEST STORY IN THE SHORT TERM WILL BE 
COLD NIGHT TIME TEMPS FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR WITH TEMPERATURES IN THE 
LOW TO MID 40S TONIGHT AND NEAR RECORD BREAKING TEMPS ON SATURDAY 
MORNING. CURRENT FORECAST TEMPS/RECORD LOW FOR SAT MORNING...CHA 
45/42...TYS 43/39...TRI 39/34. OVERALL...A COOL...CLOUDY...AND DAMP 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY ARE IN STORE.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...BLOCKED FLOW PATTERN 
WILL KEEP COOLER THAN NORMAL TEMPERATURES AROUND FOR THE FIRST 
COUPLE DAYS OF THE WEEK AS THE EASTERN U.S. UPPER TROUGH WILL TAKE 
ITS TIME MOVING OFF THE COAST. IN ADDITION...A SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL 
BUILD SOUTHEAST OUT OF THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. THE MODELS CONTINUE TO 
INDICATE THE DEEPER MOISTURE AND LIFT WILL BE POSITIONED OVER 
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA WHERE LOW CHANCE 
POPS WERE PLACED. LEFT A SLIGHT CHANCE OVER THE REST OF THE FORECAST 
AREA DURING THIS PERIOD. THE DRY PERIOD WAS MAINTAINED FROM SUNDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY FOR THE ENTIRE AREA AS TEMPERATURES GRADUALLY 
CLIMB AS AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE BUILDS SLOWLY EAST INTO THE EASTERN 
U.S. WENT AHEAD AND KEPT SOME LOW TO MEDIUM CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA FROM TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
THURSDAY NIGHT AS SEVERAL WEAK IMPULSES RIDE OVER THE TOP OF THE 
APPROACHING RIDGE AND WARMER AIR ADVANCES OVER THE RETREATING COOLER 
WEEKEND AIR MASS. IN THIS SCENARIO RAIN CHANCES ARE GENERALLY NIL 
SOUTH OF THE I-40 CORRIDOR.

FRONTAL PASSAGE AND ONLY RISE TO THE MID 60S TO NEAR 70 NORTHEAST.

DURING THE DAY AND TONIGHT NE. LOWS TONIGHT WILL DROP INTO THE LOW
TO MID 40S...POSSIBLY UPPER 30S HIGHER ELEVATIONS AS SKIES CLEAR.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER TROUGH AXIS NORTHEAST
OF AREA. BACK SIDE JET SEGMENT MOVING EAST THROUGH THE TN VALLEY ON
FRIDAY. WEAK SURFACE LOW MOVES THROUGH CNTRL APPALACHIANS WITH GOOD
MOISTURE WRAPPING INTO SW VA AND NE TN. GOOD CHANCE FOR SHOWERS
ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS. GOING BELOW MOS GUIDANCE NORTHERN AREA
EXPECTING CLOUDS AND SHOWERS. ANOTHER JET SEGMENT MOVES THROUGH
SOUTHERN TN VALLEY ON SATURDAY. CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION RETURNS
FAVORING SOUTHERN AREAS. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SETTLES INTO THE
AREA THROUGH MONDAY. LEANED ON COOL SIDE OF GUIDANCE WITH SINGLE
DIGIT H85 TEMPS LINGERING. WARM FRONT RETURNS ON TUESDAY WITH
TEMPERATURES RETURNING TO NORMAL. PRECIPITATION CHANCES RETURN BY
WEDNESDAY ALONG WARM FRONT ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS.

490 
FXUS64 KMRX 141936
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
336 PM EDT WED MAY 14 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...THE COLD FRONT CURRENTLY OVER
WEST TENNESSEE WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE TOWARDS THE APPALACHIANS
THROUGH THE NIGHT. THIS EVENING...ATMOSPHERE HAS MOISTENED UP
CONSIDERABLY FROM THE SOUNDINGS THIS MORNING. THE INSTABILITY
VALUES ARE UNDER 1000 J/KG AND THE CIN VALUES REALLY INCREASE
AROUND SUNSET. THE WINDS STILL REMAIN STRONG THROUGHOUT THE MID AND
UPPER LEVELS OF THE ATMOSPHERE...SO COULD STILL SEE SOME STRONG
WINDS IN THE CONVECTION THROUGH THE EARLY EVENING. TEMPERATURES ARE
A BIT WARMER THAN PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS WERE ANTICIPATING DUE TO THE
CLOUD COVER SLOWER TO MOVE IN ACROSS THE AREA. COULD STILL SEE A
COUPLE OF STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS ACROSS THE AREA EARLY EVENING.

FOR TONIGHT...MIDLEVEL WARM AIR ADVECTS INTO THE AREA...LIMITING 
INSTABILITY VALUES EVEN FURTHER FOR THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. SOUNDING 
FULLY SATURATED WITH PW VALUES ABOVE 1.50 INCREASES THE FLOODING 
THREAT THROUGH THE NIGHT AND EARLY MORNING. HAVE ISSUED A FLASH 
FLOOD WATCH THROUGH 2 PM THURSDAY DUE TO THE HIGH RAINFALL AMOUNTS 
EXPECTED. DOWNSLOPE FLOW WILL BE PRESENT OVER NE TN AND SW VA...SO 
FOR NOW DO NOT EXPECT THESE AREAS TO ACCUMULATE AS MUCH RAINFALL AS 
QUICKLY. WILL LET LATER SHIFTS UPDATE THIS AREA AS NEEDED. THE LOW 
LEVEL JET WILL INCREASE OVERNIGHT DUE TO UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE 
PRESENT OVER THE AREA...THIS WILL IN TURN INCREASE WINDS OVER THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

FOR TOMORROW...THE FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHEAST 
TN THROUGH THE LATE MORNING AND EARLY AFTERNOON. RAIN WILL QUICKLY 
DIMINISH BY 4PM IN THIS AREA...AND WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST OF THE 
APPALACHIANS THROUGH THE REST OF THE AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING. 
HIGH TEMPERATURES BEHIND THIS FRONT ARE EXPECTED TO LOWER TO SEVERAL 
DEGREES BELOW NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)... WITH THE
DEPARTURE OF OF THE RAIN EVENT...THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH NEXT
WEDNESAY WILL BE MUCH DRIER IN COMPARISON...WITH COOL TEMPERATURES
PERSISTING THROUGH THE WEEKEND. SATURDAY MORNING WILL SEE A FEW
PLACES REACH THE UPPER 30S. THANKS TO THE SLOW AND PERSISTENT
LONGWAVE TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN STATES...WE WILL BE DODGING WEAK
AND QUICK PRECIP EVENTS CAUSED BY DISTURBANCES IN THE NW FLOW.
RIDGING WILL RETURN EARLY IN THE NEW WORK WEEK...WITH TEMPS BACK TO
NORMAL.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             60  67  45  69 / 100  80  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  62  67  45  67 / 100  90  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       61  66  44  67 / 100  80  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              60  68  45  65 /  80 100  60  20 

&&

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...AFTER SCATTERED SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS DISSIPATED AROUND MIDNIGHT SKIES CLEARED

STORMS FIRING OVER NORTHERN AL AND SOUTHERN MIDDLE TN AND MOVING
SLOWLY NORTH. THIS CONVECTION LIES IN THE VICINITY OF A COLD FRONT
THAT LIES ACROSS MIDDLE TN EARLY THIS MORNING. SHORT RANGE MODELS
DEVELOP LOW PRESSURE AREA OVER NORTH MS THAT SLOWS FRONT DOWN AS
THE LOW MOVES ALONG IT TODAY AND THEN MOVES THE SURFACE LOW INTO
THE GREAT LAKES EARLY THURSDAY. THE FRONT IS FORECAST TO MOVE EAST
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT AND THURSDAY.

A SATURATED AND UNSTABLE AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA WILL ALLOW 
NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND STORMS TO FORM FROM WEST TO EAST LATE THIS 
MORNING OR BY MID AFTERNOON. A STRONG SHORTWAVE TROUGH OVER WEST TX 
WILL MOVE INTO THE LOWER MS VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON. THE BOUNDARY OVER 
MIDDLE TN WILL BE THE FOCUS FOR THE STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS TO 
DEVELOP AS A LINE TO THE WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS LINE IS 
EXPECTED TO MOVE EAST INTO WESTERN SECTIONS BY LATE AFTERNOON OR 
EVENING WITH A RISK OF DAMAGING WINDS AND LARGE HAIL. RAINFALL 
AMOUNTS COULD BE HEAVY BY THIS EVENING WITH THIS LINE AND THEN JUST 
AHEAD OF THE FRONT OVERNIGHT INTO THURSDAY. KEPT LOCALLY HEAVY 
RAINFALL WORDING FOR OVERNIGHT AND THURSDAY MORNING. AS FRONT
MOVES EAST THURSDAY SHOWERS WILL TAPER OFF LATE IN THE DAY. HIGH
TEMPERATURES WILL AGAIN REACH THE LOWER TO MID 80S TODAY...NOT
QUITE AS WARM AS TUESDAY. THURSDAY HIGHS SHOULD BE ABOUT 15 DEGREES
COOLER BEHIND THE FRONT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER TROUGH AXIS 
MOVES THROUGH SLOWLY THURSDAY NIGHT AND EARLY FRIDAY. POPS TAPER OFF 
THURSDAY NIGHT BUT CONTINUE SLIGHTLY INTO FRIDAY WITH NW FLOW. 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SETTLES OVER THE AREA FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE 
PERIOD. IMPULSES IN NW FLOW WILL PULL MOISTURE BACK INTO THE AREA 
WITH A LOW CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION OVER THE WEEKEND. TIMING OF 
THESE FEATURES UNCERTAIN. TRENDED TOWARD AN OVERALL DRIER FORECAST. 
TEMPERATURES WILL FALL TO WELL BELOW AVERAGE FOR THE MID RANGE 
FORECAST.

964 
FXUS64 KMRX 131829
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
229 PM EDT TUE MAY 13 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...
CONVECTION REMAINS RATHER UNORGANIZED THIS AFTERNOON AND MOVING
NORTH AT JUST OVER 10 MPH. PLENTY OF INSTABILITY BUT VERY WEAK
WINDS ALOFT. OPTED TO LOWER POPS IN EXTREME NE TN AND SW VA TO
SOLID CHANCE WITH SCATTERED WORDING FOR REST OF THE AFTERNOON AND
EARLY EVENING HOURS.

SHORTWAVE ENERGY MOVING THROUGH THE UPPER TROUGH TO OUR WEST WILL 
INCREASE WINDS ALOFT FOR WEDNESDAY...AND ALSO NUDGE THE COLD FRONT 
CLOSER TO OUR PLATEAU COUNTIES. THIS SHOULD LEAD TO INCREASING 
SHOWERS AND A BIT STRONGER TSRA FOR TOMORROW. PREVIOUS FORECAST 
GRIDS LOOKED GOOD AND WERE GENERALLY FOLLOWED...KEEPING LIKELY POPS 
FOR WRN AREAS BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. 

MIN TEMPS SHOULD BE QUITE SIMILAR TO TUESDAY MORNING LOWS...WHILE 
MAX TEMPS SHOULD COOL AT LEAST A FEW DEGREES ACROSS MOST AREAS GIVEN 
THE HIGHER RAIN CHANCES ON WEDNESDAY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
POPS WILL BE INCREASING TO CATEGORICAL WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS THE DEEP
TROUGH OVER THE PLAINS SLOWLY MOVES EAST. A SOUTHERLY FLOW FROM THE
TROPICS WILL PROVIDE DEEP MOISTURE TRANSPORT THROUGH THURSDAY.
PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES WILL BE ON THE ORDER OF 1.5 INCHES...WELL
ABOVE CLIMO NORMALS. THE SLOW MOVEMENT OF THE SYSTEM KEEPS UPPER
DIVERGENCE IN THE JET ENTRANCE REGION AND FRONTOGENETIC FORCING
OVER THE AREA FOR A GOOD 12-18 HOUR PERIOD. WILL INCLUDE A MENTION
OF LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. TWO INCH AMOUNTS MAY BE POSSIBLE IN SOME
SPOTS...MOST LIKELY IN SW NC. THE NEED FOR A FLOOD WATCH WILL BE
MONITORED. FRONTAL PASSAGE IS AGREED UPON BETWEEN THE NAM AND
GFS...EXITING THURSDAY AFTERNOON.

WITH THE DEEP TROUGH MOVING OVERHEAD FRIDAY...AND A CUT OFF LOW  
LINGERING OVER THE EASTERN CONUS THROUGH SUNDAY...TEMPERATURES WILL 
BE WELL BELOW NORMAL FOR THE WEEKEND. DISTURBANCES PASSING BY IN THE 
NW FLOW ALOFT MAY ALSO BRING SOME LIGHT SHOWERS BOTH SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY...AND WILL HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS EACH DAY AND NIGHT. 
CONFIDENCE IN THE MODELS ABLILTY TO PREDICT THESE DETAILED FEATURES 
IS LOW. IT DOES APPEAR THAT RIDGING WILL BUILD IN 
MONDAY/TUESDAY...BRINGING DRY WEATHER AND WARMER TEMPERATURES.

&&

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES
TO RIDGE INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FROM THE EAST. UPPER RIDGE
SHIFTS EAST OF THE AREA WITH AN INCREASING UPPER JET OVER THE
WESTERN TN VALLEY. WARM LAYER CAP OF RECENT DAYS NO LONGER EVIDENT
ON FORECAST SOUNDING. LAYER MOISTURE AND SURFACE DEW POINTS HAVE
RISEN. INSTABILITY ALSO HIGHER. CONVECTIVE INITIATION SHOULD BE
MORE FAVORABLE TODAY WITH OROGRAPHIC LIFT REMAINING THE BEST
TRIGGER. HIGHER POPS FORECAST FAVORING THE HIGHER TERRAIN TODAY FOR
SLOW MOVING STORMS. STRONG WINDS AND SMALL HAIL A GOOD BET WITH
THESE SUMMER LIKE STORMS. ACTIVITY WILL LINGER INTO THE EVENING
HOURS WITH EXPECTED AVAILABLE ENERGY. ONGOING CONVECTION RELATED TO
THE STRENGTHENING UPPER JET MAY MOVE EAST INTO THE AREA LATE
TONIGHT. WARM TEMPERATURES PERSIST THROUGH PERIOD.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...SLOW MOVING COLD FRONT
MOVES INTO MIDDLE TN WEDNESDAY WITH SURFACE LOW ALONG THE FRONT IN
MS THAT MOVES NORTH ALONG THE FRONT INTO TN THEN OHIO VALLEY LATE
WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY. THE NAM MODEL HAS THIS FEATURE OVER WEST
TN WITH THE GFS FARTHER EAST ACROSS MIDDLE TN. THIS WILL INCREASE
RAIN CHANCES WEDNESDAY AND ESPECIALLY WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND
THURSDAY. SOME THUNDERSTORMS MAY BECOME STRONG TO POSSIBLY SEVERE
LATE WEDNESDAY OR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF THE FRONT AS THE LOW
MOVES NORTH. RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF ONE TO TWO INCHES ARE POSSIBLE
WEDNESDAY MORNING INTO THURSDAY MORNING. ANOTHER INCH OF RAIN COULD
FALL THURSDAY ACROSS EASTERN SECTIONS. THE NAM MODEL IS A LITTLE
SLOWER WITH THE FRONT NOT BRINGING IT THROUGH UNTIL LATE THURSDAY.
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THURSDAY
FOLLOWING THE COOLER MAV GUIDANCE WITH CLOUDS AND RAIN HIGHS ABOUT
10 TO POSSIBLY 15 DEGREES COOLER. UPPER TROUGH SETS UP OVER THE
OHIO AND TN VALLEYS THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY WITH SMALL RAIN
CHANCES AS SHORTWAVE ENERGY ROTATES THROUGH. TEMPERATURES WILL BE
BELOW NORMAL WITH HIGHS 60S TO LOWER 70S AND LOWS MOSTLY 40S
THROUGH SUNDAY.RIDGING ALOFT BEGANS TO BUILD IN MONDAY. WILL KEEP
MONDAY DRY AND TEMPERATURES BEGIN TO WARM.

FXUS64 KMRX 121903
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
303 PM EDT MON MAY 12 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)... 
AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE REMAINS THE DOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE ACROSS
THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON AS TEMPERATURES HAVE SOARED INTO THE 80S
AREAWIDE ONCE AGAIN...AND WILL TOP OFF IN THE 85 TO 90 DEGREE RANGE
OVER A GOOD PORTION OF THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY THIS LATE
THIS AFTERNOON/EVENING. HOWEVER...ABUNDANT MOISTURE UNDERNEATH THIS
RIDGE HAS ALLOWED FOR SOME ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP. THIS ACTIVITY HAS MAINLY BEEN CONFINED TO
THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND THE MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA...EAST TENNESSEE AND WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA. HOWEVER...A
ROGUE THUNDERSTORM IN THE VALLEY IS NOT OUT OF THE QUESTION THOUGH
SUNSET. MODELS ARE ALSO SHOWING SOME ADDITIONAL CONVECTION FIRING
ACROSS SOUTHERN KENTUCKY AND MAKING ITS WAY ALONG THE NORTHERN
PLATEAU AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA BY THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. GIVEN
SOME INSTABILITY ACROSS THE REGION. SOME STORMS COULD BECOME
LOCALLY STRONG...AND PERHAPS APPROACH SEVERE LIMITS. HOWEVER...THE
LACK OF SHEAR WILL SIGNIFICANTLY LIMIT THE SEVERE THREAT AND
ORGANIZATION WITHIN THESE CLUSTERS OF STORMS.

THIS ACTIVITY WILL WANE BY THE EARLY EVENING WITH THE SETTING SUN AND 
ALLOW FOR A QUIET NIGHT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. MOISTURE BOUNDARY 
LAYER CONDITIONS AND CALM WINDS LATE TONIGHT WILL ALLOW FOR THE 
DEVELOPMENT OF SOME PATCHY FOG NEAR BODIES OF WATER AND IN SHELTERED 
VALLEYS...SO HAVE INCLUDED A MENTION OF THIS IN THE ZONES AS WELL. 
TUESDAY SHOULD BE A CARBON COPY OF TODAY...BUT WITH A LITTLE MORE 
CLOUD COVER AND CONVECTION THANKS TO AN APPROACHING UPPER-LEVEL 
STORM SYSTEM AND A WEAKENING CAP. THIS WILL LEAD TO MORE WIDESPREAD 
SCATTERED STORMS /SOME STRONG TO LOCALLY SEVERE BY THE AFTERNOON/ 
...SO HAVE CHANCE POPS AREAWIDE. GIVEN THE CLOUD COVER...HIGHS WILL 
BE A DEGREE OR TWO COOLER BUT STILL REACH THE MID 80S IN MOST SPOTS 
AGAIN. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
SYNOPTIC FORCING WILL BE INCREASING TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AS A 
DEEP UPPER TROUGH DIGS OVER THE PLAINS AND THE ATLANTIC RIDGE LOSES 
ITS GRIP. MOISTURE WILL BE PLENTIFUL WITH TRAJECTORIES COMING FROM 
THE GULF FOR SEVERAL DAYS. SOME AFTERNOON HEATING WEDNESDAY COULD 
PROVIDE ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR AN ISOLATED SEVERE THREAT. HOWEVER... 
THE BEST LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THE JET AND QG FORCING WILL ARRIVE 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY AS CYCLOGENESIS OCCURS OVER WEST 
TN/WESTERN KY AND THE SYSTEM SLOWLY TRACKS EAST. MODERATE TO LOCALLY 
HEAVY RAIN MAY BE POSSIBLE AT TIMES DUE TO FAVORABLE POSITION OF THE 
UPPER JET AND DEEP MOISTURE. COLD FRONT PASSAGE THURSDAY NIGHT WILL 
BRING AN END TO POPS. 

THE GENERAL FORECAST TREND FOR FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY WILL BE A 
LONGWAVE TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN CONUS. THIS WILL PROVIDE BELOW 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES EACH DAY AND NIGHT. SMALLER EMBEDDED 
DISTURBANCES MAY BRING SLIGHT CHANCES OF SHOWERS OVER THE 
WEEKEND...BUT GFS AND ECMWF DO NOT AGREE ON THE DETAILS OT TIMING OF 
THESE FEATURES. WILL NOT MAKE SIGNIFICANT CHANGES AS CONFIDENCE IS 
LOW. WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE POP OVER THE WEEKEND FOR NOW.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             88  65  87  65 /  20  10  40  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  87  63  85  63 /  20  10  40  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       87  63  85  62 /  20  10  40  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              85  60  83  59 /  20  10  30  20

335 
FXUS64 KMRX 121408 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1008 AM EDT MON MAY 12 2014

.DISCUSSION...
AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN THE DOMINANT
WEATHER FEATURE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...AND HAS PROMOTED
MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY THIS MORNING
/EXCEPTION OF A FEW BANDS OF HIGH CLOUDS MOVING OVER THE NORTHERN
PLATEAU AND CENTRAL VALLEY/. THE ABUNDANT SUNSHINE AND WARM
TEMPERATURES ALOFT/HIGH THICKNESS VALUES WILL ALLOW FOR A QUICK
WARM-UP INTO THE LOW 80S BY MIDDAY AND A EVENTUALLY INTO THE MID TO
UPPER 80S ACROSS MUCH OF THE VALLEY AGAIN BY THE AFTERNOON /WITH A
FEW SPOTS APPROACHING 90 DEGREES/. WITH MOISTURE UNDERNEATH THIS
RIDGE HOWEVER...THE SOME DIURNALLY DRIVEN CONVECTION IS EXPECTED
/PRIMARILY ALONG THE EAST TENNESSEE/WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA
MOUNTAINS/ THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. MODELS ARE ALSO SHOWING SOME
ADDITIONAL CONVECTION FIRING ACROSS SOUTHERN KENTUCKY AND MAKING
ITS WAY ALONG THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA BY THE
AFTERNOON.

GIVEN THIS...HAVE LOW-END MENTIONABLE POPS IN THESE AREAS AND
CHANCE POPS ALONG THE MOUNTAINS /AS THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD BE
ISOLATED TO SCATTERED IN NATURE/. HOWEVER...KEPT MENTIONABLE POPS
OUT OF THE VALLEY FOR NOW AS THINK MODELS ARE OVER DOING IT
SOMEWHAT WITH THE CAP STILL IN PLACE. THIS THINKING IS SUPPORTED
WELL BY THE HRRR WHICH SHOWS CONVECTION PRIMARILY ALONG THE
MOUNTAINS AND LATE MOVING INTO SW VIRGINIA. THERE WILL BE ENOUGH
INSTABILITY LATER TO SUPPORT SOME STRONG STORMS CAPABLE OF GUSTY
WINDS AND SMALL HAIL ALONG THE MOUNTAINS...WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR
A ROGUE SEVERE STORM OR TWO. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE LACK OF
ORGANIZATION...AM NOT ANTICIPATING ANYTHING MORE THAN A VERY
ISOLATED SEVERE THREAT FOR THOSE AFOREMENTIONED AREAS ATTM.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

319 
FXUS64 KMRX 120707
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
307 AM EDT MON MAY 12 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO RIDGE 
INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FROM THE ESE. AIRMASS OVER THE AREA 
IS RELATIVELY DRY BUT NEAR SEASONAL NORMAL. GOOD H85-H70 LAPSE RATE 
DEVELOPS TODAY HOWEVER WARM LAYER NEAR H50 PERSISTS. QUESTION 
REMAINS WILL CONVECTION BE ABLE TO BREAK THE CAP. BEST CHANCES ARE 
FOR OROGRAPHICALLY LIFTED STORMS OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN. ANY STORMS 
THAT DUE DEVELOP WILL BE SLOW MOVERS IN WEAK STEERING FLOW. LOW 
LEVEL THICKNESS VALUES ARE A BIT HIGHER TODAY SO WIDESPREAD READINGS 
IN THE 80S ARE ON TAP. ABOVE NORMAL READING CONTINUE OVERNIGHT. 

.LONG TERM( TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...AS A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST AND OUT OF THE AREA A WEAK IMPULSE MOVING 
THROUGH ALONG WITH A WEAKLY UNSTABLE AND MOIST AIR MASS IN PLACE  
SHOULD ALLOW FOR SCATTERED CONVECTION TO DEVELOP DURING THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS ON TUESDAY.  A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE IN MID WEEK.  
MODELS AGAIN TRENDING A BIT SLOWER WITH THE SYSTEM AND CONFIDENCE 
LOW ON TIMING BUT TREND IS TO BRING THE MAIN BAND OF CONVECTION 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  WILL KEEP POPS IN THE 
LIKELY CATEGORY FOR THE PERIOD AND EVEN OVER SOME AREAS INTO 
THURSDAY AS THE SYSTEM PULLS AWAY.  EXPECT ASSOCIATED PRECIP TO END 
THURSDAY NIGHT.  SURFACE HIGH BUILDS IN FOR A DRY DAY ON FRIDAY.  
CONFIDENCE VERY LOW BY THE END OF THE PERIOD BUT COULD SEE A SHORT 
WAVE MOVE THROUGH ON SATURDAY FOR ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SHOWERS.  
FOR NOW...WILL KEEP THINGS DRY FOR SUNDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
935 PM EDT SUN MAY 11 2014

.DISCUSSION...
AREA AIRCRAFT UPPER AIR READINGS SHOWED THAT THERE WAS A WARM LAYER
BETWEEN 500 AND 600 MB THAT PRETTY WELL KEPT THINGS CAPPED THIS
AFTERNOON. ALSO MOST LOCATIONS IN OUR AREA WERE SLIGHTLY COOLER
AND DRIER THAN SURROUNDING SITES...THEREBY STIFLING MUCH OF THE
CUMULUS CLOUD DEVELOPMENT. AS NOCTURNAL BOUNDARY LAYER WIND
ACCELERATES...WE WILL SEE IF IT MIGHT BE ABLE TO KICK OFF SOME
SHOWERS.

FORECAST LOOKS ON TRACK...WILL NOT ISSUE A NEW ZONE FORECAST.

430 
FXUS64 KMRX 111851
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 PM EDT SUN MAY 11 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...ISOLATED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE DEVELOPING OVER MIDDLE TENNESSEE
THROUGH THE AFTERNOON DUE TO ISENTROPIC LIFT. THIS CONVECTION WILL
CONTINUE TO FOLLOW THE FLOW AROUND THE HIGH PRESSURE...CURRENTLY
OVER THE COASTAL STATES. AS THE HIGH PRESSURE SLOWLY SHIFTS
EASTWARD...THE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL SLOWLY MOVE TOWARDS
THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU...SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE...AND SOUTHWEST NORTH
CAROLINA. THERE IS ENOUGH INSTABILITY AND MOISTURE AND TEMP
ADVECTION TO SUPPORT ANYTHING MOVING INTO THE AREA IN THE LATE
AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING...BUT CONFIDENCE IS LOW ON COVERAGE AND
TIMING. THE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE DIURNAL IN
NATURE...AND QUICKLY FALL APART AROUND SUNSET.

FOR TONIGHT...ENOUGH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IS STILL PRESENT FOR PATCHY 
FOG DEVELOPMENT AGAIN AREAWIDE. TOMORROW...MODELS IN PRETTY GOOD
AGREEMENT FOR ANOTHER CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MAINLY IN
THE AFTERNOON. THERE IS A DECENT AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY
TOMORROW...BUT THE WIND PROFILE IS NOT IMPRESSIVE FOR STRONG
THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT. AGAIN...THIS WILL BE MORE DIURNAL IN
NATURE AND WILL QUICKLY DISSIPATE AFTER SUNSET. TEMPERATURES WILL
BE SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.


.LONG TERM /MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY/... 

AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE GULF OF MEXICO WILL 
SLOWLY SLIDE TO THE EAST ON TUESDAY...BUT MAINTAIN ENOUGH OF AN 
INFLUENCE OVER THE REGION TO ALLOW FOR A MOSTLY DRY FORECAST FOR 
MOST OF THE DAY. HOWEVER...ENOUGH MOISTURE WILL EXIST UNDERNEATH 
THIS RIDGE WILL EXIST AND COMBINE WITH A WEAKENING TO ALLOW FOR SOME 
DIURNALLY DRIVEN CONVECTION AREAWIDE...ESPECIALLY ALONG THE PLATEAU 
AND MOUNTAINS. THIS ACTIVITY WILL MOSTLY BE SCATTERED IN 
NATURE...BUT GIVEN SOME INSTABILITY AND SHEAR...SOME STORMS COULD 
BECOME LOCALLY STRONG...AND POSSIBLY SEVERE /THOUGH AM NOT TERRIBLY 
CONFIDENT ABOUT THOSE PROSPECTS ATTM/.  

A DEEP UPPER-TROUGH WILL THEN MOVE INTO THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY AND 
DRAG A COLD FRONT WITH IT WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 
MODELS DIFFER ON THE TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM...WITH THE GFS INDICATING 
SOME DEEPER CONVECTION MOVING INTO THE REGION EARLIER ON WEDNESDAY 
/WHILE THE NAM IS TRENDING A LITTLE LATER/. AT ANY RATE...THE 
POTENTIAL FOR MORE WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION TO THE AREA THROUGH 
THURSDAY MORNING. ATTM...IT APPEARS THE HIGHEST CHANCES WILL OCCUR 
ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY THURSDAY MORNING /SO HAVE INCREASED 
POPS TO LIKELY DURING THIS PERIOD/. THEN ON THURSDAY...HAVE TAPERED  
THEM OFF FROM WEST TO EAST DURING THE DAY. MUCH COOLER AIR WILL 
FILTER INTO THE REGION BEHIND THE FRONT AS A BROAD TROUGH SETS UP 
OVER THE EASTERN CONUS. THIS WILL KNOCK TEMPERATURES BACK INTO THE 
UPPER 60S AND LOWER 70S FOR THE REST OF THE WEEK. ANOTHER SHORTWAVE 
LOOKS AS IF IT WILL TRACK TOWARD THE REGION FRIDAY NIGHT...BRINGING 
AN ADDITIONAL ROUND OF SHOWERS TO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR SATURDAY 
/BEFORE CLEARING OCCURS BY SUNDAY/.  


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

064 
FXUS64 KMRX 110715
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
306 AM EDT SUN MAY 11 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE RIDGE CONTINUES OVER THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. UPPER RIDGING BUILDS INTO THE AREA THROUGH 
THE PERIOD. BOUNDARY LAYER MOIST FROM RECENT RAINFALL. GOOD COOLING 
EARLY TONIGHT HAS LED TO OVERNIGHT FOG DEVELOPMENT. WINDS WILL 
REMAIN LIGHT SO FOG WILL BURN OFF SLOWLY THIS MORNING. LOW LEVEL 
CONVERGENCE ALONG SOUTHERN MOUNTAINS COUPLED WITH DAY TIME HEATING 
COULD LEAD TO ISOLATED OROGRAPHIC CONVECTION ACROSS SOUTHERN 
MOUNTAINS. TEMPERATURES IN THE LOW 80S WILL BE COMMON AS THICKNESS 
HEIGHTS RISE TODAY. WARMER TEMPERATURES CONTINUE TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...WEAK HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE WILL 
NUDGE INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION FOR MONDAY.  WITH SOME 
WEAK INSTABILITY REMAINING OVER THE AREA AND LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IN 
PLACE...COULD SEE MAINLY DIURNAL TYPE CONVECTION DEVELOPING AND 
GENERAL OVER NORMALLY FAVORED LOCATIONS...HIGHER TERRAIN.  MAIN 
SYSTEM OF CONCERN THROUGH THE EXTEND CONTINUES TO BE A RELATIVELY 
STRONG COLD FRONT PROGGED INTO THE AREA MID WEEK.  MODELS CONTINUE 
TO SLOW THIS SYSTEM'S EASTWARD MOVEMENT.  MAY SEE SOME SCATTERED 
CONVECTION DEVELOP AND MOVE IN ON TUESDAY AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM.  
HOWEVER...THE MAIN BAND NOW APPEARS TO HOLD OFF UNTIL LATE TUESDAY 
NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY.  LINGERING PRECIP SHOULD END FROM WEST TO EAST 
ON THURSDAY AS MUCH COOLER AIR MOVES IN.  A WEAK DISTURBANCE SLIDES
