.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY
OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH A HUMID AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST
AREA WITH DEWPOINTS MOSTLY IN THE 60S. AREA RADARS STILL REVEAL SOME

BUT THIS CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY SHOULD DIMINISH BEFORE MIDNIGHT AS AN
UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE EXITS THE REGION AND THE LOCAL AIR MASS
STABILIZES WITH THE SETTING OF THE SUN. WITH RAINFALL OBSERVED AREA
WIDE EARLIER TODAY...THINK THAT AREAS OF FOG WILL DEVELOP AFTER
MIDNIGHT AS CLOUDS DIMINISH.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT
WILL UPDATE LATER THIS EVENING TO REMOVE ANY PRECIP WORDING AND TO
MENTION AREAS OF FOG DEVELOPING AFTER MIDNIGHT.

312 
FXUS64 KMRX 101829
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
229 PM EDT SAT MAY 10 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...A SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE
THROUGH THE AREA...AS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE TO DEVELOP
OVER MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. MOVEMENT OF THESE
STORMS IS TO THE NORTHEAST...SO AREAS NORTH OF I-40 WILL SEE THE
STRONGEST SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. THERE IS ENOUGH INSTABILITY
AND SHEAR IN THE ENVIRONMENT THAT ANY STORMS THAT DO BEGIN TO
DEVELOP...COULD BE STRONG. NOT IMPRESSED WITH THE AMOUNT OF
LIFT...SO WILL HAVE TO KEEP AN EYE ON THE STORMS TO SEE IF ANY
APPROACH SEVERE CRITERIA. WITH THE PW VALUES AND WINDS AT THE LOW
AND MIDLEVELS...THE MAIN THREATS WITH THESE SHOWERS AND ANY
THUNDERSTORM ARE GOING TO BE LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND GUSTY
WINDS.

UPPER AND MID LEVEL DRY AIR IS EXPECTED TO BE ADVECTED INTO THE
AREA AROUND SUNSET. THIS WILL BEGIN TO LIMIT ANY ADDITIONAL STORM
DEVELOPMENT...AND ALLOW THE STORMS OVER THE AREA TO BEGIN TO WEAKEN
AND MOVE EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS. BEHIND THIS CONVECTION...FOG IS
POSSIBLE AROUND SUNRISE IN AREAS THROUGH THE CWA DUE TO THE AMOUNT
OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE REMAINING. SUNDAY...SKIES WILL BEGIN TO
CLEAR IN THE AFTERNOON. MODELS WANT TO BRING IN A CHANCE FOR PRECIP
IN THE MORNING AND EARLY AFTERNOON HOURS. CONFIDENCE IS LOW ON ANY
COVERAGE...SO INCLUDED JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR NOW. TEMPERATURES
WILL STILL BE JUST A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH SUNDAY.


.LONG TERM /SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY/... AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE 
OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE GULF OF MEXICO WILL NOSE INTO THE REGION 
FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY. THIS WILL PROMOTE A MOSTLY DRY FORECAST 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE MOISTURE 
UNDERNEATH THIS RIDGE...THE POTENTIAL FOR DIURNALLY DRIVEN SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE BOTH DAYS...ESPECIALLY ALONG THE 
PLATEAU AND MOUNTAINS. THIS ACTIVITY WILL MOSTLY BE ISOLATED TO 
SCATTERED IN NATURE...WITH THE BETTER COVERAGE OCCURRING ON TUESDAY. 
SOME OF THIS ACTIVITY COULD BECOME LOCALLY STRONG...BUT OVERALL 
CONFIDENCE IN ANY WIDESPREAD SEVERE WEATHER POTENTIAL IS LOW ATTM 
GIVEN THE LACK OF DYNAMICS. 

A DEEP UPPER-TROUGH WILL THEN MOVE INTO THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY AND 
DRAG A COLD FRONT WITH IT WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 
THIS WILL BRING THE POTENTIAL FOR MORE WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION TO 
THE AREA THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING. MODELS HAVE TRENDED SLOWER WITH 
THIS SYSTEM...SO HAVE KEPT A BULK OF THE HIGHEST POPS OUT OF THE 
AREA UNTIL AFTER 00Z THURSDAY...BEFORE TAPERING THEM OFF FROM WEST 
TO EAST DURING THE DAY ON THURSDAY. THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME MORE 
WIDESPREAD ORGANIZED THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY WILL BE POSSIBLE ALONG 
THE FRONT...BUT ANY SEVERE POTENTIAL WILL DEPEND ON TIMING OF THE 
FRONT AND THE AVAILABLE INSTABILITY. MUCH COOLER AIR WILL FILTER 
INTO THE REGION BEHIND THE FRONT AS A BROAD TROUGH SETS UP OVER THE 
EASTERN CONUS. THIS WILL KNOCK TEMPERATURES BACK INTO THE UPPER 60S 
AND LOWER 70S FOR THE REST OF THE WEEK...WITH ADDITIONAL RAIN 
CHANCES POSSIBLE FRIDAY INTO THE WEEKEND. 


&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EDT FRI MAY 9 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER SPEED MAX OVER OK ON 
BASE OF UPPER TROUGH WILL WEAKEN AND MOVE NE TO THE W OH VALLEY THIS 
EVENING. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO SHIFT SE OF THE 
AREA. MOISTURE INCREASES TODAY AS PWAT VALUES NEARLY DOUBLE TO 
AROUND 1.50 BY THIS EVENING. INSTABILITY AND LIFT ARE RELATIVE LOW 
BUT SUFFICIENT FOR THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPMENT. UPPER DIVERGENCE 
APPEARS TO BE THE BEST FEATURE TO AID IN DEVELOPMENT AND REGENERATION 
OF CONVECTION THAT WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA FROM THE WEST TODAY. HIGH 
POPS EXPECTED THROUGH THE PERIOD BUT CONVECTION WILL LIKELY BE 
SCATTERED AND PERIODIC IN NATURE. AFTER A LULL OVERNIGHT AN INCREASE 
IN ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED LATE TONIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY AS WEAK 
SHORT WAVE MOVES EAST THROUGH THE TN VALLEY. CONVECTION WILL 
DECREASE IN COVERAGE BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON AS TROUGH AXIS MOVES 
THROUGH AND LAYER MOISTURE DROPS OFF. AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
SLIGHTLY COOLER DUE TO CLOUD COVER. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...WILL BE IN A RATHER 
UNSETTLE WEATHER PATTERN FOR MUCH OF THE EXTENDED.  BEHIND THE 
EXITING COLD FRONT...WE WILL CONTINUE TO HAVE DECENT LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE IN PLACE AND THE AIR MASS WILL REMAIN SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE.  
THIS COMBINED WITH A COUPLE OF WEAK IMPULSE MOVING THROUGH WILL 
ALLOW FOR THE SLIGHT CHANCE OF CONVECTION ACROSS THE AREA SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY.  ANOTHER...STRONGER COLD FRONT WILL MOVE IN LATE TUESDAY 
INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  CONFIDENCE LOW ON TIMING BUT BEST CHANCE FOR 
CONVECTION APPEARS TO BE WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  THE FRONT SHOULD EXIT THE 
AREA FOR A DRY DAY ON THURSDAY

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 PM EDT THU MAY 8 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...UPPER RIDGE OVER THE REGION 
WILL SHIFT EAST. MOISTURE WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE ACROSS THE AREA 
WELL IN ADVANCE OF AN APPROACHING UPPER TROUGH TONIGHT AND FRIDAY.  
WILL SEE AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS TONIGHT...AND SOME SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS LIKELY TO DEVELOP AND MOVE IN FRIDAY MAINLY IN THE 
AFTERNOON.  INSTABILITY LOOKS TO RELATIVELY WEAK...AND RISK FOR 
SEVERE STORMS AT THIS POINT LOOKS ON THE LOW SIDE. WILL NOT STRAY 
FAR FROM MAV TEMPS WHICH LOOK REASONABLE OVERALL.   
 

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...AN ACTIVE PATTERN
IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD AS A COUPLE OF STORM SYSTEMS WILL MOVE
THROUGH THE REGION...BRINGING SOME GOOD OPPORTUNITIES FOR
PRECIPITATION. THE FIRST UPPER-TROUGH WILL SKIRT THROUGH THE GREAT
LAKES FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY...AND DRAG A WEAK COLD FRONT
THROUGH THE AREA. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP ALONG/WEST
OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER AND MOVE EAST INTO MIDDLE TENNESSEE
/WEAKENING AS THEY DO/. THE BEST CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION ACROSS
EAST TENNESSEE APPEAR TO BE FROM 06-16Z SATURDAY...BEFORE TAPERING
OFF BY THE AFTERNOON AS THE FRONT SHIFTS EAST. SOME THUNDERSTORMS
WILL BE POSSIBLE ...BUT GIVEN THE LIMITATIONS IN INSTABILITY DO NOT
THINK THERE IS MUCH IN THE WAY OF A SEVERE WEATHER THREAT ATTM.
SOME RIDGING WILL THEN BUILD BACK IN FOR SUNDAY AND
MONDAY...RESULTING IN A WARM-UP BACK INTO THE 80S FOR EARLY NEXT
WEEK. SOME ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION WILL STILL BE POSSIBLE
DURING THE DAY GIVEN THE MOISTURE-LADEN ATMOSPHERE /MAINLY ALONG
THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE PLATEAU/MOUNTAINS/. ANOTHER STRONGER
STORM SYSTEM WILL THEN MOVE INTO THE REGION TUESDAY NIGHT AND
WEDNESDAY...BRINGING A STRONGER COLD FRONT AND THE POTENTIAL FOR
SOME MORE WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING. THE
COOLER AIR ASSOCIATED WITH THIS STORM SYSTEM WILL ALSO DROP HIGHS
BACK INTO THE 60S AND 70S TO CLOSE OUT THE PERIOD.

FXUS64 KMRX 080732
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT THU MAY 8 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ONE MORE DAY UNDER THE INFLUENCE 
OF AN AMPLIFIED UPPER LEVEL RIDGE KEEPS SKIES FILLED WITH MORE 
SUNSHINE THAN CLOUD ALTHOUGH THERE WILL BE A FEW MORE CIRRUS AROUND 
TODAY. THE RIDGE SLIPS A LITTLE FURTHER EAST TO THE EASTERN SEABOARD 
OVERNIGHT. THERE WILL BE A FEW MORE CLOUDS ADVANCING AHEAD OF THE 
CENTRAL U.S. TROUGH TONIGHT BUT LITTLE CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION. 
STAYED A DEGREE OR TWO UNDER THE GUIDANCE MAXES TODAY FOLLOWING THE 
TREND OF THE LAST SEVERAL DAYS WHICH HAS RESULTED IN GUIDANCE BEING 
ABOUT A DEGREE OR TWO WARM. FOLLOWED MINS CLOSELY TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
WILL BEGIN TO ENTER THE AREA FROM THE WEST FRIDAY AFTERNOON AS AN 
UPPER TROUGH AND SURFACE FRONT APPROACH. THE BEST FORCING WITH THE 
UPPER JET APPEARS TO COME INTO OUR AREA AFTER 00Z SAT. THE LACK OF 
INSTABILITY AFTER DARK SHOULD HELP LIMIT ANY SEVERE 
THREAT...ALTHOUGH WITH A LLJ OF AROUND 50 KTS...IT CANNOT BE 
ENTIRELY RULED OUT. THE BEST MID/UPPER LEVEL DYNAMICS WITH THIS 
SYSTEM LIFTS NE FRIDAY NIGHT...SO THERE SHOULD BE A GENERAL 
WEAKENING TREND TO THE CONVECTION AS IT MOVES THROUGH. 

BEHIND THE TROUGH PASSAGE...THE FLOW BECOMES NEARLY ZONAL...AND THE 
SURFACE FRONT STALLS E-W TO OUR NORTH. FOR SATURDAY THROUGH 
MONDAY...THE ATLANTIC RIDGE WILL REMAIN THE DOMINANT FEATURE. THE 
LACK OF DEEP MOISTURE AND FORCING ALOFT WILL LIMIT CONVECTION TO 
ISOLATED/SCATTERED COVERAGE AT BEST...FAVORING TERRAIN AREAS...AND 
MAINLY DIURNALLY DRIVEN. POPS WILL BE LOWERED THESE DAYS...AND 
REMOVED ENTIRELY FROM OVERNIGHT PERIODS. 

THERE IS FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE GFS AND ECMWF OF A DEEP 
TROUGH DROPPING INTO THE PLAINS ON TUESDAY...AND THE ATLANTIC RIDGE 
GIVING WAY. THIS SHOULD ALLOW FOR GREATER MOISTURE TO ADVECT INTO 
THE AREA...AND WILL RAISE POPS INTO THE HIGH CHANCE RANGE 
TUESDAY/TUESDAY NIGHT.

FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING...DECREASING SOME IN THE
AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS MOIST FLOW CONTINUES OUT AHEAD OF FRONT.
TEMPERATURES WARM BUT COOLER FRIDAY WITH MORE CLOUDS. NIGHTTIME
TEMPERATURES CONTINUE MILD UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S. WEAKENING FRONT
MAKES IT THROUGH REGION SATURDAY NIGHT OR EARLY SUNDAY. RIDGING
ALOFT WILL KEEP PATTERN DRIER FROM SUNDAY ON BUT SOUTHWEST FLOW
ALOFT WILL KEEP ENOUGH MOISTURE STREAMING IN FROM THE GULF FOR
AFTERNOON AND EVENING SHOWERS AND STORMS SUNDAY AND MONDAY INTO
TUESDAY. ANOTHER FRONT THAT IS MORE DEVELOPED AND MAY PRODUCE SOME
SEVERE STORMS WILL MOVE INTO THE MS VALLEY TUESDAY AND MOVE ACROSS
THE EASTERN TN VALLEY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

STREAM. PRECIP CHANCES BEGIN TO ENTER WESTERN SECTIONS FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON...WITH POPS RISING TO LIKELY FRIDAY NIGHT AS THE UPPER JET 
MOVES INTO WEST TN AND THE OH VALLEY.  

BEGINNING SATURDAY...MODELS DIVERGE SIGNIFICANTLY...AND CONFIDENCE 
IS VERY LOW. THE GFS PUSHES THE SURFACE FRONT TO THE EAST...BRINGING 
DRY AIR IN SATURDAY. ECMWF HOLDS THE FRONT WELL TO OUR WEST UNTIL 
SATURDAY NIGHT. NAM HAS IT SOMEWHERE IN BETWEEN. GFS ENSEMBLE 
MEMBERS ARE ALL OVER THE PLACE. AS A RESULT...DID NOT MAKE MUCH 
CHANGE TO THE SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY PERIODS. KEPT LIKELY POPS 
GOING SATURDAY...LOWERING TO CHANCE POPS SUNDAY. THERE DOES APPEAR 
TO BE A LACK OF STRONG UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT IN ALL THE MODELS AS THE 
FLOW ALOFT IS NEARLY ZONAL...SO WILL HAVE POPS MORE DIURNALLY-BASED 
SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL

AND THURSDAY. RIDGE WILL SLIP EAST THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...AND 
MOISTURE WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE ACROSS THE AREA. WILL CARRY SLIGHT 
CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS ON FRIDAY FOR POSSIBILITY OF SOME SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS. BEYOND FRIDAY...FORECAST CONFIDENCE TAKES A TUMBLE AS 
MODEL TO MODEL AGREEMENT AND RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY BECOMES POOR.  
APPEARS SOME SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL AFFECT THE REGION AND A COLD 
FRONT WILL SAG INTO THE AREA DURING THE WEEKEND...BUT DETAILS/TIMING 
STILL SOMEWHAT MURKY.  WILL CONTINUE TO CARRY HIGHEST POPS FOR 
SATURDAY FOR NOW.  00Z ECMWF WANTS TO BUILD A RIDGE BACK OVER US FOR 
MONDAY WHILE GFS HAS ANOTHER COLD FRONT PUSHING INTO THE REGION. FOR 
NOW GIVEN UNCERTAINTY WILL JUST KEEP SOME LOW POPS FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS BOTH MONDAY AND TUESDAY.  GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE SO MAINLY MINOR TWEAKS.

FXUS64 KMRX 060721
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 AM EDT TUE MAY 6 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)... THE FORECAST WILL 
REMAIN DRY WITH ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES THROUGH THIS PERIOD AS 
HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE SLOWLY DRIFTS EAST ACROSS THE SE 
CONUS...AND THE MID/UPPER RIDGE OVER THE REGION AMPLIFIES. 
TODAY...AND CONVECTION SHOULD STAY WELL NORTH ALONG A BOUNDARY 
ACROSS WV...AND FORECAST SOUNDINGS ARE STRONGLY CAPPED. GIVEN THE 
DRY SOIL CONDITIONS...WILL LEAN TEMPERATURES TOWARD THE WARM SIDE OF 
GUIDANCE FOR HIGH TEMPS EACH DAY. THIS WILL YIELD HIGHS IN THE MID 
TO UPPER 80S IN MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS. CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE 
FROM THE WEST THURSDAY NIGHT AS THE RIDGE ALOFT SHIFTS TO THE EAST 
COAST AND THE UPPER TROUGH OVER THE PLAINS APPROACHES.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...THE PROTECTIVE UPPER RIDGE 
SLIPS FARTHER EAST OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST ON FRIDAY WHILE THE LONG 
WAVE TROUGH APPROACHES THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. TRIED TO KEEP POPS IN 
THE CHANCE CATEGORY FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ON FRIDAY AS MOST 
OF THE ACTION SHOULD BE FARTHER WEST OVER WESTERN TENNESSEE. FRIDAY 
NIGHT INTO SATURDAY PROBABILITY CRANKS UP AS DEEPER MOISTURE AND 
LIFT BUILD INTO THE REGION. 1000-500 MB MEAN MOISTURE AXIS AND BEST 
INSTABILITY BUILDS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON 
SATURDAY AND THEREFORE HIGHEST POPS WERE MAINTAINED DURING THIS 
TWELVE HOUR PERIOD. KEPT A DECENT 40 PERCENT CHANCE FOR CONVECTION 
GOING SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY AS A WEAK SURFACE BOUNDARY DROPS 
SLOWLY THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY WOULD 
EXPECT A DECREASE IN THE PROBABILITY OF CONVECTION AS RELATIVELY 
DRIER AIR BUILDS INTO THE REGION WITH NO MAJOR FOCUS APPARENT FOR 
DEVELOPMENT. STAYED AWAY FROM THE GFS CONCEPT WHICH TRIES TO BRING A 
HEALTHY LOOKING SHORT WAVE TROUGH WITH ASSOCIATED WIDESPREAD 
CONVECTION IN THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...PREFERRING THE MORE BENIGN 
APPEARANCE OF THE ECMWF.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES

ONCE AGAIN REACHING INTO THE 80S ACROSS VALLEY LOCATIONS ON TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER RIDGE AND LITTLE 
TO NO INFLUX OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE UNTIL LATE THURSDAY...SO EARLY 
PART OF LONG TERM WILL CONTINUE TO FEATURE MUCH ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS 
AND DRY WEATHER. 

MODELS ALSO GENERALLY SLOWING DOWN ANY ONSET OF CONVECTION UNTIL 
FRIDAY AFTERNOON...MAINLY ON THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. THUS...I 
LOWERED POPS FOR FRIDAY MORNING TO A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS WITH 
CHANCE POPS ALL AREAS FOR FRIDAY AFTERNOON. WETTEST PERIOD LOOKS TO 
BE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY...BUT THIS TIMING AND SEVERE WEATHER 
PARAMETERS DON'T SUGGEST STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS AT THIS TIME. I DID 
NUDGE POPS UP TO A SOLID LIKELY CHANCE BY SATURDAY AND WENT CLOSER 
TO THE COOLER ECMX MOS MAX TEMPS FOR SATURDAY.

OTHERWISE...GULF MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY INCREASE SUNDAY AND MONDAY 
SO CHANCES FOR AT LEAST DIURNAL CONVECTION...IN LINE WITH PREVIOUS 
GRIDS AND WORTH 20 TO 30 PERCENT CHANCES FOR NEW DAY 7 (MONDAY). 

GENERALLY FOLLOWED THE 00Z AND SIMILAR 12Z GFSX MOS TEMPS.

548 
FXUS64 KMRX 050656
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 AM EDT MON MAY 5 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
THE BOUNDARY STATIONED TO THE NORTH OF OUR AREA WILL BE PUSHED 
FARTHER NORTH TODAY AS THE RIDGE OVER THE GULF WILL BUILD NORTHWARD. 
FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW A STRONG CAPPING INVERSION REMAINING IN 
PLACE AREA-WIDE. THIS WILL ELIMINATE ANY CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
DEVELOPING THIS AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE THEIR UPWARD 
TREND TODAY AS TEH RIDGE BUILDS OVERHEAD...REACHING THE UPPER 80S 
SOUTH TO LOWER 80S NORTH. 

SW WINDS WILL AGAIN BE IN THE 10-20 MPH RANGE WITH SOME GUSTS 
POSSIBLE IN THE AFTERNOON...WITH MIN AFTERNOON RH IN THE 25-30 
RANGE. THIS COULD PRESENT SOME FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS...AND WILL 
COORDINATE WITH STATE FORESTRY FOR THE NEED OF ANY STATEMENTS. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
SURFACE RIDGING INTO THE GULF OF MEXICO LIMITING MOISTURE RETURN
INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS... AND UPPER RIDGING PRODUCING MID-
LEVEL WARMING CAPPING MOIST CONVECTION...WILL KEEP FORECAST AREA
DRY AND VERY WARM TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY.

BY FRIDAY...AN UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES 
FLATTENING UPPER RIDGE OVER THE AREA ALLOWING MID-LEVELS TO COOL. 
ALSO...SURFACE RIDGE INTO THE GULF WILL MOVE EAST OF THE GULF 
ALLOWING FOR MOISTURE RETURN INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. A WEAK 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL APPROACH THE AREA...BUT WILL LIKELY REMAIN 
NORTH OF THE REGION. 

MODELS DO SHOW UPPER DIVERENCE OVER THE AREA DUE TO A SERIES OF JET 
STREAKS MOVING THROUGH TENNESSEE AND OHIO VALLEYS. THESE FEATURES 
ALONG WITH INCREASING MOISTURE/INSTABILIY WILL ALLOW FOR INCREASING 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR FRIDAY. FOR SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY...MOISTURE/INSTABILITY IS SHOWN TO INCREASE A GOOD DEAL WITH 
HIGHER POPS OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

GENEALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
911 PM EDT SUN MAY 4 2014

.DISCUSSION...
A QUIET NIGHT IS PREVAILING ONCE AGAIN ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIAN REGION THIS EVENING AS A HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE CONTINUE
TO NOSE INTO THE AREA. THIS HAS RESULTED IN MOSTLY CLEAR AND WARM
CONDITIONS THIS EVENING...WITH TEMPERATURES STILL IN THE MID 70S
TO AROUND 80 DEGREES IN MANY AREAS AS OF 9 PM EDT. A WEAK FRONT
ACROSS NORTHERN KENTUCKY/CENTRAL WEST VIRGINIA IS PRODUCING SOME
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO OUR NORTH...AND HAS EVEN SENT AN
OUTFLOW BOUNDARY INTO SOUTHERN KENTUCKY. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE LACK
OF MOISTURE AND UPPER-LEVEL SUPPORT...NO CONVECTION HAS ATTEMPTED
TO DEVELOP THIS EVENING. LATEST RADAR AND SATELLITE TRENDS SUPPORT
THIS THINKING...WITH NO VERTICAL CU DEVELOPMENT. AND...WITH
CONVECTIVE INHIBITION QUICKLY DEVELOPING THIS EVENING WITH THE
SETTING SUN...AM NOT EXPECTING ANYTHING TO MATERIALIZE LATER ON.
GIVEN THIS...HAVE REMOVED MENTIONABLE POPS FROM THE NORTHEAST
ZONES. GIVEN THE WARMER CONDITIONS...LOWS TONIGHT WILL BE WARMER
AND BOTTOM OUT IN THE MID TO UPPER 50S IN MANY LOCATIONS.

332 
FXUS64 KMRX 041831
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
231 PM EDT SUN MAY 4 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER 
NORTHERN KY AND SOUTHERN WV...WITH A WEAK LEE TROUGH ALONG THE 
EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. A NORTHWEST FLOW 
UPPER-LEVEL PATTERN WILL REMAIN NEARLY PARALLEL TO THIS FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...SO NOT MUCH MOVEMENT IS EXPECTED 
WITH THIS BOUNDARY. MODELS HAVE BEEN INCONSISTENT WITH WHETHER THE 
AIR MASS WILL BE MOIST ENOUGH TO GENERATE CONVECTION AROUND THIS 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY (AND ALSO WHERE EXACTLY THIS BOUNDARY WILL SETTLE)...
BUT WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR CONVECTION OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND
NORTHEAST TN THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT SINCE THE AXIS OF INSTABILITY IS
PROGGED TO LINGER AROUND THESE AREAS. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL STEEP
LAPSE RATES OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN THROUGH TUESDAY
NIGHT...WHICH WOULD SUGGEST THAT A FEW STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS
WOULD BE POSSIBLE IF ANY CONVECTION ULTIMATELY DEVELOPS. DAMAGING
WINDS APPEAR POSSIBLE WITH ANY STORMS DUE TO AN INVERTED V SOUNDING
PROFILE IN THE LOWER LEVELS...WITH LARGE HAIL ALSO POSSIBLE DUE TO
FAIRLY LOW FREEZING LEVELS AROUND 9000 TO 9500 FT MSL. SINCE IT HAS
BEEN MY EXPERIENCE THAT NORTHWEST FLOW SEVERE EVENTS TEND TO BE
SURPRISES (ESPECIALLY DURING THE WARM SEASON)...I BELIEVE IT IS
PRUDENT TO MENTION IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK THE POSSIBILITY
OF ISOLATED STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS EACH AFTERNOON AND EVENING THROUGH
TUESDAY NIGHT OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS
AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...
BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER RIDGE STRENGTHENING OVER
THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. ISOLATED DIURNAL CONVECTION
POSSIBLE OVER HIGHER TERRAIN ON WEDNESDAY...OTHERWISE DRY CONDITIONS
ACROSS THE AREA FOR THE END OF THE WORK WEEK. THE RIDGE SHIFTS EAST
OF THE REGION ON FRIDAY ALLOWING A COLD FRONT TO APPROACH FROM THE
WEST. MODEL RUNS SHOW SOME DISCREPANCY DURING THE REST OF THE
EXTENDED AND CONFIDENCE IN TIMING IS LOW. BUT OVERALL PATTERN SHOWS
CLOUDS WILL INCREASE FRIDAY MORNING WITH SCATTERED SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP TO OUR WEST AND MOVE INTO THE MRX
CWA FRIDAY AFTERNOON OR INTO THE NIGHT. AN ADDITIONAL LINE OF
CONVECTION IS EXPECTED LATE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY SATURDAY AS THE
FRONT MOVES INTO THE AREA. ISOLATED SHOWERS WILL LINGER OVER THE
AREA INTO SUNDAY AS THE SYSTEM MOVES OUT AND ANOTHER APPROACHES FROM
THE WEST. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             58  88  59  88 /   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  57  86  58  86 /   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       57  86  58  86 /   0   0   0   0

224 
FXUS64 KMRX 041310
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
910 AM EDT SUN MAY 4 2014

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER NORTHERN KY
AND SOUTHERN WV...WITH A WEAK LEE TROUGH ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS
OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS EXPECTED TO
REMAIN QUASI-STATIONARY NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...AS
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT REMAINS NEARLY PARALLEL TO THE BOUNDARY. MODELS
INDICATE THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION DEVELOPING
THIS AFTERNOON OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN...WITH MODEL
SOUNDINGS REVEALING STEEP LAPSE RATES OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND
NORTHEAST TN. WHILE THE DRY BOUNDARY LAYER OVER THESE AREAS SHOULD
LIMIT THE AREAL COVERAGE OF CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON...ANY STORMS
THAT DEVELOP APPEAR TO HAVE A GOOD CHANCE OF BECOMING STRONG TO
SEVERE WITH DAMAGING WINDS (DUE TO INVERTED V SOUNDING PROFILE IN
THE LOWER LEVELS) AND LARGE HAIL (DUE TO LOW FREEZING LEVEL AROUND
9300 FT).

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO TWEAK THE

ISSUE A FIRE DANGER STATEMENT TO ADDRESS THE ELEVATED FIRE DANGER
FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING DUE TO BREEZY WINDS AND LOW
RELATIVE HUMIDITIES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 AM EDT SUN MAY 4 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A WEAK BOUNDARY WILL BE ORIENTED E-W ACROSS KY AND SOUTHERN WEST
VA TODAY. THIS MAY PROVIDE A FOCUS FOR SOME CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT
THIS AFTERNOON. NAM AND GFS FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW A STRONG CAP
OVER SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL SECTIONS REMAINING IN PLACE THROUGH THE
DAY...BUT NORTH...THE CAP ERODES AFTER 18Z. THERE IS LITTLE IN THE
WAY OF MID/UPPER LEVEL LIFT AND MOISTURE IS LIMITED...BUT THE
SURFACE BOUNDARY MAY HELP GET THINGS GOING. WILL HAVE A SLIGHT
CHANCE POP IN SW VA AND NE TN TODAY. ANYTHING THAT CAN DEVELOP WILL
BE DIURNALLY DRIVEN...AND SHOULD DISSIAPTE BEFORE MIDNIGHT.
TEMPERATURES TODAY WILL CONTINUE ON THE WARMING TREND...REACHING
LOWER 80S IN MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS. GUSTY WINDS TO 20-25 MPH MAY BE
POSSIBLE IN NORTHERN SECTIONS IN THE AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...
OVERALL...QUIET PATTERN WILL CONTINUE UNTIL FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.
RIDGING ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES LIMITING MOISTURE RETURN AND
UPPER RIDGING ALOFT WILL PRODUCE A QUIET PATTERN THROUGH THURSDAY.
FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW FAIRLY WARM TEMPERATURES BETWEEN 800-700MB
KEEPING THE AREA FAIRLY CAPPED. ONLY CONCERN FOR CONVECTION WILL BE
WITH A WEAK QUASI-FRONTAL BOUNDARY THAT MOVES CLOSE ENOUGH TO
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE TO KEEP LOW CHANCE POPS
EARLY NEXT WEEK.

EXTENDED PERIOD BECOMES A LITTLE MORE ACTIVE FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY 
AS AN UPPER JET OVER THE OHIO VALLEY PLACES THE FORECAST AREA UNDER 
DIVERGENCE ALOFT. A WEAKENDING FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL ALSO MOVE 
TOWARD THE AREA. MODELS SHOW ONLY LIMITED INSTABILITY...SO SEVERE 
WEATHER CHANCES LOOK MINIMAL AT THIS TIME. 

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MEX MOS THROUGHT THE FORECAST PERIOD AS 
SUMMER-LIKE CONDITIONS ANTICIPATED.

015 
FXUS64 KMRX 031831
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
231 PM EDT SAT MAY 3 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK LEE TROUGH ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE OHIO RIVER 
VALLEY. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT TOWARDS THE 
FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...AND THEN BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY SOMEWHERE 
NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY AS NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT BECOMES 
NEARLY PARALLEL TO THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY. MODELS HAVE BEEN 
INCONSISTENT WITH THE EXACT PLACEMENT OF THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY... 
WITH THE NAM AND ECMWF MODELS INDICATING THAT THE BOUNDARY WILL 
REMAIN FARTHER NORTH OVER THE MID ATLANTIC STATES. HOWEVER...THE GFS 
MODEL CONTINUES TO INDICATE THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME ISOLATED 
CONVECTION OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN...SO THINK THAT A 
MENTION OF AT LEAST SLIGHT CHANCES FOR CONVECTION IS NEEDED OVER 
THESE AREAS FOR BOTH SUNDAY AND MONDAY. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL STEEP 
LAPSE RATES DEVELOPING DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS AROUND THIS 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY...ESPECIALLY ON MONDAY AFTERNOON WHEN A MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND 
NORTHEAST TN. THUS...IT APPEARS THAT A FEW ISOLATED STORMS MAY 
BECOME STRONG TO SEVERE WITH DAMAGING WINDS AND LARGE HAIL. SINCE IT 
HAS BEEN MY EXPERIENCE THAT NORTHWEST FLOW SEVERE EVENTS TEND TO BE 
SURPRISES (ESPECIALLY DURING THE WARM SEASON)...I BELIEVE IT IS 
PRUDENT TO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF ISOLATED STRONG TO SEVERE 
STORMS FOR BOTH SUNDAY AND MONDAY AFTERNOONS OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND 
NORTHEAST TN IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS 
AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH MONDAY 
NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL
CONTINUE TO STRENGTHEN AND MOVE UP FROM THE GULF THROUGH THE WORK
WEEK. AT THE SAME TIME...A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL BEGIN TO
DEVELOP AND BY THE END OF THE WORK WEEK...BRING A COLD FRONT THE
AREA. A COUPLE OF SHORTWAVES WILL MOVE AROUND THIS HIGH PRESSURE.
HAVE INCLUDED SLIGHT POPS FOR NORTHEASTERN TN AND SOUTHWEST VA AT
THIS TIME TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND WEDNESDAY. FORCING IS VERY WEAK
THESE DAYS...BUT WILL HAVE TO KEEP AN EYE ON THE MODELS AS UPDATES
ARRIVE. BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON...THE COLD FRONT WILL BE APPROACHING
MIDDLE TN. ISOLATED SHOWERS AHEAD OF THE FRONT ARE POSSIBLE FRIDAY
AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WITH THE MAIN AREA OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH THE DAY ON SATURDAY. TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE
WORK WEEK WILL BE SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             53  84  58  87 /   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  52  82  57  85 /   0   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       53  82  57  85 /   0   0   0  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 AM EDT SAT MAY 3 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE WESTERN GULF OF MEXICO WILL EXTEND
NE INTO THE TN VALLEY REGION TODAY AND TONIGHT. A DRY NW FLOW WILL
PERSIST THROUGH THE MID AND UPPER LEVELS. THE FEW CLOUDS THAT ARE
AROUND EARLY THIS MORNING IN NORTHERN AREAS CONTINUE TO
DISSIPATE...AND MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES ARE EXPECTED THROUGH THE DAY.
W-SW WINDS WILL BE 10-15 MPH WITH SOME GUSTS AROUND 20 POSSIBLE IN
THE AFTERNOON AS LOW PRESSURE CROSSES THE GREAT LAKES TODAY.
TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE ON A WARMING TREND...WITH HIGHS IN THE
UPPER 60S TO MID 70S IN MOST LOCATIONS. LOWS TONIGHT UNDER CLEAR
SKIES WILL FALL INTO THE UPPER 40S TO LOWER 50S.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...
OVERALL...A CONTINUED QUIET EXTENDED PERIOD. FOR SUNDAY THROUGH
TUESDAY...WEST TO NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WITH SURFACE RIDGING INTO
THE GULF OF MEXICO WILL KEEP AIRMASS FAIRLY DRY FOR MAY. A SERIES
OF WEAK SHORT-WAVES WILL MOVE ACROSS THE LOWER GREAT LAKES/OHIO
VALLEY WITH A QUASI-STATIONARY BOUNDARY MOVING INTO SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA/FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. THIS BOUNDARY WILL FOCUS BOUNDARY
LAYER MOISTURE TO PRODUCE A LOW CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS...MAINLY DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING.

FOR WEDNESDAY...UPPER RIDGING WILL STRENGTHEN IN ADVANCE OF A STRONG 
SHORT-WAVE TROUGH OVER THE ROCKY'S AND PLAIN STATES. BOUNDARY WILL 
HAVE MOVED NORTH...BUT ENOUGH INSTABILITY TO WARRANT A CONTINUED LOW 
CHANCE OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN. BY THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...MID-LEVEL 
WARMING FROM UPPER RIDGING AND CONTINUED SURFACE RIDGE INTO THE 
EASTERN GULF OF MEXICO...WILL PRODUCE VERY WARM AND DRY CONDITIONS.

NEXT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS RETURN FOR NEXT WEEKEND. 
GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MEX MOS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

COMPROMISE WHERE SOME DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

WILL CONTRIBUTE TO DRY WEATHER AND MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES THROUGH THE 
END OF THE WORK WEEK. A COUPLE OF SHORTWAVES MOVING AROUND THIS

OF THE CWA. HAVE INCLUDED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN VERY FAR SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA FOR THE MORNING AND EARLY AFTERNOON MONDAY...BUT FORCING 
DOES SEEM A BIT WEAK FROM THE RECENT MODEL RUNS. THE RIDGE WILL 
SLOWLY MOVE TOWARDS THE EAST COAST BY THE END OF THE WORK WEEK...
WITH A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IN ITS WAKE DEVELOPING AND MOVING TOWARDS
THE GREAT LAKES. A COLD FRONT WITH THIS LOW WILL BRING THE NEXT
CHANCE FOR RAIN OVER THE WEEKEND. STILL TOO FAR OUT TO TELL DETAILS
WITH MUCH CONFIDENCE AT THIS TIME. TEMPERATURES THROUGH THIS PERIOD
WILL BE A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL.

DOMINATING. A SERIES OF WEAK SHORT-WAVES WILL MOVE ACROSS THE GREAT
LAKES/OHIO VALLEY WITH A QUASI-STATIONARY BOUNDARY OVER THE LOWER
OHIO VALLEY AND CENTRAL APPALACHIANS...POSSIBLY ACROSS SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA AT TIMES. THIS BOUNDARY ALONG WITH MARGINAL INSTABILITY
WILL PRODUCE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS SUNDAY AND MONDAY OVER PARTS OF
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA.

THIS BOUNDARY LIFTS NORTH FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY WITH ONLY 
FORCING BEING OROGRAPHIC LIFT. WILL INCLUDE SLIGHT POPS FOR THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS FOR THE END OF THE EXTENDED...BUT OVERALL...
A DRY FORECAST FOR MOST LOCATIONS DURING THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

INCREASING THICKNESS AND 850MB TEMPERATURES WILL ALLOW FOR A WARMING 
TREND WITH SUMMER-LIKE CONDITIONS FOR MOST OF NEXT WEEK. FOLLOWED 
GFS MEX NUMBERS CLOSELY.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EDT THU MAY 1 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE
ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT OVER THE CAROLINAS...ASSOCIATED WITH A
LARGE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION.
COOLER AND DRIER AIR WILL CONTINUE TO ADVECT INTO THE FORECAST AREA
TONIGHT...WITH CLOUDS CONTINUING TO AFFECT THE REGION THROUGH FRIDAY
AS A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH SWINGS ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY
THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THIS
UPPER TROUGH WILL HAVE LIMITED MOISTURE AVAILABLE WITH IT...SO WILL
ONLY MENTION AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS WITH NO PRECIP. AS FOR TEMPS...
GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH
SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME DIFFERENCES ARE
NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...OVERALL...DRY CONDITIONS AND
CLEAR SKIES WILL REMAIN THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD. HIGH PRESSURE
WILL SET UP IN THE GULF...WITH A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE
NORTHEAST FOR A COUPLE OF DAYS. THE FLOW THROUGH THIS TIME IS FROM
WEST NORTHWEST AND TEMPERATURES WILL BE SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL.
SEVERAL DIFFERENT SHORTWAVES WILL MOVE AROUND THAT LOW PRESSURE...
BRINGING RAIN TO THE REGIONS NORTH OF OUR CWA. THE MODELS BRING THE
SOUTHERN EXTENT OF THIS RAIN INTO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. RIGHT NOW THE
CONFIDENCE IS VERY LOW THAT THE LIFTING WILL BE STRONG ENOUGH FOR
THE SHOWERS TO MAKE IT INTO THE AREA. OTHERWISE...PLEASANT CONDITIONS
WILL PREVAIL THROUGH THE EXTENDED.

182 
FXUS64 KMRX 010648
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
248 AM EDT THU MAY 1 2014

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
SOME LINGERING LIGHT SHOWERS ALONG THE MOUNTAINS OF EAST TENNESSEE AND
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA SHOULD CLEAR THE AREA AND DISSIPATE BY DAYBREAK...
RESULTING IN A DRY FORECAST FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY. SOME
LOW STRATUS WILL CONTINUE TO PUSH TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FROM
MIDDLE TENNESSEE EARLY THIS MORNING...PROMOTING MOSTLY CLOUDY
CONDITIONS IN MOST LOCATIONS THROUGH LATE MORNING. HOWEVER...THESE
CLOUDS WILL BREAK UP SOMEWHAT BY MIDDAY AND RESULT IN PARTLY SUNNY
CONDITIONS BY THE AFTERNOON...AND MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS BY THE
EVENING AND OVERNIGHT HOURS. WITH AN UPPER-TROUGH STILL DOMINATING
THE WEATHER ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH THE END OF THE WORK
WEEK...BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES WILL KICK OFF THE MONTH OF MAY AS
HIGHS PEAK IN THE 60S AND LOWS BOTTOM OUT IN THE 40S.

.LONG TERM /FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
LONG WAVE TROUGH AXIS DOES NOT MOVE EAST OF THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS UNTIL LATE SATURDAY. HOWEVER...MODELS CONTINUE IN GOOD
AGREEMENT ON ANY PRECIPITATION STAYING TO OUR NORTH OVER THE GREAT
LAKES REGION...AND TO OUR SOUTH ACROSS THE EASTERN GULF OF MEXICO
NE TO THE CAROLINAS. THUS...NOT MANY TWEAKS NEEDED TO FORECAST
GRIDS INTO THE WEEKEND.

THE UPPER RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE REGION FROM LATE SUNDAY INTO EARLY 
NEXT WEEK...REACHING MAXIMUM AMPLIFICATION BY WEDNESDAY. SOUTHWEST 
LOW LEVEL FLOW DEVELOPS BY TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY...WITH LOTS OF 
SUNSHINE TO SEND MAX TEMPS WELL INTO THE 80S. MIN TEMPS IN THE 50S 
TO MID 60S AS WELL...WHICH WILL BE EASILY 10 DEGREES ABOVE SEASONAL 
NORMALS.

IN OTHER WORDS...THE MONTH OF MAY STARTS WITH A VERY PLEASANT AND 
DRY 7 DAYS AHEAD!

&&

738 
FXUS64 KMRX 301901
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
301 PM EDT WED APR 30 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS
SHOWS A COLD FRONT STRETCHING GENERALLY ACROSS THE GREAT TN VALLEY...
WITH SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS OCCURRING ALONG IT OVER THE CUMBERLAND
PLATEAU AND ADJACENT VALLEY AREAS. TEMPS HAVE QUICKLY WARMED INTO THE
UPPER 70S OVER NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA...WHERE THE AIR MASS HAS
BECOME MARGINALLY UNSTABLE. AS A RESULT...EXPECT SOME TSTORMS TO
DEVELOP LATER THIS AFTERNOON AS THE COLD FRONT SLOWLY MOVES THROUGH
THESE AREAS. AFTER THIS COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA
TONIGHT...COOLER AND DRIER AIR WILL THEN SETTLE INTO THE TN RIVER
VALLEY FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS...RESULTING IN TRANQUIL CONDITIONS.
AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS PROGGED TO SWING ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY
ON FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING...BUT THE MODELS AGREE THAT MOISTURE
WILL BE LIMITED WITH NO PRECIP EXPECTED. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT
WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODEL FORECASTS NOT TOO 
DISSIMILAR WITH THE WEEKEND THROUGH MID WEEK WEATHER. BASICALLY AN 
UPPER TROUGH DROPS SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN QUADRANT OF THE 
NATION ABOUT SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY. THE ASSOCIATED MODELING WITH 
THIS FEATURE INDICATES A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BUILD SOUTH INTO 
THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN PARTS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. 
MOISTURE AND LIFT NOT IMPRESSIVE WITH THIS SCENARIO. PROBABILITY 
QUITE LOW FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF SHOWERS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE IN THE VICINITY OF THE WEAK BOUNDARY SO DID 
NOT INCLUDE IN THE EARLY PORTION OF THE EXTENDED PREFERRING TO STAY 
WITH A DRY FORECAST. FOLLOWING THE DEPARTURE OF THIS UPPER TROUGH IS 
AN AMPLIFYING RIDGE WHICH SHOULD ALLOW FOR A FAIR AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE 
ALONG WITH NEAR TO ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES INTO MID WEEK.
&&

364 
FXUS64 KMRX 301335
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
935 AM EDT WED APR 30 2014

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND CUMBERLAND MOUNTAINS...WITH A WARM AND
MOIST AIR MASS STILL LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AREA RADARS
REVEAL ONLY SCATTERED SHOWERS OCCURRING ALONG THIS COLD FRONT THIS
MORNING...BUT ADDITIONAL CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP
THIS AFTERNOON AS THE AIR MASS BECOMES MARGINALLY (TO POSSIBLY
MODERATELY) UNSTABLE AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. RAINFALL AMOUNTS
HAVE NOT BEEN AS HIGH AS EXPECTED THE LAST FEW DAYS (ESPECIALLY
OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN)...AND ONLY AN ADDITIONAL
QUARTER TO HALF OF AN INCH IS EXPECTED TODAY (BUT ISOLATED AMOUNTS
UP TO AN INCH OR TWO WILL STILL BE POSSIBLE WITH A FEW STORMS).
THUS...WILL PLAN TO CANCEL THE FLOOD WATCH EARLY. IN ADDITION...
WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK TO MENTION THE
POSSIBILITY OF A FEW SEVERE STORMS OVER NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST
VA THIS AFTERNOON...WHERE THE POTENTIAL FOR A MODERATELY UNSTABLE
AIR MASS EXISTS BEFORE THE COLD FRONT IS ABLE TO PASS COMPLETELY
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA.

523 
FXUS64 KMRX 300726
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
326 AM EDT WED APR 30 2014

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
A COLD FRONT WILL SLOWLY ADVANCE TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. AHEAD OF THIS BOUNDARY...A BROAD AREA
OF MODERATE TO LOCALLY HEAVY SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS HAS BEGUN TO
MOVE NORTH AND EAST ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. THIS ACTIVITY
WILL CONTINUE TO OVERSPREAD THE AREA THROUGHOUT THE EARLY MORNING
HOURS AND INTO THE DAY TODAY. GIVEN THE MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER IN
PLACE ACROSS THE REGION...THE POTENTIAL FOR LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL
AND FLOODING WILL INCREASE THIS MORNING AND PERSIST THROUGH THE
AFTERNOON HOURS. AN ADDITIONAL 1 TO 2 INCHES OF RAINFALL IS LIKELY
ACROSS MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA...WITH SOME LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS
ALONG THE MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. THUS...HAVE OPTED
TO EXTEND THE FLOOD WATCH UNTIL 20Z. THEREAFTER...MUCH OF THE
LOCALLY HEAVIER PRECIPITATION SHOULD SHIFT OFF TO THE EAST WITH
THE FRONT AND WITH IT THE BEST RAIN CHANCES AS WELL. SOME LINGERING
LIGHT PRECIPITATION WILL STILL BE POSSIBLE TONIGHT ALONG THE
MOUNTAINS...BUT SOME THINNING OF THE CLOUDS AND PARTIAL CLEARING
SHOULD TAKE PLACE OVER MOST OF THE VALLEY BY 12Z THURSDAY. WITH THE
COOLER AIR MOVING IN...LOWS WILL BE MUCH COOLER TONIGHT AND BOTTOM
OUT IN THE MID 40S TO AROUND 50 DEGREES IN MOST SPOTS.

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...
UPPER LOW AND TROUGH STILL A 
WEATHER FACTOR EARLY IN THE LONG TERM...ALTHOUGH COVERAGE LOOKS TO 
BE LIMITED AND MAINLY SHOWERS. LIMITED RAIN CHANCES FRIDAY TO JUST 
THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. 00Z GFSX MOS POPS TRENDING DOWN TO 
SLIGHTLY BELOW CLIMO BY SATURDAY AND THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS SHOULD BE 
EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA. I KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN FOR NOW ON 
SATURDAY FOR SW VA AND THE FAR NE TN COUNTIES...BUT THESE MAY BE 
DROPPED BY LATER SHIFT. 

RISING HEIGHTS AND WARMING TEMPS FOR SUNDAY INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK... 
REALLY NOT SUPPORTIVE OF ANY POPS AT ALL. THUS...WENT AHEAD AND 
REMOVED OUR RAIN CHANCES FOR SUNDAY. GFSX 12Z AND 00Z MOS TEMPS 
GENERALLY CLOSE...BUT TRENDING SLIGHTLY WARMER FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK.  
MINOR ADJUSTMENTS MADE TO BE CLOSER TO 00Z GFSX MOS BUT STILL WITHIN 
TOLERANCE WITH NEIGHBORING NWS GRIDS.

.DISCUSSION...
THE COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE MOVING WEST THROUGH TENNESSEE THROUGH

PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS...SO ADJUSTED PRECIP TIMING AND RAINFALL
AMOUNTS. ENVIRONMENT JUST NOT SUPPORTIVE OF ANYTHING SEVERE
DEVELOPING TONIGHT...SO WILL SEE MOSTLY SHOWERS WITH OCCASSIONAL
THUNDER. OTHERWISE...THE REST OF THE FORECAST LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK
FOR TONIGHT AN EARLY TOMORROW. MODELS STILL SHOW PRECIP STILL
LINGERING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY.

087 
FXUS64 KMRX 291911
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT TUE APR 29 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...WEAK COLD FRONT ACROSS MIDDLE 
TENNESSEE CONTINUES TO CRAWL SLOWLY EAST.  STILL APPEARS THE NEXT 
ROUND OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL MOVE INTO OUR AREA THIS 
EVENING.  BEST INSTABILITY/LOW LEVEL WIND SHEAR AND JET DYNAMICS 
SHOULD BE COME TOGETHER DURING THE EVENING HOURS...AND ANOTHER ROUND 
OF STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS IS EXPECTED. VERTICAL PROFILES 
INDICATE DAMAGING WIND AND HAIL AS THE PRIMARY THREATS...ALTHOUGH 
THERE IS STILL AN ISOLATED TORNADO THREAT.  SOME HEAVY RAIN STILL 
EXPECTED AND THERE MAY BE AT LEAST LOCALIZED FLOODING...ALTHOUGH THE 
THREAT OF WIDESPREAD EXCESSIVE RAINFALL APPEARS TO HAVE LESSENED A 
BIT.  WILL CONTINUE THE FLOOD WATCH...BUT WILL NOT EXTEND INTO 
WEDNESDAY AT THIS POINT.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...THE ATMOSPHERIC 
PATTERN WILL BE RATHER SLOW TO CHANGE FOR THE FIRST SEVERAL DAYS OF 
THE EXTENDED FORECAST. THE OFFENDING MIDWESTERN UPPER LOW WILL MOVE 
SO SLOWLY AWAY TO THE NORTHEAST THAT IT WILL CONTINUE TO AFFECT THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. MEDIUM TO HIGH CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS 
WILL CONTINUE FOR MUCH OF THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THEN THERE 
WILL BE A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS MAINLY NORTH OF INTERSTATE 40 
DURING THE DAY THURSDAY AS A WEAK SHORT WAVE SWINGS NORTHEAST AROUND 
THE UPPER LEVEL LOW. EVEN AS THE THIS LOW DEPARTS ACROSS THE EASTERN 
GREAT LAKES...ENOUGH SHORT WAVELENGTH ENERGY WILL BE BUILDING INTO 
THE EASTERN U.S. FOR THE FORMATION OF A SEMI-PERMANENT LONG WAVE 
TROUGH. THIS COULD LEAD TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF SHOWERS ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA BUT PROBABILITY TOO LOW FOR MUCH MORE THAN A SLIGHT 
CHANCE MAINLY ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE ALL 
THE WAY THROUGH SUNDAY. BY MONDAY AND TUESDAY HIGHER PRESSURES MAY 
HAVE DEVELOPED ACROSS ENOUGH OF THE EASTERN U.S. FOR IMPROVED 
WEATHER CONDITIONS FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. THE COOLER WEATHER 
IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW PATTERN WILL GRADUALLY BE REPLACED BY WARMER  
CONDITIONS SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 291431
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1031 AM EDT TUE APR 29 2014

.DISCUSSION...WEAKENING BAND OF SHOWERS OVER EASTERN COUNTIES IS
SHIFTING SLOWLY EAST. THERE WILL BE A BREAK IN THE PRECIPITATION
FOR A SIGNIFICANT PORTION OF TODAY. HOW MUCH DESTABILIZATION WILL
OCCUR STILL SOMEWHAT UNCERTAIN...BUT APPEARS SOME SUN WILL BREAK
THROUGH ALLOWING INSTABILITY TO INCREASE THIS AFTERNOON. WITH COLD
FRONT SLOWLY APPROACHING AND YET ANOTHER UPPER IMPULSE WILL COMBINE
TO INCREASE CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS LATER THIS
AFTERNOON INTO TONIGHT. ASSUMING THE INSTABILITY MATERIALIZES AS
EXPECTED...APPEARS IT WILL BE FAVORABLE ONCE AGAIN FOR SEVERE
THUNDERSTORMS...WITH DAMAGING WINDS...HAIL...AND ISOLATED TORNADOES
POSSIBLE. HEAVY RAIN THREAT MORE ISOLATED TODAY GIVEN LOWER
COVERAGE OF STORMS...BUT INCREASES AGAIN TONIGHT. WILL KEEP FLOOD
WATCH AS IS FOR NOW. MAIN CHANGES TO THE FORECAST WITH THIS UPDATE
WILL BE TO LOWER POPS AND TWEAK TEMPS...DEW POINTS...WINDS...AND
SKY.

603 
FXUS64 KMRX 290951 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
551 AM EDT TUE APR 29 2014

.DISCUSSION...
BASED ON CURRENT OBS/TRENDS...HAVE CANCELLED THE TORNADO WATCH FOR
EAST TENNESSEE EARLY THIS MORNING...AS STORMS HAVE FIZZLED AS THE
ATMOSPHERE HAS STABLIZED FROM THE PREVIOUS CONVECTION EARLIER IN
THE NIGHT. HOWEVER...A RISK FOR STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS WILL
EXIST LATER THIS AFTERNOON/EVENING AND TONIGHT AS A COLD FRONT
TRACKS TOWARD THE REGION FROM THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.

UNCERTAINTY REMAINS ON HOW MUCH THE ATMOSPHERE WILL DESTABILIZE
LATER ON. THIS WILL LIKELY BE DEPENDENT ON HOW LONG THE CLOUD
COVER AND LINGERING PRECIPITATION FROM THE PREVIOUS NIGHT PERSISTS
THROUGHOUT THE DAY. HOWEVER...MODELS INDICATE A BREAK IN THE CLOUDS
AND SOME CLEARING /ESPECIALLY  ALONG THE PLATEAU AND THE SOUTHERN
AND CENTRAL VALLEYS BY MIDDAY AND INTO THE AFTERNOON WHICH WOULD
ALLOW FOR SOME HEATING TO TAKE PLACE. AS A RESULT...SOME
DESTABLIZATION WOULD OCCUR /AND COMBINED WITH THE STRONG WIND
SHEAR/...LEAD TO ORGANIZED  STRONG/SEVERE CONVECTION ALONG THE
FRONT. THE STORM MODE WOULD BE VERY SIMILAR TO TODAY...WITH BAND OF
SUPERCELLS...AND PREHAPS SOME MORE LINEAR BOWING SEGMENTS PROMOTING
A LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WIND THREAT. HOWEVER...THE MOIST BOUNDARY
LAYER/HIGH DEWPOINTS/LOW LCL HEIGHTS...STRONG 0-1 KM SHEAR...HIGHER
HELICITY VALUES AND EXISTING RESIDUAL OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES WILL ALSO
HELP TO INCREASE A TORNADO POTENTIAL WITHIN THE STRONGEST ACTIVITY
/ESPECIALLY ALONG THE SOUTHERN VALLEY AND SW NORTH CAROLINA/. IN
ADDITION TO THE SEVERE WEATHER POTENTIAL... LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL
AND THUS A THREAT OF FLODD/FLASH FLOODING WILL PERSIST THROUGHOUT
THE DAY AND NIGHT...AND POTENTIALLY INTO THE DAY ON WEDNESDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             80  59  76  49 /  70  90  60  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  77  60  75  49 /  70 100  80  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       80  58  75  49 /  70  90  70  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              74  56  74  50 /  80  90  90  30 

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 AM EDT TUE APR 29 2014

.SHORT TERM /TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
A SEVERE WEATHER OUTBREAK CONTINUES EARLY THIS MORNING ACROSS THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION...WITH THE
POTENTIAL FOR TORNADOES...LARGE HAIL...DAMAGING HAIL AND LOCALLY
HEAVY RAINFALL. AS OF 2:30 AM EDT...SCATTERED STRONG STORMS
CONTINUE TO TRACK ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE...WITH ADDITIONAL TORNADIC
STORMS STILL IN PROGRESS ACROSS NORTHEAST ALABAMA. CURRENT OBS AT
KCHA INDICATE A STILL MOIST AND UNSTABLE ENVIRONMENT FAVORABLE FOR
SUSTAINMENT OF THESE STORMS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN/CENTRAL VALLEY AS
THEY TRACK NORTHEAST. AS A RESULT...HAVE EXPANDED THE TORNADO WATCH
SOUTH TO THE GA BORDER TO INCLUDE THE CHATTANOOGA METRO AREA. THIS
WATCH IS IN EFFECT ALONG THE CENTRAL VALLEY AND THE SMOKY MTNS AND
THEIR SURROUNDING FOOTHILLS THRU 11Z. MOST OF THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD
WANE BEFORE THEN...BUT SOME LOCALLY SEVERE /POSSIBLY TORNANIC/
STORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE UNTIL DAYBREAK GIVEN THE AFOREMENTIONED
ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS.

AFTER A BRIEF LULL DURING THE MORNING HOURS...ANOTHER ROUND OF
STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE ACROSS MUCH OF THE
FORECAST AREA DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. HOWEVER...THE
PRIMARY THREAT WITH THIS NEXT ROUND OF ACTIVITY WILL BE LOCALLY
HEAVY RAINFALL AND FLOODING GIVEN THE STORM TOTAL FORECAST OF
BETWEEN 2 TO 4 INCHES ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. GIVEN THIS
/ALONG WITH THE FACT THAT SOME OF THE HEAVIEST PRECIPITATION
OCCURRED ACROSS PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA/...OPTED EXPAND THE FLOOD WATCH TO THE ENTIRE AREA THROUGH
12Z WEDNESDAY...THOUGH IT MAY NEED TO BE EXPANDED LATER ON THE DAY
SHIFT DEPENDING ON THE LATEST MODEL TRENDS. THIS ACTIVITY WILL BE
HEAVIEST FROM THE AFTERNOON THROUGH THE OVERNIGHT PERIOD
TONIGHT...BEFORE TAPERING OFF FROM WEST TO EAST ON WEDNESDAY. 

.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY/...
A FEW SHOWERS WILL LINGER INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND TO A LESSER
EXTENT THURSDAY AS THE UPPER LOW CONTINUES TO DROP INTO THE REGION.
THE TROUGH AXIS SLIDES IN ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY WHICH WILL KEEP A
SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS OVER NORTHERN LOCATIONS. AN UPPER RIDGE
BUILDS IN EARLY NEXT WEEK FOR A RETURN TO DRY CONDITIONS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             80  59  76  49 /  70  90  60  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  77  60  75  49 /  70 100  80  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       80  58  75  49 /  70  90  70  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              74  56  74  50 /  80  90  90  30

     SMOKY MOUNTAINS-EAST POLK-GRAINGER-HAMBLEN-HAMILTON-HANCOCK-

     COCKE-NORTHWEST GREENE-NORTHWEST MONROE-RHEA-ROANE-SCOTT TN-

FXUS64 KMRX 282350
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
750 PM EDT MON APR 28 2014

.AVIATION...AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT...THE AIR MASS OVER 
THE TAF SITES HAS DESTABILIZED WITH SIGNIFICANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE.  
THIS HAS ALLOWED SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP AND MOVE INTO 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION.  MULTIPLE LINES OF CONVECTION ARE 
EXPECTED THROUGH THE TAF PERIOD...SOME OF WHICH WILL LIKELY EFFECT 
TAF SITES.  ADDITIONALLY...SOME OF THESE STORMS MAY BECOME STRONG TO 
SEVERE CREATING STRONG AND GUSTY WINDS. 
 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...FLOOD WATCH FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING FOR 
     CHEROKEE-CLAY.

TN...FLOOD WATCH FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING FOR 
     ANDERSON-BLEDSOE-BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS-BRADLEY-COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS-EAST POLK-HAMILTON-JEFFERSON-KNOX-LOUDON-MARION-
     MCMINN-MEIGS-MORGAN-NW BLOUNT-NORTH SEVIER-NORTHWEST COCKE-
     NORTHWEST MONROE-RHEA-ROANE-SEQUATCHIE-SEVIER SMOKY

830 
FXUS64 KMRX 281910
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT MON APR 28 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...RADAR SHOWS A GOOD DEAL OF 
STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS OVER THE PLATEAU WITH AN OUTFLOW 
BOUNDARY OVER SOUTHERN MIDDLE TENNESSEE. THIS BOUNDARY WILL LIKELY 
BE AN IMPORTANT PART OF THE SEVERE WEATHER OUTBREAK FOR THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW FAVORABLE BOUYANCY 
AND SHEAR OVER THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN VALLEY LATE TODAY FOR SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORMS. HODOGRAPH SHOWS FAVORABLE SHEAR FOR TORNADIC 
DEVELOPMENT. ALREADY HAVE SIGNIFICANT TORNADO PARAMETER VALUES OF 2 
TO 3 OVER NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI AND NORTHERN ALABAMA.

WILL NEED WATCH FOR SUPERCELL DEVELOPMENT OVER THESE AREAS THIS 
AFTERNOON...THEN MOVE EAST NORTHEAST INTO THE PLATEAU/SOUTHEAST 
TENNESSEE LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. EVENTUALLY...THESE STORMS 
WILL COME TOGETHER AS A SQUALL LINE WITH DAMAGING WINDS A CONCERN 
FOR A GOOD PART OF THE AREA THIS EVENING/OVERNIGHT.

A SQUALL LINE WILL DEVELOP THIS EVENING THEN MOVE ACROSS THE ENTIRE 
FORECAST AREA WITH THE MAIN CONCERN BEING DAMAGING WITH ISOLATED 
TORNADO.

A BREAK IN THE CONVECTION IS EXPECTED FROM MID-MORNING THROUGH MID-
AFTERNOON...BUT ANOTHER JET WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING TUESDAY. ANOTHER ROUND OF 
THUNDERSTORMS...SOME LIKELY SEVERE. AGAIN MAIN THREAT DAMAGING 
WINDS...ISOLATED TORNADO AND HAIL.

HIGH PWS WILL PRODUCE A POTENTIAL OF HEAVY RAINFALL AND FLASH 
FLOODING AS WELL. HAVE ISSUED A WIND ADVISORY FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN 
DUE TO THE STRONG BOUNDARY LAYER JET DEVELOPING THIS 
EVENING/OVERNIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...THE SLOW MOVING
UPPER LOW TO OUR NORTHWEST WILL CONTINUE TO AFFECT THE REGION FOR
THE BEGINNING OF THE SHORT TERM PERIOD. THE ROUND OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS THAT BEGINS LATER TUESDAY AFTERNOON WILL CONTINUE
INTO TUESDAY NIGHT...WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME SEVERE STORMS
CONTINUING PAST SUNSET. HEAVY RAINFALL ALSO A THREAT TUESDAY
NIGHT...AND THE FLOOD WATCH CONTINUES FOR ALL BUT NORTHEAST ZONES.
SHOWERS AND PERHAPS SOME THUNDER LIKELY TO LINGER INTO WEDNESDAY
ESPECIALLY EASTERN ZONES...WITH SOME DRYING WORKING IN WEDNESDAY
NIGHT AND ESPECIALLY THURSDAY. WITH A BROAD AND LOW AMPLITUDE UPPER
TROUGH OVER THE EAST WE MAY SEE SHORT WAVE ENERGY BRING SOME
SHOWERS SOMETIME IN THE LATTER PART OF THE PERIOD...BUT MODELS
HAVING CONSISTENCY/AGREEMENT PROBLEMS CONCERNING TIMING. FOR NOW
WILL CARRY LOW POPS FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...BUT CONFIDENCE LOW AT
THIS POINT CONCERNING PRECIP POTENTIAL.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.DISCUSSION...OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD. MADE SOME
MINOR CHANGES TO CLOUDS AND POPS.

190 
FXUS64 KMRX 281142
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
742 AM EDT MON APR 28 2014

.AVIATION...THREAT OF TSRA AT TAF SITES FOR TODAY APPEARS TO BE 
INCREASING AS STRONG CONVECTION CONTINUES TO DEVELOP ACROSS MIDDLE 
TN. ALSO SEEING SOME LINGERING ACTIVITY NEAR WARM FRONT OVER NE TN 
AS WELL AS A LINE OF NEW CONVECTION ALONG EASTERN PARTS OF PLATEAU.

OTHERWISE...STRONG TO SEVERE TSRA ALMOST A SURE BET AFTER 29/00Z SO 
FELT IT WAS PRUDENT TO CARRY TSRA IN CHA AND TYS TAFS ALREADY.

...PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...QUITE A CHANGE FROM THE DRY 
APRIL PATTERN GETS UNDERWAY TODAY...WITH A PROLONGED WET PERIOD A 
FULL DAY BEYOND THE SHORT TERM. WARM FRONT DRAPED ACROSS NE TN IS A 
FOCUS FOR SCATTERED SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS EARLY THIS 
MORNING. FURTHER WEST CLOSER TO THE LARGE UPPER LOW IN THE CENTRAL 
PLAINS...MORE ROBUST CONVECTION CONTINUES TO DEVELOP OVER WRN KY AND 
MIDDLE TN THIS MORNING. MOIST AND UNSTABLE OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
TODAY...WITH MOS POPS AND NEIGHBORING NWS POP GRIDS GENERALLY HIGHER 
THAN OUR POP GRIDS...SO NUDGED POPS UP TO 60 TO 70 PERCENT FOR TODAY.

LITTLE CHANGES FOR TONIGHT...AS A ROUND OF STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS 
STILL LOOKS LIKELY WITH THE HEAVIEST RAINS EXPECTED FROM 00Z TO
12Z TUESDAY. MINOR TWEAKS MADE TO POP AND WEATHER GRIDS FOR TUESDAY
AFTERNOON WITH BOTH GFS AND NAM SHOWING A DRY SLOT WORKING IN...SO
LOWERED POPS TO REFLECT THIS IN THE 18Z TO 00Z GRIDS.
HOWEVER...THIS DRYING IS VERY BRIEF AS NEW CONVECTION IS SHOWN TO
QUICKLY FIRE ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND MOVE EAST INTO THE
FORECAST AREA LATE TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. HOWEVER...QPF
DOES LOOK TO DROP OFF A GOOD BIT.

MAX TEMPS TRICKY GIVEN VERY WARM 07Z VALUES TODAY...THEN THE DRY 
SLOT COULD LET TEMPS REBOUND INTO THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S TUESDAY 
AFTERNOON. A BLEND OF SIMILAR MOS MINS WAS CLOSELY FOLLOWED.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...AS NEW CONVECTION
DEVELOPS OR MOVES EAST FROM AREAS TO THE WEST AND SOUTHWEST AHEAD
OF COLD FRONT STRONG WINDS ALOFT AND SHEAR WILL BE ENOUGH FOR
POSSIBLE TORNADOES AND DAMAGING WINDS AS THE STORMS DEVELOP INTO
LINES THROUGH THE EVENING...SEE SPC DAY2 OUTLOOK. THE COLD FRONT
WILL MOST LIKELY BE APPROACHING THE PLATEAU AT 00Z AND A POSSIBLE
SECONDARY LOW ALONG THE FRONT IN NORTHERN AL WHICH COULD SLOW ITS
PROGRESS. HEAVY RAINFALL THREAT WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE NIGHT
ACROSS SOUTHERN AND EASTERN SECTIONS. LOWS STAY MILD IN THE UPPER
50S TO LOWER 60S. WEDNESDAY SLOW MOVING PARENT LOW OVER WESTERN
GREAT LAKES AND UPPER LOW MOVE LITTLE NEXT 24 HOURS. HOWEVER COLD
FRONT WILL FINALLY MOVE EAST INTO NORTH CAROLINA DURING THE DAY
WEDNESDAY. KEPT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS IN WEDNESDAY WITH SOME
POSSIBLE HEAVY RAIN IN THE MORNING WITH A FEW STRONG STORMS. THEN
THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY SHORTWAVE IMPULSES MOVING AROUND UPPER
LOW WILL BRING MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES TO NORTHERN SECTIONS AND A
CHANCE OF SHOWERS WITH PARTLY CLOUDY SOUTH. UPPER LOW FINALLY MOVES
FARTHER EAST LATE SATURDAY WITH RIDGING FROM THE WEST MOVING IN
SUNDAY FOR MOSTLY SUNNY AND SLIGHTLY WARMER. TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY
WILL BE TEMPERED BY CLOUDS AND SHOWERS BUT CLEARING SKIES FROM THE
WEST SHOULD ALLOW HIGHS TO REACH THE MID 70S LATE IN THE DAY.
BEHIND FRONT TEMPERATURES ONLY WARM TO THE 60S THROUGH SATURDAY
WITH LOWS MOSTLY 40S. TEMPERATURES WARM A LITTLE SUNDAY AS UPPER
TROUGH SHIFTS EAST. MAY EXTEND FLOOD WATCH IN TIME WEDNESDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             81  63  81  61 /  70 100  70  80 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  80  64  79  62 /  60 100  80  80 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       79  63  79  60 /  60 100  80  70 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              78  59  75  57 /  60  90  90  90 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...FLOOD WATCH FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING FOR 
     CHEROKEE-CLAY.

TN...FLOOD WATCH FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING FOR 
     ANDERSON-BLEDSOE-BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS-BRADLEY-COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS-EAST POLK-HAMILTON-JEFFERSON-KNOX-LOUDON-MARION-
     MCMINN-MEIGS-MORGAN-NW BLOUNT-NORTH SEVIER-NORTHWEST COCKE-
     NORTHWEST MONROE-RHEA-ROANE-SEQUATCHIE-SEVIER SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS-SOUTHEAST MONROE-WEST POLK.

SUNDAY FOR MOSTLY SUNNY AND SLIGHTLY WARMER. TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY
WILL BE TEMPERED BY CLOUDS AND SHOWERS BUT CLEARING SKIES FROM THE
WEST SHOULD ALLOW HIGHS TO REACH THE MID 70S LATE IN THE DAY.
BEHIND FRONT TEMPERATURES ONLY WARM TO THE 60S THROUGH SATURDAY
WITH LOWS MOSTLY 40S. TEMPERATURES WARM A LITTLE SUNDAY AS UPPER
TROUGH SHIFTS EAST. MAY EXTEND FLOOD WATCH IN TIME WEDNESDAY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EDT SUN APR 27 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...A WARM FRONT WILL MOVE NORTH 
THROUGH MUCH OF THE TN VALLEY TONIGHT. CONVECTION ALONG THE FRONT 
WILL WEAKEN AS IT MOVES NE TONIGHT. DEBRIS CLOUDS IN THE UPPER SW 
STEERING FLOW WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA. WARM TEMERATURES OVERNIGHT. 
MOS POP GUIDANCE FOR MONDAY FAIRLY HIGH AVERAGING NEAR 70. BETTER 
MOISTURE IN PLACE AND SOME INSTABILITY PROGGED BUT FORCING SEEMS TO 
BE LACKING FOR MOST OF THE DAY. DOWNSLOPING WINDS WILL ALSO 
CONTRIBUTE TO LOWER PRECIPITATION CHANCES ACROSS NE AREAS. SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORMS ON TAP FOR MONDAY. THIS ACTIVITY WILL LIKELY ADVANCE 
INTO THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU IN THE LATE AFTERNOON HOURS. 
 
.LONG TERM /MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY/...THE VIGOROUS UPPER LOW 
OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS WILL WREAK HAVOC OVER TENNESSEE...PARTS OF 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA STARTING MONDAY 
NIGHT. FIRST BRINGING CHANCES OF SEVERE WEATHER IN THE FORM OF 
DAMAGING WINDS AND ISOLATED TORNADOES POSSIBLE. LOOK FOR THE INITIAL 
THREAT TO BEGIN CLOSE TO 6PM EDT AND PERSIST INTO THE OVERNIGHT 
HOURS GENERALLY FOR THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN TN VALLEY AND PLATEAU 
AREAS. THIS IS WHERE THE MODELS INDICATE A STRONG SOUTHERLY LOW 
LEVEL JET AND CONVERGENCE...ALONG WITH STRONG UPPER LEVEL WINDS. 
THIS SHOULD INCREASE THE LIFT OVER THE FORECAST AREA AND ALLOW FOR A 
STRONG LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP IN THE EARLY EVENING HOURS 
MONDAY. ADDITIONALLY VERY HEAVY RAINFALL IS EXPECTED OVERNIGHT. 
THERE WILL LIKELY BE A LULL IN ACTIVITY BEFORE ADDITIONAL SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS REDEVELOP ON TUESDAY. THIS RAINFALL WILL ONLY 
EXACERBATE ANY FLOODING PROBLEMS THAT OCCURRED EARLIER FROM THE 
HEAVY RAINS. THUS A FLOOD WATCH HAS BEEN ISSUED MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING.

THE PESKY UPPER LOW WILL SLOWLY MEANDER INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION 
LATE WEDNESDAY. THIS WILL PROLONG THE EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF THE 
COLD FRONT ALLOWING FOR MORE SHOWERS TO DUMP ADDITIONAL RAINFALL 
TUESDAY NIGHT. THE MAJORITY OF THE HEAVY RAIN WILL COME TO AN END 
WEDNESDAY FOR THE AREAS THAT RECEIVED THE HEAVIEST RAIN EARLIER. THE 
MOUNTAINS AND NORTHERN AREAS OF THE FORECAST AREA WILL SEE LINGERING 
RAIN CHANCES INTO NEXT WEEKEND. 

LOOK FOR NEAR SEASONAL TEMPERATURES ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. WITH 
THE UPPER LOW OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION AND NORTHWEST FLOW 
ALOFT...LOOK FOR BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES TO PERSIST INTO NEXT 
WEEKEND.

224 
FXUS64 KMRX 270839
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
439 AM EDT SUN APR 27 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEATHER PATTERN CHANGES
TODAY AS HIGH PRESSURE GIVES WAY TO INCREASING MOISTURE AND
INSTABILITY...AHEAD OF THE LARGE AND SLOW MOVING AREA OF LOW
PRESSURE OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS. HOWEVER...MOS POPS (CERTAINLY
NAM) SEEM A BIT HIGH FOR TODAY. NUDGED POPS UP FOR ALL BUT FAR NE
TN AND SW VA CLOSE TO A BLEND OF THE NAM AND GFS MOS POPS. THIS
CONVECTION SHOULD BE MOSTLY DIURNAL AND TAPER OFF AFTER THE EARLY
EVENING HOURS. RAIN CHANCES SHOULD THEN INCREASE FOR AT LEAST
PLATEAU AND SE TN AREAS LATE TONIGHT...AS A SHORTWAVE MOVES ACROSS
THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.

LOWERED MAX TEMPS SLIGHTLY CLOSER TO THE GFS MOS FOR TODAY GIVEN THE 
INCREASING CLOUDS AND MOISTURE. QUITE MILD TONIGHT...BUT JUST MINOR 
TWEAKS FROM PREVIOUS MIN TEMP GRID. 

THIS INITIAL BATCH OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WON'T PRODUCE ANY 
SIGNIFICANT RAINFALL AMOUNTS...AND NOT LIKELY TO REACH STRONG TO 
SEVERE LEVELS EITHER.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MOST IF NOT ALL OF THE
FORECAST AREA WILL LIE IN THE WARM SECTOR BETWEEN A COLD FRONT
MOVING INTO MO AND AR AND A QUASI STATIONARY BOUNDARY OR WARM
FRONT OVER THE NE SECTION OF THE FORECAST AREA EARLY MONDAY.
OVERNIGHT SHOWERS AND STORMS MOVING INTO MIDDLE TN LATE TONIGHT AND
EARLY MONDAY WILL LIKELY BE DECREASING IN INTENSITY AS THEY MOVE
INTO MORE STABLE AIR OVER EAST TN. SO SHOWERS OR STORMS MAY BE
AFFECTING WESTERN SECTIONS EARLY MONDAY. THEN THERE MAY BE A LULL
UNTIL CLOUDS BREAK UP SOME AND DAYTIME HEATING CAUSES REDEVELOPMENT
FROM OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES AND SHORTWAVE ENERGY ROTATING AROUND
INTENSE LOW PRESSURE AREA OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS. 

MORE SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY SHOULD DEVELOP DURING THE
DAY TO THE WEST AND SOUTHWEST OF THE FORECAST AREA AS DEEP
MOISTURE FLOWS IN WITH THE STRONG SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST FLOW AND
DAYTIME HEATING. STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS ARE EXPECTED TO DEVELOP
OR MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA FROM THE WEST AND SOUTHWEST MONDAY
EVENING OR EARLY TUESDAY. HEAVY RAINFALL IS ALSO A THREAT
OVERNIGHT. INCREASED RAINFALL AMOUNTS MONDAY NIGHT TO OVER 2 INCHES
IN THE SOUTHWEST AND KEPT SEVERE WORDING AND HEAVY RAINFALL. MAY
NEED TO ISSUE A FLOOD WATCH DURING THE DAY TODAY FOR MONDAY NIGHT
INTO TUESDAYS RAINFALL.

ON TUESDAY THE SURFACE LOW OVER THE PLAINS AND MID MS VALLEY MOVES
EAST NORTHEAST INTO THE GREAT LAKES BY WEDNESDAY. ANOTHER ROUND OF
SHOWERS AND STORMS SHOULD OCCUR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. RAINFALL
AMOUNTS SHOULD BE LESS AND SEVERE THREAT IS EXPECTED TO BE FOCUSED
A LITTLE FARTHER SOUTH. THERE STILL COULD BE SOME SEVERE STORMS
TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING WITH THE FRONT STILL TO THE WEST. 
WEDNESDAY THE COLD FRONT IS EXPECTED TO MOVE THROUGH EARLY IN THE
MORNING SO THE RISK FOR MORE STORMS WILL BE LOWER. WINDS WILL
SHIFT TO THE WEST AND NORTHWEST. WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY
NIGHT THE LOW PRESSURE AREA REMAINS OVER THE GREAT LAKES AND UPPER
LOW AND TROUGH SHIFTS INTO THE EASTERN STATES. IMPULSES MOVING
AROUND THE UPPER LOW GIVE MORE CHANCES OF SHOWERS MAINLY ACROSS
NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE AREA AND COOLER TEMPERATURES. FRIDAY
THROUGH SATURDAY UPPER TROUGH BECOMES MORE PRONOUNCED WITH NW FLOW
ALOFT AND SOMEWHAT DRIER BUT STILL A CHANCE OF SHOWERS NORTH AND
NORTHEAST. TEMPERATURES MONDAY AND TUESDAY AHEAD OF THE FRONT WILL
STAY MOSTLY IN THE 70S TO LOWER 80S AND LOWS MONDAY NIGHT AND
TUESDAY NIGHT UPPER 50S TO MID 60S. WEDNESDAY TEMPERATURES WILL BE
COOLER AND THEN ONLY 60S FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. LOW TEMPERATURES DROP
TO THE 40S TO LOWER 50S THE LAST THREE MORNINGS.

&&

168 
FXUS64 KMRX 261932
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
317 PM EDT SAT APR 26 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE 
SLIDES SOUTHEAST OF THE AREA TONIGHT. A WARM FRONT WILL MOVE NORTH 
THROUGH THE AREA ON SUNDAY. UPPER RIDGE AXIS MOVES EAST OVER AREA 
TOMORROW. RISING UPPER HEIGHTS COUPLED WITH THE ADVANCING WARM FRONT 
WILL RESULT IN WIDESPREAD TEMPERATURES IN THE 80S. INCREASED 
SOUTHWEST FLOW IN THE LAYER WILL INCREASE PWAT VALUES TO NEAR 1.25 
ALONG SOUTHERN AND WESTERN PORTIONS OF MRX CWA. A VERY WEAK UPPER 
SHORT WAVE IS PROGGED TO MOVE NE INTO THE AREA BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON.  
SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS MAY DEVELOP ALONG OR ADVANCE INTO THE 
PLATEAU AND OR SOUTHERN MOUNTAINS AND VALLEY BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON. 

.LONG TERM /SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY/...NO MAJOR CHANGES TO 
FORECASTS FROM THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS CONCERNING THE MAJOR STORM 
SYSTEM THAT WILL BE AFFECTING THE REGION...STARTING LATE SUNDAY 
NIGHT...RAMPING-UP LATE MONDAY NIGHT AND INTO TUESDAY...THEN 
CONTINUING UNSETTLED THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD.  

WE CONTINUE TO BE EAST OF WHERE THE STRONGEST CONDITIONS COME 
TOGETHER OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS...BUT STILL WILL BE AFFECTED.  MAIN 
DIFFERENCE TODAY IS THAT DURING THE HEART OF THE EFFECTS...THE 
CHARACTER OF THE STORMS IS LOOKING A LITTLE LESS WET AND A LITTLE 
MORE SEVERE.  WE WILL BE ON THE TAIL-END OF THE SEVERE STORMS...THAT 
DEVELOP WEST OF THE MISS RIVER ON MONDAY AFTERNOON...AND MOVE INTO 
OUR AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT MONDAY NIGHT.  OVER THE LAST COUPLE OF DAYS 
IT HAD LOOKED MORE LIKE A FLOODING THREAT VERSUS A SEVERE 
THREAT...BUT MODELS ARE SHOWING MORE INSTABILITY NOW LATE MONDAY 
NIGHT AND TUESDAY MORNING...SUGGESTING A LITTLE MORE BALANCE...WITH 
SOME FLOODING POSSIBLE...BUT MORE OF A SEVERE STORM THREAT.

FOR TUESDAY MODELS NOT IN GREAT AGREEMENT DURING THE DAY...COULD BE 
LINGERING MODERATE RAINS OR RAINS COULD RACE EAST...BUT THERE WAS 
AGREEMENT THAT BY SUNSET MOST OF THE LEFT-OVER STORMS WILL BE EAST 
OF THE AREA.  THEN FOR TUESDAY NIGHT...IT DEPENDS ON HOW MUCH 
DEVELOPS IN WEST TN ALONG THE BOUNDARY...THAT COULD MOVE IN LATER IN 
THE NIGHT.  WILL PLAN ON STORMS COMING INTO THE AREA...INTO THE 
WESTERN AREAS BY LATE EVENING...AND INTO THE EAST AFTER MIDNIGHT.  

FOR WEDNESDAY...THE COLD FRONT STARTS TO SLIDE THROUGH THE 
AREA...LOOKING AT COOLER AIR ENTERING...BUT THE UPPER LOW MOVES 
LITTLE AND SEVERAL LITTLE WAVES OF LIFT AND ENERGY COME RACING 
THROUGH THE AREA...WILL KEEP SOME POPS IN FOR MUCH OF THE AREA 
THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST.

FOR TEMPS...CUT DOWN ON DIURNAL RANGE FOR MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY DUE 
TO LOW CLOUDS AS WELL AS WIND AT NIGHT.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
433 AM EDT SAT APR 26 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...VERY NICE WEATHER WILL CONTINUE 
COURTESY OF AN UPPER AND SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE. MOISTURE 
FROM FRIDAY RAINS HAS ALLOWED PATCHY AREAS OF FOG TO DEVELOP... 
MAINLY ALONG AND NORTH OF I-40 AND I-81 WHERE MORE WIDESPREAD RAINS 
OCCURRED. THIS FOG MAY DEVELOP AGAIN TONIGHT...BUT WILL WAIT BEFORE 
ADDING FOG JUST YET...SINCE A VERY WARM AND SUNNY DAY MAY DRY OUT 
THE BOUNDARY LAYER. 

OTHERWISE...SIMILAR MOS MAXES CLOSELY FOLLOWED WITH HIGH TEMPS 
TOPPING OUT ABOUT 5 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. FOR MINS TONIGHT...I 
FAVORED THE COOLER MOS WHERE WINDS STAY NEAR CALM...AND MILDER MOS 
WHERE A LIGHT SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST LOW LEVEL FLOW DEVELOPS LATE. 
CLOUDS NOT MUCH OF A FACTOR AS SKIES SHOULD REMAIN MOSTLY CLEAR AT 
LEAST INTO SUNDAY MORNING.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGING OVER
THE FORECAST AREA AND RISING HEIGHTS WILL MAKE FOR A VERY WARM DAY.
FOLLOWED CLOSE TO WARMER MAV NUMBERS. GFS SHOWS INCREASE IN HIGH
LEVEL MOISTURE AND SOME LOW LEVEL INCREASE AS WELL. SHORTWAVE
APPROACHES THE AREA DURING THE AFTERNOON AND MAY TRIGGER SOME
EVENING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AS AIR MASS BECOMES MODERATELY
UNSTABLE WITH STRONG HEATING. WELL DEVELOPED SYSTEM IN THE PLAINS
SUNDAY MOVES SLOWLY EAST REACHING THE MID MS VALLEY TUESDAY AND
WEAKENS SOMEWHAT. UPPER LOW ASSOCIATED WITH IT MOVES LITTLE OVER
THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. STILL LOOKS LIKE
BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL BE TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY. 
SEVERE THREAT AGAIN LOOKS TO BE LATE TUESDAY WITH BEST CHANCES
WESTERN SECTIONS. HEAVY RAINFALL AGAIN A THREAT WESTERN AREAS WITH
ONE TO THREE INCHES FROM TUESDAY MORNING TO WEDNESDAY MORNING AND
ONE INCH OR LESS EAST.

MILD TEMPERATURES AGAIN SUNDAY NIGHT WITH SOUTHERLY FLOW AND
INCREASING DEW POINTS. MONDAY AGAIN WARM WITH HIGHS 70S MOUNTAINS
AND UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S VALLEYS. HIGH TEMPERATURES COOLER
TUESDAY WITH CLOUDS AND WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION. HIGHEST QPF
TOTALS OR RAINFALL AMOUNTS TUESDAY NIGHT WITH THREAT FOR SEVERE
STORMS AND THEN THERE WILL BE BREAKS IN THE PRECIPITATION SOMETIME
WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY DEPENDING ON THE TRACK OF THE UPPER LOW
AND WRAP AROUND CLOUDINESS WITH IT...WITH BEST CHANCES OF SHOWERS
NORTHERN SECTIONS. IT WILL ALSO BE NOTICEABLY COOLER WEDNESDAY
THROUGH FRIDAY. HIGHS WILL BE MID 60S TO MID 70S AND LOWS THURSDAY
AND FRIDAY 40S TO LOWER 50S.

818 
FXUS64 KMRX 251936
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 PM EDT FRI APR 25 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...SHORT WAVE EXITING THE AREA 
TO THE EAST TONIGHT. DEEPEST CONVECTION HAS MOVED OFF TO THE EAST 
WITH POST FRONTAL SHOWERS ENDING EARLY THIS EVENING ACROSS NE AREAS. 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE MOVES INTO THE AREA SATURDAY AND CONTINUES 
EAST OF THE AREA ON SUNDAY. UPPER RIDGING BUILDS OVER THE AREA FROM 
THE WEST WITH RIDGE AXIS NORTH THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON 
SUNDAY. CONDITIONS SHOULD DRY OUT QUICKLY TONIGHT AND STAY DRY 
THROUGH THE PERIOD. THICKNESS HIEGHTS RISE WITH THE WARMING TREND. 
SUNDAYS HIGHS IN THE LOWER 80S MAY BE UNDERDONE.  

.LONG TERM /SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY/...NO SURPRISE THAT TIMING 
IS KIND OF IN FLUX WITH THE CUT-OFF LOW OVER THE PLAINS AND GREAT 
LAKES IN THIS PERIOD...AS THESE FEATURES TEND TO WOBBLE BOTH IN THE 
MODELS AND IN REAL-TIME. THE OVERALL PROGRESSION HAS SLOWED SINCE 
YESTERDAY'S MODELS...SO RATHER THAN THE HEART OF THE PRECIP BEING 
MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT IT IS NOW LOOKING MORE LIKE IT 
WILL BE TUESDAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...THEN TAPERING ON 
WEDNESDAY...STAY TUNED FOR FURTHER TIMING TWEAKS. 

SEVERE PARAMETERS LOOKING BETTER OVERALL FOR TUESDAY...BUT MAIN 
FOCUS IS STILL LOOKING LIKE IT IS WELL WEST OF OUR AREA ON 
TUESDAY...SO WITH THIS TIMING IT WOULD LIKELY BE DARK BEFORE A LINE 
OF STORMS WOULD MOVE INTO THE AREA.  BUT MODELS SEEM LIKE THEY WANT 
TO GET A PRETTY LARGE AREA OF PRECIP AHEAD OF THE MAIN SEVERE 
WEATHER AREA...SO LIKE YESTERDAY...STILL WONDERING THIS FAR EAST HOW 
MUCH INSTABILITY THERE WILL BE.  WILL BE WORTH WATCHING TO SEE IF 
LARGE AREA OF PRECIP DOES GET GENERATED AHEAD OF FRONT.  WITH 
PRESENT TIMING...WESTERN AREAS STAND A BETTER CHANCE OF SEVERE 
STORMS.

FOR HEAVY PRECIP...GFS PRECIPITABLE WATER FORECAST NOW EVEN HIGHER 
THAN YESTERDAY'S RUN...WITH 1.5 INCH PLUME MOVING INTO WESTERN CWA 
ABOUT 12Z TUESDAY AND LINGERING INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING...ALSO DEEP 
SATURATED WARM LAYER...AND LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE TRANSPORT MAXIMIZE 
OVER THE REGION DURING THIS SAME PERIOD. AT ANY RATE...TIMING MAY BE 
INCONSISTENT BETWEEN MODEL RUNS...BUT THE SCENARIO OF UP TO 12-18 
HOUR PERIOD OF HEAVY RAINS MAKING ITS WAY ACROSS THE AREA IS LOOKING 
PRETTY CONSISTENT IN THE MODELS.  ALTHOUGH THIS IS BEYOND OUR QPF 
TIME PERIOD...THINKING THAT 2-3 INCHES FOR PLATEAU AND SOUTHEAST 
TN...THEN MORE LIKE 1-2 INCHES IN THE UPPER PARTS OF THE VALLEY. 
 
WILL MENTION PERIODS OF HEAVY RAIN FOR TUESDAY TO GET THE WORD 
OUT...ALTHOUGH TIMING MAY NEED TO GET TWEAKED OVER THE NEXT FEW 
DAYS. FLY IN OINTMENT TO SQUELCH THIS POSSIBILITY WOULD BE A COMPLEX 
OF STORMS DEVELOPING SOUTH OF THE REGION THAT STEALS THE 
MOISTURE...THIS HAPPENED A COUPLE OF WEEKS AGO.  WITH ALL THIS IN 
MIND...WILL GO ON THE COOL SIDE OF GUIDANCE FOR THE TUESDAY MAX 
TEMP...AND WILL CONTINUE COOLER THAN GUIDANCE ON WEDNESDAY AS WELL.  
WILL RAISE DEWPOINTS DURING THIS TIME AND WILL MAKE VERY MILD MIN 
TEMP FOR MONDAY NIGHT / TUESDAY MORNING.

&&

WITH JUST MINOR TWEAKS.

NOT MUCH IN THE WAY OF COOLING THIS AFTERNOON AFTER FRONTAL PASSAGE

TEMPS.

FOR THE WEEKEND AS RIDGING ALOFT BUILDS OVER THE SOUTHEAST STATES
AND DEEP TROUGH DEVELOPS OVER THE WESTERN STATES. WARMING DAYTIME
TEMPERATURES WITH HIGHS MID 70S TO LOWER 80S SATURDAY AND MOSTLY
LOWER TO MID 80S SUNDAY. DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS OVER THE
WESTERN PLAINS. STRONG SOUTHERLY FLOW OUT AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM WILL
BEGIN TO INCREASE MOISTURE AND DEW POINTS OVER THE FORECAST AREA
SUNDAY. A CUT OFF LOW OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS WILL BE SLOW TO MOVE
EAST NORTHEAST ACROSS THE MS VALLEY AND INTO THE GREAT LAKES MONDAY
AND TUESDAY. A FEW SHOWERS COULD FORM AS EARLY AS LATE SUNDAY NIGHT
AND MONDAY WITH A FEW THUNDERSTORMS...BUT THE WEATHER SYSTEM WILL
STAY WEST OF THE AREA UNTIL LATE MONDAY NIGHT OR TUESDAY.
THUNDERSTORMS WILL BECOME MORE LIKELY TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY WITH
POSSIBLE HEAVY RAIN OR SEVERE STORMS TUESDAY. 

TEMPERATURES STAY WARM MONDAY AND TUESDAY BUT WILL COOL WEDNESDAY
AS FRONT MAKES ITS WAY EAST. SHOWERS LINGER WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND
THURSDAY IN THE COLDER AIR BEHIND THE SYSTEM. DUE TO ITS SLOW
MOVEMENT THE THREAT OF PRECIPITATION WILL BE POSSIBLE EVERY PERIOD
FROM MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY.

668 
FXUS64 KMRX 241915
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 PM EDT THU APR 24 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...STRENGTHENING SHORT WAVE WILL 
MOVE EAST ACROSS TN VALLEY TONIGHT. DEEPENING SURFACE LOW MOVES NE 
INTO THE W OH RIVER VALLEY BY FRIDAY MORNING. AIRMASS WILL MOISTEN 
UP OVERNIGHT WITH INCREASED SOUTHWESTERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW. 
INSTABILITY MEAGER BUT GOOD LIFT IN ADVANCE OF THE APPROACHING SHORT 
WAVE WILL RESULT IN CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT IN ADVANCE OF APPROACHING 
COLD FRONT. BEST CHANCE FOR STRONG CONVECTION AND ISOLATED 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE BETWEEN 25/09-25-15Z ACROSS MRX CWA. UPPER 
TROUGH AXIS...COLD FRONT...WIND SHIFT...WILL MOVE THROUGH SHORTLY 
AFTER 25/18Z. CONVECTION WILL TAPER OFF IN THE AFTERNOON HOURS. WARM 
TONIGHT WITH NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES ON FRIDAY WITH WEAK COLD OR 
NEUTRAL AIR ADVECTION BEHIND THE FRONT LATE. 

.LONG TERM /FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY/...THIS PERIOD WILL START 
OUT DRY AND QUIET...BUT WILL TURN MESSY FOR ITS SECOND HALF.  AT THE 
BEGINNING OF THIS PERIOD ON FRIDAY NIGHT...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IS 
BUILDING INTO THE AREA BEHIND A WEAK COLD FRONT.  SATURDAY LOOKS 
BEAUTIFUL...WITH SUNDAY BEGINING THE RETURN FLOW FROM THE GULF 
BRINGING WARMER AIR AND AND THE UPPER RIDGE OVERHEAD SHOULD MAKE FOR 
A WARM DAY. 

THE AFOREMENTIONED MESSINESS DEALS WITH THE CUT-OFF LOW THAT IS 
PROGGED TO HANG IN THE UPPER MISS VALLEY AND GREAT LAKES FOR SEVERAL 
DAYS...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED TROUGH HANGING IN OUR AREA.  WITH A CUT-
OFF LOW...TIMING OF SYSTEMS MOVING THROUGH COULD BE AN ADVENTURE.

ON MONDAY THE FIRST WAVE WILL BE MOVING IN...BUT THE SYSTEM WILL BE 
GETTING STRUNG OUT AS THE ANCHORING SURFACE LOW STAYS IN THE PLAINS 
AND ANY STORMS MOVING INTO OUR AREA FROM WEST/MIDDLE TN GET FARTHER 
AND FARTHER AWAY FROM THE DYNAMICS.  TUESDAY IS STARTING TO LOOK 
MORE AND MORE INTERESTING NOW...AS THE SYSTEM KICKS EAST...THE 
DYNAMICS WILL BE HEADING THIS WAY AS WELL...BUT MODELS LOOKING LIKE 
THEY WANT A LOT OF PRECIP WELL AHEAD OF THE FRONT AND THE 
DYNAMICS...SO IT MIGHT BE DIFFICULT TO GET GOOD HEATING DURING THE 
DAY...ALSO LOOKS LIKE TIMING MIGHT BE BETTER FOR WEST/MIDDLE TN 
DURING MAX HEATING AGAIN ON TUESDAY...AND THEN THE STORMS WOULD MOVE 
IN HERE TUESDAY EVENING OR NIGHT.  AT ANY RATE...FOR NOW OUR SEVERE 
THREATS LOOK PRETTY LIMITED THIS FAR EAST.  FOR PRECIP AMOUNTS...AIR 
MASS GETS HIGH MOISTURE WITH PRECIPITABLE WATER WITH VALUES >= 1.2 
INCHES FROM 06Z TUE THROUGH 06Z WED.  LOOKING LIKE WE MAY NEED TO 
KEEP AN EYE ON QPF MORE THAN SEVERE PARAMETERS AT THIS POINT.  WPC 
QPF FORECAST HAS HEAVIEST AXIS JUST SOUTH OF OUR CWA...WITH A "HOLE" 
IN THE 7 DAY QPF OVER MUCH OF MIDDLE AND EAST TN...BUT ENSEMBLES 
PROBABLILITIES HINT THAT THE AXIS COULD MOVE MORE DIRECTLY OVER OUR 
AREA.  EVEN THE AXIS AS IS COULD POSE SOME PROBLEMS IN OUR MORE-
PRONE HYDRO STREAMS AT SOUTH CHICAMAUGA CREEK NEAR KCHA AND THE 
RIVER STRETCHES NEAR NEWPORT.
 
THERE IS LOW CONFIDENCE ON TIMING DUE TO CUT-OFF LOW'S FICKLE 
MOVEMENT...WE WILL NEED TO KEEP WATCHING FOR CHANGES IN TIMING AND 
ALIGNMENT OF PARAMETERS AS TO WHETHER THIS SCENARIO HOLDS.

BY WEDNESDAY...LOOKS LIKE GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THE COLD FRONT WILL BE 
PAST US AND COOLER AIR WILL BY MOVING IN...BUT THE UPPER LOW IS 
FORECAST TO HANG IN THE GREAT LAKES AND SEND MOISTURE AND LIFT OVER 
US IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW.  LOOKS LIKE WE MIGHT HAVE A DRY SLOT MOVE 
INTO THE AREA BY AROUND THURSDAY...BUT TIMING A DRY SLOT THIS FAR 
OUT IN THIS SCENARIO IS RISKY...SO WILL NEED TO KEEP SOME LOW POPS 
IN.

FOR TEMPERATURES...WITH THE ABOVE SCENARIO IN HAND...WILL GO LOWER 
WITH THE TUESDAY MAX TEMP ACROSS THE AREA...ESPECIALLY SOUTH WHERE 
THERE SHOULD BE NO SUN ALL DAY.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             58  74  45  82 /  70  20  10   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  56  73  46  80 /  80  80  10   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       56  73  45  80 /  80  40  10   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              50  72  42  77 /  70  80  10   0

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
236 AM EDT THU APR 24 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE 
OVERALL PATTERN THROUGH THE SHORT TERM.  A WEAK RIDGE WILL SHIFT 
EAST ACROSS THE REGION TODAY FOR A SUNNY AND MILD DAY.  AS THE RIDGE 
MOVES EAST OF THE AREA OVERNIGHT...A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL TRACK INTO 
THE AREA.  DECENT MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FEATURE BUT 
INSTABILITY IS MINIMAL AND FORCING RATHER WEAK.  WILL KEEP MUCH OF 
THE AREA DRY DURING THE EVENING BUT BRING IN LIKELY POPS TOWARDS 
MORNING.  EXPECTED MAINLY A BAND OF SHOWERS WITH ONLY A SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT WITH THE OVERALL PATTERN ALTHOUGH SOME DIFFERENCES WITH THE 
DETAILS ESPECIALLY LATER IN THE PERIOD.  FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS A 
BIT ABOVE AVERAGE EARLY AND ABOUT AVERAGE LATE FOR THIS TIME OF 
YEAR.  A COLD FRONT AND UPPER LEVEL SHORT WAVE TROUGH WILL SWING 
ACROSS THE AREA ON FRIDAY. INSTABILITY LOOKS A BIT BETTER THAN IT 
DID 24 HOURS AGO...BUT STILL ON THE WEAK SIDE. WILL CARRY LIKELY 
POPS NORTHEAST TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FAR WEST ZONES FRIDAY WITH A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS INCLUDED AS WELL.  DRIER AIR WILL 
MOVE IN FOR THURSDAY NIGHT WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND A BUILDING 
UPPER RIDGE OUR MAIN WEATHER FEATURES FOR FRIDAY INTO SUNDAY. A 
CLOSED UPPER LOW WILL SLOWLY APPROACH EARLY NEXT WEEK...SO WILL 
CARRY CHANCE TO LIKELY POPS FOR THE MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY TIME 
FRAME. STILL LOOKS LIKE BEST CHANCES FOR THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY...AND ALSO LOOKS LIKE ORGANIZED SEVERE STORMS MAY 
BE POSSIBLE AT SOME POINT IN THAT TIME FRAME. WILL KEEP MENTION OF 
POSSIBILITY FOR SEVERE STORMS WITH THIS SYSTEM IN THE HWO.
