722 
FXUS64 KMRX 231911
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 PM EDT WED APR 23 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGING 
INTO THE AREA FROM THE NORTH WILL SHIFT EAST OF THE AREA THROUGH 
THURSDAY. A WARM FRONT WILL MOVE NORTH THROUGH THE TN VALLEY ON 
THURSDAY. VERY DRY AIR HAS MIXED DOWN TO THE SURFACE ESPECIALLY 
ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA. GOOD COOLING CONDITIONS SETTING UP FOR EARLY 
TONIGHT. SOME ISOLATED PATCHES OF FROST ARE POSSIBLE BUT COVERAGE 
AND DURATION APPEAR TOO BRIEF TO MEET ADVISORY CRITERIA. SOME HIGH 
CLOUDS RIDING BETWEEN UPPER RIDGE TO THE WEST AND TROUGH TO THE NE 
WILL STREAM ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN LATE TONIGHT AND EARLY THURSDAY. 
THIS WILL ALSO HINDER FROST DEVELOPMENT. TEMPERATURES WARM TO ABOVE 
NORMAL THURSDAY AFTERNOON.   
 
.LONG TERM /THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY/... A QUICK MOVING 
SHORTWAVE THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY WILL BRING SOME SHOWERS AND 
ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS TO THE REGION FROM 06-15Z ON FRIDAY...BEFORE 
RAPIDLY CLEARING THE REGION FROM WEST TO EAST BY THE EARLY 
AFTERNOON. RIDGING WILL QUICKLY BUILD IN FOR LATE FRIDAY INTO THE 
WEEKEND AND RESULT IN A NICE WARM-UP...ALONG WITH AMPLE SUNSHINE AS 
HIGHS RETURN TO THE UPPER 70S AND LOWER 80S. A FEW SPOTS COULD EVEN 
REACH THE MID 80S BY SUNDAY. 

A DEEPENING UPPER-LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL SHIFT FROM THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS INTO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY LATE SUNDAY INTO MONDAY. THIS WILL BRING THE POTENTIAL FOR 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS...WITH SOME SEVERE WEATHER POSSIBLE MONDAY 
EVENING AND NIGHT. THE LATEST RUN OF THE GFS HAS COME NICELY IN LINE 
WITH THE ECMWF WITH THE TIMING AND TRACK OF THE UPPER LOW. GIVEN THE 
MOISTURE AND SOME INSTABILITY IN PLACE DURING THE AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING /COMBINED WITH SOME FAVORABLE SHEAR/...SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS 
WILL CERTAINLY BE POSSIBLE. THE LATEST GUIDANCE SUGGESTS A SQUALL 
LINE /WITH SUPERCELLS AHEAD OF IT/ MAY DEVELOP WELL TO THE WEST 
ALONG THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY DURING THE DAY. AS THESE STORMS MOVE 
EAST INTO MIDDLE TENNESSEE THEY MAY CONGEAL INTO MORE OF A LINE OF 
STORMS...POTENTIALLY MOVING INTO THE PLATEAU AND FORECAST AREA LATE 
MONDAY EVENING AND NIGHT. DAMAGING THUNDERSTORMS WINDS APPEARS TO BE 
THE PRIMARY THREAT...BUT A LOT WILL HINGE ON THE EXACT TIMING OF THE 
STORMS AND HOW MUCH INSTABILITY IS AVAILABLE. PRECIPITATION CHANCES 
WILL PERSIST INTO TUESDAY AND THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK AS THE UPPER 
LOW GRADUALLY PUSHES INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. THIS WILL ALSO RESULT IN 
MUCH COOLER TEMPERATURES TO KICK OFF MAY...WITH HIGHS INTO THE UPPER 
50S TO MID 60S. 
 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

049 
FXUS64 KMRX 221911
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 PM EDT TUE APR 22 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...A BROAD AREA OF LOW PRESSURE 
OVER THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES WAS CONTINUING TO MOVE EAST THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EXTENDING OUT OF IT A WEAK COLD FRONT THAT HAD MOVED 
INTO THE EASTERN OH VALLEY AND WAS DIFFUSE ACROSS CENTRAL TN AND 
THEN EXTENDED SOUTHWEST INTO CENTRAL LA. AIR MASS WAS BECOMING 
SOMEWHAT UNSTABLE OVER THE FORECAST AREA BUT ACTIVITY WAS BECOMING 
WIDELY SCATTERED. MORE CONCENTRATED SHOWERS WERE FORMING NEAR
CHATTANOOGA AND TO THE WEST. RAINFALL AMOUNTS HAVE BEEN MOSTLY ONE
TENTH OF AN INCH OR LESS SO FAR TODAY AND ONLY ABOUT ONE TENTH AS
AN AVERAGE IS EXPECTED THROUGH 00Z OR SHORTLY AFTER SUNSET TONIGHT.
TEMPERATURES WERE VARIED IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S WHERE
SHOWERS WERE OCCURRING TO MID 60S TO LOWER 70S ELSEWHERE. STILL
COULD SEE A THUNDERSTORM OR TWO ESPECIALLY SOUTHERN SECTIONS
THROUGH EARLY EVENING. OTHERWISE SKIES CLEARING THIS EVENING THEN
SUNNY AND COOL AGAIN WEDNESDAY. TEMPERATURES TONIGHT COULD DIP
BELOW 40 FOR A FEW HOURS IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VA
AND EASTERN TN BUT NO SIGNIFICANT FROST EXPECTED. WITH SOME COLD
AIR ADVECTION WEDNESDAY IT WILL BE BREEZY AND RELATIVE HUMIDITY
VALUES MAY DROP TO 20 TO 25 PERCENT BY LATE AFTERNOON. WILL
HEADLINE LOW RH AND GUSTY WINDS IN THE FIRE WEATHER FORECAST AND
MAY NEED A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT ISSUED EARLY WEDNESDAY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN 
FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL A PROGRESSIVE PATTERN THROUGH 
EARLY NEXT WEEK. A WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY LATE THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY MORNING...BRINGING 
SCATTERED CONVECTION INTO THE FORECAST AREA AHEAD OF IT. THIS COLD
FRONT SHOULD THEN STALL OUT OVER THE DEEP SOUTH ON SATURDAY...AS
THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW BECOMES ZONAL AND PARALLEL TO THE FRONTAL
BOUNDARY. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS THEN PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT
NORTHWARD AS A WARM FRONT ON SUNDAY... AND MAY LINGER SOMEWHERE
AROUND THE TN RIVER VALLEY THROUGH MONDAY WITH A PROLONGED PERIOD
OF CONVECTION POSSIBLE OVER THE FORECAST AREA. A DEEP UPPER-LEVEL
TROUGH OVER THE WESTERN U.S. IS THEN PROGGED TO FURTHER AMPLIFY
OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS ON MONDAY...AND WILL SLOWLY DRIFT EASTWARD
EARLY NEXT WEEK...DEVELOPING A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE
LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY. GFS AND ECMWF MODELS DIFFER SOMEWHAT ON THE
EXACT TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM...BUT BOTH MODELS AGREE THAT IT WILL
BRING STRONG DYNAMICS AND MODERATE INSTABILITY OVER THE FORECAST
AREA EARLY NEXT WEEK WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF AN OUTBREAK OF SEVERE
STORMS. THUS...WILL BEGIN TO MENTION THIS POSSIBILITY IN THE
HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND
TOWARDS THE GFS NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE
IN LINE WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS. &&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             47  72  45  78 /  20   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  46  70  43  77 /  10   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       43  70  43  77 /  10   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              40  68  39  75 /  20   0   0   0

THUNDERSTORMS BECAUSE INSTABILITY TOO LIMITED THIS AFTERNOON. VFR
CONDITIONS EXPECTED TONIGHT THROUGH END OF FORECAST. SKIES SHOULD
CLEAR AFTER SUNSET. PATCHY FOG MAY FORM DURING EARLY MORNING DUE TO
TODAYS SHOWERS. BUT TOO EARLY TO FORECAST AT ANY SITE.

TEMPERATURES ARE VARYING DEPENDING ON SHOWER ACTIVITY FROM THE
UPPER 50S TO THE UPPER 60S. DEW POINTS ARE IN THE UPPER 40S TO
UPPER 50S. MOISTURE ADVECTION IS BRINGING MOISTURE LEVELS UP IN
SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL AREAS. JUST IN THE PAST HOUR DEW POINTS HAVE
COME UP IN NE SECTIONS TOO. FOR THE REST OF THE DAY SHOWERS WILL
CONTINUE TO DEVELOP WITH HEATING WITH THE BEST CHANCES WESTERN
AREAS NEXT FEW HOURS AND MID AFTERNOON EASTERN SECTIONS.
THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE BUT ISOLATED AS INSTABILITY IS LACKING.
RAINFALL AMOUNTS MAY ONLY BE AROUND A TENTH OR SO BUT COULD BE
ONE QUARTER INCH OR MORE IF AIR MASS BECOMES UNSTABLE ENOUGH FOR
THUNDERSTORMS. UPDATED FORECAST TO CHANGE TIMING SLIGHTLY FOR
PRECIPITATION.

AND THURSDAY.  MODELS THEN BRING IN A COLD FRONT THURSDAY NIGHT INTO

TO WEAK RIDGING DEVELOPS FOR SATURDAY.  A WEAK WARM FRONT LIFTS 
THROUGH THE AREA ON SUNDAY FOR ISOLATED CONVECTION.  THE ASSOCIATED 
COLD FRONT MOVES IN ON MONDAY WITH A LINE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED TO MOVE ACROSS THE AREA.

614 
FXUS64 KMRX 211910
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT MON APR 21 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...ANOTHER MOSTLY SUNNY DAY 
ACROSS THE EASTERN TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WITH 
TEMPERATURES IN THE MID TO UPPER 70S. DEW POINTS HAD FALLEN INTO THE 
30S TO MID 40S. RH VALUES WERE AS LOW AS AROUND 20 TO 25 PERCENT IN 
SW VA SO FAR ABOUT 5 PERCENT HIGHER THAN SUNDAY. WINDS WERE MOSTLY 
ABOUT 5 TO 10 MPH OUT OF THE SOUTHWEST OR SOUTH WITH A FEW HIGHER 
GUSTS. CLOUDS TO THE WEST WERE THICKENING UP AND EXPECT THESE TO 
MOVE OVER WESTERN SECTIONS THIS EVENING. PRECIPITATION WAS AS CLOSE 
AS THE LOWER OH VALLEY IN EXTREME WESTERN KY. 

UPPER LEVEL TROUGH TO THE WEST AND NORTHWEST MOVES SLOWLY EAST 
OVERNIGHT AND INTO THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY WITH SHOWERS AND A 
POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM. WEAK FRONT TO APPROACH IN THE MORNING AND BE 
THROUGH ENTIRE AREA BY 00Z WEDNESDAY. RAINFALL AMOUNTS ONLY AROUND 
ONE QUARTER TO ONE HALF MAINLY DAYTIME HOURS TUESDAY. MODELS HAVE 
INCREASED RH VALUES BRINGING HIGHER DEW POINTS IN QUICKER THAN WHAT 
HAS HAPPENED EACH DAY SO WILL KEEP CURRENT DEW POINTS LOW THROUGH 
ABOUT 00Z TONIGHT. LOWERED DEW POINTS TUESDAY AS WELL. BUMPED LOWS 
UP A FEW DEGREES WEST TONIGHT WITH INCREASED CLOUDS. HIGHS TUESDAY 
NEAR GUIDANCE OF UPPER 60S TO MID 70S AS THERE WILL BE LITTLE COLD 
AIR ADVECTION WITH FRONT UNTIL TUESDAY NIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL A PROGRESSIVE PATTERN THROUGH EARLY 
NEXT WEEK. AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE WILL BUILD ACROSS THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY...BRINGING TRANQUIL CONDITIONS 
AND A WARMING TREND. A WEAK COLD FRONT IS THEN PROGGED TO MOVE 
ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY LATE THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING... 
BRINGING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND TSTORMS. THIS COLD FRONT SHOULD 
THEN STALL OUT OVER THE DEEP SOUTH ON SATURDAY...AS THE UPPER-LEVEL 
FLOW BECOMES ZONAL AND PARALLEL TO THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. THIS 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY SHOULD THEN MOVE NORTHWARD AS A WARM FRONT ON 
SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY...AS A DEEP UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE 
WESTERN U.S. FURTHER AMPLIFIES OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. THIS DEEP 
UPPER TROUGH IS THEN PROGGED TO BRING A STRONG AND SLOW-MOVING LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON MONDAY NIGHT AND 
TUESDAY. THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS DIFFER SOMEWHAT ON THE EXACT 
TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM...BUT RIGHT NOW...BOTH MODELS GENERALLY AGREE 
THAT IT WILL BRING STRONG DYNAMICS OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH THE 
POSSIBILITY OF ORGANIZED SEVERE STORMS FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND A LITTLE COOLER THAN THE GFS NUMBERS 
THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH IS IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH 
THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             60  74  46  73 /  40  70   0   0

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT MON APR 21 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER RIDGE OVER THE AREA TODAY 
WILL BREAK DOWN AS AN UPPER TROUGH MOVES IN TONIGHT. A COLD FRONT 
WILL BE APPROACHING LATE IN THE PERIOD. WILL SEE VARYING AMOUNTS OF 
MAINLY HIGH CLOUDS TODAY...BUT STILL QUITE A BIT OF SUNSHINE WITH A 
WARM AFTERNOON.  CLOUDS WILL INCREASE TONIGHT AND SOME SHOWERS WILL 
BE AROUND...ESPECIALLY NORTH AND WEST. WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE TO 
CHANCE POPS. INSTABILITY LOOKS QUITE WEAK...SO NO THUNDER INCLUDED 
AT THIS TIME. WILL MAKE ONLY A FEW MINOR TWEAKS TO MAV TEMPS FOR THE 
SHORT TERM.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A COUPLE OF RELATIVELY 
INSIGNIFICANT SHORT WAVE FEATURES WITH WEAK FRONTAL SYSTEMS WILL 
AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE WEEK WHILE ANOTHER SYSTEM 
APPROACHES LATE IN THE UPCOMING WEEKEND. THE FIRST UPPER TROUGH 
MOVES ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON TUESDAY BRINGING SCATTERED 
SHOWERS AND EVEN SOME THUNDER. ALTHOUGH THE THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD BE 
MORE GARDEN VARIETY IN NATURE WITH ONLY WEAK INSTABILITY AND LIMITED 
SHEAR INDICATED IN THE MODELS. THE WEDNESDAY THROUGH DAYTIME PERIOD 
THURSDAY STILL LOOKS DRY WITH AN AMPLIFIED UPPER RIDGE BUILDING IN 
ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. ANOTHER WEAK UPPER TROUGH PRESSES EAST 
ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION THURSDAY NIGHT INTO 
SATURDAY. A WEAK COOL FRONTAL BOUNDARY EDGES SOUTHEAST FROM THE OHIO 
VALLEY LATE THURSDAY NIGHT AND ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE 
DAY FRIDAY. THOUGHT IT BEST WITH THIS SYSTEM TO MAINTAIN HIGH CHANCE 
POPS FOR SHOWERS AND A POSSIBILITY OF THUNDER AS THE FRONT SLIDES 
SOUTHEAST DURING THE DAY FRIDAY WHILE KEEPING A LOWER CHANCE POP FOR 
FRIDAY NIGHT DUE TO EXPECTED SLOW FRONTAL MOVEMENT THROUGH THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE FINAL SYSTEM OF THE LONG TERM APPROACHES 
THROUGH THE SOUTHERN PLAINS ON SUNDAY AND THERE IS A SMALL CHANCE 
FOR A PERIOD OF SHOWERS AS MOIST AIR IS LIFTED ALONG A WARM FRONT 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE SYSTEM'S MID LATITUDE CYCLONE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)... MODELS CONTINUE TO 
INDICATE WEAK UPPER TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT APPROACHING THE 
FORECAST AREA MONDAY NIGHT AND THEN PASSING THROUGH DURING THE DAY 
TUESDAY. THEN STRONG UPPER RIDGE MOVES FROM THE PLAINS STATES 
TUESDAY NIGHT TO SETTLE OVER THE SOUTHEAST AND GULF COAST WEDNESDAY 
AND THURSDAY. THE STRONGEST PART OF THIS SYSTEM TO PASS THROUGH 
GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY. LIFT AND INSTABILITY NOT THAT GREAT SO 
DON'T EXPECT MANY THUNDERSTORMS TUESDAY. RAINFALL AMOUNTS WITHOUT 
MUCH ORGANIZED CONVECTION WILL NOT BE THAT HIGH EITHER...ONLY ABOUT 
ONE QUARTER TO ONE HALF INCH. 

UPPER RIDGING BRINGS WARM TEMPERATURES AND MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES BACK 
TO THE EAST TENNESSEE VALLEY WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. A WELL 
DEVELOPED LOW PRESSURE AREA ALONG THE CANADIAN AND US BORDER AND 
COLD FRONT THAT EXTENDS TO THE SOUTH THROUGH THE PLAINS STATES MOVES 
EAST TOWARD THE GREAT LAKES THURSDAY NIGHT. WARM AIR ADVECTION TO 
INCREASE CLOUDS AND DEVELOP SHOWERS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
THURSDAY NIGHT WITH POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORMS. FRIDAY GOOD CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AS THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH. FRONT MAY HANG 
UP OR STALL JUST TO THE SOUTH OF TN FRIDAY NIGHT SO LEFT SMALL 
CHANCES OF A FEW STORMS AND SHOWERS OVERNIGHT. SATURDAY FORECAST 
AREA BETWEEN SYSTEMS SO GENERALLY FAIR SKIES. SUNDAY A FAST MOVING 
SYSTEM AGAIN TO AFFECT THE REGION WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS BY LATE 
IN THE DAY.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODEL FORECASTS RELATIVELY 
CLOSE IN DEPICTION OF EXPECTED WEATHER DURING THE LONG TERM PERIOD. 
A COUPLE OF SYSTEMS WILL AFFECT THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION WITH 
THE FIRST MOVING INTO THE AREA LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. 
STAYED WITH INCREASING CHANCE FOR SHOWERS...MAINLY AFTER MIDNIGHT 
MONDAY NIGHT WITH THE BEST CHANCE FOR RAIN DURING THE DAY TUESDAY 
JUST AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT. MODELS INDICATE THE PRESENCE OF WEAK 
INSTABILITY WITH THIS SYSTEM SO KEPT THUNDERSTORMS IN THE FORECAST. 
THE FRONT STILL APPEARS TO MOVE OUT OF THE REGION BY TUESDAY EVENING 
WITH DRY ADVECTION AND SUBSIDENCE BUILDING IN WITH AN AMPLIFIED 
UPPER RIDGE ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. THE NEXT UPPER TROUGH AND 
ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM MOVES INTO THE EASTERN U.S. LATER THURSDAY 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. MAINTAINED A GOOD CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WITH THIS FEATURE DURING THE DAY FRIDAY. THERE IS SOME 
UNCERTAINTY CONCERNING HOW QUICKLY THE FRONT ADVANCES SOUTHEAST 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AS THE UPPER LEVEL FLOW BECOMES ALIGNED 
PARALLEL TO THE FRONT LATER IN THE DAY FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. 
THEREFORE HELD ONTO LOW CHANCE POPS THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. THE FRONT 
SHOULD BE SOUTH OF THE REGION BY SATURDAY ALLOWING FOR A PLEASANT 
END TO THE WEEK COMPLETE WITH SUNSHINE AND MILD TEMPERATURES.

&&

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...

WILL KEEP A CHANCE POP SOUTHEAST IN UNTIL MIDNIGHT TO ACCOUNT FOR

WILL SEE LOW IN THE 40S...AND SKIES SHOULD BE CLEAR BY SUNRISE. 
SUNDAY WILL BE MILD AND SUNNY WITH A HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE OVERHEAD.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
MODELS SLOWING EARLY WEEK SYSTEM NOW STILL MORE. RIDGING ALOFT OUT
AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM WILL KEEP HIGH PRESSURE WITH WARM AIR MASS IN
PLACE THROUGH MOST OF MONDAY. REMOVED POPS MONDAY. TEMPERATURES 40S
TO LOWER 50S SUNDAY NIGHT WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES. MONDAY HIGH
LEVEL CLOUDINESS INCREASES BUT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE DOES NOT RETURN
UNTIL MONDAY NIGHT. LEAD SHORTWAVE MONDAY NIGHT PRODUCES A FEW
SHOWERS BUT MUCH OF THE PRECIPITATION HOLDS OFF UNTIL TUESDAY. WEAK
FRONT PASSES THROUGH THEN BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON. DRYING MOVES IN
QUICKLY TUESDAY NIGHT. THEN HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE DOWN FROM THE
UPPER MIDWEST AND MS VALLEY AND RESIDE OVER THE TN VALLEY THROUGH
THURSDAY FOR A COUPLE MOSTLY SUNNY WARM DAYS AND COOL NIGHTS. UPPER
LEVEL RIDGING SHIFTS EAST THURSDAY NIGHT AS NEXT FRONTAL SYSTEM
MOVES INTO MS AND TN VALLEYS. MAIN SURFACE LOW STAYS NORTH ALONG
CANADIAN BORDER FRIDAY. MODELS BRING FAST MOVING FRONT THROUGH
FRIDAY. KEPT POPS FRIDAY NIGHT AS WOUND UP UPPER LOW TRACKS
SOUTHEAST THROUGH OH VALLEY. WRAP AROUND SHOWERS AND STORMS COULD
AFFECT AREA OVERNIGHT. NE AREAS COULD GET A FEW MORE SHOWERS
SATURDAY MORNING. INSTABILITY NOT THAT GREAT MONDAY NIGHT AND
TUESDAY BUT KEPT MENTION OF THUNDER IN. THUNDERSTORMS A BETTER BET
WITH FRONT FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

345 AM EDT SAT APR 19 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AN UPPER LOW CENTERED OVER THE 
FLORIDA PANHANDLE WILL SLOWLY TRANSLATE INTO THE WESTERN ATLANTIC 
LATER TONIGHT. UNTIL THEN UNSETTLED WEATHER WILL PERSIST GENERALLY 
ALONG THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS TODAY AND AT LEAST FOR THE FIRST 
HALF OF THE NIGHT. THE BEST RAIN CHANCES WILL OCCUR OVER SOUTHWEST 
NORTH CAROLINA AND THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE MOUNTAINS IN E TN. SOME 
OF THIS LIGHT PRECIP MAY EXTEND A LITTLE FARTHER WEST. WHATEVER DOES 
FALL WEST OF THE MOUNTAINS AND FOOTHILLS WILL AMOUNT TO A FEW 
HUNDREDTHS OR LESS. CLOUD COVER WILL BE THICKEST OVER EASTERN 
PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA WHILE OPAQUE CIRRUS WILL BE OVER THE 
WESTERN HALF. THIS IS WHERE DAYTIME TEMPERATURES WILL BE THE 
WARMEST...GENERALLY AROUND 70 DEGREES. OVERNIGHT LOWS FOR EASTER 
MORNING WILL PROBABLY BE ON THE WARMER SIDE ESPECIALLY IF THE CLOUD 
COVER IS SLIGHTLY THICKER.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODEL FORECASTS NOT TOO 
DISSIMILAR THROUGH MOST OF THE PERIOD EXCEPT AT THE END WHERE THE 
ECMWF IS QUICKER TO MOVE A FRONTAL SYSTEM ACROSS THE REGION. STAYED 
CLOSER TO THE SLOWER GFS CONCERNING THIS FEATURE. STILL EXPECTING A 
PLEASANT SUNDAY WITH A FAIR AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE IN THE WAKE OF THE 
DEPARTING UPPER LOW. EDGED POPS BACK IN TIME ON MONDAY APPLYING JUST 
A SLIGHT CHANCE OF A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM ON THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU DURING THE AFTERNOON FOR THE POSSIBILITY THE PASSAGE OF A 
WEAK UPPER WAVE THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY. INCREASING PROBABILITY OF 
PRECIPITATION STILL IN THE WORKS FOR MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY AS 
MOIST AND UNSTABLE AIR ADVANCES AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT DUE IN THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY MORNING. 
USED A LIKELY POP FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE BIG FRONTAL 
PUSH WITH DECREASING POPS THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. IT LOOKS LIKE THERE 
WILL BE A NICE RIDGE PATTERN FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY WITH A 
MODEST WARMING TREND WHICH WILL RESULT IN HIGH TEMPERATURES IN THE 
UPPER 70S BY THURSDAY. ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED FRONTAL 
SYSTEM BUILD INTO THE REGION FRIDAY AFTERNOON INTO FRIDAY NIGHT 
(STAYED CLOSER TO THE SLOWER GFS CONCEPT HERE) WITH MODELS 
INDICATING SUFFICIENT INSTABILITY FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF CONVECTION 
WITH THE FRONT. WENT WITH MEDIUM CHANCE POP FOR THE DAYTIME PERIOD 
FRIDAY WHILE ADJUSTING TO HIGH CHANCE FOR FRIDAY NIGHT WHEN FRONT 
SWEEPS ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS.

FXUS64 KMRX 181918
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
318 PM EDT FRI APR 18 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
LIGHT RAIN IS BEGINNING TO APPROACH THE AREA FROM THE SOUTH AT A 
SLOW PACE...BUT OUR SW NC COUNTIES SHOULD SEE MEASURABLE RAINFALL 
FROM AROUND 00Z ONWARD ACCORDING TO THE RAP13 AND HRRR. THERE WILL 
BE A SHARP POP GRADIENT ACROSS THE AREA FROM SE TO NW...WITH 
CATEGORICAL POPS IN CLAY COUNTY NC TO NO POPS IN THE COUNTIES 
BORDERING THE PLATEAU. MODELS ARE IN BETTER AGREEMENT TODAY WITH THE 
WESTWARD EXTENT OF PRECIP...WITH VERY LITTLE IN THE VALLEY. WILL 
HAVE JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE BLEEDING INTO CHA-TYS-TRI TONIGHT AND 
SATURDAY. THE CLOSED LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS VERY SLOW TO MOVE 
EAST...AND SO POPS WILL BE EXTENDED/RAISED INTO SATURDAY AFTERNOON 
ALONG THE MOUNTAINS. TEMPS ON SATURDAY WILL BE WARMEST IN THE 
NORTHERN PLATEAU WHERE SOME SUN MAY BE POSSIBLE...IN THE LOWER 
70S...AND COOLEST EAST UNDER CLOUDS/PRECIP.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
BY SATURDAY NIGHT UPPER LOW WILL FINALLY BE MOVING TO THE COAST
AND PULLING MOISTURE NORTHEAST. CLOUDS WILL LINGER ALONG THE
MOUNTAINS THROUGH MOST OF THE NIGHT BUT RAINFALL CHANCES DROP TO
LESS THAN 20 PERCENT. HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE OHIO AND WESTERN TN
VALLEY TO INFLUENCE THE FORECAST AREA WITH SKIES CLEARING AND
SUNSHINE RETURNING EASTR SUNDAY. UPPER LEVEL RIDGING FROM THE LOWER
MS VALLEY SATURDAY NIGHT SHIFTS EAST TOWARD THE SOUTHEAST SUNDAY.
TEMPERATURES WARMER THAN SATURDAY...MOSTLY LOWER TO MID 70S
POSSIBLY UPPER 70S PLATEAU AND SOUTHEAST TN. LOWER PRESSURE
DEVELOPS EAST OF THE ROCKIES AND WEAK TROUGH FORMS OVER THE MS
VALLEY INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS SUNDAY NIGHT. GFS FASTEST WITH THE
SPREAD OF MOISTURE EAST FROM THIS SYSTEM MONDAY WITH SHOWERS
STARTING AS SOON AS MONDAY MORNING. CANADIAN/UKMET AND ECMWF SLOW
SYSTEM DOWN WITH APPROACH MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY. KEPT SLIGHT
CHANCE SHOWERS MONDAY AFTERNOON BUT BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE WITH FRONT TUESDAY.

SURFACE HIGH AND RIDGE ALOFT BUILD BACK IN TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
THURSDAY. NEW SYSTEM MOVING INTO THE PACIFIC NW TUESDAY CROSSES THE 
ROCKIES WEDNESDAY. SOME CLOUDS SPREAD INTO NORTHERN SECTIONS 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT EARLY THURSDAY WITH A POSSIBLE WARM FRONT. MAIN 
FRONT TO MOVE ACROSS THE PLAINS WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. THE 
BULK OF THE WEATHER STAYS ACROSS THE NORTHERN STATES UNTIL THURSDAY 
NIGHT. DEEPENING SURFACE LOW OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS THEN INDUCES 
FRONTAL DEVELOPMENT INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND MS VALLEY THURSDAY 
NIGHT. THIS FRONT MARCHES EAST INTO THE TN VALLEY FRIDAY WITH GOOD 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORMS. LOOKS LIKE BEST CHANCE 
OF CONVECTION WILL BE OUTSIDE OF FORECAST FRIDAY NIGHT. TEMPERATURES 
STAY NEAR SEASONAL AVERAGES THROUGH THE EXTENDED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT FRI APR 18 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER TROUGH TO OUR WEST WILL DIG 
SOUTHEAST AND CUT OFF...WITH SURFACE LOW OVER THE GULF TRACKING 
ACROSS FLORIDA.  BEST FORCING AND MOISTURE SHOULD STAY TO OUR SOUTH 
AND EAST...ALTHOUGH SOME MODEL DIFFERENCES WITH HANDLING OF THIS 
STILL EXIST WITH THE GFS STILL WANTING TO THROW MORE PRECIP WEST OF 
THE MOUNTAINS.  WILL LEAN MORE TOWARD AN ECMWF/NAM/SREF BLEND AND 
CARRY SIGNIFICANT POPS ALONG THE MOUNTAINS BUT MINIMAL POPS TO THE 
WEST OF THE MOUNTAINS FOR LATER TODAY AND TONIGHT.  PRECIP AMOUNTS 
NOT EXPECTED TO BE VERY HIGH...AND NO THUNDER EXPECTED GIVEN LACK OF 
INSTABILITY.  MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE OVERALL SO WILL STAY CLOSE.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODEL SOLUTIONS NOT TOO FAR 
APART ON EXPECTED WEATHER THROUGH MOST OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. ON 
SATURDAY THE NORTHEASTERN GULF OF MEXICO UPPER LOW DRIFTS EVER SO 
SLOWLY EAST ACROSS NORTHERN FLORIDA INTO THE WESTERN ATLANTIC BY 12Z 
SUNDAY. MAINTAINED A TIGHT POP GRADIENT FOR SHOWERS OVER THE CREST 
OF THE APPALACHIANS BUT SLOWED THE DEPARTURE OF THE SHOWER ACTION BY 
A FEW HOURS. WOULD EXPECT RISING MOTION ON THE EASTERN SIDE OF THE 
MOUNTAINS WITH SINKING MOTION WEST. THEREFORE...VERY LITTLE IF ANY 
CHANCE OF RAIN OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH THIS FEATURE. 
RIDGING FILLS IN BEHIND THE DEPARTING LOW FOR SUNDAY AND THEN WEAK 
SHORT WAVE ENERGY BUILDS NORTHEAST THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY PERHAPS 
GENERATING A SHOWER OR TWO ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS. NOT A GREAT DEAL 
OF CONFIDENCE IN THIS SYSTEM GENERATING RAIN SO KEPT POPS RATHER 
LOW. THE BETTER CHANCE FOR RAIN WILL LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY 
WHEN A COLD FRONT MOVES ACROSS THE REGION. RAISED POPS TO HIGH 
CHANCE WITH A POSSIBILITY OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DUE TO 
PROGGED INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THE FRONT. MORE RIDGING BUILDS IN 
BEHIND THIS SYSTEM WITH MOSTLY DRY ADVECTION SO WAS ABLE TO KEEP 
PRECIPITATION OUT OF THE FORECAST THROUGH THE END OF THE LONG TERM 
PERIOD.

320 PM EDT THU APR 17 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...
AS A TROUGH CROSSES THE SOUTHERN PLAINS...CYCLOGENESIS WILL COMMENCE 
TONIGHT JUST OFF THE MS DELTA. CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT NEAR THE FL 
PANHANDLE WILL LIKELY CUT OFF THE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE FEED TONIGHT 
AND FRIDAY MORNING...KEEPING OUR AREA DRY. THERE ARE SIGNIFICANT 
DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE MODELS IN THEIR QPF DEPICTIONS OVER OUR AREA 
FRIDAY/FRIDAY NIGHT. THE GFS GENERATES MASSIVE FRONTOGENESIS ALONG 
THE MTNS...AND TRACKS THE LOW FARTHER NORTH INTO GA. THE 
NAM...SREF...AND ECMWF DO NOT SHOW THE STRONG FRONTOGENESIS AND KEEP 
THE LOW OVER FL...AND THE QPF WELL TO OUR EAST. A DOWNSLOPE WIND 
COMPONENT COULD ALSO PLAY A ROLE IN KEEPING THE VALLEY DRY. WILL 
LEAN TOWARD THE DRIER MODEL SOLUTION IN THE VALLEY AND PLATEAU...BUT 
WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS IN SW NC AND THE MOUNTAINS TO MAINTAIN SOME 
POP/QPF CONTINUITY WITH NEIGHBORING OFFICES. TEMPERATURES FRIDAY 
WILL BE TRICKY DEPENDING ON CLOUD COVER...GENERALLY STAYED NEAR A 
BLEND OF NAM/GFS MOS FOR HIGHS.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD LOW PRESSURE MOVES ACROSS FLORIDA
PANHANDLE INTO ATLANTIC SATURDAY. FORECAST AREA MOSTLY WEST OF RAIN
AREA THAT WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE NORTHEAST. A FEW SHOWERS EARLY
SATURDAY SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA WITH CLOUDS ALONG THE EASTERN
BORDER. THEN HIGHER PRESSURE TO BUILD IN SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY
FOR MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES AND WARMER TEMPERATURES. GFS MODEL MUCH
FARTHER NORTH WITH MOISTURE SHIELD SO PREFER NAM/ECMWF WHICH KEEPS
THE DEEP MOISTURE ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE APPALACHIANS SATURDAY AND
SATURDAY NIGHT. MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT THEN
INCREASING CLOUDS MONDAY. LATE MONDAY INTO TUESDAY A WEAK SYSTEM TO
AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA. SHOWERS TO DEVELOP MONDAY AND MONDAY
NIGHT AND A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS TUESDAY AFTERNOON WITH
SOME INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. TEMPERATURES MAY BE
HINDERED SOME BY CLOUD COVER SATURDAY BUT STILL NEAR NORMAL AND
THEN WILL WARM SLIGHTLY SUNDAY WITH MORE SUNSHINE. FOR MONDAY
THROUGH WEDNESDAY TEMPERATURES STAY AT OR SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL AS
WEAK FRONT TUESDAY WILL HAVE LITTLE COOLING AFFECT.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1021 AM EDT THU APR 17 2014

.DISCUSSION...
ALL FORECAST ELEMENTS APPEAR TO BE REASONABLY ON TRACK SO FAR THIS
MORNING...SO NO UPDATE IS PLANNED. WITH THE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE TO
OUR EAST...A SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL BRING WARMER TEMPERATURES
TODAY...ALONG WITH SOME SLIGHT DOWNSLOPE WARMING IN NORTHERN AND
CENTRAL AREAS. FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS WILL BEAR WATCHING...AS
MINIMUM RH VALUES WILL BE IN THE 15-25 PERCENT RANGE IN MOST
SPOTS...AND WINDS MAY APPROACH 10 MPH AT TIMES IN THE SOUTHERN
VALLEY AREAS.

719 
FXUS64 KMRX 170659
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
259 AM EDT THU APR 17 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FOR THE NEAR-TERM...TEMPERATURES
ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA HAVE BEEN HIGHER THAN FORECAST DUE TO
EASTERLY WINDS. THIS MAY LIMIT FREEZE/FROST EXTENT EARLY THIS
MORNING...BUT SOME AREAS WILL REACH CRITERIA...SO WILL MAINTAIN
HEADLINES AS IS.

A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS TODAY. AIRMASS REMAINS QUITE DRY WITH VERY LOW
RELATIVE AFTERNOON HUMIDITIES ANTICIPATED. UPPER FLOW IS
SOUTHWESTERLY WHICH WILL ADVECT AREAS OF CIRRUS AND CIRRO-STRATUS
CLOUDS THROUGH TONIGHT.

TEMPERATURES WILL DROP INTO THE MIDDLE AND UPPER 30S AGAIN TONIGHT
ACROSS THE NORTHEAST AREAS...BUT INCREASING HIGH AND SOME MID-LEVEL
CLOUDS WILL LIMIT FROST DEVELOPMENT.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND 
REVEAL TWO WEAK COLD FRONTS AFFECTING THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE 
FRIDAY/FRIDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY NIGHT/TUESDAY TIME PERIODS. MOISTURE 
IS EXPECTED TO BE LIMITED WITH THE FIRST COLD FRONT ON FRIDAY/FRIDAY 
NIGHT...MAINLY DUE TO A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE FL 
PANHANDLE AND SOUTHERN GA WHICH WILL LIKELY CUT OFF THE NORTHWARD 
FLOW OF MOISTURE INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO. 
LATEST MODEL RUNS NOW INDICATE THAT THE SECOND COLD FRONT FOR EARLY 
NEXT WEEK WILL BE SLOWER...AND SHOULD NOT MOVE INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA UNTIL TUESDAY. BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS INDICATE THAT THIS 
SECOND COLD FRONT WILL HAVE MORE MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH IT OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA...WITH SOME MARGINAL INSTABILITY ALSO DEVELOPING 
AHEAD OF IT. THUS...WILL MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF TSTORMS ON 
TUESDAY WITH THIS SECOND COLD FRONT. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY 
TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD.

&&

781 
FXUS64 KMRX 161849
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
249 PM EDT WED APR 16 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
NO CHANGES ARE NEEDED TO THE CURRENT FROST/FREEZE ADVISORY/WARNING 
PRODUCTS THIS AFTERNOON. IT STILL LOOKS LIKE TEMPERATURES WILL FALL 
BELOW FREEZING IN NE TN/SW VA...MOUNTAINS...AND SW NC AREAS FOR A 
FEW HOURS. THE REST OF THE TN VALLEY AND PLATEAU WILL BE CLOSE TO 
FREEZING FOR A BRIEF PERIOD...AND WILL REMAIN IN A FROST ADVISORY.

HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER OH/PA TODAY WILL BE SHIFTING EAST 
TONIGHT AND OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST BY TOMORROW. A RIDGE AXIS WILL 
EXTEND SW ACROSS THE CAROLINAS...WHICH WILL GIVE A MORE SOUTHERLY 
WIND COMPONENT IN THE TN VALLEY. THIS SHOULD MEAN WARMER 
TEMPERATURES FOR THE AREA...REACHING THE LOWER TO MID 60S. LEANED ON 
THE COOL SIDE OF MOS GUIDANCE BASED ON THE LACK OF WARMING WE HAVE 
SEEN SO FAR TODAY. THERE MAY BE SOME HIGH CLOUDS BUILDING IN THROUGH 
THE DAY AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING TROUGH/JET...BUT IT SHOULD HAVE 
LITTLE IMPACT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
THERE ARE TWO SYSTEMS OF CONCERN DURING THE EXTENDED. THIS FIRST
SYSTEM WILL BRING A WEAKENING COLD FRONT ACROSS THE AREA ON FRIDAY.
MODELS SHOW LITTLE MOISTURE AND MINIMAL LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THE
FRONT. ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SHOWERS ARE POSSIBLE BUT COVERAGE
SHOULD BE LIMITED AND WILL KEEP POPS AROUND 20 TO 30. A RIDGE
DEVELOP OVER THE REGION FOR THE WEEKEND. THE SECOND OF THE SYSTEMS
WILL MOVE IN AROUND MONDAY OR MONDAY NIGHT. THIS FRONT WILL BE
STRONGER WITH DEEPER MOISTURE AND WEAK INSTABILITY FOR A BETTER
CHANCE OF CONVECTION.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 160713
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
313 AM EDT WED APR 16 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MAIN CONCERNS WILL BE VERY LOW
AFTERNOON RELATIVE HUMDITIES AND FREEZE AND FROST CONDITIONS FOR
TONIGHT.

A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS WITH A VERY DRY AIRMASS IN PLACE. AFTERNOON RELATIVE
HUMIDITIES WILL DROP INTO THE TEENS MOST LOCATIONS FOR TODAY AND
THURSDAY.

PLENTY OF SUNSHINE TODAY WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO WARM
QUICKLY...ESPECIALLY SINCE THE AIRMASS IS QUITE DRY. LIKEWISE...
DRY AIR-MASS AND LIGHT/CALM WINDS...EXCEPT ACROSS THE RIDGE
TOPS...WHERE SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL RETURN. MOST VALLEYS AND
SHELTERED AREAS WILL SEE GOOD RADITIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS TONIGHT
ALLOWING TEMPERATURES TO FALL BELOW FREEZING ACROSS THE NORTHEAST
AREAS...FAR EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. AREAS
OF FROST IS EXPECTED AREA-WIDE. HAVE ISSUED FREEZE WARNING/FROST
ADVISORIES FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL A QUIET PATTERN THROUGH EARLY NEXT 
WEEK WITH TWO WEAK COLD FRONT AFFECTING THE FORECAST AREA. THE FIRST 
COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON FRIDAY AND FRIDAY 
NIGHT...WITH THE SECOND COLD FRONT AFFECTING THE FORECAST AREA ON 
MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. THE FIRST COLD FRONT IS NOT EXPECTED TO 
HAVE MUCH MOISTURE WITH IT OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY...MAINLY DUE TO 
A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE SOUTHEAST WHICH THE MODELS 
INDICATE WILL CUT OFF THE NORTHWARD FLOW OF MOISTURE FROM THE GULF 
OF MEXICO. BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS INDICATE THAT THE SECOND 
COLD FRONT ON MONDAY/MONDAY NIGHT WILL HAVE MORE MOISTURE ASSOCIATED 
WITH IT OVER THE FORECAST AREA...AND WILL ALSO HAVE SOME MARGINAL 
INSTABILITY DEVELOPING AHEAD OF IT. THUS...WILL MENTION THE 
POSSIBILITY OF TSTORMS WITH THIS SECOND COLD FRONT. AS FOR TEMPS... 
WILL GENERALLY TREND COOLER THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH 
THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE 
ENSEMBLE MEANS.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 151912
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT TUE APR 15 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...TRAILING UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM 
WILL TAKE SEVERAL MORE HOURS TO PUSH EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS. THE 
SYSTEM WILL CONTINUE TO PRODUCE SOME LIGHT RAIN AND SNOW LOWER 
ELEVATIONS WITH SOME SNOW SHOWERS IN THE MOUNTAINS. NICE BREEZE WILL 
CONTINUE IN TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT BETWEEN THE DEPARTING LOW AND 
THE CENTRAL U.S. SURFACE RIDGE. THEREFORE WILL KEEP THE WIND 
ADVISORY GOING THROUGH MID EVENING. PRECIP SHOULD TAPER OFF BY 00Z 
WEDNESDAY BUT LOW DECK WILL TAKE A FEW HOURS TO DISSIPATE. GRADIENT 
DROPS OFF LATER THIS EVENING ALLOWING WINDS TO DECOUPLE AND THIS 
SHOULD LEAD TO A QUICKER DROP OFF IN TEMPERATURES. THE FREEZE 
WARNING WILL REMAIN IN PLACE WITH A HARD FREEZE EXPECTED ACROSS THE 
NORTH WHILE MINS ACROSS THE SOUTH WILL EDGE JUST BELOW FREEZING 
TOWARD MORNING. THIS IS SUCH AN ANOMALOUS AIRMASS THAT RECORD MINS 
COULD BE TIED OR EXCEEDED FOR THE DATE AT TRI...TYS AND CHA. DRY AIR 
AND RIDGING WILL BRIGHTEN SPIRITS ON WEDNESDAY WITH FULL SUNSHINE 
EXPECTED. EVEN WITH UNABATED INSOLATION MAX TEMPS WILL STILL BE 
ABOUT TEN DEGREES BELOW NORMAL IN THE LOW TO MID 60S.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL PRODUCE ANOTHER GOOD NIGHT OF RADIATIONAL COOLING 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT...ESPECIALLY ACROSS SHELTERED VALLEYS. MIN 
TEMPERATURES WILL DROP INTO THE UPPER 20S AND LOWER 30S ACROSS MUCH 
OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST TENNESSEE...FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE 
MOUNTAINS AND CHEROKEE AND CLAY COUNTIES OF NORTH CAROLINA. MARGINAL 
FREEZE WATCH FOR THESE AREAS FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT/THURSDAY MORNING 
REMAINS IN PLACE.

A LOW AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH MOVES THROUGH THE OHIO AND UPPER TN 
VALLEYS ON FRIDAY. WEAK FRONT ASSOCIATE WITH THIS FEATURE. MOISTURE 
IS LIMITED WITH THIS SYSTEM. THROWING OUT THE NAM WHICH FAVORS MUCH 
MORE RETURN GULF MOISTURE. CONTINUED WITH A DRIER FORECAST FOR THE 
WEEKEND. SURFACE RIDGING BUILDS IN FROM THE NORTH WITH SOUTHERN 
UPPER RIDGE MOVING EAST ACROSS THE AREA. ALSO LEANED A BIT WARMER 
FOR MINUTES OF SUNSHINE. SHORT WAVE MOVES INTO TN VALLEY ON MONDAY. 
SYSTEM SLIDES SLOWLY THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY TUE. THIS 
IS FOLLOWED BY NW FLOW WHICH COULD KEEP SCATTERED CONVECYION GOING 
INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK.

.AVIATION...500 MB TROUGH LUMBERING EAST TOWARD THE APPALACHIANS

SEVERAL MORE HOURS. PRESSURE GRADIENT GRADUALLY WEAKENS THROUGH THE
EVENING. SO THERE WILL BE SOME MVFR CEILINGS FOR A COUPLE HOURS TO
START THE FORECAST AROUND CHA AND TYS WITH IFR CONDITIONS THROUGH
ABOUT 21Z FOLLOWED BY MVFR CEILING INTO THE MID EVENING PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EDT TUE APR 15 2014

.DISCUSSION...CHILLY AIR STREAMING INTO THE REGION LATE THIS 
MORNING. THE COLD AIR...STRONG NORTHERLY FLOW AND LIGHT RAIN IS 
MAKING IT FEEL RATHER RAW OUT THERE TODAY. THE BACK EDGE OF THE RAIN 
SHIELD IS MIXING WITH AND CHANGING TO SNOW MAINLY IMPACTING HIGHER 
TERRAIN. WENT AHEAD AND JUST MIXED IN A BIT OF SNOW WITH THE RAIN 
ACROSS MUCH OF THE NORTH HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA AS NEGATIVE SEVEN 
TO NEGATIVE EIGHT DEGREE AIR SPILLS INTO THE REGION AT 85H. STILL 
COULD SEE ACCUMULATION AROUND ONE INCH ABOVE 3500 FEET. DON'T EXPECT 
MUCH IN THE WAY OF ACCUMULATION BELOW THIS ELEVATION ALTHOUGH THERE 
COULD BE A DUSTING ON THE GRASS OVER THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU 
INTO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AS THE AFTERNOON PROGRESSES. ADJUSTED THE 
HOURLY TEMPERATURE CURVE BACK SEVERAL DEGREES FOR THE AFTERNOON WITH 
STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION CONTINUING BEHIND THE FRONT. TAPERED 
PRECIP OFF FROM WEST TO EAST THROUGH 00Z WEDNESDAY ACCORDING TO 
MODEL SOLUTION.

FXUS64 KMRX 150822
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
422 AM EDT TUE APR 15 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TONIGHT)...MAIN RAINS HAVE STAYED WELL 
SOUTH...SO WILL FOCUS MAINLY ON THE POST-FRONTAL TEMPERATURES AND 
WIND.

UPGRADING TO FREEZE WARNING FOR TONIGHT FOR ENTIRE AREA. CHATTANOOGA 
AIRPORT MAY ONLY GET TO 30-32 DEGREES WITH WIND BLOWING ACROSS CITY 
HEAT ISLAND...BUT OTHER PARTS OF THE SUBURBS WILL LIKELY GO DOWN 
INTO THE UPPER 20S...SO THINK WARNING FOR EVEN SOUTHERN AREAS LOOKS 
GOOD.

AS THE COLD AIR POURS INTO THE REGION...WIND CHILL VALUES THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING WILL BE IN THE 30S IN THE VALLEY AND IN THE 
20S IN THE MOUNTAINS.  TIMING NOT VERY GOOD FOR SNOW...NOT MUCH 
MOISTURE LEFT AROUND BY THE TIME THE COLDER AIR HITS.  WILL HAVE 
SOME FLURRIES MENTIONED IN THE MOUNTAINS THIS EVENING...BUT NO 
ACCUMULATION INCLUDED.

WILL GO WITH A WIND ADVISORY FOR THE PLATEAU AND EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS...AS WELL AS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY WHERE THE PRESSURE 
GRADIENT WILL BE TIGHTER.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
PRODUCE ANOTHER GOOD NIGHT OF RADIATIONAL COOLING WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT...ESPECIALLY ACROSS SHELTERED VALLEYS. MIN TEMPERATURES WILL 
DROP INTO THE UPPER 20S AND LOWER 30S ACROSS MUCH OF SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST TENNESSEE...FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND 
CHEROKEE AND CLAY COUNTIES OF NORTH CAROLINA. WILL ISSUE A FREEZE 
WATCH FOR THESE AREAS FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT/THURSDAY MORNING.

A LESS AMPLIFIED UPPER FLOW PATTERN CAN BE EXPECTED FOR MOST OF THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD WITH A SERIES OF FAIRLY FAST MOVING SHORT-WAVE 
EJECTING ACROSS THE CENTRAL PLAINS INTO THE GREAT LAKES/OHIO VALLEY 
FOR THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. SURFACE RIDGING INTO THE 
GULF OF MEXICO THIS WEEK WILL LIMIT NORTHWARD MOISTURE RETURN. THE 
LIMITED BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE AND DYNAMICS STAYING GENERALLY NORTH 
OF THE AREA WILL KEEP CHANCES OF RAIN IN LOW CHANCE VARIETY WITH 
BEST CHANCES NORTH AND MOUNTAINS

NEXT AREA OF INTEREST WILL BE DEVELOPING CYCLOGENESIS OVER THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS AS ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE EJECT EASTWARD. THE GFS AND 
ECMWF DISAGREE ON EVOLUTION OF THIS WAVE WITH THE ECMWF A LITTLE 
STRONGER. WILL INCLUDE CHANCE OF SHOWERS FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
MONDAY...BUT OVERALL MODELS ONLY DEPICT A FAIRLY WEAK WAVE FOR NOW.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
936 PM EDT MON APR 14 2014

.DISCUSSION...SKIES ARE CLOUDY ACROSS THE REGION TONIGHT WITH VERY
LITTLE RAIN MAKING IT BACK INTO THE EASTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY SO
FAR. SATELLITE PICTURES REVEALING EXTENSIVE CLOUD SHIELD WITH COLD
FRONT NOW MOVING TOWARD THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND OUT OF MIDDLE
TN. COLD AIR ADVECTION BEHIND FRONT DROPPING TEMPERATURES OVER
WEST AND MIDDLE TN. BEST INSTABILITY AND CONVECTION IN LOWER MS
VALLEY AND AL GULF COAST AT THIS HOUR. PRECIPITATION WILL INCREASE
LATE THIS EVENING OVER THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN VALLEY AND SPREAD
NORTHEAST AND EAST AFTER MIDNIGHT. ADJUSTED RAINFALL AMOUNTS
THROUGH 12Z DOWN SOMEWHAT AND THINK THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE VERY
ISOLATED. WINDS HAVE DECREASED TO LIGHT AS PRESSURE GRADIENT HAS
RELAXED WITH BROAD SURFACE LOW OVER EASTERN KY. WINDS SHOULD PICK
UP FROM THE WEST AND NORTHWEST EARLY TUESDAY. HIGHS FOR THE DAY MAY
COME EARLY COLD AIR ADVECTION BEGINS IN EARNEST. STILL LOOKS LIKE
HARD FREEZE TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY MORNING. WILL FRESHEN WORDING
OF WATCH NEXT FEW MINUTES. UPDATE ALREADY SENT.

880 
FXUS64 KMRX 141913
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT MON APR 14 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...COLD FRONT IS MAKING 
PROGRESS THROUGH THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON AND WILL MOVE 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA LATER THIS EVENING. MODEL INSTABILITY NOT 
TERRIBLY IMPRESSIVE AHEAD OF THE BOUNDARY SO USED CHANCE TYPE 
WORDING FOR CONVECTION IN THE CATEGORICAL POP ENVIRONMENT. THE MASS 
OF SHOWERS WILL ADVANCE SLOWLY ACROSS THE REGION WITH THE HIGHLY 
AMPLIFIED TRAILING UPPER TROUGH. BASICALLY HAVE THE RAIN ENDING 
ACROSS MUCH OF THE WESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA BY MID DAY BUT 
CONTINUING A LITTLE WHILE LONGER ACROSS THE EASTERN SECTION. MUCH 
COLDER AIR SPILLS IN BEHIND THE FRONT. MAX TEMPS WILL PROBABLY BE 
DURING THE MORNING AS STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION CONTINUES THROUGH 
THE DAY. THE TEMPERATURE PROFILE WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR A PERIOD OF 
SNOW SHOWERS AT ELEVATIONS ABOVE 4000 FT TUESDAY AFTERNOON. BY 
EVENING...THE SNOW SHOWERS WILL TAPER OFF ACROSS THE HIGHEST PEAKS 
IN THE SMOKIES. DON'T EXPECT MUCH MORE THAN AN INCH IN THESE AREAS. 
ATTENTION THEN TURNS TO THE POSSIBILITY OF A HARD FREEZE TUESDAY 
NIGHT AS SKIES CLEAR AND WIND SPEED DROPS. MAINTAINED THE FREEZE 
WATCH TO HIGHLIGHT THIS POSSIBILITY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL HAVE 
MOVED IN BY WEDNESDAY BEHIND THE DEPARTED LONG WAVE TROUGH. 
WEDNESDAY'S HIGHS SHOULD BE ROUGHLY 10 TO 12 DEGREES WARMER THAN 
TUESDAY'S WITH TEMPS RANGING FROM THE MID 50S TO LOWER 60S...WHICH 
WILL STILL BE AROUND 8 DEGREES BELOW AVERAGE. BELOW AVERAGE HIGHS ON 
WEDNESDAY...COMBINED WITH CALM AND CLEAR CONDITIONS ON WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT...WILL LEAD TO POSSIBLE FROST ACROSS SOME OF THE NORTHERN 
AREAS. THE MAIN AREAS OF CONCERN WILL LOOK TO BE FROM KNOXVILLE 
NORTH BUT MORE SO ACROSS NETN AND ESPECIALLY FOR SWVA. HIGH PRESSURE 
CONTINUES FOR THURSDAY AND WILL NOW BE TO OUR EAST...RESULTING IN A 
A RETURN TO A MORE SOUTHERLY FLOW. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR TEMPS TO BE 
EVEN WARMER ON THURSDAY WITH HIGHS RANGING FROM THE LOW 60S TO UPPER 
60S. BY THURSDAY NIGHT WE SHOULD BE CLEAR OF ANY FROST DANGER AS 
TEMPS WILL BE IN THE UPPER 40S TOWARD CHATT...LOW TO MID 40S FOR 
KNOX...AND MID TO UPPER 30S ACROSS THE TRI-CITIES. 

HIGH PRESSURE STARTS TO MOVE OFF TO OUR EAST ON FRIDAY AS OUR NEXT 
WEATHER SYSTEM APPROACHES. A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM COMES OUT OF THE 
ROCKIES AND INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS BUT QUICKLY RACES OFF TO THE 
NORTHEAST AND INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION BY FRIDAY NIGHT. THIS MAY 
PROVIDE US WITH SOME SHOWERS THROUGH THE DAY ON FRIDAY AND INTO 
SATURDAY MORNING BUT THE CENTER OF THE LOW IS SO FAR NORTH THAT IT 
SHOULDN'T CAUSE US TOO MANY PROBLEMS OTHER THAN SOME LIGHT RAIN AND 
INCREASED CLOUD COVER. CLOUDS WILL PROBABLY HANG AROUND FOR MOST OF 
THE DAY SATURDAY BUT STARTING TO CLEAR BY LATE AFTERNOON AND INTO 
THE EVENING HOURS.

THE GFS AND ECMWF GREATLY DIFFER ON SUNDAY...GFS SHOWS A WET SUNDAY 
WHILE THE ECMWF IS DRY WITH A WEDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER US. WILL 
KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN PLACE UNTIL MODELS BETTER RESOLVE THEIR 
DIFFERENCES. WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING THROUGH MONDAY AS 
MODELS SHOW YET ANOTHER SYSTEM APPROACHING DURING THIS TIMEFRAME 
WITH A WAVE COMING OUT OF THE NORTHWEST. SATURDAY AND SUNDAYS HIGHS 
RANGE FROM THE MID AND UPPER 60S TO THE LOW 70S. CONDITIONS WILL 
BEGIN TO CLEAR MONDAY AFTERNOON AS HIGH PRESSURE STARTS TO BUILD 
BACK IN WITH TEMPS SIMILAR TO SAT AND SUN.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             48  52  30  64 / 100  60   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  47  50  27  61 / 100  80   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       48  49  27  60 / 100  80   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              51  53  25  60 / 100  90  10   0 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...FREEZE WATCH FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING FOR 
     CHEROKEE-CLAY.

TN...FREEZE WATCH FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING FOR 
     ANDERSON-BLEDSOE-BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS-BRADLEY-CAMPBELL-
     CLAIBORNE-COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS-EAST POLK-GRAINGER-HAMBLEN-
     HAMILTON-HANCOCK-HAWKINS-JEFFERSON-JOHNSON-KNOX-LOUDON-
     MARION-MCMINN-MEIGS-MORGAN-NW BLOUNT-NORTH SEVIER-NORTHWEST 
     CARTER-NORTHWEST COCKE-NORTHWEST GREENE-NORTHWEST MONROE-
     RHEA-ROANE-SCOTT TN-SEQUATCHIE-SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS-
     SOUTHEAST CARTER-SOUTHEAST GREENE-SOUTHEAST MONROE-SULLIVAN-

FXUS64 KMRX 141719
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
119 PM EDT MON APR 14 2014

.AVIATION...PRECIPITATION WITH FIRST SHORT WAVE JUST ABOUT OUT OF
THE PICTURE AT THE TERMINALS AS BACK EDGE NEARING TYS AND DOWNSLOPE
COMPONENT CONTINUES TO ERADICATE RAIN AT THE NORTHERN END OF THE
GREAT VALLEY. SHOULD BE QUITE A FEW HOURS OF VFR FLIGHT CONDITIONS
UNTIL LATER THIS EVENING WHEN SHOWERS AND A COUPLE THUNDERSTORMS
MOVE BACK ACROSS THE VALLEY IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE COLD FRONT. HAD
TO MAINTAIN LIGHT RAIN WELL INTO TUESDAY MORNING DUE TO THE SHARP
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH TRAILING BEHIND THE SURFACE FRONT. IT CERTAINLY
WILL BE BREEZY AT TIMES DURING THE FORECAST PERIOD...ESPECIALLY ON
TUESDAY WITH TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT INDICATED BY THE MODELS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1015 AM EDT MON APR 14 2014

.DISCUSSION...LEAD SHORTWAVE MAKING PROGRESS INTO THE WESTERN HALF 
OF THE VIEWING AREA THIS MORNING. RADAR REFLECTIVITY NOT REAL 
IMPRESSIVE AND SURFACE OBS REVEAL THAT THE RAIN IS QUITE LIGHT. LIFT 
WITH THIS INITIAL FEATURE IS RATHER WEAK. THE HEALTHY SOUTHERLY 85H 
FLOW ACROSS THE TERRAIN COULD REDUCE THE PRECIPITATION ACROSS 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE TO JUST A FEW DROPS OF RAIN AS THE WAVE WORKS 
EAST. THE NAM LOOKS LIKE IT HAS A PRETTY DECENT GRASP OF THE 
SITUATION WITH THE WEAK AFTERNOON SHORTWAVE FOLLOWED BY A BETTER 
CHANCE OF RAIN IN SHOWERS WITH SOME THUNDER AHEAD OF THE STRONG COLD 
FRONT. HOWEVER...THIS PRECIP DOESN'T ENTER THE WESTERN HORIZON UNTIL 
CLOSE TO 00Z TUESDAY. CURRENT POPS IN THE GRIDS ARE ACTUALLY PRETTY 
GOOD WITH THE DECREASING TREND NORTHEASTERN SECTIONS OF THE VIEWING 
AREA WITH THE MAIN EVENT AROUND 00Z TUESDAY AND LATER. NOT REAL 
CONFIDENT IN THE ATMOSPHERE'S ABILITY TO PRODUCE CONVECTION ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE SO WILL REMOVE THIS 
WORDING HERE. TEMPERATURE FORECAST WILL BE DIFFICULT WITH 
TEMPERATURES QUITE MILD THIS MORNING BUT THE MID DECK WILL KEEP 
SUNSHINE AT BAY FOR A FEW HOURS THIS MORNING WEST BEFORE SOME BREAKS 
APPEAR WHILE THE EASTERN HALF WILL KEEP A MID DECK FOR A LITTLE 
WHILE LONGER INTO THE AFTERNOON.

.AVIATION...FLIGHT CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE TO DETEORIATE ACROSS CHA

WILL DROP TO MVFR AND IFR AT CHA DURING THE EVENING. FLIGHT 
CONDITIONS WILL DROP TO IFR AT TYS AND CHA AFTER 06Z.

PRODUCE BREEZY SOUTHWEST WINDS THROUGH THE PERIOD...ESPECIALLY 
DURING THE AFTERNOON TODAY AND IN/NEAR STORMS.

COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TAF SITES OVERNIGHT (CHA 04Z...TYS 
06Z AND TRI 08Z). WINDS WILL BECOME NORTHWEST 12-17KTS WITH GUSTS UP 
TO 25KTS AT CHA AND TYS.

818 
FXUS64 KMRX 140744
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
344 AM EDT MON APR 14 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A LARGE AREA OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WILL
CONTINUE INTO THE AREA THIS MORNING. THIS AREA OF RAIN WILL SLOWLY
DIMINISH IN COVERAGE THIS AFTERNOON WITH ONLY SCATTERED CONVECTION
EXPECTED DURING THE REST OF THE AFTERNOON.

MAIN DYNAMICS WITH UPPER JET AND ASSOCIATED FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE REGION OVERNIGHT AND EASTERN AREAS WEDNESDAY
MORNING. WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND AGAIN SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS ARE
ANTICIPATED. SOME STRONG THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED WITH THE MAIN
CONCERN BEING STRONG/GUSTY WINDS AND HEAVY RAINS. 

STRONG COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA BETWEEN 06-12Z TONIGHT
WITH COLD AIR ADVECTION FOR WEDNESDAY. VERTICAL PROFILE WILL
SUPPORT THE RAIN CHANGING TO SNOW OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THE
HIGHEST PEAKS COULD SEE MINOR SNOW ACCUMULATIONS. HIGHS WEDNESDAY
WILL BE IN THE MORNING...THEN DROP DURING THE DAY.

.LONG TERM /TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY/... 
IN THE WAKE OF A COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE REGION ON TUESDAY... 
STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL TAKE PLACE AS BRISK NORTHERLY WINDS 
PUSH COOLER AND DRY AIR INTO THE FORECAST AREA. THIS WILL RESULT IN 
A HARD AND POTENTIALLY KILLING FREEZE ACROSS A VAST MAJORITY OF THE 
FORECAST AREA /PARTICULARLY ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE AND INTO THE CENTRAL VALLEY WHERE READINGS IN THE 23 TO 28 
DEGREE RANGE MAY BE COMMON/. ADDITIONALLY...NEARLY ALL OF OF THE 
SOUTHERN VALLEY WILL DROP TO AROUND 30 DEGREES...WITH SOME SHELTERED 
VALLEYS THERE DIPPING INTO THE UPPER 20S. GIVEN THE HIGH IMPACT AN 
EVENT LIKE THIS WILL HAVE TO CROPS AND PLANTS...THOSE WITH 
AGRICURTUAL INTERESTS SHOULD ESPECIALLY TAKE MEASURES TO PROTECT ALL 
TENDER VEGETATION.

AFTER A COOL DAY ON WEDNESDAY WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 
60S...AN ADDTIONAL LIGHT FREEZE AND FROST SEEMS PROBABLE FOR 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT FOR MUCH OF THE AREA AGAIN /AND POSSIBLY EVEN 
THURSDAY NIGHT ACROSS THE NORTHEAST ZONES/. HOWEVER...A GRADUAL 
WARMING TREND IS EXPECTED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WORK WEEK AS 
WINDS VEER TO THE SOUTHWEST AND HIGHS RETURN TO THE UPPER 60S AND 
LOWER 70S BY THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. ANOTHER WEAK FRONT WILL MOVE 
THROUGH THE AREA ON FRIDAY AS WELL...BRINGING A DECENT CHANCE FOR 
SCATTERED SHOWERS FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT. HOWEVER...RIDGING WILL 
QUICKLY RETURN FOR SATURDAY...ALONG WITH CLEARER CONDITIONS AND 
SLIGHTLY WARMER TEMPERATURES. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       74  44  48  28 /  80 100  70  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              75  51  52  25 /  60 100  90  10

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1011 PM EDT SUN APR 13 2014

.DISCUSSION...HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS ARE INCREASING OUT AHEAD OF
SIGNIFICANT FRONTAL SYSTEM NOW MOVING INTO THE MID MS VALLEY AND
SOUTHERN PLAINS. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OUT AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM
HAVE REACHED EASTERN ARKANSAS AND WILL BE MOVING INTO WEST TN THE
NEXT FEW HOURS. INITIAL SHORTWAVE IS EXPECTED TO SPREAD LARGE AREA
OF SHOWERS AND STORMS EAST OVERNIGHT REACHING WESTERN PARTS OF THE
CWA BY MORNING. THIS AREA WILL DECREASE IN INTENSITY AS IT
APPROACHES. TEMPERATURES AT THIS HOUR ARE MILD IN THE UPPER 60S
MOUNTAINS AND LOWER TO MID 70S VALLEYS. TEMPERATURES SHOULD ONLY
DROP ABOUT 10 DEGREES OR SO AS SOUTH WINDS STAY UP AND CLOUDS
INCREASE AND LOWER. UPDATED HOURLY TEMPERATURE AND DEW POINT GRIDS
AND ALSO SLOWED THE BEGINNING OF THE PRECIPITATION SLIGHTLY.

714 
FXUS64 KMRX 131932
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EDT SUN APR 13 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...OVERVIEW...A WET SHORT 
TERM PERIOD WILL ENSUE AS OUR NEXT WEATHER SYSTEM APPROACHES. A 
SHORTWAVE ROTATING THROUGH THE LONGWAVE TROUGH WILL FIRST IMPACT US 
ON MONDAY MORNING WITH THE LONGWAVE TROUGH TO FOLLOW MONDAY NIGHT 
INTO TUESDAY. BOTH OF THESE FEATURES WILL BRING WIDESPREAD RAIN 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WITH A BETTER CHANCE OF STRONGER STORMS  
WITH THE ARRIVAL OF THE LONGWAVE TROUGH DUE TO HIGHER INSTABILITY 
VALUES. 

THE LATEST GFS HAS SLOWED A LITTLE BIT ON THE ARRIVAL TIME OF THE 
FIRST SHORTWAVE WITH THE NAM STILL HAVING AN EVEN LATER ARRIVAL 
TIME. SO CURRENT THINKING IS THAT SHOWERS WON'T GET INTO THE PLATEAU 
COUNTIES UNTIL WELL AFTER MIDNIGHT...PERHAPS AS LATE AS 08/09Z AND 
THEN CONTINUE TO SPREAD EASTWARD INTO THE VALLEY. SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE DAY IN RESPONSE TO THIS 
FIRST SHORTWAVE BUT IT APPEARS THAT AN EVEN BETTER CHANCE FOR 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL COME DURING THE EVENING HOURS AND OVERNIGHT 
MONDAY AS INSTABILITY INCREASES OUT AHEAD OF THE LONG WAVE TROUGH 
AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT. HIGHER INSTABILITY VALUES WILL BE IN 
PLACE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY AS OPPOSED TO NETN AND INTO SWVA. 
STILL...ENOUGH CAPE SHOULD SHOULD BE PRESENT TO SUPPORT A FEW STRONG 
TO POSSIBLY SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS JUST OUT AHEAD OF THE LONG WAVE 
TROUGH. MEAN WINDS APPEAR TO BE MOSTLY PARALLEL TO THE FRONT SO THIS 
WOULD SUGGEST A LINEAR EVENT. IT IS LIKELY THAT WE WILL SEE A LINE 
OF SHOWERS AND STORMS DEVELOP IN THE LATE AFTERNOON TO OUR WEST AND 
MOVE THROUGH OUR AREA DURING THE EVENING AND INTO THE OVERNIGHT 
HOURS. SHEAR...HELICITY...AND LCL VALUES LOOK GOOD ENOUGH THAT AN 
ISOLATED TORNADO CAN'T BE RULED OUT BUT THE MAIN THREAT HOWEVER 
APPEARS TO BE GUSTY STRAIGHT LINE WINDS. THE HAIL THREAT DOESN'T 
LOOK TOO GREAT BUT SMALL HAIL LOOKS POSSIBLE...UP TO HALF AN INCH. 
THE BEST CHANCE AT SEEING STRONGER STORMS LOOKS TO BE BETWEEN 00 AND 
06 UTC. 

THE SEVERE THREAT WILL TAPER OFF ONCE THE LINE OF SHOWERS AND STORMS 
MOVE THROUGH. THE COLD FRONT DOESN'T MOVE THOUGH UNTIL TUESDAY 
MORNING BUT SHOWERY ACTIVITY WILL LIKELY CONTINUE UNTIL THE FRONT IS 
OFF TO OUR EAST...WHICH SHOULD BE SOMETIME TUESDAY AFTERNOON. LOOK 
FOR CONDITIONS TO SLOWLY IMPROVE BY LATE TUESDAY AFTERNOON WITH 
CLEARING SKIES EXPECTED ACROSS OUR WESTERN COUNTIES AND GRADUALLY 
WORKING THEIR WAY EASTWARD. TUESDAY WILL BE MUCH COOLER AS A BRIEF 
BLAST OF COLDER AIR MOVES INTO OUR AREA BEHIND THE FRONT. TEMPS WILL 
BE IN THE 50S ON TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER TROUGH MOVES AWAY 
TUESDAY NIGHT WITH A COUPLE SHOWERS STILL POSSIBLE ACROSS A PART OF 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND EXTREME NORTHEAST TENNESSEE DURING THE 
EVENING. SHOULD BE A CHILLY NIGHT WITH WELL BELOW NORMAL MIN TEMPS 
EXPECTED. FREEZING TEMPERATURES ARE POSSIBLE ACROSS MOST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA UNDER CLEARING SKIES. A DRY REGIME UNDER THE INFLUENCE 
OF RIDGING IS STILL IN STORE FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. ECM/GFS 
HAVE COME INTO A LITTLE BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE UPPER TROUGH 
EXPECTED ON FRIDAY ALTHOUGH THE GFS IS A LITTLE QUICKER TO BRING A 
SURFACE BOUNDARY INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. WENT CLOSER TO THIS 
CONCEPT WITH POPS INCREASING TO MEDIUM CHANCE BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON 
WITH A SLOW DEPARTURE OF THE SYSTEM HANGING ONTO SLIGHT AND LOW 
CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS THROUGH THE DAYTIME PERIOD SATURDAY. DRIER 
WESTERLY FLOW BUILDS IN FOR SUNDAY TO COMPLETE THE WEEKEND WITH 
IMPROVED WEATHER.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             61  72  49  56 /  40  90  90  70 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  60  74  49  54 /  20  80  90  90 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       60  72  48  55 /  20  80  90  70 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              54  73  51  55 /  10  60  90  90

542 
FXUS64 KMRX 130650
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 AM EDT SUN APR 13 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE
OVER THE EXTREME SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES WITH MID-LEVEL INVERSION
KEEPING CONVECTION CHANCES LIMITED/NIL TODAY. TIGHTENING PRESSURE
GRADIENT OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AHEAD OF UPPER TROUGH OVER THE 
PLAIN STATES WILL PRODUCE BREEZY SOUTHWEST WINDS BETWEEN 10 AND 20
MPH WITH GUSTS AROUND 25 MPH FOR THIS AFTERNOON.

FOR TONIGHT...UPPER FORCING FROM INCOMING UPPER TROUGH WILL PULL
SCATTERED SHOWERS INTO THE PLATEAU TOWARD MONDAY MORNING.
OTHERWISE...INCREASING CLOUDS ANTICIPATED...ESPECIALLY AFTER
MIDNIGHT WITH MILD OVERNIGHT LOWS.

.LONG TERM /MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY/...A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL
MOVE IN FROM THE WEST LATE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY...BRINGING A
HIGH POTENTIAL FOR PRECIPITATION EARLY NEXT WEEK. TRENDS CONTINUE
TO SUPPORT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MOVING INTO THE REGION WELL
AFTER SUNRISE ON MONDAY...FROM THE LATE MORNING THOUGH THE MID TO
LATE AFTERNOON. THEN...AN ADDITIONAL ROUND OF STRONG TO LOCALLY
SEVERE STORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE DURING THE EVENING HOURS INTO THE
NIGHT AS ANOTHER LONGWAVE TROUGH DRAGS A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE
AREA. MODELS ARE HINTING AT A QLCS FEATURE TRACKING FROM MIDDLE
TENNESSEE AND NORTHERN ALABAMA INTO THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND
EVENTUALLY INTO THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY BETWEEN 00-06Z
TUESDAY. THE PRIMARY QUESTION REMAINS HOW MUCH AVAILABLE
INSTABILITY THERE WILL BE. ATTM...IT DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE VERY
APPRECIABLE GIVEN THE TIMING OF THIS ACTIVITY AND A SOMEWHAT WORKED
OVER ATMOSPHERE FROM EARLIER CONVECTION. HOWEVER...A 40-50 KT LOW-
LEVEL JET ROTATING OVER THE REGION WILL SUPPORT GOOD BULK SHEAR
VALUES AND LINEAR STORM ORGANIZATION. AS A RESULT SOME GUSTY
STRAIGHT LINES WINDS AND PERHAPS AN ISOLATED TORNADO COULD BE
POSSIBLE WITH THE STRONGEST ACTIVITY.

BY LATE MONDAY NIGHT...THE SEVERE THREAT WILL DIMINISH AS THE LINE 
TRACKS EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS. HOWEVER...SOME POST-FRONTAL SHOWERS 
WILL STILL BE POSSIBLE THROUGH MIDDAY BEFORE THINGS TAPER OFF AND 
THE SKY RAPIDLY BEGINS TO CLEAR. THE COOL AND DRY AIR MASS THAT WILL 
FOLLOW WILL KNOCK HIGHS WELL BELOW SEASONABLE NORMALS FOR 
TUESDAY...AS TEMPERATURES WILL PEAK IN THE 50S IN MOST LOCATIONS. 
ADDITIONALLY...A CLEAR...COOL AND CALM NIGHT WILL RESULT IN A 
FREEZE/FROST FOR A GOOD PORTION OF THE REGION TUESDAY NIGHT AS LOWS 
BOTTOM OUT IN THE MID 20S TO LOWER 30S. AN ADDITIONAL FROST MAY BE 
POSSIBLE ACROSS FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AS 
WELL WEDNESDAY NIGHT. HIGHS WILL GRADUALLY INCREASE BACK INTO 
THE 60S AND LOWER 70S BY THURSDAY AS UPPER-RIDGING BUILDS BACK IN 
BRIEFLY. ANOTHER STORM SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO IMPACT THE AREA FRIDAY 
AND FRIDAY NIGHT...WHICH COULD BRING ANOTHER ROUND OF SHOWERS AND 
STORMS TO KICKOFF THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND.

196 
FXUS64 KMRX 121926
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EDT SAT APR 12 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE 
TO SLOWLY BUILD OVERNIGHT OUT AHEAD OF AN ADVANCING LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM AND LONG WAVE TROUGH. EXPECT CLEAR AND CALM CONDITIONS 
OVERNIGHT WITH TEMPS 5 TO 8 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF 
YEAR.

HEIGHTS CONTINUE TO BUILD ON SUNDAY AS THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM AND 
LONG WAVE TROUGH GET CLOSER TO OUR AREA. THIS SHOULDN'T IMPACT 
SUNDAY'S WEATHER THOUGH AS CONDITIONS WILL BE SIMILAR TO TODAY'S 
WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES AND TEMPERATURES ROUGHLY 10 DEGREES ABOVE 
NORMAL. INCREASING HEIGHTS AND SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL LIKELY LEAD TO 
SOME IF NOT MANY AREAS SEEING THE WARMEST TEMPERATURES OF THE YEAR.
 
CLOUDS BEGIN TO INCREASE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY AS THE 
AFOREMENTIONED LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES IN FROM THE WEST. THE LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH MONDAY/MONDAY AFTERNOON WITH THE LONG 
WAVE TROUGH JUST BEHIND IT BUT NOT ROLLING THROUGH UNTIL DURING THE 
LONG TERM PERIOD OF THE FORECAST. MONDAY'S SYSTEM DOESN'T APPEAR TO 
BE HIGHLY ORGANIZED AND INSTABILITY VALUES STILL DON'T LOOK 
IMPRESSIVE ACROSS OUR AREA. AT THIS TIME...BETTER CHANCES FOR 
STRONGER STORMS WILL LIKELY BE BACK TO OUR WEST AND SOUTHWEST WHERE 
INSTABILITY VALUES ARE HIGHER. HOWEVER...THERE WILL STILL BE ENOUGH 
SHEAR ACROSS OUR AREA THAT IF WE CAN GET A LITTLE INSTABILITY WE 
COULD POSSIBLY SEE SOME STRONGER STORMS. WILL HAVE TO CLOSELY 
MONITOR FUTURE MODEL RUNS TO SEE HOW THEY HANDLE INSTABILITY VALUES. 
ALSO...SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES IN ARRIVAL TIME STILL EXISTS BETWEEN 
MODELS. THE LATEST NAM IS SLOWER WHILE THE GFS IS QUICKER. WILL 
TREND TOWARD THE QUICKER GFS FOR NOW.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODEL SOLUTIONS SIMILAR 
THROUGH MUCH OF THE PERIOD HOWEVER...DIVERGENCE OF OPINION NOTED 
TOWARD THE END OF THE LONG TERM...FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. STAYED 
CLOSER TO THE GFS FOR THE LATER PERIODS. THE MAIN EVENT WILL BE THE 
THE RATHER STRONG FRONTAL SYSTEM DRIVEN BY A HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER 
TROUGH. CATEGORICAL POPS CONTINUE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
THROUGH THE EARLY MORNING HOURS TUESDAY UNTIL THE SURFACE COLD FRONT 
MOVES EAST OF THE TERRAIN. MUCH COLDER AIR FOLLOWS THE BOUNDARY 
KEEPING TEMPERATURES A GOOD TEN TO FIFTEEN DEGREES BELOW NORMAL ON 
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY FOLLOWED BY A GRADUAL WARMING TREND WHICH 
ALLOWS FOR A RETURN TO SEASONAL TEMPERATURES BY FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. 
AGAIN...MODELS DISSIMILAR DURING THIS PERIOD BUT THE GFS SHOWS 
ARRIVAL OF ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY. DUE TO 
UNCERTAINTY DURING THIS PERIOD JUST ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR 
SHOWERS LATE FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY FOR THIS POSSIBILITY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

054 
FXUS64 KMRX 120649
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
249 AM EDT SAT APR 12 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AREA OF CONVECTION HAS FINALLY
DISSIPATED. TEMPERATURE/DEWPOINT SPREAD QUITE CLOSE OVER THE
PLATEAU AND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE DUE TO THE RECENT RAINS. WILL
INCLUDE PATCHY FOG THERE THIS MORNING.

A STATIONARY FRONT WAS LOCATED ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST
TENNESSEE EARLY THIS MORNING. THIS BOUNDARY WILL PULL NORTHEAST
TODAY AND TONIGHT. MODELS SHOW INCREASING 800MB WARMING WITH AN
INVERSION SETTING UP ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA
FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND INTO THE REST OF THE AREA OVERNIGHT. CAN NOT
RULE OUT A FEW SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA
THIS AFTERNOON...BUT CONFIDENCE TO IS TOO LOW TO INCLUDE.

OTHERWISE...BESIDES SOME HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS...A SUNNY DAY IS IN
STORE WITH WARM AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES. FOLLOWED GFS MOS CLOSELY.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...
AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE CAROLINA WILL BE
THE PREDOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE OVER THE REGION FOR
SUNDAY...PROMOTING WARM/MOIST SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW AND DRY...SUNNY
CONDITIONS. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR ANOTHER WARM DAY /PERHAPS THE
WARMEST OF THE YEAR SO FAR FOR MANY AREAS/...AS HIGHS WILL PEAK IN
THE LOWER 80S IN MANY LOCATIONS. HOWEVER...A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM
WILL MOVE IN FROM THE WEST LATE SUNDAY NIGHT...BRINGING A HIGH
POTENTIAL FOR PRECIPITATION EARLY NEXT WEEK. AT THIS TIME...IT
APPEARS THAT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION
WELL AFTER SUNRISE ON MONDAY...FROM THE LATE MORNING THOUGH THE MID
TO LATE AFTERNOON. DEPENDING ON THE TIMING OF THIS ACTIVITY AND
AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY THAT IS AVAILABLE...SOME OF THESE STORMS
COULD BECOME STRONG TO SEVERE DURING THE DAY GIVEN THE STRONG WIND
SHEAR IN PLACE.

A LONGWAVE TROUGH WILL THEN SLIDE INTO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY 
MONDAY EVENING...AND HELP TO GENERATE LIFT AND THUS AN ADDITIONAL 
ROUND OF SHOWERS MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY MORNING...BEFORE THE 
PRECIPITATION RAPIDLY TAPERS OFF FROM WEST TO EAST TUESDAY 
AFTERNOON. A MUCH COOLER AND DRIER AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE AREA IN 
IT'S WAKE...RESULTING IN A FREEZE/FROST FOR A GOOD PORTION OF THE 
REGION TUESDAY NIGHT. AS A RESULT...HAVE ADDED THIS TO THE GRIDS 
DURING THAT PERIOD. HIGHS WILL BE ABNORMALLY COOL FOR MOST OF THE 
WEEK...PEAKING IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY...BEFORE A WARMING TREND OCCURS AS A HIGH BUILDS IN LATE 
IN THE WEEK. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
322 PM EDT FRI APR 11 2014


.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY/...SYSTEM TO OUR NORTH THAT WAS 
EXPECTED TO SETTLE OVER OUR NORTHERN SECTIONS NOW SEEMS CONTENT TO 
MAINLY STAY TO OUR NORTH.  HAVE SLIGHT POPS THIS EVENING...THEN DRY 
FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEKEND AS THE UPPER RIDGE SWELLS SLIGHTLY 
NORTHWARD.  SHOULD BE BREEZY OVER THE WEEKEND...SO FIRE WEATHER 
STILL A SLIGHT CONCERN...ALTHOUGH THE HUMIDITY VALUES WILL BE HIGHER 
AS GULF MOISTURE CONTINUES TO FLOW INTO THE AREA.  STAYED PRETTY 
CLOSE TO GUIDANCE ON TEMPS...USED A MIX OF NAM/GFS MOS FOR DEWPOINTS 
WITH A FEW TWEAKS LOWER AT A FEW LOCATIONS/TIMES.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS RELATIVELY CLOSE 
IN DEPICTION OF EXPECTED WEATHER EARLY BUT THE ECMWF APPEARS MUCH 
TOO AMPLIFIED AND THUS SLOWER AT MID WEEK SO WENT CLOSER TO THE GFS 
SOLUTION HERE. MODELS STILL INDICATE AN INITIAL SHORT WAVE MOVES 
FROM THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY DURING THE 
DAY MONDAY. A SHARP AND SLOW MOVING FRONTAL BOUNDARY BUILDS INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA AT THIS TIME. SLOWED THE ARRIVAL OF PRECIP JUST A BIT 
DURING THE DAY MONDAY FAVORING MUCH HIGHER POPS CLOSER TO THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. MODELS REALLY NOT SHOWING A GREAT DEAL OF 
INSTABILITY WITH THIS EVENT SO APPLIED JUST A CHANCE FOR CONVECTION 
IN CONJUNCTION WITH LIKELY PROBABILITY OF SHOWERS MONDAY INTO MONDAY 
NIGHT. THE COLD FRONT PRESSES EAST ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS TOWARD 
MIDNIGHT BUT MODELS STILL SHOW THE MAIN 500 MB UPPER TROUGH TRAILING 
WELL TO THE WEST. DEEP MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FEATURE SHOULD 
KEEP A HIGH LIKELIHOOD FOR SHOWERS GOING THROUGH THE DAY TUESDAY 
WITH THE PRECIPITATION TAPERING OFF LATER IN THE AFTERNOON. ENTIRE 
FORECAST AREA SHOULD BE PRECIP FREE BY MIDNIGHT. DRY...ALBEIT 
COOL...WESTERLY FLOW BEHIND THIS SYSTEM ENSURES A DRY WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY. MODELS NOT ON THE SAME PAGE FOR FRIDAY WITH THE GFS 
BRINGING ANOTHER SHORT WAVE INTO THE PICTURE LATER IN THE DAY 
FRIDAY. DUE TO UNCERTAINTY STAYED CLOSER TO THE LESS ENERGETIC ECMWF 
AT THIS TIME. THUS...STAYING WITH A DRY FORECAST THROUGH FRIDAY 
NIGHT.

DEWPOINTS HAVE INCREASED SOME THE PAST 12 HOURS...BUT EXPECT
ANOTHER DAY OF GOOD MIXING ALLOWING AFTERNOON RELATIVE HUMIDITIES
TO DROP INTO THE UPPER 20S TO MIDDLE 30S. ALSO...BOUNDARY LAYER
MIXING AND TIGHTENING PRESSURE GRADIENTS WILL PRODUCE SUSTAINED
SOUTHWEST WINDS OF 10 TO 20 MPH WITH GUSTS TO 25 MPH. BOTH LOW
HUMIDITIES AND BREEZY CONDITIONS WILL INCREASE FIRE DANGER
CONDITIONS AGAIN TODAY.

A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE OHIO VALLEY WILL APPROACH THE NORTHERN
AREAS THIS AFTERNOON/EVENING BEFORE BECOMING QUASI-STATIONARY
OVERNIGHT. NAM/GFS SHOW ENOUGH INSTABILITY TO PRODUCE SCATTERED
SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A THUNDERSTORM OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND
NORTHERN TENNESSEE LATE AFTERNOON/EVENING.

OTHERWISE...ZONAL FLOW PATTERN WILL BRING IN A GOOD DEAL OF
HIGH/MID LEVEL CLOUDS AND WARM AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM /SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY/...
AN UPPER-RIDGE AXIS WILL BE THE PREDOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE OVER THE 
REGION THIS WEEKEND...PROMOTING WARM CONDITIONS AS HIGHS WILL PEAK 
IN THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S IN MOST LOCATIONS. A WEAK FRONT WILL 
APPROACH THE AREA FROM THE OHIO VALLEY ON SATURDAY...BUT WILL WEAKEN 
SUBSTANTIALLY AS IT MOVES INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. OTHER THAN SOME 
EARLY MORNING CLOUD COVER AND PERHAPS AN ISOLATED SPRINKLE...DO NOT 
ANTICIPATE ANY IMPACTS FROM THIS WEAK SYSTEM. A MUCH STRONGER STORM 
SYSTEM WILL IMPACT THE REGION EARLY NEXT WEEK...BRINGING A HIGH 
POTENTIAL FOR PRECIPIATION /AND PERHAPS SOME LOCALLY HEAVY 
RAINFALL/. THIS ACTIVITY WILL APPROACH THE AREA FROM THE WEST LATE 
SUNDAY NIGHT AND OVERSPREAD THE REGION ON MONDAY IN THE FORM OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. DEPENDING ON THE AMOUNT OF INSTABLITY 
THAT IS AVIALABLE...SOME OF THESE STORMS COULD BECOME STRONG TO 
SEVERE DURING THE DAY...GIVEN THE STRONG WIND SHEAR IN PLACE. AN 
ADDITIONAL LONGWAVE TROUGH WILL THEN SLIDE INTO THE LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY MONDAY EVENING...AND HELP TO GENERATE AN 
ADDITIONAL ROUND OF SHOWERS MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY MORNING... 
BEFORE THINGS TAPER OFF AREAWIDE BY THE AFTERNOON. IN IT'S 
WAKE...MUCH COOLER AND DRIER AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE REGION. THIS 
COULD RESULT IN A FREEZE/FROST FOR A GOOD PORTION OF THE REGION 
TUESDAY NIGHT...AND PERHAPS PORTIONS OF THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL 
VALLEY WEDNESDAY NIGHT GIVEN THE CLEAR CONDITIONS. HIGHS DURING THIS 
PERIOD WILL BE ABNORMALLY COOL...PEAKING IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 
60S...BEFORE A WARMING TREND OCCURS AS A HIGH BUILDS IN LATE NEXT 
WEEK. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             76  51  80  56 /   0  10   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  75  51  78  56 /  10  10  10   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       76  52  79  56 /  10  10  10   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              75  46  74  50 /  20  20  10  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 PM EDT THU APR 10 2014

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY/...VERY DRY AND BREEZY 
CONDITIONS CONTINUE THIS AFTERNOON...BUT THIS EVENING HUMIDITY 
VALUES SHOULD RECOVER PRETTY WELL AS GULF MOISTURE SPREADS ACROSS 
THE AREA.  THEN ON FRIDAY HUMIDITY VALUES SHOULD NOT FALL NEARLY AS 
MUCH.  WEAK SYSTEM SAGGING INTO THE NORTHERN PARTS OF THE AREA WILL 
INCREASE THE CHANCES FOR SHOWERS OVER THE NORTH FOR FRIDAY AFTERNOON 
AND FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT PRETTY MINIMAL PRECIP AMOUNTS EXPECTED WITH 
IT. WENT CLOSE TO GUIDANCE ON TEMPS OVERALL.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...THE UPPER LEVEL 
PATTERN WILL BECOME INCREASINGLY AMPLIFIED DURING THE BEGINNING OF 
THE WEEK WITH RIDGING OVER THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE NATION WITH A 
TROUGH OUT WEST. THE FORECAST AREA WILL ENJOY THE WARMEST DAY OF THE 
LONG TERM PERIOD ON SUNDAY AS WINDS INCREASE OUT OF THE SOUTH AHEAD 
OF A STRENGTHENING FRONTAL SYSTEM...COMPLIMENTS OF THE AMPLIFIED 
WESTERN TROUGH. ALONG WITH THE MILD AIR WILL COME INCREASING 
MOISTURE OFF THE GULF OF MEXICO. STRENGTHENING WIND FIELDS ALONG 
WITH AN INCREASE IN INSTABILITY DURING THE DAY MONDAY SHOULD LEAD TO 
THE DEVELOPMENT OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM 
COLD FRONT. THE FRONT SHIFTS INTO THE CAROLINAS BY MONDAY EVENING 
BUT TRAILING SHORT WAVE ENERGY AND ASSOCIATED DEEP MOISTURE APPEAR 
TO KEEP THE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS GOING MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY WHEN 
THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS FINALLY MOVES ONTO THE EASTERN SEABOARD. DRIER 
AIR SPILLS IN BEHIND THE DEPARTING TROUGH THE NORTHWESTERLY WIND 
FLOW WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES WELL BELOW NORMAL ON TUESDAY. A GRADUAL 
WARMING TREND MY ALLOW FOR TEMPERATURES A LITTLE CLOSER TO NORMAL BY 
THURSDAY.

TEMPERATURES CONTINUE WITH RELATIVELY DRY AND WARM SOUTHWESTERLY
FLOW THROUGH LATE SUNDAY. SOUTHERN SHORT WAVE AND NORTHERN STREAM
NEARLY PHASE FROM TENNESSEE VALLEY TO THE NORTHERN GULF BY LATE IN
THE WEEKEND. WET PERIOD EARLY NEXT WEEK WITH CHANCE OF STRONG
THUNDERSTORMS ON MONDAY. COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH MONDAY EVENING.

FOR THE MID WEEK. MINIMUM TEMPERATURES DROPPING INTO THE 30S LIKELY
ACROSS NORTHERN VALLEYS AND THE MOUNTAINS TUE AND WED MORNING.

092 
FXUS64 KMRX 091924
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 PM EDT WED APR 9 2014

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND THURSDAY/... HIGH PRESSURE NOW BUILDING 
INTO THE AREA...CLOUDS CONTINUE TO DIMINISH...BUT CUMULUS HOLDING ON 
FOR THE AFTERNOON...BUT SHOULD DISSIPATE QUICKLY AS SOON AS SURFACE 
STARTS TO COOL TOWARD EVENING.  DEW POINTS FOR TONIGHT AND TOMORROW 
NEVER REALLY FALL AS FAR AS A USUAL POST-FRONTAL SETTING...SO 
INITIALLY LOOKED LIKE WE MIGHT HAVE GOOD CUMULUS FIELD AGAIN 
TOMORROW...BUT MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW A STRONG SUBSIDENCE INVERSION 
SETTLING OVER THE AREA THAT MAY LIMIT DEVELOPMENT...BUT LOOKING AS 
SCT CLOUDS AT MOST ANYWAY FOR TOMORROW.  

WINDS SHOULD SUBSIDE AS WELL QUICKLY THIS EVENING...ALLOWING GOOD 
RADIATIONAL COOLING.  PUTTING IN PATCHY FROST OVER IN THE NERN AND 
SERN SECTIONS...WHERE TEMPS SHOULD COOL TO LESS THAN 40 DEGREES AND 
WINDS SHOULD DIE-OFF ALL NIGHT.  WINDS ON THE PLATEAU AND NWRN 
SECTIONS WILL LIKELY START TO PICKUP PRIOR TO DAYBREAK...THEREBY 
LIMITING RADIATIONAL COOLING.

WENT VERY CLOSE TO GFS MOS TEMPS FOR TONIGHT AND THURSDAY...BUT NOT 
QUITE AS COLD AS MOS IN TRI AREA.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...FOR THURSDAY NIGHT 
AND FRIDAY...UPPER FLOW WILL BE ZONAL WITH A COLD FRONT TRYING TO 
PULL SOUTH INTO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. GIVEN FRONT BECOMING PARALLEL
WITH UPPER FLOW...BOUNDARY WILL BECOME STATIONARY JUST OVER
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA LATE FRIDAY...THEN PULL BACK NORTH FOR SATURDAY.
WILL MAINTAIN LOW CHANCE POPS OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHERN TENNESSEE.

MAIN ACTION DURING THE EXTENDED WILL BE A NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN 
STREAM SHORT-WAVES MOVING INTO THE ROCKIES FOR THIS WEEKEND...THEN 
PULLING EAST INTO THE PLAIN STATES FOR SUNDAY. DEPENDING ON AMOUNT 
OF PHASING BETWEEN THE NORTHERN/SOUTHERN STREAM WAVES...FAIRLY 
STRONG CYCLO-GENESIS POSSIBLE OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS THEN LIFTING 
NORTHEAST INTO THE OHIO VALLEY FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. 

FAIRLY GOOD UPPER DYNAMICS/FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING DEPICTED FOR LATE 
MONDAY/MONDAY EVENING. AT THIS TIME...MODELS SHOW LIMITED 
INSTABILITY...BUT WILL NEED TO WATCH FOR THE POTENTIAL OF 
STRONG/SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS FOR MONDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING.

FRONT MOVES EAST WITH DRY CONDITIONS FOR MID-WEEK NEXT WEEK.

&&

040 
FXUS64 KMRX 081839
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
239 PM EDT TUE APR 8 2014

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY/...
AN UPPER-TROUGH SWINGING THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY THIS
AFTERNOON WILL BRING CLOUD COVER AND SOME PRECIPITATION CHANCES TO
THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING AND OVERNIGHT. THE BRUNT OF THIS
ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO GRADUALLY DEVELOP OVER MIDDLE TENNESSEE
THIS AFTERNOON AND SPREAD EASTWARD INTO THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU BY
EARLY EVENING AND EVENTUALLY THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEYS AFTER
SUNSET. GIVEN SOME MODEST INSTABILITY...AN ISOLATED RUMBLE OF
THUNDER MAY BE POSSIBLE WITH THE STRONGEST ACTIVITY THROUGH 03Z OR
SO. AS THE BASE OF THE TROUGH PASSES THROUGH THE AREA OVERNIGHT...
INCREASED LIFT WILL GENERATE SOME MORE WIDESPREAD SHOWER ACTIVITY
BETWEEN 06-12Z. MOST RAINFALL TOTALS WILL REMAIN LIGHT...WITH
AMOUNTS AROUND ONE-TENTH TO TWO-TENTHS OF AN INCH BEING THE
MAXIMUM AMOUNT OF RAINFALL EXPECTED. SOME LOW CLOUDS AND LIGHT
PRECIPITATION MAY LINGER ACROSS NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA WEDNESDAY MORNING...BUT DRIER AIR WILL CREATE MOSTLY
CLEAR CONDITIONS BY THE AFTERNOON. THE NORTHWEST FLOW WILL HELP TO
REINFORCE THIS COOLER AIR MASS...BUT SUNSHINE SHOULD ALLOW HIGHS TO
REACH THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S IN MOST SPOTS ONCE AGAIN.

.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY/...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE OVER THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT...PROVIDING A 
CLEAR AND CHILLY NIGHT WITH SOME SPOTS DROPPING INTO THE 30S. 
THURSDAY LOOKS SUNNY AND WARMER AS THE RIDGE MOVES TO OUR EAST AND A 
SOUTHERLY FLOW DEVELOPS...GIVING HIGHS IN THE 70S WITH SUNNY SKIES. 

THERE IS SOME MODEL DISAGREEMENT WITH THE APPROACH OF A COLD FRONT 
ON FRIDAY/FRIDAY NIGHT. THE GFS KEEPS THE VORT MAX/UPPER JET WELL 
NORTH...WITH MOST PRECIP OVER THE OH VALLEY AND KY. THE NAM IS 
FARTHER SOUTH WITH THESE FEATURES...AND DEVELOPS A PRE-FRONTAL 
TROUGH OVER OUR AREA FRI AFTERNOON. THE NAM PRECIP DEPICTION IS 
SUPPORTED BY THE SREF AND ECMWF...SO WILL LEAN IN THAT DIRECTION AND 
HAVE HIGH CHANCE POPS NORTH LATE FRI AFTERNOON/EVENING. THE COLD 
FRONT STALLS SOMEWHERE NEARBY ON SATURDAY. THE ECMWF AND GFS 
CONTINUE TO DIFFER WITH THE FRONTAL POSITION...BUT WITH LITTLE UPPER 
LEVEL SUPPORT FOR LIFT AND LITTLE MOISTURE...WE SHOULD STAY DRY IN 
EITHER SCENARIO. A WARMING TREND IS EXPECTED THROUGH THE WEEKEND 
WITH HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST...WITH HIGHS 
REACHING THE MID AND UPPER 70S BY SUNDAY.

THERE IS GENERAL MODEL AGREEMENT ON A DEEPENING TROUGH OVER THE 
PLAINS ON MONDAY...WHICH SPREADS PRECIP INTO OUR AREA MONDAY THROUGH 
TUESDAY. HOWEVER...THE 12Z GFS CUTS OFF A CLOSED LOW OVER ARKANSAS 
THAT IS SLOW TO MOVE EAST THROUGH TUESDAY. THIS IS THE FIRST RUN OF 
THE GFS THAT HAS SHOWN THIS PATTERN. THE ECMWF AND GFS ENSEMBLE MEAN 
HAVE AN OPEN WAVE TROUGH THAT EXITS BY TUESDAY. WILL HAVE HIGH 
CHANCE POPS IN FOR MONDAY/MONDAY NIGHT WITH DECREASING PRECIP 
CHANCES TUESDAY AND COOLER TEMPERATURES.

&&

.DISCUSSION...

CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION LATER THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THIS
MORNING THOUGH...SOME BRIEF CLEARING HAS BEGUN TO OCCUR ALONG THE
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU INTO THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEYS AS SOME
DRIER AIR WORKS ITS WAY IN. THIS CLEARING WILL EVENTUALLY WORK ITS
WAY INTO THE NORTHERN VALLEY BY THE LATE MORNING BEFORE SOME
ADDITIONAL CLOUD COVER MOVES INTO THE REGION LATER. GIVEN
THIS...HAVE LOWERED POPS ALONG THE VALLEY THROUGH 18Z. THIS
AFTERNOON AND EVENING...THE BASE OF THE TROUGH WILL SWING THROUGH
THE REGION...EXPANDING A LOW TO MID CLOUD SHIELD OVER THE AREA FROM
MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND BRING SOME ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SHOWERS /AND
PERHAPS A RUMBLE OF THUNDER OR TWO/ TO THE AREA. GUIDANCE IS
SUGGESTING THE BULK OF THIS ACTIVITY WILL LIKELY NOT MOVE IN UNTIL
LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...SO HAVE KEPT MOST OF THE AREA DRY
UNTIL 21Z. ALSO...GIVEN THE OPPORTUNITY FOR SOME SUNSHINE/HEATING
OVER THE VALLEY...HAVE TWEAKED TEMPS UP A DEGREE OR SO THERE...INTO
THE LOW TO MID 60S.

131 
FXUS64 KMRX 071911
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 PM EDT MON APR 7 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...THE MAIN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH
CONTINUES TO TRACK INTO THE OHIO VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON...AND WITH
IT A STRONG 40-50 KT LOW-LEVEL JET IS MOVING ACROSS MIDDLE
TENNESSEE INTO EASTERN KENTUCKY BY THIS EVENING. THE SKY HAS
REMAINED MOSTLY CLOUDY ACROSS THE REGION FOR MOST OF THE...THOUGH
SOME BREAKS HAVE OCCURRED JUST TO THE WEST ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE
ALONG AND JUST AHEAD OF A SLOW ADVANCING COLD FRONT. THOUGH LIMITED
HEATING HAS OCCURRED...HIGHS HAVE RISEN INTO THE LOWER 60S IN MANY
LOCATIONS TODAY...WITH DEWPOINTS PRESENTLY IN THE MID TO UPPER 50S
ALONG THE PLATEAU AND MUCH OF THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEYS.
THROUGH THERE IS VERY LITTLE TO NO SURFACE BASED INSTABILITY...SOME
VERY LIMITED DESTABILIZATION ALOFT HAS OCCURRED ALOFT...WITH ML
CAPE VALUES OF AROUND A FEW HUNDRED J/KG BY MID TO LATE AFTERNOON.
THIS LIMITED INSTABILITY...COMBINED WITH THE STRONG BULK SHEAR HAS
ALLOWED 0-3 KM SR HELICITY VALUES TO CLIMB TO 300-500 M2/S2 ACROSS
MIDDLE/EAST TENNESSEE AND LIFTED INDEX VALUES TO -1 TO -2.

SOME EVIDENCE OF SOME SHOWERS DEVELOPING ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE 
AND SOME SCATTERED STORMS ACROSS MIDDLE TENENSSEE SUPPORT THE MODEL 
GUIDANCE OF SOME ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION OCCURRING MID TO 
LATE AFTERNOON. GIVEN THE AFOREMENTIONED ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS 
/ALONG WITH THE LATEST RADAR TRENDS TO THE WEST/...STILL THINK SOME 
LOCALLY ORGANIZED STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS MAY BE POSSIBLE... 
IN THE FORM OF LINE SEGMENTS AND LOW-TOPPED SUPERCELLS. THE MAINLY 
UNIDIRECTIONAL SHEAR IN PLACE BY LATE THIS AFTERNOON WILL SUPPORT A 
DAMAGING WIND THREAT WITH THE STRONGEST ACTIVITY. HOWEVER...SOME 
MARGINALLY SEVERE HAIL AND EVEN AN ISOLATED TORNADO CANNOT BE RULED 
OUT... ESPECIALLY IN AREAS WHERE A WEAK PRE-EXISTING BOUNDARY MAY 
EXIST AND WHERE WINDS ARE LOCALLY BACKED NEAR THE SURFACE. 

THIS ACTIVITY WILL DIE OFF THIS EVENING AFTER SUNSET AND THE 
BOUNDARY LAYER STABILIZES. HAVE REMOVED POPS IN ALL BUT THE NORTHEAST 
ZONES AFTER MIDNIGHT. AFTER SUNRISE...THE BASE OF THE TROUGH WILL 
SWING THROUGH THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS...BRINGING ANOTHER 
OPPORTUNITY FOR SOME SHOWERS ON TUESDAY...MAINLY DURING THE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THUS...HAVE ADJUSTED POPS DOWN IN THE MORNING 
AND UP IN THE AFTERNOON TO SUPPORT THIS CONFIDENCE. HIGHS ON TUESDAY 
WILL ON THE COOL SIDE /SIMILAR TO TODAY/...AND PEAK IN THE UPPER 50S 
TO LOWER 60S. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...A BROAD UPPER TROUGH 
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT WITH SCATTERED SHOWERS 
EXPECTED. TROUGH AXIS WILL MOVE EAST OF THE AREA EARLY WEDNESDAY 
WITH UPPER FLOW BECOMING ZONAL FOR THE LATTER HALF OF THE WEEK. A 
FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY APPROACHING THE FORECAST AREA 
FRIDAY...BUT GIVEN THE ZONAL FLOW ALOFT...FRONT WILL REMAIN NORTH OF 
THE AREA WITH ONLY LOW CHANCE POPS FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/FAR 
NORTHERN AREA OF TENNESSEE FRIDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING.

SURFACE RIDING AND DRY AIRMASS WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO DROP INTO 
THE MIDDLE 30S ACROSS NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND NORTHERN PLATEAU FOR 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. MAY NEED TO ISSUE A FROST ADVISORY FOR THESE AREAS 
LATER THIS WEEK.

NEXT UPPER TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE ROCKIES INTO THE PLAIN STATES 
FOR THIS WEEKEND. MODELS SHOW A NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN STREAM WAVES 
PHASING OVER THE PLAIN STATES FOR SUNDAY. GFS AND ECMWF DISAGREE 
WITH TIMING AND LOCATION OF CYCLO-GENEIS...BUT FROM SUNDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH TUESDAY LOOKS WET WITH WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY 
THUNDERSTORMS.

FOLLOWED GFS MEX MOS CLOSELY THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             44  63  45  65 /  20  40  30  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  43  59  44  64 /  20  30  30  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       44  60  42  64 /  20  30  30  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              41  56  39  62 /  30  20  30  20
