972 
FXUS64 KMRX 071408 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1008 AM EDT MON APR 7 2014

.DISCUSSION...
THE INITIAL AREA OF SHOWERS IS QUICKLY EXITING THE REGION THIS
MORNING AS THE MAIN UPPER-TROUGH SHIFTS INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. AS
IT DOES SO A STRONG 40-50 KT LOW-LEVEL JET WILL ROTATE OUT OF
MIDDLE TENNESSEE INTO EASTERN KENTUCKY...WITH A 90-100 KT 500 MB
JET PASSING OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THIS WILL PROVIDE THE
POTENTIAL FOR SOME STRONG GRADIENT WINDS OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN
THROUGH THE EARLY AFTERNOON /THANKS ALSO TO A PERSISTENT THIN
STABLE LAYER ALOFT/. THUS...WILL KEEP THE HIGH WIND WARNING GOING
THROUGH 20Z...MAINLY FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

ADDITIONALLY...THIS WILL ALSO HELP TO INCREASE THE POTENTIAL FOR
STRONG TO POSSIBLY SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS LATER THIS AFTERNOON ALONG
THE FRONT. THE MAIN QUESTION WILL DEAL WITH INSTABILITY...AS VERY
LITTLE SURFACE BASED CAPE SEEMS PROBABLE THIS AFTERNOON GIVEN THE
CURRENT CLOUD COVER. HOWEVER...DEPENDING IF THERE ARE ANY
SUFFICIENT BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS SOME HEATING COULD OCCUR AND THUS
WEAKEN THE CAP BY 18Z OR SO. MUCAPE VALUES ARE ALSO PROGGED TO BE A
LITTLE HIGHER...AND APPROACH 300-400 J/KG BY THE AFTERNOON...WITH
LIFTED INDEX VALUES AOA -1 TO -3. GIVEN THE STRONG BULK SHEAR
VALUES AND THIS MODEST INSTABILITY...THINK THAT SOME ORGANIZED
STRONG CONVECTION IS POSSIBLE DURING THE AFTERNOON...PARTICULARLY
IN THE FORM OF LOW-TOPPED SUPERCELLS. THE PRIMARY THREAT OF ANY
SEVERE WEATHER WILL BE DAMAGING WINDS GIVEN THE MOSTLY
UNIDIRECTIONAL SHEAR BY THE AFTERNOON. HOWEVER...SOME MARGINALLY
SEVERE HAIL AND EVEN AN ISOLATED TORNADO CANNOT BE RULED OUT...
ESPECIALLY IN AREAS WHERE A WEAK PRE-EXISTING BOUNDARY MAY EXIST
AND WHERE WINDS ARE LOCALLY BACKED NEAR THE SURFACE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
301 AM EDT MON APR 7 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DEEPENING SURFACE LOW PRESSURE 
WILL MOVE NE THROUGH THE W TN VALLEY TO OVER OHIO THIS EVENING. 
INCREASING SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL JET MOVES THROUGH MRX TODAY. H85 JET 
MAX NEAR 70 KTS DEVELOPS OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU THIS MORNING. 
CONDITIONS FAVORABLE FOR DOWNSLOPING WINDS ALONG TN MNTS AND 
FOOTHILLS. THIS IS BEGINNING TO MATERIALIZE ON 88D DISPLAYS. 
CONDITIONS WILL BECOME BREEZY ACROSS VALLEY LOCATIONS AND THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU BUT SHOULD STAY JUST BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA. 
STRONG LIFT WILL CONTINUE WITH ACCENT ALONG AND NORTH OF NORTHWARD 
ADVANCING WARM FRONT EARLY. WIDESPREAD RAINFALL UNDERWAY. EMBEDDED 
ELEVATED CONVECTION WILL LIKELY MOVE INTO THE AREA THIS MORNING. LOW 
TOPPED CONVECTION COULD MIX DOWN SOME DAMAGING WINDS.  LOCALIZED 
FLOODING POSSIBLE PRIMARILY ACROSS SOUTHERN AREAS TODAY. UPPER SW-NE 
SPEED MAX IN ADVANCE OF APPROACHING UPPER TROUGH SHOULD MOVE EAST OF 
THE AREA AROUND MIDNIGHT. PRECIPITATION WILL BE LINGER MUCH OF TODAY 
BEFORE TAPERING OFF FROM THE WEST AS SURFACE COLD FRONT MOVES EAST 
THROUGH THE AREA THIS EVENING. TEMPERATURES WILL BE RELATIVELY WARM 
TODAY DESPITE PERSISTENT SHOWERS AND CLOUD COVER. UPPER TROUGH AXIS 
REMAINS WEST OVERNIGHT. LOW LEVEL CLOUDS SHOULD REMAINED CAPPED MOST 
OF TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES COOL TO NEAR NORMAL. 
 
.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS TRENDING A BIT SLOWER 
BRINGING IN A TROUGH AXIS AND SHORT WAVE THROUGH THE AREA.  MAIN 
BAND OF ASSOCIATED PRECIP NOW LOOKING TO MOVE THROUGH LATE TUESDAY 
EVENING INTO TUESDAY NIGHT.  HAVE TRENDED GRIDS TOWARDS THIS AND 
LOWERED POPS TO SLIGHT CHANCE EARLY TUESDAY WITH BEST CHANCE 00Z TO 
06Z WEDNESDAY.  A FEW SHOWERS MAY LINGER INTO WEDNESDAY 
MORNING...BUT THIS SHOULD END EARLY IN THE DAY AS HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN.  THE HIGH WILL CONTROL AREA WEATHER THROUGH MUCH OF 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.  A WEAKENING BOUNDARY TO OUR NORTH MAY 
BRIEFLY DRIFT SOUTH INTO THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE MRX CWA ON 
FRIDAY FOR A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWER ACTIVITY.  THE NEXT CONCERN IS 
A SYSTEM APPROACHING FROM THE WEST.  HOWEVER...CLOUDS MAY BEGIN TO 
INCREASE AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM BUT EXPECTED ASSOCIATED PRECIP TO STAY 
TO OUR WEST THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

145 
FXUS64 KMRX 070138
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
938 PM EDT SUN APR 6 2014

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED OVER
SOUTHWESTERN LA...WITH A WEAK INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH EXTENDING
NORTHEAST OF IT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. AREA RADARS REVEAL AN
EXTENSIVE AREA OF RAIN SPREADING NORTHEASTWARD...WITH THE LEADING
EDGE OVER SOUTHEAST TN. LIGHTNING WAS ALSO BEING OBSERVED OVER
CENTRAL AL...WITH MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATING SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY
DEVELOPING OVER THE FORECAST AREA LATER TONIGHT. MODELS ALSO INDICATE
A STRONG SOUTH-TO-SOUTHEASTERLY 850 MB WIND FLOW DEVELOPING NORTHWEST
OF THE APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS AFTER MIDNIGHT...WITH THE NAM MODEL
REVEALING STRONGER 850 MB WINDS (70 TO 75 KT) THAN THE GFS MODEL
(50 TO 55 KT). THIS SCENARIO APPEARS CONDUCIVE TO THE FORMATION OF
HIGH WINDS DUE TO MOUNTAIN WAVES IN THE FOOTHILLS OF THE MOUNTAINS
LATER TONIGHT INTO MONDAY...BUT A POTENTIAL "FLY IN THE OINTMENT"
APPEARS TO BE THE SURFACE-BASED STABLE LAYER THAT BARELY EXTENDS
OVER THE MOUNTAINS. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL AN UNSTABLE LAYER BEGINNING
AROUND 800 MB AND EXTENDING FURTHER UP THE ATMOSPHERE. IT'S NOT
REALLY KNOWN HOW THIS SOMEWHAT SHALLOW STABLE LAYER WILL AFFECT THE
INTENSITY OF THE MOUNTAIN WAVES LATER TONIGHT...BUT OVERALL...THE
HIGH WIND WARNING APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK AND WILL NOT MAKE ANY
CHANGES TONIGHT.

OTHERWISE...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO REMOVE
ANY MENTION OF EVENING PRECIP FOR TONIGHT. 
&&

TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              47  65  46  55 / 100 100  30  30

.AVIATION...CENTER OF STRONG SPRING STORM SYSTEM SHIFTS NORTHEAST
FROM THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY
THROUGH THE NEXT 24 HOURS. STRONG ISENTROPIC LIFT PRESSING NORTH
INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WITH LEADING EDGE OF LIGHT RAIN MOVING
INTO CHA. RAINFALL INTENSITY SHOULD PICK UP LATER TONIGHT HERE WITH
MVFR CONDITIONS DETERIORATING TO EITHER LOW END MVFR OR EVEN IFR AS
CEILINGS DROP TO AROUND A THOUSAND FEET. WOULD EXPECT CONDITIONS TO
BE BETTER AT TYS AND TRI WITH RELATIVELY STRONG SOUTHEAST FLOW
ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS. THE COMPRESSIONAL WARMING AND DRYING MAY
KEEP THESE TERMINALS IN AN VFR CATEGORY THROUGH MUCH OF THE EVENT.
HOWEVER...DID BRING CEILINGS DOWN TO 2500 FEET AT EACH SITE FROM
MID DAY INTO THE LATE AFTERNOON. KEPT SOME LOW LEVEL WIND SHEAR
GOING WITH LOW LEVEL JET PICKING UP ACROSS THE REGION. SURFACE
WINDS WILL BECOME RATHER STRONG AND GUSTY ESPECIALLY ON MONDAY AS
THE DEEP SURFACE LOW MAKES ITS MOVE ACROSS TENNESSEE.

745 
FXUS64 KMRX 061852
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
252 PM EDT SUN APR 6 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL 
APPROACH FROM THE SOUTHWEST TONIGHT AND WILL DEEPEN AS IT TRACKS BY 
TO OUR WEST AND INTO OHIO MONDAY.  ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL 
PUSH IN MONDAY AFTERNOON. STRONG SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW WILL BRING 
PLENTY OF MOISTURE INTO THE AREA...SO SHOULD BE A SIGNIFICANT RAIN 
EVENT FOR THE ENTIRE AREA.  WILL CARRY CAT POPS ALL ZONES BOTH 
PERIODS. HIGHEST PRECIP TOTALS EXPECTED TO BE SOUTH AND 
SOUTHEAST...WHERE RAINFALL MAY EXCEED 2 INCHES IN SOME AREAS.  
FLOODING POSSIBILITY OF SOME CONCERN...ALTHOUGH GROUND IS FAIRLY DRY 
WITH 6 HOUR FFG AREAS IN THESE AREAS GENERALLY AROUND 3 INCHES OR 
HIGHER...SO FOR NOW NO FLOOD WATCH FOR NOW. SECOND CONCERN IS STRONG 
WINDS IN THE NORMALLY FAVORED MOUNTAINS AND FOOTHILLS GIVEN 
POSSIBILITY OF MOUNTAIN WAVES.  GFS LOW LEVEL WINDS NOT AS STRONG 
BUT MORE FAVORABLE DIRECTION...NAM LOW LEVEL FLOW QUITE STRONG BUT 
DIRECTION STAYS FAVORABLE FOR A SHORTER PERIOD OF TIME.  OTHER 
CONCERN IS STABLE LAYER MAY BE A BIT SHALLOW TO BE IDEAL...BUT MODEL 
SOUNDINGS HINT IT MAY BE DEEP ENOUGH AT LEAST FOR A SHORT PERIOD.  
WILL GO AHEAD AND UPGRADE THE HIGH WIND WATCH TO A WARNING AND ISSUE 
A WIND ADVISORY FOR SOUTHERN MOUNTAIN ZONES NOT IN THE WATCH.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...SHOWERS WILL
CONTINUE TO GRADUALLY TAPER OFF MONDAY NIGHT FROM THE INITIAL
DEPARTING LOW...BUT SOME ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL BE
POSSIBLE ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF EAST TENNESSEE AND IN
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA THROUGH THE NIGHT. ANOTHER FAST MOVING TROUGH
WILL QUICKLY FOLLOW...MOVING INTO THE REGION TUESDAY AND TUESDAY
NIGHT. THOUGH LIFT/MOISTURE WILL NOT BE AS HIGH...SCATTERED SHOWERS
WILL BE POSSIBLE THROUGHOUT THE DAY AND EVENING ON TUESDAY...BUT
WILL TAPER OFF LATE TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY AS THE SYSTEM
SHIFTS EAST. CLOUD COVER SHOULD KEEP LOWS IN THE 40S MONDAY AND
TUESDAY NIGHT...DESPITE THE COOLER HIGHS ONLY PEAKING IN THE 50S IN
MOST PLACES DURING THE DAY. HOWEVER...THE RAPID CLEARING THAT WILL
TAKE PLACE BY WEDNESDAY EVENING WILL ALLOW FOR GOOD RADIATIONAL
COOLING THAT NIGHT...LIKELY RESULTING IN A FROST/LIGHT FREEZE
ACROSS THE NORTHERN VALLEY AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA THAT NIGHT.
THEREAFTER...RIDGING FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WILL ALLOW HIGHS TO
RETURN TO THE 70S...WITH AMPLE SUNSHINE AND SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS.
ANOTHER DISTURBANCE MAY APPROACH THE AREA EARLY THIS WEEKEND...BUT
GIVEN UNCERTAINTIES IN HOW FAR SOUTH THE FRONT WILL PUSH...AND THE
WEAKER LIFT/MOISTURE...HAVE LOW MENTIONABLE POPS IN THE FORECAST
FOR NOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 AM EDT SUN APR 6 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...FROST ADVISORY AREA 
MARGINAL BUT FROST FORMING TEMPERATURES REMAIN PROGGED BY LAMP AND 
HRRR MODELS SO KEPT IT IN PLACE FOR THIS MORNING. SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL SLIDE EAST OF THE AREA TODAY AS INVERTED SURFACE 
TROUGH DEVELOPS NORTHEAST INTO THE EAST TENNESSEE VALLEY. HIGH AND 
THEN MID LEVEL CLOUDS WILL BE ON THE INCREASE TODAY WITH LIGHT RAIN 
MOVING INTO SOUTHERN AREA THIS AFTERNOON. STRONG LOW LEVEL JET 
REMAINS ON TRACK WITH SPEED MAX MOVING THROUGH THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU OVERNIGHT. GOOD SET UP FOR HIGH WINDS IN THE MOUNTAINS AND 
MOUNTAIN WAVE WINDS ALONG ADJACENT FOOTHILLS. LARGE AREA OF 
PRECIPITATION WILL MOVE IN FROM THE SOUTHWEST TONIGHT AND CONTINUE 
FOR MOST OF MONDAY. HAVE DOWNPLAYED DOWNSLOPING AFFECTS ON SKY COVER 
TEMPERATURES AND PRECIPITATION ACROSS NE VALLEY LOCATIONS FOR NOW 
BUT SOME TWEAKING MAY BE NEEDED BY MONDAY AS CONFIDENCE IN MOUNTAIN 
WAVE EVENT RISES. LAYER SHEAR VERY GOOD FOR MONDAY AS LOW MOVES NE 
THROUGH W TN VALLEY BUT INSTABILITY ON THE LOW SIDE AND SEVERE 
THREAT REMAINS LOW. STRONG GUSTY WINDS VERY LIKELY WITH EMBEDDED 
ELEVATED CONVECTION. LOW MOVES TO OHIO MONDAY NIGHT WITH COLD FRONT 
AND LAYER DRYING MOVING EAST THROUGH THE AREA LATE MONDAY NIGHT. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE MODERATED BY THICK CLOUD COVER GENERALLY 
BRACKETED INSIDE CLIMO. 
 
.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...TROUGH AXIS MOVING ACROSS 
THE REGION WITH A COUPLE OF WEAK SHORT WAVES TRAVELING THROUGH THE 
UPPER FLOW WILL GENERATE SCATTERED SHOWERS ACROSS THE AREA TUESDAY 
INTO TUESDAY NIGHT.  A FEW SHOWERS MAY LINGER OVER FAR EASTERN 
LOCATIONS EARLY WEDNESDAY...BUT OVERALL MAIN WEATHER FEATURE WILL BE 
A SURFACE HIGH BUILDING INTO TO THE REGION.  THIS HIGH WILL DOMINATE 
WEATHER FOR MUCH OF WEDNESDAY AND THROUGH THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.  
RETURN MOISTURE AND WEAK INSTABILITY MAY PROVIDE ISOLATED CONVECTION 
ON SATURDAY...MAINLY OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

&&

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED
OVER THE MID WEST...WITH A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY ALONG
THE NORTHERN GULF COAST. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALED AN EXTENSIVE
AREA OF CLOUDS OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY...MOVING NORTHEASTWARD
INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS EVENING. AS A RESULT...IT APPEARS THAT
CONDITIONS WILL NOT BE OPTIMAL FOR FROST FORMATION OVERNIGHT...BUT
WILL LEAVE THE FROST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR NORTHEAST TN JUST IN
CASE ENOUGH BREAKS OCCUR OVERNIGHT.

OTHERWISE...FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK FOR THE MOST PART...BUT
WILL UPDATE THIS EVENING TO TWEAK SKY CONDITIONS ACCORDING TO THE
LATEST TRENDS.

164 
FXUS64 KMRX 051927
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
327 PM EDT SAT APR 5 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO 
EXTEND INTO THE AREA TONIGHT INTO EARLY SUNDAY BUT WILL RETREAT TO 
THE NORTHEAST AS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM BEGINS TO APPROACH LATER 
SUNDAY. WE WILL SEE AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS...ESPECIALLY SOUTH...AND 
SOME RAIN MAY MOVE IN LATE SUNDAY AGAIN MAINLY SOUTH.  WILL CARRY 
CHANCE POPS SOUTH AND SLIGHT CHANCE MOST CENTRAL ZONES LATE SUNDAY.  
TEMPS TONIGHT EXPECTED TO FALL INTO THE MID 30S ACROSS PORTIONS OF 
THE NORTHERN VALLEY...AND MAY DIP BELOW 40 ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE 
NORTHERN PLATEAU AND CENTRAL VALLEY AS WELL AS SOUTHWEST NORTH 
CAROLINA. WILL MENTION PATCHY FROST PARTS OF CENTRAL VALLEY AND 
NORTHER PLATEAU...AND WILL INCLUDE AREAS OF FROST AND ISSUE A FROST 
ADVISORY FOR LATE TONIGHT/EARLY SUNDAY ACROSS THE NORTHERN TN 
VALLEY.  OTHER COLD AREAS SUCH AS SW VA AND SOME CENTRAL/NORTHERN 
MOUNTAIN VALLEYS STILL OUT OF FREEZE PROGRAM SO NO FROST MENTION 
THERE.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...AT THE START OF THIS 
PERIOD THE UPPER TROUGH IN THE PLAINS IS STILL DIGGING AND MAKING 
SLOW EASTWARD PROGRESS.  BUT THE DIGGING IS INDUCING A DEEPER AND 
DEEPER MOIST SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT OVER OUR AREA.  A LARGE AREA 
OF RAIN SHOULD BE SPREADING OVER THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT...ASSOCIATED 
WITH A WARM FRONT.  AS THE FRONT GETS NORTH OF THE AREA ON 
MONDAY...THE STEADY RAINS WILL MOVE AWAY WITH IT LEAVING US WITH 
MORE SPOTTY PRECIP CHANCES FOR PART OF THE DAY ON MONDAY.  HOWEVER, 
BY MONDAY LATE AFTERNOON OR EVENING A COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE 
REGION FROM THE WEST...BRING BETTER CHANCES FOR PRECIP AS A LINE OF 
SHOWERS/STORMS MARCHES THROUGH THE AREA. MOISTURE RECOVERY AHEAD OF 
THIS FRONT WILL ONLY BE MARGINAL WITH DEW POINTS ONLY RISING INTO 
THE 50S...SO NOT FORECASTING ANY SEVERE STORMS FOR NOW...BUT WILL 
NEED TO WATCH FOR GUSTY WINDS IN ANY SHOWERS OR STORMS DUE TO 
GENERAL STRONG WIND FIELD THAT COULD GET BROUGHT TO SURFACE. 

FOR MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...KEEPING CHANCES OF SHOWERS 
FOR MUCH OF THE AREA AS MOISTURE HANGS AROUND AND LITTLE WAVES OF 
LIFT RACE THROUGH THE AREA. LOOKS LIKE THE LAST OF THESE WAVES MOVE 
THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING/NIGHT...ALONG WITH RE-ENFORCING COLD FRONT 
AND DRIER AIR FOLLOWS.

BY WEDNESDAY...CHANCES FOR PRECIP SHOULD BE JUST ABOUT GONE THROUGH 
THE END OF THE WEEK AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE AREA. 

BY SATURDAY...THE RETURN FLOW HAS MOISTURE MOVING BACK INTO THE 
ENTIRE REGION AND INSTABILITY IS BEGINNING TO BUILD...AND 
INTRODUCING SOME POPS FOR SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT.


&&

THE GULF COAST WILL BEGIN TO PUSH NORTH TOWARDS THE MRX CWA ON 
SUNDAY.  CLOUDS WILL INCREASE FROM SOUTH TO NORTH AND A FEW ISOLATED 
SHOWERS MAY WORK INTO FAR SOUTHERN AREAS BY THE END OF THE DAY.  
HOWEVER...OVERNIGHT...A LARGE BAND OF SHOWER WILL MOVE ACROSS THE 
AREA FOR CATEGORICAL POPS.  ADDITIONALLY...A STRONG 850 MB JET WILL 
ACCOMPANY THE LOW AND CREATE STRONG GUSTY WINDS ACROSS HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS AND FAVORED AREAS OF THE FOOTHILLS.  A HIGH WIND WATCH 
WILL BE IN EFFECT SUNDAY NIGHT AND MUCH OF MONDAY.  THE MAIN BAND OF 
RAIN WILL PULL OUT OF THE AREA MONDAY MORNING AND SHOULD SEE A DRY 
SLOT SHIFT INTO THE REGION BY THE AFTERNOON AND INTO MONDAY 
NIGHT...REDUCING SHOWERS ACTIVITY TO SCATTERED COVERAGE.  THE UPPER 
TROUGH WILL CONTINUE TO BRING IN LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND WEAK LIFT ON 
TUESDAY FOR A CONTINUED CHANCE OF SHOWERS.  THE TROUGH WILL EXIT THE 
REGION ON WEDNESDAY AND ASSOCIATED SHOWERS WILL PULL AWAY FROM THE 
AREA.  SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR THURSDAY AND SHOULD 
MAINTAIN CONTROL OF AREA WEATHER INTO FRIDAY FOR DRY WEATHER AND A 
WARMING TREND.

FXUS64 KMRX 041912
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 PM EDT FRI APR 4 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...CURRENT RADAR ACTIVITY 
JUST WEST OF CUMBERLAND PLATEAU IS OCCURRING ALONG APPROACHING COLD 
FRONT. FURTHER SHOWERY ACTIVITY MAY DEVELOP ALONG THE COLD FRONT AS 
IT MOVES INTO OUR AREA. WE MAY SEE A RUMBLE OF THUNDER OR TWO WITH 
THE AFOREMENTIONED ACTIVITY BUT THE MAJORITY OF IT SHOULD REMAIN AS 
SHOWERS DUE TO THE LACKING INSTABILITY BECAUSE OF DENSE CLOUD COVER 
THAT PERSISTED ACROSS OUR AREA TODAY. 

MODELS SHOW THE FRONT DRAPED ACROSS OUR AREA BY AROUND 00Z AND 
MOVING THROUGH SHORTLY THEREAFTER. WITH THE DEPARTED FRONT...EXPECT 
SLOWLY CLEARING CONDITIONS OVERNIGHT AS WE RETURN TO A ZONAL FLOW 
ALOFT. CHA WILL START TO CLEAR FIRST WITH TRI LIKELY HANGING ON TO 
SOME CLOUD COVER THROUGH MOST OF THE NIGHT. WINDS WILL ALSO STAY UP 
THROUGH MOST OF THE NIGHT UNTIL THE FRONT CAN MOVE FURTHER TO OUR 
EAST WITH WINDS FINALLY CALMING CLOSER TO SUNRISE. OVERNIGHT LOWS 
WILL GENERALLY BE IN THE LOW TO MID 40S. HIGH TEMPS ON SATURDAY WILL 
BE ROUGHLY 5 DEGREES COLDER THAN NORMAL AREA WIDE WITH TEMPERATURES 
IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S WITH SUNSHINE RETURNING.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...ANOTHER DEEPENING
UPPER-LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL SHIFT FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS INTO
THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ON SUNDAY...BRINGING INCREASED CLOUD COVER
INTO THE REGION AND WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS
TO THE AREA OVERNIGHT. HAVE MAINTAINED THE CHANCE POPS DURING THE
LATE AFTERNOON ON SUNDAY...AND THE CATEGORICAL POPS SUNDAY
NIGHT...AS ALL MODELS ARE HINTING AT WIDESPREAD SHOWERS MOVING INTO
THE AREA FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST AFTER 00Z MONDAY.
ADDITIONALLY...HAVE MAINTAINED THE CATEGORICAL TO LIKELY POPS
MONDAY MORNING...BEFORE GRADUALLY TAPERING THEM OFF MONDAY
AFTERNOON AS DRY SLOTTING OCCURS. IN ADDITION TO THE RAIN
POTENTIAL...SOME STRONG SOUTHEASTERLY GRADIENT WINDS SUNDAY NIGHT
WILL ALSO SUPPORT THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME MOUNTAIN WAVES ALONG THE
HIGHER TERRAIN AND FOOTHILLS OF EAST TENNESSEE. A HIGH WIND WATCH
MAY BE NEEDED TOMORROW ALONG THE MOUNTAIN ZONES AND FAVORED
FOOTHILL LOCATIONS SHOULD THESE MODEL TRENDS CONTINUE.
 
A BROAD TROUGH WILL THEN SWING INTO THE REGION FOR TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY...MAINTAINING THE BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES AND GENERATING 
SOME ISOLATED TO PERHAPS SCATTERED SHOWER ACTIVITY /ALONG WITH SOME 
DENSE CLOUD COVER/. ZONAL FLOW ALOFT AND SOME WEAK RIDGING WILL 
ALLOW FOR A WARM-UP LATE IN THE WORK WEEK AS THE SKY CLEARS AND 
SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS PUSH TEMPERATURES BACK UP INTO THE 60S TO LOWER 
70S.

.DISCUSSION...SEVER THUNDERSTORM WATCH HAS BEEN CANCELLED FOR OUR AREA 
AS CURRENT RADAR SHOWS MAIN LINE OF STORMS EAST OF WATCH AREA.  
EXTREME NETN AND SWVA COULD STILL SEE SOME HIGHER WIND GUSTS WITH 
THE LINE OF STORMS CURRENTLY MOVING THROUGH BUT OVERALL TREND HAS 
BEEN WEAKENING OF THE LINE OF STORMS OVER THE PAST FEW HOURS. WE 
HAVE HAD A FEW TREES DOWN HERE AND THERE BUT NO WIDESPREAD OR MAJOR 
DAMAGE HAS BEEN REPORTED. WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO BE GUSTY THIS 
AFTERNOON AS COLD FRONT IS STILL BACK TO OUR WEST. CURRENT SURFACE 
PLOTS SHOW THE FRONT TO BE JUST WEST OF NASHVILLE. THE BIG QUESTION 
OF THE DAY IS WHETHER ANY NEW DEVELOPMENT WILL OCCUR LATER THIS 
AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING AS COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH. WILL LEAVE 
MENTION OF ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS IN ZONES FOR THIS AFTERNOON IN 
CASE WE DO HAVE NEW DEVELOPMENT. AT THIS TIME HOWEVER...CONFIDENCE 
NOT OVERLY HIGH THAT WE WILL HAVE NEW DEVELOPMENT. IF ANYTHING DOES 
DEVELOP...IT MAY BE MORE ISOLATED/SCATTERED CONVECTIVE TYPE ACTIVITY 
AS OPPOSED TO SEVERE. NEW ZONES OUT SOON TO REMOVE WATCH HEADLINE. 
WILL ALSO TWEAK HOURLY TEMPS. 


&&

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WARM AIRMASS IN PLACE EARLY TODAY.

TODAY. UPPER LOW OVER IOWA WILL MOVE NE TO THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES 
TODAY. UPPER SPEED MAX WILL MOVE FROM W TN TO OH RVR VALLEY TODAY 
GIVING UPPER TROUGH A WEAK NEGATIVE TILT INTO SW VA. INCREASED 
SOUTHWEST LAYER FLOW WILL DRIVE PWAT VALUES ABOVE 1.25 BY THE NOON 
HOUR. LOW LEVEL THICKNESS VALUES PROGGED TO BE LOWER THAN THU AND 
MORE CLOUD COVER IS EXPECTED TODAY. FEEL THESE PROGS A BIT OVERDONE 
AND WENT ABOVE MOS GUIDANCE FOR MAXS TODAY. MODERATE INSABILITY AND 
LAPSE RATES WILL BE IN PLACE AS ONGOING CONVECTION MOVES INTO THE 
AREA TODAY. BULK SHEAR IS THE BEST LOOKING PARAMETER FOR STRONG 
CONVECTIVE. A FEW SUPERCELLS ARE POSSIBLE WITH STRONG WINDS AND 
LARGE HAIL POSSIBLE. UPPER TROUGH AXIS AND SURFACE COLD FRONT MOVE 
THROUGH THIS EVENING. CONVECTION WILL TAPER OFF THIS EVENING AND END 
MOST PLACES BY MIDNIGHT. TEMPERATURES COOL TO NEAR NORMAL. 
 
.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...ZONAL FLOW ALOFT AND 
NORTHERLY LOW LEVEL WINDS EXPECTED ON SATURDAY WILL PROVIDE DRY BUT 
SLIGHTLY COOLER CONDITIONS.  WILL THEN TRANSITION INTO AN UNSETTLED 
WEATHER PATTERN AS A LOW BEGINS TO NUDGE IN FROM THE SOUTH ON 
SUNDAY...SPREADING A LARGE BAND OF SHOWERS INTO THE AREA SUNDAY 
NIGHT.  HAVE INCREASED POPS TO CATEGORICAL SUNDAY NIGHT.  ALSO OF 
CONCERN WILL BE AN INCREASE IN WINDS...ESPECIALLY OVER HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS SUNDAY NIGHT AS A STRONG 850 MB JET ACCOMPANYING THE LOW. 
A DRY SLOT TRACKS INTO THE REGION LATE MONDAY INTO MONDAY NIGHT 
ALLOWING PRECIP TO DIMINISH TO MORE ISOLATED TO SCATTERED COVERAGE.  
WRAP AROUND MOISTURE AND WEAK LIFT MOVE IN FOR TUESDAY...EXTENDING 
THE SCATTERED LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS OVER THE AREA.  UPPER TROUGH WILL 
REMAIN OVER THE REGION INTO WEDNESDAY WITH A DISTURBANCE TRACKING 
THROUGH FOR ISOLATED SHOWER ACTIVITY.  WEAK RIDGING TO ZONAL FLOW 
RETURN FOR THURSDAY ALLOWING FOR A DRY END OF THE EXTENDED.

670 
FXUS64 KMRX 031939
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
339 PM EDT THU APR 3 2014

.SHORT TERM.../TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY/...CURRENT ACTIVITY ON RADAR
TO OUR NORTHWEST MAY SLOWLY WORK ITS WAY INTO PORTIONS OF OUR
AREA...MAINLY FROM THE CENTRAL VALLEY AND NORTHWARD WITH BETTER
CHANCES ACROSS EXTREME NETN AND SWVA LATER THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY
EVENING. CURRENT MESO ANALYSIS SHOWS CAP SLOWLY WEAKENING ACROSS
THESE AREAS. WILL ADD IN SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR CENTRAL VALLEY FOR
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DURING THE LATE AFTERNOON AND EARLY
EVENING HOURS AND CHANCE FOR NETN AND SWVA. THREAT SHOULD BE OVER
WITH BY AROUND 03Z. AFTER THIS...CALMER CONDITIONS WILL SETUP
OVERNIGHT BEFORE THE NEXT ROUND OF WEATHER MOVES IN.

MODELS ARE IN AGREEMENT THAT A POTENTIALLY STRONG LINE OF SHOWERS 
AND STORMS WILL APPROACH OUR AREA FROM THE WEST OVERNIGHT AND ARRIVE 
TOWARD MORNING. THIS LINE OF STORMS IS EXPECTED TO ARRIVE ON THE 
PLATEAU BETWEEN 12/15Z AND INTO THE CENTRAL VALLEY BETWEEN 15/18Z. 
THE DRIVING FORCE BEHIND THIS ACTIVITY IS A NEGATIVELY TILTED TROUGH 
THAT WILL SWING ACROSS OUR AREA. AS THE TROUGH SWING THROUGH THE LOW 
WILL LIFT FURTHER NORTH UP INTO THE GREAT LAKES...THIS SHOULD HELP 
TO WEAKEN FORCING ACROSS OUR AREA. HOWEVER...MULTIPLE PARAMETERS 
INDICATE THAT THERE STILL COULD BE SOME SEVERE STORMS WITHIN THIS 
LINE. A STRONG WIND FIELD WILL ACCOMPANY THE TROUGH WITH ROUGHLY 45 
TO 60KTS OF 0-6KM BULK SHEAR AND 0-1KM SHEAR OF 30 TO 40KTS AS WELL 
AS ENHANCED VALUES OF SRH AND EHI. THESE PARAMETERS SUGGEST 
THAT...THOUGH NOT THE MAIN THREAT ANTICIPATED...AN ISOLATED TORNADO 
OR TWO CAN NOT BE RULED OUT. LOW LCL HEIGHTS ALSO SUPPORT AN 
ISOLATED TOR RISK. CAPE WILL BE SUFFICIENT ENOUGH TO SUPPORT STRONG 
TO SEVERE STORMS WITH SURFACE BASED CAPE VALUES ROUGHLY BETWEEN 500 
AND 1000 J/KG AND MU CAPE UP TO 1500 J/KG. HAIL THREAT STILL LOOKS 
MARGINAL AS THERE APPEARS TO BE SOME CAPE IN THE HAIL GROWTH ZONE AS 
WELL AS LOW WBZ HEIGHTS. OVERALL...MAIN THREAT APPEARS TO BE 
DAMAGING STRAIGHT LINE WINDS. THE THREAT FOR SEVERE STORMS APPEARS 
THAT IT WILL END BY LATE AFTERNOON AS DRIER AIR BEGINS TO BUILD IN 
ACROSS OUR AREA.

.LONG TERM.../FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY/...
COOLER AND DRIER AIR WILL QUICKLY FILER INTO THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY 
NIGHT AS THE COLD FRONT DEPARTS THE REGION. THIS WILL RESULT IN A 
MOSTLY SUNNY...BUT COOLER DAY ON SATURDAY AS NORTHWESTERLY FLOW 
PREVAILS...WITH HIGHS TOPPING OFF IN THE 60S. ANOTHER DEEPENING 
UPPER-LOW WILL SHIFT FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS INTO THE MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY ON SUNDAY...BRINGING INCREASED CLOUD COVER FOR SUNDAY AND A 
HIGH POTENTIAL FOR WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. 
GIVEN GOOD MODEL CONTINUITY...HAVE INCREASED POPS TO CATEGORICAL 
OVER THE SOUTHERN ZONES SUNDAY NIGHT...AND HAVE GONE LIKELY POPS 
ELSEWHERE THROUGH MONDAY MORNING. IN ADDITION TO THE RAIN 
POTENTIAL...SOME STRONG SOUTHEASTERLY GRADIENT WINDS SUNDAY NIGHT 
WILL ALSO SUPPORT THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME MOUNTAIN WAVES ALONG THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN AND FOOTHILLS OF EAST TENNESSEE. THIS WILL NEED TO BE 
MONITORED AS THE WEEKEND APPROACHES. 
 
SOME DRY SLOTTING WILL THEN BEGIN TO OCCUR BY MONDAY AFTERNOON... 
DECREASING THE RAIN POTENTIAL BY THE EVENING. MODELS ARE HINTING AT 
SOME WRAP AROUND MOISTURE GENERATING SOME LIGHT SHOWERS ACROSS 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA MONDAY NIGHT...SO HAVE 
KEPT CHANCE POPS IN UP THERE. A BROAD TROUGH WILL THEN REMAIN IN 
PLACE ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF THE COUNTRY THOUGH MOST OF THE WEEK 
AHEAD...PROMOTING BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES AND SOME SLIGHT CHANCES 
FOR PRECIPITATION  EACH DAY THROUGH AT LEAST THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK. 



&&

921 
FXUS64 KMRX 030844
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 AM EDT THU APR 3 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A SHORT WAVELENGTH TROUGH IS 
MOVING ACROSS THE MID SOUTH EARLY THIS MORNING. THE FEATURE IS 
UTILIZING SUFFICIENTLY MOIST AND UNSTABLE AIR IN PLACE ACROSS THE 
REGION LEADING TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. SOME 
OF THE STORMS PRODUCED LARGE HAIL ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE BUT MODEL 
DEPICTION INDICATES INSTABILITY DECREASING TO A CERTAIN DEGREE 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH THE MORNING WITH THE 
ATMOSPHERE BECOMING CAPPED OFF MID DAY INTO THE AFTERNOON. WITH THIS 
IN MIND AND THE DEPARTURE OF THE UPPER TROUGH LATER THIS MORNING 
INTO THE AFTERNOON WOULD EXPECT A SIGNIFICANT DROP OFF IN 
PROBABILITY OF PRECIP. TWEAKED MAX TEMPS UP A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE 
GUIDANCE WITH INCREASING INSOLATION DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS. MUCH 
OF THE OVERNIGHT PERIOD APPEARS TO BE DRY WITH DEEPER MOISTURE AND 
LIFT ARRIVING DURING THE DAY FRIDAY. HOWEVER...KEPT A TIGHT POP 
GRADIENT FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FROM THE PLATEAU EASTWARD IN 
CASE STRONG STORM SYSTEM SQUALL LINE RACES OUT AHEAD OF THE COLD 
FRONT.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)... STORMS ARE EXPECTED TO BE 
APPROACHING OUR PLATEAU COUNTIES AT THE START OF THE PERIOD....WITH 
THE 14-19Z PERIOD BEING THE HEIGHT OF ACTIVITY IN OUR AREA. THE NE 
MOVEMENT OF THE UPPER LOW AND JET FROM THE PLAINS TOWARD THE GREAT 
LAKES WILL MEAN THAT SYNOPTIC FORCING WILL BE DIMINISHING THROUGH 
THE DAY...WHICH WILL HELP LIMIT THE THREAT OF SEVERE STORMS 
SOMEWHAT. CAPE VALUES ON FRIDAY ARE FAIRLY LOW...WITH MAX MUCAPE 
NEAR 800 J/KG SOUTH...HOWEVER DEEP LAYER SHEAR IS HIGH...AS IS 0-1 
KM HELICITY. LCL HEIGHTS ARE ALSO QUITE LOW IN OUR SOUTHERN 
COUNTIES. SO THERE WILL BE A THREAT OF SUPERCELLS WITH DAMAGING 
WINDS AND POSSIBLY TORNADOES. LOW WBZ HEIGHTS SUGGEST A MARGINAL 
HAIL THREAT AS WELL. THE THREAT SHOULD END BY LATE AFTERNOON...WITH 
POPS DROPPING OFF TO NIL AROUND MIDNIGHT AS DRIER AIR BUILDS IN 
BEHIND THE COLD FRONT. 

SATURDAY WILL BE A SUNNY BUT COOL DAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE 
OHIO VALLEY AND A SHORTWAVE RIDGE ALOFT. THIS PATTERN CHANGES 
QUICKLY HOWEVER...AS LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS OVER TX/OK ON 
SUNDAY...AND TRACKS NE ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY THROUGH MONDAY. GFS 
AND ECMWF ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THIS SYSTEM. A WARM FRONT AND 
ISENTROPIC LIFT SPREADS RAIN BACK INTO OUR AREA SUNDAY AFTERNOON. 
MAX LIFT COMES SUNDAY NIGHT WITH FAVORABLE POSITIONING OF THE JET 
EXIT/ENTRANCE REGIONS OVER THE TN VALLEY ALONG WITH A NEGATIVE TILT 
TO THE 300-500 MB TROUGH...AND WILL MENTION A SLIGHT CHANCE OF TSTMS 
THIS PERIOD. THE SURFACE COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH ON MONDAY...BUT 
THE CHANCE OF SHOWERS PERSISTS THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT AS THE LONGWAVE 
TROUGH SLOWLY MOVES EAST. CLOUDY AND COOL CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED 
WITH THE LINGERING TROUGH FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
835 PM EDT WED APR 2 2014

.DISCUSSION...CLOSEST AND MOST ORGANIZED CONVECTION TO OUR NW IS 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE WARM FRONT...WHERE MUCAPE WAS RUNNING 500 TO 
1000 J/KG OVER W TN AND WRN KY THIS EVENING. SURFACE DEWBPOINTS IN

THIS TIME. RAP13 MODEL SPREADS SOME LIGHT PRECIPITATION ACROSS PARTS 
OF E TN AFTER MIDNIGHT...BUT NOT MUCH INDICATED FOR SW VA. CURRENT 
FORECAST GRIDS NUDGE POPS UP TO 20 PERCENT SOUTH TO 40 PERCENT NORTH 
OVERNIGHT. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW SLIGHT INSTABILITY OVERNIGHT...
SO WILL CONTINUE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. 

OTHERWISE...HOURLY TEMPS AND DEW POINT TEMPS IN THE GRIDS ARE 
RUNNING CLOSE TO SURFACE OBSERVATIONS. PROBABLY WILL FRESHEN THE 
HOURLY GRIDS JUST SLIGHTLY AND REMOVE ANY AFTER MIDNIGHT WORDING 
TOWARD 1030 TO 11 PM EDT.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...DEEPENING SURFACE
LOW TO MOVE FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS THURSDAY NIGHT TO THE GREAT
LAKES FRIDAY. MOST OF THE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE ALONG
AND AHEAD OF THE FRONT ACROSS WESTERN AND MIDDLE TN THURSDAY NIGHT
WITH SOME SHOWERS AND STORMS SPREADING INTO WESTERN SECTIONS
OVERNIGHT. BETTER CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FRIDAY
MORNING AND INTO THE AFTERNOON. MOIST AND UNSTABLE AIR MASS AHEAD
OF FRONT WILL LEAD TO WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.
DAMAGING WINDS WILL BE THE MAIN THREAT BUT ISOLATED TORNADOES
POSSIBLE AS WELL. THE STORMS MAY BE WEAKENING AS THEY MOVE INTO THE
CWA FROM THE WEST IN THE MORNING...BUT COULD REDEVELOP AND GET
STRONG AS THEY MOVE INTO EASTERN AREAS.

SHOWERS AND STORMS MOVE EAST FRIDAY EVENING AND HIGH PRESSURE WILL
SLIDE IN FOR A SUNNY SATURDAY AND PARTLY CLOUDY SUNDAY. A SURFACE
LOW DEVELOPING OVER TX COAST SUNDAY WILL BRING UP OLD FRONTAL
BOUNDARY NORTH SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. THIS LOW DEEPENS AS IT
MOVES NORTH ACROSS LOWER MS VALLEY INTO THE GREAT LAKES. PRE
FRONTAL RAINS WILL BE LIKELY MONDAY AND THEN WRAP AROUND SHOWERS
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE SEVERAL DEGREES COOLER
FRIDAY WITH CLOUDS AND PRECIPITATION. THEN COOLER ON THE WEEKEND
WITH A DRIER AIR MASS. TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY MUCH BELOW NORMAL
TEMPERATURES BEHIND MONDAYS FRONT WITH HIGHS BACK IN THE 50S.

545 
FXUS64 KMRX 020814
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT WED APR 2 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...TODAY SHOULD BE ANOTHER DRY DAY 
ALTHOUGH SOME CIRRUS AND ALTO CU WILL BE ON THE INCREASE THROUGH THE 
DAY AS A SHORT WAVE TROUGH RIDES EAST NORTHEAST OUT OF THE LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. BOTH THE GFS AND NAM MOVE THIS WAVE ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA TONIGHT HOWEVER THE GFS WAS LESS OPTIMISTIC WITH THE 
ABILITY OF THE SHORT WAVE TO PRODUCE SHOWERS ACROSS THE REGION. 
THEREFORE...STAYED WITH SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS FOR MOST OF THE 
AREA. WENT A LITTLE HIGHER ON THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WHERE THERE IS 
A SMALL CHANCE FOR A BRIEF PERIOD OF THUNDER DUE TO PROXIMITY TO THE 
SLIGHTLY BETTER INSTABILITY. CONVECTIVE INHIBITION SHOULD BE A 
LITTLE TOO GREAT FARTHER EAST FOR THUNDER. STAYED RIGHT IN THE 
MIDDLE OF GUIDANCE MAXES TODAY WHILE EDGING MINS CLOSER TO THE 
MILDER NAM TEMPERATURES TONIGHT DUE TO THE EXPECTED INCREASE 
IN MID DECK CLOUDS. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL BE 
EXITING TO THE NE THURSDAY MORNING...AND WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS 
NORTH. BEHIND THIS EXITING TROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON...THERE WILL BE 
LITTLE IN THE WAY OF FORCING TO OVERCOME A STRONG CAPPING INVERSION 
THAT WILL BE IN PLACE. CIN IS STRONGEST OVER SOUTHERN AREAS...SO 
WILL REMOVE POPS FROM THAT AREA...WITH JUST LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCES 
NORTH WHERE THE CAP IS WEAKER. 

THE CAP BEGINS TO ERODE THURSDAY NIGHT...AND QG FORCING INCREASES 
FRIDAY MORNING AS THE UPPER TROUGH AND SURFACE FRONT APPROACH FROM 
THE WEST. HOWEVER FORCING IS NOT PARTICULARLY STRONG AS THE UPPER 
JET LIFTS NE ACROSS THE PLAINS AND MS VALLEY...AND INSTABILITY IS 
MARGINAL WITH MAX MUCAPE VALUES IN THE 500-800 J/KG RANGE WITH THE 
MORE UNSTABLE NAM. THERE IS SOME FAVORABLE 0-6 KM SHEAR...STEEP LOW 
LEVEL LAPSE RATES...AND LOW LCL HEIGHTS...SO THERE COULD BE A FEW 
STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS POSSIBLE WITH A THREAT OF ISOLATED 
TORNADOES. WINDOW OF TIMING FOR THE BEST THREAT LOOKS TO BE 15-21Z. 
GFS IS FASTER WITH THE FRONTAL EXIT FRIDAY EVENING THAN THE NAM BY 
ABOUT 3 HOURS...BUT EVEN THE NAM HAS IT THROUGH BY MIDNIGHT. WILL 
SPEED UP THE ENDING OF POPS AREAWIDE TO MIDNIGHT.

DRY AND SUNNY CONDITIONS WITH COOLER TEMPS ARE EXPECTED FOR SATURDAY 
AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM THE NW. THERE IS REASONABLY GOOD 
AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE GFS AND ECMWF ON A DEEP TROUGH MOVING ACROSS 
THE PLAINS...WHICH INDUCES A LOW TO DEVELOP OVER THE SOUTHERN MS 
VALLEY REGION. THIS LOW TRACKS NE ACROSS THE CAROLINAS THROUGH 
MONDAY. BOTH MODELS BEGIN TO SPREAD PRECIP INTO OUR AREA LATE SUNDAY 
AND SUNDAY NIGHT. WILL RAISE POPS TO LIKELY FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
MONDAY. THE DEEP UPPER TROUGH IS SLOW TO EXIT THE REGION...SO WILL 
KEEP CHANCE POPS IN THROUGH TUESDAY WITH BELOW NORMAL TEMPS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...WEAK HIGH PRESSURE DOMINATING

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...RAIN CHANCES CONTINUE 
FOR THE EARLY PARTS OF THE LONG TERM...ALTHO NOT THAT HIGH UNTIL 
LATE THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY...WHICH IS ALSO THE MAIN PERIOD FOR 
THUNDERSTORMS (A FEW STRONG TO SEVERE). TIMING OF FRONTAL PASSAGE 
LOOKS ON TRACK...SO WILL NOT MENTION ANY THUNDERSTORMS AFTER FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON WITH RAIN CHANCES FALLING SHARPLY FRIDAY EVENING.

SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGE BRIEFLY BUILD OVER THE EASTERN STATES 
SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT...KEEPING THIS OUR MAIN DRY PERIOD. 
LONGWAVE TROUGH STARTS TO BUILD ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND SRN PLAINS BY 
SUNDAY...WITH A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM PROGGED TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE 
LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND GULF COAST REGION SUNDAY EVENING. THIS 
SYSTEM IS NOW INDICATED TO BE A MAJOR WEATHER MAKER FOR US INTO 
TUESDAY...WITH SOME AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS. THE 
MAIN CHANGE IN FORECAST GRIDS WAS TO GENERALLY INCREASE POPS FROM 
SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. NO SUPPORT FOR MORE THAN SHOWERS 
AND MUCH TOO WARM FOR ANY SNOW SHOWERS EVEN IN OUR HIGHEST TERRAIN 
FOR NOW. 

OTHERWISE...BREEZY TO WINDY CONDITIONS THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. 
TEMPS WILL CONTINUE TO RUN ABOVE CLIMO FOR BOTH THURSDAY AND FRIDAY 
THEN FALL TO AROUND CLIMO FOR THE WEEKEND INTO MONDAY. SOME DEGREE 
OF CLOUDINESS AND COOLER TEMPS EXPECTED FOR TUESDAY AS THE LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKS NE ACROSS THE MID-ATLANTIC AND NEW ENGLAND 
STATES AT THAT TIME. 00Z AND 12Z GFSX MOS NOT THAT FAR APART AND 
ALSO SIMILAR TO LATEST ECMX MOS...SO JUST MINOR TWEAKS WHERE NEEDED.

325 
FXUS64 KMRX 010811
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
410 AM EDT TUE APR 1 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY)... A VORT MAX WILL CROSS THE 
AREA THIS MORNING...BRINGING MAINLY MIDLEVEL CLOUDS TO THE AREA. 
MOST OF THE PRECIP SEEN ON RADAR IS NOT REACHING THE GROUND AS THE 
SURFACE TO 700 MB LAYER IS VERY DRY. ANY RAIN THAT DOES REACH THE 
GROUND WILL BE TOO ISOLATED AND LIGHT TO WARRANT ANY POPS THIS 
MORNING. WE SHOULD SEE MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES BY AFTERNOON...AND WITH A 
LOW LEVEL SW FLOW...TEMPS WILL WARM INTO THE MID AND UPPER 70S IN 
THE VALLEY. THIS PATTERN WILL PERSIST THROUGH WEDNESDAY AS A RIDGE 
SLOWLY DRIFTS EAST OFF THE GA/FL COAST. HIGHS MAY REACH 80 IN THE 
SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY ON WEDNESDAY. 

A SHORTWAVE TROUGH IS SHOWN BY THE NAM AND GFS TO MOVE THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. A PUSH OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE BEHIND A 850 MB WARM 
FRONTAL FEATURE WILL PROVIDE ENOUGH MOISTURE TO BRING SOME LIGHT 
SHOWERS. A CHANCE OF SHOWERS CONTINUES THROUGH THURSDAY AS WE GET AN 
INCREASINGLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING...SUPPORTED BY SOME WEAK 
UPPER DIVERGENCE AND A STRENGTHENING LLJ. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW 
THE CAPPING INVERSION STRONGEST SOUTH AND EAST...AND WEAKEST NORTH 
AND WEST. WILL PATTERN POPS ACCORDINGLY...FROM SLIGHT CHANCES SE TO 
HIGH CHANCES NW...WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE OF TSTMS EVERYWHERE.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS GENERALLY AGREE 
THAT A RELATIVELY STRONG SHORT WAVE TROUGH WILL BUILD NORTHEAST FROM 
THE CENTRAL PLAINS INTO THE GREAT LAKES FROM THURSDAY EVENING 
THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING. ASSOCIATED DEEPENING SURFACE LOW PRESSURE 
WILL DRAG A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY AND MODELS 
DEPICT SUFFICIENT SHEAR AND INSTABILITY FOR CONVECTIVE STORMS AHEAD 
OF THE FRONT. THIS EVENT IS STILL A FEW DAYS AWAY BUT THE 
POSSIBILITY EXISTS FOR A FEW STORMS TO PRODUCE DAMAGING WINDS AND AN 
ISOLATED TORNADO DURING THE DAY FRIDAY. THE FRONT SHIFTS STEADILY 
EAST FRIDAY NIGHT WITH A DECREASING CHANCE OF RAIN. THE DAYTIME 
PERIOD SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY STILL LOOKS DRY AS A SHORT WAVE RIDGE 
BUILDS ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN STATES. ECMWF AND GFS SOLUTIONS 
DIVERGE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY SO FORECAST CONFIDENCE DIMINISHES 
TOWARD THE END OF THE LONG TERM. MODELS SHOW VARYING STRENGTHS AND 
SYSTEM TRACK WITH THE EARLY WEEK EVENT BUT GENERALLY TRY TO BRING 
ANOTHER SHORT WAVE TROUGH NORTHEAST FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS ACROSS 
THE OHIO VALLEY. USED MEDIUM CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS DUE TO 
UNCERTAINTY WITH THIS SYSTEM.

&&

046 
FXUS64 KMRX 010140 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
940 PM EDT MON MAR 31 2014

.DISCUSSION...
MILD CONDITIONS ARE IN PLACE THIS EVENING ACROSS THE REGION DUE TO
THE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE THAT WAS IN PLACE TODAY...WHICH ALLOWED
TEMPERATURES TO CLIMB WELL INTO THE 60S TO LOWER 70S. A SHORTWAVE
TROUGH TO THE WEST WILL CONTINUE TO APPROACH THE REGION OVERNIGHT.
AS A RESULT...DECKS OF MID TO HIGH-LEVEL CLOUDS WILL INCREASE
/ESPECIALLY AFTER MIDNIGHT/. THIS WILL PREVENT RADIATIONAL COOLING
FROM BEING AS PRONOUNCED AS WHAT WAS OBSERVED LAST NIGHT. AS A
RESULT...LOWS WILL BE 10-15 DEGREES WARMER THAN LAST NIGHT AS THE
MERCURY WILL BOTTOM OUT IN THE 40S TO LOWER 50S ACROSS THE VALLEY.
MODELS ARE KICKING OFF SOME LIGHT QPF SIGNALS LATE TONIGHT AS THE
BRUNT OF THE SHORTWAVE MOVES THROUGH. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE DECAYING
LIFT AND DRY BOUNDARY LAYER...HAVE HELD OFF ON ANY MENTIONABLE POPS
FOR NOW...AS THINK THIS WILL PRIMARILY BE SOME PASSING DENSER
CLOUD COVER PASSING THROUGH AROUND DAYBREAK.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             50  78  50  80 /  10  10   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  48  76  49  79 /  10  10   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       49  76  49  78 /  10  10   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              43  74  41  78 /  10  10   0   0

SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS BY THE LATE MORNING AND AFTERNOON.

LOWER 80S FOR HIGHS WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. A WARM FRONT LIFTS NORTH 
INTO THE OHIO VALLEY REGION THURSDAY...WHILE SW FLOW ALOFT CONTINUES 
AND 925 TO 850 MB TEMPS SHOW A GOOD RISE. COORDINATED WITH OUR NWS 
NEIGHBORS AND FOUND SUPPORT TO PUSH MAX TEMPS UP IN LINE WITH THE 
LATEST MOS GUIDANCE.

MODELS SHOW GOOD CONTINUITY IN DEVELOPING ORGANIZED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS ON FRIDAY AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT. KEPT POPS AT LIKELY 
FOR BOTH FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW STRONG 
WIND FIELDS AND SLIGHT INSTABILITY FOR THOSE PERODS...PLUS TIMING OF 
CONVECTION WILL BE DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. PREVIOUS 
WORDING OF A FEW STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS IN THE HWO PRODUCT LOOKED 
ON TRACK.

OTHERWISE...A DRY WEEKEND WITH SEASONAL TEMPS...SO LITTLE TO NO 
CHANGES MADE. INTRODUCING MONDAY WITH CHANCE POPS NORTH TO SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS SOUTH FOR NOW...ALTHO MODELS DO DIVERGE SOME BY THAT FAR 
OUT.

418 
FXUS64 KMRX 310657 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
257 AM EDT MON MAR 31 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
TEMPERATURES EARLY THIS MORNING ARE RUNNING A TAD COOLER THAN
FORECAST IN A FEW VALLEY LOCATIONS. PROJECTED LOW TEMPS ARE STILL
IN THE RANGE FOR POSSIBLE FROST...SO THE ADVISORY WILL BE
MAINTAINED UNCHANGED.

HIGH PRESSURE FROM THE SURFACE THROUGH 300 MB WILL BE OVER THE AREA 
TODAY...PROVIDING SUNNY SKIES AND WARMER TEMPERATURES IN THE MID 60S 
TO LOWER 70S IN MOST SPOTS. GFS MOS TEMPS SEEM A BIT ON THE WARM 
SIDE...SO WILL UNDERCUT IT BY A FEW DEGREES...CLOSER TO NAM MOS. 
TONIGHT THE RIDGE AXIS SHIFTS EAST OF THE AREA...AND A SW FLOW 
DEVELOPS THROUGH THE COLUMN. A WEAK TROUGH REFLECTED AT 700-500MB 
WILL MOVE THROUGH AFTER MIDNIGHT...WHICH SHOULD BRING SOME BROKEN 
HIGH TO MIDLEVEL CLOUDS. THIS WILL HOLD LOW TEMPS UP IN THE 40S IN 
MOST SPOTS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
A RETURN TO MORE WEST TO SOUTHWEST FLOW TUESDAY THOUGH FRIDAY WILL
ALLOW FOR SPRING-LIKE TEMPERATURES TO SPREAD INTO THE TENNESSEE
VALLEY. FOR LATE MONDAY AND TUESDAY...A NORTHERN STREAM UPPER
TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES WITH ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT
PULLING INTO THE LOWER OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS...BUT UPPER
DYNAMICS WELL NORTH AND AIRMASS STILL STABLE. WILL KEEP FORECAST
DRY.

THIS BOUNDARY WILL LIFT BACK NORTH INTO THE OHIO VALLEY WITH 
SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT ANTICIPATED FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AHEAD OF A 
STRONGER SOUTHERN STREAM TROUGH EXITING THE ROCKIES INTO THE PLAINS. 
THE UPPER TROUGH AND CYCLOGENESIS WILL LIFT NORTHEAST INTO THE GREAT 
LAKES FOR FRIDAY WITH TRAILING COLD FRONT MOVING INTO THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY. AN OUTBREAK OF SEVERE STORMS ARE POSSIBLE OVER THE WESTERN/ 
MIDDLE TENNESSEE VALLEY FRIDAY...THEN SPREAD INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
LATE FRIDAY/FRIDAY EVENING.

WILL NEED TO CONTINUE TO WATCH FOR THIS POSSIBILITY THROUGHOUT THE 
WEEK AND WILL INCLUDE IN THE HWO. MAIN CONCERN WILL BE DAMAGING 
WINDS AND ISOLATED TORNADOES.

THIS SYSTEM PULLS EAST OF THE AREA FOR NEXT WEEKEND. WILL KEEP NEXT 
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY DRY.

.DISCUSSION...

QUICKLY DROPPED OFF AFTER SUNSET...AND WILL LIKELY DROP BELOW
FREEZING OVER NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA LATER
TONIGHT. ADDITIONALLY...LOWS IN THE MID 30S WILL BE COMMON OVER
THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY. DUE TO THE RECENT GREEN UP THAT
HAS OCCURRED...THE THREAT FOR A DAMAGING FROST WILL EXIST IN THESE
LOCATIONS...SO A FROST ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT LATE TONIGHT THROUGH
MID-MORNING ON MONDAY. ANY PRECAUTIONS TO COVER SENSITIVE PLANTS
THAT MAY BE OUT IN THESE AREAS SHOULD BE TAKEN.

FXUS64 KMRX 301840
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT SUN MAR 30 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED OFF THE MID ATLANTIC
COAST...WITH AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MID MS
RIVER VALLEY. THIS HIGH WILL SLOWLY SETTLE OVER THE FORECAST AREA
TONIGHT...WITH CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS CREATING EXCELLENT
RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS. AS A RESULT...THINK THAT AREAS OF
FROST WILL DEVELOP OVER THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA...AND WILL ISSUE A
FROST ADVISORY FOR SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY AREAS WHERE THE
SPRING FREEZE PROGRAM HAS ALREADY BEGUN. A RAPID WARMING TREND IS
EXPECTED TO BEGIN ON MONDAY...AS A SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW DEVELOPS ON
THE BACK SIDE OF THE DEPARTING HIGH. OVERALL...DRY AND TRANQUIL
CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...WITH AFTERNOON
TEMPS SOME TEN TO FIFTEEN DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM
AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH TUESDAY
NIGHT...BUT WILL TREND TOWARDS THE WARMER GFS NUMBERS THROUGH THE
PERIOD SINCE SOUTHERLY WINDS AND MOSTLY SUNNY ARE EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY TO SUNDAY)...WEAK RIDGING TO ZONAL ALLOW OVER 
THE EASTERN U.S. ON WEDNESDAY WILL ALLOW FOR A DRY AND WARM DAY.  
WILL THEN MOVE INTO A MORE PROGRESS PATTERN AND A CHANGE TO 
UNSETTLED WEATHER FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.  A STRONG SHORT WAVE 
PUSHES THROUGH ON THURSDAY FOR AN INITIAL ROUND OF CONVECTION.  ONLY 
WEAK INSTABILITY IN PLACE SHOULD GENERATE A BAND OF SHOWERS WITH 
SOME EMBEDDED THUNDER.  THEN...A STRONG FRONT MOVES IN FOR FRIDAY 
PROVIDING A SECOND ROUND OF CONVECTION WITH INCREASED INSTABILITY 
AND BETTER JET DYNAMICS FOR A BETTER CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS ON 
FRIDAY. MODELS IN RATHER POOR AGREEMENT FOR THE REST OF THE PERIOD 
AND IS CONFIDENCE LOW.  A FEW LINGERING SHOWERS ARE POSSIBLE INTO 
SATURDAY AS THE FRONT EXITS THE REGION.  GFS BRINGS IN SURFACE HIGH 
BUILDING IN ON SUNDAY WHILE THE ECMWF BRINGS UP AN AREA OF LOW 
PRESSURE FROM THE SOUTH.  WILL LEAVE THINGS DRY FOR NOW AND MONITOR 
FUTURE MODEL RUNS.

649 
FXUS64 KMRX 300658
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
258 AM EDT SUN MAR 30 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
THE CLOSED UPPER LOW OVERHEAD AT THE MOMENT WILL BE EXITING THE AREA 
THROUGH THE MORNING. STABILIZATION AND DECREASING MOISTURE WILL 
LIKELY BRING AN END TO SNOW SHOWERS IN MOST SPOTS BY 12Z. WILL KEEP 
SOME POPS GOING FROM 12-15Z IN THE MOUNTAINS AND SW VA...BUT THERE 
SHOULD NOT BE MUCH MORE ACCUMULATION AFTER DAYBREAK. WITH SNOW STILL 
ONGOING AT THE MOMENT...WILL KEEP THE WSW RUNNING...BUT THIS MAY 
NEED TO BE UPDATED FOR CANCELLATION BEFORE 12Z.

OBS ACROSS THE AREA SHOW ONLY A FEW SPOTS WITH WINDS ABOVE 10 
MPH...AND NO GUSTS HIGHER THAN 25...WELL BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA. 
WINDS ARE ONLY EXPECTED TO WEAKEN THROUGH THE EARLY MORNING 
HOURS...SO WILL CANCEL THE WIND ADVISORY. 

THE CLOUD AND TEMPERATURE FORECAST WILL BE TRICKY TODAY...AND 
SATELLITE SHOWS EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER UPSTREAM...AND MODELS ARE 
LIKELY CLEARING CLOUDS OUT TOO QUICKLY THIS MORNING. WILL LEAN ON 
THE COOL SIDE OF MOS GUIDANCE FOR HIGH TEMPS...ESPECIALLY NORTH. WE 
SHOULD SEE CLEAR SKIES EVERYWHERE BY LATE AFTERNOON...WITH CLEAR 
SKIES THROUGH THE NIGHT. LOW TEMPS TONIGHT WILL BE IN THE LOWER 30S 
IN THE NORTHERN HALF...AND LATER FORECASTS MAY NEED TO MONITOR THE 
NEED FOR A FREEZE WARNING OR FROST ADVISORY TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...
A MORE WEST TO SOUTHWEST FLOW IS EXPECTED THROUGH THE EXTENDED
PERIOD. FIRST SHORT-WAVE MOVES EAST ACROSS THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL
PLAINS THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES LATE MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY.
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY...BUT
LITTLE TO NO UPPER DYNAMICS AND LIMITED MOISTURE AND
INSTABILITY...SO KEPT FORECAST DRY.

A STRONGER UPPER TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE ROCKIES INTO THE PLAIN 
STATES FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY WITH ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT 
MOVING ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. AIRMASS 
AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM WILL BECOME MOIST AND UNSTABLE AS GULF MOISTURE 
PULLS NORTH. GFS AND ECMWF DIFFER ON TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM WITH THE 
GFS THE SLOWEST. WILL CALL FOR INCREASING CONVECTION FOR THURSDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. STRONG UPPER LEVEL JET WILL PLACE THE 
AREA UNDER FAVORED DIVERGENCE ALOFT LATE FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. 
SOUNDINGS SHOW DECENT DIRECTIONAL/SPEED SHEAR AS WELL. WILL CONTINUE 
TO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF SEVERE STORMS LATE FRIDAY AND FRIDAY
NIGHT.

DUE TO WEST TO SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT...A WARMING TREND WILL BE RULE 
FOR MOST OF THE EXTENDED WITH HIGHS CLIMBING INTO THE 70S.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             63  37  75  48 /   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  56  34  69  45 /   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       56  34  70  46 /   0   0   0   0

FXUS64 KMRX 300250

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1050 PM EDT SAT MAR 29 2014

.DISCUSSION...
COLD AIR IS FILTERING INTO THE REGION QUICKLY THIS EVENING BEHIND A 
COLD FRONT...WITH A GOOD SET-UP FOR SOME LOCALLY HEAVY NORTHWEST
FLOW SNOW SHOWERS ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS...PARTICULARLY ALONG THE GREAT SMOKY MOUNTAINS. GIVEN
THE DEEP MOISTURE IN PLACE AND THE STRONG NORTHWEST FLOW COMPONENT
/WHICH WILL FURTHER ENHANCE THE OROGRAPHIC LIFT/...PERIODS OF
LOCALLY HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THESE AREAS LATE
THIS EVENING AND THROUGH THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. SNOWFALL AMOUNTS OF
AROUND 4 INCHES WILL BE COMMON IN THESE AREAS...WITH LOCALLY HIGHER
AMOUNTS POSSIBLE ABOVE 4000 FT OR SO. THUS...HAVE DECIDED TO
UPGRADE TO A WINTER STORM WARNING IN THESE AREAS. ADDITIONALLY...
NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW SHOWERS WILL ALSO BE POSSIBLE THROUGHOUT THE
NIGHT INTO SUNDAY MORNING ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA. TOTALS OF 1 TO 3 INCHES WILL GENERALLY BE COMMON
THERE...AND MAINLY ABOVE 2500 FT. SOME LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS WILL
BE POSSIBLE...BUT WILL NOT BE WIDESPREAD ENOUGH TO WARRANT AN
UPGRADE TO A WARNING.

THE AFOREMENTIONED SNOWFALL IS FORECAST TO IMPACT LOCATIONS AT OR 
AROUND 2500 FT. SOME LIGHT SNOW MAY BE POSSIBLE IN THE VALLEYS...
ESPECIALLY AT LOCATIONS DOWN TO 2000 FT OR SO. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE
WARM CONDITIONS THAT HAVE BEEN IN PLACE FOR THE PAST SEVERAL
DAYS...DO NOT EXPECT MUCH IN THE WAY OF AN IMPACTS. MUCH OF THE
NORTHERN...CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY WILL REMAIN AT OR ABOVE
FREEZING OVERNIGHT AS WELL...SO NO IMPACTS ARE EXPECTED FROM ANY OF
THE FLURRIES THAT MAY MIX IN WITH THE LIGHT RAIN LATE TONIGHT AS
WELL.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             37  65  37  72 /  10   0   0   0

OAK RIDGE, TN                       35  59  33  70 /  50   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              33  53  29  68 /  70  40   0   0

010 
FXUS64 KMRX 291901
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT SAT MAR 29 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED OVER SOUTHWEST VA... 
WITH A COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHWEST OF IT ACROSS THE GREAT TN 
VALLEY. THIS LOW WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE NORTHEASTWARD TONIGHT...WITH 
A DEEP UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH BEHIND IT BRINGING A STRONG NORTHWESTERLY 
WIND FLOW OVER THE FORECAST AREA. SCATTERED RAIN SHOWERS THIS 
EVENING WILL EVENTUALLY TRANSITION TO SNOW SHOWERS TOWARDS MIDNIGHT 
AND THEREAFTER...WITH LIGHT SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED IN THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS...MAINLY ABOVE 2500 FEET. IT APPEARS THAT TEMPS 
WILL REMAIN TOO WARM IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS FOR MUCH ACCUMULATIONS. 
WITH UPSLOPE FLOW ALSO ENHANCING PRECIP AMOUNTS IN THE MOUNTAINS... 
WILL ISSUE A WINTER WX ADVISORY FOR LATE TONIGHT AND SUNDAY MORNING 
ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VA AND THE EAST TN 
MOUNTAINS. WILL ALSO ISSUE A WIND ADVISORY FOR THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS 
FOR LATE TONIGHT AND INTO SUNDAY MORNING...WHERE SUSTAINED WINDS 
WILL LIKELY BE ABOVE 25 MPH. HIGH PRESSURE THEN BEGINS TO BUILD OVER 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON...WITH SOUTHERLY WINDS ON 
ITS BACK SIDE BRINGING A RAPID WARMING TREND ON MONDAY. AS FOR 
TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT 
THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO WHERE 
SOME DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN OVER 
THE AREA TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND DRY 
WEATHER. A COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE AREA BY THURSDAY...WITH 
MODELS DISAGREEING ON TIMING OF ARRIVAL. ECMWF IS A LITTLE BIT MORE 
EXCITED BRINGING PRECIP AHEAD OF THE FRONT INTO THE AREA THURSDAY 
MORNING...AND CONVECTION THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING WHEN THE FRONT MOVES 
EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS. 

SOUNDINGS SHOW AMPLE MID AND UPPER LEVEL MOISTURE...BUT LIMITED CAPE 
THROUGH THE DAY THURSDAY. WILL SEE ENOUGH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ON 
FRIDAY TO INCREASE INSTABILITIES AND LOWER LCL HEIGHTS. DECENT WIND 
SHEAR IS PRESENT THROUGHOUT THE DAY FRIDAY. MID AND UPPER LEVEL WINDS 
WILL BE GREATER THAN 50 KTS...ESPECIALLY FRIDAY EARLY AFTERNOON. 
CONCERN WILL ALSO BE IF THESE WINDS GET PULLED DOWN TO THE SURFACE 
WITH THIS SYSTEM. FOR NOW...A FEW STORMS COULD BE STRONG TO 
SEVERE...BUT WILL NEED TO KEEP AN EYE ON THAT MOISTURE ARRIVAL. 
TEMPERATURES BEFORE THE ARRIVAL OF THE COLD FRONT WILL BE A COUPLE 
OF DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL...COOLING TO NORMAL TEMPERATURES WITH THE 
COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE. 
&&

.DISCUSSION... 
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED OVER 
NORTHEAST AL AND NORTHWEST GA...WITH AN INVERTED TROUGH EXTENDING 
NORTHEASTWARD OF IT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. AREA RADARS REVEAL 
ANOTHER LARGE CONVECTIVE COMPLEX ALONG THE NORTHERN GULF COASTAL 
REGION THIS MORNING...WHICH HAS AGAIN CUT OFF THE MOISTURE INFLOW 
INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY AHEAD OF THIS LOW. HOWEVER...A LARGE AREA 
OF RAIN WAS OCCURRING OVER MIDDLE TN BEHIND THIS LOW PRESSURE 
AREA...WHICH WILL EVENTUALLY SPREAD ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA 
TODAY AS THE LOW MOVES NORTHEASTWARD. MODELS CONTINUE TO INDICATE 
SOME WEAK INSTABILITY DEVELOPING OVER THE FORECAST AREA BY EARLY 
THIS AFTERNOON...SO THINK THAT A FEW RUMBLES OF THUNDER WILL BE 
POSSIBLE...BUT SHOWERS SHOULD REMAIN THE PREDOMINATE PRECIP TYPE. 

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO MENTION 
THUNDER...AND TO RAISE TEMPS A LITTLE OVER NORTHEAST TN AND 
SOUTHWEST VA WHERE THE COLD FRONT WILL NOT PASS THROUGH UNTIL 
LATE AFTERNOON.

010 
FXUS64 KMRX 290720
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 AM EDT SAT MAR 29 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
THE ONSET OF PRECIP WILL BE DELAYED FURTHER FROM PREVIOUS 
FORECAST...AS PRECIP ROTATING SLOWLY NE OVER MS/AL AT THE MOMENT 
WILL REACH OUR SOUTHERN COUNTIES AFTER 10Z. LIFT OVER THE ENTIRE 
AREA WILL MAX OUT BETWEEN 12Z AND 18Z AS THE SURFACE TO 850 MB LOW 
TRACKS ACROSS KY AND JET ENTRANCE REGION PROVIDES UPPER DIVERGENCE. 
ONE POTENTIAL CONCERN IS THE DEVELOPMENT OF CONVECTION TO OUR 
SOUTH...WHICH COULD CUT OFF OUR MOISTURE FEED AND REDUCE PRECIP 
AMOUNTS. WILL LOWER QPF A BIT TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS...BUT STILL HAVE 
CATEGORICAL POPS. WEAK INSTABILITY SUGGESTS JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
TSTMS SOUTH. AS THE UPPER LOW MOVES ACROSS TONIGHT...STEEPENING LOW 
LEVEL LAPSE RATES WILL KEEP SCATTERED SHOWERS GOING OVERNIGHT IN 
NORTHERN AREAS...WITH SOME UPSLOPE FLOW ENHANCING PRECIP AMOUNTS IN 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. COLD ADVECTION DURING THIS TIME WILL CHANGE 
PRECIP TO SNOW...MAINLY AFTER 06Z. SOME LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS AROUND 1 
INCH CAN BE EXPECTED...LOCALLY UP TO 2 POSSIBLE IN THE HIGHEST PEAKS 
OF THE SMOKIES AND AT HIGH KNOB.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...
NORTHWEST FLOW AND WRAP- AROUND MOISTURE WILL KEEP A CHANCE OF
SNOW SHOWERS GOING ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE SUNDAY MORNING. UPPER TROUGH WILL
MOVE EAST OF THE AREA SUNDAY WITH PRECIPITATION ENDING AREA-WIDE BY
NOON WITH CLEARING SKY. A CHILLY NIGHT FOR SUNDAY NIGHT/MONDAY
MORNING DUE TO SURFACE RIDGING OVER THE AREA.

FOR MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...UPPER FLOW BECOMES WEST...THEN 
SOUTHWEST AS AN UPPER TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE ROCKIES INTO THE 
PLAINS. THICKNESS AND 850MB TEMPERATURES WARM WITH TEMPERATURES 
CLIMBING INTO THE 70S MOST LOCATIONS BY MID-WEEK. SURFACE RIDGING 
MOVING EAST OF THE AREA WILL ALLOW GULF MOISTURE TO PULL NORTH INTO 
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WITH INCREASING INSTABILITY AS WELL. 

AS THE UPPER TROUGH MOVES EAST FROM THE PLAINS TOWARD THE OHIO 
VALLEY...SURFACE LOW AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE 
OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS FOR FRIDAY. INCREASING CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
FOR THURSDAY WITH THUNDERSTORMS ANTICIPATED FOR FRIDAY. DEPENDING ON 
TIMING OF FRONTAL BOUNDARY FRIDAY...STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS 
ARE POSSIBLE. WILL NEED TO WATCH FOR THE POTENTIAL OF WIDESPREAD 
SEVERE STORMS FOR THE END OF THE WEEK.

FOLLOWED GFS MOS CLOSELY THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1005 PM EDT FRI MAR 28 2014

.DISCUSSION...
A WEAKENING COMPLEX OF THUNDERSTORMS ALONG THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER
THIS EVENING CONTINUES TO TRACK TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA AS AN
UPPER-TROUGH DEEPENS AND SHIFTS EASTWARD TOWARD EAST TENNESSEE
TONIGHT INTO SATURDAY. THOUGH WIND SHEAR VALUES WILL SUPPORT SOME
SHOWER/STORM ORGANIZATION...INSTABILITY VALUES REMAIN FAIRLY LOW.
AS A RESULT...THE STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORM POTENTIAL WILL BE
FAIRLY LOW. HOWEVER...THE THREAT FOR EMBEDDED THUNDERSTORMS WITHIN
THE ADVANCING SHOWERS WILL EXIST AFTER MIDNIGHT AS THE
AFOREMENTIONED ACTIVITY MOVES IN. GIVEN THE MOIST BOUNDARY
LAYER...THE INCREASING LIFT FROM THE APPROACHING TROUGH AND THE
CURRENT MOVEMENT OF THE SHOWERS/STORMS...HAVE MAINTAINED
CATEGORICAL POPS ACROSS MUCH OF THE REGION AFTER MIDNIGHT. GIVEN
THE CLOUD COVER AND SOUTHERLY FLOW...LOWS TONIGHT WILL BE MILD AND
BOTTOM OUT IN THE 50S AREAWIDE.

FXUS64 KMRX 281850
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EDT FRI MAR 28 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT OVER KY AND WEST TN...GENERALLY ALONG A 
CINCINNATI TO CLARKSVILLE TO MEMPHIS LINE. CURRENT RADARS REVEAL 
ONLY A FEW LIGHT AND ISOLATED SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH 
A LARGE CONVECTIVE COMPLEX OVER THE NORTHERN GULF COAST REGION  
CUTTING OFF THE MOISTURE INFLOW INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY TODAY. AS A 
RESULT...EXPECT ONLY SCATTERED CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY THROUGH THE 
EVENING HOURS. CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY SHOULD INCREASE AFTER MIDNIGHT... 
AS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPS OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY AND 
MOVES NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY SATURDAY MORNING. 
THIS LOW AND ITS ASSOCIATED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH SHOULD PRODUCE A GOOD 
COVERAGE OF CONVECTION OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY...WITH 
SOME MARGINAL INSTABILITY DEVELOPING OVER THE FORECAST AREA AHEAD OF 
A COLD FRONT SATURDAY MORNING. WILL MENTION SHOWERS AS THE 
PREDOMINATE PRECIP TYPE WITH A JUST CHANCE OF TSTORMS DUE TO THE 
WEAK INSTABILITY. THE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH ASSOCIATED WITH THIS LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO FURTHER AMPLIFY ON SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON...WITH NORTHWESTERLY FLOW PRODUCING UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS 
OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. RIGHT 
NOW...IT APPEARS THAT LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE POSSIBLE OVER 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FT. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT... 
BUT WILL COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO WHERE SOME DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
DOMINATE AREA WEATHER EARLY IN THE EXTENDED.  THIS WILL PROVIDE DRY 
AND WARM CONDITIONS MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.  ONLY CONCERN THIS 
PERIOD WILL BE A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY APPROACHING FROM THE WEST ON 
TUESDAY.  MODELS WEAKEN THIS FEATURE AS IT MOVES INTO THE UPPER 
RIDGE.  EXPECT MOSTLY A FEW CLOUDS MOVING THROUGH TO BE THE MAIN 
EFFECT FROM THIS FEATURE.  MAIN SYSTEM OF CONCERN THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED WILL BE A COLD FRONT APPROACHING DURING THE THURSDAY/FRIDAY 
TIME FRAME.  MODELS/RUNS IN POOR AGREEMENT...ESPECIALLY WITH TIMING 
OF THIS SYSTEM.  MODELS TRENDING TOWARD THE RIDGE MAINTAINING OVER 
THE EASTERN U.S. INTO THURSDAY...ONLY ALLOWING A WEAK IMPULSE TO 
MOVE IN ON THURSDAY AND THE MAIN FRONT AND ASSOCIATED PRECIP HOLDING 
OFF UNTIL FRIDAY.  OVERALL...CONFIDENCE IS LOW BUT HAVE TRENDED 
GRIDS TOWARDS THIS AND HAVE LOWERED POPS A BIT ON THURSDAY AND 
INTRODUCE CHANCE POPS FRIDAY. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

WITH A LARGE CONVECTIVE COMPLEX OVER THE DEEP SOUTH WHICH HAS CUT 
OFF THE MOISTURE INFLOW INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS MORNING. AS A 
RESULT...EXPECT ONLY SCATTERED CONVECTIVE TO CONTINUE THROUGH THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS. THE COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO ONLY SLOWLY DRIFT 
EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY TODAY...WITH MARGINAL 
INSTABILITY DEVELOPING AHEAD OF IT OVER MIDDLE TN AND THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU. WHILE THE MODELS INDICATE THAT MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA 
WILL BE STABLE THIS AFTERNOON...WILL MENTION THUNDER SINCE THE AXIS 
OF INSTABILITY WILL BE RIGHT ALONG THE WESTERN EDGES OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. OBSERVATIONS AROUND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS INDICATE THAT WINDS 
WERE QUICKLY DIMINISHING THIS MORNING...AND MODELS INDICATE THAT THE 
STRONG LOW-LEVEL 850 MB JET WAS LIFTING TO THE NORTH. THUS...WILL 
PLAN TO CANCEL THE WIND ADVISORY EARLY THIS MORNING. 

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO REMOVE 
THE WIND ADVISORY...LOWER POPS SOME FOR THIS AFTERNOON...AND TO 
RAISE AFTERNOON TEMPS A LITTLE IN ALL ZONES. 
&&

846 
FXUS64 KMRX 280711
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 AM EDT FRI MAR 28 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...
RAIN SHOWERS WILL BE SPREADING ACROSS THE AREA THIS MORNING IN 
ASSOCIATION WITH GOOD UPPER DIVERGENCE AND A STRONG LLJ. WILL KEEP 
THE WIND ADVISORY FOR THE MTNS IN PLACE AS OBSERVED WIND GUSTS HAVE 
BEEN NEAR 40 MPH. DRY LOW LEVEL AIR AT THE MOMENT WILL GRADUALLY 
MOISTEN THROUGH THE MORNING. BY THE AFTERNOON...SOME MIDLEVEL DRYING 
AND THE EXIT OF THE UPPER JET WILL LOWER PRECIP CHANCES. THE SURFACE 
FRONT STALLS TO OUR NORTH AND WEST...AND LOW PRESSURE TRACKS NE 
ALONG THE FRONT. THIS WILL SPREAD PRECIP BACK INTO THE AREA FROM THE 
SOUTH TONIGHT. THERE IS SOME WEAK INSTABILITY TONIGHT...AND WITH 
SOME STRONG FORCING ALOFT...WILL INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF TSTMS. 
THE LOW WILL BE TO OUR NE SAT AFTERNOON...BUT THE 500 MB TROUGH WILL 
BE DELAYED UNTIL SATURDAY NIGHT. VORT ADVECTION AND COOLING MIDLEVEL 
TEMPS WILL KEEP SOME SHOWERS IN NORTHERN AREAS THROUGH SAT NIGHT. A 
TRANSITION TO SNOW WILL OCCUR IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. SOME LIGHT 
ACCUMULATIONS ARE POSSIBLE WITH UPSLOPE NW FLOW BEFORE THE TROUGH 
AND MOISTURE EXITS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...
UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE EAST OF THE AREA SUNDAY. NORTHWEST FLOW
AROUND EXITING SURFACE LOW WILL PRODUCE SOME LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS
ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE
SUNDAY MORNING...OTHERWISE CLEARING SKY.

FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...UPPER AND SURFACE 
RIDGING WILL PRODUCE DRY CONDITIONS WITH WARMING THICKNESS/850MB 
TEMPERATURES. UPPER FLOW WILL BECOME ZONAL FOR EARLY PART OF THE 
WEEK UNTIL BROAD UPPER TROUGH OVER THE ROCKYS MOVE EAST TOWARD THE 
PLAIN STATES BY MID-WEEK. 

A SERIES OF SHORT-WAVES/JETS WILL MOVE EAST INTO THE PLAINS FOR 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY WITH SOUTHERLY BOUNDARY LAYER JET INCREASING 
OVER THE MIDDISSIPPI AND WESTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY. THE LOW-LEVEL JET 
WILL PULL INCREASING MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY INTO THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY FOR THE LATTER HALF OF THE WEEK. 

FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...SURFACE LOW WILL MOVE ACROSS THE 
MID-WEST/UPPER OHIO VALLEY WITH ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT PULLING INTO 
THE WESTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY. WIDESPREAD THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP 
BY THURSDAY MORNING OVER WESTERN TENNESSEE THEN SPREAD EAST TOWARD 
THE REGION DURING THE AFTERNOON/EVENING. GFS/ECMWF ARE DIFFERENT ON 
THE TIMING AND STRUCTURE OF THE UPPER FLOW WITH THIS SYSTEM. WILL 
CALL FOR CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE END OF THE 
EXTENDED.

FOLLOWED GFS MEX MOS CLOSELY THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH A WARM-UP 
ANTICIPATED AS SOUTHERLY WINDS INCREASE OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY BY 
MID-WEEK.

&&

260 
FXUS64 KMRX 271848
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EDT THU MAR 27 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OFF THE MID ATLANTIC COAST... 
WITH A VERY DRY AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. SOUTHERLY WINDS ON 
THE BACK SIDE OF THIS HIGH WILL CONTINUE TO BRING WARM AND MOIST AIR 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT 
PRE-FRONTAL CONVECTION AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT OVER THE MS RIVER 
VALLEY WILL MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA LATER TONIGHT...MAINLY AFTER 
MIDNIGHT AND INTO FRIDAY MORNING. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO 
SLOWLY MOVE EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON FRIDAY...WITH 
SOME MARGINAL INSTABILITY DEVELOPING AHEAD OF IT OVER MIDDLE TN. AS 
A RESULT...SCATTERED CONVECTION SHOULD REDEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA ON FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE 
PLAINS IS THEN PROGGED TO DEVELOP A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY LATE FRIDAY NIGHT...WHICH SHOULD PRODUCE A GOOD 
COVERAGE OF CONVECTION OVER THE FORECAST AREA LATE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO 
SATURDAY MORNING. MODELS INDICATE THE BEST INSTABILITY OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA WITH THIS LOW ON SATURDAY MORNING...SO WILL MENTION A 
BETTER COVERAGE OF TSTORMS THEN. BEFORE SATURDAY MORNING...WILL 
MENTION SHOWERS AS THE PREDOMINATE PRECIP TYPE WITH A JUST CHANCE OF 
TSTORMS DUE TO THE WEAK INSTABILITY. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT... 
BUT WILL COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE 
NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...WILL BE IN A QUIET WEATHER 
PATTERN FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE EXTENDED WITH A RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE IN CONTROL.  THIS WILL ALLOW FOR WARM AND DRY CONDITIONS 
SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.  ONLY CONCERN THIS TIME FRAME WILL BE A 
VERY WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY DAMPENING AS IT MOVE INTO THE HIGH 
PRESSURE RIDGE ON TUESDAY.  WILL KEEP A FEW LOW POPS OVER THE HIGHER 
AS THIS MOVES THROUGH.  THE RIDGE MOVES TO OUR EAST LATE IN THE 
PERIOD ALLOWING THE NEXT SYSTEM TO MOVE IN WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO 
THURSDAY FOR A RETURN OF A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND EVEN A FEW 
THUNDERSTORMS LATE IN THE PERIOD.

247 
FXUS64 KMRX 270734
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
334 AM EDT THU MAR 27 2014

.SHORT TERM /TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY/...
WIDESPREAD SUBFREEZING TEMPERATURES ARE IN PLACE ACROSS NEARLY ALL
OF THE FORECAST AREA ONCE AGAIN THIS MORNING THANKS TO THE COLD
AND DRY AIR MASS IN PLACE...ALONG WITH THE FAIRLY CALM WINDS AND
MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS EARLIER. AREAS OF MID TO HIGH CLOUDS WILL
OVERSPREAD THE REGION EARLY THIS MORNING AND INTO THE DAY
TODAY...WHICH WILL KEEP LOWS WARMER IN MOST LOCATIONS THAT LAST
NIGHT. WINDS WILL VEER TO THE SOUTHEAST AND QUICKLY INCREASE BY
MIDDAY...AND BECOME GUSTY AT TIMES BY THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS
A STRONG LOW-LEVEL JET PASSES TO THE NORTHWEST OF THE REGION OVER
MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND CENTRAL KENTUCKY. HOWEVER...WHILE WIDESPREAD
BREEZY CONDITIONS WILL EXIST /ESPECIALLY ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN
OF THE SMOKIES/...DO NOT THINK WIDESPREAD ADVISORY-LEVEL WINDS
WILL QUITE BE REACHED THIS EVENING AND OVERNIGHT. HOWEVER...SOME
LOCALLY STRONG GUSTS WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THESE MOUNTAINOUS
AREAS /WHILE THE VALLEYS SHOULD EXPERIENCE SOME BREEZY...BUT
WEAKER WIND SPEEDS/. THESE WINDS WILL ALSO HELP TO PUSH HIGHS INTO
THE LOW TO MID 60S IN MOST SPOTS BY THIS AFTERNOON...AND KEEP LOWS
TONIGHT ABOUT 15 TO 20 DEGREES WARMER THAN THE PREVIOUS NIGHT.

THE ATTENTION WILL THEN TURN TO AN UPPER-TROUGH THAT WILL PUSH
AREAS OF SHOWERS AND ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS INTO THE
AREA LATE TONIGHT INTO FRIDAY. STRONG BULK SHEAR VALUES AND SOME
INSTABILITY MAY ALLOW FOR SOME STRONGER STORMS TO ORGANIZE AND
DEVELOP...PARTICULARLY DURING THE DAY ON FRIDAY. HOWEVER...ATTM
THE BEST INSTABILITY WILL BE DISPLACED WELL TO THE SOUTH AND WEST
SO THINK THAT THE SEVERE THREAT IS FAIRLY LOW. THE MAIN FORECAST
ADJUSTMENT FOR THIS PERIOD WAS TO INCREASE POPS TO CATEGORICAL
ALONG THE PLATEAU BETWEEN 09-12Z TONIGHT AND AREAWIDE FROM 12-18Z
FRIDAY...BEFORE GRADUALLY TAPERING THEM OFF FROM WEST TO EAST
DURING THE MID AFTERNOON TO EVENING. HIGHS FRIDAY WILL BE SLIGHTLY
COOLER GIVEN THE PRECIPITATION AND CLOUD COVER...BUT WILL STILL
PEAK IN THE LOWER 60S IN MOST SPOTS ALONG THE VALLEY.

.LONG TERM /FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
THREAT OF STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY
HAS GREATLY DIMINISHED WITH SPC DAY 2 OUTLOOK NOW KEEPING SLIGHT
RISK OF SEVERE STORMS CONFINED TO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY
REGION. THIS MAKES SENSE AS LOW LEVEL SHEAR PROGGED TO BE ONLY
AROUND 25 KNOTS WITH THE MUCAPE ROUGHLY 400 J/KG OR LESS FOR FRIDAY
NIGHT...WITH EVEN LESS CAPE OVER NE TN AND SW VA. A BIT OF
INSTABILITY DOES LINGER INTO SATURDAY MORNING AND POSSIBLY SATURDAY
AFTERNOON...DEPENDING ON ACTUAL TIMING OF FRONTAL PASSAGE. I DID
DEPICT A BRIEF LOWERING OF POPS FOR 00Z TO 06Z SATURDAY...SHOWING A
BREAK BETWEEN EXITING CONVECTION FRIDAY AND THE APPROACH OF
ADDITIONAL CONVECTION FRIDAY NIGHT. PUSHED POPS BACK UP TO LIKELY
IN THE 06Z TO 12Z SATURDAY GRIDS...WITH PREVIOUS POP AND WEATHER
GRIDS GENERALLY STILL ON TRACK FOR SATURDAY.

OTHERWISE...SEE NO REASON NOT TO KEEP SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY DRY 
AT THIS TIME. MODELS ACTUALLY IN BETTER AGREEMENT ON THIS THAN 24 
HOURS AGO. UPPER AND SURFACE RIDGE STILL THE DOMINANT FEATURES FOR 
OUR REGION INTO MONDAY. LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS OVER MID-MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY REGION ON MONDAY THEN TRACKS NE INTO THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. 
THIS DEVELOPS S-SW LOW LEVEL FLOW FOR MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY... 
WHICH SUPPORTS WARMER MINS AND MAXES. MORE RIDGING FOR WEDNESDAY SO 
ANOTHER DRY PERIOD. THE 27/00Z GFSX MOS REFLECTS THESE WARMER TEMPS 
FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...SO I NUDGED TEMPS UP A BIT BUT STAYED CLOSE TO 
NWS NEIGHBORS GRIDS AS WELL. DAY SHIFT CAN MAKE FURTHER TWEAKS UP 
WITH TEMPS IF NEEDED.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             63  54  64  55 /   0  80  80  70 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  62  52  63  52 /   0  80  80  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       61  51  63  52 /   0  80  80  70 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              58  44  60  48 /   0  60  80  60 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...FREEZE WARNING UNTIL 9 AM EDT /8 AM CDT/ THIS MORNING FOR 
     ANDERSON-BLEDSOE-BRADLEY-GRAINGER-HAMBLEN-HAMILTON-
     JEFFERSON-KNOX-LOUDON-MARION-MCMINN-MEIGS-NW BLOUNT-NORTH 
     SEVIER-NORTHWEST COCKE-NORTHWEST MONROE-RHEA-ROANE-
     SEQUATCHIE-UNION-WEST POLK.

SIGNIFICANT PORTION OF SOUTHERN COUNTIES THAT WERE NOT IN THE
FREEZE WARNING WILL FALL TO OR BELOW FREEZING...SO WILL EXPAND
FREEZE WARNING SOUTH TO THE BORDER. WILL ALSO LOWER SOME MIN TEMPS
A BIT...LOWER WIND SPEEDS...AND TWEAK DEW POINTS AND SKY. UPDATE
OUT SOON.  


&&

682 
FXUS64 KMRX 261911
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT WED MAR 26 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY... 
WITH A VERY DRY AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS HIGH PRESSURE 
AREA WILL CONTINUE TO SLOWLY DRIFT EASTWARD OVER THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS TONIGHT...WITH CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS CREATING 
ANOTHER UNSEASONABLY COLD NIGHT. HIGH CLOUDS ARE EXPECTED TO 
INCREASE FROM THE SOUTHWEST OVERNIGHT...WHICH SHOULD HELP TO KEEP 
TEMPS ABOVE FREEZING AROUND THE CHATTANOOGA AREA. OTHERWISE...TEMPS 
SHOULD FALL BELOW FREEZING EVERYWHERE ELSE...AND WILL CONTINUE THE 
FREEZE WARNING FOR THE CENTRAL VALLEY AREAS WHERE THE SPRING FREEZE 
PROGRAM HAS BEEN BEGUN DUE TO BLOOMING VEGETATION. AS THE HIGH MOVES 
FURTHER EAST OFF THE CAROLINA COAST ON THURSDAY...SOUTHERLY WINDS ON 
ITS BACK SIDE WILL BRING A QUICK WARMING TREND OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. A COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE EASTWARD ACROSS THE MS RIVER 
VALLEY ON THURSDAY NIGHT...WITH PRE-FRONTAL CONVECTION AHEAD OF IT 
BRINGING SHOWERS...MAINLY AFTER MIDNIGHT. MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THAT SOME MARGINAL INSTABILITY WILL DEVELOP OVER THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY ON FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...AS THE COLD FRONT STALLS 
OUT AROUND THE FORECAST AREA. AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE PLAINS 
IS THEN PROGGED TO DEVELOP A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY FRIDAY NIGHT...WHICH WILL PRODUCE A GOOD COVERAGE OF 
CONVECTION THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL 
COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SOME RELATIVELY MINOR 
DIFFERENCES IN MODELS THROUGH THE PERIOD WHICH FEATURES A COUPLE OF 
SYSTEMS THAT SHOULD BE ABLE TO PRODUCE SOME SHOWERS. THE FIRST WILL 
BE A STRENGTHENING SHORT WAVE EMERGING FROM THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY 
FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. SURFACE LOW PRESSURE WILL SHIFT 
NORTHEAST FROM THE TENNESSEE VALLEY OF ALABAMA LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA BY MID TO LATE AFTERNOON SATURDAY. THE LOW 
WILL DRAG A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AND MODEL FORECASTS 
GENERATE SOME WEAK INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THE FRONT SO MAINTAINED A 
CHANCE FOR CONVECTION DURING THIS PERIOD. MORE SHORT WAVE ENERGY 
BUILDS SOUTHEAST ACROSS MAINLY THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST 
AREA SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUFFICIENTLY DEEP MOISTURE WILL BE AVAILABLE 
FOR LIFTING SO KEPT A CHANCE OF SHOWERS GOING ACROSS THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN AREAS INCLUDING SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU 
AND ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. A NICE PERIOD OF RIDGING SHOULD 
KEEP DRY WEATHER IN PLACE WITH A WARMING TREND TO START OUT THE NEW 
WEEK BUT THE MODELS SWING A COLD FRONT BACK ACROSS THE REGION ON 
TUESDAY. BOTH THE ECMWF AND THE GFS CONTINUE TO SHOW LIMITED 
MOISTURE RETURN AHEAD OF THE FRONT SO WENT AHEAD AND MAINTAINED 
CONTINUITY WITH THE PREVIOUS FORECAST KEEPING DRY CONDITIONS IN 
PLACE FOR THIS FEATURE. AN AMPLIFYING UPPER RIDGE MOVES IN FOR THE 
FINAL DAY OF THE PERIOD WHICH MAY ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO CLIMB 
SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. TRIED NOT TO GO TOO WARM FOR WEDNESDAY 
...DUE TO UNCERTAINTY AT THIS TIME RANGE...ADJUSTING TEMPERATURES 
JUST A FEW DEGREES AHEAD OF CLIMATOLOGY. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             35  62  54  66 /   0   0  60  70 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  30  61  52  65 /   0   0  60  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       30  61  51  65 /   0   0  60  70 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              24  60  46  64 /   0   0  50  70 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...FREEZE WARNING FROM 2 AM EDT /1 AM CDT/ TO 9 AM EDT /8 AM CDT/ 
     THURSDAY FOR ANDERSON-BLEDSOE-GRAINGER-HAMBLEN-JEFFERSON-
     KNOX-LOUDON-MCMINN-MEIGS-NW BLOUNT-NORTH SEVIER-NORTHWEST 
     COCKE-NORTHWEST MONROE-RHEA-ROANE-UNION.

.DISCUSSION... 
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE TN

SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES OVER MOST OF THE TN

AND NORTHEAST TN. HOWEVER...MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES SHOULD PREVAIL 
OVERALL TODAY...BUT TEMPS WILL CONTINUE TO BE BETWEEN FIFTEEN AND 
TWENTY DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. 

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THIS MORNING TO REMOVE MENTION OF THIS 
MORNING'S FREEZE WARNING...AND TO RAISE MAX TEMPS A LITTLE FOR THIS 
AFTERNOON.


778 
FXUS64 KMRX 260758 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
358 AM EDT WED MAR 26 2014

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
AN ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM HAS PROMOTED MOSTLY CLEAR...CALM
AND DRY CONDITIONS OVER A GOOD PORTION OF THE FORECAST AREA EARLY
THIS MORNING. THE ONE EXCEPTION IS FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA WHERE SOME LIGHT NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW SHOWERS ARE
CONTINUING ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN THERE. AM EXPECTING THIS
ACTIVITY TO CONTINUE TO WANE OVER THE REMAINDER OF THE NIGHT...BUT
SOME VERY LIGHT SHOWERS MAY PERSIST THROUGH DAYBREAK. THE COLD AIR
HAS ALSO ALLOWED TEMPERATURES TO PLUMMET INTO THE 20S THIS
MORNING...SO HAVE A FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FOR THE CENTRAL AND
SOUTHERN VALLEYS THROUGH 10 AM EDT.

THE MAIN STORY FOR TODAY WILL BE THE COOL AND DRY AIR IN PLACE
ASSOCIATED WITH THE AFOREMENTIONED ARCTIC HIGH. NORTHERLY
WINDS...ALONG WITH THIS COLDER AIR WILL KEEP HIGHS IN THE 40S
ACROSS THE AREA TODAY...WITH SOME AREAS IN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA ONLY
REACHING THE UPPER 30S...ABOUT 20 TO 25 DEGREES BELOW SEASONABLE
NORMALS FOR LATE MARCH. THE INITIAL CLEAR...CALM AND DRY
CONDITIONS WILL ALLOW FOR EXCELLENT RADIATIONAL COOLING AGAIN
TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES WILL QUICKLY FALL AFTER SUNSET AND DROP
BELOW THE FREEZING MARK AFTER MIDNIGHT ACROSS MUCH OF THE CENTRAL
AND SOUTHERN VALLEY ONCE AGAIN. THE ONE CHALLENGE WAS EVALUATING
HOW THE INCOMING CLOUD COVER LATE TONIGHT...ALONG WITH WINDS
VEERING TO SOUTHEAST WILL INFLUENCE TEMPS ALONG THE SOUTHERN
PLATEAU AND VALLEY. THINK THAT MOST OF THE VALLEY AREAS WILL STILL
REACH CRITERIA WITH THE EXCEPTION OF HAMILTON...BRADLEY AND
SEQUATCHIE AND MARION DUE TO THE AFOREMENTIONED FACTORS.
THUS...HAVE ISSUED AN ADDITIONAL FREEZE WARNING FOR MOST OF THESE
SAME AREAS ONCE AGAIN FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH EARLY THURSDAY
MORNING.

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY/...
UNSETTLED AND PROGRESSIVE PATTERN EARLY IN THE LONG RANGE...BUT
GOOD NEWS IS WARMER AND CLOSER TO CLIMO TEMPS THROUGH THE PERIOD.
FIRST CHANCE OF RAIN STILL LOOKS TO BE LATE THURSDAY NIGHT IN
WESTERN AREAS AND GENERALLY AREA- WIDE ON FRIDAY INTO EARLY FRIDAY
NIGHT...ASSOCIATED WITH SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND COLD FRONT. THE TRACK
OF THE SHORTWAVE AND LIMITED INSTABILITY DOES NOT SUPPORT MUCH OF A
MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS FOR NOW. SLIGHT CHANCE OF TSRA IN PREVIOUS
GRIDS FOR FAVORED AREAS LOOKED GOOD.

THE SECOND SYSTEM SHORTWAVE TROUGH APPROACHES RATHERLY QUICKLY ON 
THE HEELS OF THE EXITING SYSTEM...PER MODEL CONSENSUS. HOWEVER...I 
FELT THERE WILL BE AT A LEAST A BRIEF BREAK (6 HOURS OR SO) BEFORE 
SHOWERS ADVANCE AHEAD OF THE NEXT SYSTEM. AGAIN...NOT SEEING MUCH 
SUPPORT FOR MENTIONING THUNDERSTORMS. THUS...TWEAKED POP AND WEATHER 
GRIDS A BIT...SHOWING A DECREASE IN POPS FROM 06Z TO 12Z SATURDAY. 
GFSX AND ECMX MOS POPS CONTINUE TO RUN NEAR CATEGORICAL FOR 
SATURDAY...BUT I PREFERRED TO STAY WITH A SOLID LIKELY GIVEN THE 
POSSIBILITY OF TIMING ISSUES. 

SOME WEAK SIGNALS OF SLIGHT POPS NEEDED FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY
...BUT MODELS SHOW A LARGE DEGREE OF VARIABILITY LATE IN THE PERIOD.
KEEPING A DRY FORECAST FOR NOW FROM SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT.
SOMETHING TO WATCH AND ADJUST AS NEEDED.

FOR TEMPS...MIN TEMPS CERTAINLY RECOVER IN THE LONG TERM FROM THE 
FROSTY MINS OF RECENT. MOS GUIDANCE GENERALLY CONSISTENT FROM 25/12Z 
TO 26/00Z RUN...AND CLOSE TO PREVIOUS GRIDS. I DID CONTINUE TO 
SLIGHTLY UNDERCUT MAX TEMPS ON DAYS WITH HIGH RAIN CHANCES AND ALSO 
SUNDAY AS THE SURFACE RIDGE IS SETTLING OVER THE REGION AND HEIGHTS 
ALOFT ARE JUST STARTING TO INCREASE. MONDAY LOOKS LIKE THE WARMEST 
DAY WITH UPPER RIDGE ACROSS THE REGION AND SW LOW LEVEL FLOW 
RETURNING. ADJUSTED MONDAY MAXES UP IN LINE WITH THE WARMER 26/00Z 
MOS. TUESDAY MAXES STILL RUN SLIGHTLY ABOVE CLIMO.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             48  34  63  50 /   0   0  10  80 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  44  29  61  46 /   0   0  10  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       45  30  60  47 /   0   0  10  80 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              39  25  59  41 /   0   0  10  40 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...FREEZE WARNING UNTIL 10 AM EDT /9 AM CDT/ THIS MORNING FOR 
     ANDERSON-BLEDSOE-BRADLEY-GRAINGER-HAMBLEN-HAMILTON-
     JEFFERSON-KNOX-LOUDON-MARION-MCMINN-MEIGS-NW BLOUNT-NORTH 
     SEVIER-NORTHWEST COCKE-NORTHWEST MONROE-RHEA-ROANE-
     SEQUATCHIE-UNION-WEST POLK.

     FREEZE WARNING FROM 2 AM EDT /1 AM CDT/ TO 9 AM EDT /8 AM CDT/ 
     THURSDAY FOR ANDERSON-BLEDSOE-GRAINGER-HAMBLEN-JEFFERSON-
     KNOX-LOUDON-MCMINN-MEIGS-NW BLOUNT-NORTH SEVIER-NORTHWEST 
     COCKE-NORTHWEST MONROE-RHEA-ROANE-UNION.

VA...NONE.

THEN...WHICH IS IN LINE WITH THE CURRENT FORECAST. THE WINTER
WEATHER ADVISORY WILL BE ALLOWED TO EXPIRE ON SCHEDULE. SO NO
SIGNIFICANT CHANGES ARE NEEDED THIS EVENING.

FOLLOWING SUNSET. NORTHWEST WINDS WILL CONTINUE OVERNIGHT. VFR
