AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
318 PM EDT TUE MAR 25 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...SHORT-WAVE WITH COLD AIR
ALOFT IS MOVING ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE. RADAR SHOWS A GOOD DEAL OF
SNOW SHOWER ACTIVITY DUE TO THE ASSOCIATED COLD AIR ALOFT...
PRODUCING A GOOD DEAL OF LOW-LEVEL INSTABILITY. AREA OBSERVATIONS
AND WEBCAMS SHOW SNOW IS ACCUMULATING ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND
LIKELY OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN AS WELL. GIVEN MODELS KEEPING SNOW
SHOWERS OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA THROUGH
AT LEAST 03Z...WILL CONTINUE ADVISORY THERE.

SNOW ACCUMULATIONS OVER THE REST OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE WILL BE BETWEEN 1/2 AND 1 INCH AND MAINLY ON
GRASSY SURFACES.

AS WE APPROACH SUNSET...LOW-LEVEL INSTABILITY WILL LESSEN WITH SNOW 
SHOWERS DIMINISHIHG. LOW-CLOUDS WILL SLOPE DISSIPATE FROM
SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST OVERNIGHT. CLEAR SKIES ANTICIPATED AREA-WIDE
BY MID-MORNING WEDNESDAY. WILL MAINTAIN FREEZE WARNING AS A HARD
FREEZE IS EXPECTED.

WINDS WILL REMAIN GUSTY THIS AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING AS PRESSURE 
GRADIENTS TIGHTEN AND DOWNDRAFTS FROM SCATTERED SHOWERS.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
A DEEP SW FLOW DEVELOPS OVER THE AREA WED NIGHT AS THE RIDGE AXIS 
SHIFTS EAST. MIDLEVEL MOISTURE INCREASES THU WITH A SHORTWAVE TROUGH 
PASSAGE...BUT DRY AIR BELOW 700 MB SHOULD HOLD OFF PRECIP UNTIL THE 
LLJ ADVECTS HIGHER THETA-E AIR INTO THE AREA THU NIGHT. THE COLUMN 
WILL BE WELL SATURATED BY FRI MORNING...WITH LIFT PROVIDED BY UPPER 
DIVERGENCE IN THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE JET AND GOOD 850 MB 
CONVERGENCE. WILL HAVE CATEGORICAL POPS THU NIGHT/FRI. ONCE THESE 
FEATURES PASS...WE MAY SEE A LULL FRI NIGHT...THEN THE MAIN UPPER 
TROUGH MOVES THROUGH SAT. WILL RAISE POPS INTO THE LIKELY RANGE FOR 
SAT. THE COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH SAT AFTERNOON. SOME MOISTURE 
WRAPPING AROUND THE BACK OF THE LOW COULD KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE NORTH 
SAT NIGHT. 

A BUILDING RIDGE WILL PROVIDE DRY AND SUNNY CONDITIONS FOR SUN...BUT 
COOL TEMPS BEHIND THE COLD FRONT. TEMPS WILL WARM TO THE LOWER 70S 
IN THE VALLEY BY MON AS THE RIDGE MOVES EAST. THERE ARE BIG 
DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE GFS AND ECMWF FOR TUE. ECMWF TRACKS A CLOSED 
LOW ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY...WHILE THE GFS SHOWS A FAST-MOVING COLD 
FRONT WITH LITTLE MOISTURE. FOR NOW...WILL KEEP TUE DRY AS 
CONFIDENCE IS LOW.

CLOUDS OVER THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY...AND INCOMING COLD AIR
ALOFT WITH 300MB TEMPERATURES AT OR BELOW 30 DEGREES CELCIUS...
I EXPECTED PLENTY OF SHOWERS.

VERTICAL TEMPERATURE PROFILE SUGGEST A GOOD DEAL OF SNOW SHOWERS
WITH SOME MIXING WITH RAIN...MAINLY OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE
VALLEY. LIMITED ACCUMULATION...EXCEPT ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.
WILL KEEP THE ADVISORIES AS IS...BUT AGAIN MOST OF THE
ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN.

HAVE LOWERED HIGHS SOME DUE TO INCOMING CLOUDS AND PRECIPITATION.

947 
FXUS64 KMRX 250724
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 AM EDT TUE MAR 25 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHORTWAVE TROUGH IS APPROACHING
WESTERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH LIFT DEVELOPING...SPREADING
LIGHT PRECIPITATION ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU INTO THE VALLEY
COUNTIES JUST NOW. HOWEVER...SURFACE DEW POINT TEMPS CONTINUED TO
RUN MUCH LOWER THAN MOS GUIDANCE. THIS AIRMASS IN PLACE IS QUITE
DRY SO MUCH OF THE RADAR ECHOES ARE STILL EVAPORATING BEFORE
REACHING THE SURFACE. THIS MAKES THE LATEST HEAVIER QPF FOR TODAY
QUESTIONABLE...SO I STUCK WITH LIQUID AMOUNTS AROUND 1/10 OR LESS
FROM 12Z TO 18Z...THEN 0.05 OR LESS FROM 18Z TO 00Z. 

OTHERWISE...PREVIOUS SNOW AMOUNTS AND ADVISORY AREAS LOOKED GOOD
OVERALL. I DID ADD WISE AND SCOTT COUNTIES OF SW VA INTO THE NRN
MOST WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY AND EXTENDED THAT ONE OUT TO 21Z
TODAY. SOME WRAP AROUND MOISTURE IS INDICATED WITH MOISTURE RUNNING
UP TO 600 MBS OR SO INTO THE AFTERNOON...PLUS SOME 20 KNOTS OR SO
OF UPSLOPE LOW LEVEL FLOW. NOT MUCH CHANGE IN GENERAL ELSEWHERE.
UNDERCUT MOS MAX TEMPS BY SEVERAL DEGREES DUE TO STRONG COLD AIR
ADVECTION THIS AFTERNOON.

FOR TONIGHT...CLEAR OR DECREASING CLOUDS AND VERY COLD FOR LATE
MARCH...TEENS TO MID 20S. THUS...UPGRADED THE FREEZE WATCH AREAS TO
A FREEZE WARNING. UPDATED WSW AND NPW PRODUCTS TO FOLLOW.


.LONG TERM.../WEDNESDAY THOUGH MONDAY/...IN WAKE OF THE FRONTAL
SYSTEM THAT WILL PASS THROUGH THE REGION ON TUESDAY...A RIDGE OF
HIGH PRESSURE WILL QUICKLY BUILD INTO THE REGION AND NORTHWESTERLY
WINDS WILL REINFORCE A DOME OF COLD AIR...RESULTING IN HIGHS AND
LOWS RUNNING SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW SEASONABLE NORMS. THE HIGH ON
WEDNESDAY WILL STRUGGLE TO CLIMB OUT OF THE LOW TO MID 40S IN MOST
LOCATIONS...WITH LOWS BOTTOMING OUT IN THE 20S ONCE AGAIN IN MANY
AREAS DESPITE THE AMPLE SUNSHINE. ADDITIONALLY...THE DRY AIR WILL
ALSO LEAD TO RH VALUES PLUMMETING TO 20 TO 30 PERCENT IN THE
AFTERNOON. WINDS WILL QUICKLY SHIFT TO THE SOUTH ON THURSDAY AHEAD
OF THE NEXT FRONTAL SYSTEM HOWEVER...WHICH WILL QUICKLY PUSH HIGHS
BACK INTO THE 60S AND INCREASE GULF MOISTURE ACROSS THE AREA. THIS
WILL SET THE STAGE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MOVING INTO THE
REGION THURSDAY NIGHT AND ESPECIALLY FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT AS
THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA. AFTER A SLIGHTLY COOLER DAY ON
SATURDAY...A HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE WILL QUICKLY BUILD IN FOR SUNDAY
AND MONDAY...PROMOTING MOSTLY CLEAR AND DRY CONDITIONS. HIGHS WILL
CLIMB WELL INTO THE UPPER 60S AND LOWER 70S BY EARLY NEXT WEEK.

&&

.AVIATION...MOISTURE STILL MOVING INTO THE REGION AND LIFT IS

SURFACE DEWPOINT TEMPS PLUS NORTHERLY WINDS WILL INHIBIT VISBY 
REDUCTION FROM FOG. BEST CHANCE OF SIGNIFICANT PRECIPITATION (PCPN) 
WILL BE AT TRI TODAY...MOSTLY IN THE FORM OF SNOW. ACCEPTED THE 
RAPID DECLINE OF CIGS FOR TRI FROM BOTH SOUNDINGS AND MOS GUIDANCE. 
THIS TAKES TRI QUICKLY DOWN TO MVFR THEN IFR BY DAYBREAK. 

THE PATTERN FAVORS SNOW SHOWERS LINGERING WELL INTO THE AFTERNOON 
HOURS...SO A BRIEF LOWERING TO UPPER END OF MVFR IS POSSIBLE AT TRI. 
OTHERWISE...GENERALLY VFR FOR THIS PERIOD AT TYS AND CHA...WITH CHA 
NOT LIKELY TO GET MORE THAN A SPRINKLE AT THE SURFACE THIS MORNING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 PM EDT MON MAR 24 2014

.DISCUSSION...A WEAK WEATHER DISTURBANCE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION LATE TONIGHT.  WITH IT WILL COME 
INCREASED LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND DECENT FORCING WHICH WILL GENERATE 
A COUPLE BANDS OF SHOWERS.  A COOL AIR MASS IN PLACE WILL ALLOW FOR 
A MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW ACROSS THE AREA.  MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS WILL 
SEE SCATTERED LIGHT RAIN SHOWER...POSSIBLY WITH A FEW FLURRIES MIXED 
IN.  A LIGHT DUSTING IS POSSIBLE MAINLY FOR HIGHER TERRAIN.  
HOWEVER...IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...ESPECIALLY THE EAST TN 
MOUNTAINS...EXPECT TO PICK UP A COUPLE OF INCHES OF SNOW.  THE FAR 
NORTHERN VALLEY AND PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST VA COULD SEE MINOR 
ACCUMULATIONS.  A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS IN  EFFECT FOR THESE 
AREAS.  ALL ON TRACK IN THE CURRENT FORECAST...WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE 
EVENING WORDING.

.AVIATION...
HIGH CLOUDS WILL BE INCREASING OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS...AND
GRADUALLY LOWERING TO NEAR OR BELOW 5 KFT BY MIDNIGHT AS A LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEM APPROACHES AND MOISTURE INCREASES. SOME LIGHT
PRECIP IS EXPECTED AT TYS AND TRI...WHICH WILL LOWER VIS TO AT
LEAST MVFR. PRECIP IS EXPECTED TO BE SNOW AT TRI...WHICH SHOULD
MEAN IFR VIS AND CIGS AT TIMES LATE TONIGHT. THE PRECIP SHOULD END
BY MID-MORNING...WITH CIGS RISING BACK TO VFR BY NOON. WINDS ARE
EXPECTED TO BE GUSTY TOMORROW AS THE SYSTEM EXITS AND HIGH PRESSURE
BUILDS IN.

FXUS64 KMRX 241910
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT MON MAR 24 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...ACTIVE SHORT-TERM. SATELLITE
SHOWS A FAIRLY STRONG SHORT-WAVE MOVING ACROSS THE CENTRAL PLAINS
WITH DECENT PRESSURE FALLS AHEAD OF THE WAVE. STRONG UPPER JET OVER
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WILL HELP STRENGTHEN AN INVERTED TROUGH OVER
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TONIGHT WITH INCREASING FRONTO-GENETIC
FORCING. INITIALLY AIRMASS IS QUITE DRY...BUT WITH MOISTURE
CONVERGENCE ALONG INVERTED TROUGH...BOUNDARY LAYER WILL MOISTEN
WITH PRECIPITATION DEVELOPING OVER THE SOUTHERN AREAS AROUND
06Z...THEN SPREADING NORTHEAST. LIKELY-CAT POPS FOR THE FAR EASTERN
COUNTIES FROM CHEROKEE-CLAY NC TO RUSSELL-WASHINGTON COUNTIES VA.
LESSER CHANCES FAR WEST.

TEMPERATURE PROFILE FAVORABLE FOR SNOW ACROSS THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS...GENERALLY AT OR ABOVE 2500 FEET...EXCEPT FOR THE
NORTHEAST SECTIONS...SUCH AS THE TRI-CITIES WERE SNOW ACCUMULATIONS
ARE EXPECTED...MAINLY GRASSY AND ELEVATED SURFACES. HAVE ISSUED A
WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR THESE AREAS.

FOR TUESDAY...FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING MOVES EAST OF THE AREA BY
15Z...HOWEVER...MODELS SHOW ANOTHER WAVE MOVING SOUTHEAST INTO THE
AREA WITH 500MB TEMPERATURES DROPPING TO -30 DEGREES C. THE COLD
AIR ALOFT WILL PRODUCE SCATTERED RAIN/SNOW SHOWERS OVER THE AREA.
THESE SHOWERS WILL PRODUCE GUSTY AFTERNOON WINDS UP TO 30-35 MPH.

ALSO...WINDS WILL BECOME NORTHWESTERLY PRODUCE OROGRAPHIC LIFT INTO
THE WESTERN SLOPES OF THE FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS INTO THE
EVENING HOURS TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE 
PATTERN...AND REVEAL THE MAIN PRECIP-MAKERS FOR THE FORECAST AREA 
BEING A COLD FRONT ON FRIDAY AND AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH ON SATURDAY. 
A LARGE DOME OF ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE WILL SETTLE OVER THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY MORNING...BRINGING 
UNSEASONABLY COLD TEMPS SOME 15 TO 20 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. AS A 
RESULT...WILL ISSUE A FREEZE WATCH FOR THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL 
VALLEY AREAS WHERE THE SPRING FREEZE PROGRAM HAS STARTED...BUT THE 
ENTIRE FORECAST AREA CAN EXPECT A HARD FREEZE ON WEDNESDAY MORNING. 
AS THIS HIGH DRIFTS EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA ON WEDNESDAY...A 
WARMING TREND WILL THEN QUICKLY DEVELOP FOR THE REST OF THE WEEK. IN 
FACT...BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS INDICATE SOME WEAK INSTABILITY 
DEVELOPING ON FRIDAY AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT. WHILE THIS 
COLD FRONT SHOULD MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY SATURDAY...AN 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS PROGGED TO SWING ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY 
BEHIND IT ON SATURDAY. AS A RESULT...SOME LINGERING CONVECTION WILL 
STILL BE POSSIBLE ON SATURDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND COOLER THAN 
THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE 
IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             36  51  26  51 /  20  10   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  33  44  23  48 /  50  40  10   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       33  45  23  48 /  30  40  10   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              30  42  19  43 /  80  80  40   0 

&&

     CHEROKEE-CLAY.

TN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FROM 4 AM TO 11 AM EDT TUESDAY FOR 
     NORTHWEST CARTER-NORTHWEST GREENE-SULLIVAN-WASHINGTON TN.

     FREEZE WATCH FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING 
     FOR ANDERSON-BLEDSOE-BRADLEY-GRAINGER-HAMBLEN-HAMILTON-
     JEFFERSON-KNOX-LOUDON-MARION-MCMINN-MEIGS-NW BLOUNT-NORTH 
     SEVIER-NORTHWEST COCKE-NORTHWEST MONROE-RHEA-ROANE-
     SEQUATCHIE-UNION-WEST POLK.

     WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FROM 2 AM TO 8 PM EDT TUESDAY FOR BLOUNT 
     SMOKY MOUNTAINS-COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS-JOHNSON-SEVIER SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS-SOUTHEAST CARTER-SOUTHEAST GREENE-UNICOI.

     WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FROM 2 AM TO 8 AM EDT TUESDAY FOR 
     SOUTHEAST MONROE.

     RUSSELL-WASHINGTON.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
129 PM EDT MON MAR 24 2014

.AVIATION...VFR CONDITIONS WILL DETEORIATE AFTER 06Z. MVFR CONDTIONS 
ANTICIPATED AT TYS DUE TO VISIBILITY BETWEEN 07-11Z AND TRI DUE TO 
CEILINGS (1500-2500 FEET) AND VISBILITIES OF 3-4 MILES BETWEEN 08-
14Z. CHA WILL REMAIN VFR THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD.

FLIGHT CONDITIONS WILL IMPROVE AT TRI AND TYS BY MID-MORNING TUESDAY.

MAIN QUESTION IS TONIGHT'S FORECAST OF SNOWFALL POTENTIAL AND 
EXPECTED LOWER CEILINGS. IN RESPONSE TO STRONG JET MOVING ACROSS THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY INTENSIFIES AN INVERTED TROUGH OVER THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. THE STRENGTHENING INVERTED WILL INCREASE THE FRONTO-
GENETIC FORCING AND LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE OVER THE FAR EASTERN 
COUNTIES. PRECIPITATION WILL DEVELOP OVER NORTHERN GEORGIA THEN 
SPREAD NORTH TO NORTHEAST ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1052 AM EDT MON MAR 24 2014

.DISCUSSION...CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD FOR TODAY. PLENTY OF 
SUNSHINE AND DRY AIRMASS WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO WARM TO 
GOING FORECAST HIGHS. 

MAIN QUESTION IS TONIGHT'S FORECAST OF SNOWFALL POTENTIAL. IN 
RESPONSE TO STRONG JET MOVING ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
INTENSIFIES AN INVERTED TROUGH OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE 
STRENGTHENING INVERTED WILL INCREASE THE FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING AND 
LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE OVER THE FAR EASTERN COUNTIES. PRECIPITATION 
WILL DEVELOP OVER NORTHERN GEORGIA THEN SPREAD NORTH TO NORTHEAST 
ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS.

TEMPERATURE PROFILE IS FAVORABLE FOR SNOW OVER THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS...GENEALLY AT OR ABOVE 2500 FEET. SNOW ACCUMULATIONS OF 1 
TO 3 INCHES ANTICIPATED. WILL LIKELY BE ISSUING A WINTER WEATHER 
ADVISORY FOR CHEROKEE AND CLAY COUNTIES NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE FAR 
EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND PARTS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA FOR LATE 
TONIGHT AND TUESDAY MORNING. ADVISORY WILL LIKELY BE ISSUED FOR THE 
AFTERNOON PACKAGE.

249 
FXUS64 KMRX 240754
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
354 AM EDT MON MAR 24 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...TEMPS FALLING IN LINE WITH 
FREEZE WARNING IN GENERAL...ALTHO A MUCH COLDER NIGHT IS IN STORE 
FOR THE REGION TUESDAY NIGHT WHEN A HARD FREEZE WILL LIKELY OCCUR.

RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE SETTLING IN TODAY WILL PROVIDE DRY WEATHER... 
BUT HIGHS WILL FALL ABOUT 10 DEGREES SHORT OF NORMALS FOR LATE 
MARCH. ALSO...EXPECT DRY WEATHER TO LAST THROUGH 06Z TUESDAY. A FAST 
MOVING SHORTWAVE APPROACHES AFTER 06Z TUESDAY WITH CLOUDS ON THE 
INCREASE. 

PRECIPITATION WILL DEVELOP MAINLY ACROSS THE NRN TWO THIRDS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA...MAINLY IN THE FORM OF LIGHT SNOW. A LIGHT SNOW 
ACCUMULATION SEEMS QUITE POSSIBLE OVER SWRN VA AND THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN OF NE TN...UP TO 2 INCHES...POSSIBLY UP TO 3 INCHES WHERE A 
BIT OF LOW LEVEL UPSLOPE OCCURS DURING THE DAY TUESDAY. 

SEE LITTLE IF ANY THREAT OF MEASURING WARNING AMOUNTS...PER SOME 
COORDINATION WITH NEIGHBORING NWS OFFICES AND GUIDANCE GRAPHICS. 
THUS...NO WINTER STORM WATCH AT THIS POINT. PREFER TO ISSUE AN SPS 
TO HIGHLIGHT THIS LIGHT SNOW LATE TONIGHT AND TUESDAY...PLUS WILL 
HIT THE HARD FREEZE FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AS WELL. 

CLOSELY FOLLOWED SIMILAR MOS MAX FOR TODAY AND MINS FOR TONIGHT. 
HOWEVER...PREFERRED TO UNDERCUT THE TUESDAY MAX TEMPS GIVEN STRONG 
COLD AIR ADVECTION...CLOUDS AND SNOW.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...LATE SEASON ARCTIC
HIGH PRESSURE BRINGS VERY COLD TEMPERATURES TUESDAY NIGHT. A FEW
SNOW SHOWERS LINGER IN EXTREME NE TN AND SW VA TUESDAY EVENING AND
STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION BEHIND FRONT WILL DROP TEMPERATURES INTO
THE 20S...TEENS NE AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE MOUNTAINS OF VA AND
TN. WINDS WILL STILL BE 10 TO 20 FROM THE NW IN THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS OF SW VA AND THE EASTERN TN MOUNTAINS SO WIND CHILLS
WILL MAKE CONDITIONS FEEL EVEN COLDER. DAY SHIFT WILL BE LOOKING AT
ANOTHER FREEZE WATCH FOR TUESDAY NIGHT. WEDNESDAY ARCTIC HIGH
SETTLES OVERHEAD FORECAST AREA. HIGH TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY 15 TO
20 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. ANOTHER COLD NIGHT WEDNESDAY NIGHT BUT
SLIGHTLY WARMER. MOST SITES AGAIN BELOW FREEZING. AS COLD UPPER
TROUGH SHIFTS EAST WEDNESDAY NIGHT A QUICK WARMUP THURSDAY. MID
RANGE MODELS STILL SHOWING DEEP SURFACE LOW THURSDAY OVER THE
PLAINS STATES. THIS SYSTEM MOVES NE ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND THEN
INTO EASTERN CANADA BY SATURDAY. AS FRONT APPROACHES FRIDAY BEST
CHANCE OF SHOWERS JUST AHEAD OF FRONT WITH THUNDERSTORMS ALSO
POSSIBLE.

AFTER FRIDAY MODELS NOT SURE ON SPEED OF SYSTEM WITH SOME MOVING
SYSTEM TO THE EAST AND BRINGING IN HIGH PRESSURE INTO AREA FRIDAY
NIGHT AND SATURDAY WHILE OTHERS KEEP MORE SHORTWAVE ENERGY TRAILING
SATURDAY FOR MORE SHOWERS AND A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. FOLLOWED
SLOWER SOLUTION. SUNDAY HIGH PRESSURE FINALLY MOVES EAST FOR
CLEARING SKIES.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  53  34  46  23 /   0  30  20   0

TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              48  31  43  19 /   0  40  30  10

945 PM EDT SAT MAR 23 2014
 
.DISCUSSION...MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES ARE PRESENT ACROSS THE MAJORITY
OF OUR AREA AFTER AN UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCE HAS MOVED WELL OFF 
TO OUR EAST...WITH ONLY A FEW CLOUDS LINGERING ACROSS SWVA AND 
EXTREME NETN. CLEARING CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE OVERNIGHT. WINDS 
WILL REMAIN LIGHT BUT STEADY THROUGH THE EVENING OUT OF THE NORTH. 
TONIGHT'S LOWS WILL BE ROUGHLY 10 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL FOR THIS 
TIME OF YEAR. FREEZE WARNING STILL IN EFFECT FROM 4AM EDT FOR 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY UNTIL 9AM EDT. CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS
TO BE ON TRACK. NO UPDATES PLANNED AT THIS TIME OTHER THAN TO TWEAK
HOURLY TEMPS.

890 
FXUS64 KMRX 231907
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
307 PM EDT SUN MAR 23 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...CLOUDS ARE SLOW TO CLEAR 
BEHIND THE COLD FRONT THAT EXITED THE REGION THIS MORNING. A BROKEN 
DECK DEVELOPED AND IS CURRENTLY MOVING THROUGH EAST TENNESSEE. 
CONFIDENCE IS LOW ON TIMING OF THE SKIES CLEARING...BUT LOOKING AT 
THE SOUNDINGS AND THE MOISTURE PROFILE...EXPECT THIS TO BE EARLY 
EVENING. CLEARING SKIES WILL BE PRESENT THROUGH THE NIGHT...AND FLOW 
WILL SET UP FROM THE NORTH. LOW TEMPERATURES TONIGHT WILL BE WELL 
BELOW NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. WILL CONTINUE THE FREEZE WARNING 
FOR SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN EAST TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR TONIGHT 
INTO MONDAY MORNING. FOR MONDAY...HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES OVER THE 
OHIO VALLEY WITH CLEAR SKIES AND TEMPERATURES AGAIN A COUPLE OF 
DEGREES BELOW NORMAL.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A SERIES OF SHORT-WAVES
WILL CARVE OUT A FAIRLY AMPLITUDE TROUGH ACROSS THE OHIO AND
TENNESSEE VALLEYS MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. MAJORITY OF THE
DYNAMICS WITH THESE WAVES WILL BE NORTH OF THE AREA KEEPING CHANCE
OF PRECIPITATION LIMITED WITH BEST CHANCES OVER THE NORTH AND
MOUNTAINS FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. LAST WAVE FOR TUESDAY
EVENING WILL STRENGTH NORTHWEST FLOW WITH OROGRAPHIC LIFT PRODUCING
SNOW SHOWERS FOR THE MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND FAR
EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS. LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ARE POSSIBLE.

FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...UPPER TROUGH MOVES EAST WITH FLOW
BECOMING WEST THEN SOUTHWEST FOR THE LATTER HALF OF THE WEEK AS AN
UPPER TROUGH DIGS INTO THE ROCKIES/HIGH PLAINS. CONFIDENCE ON THE
EVOLUTION OF THE ASSOCIATED UPPER JET/TROUGH AS IT MOVES INTO THE
PLAINS IS QUITE LOW. THE GFS/ECMWF DIFFER ON TIMING AND STRENGTH.
A ROUND OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE FOR LATE IN THE
WEEK.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              24  48  33  44 /   0   0  40  30

829 
FXUS64 KMRX 230831
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
431 AM EDT SUN MAR 23 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...QUITE A BIT OF SIGNIFICANT
WEATHER CRAMMED INTO THE FIRST 2 PERIODS OF THE FORECAST GRIDS
THIS MORNING. RAIN IS ON THE WAY...MOVING QUICKLY ENE THROUGH
MIDDLE TN AND LIKELY REACHING OUR PLATEAU COUNTIES IN THE NEXT
1 TO 2 HOURS. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SUGGEST SNOW FOR MUCH OF SW VA
AND FAR NRN MTNS OF E TN FROM 12Z TO 16Z TODAY...BUT LIGHT QPF AND
SUCH WARM TEMPS AHEAD OF THE RAIN...DON'T SUPPORT MUCH IN THE WAY
OF ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL. I DID ADD SNOW SHOWERS TO A LARGER PART
OF SW VA AND PARTS OF JOHNSON CARTER AND UNICOI COUNTIES THIS
MORNING. MAX TEMPS MAY OCCUR JUST AROUND 12Z TODAY IN OUR NWRN
AREAS...AND MAY MAX OUT THIS MORNING BEFORE STEADY OR FALLING IN
THE AFTERNOON ELSEWHERE.

FOR TONIGHT...MIN TEMPS IN THE UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S LOOK ON TRACK 
FOR THE SRN AND CENTRAL VALLEY COUNTIES OF E TN (WHERE FROST/FREEZE 
PROGRAM HAS BEEN ACTIVATED)...AND CERTAINLY MUCH COLDER OVER ALL NRN 
AREAS. OPTED TO UPGRADE THE FREEZE WATCH TO A FREEZE WARNING...SINCE 
OUTLYING RURAL AREAS SHOULD BE A FEW DEGREES COLDER THAN THE 30 TO 
32 DEGREE MINS EXPECTED AT TYS AND CHA ASOS SITES.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MONDAY HIGH PRESSURE WITH
COLD BUT DRY AIR MASS WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES COOL AGAIN MONDAY.
SKIES SHOULD STAY MOSTLY SUNNY SO WITH THE HIGHER SUN ANGLE
TEMPERATURES WILL STILL CLIMB TO THE UPPER 40S TO MID 50S. FOLLOWED
CLOSER TO COOL NAM GUIDANCE. FAST MOVING CLIPPER SYSTEM TO AFFECT
THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING. CLOUDS
INCREASE MONDAY EVENING WITH PRECIPITATION STARTING AFTER MIDNIGHT.
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN LOWER ELEVATIONS HAVE A COLD RAIN TUESDAY INTO
TUESDAY NIGHT...POSSIBLY WITH SOME LIGHT SNOW MIXED IN. HIGHER
ELEVATIONS FROM THE SMOKIES NORTH INTO VIRGINIA CHANGE RAIN TO SNOW
TUESDAY MORNING. AMOUNTS OF A COUPLE INCHES OF SNOW IN THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS WITH TRACE TO AROUND ONE HALF INCH LOWER ELEVATIONS OF
NE TN AND SW VA STILL LOOK POSSIBLE. DID NOT CHANGE SNOWFALL AMOUNT
GRIDS SIGNIFICANTLY. TUESDAY NIGHT TEMPERATURES TAKE NOSE DIVE
AGAIN FROM BELOW 20 HIGHER ELEVATIONS MOUNTAINS TO 20S ELSEWHERE.
FREEZE WATCH AGAIN LIKELY TO BE ISSUED MONDAY AND LOWS EVEN COLDER
THAN TONIGHT. WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT BELOW NORMAL
TEMPERATURES CONTINUE AS COLD AIR MASS MOVES OVERHEAD. SURFACE HIGH
BEGINS TO SHIFT EAST WITH MUCH WARMER TEMPERATURES THURSDAY. A
SURFACE LOW DEVELOPING EAST OF THE ROCKIES WILL BRING UP A WARM AND
MOIST AIR MASS FROM THE GULF INTO THE REGION FRIDAY. A DEEPENING
SURFACE LOW THEN MOVES FROM THE MS VALLEY TO THE GREAT LAKES AND
SOUTHERN CANADA FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY. ECMWF IS FAST WITH THE SYSTEM
BUT GFS SLOWS THE FRONT DOWN AS IT MOVES SOUTH HANGING IT UP OVER
THE TN VALLEY THROUGH SATURDAY. ADDED THUNDERSTORMS TO FORECAST
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY TO FOLLOW SLOWER SOLUTION OF THE SYSTEM. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             56  32  57  38 /  80   0   0  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  54  29  53  35 /  60   0   0  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       53  29  53  35 /  60   0   0  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              52  24  48  32 /  60   0   0  60

030 
FXUS64 KMRX 221930
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EDT SAT MAR 22 2014

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A WEAK COLD FRONT CURRENTLY
MOVING THROUGH THE AREA IS EXPECTED TO SLOW DOWN A BIT AS A LOW
PRESSURE DEVELOPS IN THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. THE CLOUD SHIELD
CURRENTLY OVER MIDDLE AND EAST TENNESSEE WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST
WITH GREAT SPEED LEADING TO PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES THIS EVENING. THE
BIG RAIN FOR THIS WEEKEND WILL MOVE INTO THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND
FAR SOUTHEAST TN BETWEEN 4 AND 6 AM...THEN UP THE VALLEY REACHING
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA BETWEEN 6 AND 8 AM.

OVERALL LIGHT RAINFALL AMOUNTS EXPECTED WITH LOCALLY HEAVIER AMOUNTS 
POSSIBLE...ESPECIALLY SOUTH OF I40. WITH THE UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE 
AND FORCING IN PLACE...EXPECTING THE MAIN RAIN EVENT TO LAST THROUGH 
2 PM THEN TAPERING OFF FROM WEST TO EAST. TEMPERATURES WILL BE A BIT 
COLDER THROUGH THE DAY THAN THE PAST COUPLE OF DAYS AS THE COLD AIR 
FILTERS IN BEHIND THE FRONT. SOUNDINGS FOR HIGH KNOB AND HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS IN WISE AND LEE COUNTIES IN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA ARE JUST 
BELOW FREEZING OR RIGHT AT THE FREEZING MARK. SO WITH 
THIS...ACTUALLY LOOKING AT A DUSTING TO HALF OF AN INCH OF SNOW IN 
THESE COUNTIES...WITH HIGH KNOB RECEIVING UP TO ONE INCH OF SNOW  
EPENDING ON THE ARRIVAL TIME OF THE COLD AIR. WILL HOLD OFF ON ANY 
MENTION IN A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT FOR NOW TO VIEW MORE MODEL 
RUNS AND VIEW THE CONSISTENCY OF THIS EARLY COLD AIR ARRIVAL. AS THE 
SYSTEM MOVES EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS IN THE LATE AFTERNOON...SKIES 
WILL BEGIN TO CLEAR WITH TEMPERATURES DROPPING. EXPECTING WINDY 
CONDITIONS WITH GUSTS UP TO 20 MPH ON SUNDAY AS THIS FRONT EXITS THE 
AREA.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...A RIDGE OF HIGH
PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS SUNDAY NIGHT.
AREA FRUIT TREES ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND CENTRAL AND
SOUTHERN TENNESSEE VALLEY HAVE BLOOMED MAKING THEM SUCEPTIBLE TO
FREEZE DAMAGE...SO A FREEZE WATCH HAS BEEN ISSUED FOR EARLY MONDAY
MORNING.

NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEMS WILL COME TOGETHER FOR MONDAY
NIGHT AND TUESDAY WITH A CHANCE OF RAIN AND/OR SNOW...ESPECIALLY
ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THE GFS AND ECMWF DIFFER ON THE
STRENGTH OF THE TWO SYSTEMS WITH THE GFS STRONGER WITH THE SOUTHERN
WAVE AND ECMWF WITH THE NORTHERN SYSTEM. EITHER WAY...LIGHT SNOW
ACCUMULATIONS ARE POSSIBLE OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND FAR EASTERN
TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS. THIS SYSTEM WILL PULL EAST TUESDAY NIGHT.

UPPER FLOW WILL BECOME SOUTHWEST BY THE LATTER HALF OF THE WEEK
WITH A WARMING TREND. ANOTHER SYSTEM PULLS INTO THE AREA FOR LATE
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY
THUNDERSTORMS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       44  50  29  55 /  70  60   0   0

FXUS64 KMRX 220836

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
436 AM EDT SAT MAR 22 2014

.SHORT TERM...TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK COLD FRONT LOCATED ACROSS NW 
TN AND THE WRN THIRD OF KY THIS MORNING. NOT MUCH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
AHEAD OF THE FRONT AND FORCING LOOKS QUITE WEAK. FLOW ALOFT IS 
MOSTLY ZONAL WITH JUST A WEAK UPPER TROUGH NOTED TO MOVE EAST ACROSS 
THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY REGION THIS AFTERNOON. OPTED TO 
LOWER POPS CONSIDERABLY THIS MORNING WITH JUST HIGH LEVEL CLOUDINESS 
IN PLACE AT THIS POINT. KEPT POPS NO MORE THAN 20 TO 30 PERCENT FOR 
THE AFTERNOON HOURS AS THE FRONT MOVES SE INTO THE REGION. TWEAKED 
MAX TEMP GRID BASED ON TIMING OF COLD FRONT AND SLIGHT COOLING OF 
850 MB TEMPS THIS AFTERNOON...BUT CLOUD COVER SHOULD NOT BE A MAJOR 
FACTOR.

EXPECTING A BREAK IN RAIN CHANCES FOR THE EVENING HOURS BEFORE RAIN 
CHANCES INCREASE IN THE 06Z TO 12Z PERIOD...AS LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS 
OVER THE GULF COAST STATES. SIMILAR MOS MINS GENERALLY FOLLOWED. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...LOW PRESSURE MOVES UP THE
EAST COAST WITH OVERRUNNING MOISTURE INCREASING AND RAIN SHOWERS
DEVELOPING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. NAM MODEL KEEPS SYSTEM A LITTLE
FARTHER SOUTH THAN GFS. AS A RESULT TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES
COLDER. FOLLOWED THE COLDER NAM WITH TEMPERATURES RISING ONLY A FEW
DEGREES TO THE 40S TO LOWER 50S. COLD UPPER TROUGH SETS UP OVER THE
EASTERN STATES AND MUCH COLDER AIR MASS MOVES IN SUNDAY NIGHT AND
MONDAY. NEXT SYSTEM IN NW FLOW BRINGS RAIN AND SNOW TO FORECAST
AREA MAINLY MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE IN THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF EAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA.
TEMPERATURES TO REMAIN MUCH BELOW NORMAL THROUGH WEDNESDAY. LOWS
MONDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY WILL BE BELOW FREEZING WITH FREEZE
WARNINGS LIKELY IN THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL SECTIONS AS GROWING
VEGETATION WILL LIKELY BE DAMAGED BY FROST. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE
MOVES INTO THE REGION WITH WARMING TEMPERATURES THURSDAY AND NEW
WARMER SYSTEM APPROACHES FRIDAY.

THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY REGION THIS AFTERNOON. OPTED TO 
LOWER POPS CONSIDERABLY THIS MORNING WITH JUST HIGH LEVEL CLOUDINESS 
IN PLACE AT THIS POINT. KEPT POPS NO MORE THAN 20 TO 30 PERCENT FOR 
THE AFTERNOON HOURS AS THE FRONT MOVES SE INTO THE REGION. TWEAKED 
MAX TEMP GRID BASED ON TIMING OF COLD FRONT AND SLIGHT COOLING OF 
850 MB TEMPS THIS AFTERNOON...BUT CLOUD COVER SHOULD NOT BE A MAJOR 
FACTOR.

EXPECTING A BREAK IN RAIN CHANCES FOR THE EVENING HOURS BEFORE RAIN 
CHANCES INCREASE IN THE 06Z TO 12Z PERIOD...AS LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS 
OVER THE GULF COAST STATES. SIMILAR MOS MINS GENERALLY FOLLOWED.

SHORTLY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
313 PM EDT FRI MAR 21 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE EAST
OF THE APPALACHIANS OVERNIGHT AS A COLD FRONT APPROACHES FROM THE
WEST. CLOUDS WILL INCREASE TONIGHT AND SUNDAY AHEAD OF THIS FRONT.
LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS ARE EXPECTED TO MOVE INTO THE PLATEAU AND THEN
VALLEY BETWEEN 10 AM AND NOON SATURDAY...LASTING THROUGH THE LATE
AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING.

THE GFS AND NAM MODELS SHOW MID AND UPPER LEVEL DRY
AIR MOVING INTO THE AREA OVERNIGHT SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY...WITH
ECMWF PERSISTENT ON RAIN THROUGH THE NIGHT. HAVE OPTED FOR MORE OF
THE NAM/GFS SOLUTION...WITH ANOTHER SHOT OF MOISTURE AND RAIN
SHOWERS BEGINNING SUNDAY MORNING BETWEEN 2 AM AND 5 AM. THE RAIN
WILL LAST THROUGH SUNDAY TAPERING OFF LATE SUNDAY AFTERNOON. COLD
AIR WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION BEHIND THIS FRONT.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)... NOT MANY CHANGES.
COLDER AIR WILL TAKE OVER THE AREA FOR MUCH OF THE NEXT WORK WEEK
WITH TEMPERATURES 10-15 DEG BELOW NORMAL TUES/WED. LIGHT PRECIP IS
POSSIBLE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. WE'LL HAVE A H5 TROUGH
INITIATE PRECIP...MOSTLY LIQUID AND MAYBE SOME FREEZING/FROZEN MIX
TUES MORNING...THEN A SECOND COLDER REINFORCING TROUGH WILL HELP
LINGERING NW FLOW PRECIP LATE TUES AND TUES NIGHT BECOME SNOW.
ACCUMULATIONS SHOULDN'T BE OVERLY TROUBLESOME...BUT THERE ARE
SEVERAL DAYS TO MONITOR THIS SYSTEM. BY LATE WEEK A WARMUP TO NEAR
NORMAL TEMPS WILL OCCUR...WITH ANOTHER FROPA FRIDAYISH WITH SOME
CONVECTION.

479 
FXUS64 KMRX 210803
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
403 AM EDT FRI MAR 21 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FREEZE/FROST PROGRAM BEGINS TODAY 
FOR THE SRN AND CENTRAL VALLEY COUNTIES OF EAST TN. DRY AIR MASS IN
PLACE WITH SURFACE RIDGE AXIS ACROSS THE REGION THIS MORNING...HAS
ALLOWED TEMPS TO TUMBLE DOWN INTO THE 30S ACROSS MOST OF THE
FORECAST AREA. ADDED PATCHY FROST FOR EARLY THIS MORNING.

HIGH CLOUDS ON THE INCREASE THIS AFTERNOON BUT STILL SEE NO REASON 
WE WON'T TOP OUT IN THE 60S TO LOWER 70S...IN LINE WITH SIMILAR MOS 
MAXES. TONIGHT LOOKS MOSTLY DRY...BUT I DID ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
FOR NRN PLATEAU COUNTIES PLUS LEE AND WISE COUNTIES OF SW VA FOR 
LATE TONIGHT. THIS BLENDS WELL WITH JKL AND RLX FORECAST GRIDS... 
PLUS IS A SMOOTHER TRANSITION INTO CHANCE POPS ON SATURDAY AREAWIDE. 

OTHERWISE...MUCH MILDER FOR TONIGHT GIVEN THE INCREASING CLOUDS AND 
SW LOW LEVEL FLOW AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. SIMILAR MOS MINS CLOSELY 
FOLLOWED.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE
SHIFTS EAST SATURDAY AS COLD FRONT TO MOVE THROUGH WITH SOME LIGHT
SHOWERS SATURDAY AND EARLY SATURDAY NIGHT. SOME INSTABILITY DURING
THE LATE AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING ALONG THE TN BORDER WITH GA
AND AL SO FEW THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE...BUT MAINLY SHOWERS. THE
FRONT WILL MOVE ONLY VERY SLOWLY EAST AND SOUTH. ENHANCEMENT ALONG
THE FRONT SUNDAY WILL BRING SOME MORE MODERATE RAINS AND MUCH
COLDER TEMPERATURES AS MOISTURE OVERRUNS THE FRONT. COLD RAIN
ACROSS THE REGION BUT A LITTLE SNOW POSSIBLE AROUND HIGH KNOB IN
WISE COUNTY VA EARLY SUNDAY. RAIN TO END LATE SUNDAY WITH COLD HIGH
PRESSURE BRINGING CLEARING SKIES AND BELOW FREEZING TO NEAR
FREEZING TEMPERATURES TO THE NORTHERN TWO THIRDS OF THE FORECAST
AREA. BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES CONTINUE MONDAY. MONDAY NIGHT INTO
WEDNESDAY COLD TROUGH CONTINUES OVER THE EASTERN STATES. A COUPLE
DISTURBANCES IN THE NW FLOW TO GIVE THE REGION ANOTHER SHOT OF SNOW
AND RAIN WITH SOME ACCUMULATION POSSIBLE IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.
TEMPERATURES ONLY IN THE 30S IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS BOTH DAYS
WITH 40S LOWER ELEVATIONS. THURSDAY TROUGH FINALLY SHIFTS EAST AND
HIGH PRESSURE WITH UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WARMS TEMPERATURES SEVERAL
DEGREES.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

CONDITIONS.

WEEKEND SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH TO BE ALL LIQUID AND PERHAPS BE UP TO
MODERATE IN INTENSITY AT TIMES. THE SECOND SYSTEM MONDAY NIGHT
THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT WILL BE COLDER...ALTHOUGH THE PRECIP COMES UP
FROM THE GULF. AMOUNTS SHOULD BE LIGHTER THE SECOND TIME AROUND BUT
WE MAY SEE SNOW WITH THIS SECOND SYSTEM. THE UPCOMING WORK WEEK
WILL BE NOTABLY COLDER THAN NORMAL.

EXPECTED.  COULD EVEN BE SOME SNOW SHOWERS HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF FAR 
NORTH GIVEN COLDER AIR MOVING IN.  SHOULD BE BRIEFLY DRY AGAIN FOR

305 
FXUS64 KMRX 191909
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
309 PM EDT WED MAR 19 2014

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND THURSDAY/...LARGE SHIELD OF STRATOCUMULUS 
OVER WESTERN AND CENTRAL PARTS OF THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON. FOR 
POPS...GOING WITH SLIGHT CHANCE OVER THE NORTHERN 1/3 OF THE VALLEY 
AREA TONIGHT...WITH POSSIBILITY OF SPRINKLES ABOUT AS FAR SOUTH AS 
KNOXVILLE. COLD FRONT SHOULD BE WASHING THROUGH THE AREA AROUND 
MIDNIGHT...AND FRONT SHOULD TAKE SPRINKLES AND CLOUDS OUT OF THE 
AREAS.
 
SLIGHT FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS THURSDAY AS RH VALUES FLIRT WITH THE 
20S IN THE AFTERNOON.  FORTUNATELY WINDS WILL BE GETTING LIGHTER 
THROUGH THE DAY.

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
AN ACTIVE PATTERN WILL PERSIST THROUGH THE WEEK AHEAD AS A SERIES
OF TROUGHS WILL PASS THROUGH THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS. THIS
WILL PROMOTE SOME CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION...ALONG WITH BELOW
NORMAL TEMPERATURES FROM SUNDAY THROUGH MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. AHEAD
OF THE FIRST FRONT...WHICH IS PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE AREA
SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. AHEAD OF THE INITIAL WEAK COLD
FRONT...SOME BREEZY SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS WILL HELP TO PUSH HIGHS
WELL INTO THE UPPER 60S AND LOWER 70S ON FRIDAY...AND MID TO UPPER
60S ON SATURDAY. SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL THEN MOVE THROUGH THE
AREA SATURDAY EVENING AND NIGHT WITH THE FRONT...AND COULD LINGER
INTO SUNDAY /ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY/. HOWEVER...NO
SUBSTANTIAL PRECIPITATION  AMOUNTS ARE EXPECTED FROM THIS EVENT.

THE MAIN STORY ACROSS THE REGION NEXT WEEK WILL BE THE PERSISTENT
COOL TEMPERATURES AS A BROAD TROUGH SETS UP ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES
AND OHIO VALLEY. THIS WILL MAINTAIN A SOMEWHAT BREEZY WNW TO NW
FLOW ACROSS THE AREA AND REINFORCE THIS COOLER AIR MASS.
PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL RETURN ON TUESDAY AS ANOTHER WEAK FRONT
PUSHES THROUGH THE REGION. THE COLDER AIR BEHIND THIS SYSTEM MAY
ALLOW FOR SOME SNOW TO MIX IN WITH THE RAIN...ESPECIALLY  ACROSS
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. HOWEVER...NO SIGNIFICANT PRECIPITATION 
AMOUNTS ARE EXPECTED WITH THIS STORM SYSTEM EITHER AS THE BEST
MOISTURE/LIFT WILL BE DISPLACED TO THE SOUTH AND EAST OF THE AREA.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...BAND OF LOW CLOUDS CONTINUES TO

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN DECENT
AGREEMENT FOR THE EARLY PART OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD...BUT GFS
DEPARTURE FROM CONTINUITY AND MODEL DISAGREEMENT FROM LATTER HALF
OF THE WEEKEND ON LEADS TO GREATER FORECAST UNCERTAINTY LATE. HIGH
PRESSURE AND A DRY AIR MASS WILL BE IN CONTROL FOR THURSDAY AND
FRIDAY. A COLD FRONT IS FORECAST TO MOVE THROUGH ON SATURDAY...AND
MODEL TREND HAS GENERALLY BEEN DRIER WITH THIS SYSTEM. WILL GO NO
HIGHER THAN SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NOW AND NO MENTION OF THUNDER
SATURDAY. FOR NOW WILL LEAN AWAY FROM GFS DEPICTION OF ANOTHER WAVE
BRINING SIGNIFICANT PRECIP TO THE AREA ON SUNDAY...AND WILL LEAN
TOWARD LESS AGGRESSIVE ECMWF AND CONTINUITY. HOWEVER...WILL TREND
CLOUDS HIGHER FOR SUNDAY AND INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP SOUTH.
MONDAY SHOULD BE DRY...THEN ANOTHER COLD FRONT EXPECTED TO PUSH
THROUGH TUESDAY. WILL CARRY LOW POPS MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. MAY
BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SOME FROZEN PRECIP ESPECIALLY HIGHER ELEVATIONS
WITH THIS SYSTEM...BUT AT THIS TIME APPEARS PRECIP WILL BE ON THE
LIGHT SIDE.

399 
FXUS64 KMRX 181856
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 PM EDT TUE MAR 18 2014

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY/...
CLOUD COVER CONTINUES TO HANG ON OVER A GOOD CHUNK OF THE
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEYS THIS AFTERNOON
DESPITE SOME DRIER AIR MOVING INTO THE REGION AND WINDS VEERING
TOWARD THE SOUTH. HOWEVER...A LARGE BIT OF EROSION HAS TAKEN PLACE
ACROSS NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA WHERE MOSTLY
CLEAR AND SUNNY CONDITIONS ARE PREVAILING. TEMPERATURES HAVE
CLIMBED INTO THE UPPER 50S IN THESE AREAS AS OF MID-AFTERNOON...
WHILE THEY ARE REMAINING IN THE UPPER 40S AND LOWER 50S UNDER THE
DENSE CLOUD CANOPY TO THE SOUTH. FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE
AFTERNOON...THESE CLOUDS SHOULD SLOWLY CONTINUE TO ERODE TOWARD
THE SOUTH AND WEST...WITH AT LEAST SOME BREAKS OCCURRING ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND VALLEY BY THIS EVENING.

SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL REMAIN IN PLACE OVERNIGHT...WITH SOME CLOUD
COVER REMAINING IN PLACE OR RETURNING TO THE NORTHERN ZONES LATER
TONIGHT. SOME MORE SUBSTANTIONAL CLEARING WILL THEN OCCUR
THROUGHOUT THE DAY ON WEDNESDAY AS WINDS INCREASE AND VEER TO THE
SOUTHWEST AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING WEAK COLD FRONT FROM THE WEST.
THE ADDITIONAL HEATING AND THESE SOUTHERLY WINDS SHOULD ALLOW
TEMPERATURES TO WARM INTO THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S BY THE
AFTERNOON. ADDITIONALLY...SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE
AS THIS SHORTWAVE PASSES THROUGH...MAINLY ALONG THE PLATEAU AND THE
CUMBERLAND MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. GUIDANCE HAS BACKED OFF
ON POPS...SO HAVE FOLLOWED SUIT SOMEWHAT IN THE GRIDS...SCALING
THEM BACK TO SLIGHT CHANCE IN THESE AREAS.

.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY/...
MODELS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN
THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL A QUIET
PATTERN OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK. HIGH
PRESSURE IS PROGGED TO BUILD OVER THE SOUTHEAST FOR THE END OF THIS
WEEK...WITH A COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON
SATURDAY. BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS INDICATE SOME MARGINAL
INSTABILITY DEVELOPING OVER THE FORECAST AREA AHEAD OF THIS COLD
FRONT...SO WILL MENTION A CHANCE OF TSTORMS ON SATURDAY. A BROAD
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS THEN EXPECTED TO SLIGHTLY AMPLIFY OVER THE
EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION BY EARLY NEXT WEEK... WHICH IS THEN
PROGGED TO DEVELOP A WEAK SURFACE LOW ALONG THE NORTHERN GULF
COAST. MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS LOW MAY BE PULLED NORTHWARD
INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY...BUT WILL
MENTION SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NOW SINCE THE FORECAST AREA IS
EXPECTED TO BE ON THE NORTHERN EDGE OF THIS PRECIP AREA. AS FOR
TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND A LITTLE COOLER THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE
NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH IS IN BETTER
AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.


&&

1018 AM EDT TUE MAR 18 2014

.DISCUSSION...
SOMEWHAT CHALLENGING FORECAST THIS MORNING AS QUESTIONS EXIST AS
TO THE EXTENT OF CLEARING THAT WILL TAKE PLACE LATER TODAY. CURRENT
TRENDS SHOW DRY AIR FROM THE ADVANCING RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE HAS
SLOWLY BEGUN TO ERODE THE CLOUD SHIELD...ESPECIALLY ALONG THE
MOUNTAINS WHERE PARTLY/MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS ARE TAKING PLACE.
HOWEVER...THE NORTHEAST FLOW DOWN THE VALLEY HAS HELPED TO MAINTAIN
THE LOW STRATUS DECK ALL NIGHT AND SHOULD KEEP IT IN PLACE ACROSS
PARTS OF THE TENNESSEE VALLEY THROUGH AT LEAST THE EARLY TO MID
AFTERNOON. WINDS WILL GRADUALLY VEER TO THE SOUTHEAST AND
EVENTUALLY SOUTHWEST LATER IN THE DAY AND EVENING WHICH WILL HELP
TO ERODE THESE CLOUDS. THIS SHOULD ALLOW FOR SOME HEATING TO TAKE
PLACE AND TEMPERATURES TO RISE INTO THE MID 50S IN MOST LOCATIONS
BY THE AFTERNOON /WITH SOME AREAS APPROACHING 60 DEGREES ACROSS
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND ALONG THE VALLEYS PARALLELING THE
MOUNTAINS.

TRACKING THROUGH THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY.  MAIN MOISTURE AND LIFT 
WILL STAY TO OUR NORTH BUT WILL SEE A FEW ISOLATED TO SCATTERED 
SHOWERS MOVING THROUGH...ESPECIALLY EARLY IN THE DAY.  A FEW SHOWERS 
MAY LINGER OVER THE FAR EASTERN AREAS WEDNESDAY EVENING. 
OTHERWISE...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND WILL 
DOMINATE AREA WEATHER THROUGH THE REST OF THE WORK WEEK.  A COLD 
FRONT WILL THEN MOVE THROUGH ON SATURDAY.  MAINLY EXPECT A LINE OF 
SHOWERS TO MOVE THROUGH...HOWEVER THE AIR MASS IS WEAKLY UNSTABLE 
AND MAY SEE A FEW RUMBLES OF THUNDER.  SURFACE HIGH BUILDS BACK IN 
FOR SUNDAY.

931 
FXUS64 KMRX 171942
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
342 PM EDT MON MAR 17 2014

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND TUESDAY/...
DRIZZLE AND LOW CLOUDS CONTINUE TO LINGER ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS AND TENNESSEE VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON IN THE WAKE OF A
COLD FRONT THAT MOVED THROUGH THE REGION ON SUNDAY. THE
NORTHEASTERLY FLOW IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION...COMBINED WITH THE
DENSE CLOUD COVER HAS HELPED TO KEEP TEMPERATURES IN 40S IN MOST
AREAS TODAY...AND WELL BELOW SEASONABLE AVERAGES. THROUGH SOME
DRIER AIR IS SLOWLY BEGINNING TO FILTER INTO TO WESTERN AND MIDDLE
TENNESSEE...MODELS ARE INDICATING THAT THIS VERY MOIST BOUNDARY
LAYER WILL PERSIST OVERNIGHT AND INTO THE MORNING ON TUESDAY. THIS
WILL RESULT IN THE LOW CLOUDS LIKELY LINGERING THROUGH THE MID TO
LATE MORNING HOURS ON TUESDAY. LOW STRATUS DECKS OF A FEW HUNDRED
FEET OR LESS AND SOME PATCHY FOG ARE EXPECTED TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE
REGION BY LATE THIS EVENING AND LINGER THROUGH DAYBREAK AS WELL.
THEREAFTER...THE AFOREMENTIONED DRIER AIR AND SOME RIDGING WILL
HELP TO ERODE AWAY THIS CLOUD COVER AND WINDS BEGIN TO VEER TO THE
SOUTH. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR SOME CLEARING TO TAKE PLACE BY TUESDAY
AFTERNOON AND HIGHS TO REACH THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S IN MOST
SPOTS.

.LONG TERM /TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY/...
RELATIVELY BUSY PATTERN CONTINUES...ALTHOUGH OUR AREA WILL NOT BE
IN THE DIRECT PATH OF ANY MAJOR WEATHER SYSTEMS.

THIS PERIODS STARTS TUESDAY EVENING WITH OUR AREA BETWEEN THE SYSTEM 
THAT IS LINGERING OVER US NOW...HAVING MOVED OUT TO SEA OVER THE 
ATLANTIC...AND ANOTHER SYSTEM IN THE PLAINS THAT IS HEADED TO THE 
EAST-NORTHEAST.  A WEAK COLD FRONT FROM THIS SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY AND A SHORTWAVE FROM THIS SYSTEM SWEEPS THROUGH THE AREA 
AROUND THURSDAY MORNING.  THEN A LARGER SYSTEM WITH A CONNECTION TO 
THE GULF MOVES INTO THE REGION FRIDAY NIGHT/SATURDAY MORNING...WITH 
A COLD FRONT SWEEPING THROUGH AND STRONG HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING INTO 
THE REGION BY SUNDAY.

WITH THE FRONT ON SATURDAY THERE MAY BE ENOUGH RETURN FLOW MOISTURE 
TO BOOST THE INSTABILITY FOR THUNDERSTORMS.  WILL INSERT SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF THUNDER FOR LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND INTO SATURDAY FOR THE 
SOUTHERN HALF OF THE AREA.  

FOR TEMPS...PRETTY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE WITH OVERALL...BIGGEST 
EXCEPTION IS THE COLDER AIR BY NEXT SUNDAY.  ALSO WITH COLD HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDING IN WENT BELOW GUIDANCE ON POPS TOWARD END OF 
FORECAST.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             42  62  46  67 /  20  10  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  39  61  43  64 /  10  10  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       38  60  43  64 /  10  10  10  30

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1013 AM EDT MON MAR 17 2014

.DISCUSSION...
LIGHT RAIN CONTINUE TO MOVE ACROSS THE REGION LATE THIS
MORNING...WITH LOW CLOUDS AND SOME LIGHT FOG KEEPING TEMPERATURES
IN THE MID 30S TO LOWER 40S IN MOST AREAS. HOWEVER...SOME LOCALIZED
AREAS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA ARE STILL LINGERING AT OR AROUND
THE FREEZING MARK. AS A RESULT...SOME LIGHT FREEZING DRIZZLE WILL
BE POSSIBLE /PARTICULARLY ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS OF THE
CUMBERLAND MOUNTAINS/ THROUGH NOON BEFORE TEMPERATURES CREEP UP A
DEGREE OF TWO AND THE PRECIPITATION BEGINS TO WANE. THE LIGHT
NORTHEASTERLY FLOW WILL PERSIST THROUGHOUT THE DAY...AND ALONG WITH
THE DAMP BOUNDARY LAYER AND DENSE CLOUD COVER WILL KEEP
TEMPERATURES FROM CLIMBING NO HIGHER THAN ABOUT 5 TO 10 DEGREES
MORE BY THE AFTERNOON. HIGHS IN THE LOW TO MID 40S WILL BE PROBABLE
WITH LOCATIONS ALONG THE SOUTHERN VALLEY...CREEPING CLOSER TO 50
DEGREES.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE INVERTED TROUGH THAT EXTENDS 
INTO OUR AREA WILL WEAKEN TODAY...BUT CONSIDERABLE MOISTURE WILL 
LINGER OVER THE REGION THROUGH THE SHORT TERM PERIOD.  BEST FORCING

DOES NOT LOOK LIKE THERE WILL BE MUCH CHANCE OF SIGNIFICANT 
ICING...SO WILL JUST CONTINUE SPS. FOR TONIGHT NOT EXPECTING MUCH 
MORE THAN SOME PATCHY DRIZZLE AND PLENTY OF CLOUDS.  WILL GENERALLY 
GO A BIT BELOW MAV TEMPS FOR TODAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE MODELS GENERALLY AGREE ON 
THE LONG TERM PERIOD WHICH STARTS OUT WITH A MAINLY DRY TUESDAY. 
KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SHOWERS GOING ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS 
WHERE SOME DEEPER MOISTURE LINGERS VICINITY OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN 
ALONG WITH SOME WEAK LIFT. NEXT UPPER TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD 
FRONT GLIDE EAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON WEDNESDAY. IT 
STILL APPEARS SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE WILL BE LACKING AHEAD OF THIS 
FEATURE SO MAINTAINED SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS AT MID 
WEEK.  MORE DRY AIR AND RIDGING KEEP THE FORECAST RATHER PLEASANT 
FOR THE LAST COUPLE DAYS OF THE WORK WEEK. THE NEXT FRONTAL SYSTEM 
IMPACTS THE REGION ON SATURDAY WITH ANOTHER PERIOD OF SHOWERS 
FOLLOWED BY A DRIER AND SLIGHTLY COOLER END TO THE WEEKEND ON SUNDAY.

352 
FXUS64 KMRX 161933
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
333 PM EDT SUN MAR 16 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...
THE NEXT FEW HOURS LOOK TO BE MAINLY DRY ACROSS MOST OF THE 
AREA...ASIDE FROM SOME SCATTERED SPRINKLES. EXPECT THAT PRECIP 
CHANCES/AMOUNTS WILL INCREASE AGAIN LATER TONIGHT...MOST LIKELY 
AFTER MIDNIGHT AS A TROWAL FEATURE DEVELOPS ACROSS SW VA/NE TN ON 
THE NW SIDE OF THE SURFACE LOW THAT TRACKS ACROSS NRN GA. THE MODELS 
DIFFER ON HOW MUCH COLD AIR IS ABLE TO WORK ITS WAY IN FROM THE 
NW...WITH THE NAM BEING COLDER THAN THE GFS IN SW VA. THE NAM SEEMS 
TO HAVE A TENDENCY OF LATE TO OVERDO COOLING AND FROZEN PRECIP...BUT 
WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION A CHANCE OF LIGHT IP/FZRA IN WISE 
COUNTY...AND ADD A CHANCE OF IP IN THE NORTHERN PLATEAU COUNTIES. 
THE WINDOW FOR ICING IS VERY SMALL...MAINLY 09-13Z...AND CONFIDENCE 
IS LOW THAT THERE WILL BE ANY ACCUMULATION...SO WILL FOREGO AN 
ADVISORY AT THIS TIME AND ISSUE A SPS FOR WISE. 

MODELS ARE MORE AGGRESSIVE TODAY TO BRING DRIER AIR IN FROM THE WEST 
BEHIND THE UPPER TROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON...WITH MOISTURE CONFINED TO 
A SHALLOW LAYER AND NO LIFT TO SPEAK OF. THUS POPS WILL BE DROPPED 
AFTER 18Z. SOME PARTIAL CLEARING FROM THE WEST MAY OCCUR MONDAY 
NIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
AS SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVE MOVES UP FROM THE SOUTHEAST COAST
EARLY TUESDAY SKIES WILL BE SLOW TO CLEAR FROM THE SOUTHWEST TO
NORTHEAST. A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS ALONG THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS
TUESDAY THEN ONLY IN SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA TUESDAY NIGHT.
SURFACE LOW AND UPPER FLOW BECOMES MORE SOUTHWESTERLY AS SURFACE
HIGH MOVES EAST ACROSS THE NORTHERN GULF AND RETURN FLOW AROUND IT
COMBINED WITH COUNTER CLOCKWISE FLOW AROUND SURFACE LOW TO THE NW
BRING DRYING SOUTHWEST WINDS INTO REGION LATE TUESDAY AND TUESDAY
NIGHT. THERE SHOULD BE AT LEAST PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES IN THE
AFTERNOON WESTERN AND SOUTHERN SECTIONS.

AS THE WEAK SHORTWAVE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SURFACE LOW APPROACHES
OVERNIGHT TUESDAY NIGHT TEMPERATURES WILL STAY WARMER. CLOUDS AND
RAIN WITH THIS SYSTEM WILL KEEP HIGHS DOWN SOMEWHAT WEDNESDAY BUT
ONLY SMALL AMOUNT OF RAIN AND LOW RAIN CHANCES. HIGH PRESSURE TO
RECLAIM THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY.
LOWS WILL BE IN THE 30S AND HIGHS RISING TO THE MID 50S TO MID 60S
THURSDAY AND MID 60S TO NEAR 70 FRIDAY. MODELS BRING NEXT UPPER
TROUGH AND FAST MOVING SYSTEM THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY
WITH IMPROVING CONDITIONS SUNDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 161413 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1013 AM EDT SUN MAR 16 2014

.DISCUSSION...
WARM ADVECTION AND ISENTROPIC LIFT ARE SPREADING PRECIP ACROSS THE
AREA THIS MORNING...BUT WE ARE SEEING THE DRY SLOT JUST SOUTH OF
OUR AREA. MODELS...ESPECIALLY THE NAM...ARE MORE AGGRESSIVE THIS
MORNING IN BRINGING MIDLEVEL DRYING TO THE AREA THIS
AFTERNOON...AND THUS FAR THIS ALIGNS WITH WHAT WE ARE SEEING ON
RADAR. ALSO INTERESTING TO NOTE IS THE NE-SW ALIGNMENT OF
CONVECTION NEAR THE GULF COAST...WHICH TENDS TO CUT OFF GULF
MOISTURE AND REDUCE PRECIP AMOUNTS IN OUR AREA. THERE IS ALSO A
GOOD DOWNSLOPE FLOW IN THE VALLEY THIS MORNING AS EVIDENCED BY
WARMER TEMPS AT TRI...VJI...AND LNP. THESE FACTORS SUGGEST THAT
PRECIP WILL BE GRADUALLY TAPERING OFF THIS AFTERNOON FROM SW TO NE.
WILL ADJUST POPS AND QPF DOWN SLIGHTLY. TEMPS WILL ALSO BE ADJUSTED
TO BRING THEM CLOSER TO CURRENT OBS...WARMER IN THE NORTH DUE TO
DOWNSLOPING AND COOLER SOUTH WHERE RAIN HAS BEEN FALLING.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

TO BE QUITE LIGHT.  WILL GENERALLY STAY CLOSE TO MAV TEMPS...BUT 
WILL GO A BIT BELOW TONIGHT ESPECIALLY NORTH.

SHOULD KEEP SKIES CLOUDY AND THE FORECAST A LITTLE DAMP POSSIBLY 
INTO TUESDAY MORNING. DRIER AIR SPILLS IN BEHIND THIS FEATURE FOR 
TUESDAY BUT ANOTHER WEAK SHORT WAVE AND COLD FRONT BUILD ACROSS THE 
REGION ON WEDNESDAY. SYSTEM APPEARS TO LACK SUFFICIENTLY DEEP 
MOISTURE AND SO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS WERE APPLIED AT MID WEEK. SOME 
LATE WORK WEEK RIDGING AND DRY ADVECTION SHOULD ALLOW FOR A DECENT 
COUPLE DAYS WITH SUNSHINE RETURNING. HOWEVER...THE NEXT UPPER TROUGH 
BUILDS INTO THE AREA ON SATURDAY AND MAINTAINED MEDIUM CHANCE POPS 
AS A SLIGHTLY STRONGER FRONTAL SYSTEM ARRIVES IN THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS.

.DISCUSSION... FLIGHT CONDITIONS WILL DETERIORATE FROM CHA...TYS AND 
THEN TRI BEGINNING EARLY SUNDAY MORNING. CONDITIONS AT CHA AND TYS 
WILL BE IFR TO OCCASIONALLY LIFR AT BETWEEN 12-15Z SUNDAY DUE TO LOW 
CLOUD CEILINGS. AT TRI...CEILINGS WILL DROP TO MVFR CONDITIONS 
SUNDAY AFTERNOON.

LLWS MAY BECOME A PROBLEM AS WELL AT ALL TAF SITES SUNDAY DUE TO 
NORTHEAST-EAST SURFACE WINDS BECOMING SOUTHEAST-SOUTH (40-50KTS) AT 
5KFT ABOVE GROUND.

AN UPPER TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED CYCLOGENESIS WILL MOVE ACROSS THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND GULF COAST STATES SUNDAY BRINGING STRONG UPPER 
DYNAMICS AND ISENTROPIC LIFT. WIDESPREAD RAIN IS ANTICIPATED AT ALL 
TAF SITES BEGINNING CHA AROUND 06-08Z...TYS 10-12Z...AND TRI 15-17Z.

FXUS64 KMRX 151915
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT SAT MAR 15 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
AS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPS OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND 
TRACKS EAST...ISENTROPIC LIFT AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM WILL BE SPREADING 
CLOUDS INTO SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA THIS EVENING. STRONGER 
FORCING IN THE 850 MB CONVERGENCE ZONE AND UPPER DIFFLUENCE IN THE 
JET EXIT REGION WILL PROVIDE MODERATE PRECIP BEGINNING IN THE 09-12Z 
WINDOW...AND SPREAD NORTHWARD THROUGH THE MORNING. 

THE NAM AND GFS CONTINUE TO HAVE DIFFERENCES WITH REGARD TO THE 
TIMING OF THE EXITING LIFT/MOISTURE SUNDAY EVENING...WITH THE GFS 
BEING FASTER. IT PUTS US FIRMLY IN THE DRY SLOT BETWEEN 21-
00Z...LEAVING ONLY DRIZZLE OR VERY LIGHT RAIN. NAM SHOWS SOME DRYING 
ALOFT OCCURRING AFTER 00Z...BUT NOT AS DRAMATICALLY AS THE GFS. WILL 
LEAN TOWARD THE GFS AND TREND POPS DOWNWARD AFTER 21Z...BUT STAY IN 
THE LIKELY RANGE WITH LOW QPF AMOUNTS THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. A TROWAL 
FEATURE APPEARS IN THE NAM AND GFS SUNDAY NIGHT...WHICH MAY INCREASE 
PRECIP AMOUNTS AGAIN IN THE 06Z-12Z WINDOW ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS. 

ALSO DURING THIS TIME...THE NAM RAPIDLY COOLS THE 1000-850 MB LAYER 
ON THE NW SIDE OF THE 850 MB LOW CENTER...SUGGESTING A PERIOD OF 
SLEET/FZRA IN SW VA AND THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AREA. THE GFS IS 
PROFILE WARMER INITIALLY...BUT STILL DROPS BELOW FREEZING IN THIS 
LAYER BRIEFLY AROUND 12Z. WILL ADD A CHANCE OF SLEET TO THE PLATEAU 
AND PARTS OF SW VA. IF THE NAM IS CORRECT...ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE 
POSSIBLE...BUT WILL NOT ISSUE ANY ADVISORIES AT THIS TIME AS 
CONFIDENCE IS LOW AND STILL 36+ HOURS OUT.

MOISTURE DEPTH DECREASES RAPIDLY MONDAY MORNING...AND LIFT IS WEAK 
AT THIS TIME...WHICH SHOULD LOWER POPS TO JUST A LOW TO SLIGHT
CHANCE IN THE AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)... MOISTURE LINGERS
MONDAY NIGHT AS BACK EDGE OF SYSTEM SLOWLY MOVES UP THE EAST COAST.
AS TEMPERATURES COOL MONDAY NIGHT MIXTURE OF SLEET OR A LITTLE
LIGHT SNOW POSSIBLE NE TN AND SW VA AS SYSTEM DEPARTS. SNOW OR
POSSIBLY SLEET AMOUNTS EXPECTED TO BE VERY LIGHT SO DID NOT ADD ANY
TO SNOWFALL GRIDS. LOWS MONDAY NIGHT MOSTLY UPPER 30S TO NEAR 40
BUT LOWER 30S NORTHEAST SECTIONS. TUESDAY WEAK HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS
IN FROM THE WEST AND AT THE SAME TIME SURFACE LOW DEVELOPS OVER THE
CENTRAL PLAINS. CLOUDS MAYBE SLOW TO MOVE OUT BUT HIGHS WARM TO THE
LOWER 50S TO LOWER 60S. SOUTHWEST WINDS MAY INCREASE AS SURFACE LOW
DEVELOPS TO THE NW BY TUESDAY NIGHT. NORTHERN SYSTEM MOVING THROUGH
THE GREAT LAKES TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY WILL BRING SOME CLOUDS
INTO THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY WITH MUCH WARMER
TEMPERATURES...MOSTLY 60S AND A CHANCE OF SHOWERS WEDNESDAY NIGHT.
AFTER THIS SYSTEM PULLS OUT EARLY THURSDAY ANOTHER TRANQUIL PERIOD
THROUGH FRIDAY WITH BUILDING HIGH PRESSURE. STRONGER SYSTEM MOVES
IN SATURDAY. SHOWERS AGAIN POSSIBLE...THUNDER MAY HAVE TO BE ADDED
LATER IF LATER RUNS SHOW STRENGTHENING OF THIS SYSTEM.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...SOME DIFFERENCES NOTED IN THE 
MODELS THROUGHOUT THE LONG TERM PERIOD ALTHOUGH MAIN DIFFERENCES NOT 
SEEN UNTIL ABOUT MIDDLE PART OF NEXT WEEK WHEN THE GFS IS A GOOD SIX 
HOURS AHEAD OF THE ECMWF WITH A COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE. A LEADING 
NORTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVE BUILDS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
SUNDAY INTO SUNDAY NIGHT WITH CATEGORICAL POPS FOR THE RAIN EVENT. A 
TRAILING SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE KEEPS THE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS GOING 
THROUGH THE DAY MONDAY WITH POPS FINALLY TAPERING OFF LATER MONDAY 
NIGHT. THERE COULD BE ENOUGH COLD AIR SPILLING INTO THE NORTHERN 
REACHES OF THE FORECAST AREA LATE MONDAY NIGHT FOR THE POSSIBILITY 
OF SOME LIGHT SNOW IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN AS THE BACK EDGE OF THE 
DEEPER MOISTURE SHIFTS INTO THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC REGION. DRIER AIR 
BUILDS IN ON TUESDAY WITH SOME RIDGING AHEAD OF THE NEXT SIGNIFICANT 
UPPER TROUGH. BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THE CHANCE FOR RAIN WILL BE 
BACK IN THE FORECAST AS WARMER AIR IS LIFTED OVER THE RETREATING 
COOLER AIRMASS ACROSS REGION. A BETTER CHANCE OF RAIN WILL BE IN 
PLACE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS ANOTHER COLD FRONT MOVES ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. MUCH OF THE RAIN MAY END PRIOR TO DAYBREAK 
THURSDAY BUT BECAUSE OF UNCERTAINTY IN FRONTAL TIMING KEPT SOME 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING INTO THURSDAY MORNING. ANOTHER PERIOD OF 
RIDGING WITH DRY ADVECTION MAY ALLOW FOR A RETURN TO SUNSHINE AND 
WARMER TEMPERATURES ON FRIDAY.

330 PM EDT FRI MAR 14 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)... AS A BROAD TROUGH
APPROACHES AND THE UPPER JET NOSES INTO WEST AND MIDDLE TN...WE
WILL SEE INCREASING HIGH AND MID LEVEL CLOUDS THIS EVENING. THE

PASSAGE TONIGHT. THE ASSOCIATED SURFACE FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE
AREA SATURDAY MORNING...AND SETTLE ACROSS THE TN/GA BORDER BY THE
AFTERNOON. THIS MAY KEEP SOME CLOUDS IN SOUTHERN AREAS TOMORROW
AFTERNOON...WHILE NORTHERN AREAS SHOULD BE MOSTLY SUNNY. MOST
VALLEY LOCATIONS WILL REACH THE MID TO UPPER 60S.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...GRADUAL INCREASE IN 
MOISTURE SATURDAY NIGHT AS FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
MOVES NORTH AS A WARM FRONT. SURFACE LOW DEEPENING OVER THE LOWER MS 
VALLEY SUNDAY MORNING WILL THEN RAPIDLY SPREAD RAIN SHOWERS EAST 
TOWARD THE APPALACHIANS. RAIN SPREADS NORTHEAST DURING THE DAY. NAM 
MODEL SHOWS A DRY SLOT FORMING WITH THE LOW AS IT MOVES EAST 
NORTHEAST ACROSS TN SO RAINFALL COULD TAPER OFF FROM SOUTHWEST TO 
NORTHEAST BY LATE IN THE DAY. ECMWF AND GFS ARE SLOWER WITH THE 
SPEED OF THE SURFACE LOW AND MUCH FARTHER SOUTH WITH ITS PROGRESS 
EAST WHICH WOULD KEEP STEADY RAIN OVER MUCH OF EAST TN THROUGHOUT 
THE DAY. DIGGING UPPER TROUGH ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE SYSTEM BRINGS 
IN COLDER AIR LATE SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. THIS COULD BRING A 
LITTLE SNOW TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND NORTHEAST BUT TEMPERATURES 
MAY NOT BE QUITE COLD ENOUGH FOR ANY SIGNIFICANT ACCUMULATION. 
PRECIPITATION MOVES OUT BY LATE MONDAY. HIGHER PRESSURE TO RETURN 
TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY. A WEAK SYSTEM TO AFFECT THE REGION WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT INTO THURSDAY AND THEN FAIR WEATHER FRIDAY. LOWS SATURDAY 
NIGHT MOSTLY IN THE 40S. SUNDAY WENT BELOW GUIDANCE WITH HIGHS MID 
40S HIGHER ELEVATIONS TO MOSTLY LOWER TO MID 50S ELSEWHERE. SUNDAY 
NIGHT AND MONDAY IN COLDER AIR MASS LOWS IN THE MID 30S TO NEAR 40 
AND HIGHS IN THE 40S TO LOWER 50S.

THROUGH ABOUT TUESDAY EVENING BUT THEN DIFFERENCES WERE NOTED 
BETWEEN THE ECMWF AND GFS. INITIALLY A WEAKENING SHORT WAVE BUILDS 
NORTHEAST ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN STATES ON LATER SATURDAY INTO 
SUNDAY. TRIMMED POPS BACK SIGNIFICANTLY IN TERMS OF PROBABILITY AND 
TIMING ON SATURDAY LEAVING JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE OF A SHOWER ACROSS 
THE EXTREME SOUTHERN PORTION OF THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...A 
DEEPENING UPPER TROUGH WITH A STRONG UPPER JET ROUNDING THE BASE OF 
THE TROUGH WILL AID IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF...A LOWER TENNESSEE VALLEY 
TRANSITING...HEALTHY SURFACE LOW LATER SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
SUNDAY. NICE MOISTURE ADVECTION OFF THE GULF WILL BE IN PLACE AHEAD 
OF THE SYSTEM TO PRODUCE A MASS OF SHOWERS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. MORE CHILLY 
AIR BUILDS IN BEHIND THE SYSTEM SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY AND THERE 
COULD BE A FEW SNOW SHOWERS IN THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS LATE SUNDAY 
NIGHT INTO MONDAY AND THEN AGAIN MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY AS AN 
ENERGETIC SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM TRAILS THE WEEKEND STORM SYSTEM. 
FINALLY...A BRIEF PERIOD OF RIDGING KEEPS THE FORECAST AREA DRY 
TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY BUT THE NEXT UPPER TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED 
FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL BE DRIVING EAST INTO THE REGION WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
INTO THURSDAY (PREFERRED THE SLOWER ECMWF OVER THE GFS HERE). STAYED 
WITH LOW TO MEDIUM CHANCE POPS FOR THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST DUE

012 
FXUS64 KMRX 131929
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
329 PM EDT THU MAR 13 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...THE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE OVER THE 
AREA TODAY WILL SHIFT TO OUR EAST OVERNIGHT. SKIES WILL BE CLEAR
TONIGHT...BUT HIGH CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE FROM THE WEST
TOMORROW AS THE JET STREAM MOVES INTO WEST TN. A SW FLOW WILL
GRADUALLY STRENGTHEN THROUGH THE DAY AS A TROUGH/FRONT MOVE
EASTWARD ACROSS THE PLAINS. THIS WILL TIGHTEN THE PRESSURE GRADIENT
ONCE MORE...AND WINDS WILL BE PICKING UP TO 10-15 MPH. WITH MIN RH
VALUES IN THE 20S...FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS WILL BE A CONCERN.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...AS WITH YESTERDAY'S 
DISCUSSION...THE MAIN STORY THROUGH THE LONG TERM WILL BE DEALING 
WITH A TRICKY WEEKEND FORECAST DUE TO A DISORGANIZED 300MB FLOW 
CAUSED BY A SPLIT FLOW PATTERN. 

FRIDAY NIGHT WE WILL REMAIN IN ZONAL FLOW WITH A WEAK COLD FRONT 
SLOWLY APPROACHING FROM THE NORTHWEST. MODELS SHOW THE FRONT SLOWLY 
DRAGGING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING...WITH ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR 
PRECIP ACROSS NETN AND INTO SWVA. LATER ON SATURDAY A WARM FRONT 
WILL BEGIN TO SLOWLY LIFT NORTHWARD INTO OUR AREA THAT IS ASSOCIATED 
WITH A SHORTWAVE COMING OUT OF TEXAS. THE WARM FRONT WILL PROVIDE A 
CHANCE FOR SOME LIGHT SHOWERS AREA WIDE AS THE LIFT WILL GENERALLY 
BE WEAK. WHILE AT THE SAME TIME A DEVELOPING TROUGH IS TAKING SHAPE 
ACROSS THE PLAINS ALONG WITH A NEW WAVE OF ENERGY THAT BEGAN DROPING 
OUT OF THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST ON FRIDAY.  AGAIN...THIS IS WHERE THE 
FORECAST BECOMES TRICKY.
 
THE ECMWF WANTS TO BETTER DEVELOP THIS SYSTEM...COMPARED TO PREVIOUS 
RUNS OF THE GFS...WHICH WOULD INCREASE AND PROLONG PRECIP ACROSS OUR 
AREA...WITH PRECIP LASTING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING. WHEREAS THE 
LATEST GFS IS NOW SHOWING SOMETHING NEW...A LOW DEVELOPING ACROSS 
THE GULF COAST STATES AND SWINGING WELL SOUTH OF OUR AREA AND ACROSS 
THE COASTAL CAROLINAS. THE LATEST NAM DOESN'T CAPTURE THE ENTIRE 
WEEKEND...BUT DOES GO THROUGH MONDAY 00Z AND APPEARS TO BE MORE IN 
LINE WITH THE ECMWF. REGARDLESS OF HOW THE WEEKEND SYSTEM 
EVOLVES...IT IS SAFE TO SAY THAT THE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY 
NIGHT TIME PERIOD LOOKS TO BE WET AND WILL THEREFORE INCREASE POPS 
INTO THE LIKELY CATEGORY. THERE IS STILL THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME SNOW 
SUNDAY EVENING INTO MONDAY MORNING. STILL NOT GOING TO THROW OUT ANY 
AMOUNTS AS THEY SEEM TO CHANGE WITH EACH MODEL RUN DUE TO THE 
UNCERTAINTY WITH THIS SYSTEM. IF THERE IS GOING TO BE ANY 
ACCUMULATION...IT WILL LIKELY BE LIMITED TO EXTREME NETN AND INTO 
SWVA. MOST AREAS COULD SEE UP TO HALF AN INCH OF LIQUID PRECIP WITH 
THE WEEKEND SYSTEM AND SOME AREAS EVEN MORE.

MODELS SHOW CLEARING CONDITIONS FOR MONDAY/MONDAY NIGHT AS THE 
WEEKEND SYSTEM MOVES OFF TO THE EAST. MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
SHOULD BE QUIET WEATHER AS WE WILL RETURN TO A MAINLY ZONAL FLOW. 
THE NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES SOMETIME DURING THE WED/THURSDAY TIME 
FRAME...DEPENDING ON WHICH MODEL YOU LOOK AT...AND WILL BRING US OUR 
NEXT CHANCE OF PRECIP. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL CONTINUE THE PREVIOUS 
TREND OF STAYING CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH SATURDAY 
NIGHT...BUT WILL THEN TREND CLOSER TO THE ENSEMBLE MEANS THEREAFTER 
DUE TO PATTERN UNCERTAINTY (WHICH ARE COOLER THAN THE GFS NUMBERS).


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             31  65  43  64 /   0   0  10  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  29  62  40  62 /   0   0  10  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       29  61  40  62 /   0   0  10  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              24  59  36  60 /   0   0  10  20

.AVIATION...
WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO BE GUSTY THROUGH THE AFTERNOON AT TRI..AND
AROUND 10-15 KTS AT TYS AND CHA. AS WE APPROACH SUNSET...WINDS
SHOULD BECOME LIGHT AND VARIABLE. AS HIGH PRESSURE MOVES EAST OF

BE AROUND 10 KTS BY LATE MORNING. SOME GUSTS WILL BE POSSIBLE AFTER
18Z. NO VIS/CIG RESTRICTIONS ARE EXPECTED.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
118 AM EDT THU MAR 13 2014

.AVIATION...MVFR CONDITIONS AT TYS AND TRI WILL IMPROVE TO VFR 
BETWEEN 10-14Z. BRISK NORTHWEST WINDS WILL CONTINUE AT ALL TAF SITES 
WITH THE STRONGEST WINDS AT TRI. SURFACE RIDGING WILL BUILD INTO THE 
AREA LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING WITH WINDS BECOMING LIGHT AND 
VARIABLE BY SUNSET.

THE MAIN WEATHER STORY IS THE COLD UPPER LEVEL AIR WITH 500MB 
TEMPERATURES NEAR 30 DEGREES BELOW ZERO. THE COLD AIR ALOFT IN 
HELPING TO PRODUCE A GOOD DEAL OF SNOW SHOWERS. COLD AIR ALOFT WILL 
MOVE EAST OF THE AREA BY 12Z WITH CLOUDS AND SNOW SHOWERS ENDING.

FXUS64 KMRX 130154
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
954 PM EDT WED MAR 12 2014

.DISCUSSION...
ONLY MAIN ADJUSTMENT TO THE FORECAST IS THAT RAIN SHOWERS HAVE
ALMOST ALL CHANGED TO SNOW AS THE TEMPERATURES CONTINUE TO COOL
THROUGH THE LATE EVENING. ONLY TRACE AMOUNTS IN EAST TENNESSEE AND
UP TO ONE INCH IN THE CUMBERLAND MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA
CAN BE EXPECTED THROUGH THE EARLY MORNING. THE ISOLATED SNOW
SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE UNTIL RIGHT BEFORE SUNRISE. NORTHWEST FLOW
WILL KEEP HEAVIER AMOUNTS OF ONE TO THREE INCHES POSSIBLE IN THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS AND WISE VIRGINIA. GUSTY
WINDS COULD BE POSSIBLE THROUGH THE NIGHT...AND WILL LET THE WIND
ADVISORY EXPIRE AT 03Z. WILL KEEP THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY GOING
THROUGH 09Z.

A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST THROUGH THE
APPALACHIANS THROUGH TONIGHT. LIGHT ISOLATED SHOWERS BEHIND THE
FRONT WILL MAINLY IMPACT KTYS UNTIL 02Z...AND KTRI THROUGH 04Z.
KTRI COULD HAVE SOME SNOW SHOWERS AS THE TEMPERATURES DROP TO
FREEZING. SKIES WILL CLEAR BY 10Z AT KCHA AND 12Z AT KTYS AND
KTRI...WITH HIGH PRESSURE DEVELOPING THROUGH THURSDAY.

818 
FXUS64 KMRX 121933
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
333 PM EDT WED MAR 12 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A COLD FRONT IS EXITING TO THE EAST...AND GUSTY WINDS HAVE DEVELOPED 
ACROSS THE AREA AS THE DEEPENING SURFACE LOW TRACKS INTO THE CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS. SEVERAL OBS SITES ARE SHOWING WINDS ABOVE ADVISORY 
CRITERIA...AND THIS IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE THROUGH THE EVENING. THE 
CURRENT END TIME OF 03Z FOR THE ADVISORY LOOKS GOOD. 

TEMPS ARE FALLING RAPIDLY BEHIND THE FRONT AS STRONG COLD ADVECTION 
SPREADS INTO THE AREA. LIGHT SHOWERS OVER ERN KY WILL SPREAD INTO SW 
VA THROUGH THE REST OF THE AFTERNOON...CHANGING OVER TO SNOW THIS 
EVENING AS MIDLEVEL TEMPS DROP. STEEP LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES WILL 
HELP MAINTAIN SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS SNOW SHOWERS IN NORTHERN AREAS 
OVERNIGHT...WITH A 30-40 KT NW FLOW FROM 925-850 MB ENHANCING 
AMOUNTS IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS. MOISTURE DEPTH APPEARS ADEQUATE FOR 
ACCUMULATIONS BETWEEN 00Z AND 06Z...AFTER WHICH TIME PRECIP SHOULD 
TAPER OFF. 1-3 INCH AMOUNTS APPEAR REASONABLE IN ELEVATIONS ABOVE 
2500 FT...WILL LESS THAN 1 INCH BELOW THAT LEVEL FOR SW VA AND NE 
TN. WILL MAINTAIN THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY AS IS. 

MORNING CLOUDS WILL GIVE WAY TO SUNSHINE TOMORROW AFTERNOON...BUT 
HIGH TEMPS WILL ONLY REACH INTO THE 40S IN MOST SPOTS...WITH 30S 
NORTH AND IN THE MOUNTAINS. WENT A BIT BELOW MOS TEMPS AS THIS IS AN 
ANOMALOUSLY COLD AIR MASS FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
A QUIET START TO THE LONG TERM WITH A POTENTIALLY WET WEEKEND
FOLLOWED BY A RETURN OF QUIET WEATHER THROUGH THE REST OF THE
PERIOD.

HIGH PRESSURE IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE BUILDING OVER OUR AREA 
THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH MOST OF THE DAY ON FRIDAY. CLEAR SKIES ON 
THURSDAY NIGHT WILL GIVE WAY TO INCREASING CLOUDS THROUGH THE DAY ON 
FRIDAY AS AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH BEGINS TO SWING ACROSS THE OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY. THURSDAY NIGHT WILL ONCE AGAIN BE COLD WITH LOWS IN 
THE UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S. FRIDAY TEMPS REBOUND BACK INTO MID/UPPER 
50S AND LOW 60S. THE LOW PRESSURE CENTER ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER 
LEVEL TROUGH IS NORTH OF THE GREAT LAKES SO WHATEVER TRAILING ENERGY 
SWEEPS ACROSS OUR AREA ON FRIDAY NIGHT/SATURDAY MORNING WILL BE VERY 
WEAK AND SHOULD KEEP US MOSTLY DRY BUT WILL DROP TEMPS A FEW DEGREES 
AS THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH. BY SATURDAY MORNING MODELS ARE SHOWING A 
WEAK WAVE OVER THE TEXAS PANHANDLE AND ANOTHER STRONGER WAVE MOVING 
INTO THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST. THE WEAKER WAVE WILL MOVE EAST AND GIVE 
US A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SOME LIGHT PRECIP THROUGH THE DAY ON 
SATURDAY. THIS IS WHERE PATTERN BECOMES A LITTLE MESSY. 

SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY...THE AFOREMENTIONED WAVE ACROSS THE 
PACIFIC NORTHWEST DROPS DOWN INTO TEXAS ALONG WITH THE DEVELOPING 
TROUGH...BUT STRONG RIDGING OFF THE BAJA PENINSULA FORCES THAT WAVE 
DOWN INTO MEXICO INSTEAD OF ON A CONTINUED EASTWARD TRACK ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN U.S. THE MODELS WANT TO SHOW THE APPROACHING TROUGH 
CATCHING UP TO THE FIRST WEAKER WAVE...NOW LOCATED AROUND THE 
MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY...AND PHASE THESE TWO FEATURES 
TOGETHER...RESULTING IN A STRENGTHENING SYSTEM. WHEN/WHERE/IF THEY 
PHASE WILL GREATLY IMPACT OUR WEATHER DURING THE SATURDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH MONDAY PERIOD. BOTH THE ECMWF AND GFS SHOW COLDER AIR 
GETTING PULLED INTO OUR AREA ON SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY ON THE BACK 
SIDE OF THE DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM...WHICH MEANS THAT IF 
THERE IS ENOUGH MOISTURE STILL AROUND WE COULD SEE SOME SNOW SUNDAY 
NIGHT INTO MONDAY. STILL WAY TOO EARLY FOR ANY TYPE OF SNOW AMOUNTS 
DUE TO THE UNCERTAINTY WITH THIS SYSTEM. BOTH MODELS SHOW THE TROUGH 
EXITING TO OUR EAST ON MONDAY WITH CLEARING CONDITIONS THEREAFTER. 

HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS BACK IN FOR TUESDAY WITH ANOTHER SYSTEM 
POSSIBLE ON WEDNESDAY.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              23  40  26  58 /  50  10   0   0

     MOUNTAINS-COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS-JOHNSON-SEVIER SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS-SOUTHEAST CARTER-SOUTHEAST GREENE-SOUTHEAST 
     MONROE-UNICOI.

     WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 11 PM EDT /10 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING FOR 
     ANDERSON-BLEDSOE-BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS-BRADLEY-CAMPBELL-
     CLAIBORNE-COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS-EAST POLK-GRAINGER-HAMBLEN-
     HAMILTON-HANCOCK-HAWKINS-JEFFERSON-JOHNSON-KNOX-LOUDON-
     MARION-MCMINN-MEIGS-MORGAN-NW BLOUNT-NORTH SEVIER-NORTHWEST 
     CARTER-NORTHWEST COCKE-NORTHWEST GREENE-NORTHWEST MONROE-
     RHEA-ROANE-SCOTT TN-SEQUATCHIE-SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS-
     SOUTHEAST CARTER-SOUTHEAST GREENE-SOUTHEAST MONROE-SULLIVAN-
     UNICOI-UNION-WASHINGTON TN-WEST POLK.

324 
FXUS64 KMRX 121357 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
957 AM EDT WED MAR 12 2014

.DISCUSSION...
A BAND OF SHOWERS MARKS THE POSITION OF THE COLD FRONT...WHICH HAS
MOVED TO THE EAST OF OHX. TIMING OF THE FRONT BRINGS IT THROUGH
OUR AREA BETWEEN 15Z AND 19Z. BEHIND THE FRONT...NO PRECIP APPEARS
ON RADAR...AND THIS TIMING LINES UP WELL WITH THE RUC AND NAM
DEPICTIONS OF DRYING ALOFT. AS A RESULT...WILL SPEED UP THE
DECREASE IN POPS THIS AFTERNOON. SOME LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND
UPSLOPE NW FLOW WILL KEEP SOME CHANCE POPS GOING IN THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS. 

ALTHOUGH CURRENTLY THE WINDS ACROSS THE AREA ARE BELOW ADVISORY
CRITERIA...BETWEEN 10 AND 20 MPH WITH GUSTS TO 25 MPH...OBS BEHIND
THE FRONT SHOW STRONGER WINDS WILL ARRIVE THIS AFTERNOON. THE WIND
ADVISORY WILL BE LEFT UNCHANGED.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             67  28  49  32 /  80  10   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  68  25  43  32 /  90  60   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       66  25  43  32 /  80  40   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              65  21  38  26 /  90  60  20   0 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR CHEROKEE-CLAY.

TN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 AM EDT 
     THURSDAY FOR BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS-COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS-
     JOHNSON-SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS-SOUTHEAST CARTER-SOUTHEAST 
     GREENE-SOUTHEAST MONROE-UNICOI.

     WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 11 PM EDT /10 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING FOR 
     ANDERSON-BLEDSOE-BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS-BRADLEY-CAMPBELL-
     CLAIBORNE-COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS-EAST POLK-GRAINGER-HAMBLEN-
     HAMILTON-HANCOCK-HAWKINS-JEFFERSON-JOHNSON-KNOX-LOUDON-
     MARION-MCMINN-MEIGS-MORGAN-NW BLOUNT-NORTH SEVIER-NORTHWEST 
     CARTER-NORTHWEST COCKE-NORTHWEST GREENE-NORTHWEST MONROE-
     RHEA-ROANE-SCOTT TN-SEQUATCHIE-SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS-
     SOUTHEAST CARTER-SOUTHEAST GREENE-SOUTHEAST MONROE-SULLIVAN-

607 
FXUS64 KMRX 120824
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
424 AM EDT WED MAR 12 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A VERY DYNAMIC SYSTEM IS
CONTINUING TO DEVELOP OVER THE WESTERN OHIO VALLEY WITH PRESSURE
FALLS OVER THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS. THE STRONG CYCLO-GENESIS
WILL MOVE EAST ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY WITH A STRONG COLD FRONT
SWEEPING THROUGH THE AREA BY EARLY AFTERNOON. UPPER FORCING FROM A
STRONG 110KT+ JET OVER MISSOURI/ARKANSAS WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION
THIS MORNING. WATER VAPOR LOOPS SHOWS INCREASING DIFLUENCE ALOFT
OVER THE MID-MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY MOVING INTO THE
OHIO/TENNESSEE VALLEYS. THIS LIFT ALONG WITH STRONG FRONTO-GENETIC
FORCING ALONG THE BOUNDARY WILL PRODUCE WIDESPREAD SHOWERS OVER THE
AREA THIS MORNING/EARLY AFTERNOON.

MODELS SHOW ENOUGH INSTABILITY AHEAD OF FROPA WITH CAPE VALUES OF
250-500 J/KG...SO HAVE ALSO KEPT ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS OVER THE
REGION AS WELL. DECENT COLD AIR ADVECTION ALOFT...SO WOULD NOT BE
SUPRISED TO SEE ISOLATED SMALL HAIL AS WELL...ESPECIALLY OVER
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST TENNESSEE LATE THIS MORNING/EARLY
AFTERNOON.

STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION AFTER FROPA...SO HIGHS TODAY WILL BE BY
EARLY AFTERNOON...THEN DROPPING AREA-WIDE THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY.

THE TIGHT PRESSURE AND THERMAL GRADIENT WITH THIS SYSTEM WILL
PRODUCE WINDY CONDITIONS BY THIS AFTERNOON AND CONTINUE INTO THE
EVENING. FOR LATE TODAY AND TONIGHT...STRONG NORTHWEST FLOW WILL
PRODUCE OROGRAPHIC LIFT INTO THE NORTHWEST FACING SLOPES. CROSS-
SECTION SHOW PLENTY OF MOISTURE...LIFT AND FAVORABLE DENDRITIC SNOW
GROWTH FOR SNOW ACCUMULATIONS OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. HAVE
ISSUED A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR THE FAVORED NORTHWEST FLOW SNOWFALL
REGIONS.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT THEN DIVERGE BY SUNDAY WITH THE 
HANDLING OF A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE DEEP SOUTH. 
HIGH PRESSURE IS EXPECTED TO BUILD OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON 
THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT...BRINGING A SHOT OF UNSEASONABLY COLD 
AIR INTO THE REGION. THIS HIGH WILL THEN QUICKLY MOVE EAST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY...WITH SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS ON ITS BACK SIDE 
CREATING A RAPID WARMING TREND. A COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE 
SOUTHWARD INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON SATURDAY...WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL 
SHORT WAVE HELPING TO GENERATE SCATTERED SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. THIS COLD FRONT WILL BE SLOW TO MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST 
AREA...SINCE THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW IS PROGGED TO BE ZONAL THROUGH 
SATURDAY NIGHT. BOTH THE ECMWF AND GFS MODELS THEN INDICATE AN UPPER-
LEVEL TROUGH DEVELOPING OVER THE PLAINS ON SUNDAY...BUT THE GFS 
MODEL CREATES A CUT-OFF UPPER LOW OVER TEXAS WHICH THEN SINKS 
SOUTHWARD INTO NORTHERN MEXICO. THE ECMWF MODEL REVEALS A MORE 
AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH ON SUNDAY...WHICH MOVES EASTWARD ACROSS 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY AND DEVELOPS A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER 
THE DEEP SOUTH ON SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT. WILL PLAN TO FOLLOW THE 
ECMWF MODEL SOLUTION SINCE IT IS MORE CONSISTENT WITH PREVIOUS MODEL 
RUNS (OF BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS)...AND IT ALSO APPEARS TO BE 
MORE REALISTIC WITH CLIMATOLOGY. AS A RESULT...WILL KEEP A CHANCE OF 
PRECIP IN THE FORECAST THROUGH MONDAY EVENING. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT 
WILL THEN TREND CLOSER TO THE ENSEMBLE MEANS THEREAFTER.

&&

101 
FXUS64 KMRX 111909
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
ISSUED BY NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE NASHVILLE TN
309 PM EDT TUE MAR 11 2014

.DISCUSSION...
OUTSTANDING DAY TODAY WITH FULL SUNSHINE AND LIGHT SW BREEZES. THIS
COMBO HAS HELPED TEMPS INCREASE 5 TO 10 DEGREES OVER YESTERDAY/S
TEMPS...WITH AT LEAST MID 60S AREA WIDE THIS AFTERNOON PLUS SOME
70S IN SOUTHERN SECTIONS.

UNFORTUNATELY...BIG CHANGES ARE ON THE WAY WITH PRECIP...STRONG
WINDS AND MUCH COLDER AIR ALL SET TO ARRIVE WITHIN 24 HOURS. THE H5
LOW OVER THE TX/LA COAST THIS AFTERNOON WILL MOVE EAST TONIGHT.
ALTHOUGH IT WILL PASS TO OUR SOUTH...IT WILL PULL PLENTY OF
MOISTURE NORTHWARD INTO OUR REGION TONIGHT AND PROVIDE SOME WEAK
LIFT. WILL RAMP UP THE POPS TONIGHT WITH INCREASING CHANCES OF A
RELATIVELY LOW QPF EVENT. ALSO...ISOLATED ELEVATED CONVECTION
POSSIBLE.

A BIGGER ISSUE IS THE IMPACT FROM THE APPROACHING TROUGH THAT IS
PRESENTLY OVER THE CENTRAL HIGH PLAINS. IT SHOULD STRENGTHEN AS IT
MOVES INTO THE EASTERN U.S. LATER TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY. THIS
SYSTEM WILL SEND A COLD FRONT...WHICH AT 19Z WAS MOVING THROUGH OK
AND KS...RACING THROUGH OUR REGION WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. WINDS WILL
PICK UP A BIT TONIGHT AS GRADIENTS INCREASE...THEN INCREASE
SHARPLY ALL DAY WEDNESDAY AS THE FRONT APPROACHES AND MOVES
THROUGH. WILL ISSUE WIND ADVISORY FOR THE ENTIRE REGION 12Z WEDNESDAY
THROUGH 00Z THURSDAY. LATER SHIFTS MAY NEED TO EXPAND ADVISORY A
FEW HOURS PAST 00Z.

MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THE STRONGER TROUGH IS MARGINAL BUT ENOUGH
SHOULD EXIST FOR PRECIP TO CONTINUE FROM LATE WEDNESDAY INTO EARLY
THURSDAY MORNING...ESPECIALLY IN FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS. RAIN WILL
CHANGE TO SNOW WITH SOME LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED IN THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS AND FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS.

NW FLOW ALOFT WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE REGION THURSDAY AS THE LARGE
TROUGH SLOWLY MOVES OFF THE EAST COAST. WEAK H5 RIDGE DEVELOPS
EARLY FRIDAY BUT A NEW H5 TROUGH SHOULD APPROACH FROM THE WEST
FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. WILL GO WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS STARTING
FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH CHANCE POPS SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY. AFTER A
COLD DAY ON THURSDAY...TEMPS WILL MODERATE FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY
BEFORE COOLING OFF AGAIN EARLY NEXT WEEK WITH THE ARRIVAL OF
ANOTHER COLD FRONT.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

ISSUED BY NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE NASHVILLE TN
1104 AM EDT TUE MAR 11 2014

.DISCUSSION...
A SPRING LIKE DAY CONTINUES TO UNFOLD TODAY. FAIRLY ZONAL H5 FLOW
EXISTS ACROSS THE REGION BETWEEN COMPACT/WEAK H5 LOW OVER THE GULF
COAST AND ANOTHER ONE OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS. AT SFC...HIGH
PRESSURE HAS MOVED EASTWARD...ALLOWING LIGHT SW WINDS TO COMBINE
WITH SUNNY SKIES TO MAKE TEMPS ABOUT 5 TO 10 DEGREES HIGHER THAN
THEY WERE 24 HOURS AGO. CURRENT FORECAST MAX TEMPS ARE ROUGHLY 5
DEGREES HIGHER THAN YESTERDAY/S MAX TEMPS...SO NO CHANGES NEEDED
FOR TODAY.

CHANGES ARE STILL ON THE WAY TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. THE ADVANCING
H5 LOW OVER THE GULF COAST WILL INCREASE MOISTURE ACROSS OUR REGION
AND COMBINE WITH THE DIGGING NORTHERN PLAINS LOW TO INCREASE PRECIP
CHANCES LATE TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY. THE SAME PATTERN WILL SEND
A VERY STRONG COLD FRONT THROUGH THE REGION WEDNESDAY
AFTERNOON/NIGHT WITH STRONG WINDS AND MUCH COLDER AIR STILL
EXPECTED.

822 
FXUS64 KMRX 110909
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
ISSUED BY NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE PEACHTREE CITY GA
509 AM EDT TUE MAR 11 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...
PRIMARY FOCUS IS ON STRONG SURFACE CYCLOGENESIS TAKING PLACE OVER
THE OH VALLEY WEDNESDAY WHICH RESULT IN SIGNIFICANT WIND IMPACTS AS
WELL AS CHC FOR CONVECTION AND SNOW SHOWERS. TWO SHORT WAVES
EXPECTED TO PHASE ACROSS OH VALLEY WEDNESDAY...ONE CURRENTLY OVER
ERN TX...THE OTHER OVER COLORADO. BY 12Z WED..TX WAVE FCST TO
DAMPEN OVER GA/FL WHILE COLORADO WAVE AMPLIFIES WITH IMPRESSIVE
SURFACE CYCLOGENESIS TAKING PLACE OVER OH/KY...MOST MODELS PROGGING
SFC LOW OF APPROX 990MB WITH PRESSURE FALLS AROUND 6MB/6HRS OVER A
24 HOUR PERIOD AS IT TRACKS EAST. FORTUNATELY ARCTIC HIGH BEHIND
THIS SYSTEM NOT AS STRONG AS SOME OTHERS THIS WINTER...BUT
CERTAINLY STRONG ENOUGH TO PRODUCE SIGNIFICANT PRESSURE GRADIENT
BEHIND SFC LOW AND FRONT. WHILE WE EXPECT SNOW SHOWERS ESPECIALLY
IN FAVORABLE WEST TO NORTHWEST FLOW PATTERN LIKE THIS...MOST
SIGNIFICANT IMPACT MAY BE STRONG WINDS WHICH COULD GUST OVER 50 MPH
WED AFTERNOON AND OVERNIGHT. STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL SERVE
TO MIX DOWN STRONG WINDS ALOFT EVEN OVERNIGHT. AHEAD OF
FRONT...COULD SEE A FEW ISOLATED STORMS BUT INSTABILITY EXPECTED TO
REMAIN MEAGER WITH MOST UNSTABLE CAPE VALUES LESS THAN 150 J/KG.
HAVE LIMITED TSTM PROBABILITIES TO SLT CHC WITH CATEGORICAL POPS
FOR SHOWERS. BASED ON PATTERN AND INPUT FROM MRX FORECASTERS...HAVE
PENCILED IN 1-3 INCHES IN FAVORABLE UPSLOPE AREAS FOR WEST TO
NORTHWEST FLOW. SPS WAS SENT WITH MORE DETAILS ON WINDS AND TIMING
OF FRONT AND PRECIP. USED BLEND OF GRIDDED GFS MOS...NAM12 AND
PERSISTENCE FOR MOST ELEMENTS.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
FAIRLY TRANQUIL PATTERN AFTER SYSTEM LIFTS OUT AND UPSLOPE PRECIP
ENDS BY THURSDAY. NEXT CHC FOR PRECIP NOT UNTIL SATURDAY AND
REINFORCEMENT OF ARCTIC AIR SUN/MON...MORE SO SEEN IN 00Z GFS
OUTPUT. LARGE DISCREPANCY BETWEEN 00Z GFS AND ECMWF. HAVE SIDED
WITH WPC GUIDANCE FOR THE MOST PART.

SNELSON
