296 
FXUS64 KMRX 102132
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
ISSUED BY NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE NASHVILLE TN
530 PM EDT MON MAR 10 2014

.DISCUSSION...

MANY APOLOGIES FOR THE DELAY IN GETTING PRODUCTS OUT THIS 
AFTERNOON...BUT UNFORTUNATELY NUMEROUS GFE AND AWIPS ISSUES 
RESULTED IN A LOSS OF ALL DATA WHICH REQUIRED A COMPLETE REDO OF 
THE AFTERNOON FORECAST PACKAGE FROM SCRATCH. IN ANY 
EVENT...BEAUTIFUL DAY ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE AND ADJACENT SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND 
TEMPERATURES IN THE 60S TO LOWER 70S. AN EVEN WARMER DAY IS ON TAP 
FOR TUESDAY WITH MUCH OF THE CWA REACHING THE 70S...WITH UPPER 70S 
POSSIBLE AROUND CHA. 

12Z GFS/ECMWF IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON AN INTENSE SURFACE LOW DEVELOPING 
ALONG THE LOWER OHIO RIVER THEN MOVING QUICKLY ENE ACROSS KY TUESDAY 
NIGHT WHILE DEEPENING TO SUB-990MB. AHEAD OF THE LOW...STRONG 
MOISTURE AND WARM AIR ADVECTION WILL BRING SHOWERS INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA MAINLY AFTER MIDNIGHT TUESDAY NIGHT...WITH MOST WIDESPREAD 
ACTIVITY WEDNESDAY MORNING. FORECAST SOUNDINGS INDICATE WEAK 
INSTABILITY WITH K INDEX VALUES IN THE 30S SO WILL CONTINUE MENTION 
OF A FEW THUNDERSTORMS AS WELL. INTENSE COLD FRONT WILL SWEEP 
THROUGH THE CWA LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING INTO THE AFTERNOON WITH TEMPS 
RAPIDLY DROPPING THROUGH THE DAY. MAJORITY OF PRECIP WILL MOVE OUT 
BY AFTERNOON...BUT OROGRAPHIC UPLIFT EXPECTED TO BRING LIGHT SNOW TO 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND EAST TENNESSEE 
WEDNESDAY EVENING BEFORE TAPERING OFF WEDNESDAY NIGHT. ADDED LIGHT 
SNOW ACCUMS AROUND A HALF AN INCH ABOVE 3000 FEET FOR THIS 
TIMEFRAME...ALTHOUGH AN INCH IS POSSIBLE IN THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS. 
VERY SHARP PRESSURE GRADIENT IN WAKE OF FRONT ALSO EXPECTED TO BRING 
QUITE BREEZY CONDITIONS TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WITH GFS INDICATING 
GUSTS TO 50 MPH...AND A WIND ADVISORY MAY BE NECESSARY FOR THE HIGH 
ELEVATIONS. 

DRY BUT COLDER WEATHER EXPECTED ON THURSDAY WITH LOWS WELL BELOW 
FREEZING IN THE TEENS AND 20S AND HIGHS ONLY IN THE 30S/40S FOR MOST 
AREAS. WARMING TREND EXPECTED OVER THE WEEKEND AS SURFACE HIGH 
SHIFTS EASTWARD AND RETURN FLOW OFF THE GULF OF MEXICO BEGINS. 
GFS/ECMWF DIFFER GREATLY IN PRECIP CHANCES AND TEMPS OVER THE 
WEEKEND WITH ACTIVE WEST TO NW JET STREAM ALOFT...SO WILL MAINTAIN 
LOW POPS FOR NOW WITH TEMPS NEAR MEX GUIDANCE NUMBERS.

&&

ADJUSTMENTS TO SKY COVER NO CHANGES WERE MADE TO REST OF FORECAST
ATTM...WITH A WARM LATE WINTER DAY ANTICIPATED WITH HIGHS IN THE
UPPER 50S MOUNTAINS AND 60S TO AROUND 70 ELSEWHERE.

057 
FXUS64 KMRX 100703
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 AM EDT MON MAR 10 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE CAROLINAS...WITH 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. THIS HIGH PRESSURE 
AREA WILL LINGER OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY TODAY AND TONIGHT...WITH 
DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS EXPECTED OVER THE FORECAST AREA...ALONG 
WITH UNSEASONABLY WARM TEMPS DUE TO SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS DEVELOPING 
BY THIS AFTERNOON. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE 
IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL TREND CLOSER 
TO THE SLIGHTLY WARMER GFS NUMBERS DUE TO THE SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES WILL 
CONTINUE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION 
ON TUESDAY AS A BRISK SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW AND MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS 
WILL HELP TO PROMOTE A WARM-UP INTO LOWER 70S IN MOST SPOTS. 
HOWEVER...A QUICK CHANGE IN THE PATTERN IS EXPECTED AS AN UPPER- 
TROUGH SWINGS FROM THE OHIO VALLEY INTO THE REGION TUESDAY NIGHT 
INTO WEDNESDAY...BRINGING A SOME WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND SOME 
SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS TO THE AREA. THE BEST WINDOW FOR MEANINGFUL 
PRECIPITATION APPEARS TO BE FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY...SO HAVE INCREASED POPS TO HIGH-END LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL 
DURING THIS TIME PERIOD. 

AS THE FRONT PASSES THROUGH...WINDS WILL QUICKLY SHIFT TO THE 
NORTHWEST AND INCREASE /BECOMING GUSTY AT TIMES/ DURING THE LATE 
AFTERNOON...EVENING AND OVERNIGHT HOURS. THIS WILL ENHANCE COLD AIR 
ADVECTION AS TEMPERATURES WILL DROP WELL INTO THE 20S OVERNIGHT 
GIVEN THE MUCH COLDER AIR THAT WILL BE FILTERING INTO THE REGION 
BEHIND THE FRONT. AS A RESULT...A CHANGE OVER TO SOME LIGHT SNOW IS 
EXPECTED IN MANY AREAS ALONG THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY AND 
MOUNTAINS WEDNESDAY EVENING/NIGHT AS SOME NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW 
SHOWERS MAY LINGER THROUGH THE NIGHT. SOME MINOR ACCUMULATIONS OF 
HALF AN INCH TO LOCALLY ONE INCH IN SOME LOCATIONS MAY BE POSSIBLE 
THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING...PARTICULARLY ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. A MUCH COLDER DAY IN THE 
40S ON THURSDAY WILL QUICKLY GIVE WAY TO SOME SEASONABLE CONDITIONS 
IN THE LOWER 60S FOR FRIDAY INTO THE WEEKEND. AN APPROACHING STORM 
SYSTEM THIS WEEKEND WILL ALSO GIVE THE REGION ANOTHER DECENT SHOT OF 
PRECIPITATION THIS WEEKEND...THOUGH MODELS DIFFER ON THE TRACK AND 
TIMING OF THE UPPER-LOW ATTM.
&&

697 
FXUS64 KMRX 091920
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EDT SUN MAR 9 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...CLOUDS FINALLY CLEARED
OUT BEHIND THE WEAK COLD FRONT WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES EXPECTED
OVERNIGHT. SURFACE RIDGE SETTLES ACROSS THE REGION PROVIDING LIGHT
WINDS SO I WENT CLOSER TO THE COOLER GFS MINS.

FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE SHORT TERM...CONTINUED DRY WEATHER WITH
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS. UPPER RIDGE FOR MONDAY WILL FLATTEN TO A ZONAL
FLOW ALOFT BY TUESDAY. SURFACE RIDGE DOMINATES AND THE SW SURFACE
GRADIENT SHOULD TIGHTEN A BIT BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON AS A COLD FRONT
APPROACHES TUESDAY NIGHT. THE DRY AIRMASS AND W-SW LOW LEVEL FLOW
FAVORED NUDGING MAX TEMPS UP IN LINE WITH THE WARMER GFS MAXES.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...SHOWERS AND EVEN THE 
POSSIBILITY OF THUNDER IS IN THE WORKS FOR THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY AS A STRONG STORM SYSTEM BUILDS EAST 
FROM THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TO THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC COAST FROM 
TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH EARLY WEDNESDAY NIGHT. A HEALTHY AMOUNT OF 
LIFT AND INSTABILITY WOULD LEAD TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF CONVECTION 
AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT ON WEDNESDAY. STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION 
BEHIND THE DEPARTING LOW WITH MORE ENERGY DIVING THROUGH THE BACK 
SIDE OF THE DEEP UPPER TROUGH SHOULD ALLOW FOR A CONTINUATION OF 
RAIN SHOWERS AND EVEN SOME SNOW SHOWERS MAINLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AS NORTHWEST FLOW 
CRANKS UP IN THE TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT BETWEEN THE ATLANTIC LOW 
AND APPROACHING MID CONTINENT RIDGE. THE GOOD NEWS IS DRIER WEATHER 
AND A MODEST WARMING TREND FILL IN BEHIND THE WET MID WEEK SYSTEM 
KEEPING IMPROVED WEATHER IN PLACE THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. MODELS 
NOT ALL ON THE SAME PAGE WITH A LATE WEEKEND SYSTEM SO CONFIDENCE 
LOW AT THIS POINT BUT ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS IN FOR 
SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY.

STILL BE POSSIBLE...WITH SOME MINOR ACCUMULATIONS OF HALF AN INCH TO 
LOCALLY ONE INCH IN SOME LOCATIONS THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING. AFTER A 
MUCH COLDER DAY ON THURSDAY...A GRADUAL WARMING TREND WILL THEN

UPPER 50S AND LOWER 60S.

.DISCUSSION...

MOVE THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING WITH LIGHT SHOWERS POSSIBLE MAINLY
NORTH OF I-40. BEHIND THAT...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE
REGION WITH CLEARING SKIES AND A GRADUAL WARMING TREND.

367 
FXUS64 KMRX 082003
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
303 PM EST SAT MAR 8 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...NOT MUCH TO COMPLAIN ABOUT
WEATHER WISE FOR THESE PERIODS AS ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS CONTINUE. THE
WEAK COLD FRONT APPROACHING LATE TONIGHT LACKS MOISTURE AND FORCING
WITH BOTH OPERATIONAL SHORT TERM MODELS TRENDING EVEN DRIER ON THE
12Z RUN. TRIMMED POPS BACK TO VERY MINIMAL CHANCES...REMOVED FROM
SRN AREAS TONIGHT...AND REALLY LIMITED POPS TO MAINLY NE AREAS ON
SUNDAY MORNING. TEMPS SHOULD BE CLOSE TO GFS MOS VALUES TONIGHT
WITH CLOUDS INCREASING...THEN REBOUND TO SIMILAR MOS MAXES FOR
SUNDAY AFTERNOON.

OTHERWISE...DRY WEATHER FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY WITH UPPER
RIDGING OR ZONAL FLOW ALOFT. WEST TO SOUTHWEST LOW LEVEL FLOW WILL
KEEP TEMPS ON THE MILD TO WARM SIDE...WITH COOLEST NIGHT BEING
SUNDAY NIGHT AS SURFACE RIDGE SETTLES OVER THE REGION. GENERALLY
HARD TO BEAT THE GFS MOS TEMPS FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS IN EVEN BETTER 
AGREEMENT WITH THE EXTENDED PERIOD. STILL LOOKS LIKE A RELATIVELY 
DECENT TUESDAY WITH MILD TEMPERATURES AND PRECIP ARRIVING MAINLY 
TUESDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF THE TWO WAVES MAKING PROGRESS INTO OR THROUGH 
THE EASTERN U.S. THE FIRST WAVE RIPS EAST ALONG THE GULF COAST AND 
THERE SHOULD BE SOME MOISTENING AHEAD OF THIS FEATURE DURING THE DAY 
TUESDAY BUT THE MAIN SYSTEM IS A NORTHERN STREAM WHICH AMPLIFIES 
INTO THE EASTERN STATES ON WEDNESDAY. SURFACE LOW PRESSURE 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE NORTHERN TROUGH DEEPENS WHILE SHIFTING EAST 
NORTHEAST ALONG THE OHIO VALLEY LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY. DEEP MOISTURE WILL BE LIFTED INTO A BROAD AREA OF LIGHT 
TO MODERATE SHOWERS INTO MID DAY WEDNESDAY AND EDGED LIKELY POPS A 
LITTLE HIGHER FOR THE BIG MID WEEK EVENT. ONCE AGAIN WITH THE 
SHARPENING EASTERN U.S. TROUGH...MUCH COLDER AIR WILL BE SPILLING 
INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN BEHIND THE FRONT AND TRAILING SHORT 
WAVE ENERGY AND RELATIVELY DEEP MOISTURE SHOULD CONTRIBUTE TO AN 
EXTENDED PERIOD OF POST FRONTAL SHOWERS WHICH WILL MIX WITH AND 
CHANGE TO SOME SNOW SHOWERS LATER WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY 
MORNING BEFORE ENDING. THE REMAINING TWO DAYS OF THE FORECAST SHOULD 
STAY ON THE DRY SIDE. COLD HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN BEHIND THE SYSTEM 
FOR THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY KEEPING TEMPERATURES SEVERAL DEGREES 
BELOW NORMAL. MODIFICATION GETS UNDERWAY OVER THE WEEKEND WITH HIGHS 
BACK CLOSE TO NORMAL WITH SUNSHINE EXPECTED ON SATURDAY. 


&&

524 
FXUS64 KMRX 080802
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EST SAT MAR 8 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED ALONG THE NORTHERN GULF COAST...WITH A WEAK 
COLD FRONT OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED 
TO SLOWLY MOVE TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...WITH CLOUDS AND 
SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS INCREASING AHEAD OF IT. THESE SOUTHWESTERLY 
WINDS WILL HELP TO PRODUCE AN UNSEASONABLY WARM DAY...WITH HIGHS IN 
THE 60S OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. THE COLD FRONT SHOULD THEN 
MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...WITH THE MODELS IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THAT A FEW POST-FRONTAL SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE AFTER 
MIDNIGHT. HOWEVER...MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED BEHIND THIS FRONT...SO 
WILL MENTION ONLY CHANCE POPS...ESPECIALLY OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF 
THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE 
IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE 
SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...ANOTHER FAST MOVING UPPER- 
TROUGH WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION ON SUNDAY...BRINGING SOME LIGHT 
SHOWER ACTIVITY AND CLOUD COVER TO THE AREA WITH THE PASSAGE OF A 
WEAK FRONT. THIS FRONT WILL ACT TO LOWER TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY...BUT 
SOME CLEARING BY THE AFTERNOON WILL STILL ALLOW THE MERCURY TO CLIMB 
INTO THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S. SOME SURFACE RIDGING WILL SET-UP 
EARLY NEXT WEEK FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY AS A BRISK SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW 
AND MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS WILL HELP TO PROMOTE A WARM-UP INTO THE 
70S IN MOST SPOTS BY TUESDAY. THEREAFTER...ANOTHER BROAD 
UPPER-TROUGH WILL SWING A COLD FRONT OUT OF THE OHIO VALLEY AND 
BRING A GOOD OPPORTUNITY FOR SOME WIDESPREAD SHOWER ACTIVITY 
WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. GIVEN THE INCREASED CONFIDENCE...HAVE 
INCREASED POPS TO LIKELY. ALSO HAVE SOME CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY AS 
WRAP AROUND MOISTURE ON THE BACK-SIDE OF THE SYSTEM COULD GIVE THE 
AREA ANOTHER SHOT OF LIGHT PRECIPITATION. GIVEN THE COLD AIR BEHIND 
THIS SYSTEM...SOME LIGHT SNOW COULD MIX IN WITH THE RAIN ACROSS THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS EARLY THURSDAY MORNING. WITH A COLDER AIR MASS IN 
PLACE...HIGHS WILL STRUGGLE TO CLIMB OUT OF THE UPPER 40S AND LOWER 
50S FOR THURSDAY...WITH A WARMING TREND THE OCCURRING FOR FRIDAY 
INTO THE WEEKEND AS CLEARING OCCURS AND WINDS VEER BACK TO THE 
SOUTHWEST.
&&

434 
FXUS64 KMRX 071953
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 PM EST FRI MAR 7 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...SOME CLOUDS HANGING IN THE
TERRAIN ALONG THE TN-NC LINE AND ALSO A FEW CUMULUS CLOUDS
DEVELOPING OVER NRN PLATEAU AND SW VA COUNTIES. THINK SKIES WILL
BECOME GENERALLY CLEAR THIS EVENING WITH LIGHT AND VARIABLE WINDS.
THE BOUNDARY LAYER SHOULD BE DRY OVERNIGHT...AS RAINFALL ACROSS THE
VALLEY COUNTIES WAS NOT MUCH MORE THAN A TRACE TO 0.05 INCH...SO NO
FOG. FAVORED THE SLIGHTLY COOLER MINS WHERE MINOR DIFFS WERE NOTED
IN MOS.

REALLY AN EXCELLENT SATURDAY SHAPING UP WITH LOTS OF SUNSHINE
COUPLED WITH SW-W SURFACE WINDS. SHOULD SEE MAX TEMPS GET WELL INTO
THE 60S (MAYBE LOW 70S) LOWER ELEVATIONS...AND 50S IN THE MTNS. 

THE OUTLIER NAM MODEL (PREVIOUS RUNS) HAS COME MORE IN LINE WITH
OTHER MODELS ON THE STRENGTH OF A MINOR SHORTWAVE AND WEAK COLD
FRONT LATE SATURDAY NIGHT. PREVIOUS GRIDS LOOKED VERY REASONABLE
WITH NO MORE THAN 20 TO 30 PERCENT POPS. I DID OPT TO DROP THE POPS
IN NEARLY ALL AREAS BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON. SIMILAR MOS MINS/MAXES
FOLLOWED AS THE NICE WEATHER CONTINUES!


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE ATMOSPHERE IS PROGGED 
TO BE RELATIVELY QUIET FOR THE ABOUT THE FIRST TWO AND A HALF DAYS 
OF THE FORECAST WITH SOME SUNSHINE AND WE SHOULD BE ABLE TO ENJOY 
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES FOR A CHANGE...ESPECIALLY MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY AS THE UPPER FLOW TURNS TO THE SOUTHWEST AHEAD OF THE NEXT 
MAJOR STORM SYSTEM. THE MODELS INDICATE INCREASING MOISTURE AHEAD OF 
THE SPLIT STREAM SYSTEMS WITH A WAVE BUILDING EAST ALONG THE GULF 
COAST LATER TUESDAY INTO TUESDAY NIGHT WITH TRAILING SHORT WAVE 
ENERGY DRIVING INTO THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION ON 
WEDNESDAY. WAS ABLE TO EXTEND HIGHER CONFIDENCE ON THIS PERIOD OF 
THE FORECAST WITH MODELS STAYING CLOSE TO PREVIOUS FORECAST 
SCENARIO. THEREFORE...RAISED POPS FOR SHOWERS TO LIKELY FROM LATE 
NIGHT TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING. DEFINITELY HAVE TO HANG ONTO 
MEDIUM TO HIGH CHANCE POPS FOR MORE SHOWERS LATER IN THE DAY 
WEDNESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS DEEP MOISTURE IS LIFTED IN THE 
PRESENCE OF THE HEALTHY TRAILING UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM. CHILLY 
NORTHWEST FLOW WITHIN THIS FEATURE CONTINUES INTO THURSDAY AND THIS 
WOULD TEND TO ALLOW FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF MORE SNOW SHOWERS IN THE 
NEVER ENDING WINTER SEASON.    

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 071500
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 AM EST FRI MAR 7 2014

.DISCUSSION...BACK SIDE OF PRECIPITATION REMAINS VERY LIGHT THIS 
MORNING AND GENERALLY CONFINED TO THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. RADAR ECHOES PASSING SOUTH ACROSS THE MORRISTOWN AREA ARE 
BARELY REACHING THE SURFACE...WHILE TRI CONTINUES TO REPORT LIGHT 
RAIN WITH NO VISBY REDUCTION AT ALL. SURFACE TEMPS ARE ALREADY IN 
THE MID 30S TO NEAR 40 DEGREES OVER SW VA AND NE TN...WITH 12Z UPPER 
AIR PLOTS SHOWING 850 MB TEMPS RUNNING 1 TO 2 DEGREES CELSIUS ACROSS 
THAT AREA. THUS...ONLY SOME LINGERING VERY LIGHT RAIN TO DEAL WITH 
FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE MORNING.

DEEP SURFACE LOW PRESSURE CENTER NOW OFF THE NC COAST WITH THE LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVING NE AWAY FROM THE REGION. LATEST RUC MODEL 
INDICATES RAIN ENDING ACROSS THE TN VALLEY SHORTLY...AND ALSO ENDING 
OVER THE TN-NC LINE BY NOON TO 1 PM EST. FORECAST GRIDS REFLECT THIS 
TIMING. PLAN TO UPDATE GRIDS AND WEB PRODUCTS BEFORE NOON...ENDING 
RAIN IN MOST AREAS. 12Z OHX SOUNDING SUPPORTS HIGHS REACHING 50S TO 
PERHAPS LOWER 60S IN SE TN.

.AVIATION...

TODAY...WITH CLOUDS GRADUALLY DIMINISHING OVER THE TAF SITES DURING 
THE AFTERNOON HOURS. OVERALL...VFR CONDITIONS AND LIGHT WINDS ARE

991 
FXUS64 KMRX 070814
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EST FRI MAR 7 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED OFF THE CAROLINA COAST...WITH TEMPS 
REMAINING ABOVE FREEZING OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. RECENT 
PHONE CALL TO THE JOHNSON COUNTY DISPATCH INDICATES THAT LIGHT SNOW 
WAS FALLING...BUT WITH LITTLE OR NO ACCUMULATIONS. MODEL SOUNDINGS 
INDICATE TEMPS AROUND FREEZING FROM THE SURFACE UP TO AROUND 800 
MB...SO IT APPEARS THAT SNOW WILL BE PREDOMINATE PRECIP TYPE THIS 
MORNING (UNTIL CHANGING BACK TO RAIN AS TEMPS WARM AFTER SUNRISE). 
AREA RADARS REVEAL THE BULK OF THE PRECIP REMAINING OVER THE 
CAROLINAS...WITH ONLY LIGHT ECHOES OBSERVED OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
THUS...IT APPEARS THAT THE ADVISORY MAY NOT VERIFY WITH ENOUGH 
SNOWFALL TO JUSTIFY CONTINUING IT UNTIL 9 AM. FOR NOW...WILL LET THE 
ADVISORY CONTINUE FOR A FEW MORE HOURS...BUT WILL PROBABLY CANCEL IT 
EARLY CLOSER TO SUNRISE. THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO 
SLOWLY MOVE NORTHEASTWARD UP THE ATLANTIC COAST TODAY...WITH CLOUDS 
AND PRECIP GRADUALLY DIMINISHING OVER THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE 
SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A WARM-UP WILL BE IN STORE 
FOR THE REGION ON SATURDAY AS A HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE MOVES OVER THE 
AREA...PROMOTING MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS WITH HIGHS REACHING THE 60S 
TO LOWER 70S ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. ANOTHER FAST MOVING 
UPPER-TROUGH WILL THEN PUSH THROUGH THE REGION ON SUNDAY...THOUGH 
MODELS DIFFER WITH THE AMOUNT OF PRECIPITATION THAT WILL OCCUR. THE 
NAM IS MORE BULLISH AND INDICATES THE POTENTIAL FOR WIDESPREAD 
SHOWER ACTIVITY MOVING IN AROUND DAYBREAK AND PERSISTING THROUGHOUT 
THE DAY. THE GFS ON THE OTHER HAND IS FASTER AND INDICATES ONLY 
LIGHT QPF SIGNALS...WITH CLEARING LATE IN THE AFTERNOON. FOR NOW... 
HAVE MAINTAINED A MODEL BLEND OF THE TWO. IT SHOULD ALSO BE NOTED 
THAT TEMPERATURES APPEAR TO BE WARMER ENOUGH TO SUPPORT AN ALL RAIN 
EVENT AS HIGHS IN THE UPPER 50S AND 60S ARE EXPECTED FOR SUNDAY AS 
WELL. ANOTHER ROUND OF EARLY WEEK RIDGING WILL THEN ENSUE AS HIGHS 
CLIMB BACK INTO THE 60S AND LOWER 70S FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY BEFORE 
ANOTHER STORM SYSTEM LOOKS AS IF IT WILL IMPACT THE REGION FOR 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. MODELS DISAGREE WITH THE EXACT TRACK OF THE 
SYSTEM...BUT IT APPEARS THAT THE BEST OPPORTUNITY FOR PRECIPITATION 
WILL BE WEDNESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WITH SOME LIGHT ACTIVITY 
POSSIBLE ON THURSDAY AS THINGS TAPER OFF. THUS...HAVE INCREASED POPS 
TO HIGH-END CHANCE DURING THE AFOREMENTIONED TIME PERIOD TO ACCOUNT 
FOR AN INCREASED CONFIDENCE IN THIS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN             59  38  65  44  58 /  20   0   0  30  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    55  35  60  40  55 /  50   0   0  30  20

135 
FXUS64 KMRX 062026
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
326 PM EST THU MAR 6 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...WINTER WEATHER NOT YET
READY TO GIVE WAY TO SPRING TIME. LOW PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE
ERN GULF OF MEXICO WILL TRACK NE OVERNIGHT...WITH THE PROBLEM BEING
A LARGE WEDGE OF COLD AIR AT THE SURFACE ACROSS MUCH OF NC AND VA.
THIS COLD AIR HAS A CHANCE TO AT LEAST EDGE SW INTO OUR 3 NERN MOST
COUNTIES OVERNIGHT...SO OPTED TO ISSUE A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY
FOR THAT SMALL PART OF OUR FORECAST AREA. FORECAST SOUNDINGS JUST
DON'T SUPPORT MUCH IF ANY SNOW...BEING MORE INDICATIVE OF A LIGHT
SLEET AND/OR LIGHT FREEZING RAIN MIX. I DON'T EXPECT WIDESPREAD
OCCURRENCES OF BELOW 32 DEGREE TEMPS IN THE ADVISORY AREA...AND THE
PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE LIGHT. HOWEVER...I DID ALLOW FOR UP TO 1/10
INCH OF ICE ACCUMULATION IN THE ADVISORY AREA.

OTHERWISE...REMAINING AREAS GET RAIN OVERNIGHT WITH THE RAIN ENDING
FROM THE WEST AFTER FRIDAY MORNING. TEMPS SHOULD RECOVER AT LEAST
CLOSE TO A MOS BLEND FOR MAXES FRIDAY.

NOT REALLY MUCH IF ANY CHANGES FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY AS
SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGING SETTLE AT LEAST BRIEFLY OVER THE REGION. 
GENERALLY FOLLOWED THE SIMILAR GFS/NAM MOS TEMPS THROUGH THE
PERIOD. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...TYPICALLY MODELS NOT 
TOO FAR APART IN DEPICTION OF WEATHER EVENTS EARLY IN THE EXTENDED 
FORECAST BUT DIVERGE LATE. THIS IS THE CASE WITH THE CURRENT 
EXTENDED FORECAST WHICH ALLOWS FOR A WEAK UPPER TROUGH/SURFACE 
FRONTAL PASSAGE ON SUNDAY. SYSTEM IS MOISTURE STARVED WITH WEAK LIFT 
SO MAINTAINED THE SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS FOR THIS SYSTEM. THE 
FORECAST AREA ENJOYS AT LEAST A 36 HOUR PRECIPITATION FREE PERIOD 
WITH MAINLY DRY ADVECTION IN A ZONAL CONFIGURATION WITH SOME SURFACE 
RIDGING SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. BY TUESDAY MODELS 
GENERALLY INDICATE MORE SPLIT FLOW WEATHER MAKERS WITH A BROAD AND 
THUS WEAKER NORTHERN STREAM UPPER TROUGH OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS 
WHILE MORE AMPLIFIED CLOSED UPPER LOW FORMS OVER THE WESTERN GULF OF 
MEXICO. THE CANADIAN AND GFS KEEP THE STREAMS MORE SEPARATED AS 
THEY PROGRESS THROUGH THE EASTERN U.S. WHILE THE ECMWF GENERATES A 
HIGHLY AMPLIFIED TROUGH DURING THE PERIOD WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO 
THURSDAY. BOTH THE GFS AND ECM DEVELOP RELATIVELY DEEP SURFACE LOW 
PRESSURE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH ON WEDNESDAY WHICH ENDS UP DRAGGING 
MUCH COLDER AIR BACK INTO THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO 
THURSDAY. DUE MODERATE LEVEL OF UNCERTAINTY AT THIS TIME 
RANGE...JUST KEPT CHANCE POPS GOING WITH THE HIGHEST POP FOR RAIN 
SHOWERS ON WEDNESDAY AS THE DEEP SURFACE LOW SHIFTS EAST ACROSS THE 
VIEWING AREA. ANOTHER POSSIBILITY OF SNOW EXISTS IN THE UPSLOPE COLD 
AIR ADVECTION PATTERN BEHIND THE DEPARTING SURFACE SYSTEM WEDNESDAY 
EVENING INTO THURSDAY MORNING.

COLDEST AREAS OF NE TN AND SW VA SO THINK ANY ACCUMULATION OF
SLEET OR FREEZING RAIN WILL BE MINIMAL. SNOWFALL OF AN INCH OR TWO
COULD FALL IN THE NE TN MOUNTAINS BEFORE TEMPERATURES WARM FRIDAY.

NUMBERS TONIGHT. FRIDAY HIGHS CLOSER TO NAM IN THE UPPER 40S TO MID
50S BUT NEAR 60 AT CHA WHERE PRECIPITATION AND CLOUDS WILL DEPART
SOONER. WILL UPDATE HWO TO INDICATE SOME WINTRY PRECIPITATION
POSSIBLE NE SECTIONS.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...WARM ON SATURDAY 
AHEAD OF WEAK CLIPPER SYSTEM. SYSTEM WILL BE LOSING MOISTURE AS IT 
MOVES THROUGH THE AREA WITH LIGHT RAINSHOWERS. AIRMASS DRIES OUT 
BEHIND CLIPPER WITH WARMING TREND EARLY NEXT WEEK. COLD CORE LOW 
SLIDES INTO THE GULF OF MEXICO BY TUESDAY. TRACK AND STRENGTH REMAIN 
IN QUESTION BUT SYSTEM SHOULD BRING SOME RAIN INTO THE AREA BY MID 
WEEK.

346 
FXUS64 KMRX 052044
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
344 PM EST WED MAR 5 2014

.SHORT TERM.../TONIGHT AND TOMORROW/...OVERALL...A PRETTY QUIET
SHORT TERM. CLEAR CONDITIONS THIS EVENING WILL START TO GIVE WAY TO
INCREASING CLOUD COVER LATE TONIGHT AND CONTINUE THROUGH THE DAY
TOMORROW. CLOUD COVER WILL FIRST BEGIN TO INCREASE ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN VALLEY WHERE MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS WILL BE IN PLACE BY
LATE TOMORROW MORNING. CLOUD COVER WILL WORK ITS WAY NORTHWARD
DURING THE DAY WITH ALL AREAS BEING MOSTLY CLOUDY BY LATE
AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING. THIS IS DUE TO AN APPROACHING UPPER LEVEL
LOW THAT WILL SWING ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES THROUGH THE DAY
TOMORROW. IT LOOKS LIKE MOST AREAS WILL STAY DRY TOMORROW EXCEPT
FOR THE EXTREME SOUTHERN VALLY AND SWNC WHERE I HAVE PUT A SLIGHT
CHANCE POP IN PLACE DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS.

TEMPERATURES FOR TONIGHT WILL BE A FEW DEGREES BELOW NORMAL TO NEAR 
NORMAL. WILL INCLUDE PATCHY FREEZING FOG IN GRIDS ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN PLATEAU...THE SAME AREAS THAT RECEIVED FOG THIS MORNING. 
TOMORROWS HIGH TEMPS WILL BE SLIGHTLY COOLER ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
VALLY WHERE CLOUD COVER WILL FIRST MOVE IN AND A FEW DEGREES WARMER 
ACROSS NETN AND UP INTO SWVA WHERE CLOUD COVER WILL HOLD OFF LONGER. 

.LONG TERM.../THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...STILL A RELATIVELY 
BUSY PATTERN WITH THREE WEATHER SYSTEMS DURING THIS PERIOD. THE 
FIRST SYSTEM IS ON THE DOORSTEP AS THIS PERIOD STARTS...THEN A WEAK 
CLIPPER SYSTEM FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY...AND FINALLY A LARGER 
SYSTEM FOR THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK.

FOR THIS FIRST SYSTEM THE BIGGEST QUESTION IS WHETHER THERE WILL BE 
ANY WINTRY PRECIPITATION THURSDAY NIGHT. MODELS ARE NOT IN GREAT 
AGREEMENT...BUT FOR THIS MAIN QUESTION...IT APPEARS THAT THE THREAT 
FOR ICING IN OUR AREA IS RATHER SLIM...WITH BETTER CHANCES EAST OF 
THE CONTINENTAL DIVIDE...THEREBY EAST OF OUR AREA.  MODELS THAT TAKE 
MIN TEMPERATURES BELOW FREEZING ALSO HAVE ZERO TO MINIMAL PRECIP IN 
THOSE AREAS...WHERE AS MODELS WITH MORE PRECIP KEEP OUR AREAS ABOVE 
FREEZING...SO THE PRECIP WOULD BE BRINGING WARMER AIR WITH IT.  FOR 
OUR GRIDS...AM GOING WITH RELATIVELY HIGH POPS IN OUR EASTERN AREAS 
FOR THURSDAY NIGHT...BUT KEEPING ALL TEMPERATURES ABOVE FREEZING.

THE NEXT SYSTEM IS A WEAK CLIPPER DUE TO RACE ACROSS THE AREA 
SATURDAY NIGHT AND/OR SUNDAY.  THIS SYSTEM WILL BE ALL LIQUID AND 
POPS WILL BE RELATIVELY LOW.  THEN IT SHOULD BE DRY FOR A COUPLE OF 
DAYS BEFORE A LARGER SYSTEM MOVES IN TOWARD THE END OF THE PERIOD.  
RIGHT NOW...LOOKS LIKE MOST OF THE HEAVIER PRECIP WILL STAY SOUTH OF 
US. ALSO...RIGHT NOW JUST HAVE OUR AREA AS SHOWERS...WILL NEED TO 
SEE IF THE THREAT OF STORMS CAN MOVE FARTHER NORTH.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             36  53  41  60  40 /  10  20  70  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  33  55  39  58  37 /  10  10  50  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       32  55  39  59  37 /  10  10  40  10  10

TODAY...WITH LIGHT WINDS AND VFR CONDITIONS EXPECTED AT ALL TAF
SITES. SOME MVFR FOG LIKELY TO RETURN AT ABOUT 9Z TONIGHT.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE LIES OVER THE

COAST WITH A WEAK DISTURBANCE ALOFT OVER GA AND THE CAROLINAS. 
CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE DISTURBANCE TO THE SOUTH HAD ALMOST MOVED 
THROUGH THE EASTERN TN VALLEY. MOSTLY HIGH CLOUDS COVERED THE AREA. 
TEMPERATURES AT 300 AM WERE IN THE UPPER 20S TO MID 30S. AS THESE 
CLOUDS SHIFT EAST DURING THE NEXT FEW HOURS SKY CONDITIONS WILL 
BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR TO MOSTLY SUNNY AFTER SUNRISE. THE FORECAST FOR 
THE NEXT 24 HOURS THE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TODAY AND TONIGHT
WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS. THERE MAY BE SOME INCREASE
IN CLOUDS LATE TONIGHT AS SURFACE LOW APPROACHES THE LA/AL COAST.
TEMPERATURES SHOULD WARM 10 DEGREES NORTH TO 15 DEGREES SOUTH.
TONIGHT LOWS MOSTLY NEAR TO BELOW FREEZING AGAIN EXCEPT SLIGHTLY
WARMER SE TN.

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO DIFFER
ON TIMING OF SOUTHERN LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. CMC FASTER...NAM
SLOWER...USED A ECMWF/GFS BLEND WHICH MOVE UPPER TROUGH AXIS
THROUGH THE AREA BY 07/12Z FRI. WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE NAM
PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE RELATIVELY LIGHT OUTSIDE SE TN/SW NC AND
THE SMOKIES. KEPT PRECIPITATION GOING INTO FRI ACROSS EASTERN
AREAS. FREEZING LEVEL HOLDS UP SO FREEZING RAIN/SNOW CHANCES LOOK
LOW. SURFACE RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE AREA WITH MILD WARMING TREND.
WEAK FRONT PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH AREA ON SUNDAY. FORCING AND LIFT
LIMITED AND EXPECT PRECIPITATION TO BE TAPER OFF ALONG FRONT.
SOUTHERN LOW MOVES INTO THE GLFMEX EARLY NEXT WEEK. LOW CONFIDENCE
WITH TIMING AND NORTHERN EXTENT OF PRECIPITATION WITH TEMPERATURES
SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
830 PM EST TUE MAR 4 2014

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED 
OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE 
WESTERN GULF OF MEXICO. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE AREA 
OF HIGH CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS GULF LOW MOVING NORTHEASTWARD 
ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. MODEL SOUNDINGS ALSO REVEAL A BOUNDARY 
LAYER INVERSION EXTENDING UP TO AROUND 750 MB THIS EVENING...WHICH 
IS PROGGED TO LINGER INTO WEDNESDAY OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS 
INVERSION SHOULD HELP TO PREVENT ANY VERTICAL MIXING...AND THUS... 
SHOULD KEEP ANY LOW LEVEL MOISTURE FROM DISSIPATING TOO QUICKLY. AS 
A RESULT...WILL BE MORE PESSIMISTIC WITH CLOUD COVER FOR TONIGHT AND 
INTO WEDNESDAY. IN ADDITION...HAVE RAISED TEMPS A LITTLE FOR TONIGHT 
TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS MORE EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER.

668 
FXUS64 KMRX 042002
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
302 PM EST TUE MAR 4 2014

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
WITH A SURFACE TROUGH IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION PROMOTING A
NORTHEASTERLY FLOW...SOME DENSE LOW STRATUS HAVE HUNG ON THROUGHOUT
THE DAY DUE TO THE REINFORCEMENT OF THE COLDER AIR. THESE CLOUDS
HAVE KEPT TEMPERATURES LOWER THAN EXPECTED BY A FEW DEGREES.
STILL...MOST AREAS HAVE CLIMBED INTO THE UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S DUE
TO A FEW BREAKS IN THIS CLOUD COVER. GIVEN THE CLOUDS HANGING ON
AND THE COLD NORTHEAST FETCH OVERNIGHT...HAVE BEEN HESITANT TO
REDUCE CLOUD COVER MUCH TONIGHT. THINK THAT SOME DRY AIR MAY HELP
TO ERODE SOME OF THE SHIELD LATE TONIGHT...BUT AM EXPECTING
MOSTLY/PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS IN MOST LOCATIONS. THIS WILL HELP
TO TO KEEP TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES WARMER AS WELL...EXCEPT
ACROSS FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA WHERE SOME
DECENT CLEARING MAY TAKE PLACE. LOWS WILL RANGE FROM THE MID 20S IN
THE FAR NORTHEAST ZONES...TO THE UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S ELSEWHERE.
THE NORTHEAST FLOW ALONG WITH SOME CLOUDS WILL ALSO HELP TO KEEP
TEMPERATURES DOWN...BUT SOME ADDITIONAL BREAKS /ESPECIALLY BY THE
AFTERNOON/ WILL ALLOW HIGHS TO CLIMB INTO THE 50S IN MOST SPOTS.

.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY/... 
THE PAST FEW RUNS OF THE NAM HAVE TRENDED MORE TOWARD THE GFS
SOLUTION FOR THE SYSTEM CROSSING THE SOUTHEAST REGION THURSDAY
THROUGH FRIDAY...HOWEVER THERE REMAIN SOME SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCES
FOR PRECIP AMOUNTS OVER THE TN VALLEY. THE NAM WRAPS MUCH MORE
MOISTURE AROUND THE MID-LEVEL CIRCULATION OVER MS/AL THURSDAY
NIGHT...AND IS SLOWER WITH ITS EXIT ON FRIDAY COMPARED TO THE GFS.
THE GFS HAS SUPPORT OF THE ECMWF...CMC...AND SREF...AND HAS BEEN
MORE CONSISTENT WITH THIS SYSTEM. THUS...WILL CONTINUE TO FOLLOW
THE GFS. THE GFS HAS TRENDED A BIT SLOWER...SO POPS WILL BE REMOVED
FROM WEDNESDAY NIGHT...MEANING LESS POTENTIAL FOR SNOWFALL AT
ONSET. HIGHEST POPS WILL BE IN SOUTHERN AND EASTERN SECTIONS FOR
THURSDAY AFTERNOON...WITH POPS TAPERING OFF LATE THURSDAY NIGHT.

A RIDGE OVER THE REGION WILL PROVIDE DRY AND SLIGHTLY WARMER WEATHER 
FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. BEYOND THIS PERIOD...CONFIDENCE IS LOW AS 
THE GFS HAS CHANGED ITS TUNE FROM YESTERDAY. IT SWITCHED FROM A NW 
FLOW SHORTWAVE TROUGH PASSAGE ON SUNDAY TO A SPLIT FLOW PATTERN 
DEVELOPING ON SUNDAY. THE GFS...ECMWF...AND CMC ALL SHOW A SOUTHERN 
STREAM CLOSED LOW DEVELOPING OVER TX...BUT TRACK IT EASTWARD AT 
DIFFERENT SPEEDS. ENSEMBLE MEMBERS ARE WIDELY VARIED AS WELL. THIS 
IS TYPICALLY A DIFFICULT PATTERN FOR MODELS TO HANDLE. WITH THIS 
UNCERTAINTY...WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE POP GOING ON SUNDAY...AND 
HAVE MONDAY AND TUESDAY DRY.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  29  54  35  55  35 /   0   0  10  50  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       29  53  34  55  35 /   0   0  10  30  10

ECMWF STRONGER WITH THIS SYSTEM AND DEVELOPS STRONG SURFACE LOW
ALONG SE COAST FRIDAY THAT RACES NE LATE FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. GFS
AND NAM NOT QUITE AS STRONG WITH THE SYSTEM AS IT MOVES OFF THE
COAST AND TO THE NE. HIGHER PRESSURE SETTLES BACK OVER THE SE
STATES FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. LONG RANGE MODELS STILL INDICATING
ANOTHER FRONT APPROACHING SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT. TEMPERATURES
WILL STAY NEAR TO SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THE EXTENDED.

.DISCUSSION...UPDATE TO INCLUDE PATCHY FREEZING DRIZZLE ACROSS
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND EXTREME SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA.
ALSO..MADE MINOR CHANGES TO CLOUDS AND MINS FOR TONIGHT.

CLEARING LINE ACROSS SOUTHEAST KENTUCKY MOVING SLOWLY SOUTHEAST
INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. LATEST NAM SHOWS DEPICTS THE BOUNDARY
LAYER MOISTURE QUITE WELL WITH CLEARING OVER THE NORTH. HOWEVER...
SURFACE ANALYSIS AND SATELLITE SHOWS A WEDGE OF MILDER AIR MOVING
NORTHEAST ACROSS NORTHERN GEORGIA. NAM SHOWS ASSOCIATED MOISTURE
WITH THIS WEDGE MOVING INTO THE SOUTHERN AREAS OVERNIGHT.

SINCE THE AIRMASS ASSOCIATED WITH THE WEDGE WILL BRING DEWPOINTS
INTO THE 30S INTO THE COLD AIR AT THE SURFACE...WEAK ISENTROPIC
LIFT IS EXPECTED. THIS LIFT MAY PRODUCE PATCHY AREAS OF FREEZING
DRIZZLE. WILL WATCH THIS POSSIBLE DEVELOPMENT AND EXTENT DURING THE
MIDNIGHT SHIFT.


630 
FXUS64 KMRX 031959
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
259 PM EST MON MAR 3 2014

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND TUESDAY/...
THE WINTER STORM THAT IMPACTED THE REGION TODAY IS WINDING DOWN
THIS AFTERNOON. EARLIER...SOME LOCALLY HEAVY FREEZING RAIN AND
SLEET FELL ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND ALONG THE CUMBERLAND
MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...WHERE UP TO A QUARTER INCH OF
ICING WAS OBSERVED ALONG WITH HALF AN INCH TO ONE INCH OF SLEET IN
SOME AREAS. A SECONDARY AREA OF LIGHT FREEZING RAIN BROUGHT SOME
ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS TO THIS AREA ALONG WITH A GOOD PORTION OF
THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY AS SOME COLDER SUBFREEZING AIR
FILTERED IN BEHIND THE PASSAGE OF A COLD FRONT. AS TEMPERATURES
COOLED ALOFT BY THE EARLY AFTERNOON...THIS FREEZING RAIN QUICKLY
CHANGED OVER TO LIGHT SNOW. IN GENERAL...MOST LOCATIONS ACROSS THE
AREA HAVE RECEIVED A DUSTING TO UP ONE INCH OF SNOW...WITH A FEW
LOCATIONS ALONG THE CUMBERLAND AND CLINCH MOUNTAINS RECEIVING
AROUND TWO INCHES.

AS DRIER AIR MOVES IN...THE INTENSITY OF THE PRECIPITATION IS
BEGINNING TO WANE. FOR THIS REASON...HAVE OPTED TO CANCEL THE
WINTER STORM WARNING FOR THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND CUMBERLAND
MOUNTAINS WHERE SOME SIGNIFICANT ICING AND SOME SNOW ACCUMULATED
EARLIER AND REPLACE IT WITH AN ADVISORY. WILL ALSO KEEP THE
EXISTING ADVISORY FOR THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY GOING
THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING AS WELL TO
ACCOUNT FOR THIS PRECIPITATION WHICH COULD STILL PRODUCE SOME LIGHT
ACCUMULATIONS AND ALSO THE POTENTIAL FOR LOCALIZED SLICK ROADS ON
THE EVENING RUSH HOUR COMMUTE. 

BY THIS EVENING...THE SKY SHOULD BEGIN TO CLEAR A BIT AS DRIER AIR
MOVES IN AND PRECIPITATION COMPLETELY ENDS. THE COLD AIR WILL
CONTINUE TO FILTER IN OVERNIGHT AND WILL BE REINFORCED BY A MODEST
NORTHERLY FLOW. TEMPERATURES WILL PLUNGE INTO THE TEENS ACROSS
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND THE PLATEAU...AND DROP
INTO THE LOWER 20S ACROSS THE VALLEYS. THE COLD AIR WILL ALSO ALLOW
ANY ICE AND SNOW COVER TO REMAIN IN PLACE OVERNIGHT AND INTO THE
MORNING HOURS ON TUESDAY WHICH WOULD RESULT IN HAZARDOUS TRAVEL
CONDITIONS PERSISTING IN THESE AREAS THROUGH THE RUSH HOUR COMMUTE.
THE MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS ON MONDAY WILL RESULT IN SOME WARMING
INTO THE 40S DESPITE THE NORTHERLY FLOW. HOWEVER...THESE
TEMPERATURES ARE STILL WELL BELOW NORMAL FOR EARLY MARCH...AND IT
WILL FEEL LIKE WINTER FOR MUCH OF THE DAY.

.LONG TERM /TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY/...
THE NEXT CHANCE OF PRECIP WILL ARRIVE LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT/THURSDAY. 
THE NAM AND GFS HAVE VERY DIFFERENT DEPICTIONS OF THIS SYSTEM. THE 
GFS SHOWS A CLOSED MIDLEVEL CIRCULATION DEVELOPING OVER THE 
SOUTHEAST...WHILE THE NAM HAS A SHARP OPEN TROUGH PASSING TO OUR 
NORTH. THE GFS HAS SUPPORT FROM THE CANADIAN AND THE ECMWF. THE 
PREVIOUS FORECAST LOOKS MORE LIKE THE GFS AS WELL...SO WILL NOT MAKE 
SIGNIFICANT CHANGES BASED ON THE LATEST NAM. MOST OF THIS EVENT 
LOOKS TO BE LIQUID PRECIP...WITH ONLY THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND 
PERHAPS SW VA SEEING A LITTLE SNOW.

A RIDGE OVER THE REGION WILL PROVIDE DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY WITH GRADUALLY WARMING TEMPS. THEN A POSITIVELY-TILTED 
TROUGH AND COLD FRONT MOVE THROUGH THE AREA ON SUNDAY. MODELS ARE IN 
DECENT AGREEMENT WITH THIS SYSTEM...SO POPS WILL BE RAISED INTO THE 
CHANCE RANGE FOR SUNDAY. THIS EVENT LOOKS TO BE ALL LIQUID PRECIP AS 
THE COLD AIR LAGS WELL BEHIND THE DEPARTING MOISTURE DUE TO THE 
POSITIVE TILT OF THE MIDLEVEL TROUGH. MONDAY LOOKS DRY WITH BELOW 
NORMAL TEMPS.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1110 AM EST MON MAR 3 2014

.DISCUSSION...
THE COLDER...SUBFREEZING AIR IS FINALLY INFILTRATING A GOOD CHUNK OF 
THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
AFTERNOON AS THE TEMPERATURE HAS DROPPED TO AT OR BELOW FREEZING 
ALONG AND NORTH OF THE INTERSTATE 40 TO INTERSTATE 81 CORRIDOR. THIS 
HAS RESULTED IN LIGHT RAIN QUICKLY TRANSITIONING TO LIGHT FREEZING 
RAIN AND DRIZZLE /WHICH HAS BEGUN TO ACCUMULATE ON SURFACES SUCH AS 
TREES AND UNTREATED ROADS/. THUS...SOME LOCALIZED SLICK SPOTS ARE 
EXPECTED OVER A GOOD PORTION OF THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY THIS 
AFTERNOON DUE TO THIS LIGHT ACCUMULATING ICE AS TEMPERATURES 
CONTINUE TO FALL THROUGHOUT THE DAY. LOCATIONS ALONG THE NORTHERN 
PLATEAU AND THE CUMBERLAND MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA HAVE 
PICKED UP CLOSE TO ONE-QUARTER INCH OF ICE ALONG WITH SOME SLEET 
FROM THE EARLIER FREEZING RAIN THAT OCCURRED AROUND DAYBREAK. THUS 
THE ADDITIONAL LIGHT ICE ACCUMULATIONS WILL ONLY EXASPERATE THE 
HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS IN THOSE AREAS.

SOME LIGHT SNOW WILL THEN MOVE INTO THE REGION AS TEMPERATURES COOL 
ALOFT BY THE EARLY AFTERNOON. TOTAL SNOWFALL OF 1 TO 2 INCHES WILL 
BE POSSIBLE WITHIN THE HEAVIEST BANDS OF THIS ACTIVITY ALONG THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS WITHIN THE WARNING AREA. THUS...WILL MAINTAIN 
THE WINTER STORM WARNING FOR THOSE AREAS THROUGH 00Z. THIS AREA OF 
LIGHT SNOW WILL ALSO TRACK THROUGH THE ADVISORY AREA ALONG THE 
CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY...AND COULD BRING HALF AN INCH TO 
PERHAPS AN INCH OF SNOW ACCUMULATION IN SOME SPOTS BY THE MID TO 
LATE AFTERNOON. THUS...DID DECIDE TO EXTEND THE TIME ON THE ADVISORY 
TO ACCOUNT FOR THE POTENTIAL FOR THESE LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS LASTING 
THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE AFTERNOON. THEREAFTER...PRECIPITATION 
WILL SHIFT EAST AS DRIER AIR WAYS ITS WAY INTO THE AREA FROM THE 
WEST. HOWEVER...DUE TO THE SUBFREEZING TEMPERATURES...SLIPPERY ROADS 
WILL PERSIST OVERNIGHT. 

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EST MON MAR 3 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAKENING SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE 
EAST THROUGH THE TN VALLEY TODAY. UPPER JET SEGMENT EAST OF THE 
SHORT WAVE PROVIDING GOOD LIFT AND RESULTING IN WIDESPREAD 
PRECIPITATION ACROSS THE REGION. SURFACE LOW JUST EAST OF THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WITH ATTENDANT FRONTAL BOUNDARY HANGING BACK 
INTO THE SOUTHEAST TN VALLEY EARLY TODAY. THESE FEATURES WILL SLIDE 
SE TODAY ALLOWING HIGH PRESSURE AND COLD AIRMASS TO FILTER IN FROM 
THE NW. BEST GUESS FOR SURFACE FREEZING LINE AT 8 AM EST IS FROM 
ABINGDON VA TO W KNOXVILLE TO JASPER TN. TEMPERATURES WILL STAY 
FAIRLY WARM IN SE TN/SW NC ...INCLUDING THE SMOKIES EARLY TODAY. 
PRECIPITATION TYPE REMAINS CHALLENGING. FORECAST SOUNDING SWITCH 
FROM RAIN TO FREEZING RAIN TO SLEET AS SHALLOW COLD AIRMASS FILTERS 
IN FROM THE NW. THIS TRANSITION ZONE WILL MIGRATE SLOWLY SE. 
PRECIPITATION WILL CHANGE TO SNOW A BIT FARTHER NW OF THE FRONTAL 
ZONE AS THE WARM LAYER RECEDES TO BELOW FREEZING. THIS TRANSITION 
WILL ALSO BE TEMPORAL AS THE LAYER MOISTURE DROPS TO BELOW THE 
DENDRITIC GROWTH REGION BY 1 PM EST AS THE UPPER JET CORE SLIDES 
EAST IN THE MOUNTAINS. AFTER WHICH IT APPEAR FREEZING RAIN/DRIZZLE 
SHOULD BE THE DOMINATE PRECIPITATION TYPE. CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN 
VALLEY FREEZING TEMPERATURES APPEAR TO BE SPOTTY DURING THE DAY 
TIME HOURS BUT POCKETS OF SUB FREEZING ARE LIKELY TO OCCUR. 
CONDITIONS SHOULD CLEAR OUT FAIRLY FAST TONIGHT. SURFACE ICING MAY 
BE A CONTINUED CONCERN IN THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. COLD TEMPERATURES 
TONIGHT. 
 
.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...WILL BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS 
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY WITH ZONAL FLOW ALOFT.  THE COLD ARCTIC AIR 
MASS IN PLACE EARLY IN THE PERIOD WILL SLOWLY MODERATE WITH 
TEMPERATURES WARMING INTO THE 50S BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON.  MODEL AND 
RUN CONSISTENCY QUIET POOR FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED AND 
CONFIDENCE LOW...SO MADE LITTLE IN THE WAY OF CHANGES THURSDAY 
THROUGH SUNDAY.  PRIOR MODEL RUNS HAD BEEN BRINGING A SYSTEM IN FROM 
THE SOUTH ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY BUT ARE NOW TRENDED THIS FURTHER 
EAST AND ARE CURRENTLY BRINGING IN A FRONT FROM THE NORTHWEST DURING 
THIS TIME FRAME.  HAVE INCREASE POPS OVER FAR NORTHWEST COUNTIES TO 
CHANCE CATEGORY.  THIS SYSTEM SHOULD BE OUT EARLY IN THE DAY FRIDAY 
AND HAVE KEPT ONLY LOW POPS OVER FAR NORTHERN AND EASTERN 
LOCATIONS.  ANOTHER SYSTEM IS EXPECTED TO MOVE THROUGH DURING THE 
WEEKEND.  HOWEVER...TIMING...STRENGTH AND AVAILABLE MOISTURE REMAIN 
IN QUESTION AND HAVE KEPT POPS LOW.  WITH BOTH OF THESE LAST 
SYSTEMS...TEMPERATURE PROFILE LOOKS TO KEEP PRECIP MAINLY RAIN BUT 
COULD SEE SOME SNOWFALL OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND ACROSS SOME 
NORTHERN AREAS DURING OVERNIGHT HOURS.

FXUS64 KMRX 030223
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
920 PM EST SUN MAR 2 2014

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE 
SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS...WITH A WARM AIR MASS (TEMPS IN THE 50S 
AND 60S) STILL LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...TEMPS 
QUICKLY FALL INTO THE 40S ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND INTO THE 
30S ACROSS MIDDLE TN AND SOUTHEAST KY. THIS VERY COLD AIR MASS WILL 
SLOWLY MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA LATER TONIGHT...WITH THE MODELS 
IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT RAIN WILL CHANGE TO FREEZING RAIN...SLEET... 
AND SNOW BEFORE SUNRISE OVER THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND 
CUMBERLAND MOUNTAINS (WHERE A WINTER STORM WARNING IS CURRENTLY IN 
EFFECT). FREEZING SURFACE TEMPS ARE EXPECTED IN THESE AREAS BEFORE 
SUNRISE (WITH BOTH ICE AND SNOW ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED)...BUT THE 
MODELS SUGGEST THIS COLDER AIR WILL BE SLOWER TO MOVE EASTWARD INTO 
THE GREAT TN VALLEY AFTER SUNRISE ON MONDAY MORNING. THUS...ANY 
ACCUMULATIONS MONDAY MORNING IN THE GREAT TN VALLEY MAY BE MORE SNOW 
THAN ICE. BOTH THE NAM AND GFS MODELS INDICATE THAT RAIN WILL 
INITIALLY CHANGE TO SLEET (OR FREEZING RAIN WHERE TEMPS ARE ABLE TO 
FALL TO THE FREEZING MARK)...BEFORE CHANGING COMPLETELY TO SNOW 
BEFORE THE PRECIP ENDS.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL UPDATE 
LATER THIS EVENING TO REMOVE ANY EVENING WORDING. ALSO...WILL ADD 
MARION COUNTY TO THE WINTER WX ADVISORY WHERE THERE COULD BE SOME 
LIGHT ICE OR SNOW ACCUMULATIONS DEVELOPING IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
ON MONDAY MORNING.

684 
FXUS64 KMRX 022118
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
418 PM EST SUN MAR 2 2014

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND MONDAY/...
A VERY CHALLENGING FORECAST 
FOR THE SHORT TERM AS RAIN...FREEZING RAIN...SLEET...AND SNOW ARE 
ALL EXPECTED. A STRONG COLD FRONT WILL MAKE ITS WAY INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA LATER THIS EVENING AND OVERNIGHT WITH PLENTY OF QPF 
AND COLD AIR TO MAKE FOR A MESSY FORECAST AND TRAVEL PROBLEMS ACROSS 
MANY OF OUR COUNTIES. RAIN WILL TRANSITION TO FREEZING RAIN 
BEGINNING AROUND 06 UTC ACROSS THE COUNTIES IN THE WARNING...THEN A 
BRIEF PERIOD OF SLEET...FOLLOWED BY SNOW AFTER 12 UTC DUE TO THE 
850MB WARM NOSE BEING ERODED BY THE COLDER AIR. FREEZING RAIN WILL 
BEGIN AROUND 09 TO 12 UTC FOR COUNTIES IN THE ADVISORY AND LAST 
THROUGH AROUND 14 UTC WHERE THEN A TRANSITION TO SNOW IS EXPECTED. 
SNOW SHOULD TAPER OFF TO LIGHT FREEZING DRIZZLE ACROSS ALL AREAS BY 
THE AFTERNOON HOURS AS SOUNDINGS SHOW A LOSS OF THE DEEPER MOISTURE 
WHICH THEREFORE KEEPS THE MOISTURE OUT OF THE DENDRITIC GROWTH ZONE. 
BY THIS POINT THOUGH...ONLY MINOR ACCUMULATIONS ARE EXPECTED AS THE 
MAJORITY OF THE MOISTURE WILL BE OFF TO OUR EAST BY AROUND 18 UTC. 
BACKWARD TEMPERATURE CURVE TOMORROW AS TEMPERATURES WILL BE WARMEST 
TOMORROW MORNING AND WILL STEADILY FALL THROUGHOUT THE DAY. THIS 
WILL ALLOW FOR WHAT WINTRY PRECIP THAT DOES FALL...TO STICK AROUND 
AS MOST AREAS WILL BE WELL BELOW FREEZING BY THE AFTERNOON HOURS. 
STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY IN REGARDS TO FREEZING RAIN AND SNOW AMOUNTS 
DUE TO WHEN THE TRANSITION TAKES PLACE. FUTURE SHIFTS WILL HAVE TO 
CLOSELY MONITOR TRENDS AND MAKE UPDATES AS NEEDED.

.LONG TERM /MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY/...
IN WAKE OF THE STORM SYSTEM THAT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION 
TONIGHT INTO MONDAY...A STOUT NORTHWEST FLOW WILL HELP TO REINFORCE 
THE COLDER AIR ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH AT LEAST THE MIDDLE OF THE 
UPCOMING WORK WEEK. SOME CLEARING WILL TAKE PLACE BY MONDAY EVENING 
/WHICH ALONG WITH THE COLD AIR MASS/ WILL PROMOTE LOW TEMPERATURES 
DROPPING INTO THE TEENS ACROSS MUCH OF THE REGION. SOME SUNSHINE ON 
TUESDAY WILL ALLOW FOR SOME MELTING OF ICE AND SNOW ON THE ROADS BY 
THE LATE MORNING AND AFTERNOON...AND HIGHS SHOULD CLIMB WELL INTO 
THE 40S. WARMER...BUT STILL SUBFREEZING TEMPERATURES WILL RETURN 
TUESDAY NIGHT...BEFORE A SLIGHTLY WARMER DAY IN THE MID 40S TO LOWER 
50S WILL TAKE PLACE ON WEDNESDAY. MODELS DIFFER SLIGHTLY ON THE 
TIMING OF NEXT STORM SYSTEM THAT WILL CLIP THE REGION DURING THE 
LATER PART OF THE WORK WEEK. THE GFS IS A LITTLE FASTER THAN THE 
ECMWF AND SHOWS SOME SHOWERS SKIRTING THE REGION THURSDAY INTO 
THURSDAY NIGHT...WHILE THE ECMWF INDICATES A THURSDAY NIGHT INTO 
FRIDAY TIME FRAME. DURING THIS TIME FRAME...WINDS WILL ALSO SHIFT TO 
THE SOUTHWEST LATE IN THE WEEK INTO THE WEEKEND WHICH WILL ALLOW 
HIGHS TO RETURN INTO THE 50S TO LOWER 60S AND LOWS INTO THE UPPER 
30S AND 40S. THIS WOULD PROMOTE A MOSTLY LIQUID PRECIPITATION 
EVENT. AN ADDITIONAL CLIPPER FRONT WILL THEN DROP SOUTH FROM THE 
OHIO VALLEY INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS SATURDAY INTO 
SUNDAY...THOUGH THE GFS IS AROUND 12 HOURS FASTER THAN THE ECMWF. 
FOR NOW...HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GIVEN THE WEAK QPF SIGNALS 
ASSOCIATED WITH IT AND WILL WAIT FOR BETTER MODEL AGREEMENT. 

&&

548 
FXUS64 KMRX 020916
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
412 AM EST SUN MAR 2 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH MONDAY)...STRONG COLD FRONT EXTENDS FROM 
WV THROUGH EAST CENTRAL KY TO W TN THIS MORNING. UPPER NORTHERN JET 
NEAR ZONAL THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES REGION TODAY. SHORT WAVE TROUGH 
MOVING EAST INTO OK LATER TODAY. INCREASED SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ACROSS 
THE TN VALLEY TODAY. THESE FEATURES LEAD TO LITTLE MOVEMENT OF THE 
FRONT TODAY. CLOUDS WILL BE ON THE INCREASE TODAY WITH LIGHT RAIN 
MOVING INTO THE AREA LATE. TEMPERATURES WILL BE ABOVE NORMAL WITH 
GOOD WARM AIR ADVECTION SE OF THE FRONT. SHORT WAVE MOVES INTO W TN 
TONIGHT WITH STRENGTHENING JET EAST OF THE TROUGH OVER THE TN 
VALLEY. PRECIPITATION WILL BECOME WIDESPREAD AND WITH THE POSITION 
OF THE SHORT WAVE ...BE ALONG AND MAINLY BEHIND SURFACE FRONT. 
STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL OCCUR BEHIND FRONT AS IT MOVES 
SOUTHEAST INTO THE MRX CWA EARLY MONDAY. FORECAST SOUNDINGS DEPICT 
INITIALLY SHALLOW COLD AIR WORKING ITS WAY UP TO H85 ACROSS NW AREAS 
BY 03/12Z. SOUNDINGS ARE NEAR O ISOTHERM UP TO H70 AT THAT TIME. 
SLEET IS AS LIKELY AS FREEZING RAIN AS PRECIPITATION TYPE IS IN 
TRANSITION. JET AXIS REMAINS BACK TOWARD MIDDLE TN SO MODERATE 
PRECIPITATION WILL CONTINUE ON BACKSIDE OF COLD FRONT. LEANED TOWARD 
A LOW RATIO OF ICE ACCRETION RATES SINCE PRECIPITATION RATES LOOK 
MODERATELY HEAVY INITIALLY. WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE UPPER TROUGH 
AXIS BY MID DAY MONDAY LAYER MOISTURE DROPS OF WITH BULK OF MOISTURE 
BELOW THE SNOW GROWTH REGION. PRECIPITATION TYPE COULD EASILY BE 
FREEZING DRIZZLE AS WELL AS SNOW...ESPECIALLY ACROSS VALLEY 
LOCATIONS. LIGHT SNOW WILL LINGER IN SW VA AND TN MOUNTAINS. 
DRAMATIC TEMPERATURE FALL EXPECTED MONDAY. ADVISORIES MAY NEED TO BE 
EXTENDED...MAINLY FOR ICE ON MONDAY PENDING SYSTEM EVOLUTION.


.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...A FEW LINGERING LIGHT 
SNOW SHOWERS WILL REMAIN OVER FAR NORTHEASTERN LOCATIONS MONDAY 
EVENING AS THE MONDAY MORNING COLD FRONT EXITS THE AREA. NO 
ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS ARE EXPECTED BY THIS TIME FRAME.  
HOWEVER...MUCH COLDER AIR WILL CONTINUE TO FILTER IN THROUGH THE 
NIGHT...PUSHING OVERNIGHT LOWS INTO THE TEENS AND 20S.  FLOW ALOFT 
BECOMES ZONAL THROUGH THE NIGHT AND WILL BE BETWEEN WEATHER SYSTEMS 
FOR THE REST OF MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY WITH TEMPERATURES 
SLOWLY MODERATING.  THE NEXT SYSTEM WILL MOVE IN LATE WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT INTO THURSDAY.  PRECIP WILL MOVE IN FROM THE SOUTH AND SPREAD 
NORTHEAST ACROSS THE MRX CWA.  A MIX OF RAIN AND SNOWS IS POSSIBLE 
LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY THURSDAY MORNING...THE CHANCE OF SNOW 
WILL MAINLY BE OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS.  
THE SNOW SHOULD TRANSITION TO RAIN BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON AS 
TEMPERATURES WARM.  SCATTERED PRECIP WILL SLOWLY END THURSDAY NIGHT 
INTO FRIDAY MORNING BUT THESE LINGERING SHOWERS MAY ONCE AGAIN 
SWITCH BACK TO LIGHT SNOW LATE THURSDAY NIGHT AGAIN OVER HIGHER 
TERRAIN AND NORTHERN AREAS.  MODEL CONSISTENCY BECOMES QUIET POOR BY 
THE END OF THE PERIOD.  THE GFS INDICATES ANOTHER SYSTEM...A WEAK 
COLD FRONT...MAY MOVE IN FOR SATURDAY.  WITH CONFIDENCE LOW WILL 
KEEP POPS LOW FOR NOW.

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT OVER KY AND WEST TN... 
GENERALLY ALONG A CINCINNATI TO CLARKSVILLE TO MEMPHIS LINE. THIS 
COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO ONLY SLOWLY DRIFT EASTWARD TONIGHT...AS A 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM STRENGTHENS OVER THE ARKLATEX REGION. SATELLITE 
IMAGERY REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDS OVER MOST OF THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY THIS EVENING...WITH SOME BREAKS OCCURRING OVER 
NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA. THESE CLOUDS SHOULD COMBINE WITH 
RISING DEWPOINTS TO KEEP TEMPS FROM FALLING TOO MUCH OVERNIGHT.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...AND 
WILL NOT PLAN TO UPDATE THIS EVENING.

518 
FXUS64 KMRX 012016
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 PM EST SAT MAR 1 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...CONSIDERABLE MOISTURE WILL 
LINGER OVER THE AREA DURING THE PERIOD.  A COLD FRONT WILL SLOWLY 
SAG INTO OUR AREA BY SUNDAY MID TO LATE AFTERNOON...BUT THE 
PRECIPITATION WILL BE MAINLY BEHIND IT.  WILL KEEP THINGS DRY FOR 
TONIGHT WITH CHANCE POPS REACHING INTO WESTERN ZONES AND SLIGHT 
CHANCE MUCH OF CENTRAL BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON.  WILL KEEP POPS OUT OF 
EASTERN MOUNTAINS THROUGH SUNDAY.  TEMPS WILL BE ABOVE NORMAL 
SUNDAY. WILL GENERALLY GO AT OR A BIT ABOVE MAV TEMPS FOR THE SHORT 
TERM. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...A VERY COMPLICATED
FORECAST IN PLACE FOR LATE SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY REGARDING A LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVING ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY THAT WILL LIKELY
BRING THE REGION A BOUT OF WINTER WEATHER. RAIN ON SUNDAY EVENING
WILL EVENTUALLY MIX WITH AND CHANGE OVER TO WINTERY PRECIPITATION
LATE SUNDAY NIGHT ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND CUMBERLAND
MOUNTAINS...AND EVENTUALLY SPREAD SOUTHWARD ACROSS THE VALLEY AND
INTO THE EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AFTER SUNRISE ON MONDAY. A GREAT
DEAL OF UNCERTAINTY STILL EXISTS REGARDING WHEN THE ONSET OF
SUBFREEZING AIR WILL ARRIVE AND HOW MUCH AVAILABLE MOISTURE WILL BE
PRESENT AT THAT TIME. HOWEVER...THE LATEST TRENDS ALL INDICATE A
SOUTHWARD MOVING COLD FRONT MOVING IN AROUND 12Z MONDAY AND SOME
SUBFREEZING AIR FILTERING INTO THE REGION IN ITS WAKE...WHICH WOULD
CHANGE RAIN OVER TO FREEZING RAIN AND SLEET INITIALLY AND
EVENTUALLY OVER TO SNOW AS TEMPERATURES ALOFT COOL AND THE SYSTEM
WINDS DOWN AND HEAD EAST.

THE NAM AND ECMWF SOLUTIONS BOTH INDICATE A COLDER BOUNDARY LAYER 
PROFILE AND A FASTER ONSET OF SUBFREEZING TEMPERATURES. THE NAM IN 
PARTICULAR SHOWS A PRONOUNCED WARM NOSE ALOFT ON MODEL SOUNDINGS FOR 
THE 09-15Z TIME PERIOD WHICH WOULD PROMOTE A LONGER DURATION 
FREEZING RAIN AND SLEET EVENT ONCE THE COLDER AIR SUBFREEZING AIR 
MOVES IN AT THE SURFACE. THIS ICING POTENTIAL IS EVIDENT ESPECIALLY 
ALONG THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND CUMBERLAND MOUNTAINS WHICH 
WILL EXPERIENCE THE COLDER SURFACE TEMPERATURES LONGER...COUPLED 
WITH SOME OF THE DEEPER MOISTURE. INCREASING THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME 
LOCALLY HEAVIER WINTERY PRECIPITATION IN THESE AREAS WILL BE SOME 
ENHANCED FRONTOGENESIS /AND ASSOCIATED LIFT/ TAKING PLACE ALOFT AS 
THE FRONT PUSHES THROUGH AROUND DAYBREAK. THE FREEZING RAIN/SLEET 
PROFILE WILL EVENTUALLY SAG SOUTHWARD TOWARD THE I-40/I-81 CORRIDOR 
AND THE KNOXVILLE/MORRISTOWN/TRI-CITIES METRO AREAS BY RUSH HOUR 
THROUGH PERHAPS MID-MORNING. WHILE THE MOISTURE IS NOT AS DEEP AT 
THIS TIME PERIOD...THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME LIGHT ICING AND 
POTENTIALLY SLIPPERY ROADWAYS WILL STILL EXIST ACROSS THE CENTRAL 
AND NORTHERN VALLEY. BY MID-MORNING...COLDER AIR WILL QUICKLY FILTER 
IN ALOFT AND A CHANGE OVER TO ALL SNOW IS EXPECTED ACROSS THE 
REGION. LOCATIONS ACROSS THE FOOTHILLS AND MOUNTAINS WILL LIKELY 
JUST EXPERIENCE THIS CHANGE OVER FROM RAIN TO SNOW BY THE LATE 
MORNING THROUGH THE AFTERNOON AS THE SYSTEM WINDS DOWN. SOME LIGHT 
SNOW ACCUMULATIONS OF UP TO HALF AN INCH ARE POSSIBLE IN MANY 
AREAS...WITH AMOUNTS OF 1 INCH TO PERHAPS 2 INCHES IN A FEW HIGHER 
ELEVATION AREAS POSSIBLE ACROSS FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. THE GFS ON THE OTHERHAND...IS SLIGHTLY SLOWER 
WITH THE ONSET OF THE COLDER AIR...BUT IT STILL SHOWS SOME BRIEF 
PERIODS OF FREEZING RAIN AND SNOW OVER MANY OF THE AFOREMENTIONED 
AREAS DURING MORNING. 


ONE LAST NOTE ON THE ICING POTENTIAL SHOULD BE THAT THE WARM 
ANTECEDENT TEMPERATURES AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM WILL HELP TO PREVENT 
PROBLEMS INITIALLY AS SURFACE TEMPERATURES WILL BE WARMER...BUT ONCE 
THE COLDER SUBFREEZING AIR SETTLES IN AROUND DAYBREAK...ICE 
ACCUMULATIONS /ESPECIALLY IN THE AFOREMENTIONED FAVORED AREAS/ ARE 
EXPECTED. THUS...HAVE AMENDED THE FORECAST TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS 
INCREASED POTENTIAL. WHILE MOST LOCATIONS WILL EXPERIENCE A FEW 
HUNDREDTHS OF AN INCH OF ICE ACCUMULATIONS...SOME AREAS ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN PLATEAU AND CUMBERLAND MOUNTAINS WILL SEE AMOUNTS OVER 
ONE-TENTH OF AN INCH. THESE LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS COMBINED WITH THE 
POSSIBLE LIGHT SNOW WOULD LEAD TO SOME POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS TRAVEL 
CONDITIONS IN THESE AREAS MONDAY MORNING. AN ADVISORY WILL LIKELY BE 
NEEDED FOR THESE AREAS...AND PERHAPS INTO THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL 
VALLEY FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY MORNING SHOULD THESE TRENDS 
CONTINUE. FOR NOW...WILL CONTINUE TO HANDLE WITH AN SPS. 

BEHIND THE COLD FRONT...MUCH COLDER AIR WILL RUSH INTO THE 
AREA...ALLOWING TEMPERATURES TO FALL THROUGHOUT THE DAY ON MONDAY 
AND PLUMMET MONDAY NIGHT INTO THE TEENS AS COLD AIR ADVECTION TAKES 
PLACE. DRY WEATHER IS EXPECTED FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY BEFORE THE 
NEXT STORM SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO IMPACT THE REGION SOMETIME LATE IN 
THE WEEK. HOWEVER...THE GFS IS MUCH FASTER THAN THE ECMWF BY AROUND 
A DAY TO DAY AND A HALF. THUS...HAVE BEEN CAUTIOUS WITH ADJUSTING 
POPS TOO HIGH FOR NOW AND WILL WAIT FOR ADDITIONAL MODEL RUNS.

253 
FXUS64 KMRX 010856
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EST SAT MAR 1 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE RIDGING REMAINS ACROSS THE 
AREA THROUGH THE PERIOD. UPPER TROUGH MOVES EAST OF THE AREA TODAY 
WITH ZONAL FLOW TONIGHT. LIGHT PRECIPITATION WILL EXIT THE AREA 
EARLY THIS MORNING. EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER WILL BREAK UP SOME IN THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS. LOW LEVEL THICKNESS VALUES RISE THROUGH TONIGHT. 
TEMPERATURES NEAR OR SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A DIFFICULT FORECAST EARLY IN 
THE EXTENDED.  SUNDAY...AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING SYSTEM SHOULD SEE 
WARM AND DRY CONDITIONS.  HOWEVER...HAS A STRONG COLD FRONT MOVES IN 
FROM THE NORTH...A LARGE BAND OF RAIN WILL PUSH IN SUNDAY NIGHT.  
COLD AIR WILL MOVE IN TOWARDS MORNING...AND AS THIS REACHES THE 
NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND FAR WESTERN VA COUNTIES...MAY SEE A 
FEW POCKETS OF FREEZING RAIN DEVELOP A LITTLE BEFORE SUNRISE.  THE 
COLD ADVECTION CONTINUES THROUGH THE DAY ALLOWING TEMPERATURES TO 
FALL AT TIMES DURING THE DAYTIME HOURS.  THE MAIN BAND OF RAIN 
SHOULD MOVE OUT BETWEEN 12Z AND 15Z...HOWEVER...SOME SCATTERED 
SHOWERS MAY LINGER OVER THE AREA INTO THE AFTERNOON.  WITH THE 
COLDER AIR MOVING IN...AREAS OF FREEZING DRIZZLE AND POSSIBLY EVEN 
A FEW POCKETS OF SLEET ARE POSSIBLE...MAINLY OVER THE NORTHERN THIRD 
OF THE MRX CWA.  MOST OF THESE LOCATIONS SHOULD SEE MINIMAL IF ANY 
ICE ACCUMULATIONS.  PORTIONS OF THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND 
WISE AND POSSIBLY LEE COUNTIES IN VA COULD SEE UP TO A TENTH OF AN 
INCH OF ICE.  THE SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH QUICKLY AND DRY...BUT COLD 
CONDITIONS EXPECTED FOR MONDAY NIGHT.  TEMPERATURES WILL ONCE AGAIN 
FALL INTO THE UPPER TEENS AND 20S ACROSS THE AREA.  WE WILL BE 
BETWEEN SYSTEMS TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY AS TEMPERATURES MODERATE.  THE 
NEXT SYSTEM MOVE IN FROM THE SOUTH ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND WILL 
EFFECT THE AREA THROUGH THE REST OF THE EXTENDED.  EXPECTED MOSTLY 
RAIN...ESPECIALLY DURING THE DAY BUT COULD SEE A MIX OF RAIN AND 
SNOW DURING THE OVERNIGHT HOURS...MAINLY OVER NORTHERN LOCATIONS AND 
HIGHER TERRAIN.


112 
FXUS64 KMRX 282032
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
332 PM EST FRI FEB 28 2014

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND SATURDAY/...
A WEAKENING SHORT WAVE WILL SWING ACROSS THE REGION TONIGHT/EARLY
SATURDAY. FORCING WILL BE UNIMPRESSIVE...BUT A BAND OF WEAK
ISENTROPIC LIFT MAY BRING SOME VERY LIGHT PRECIP TO THE AREA.
MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED...AND TREND OF THE MODELS HAS BEEN DRYER.
LOW LEVELS ESPECIALLY DRY TO START...SO WHAT LITTLE PRECIP FALLS
WILL HAVE A HARD TIME REACHING THE SURFACE AT LEAST AT FIRST. WILL
JUST CARRY LOW CHANCE POPS SOUTHWEST ZONES AND SLIGHT CHANCE
ELSEWHERE WITH THIS. WHILE ANY PRECIP IS EXPECTED TO BE QUITE LIGHT
AND MOST AREAS UNLIKELY TO MEASURE EVEN A HUNDREDTH...PRECIP TYPE
WILL BE PROBLEMATIC ANYWHERE PRECIP OCCURS. EVAPORATIVE COOLING MAY
LEAD TO SOME SNOW OR SLEET MIXING IN WITH THE RAIN...AND SURFACE
TEMPS MAY BE LOW ENOUGH FOR FREEZING RAIN AT LEAST IN A FEW SPOTS.
ONCE ANY PRECIP EXITS THE NORTHEAST ZONES SATURDAY...SHOULD SEE AT
LEAST SOME DECREASE IN CLOUDS...AND HIGH TEMPS CLOSE TO SEASONAL
NORMALS.

.LONG TERM SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY/...
A VERY COMPLICATED FORECAST IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD AS THE
POTENTIAL FOR SOME WINTER WEATHER WILL EXIST LATE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO
MONDAY AS A FAST-MOVING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM SHIFTS FROM THE LOWER-
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY OVERNIGHT AND
EVENTUALLY THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AFTER DAYBREAK. AHEAD OF THIS
SYSTEM...BREEZY SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS WILL PUSH HIGH TEMPERATURES
INTO THE 60S IN MOST LOCATIONS BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON. THE FAIRLY MILD
CONDITIONS WILL PERSIST INTO EVENING HOURS BEFORE A COLD FRONT WILL
RAPIDLY APPROACH THE REGION LATE IN THE NIGHT. DEPENDING ON THE
TIMING OF THIS FRONT AND ITS ASSOCIATED COLD AIR...A CHANGE OVER TO
SOME FREEZING RAIN WILL BE POSSIBLE LATE SUNDAY NIGHT ALONG THE
NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND THE CUMBERLAND MOUNTAINS OF
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. THE NAM IS MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH THE COLDER AIR
MOVING IN FASTER...AND IS COUPLED WITH SOME HEAVIER BANDS OF
PRECIPITATION AND MOISTURE. THE GFS IS NOT QUITE AS BULLISH WITH
THE MOISTURE AND THE COLDER AIR...BUT IT TOO SHOWS A QUICKER
MOVING SYSTEM AND SOME FREEZING RAIN AND SLEET OCCURRING WITHIN
THESE AREAS AS WELL BY 12Z OR SO. THE WARM ANTECEDENT TEMPERATURES
AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM WILL HELP TO PREVENT PROBLEMS INITIALLY AS
SURFACE TEMPERATURES WILL BE WARMER...BUT ONCE THE COLDER
SUBFREEZING AIR SETTLES IN AROUND DAYBREAK SOME LIGHT ICE
ACCUMULATIONS OF A FEW HUNDREDTHS OF AN INCH WILL BE POSSIBLE IN
THESE AREAS. GIVEN THE LATEST MODEL TRENDS...HAVE AMENDED THE
FORECAST TO REFLECT THESE CHANGES FOR SOME MINOR ICING. THIS SYSTEM
WILL CERTAINLY NEED TO BE MONITORED AS THE NAM IS MORE BULLISH WITH
BRINGING THE POTENTIAL FOR FREEZING RAIN AND SLEET /POSSIBLY
HEAVIER/ FURTHER SOUTH AND EAST INTO THE VALLEY. HOWEVER...IT
SHOULD BE NOTED THAT CONFIDENCE IS STILL FAIRLY LOW CONCERNING ANY
WIDESPREAD ICING OF ONE-TENTH OF AN INCH OR MORE...SO WILL REMAIN
CAUTIOUS FOR THIS ISSUANCE AND WAIT TO SEE WHICH WAY THE MODELS
TREND IN SUCCESSIVE RUNS THIS EVENING AND TONIGHT. WILL HANDLE THIS
WITH A MENTION IN THE HWO AND A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT FOR THESE
AREAS FOR NOW.

BEHIND THE INITIAL BURST OF FREEZING RAIN AND RAIN...TEMPERATURES
WILL BEGIN TO FALL THROUGH THE DAY AS COLD AIR ADVECTION TAKES
PLACE. A CHANGE OVER TO LIGHT SNOW IS EXPECTED BY THE AFTERNOON
ALONG THE PLATEAU BEFORE TAPERING OFF BY EARLY EVENING IN THE
NORTHEAST ZONES. VERY MINOR ACCUMULATIONS ARE EXPECTED IN THESE
AREAS AND MOST LOCATIONS WILL SEE NO SNOWFALL. THE SKY MAY BEGIN TO
CLEAR SLIGHTLY SOONER AS THE SYSTEM DEPARTS MONDAY NIGHT...SO HAVE
REFLECTED THIS TREND IN THE GRIDS AS WELL. DRY WEATHER IS EXPECTED
FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY BEFORE THE NEXT STORM SYSTEM IS PROGGED
TO IMPACT THE REGION SOMETIME LATE IN THE WEEK...YIELDING ANOTHER
DECENT CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION. THE GFS IS MUCH FASTER THAN THE
ECMWF BY AROUND A DAY OR SO. THUS...HAVE BEEN CAUTIOUS WITH
ADJUSTING POPS TOO HIGH FOR NOW AND WILL WAIT FOR ADDITIONAL MODEL
RUNS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             36  59  43  69  41 /  30  10  10  20  80 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  32  58  40  66  41 /  20  10  10  10  80 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       32  57  41  64  39 /  20  10  10  30  90 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              25  55  35  62  41 /  10  20  10  20  80

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EST FRI FEB 28 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...VERY DRY AIRMASS IN PLACE 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS MORNING. UPPER SHORT WAVE WILL 
MOVE QUICKLY EAST THROUGH THE TN VALLEY EARLY TONIGHT. WEAK PRESSURE 
FALLS AND WARM AIR ADVECTION TODAY IN ADVANCE OF SHORT WAVE. GOOD 
UPPER DIVERGENCE AND LIFT TONIGHT ASSOCIATED WITH SYSTEM. DECENT 
DIFFERENTIAL POTENTIAL VORTICITY MAINLY BETWEEN 01/00-01/06Z. 
AVAILABLE MOISTURE WILL BE THE LIMITING FACTOR TO PRECIPITATION 
CHANCES. LOW LEVELS WILL REMAIN RELATIVELY DRY TONIGHT AS 
PRECIPITATION EVAPORATES INTO LAYER. THUS...LOWERED POPS TOWARD 
LOWER RECENT MODEL TRENDS. FREEZING LEVEL HOLDS UP NICELY TONIGHT 
BUT SURFACE WET BULB TEMPERATURES SUPPORT SOME AREAS LOWERING TO 
FREEZING. FREEZING RAIN TOO LOW A PROBABILITY FOR NOW BUT MAY NEED 
TO BE ADDRESSED PRIOR TO TONIGHT. SATURDAY...WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT 
DEVELOPS WEST OF THE AREA AND MAY BRING LIGHT RAIN TO THE PLATEAU.
TEMPERATURES WARM TO NEAR NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...WILL QUICKLY MOVE 
INTO AN UNSETTLE WEATHER PATTERN EARLY IN THE EXTENDED AS A COLD 
FRONT APPROACHES THE AREA ON SUNDAY.  THERE IS SOME MINOR 
DIFFERENCES IN TIMING AND STRENGTH...BUT OVERALL MODELS IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE.  COULD SEE A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS 
MOVING IN LATE SUNDAY...BUT MAIN BAND OF CONVECTION WILL PUSH 
THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY FOR LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS.  AS 
THE FRONT EXITS THE REGION...COLDER AIR WILL MOVE IN AND ANY LINGER 
SHOWERS AS FLOW SHIFTS NORTHWESTWARD WILL TRANSITION TO SNOW.  WILL 
MOVE INTO A QUIET WEATHER PATTERN BETWEEN SYSTEMS TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY.  THE NEXT SYSTEM WILL MOVE IN FROM THE SOUTHWEST... 
SPREADING PRECIP FROM NORTHWEST TO NORTHEAST WEDNESDAY NIGHT... 
PROVIDING A CHANCE OF SNOW...ESPECIALLY OVER NORTHERN LOCATIONS.  
THIS SNOW WILL SWITCH TO RAIN WITH TEMPERATURES WARMING DURING THE 
DAY ON THURSDAY AS THE SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH THE REGION.

041 
FXUS64 KMRX 271952
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
252 PM EST THU FEB 27 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...ATMOSPHERE QUITE DRY OVER 
THE AREA.  CENTER OF SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL SLIDE BY TO OUR 
NORTH AND WILL BE TO OUR NORTHEAST FRIDAY.  SOME MOISTURE WILL START 
TO RETURN LATER TONIGHT AND FRIDAY...MAINLY IN THE FORM OF HIGH 
CLOUDS. WILL STICK CLOSE TO MAV TEMPS...WHICH LOOK GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE.   

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...A SHORTWAVE CLIPPER
SYSTEM WILL TRACK THROUGH THE REGION FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY
MORNING...BRINGING A BRIEF PUSH OF COLDER AIR INTO THE REGION
BEHIND THE FRONT. SOME LIGHT SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE
ENTIRE REGION LATE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY SATURDAY
MORNING...THOUGH THE MODELS DIFFER SIGNIFICANTLY WITH QPF AMOUNTS.
THE NAM IS FAR MORE BULLISH SHOWING AROUND ONE-TENTH TO TWO-TENTHS
OF LIQUID PRECIP OVER A GOOD PORTION OF THE CWA...WHILE THE GFS
YIELDS ONLY A TRACE TO ONE-HUNDREDTH IN A FEW LOCATIONS AND
INDICATES DRY CONDITIONS ELSEWHERE. GIVEN THE ABUNDANT MOISTURE AND
SOME FORCING ARRIVING LATE IN THE NIGHT...THINK THERE IS A
REASONABLE SHOT THAT MOST LOCATIONS WILL EXPERIENCE SOME MEASURABLE
PRECIPITATION...BUT NOT FOR AS LONG OF A DURATION AS THE NAM
SUGGESTS. THE OTHER QUESTION WILL BE THE POTENTIAL FOR SNOW LATE
FRIDAY NIGHT IN THE NORTHEAST ZONES AS THE COLDER AIR MOVES IN.
THINK THAT A DUSTING TO PERHAPS HALF AN INCH WILL BE POSSIBLE
ACROSS NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...WITH A COUPLE
SPOTS ALONG THE PEAKS POSSIBLY APPROACHING ONE INCH. HOWEVER...MOST
AREAS EXPERIENCE A COLD RAIN WITH SOME LIGHT SNOW MIXING IN LATE.

ANOTHER STRONGER FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION LATE 
SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY...BRINGING A MUCH BETTER OPPORTUNITY FOR 
WIDESPREAD MEANINGFUL PRECIPITATION. HAVE INCREASED POPS TO HIGH-END 
LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL DURING THIS TIME PERIOD TO REFLECT THIS 
CONFIDENCE. A STRONG SOUTHWEST FLOW AHEAD OF THE FRONT ON SUNDAY 
WILL PUSH HIGHS WELL INTO THE 60S TO AROUND 70 DEGREES IN SOME 
SPOTS. THE WARM CONDITIONS OVERNIGHT INTO MONDAY WILL KEEP 
PRECIPITATION ALL RAIN EXCEPT AT THE TAIL END OF THE EVENT LATE 
MONDAY NIGHT WHEN SOME LIGHT SNOW COULD MIX IN LATE ALONG THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN OF THE NORTHEAST ZONES. A DRY AND FAIRLY SEASONABLE PATTERN 
WILL THEN SET-UP FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY BEFORE MODELS DIVERGE 
GREATLY FOR DAY 7 ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. THE ECMWF SHOWS A 
STRONG UPPER-LOW TRACKING OVER THE REGION BRINGING WIDESPREAD HEAVY 
PRECIPITATION TO THE AREA...WHILE THE GFS INDICATES A MUCH WEAKER 
TROUGH AND FAIRLY DRY WEATHER. FOR NOW...HAVE BEEN CAUTIOUS AND HAVE 
ONLY LOW-END CHANCE POPS FOR THE EXTENDED...AND WILL WAIT TO SEE HOW 
THINGS SHAKE OUT WITH FUTURE MODEL RUNS IN THE COMING DAY OR TWO. 


&&

THUS...AN EXTENDED PERIOD OF VFR CONDITIONS.

738 
FXUS64 KMRX 261954
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
254 PM EST WED FEB 26 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL EXTEND 
INTO THE AREA TONIGHT...THEN A WEAKENING AND DRY COLD FRONT WILL 
PUSH THROUGH THURSDAY...WITH LITTLE EFFECT EXCEPT TO INCREASE THE 
WINDS A BIT.  THE ATMOSPHERE OVER THE AREA WILL REMAIN QUITE 
DRY...SO THE SKY SHOULD BE MAINLY CLEAR. WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM MAV 
TEMPS...WHICH LOOK REASONABLE OVERALL.  RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES 
WILL BE QUITE LOW THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND WINDS WILL BE 
SIGNIFICANT...BUT AT THIS POINT IT DOES NOT LOOK LIKE WINDS WILL BE 
STRONG ENOUGH TO REACH RED FLAG WARNING CRITERIA...SO NO WATCH OR 
WARNING AT THIS POINT.   

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WITH 
COLD AND DRY WEATHER CONTINUES THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. MUCH BELOW 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES AGAIN THURSDAY NIGHT WITH LOWS IN THE TEENS TO 
LOWER 20S. RIDGE SHIFTS EAST FRIDAY NIGHT WITH ANOTHER SYSTEM 
DROPPING DOWN FROM THE GREAT LAKES. TEMPERATURES WILL DROP TO BE 
JUST COLD ENOUGH NE AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS FOR A LITTLE LIGHT SNOW 
LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY. FOR THE WEEKEND UPPER LEVEL 
RIDGING OVER THE GULF BUILDS NORTH INTO THE SOUTHEAST STATES. 
TEMPERATURES REBOUND TO ABOVE NORMAL. SATURDAY HIGHER PRESSURE 
RETURNS. THEN SUNDAY WARM FRONT TO THE NORTH AND SOUTHWEST FLOW WILL 
WARM TEMPERATURES EVEN MORE. LATE SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY WET PATTERN 
RETURNS AS SURFACE LOW TO THE SOUTHWEST FORMS AND MOVES NORTHEAST. 
THIS FRONT MOVES SLOWLY THROUGH THE REGION MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. 
PRECIPITATION MOVES OUT TUESDAY WITH RAIN POSSIBLY CHANGING TO SNOW 
ESPECIALLY NORTHERN SECTIONS BEFORE ENDING. TEMPERATURES AGAIN MUCH 
COLDER BEHIND FRONT TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY AS COLD HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS BACK INTO THE REGION.

939 
FXUS64 KMRX 260844
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 AM EST WED FEB 26 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LIGHT SNOW STREAKING OUT IN WEST 
THROUGH EAST FASHION JUST SOUTH OF THE OHIO VALLEY IN ASSOCIATION 
WITH AN UPPER TROUGH. KEPT THE SAME FORECAST IDEOLOGY GOING FROM 
PREVIOUS FORECAST WHICH BASICALLY HAS LIKELY POPS ACROSS SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA AND EXTREME NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AS THIS BAND OF LIGHT SNOW 
DROPS SOUTH ACROSS THIS REGION OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. 
MOISTURE IS LIMITED AND LIFT NOT TERRIBLY IMPRESSIVE WITH THIS 
FEATURE AND ASSOCIATED MODIFIED ARCTIC SURFACE BOUNDARY. THEREFORE 
WHILE LIGHT SNOW MAY OCCUR IN THIS AREA...AND TO A LESSER EXTENT 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND OVER THE SMOKY 
MOUNTAINS...ACCUMULATION WILL BE MAINLY LIMITED TO THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN WHERE UP TO AN INCH IS POSSIBLE. ONLY A MINOR DUSTING IS 
EXPECTED IN THE VALLEYS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. FARTHER SOUTH 
ACROSS CENTRAL EAST AND A SMALL PART OF SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE WOULD 
EXPECT JUST A COUPLE FLURRIES. MODEL FORECASTS INDICATE A CLEARING 
TREND FOR THE AFTERNOOON HOURS AS THE UPPER TROUGH SHIFTS EAST. 
UNDERCUT MOS MAX TEMPS BY SEVERAL DEGREES TODAY AS THE NEW ARCTIC 
SURGE SPREADS ACROSS THE AREA AND WENT SLIGHTLY BELOW SUGGESTED MINS 
TONIGHT IN THE CLEAR SKY AND DRY AIR ENVIRONMENT EXPECTED ACROSS THE 
REGION.  

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A REINFORCING SHOT OF COLD 
AIR MOVES IN THURSDAY AS A CLOSED LOW TRACKS ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES. 
THE COLUMN REMAINS VERY DRY WITH THE FRONT/TROUGH PASSAGE...SO NO 
PRECIP IS EXPECTED. A RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE AREA FRIDAY...FOLLOWED 
BY A BACKING WINDS AHEAD OF A SHORTWAVE TROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. THIS 
WILL RESULT IN SOME ISENTROPIC LIFT AND LIGHT PRECIP FRIDAY 
NIGHT...PERHAPS LINGERING INTO SATURDAY MORNING IN NE SECTIONS. 
TEMPS MAY BE COLD ENOUGH FOR A LITTLE SNOW IN SW VA AND HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS...BUT THE FAST MOVEMENT WILL KEEP ANY ACCUMULATIONS 
LIGHT. THE NAM SHOWS A BIT OF A WARM NOSE DEVELOPING BEFORE THE 
PRECIP ENDS...SUGGESTING A PERIOD OF SLEET/FZRA IS POSSIBLE. AT THIS 
TIME THE WARM NOSE APPEARS WEAK...SO WILL NOT MENTION ANY MIXED 
PRECIP YET...BUT IT WILL BEAR WATCHING IN LATER FORECASTS.

THE PATTERN TURNS WARMER AND MORE MOIST FOR THE WEEKEND AS HIGH 
PRESSURE OFF THE GA/FL COAST PROVIDES A DEEP SW FLOW. TEMPERATURES 
WILL RISE ABOVE NORMAL. A BOUNDARY SETS UP FROM TX/OK TO THE OHIO 
VALLEY...PARALLEL TO THE MID/UPPER FLOW. THUS PRECIP WILL BE SLOW TO 
MOVE INTO THE AREA ON SUNDAY...BUT BY SUNDAY NIGHT POPS BEGIN TO 
RISE AS THE FRONT BEGINS TO SAG SOUTHEAST AND TH UPPER JET DRAWS 
CLOSER. THE GFS AND ECMWF HAVE SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES DUE TO THE 
ECMWF HAVING A MORE WELL DEFINED AND PROGRESSIVE 500 MB TROUGH...BUT 
THE GEFS MEMBERS SEEM TO BE CLUSTERING AROUND MONDAY MORNING FOR 
HIGHEST PRECIP CHANCES. WILL RAISE POPS TO LIKELY THIS PERIOD. THE 
MORE PROGRESSIVE ECMWF ENDS PRECIP QUICKLY MONDAY NIGHT...BUT THE 
GFS BRINGS A SECONDARY TROUGH THROUGH ON TUESDAY...WITH ANOTHER SHOT 
OF COLD AIR BEHIND IT. WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING FOR 
TUESDAY AS WAS PREVIOUSLY FORECAST.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             42  20  46  21  52 /  10   0   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  37  19  42  20  49 /  20   0   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       36  18  42  18  48 /  20   0   0   0  10

.AVIATION...WEATHER WILL BE DOMINATED BY AN UPPER TROUGH EXTENDING
SOUTH FROM HUDSON BAY THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES DURING THE PERIOD.

RIPPLE IS STREAKING RAPIDLY EAST ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH AND A COUPLE

OF SHORT WAVE LIFT MOVES EAST. THE LOW DECK MAY CLEAR OUT AROUND
MID DAY AT CHA AND TYS BUT MAY TAKE SEVERAL MORE HOURS BEFORE THE
VFR LOW DECK DISSIPATES AT TRI. ALL CONSIDERED IT APPEARS THAT

642 
FXUS64 KMRX 260213
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
910 PM EST TUE FEB 25 2014

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. TALE OF TWO JETS PLAYING OUT. WEAK 
SOUTHERN JET WILL STRENGTHEN SLIGHTLY OVER AL/GA OVERNIGHT. THIS 
WILL KEEP BULK OF SOUTHERN PRECIPITATION AREA SHUNTED SOUTH. TAIL 
END OF NORTHERN STREAM WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA EARLY WEDNESDAY. 
DECENT LIFT PROVIDE BY JET BUT MOISTURE IS LIMITED. PRECIPITATION 
CHANCES OUTSIDE OF VA REMAIN LOW AND SNOW AMOUNTS WILL BE LIGHT. 
ADJUSTED CURRENT DEW POINTS DOWNWARD. MIN TEMPS SLIGHTLY BELOW 
GUIDANCE LOOKS GOOD OVERNIGHT. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL QUICKLY 
MOVE THROUGH LATE TONIGHT INTO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING.  MODELS 
TRENDING A BIT DRIER AND WEAKER.  STILL EXPECT LOW TO MID LEVEL 
CLOUDS MOVING IN LATE TONIGHT.  LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS WILL DEVELOP BUT 
COVERAGE SHOULD BE FAIRLY LOW WITH BEST CHANCE OVER NORTHERN AREAS 
AND HIGHER TERRAIN.  HOWEVER...THERE IS A DISTURBANCE TRACKING TO 
OUR SOUTH THAT MAY AID SHOWER DEVELOPMENT OVER SOUTHERN LOCATIONS.  
OVERALL...PRECIP AMOUNTS LOOK LOW WITH MOST LOWER ELEVATIONS SOUTH 
RECEIVING LITTLE TO NO ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL.  A COUPLE OF TENTH OF 
SNOW IS POSSIBLE NORTH.  HIGHER ELEVATIONS MAY AVERAGE AROUND A HALF 
INCH WITH A FEW FAVORED LOCATIONS SEE UP TO AN INCH.  THE SYSTEM 
MOVES OUT QUICKLY AND DRY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED BY AFTERNOON.  
BEHIND THE FRONT...MUCH COLDER AIR WILL BEGIN TO SETTLE INTO THE 
REGION...AND WEDNESDAY/S HIGHS WILL BE WELL BELOW NORMAL.

LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...GOOD CONTINUITY AND 
MODEL CONSENSUS FOR EXPECTED WEATHER PATTERNS THROUGH SATURDAY. 
HOWEVER...MODELS ARE STILL QUITE DIVERGENT WITH THE DEVELOPING UPPER 
TROUGH FOR SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...ESPECIALLY ON TIMING THE SYSTEM 
MOVING THROUGH THE APPALACHIANS. ECMWF IS STILL ABOUT 6 TO 12 HOURS 
FASTER...WHICH COULD LEAD TO DRY WEATHER AS EARLY AS MONDAY NIGHT 
AND CERTAINLY TUESDAY. GFS WAS MUCH SLOWER WITH THE 00Z MODEL RUN... 
BUT STILL SOMEWHAT SLOWER THAN LATEST ECMWF WITH THE 12Z RUN TODAY. 

MINOR CHANGES I MADE FOR SENSIBLE WEATHER WAS TO GO LOW END OF 
LIKELY ON POPS FOR MONDAY...SUPPORTED BY EITHER SOLUTION. AN 
INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH AXIS WILL EXTEND N TO NE INTO THE REGION 
SUNDAY NIGHT WITH A COLD FRONT APPROACHING BY MONDAY MORNING. WENT 
WITH SHOWERS AT THIS POINT GIVEN THE LACK OF INSTABILITY. HAD TO 
KEEP SOME POPS IN FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND SLIGHT CHANCE ON TUESDAY 
UNTIL MODELS AGREE BETTER ON TIMING. 

OTHERWISE...EXCEPT FOR FRIDAY NIGHT...KEEPING A MOSTLY DRY FORECAST 
FOR THE EARLY PERIODS OF THE LONG TERM...AND ACTUALLY LITTLE CHANGES 
WERE MADE FOR THOSE PERIODS. MADE SOME SIGNIFICANT TWEAKS TO 
TEMPERATURES FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...ESPECIALLY TO RAISE MAX TEMPS 
GIVEN THE BUILDING UPPER RIDGE AND S-SW LOW LEVEL FLOW. IF ECMWF 
TRENDS SLOWER SIMILAR TO GFS...THEN NEXT SHIFT MAY NEED TO PUSH 
SUNDAY MAX TEMPS UP A FEW MORE DEGREES. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  30  40  21  47  22 /  40  20   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    29  35  20  43  19 /  40  30   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN            27  34  18  42  20 /  40  30   0   0   0

159 
FXUS64 KMRX 250828
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
328 AM EST TUE FEB 25 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
AN AREA OF DENSE CLOUD COVER IS BUILDING IN FROM THE WEST THIS 
MORNING. THE MODELS SEEM TO HAVE A HANDLE ON THIS...AND SHOW THESE 
CLOUDS DISSIPATING IN THE AFTERNOON. IN ADDITION...A 850 MB TROUGH 
MOVES THROUGH THIS MORNING...WITH WEAK COLD ADVECTION DEVELOPING 
BEHIND. THIS WILL MAKE FOR A TRICKY TEMPERATURE FORECAST TODAY. WENT 
A BIT BELOW MOS GUIDANCE CONSIDERING THE AMOUNT OF UPSTREAM CLOUD 
COVER...MAKING ME SKEPTICAL OF MUCH AFTERNOON CLEARING. WILL KEEP 
TODAY DRY AS MOISTURE IS CONFINED TO THE 850-700 MB LAYER WITH VERY 
WEAK LIFT. 

NAM AND GFS APPEAR TO BE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE TROUGH PASSAGE 
TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY MORNING. BOTH SHOW A DISCONNECT BETWEEN THE 
NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN STREAM JETS UNTIL THE TROUGH MOVES WELL EAST. 
THIS SHOULD MEAN WEAK FORCING AND LIMITED MOISTURE AS THE 
FAST-MOVING NORTHERN STREAM WILL BE THE MAIN PLAYER FOR OUR AREA. 
STRONG COLD ADVECTION DEVELOPS LATE TONIGHT...WITH LIGHT SNOW COMING 
MAINLY BETWEEN 08Z AND 12Z. HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SW VA AND NE TN 
COULD SEE AROUND ONE INCH ACCUMULATION WHERE UPSLOPE FLOW WILL AID 
PRECIP...AND SNOW-LIQUID RATIOS MAY BE HIGH. MOST LOCATIONS IN THE 
NORTHERN PLATEAU AND NORTHERN VALLEY MAY SEE A FEW TENTHS AT BEST. 
TIMING AROUND SUNRISE COULD POSE SOME MORNING COMMUTE ISSUES...SO 
WILL ISSUE AN SPS. 

THE REST OF THE PERIOD WILL FEATURE TEMPERATURES WELL BELOW NORMAL 
AS THE LONGWAVE TROUGH SETS UP OVER THE EAST COAST AND A DEEP NW 
FLOW PERSISTS OVER THE AREA. ANOTHER SHOT OF COLD AIR ARRIVES ON 
THURSDAY AS A CLOSED LOW TRACKS ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
GFS/ECMWF RELATIVELY CLOSE IN DEPICTION OF EXPECTED WEATHER
THROUGH MOST OF THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST.
HOWEVER...DETERMINISTIC RUNS ARE WILDLY OUT OF SYNC LATER SUNDAY
NIGHT INTO MONDAY AND BEYOND. THEREFORE...CONFIDENCE QUITE A BIT
LOWER THAN USUAL AT THE END OF THE LONG TERM. FRIDAY BASICALLY
STARTS OUT DRY BUT A FAST MOVING LOW AMPLITUDE SHORT WAVE BUILDS
EAST FROM THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY LATER IN THE DAY FRIDAY EXITING
ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS AROUND THE 12Z SATURDAY TIME FRAME. STAYED
WITH MEDIUM TO HIGH CHANCE POPS FOR LIGHT RAIN AND SOME LIGHT SNOW
AS SURFACE TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED TO BE TOO COLD FOR RAIN
ESPECIALLY AFTER MIDNIGHT. LOWERED POPS QUITE A BIT BEHIND THIS
WAVE WHICH APPEARS TO DEPART SATURDAY MORNING. THIS ALLOWS FOR
ABOUT A 24 HOUR BREAK IN THE ACTION CONCERNING PRECIPITATION WITH
AMPLIFICATION IN THE UPPER PATTERN DEVELOPING. UPPER LEVEL RIDGING
WITH INCREASING SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT HELPS TO BOOST MAX
TEMPERATURES BACK CLOSE TO NORMAL SUNDAY INTO MONDAY. ALONG WITH
THE WARM UP WILL COME INCREASING MOISTURE ON SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL
FLOW WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS SUNDAY AFTERNOON WITH AN
APPROACHING UPPER TROUGH. SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY IS WHERE THE
MODELS REALLY DIVERGE WITH THE ECMWF SMOKING AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH
AND MID LATITUDE CYCLONE THROUGH THE EASTERN U.S. WHILE THE GFS IS
MUCH SLOWER TO ADVANCE THIS SYSTEM EAST. (ALONG WITH SURROUNDING
WFOS) WENT CLOSER TO THE SLOWER GFS ALLOWING FOR HIGHEST POPS FOR
SHOWERS ON SUNDAY NIGHT AND THEN HOLDING ONTO AT LEAST 40 PERCENT
POPS MONDAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT.

068 
FXUS64 KMRX 250156 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
856 PM EST MON FEB 24 2014

.DISCUSSION...
FAIRLY BENIGN CONDITIONS ARE IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION THIS
EVENING AS A COOL AND DRY POST-FRONTAL AIR MASS IS PROMOTING MOSTLY
CLEAR CONDITIONS. DEWPOINTS ARE ACTUALLY IN THE LOW TO MID TEENS
OVER MUCH OF THE REGION THIS EVENING...CREATING DEWPOINT
DEPRESSIONS OF 25 TO 30 DEGREES IN MANY SPOTS. THIS DRY AIR ALONG
WITH THE CLEAR SKY AND LIGHT WINDS HAS ALLOWED FOR GOOD RADIATIONAL
COOLING AS TEMPERATURES HAVE DROPPED INTO THE 40S AND EVEN THE
UPPER 30S IN A FEW SPOTS AS OF 9 PM EST. SOME CLOUD COVER SHOULD
INCREASE OVERNIGHT AS THE NEXT TROUGH OF LOW PRESSURE APPROACHES
THE AREA FROM THE WEST...BUT THEY WILL MAINLY BE IN THE FORM OF
HIGH-LEVEL CLOUDS UNTIL DAYBREAK ON TUESDAY. THUS...AM STILL
EXPECTING LOWS TO BOTTOM OUT IN THE MID TO UPPER 20S ACROSS
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...WITH READINGS JUST IN
THE LOW TO MID 30S ELSEWHERE ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN
VALLEY.
