622 
FXUS64 KMRX 241938
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EST MON FEB 24 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE 
AREA THIS EVENING WILL SLOWLY LIFT OUT OVERNIGHT ALLOWING A WEAK 
SHORT WAVE TO PUSH THROUGH ON TUESDAY.  THE RESULT WILL BE DRY 
CONDITION WITH INCREASING CLOUDS LATE TONIGHT.  ON TUESDAY...THE 
SHORT WAVE MOVES THROUGH.  LITTLE MOISTURE OR LIFT IS ASSOCIATED 
WITH THE WAVE AND EXPECT A BAND OF LOWER TO MID LEVEL CLOUDS TO MOVE 
IN WITH A FEW AREAS OF SLIGHT MAINLY RAIN OR SPRINKLES POSSIBLE 
MAINLY DURING THE LATE MORNING INTO EARLY AFTERNOON.  COVERAGE 
SHOULD BE MINIMAL AND WILL KEEP POPS AT 20.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...APPEARS TO BE 3 SYSTEMS 
CAPABLE OF CREATING CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION IN THE LONG TERM...AND 
WITH TEMPS FALLING FROM THOSE NICE AND MILD WEEKEND VALUES...A 
MENTION OF SNOW IS REQUIRED. THE INITIAL SYSTEM IS TUESDAY NIGHT 
INTO WEDNESDAY WITH VERY CLOSE TIMING AS FROM EARLIER MODEL RUNS. 
THERE IS UNCERTAINTY DUE TO SOME PHASING WITH THE NRN AND SRN STREAM 
ENERGY POSSIBLE...BUT HARD TO DETERMINE HOW STRONG ANY FORCING WILL 
BE. FAVORED THE NAM AND SREF SOLUTIONS OVER THE GFS SPREADING LIGHT 
PRECIPITATION OVER TOO MUCH OF THE REGION. THE NAM AND SREF ARE MORE 
LOCALIZED...WITH THE BEST LIFT AND LIGHTER QPF ACROSS SW VA/NE TN 
AND THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF E TN. THIS ALSO FITS WELL WITH PREVIOUS 
GRIDS...ADJACENT NWS GRIDS AND THE LATEST WWD GRAPHICS. THUS...WILL 
CONTINUE SOME LIKELY POPS ACROSS SW VA AND HIGHER TERRAIN OF NE 
TN...WITH A MENTION OF UP TO 2 INCHES OF SNOW FOR AREAS SUCH AS WISE 
COUNTY VA. ALSO ADDING THIS TO OUR HWO PRODUCT IN THE AFTERNOON 
UPDATE.

A SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM WILL THEN ATTEMPT TO BRING MOSTLY RAIN TO 
THE REGION FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. 850 MB TEMPS ARE COLD ENOUGH 
FOR A MENTION OF LIGHT SNOW FROM ABOUT 09Z TO 15Z SATURDAY...MAINLY 
ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN. NUDGED POPS UP TO AROUND 40 PERCENT FOR NOW.

A DEEPER SHORTWAVE TROUGH LOOKS MORE ROBUST FOR MONDAY...DEVELOPING 
ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY REGION. THIS SYSTEM WOULD BE 
WARMER SO NO MENTION OF SNOW JUST RAIN SHOWERS (POSSIBLE THUNDER). A 
BIT EARLY TO INTRODUCE WITH LIKELY OR HIGHER POPS...SO WENT WITH A 
SOLID 40 PERCENT CHANCE. 

24/12Z GFSX MOS TEMPS WERE CLOSE TO 24/00Z GUIDANCE AND GENERALLY 
FOLLOWED. MODELS ARE ADVERTISING LESS CLOUDINESS ON SUNDAY...SO I 
DID BOOST OUR MAX TEMPS UP FOR SUNDAY ABOVE THE PREVIOUS GRIDS.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 AM EST MON FEB 24 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A COLD FRONT HAS MOVED THROUGH THE AREA EARLY THIS 
MORNING...AND ASSOCIATED PRECIP HAS EXITED TO THE EAST. COLD
ADVECTION THROUGH THE DAY WILL COUNTER-BALANCE DECREASING CLOUDS.
STAYED CLOSE TO MOS GUIDANCE FOR HIGH TEMPS...IN THE UPPER 40S
NORTH TO UPPER 50S SOUTH. TONIGHT WILL BE MOSTLY CLEAR AND
CALM...WITH SOME HIGH TO MID LEVEL CLOUDS COMING IN LATE AHEAD OF A
BROAD SHORTWAVE TROUGH.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL PRODUCE DRY CONDITIONS ACROSS THE
AREA TUESDAY...BUT A NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN STREAM JETS WILL PRODUCE
THE NEXT ROUGH OF PRECIPITATION FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY
MORNING. MODELS CONTINUE TO HAVE DISAGREEMENTS ON THE AMOUNT OF
PHASING BETWEEN THE NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN STREAM WAVES. CURRENTLY
GFS AND NAM SEEM CLOSER WITH THE ECMWF NOW THE WEAKEST OF THE THREE
MODELS. WILL CALL FOR PRECIPITATION DEVELOPING TUESDAY NIGHT WITH A
RAIN TO SNOW ANTICIPATED. LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS
POSSIBLE...MAINLY FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

FOR WEDNESDAY MORNING...NORTHWEST FLOW OROGRAPHIC FLOW WILL HIGH 
CHANCE OF SNOW FOR THE FAVORED NORTHWEST FACING SLOPES WITH 
ADDITIONAL LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS.

FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT...SURFACE RIDGING AND DRY 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL PRODUCE DRY CONDITIONS. MAIN WEATHER STORY 
WILL BE UNSEASONABLY COLD CONDITIONS.

FOR LATE FRIDAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...THE GFS AND ECMWF AGREE WITH 
A SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT-WAVE MOVING FROM TEXAS INTO THE GULF COAST 
STATES WITH PRECIPITATION MOVING ACROSS THE AREA. A MIXTURE OF 
RAIN/SNOW NORTH AND RAIN SOUTH ANTICIPATED.

FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...MODELS SHOW A GOOD DEAL OF BOUNDARY LAYER 
MOISTURE REMAINING OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS DUE TO AN INVERTED 
TROUGH OVER THE AREA. SOME WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE AREA WILL 
KEEP PLENTY OF CLOUDS AND CHANCE OF DRIZZLE OVER THE AREA. DUE TO 
ABUNDANT CLOUD COVER...WENT A CAT OR TWO BELOW GFS MOS HIGHS FOR 
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
904 PM EST SUN FEB 23 2014

.DISCUSSION...
THIS EVENING...A WEAK COLD FRONT CONTINUES TO TRACK TOWARD THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION AND THE TENNESSEE VALLEY...BRINGING
WIDESPREAD CLOUD COVERAGE AND EVENTUALLY SOME LIGHT SHOWERS TO
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE...THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA. GIVEN THE WARMER TEMPERATURES AHEAD OF THE FRONT...THIS
PRECIPITATION WILL START OFF AS RAIN AND EVENTUALLY MIX WITH OR
CHANGE ALL OVER TO SNOW IN THE HIGHER ELEVATION LATE TONIGHT AS THE
COLDER AIR FILTERS INTO THE REGION BEHIND THE FRONT. HOWEVER...
GIVEN THE WARM CONDITIONS THAT HAVE BEEN IN PLACE OVER THE REGION
FOR THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS...GROUND TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE FAIRLY
WARM FOR THE DURATION OF THE EVENT. ADDITIONALLY...GIVEN THE LIGHT
NATURE OF THIS PRECIPITATION...VERY MINOR ACCUMULATIONS OF SNOW ARE
EXPECTED...AND THEY WOULD ONLY BE CONFINED TO THE HIGHEST
ELEVATIONS. OTHERWISE...LOWS IN THE LOW TO MID 30S WILL BE COMMON
OVER THE AREA WITH COOLER NORTHWESTERLY WINDS USHERING IN THE NEW
AIR MASS BY DAYBREAK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EST SUN FEB 23 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND 
CUMBERLAND MOUNTAINS...WITH A VERY WARM AND DRY AIR MASS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. THIS COLD FRONT IS EXPECTED TO SLOWLY DRIFT THROUGH 
THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...WITH A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE 
HELPING TO GENERATE SOME LIGHT PRECIP OVER MAINLY THE NORTHERN HALF 
OF THE FORECAST AREA. HIGH PRESSURE THEN BUILDS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA ON MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT...WITH COOLER BUT NEAR NORMAL TEMPS 
EXPECTED THROUGH TUESDAY. A STRONGER COLD FRONT WILL THEN MOVE INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY NIGHT...WITH A MORE AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH HELPING TO GENERATE A BETTER CHANCE FOR PRECIP. MODELS STILL 
HAVE DISAGREEMENTS WITH HOW MUCH MOISTURE WILL BE ASSOCIATED WITH 
THIS COLD FRONT...SO WILL KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE CATEGORY FOR NOW. 
AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT 
THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME DIFFERENCES 
ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...ANY REMAINING SCATTERED SNOW 
SHOWERS OVER THE AREA WEDNESDAY MORNING WILL END FROM WEST TO EAST 
AS THE SYSTEM PULLS AWAY FROM THE AREA. ANY ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS 
WILL BE MINOR AND SHOULD BE CONFINED TO FAR NORTHERN AND EASTERN 
LOCATIONS. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BEGIN TO BUILD IN DURING THE 
AFTERNOON. HOWEVER...BEHIND THE EXITING SYSTEM...MUCH COLDER AIR 
WILL PUSH IN AND LOOK FOR OVERNIGHT LOWS WEDNESDAY NIGHT TO FALL 
INTO THE TEENS ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA. WILL BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS WITH 
GENERALLY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT THURSDAY AND WITH LATE WINTER SUNSHINE... 
TEMPERATURES WILL SLOWLY BEGIN TO MODERATE. MODELS BEGIN TO DIVERGE 
LATE IN THE EXTENDED...ESPECIALLY IN TIMING OF THE NEXT SYSTEM. WILL 
GO WITH LOW POPS FRIDAY AS THE NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES THE AREA... 
WITH BEST CHANCE OF PRECIP FRIDAY NIGHT AND LINGERING INTO SATURDAY. 
PRECIP THAT FALLS DURING THE DAY AND EARLY EVENING SHOULD FALL AS 
RAIN WITH RAIN TRANSITION OVER TO SNOW FRIDAY NIGHT AND EARLY 
SATURDAY. THE SYSTEM SHOULD MOVE OUT FOR A DRY DAY ON SUNDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
313 AM EST SUN FEB 23 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
WEAK CHANNELLED VORTICITY WILL BRING SOME MIDLEVEL CLOUDS TO THE 
AREA TODAY...BUT THE SURFACE AIR MASS REMAINS QUITE DRY. LOW LEVELS 
BEGIN TO MOISTEN A BIT MORE TOWARD THE EVENING AS A FRONT APPROACHES 
FROM THE NORTHWEST. SOME LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE NEAR THE FRONTAL ZONE 
PROVIDES SOME LIFT IN THE 03-09Z TIMEFRAME...MAINLY IN NORTHERN 
AREAS. BUT LIMITED MOISTURE DEPTH WILL KEEP QPF LIGHT AND POPS IN 
THE SLIGHT TO LOW CHANCE RANGE. WITH FROPA BETWEEN 06Z AND 
09Z...TEMPS WILL BE FALLING AND MAY CHANGE PRECIP TO SNOW BRIEFLY 
LATE TONIGHT BEFORE MOISTURE MOVES OUT BY 12Z. EXPECT THAT THIS WILL 
BE MAINLY AT OR ABOVE 2500 FT ELEVATIONS. TEMPS WILL BE COOLER FOR 
MONDAY...WITH HIGHS IN THE MID 40S NORTH TO MID 50S SOUTH.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE OVER THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT. NAM
AND GFS DIFFER ON EXTENT OF MOISTURE RETURN FOR TUESDAY AS HIGH
MOVES EAST OF THE AREA. WILL CONTINUE WITH A LOW CHANCE POP FOR
TUESDAY BUT CONFIDENCE IS LOW. FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY
MORNING...GFS AND ECMWF CONTINUES TO DIFFER ON THE EXTENT OF
PHASING BETWEEN THE NORTHERN STREAM SHORT-WAVE TROUGH OVER THE
GREAT LAKES AND SOUTHERN STREAM ENERGY MOVING ACROSS THE GULF
COASTS. THE ECMWF IS THE MOST AGGRESSIVE MODEL. WILL CONTINUE WITH
CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION. IF THE ECMWF IS RIGHT...THEN ANOTHER ROUND
OF SNOWFALL IS POSSIBLE TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY MORNING.

MORE ZONAL UPPER FLOW AND SURFACE RIDGING FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING PRODUCING DRY CONDITIONS. BOTH THE GFS AND 
ECMWF SHOW A SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM MOVING ACROSS THE GULF COAST 
STATES AND TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING.

OVERALL...COLDER THAN NORMAL TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD.

TEMPERATURES ARE RANGING FROM THE UPPER 40S AND LOWER 50S ACROSS
THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY TO THE LOWER 40S OVER THE NORTHERN
VALLEY AS OF 02Z. GIVEN THE CLEAR AND CALM CONDITIONS...GOOD
RADIATIONAL COOLING IS TAKING PLACE AND LOWS SHOULD DROP INTO THE
30S IN MOST LOCATIONS BY DAYBREAK...WITH LOCATIONS ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN VALLEY HOVERING AROUND 40 DEGREES. ADJUSTED DEWPOINTS DOWN
AS WELL AS CLOUD COVER SOMEWHAT TO ACCOUNT FOR THE DRIER AIR IN
PLACE ACROSS THE REGION.

995 
FXUS64 KMRX 221952
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EST SAT FEB 22 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE CAROLINAS...WITH A WEAK COLD FRONT 
OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. THIS COLD FRONT IS EXPECTED TO ONLY 
SLOWLY DRIFT TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT AND SUNDAY...AS THE 
UPPER-LEVEL FLOW REMAINS ZONAL AND NEARLY PARALLEL TO THE BOUNDARY. 
AS A RESULT...THINK DRY CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL THROUGH SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON...BUT WITH CLOUDS INCREASING DURING THE DAY. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR 
TONIGHT AND SUNDAY...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME DIFFERENCES ARE 
NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE 
THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT/EARLY MONDAY AND WILL BRING A SLIGHT 
CHANCE FOR PRECIP ACROSS NE TN...SW VA AND ACROSS THE SMOKIES. A FEW 
AREAS WILL SEE A TRANSITION FROM RAIN TO SNOW OVERNIGHT AS 
TEMPERATURES EVENTUALLY APPROACH FREEZING. PRECIPITATION IS EXPECTED 
TO BE LIGHT AND NO SNOW ACCUMULATION IS EXPECTED. 

MONDAY WILL BE ROUGHLY 10 TO 15 DEGREES COOLER COMPARED TO SUNDAY... 
AS WE WILL BE IN A POST FRONTAL AIRMASS. HAVING SAID THAT... 
TEMPERATURES WILL STILL BE CLOSE TO NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. 
MONDAY REMAINS DRY AS WE ARE IN ZONAL FLOW WITH THE FRONT WELL OFF 
TO OUR SOUTH AND EAST. 

TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY IS STILL IN QUESTION REGARDING PRECIP 
CHANCES AND AMOUNT DUE TO THE TIMING OF AN APPROACHING UPPER LEVEL 
TROUGH AND SOUTHERN STREAM JET. LATEST MODEL RUNS LAG THE COLD FRONT 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER TROUGH WELL BEHIND THE SOUTHERN STREAM 
MOISTURE TO OUR SOUTH. THIS KEEPS TUESDAYS TEMPS VERY SIMILAR TO 
MONDAY WITH THE BIG COOL DOWN NOT OCCURRING UNTIL WEDNESDAY...AS THE 
COLD FRONT DOESN'T MOVE THROUGH UNTIL LATE TUESDAY NIGHT/EARLY 
WEDNESDAY MORNING. THIS WOULD KEEP TUESDAY ALL RAIN WITH A 
TRANSITION OVER TO SNOW TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. THE GFS SHOWS 
THE BULK OF THE MOISTURE TO OUR SOUTH AND SUGGEST A DRIER FRONTAL 
PASSAGE. THE ECMWF ALSO KEEPS MOST OF THE MOISTURE SOUTH BUT SHOWS A 
WETTER FRONTAL PASSAGE. WILL LEAVE POPS RELATIVELY UNCHANGED FROM 
PREVIOUS SHIFT WITH CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY/TUESDAY NIGHT WITH 
SLIGHT CHANCE BY WEDNESDAY. POPS COULD STILL CHANGE QUITE A BIT 
DURING THE TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY PERIOD...DEPENDING ON TIMING OF 
THE AFOREMENTIONED FEATURES. WEDNESDAY LOOKS TO BE AROUND 15 DEGREES 
COOLER THAN TUESDAY...DUE TO THE FRONTAL PASSAGE RESULTING IN HIGHS 
AROUND 15 TO 18 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. WEDNESDAY NIGHT WILL BE THE 
COLDEST NIGHT OF THE WEEK WITH LOWS ALSO 15 TO 18 DEGREES BELOW 
NORMAL.  

WE REBOUND A LITTLE ON TEMPS FOR THURSDAY...AND THEN A FEW MORE 
DEGREES ON FRIDAY...AS WE RETURN TO ZONAL FLOW WITH SURFACE RIDGING 
BUILDING BACK IN. HOWEVER...ANOTHER SYSTEM IS POSSIBLE FRIDAY NIGHT 
INTO SATURDAY...AS THE SOUTHERN JET RETURNS ALONG WITH ANOTHER 
APPROACHING TROUGH. WILL ONLY MENTION SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THIS 
SYSTEM...AS THE ECMWF KEEPS US DRY WITH THE SYSTEM WELL TO OUR 
SOUTH...WHILE THE GFS BRINGS IT FURTHER NORTH INTO OUR AREA.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...

EAST THROUGH TODAY...AND WE WILL SEE A LIGHT SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL 
FLOW BY THE AFTERNOON. THIS WILL ALLOW TEMPS TO WARM INTO THE LOWER 
AND MIDDLE 60S TODAY...UNDER MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES. THE PROXIMITY OF 
THE UPPER JET JUST NORTH OF THE AREA COULD BRING SOME CIRRUS 
CLOUDS...BUT THEY SHOULD HAVE LITTLE IMPACT TO TEMPERATURES. THE

DYNAMICS...ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER JET ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES/OHIO
VALLEY...WILL BE MAINLY NORTH OF THE REGION. HOWEVER..WILL MAINTAIN

CLOSER PROXIMITY TO THE JET DYNAMICS.

SURFACE RIDGING AND ZONAL FLOW ALOFT EXPECTED FOR MONDAY WITH DRY 
CONDITIONS. AN ARCTIC COLD FRONT WILL MOVE SOUTH INTO THE OHO VALLEY 
FOR LATE MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT...THEN SPILL INTO THE REGION FOR 
TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. ANOTHER SOUTHERN STREAM JET WILL MOVE 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND GULF COAST STATES WITH CYCLOGENESIS 
OVER THE CAROLINAS LATE TUESDAY/TUESDAY NIGHT. MODELS DIFFER ON THE 
LOCATION OF CYCLOGENESIS OVER THE CAROLINAS/EASTERN ATLANTIC WITH THE
ECMWF CLOSEST TO THE COASTS. WILL CALL FOR A CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION 
FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT WITH RAIN CHANGING TO SNOW.

FOR THE LATTER HALF OF WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING...SURFACE 
RIDGING WILL ONCE AGAIN DOMINATE WITH DRY CONDITIONS AND BELOW 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES. THE GFS AND ECMWF SHOW ANOTHER SOUTHERN STREAM 
WAVE MOVING ACROSS TEXAS THROUGH THE GULF COAST STATES FOR FRIDAY 
AND SATURDAY OF NEXT WEEK KEEPING PRECIPITATION SOUTH OF THE REGION.


469 
FXUS64 KMRX 212016
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST FRI FEB 21 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
A COLD FRONT OVER THE CAROLINAS...WITH BREEZY WESTERLY WINDS 
BRINGING A COOLER AND DRIER AIR MASS (COMPARED TO YESTERDAY) INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA. HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD OVER THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TONIGHT...BRINGING DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS 
INTO SATURDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TONIGHT AND SATURDAY...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE 
SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...SAME OVERALL THEME AS 
WAS DISCUSSED YESTERDAY WITH A FEW MINOR TWEAKS. MAINLY ZONAL FLOW 
SHIFTING TO A NW FLOW AS A BROAD UPPER LEVEL TROUGH APPROACHES BY 
MID WEEK WITH TEMPERATURES BELOW NORMAL STARTING MONDAY THROUGH THE 
END OF THE EXTENDED.

SURFACE RIDGING MOVES OFF TO OUR EAST ON SATURDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF AN 
APPROACHING COLD FRONT LATE SUNDAY AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING. SUNDAY 
LOOKS TO BE THE LAST DAY WHERE TEMPS WILL BE WELL ABOVE NORMAL. THE 
NAM STILL WANTS TO SHOW MORE MOISTURE WITH THE ARRIVAL OF THE FRONT 
THAN DOES THE GFS. DECIDED TO GO WITH A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO 
AND KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN PLACE OVERNIGHT SUNDAY WITH CHANCE 
ACROSS OUR FAR EASTERN COUNTIES AS WELL AS UP INTO NE TN AND SW VA. 
RAIN WILL TRANSITION TO SNOW SUNDAY NIGHT ACROSS AREAS THAT APPROACH 
FREEZING. NO ACCUMULATION EXPECTED AT THIS TIME. MONDAY LOOKS DRY 
BEHIND THE FRONTAL PASSAGE WITH TEMPERATURES NEAR NORMAL TO A FEW 
DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. 

BY TUESDAY THE BROAD UPPER LEVEL TROUGH IS BEGINNING TO TAKE SHAPE 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS WHILE THE SUB TROPICAL JET STARTS TO 
BRING IN MOISTURE FROM THE SW. A SHORTWAVE MOVES ACROSS THE GREAT 
LAKES ON TUESDAY WHILE ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT LOOKS TO DRAG 
THROUGH OUR AREA AND BRING SOME LIGHT PRECIP DURING THE DAY. WILL 
KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NOW AS FORCING BEGINS TO WEAKEN AS THE 
FRONT MOVES INTO OUR AREA. THIS COLD FRONT WILL ALSO BRING FURTHER 
REINFORCEMENT OF COLDER AIR FOR WEDNESDAY. 

TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY...THE BASE OF THE BROAD TROUGH 
APPROACHES OUR REGION AS DOES THE SUBTROPICAL JET TO OUR SOUTH. THE 
GFS AND ECMWF BOTH WANT TO PHASE THESE TWO FEATURES OVER THE 
SOUTHEASTERN U.S. BUT EXACTLY WHEN/WHERE THEY PHASE WILL ALTER OUR 
PRECIP CHANCES AND AMOUNTS. THE GFS IS A WETTER SOLUTION ON TUESDAY 
NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY AS IT WANTS TO PHASE THESE TWO FEATURES CLOSER 
TO OUR AREA BRINGING US BETTER CHANCES FOR PRECIP AND MORE 
WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION. THE ECMWF HOWEVER WANTS TO PHASE THE 
AFOREMENTIONED FEATURES FURTHER SOUTH WHICH SUPPRESSES THE MOISTURE 
FROM THE SUBTROPICAL JET FURTHER SOUTH AND RESULTS IN A DRIER 
SOLUTION FOR US. WILL PUT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN PLACE TUESDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY BUT POPS MAY HAVE TO BE RAISED IN FUTURE SHIFTS 
DEPENDING ON HOW THE MODELS HANDLE THE PHASING. ALSO...DEPENDING ON 
HOW MUCH COLD AIR CAN SINK SOUTH WITH THE BASE OF THE TROUGH...SOME 
AREAS COULD SEE RAIN/SNOW ON TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. STILL TOO 
EARLY TO TRY AND DETERMINE ANY ACCUMULATION AMOUNTS IF ANY.

WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY...WE WILL BE ON THE BACK SIDE OF 
THE TROUGH WHICH WILL KEEP US IN A BRIEF NW FLOW PATTERN WHILE ALSO  
REMAINING DRY. FRIDAY LOOKS DRY FOR NOW AS WE SLOWLY RETURN TO A 
MORE ZONAL FLOW.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     31  62  37  64  34 /   0   0  10  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN             31  62  37  64  33 /   0   0  10  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    26  61  33  61  30 /   0   0  10  10  30

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DRIER AIR AND SOMEWHAT COOLER

GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO WILL STAY CLOSE.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...WARMER WESTERLY FLOW
CONTINUES SATURDAY AS BROAD UPPER TROUGH OVER THE NORTHERN STATES
WITH DEEP UPPER LOW OVER HUDSONS BAY. THIS KEEPS A SUNNY AND MILD
PATTERN OVER THE FORECAST AREA. WEAK SHORTWAVE ENERGY MOVES
SOUTHEAST TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT AS A
COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH. LOWS DROP TO NEAR FREEZING OR SLIGHTLY
BELOW NORTH WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN AND SNOW BUT NO
ACCUMULATION. MONDAY TEMPERATURES MUCH COOLER AS PATTERN BRINGS
COLDER AIR SE AS TROUGH DEEPENS OVER THE EAST MUCH OF THE WEEK.
ANOTHER WEAK FRONT TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT WILL REINFORCE THE
COOLER AIR MASS BUT PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS BOTH RAIN...AND SNOW
OVERNIGHT HOURS WILL AGAIN BE LIGHT. WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY
HIGH PRESSURE REBUILDS AGAIN BUT TEMPERATURES TO STAY BELOW NORMAL
AS FLOW ALOFT STAYS FROM THE NW.

650 
FXUS64 KMRX 202025
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EST THU FEB 20 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED OVER NORTHEASTERN MISSOURI...WITH ITS 
ASSOCIATED WARM FRONT EXTENDING EAST ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY 
AND ITS COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTH ACROSS THE OZARKS AND ARKLATEX 
REGIONS. SOUTHERLY WINDS AHEAD OF THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL 
CONTINUE TO BRING WARM AND MOIST AIR INTO THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
EVENING. ALTHOUGH THE WINDS IN THE GREAT TN VALLEY SHOULD WEAKEN A 
LITTLE THIS EVENING AS THE SUN SETS...MODELS INDICATE THAT THE 850 
MB WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO STRENGTHEN THIS EVENING (TO BETWEEN 60 AND 
70 KT) AS THE COLD FRONT APPROACHES. ALTHOUGH THE MODELS AGREE THAT 
THE CONVECTIVE SQUALL LINE ALONG THE COLD FRONT WILL AFFECT THE 
FORECAST AREA DURING THE EARLY MORNING HOURS AFTER MIDNIGHT...THINK 
THAT THIS SQUALL LINE COULD QUICKLY RACE AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT AND 
POSSIBLY ARRIVE SOONER (AROUND MIDNIGHT ON THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU). 
WITH THE STRONG 850 MB JET AND LARGE LOW-LEVEL HELICITY VALUES (0-1 
KM VALUES OF 300 TO 400 M2/S2)...IT CERTAINLY APPEARS THAT DAMAGING 
WINDS AND ISOLATED TORNADOES ALONG THE SQUALL LINE WILL BE POSSIBLE 
TONIGHT...EVEN IF THE INSTABILITY WEAKENS TO MARGINAL VALUES OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA AFTER SUNSET (AS THE MODELS SUGGEST). SCATTERED 
SHOWERS WILL LIKELY STILL BE LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA IN THE 
MORNING HOURS AROUND SUNRISE...BUT RAPID CLEARING IS EXPECTED BY THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TONIGHT AND FRIDAY...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE 
SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...NOT MUCH CHANGE FROM 
PREVIOUS DISCUSSION. A MUCH CALMER WEATHER PATTERN IN STORE THROUGH 
THE EXTENDED. OVERALL...MAINLY ZONAL FLOW THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
SWITCHING TO SOMEWHAT OF A NW FLOW TOWARD THE END OF THE PERIOD. WE 
WILL BE STARTING A COOLING TREND AFTER SATURDAY AND IT WILL CONTINUE 
THROUGH THE END OF THE EXTENDED WITH TEMPERATURES ROUGHLY 5 TO 10 
DEGREES BELOW NORMAL.

FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY ZONAL FLOW WITH SURFACE RIDING LOOKS TO 
BE IN PLACE. MODELS SHOW A WEAK COLD FRONT COMING THROUGH LATE 
SUNDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING WITH THE GFS AND NAM DIFFERING ON AMOUNT OF 
MOISTURE PRESENT. THE GFS SUGGEST A MAINLY DRY FRONTAL PASSAGE WITH 
THE NAM BEING A WETTER SOLUTION. WILL KEEP TRENDING TOWARD THE DRIER 
GFS SOLUTION AT THIS POINT IN TIME. THE COLD FRONT BRINGS IN COOLER 
AIR FOR MONDAY WITH HIGHS A FEW DEGREES BELOW NORMAL AREA WIDE. 
MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY...OUT AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING BROAD UPPER 
LEVEL TROUGH...WE GET CAUGHT IN BETWEEN THE POLAR AND SUB-TROPICAL 
JET WHICH WILL HELP TO SLIGHTLY INCREASE MOISTURE ACROSS THE AREA 
BUT STILL ONLY WARRANTING A SLIGHT CHANCE OF PRECIP.  ANOTHER WEAK 
COLD FRONT WILL ACCOMPANY THE ARRIVAL OF THE BROAD UPPER TROUGH ON 
TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING BUT LOOKS TO REMAIN DRY FOR NOW. 
THIS TROUGH WILL SHIFT US INTO MORE OF A NW FLOW. THE FRONTAL 
PASSAGE WILL DROP TEMPERATURES EVEN FURTHER ON WEDNESDAY WITH HIGHS 
8 TO 10 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. HIGH TEMPERATURES GO UNCHANGED FOR 
THURSDAY WHILE WE REMAIN IN NW FLOW AS WELL AS STAYING PRECIP FREE. 

FOR TEMPS...CONTINUED TO AGREE WITH PREVIOUS SHIFT THAT FAVORING THE 
COOLER ECMWF MOS FOR SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY IS THE BEST COURSE TO 
TAKE.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   45  59  33  66  38 /  90  20   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     47  57  32  63  36 / 100  40   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             45  57  32  61  36 /  90  30   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    48  55  25  59  32 / 100  50   0   0  10

.AVIATION...BRIEF MVFR AT CHA DUE TO LOW CLOUD DECK AND MINIMAL FOG

BEFORE TSRA CAN REACH EXTREME NE TN...SO KEPT JUST SHOWERS FOR NOW
AT TRI.

THEN WEST AND STILL GUSTY AFTER PASSAGE OF SQUALL LINE. THESE
STRONG WINDS SHOULD KEEP CIGS AND VISBYS ONLY DOWN TO MVFR WITH

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
353 AM EST THU FEB 20 2014

.SHORT TERM /TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY/...
THE MAIN FOCUS FOR THE SHORT TERM WILL BE THE STRONG STORM SYSTEM
THAT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS THIS
AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT...BRINGING THE POTENTIAL FOR STRONG TO SEVERE
THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ALONG/AHEAD OF A COLD
FRONTAL BOUNDARY THAT WILL SWEEP EAST. AHEAD OF THE FRONT DURING
THE DAY...BREEZY SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL HELP TO PUSH HIGH
TEMPERATURES INTO THE LOWER 70S ACROSS MUCH OF THE REGION AND
DEWPOINTS WELL INTO THE MIDDLE 50S. THIS WARM/MOIST AIR WILL LINGER
AHEAD OF THE FRONT WELL INTO THE EVENING HOURS. ALOFT...A STRONG
UPPER-LEVEL JET OVER THE OHIO VALLEY WILL PLACE THE TENNESSEE
VALLEY IN THE FAVORED RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION AND PROMOTE STRONG
UPPER-LEVEL DIVERGENCE AND LIFT ALONG THE ADVANCING FRONTAL BOUNDARY
THIS EVENING AND TONIGHT.

THE LATEST MODEL PROJECTIONS ARE SLIGHTLY SLOWER WITH THE
TIMING...AND INDICATE A LINE OF STORMS APPROACHING THE WESTERN
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU ZONES AROUND 03-04Z AND MOVING INTO THE
SOUTHERN/CENTRAL VALLEYS AROUND 06Z FRIDAY. DESPITE THE SLIGHTLY
LATER PROJECTIONS FOR THE ONSET OF THIS ACTIVITY...AN ENVIRONMENT
FAVORABLE FOR THE SUSTAINMENT OF STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS
WILL STILL BE PRESENT...PARTICULARLY GIVEN THE VERY STRONG BULK
SHEAR VALUES ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM. HOWEVER...MODEL SOUNDINGS
AT KCHA...KCSV..AND KTYS ALSO INDICATE APPRECIABLE SURFACE BASED
INSTABILITY AOA 400 TO 500 J/KG...WITH SOME ADDITIONAL CAPE TO WORK
WITH ALOFT. HELICITY VALUES ARE ALSO FAIRLY HIGH AND UP TO 500 TO
600 M2/S2 OVER THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN VALLEY. ALL SAID...THIS
WILL RESULT IN THE SUSTAINMENT OF THE SQUALL-LINE AND SEVERE
WEATHER THREAT INTO OUR AREA WELL AFTER SUNSET.

GIVEN THE LINEAR MODE OF THE THUNDERSTORMS AND THE STRONG WIND
FIELD IN PLACE...AM EXPECTING DAMAGING STRAIGHT-LINE WINDS IN
EXCESS OF 60 MPH TO BE THE PRIMARY THREAT. HOWEVER...THE STRONG 0-1
KM SHEAR AND HELICITY VALUES WILL ALSO ALLOW FOR AN ISOLATED
TORNADO THREAT...PARTICULARLY IN AREAS WHERE LOW-LEVEL WINDS MAY
STAY LOCALLY BACKED AHEAD OF THE LINE...AND WITH ANY SUPERCELLUAR
OR BOOK-END VORTEX STRUCTURES WITHIN THE LINE. SOME LOCALLY HEAVY
RAINFALL WILL ALSO BE POSSIBLE...THOUGH GIVEN THE FAST MOVING
NATURE OF THESE STORMS...ANY LONG-TERM FLOODING CONCERNS WILL BE
MINIMAL. EVENTUALLY LATE TONIGHT THE LINE WILL OUTPACE THE
FAVORABLE UNSTABLE AREA AND BEGIN TO WEAKEN AS IT APPROACHES THE
MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE BY DAYBREAK. HOWEVER...THE THREAT
FOR STRONG WINDS WITHIN THE EXISTING LINE WILL STILL BE POSSIBLE IN
THESE AREAS AS WELL. ON FRIDAY...THE LINE WILL BEGIN TO MOVE EAST
OF THE REGION...LEAVING SOME LINGERING MORNING SHOWERS BEFORE
CLEARING OCCURS BY THE AFTERNOON.


.LONG TERM /FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
WEATHER BECOMES QUITE 
TRANQUIL AFTER THE STRONG STORM SYSTEM IN THE SHORT TERM PERIODS. 
NEARLY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT THROUGH THE WEEKEND...THEN SOME UPPER LEVEL 
TROUGHING DEVELOPS OVER NRN PLAINS AND UPPER MIDWEST STATES. THIS 
SHIFTS THE FLOW ALOFT TO SLIGHTLY NW...BUT GENERALLY NOT MUCH 
MOISTURE INDICATED FOR ANY SYSTEM TO WORK WITH. A WEAK COLD FRONT 
SAGGING SOUTH ON SUNDAY LOOKS STARVED FOR MOISTURE...SO I DROPPED 
THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS. SURFACE RIDGING SHOULD KEEP MONDAY DRY AND I 
KEPT THE LOW POPS IN FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY FOR NOW. NO REASON 
TO MENTION ANY RAIN FOR WEDNESDAY.

FOR TEMPS...AGREE WITH PREVIOUS SHIFT THAT FAVORING THE COOLER ECM 
MOS FOR SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY IS THE BEST COURSE TO TAKE. THE LOW 
LEVEL FLOW STAYING W TO N NOT ONLY LIMITS MOISTURE...BUT SHOULD KEEP 
TEMPS NEAR OR SLIGHTLY BELOW SEASONAL VALUES. THE WARMEST DAY WILL 
CLEARLY BE SATURDAY WITH HIGHS MOSTLY IN THE 60S.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  71  46  56  32  63 /  20 100  40   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       70  44  57  32  61 /  20 100  30   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              68  47  52  25  59 /  20 100  50   0   0

262 
FXUS64 KMRX 192025
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EST WED FEB 19 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...COLD FRONT IS MOVING
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON. LITTLE TO NO CONVECTION
WITH THE BOUNDARY. THIS FRONT WILL BECOME STATIONARY JUST SOUTH OF
THE AREA OVERNIGHT...THEN PULL NORTH THURSDAY. SOME ISENTROPIC LIFT
WILL RETURN OVER THE FRONT LATER TONIGHT...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH A
SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS OVER THE SOUTHERN COUNTIES.

FOR THURSDAY...FRONTAL BOUNDARY PULLS NORTH AS STRONG SOUTHERLY
WINDS DEVELOP OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING SHORT-WAVE.
STRONG UPPER LEVEL JET WILL MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY PLACING THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY UNDER THE FAVORED RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE JET
AND STRONG DIVERGENCE. THE DIRECT CIRCULATION WITH THE JET WILL
PRODUCE STRONG FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING ALONG AN IN-COMING FRONTAL
BOUNDARY FOR THURSDAY NIGHT. 

FOR THURSDAY...STRONG SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL PULL WARM AND MOIST AIR
INTO THE REGION...ESPECIALLY FOR THE WESTERN AND SOUTHERN SECTIONS
OF THE TENNESSEE VALLEY/PLATEAU. VERY LITTLE FORCING FOR
THURSDAY...SO PRECIPITATION CHANCES LOW. FOR THURSDAY
NIGHT...WIDESPREAD THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPMENT OVER THE
WESTERN/MIDDLE TENNESSEE VALLEY WILL PULL INTO THE AREA BETWEEN 9
AND 11 PM PLATEAU TO 1 AND 3 AM FAR NORTHEAST SECTIONS. DUE TO A
65-70 KT LOW-LEVEL JET...MAIN CONCERN WILL BE DAMAGING STRAIGHT
LINE WINDS. ALSO...ENOUGH SHEAR...ESPECIALLY SPEED SHEAR...TO
PRODUCE HIGH HELICITY VALUES. ISOLATED TORNADOES ARE POSSIBLE...
MAINLY AT/WEST AND SOUTH OF KNOXVILLE...TENNESSEE. GREATEST CHANCES
WILL BE ASSOCIATED WITH ANY BOOK-END VORTICES ALONG THE IN-COMING
SQUALL-LINE. WENT FOR CAT POPS FOR THURSDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS GENERALLY STAY IN THE 
SAME BALLPARK CONCERNING THE LONG TERM PERIOD WHICH FEATURES A 
DEPARTING STRONG COLD FRONT DURING THE MORNING ON FRIDAY. 
THEREFORE...HELD ONTO A GRADIENT OF LIKELY POPS NEAR THE MOUNTAINS 
THROUGH SLIGHT CHANCE POP ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. DRY AIR AND 
SURFACE RIDGING BUILD IN BEHIND THE SYSTEM TO KEEP PRECIPITATION OUT 
OF THE FORECAST ALL THE WAY THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. 
HOWEVER...ANOTHER WEAK SHORT WAVE AND A COLD FRONT ARE DEPICTED 
(WITH SOME STRENGTH AND TIMING ISSUES) TO MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA ON SUNDAY SO ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP HERE FOR RAIN SHOWERS. 
WAS ABLE TO KEEP SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH THE DAYTIME PERIOD MONDAY DRY.
A MORE AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH AND SURFACE FRONTAL SYSTEM MOVE INTO 
THE APPALACHIAN REGION MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY AND THIS 
AMPLIFICATION APPEARS LIKE IT WILL LEAD TO ANOTHER PERIOD OF WELL 
BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES. WITH THIS IN MIND...THERE WILL BE THE 
POSSIBILITY OF MORE WINTER PRECIPITATION DURING THIS TIMEFRAME. 
STAYED CLOSER TO THE COLDER ECM TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE ESPECIALLY 
LATER IN THE LONG TERM PERIOD.

130 
FXUS64 KMRX 190835
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 AM EST WED FEB 19 2014

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE TO PUSH ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA EARLY THIS MORNING AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT DRAPED
ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE. WINDS ARE MAKING A TRANSITION FROM
NORTHEAST TO SOUTHWEST...AND THIS IS ACTUALLY HELPING TO RAISE
TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY INTO THE UPPER 50S AND LOWER 60S OVER THE
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY...WHILE LOCATIONS ACROSS NORTHEAST
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA REMAIN IN THE 40S AS OF 3 AM. A
LINE OF STRONGER STORMS WILL MOVE INTO THE NORTHERN PLATEAU WITHIN
THE NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS...BRINGING WITH IT SOME GUSTING WINDS AND
LIGHTNING. THIS ACTIVITY WILL CONTINUE AFTER SUNRISE OVER THE
REGION...BEFORE DIMINISHING BY THE LATE MORNING AND EARLY AFTERNOON
FROM WEST TO EAST AS THE SKY BEGINS TO CLEAR. THE PREFRONTAL
SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL ALSO HELP TO PUSH HIGHS WELL UP INTO THE MID TO
UPPER 60S IN MOST SPOTS BEFORE THE POST-FRONTAL NORTHWEST FLOW
OCCURS BY THE AFTERNOON. SOME ADDITIONAL SHOWERS WILL BEGIN TO WORK
THEIR WAY INTO THE REGION TONIGHT AHEAD OF THE NEXT STORM SYSTEM
THAT WILL IMPACT THE AREA ON THURSDAY EVENING. 


.LONG TERM /THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY/...
MAIN WEATHER OF CONCERN 
OCCURS ON THURSDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY FRIDAY. MODELS CONSISTENT WITH 
DEVELOPING A DEEPENING UPPER TROUGH OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS ON 
THURSDAY. THE TROUGH BECOMES NEGATIVELY TILTED BY THURSDAY EVENING 
WITH THE ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW TRACKING NE FROM UPPER MIDWEST 
STATES. 50 TO 60 KNOT LOW LEVEL JET ACROSS PLATEAU COUNTIES BY 
THURSDAY AFTERNOON...THEN MOVES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY 
NIGHT AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. STRONG SHEAR AND MARGINAL INSTABILITY 
SHOULD ALLOW A LINE OF SEVERE STORMS TO MOVE INTO WRN AREAS THURSDAY 
EVENING...WITH A THREAT FOR DAMAGING STRAIGHT LINE WINDS AND 
ISOLATED TORNADOES. POTENTIAL FOR WEAKENING OF STORMS AFTER MIDNIGHT 
SO I STOPPED SHORT OF MENTIONING SEVERE STORMS IN ZONE FORECAST 
PRODUCT. BEEFED THUNDERSTORM WORDING UP TO SCATTERED OVER SRN AND 
CENTRAL AREAS WITH ISOLATED WORDING IN NE TN/SW VA AREAS.

NAM 12KM WINDS WERE USED FOR THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT...WITH A 
VERY TIGHT GRADIENT PLUS LOW LEVEL JET...SO MAY VERY WELL NEED A 
WIND ADVISORY POSTED FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA FOR THOSE PERIODS. 

OTHERWISE...REMAINDER OF THE LONG TERM PERIODS LOOKS QUITE TRANQUIL 
COMPARED TO THE FIRST 3 PERIODS. NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES MADE TO 
PREVIOUS GRIDS...AS THE AMOUNT OF UNCERTAINTY DOES NOT CREATE THE 
CONFIDENCE TO TWEAK GRIDS AT THIS POINT. GOOD CONTINUITY ON DRY 
WEATHER FROM FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY...THEN SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. MAJOR TEMP DIFFERENCES BTWN 18/12Z 
GFSX MOS AND 19/00Z GFSX MOS...GENERALLY FROM THE WEEKEND THRU 
TUESDAY. EXPECTED SYNOPTIC SURFACE PATTERN DID NOT FAVOR BUMPING UP 
TO THE WARMER 19/00Z MOS TEMPS...SO STAYED CLOSE TO PREVIOUS MAX/MIN 
TEMPS AND ADJACENT NWS GRIDS FOR NOW. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  68  49  70  46  57 /  50  40  20  90  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       67  49  69  44  56 /  40  40  20  90  30

655 
FXUS64 KMRX 182022
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
322 PM EST TUE FEB 18 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MOISTURE AND RAINS POISED 
TO MOVE BACK INTO THE AREA TONIGHT...SPREADING NORTH AND 
NORTHEAST. MODEL POPS NOW LOOKING MORE IN LINE WITH WHAT MID SHIFT
WAS THINKING WITH POPS NOW MUCH HIGHER. WENT CLOSE TO MOS POPS FOR
TONIGHT...BUT DEFINITELY LEANING TOWARD DRIER MAV POPS FOR
WEDNESDAY WHEN LOOKING AT SHORT-TERM ENSEMBLES. THINK THAT MOST OF
THE PRECIP WILL MOVE OUT OF THE AREA. LOOKING LIKE ENOUGH ELEVATED
INSTABILITY TO INCLUDE THUNDER FOR TONIGHT. JUST LEAVING LOW POPS
AS SHOWERS FOR WEDNESDAY. WENT CLOSE TO MOS TEMPS AS WE CONTINUE IN
RELATIVELY WARM AIRMASS.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT OVERALL FOR MUCH OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD...BUT A BIT MORE 
INCONSISTENCY AND DISAGREEMENT LATE IN THE PERIOD.  FORECAST 
CONFIDENCE A BIT ABOVE AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND BUT FALLS TO AVERAGE LATE.  MOISTURE WILL INCREASE WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AS LOW LEVEL FLOW TURNS MORE SOUTHERLY AND INCREASES.  ENOUGH 
WEAK LIFT INDICATED TO CARRY CHANCE POPS ALL ZONES.  MAY BE AN 
ISOLATED SHOWER THURSDAY...BUT OVERALL WARM AND MOSTLY DRY.  A COLD 
FRONT WILL SWEEP THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT.  APPEARS THERE MAY BE 
ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR SOME THUNDER...AND GIVEN THE STRONG LOW LEVEL 
WIND FIELDS SEVERE STORMS CANNOT BE RULED OUT.  WILL CONTINUE TO 
MENTION IN HWO.  MAY ALSO BE SOME STRONG GUSTY WINDS GIVEN STRENGTH 
OF LOW LEVEL JET...ESPECIALLY OVER SOME OF THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  
WILL MENTION WINDY CONDITIONS IN THE HWO AS WELL.  CAT POPS ALL 
ZONES THU NIGHT.  COOLER AND DRIER AIR WILL PUSH IN FRIDAY...WITH 
TEMPS FALLING BACK TO NEAR NORMAL.  DRY CONDITIONS AND MOSTLY 
SEASONABLE TEMPS EXPECTED FOR THE WEEKEND INTO MONDAY.  ANOTHER 
SYSTEM MAY BRING SOME RAIN AND/OR SNOW FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND 
TUESDAY...BUT FORECAST UNCERTAINTY IS HIGHER GIVEN MODEL 
DIFFICULTIES WITH TIMING AND PLACEMENT.    

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

317 
FXUS64 KMRX 180917
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
417 AM EST TUE FEB 18 2014

.SHORT TERM.../TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
SHOWERS WITH THE COLD FRONT ENDED VERY EARLY WITH JUST SOME
REMNANT CLOUDS HANGING IN ACROSS THE FOOTHILLS AND ERN MTNS AT THE
PRESENT TIME. WINDS STAYED UP A BIT AND THE DRIER AIR MOVING IN
SHOULD CONTINUE TO INHIBIT ANY SIGNIFICANT FOG DEVELOPMENT.

LOTS OF SUNSHINE FOR TODAY AND THE SW WINDS KICK IN FOR THE
AFTERNOON...AHEAD OF THE NEXT COLD FRONT. MOS HAS UNDERESTIMATED
MAX TEMPS FOR THE PAST 2 DAYS...SO WENT A FEW DEGREES ABOVE EVEN
THE MILDER GFS MOS UP THE SRN AND CENTRAL VALLEY...GIVEN LOW LEVEL
WARM AIR ADVECTION. 

MODELS TRENDING WETTER FOR TONIGHT...ALTHOUGH NOT MUCH QPF
EXPECTED. TIMING WAS SIMILAR TO PREVIOUS GRIDS...BUT I DID NUDGE
POPS UP ACROSS THE BOARD AFTER MIDNIGHT. A SWATH OF LOW END LIKELY
POPS FOR ALL 3 ASOS SITES...CLOSER TO THE MOS BLEND THAN THE 
CATEGORICAL NAM MOS POPS. GFS MOS MINS LOOKED GOOD AND WERE CLOSELY
FOLLOWED. 


.LONG TERM.../WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY/...
A WEAK SHORTWAVE WILL PROPAGATE THROUGH THE REGION ON 
WEDNESDAY...BRINGING SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS TO THE REGION...ALONG 
WITH SOME DENSE CLOUD COVER. AFTER A BRIEF LULL WEDNESDAY NIGHT THE 
MAIN PRECIPITATION EVENT WILL OCCUR THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH 
THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING AS A DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
MOVES THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY. THIS WILL DRAG A COLD FRONT THROUGH 
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. AHEAD OF THE 
BOUNDARY...SOME LIGHT SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE DURING THE DAY ON 
THURSDAY BEFORE THE MAIN FRONT AND SOME MORE WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND 
SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE OVERNIGHT. THE STRONG WIND 
SHEAR ASSOCIATED WITH THE STORM SYSTEM WILL ALLOW FOR THE 
POSSIBILITY OF SOME STRONG AND ORGANIZED THUNDERSTORMS DESPITE THE 
LIMITED INSTABILITY. HOWEVER...THE POTENTIAL FOR WIDESPREAD SEVERE 
WEATHER DOES NOT APPEAR VERY HIGH GIVEN THE AFOREMENTIONED 
LIMITATIONS...BUT A LOCALIZED DAMAGING WIND THREAT SEEMS PLAUSIBLE 
GIVEN THE STRONG WIND FIELD ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM. BEHIND IT 
HEADING INTO THE WEEKEND...BENIGN WEATHER IS GENERALLY EXPECTED AS 
ZONAL FLOW ALOFT PREVAILS. A COUPLE OF WEAK CLIPPER SYSTEMS LOOK TO 
APPROACH THE REGION BY THE EARLY PART OF NEXT WEEK...THOUGH THE 
POSSIBILITY  OF WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY 
APPEARS TO BE FAIRLY LOW ATTM. 




.LONG TERM.../WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY/...
A WEAK SHORTWAVE WILL PROPAGATE THROUGH THE REGION ON 
WEDNESDAY...BRINGING SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS TO THE REGION...ALONG 
WITH SOME DENSE CLOUD COVER. AFTER A BRIEF LULL WEDNESDAY NIGHT THE 
MAIN PRECIPITATION EVENT WILL OCCUR THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH 
THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING AS A DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
MOVES THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY. THIS WILL DRAG A COLD FRONT THROUGH 
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. AHEAD OF THE 
BOUNDARY...SOME LIGHT SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE DURING THE DAY ON 
THURSDAY BEFORE THE MAIN FRONT AND SOME MORE WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND 
SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE OVERNIGHT. THE STRONG WIND 
SHEAR ASSOCIATED WITH THE STORM SYSTEM WILL ALLOW FOR THE 
POSSIBILITY OF SOME STRONG AND ORGANIZED THUNDERSTORMS DESPITE THE 
LIMITED INSTABILITY. HOWEVER...THE POTENTIAL FOR WIDESPREAD SEVERE 
WEATHER DOES NOT APPEAR VERY HIGH GIVEN THE AFOREMENTIONED 
LIMITATIONS...BUT A LOCALIZED DAMAGING WIND THREAT SEEMS PLAUSIBLE 
GIVEN THE STRONG WIND FIELD ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM. BEHIND IT 
HEADING INTO THE WEEKEND...BENIGN WEATHER IS GENERALLY EXPECTED AS

.DISCUSSION...A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION TONIGHT.  AHEAD OF THE FRONT...A LINE OF SHOWERS WITH A STRAY 
RUMBLE OF THUNDER IS MOVING THROUGH THE AREA.  THE LIKELY POPS IN 
PLACE IN THE FORECAST LOOK REASONABLE AND TEMPERATURES PROFILE 
INDICATING A RAIN EVENT.  ONLY QUESTION IS WHETHER COLD AIR WILL 
PUSH IN FAST ENOUGH BEHIND THE EXITING COLD FRONT TO SWITCH ANY 
LINGER LIGHT SHOWERS OVER TO FLURRIES OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE 
FAR NORTHEASTERN LOCATIONS LATE TONIGHT.  FOR NOW...WILL KEEP PRECIP 
ALL RAIN.  THEREFORE...ALL LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK IN THE CURRENT 
FORECAST...WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING.

215 
FXUS64 KMRX 171949
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
249 PM EST MON FEB 17 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...TEMPERATURES AGAIN RISING
MUCH MORE QUICKLY THIS AFTERNOON THAN THE MODELS ANTICIPATED.
ORIGINAL GUIDANCE SUGGESTED AN OVERCAST DECK THROUGH THE DAY AND
NIGHT...BUT THE CLOUD SHIELD THAT IS CURRENTLY OVER MIDDLE AND
EASTERN TENNESSEE IS PROGRESSING VERY SLOWLY TOWARDS THE
APPALACHIANS...THUS LEAVING AMPLE HEATING TO TAKE PLACE. HAVE
ADJUSTED TEMPERATURES A COUPLE OF DEGREES HIGHER FOR TODAY AND
TONIGHT TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS.

TONIGHT...A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL MAKE ITS WAY EAST OVER THE OHIO 
VALLEY WITH AN ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT SWINGING DOWN THROUGH THE AREA. 
THE FRONT IS EXPECTED TO ENTER FOR THE FORECAST AREA LATE EVENING 
AND MOVE QUICKLY TO THE EAST OF THE SMOKIES WELL BEFORE SUNRISE. THE 
TEMPERATURES DO NOT TREND CLOSE TO THE FREEZING LINE UNTIL DAY 
BREAK...WHICH IS AFTER THE MOISTURE EXITS THE AREA. THEREFORE ONLY 
RAIN IS EXPECTED. LIGHT AMOUNTS CAN ACCUMULATE AS THIS SYSTEM HAS 
VERY LITTLE LIFT AND A WARM MID LEVEL LAYER CREATING A DECENT
INVERSION THROUGH THE NIGHT.

DRY WEATHER WILL MOVE IN BEHIND THIS FRONT...WITH SKIES CLEARING 
QUICKLY TUESDAY MORNING. FOR TEMPERATURES...HAVE GONE A COUPLE OF 
DEGREES ABOVE GUIDANCE THROUGH TUESDAY DUE TO THE SOUTHWEST FLOW 
PRESENT AND THE SHORT TEMPORAL COVERAGE OF CLOUDS EXPECTED.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY DAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT OVERALL FOR MUCH OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD...BUT SOLUTION 
DIVERGENCE INCREASES LATE.  FORECAST CONFIDENCE ABOUT AVERAGE FOR 
THIS TIME OF YEAR.  IT LOOKS LIKE THERE MAY BE TWO PERIODS OF WEAK 
ISENTROPIC LIFT EARLY ON...ONE TUESDAY NIGHT AND ANOTHER WED NIGHT.  
APPEARS MOISTURE WILL BE SHALLOW AND LIFT WEAK BOTH PERIODS.  WILL 
JUST CARRY A LOT OF CLOUDS AND SOME LOW END POPS BOTH PERIODS.  MAIN 
EVENT WILL BE THURSDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY FRIDAY.  A COLD FRONT WILL 
SWEEP IN AS AN UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES...WITH MORE SIGNIFICANT 
MOISTURE AND FORCING. MAY BE SOME THUNDER WITH THIS SYSTEM THURSDAY 
NIGHT...SO WILL CONTINUE TO CARRY IN THE FORECAST.  WILL GO WITH HIGH
LIKELY TO CAT POPS...ONLY REASON NOT TO GO WITH CAT POPS ALL ZONES 
IS DUE TO POSSIBLE TIMING ISSUES.  LOOKS LIKE A QUIETER PERIOD FOR 
THE WEEKEND...WITH TEMPS NOT TOO FAR FROM NORMAL.  MONDAY THE ECMWF 
IS PUSHING THE NEXT SYSTEM IN...WHILE THE GFS STILL IS DRY.  FOR NOW 
WILL KEEP PRECIP OUT SIMILAR TO THE GFS.

731 
FXUS64 KMRX 170856
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
356 AM EST MON FEB 17 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CLOUDS A BIT SLUGGISH TO SPREAD 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA SO FAR THIS MORNING...SO HOURLY AND MIN TEMPS 
WERE LOWERED A BIT WHERE CLOUDS REMAINED THIN OR ABSENT. LOW CLOUD 
DECK FORMED AT LNP (WISE CO VA)...BUT SO FAR NO FOG INDICATED. 

SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVING EAST OUT OF THE MID MS VALLEY REGION WILL 
BRING SOME MUCH WELCOMED WARMING TODAY...BUT MODELS IN GENERAL HAVE 
SLOWED DOWN THE ONSET OF LIGHT RAIN (AHEAD OF THE WARM FRONT). 
APPEARS THERE WILL BE ABOUT A 3 TO 6 HOUR PERIOD OF LIGHT TO 
MODERATE SHOWERS AHEAD OF OR WITH THE COLD FRONT TONIGHT. THE 
STRONGER DYNAMICS AND FORCING/LIFT ARE NORTH OF OUR AREA...SO JUST 
SHOWERS.

ALTHOUGH THE RAIN ARRIVES SLIGHTLY LATER...STILL EXPECT GENERALLY 
ALL RAIN TO END BY 09Z TUESDAY. TEMPS SHOULD STILL BE NO COOLER THAN 
MID TO UPPER 30S WHEN MOISTURE IS TOTALLY DEPLETED...SO NO WINTRY 
PRECIPITATION WITH THIS SYSTEM.

OTHERWISE...BASED ON HOW WARM TEMPS GOT YESTERDAY...WENT SLIGHTLY 
ABOVE THE MILDER MAXES FOR TODAY...ALSO FACTORING A SLOWER INCREASE 
IN CLOUDS. LIKED THE MILDER NAM MOS MINS TONIGHT FOR SRN AND CENTRAL 
PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA...AS BETTER COLD AIR ADVECTION SEEMS 
LIMITED TO SW VA AND NE TIP OF TN.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BRINGS A
MOSTLY SUNNY MILD LATE WINTER DAY TO THE EASTERN TN VALLEY AND
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TUESDAY. FOLLOWED CLOSE TO MAV GUIDANCE WITH
HIGHS EXPECTED TO BE IN THE UPPER 50S TO MID 60S. THE COLD FRONT
THAT PASSED THROUGH LATE MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT WILL MOVE JUST
SOUTH OF THE REGION. TUESDAY NIGHT THIS FRONT MOVES BACK NORTH AS
A WARM FRONT AS DEVELOPING SYSTEM TO THE NORTH MOVES THROUGH THE
GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY. THERE WILL BE ENOUGH MOISTURE FOR
INCREASED CLOUDS AND SOME RAIN LATE TUESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY
WEDNESDAY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA BUT THE BULK OF THIS FRONTS
MOISTURE STAYS TO THE NORTH. SKIES CLEAR QUICKLY WEDNESDAY AS
ANOTHER HIGH PRESSURE AREA SHIFTS EAST INTO THE EASTERN TN VALLEY.
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY A STRONGER SYSTEM DEVELOP THROUGH THE
PLAINS STATES. THURSDAY WILL LIKELY BE THE WARMEST DAY OF THE
EXTENDED AS WARM SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST WINDS AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM MOVE
INTO THE REGION. AIR MASS WILL BECOME SOMEWHAT UNSTABLE WITH
THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE LATE THURSDAY OR THURSDAY EVENING. THE COLD
FRONT IS PROGGED TO NOT REACH EAST TN UNTIL THE LATE NIGHT OR
MORNING HOURS FRIDAY SO TO EARLY TO TELL IF STORMS WILL BE STRONG.
UPPER FLOW BECOMES MORE ZONAL BEHIND THE FRONT AS EASTERN STATES
BECOME UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF A BROAD TROUGH. WEAK SHORTWAVE ENERGY
ROTATES THROUGH BROAD TROUGH OVER THE WEEKEND WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE
OF SHOWERS OVER MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA EACH DAY. TEMPERATURES
WILL BE COOLER MOSTLY IN THE 50S FROM FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY.

068 
FXUS64 KMRX 161942
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
242 PM EST SUN FEB 16 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE
TO BUILD IN TONIGHT AND MONDAY WITH SKIES CLEARING MUCH FASTER
TODAY THAN MODELS ANTICIPATED. ALONG WITH THE SOUTHWEST FLOW...HAD
TO RAISE TEMPERATURES THIS AFTERNOON SEVERAL MORE DEGREES FROM THE
MORNING UPDATE. CLOUDS WILL INCREASE OVER THE FORECAST AREA
OVERNIGHT...AS MID AND UPPER LEVEL MOISTURE INCREASES AHEAD OF A
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVING ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY. A COLD FRONT
WILL APPROACH THE AREA MONDAY EVENING...WITH RAIN AS THE MAIN
PRECIP TYPE. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL THROUGH MONDAY.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...ABUNDANT MOISTURE WILL
STREAM WELL TO THE NORTH ALONG A COLD FRONT THAT WILL PUSH ACROSS
THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY NIGHT. CATEGORICAL POPS WERE CHOSEN FOR AT
LEAST THE FIRST HALF OF THE EVENING WHILE THE FRONT PASSES BY.
ALTHOUGH IT/S A COLD FRONT...TEMPERATURES WILL NOT BE VERY COLD
BEHIND IT. LOOK FOR OVERNIGHT LOWS TO RANGE FROM ABOUT 33 DEGREES
IN SW VA TO 41 DEGREES FOR THE SOUTHERN TN VALLEY.

BY EARLY TUESDAY THE MAJORITY OF PRECIPITATION SHOULD HAVE MOVED 
WELL EAST OF THE AREA...HOWEVER GIVEN THE PAST FEW MISLEADING MODEL 
RUNS THE PRECIP MAY HANG AROUND A LITTLE LONGER. THE FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY WILL REMAIN CLOSE BY AND MAY SERVE AS A FOCUS FOR 
ADDITIONAL SHOWERS TO MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY. 
WEDNESDAY WILL BE A TRANSITION DAY AND CERTAINLY THE LOWEST CHANCES 
OF RAINFALL FOR THE WEEK. ANOTHER FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA ON 
THURSDAY. AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM THERE MAY BE A FEW THUNDERSTORMS 
ESPECIALLY OVER THE SOUTHERN TN VALLEY. THURSDAY NIGHT TRANSITIONS 
INTO MORE STABLE AIR BUT CHANCES FOR RAIN INCREASE DRAMATICALLY. AS 
WE MOVE INTO FRIDAY THE CONFIDENCE OF THE FORECAST IS VERY LOW. THE 
GFS IS MUCH DRIER THAN THE ECMWF. HAVE TRENDED TOWARD THE ECMWF IN 
THE LONG TERM. 

DAYTIME TEMPS FOR THE WEEK WILL GENERALLY BE IN THE 50S AND 60S. 
WHILE OVERNIGHT LOW TEMPERATURES FROM TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY WILL 
GENERALLY BE IN THE 40S. WEEKEND LOW TEMPERATURES WILL FALL BACK 
INTO THE 30S BY NEXT SUNDAY.

042 
FXUS64 KMRX 160927
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
427 AM EST SUN FEB 16 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SNOW TAPERING OFF OVER THE CENTRAL 
VALLEY AND SMOKIES AT THIS TIME...AND SHOULD MAINLY AFFECT NE TN AND 
SW VA THROUGH ABOUT 12Z TODAY. LOWERED POPS FOR THE PRE 12Z GRIDS A 
BIT IN LINE WITH LATEST RADAR TRENDS AND SURFACE OBSERVATIONS. SEEMS 
TO BE ABOUT A 1 TO 2 HR PERIOD FOR LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WITH THE 
SNOW EARLY THIS MORNING. ENDED UP WITH VERY CLOSE TO 1/2 INCH OF 
SNOW AT OUR NWS OFFICE IN MORRISTOWN. CARRIED SOME LINGERING SNOW 
SHOWERS WITH CHANCE POPS FOR EXTREME NE AREAS FROM 12Z TO 15Z.

OTHERWISE...CLOUDS WILL DECREASE BEHIND THIS PASSING DISTURBANCE... 
WHICH I WON'T REFER TO AS WEAK...SINCE WE DID GET A BAND OF 1 TO 2 
INCHES OF SNOWFALL OVERNIGHT. MODELS...OTHER THAN RUC...REALLY UNDER 
FORECAST THIS FEATURE. SUNSHINE MAKES A WELCOMED APPEARANCE AND WE 
SHOULD WARM QUITE CLOSE TO THE GFS MOS HIGHS.

GOING TO SPREAD SOME CLOUDS BACK INTO THE FORECAST GRIDS FOR TONIGHT 
BUT NOT ADDING ANY PRECIPITATION CHANCES AT THIS TIME. UPPER RIDGE 
PUSHES ITS WAY EASTWARD TONIGHT...SO THINKING THE DISTURBANCE TRACK 
WILL BE NORTH OF THE SRN APPALACHIANS. THE CLOUDS RETURNING WOULD 
FAVOR A BLEND BETWEEN THE COOLER GFS AND MILDER NAM MOS MINS. 

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...WARMING TREND CONTINUES
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA EARLY IN THE WEEK. TRANSITORY HIGH
PRESSURE AREA SHIFTS EAST EARLY MONDAY. SHORT RANGE MODELS BRING
A WEAK FRONTAL SYSTEM TOWARDS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS MONDAY. A
WARM FRONT WILL WARM TEMPERATURES SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE TODAYS HIGH
TEMPERATURES MONDAY. THE COLD FRONT MONDAY NIGHT WILL ACTUALLY
USHER IN EVEN MILDER TEMPERATURES TUESDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE WITH
A SOURCE REGION FROM THE SOUTHWEST BUILDS OVER THE TN VALLEY.
EXPECTING HIGHS IN THE UPPER 50S TO THE MID 60S. THE COLD FRONT TO
THE SOUTH WILL THEN MOVE BACK NORTH TUESDAY NIGHT. THIS WILL BRING
AN UNSETTLED PERIOD AS THE FRONT STAYS NEAR THE FORECAST AREA
THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. SKIES WILL BE MOSTLY CLOUDY
WITH SHOWERS POSSIBLE EACH DAY AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS FRIDAY AND
SATURDAY.

1255 AM EST SUN FEB 16 2014

.DISCUSSION...OPTED TO DO A QUICK UPDATE OF THE FORECAST GRIDS AND

COUNTIES OF EAST TN. THE LATEST RUC MODEL AND ACTUALLY THE 16/00Z
GFS MODEL BOTH TAKE THIS LIGHT SNOWFALL ACROSS THE REMAINDER OF NE
TN AND SW VA. SURFACE OBSERVATIONS UNDER THE SNOW BANDS EARLIER
INDICATED THE SNOW WOULD GRADUALLY REACH THE SURFACE AFTER FALLING
FROM A MID DECK FOR ABOUT AN HOUR OR TWO. KEPT ACCUMULATIONS TO
AROUND AN INCH OR LESS...BUT ALLOWED FOR UP TO 2 INCHES LOCALLY
OVER SW VA AND NRN MTNS OF E TN. SMOKIES NOT PROGGED TO BE UNDER
THE SNOW BANDS SO JUST SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS THERE AND LITTLE
ACCUMULATION. LOCALLY WE HAVE JUST UNDER 1/2 INCH OF NEW SNOW
ACCUMULATION AT OUR NWS OFFICE IN MORRISTOWN. 

SPS ISSUED EARLIER STILL LOOKS GOOD...BUT WILL ALSO UPDATE OUR
GRAPHICAST. 

&&

.AVIATION...A WEAK DISTURBANCE...MOVING THROUGH EAST TN OVERNIGHT
INTO SUNDAY MORNING WILL AFFECT MAINLY NE TN. SNOW IS MOSTLY OVER AT
TYS BUT COULD DROP VSBY TO 3 MILES NEXT 2 HOURS. AT TRI THE SNOW IS
EXPECTED TO DEVELOP FOR A FEW HOURS DROPPING VISIBILITY TO IFR
AROUND 8Z THEN IMPROVE AROUND 10Z. CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO DECREASE
THIS MORNING AT CHA FIRST...AND THEN TYS BY MID MORNING...WITH TRI
HANGING ON TO CLOUDS UNTIL AROUND 00Z MONDAY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
946 PM EST SAT FEB 15 2014

.DISCUSSION...WEAK UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCE WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE 
THROUGH OUR AREA OVERNIGHT AND INTO TOMORROW MORNING. DECIDED TO 
INCLUDE SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A LIGHT SNOW SHOWER DOWN INTO THE CENTRAL 
VALLEY AS CURRENT RADAR IMAGERY IS SHOWING SOME RETURNS ACROSS THE 
AREA WITH -SN AT CROSSVILLE HAVING BEGUN AN HOUR OR SO AGO. LOW 
LEVELS ARE VERY DRY SO IT WILL TAKE SOME TIME FOR THEM TO MOISTEN. 
HOWEVER...THE NASHVILLE OFFICE HAS RECEIVED REPORTS OF 1/2 AN INCH 
OF SNOW WITH A SOMEWHAT MODERATE BUT NARROW BAND OF PRECIP THAT IS 
CURRENTLY MOVING SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND DOWN INTO 
THE CENTRAL VALLEY. AREAS UNDER THIS BAND COULD PICK UP BETWEEN A 
TRACE AND 1/2 INCH OF SNOW. NOT ALL AREAS WILL SEE SNOW AS THE DRY 
AIR WILL BE TOO MUCH TO OVERCOME. AFTER THIS BAND MOVES 
THROUGH...PORTIONS OF THE CENTRAL VALLEY AND NORTHWARD TO SWVA WILL 
CONTINUE TO SEE LIGHT PASSING SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES THROUGH THE 
REST OF THE NIGHT. TRACE ACCUMULATIONS ARE POSSIBLE. MADE A FEW 
OVERNIGHT MIN TEMP ADJUSTMENTS...ESPECIALLY ACROSS SWVA WHERE 
CURRENTLY CLEAR SKIES HAVE ENABLED TEMPS TO DROP CLOSE TO PREVIOUSLY 
FORECAST MINS. WILL UPDATE ZONES TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING AND TO 
INCLUDE SLIGHT CHANCE SNOW FOR AFOREMENTIONED AREAS. WILL TWEAK 
HOURLY TEMPS AND DEWPOINTS TO MATCH UP WITH CURRENT OBS.

599 
FXUS64 KMRX 152011
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 PM EST SAT FEB 15 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...LOW PRESSURE OVER THE EAST
COAST WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE NORTHEAST. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL EXIT
THE AREA WITH SKIES BECOMING PARTLY CLOUDY IN THE LATE AFTERNOON
AND EVENING. MID AND UPPER LEVEL MOISTURE MOVE INTO THE REGION
AHEAD OF AN UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCE...INCREASING CLOUDS OVERNIGHT.
NORTHWEST FLOW WITH THIS SYSTEM WILL BRING THE CHANCE OF LIGHT SNOW
AMOUNTS TO NORTHEAST TENNESSEE...SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...AND THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS. AMOUNTS WILL RANGE FROM A
DUSTING TO A COUPLE OF HUNDREDTHS OF AN INCH. HIGH PRESSURE WILL
THEN MOVE INTO THE AREA FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON. WENT A COUPLE OF
DEGREES BELOW GUIDANCE FOR TONIGHT DUE TO THE CLOUD COVER
PERSISTENT THROUGH MUCH OF THE DAY. TEMPERATURES TONIGHT AND
TOMORROW WILL BE A COUPLE OF DEGREES BELOW NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF
YEAR.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)... AFTER A COOL START
TO THE DAY MONDAY MORNING...THE SPRING WARM UP WILL COMMENCE WITH
MONDAY HIGHS IN THE 50S IN MOST OF THE VALLEY. BY
WEDNESDAY...MORNING LOWS WILL BE IN THE 40S AND HIGHS SOLIDLY IN
THE 60S. TEMPS WILL FLUCTUATE A BIT DUE TO OCCASIONAL RAINY PERIODS
BUT WILL REMAIN ABOVE AVERAGE THOUGH SATURDAY. BEST RAIN CHANCES
WILL BE MONDAY NIGHT AND AGAIN THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY. MODELS ARE
STRUGGLING WITH THE TIMING OF THE LATTER WEEK FRONTAL PASSAGES/RAIN
EVENTS DUE TO THE ZONAL FLOW ALOFT PROVIDING A FAIRLY PROGRESSIVE
PATTERN OF DISTURBANCES. BUT WITH SPRINGTIME TEMPERATURES AND
MOISTURE COMES SPRINGTIME RAIN AMOUNTS...AND THE EVENT THURS
NGT/FRI AND ANOTHER POTENTIAL EVENT NEXT WEEKEND COULD HAVE A
COUPLE INCHES OF RAIN EACH FOR SOME PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA.



&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

MOUNTAINS AND WISE COUNTY IN VIRGINIA. NORTHWEST FLOW AND LOW LEVEL
MOISTURE WILL PREVAIL THROUGH THE EARLY AFTERNOON...KEEPING A
CHANCE FOR AN ADDITIONAL INCH OR TWO IN THESE AREAS. TEMPERATURES
SLOW TO RISE TODAY DUE TO CLOUD COVER...HAVE ADJUSTED HOURLY AND
MAX TEMPS TODAY TO REFLECT THIS.

FXUS64 KMRX 150920
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
420 AM EST SAT FEB 15 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOW PRESSURE
OVER WRN NC AND CENTRAL VA CONTINUES TO MOVE EAST TO NORTHEAST
THIS MORNING. THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT HAD JUST MOVED EAST OFF THE
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AT 09Z. TEMPS STAYED ON THE MILD SIDE OVERNIGHT
AND HAD JUST RECENTLY FALLEN BELOW 32 DEGREES ACROSS OUR NRN
PLATEAU COUNTIES AND PARTS OF LEE AND WISE COUNTIES OF SW VA.

WRAP AROUND MOISTURE WILL CONTINUE TO AFFECT MAINLY SW VA AND NE TN 
THIS MORNING...BUT WAS ALREADY BECOMING VERY SHALLOW OVER WRN AREAS.
THE MOISTURE DECREASE AND MILD TEMPS OVERNIGHT SEVERELY HINDERED 
GETTING MUCH SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ON OUR PLATEAU AND CENTRAL VALLEY 
COUNTIES...SO OPTED TO CANCEL THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR THOSE 
AREAS. KEEPING THE ADVISORY AND WARNING AREAS INTACT FOR NOW FOR SW 
VA...NE TN AND THE NRN/SMOKY MTNS OF E TN. RUC AND NAM MODELS SHOW A 
DECENT AMOUNT OF W-NW UPSLOPE LOW LEVEL FLOW AND SOME INSTABILITY 
THROUGH THE MORNING HOURS...PLUS SOUNDINGS IN THESE AREAS INDICATED 
A GOOD POSSIBILITY OF SNOW OCCURRING ABOVE 2500 TO 3000 FEET 
OVERNIGHT. 

OTHERWISE...TEMPS WILL PROBABLY MAX OUT THIS MORNING OR AT BEST WARM 
A FEW DEGREES IN THE AFTERNOON WITH SUNSHINE EXPECTED. MID AND HIGH 
CLOUDS SHOULD INCREASE TONIGHT WHICH SUPPORTED MORE OF A BLEND OF 
THE DIFFERING MOS MINS. ANY PRECIPITATION FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE 
A TRACE EVENT WITH FLURRIES...WHICH WAS DOWNPLAYED IN THE GRIDS. 
LATER SHIFTS MAY BE ABLE TO DROP ALL MENTION OF ANY FLURRIES FOR 
TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...WEAK DISTURBANCE IN NW FLOW
WILL BRUSH NE TN AND SW VA SUNDAY MORNING. SOME LIGHT SNOW OR SNOW
FLURRIES WILL END BY LATE MORNING THEN WEAK HIGH PRESSURE WILL
BUILD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH FLOW BECOMING MORE ZONAL. SKIES
WILL BECOME MOSTLY SUNNY CENTRAL AND SOUTH WITH TEMPERATURES WARMING
TO NEAR AVERAGE ACROSS THE SOUTH AND CENTRAL BUT LINGERING CLOUDS
ACROSS THE NORTH WILL KEEP HIGHS THERE IN THE UPPER 30S TO LOWER
40S. SUNDAY NIGHT HIGH PRESSURE BEGINS TO SHIFT EAST. MONDAY LOW
PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND DEVELOPING FRONTAL SYSTEM
SPREADS CLOUDS INTO THE TN VALLEY WITH CHANCE OF RAIN BY AFTERNOON.
SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST WINDS AHEAD OF THE FRONT WILL WARM TEMPERATURES
INTO THE 50S. THIS IS THE BEGINNING OF A MUCH WARMER PATTERN. AS THE
FRONT MOVES THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT SKIES WILL CLEAR EARLY TUESDAY AS
HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS EAST. TUESDAY WILL CONTINUE TO BE MILDER AND
SUNNY WITH HIGHS IN THE 50S TO LOWER 60S. TUESDAY NIGHT MOISTURE
SPREADS BACK NORTH AND AN UNSETTLED PATTERN SETS UP WITH SHOWERS
WEDNESDAY AS A DEEPER AREA OF LOW PRESSURE FORMS OVER THE PLAINS BY
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THIS STRONGER SYSTEM BRINGS EVEN WARMER CONDITIONS
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY AS THE MAIN FRONTAL SYSTEM APPROACHES. SHOWERS
AGAIN WILL BE ON THE INCREASE WITH THE AIR MASS BECOMING UNSTABLE
THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY WITH THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE AS HIGHS REACH
INTO THE 60S IN ALL BUT THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS BOTH DAYS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1003 PM EST FRI FEB 14 2014

.DISCUSSION...PREVIOUS FORECAST MOSTLY ON TRACK. WILL BUMP DOWN 
SNOWFALL TOTALS JUST A TAD FOR ALL AREAS BELOW 3000 FEET AS LATEST 
MODEL RUNS SHOWING A LITTLE LESS ACCUMULATION. UPPER TROUGH WILL 
CONTINUE MOVING THROUGH OUR REGION OVERNIGHT WITH RAIN EVENTUALLY 
CHANGING OVER TO ALL SNOW AS COLD AIR GETS PULLED IN ON THE BACK 
SIDE OF THE LOW. SOUNDINGS SHOW THAT AREAS ABOVE 3000/3500 FEET 
SHOULD BE ALL SNOW AT THIS POINT. FREEZING LEVEL WILL CONTINUE TO 
DROP THROUGH THE NIGHT WITH MOST LOCATIONS CHANGING OVER TO SNOW BY 
AROUND 07Z. LIGHT TO MODERATE SNOWFALL RATES ARE ARE STILL EXPECTED 
OVERNIGHT ACROSS SOME AREAS. AS WITH PREVIOUS FORECAST...SURFACE 
ABILITY TO ACCUMULATE SNOWFALL IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS IS 
QUESTIONABLE...BUT HAZARDOUS IMPACTS ARE STILL ANTICIPATED AND WILL 
THEREFORE LEAVE ALL ADVISORIES AND WARNINGS IN PLACE. WILL UPDATE 
ZONES TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING AS WELL AS TWEAK HOURLY TEMPS AND 
DEWPOINTS IN THE GRIDS.

FXUS64 KMRX 142004
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST FRI FEB 14 2014

.SHORT TERM...UPPER TROUGH MOVING EAST ACROSS TN VALLEY TONIGHT. 
STRENGTHENING BACK SIDE JET MAX SLOWING TROUGH DOWN AND DEEPENING 
IT. RELATIVELY SMALL SURFACE LOW TRACKING ALONG N TN BORDER TONIGHT 
TO OVER TRI BY SATURDAY MORNING. THINGS WE KNOW ARE SYSTEM IS A 
SMALL ... FAST AND IS CARRYING ITS OWN MOISTURE. PROGS STARTING TO 
LEAN TOWARD MORE MOISTURE ON COLD SIDE OF CYCLONE. VERY GOOD WARM UP 
TODAY BUT FREEZING LEVEL ONLY REACHING NEAR 6200 FEET. WITH ONSET OF 
RAIN TONIGHT...HIGHER ELEVATIONS WILL EASILY COOL TO BELOW FREEZING. 
MAJORITY OF PRECIPITATION ABOVE 3500 WILL LIKELY BE SNOW THROUGH THE 
EVENT. FREEZING LEVEL DOESNT DROP BELOW 3500 TIL ~15/07Z. STRONG 
COLD AIR WRAPPING AROUND LOW AFT 15/07Z. THAT IS THE TIME WHEN 
VALLEY LOCATIONS WILL BEGIN TO SEE RAIN CHANGE TO MOSTLY SNOW. THE 
FREEZING LEVEL WILL LOWER TO OR NEAR THE SURFACE THROUGH 15/12Z. 
LIGHT TO MODERATE SNOWFALL RATES ARE EXPECTED OVERNIGHT. SURFACE 
ABILITY TO ACCUMULATE IS QUESTIONABLE BUT HAZARDOUS IMPACTS WARRANT 
ADVISORY CONDITIONS WERE POSTED. ELEVATED AREAS OF THE SOUTHERN 
PLATEAU WILL BE MONITORED BUT POST COLD AIR PRECIPITATION/SNOW LOOKS 
BRIEF. SW NC HOLDS ON TO WARM AIR A BIT LONG TO INCLUDE IN ADVISORY 
FOR NOW. GOOD SPEED AND DIRECTION FOR MORNING UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
SPRING PROMISES TO MAKE AN APPEARANCE NEXT WEEK...BUT FIRST ONE MORE 
QUICK AND INSIGNIFICANT CHANCE OF SNOW FLAKES DURING SATURDAY NIGHT 
AND SUNDAY MORNING...NO REAL ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED. THE JET STREAM 
WILL THEN LIFT NORTHWARD AND PRETTY MUCH STAY THERE ALL WEEK...
KEEPING AWAY ARCTIC AIR. A WARMING SOUTHERLY FLOW AT THE SURFACE AND 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT WILL BRING SPRINGLIKE TEMPS TO THE REGION 
THROUGH THE WEEK NEXT WEEK. THIS FLOW WILL BRING GULF MOISTURE INTO 
THE AREA...INCREASING THE HUMIDITY AND KEEPING OVERNIGHT LOW 
TEMPERATURES QUITE MILD FOR THE SECOND HALF OF NEXT WEEK...SOME 
TENNESSEE VALLEY LOW TEMPS DURING LATE NEXT WEEK MAY NOT FALL BELOW 
50. WITH THE INCREASED MOISTURE COMES A GENERAL CHANCE FOR 
DISORGANIZED SHOWERS THAT WILL PERSIST MUCH OF THE WORK WEEK...WITH 
THE BEST CHANCES FOR ORGANIZED RAINFALL BEING FOCUSED MAINLY ON 
MONDAY NIGHT...AND AGAIN THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY.

SNOW ACCUMULATIONS STILL QUESTIONABLE BELOW 2000 FEET. HIGHER
ELEVATIONS STAND TO GET A NICE QUICK SHOT OF SNOW TONIGHT WITH

509 
FXUS64 KMRX 140928
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
428 AM EST FRI FEB 14 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...SHORT TERM PROBLEM EARLIER 
WAS SOME PATCHY AREAS OF FOG OR FREEZING FOG. SURFACE WINDS PICKED 
UP A BIT AND A FEW CLOUDS DRIFTED OVERHEAD...SO FOG HAS LIFTED FOR 
THE MOST PART.

MODELS SLOWING DOWN THE PRECIPITATION AHEAD OF THE UPPER TROUGH AND 
COLD FRONT...SO POPS WERE TRIMMED BACK SIGNIFICANTLY FOR TODAY. ALSO 
BUMPED UP POPS FOR AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT DUE TO THE SLOWER TIMING.
00Z GFS AND NAM MODELS CRANKING OUT SIGNIFICANTLY MORE SNOW MAINLY 
NWRN PARTS OF OUR FORECAST AREA...BUT THIS IS SUSPECT DUE TO HOW 
WARM TEMPS GET AHEAD OF THE FRONT...PLUS HOW QUICKLY THE DEEPER 
MOISTURE EXITS THE REGION. 

THUS...I STAYED WITH SNOW ACCUMULATIONS SIMILAR TO PREVIOUS GRIDS 
AND LATEST WWD GRAPHICS. COORDINATED WITH ADJACENT NWS OFFICES ON 
BUMPING THE WATCH AREA TO A LOW END WARNING EVENT (2 TO 6 INCHES)... 
AND WILL ISSUE A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR REMAINING AREAS OTHER 
THAN SE TN AND SW NC COUNTIES. NO CHANGE TO STARTING TIMES BUT DID 
EXTEND ENDING TIME FOR WARNING AND NE TN/SW VA ADVISORY OUT TO 10 AM 
EST SATURDAY. 

OTHERWISE...TRENDED VERY CLOSE TO SIMILAR MOS TEMPS FOR TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...THEN FAVORED THE COOLER GFS MOS FOR MAX TEMPS ON 
SATURDAY.  

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...ANOTHER WEAKER
CLIPPER TYPE SYSTEM TO AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT AND
EARLY SUNDAY. HAVE KEPT PRECIPITATION CHANCES LOW AND ONLY MINOR
ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED. AFTER THIS FAST MOVING SYSTEM MOVES OUT
LATER SUNDAY TEMPERATURES REBOUND AS FLOW BECOMES MORE ZONAL. ONLY
A BRIEF PERIOD OF CLEARING SUNDAY NIGHT AND EARLY MONDAY BEFORE A
STRONGER SYSTEM TO BRING A CHANCE OF JUST RAIN LATE MONDAY INTO
TUESDAY. GFS BRINGS FRONT THROUGH BRINGING DRIER WEATHER TO THE
REGION TUESDAY WHILE ECMWF KEEPS FRONT CLOSE BY TO THE SOUTH. WILL
FOLLOW THE WETTER ECMWF SOLUTION. SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT AND LOWER
PRESSURE DEVELOPING TO THE SOUTHWEST WILL INDUCE MORE LIFT ALONG
THE FRONT. ANOTHER SHORTWAVE ALONG FRONT SPREADS RAIN BACK NORTH
TUESDAY AND THE WET PATTERN CONTINUES THROUGH THURSDAY. SOUTHERLY
FLOW WILL ADD GULF MOISTURE INTO THE TN VALLEY WITH WARMING
TEMPERATURES INTO THE 60S BY WEDNESDAY SOUTH AND THURSDAY ALL THE
WAY NORTH INTO VIRGINIA AND A CHANCE OF A FEW THUNDERSTORMS.
HEAVIER RAINS BY WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY ANY ANY LEFTOVER SNOW MELT
MAY CREATE SOME RIVER RISES.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
900 PM EST THU FEB 13 2014

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED 
OFF THE NEW JERSEY COAST...WITH AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED 
OVER THE NORTHERN GULF OF MEXICO. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS THAT 
CLOUDS HAVE CLEARED OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA...WITH TEMPS 
RANGING FROM THE UPPER 20S OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN TO THE 
UPPER 30S OVER SOUTHEAST TN. WITH LIGHT WINDS ALSO EXPECTED 
TONIGHT...GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING AND ADDITIONAL COOLING FROM THE 
SNOW COVER WILL CAUSE TEMPS TO FALL WELL INTO THE 20S OVER MOST OF 
THE FORECAST AREA. A POTENTIAL CONCERN FOR TONIGHT WILL BE THE 
DEVELOPMENT OF BLACK ICE FROM THE REFREEZING OF LINGERING MOISTURE 
ON AREA ROADWAYS.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...AND 
WILL NOT PLAN TO UPDATE THIS EVENING.

482 
FXUS64 KMRX 132106
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 PM EST THU FEB 13 2014

.NEAR TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...SHORT WAVE SURFACE RIDGE MOVES 
ACROSS THE AREA TODAY AND TONIGHT. CLEAR SKIES WILL LEAD TOWARD GOOD 
COOLING EARLY TONIGHT. THIS COUPLED WITH SNOW FIELDS LEADS FORECAST 
TO LOW END OR BELOW GUIDANCE FOR MINS TONIGHT. STRONG LOW LEVEL 
INVERSION SETS UP TONIGHT. EVAPORATION AND SUBLIMATION OF SNOW 
SHOULD LEAD TO A RELATIVELY MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER. MODEL T/TD SPREADS 
ARE FAIRLY WIDE BUT FEEL LATE NIGHT PATCHY FREEZING FOG WILL OCCUR. 
DECENT WARM AIR ADVECTION IN SOUTHWEST FLOW FRIDAY AS UPPER TROUGH 
APPROACHES FROM THE WEST LATE. INCREASING CLOUDINESS THROUGH THE 
AFTERNOON. PRECIPITATION MOST LIKELY HOLDING OFF THROUGH DAY TIME 
HOURS.  

.SHORT TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY)...ANOTHER DYNAMIC SYSTEM 
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE CENTRAL PLAINS...OHIO VALLEY INTO THE CENTRAL 
AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. MODELS SHOW A 
NICE LOBE OF Q-VECTOR FORCING ASSOCIATED WITH THE SHORT-WAVE AS WELL
AS FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING ALONG THE FRONT AND ISENTROPIC LIFT AHEAD 
OF THE FRONT. THE STRONG FORCING WILL PRODUCE ANOTHER ROUND OF 
PRECIPITATION STARTING 00Z SATURDAY. THE UPPER TROUGH WILL BRING 
WITH IT FAIRLY GOOD 500MB TEMPERATURES BETWEEN -30 TO -32 DEGREES 
CELSIUS ALONG WITH STRONG 850MB COLD AIR ADVECTION FRIDAY EVENING. 

MODELS SHOW GOOD LIFT WITHIN THE DENDRITIC GROWTH REGION BETWEEN 
00-04Z...HOWEVER...SOUNDINGS INDICATE THE FIRST 100MB WILL BE TOO 
WARM FOR SNOW. I FEEL THAT THE STRONG FORCING AND COLD AIR ALOFT 
WILL HELP OVER-COME THE SHALLOW BOUNDARY LAYER WARM AIR TO 
EVENTUALLY CHANGE RAIN TO SNOW FRIDAY EVENING. FOR THE 
MOUNTAINS...ABOVE 2500 FEET...CHANGE TO SNOW WILL OCCUR FAIRLY 
QUICKLY TO WARRANT A WATCH FOR 3 TO 6 INCHES. WILL ISSUE A SPS FOR 
THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA WITH 1 TO 2 INCHES POSSIBLE.

SYSTEM MOVES OUT FOR SATURDAY WITH RETURN OF SUNSHINE IN THE MORNING.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
THERE IS A WARM-UP COMING! TENNESSEE VALLEY DAYTIME HIGHS MAY BE IN 
THE 60S BY MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. DEFINITELY A GLIMPSE OF SPRING. 

NORTHWEST FLOW SAT NGT AND SUNDAY MAY ALLOW A WEAK SYSTEM TO QUICKLY 
MOVE SOME LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA LATE 
SATURDAY NIGHT...NO ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED. ZONAL FLOW AFTER SUNDAY 
WILL KEEP AWAY ARCTIC AIR WHILE PUSHING A WEAK FRONTAL SYSTEM 
THROUGH THE REGION MONDAY NIGHT WITH A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS. ONE 
CAVEAT IS IF A SUBSTANTIAL AMOUNT OF SNOW REMAINS ON THE GROUND OVER 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS UNTIL MONDAY NIGHT...THEN THE MONDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH MID-WEEK RAINS WOULD RAPIDLY MELT THE SNOW AND PROVIDE 
SNOWMELT-ASSISTED RIVER RISES. BY TUESDAY...SOUTHERLY SURFACE WINDS 
WILL DEVELOP WHILE UPPER LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD OVER THE MID 
ATLANTIC STATES...PLACING US IN SW FLOW ALOFT TOO. THE RESULT WILL 
BE THE INVASION OF HIGHER TEMPERATURES AND DEWPOINTS FROM TUESDAY 
THROUGH SATURDAY...WITH A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS EACH DAY. EXPECT THE 
AFOREMENTIONED HIGHS IN THE 60S WHILE OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL DIP ONLY 
INTO THE 40S THANKS TO THE INCREASED MOISTURE.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    22  42  26  35  23 /  10  70 100  10  20

222 
FXUS64 KMRX 130815
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EST THU FEB 13 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...STRONG WINTER STORM WILL SLOWLY 
COME TO AN END TODAY.  WILL EXTEND THE WARNING OVER PORTIONS OF THE 
CENTRAL VALLEY UNTIL 15Z.  SNOW SHOULD END AROUND THE CHA AREA BY 
SUNRISE SO WILL PLAN TO ALLOW THAT WARNING TO EXPIRE AT 12Z.  THE 
WARNING OVER SOUTHWEST NC WILL EXPIRE AT 18Z AND THE EAST TN 
MOUNTAIN...SOUTHWEST VA AND THE NORTHERN TN VALLEY WILL REMAIN UNDER A 
WARNING THROUGH 00Z FRI.  WITH SIGNIFICANT SNOW COVER CROSS THE 
REGION...TEMPERATURES WILL STRUGGLE TO CLIMB THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EXPECTED HIGHS TO ONLY REACH INTO THE 30S WITH A FEW LOW 40S SOUTH.  
A FEW FLURRIES MAY LINGERING OVER FAR NORTHEASTERN AREAS THIS 
EVENING...OTHERWISE ALL SNOW SHOULD BE ENDED BY 00Z.  FLOW ALOFT 
WILL BECOME ZONAL TONIGHT AND SKIES SHOULD BRIEFLY CLEAR AS 
TEMPERATURES FALL INTO THE 20S ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO BE IN 
DECENT AGREEMENT OVERALL FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD...AND FORECAST 
CONFIDENCE IS ABOUT AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.  A SHORT WAVE AND 
COLD FRONT WILL SWING ACROSS THE AREA FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. 
APPEARS THERE WILL BE AN AREA OF RAIN THAT WILL MOVE IN FRIDAY...AND 
LINGER INTO FRIDAY NIGHT.  A LOOK AT THERMAL PROFILES SUGGESTS THERE 
MAY BE SOME SNOW FRIDAY OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...AND THE RAIN 
MAY TRANSITION TO SNOW FRIDAY NIGHT BEFORE ENDING EVEN IN LOWER 
ELEVATION AREAS.  SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE 
POSSIBLE...ESPECIALLY HIGHER ELEVATIONS. NO ADVISORY FOR NOW 
ESPECIALLY GIVEN THE ONGOING WARNING FOR THE CURRENT EVENT...BUT 
WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION IN HWO.  ANOTHER WEAKER SHORT WAVE FORECAST 
TO BRUSH BY TO OUR NORTH SAT NIGHT INTO SUNDAY...BUT JUST SOME 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS MAINLY NORTH WITH THIS ONE. SHOULD BE DRY AND 
MILDER SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...THEN A WEAK COLD 
FRONT EXPECTED TO PUSH IN MONDAY NIGHT. IT SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR 
ALL RAIN SHOWERS WITH THIS ONE...AND WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS ALL 
ZONES FOR MONDAY NIGHT...SLIGHT CHANCE TUESDAY. NOT REALLY ANY PUSH 
OF COLD AIR BEHIND THIS WEAK FRONT...SO SHOULD BE WARM AND PRECIP 
FREE ON WEDNESDAY. WILL GENERALLY GO NEAR OR UNDERCUT GFS MOS TEMPS 
FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

INTO THESE SECTIONS OF THE GREAT VALLEY. MAINTAINED A CLEARING

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
920 PM EST WED FEB 12 2014

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED OVER 
THE FL PANHANDLE...WITH AN INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH EXTENDING NORTH 
OF IT ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. AREA RADARS REVEAL THAT SNOW 
HAS INCREASED IN INTENSITY AND AREAL COVERAGE OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS EVENING...AS DIVERGENCE ALOFT INCREASES WITH A DEFORMATION ZONE 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. IN ADDITION...SNOW HAS INCREASED FURTHER 
UPSTREAM OVER MIDDLE TN AND NORTHERN AL...WHERE SATELLITE IMAGERY 
REVEALS COLDER CLOUD TOPS IN THE BASE OF THE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY. THIS UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL CONTINUE TO SLOWLY 
DRIFT EASTWARD OVER THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...WITH MODERATE TO 
HEAVY SNOW CONTINUING FOR SEVERAL MORE HOURS OVERNIGHT.

AS A RESULT...WILL KEEP THE SNOWFALL FORECAST UNCHANGED THIS 
EVENING...AND WILL CONTINUE THE WINTER STORM WARNINGS/ADVISORIES 
WITHOUT ANY CHANGES. HOWEVER...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE ZONE 
FORECASTS THIS EVENING TO LOWER TEMPS A LITTLE...ESPECIALLY OVER THE 
NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA WHERE DRIER AIR HAS CREATED MORE 
EVAPORATIVE COOLING THIS EVENING.
&&

656 PM EST WED FEB 12 2014

.AVIATION... WINTER STORM SYSTEM CURRENTLY MAKING ITS WAY VERY
SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. TRIED TO STAY ON THE PESSIMISTIC
SIDE CONCERNING FLIGHT WEATHER AT THE TERMINALS THROUGH MUCH OF THE
FIRST 6 TO 12 HOURS OF THE FORECAST WITH THE SECOND HALF OF THE
STORM SYSTEM ON ITS WAY. THIS SECOND HALF...CURRENTLY SEEN AS AN
ENHANCEMENT ON IR SATELLITE IMAGERY ACROSS NORTHERN ALABAMA AND
MIDDLE TENNESSEE...WILL BE BUILDING SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIAN REGION THROUGH THE NEXT 12-15 HOURS. THEREFORE...KEPT
IFR CONDITIONS IN LIGHT TO OCCASIONALLY MODERATE SNOW AND FOG WITH 
WIDESPREAD CEILINGS AROUND 600 TO 1000 FEET. IMPROVEMENT WILL
OCCUR FROM AROUND 12Z AT CHA TO AROUND 18Z AT TYS. TRI MAY HANG
ONTO AN MVFR CEILING FROM 18Z ONWARD.

FXUS64 KMRX 122028
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
328 PM EST WED FEB 12 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...UPPER LOW MOVING THROUGH THE TN 
VALLEY TONIGHT...THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS EARLY 
THURSDAY...THEN TO NEAR THE NC/VA COAST BY LATE THURSDAY. SURFACE 
LOW OVER FL PNHDLE WILL DEEPEN AND MOVE NORTHEAST TONIGHT AND ALONG 
THE ATLANTIC COAST ON THU. 

INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH EXTENDS INTO THE EASTERN MIDDLE TN VALLEY 
FROM SOUTHERN LOW. LAYER MOISTURE HAS BEEN ON THE RISE TODAY AND 
WILL MAINTAIN IN ADVANCE OF UPPER LOW/TROUGH AXIS OVERNIGHT. +3C 
WARM LAYER...SHOWING UP NICELY IN 12/18Z FFC SOUNDING PROVING TO BE 
INTERESTING FEATURE IN RELATION TO PRECIPITATION TYPE ACROSS 
SOUTHERN AREAS. THESE SWINGS IN PRECIP TYPE HAVE BEEN REPORTED AS FAR N 
AS ATHENS MID DAY TODAY. A DOWN VALLEY LOWER LAYER FLOW IS TAKING 
SHAPE AND THE WARM LAYER IS EXPECTED TO MOVE SOUTH OF THE TN BORDER 
SHORTLY. H70 DEFORMATION ZONE MODELED NICELY AND ESTABLISHING ALONG 
NW MRX CWA BORDER. LATEST SAT PIX VERIFYING POSITION. SNOW BANDS 
SHOULD BE ON THE INCREASE THIS EVENING AND CONTINUE OVERNIGHT. BEST 
FRONTOGENESIS DEPICTED FROM 13/00-13/06Z. ORIENTATION/PIVOT OF 
DEFORMATION ZONE OVERNIGHT SUPPORTS SNOW LINGERING IN NE AREAS EARLY 
THU. A CRACK OF THUNDERSNOW POSSIBLE WHEN COLDER CORE MID LEVEL TEMPS 
SLIDE IN OVERNIGHT. BEST CHANCE ALONG SOUTHERN MOUNTAINS. 
TEMPERATURES WILL MOVE LITTLE AND LEANED COOLER FOR THU EXPECTING CU 
FIELD TO LINGER A BIT LONGER THAN CURRENT MODEL DEPICTION.    

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
IN WAKE OF TODAY WINTER STORM...CLEARING WILL BEGIN TO TAKE PLACE BY 
THE LATE AFTERNOON AND EVENING ON THURSDAY. THE SUBFREEZING 
TEMPERATURES WILL RESULT IN A REFREEZING OF ANY LINGERING SNOW AND 
SLUSH ON ROADWAYS...CREATING SOME HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS 
OVERNIGHT AND THROUGH THE FRIDAY MORNING COMMUTE. THIS OTHERWISE 
BOUT OF QUIET WEATHER WILL BE SHORT-LIVED HOWEVER...AS ANOTHER 
SHORTWAVE WILL SWING THROUGH THE AREA ON FRIDAY. AHEAD OF THIS 
SYSTEM...SOME BREEZY SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL HELP TO PUSH HIGHS WELL 
INTO THE UPPER 30S TO MID 40S. THIS WILL HELP TO MELT SOME OF THE 
LINGERING SNOWPACK AND ALLOW FOR SOME RAIN SHOWERS TO SPREAD OVER 
THE REGION AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM BY THE AFTERNOON. HOWEVER...AS 
TEMPERATURES COOL BY THE EVENING...THE RAIN WILL MIX WITH AND CHANGE 
OVER TO SNOW. ONLY VERY MINOR ACCUMULATIONS ARE EXPECTED IN MOST 
LOCATIONS...BUT HIGHER ELEVATIONS AREAS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE COULD SEE SOME LOW-END ADVISORY-LEVEL 
ACCUMULATIONS. 

ANOTHER CLIPPER SYSTEM WILL BRING SOME LIGHT SNOW AND RAIN SHOWERS 
FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY BEFORE RIDGING WILL PROMOTE A WARM-UP 
INTO THE 50S ACROSS THE REGION SUNDAY AND MONDAY. ANOTHER STRONG 
STORM SYSTEM LOOKS AS IF IT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION SOMETIME 
INTO THE EARLY PART OF THE WORK WEEK...BUT THE LONG-TERM SOLUTIONS 
DIFFER WITH THE TIMING AND MAGNITUDE OF THE PRECIPITATION. HAVE 
ATTEMPTED A BLEND OF THE GFS AND  ECMWF AND HAVE SOME CHANCE POPS 
WORKING THEIR WAY MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY...WITH IT LOOKING AS 
IF IT WILL BE WARM ENOUGH TO BE A MOSTLY RAIN EVENT FOR NOW. 
THEREAFTER...TEMPERATURES MAY APPROACH THE UPPER 50S AND LOWER 60S 
RIDGING MOVES BACK IN TO CLOSE OUT THE PERIOD.  


&&

.AVIATION...SURFACE LOW TRAVELING NORTH ALONG THE CAROLINA COASTS
THROUGH THE PERIOD. SURFACE WINDS WILL BE LIGHT AND NORTHEAST
SHIFTING TO THE NORTHWEST LATE IN THE PERIOD. FREEZING LEVEL WILL
BE NEAR THE SURFACE THROUGH THE PERIOD. AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL
SWING THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TONIGHT. THIS FEATURE WILL
DRAW MOISTURE INTO THE AREA FOR MUCH OF THE PERIOD. SOME MIXED
PRECIPITATION EARLY THIS AFTERNOON VCNTY CHA BUT ALL SNOW IS
EXPECTED THIS EVENING AND OVERNIGHT. CONDITIONS WILL LOWER TO IFR
MAINLY FOR CIGS WILL VSBYS ALSO LOWERING DURING MODERATE TO HEAVY
SNOWFALL. MVFR CONDITIONS WILL RETURN TO CHA BEFORE 13/12Z...TYS
BEFORE 13/15Z WITH CONDITIONS IMPROVING TOWARD THE END OF THE
PERIOD AT TRI.

.DISCUSSION...NAM BUFR SOUNDINGS SHOW BRIEF WARMING AT AROUND 3000
FEET EARLY THIS AFTERNOON. THIS IS SHOWING UP IN SOME OBS WITH
MIXED PRECIP ALONG TN/GA BORDER. WARM LAYER APPEARS THIN AND SHOULD
BE BRIEF WITH CHANGE OVER TO SNOW STILL EXPECTED.

TONIGHT PERIOD WHEN PROLONGED MODERATE SNOWFALL IS EXPECTED.
NORTHWEST PLATEAU STILL LOOKS GOOD IN ADVISORY WITH LESS THAN 4
INCHES EXPECTED BUT MINOR PATTERN SHIFT COULD CHANGE OUTLOOK.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
331 AM EST WED FEB 12 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MAJOR WINTER STORM SET TO
MOVE INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION TODAY. LOW PRESSURE
SYSTEM TRACKING THROUGH GA AND ACROSS THE CAROLINAS WILL BRING IN
DEEP MOISTURE AND STRONG LIFT ACROSS THE REGION TODAY AND TONIGHT.
THIS LOOKS LIKE AN ALL SNOW EVENT. SNOW WILL DEVELOP TO OUR SOUTH
EARLY THIS MORNING AND SLOWLY WORK NORTHWARD INTO THE FAR SOUTHERN
AREAS OF THE MRX CWA AROUND 12Z...REACHING NEAR TYS AROUND 15Z AND
INTO THE NORTHERN LOCATIONS AROUND THE 18Z TIME FRAME. SIGNIFICANT
SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS ARE EXPECTED WITH 3 TO 6 INCHES POSSIBLE
OVER THE SOUTHERN...4 TO 8 CENTRAL VALLEY...5 TO 9 OVER THE NORTH
VALLEY AND SW VA...1 TO 4 OVER THE NORTHER CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND 8
TO 12 OVER THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS. LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS ARE
POSSIBLE...ESPECIALLY AT THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS. THE SYSTEM WILL
PULL AWAY FROM THE AREA LATE TONIGHT INTO THURSDAY. SNOW SHOULD END
OVER SOUTHERN LOCATIONS BY SUNRISE. HOWEVER...EXPECT SNOW TO
CONTINUE TO ACCUMULATE OVER THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS...NORTHEAST TN
AND SW VA INTO THURSDAY. A WINTER STORM WARNING IS IN EFFECT FOR
TODAY AND TONIGHT...HOWEVER WILL EXTEND THE WARNING THROUGH 18Z
THURSDAY FOR THE TN MOUNTAINS AND THE NORTHERN COUNTIES.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT OVERALL FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD...AND FORECAST CONFIDENCE 
IS ABOUT AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.  A SHORT WAVE WILL SWING 
ACROSS THE AREA FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH SOME SHOWERS/SNOW 
SHOWERS.  WILL CARRY LIKELY POPS ALL ZONES FRIDAY AND NORTHERN HALF 
FRIDAY NIGHT.  MAY BE SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS...SO WILL 
MENTION IN HWO. ANOTHER WEAKER SHORT WAVE FORECAST TO BRUSH BY TO 
OUR NORTH SAT NIGHT INTO SUNDAY...BUT JUST SOME SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS...LOW CHANCE FAR NORTH...WITH THIS ONE. SHOULD BE DRY AND 
MILDER SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY...THEN A COLD FRONT EXPECTED 
TO PUSH IN MONDAY NIGHT. IT SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR ALL RAIN 
SHOWERS WITH THIS ONE...AND WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS ALL ZONES FOR 
MONDAY.
