289 
FXUS64 KMRX 112022
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EST TUE FEB 11 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...SKIES HAVE BECOME 
MOSTLY SUNNY THIS AFTERNOON OVER THE NORTHWEST TWO THIRDS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. DEWPOINTS HAVE DROPPED TO THE TEENS AND COLDER IN 
NORTHERN SECTIONS. TEMPERATURES HAVE WARMED TO AROUND 40 IN THE 
LOWER ELEVATION SUNNY AREAS TO 30S ELSEWHERE. ONLY LIGHT SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS OCCURRED MAINLY SE TN AND SW NC MOUNTAINS. 

MODELS STILL SHOWING DIFFERENCES IN SYSTEM WITH GFS...CANADIAN AND 
ECMWF SHOWING A DEEPER TROUGH DIGGING SOUTH WEDNESDAY THROUGH 
THURSDAY OVER THE EASTERN STATES AND SURFACE LOW TRACKING FROM THE 
NE GULF ACROSS NORTH FLORIDA AND UP THE EAST COAST COMPARED TO THE 
NAM. THIS DEEPER TROUGH IS EXPECTED TO INDUCE MORE LIFT OVER EAST TN 
AND ADJACENT NC MOUNTAINS WEDNESDAY AND SHIFTING NORTHEAST WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT WITH SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL EXPECTED. INCREASED QPF AMOUNTS 
WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS MODELS SHOWING INCREASED 
FORCING DURING THAT TIME PERIOD. INCREASED TOTAL SNOWFALL AMOUNTS A 
COUPLE INCHES EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST AND AROUND ONE INCH 
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND NORTHERN PLATEAU. INCREASED POPS SLIGHTLY 
OVERNIGHT TONIGHT AND EARLY TOMORROW AND KEPT SOME LIGHT RAIN OR 
SLEET IN GRIDS IN SE TN SECTIONS THROUGH 12Z WEDNESDAY. LOWS TONIGHT 
WILL ONLY FALL TO AROUND 30 ACROSS THE EXTREME SOUTH WHERE CLOUDS 
WILL LIKELY NOT THIN MUCH. FARTHER NORTH TEMPERATURES EXPECTED TO 
DROP INTO THE MID TO UPPER 20S EXCEPT ALONG THE KY BORDER AND SW VA 
WHERE SKIES MAY STAY CLEAR MOST OF THE NIGHT. WEDNESDAY TEMPERATURES 
NOT LIKELY TO RISE MUCH IN THE MORNING SOUTH WITH SNOW STARTING 
EARLY. CENTRAL AND NORTH SECTIONS STARTING COLDER COULD SEE 
TEMPERATURES RISING TO AROUND FREEZING OR SLIGHTLY HIGHER BEFORE 
SNOW STARTS TO FALL. WENT A COUPLE DEGREES BELOW MAV GUIDANCE 
WEDNESDAY MOST LOCATIONS. WEDNESDAY NIGHT GENERALLY FOLLOWED MAV 
GUIDANCE FOR LOWS AS SNOW CONTINUES BUT WILL LIKELY TAPER OFF FROM 
WEST TO EAST AFTER MIDNIGHT. WINTER STORM WATCH WILL BE CHANGED TO 
WARNING WITH THIS FORECAST AND ONLY THREE NORTHERN PLATEAU COUNTIES 
WILL HAVE LOW ENOUGH TOTALS FOR ADVISORY. WARNING WILL BE STAGGERED 
FROM SOUTH 12Z...CENTRAL AREAS 15Z AND 18Z NORTHEAST ENDING AT 12Z 
THURSDAY. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN REASONABLE 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL THREE QUICK-MOVING SYSTEMS AFFECTING 
THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE FRIDAY/FRIDAY NIGHT...SATURDAY NIGHT/ 
SUNDAY...AND MONDAY/MONDAY NIGHT TIME PERIODS. THERE REMAIN SOME 
DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE MODELS REGARDING THE AMOUNT OF MOISTURE 
EXPECTED WITH EACH OF THESE SYSTEMS...BUT THE MODELS SHOW VERY GOOD 
TIMING AGREEMENTS WITH THESE THREE SYSTEMS. THE GFS...CANADIAN...AND 
ECMWF MODELS ALL AGREE THAT THE FIRST CLIPPER SYSTEM ON FRIDAY/ 
FRIDAY NIGHT WILL BRING A GOOD COVERAGE OF PRECIP FRIDAY AFTERNOON 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. WITH TEMPS EXPECTED TO BE IN THE UPPER 30S 
TO LOWER 40S ON FRIDAY AFTERNOON...IT APPEARS THAT THE INITIAL 
PRECIP WILL BEGIN AS RAIN...BUT THIS RAIN SHOULD THEN QUICKLY CHANGE 
TO SNOW AS THE SUN SETS FRIDAY EVENING. RIGHT NOW...IT APPEARS THAT 
SOME LIGHT SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH THIS SYSTEM 
BY FRIDAY NIGHT...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. ANOTHER 
WEAKER UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE WILL THEN MOVE ACROSS THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY DURING THE SATURDAY NIGHT/SUNDAY TIME PERIOD...BRINGING A 
RAIN/SNOW MIXTURE AGAIN ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. 

ANOTHER FAIRLY STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS THEN PROGGED TO REMAIN 
NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA (OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION) DURING THE 
MONDAY/MONDAY NIGHT TIME PERIOD...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT 
TRIGGERING MOSTLY RAIN SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. BECAUSE OF 
ITS MORE NORTHERLY TRACK...IT APPEARS RIGHT NOW THAT WARMER TEMPS 
WILL BE PULLED NORTHWARD INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY RESULTING IN 
MAINLY A RAIN EVENT FOR THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
GENERALLY TREND COOLER THAN THE GFS NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...WHICH IS IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS...AND 
ALSO TAKES INTO ACCOUNT THE EXPECTED SNOW COVER WHICH WILL LIKELY 
KEEP TEMPS COOLER THAN GUIDANCE.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1107 AM EST TUE FEB 11 2014

.DISCUSSION...UPDATED FORECAST TO REMOVE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY
AND LOWER POPS SOUTHERN SECTIONS AS RADARS SHOW PRECIPITATION IS
MOSTLY SOUTH OF THE TN/GA BORDER AND EAST OF THE TN/NC BORDER.
STILL REPORTING SOME LIGHT RAIN AND SNOW SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA
SO KEEPING CHANCE POPS THERE FOR THE AFTERNOON. NORTHERN AND
CENTRAL SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA ARE MOSTLY SUNNY SO DECREASED
CLOUD COVER SOME OVER CENTRAL SECTIONS. HIGH TEMPERATURES LOOK A
LITTLE TOO WARM SOUTHERN SECTIONS BUT CLOUDS MAY THIN SOME LATER
THIS AFTERNOON. CHANGED HIGHS TO AROUND 40 LOWER ELEVATIONS SOUTH
AND CENTRAL. UPDATED WORDING IN WSW SLIGHTLY AND REISSUED. STILL
LOOKS LIKE SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL STARTING WEDNESDAY MORNING AND

FXUS64 KMRX 110903
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EST TUE FEB 11 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...BAND OF ISENTROPIC LIFT BRUSHING 
SOUTHERN AREAS THIS MORNING.  SOME SNOW CAN BE EXPECTED MAINLY 
DURING THE MORNING HOURS. LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS STILL LOOK POSSIBLE IN 
THE ADVISORY AREA...SO WILL LEAVE IN PLACE.  HOWEVER...WILL MOVE 
ENDING TIME UP TO NOON AS IT APPEARS ACCUMULATING SNOW SHOULD BE 
OVER BY THEN. SHOULD BE A FAIRLY TIGHT GRADIENT ON THE PRECIP...SO 
WILL KEEP THINGS DRY FURTHER NORTH. TONIGHT...MOISTURE WILL START TO 
INCREASE AGAIN AHEAD OF THE NEXT SYSTEM.  SOME LIGHT SNOW AND/OR 
SLEET MAY BEGIN TO MOVE INTO MAINLY SOUTHERN AREAS LATE.  WILL CARRY 
CHANCE POPS FAR SOUTH...SLIGHT CHANCE CENTRAL.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS COMING INTO BETTER 
AGREEMENT REGARDING A STRONG WINTER STORM SYSTEM THAT WILL MOVE INTO 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON WEDNESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  
HOWEVER...THIS IS STILL SOME MINOR DIFFERENCES IN EXACT TRACK OF 
LOW.  THIS SYSTEM HAS DEEP MOISTURE AND STRONG LIFT.  THIS COMBINED 
WITH A COLD TEMPERATURE PROFILE WILL GENERATE A SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL 
EVENT.  AROUND 4 INCHES OF SNOW IS POSSIBLE ACROSS MANY VALLEY 
LOCATIONS...WITH 6 TO 9 EXPECTED IN THE MOUNTAINS.  THE WINTER STORM 
WATCH WILL BE EXPANDED ACROSS ALL AREAS BUT THE NORTHERN PLATEAU.  
THE SYSTEM WILL SLOWLY PULL OUT LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY.  
A FEW SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS MAY LINGER OVER THE EASTERN LOCATIONS 
INTO THURSDAY AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN.  THE NEXT 
SYSTEM...A QUICK CLIPPER SYSTEM...MOVES IN ON FRIDAY.  AS THE PRECIP 
MOVES IN FRIDAY MORNING...EXPECTED MAINLY LIGHT SNOW...HOWEVER AS 
TEMPERATURES WARM DURING THE AFTERNOON THE SNOW WILL TRANSITION TO 
RAIN.  ANY LINGER SHOWERS WILL SWITCH BACK TO LIGHT SNOW FRIDAY 
NIGHT.  ANOTHER CLIPPER SYSTEM MOVES IN AROUND THE SATURDAY NIGHT 
TIME FRAME.  THIS ONE HAS LESS MOISTURE AND WILL KEEP POPS LOW AT 20 
WITH RAIN CHANGING TO LIGHT SNOW DURING THE NIGHT.

&&

740 
FXUS64 KMRX 102022
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EST MON FEB 10 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...COLDER MODIFIED ARCTIC AIR MASS 
CONTINUES TO FILTER COLD AIR INTO THE REGION TODAY. LIGHT SNOW 
SHOWERS AND FLURRIES HAVE DEVELOPED FIRST AROUND CHA AND THEN LATER 
TODAY ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA. ONLY A FEW ACCUMULATION REPORTS HAVE 
COME IN AND THEY HAVE BEEN LIGHT. CURRENT TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE 
UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF PLATEAU AND EASTERN AND 
NORTHERN MOUNTAINS TO MID 30S TO JUST ABOVE 40 LOWER VALLEYS. 
CURRENT PRECIPITATION ACROSS THE NORTH AND MOUNTAINS SHOULD SHIFT 
EAST INTO NC AFTER 00Z. THERE THEN MAY BE SOME CLEARING NORTHERN 
AREAS AS DRIER AIR CONTINUES FILTERING. LOWS WILL BE IN THE TEENS 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS NORTHERN PLATEAU AND SW VA TO 20S TO NEAR 30 
ELSEWHERE. A SHORTWAVE MOVING ACROSS AL AND GA TUESDAY WILL ENHANCE 
LIFT ACROSS THE SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH SOME 
LIGHT SNOW FROM ABOUT 9Z THROUGH MID TO LATE AFTERNOON. UP TO ABOUT 
ONE INCH OF SNOW IS POSSIBLE OVER THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN VALLEY 
AND ONE TO THREE INCHES SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC MOUNTAINS 
DURING THE DAY TUESDAY. WITH CLOUD COVER ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
SECTIONS TEMPERATURES EXPECTED TO BE BELOW GUIDANCE WITH UPPER 20S 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS TO 30S LOWER ELEVATIONS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN REASONABLE 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...BUT ARE BACK TO SHOWING SOME DIFFERENCES WITH PATH OF THE 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM FOR WEDNESDAY/WEDNESDAY NIGHT. A LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP ALONG THE NORTHERN GULF COAST WEDNESDAY 
MORNING...AND WILL THEN MOVE NORTHEASTWARD UP ALONG THE CAROLINA 
COAST ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT. ITS ASSOCIATED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS 
PROGGED TO SWING ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON INTO 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WHICH WILL HELP TO CREATE A DEFORMATION ZONE OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA AND WILL PULL SOME MOISTURE FROM THE SURFACE LOW 
(OVER THE CAROLINA COAST) FARTHER WEST OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THE 
LATEST NAM MODEL RUN SHOWS MOST OF THIS SYSTEM'S MOISTURE REMAINING 
EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS OVER THE CAROLINAS...WITH ONLY SOME LIGHT 
PRECIP AMOUNTS OVER THE GREAT TN VALLEY. HOWEVER...THE LATEST RUNS 
OF THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS CONTINUE TO BRING SOME DECENT MOISTURE 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT... 
WHICH SHOULD RESULT IN AT LEAST ADVISORY SNOWFALL AMOUNTS (GENERALLY 
ONE TO FOUR INCHES) BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT. RIGHT NOW...IT APPEARS THAT 
TEMPS ON WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON WILL BE WARM ENOUGH FOR THE INITIAL 
PRECIP TO BEGIN AS RAIN...BUT THIS RAIN SHOULD THEN QUICKLY CHANGE 
TO SNOW AS THE SUN SETS WEDNESDAY EVENING. SINCE THE FORECAST AREA 
WILL BE ON THE WESTERN EDGE OF THE PRECIP AREA ASSOCIATED WITH THIS 
SYSTEM...LATER MODEL RUNS COULD EASILY CHANGE PRECIP AMOUNTS OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA...ESPECIALLY IF THE NAM MODEL IS RIGHT ABOUT THE 
BULK OF THE MOISTURE REMAINING FARTHER EAST OVER THE CAROLINAS. WITH 
ALL OF THIS IN MIND...IT APPEARS RIGHT NOW THAT SOUTHWEST NC AND THE 
MOUNTAINS OF EAST TN COULD SEE SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS OF FOUR TO 
EIGHT INCHES (WITH LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS ON THE HIGHEST PEAKS) BY 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THUS...WILL CONTINUE THE WINTER STORM WATCH FOR 
THESE AREAS. OUTSIDE OF THESE AREAS (FOR THE GREAT TN VALLEY AND THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU)...IT APPEARS THAT ONE TO FOUR INCHES OF SNOW 
WILL BE POSSIBLE WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THUS...WILL ISSUE A SPECIAL 
WEATHER STATEMENT FOR THESE AREAS.

AFTER THE WEDNESDAY/WEDNESDAY NIGHT SYSTEM MOVES NORTHEASTWARD UP 
THE NORTHEAST COAST...A COUPLE OF QUICK-MOVING CLIPPER SYSTEMS WILL 
THEN AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA FOR THE FRIDAY/FRIDAY NIGHT AND 
SATURDAY NIGHT/SUNDAY TIME PERIODS. FOR NOW...WILL MENTION CHANCE 
POPS WITH THESE SYSTEMS SINCE THE MODELS HAVE DISAGREEMENT WITH THE 
AMOUNT OF MOISTURE WITH THESE SYSTEMS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY 
TREND A LITTLE COOLER THAN THE GFS NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...WHICH IS IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN             25  37  29  40  28 /  10  10  20  60  60

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

1114 AM EST MON FEB 10 2014

.DISCUSSION...SKIES HAVE REMAINED CLOUDY OVER THE FORECAST AREA
THIS MORNING WITH PATCHY LIGHT DRIZZLE AND SNOW OVER SOUTHEAST
TENNESSEE. RADAR SHOWING SOME LIGHT RETURNS MAINLY OVER THE ABOVE
MENTIONED AREA AT THIS TIME AND JUST EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS.
COLDER AIR MASS CONTINUES TO PUSH INTO THE REGION BEHIND COLD
FRONT AND TEMPERATURES HAVE BEEN SLOW TO WARM THIS MORNING. MOST
AREAS STILL IN THE UPPER 20S TO MID 30S. LIGHT PRECIPITATION STILL
EXPECTED TO DEVELOP IN THE FOOTHILLS AND MOUNTAINS OF CENTRAL EAST
AND NORTHEAST TN THIS AFTERNOON INTO THE EARLY EVENING SO DID NOT
CHANGE POPS MUCH EXCEPT TO PUT MOST CENTRAL VALLEY AREAS INTO
CHANCE RANGE. ACCUMULATIONS STILL LOOK TO BE LIGHT...LESS THAN ONE
INCH BUT POSSIBLY HIGHER IN THE HIGHER MOUNTAINS OF SW VA AND EAST
TN AND MOSTLY ON NON PAVEMENT SURFACES AS ROAD TEMPERATURES ARE TOO
WARM AT LOWER ELEVATIONS. LOWERED HIGHS SLIGHTLY SOUTHERN AREAS
WHERE PRECIPITATION IS OCCURRING NOW.

799 
FXUS64 KMRX 100956
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
445 AM EST MON FEB 10 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLDER AIR WILL CONTINUE TO PUSH 
INTO THE AREA TODAY BEHIND THE COLD FRONT.  EXPECT AN AREA OF LIGHT 
PRECIP TO DEVELOP IN AREA OF WEAK FRONTOGENETIC FORCING...BUT EXACT 
PLACEMENT AND TIMING PROBLEMATIC.  APPEARS BEST CHANCE FOR PRECIP 
WILL BE ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEYS AND INTO 
THE MOUNTAINS SO WILL CARRY LIKELY POPS THERE.  CHANCE ELSEWHERE.  
PRECIP TYPE WILL LIKELY BE SNOW...BUT SOME RAIN MAY MIX IN ACROSS 
THE VALLEY.  SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATION WILL ALSO BE 
POSSIBLE...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WHERE AN INCH OF 
SNOW MAY ACCUMULATE.  NO WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY...BUT WILL INCLUDE 
IN HWO.  TONIGHT WILL BE DRY OVER MUCH OF THE AREA...BUT WILL 
INCLUDE SOME LOW POPS FAR SOUTH CLOSER TO THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. WILL 
GENERALLY UNDERCUT MAV TEMPS A BIT FOR HIGHS GIVEN EXPECTED CLOUDS 
AND RECENT TRENDS.  AT OR SLIGHTLY ABOVE MAV TEMPS TONIGHT.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...WEAK SHORT WAVE MOVES ACROSS 
THE MID SOUTH ON TUESDAY AND THERE IS A SLIGHT TO LOW CHANCE FOR 
SOME LIGHT PRECIPITATION DURING THE DAY TUESDAY FOR CENTRAL EAST 
TENNESSEE. THE CHANCE IS A LITTLE HIGHER ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE 
AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA WHERE TIMING OF PRECIP DURING THE 
MORNING BEFORE TEMPERATURES RISE ABOVE FREEZING WOULD MEAN A 
POSSIBLE LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATION ON THE ORDER OF A DUSTING TO 
PERHAPS ONE INCH...MAINLY HIGHER CUMBERLAND PLATEAU TERRAIN AS WELL 
AS HIGHER MOUNTAIN PEAKS ACROSS SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. THE MAIN 
EVENT APPEARS TO BE TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY WHEN A STRONGER 
SHORT WAVE BUILDS ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. THE SYSTEM WILL 
GENERATE AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE ACROSS THE  
NORTHWESTERN GULF OF MEXICO BY TUESDAY EVENING. AS THE LOW MOVES 
NORTHEAST INTO ALABAMA AND GEORGIA LOW LEVEL MOISTURE FROM THE GULF 
WILL OVERSPREAD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. TEMPERATURES SHOULD 
BE COLD ENOUGH FOR ACCUMULATING SNOW ACROSS THE APPALACHIAN 
MOUNTAINS WHERE ONE TO THREE INCHES OF SNOW MAY FALL BY DAYBREAK 
WEDNESDAY. ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATION WEDNESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
COULD BRING TOTALS TO AROUND 3 TO 5 INCHES IN THE MOUNTAINS WITH 
LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS ABOVE 5000 FEET. LIGHT SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS 
ON THE ORDER OF 1 TO 2 INCHES ARE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE GREAT VALLEY 
MAINLY ON WEDNESDAY AS THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH MOVES SLOWLY EAST 
TOWARD THE ATLANTIC COAST. 

&&

094 
FXUS64 KMRX 092025
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EST SUN FEB 9 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...A COLD FRONT LOCATED
FROM E KY TO MIDDLE TN AT THE MOMENT WILL BE PUSHING ACROSS THE
AREA THIS EVENING. THE MAIN IMPACT OF THE FRONT WILL BE LOWER
SURFACE DEWPOINTS...SLIGHTLY COLDER LOW TEMPS TONIGHT...AND A WIND
SHIFT TO N-NW. IT MAY PROVIDE SOME WEAK LIFT ACROSS NORTHERN
AREAS...AND SO WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE POP GOING THERE. MID AND
HIGH CLOUDS INCREASE LATER TONIGHT...WHICH MAY PROVIDE FOR SOME
SEEDING OF THE LOWER CLOUD DECK AND THUS SOME BETTER CHANCES OF
PRECIP LATE TONIGHT...MAINLY NORTH.

THE NAM AND GFS HAVE COME INTO BETTER AGREEMENT FOR 
MONDAY...ALTHOUGH THE NAM STILL SHOWS MORE QPF THAN THE GFS. BOTH 
SHOW PLENTY OF MOISTURE...ALONG WITH SOME FRONTOGENETIC FORCING AND 
AGEOSTROPHIC LIFT IN THE 850-700 MB LAYER MONDAY MORNING...THOUGH 
THE NAM IS STRONGER WITH THIS. GIVEN THE INCONSISTENCIES OF THE NAM 
OF LATE...PREFER THE QPF OF THE GFS...WHICH HAS SUPPORT FROM THE 
SREF. WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS AND SNOW ACCUMULATIONS UP TO 1 INCH IN 
SW VA AND NE TN MOUNTAINS...WITH CHANCE POPS AND LESS THAN 1 INCH 
FROM TRI-CITIES TO KNOXVILLE. WILL ISSUE A SPS SINCE THE SNOW WILL 
BE ARRIVING AROUND THE MORNING COMMUTE TIME.

DEEP MOISTURE GETS PUSHED TO OUR SOUTH ON MONDAY NIGHT AS THE 
925-850 MB FLOW TURNS NORTHERLY. CYCLOGENESIS BEGINS ALONG THE 
BOUNDARY TO OUR SOUTH...AND MOST PRECIP SHOULD STAY OUT OF OUR AREA 
UNTIL DAYBREAK TUESDAY. WILL BRING POPS UP TO A CHANCE VERY LATE 
MONDAY NIGHT ACROSS SW NC AND THE SOUTHERN VALLEY COUNTIES IN CASE 
THE MODELS SHOULD CHANGE THEIR MINDS AND BRING THINGS NORTH A LITTLE 
MORE QUICKLY. 

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...WITH CYCLOGENESIS ALONG
THE COLD FRONT ALONG THE GULF COAST ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE FRONT
WILL PRODUCE SNOWFALL BEGINNING EARLY TUESDAY OVER SE TN AND SW NC.
IN COLD AIR MASS TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S WILL BE
SLOW TO RISE POSSIBLY REACHING THE MID TO UPPER 30S LATE IN THE
DAY. LOWER ELEVATIONS MAY SEE A CHANGE OVER TO RAIN BUT HIGHER
ELEVATIONS SHOULD SEE ALL SNOW. ONLY LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS ARE
EXPECTED ON THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN VALLEY BUT A FEW INCHES ARE
POSSIBLE IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS OF THE SE TN AND SW NC MOUNTAINS
AND POSSIBLY FOUR TO SIX INCHES IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS TUESDAY
AND TUESDAY NIGHT. PLACES FARTHER NORTH IN THE CENTRAL VALLEY NORTH
WILL BE DRIER WITH A SHARP MOISTURE GRADIENT. MAY SEE SOME CLOUDS
AND A FEW FLURRIES BUT NO SIGNIFICANT SNOW EXPECTED. TUESDAY NIGHT
AND WEDNESDAY TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN STATES DEEPENS AND AN
INVERTED TROUGH INCREASES MOISTURE OVER THE EAST TN VALLEY. THIS
WILL SPREAD SNOW AND RAIN NORTH INTO NE SECTIONS OF THE AREA.
 
SNOWFALL AMOUNTS RIGHT NOW ARE EXPECTED TO BE LIGHT WITH HEAVIER 
AMOUNTS OF A COUPLE INCHES POSSIBLE ALONG THE APPALACHIAN CREST OR 
EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS IN THE 24 HOUR PERIOD FROM TUESDAY NIGHT 
INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT. AT THE SAME TIME WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
MEDIUM RANGE MODELS DEVELOP A SURFACE LOW ALONG THE FRONT OVER THE 
NORTHERN GULF AS UPPER TROUGH DIGS SOUTH AND THEN MOVE IT NE ACROSS 
THE SE STATES THROUGH THE CAROLINAS. THIS SYSTEMS TRACK MAY GIVE THE 
EASTERN PART OF THE FORECAST AREA A MORE SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL. WITH 
UPPER FLOW SWITCHING TO THE NW LATE WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY MORE 
ACCUMULATING SNOW IS POSSIBLE ESPECIALLY IN THE HIGHER EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS AND HIGH KNOB AREA OF VIRGINIA. MODELS SHOW A POSSIBLE 
BRIEF DRY PERIOD THURSDAY NIGHT OR FRIDAY BEFORE ANOTHER SYSTEM 
MOVES IN SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. FORECASTED TEMPERATURES BELOW 
GUIDANCE TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY DUE TO CLOUDS AND PRECIPITATION AND 
ONLY SLIGHTLY WARMER THURSDAY. TEMPERATURES FRIDAY THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND WARM A FEW MORE DEGREES BUT STILL BELOW NORMAL AS UPPER 
TROUGH STAYS OVER THE EASTERN STATES.      

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  32  38  26  37  28 /  20  40  10  20  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       31  37  25  36  26 /  30  50  10  10  20

DOWNWARD AND ADD A MENTION OF DRIZZLE. TEMPERATURES WILL ALSO BE
ADJUSTED DOWN SLIGHTLY AS CLOUDY SKIES ARE EXPECTED TO
PERSIST...AND THE LATEST LAMP GUIDANCE IS COOLER THAN PREVIOUSLY

206 
FXUS64 KMRX 090930
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 AM EST SUN FEB 9 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL SWING 
THROUGH THE AREA LATER TODAY.  MOISTURE WILL BE RATHER SHALLOW AND 
FORCING WILL BE WEAK...SO JUST SOME LOW POPS MAINLY NORTHERN HALF 
TODAY. PRECIP TYPE WILL BE PRIMARILY LIQUID GIVEN THERMAL PROFILES.  
SOME ADDITIONAL WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL MOVE ACROSS 
TONIGHT...AND MOISTURE SHOULD DEEPEN A BIT.  HOWEVER...FORCING LOOKS 
QUITE WEAK...SO JUST SOME SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE POPS FOR 
TONIGHT FOR SOME RAIN/SNOW SHOWERS.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE...SO WILL STAY CLOSE WITH JUST SOME TWEAKS DOWN FOR MAX 
TEMPS TODAY AND A FEW TWEAKS UP FOR LOWS TONIGHT GIVEN EXPECTED 
CLOUD COVER.        

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...STILL A FAIR AMOUNT OF 
UNCERTAINTY IN THE LONGER TERM FORECAST MODEL DIFFERENCES NOTED. 
LEADING EDGE OF COLDER CANADIAN AIRMASS DROPS WELL SOUTH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY WITH LARGE SURFACE HIGH SLIPPING SLOWLY EAST 
ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION. ANOTHER IN A SERIES 
OF SHORT WAVE FEATURES WILL BUILD THROUGH THE EASTERN U.S. LATER 
MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY INDUCING A SURFACE WAVE ON THE DEEP SOUTH 
COLD FRONT. PACIFIC MOISTURE WILL BE LIFTED ISENTROPICALLY OVER THE 
CHILLY SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN AIRMASS MONDAY INTO TUESDAY. WOULD 
EXPECT SOME VERY LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES ACROSS THE REGION DURING THE 
DAY MONDAY AS THE COLD AIR PRESSES FURTHER SOUTH. LIFT INCREASES 
MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY WITH MODELS COMING TOGETHER ON A SHARP 
MOISTURE GRADIENT NEAR OR JUST SOUTH OF THE TENNESSEE/GEORGIA 
BORDER. IN THIS SCENARIO THE BEST CHANCE OF LIGHT SNOWFALL 
ACCUMULATION WOULD BE ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH 
CAROLINA...PERHAPS AN INCH OR TWO IN THE LOWEST ELEVATIONS WITH A 
LITTLE MORE IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. THIS SYSTEM WOULD BE MOVING AWAY 
TO THE EAST LATER IN THE DAY TUESDAY. HOWEVER...THE LONG TERM MODELS 
SHOW A MORE AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH FORMING ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY ON WEDNESDAY. THIS LEADS TO MORE ISENTROPIC LIFTING ALONG 
WITH INCREASING DYNAMICS WITH THE DEEPENING UPPER TROUGH. TIMING OF 
PRECIP IS CRITICAL DUE TO DIURNAL RISE IN SURFACE TEMPS BUT IT 
APPEARS THERE WILL BE ANOTHER CHANCE FOR SOME LIGHT SNOW 
ACCUMULATION ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON WEDNESDAY. HELD ONTO SOME 
SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS FOR OROGRAPHIC SNOW WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO 
EARLY THURSDAY BUT MOST OF THE REGION COULD ENJOY A BREAK IN THE 
ACTION FOR MOST OF THE DAY THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY NIGHT WITH SOME 
DRY ADVECTION. FORECAST CONFIDENCE DROPS OFF EVEN MORE TOWARD THE 
WEEKEND WITH SHORT WAVE TIMING BETWEEN MODELS OUT OF SYNC BUT WENT 
WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR A MIX OF LIGHT RAIN AND SNOW FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY WITH A COUPLE MORE UPPER TROUGH APPEARANCES TO ROUND OUT 
THE WEEK.

441 
FXUS64 KMRX 081956
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 PM EST SAT FEB 8 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...
SOME ISOALTED FLURRIES ARE LINGERING OVER SW VA THIS
AFTERNOON...BUT WILL EXIT BY SUNSET. CONFIDENCE IS LOW EVEN
THROUGH THE SHORT TERM PERIOD AS WEAK VORT MAXES MOVE ACROSS THE
REGION IN THE WESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. THERE ARE NO WELL-DEFINED
PERIODS OF LIFT TO PRODUCE MUCH MEASUREABLE PRECIP. ADDING TO THE
DIFFICULTY IS THAT MOISTURE IS MAINLY CONFINED TO 850 MB AND BELOW
THROUGH THE PERIOD...SO DRIZZLE MAY OCCUR AT TIMES SUNDAY AND
SUNDAY NIGHT. THE NAM AND GFS DO SHOW SOME MIDLEVEL MOISTURE
ARRIVING SUNDAY NIGHT...WHICH MAY ALLOW FOR SOME DENDRITE GROWTH
AND SNOWFALL...MAINLY AFTER MIDNIGHT IN THE NORTHERN HALF. WILL
KEEP POPS IN THE SLIGHT TO LOW CHANCE RANGE SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH
LIGHT QPF. HIGH TEMPS SUNDAY WILL UNDERCUT MOS GUIDANCE BY A FEW
DEGREES GIVEN EXPECTED OVERCAST/BROKEN CLOUD COVER AND MOS WARM
BIAS OF LATE.

LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...
OVERALL FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS LOW DUE TO LARGE AND CONSISTENT
MODEL DIFFERENCES. PRECIP CHANCES WILL BEGIN TO DECREASE THROUGH
THE DAY MONDAY AS THE MID LEVEL MOISTURE MOVES OUT OF THE AREA. A
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM BEGINS TO FORM ON THE GULF COAST...AND THEN
PROGRESS NORTHEASTWARD THROUGH MIDWEEK. ECMWF AND NAM ARE
AGGRESSIVE WITH THE PRECIPITATION MOVING INTO THE CWA...WITH GFS
AND SREF KEEPING MAIN CHANCES FOR ANY PRECIP AND SNOW ACCUMULATION
TO SOUTHEASTERN TN AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. GFS SEEMS TO BE
THE MOST CONSISTENT BETWEEN MODEL RUNS...WITH ADDITIONAL MODELS
ALIGNING TO THE GFS OUTPUT. HAVE GONE WITH THE GFS FOR NOW.

BELOW FREEZING TEMPERATURES AND AMPLE MIDLEVEL MOISTURE WILL LEAD TO 
SNOWFALL ACCUMULATION ACROSS THE AREA...WITH THE HIGHER AMOUNTS 
SOUTH OF KNOXVILLE. MID LEVEL DRY AIR BEGINS TO MOVE IN FOR LATE 
TUESDAY EVENING AND NIGHT. ENOUGH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL BE PRESENT 
FOR LIGHT ADDITIONAL SNOWFALL AMOUNTS ACROSS THE AREA. THE ECMWF 
MODEL APPEARS TO PICK UP THE EXIT OF THE SYSTEM BETTER THAN THE 
GFS...SO WENT CLOSER TO THAT MODEL FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED. 
SNOW WILL SLOWLY CHANGE TO RAIN THROUGH WEDNESDAY AS THE 
TEMPERATURES APPROACH THE LOWER TO MID 40S...THEN BACK TO SNOW 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS THE TEMPERATURES DROP BACK TO AROUND FREEZING. 
RAIN IS THEN EXPECTED TO SLOWLY DECREASE FROM WEST TO EAST THROUGH 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AS THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES UP THE EAST 
COAST. 

CLOUD COVER EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY CLOUDY THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED...CLEARING SLIGHTLY BY THE END OF THE WORK WEEK. HAVE 
LOWERED TEMPERATURES FROM GUIDANCE A COUPLE OF DEGREES DUE TO THE 
CLOUD COVER AND AIRMASS MOVING INTO THE AREA. TEMPERATURES WILL BE A 
COUPLE OF DEGREES BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THE EXTENDED. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             33  51  35  42  30 /   0  10  20  30  60 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  33  48  32  40  25 /   0  10  20  30  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       33  48  31  38  24 /  10  10  30  30  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              29  45  30  36  22 /  10  20  30  40  40

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
355 AM EST SAT FEB 8 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL EXIT BY 
THIS AFTERNOON.  BAND OF LIGHT SNOW ENTERING THE AREA WILL PUSH 
THROUGH FAIRLY QUICKLY.  STILL LOOKS LIKE BEST CHANCES FOR SNOW 
ACCUMULATION WILL BE NORTH.  NOT CONFIDENT WE WILL GET MORE THAN AN 
INCH ANYWHERE...BUT WILL LEAVE ADVISORY IN PLACE ACROSS NORTHERN 
PLATEAU AND SW VA FOR NOW. SNOW MAY MIX WITH SOME RAIN BEFORE 
ENDING.  ONCE THE PRECIP EXITS...CONSIDERABLE MOISTURE WILL 
LINGER...SO EXPECT CLOUDS TO HANG AROUND FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE 
PERIOD.  WILL HAVE TO KEEP AN EYE ON POSSIBILITY OF SOME 
DRIZZLE/FREEZING DRIZZLE ESPECIALLY NORTH TONIGHT...BUT PROBABILITY 
LOOKS ON THE LOW SIDE SO WILL KEEP OUT OF FORECAST FOR NOW. WILL 
GENERALLY UNDERCUT MAV MAX TEMPS A BIT TODAY GIVEN EXPECTED CLOUD 
COVER...WILL GO AT OR SLIGHTLY ABOVE FOR MINS TONIGHT.      

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...JUST AN ALL AROUND LOW 
CONFIDENCE FORECAST WITH MODELS INDICATING DIFFERING SOLUTIONS IN 
TERMS OF SYSTEM LOCATION...TIMING AND AMPLIFICATION. PAINTED SOME 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE KENTUCKY BORDER AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS FOR SUNDAY AS AN UPPER TROUGH 
PRESSES EAST ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY. DON'T EXPECT MUCH OUT OF THIS. 
ON MONDAY...THE GFS IS RADICALLY DIFFERENT WITH LITTLE HAPPENING 
WHILE THE ECM/CANADIAN AND WRF SHOW A NICE LITTLE WAVE PASSAGE WITH 
SOME ASSOCIATED DEEP MOISTURE. SUB-FREEZING OVERNIGHT THROUGH MONDAY 
MORNING TEMPERATURES WOULD ARGUE FOR SOME LIGHT SNOW IN THIS 
SCENARIO. KEPT AMOUNTS ON THE LIGHT SIDE DUE TO LOWERED CONFIDENCE 
WITH THIS SYSTEM. THE REST OF THE FORECAST DOESN'T GET ANY BETTER 
WITH VARYING MODEL SOLUTIONS BUT IT APPEARS THAT THERE WILL BE AN 
ACTIVE SOUTHERN STREAM ON TUESDAY WITH A SURFACE WAVE THAT HAS 
GREATER IMPACT ON THE DEEP SOUTH INTO THE SOUTHEAST ATLANTIC COASTAL 
STATES. MODELS GENERALLY INDICATE MORE AMPLIFICATION WITH AN UPPER 
TROUGH PASSAGE ON WEDNESDAY WITH SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SHIFTING 
NORTHEAST FROM THE NORTHERN GULF OF MEXICO AROUND 12Z WEDNESDAY TO 
THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC COAST BY 12Z THURSDAY. THIS TYPE OF SYSTEM WOULD 
TEND TO GENERATE SOME SNOWFALL ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA IN THE 
COLDER AIR PRESENT ACROSS THE MID SOUTH BUT DUE TO LOW CONFIDENCE 
KEPT POPS AROUND 40 PERCENT. MODEL SOLUTION DIVERGENCE CONTINUES 
WITH BRAVADO LATE IN THE PERIOD. STAYED CLOSEST TO THE ECMWF FOR 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WHICH ALLOW THE MID WEEK UPPER TROUGH TO MOVE 
OUT TO SEA FOLLOWED BY LESS AMPLIFICATION TO THE UPPER LEVEL FLOW 
AND THEREFORE LESS ACTION ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION AT 
THE END OF THE WORK WEEK.

ENHANCING FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING (850-700MB LEVEL) ACROSS THE
NORTHERN PLATEAU EASTWARD TO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. MODELS SHOW A
DISTINCT AREA OF FORCING ACROSS THIS AREA WITH LITTLE TO NO OVER
THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. BEST FORCING IS BETWEEN 08-16Z.
TEMPERATURE PROFILE DEFINITELY SUPPORTS SNOW WITH MOISTURE
EXTENDING INTO THE DENDRITIC SNOW GROWTH AREA.

MAIN LIMITATION IS MOISTURE. INITIALLY A GOOD DEAL OF VIRGA IS
EXPECTED...BUT MODEL SOUNDINGS DO SHOW THE BOUNDARY LAYER
MOISTENING. SNOW ACCUMULATIONS OF 1 TO 2 INCHES ARE EXPECTED IN THE
ADVISORY AREA. AREAS JUST SOUTH...WHICH INCLUDES KNOXVILLE AND THE
TRI-CITIES WILL LIKELY SEE SOME LIGHT SNOW WITH ACCUMULATIONS OF
1/2 INCH POSSIBLE.

206 
FXUS64 KMRX 071949
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
249 PM EST FRI FEB 7 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
NO MAJOR CHANGES ARE NEEDED FOR THE EXPECTED LIGHT SNOW EVENT 
TONIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING...AS MODELS HAVE BEEN CONSISTENT AND IN 
AGREEMENT WITH EACH OTHER SHOWING ABOUT 1 INCH ACCUMULATIONS IN SW 
VA...AND ABOUT HALF AN INCH ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLATEAU TO 
TRI-CITIES. A SPS WILL BE ISSUED FOR THESE AREAS. 

LIFT APPEARS TO BE DRIVEN MAINLY BY 300-500 MB DIFF VORTICITY 
ADVECTION AND WEAK 850-700 MB CONVERGENCE. THESE FEATURES MOVE 
THROUGH THE AREA IN A WINDOW OF APPROX 08Z AND 14Z. ALL ACCUMULATING 
PRECIP SHOULD END BY EARLY AFTERNOON WITH DRYING ALOFT...BUT LOW 
CLOUDS MAY LINGER INTO THE AFTERNOON. WILL UNDERCUT MOS GUIDANCE BY 
A FEW DEGREES FOR HIGH TEMPS SATURDAY...GIVEN EXPECTED 
CLOUDS...POSSIBLE SNOW COVER NORTH...AND THE FACT THAT MOS HAS HAD A 
WARM BIAS FOR THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
WE WILL BE IN A RATHER ACTIVE WEATHER PATTERN THROUGHOUT THE
EXTENDED. SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY...A MINOR TROUGH WITH A WEAK
SHORT WAVE MOVING THROUGH TO OUR NORTH MAY GENERATE A FEW ISOLATED
SHOWERS OVER FAR NORTHERN AREAS AND ACROSS HIGHER ELEVATIONS.
TEMPERATURES SATURDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY MORNING WILL BE COLD ENOUGH
FOR LIGHT SNOW AND MINOR SNOW ACCUMULATIONS OF A FEW TENTHS ARE
POSSIBLE. THE SNOW SHOULD TRANSITION OVER TO LIGHT RAIN SUNDAY
AFTERNOON.

SUNDAY NIGHT...A BOUNDARY TO OUR NORTH WILL BEGIN TO DROP SOUTH
INTO THE MRX CWA...SPREADING A BAND OF ISOLATED LIGHT PRECIP ACROSS
THE AREA. RAIN WILL SWITCH TO SNOW OVERNIGHT. THE BOUNDARY WILL
SLOWLY MOVE SOUTH ACROSS THE AREA MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT PROVIDING
OUR BEST CHANCE OF PRECIP FOR THE EXTENDED. MONDAY MORNING
TEMPERATURES WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW BUT AS TEMPERATURES WARM
THROUGH THE DAY THIS WILL TRANSITION TO RAIN FOR THE
AFTERNOON...THEN SWITCH BECK TO SNOW MONDAY NIGHT AS TEMPERATURES
ONCE AGAIN FALL. MODELS DIVERGE THROUGH THE REST OF THE PERIOD AND
CONFIDENCE DROPS OFF. FOR NOW...WILL GO WITH A COMPROMISE BETWEEN
THE MODELS TUESDAY THOUGH FRIDAY. THIS WILL STALL THE BOUNDARY TO
OUR SOUTH ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...PROVIDING THE BETTER CHANCE OF
PRECIP OVER SOUTHERN AREAS. MAINLY RAIN EXPECTED DURING THE DAY AND
A TRANSITION TO LIGHT SNOW DURING THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. A COLD FRONT
MOVES IN ON THURSDAY FOR ANOTHER ROUND OF PRECIPITATION.
AGAIN...MAINLY RAIN EXPECTED DURING THE DAY AND LIGHT SNOW
OVERNIGHT. BEHIND THE FRONT ON FRIDAY...FLOW WILL COME
NORTHWESTERLY WITH NORMALLY FAVORED UPSLOPE PRECIP EXPECTED.

&&

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...LOW CLOUDS OVER THE 
AREA SHOULD BREAK UP BEFORE NOON...BUT HIGH CLOUDS WILL BE MOVING IN 
AHEAD OF NEXT SHORT WAVE.  MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT WITH NEXT 
SHORT WAVE...BRINGING SOME LIGHT PRECIP FOR A BRIEF PERIOD 
ESPECIALLY NORTH LATE TONIGHT INTO EARLY FRIDAY.  PRECIP TYPE SHOULD 
BE PRIMARILY SNOW GIVEN THERMAL PROFILES...ALTHOUGH SOME RAIN MAY 
MIX IN TONIGHT SOUTH AND ALL AREAS SATURDAY BEFORE THE LIGHT PRECIP

ACCUMULATION OCCURS...MAINLY NORTH.  WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS TONIGHT 
ALL ZONES EXCEPT LIKELY NORTHEAST...THEN LIKELY POPS FAR NORTH TO 
SLIGHT CHANCE FAR SOUTH EARLY SATURDAY.  NO SNOW ADVISORY AT THIS

AROUND AN INCH OR LESS EVEN IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS NORTH.    

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...WENT WITH A BLEND OF 
THE GFS AND ECMWF FOR THIS PART OF THE FORECAST. AT LEAST A COUPLE 
SHORTER WAVELENGTH TROUGHS RIP RAPIDLY EAST ACROSS THE EASTERN 
STATES EARLY IN THE PERIOD WITH DEEPEST MOISTURE AND BETTER LIFTING 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. IN THE RATHER COLD AIR THAT WILL BE A COMMON 
FEATURE DURING THE EXTENDED PERIOD...HAD TO MIX SOME SNOW IN AT 
TIMES...MAINLY DURING THE OVERNIGHT HOURS AND IN THE MOUNTAINS. THE 
EARLY THROUGH MIDDLE PART OF THE WORK WEEK LOOKS INTERESTING WITH 
TEMPERATURES A FEW TO SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW NORMAL FOR EARLY 
FEBRUARY AND AN ENERGETIC SOUTHERN STREAM JET. THE MODELS BRING AN 
AMPLIFIED SHORT WAVE ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. DURING THIS 
TIMEFRAME WITH A POTENTIAL SURFACE LOW TRACK EMERGING FROM THE 
WESTERN GULF OF MEXICO TUESDAY ON ITS WAY INTO THE CAROLINAS AROUND 
THE WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING PERIOD. OF COURSE 
THIS STORM TRACK WOULD RESULT IN MORE SNOW FOR THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION. AS ALWAYS...THIS IS AN EVENT THAT IS BEING 
MODELED SEVERAL DAYS PRIOR TO REALITY SO SYSTEM STRENGTH...TRACK AND 
POSITION OF TEMPERATURE GRADIENT WILL LIKELY BE CHANGING TO SOME 
DEGREE OR ANOTHER IN THE NEXT FEW DAYS.

934 PM EST THU FEB 6 2014

.DISCUSSION...MIDLEVEL SHORTWAVE MENTIONED IN PREVIOUS FORECAST 
DISCUSSION HAS ALMOST EXITED THE AREA. THIS FEATURE SHOULD BE TO OUR 
EAST BY MIDNIGHT. THIS WAVE BROUGHT FLURRIES TO EASTERN SECTIONS OF

REST OF THE NIGHT WILL REMAIN CLOUDY WITH LOWS IN THE LOW TO MID 20S 
WITH WINDS REMAINING OUT OF THE NORTH. NO CHANGES TO PREVIOUS 
FORECAST OTHER THAN TO FRESHEN HOURLY TEMPS AND DEWPOINTS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
226 PM EST THU FEB 6 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
SATELLITE SHOWS A MIDLEVEL SHORTWAVE TROUGH OVER LA/MS THIS 
AFTERNOON...AND MODELS SHOW THIS FEATURE TRACKING QUICKLY TO THE 
E-NE THROUGH THE EVENING. THE QUESTION IS WHETHER LIFT WILL BE 
ADEQUATE OVER OUR AREA TO OVERCOME DRY LOW LEVEL AIR. THE GFS IS 
MORE BULLISH ON PRECIP FOR OUR SW NC COUNTIES THAN THE NAM AND THE 
SREF. WILL KEEP MEASURABLE PRECIP OUT OF THE FORECAST FOR THAT AREA 
TONIGHT...BUT WILL MENTION SCATTERED SPRINKLES/FLURRIES THROUGH 
MIDNIGHT. 

THE JET STREAM REMAINS POSITIONED OVER KY/WV THROUGH FRIDAY...WHICH 
SHOULD KEEP SOME AMOUNT OF MID TO HIGH CLOUDS OVER THE AREA. THIS 
WILL MAKE FOR A TRICKY TEMPERATURE FORECAST. SINCE MOS GUIDANCE 
APPEARS TO BE A BIT TOO WARM LATELY...WILL LEAN TOWARD THE COOLER 
GFS MOS GUIDANCE FOR HIGHS.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL QUICKLY MOVE NORTHEAST AS A SHORTWAVE MOVES
ACROSS THE AREA. PRECIP WILL START AS SNOW AND TRANSITION TO RAIN
THROUGH THE LATE MORNING SATURDAY AS TEMPERATURES SLOWLY CLIMB
ABOVE FREEZING. TEMPERATURES DROP BELOW FREEZING SUNDAY
MORNING...WITH THE RAIN TRANSITION BACK TO SNOW THROUGH THE REST OF
THE DAY. LIFT IS NOT IMPRESSIVE...BUT THE MOISTURE PROFILE WOULD
SUPPORT A COUPLE OF TENTHS OF AN INCH IN NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE REMAINS THROUGH THE WEEKEND...WITH
SLIGHTLY CLEARING SKIES SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. MONDAY LOOKS TO BE
DRY AS HIGH PRESSURE TRIES TO BUILD IN OVER THE OHIO VALLEY.

MODELS DISAGREE ON TIMING OF NEXT CHANCE OF PRECIP MOVING IN ON 
TUESDAY. WENT WITH MORE OF THE ECMWF...KEEPING PRECIP CHANCES IN 
FROM EARLY TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT FOR MOST OF THE 
AREA. SNOW WILL TRANSITION TO RAIN TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY AS THE 
TEMPERATURES WARM...AND TRANSITION BACK TO SNOW THROUGH THE NIGHT AS 
THE TEMPERATURES COOL. OVERALL TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE WEEK WILL BE 
NEAR NORMAL...WITH OVERCAST SKIES THROUGH THE REST OF THE WORK WEEK.

640 
FXUS64 KMRX 060749
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
249 AM EST THU FEB 6 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A FAIRLY BENIGN FORECAST FOR
TODAY AND TONIGHT. A GOOD DEAL OF COLD AIR STRATO-CU ACROSS THE
REGION WITH FLURRIES OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. MODELS CONTINUE TO
SHOW SHALLOW DEPTH OF BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE DISSIPATING BY MID TO
LATE MORNING...SO FLURRIES WILL END THIS MORNING.

UPPER FLOW IS GENERALLY ZONAL ACROSS THE UNITED STATES WITH A
SERIES OF FAST MOVING WAVES GOING ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES. A
FEW SPRINKLES OR FLURRIES IS POSSIBLE THIS AFTERNOON/EVENING DUE 
WEAK/MODERATE ISENTROPIC LIFT. PRECIPITATION WILL BE COMING OUT OF
A MID-LEVEL DECK WITH A GOOD DEAL OF DRY BOUNDARY LAYER AIR.

GENERALLY MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS THROUGH THE PERIOD. FOLLOWED MOS
GUIDANCE CLOSELY.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND REVEAL A FAIRLY QUIET PATTERN 
UNTIL THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE IS 
PROGGED TO SETTLE OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION ON FRIDAY... 
WITH ZONAL UPPER-LEVEL FLOW HELPING TO PRODUCE A TRANQUIL PATTERN 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. WITH A MID LEVEL INVERSION PROGGED TO BE 
LINGERING OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON FRIDAY (LIMITING ANY VERTICAL 
MIXING) AND AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE TROUGH OVER THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS...THINK THAT EXTENSIVE CLOUDS COULD BE OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
ON FRIDAY...SO WILL PLAN TO BE PESSIMISTIC WITH CLOUD COVER. THE 
UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE TROUGH OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS IS THEN 
PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON SATURDAY...WITH 
ANOTHER SHORT WAVE TROUGH QUICKLY MOVING IN BEHIND IT ON SUNDAY. THE 
GFS...CANADIAN...AND ECMWF MODELS ARE ALL IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT 
THESE TWO UPPER-LEVEL TROUGHS WILL PRODUCE ONLY LIGHT PRECIP OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA THIS WEEKEND...WITH ANY LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS 
MOST LIKELY CONFINED TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS THEN PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE 
NORTHWESTERN GULF OF MEXICO ON TUESDAY...AND THEN MOVE EASTWARD OVER 
THE SOUTHEAST ON WEDNESDAY. BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS AGREE THAT 
THIS SYSTEM WILL BRING AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF PRECIP OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA BY TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY...BUT THEY DISAGREE ON HOW COLD 
THE AIR MASS WILL BE OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THUS...THE WARMER ECMWF 
MODEL REVEALS MORE OF A RAIN EVENT...WHILE THE COOLER GFS MODEL 
INDICATES MORE POSSIBILITIES FOR SNOW...ESPECIALLY OVER THE NORTHERN 
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. FOR NOW...WILL COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO 
MODELS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND COOLER THAN THE GFS 
NUMBERS THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK (WHICH IS IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH 
THE ENSEMBLE MEANS)...BUT WILL THEN TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS NUMBERS 
FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  40  25  43  31  50 /  10   0   0  20  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       38  25  43  31  50 /  10   0   0  20  30

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
306 PM EST WED FEB 5 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
SOME LIGHT RETURNS ARE SHOWING UP ON RADAR ACROSS NE TN/SW VA/E KY. 
ACCUMULATING PRECIP SEEMS UNLIKELY WITH DRY AIR ABOVE 850 MB...SO 
WILL CARRY NO POPS BUT MENTION SCATTERED SPRINKLES CHANGING TO
FLURRIES IN THE EVENING IN NORTHERN AREAS AND THE MOUNTAINS. LOW
CLOUDS WILL LIKELY REMAIN IN PLACE THROUGH THE NIGHT AND MUCH OF
THURSDAY MORNING...SO WILL LEAN ON THE WARM SIDE OF GUIDANCE FOR
LOW TEMPS TONIGHT.

AS LOW LEVELS DRY THURSDAY MORNING...MIDLEVELS WILL BE MOISTENING 
THROUGH THE DAY AS A WEAK SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVES QUICKLY ACROSS 
AL/GA/SC THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. WITH BROKEN TO OVERCAST 
MIDLEVEL CLOUDS EXPECTED...LEANED ON THE COOL SIDE OF MOS FOR HIGH 
TEMPS ON THURSDAY. LIFT IS WEAK OVER OUR AREA...AND ANY PRECIP 
GENERATED BY THE MIDLEVEL MOISTURE/LIFT WILL HAVE TO FALL THROUGH A 
DRY LAYER BELOW 800 MB...SO CHANCES OF ACCUMULATING PRECIP LOOK 
SMALL. WILL HAVE JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN SW NC/SE TN FOR 
THURSDAY EVENING. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE STILL IN CONTROL FRIDAY WITH SKIES PARTLY TO MOSTLY
SUNNY AND HIGH TEMPERATURES ABOUT 5 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. A
SHORTWAVE IS FORECAST TO MOVE THROUGH THE REGION EARLY SATURDAY.
PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS EXPECTED TO BE FAIRLY LIGHT BUT COOLING
TEMPERATURES FRIDAY NIGHT WILL ALLOW FOR SOME SNOW MAINLY PLATEAU
AND HIGHER EASTERN MOUNTAINS. AMOUNTS GENERALLY AN INCH OR LESS. A
SURFACE LOW IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP OFF THE COAST OF GA SATURDAY
THEN MOVE NORTHEAST ALONG THE CAROLINA COAST LATER SATURDAY AND
SATURDAY NIGHT. THIS MAY ENHANCE PRECIPITATION OVER THE EASTERN
PART OF THE FORECAST AREA IF IT DEEPENS FASTER THAN FORECAST
OTHERWISE COLD FRONT MOVES ACROSS TN VALLEY SATURDAY AND SATURDAY
NIGHT INTO SUNDAY WITH MOST OF THE PRECIPITATION NORTH OF THE
REGION. LIGHT SNOWFALL AMOUNTS WILL BE POSSIBLE AGAIN SATURDAY
NIGHT AND SUNDAY MAINLY HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND MOUNTAINS FROM THE
SMOKIES NORTH WITH LIGHT RAIN LOWEST ELEVATIONS. MODIFIED ARCTIC
AIRMASS SETTLES OVER THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY WITH LOWS
DROPPING BACK TO THE TEENS TO LOWER 20S AND HIGHS MONDAY IN THE 30S
TO LOWER 40S. A MORE SOUTHERN STRONGER SYSTEM APPROACHES LATE
TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY. CLOUDS INCREASE TUESDAY WITH CHANCE OF
PRECIPITATION TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL SLOWLY
WARM TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY. HOWEVER SOME SNOW WILL BE POSSIBLE
TUESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY WEDNESDAY ONCE AGAIN IN NORTHERN SECTIONS
AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS IN THE MOUNTAINS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...REPORTS FROM COVE MOUNTAIN AND

850MB JET MOVING EAST OF THE AREA BY 12Z...SO CURRENT TIMING OF
HIGH WIND WARNING LOOKS GOOD.

FRONTO-GENETIC BAND OF RAIN WILL EXIT THE AREA AROUND 12Z THIS
MORNING. COLD AIR ADVECTION IS EXPECTED TODAY WITH A GOOD DEAL OF
LOW-LEVEL CLOUDS. THE COLD AIR ADVECTION MAY SQUEEZE OUT SOME
ADDITIONAL DRIZZLE OR LIGHT SHOWERS TODAY...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE
MOUNTAINS. FOR TONIGHT...WINDS BECOME NORTHWEST WITH WEAK
OROGRAPHIC LIFT INTO THE MOUNTAINS. BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE IS
QUITE SHALLOW...SO PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS WILL BE LIGHT.
TEMPERATURES ARE COLD ENOUGH FOR SOME SNOW SHOWERS OR
FLURRIES...BUT LITTLE TO NO ACCUMULATION ANTICIPATED.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN FAIRLY GOOD 
AGREEMENT THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL A LESS 
ACTIVE PATTERN COMPARED TO PREVIOUS RUNS. A LARGE DOME OF HIGH 
PRESSURE IS PROGGED TO SETTLE OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION 
FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...WITH ZONAL UPPER-LEVEL FLOW HELPING TO 
PRODUCE A TRANQUIL PATTERN OVER THE FORECAST AREA. WITH A MID LEVEL 
INVERSION EXPECTED TO LINGER OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON THURSDAY 
AND FRIDAY...THINK THAT CLOUDS WILL LIKELY LINGER DUE TO A LACK OF 
VERTICAL MIXING. THUS...WILL PLAN TO BE PESSIMISTIC WITH CLOUD COVER 
THROUGH THIS PERIOD. A SHORT WAVE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS THEN PROGGED 
TO SLOWLY MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...AS 
A COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT. GFS... 
CANADIAN...AND ECMWF MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THIS SYSTEM 
WILL BE WEAKER AND WITH LESS MOISTURE (COMPARED TO PREVIOUS MODEL 
RUNS). A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP OFF THE GA AND 
SC COASTS ON SATURDAY...BUT THE MODELS INDICATE THAT IT WILL REMAIN 
FAR ENOUGH AWAY FROM THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR ONLY LIGHT PRECIP 
TO AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA OVER THE WEEKEND. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
GENERALLY TREND COOLER THAN THE GFS NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...WHICH IS IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST TUE FEB 4 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...DOWNSLOPING EFFECTS OVER THE
NORTHERN VALLEY WILL CONTINUE INTO THE EVENING WITH MILD TEMPS AND
DRY CONDITIONS. BUT BATTLING FROM THE OTHER DIRECTION IS
APPROACHING COLD FRONT AND ASSOCIATED RAIN SHIELD /AND AN ISOLATED
TSTM OR TWO/. THINK THE BEST RAINFALL WILL BE OVER THE PLATEAU WITH
LESSER AMOUNTS ELSEWHERE. RAIN WILL EVEN OVERTAKE THE NORTHERN
VALLEY OVERNIGHT BUT THIS WILL HOPEFULLY BE WHERE THE LEAST RAIN
FALLS...GIVEN THE CONTINUED RISES ON THE CLINCH AND POWELL RIVERS FROM
THE PREVIOUS DAY/S RAINFALL. BULK OF THE RAIN WILL MOVE EAST OF THE
FORECAST AREA BY 12Z WITH ONLY ISOLATED TO SCATTERED NORTHWEST-
FLOW TYPE SHOWER ACTIVITY EXPECTED DURING THE DAY WEDNESDAY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...LIGHT UPSLOPE SNOW 
SHOWERS CONTINUE WEDNESDAY NIGHT. LARGE SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
SETTLES INTO THE OH VALLEY THROUGH FRIDAY WITH RIDGING INTO THE TN 
VALLEY AND THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. TRENDING SLIGHTLY COOLER AND 
DRY THROUGH END OF WORK WEEK. CLOUDS WILL INCREASE LATER FRIDAY AS
LOW LEVEL ISENTROPIC LIFT GETS UNDERWAY. LIGHT PRECIPITATION WILL 
COMMENCE OVERNIGHT INTO SATURDAY. LIGHT SNOW CHANGING TO MORE 
WIDESPREAD RAIN BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON. PATTERN REMAINS MUDDLED 
THROUGH EARLY SUNDAY. SHORT WAVE MOVING THROUGH TN VALLEY SUNDAY 
MORNING. ECMWF/CMC FASTER AND MORE SHEARED THAN GFS. SURFACE LOW 
DEVELOPMENT...REGARDLESS OF LOCATION WILL BE WEAK INITIALLY. FOR NOW 
LOOKS LIKE 1-2 INCHES OF SNOW ACROSS NORTHERN 2/3 OF MRX CWA SUNDAY. 
GFS 04/12Z ABOUT DOUBLES THOSE AMOUNTS. SNOW SHOWERS SHOULD LINGER 
INTO SUNDAY NIGHT. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE...WITH A COOL AIRMASS 
SETTLES INTO THE REGION EARLY NEXT WEEK.

391 
FXUS64 KMRX 040811
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EST TUE FEB 4 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY ALONG THE NORTHERN GULF COAST... 
WITH AN INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH EXTENDING NORTH OF IT ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS. CURRENT OBS FROM THE CROSSVILLE AND 
LONESOME PINE AIRPORTS ARE REPORTING FREEZING DENSE FOG THIS 
MORNING...SO HAVE ISSUED A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT TO MENTION THE 
POSSIBILITY OF BLACK ICE ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU/MOUNTAINS. 
MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT IN SHOWING AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER 
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS DEVELOPING A SURFACE LOW OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER 
VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON. THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS THEN PROGGED TO 
MOVE NORTHEASTWARD INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY BY THIS EVENING...WITH 
ITS ASSOCIATED WARM FRONT TRIGGERING SCATTERED SHOWERS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA BEGINNING THIS AFTERNOON. MODELS INDICATE A BRIEF LULL 
IN SHOWER ACTIVITY OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...BEFORE THE 
MAIN AREA OF SHOWERS ALONG THE LOW PRESSURE AREA AND ITS ASSOCIATED 
COLD FRONT MOVE INTO FORECAST AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT. MODEL SOUNDINGS 
INDICATE THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY AFTER MIDNIGHT 
OVER THE SOUTHERN TWO-THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA...SO WILL MENTION 
THE POSSIBILITY OF ISOLATED TSTORMS AFTER MIDNIGHT IN THESE AREAS.

MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT A VERY STRONG (BETWEEN 60 AND 70 
KT) 850 MB JET WILL DEVELOP NORTHWEST OF THE MOUNTAINS BY LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON AND INTO TONIGHT. WITH A STABLE LAYER EXTENDING ABOVE THE 
MOUNTAINS (UP TO AROUND 700 MB)...SOUTHERLY WINDS ORIENTED 
PERPENDICULAR TO THE MOUNTAINS...AND A VEERING VERTICAL WIND PROFILE 
THAT INCREASES WITH HEIGHT...IT APPEARS THAT A HIGH END MOUNTAIN 
WAVE EVENT WILL BE POSSIBLE LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND INTO TONIGHT 
ALONG THE FOOTHILLS OF THE APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS. THUS...WILL 
UPGRADE THE HIGH WIND WATCH TO A WARNING DUE TO THE POSSIBILITY OF 
WIND GUSTS IN EXCESS OF 60 MPH ALONG THE FOOTHILLS (AND POSSIBLY UP 
TO 100 MPH AT THE COVE MTN OBS SITE). AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT 
WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...THERE ARE STILL FAIRLY LARGE 
DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE MEDIUM RANGE MODELS...ESPECIALLY FOR FRIDAY 
THROUGH SUNDAY. DUE TO THE LARGE DIFFERENCES IN TIMING AND STRENGTH 
OF THE WEEKEND SYSTEM...CONFIDENCE IS LOW. HOWEVER...DUE TO NCEP 
DISCUSSION AND HANDLING OF ENSEMBLE MODELS...WILL TREND CLOSER TO 
THE ECMWF SOLUTION...WHICH BRINGS CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION SOONER.

FOR WEDNESDAY...STRONG SYSTEM HAS MOVED NORTHEAST OF THE AREA WITH 
COLD AIR ADVECTION AND NORTHWEST FLOW PRODUCING OROGRAPHIC 
PRECIPITATION FOR THE MOUNTAINS. HIGHS WILL LIKELY BE IN THE 
MORNING...THEN DROP IN THE AFTERNOON.

UPPER FLOW REMAINS WEST TO SOUTHWEST FOR THE LATTER HALF OF THE WEEK 
WITH MOISTURE RETURNING TO THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. A 
QUICK MOVING UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR 
SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY. CYCLOGENESIS WILL DEVELOP JUST OFF THE 
CAROLINAS WITH NORTHERLY PULLING COLDER AIR INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. PRECIPITATION WILL CHANGE TO SNOW SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
CONTINUE THROUGH PARTS OF SUNDAY. AGAIN...THERE ARE STILL A LOT OF 
QUESTION IN REGARD TO HOW STRONG THE UPPER TROUGH WILL BE AND 
ASSOCIATED CYCLOGENESIS...AND TRACK OF LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM.

HOWEVER...SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ARE POSSIBLE AREA-WIDE WITH SIGNIFICANT 
SNOWFALL ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS. WILL INCLUDE IN THE HWO.

435 
FXUS64 KMRX 040317
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1017 PM EST MON FEB 3 2014

.DISCUSSION...COLD FRONT HAS NOW MOVED WELL EAST OF THE
APPALACHIANS THIS EVENING WITH LOW PRESSURE IN THE SAVANNAH RIVER
VALLEY. COLD AIR ADVECTION BEHIND THE FRONT WAS LAGGING SOMEWHAT
AND TEMPERATURES HAVE BEEN SLOW TO FALL ACROSS FORECAST AREA. ALSO
STUBBORN LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IN THE FORM OF LOW CLOUDS HAVE BEEN
PERSISTENT WHICH ALSO CONTRIBUTING TO WARMER TEMPERATURES THIS
EVENING. PATCHY FREEZING FOG...LOCALLY DENSE HAS DEVELOPED ACROSS
THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND PARTS OF SW VA. WHERE TEMPERATURES ARE
ALREADY AROUND FREEZING. ELSEWHERE TEMPERATURES ARE MOSTLY IN THE
MID TO UPPER 30S. EXPECT CLOUDS TO CONTINUE MOST OF THE NIGHT WITH
HIGHER CLOUDS MOVING IN ABOVE LOWER CLOUDS. TEMPERATURES SHOULD
CONTINUE TO FALL SLOWLY TO MOSTLY LOW AND MIDDLE 30S. WINDS WILL
BE MOSTLY LIGHT THROUGH THE NIGHT. ADJUSTED LOWS SLIGHTLY AND
TEMPERATURE TRENDS. ADDED PATCHY FOG AND FREEZING FOG TO MAINLY
NORTHERN TWO THIRDS OF FORECAST AREA. WILL REISSUE HIGH WIND WATCH
FOR LATE TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. STILL LOOKS LIKE STRONG
SOUTHEAST WINDS IN THE MOUNTAINS AND ADJACENT FOOTHILLS TOMORROW NIGHT.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 032043
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
343 PM EST MON FEB 3 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...QUIET NIGHT TONIGHT WILL
GIVE WAY TO THE NEXT APPROACHING WEATHER SYSTEM TUESDAY. RAIN WILL
MOVE INTO THE WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA DURING TUESDAY MORNING
AND INCREASE IN COVERAGE DURING THE AFTERNOON. BY TUESDAY NIGHT
RAIN CHANCES ARE CATEGORICAL. SOME OF THE RAIN MAY EXCEED AN INCH
OR TWO ESPECIALLY OVER THE WESTERN AREAS LIKE THE PLATEAU. WITH
RIVERS ALREADY UP FROM LAST NIGHT/S RAIN...MAY SEE A FEW RIVER
FORECAST POINTS GO ABOVE FLOOD...BUT THIS IS NOT UNUSUAL FOR THE
TIME OF YEAR AND HAS LIMITED IMPACTS. NOT CONFIDENT OF THE NEED FOR
ANY GENERAL FLASH FLOOD WATCH AND WILL NOT GO THAT DIRECTION.
NOW...A MOUNTAIN WAVE WIND EVENT IS POSSIBLE FOR TUESDAY AFTERNOON
AND NIGHT...AND HIGH WIND WATCH HAS BEEN ISSUED FOR THAT. THOSE
SOUTHERLY DOWNSLOPING WINDS HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO PLAY GAMES WITH
MAX TEMPS AND POPS IN THE VALLEY TOMORROW...SO BE AWARE. WE FIND
OURSELVES ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE SYSTEM WEDNESDAY WITH NW FLOW
TYPE OF SCATTERED LIGHT PRECIP.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS 
ENDING AS LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS NE AREAS WEDNESDAY NIGHT. LARGE 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE SETTLES INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. 
TEMPERATURES WILL HOVER BELOW NORMAL. ENTRANCE REGION OF UPPER JET 
WILL LINGER NEAR THE E TN RVR VALLEY. HIGH AND MID LEVEL CLOUDINESS 
WILL VARY INTO FRIDAY. INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH BEGINS TO DEVELOP 
FRIDAY RESULTING IN A MILD WARM UP. BACKED OFF ON POPS FOR FRIDAY 
WITH WEAK LIFT PRESENT. RAINFALL OR EARLY SNOWFALL IF THEY OCCUR 
WILL BE LIGHT. INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH FROM GLFMEX TO TN VALLEY 
TAKES BETTER SHAPE ON SATURDAY AS UPPER LOW MOVES INTO TX. WARM UP 
CONTINUES WITH BETTER ISENTROPIC LIFT AND RAIN CHANCES. MIXED PRECIP 
TYPES PROBABLE ACROSS NORTH AREAS AND EASTERN MOUNTAINS FRI 
NGT/EARLY SAT. RAIN LIKELY MOST OF SAT WITH INCREASING LIFT AND 
LAYER MOISTURE. SAT NGT INTO SUNDAY IS WHEN THINGS GET A BIT 
UNCERTAIN. SYSTEM TAKING SHAPE AS APPS RUNNER/ MILLER A HYBRID. 
CRITICAL THICKNESS VALUES IN QUESTION WHEN BEST AVAILABLE MOISTURE 
IS IN PLACE EARLY SUNDAY. WEAK FLOW IN NEGATIVELY TILTING MEAN 
TROUGH LENDS SOME CREDIT TO NORTHERN GFS TRACK. LEANED TOWARD A 
WARMER AND LONGER LIQUID SOLUTION. VERY GOOD UPPER DIVERGENCE SETS 
UP NORTH OF AREA BY SUNDAY AFTN. CURRENT GFS TRACK BRINGS DRY SLOT 
INTO THE MRX CWA BY SUN AFTN. SIGNIFICANT WINTER WEATHER EVENT 
REMAINS POSSIBLE BUT UNCERTAIN TRACK LEADS TO BROAD SOLUTIONS FOR 
MRX CWA. LIGHT SNOW SUNDAY NIGHT ENDING AS UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS ON 
MONDAY.

003 
FXUS64 KMRX 030821
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 AM EST MON FEB 3 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
ELONGATED AREA OF LOW PRESSURE STRETCHING ALONG THE SPINE OF THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH NEAR FREEZING TEMPS APPROACHING THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND CUMBERLAND MOUNTAINS. SO FAR...TEMPS ALONG 
THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU/MOUNTAINS HAVE REMAINED JUST ABOVE FREEZING 
THIS MORNING...BUT FREEZING TEMPS ARE CURRENTLY BEING REPORTED OVER 
MOST OF EASTERN KY. THUS...WILL CONTINUE THE WINTER WX ADVISORY 
ACROSS THESE AREAS THIS MORNING FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF ICE 
ACCUMULATIONS FROM FREEZING RAIN AND SLEET. MODEL SOUNDINGS STILL 
INDICATE A VERTICAL TEMP PROFILE SUPPORTIVE OF SLEET AND FREEZING 
RAIN...WITH A WARM ABOVE-FREEZING LAYER LINGERING AROUND 800 MB. 
CURRENT OBS AT CROSSVILLE AND LONESOME PINE AIRPORTS ARE REPORTING 
RAIN...SO THINK THE MAIN THREAT WILL BE THE POSSIBILITY OF LIGHT ICE 
ACCUMULATIONS. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT PRECIPITATION WILL 
END OVER THE FORECAST AREA BY THIS AFTERNOON...AS THE LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM MOVES EASTWARD OUT OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY 
AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL 
IMPACT THE REGION MIDWEEK...BRINGING GOOD CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION 
TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT...AND SOME COLDER AIR BY WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON AS ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE AREA. SOME 
LIGHT WIDELY SCATTERED SHOWERS DURING THE MORNING ON TUESDAY WILL 
INCREASE IN COVERAGE BY THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS LIFT INCREASES 
FROM A 60-70 KT 850 MB JET OVER MIDDLE/EAST TENNESSEE. THE BEST 
OPPORTUNITY FOR PRECIPITATION AND PERHAPS SOME LOCALLY HEAVY 
RAINFALL LOOKS TO BE TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING 
AS A PREFRONTAL TROUGH MOVES THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. SOME 
ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS MAY ALSO BE POSSIBLE WITH THIS ACTIVITY GIVEN 
THE STRONG DYNAMICS...BUT THE BEST INSTABILITY WILL BE DISPLACED TO 
THE WEST OF THE AREA SO THINK SHOWERS WILL BE THE DOMINANT 
PRECIPITATION MODE. ANOTHER BIGGER CONCERN FOR TUESDAY AFTERNOON/ 
EVENING WILL BE THE POTENTIAL FOR MOUNTAIN WAVES ALONG THE SMOKY 
MOUNTAIN FOOTHILLS GIVEN THE STRONG JET TO THE NORTHWEST AND THE 
STOUT SOUTHEAST FLOW AHEAD OF THE FRONT. WILL MAKE A MENTION OF THIS 
IN THE HWO DUE TO GUSTY CONDITIONS EXPECTED IN THE VALLEYS AND THE 
STRONG WINDS IN THE MOUNTAINS DURING THIS TIME PERIOD.
 
BY LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING INTO THE AFTERNOON...COLDER AIR WILL MOVE 
INTO THE AREA AS A COLD FRONT WILL MAKE IT THROUGH THE FORECAST 
AREA...CLEARING THE EASTERN ZONES BY 00Z THURSDAY. THE REMAINING 
WRAP AROUND MOISTURE ON THE BACKSIDE OF THE TROUGH AND THE STRONG 
NORTHWEST FLOW WILL HELP TO GENERATE SOME LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS 
THE EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...WHICH MAY 
PRODUCE SOME LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN BY THE LATE 
EVENING.  

ANOTHER SHORT-LIVED PERIOD OF CALM AND DRY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED 
FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY BEFORE THE NEXT STORM SYSTEM MOVES 
INTO THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. LATE THIS WEEK. THERE ARE STILL SOME 
DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE MODELS ON THE TRACK AND TIMING OF THIS 
SYSTEM. THE ECMWF IS A LITTLE MORE PROGRESSIVE AND SHOWS A WARMER 
SOLUTION...INDICATING A MAINLY LOCALLY HEAVY RAIN EVENT. THE GFS 
INDICATES THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL BUT ALSO 
HINTS AT THE UPPER-LOW TRACKING FURTHER SOUTH. THIS WOULD PROMOTE 
SOME COLDER AIR WORKING ITS WAY INTO THE AREA AS THE BASE OF THE 
TROUGH SWINGS THROUGH...CREATING SOME WINTER WEATHER CONCERNS 
SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. GIVEN THE HIGH VARIABILITY IN THE 
MODELS...CONFIDENCE IS NOT TERRIBLY HIGH ON THE EVOLUTION OF THIS 
SYSTEM ATTM. HOWEVER...THERE IS GOOD CONSENSUS FOR PRECIPITATION 
OCCURRING THIS WEEKEND SO HAVE INCREASED POPS TO MODERATE TO HIGH 
CHANCE LEVELS THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD. 
&&

805 
FXUS64 KMRX 022019
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 PM EST SUN FEB 2 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MORE INTERESTING SYSTEM
WILL BE AFFECTING THE REGION TONGIHT AND MONDAY...WITH THE SURFACE
LOW PRESSURE CENTER OVER CENTRAL MS EXPECTED TO TRACK NE TO JUST SW
OF CHA BY 06Z MONDAY...THEN TO THE CAROLINAS BY MID MORNING MONDAY. 
MODELS AGREE ON INCREASING FRONTOGENTICAL FORCING OVERNIGHT WITH
OPF AMOUNTS INDICATING MODERATE TO LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS BRIEFLY.

NOW...WHAT ABOUT THE FREEZING RAIN AND SLEET POTENTIAL? STILL A
POSSIBILITY BUT REALLY LIMITED TO THE FAR NRN FRINGES...ALONG THE
NRN MOST PLATEAU COUNTIES INTO LEE AND WISE COUNTIES OF SW VA.
SOUNDINGS REMAIN MUCH TOO WARM FOR ANY SNOW...AND ALSO THE COLDER
AIR SEEMS DELAYED A FEW HOURS. THUS...OPTED TO KEEP THE ADVISORY
INTACT AS ISSUED EARLIER TODAY...BUT DELAYED THE ONSET OF ANY
WINTRY MIX BY A FEW HOURS OR SO. THE STRONGER LIFT EQUATES TO
HEAVIER RAINS WHICH COULD BRING THE WARMER AIR ALOFT TO THE
SURFACE. THIS LEAVES JUST A FEW SPOTS THAT DROP BELOW 32 DEGREES
...SUCH AS SHELTERED VALLEYS OF WISE COUNTY VA. BASED ON THESE
CHANGES I LOWERED THE ICE AMOUNTS TO BETWEEN A FEW HUNDREDTHS AND
1/10TH OF AN INCH IN THE ADVISORY AREA.

RAIN SHOULD GENERALLY BE GONE BY MONDAY AFTERNOON...SO LEFT THE
AFTERNOON GRIDS DRY FOR NOW. THAT DRY PERIOD IS REALLY SHORTLIVED
AS LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS AGAIN OVER THE LOWER MS VALLEY REGION ON
TUESDAY. SHOWERS SPREAD QUICKLY NE ON TUESDAY WITH LIKELY TO
CATEGORICAL POPS NEEDED AT THAT TIME. IF RAIN IS DELAYED ENOUGH ON
MONDAY NIGHT THEN SOME PATCHY FOG...LOCALLY DENSE...IS POSSIBLE IN
THE FAVORED VALLEY SPOTS.

FOR TEMPS...MOS MINS WERE GENERALLY CLOSE EACH NIGHT AND FOLLOWED
SOMEWHAT. MOS MAX TEMPS HAVE BEEN OFF A GOOD BIT OVER THE PAST
COUPLE OF DAYS...AND LOOKED JUST A BIT TOO WARM FOR MONDAY. FOR
TUESDAY IT REALLY DEPENDS ON HOW FAST CLOUDS INCREASE AND SHOWERS
DEVELOP. I WENT BELOW GUIDANCE IN SRN AND PLATEAU AREAS...BUT ABOVE
GUIDANCE FOR TRI WHERE DOWNSLOPE LOW LEVEL WINDS WERE INDICATED.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...DEEP MOISTURE AND SOME 
SHORT WAVE LIFTING WITH DEPARTING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TUESDAY NIGHT 
INTO WEDNESDAY KEEPS THE CHANCE FOR RAIN ALIVE DURING THIS PERIOD. 
HOWEVER...THE RAIN WILL BE TAPERING OFF THROUGH THE DAY. COLD 
NORTHWEST FLOW AND LOW LEVEL MOISTURE COULD LEAD TO A FEW LIGHT 
FLURRIES OR SNOW SHOWERS IN THE SW VA MOUNTAINS AND TN/NC BORDER 
REGION THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING BEFORE ENDING. THE FORECAST STILL 
ALLOWS FOR A TWENTY FOUR HOUR DRY PERIOD FOR THE ENTIRE AREA ON 
THURSDAY. POPS SLOWLY CRANK UP AGAIN FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT AS THE 
SOUTHERN STREAM BECOMES ACTIVE WITH SHORT WAVE ENERGY INDUCING 
LOWERING PRESSURES FROM THE WESTERN GULF OF MEXICO NORTHEAST INTO 
THE MID SOUTH. A STRENGTHENING SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT AND 
SOUTHERLY COMPONENT OFF THE GULF SHOULD STEADILY MOISTEN THE LOCAL 
ATMOSPHERE TO GENERATE SOME LIGHT RAIN FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. 
FORECAST DETAIL CONCERNING THE EXACT TRACK OF SYSTEMS AND 
TEMPERATURE STRUCTURE THROUGH THE ATMOSPHERIC COLUMN IS LACKING AT 
THIS TIME RANGE AND THROUGH THE REST OF THE WEEKEND BUT THERE IS THE 
POSSIBILITY OF A MIXED BAG OF WINTERY PRECIP FRIDAY MORNING BEFORE 
THE LOW LEVEL AIRMASS WARMS ABOVE FREEZING AND AGAIN FRIDAY NIGHT 
WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF SUB-FREEZING SURFACE TEMPERATURES. BASICALLY 
STAYED WITH THE OLD BROAD BRUSHED APPROACH CONCERNING CLOUD 
COVER...POP AND EVEN TEMPERATURE HERE. THUS...THE THREAT FOR WINTERY 
PRECIP IN THE FORECAST. THE GFS AND ECMWF START OUT SOMEWHAT ON THE 
SAME PAGE FOR THE WEEKEND BUT THE ECM IS FASTER AND LESS AMPLIFIED 
WITH SATURDAY AND SUNDAY'S SYSTEM PROGRESSION ACROSS THE EASTERN 
U.S. WENT WITH THE FASTER ECM IDEA WHICH LEADS TO INCREASING CHANCE 
FOR RAIN SATURDAY INTO SATURDAY NIGHT WITH A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
TRACKING NORTHEAST OUT OF THE WESTERN GULF ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. 
WITH TEMPERATURES DROPPING OFF BEHIND THE PRESSURE SYSTEM'S COLD 
FRONT SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY...RAIN WOULD BE CHANGING TO SNOW 
DURING THIS PERIOD. KEPT A BIT OF SNOW MIXED WITH RAIN ON SUNDAY 
INTO THE WRAP AROUND NORTHWEST FLOW BEHIND THE DEPARTING STORM 
SYSTEM. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             43  51  36  53  45 / 100  50  20  80  90 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  41  49  35  52  42 / 100  60  10  80  90 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       38  48  32  49  41 / 100  60  10  80  90 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              39  47  29  54  41 / 100  80   0  60  90

1252 PM EST SUN FEB 2 2014

.AVIATION...NICE WET SYSTEM IN STORE DURING THE FORECAST PERIOD AS
SHORT WAVE AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW UTILIZE MOISTURE FROM BOTH
THE PACIFIC OCEAN AND THE GULF OF MEXICO. LENGTHY PERIODS OF IFR

SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. LIFR CONDITIONS ARE A POSSIBILITY IN THIS

FXUS64 KMRX 021457
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
957 AM EST SUN FEB 2 2014

.DISCUSSION...THE APPROACHING COLD FRONT HAS PASSED EAST OF A 
BOWLING GREEN KY TO NASHVILLE TN TO MUSCLE SHOALS AL LINE PER 14Z 
SURFACE MAP. SEEING MAINLY LIGHT SHOWERS AT THIS POINT...JUST NOW 
STARTING TO ENTER WRN MOST COUNTIES OF OUR FORECAST AREA. COVERAGE 
DOES NOT APPEAR TO WARRANT ANY HIGHER THAN 60 TO 70 PERCENT...SO
LITTLE CHANGES PLANNED FOR REST OF THE FIRST PERIOD GRIDS. WILL 
CHECK HOURLY GRIDS AND MAKE A FEW TWEAKS AS NEEDED...SUCH AS MAX 
TEMPS WHICH MAY BE OFF A BIT DUE TO SOME PATCHY FOG AND LOW CLOUDS 
AND THE ONSET OF SHOWERS SHORTLY. 

RAIN LOOKS TO BE MODERATE OR HEAVIER THIS EVENING AS A SURFACE LOW 
DEVELOPS ALONG THE COLD FRONT...AROUND NRN AL THEN TRACKS NE TO THE 
CAROLINAS BY MONDAY MORNING. 

WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY LOOKS GOOD AS ISSUED FOR BOTH TIMING AND 
AREAL COVERAGE. MODEL SOUNDINGS ONLY SUPPORT RAIN CHANGING BRIEFLY 
TO LIGHT FREEZING RAIN OR SLEET IN THE ADVISORY AREA...NO SNOW. THE 
WINTRY PRECIPITATION (PCPN) SHOULD BE LIMITED TO SHELTERED VALLEYS 
WHERE COLD AIR IS MORE LIKELY TO BE TRAPPED. MOS GUIDANCE HAS 
STEADILY FORECAST A LOW AT LONESOME PINE (WISE CO) AROUND 32 TO 33 
DEGREES...SO ICE ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE SPOTTY AND STAY 1/10TH OF 
AN INCH OR LESS.

230 
FXUS64 KMRX 020805
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 AM EST SUN FEB 2 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH MONDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
A COLD FRONT OVER THE WESTERN TN RIVER VALLEY...WITH TEMPS AND 
DEWPOINTS SLOWLY RISING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS COLD FRONT IS 
PROGGED TO SLOWLY MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON... 
WITH MOST OF ITS ASSOCIATED RAIN OCCURRING BEHIND THE FRONT. THUS... 
IT APPEARS THAT THE BULK OF THE RAINFALL WILL BEGIN TO AFFECT THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU/CUMBERLAND MOUNTAINS BY LATE AFTERNOON...WITH THE 
REST OF THE FORECAST AREA RECEIVING THE BULK OF THE RAINFALL 
TONIGHT. MODELS HAVE COME INTO BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE EASTWARD 
EXTENT OF SOME LOW-LEVEL SUB-FREEZING AIR LATER TONIGHT...WITH MODEL 
SOUNDINGS INDICATING A VERTICAL TEMP PROFILE SUPPORTIVE OF SLEET AND 
FREEZING RAIN DUE TO A WARM ABOVE-FREEZING LAYER LINGERING AROUND 
800 MB. WITH THIS IN MIND...WILL PLAN TO ISSUE A WINTER WX ADVISORY 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND THE CUMBERLAND MOUNTAINS 
OF SOUTHWEST VA FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF ICE ACCUMULATIONS BETWEEN 
MIDNIGHT TONIGHT AND NOON ON MONDAY. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THAT THIS SUB-FREEZING LOW-LEVEL AIR WILL NOT PROGRESS MUCH FARTHER 
EAST THAN THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU/MOUNTAINS...WITH TEMPS REMAINING IN 
THE MID 30S TO LOWER 40S OVER THE GREAT TN VALLEY. AN AREA OF LOW 
PRESSURE IS PROGGED TO MOVE NORTHEASTWARD FROM THE DEEP SOUTH UP 
ALONG THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY ON MONDAY MORNING...BUT THIS LOW SHOULD 
STAY EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH PRECIP ENDING OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA BY MONDAY AFTERNOON. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES FOR TODAY...AND WILL GENERALLY 
TREND TOWARDS A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO. THESE GFS AND NAM 
NUMBERS ARE IN FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TONIGHT AND MONDAY...AND 
LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...A BRIEF BOUT OF 
SUBTROPICAL RIDGING MONDAY NIGHT WILL PROMOTE MOSTLY DRY CONDITIONS 
AS A SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ADVECTS GULF MOISTURE INTO THE REGION TO SET 
THE STAGE FOR A WETTER PERIOD TUESDAY AND ESPECIALLY TUESDAY NIGHT. 
SHOWERS DURING THE DAY ON TUESDAY SHOULD BE GENERALLY LIGHT AND 
SCATTERED IN NATURE FOR THE MOST PART AS THEY MOVE IN FROM THE 
SOUTH...BUT THEY WILL BECOME MORE WIDESPREAD BY THE AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING AS AN UPPER-TROUGH AND COLD FRONT APPROACH FROM THE WEST. 
THE BEST OPPORTUNITY FOR PRECIPITATION AND PERHAPS SOME LOCALLY 
HEAVY RAINFALL LOOKS TO BE TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH EARLY WEDNESDAY 
MORNING AS THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH. IN WAKE OF THE FRONT...COLDER 
AIR WILL MOVE IN COMBINE WITH SOME WRAP AROUND MOISTURE ON THE 
BACKSIDE OF THE TROUGH TO GENERATE SOME LIGHT NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW 
SHOWERS ACROSS THE EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA...WHICH MAY PRODUCE SOME LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. 

ANOTHER SHORT-LIVED PERIOD OF CALM AND DRY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED 
FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...BEFORE THE NEXT STORM SYSTEM 
MOVES INTO THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ON FRIDAY AND EVENTUALLY THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY BY SATURDAY. ATTM...THERE ARE SOME DIFFERENCES 
BETWEEN THE MODELS ON THE TIMING OF THE ONSET OF PRECIPITATION /WITH 
THE ECMWF BEING A LITTLE FASTER/. HOWEVER...BOTH MODELS INDICATE THE 
POTENTIAL FOR SOME APPRECIABLE RAINFALL SATURDAY AND SATURDAY 
NIGHT...SO HAVE BUMPED POPS UP TO SOLID CHANCE IN THIS PERIOD. 
DEPENDING ON THE TIMING/TRACK OF THIS SYSTEM...THE POSSIBILITY OF 
SOME WINTERY PRECIPITATION MAY ALSO EXIST AS WELL.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   59  42  51  38  55 /  60 100  40  20  70 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     57  41  50  36  54 /  60 100  50  10  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN             57  39  50  35  51 /  70 100  50  10  70 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    55  38  48  31  50 /  60 100  70   0  50 
&&

147 
FXUS64 KMRX 012015
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST SAT FEB 1 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...CLOUDS WILL INCREASE TONIGHT 
WITH CLEAR SKIES LONG ENOUGH IN MANY LOCATIONS...TO ALLOW PATCHY 
AREAS OF FOG AND LOW CLOUDS TO DEVELOP. LOW TEMPS ABOVE FREEZING 
TONIGHT FOR A CHANGE SHOULD CAUSE THE BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE TO BE 
TAPPED INTO FOR THE FOG DEVELOPMENT. OTHERWISE...MODELS SLOWING DOWN 
THE LIGHT RAIN AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT...SO I LOWERED POPS 
CONSIDERABLY FOR EARLY TONIGHT AND KEPT POPS ONLY 20 TO 30 PERCENT 
CHANCE FOR LATE TONIGHT.

SHOWERS SHOULD DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT SUNDAY...AND EASILY 
SPREAD INTO WESTERN AREAS BY THE AFTERNOON. QUESTIONABLE IF RAIN 
REACHES FAR NE TN AND SW VA SECTIONS BEFORE 7PM SUNDAY...WITH 
WETTEST PERIOD TO BE SUNDAY NIGHT UP TO ABOUT 16Z MONDAY. PUSHED 
POPS UP NEAR 100 PERCENT FOR SUNDAY NIGHT. 

12Z MODELS VERY CONSISTENT IN LIMITING ANY WINTRY PRECIPITATION 
(PCPN) TO NRN MOST PLATEAU COUNTIES TO LEE/WISE AND RUSSELL COUNTIES 
OF SW VA...MAINLY LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING (ABOUT 6 
HOURS OR SO). WINTER WEATHER DESK GRAPHICS NOW REFLECT THIS THINKING 
WITH A MUCH LESSER THREAT OF ANY SIGNIFICANT ICING OR SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS IN THESE AREAS. THUS...PER COORDINATION...NO NEED FOR 
A WINTER STORM WATCH AT THIS TIME...BUT WILL FRESHEN OUR HAZARDOUS 
WEATHER PRODUCT. 

MOS TEMPS SIMILAR AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED THROUGH THESE PERIODS
WITH MAX TEMPS MORE CHALLENGING THAN MIN TEMPS. LOW CLOUDS AHEAD OF 
THE SHOWERS ON SUNDAY SHOULD KEEP CHA COOLER THAN AREAS TO THE NE 
SUCH AS TRI. RAIN TAPERS OFF FROM THE WEST MONDAY WITH AT LEAST 
PARTIAL CLEARING IN THE AFTERNOON...BUT I FAVORED THE SLIGHTLY 
COOLER NAM MOS FOR HIGHS ON MONDAY.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...A COUPLE SYSTEMS AFFECT 
THE REGION DURING THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST. THE FIRST SHORT WAVE 
SWINGS NORTHEAST OUT OF THE SOUTHERN PLAINS ON TUESDAY WITH WARM AND 
MOIST AIR RETURNING AND A SURFACE WAVE SHIFTING FROM THE LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY EARLY ON TUESDAY ON ITS WAY ACROSS THE CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS BY 12Z WEDNESDAY. RAIN BUILDS IN DURING THE DAY TUESDAY 
WITH THE HIGHEST PROBABILITY OF OCCURRENCE TUESDAY NIGHT IN THE 
BETTER LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THE SYSTEM COLD FRONT. IN THE STILL 
MOIST ENVIRONMENT BEHIND THE FRONT THERE COULD BE A FEW SHOWERS 
AROUND DURING THE DAY WEDNESDAY AND AN UPSLOPE COMPONENT COULD LEAD 
TO A FEW OROGRAPHIC SHOWERS WEDNESDAY EVENING. THE RAIN MAY CHANGE 
TO SOME LIGHT SNOW IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN BEFORE WRAPPING UP AROUND 
MIDNIGHT. THE FORECAST AREA GETS TO ENJOY A DRY TWENTY FOUR HOUR 
PERIOD ON THURSDAY BUT ANOTHER LONG WAVE TROUGH WILL BE AMPLIFYING 
ACROSS THE WESTERN STATES AND SOME SHORTWAVE ENERGY AND 
STRENGTHENING ISENTROPIC LIFT SHOULD LEAD TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF 
PRECIPITATION ON FRIDAY. WARM AND MOIST AIR STREAMING IN OVER THE 
COLD LOWER LEVEL AIRMASS COULD ALLOW FOR A MIXED BAG OF WINTERY 
PRECIPITATION THROUGH AT LEAST EARLY AFTERNOON FOR MOST AREAS UNTIL 
SUFFICIENT LOW LEVEL WARMING TAKES PLACE. FRIDAY NIGHT IS IN 
QUESTION CONCERNING SURFACE TEMPERATURES SO HAD TO MIX SOME MORE 
WINTER TIME PRECIP INTO THE EQUATION AT THIS TIME BUT IF THE 
SOUTHERLY FLOW AHEAD OF A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ACROSS THE 
PLAINS IS STRONG ENOUGH THIS WON'T BE AN ISSUE BECAUSE THE PRECIP 
WILL ENTIRELY LIQUID. BOTH THE ECMWF AND THE GFS INDICATE A MID 
LATITUDE CYCLONE TRACK WELL WEST OF THE VIEWING AREA ON SATURDAY SO 
WELL ABOVE FREEZING TEMPERATURES APPEAR TO BE IN STORE AND THUS RAIN 
RATHER THAN SNOW FOR DAY SEVEN.    

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 011457
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
957 AM EST SAT FEB 1 2014

.DISCUSSION...STARTING OUT THIS MORNING UNDER MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES AND 
THE LACK OF CLOUDS OVERNIGHT ALLOWED MIN TEMPS TO FALL INTO THE 
TEENS AND 20S. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW LITTLE INCREASE IN CLOUDINESS 
UNTIL QUITE LATE...PROBABLY MID OR LATE THIS AFTERNOON. WILL ADJUST 
SKY COVER GRIDS AND MAY NEED TO NUDGE MAX TEMPS UP A BIT...GIVEN 
MORE SUNSHINE PLUS MUCH LESS SNOW COVER REMAINING TODAY. HOURLY TEMP 
AND DEW POINT TEMP GRIDS HAVE DRIFTED WELL OFF REALITY AND WILL GET 
UPDATED. 

FOR THE WINTRY SYSTEM SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY...WAITING FOR THE 12Z 
DATA TO ARRIVE TO COMPARE TO 06Z RUNS. 06Z RUNS OF GENERALLY BOTH 
NAM AND GFS WOULD LIMIT ANY WINTRY PCPN TO OUR NRN MOST ROW OF E TN 
COUNTIES INTO LEE AND WISE COUNTIES OF SW VA. EVEN USING THE COLDER 
NAM SOLUTION WOULD NOT CHANGE RAIN OVER TO SNOW OR SLEET UNTIL 
AROUND 09Z MONDAY...PLUS SURFACE TEMPS ARE STILL NOT PROGGED TO FALL 
TO 32 DEGS OR COLDER ANYWHERE...BUT AT LONESOME PINE (WISE CO VA). 
06Z GFS HAD A RATHER LARGE AND DEEP LAYER OF WARM AIR ABOVE THE 
SURFACE...WITH ANY SNOW ACCUMULATIONS LIMITED TO NW OF OUR FORECAST 
AREA. 

COORDINATED EARLIER WITH NWS JKL ON A POSSIBLE WINTER STORM WATCH 
FOR MOST OF THEIR AREA WITH THIS SYSTEM. THE WINTRY THREAT FOR OUR 
AREA LOOKS LIMITED AT THIS POINT...BUT WILL BE RE-EVALUATED LATER 
TODAY.

278 
FXUS64 KMRX 010902
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST SAT FEB 1 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MID ATLANTIC STATES...WITH A 
QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY AND 
MID WEST. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY MOVE TOWARDS 
THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...WITH SOME ISENTROPIC LIFT AHEAD OF IT 
PRODUCING AN INCREASE CLOUDS OVER THE FORECAST AREA AND A CHANCE OF 
RAIN MAINLY AFTER MIDNIGHT. SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS WILL INCREASE OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA TODAY AHEAD OF THIS COLD FRONT...WHICH WILL HELP 
TO PRODUCE ANOTHER WARM DAY WITH TEMPS ACTUALLY RISING FIVE TO TEN 
DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES FOR TODAY...AND WILL GENERALLY TREND 
TOWARDS THE WARMER GFS NUMBERS SINCE THEY VERIFIED BETTER YESTERDAY. 
GFS AND NAM NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TONIGHT...AND LOOK 
REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...AN ACTIVE PATTERN IS EXPECTED 
FOR THE WEEK AHEAD...WITH SEVERAL SHORTWAVE TROUGHS OF LOW PRESSURE 
SCOOTING THROUGH THE REGION...AND BRINGING A GOOD OPPORTUNITY FOR 
PRECIPITATION DURING THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS.

TONIGHT INTO SUNDAY MORNING...SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO 
ADVECT WARMER AIR AND GULF MOISTURE INTO THE FORECAST AREA. AREAS OF 
RAIN SHOWERS WILL OVERSPREAD THE AREA FROM WEST TO EAST THROUGHOUT 
THE DAY ON SUNDAY. THEN BY MIDDAY...A COLD FRONT WILL PASS THROUGH 
AND SHIFTING WINDS TO THE NORTHWEST BY THE AFTERNOON. SHOWERS WILL 
CONTINUE TO INCREASE IN COVERAGE AHEAD OF THE MAIN TROUGH WHICH IS 
PROGGED TO MOVE AROUND 12-15Z MONDAY MORNING. WITH COLDER AIR 
FILTERING INTO THE AREA...A CHANGEOVER TO SOME SNOW AND/OR FREEZING 
RAIN/SLEET WILL BE POSSIBLE ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND THE 
CUMBERLAND MOUNTAINS OF ALONG THE KENTUCKY/TENNESSEE BORDER AND IN 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA LATE SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY MORNING. THERE ARE 
SOME DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE MODELS REGARDING THE DEPTH OF THE COLD 
AIR. THE NAM SOUNDING IS INDICATING A COLDER ATMOSPHERE WHICH WOULD 
PROMOTE ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL. THE GFS SHOWS A WARMER LAYER OF ABOVE 
FREEZING AIR ALOFT...INDICATING A HIGHER POTENTIAL OF SOME SLEET AND 
FREEZING RAIN TO OCCUR ALONG WITH SOME SNOW IN THESE AREAS. GIVEN 
THE UNCERTAINTY IN THE EXACT DETAILS AND THE LOCALIZED NATURE OF 
THIS ACTIVITY...HAVE HELD OFF ON A WATCH FOR NOW AS SNOWFALL AND ICE 
ACCUMULATION PROJECTIONS FOR NOW FALL WITHIN ADVISORY CRITERIA. THIS 
WINTERY ACTIVITY IS ONLY EXPECTED TO IMPACT THE AFOREMENTIONED 
NORTHERN CWA AREAS AS LOCATIONS ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND THE 
EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND FOOTHILLS WILL BE IN WARMER AIR FOR THE 
DURATION OF THE EVENT BEFORE THE PRECIPITATION TAPERS OFF BY THE 
LATE MORNING AND AFTERNOON.

A SECOND SHORTWAVE WILL BRING ANOTHER ROUND OF WIDESPREAD SHOWERS 
INTO THE REGION TUESDAY INTO TUESDAY NIGHT...PROVIDING ANOTHER 
OPPORTUNITY FOR WIDESPREAD RAINFALL ACCUMULATIONS. THEN BY WEDNESDAY 
MORNING...A CHANGEOVER TO SOME LIGHT NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW SHOWERS 
WILL BE POSSIBLE ALONG THE EAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
THROUGH THE AFTERNOON AS COLDER AIR FILTERS IN AND COMBINES WITH 
SOME WRAP AROUND MOISTURE ON THE BACKSIDE OF THE TROUGH. A BRIEF 
BOUT OF DRIER AND WARMER WEATHER IS EXPECTED ON THURSDAY AS SOME 
RIDGING TAKES PLACE...BEFORE THE NEXT STORM SYSTEM MOVES INTO THE 
REGION FOR FRIDAY. THIS MAY BRING ANOTHER OPPORTUNITY FOR WIDESPREAD 
RAIN SHOWERS AND THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME WINTERY PRECIPITATION AS 
WELL.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   59  41  53  37  49 /   0  30  70  90  40 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     57  40  50  34  46 /   0  30  70  90  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN             57  41  49  34  45 /   0  40  70  90  50
