016 
FXUS64 KMRX 312028
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
328 PM EST FRI JAN 31 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...LOW CLOUD DECK FROM 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WESTWARD HAS BEEN ERODING SLIGHTLY ON THE EASTERN 
PERIPHERY THIS AFTERNOON...BUT COULD SPREAD EAST INTO AT LEAST OUR 
PLATEAU AND SE TN COUNTIES EARLY TONIGHT. EXPECTING HIGH CLOUDS ALSO 
IN THE ZONAL FLOW ALOFT...SO WILL RUN PARTLY CLOUDY ACROSS THE BOARD 
FOR TONIGHT. GFS MOS MINS WERE 3 TO 5 DEGREES TOO COLD FOR FRIDAY 
MORNING LOWS...SO I BLENDED THE MINOR DIFFERENCES OUT FOR TONIGHT.
DID FAVOR THE MILDER NAM MOS MINS WHERE CLOUDS OR LIGHT SOUTH WINDS 
ARE FACTORS TO CONSIDER. 

SATURDAY STILL SHAPING UP TO BE A NICE MILD AND DRY DAY...AND I 
CHOSE TO DROP POPS FOR SATURDAY AFTERNOON IN THE WEST. RAIN CHANCES 
FOR SATURDAY NIGHT NOT WORTH MORE THAN CHANCE POPS...WITH NO CHANGES 
MADE TO PREVIOUS POP/WX GRIDS FOR NOW. SHOWERS SPREAD ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA SUNDAY WITH AND JUST AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. SOME 
DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE LATEST GFS AND NAM MODEL RUNS...ON 1) HOW 
STRONG THE COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL BE ACROSS THE NRN 1/3 OF THE 
FORECAST AREA LATE SUNDAY AFTERNOON...AND 2) HOW MUCH LIGHT SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS MAY OCCUR SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. NOT ABLE TO HIT 
THE SNOW MUCH JUST YET THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON...GIVEN THE WARMER 
SURFACE TEMPERATURES AND THE FACT THAT THE TOP OF THE SATURATED 
COLUMN WON'T FAVOR SNOW/ICE CRSYTAL GROWTH UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING. 

WINTER WEATHER DESK PROGS SHOW SOME ICE POTENTIAL FROM 12Z SUNDAY TO 
12Z MONDAY...BUT MODEL SOUNDINGS LOOK MORE SUPPORTIVE OF RAIN...THEN 
A MIX WITH SLEET...AND FINALLY A CHANGE TO LIGHT SNOW FOR MAINLY NRN 
AREAS. GFS MODEL KEEPS SURGING WARM AIR NORTHWARD INTO SE TN AND SW 
NC...WHICH GIVES LOW CONFIDENCE FOR ANY WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY 
CRITERIA BEING MET OUTSIDE OF SW VA AND THE NRN MTNS OF E TN. 

OTHERWISE...MOS TEMPS GENERALLY FOLLOWED FOR SATURDAY AND SATURDAY 
NIGHT. SUNDAY MAXES SHOULD OCCUR IN THE MORNING OR NO LATER THAN 
VERY EARLY AFTERNOON...AS REFLECTED IN FORECAST GRIDS.

THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK PRODUCT (HWO) WAS UPDATED EARLIER TO 
HIGHLIGHT THE WEEKEND SYSTEM...AND A WEBINAR ALSO WAS DONE.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE EXTENDED PERIOD 
INCLUDES THREES SYSTEMS TO AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA. COLDER AIR 
FLOWS INTO THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT BEHIND A DEPARTING FRONTAL SYSTEM 
WHILE A FAST MOVING SHORT WAVE TRAILS ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. MODEL 
FORECASTS INDICATE SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND LIFTING OCCURS FOR 
PRECIPITATION BEHIND THE FRONT. TEMPERATURES WILL BE FALLING THROUGH 
THE EVENING AND LIGHT SNOW APPEARS LIKELY AFTER MIDNIGHT ACROSS THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...MUCH OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE AS WELL AS HIGH NORTH CAROLINA BORDER TERRAIN THROUGH 
MONDAY MORNING BEFORE PRECIP TAPERS OFF AS THE WAVE DEPARTS. 
ANOTHER...MORE WELL DEVELOPED SHORT WAVE ENTERS THE PICTURE LATER 
TUESDAY INTO TUESDAY NIGHT. BECAUSE SOME MOISTURE AND WARM AIR 
ADVECTION WILL BE MOVING IN WELL AHEAD OF THIS FEATURE ALOFT...THERE 
WILL BE JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE OF LIGHT RAIN OVER MUCH OF THE FORECAST 
AREA AND TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE COLD ENOUGH ACROSS SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF SOME LIGHT 
FREEZING RAIN AND SLEET LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING 
BEFORE THE LOWER LEVELS OF THE ATMOSPHERE WARM SUFFICIENTLY FOR A 
CHANGEOVER TO LIQUID PRECIP. THE MAIN BRUNT OF THIS SYSTEM BUILDS 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TUESDAY AFTERNOON INTO TUESDAY 
NIGHT WITH A NICE MILD SOUTHERLY FLOW. THEREFORE...THIS EVENT WILL 
BE A RAIN EVENT. THE SYSTEM COLD FRONT MOVES AWAY TO THE EAST DURING 
THE DAY WEDNESDAY WITH THE CHANCE OF RAIN TAPERING OFF. MODELS SHOW 
SOME LINGERING LOWER LEVEL MOISTURE ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND WITH TEMPERATURES DROPPING 
BELOW FREEZING HAD TO INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR LIGHT SNOW IN THIS 
AREA. THE FINAL SYSTEM APPEARS ON THE HORIZON AT THE END OF THE 
PERIOD ON FRIDAY. AT THIS RATHER REMOTE PERIOD OF THE 
FORECAST...WHERE UNCERTAINTY STILL ABOUNDS...ANOTHER SOUTHERN STREAM 
WAVE BUILDS EAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS WITH SURFACE LOW 
PRESSURE FORMING OVER THE WESTERN GULF OF MEXICO. WHILE TRACK OF 
THIS ENTIRE SYSTEM IS IN QUESTION THIS FAR OUT IN THE FORECAST...A 
SOUTHERN TRACKING LOW EMERGING NORTHEAST OUT OF THE GULF WOULD BE IN 
A FAVORABLE POSITION TO GENERATE MORE FREEZING/FROZEN PRECIPITATION. 
TEMPERATURES APPEAR TO BE COLD ENOUGH FOR THIS POSSIBILITY IF THE 
SYSTEM DEVELOPS ACCORDING TO CURRENT MODEL FORECASTS. STAYED BELOW 
THE WARMER MEX MOS TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE THROUGHOUT THE LONG TERM 
PERIOD.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             30  56  43  53  37 /   0  10  40  70  70 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  28  55  42  52  36 /   0  10  40  70  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       28  54  41  50  35 /   0  10  50  70  70

464 
FXUS64 KMRX 310825
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EST FRI JAN 31 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE CAROLINAS...WITH A QUASI- 
STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY AND MID 
WEST. THIS HIGH PRESSURE AREA IS PROGGED TO REMAIN ANCHORED OVER THE 
SOUTHEAST TODAY AND TONIGHT...BRINGING DRY AND WARMER CONDITIONS AS 
A DEEP SOUTHWESTERLY WIND FLOW DEVELOPS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AS 
FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES 
FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS THE WARMER 
GFS NUMBERS FOR TODAY AND THE WARMER NAM NUMBERS FOR TONIGHT DUE TO 
THE SOUTHWESTERLY WIND FLOW OVER THE FORECAST AREA.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...WARMER AIR IS ON THE WAY 
FOR THE WEEKEND AS A SUBTROPICAL RIDGE TO THE SOUTHEAST OF THE 
REGION AND AN UPPER-TROUGH OVER THE ROCKY MOUNTAINS WILL PROMOTE A 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW OVER THE REGION FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...AND 
ALLOW HIGHS TO CLIMB BACK INTO THE UPPER 40S AND 50S. SOME GULF 
MOISTURE WILL ALSO INCREASE ACROSS THE REGION AS WELL...AND A 
PASSING SHORTWAVE LATE SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY WILL LIKELY 
TRIGGER SOME AREAS OF SHOWERS ON SUNDAY. ANOTHER STRONGER SHORTWAVE 
SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY...WILL TRIGGER SOME ADDITIONAL HEAVIER 
SHOWERS DURING THIS TIME PERIOD /AND EVEN A CHANGEOVER TO SOME LIGHT 
SNOW ACROSS THE NORTHERN ZONES LATE SUNDAY NIGHT/...BEFORE THINGS 
TAPER OFF BY MONDAY AFTERNOON.

SOME BRIEF RIDGING ON MONDAY NIGHT WILL PROMOTE SOME MOSTLY/PARTLY 
CLEAR AND DRY CONDITIONS BEFORE THE NEXT SHORTWAVE WILL DRIVE A WEAK 
COLD FRONT THROUGH THE REGION ON TUESDAY. THIS WILL PROVIDE ANOTHER 
OPPORTUNITY FOR LIKELY POPS TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT...BEFORE 
THINGS TAPER OFF FROM WEST TO EAST ON WEDNESDAY. AS SOME COLDER AIR 
FILTERS INTO THE REGION WEDNESDAY EVENING/NIGHT...ANOTHER 
OPPORTUNITY FOR SOME NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE 
/MAINLY ACROSS THE NORTHEAST AND MOUNTAIN ZONES/ FROM THE WRAP- 
AROUND MOISTURE ON THE BACKSIDE OF THIS LOW. THEREAFTER...SOME DRIER 
AND WARMER CONDITIONS BACK INTO THE 50S CAN BE EXPECTED TO CLOSE OUT 
THE PERIOD ON THURSDAY.
&&

580 
FXUS64 KMRX 302014
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 PM EST THU JAN 30 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...SOME SIGNIFICANT
IMPROVEMENTS IN OUR WEATHER AFTER WE GET THROUGH ONE MORE COLD
NIGHT. THE CORE OF THE ARCTIC HIGH IS STILL GENERALLY OVER OR JUST
SE OF THE APPALACHIANS OVERNIGHT...SO MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT
WINDS. LINGERING SNOW COVER IS ALSO A FACTOR...MAINLY IN SHELTERED
VALLEYS WHERE WINDS MAY BE NEAR CALM. A STRONG LOW LEVEL
TEMPERATURE INVERSION WILL BE SETUP TONIGHT...SO RIDGE-LINES AND
PEAKS SHOULD BE NOT NEARLY AS COOL AS THOSE SHELTERED VALLEYS. THE
FIRST PERIOD OF THE ZONE FORECAST REFLECTS THIS.

AREA ROADS...ALTHO MUCH IMPROVED DURING THE DAY...WILL RE-FREEZE
AND BE HAZARDOUS AGAIN OVERNIGHT. A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT WAS
ISSUED EARLIER TO HIGHLIGHT THIS.

OTHERWISE...DRY WITH A WARMING TREND FOR FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY...
AS FLOW ALOFT BECOMES ZONAL FRIDAY AND INCREASINGLY SW BY THE
WEEKEND. CLOUD AND MOISTURE RETURN IS PRETTY SCANT UNTIL SATURDAY.
KEPT IN SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR WRN AND SE AREAS LATE SATURDAY FOR
WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT.

MOS MAX TEMPS WERE CLOSE EACH DAY AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED. A LARGE
DISPARITY IN LOWS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH SOME ADJUSTMENTS MADE TO
FIT THE LIKELY SURFACE PATTERN. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...AN WELCOME UPPER 
LEVEL PATTERN CHANGE IS IN STORE WHICH WILL REVERSE THE RECENT TREND 
OVER THE EASTERN U.S. AN AMPLIFIED UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL BE IN 
PLACE ACROSS THE WESTERN STATES WITH A RIDGE DEVELOPING ACROSS THE 
EAST WHICH MEANS THE FLOW WILL SHIFT FROM NORTHERLY TO SOUTHERLY 
BRINGING MILDER AIR INTO THE REGION. THE PERIOD STARTS OUT WITH A 
SHORT WAVE AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE FRONTAL SYSTEM SO HIGH CHANCE POPS 
SATURDAY NIGHT BUMP UP TO LIKELY PROBABILITIES FOR SHOWERS ON 
SUNDAY. TRAILING SHORT WAVE ENERGY BUILDS IN BEHIND THE DEPARTING 
SURFACE SYSTEM SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY AND TEMPERATURES DROP BACK 
INTO THE UPPER 20S AND LOWER 30S ACROSS THE NORTHWESTERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. THEREFORE KEPT SOME LIGHT RAIN CHANGING TO LIGHT SNOW 
IN THIS AREA LATER SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY MORNING BEFORE THE 
PRECIP TAPERS OFF. ANOTHER...STRONGER SYSTEM WILL BE ON THE APPROACH 
MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY WITH INCREASING WAVE AMPLIFICATION SO 
SLIGHT THROUGH LOW CHANCE POPS FOR RAIN SHOWERS INCREASE TO LIKELY 
CATEGORY BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS THE ASSOCIATED SURFACE 
WAVE MOVES FROM THE WESTERN GULF OF MEXICO NORTHEAST INTO THE 
CENTRAL APPALACHIANS BY WEDNESDAY MORNING. COLDER AIR SPILLS IN 
BEHIND THE SYSTEM COLD FRONT LATER IN THE DAY INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
WITH SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND LIFT FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME SNOW 
SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE 
MOUNTAINS OF NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. WENT CLOSER TO A GUIDANCE BLEND 
FOR MAX AND MIN TEMPS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

942 
FXUS64 KMRX 300919
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
419 AM EST THU JAN 30 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE NOW
CENTERED OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING. TEMPERATURES HAVE
REALLY BOTTOMED OUT DUE TO THE CALM CONDITIONS AND STILL
SUBSTANTIAL SNOW COVER. CURRENT TEMPERATURES ARE AT OR BELOW
THIS MORNINGS FORECAST LOWS WITH 8 AT CHA...5 AT TYS AND -1 AT TRI
AT 400 AM. THINK LOWS COULD DROP A FEW MORE DEGREES BY MORNING
WHICH COULD REACH ZERO IN KNOXVILLE. SOME LIGHT SOUTHERLY WINDS
HAVE AFFECTED TEMPERATURES ON THE PLATEAU AND MIDDLE ELEVATIONS IN
THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS WITH THOSE TEMPERATURES STILL IN THE TEENS.
WITH THE HIGH PRESSURE AREA SHIFTING EAST TODAY WINDS WILL BECOME
SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST AT ABOUT 5 TO 10 MPH. TEMPERATURES STILL LOOK TO
WARM SIGNIFICANTLY TODAY MOSTLY IN THE 30S TO POSSIBLY LOWER 40S BY
MID AFTERNOON. VERY DRY AIR MASS WOULD NORMALLY ALLOW A FAST WARM UP
BUT THIS WILL BE INHIBITED BY THE SNOW COVER. TONIGHT SOME HIGH
CLOUDS WILL MOVE IN FROM THE WEST BUT SHOULD NOT BE THAT THICK.
WITH SNOW COVER THERE COULD BE A WIDE RANGE OF LOWS...FROM LOWER TO
MID 20S WHERE SOUTH WINDS PERSIST OVERNIGHT AND INTO THE TEENS IN
CALMER AREAS. SOME LOCATIONS MIGHT EVEN FALL INTO THE SINGLE DIGITS
AGAIN. KEPT HIGHS AND LOWS BELOW GUIDANCE A FEW DEGREES BASED ON
CURRENT SNOW COVER. EXPECTING NOT ALL THE SNOW TO MELT BY LATE
AFTERNOON TODAY WHICH WILL ALLOW MORE RADIATIONAL COOLING TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SE OF THE AREA WITH WARMING TREND UNDERWAY. 
NIGHT TEMPERATURES REMAIN ON THE COOL SIDE WITH DRY AIR MASS IN 
PLACE. SW TO NE ORIENTATED UPPER JET OVER THE OHIO VALLEY WILL 
SLOWLY MOVE INTO THE TN VALLEY THIS WEEKEND. LIGHT RAIN BECOMES 
POSSIBLE ON SATURDAY BUT BETTER CHANCES INCREASE INTO SUNDAY. COLD 
FRONT NEARLY PARALLEL WITH UPPER FLOW SLOWLY MARCHES INTO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS SUNDAY WITH GOOD LIFT PROVIDED BY ENTRANCE 
REGION OF UPPER JET. TEMPERATURES WILL BEGIN FALLING SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON. UPPER TROUGH AXIS MOVES INTO SW VA SUN NIGHT WITH 
CONTINUED CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION. SUB FREEZING TEMPERATURES MAY 
FILTER INTO NW AREAS WHILE RAIN IS TAPERING OFF. FREEZING RAIN A 
POSSIBILITY ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA MONDAY MORNING. SURFACE RIDGE 
MOVES EAST THROUGH CENTRAL APPALACHIANS MONDAY NIGHT WITH WARM 
RETURN FLOW TO TN VALLEY ON TUESDAY WITH RAPID DEVELOPMENT OF 
SURFACE LOW OVER W TN. ISENTROPIC LIFT SHOULD BRING WIDESPREAD 
RAINFALL INTO THE AREA TUESDAY THROUGH EARLY WEDNESDAY. COLD FRONT 
MOVES THROUGH BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON WITH POST FRONTAL WRAP AROUND 
LIGHT SNOW BY THURSDAY MORNING. 

&&

975 
FXUS64 KMRX 292015
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST WED JAN 29 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...VISIBLE SATELLITE PICS
SUGGEST POSSIBLY A SLIGHT DECREASE IN THE SNOW COVER AROUND THE
EDGES. HOWEVER...A SOLID PART OF THE FORECAST AREA (OUTSIDE OF NW
PLATEAU COUNTIES) WILL BE SIGNIFICANTLY AFFECTED BY SNOW OVERNIGHT.
OTPED TO EXPAND THE RANGE OF MIN TEMPS...AS SHELTERED VALLEYS
SHOULD PLUNGE A FEW DEGREES BELOW MOS MIN TEMPS...WHILE HIGHER
TERRAIN OVER WRN AREAS MAY GET A LIGHT SOUTHERLY FLOW BETWEEN 06Z
AND 12Z THURSDAY (MILDER MINS THAN THIS MORNING'S MINS).

ALSO THINKING THAT IT WOULD BE WISE TO UNDERCUT MOS MAX TEMPS FOR
THURSDAY...GIVEN THE EXTENSIVE AREA OF AT LEAST 1 TO 3 INCHES OF
SNOW LIKELY LINGERING FOR EARLY THURSDAY. 

ROADS MAY HAVE IMPROVED DURING THE DAY BUT SNOW AND ICE COVERED
ACROSS THE BOARD OVERNIGHT...ESPECIALLY SHELTERED BACK ROADS WHERE
HEAVIER SNOW OCCURRED AND LESS TRAFFIC FLOWED TODAY. UPDATED
HAZARDOUS WEATHER PRODUCT PLUS ISSUED A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT TO
HIGHLIGHT THE TREACHEROUS ROADS.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
WARMING TREND WILL BE UNDERWAY WITH TEMPERATURES STARTING TO REACH 
ABOVE NORMAL LEVELS BY THE WEEKEND. THE PERSISTENT COLD LONGWAVE 
TROUGHING WE/VE BEEN EXPERIENCING WILL BE REPLACED WITH WEAK RIDGING 
ALONG THE EAST COAST AND TROUGHING OUT WEST. THUS...SW FLOW ALOFT 
WILL BE DEVELOPING BY THE WEEKEND...WHICH WILL HELP TO GRADUALLY 
INCREASE SUBTROPICAL MOISTURE INTO THE AREA. A COLD FRONT WILL DROP 
DOWN INTO THE AREA SUNDAY WITH RAIN AND SHOWERS ALONG IT. GFS HINTS 
AT A SECOND QUICK WAVE OUT OF TEXAS THAT MAY TOUCH OFF ADDITIONAL 
PRECIP MONDAY...WHILE THE ECMWF KEEPS US MAINLY DRY MONDAY. WILL 
HEDGE WITH SOME CHANCE POPS MONDAY UNTIL OUR FOCUS SHARPENS. EVEN 
SO...BOTH MODELS ARE SHOWING ANOTHER H5 TROUGH MOVING THROUGH THE 
SOUTHERN ROCKIES AND INTO THE HIGH PLAINS DURING MONDAY/TUESDAY... 
AND INTO THE MIDATLANTIC STATES LATE WEDNESDAY. AN ASSOCIATED COLD 
FRONT MAY STALL OVER MIDDLE TN WITH HIEST PRECIP AMOUNTS THERE...BUT 
THIS SYSTEM WILL LIKELY PRODUCE SOME MODERATE RAINFALL AMOUNTS IN 
OUR AREA AS IT MOVES THROUGH. CURRENT INDICATIONS ARE THAT THE FRONT 
HANGING UP IN MIDDLE TN WILL KEEP OUR AREA IN THE WARM SECTOR... 
MINIMIZING ANY WINTRY PRECIP RISK FOR US...AT LEAST TROUGH THE 
DAYTIME WEDNESDAY. PERHAPS WILL SEE LOW-POP LIGHT WINTRY PRECIP WITH 
UPSLOPE CONDITIONS OVER THE PLATEAU AND APPALACHIANS WED NGT AFTER 
THE FRONT PASSES BY.

426 
FXUS64 KMRX 290914
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
414 AM EST WED JAN 29 2014

.SHORT TERM...TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SNOWFALL HAS NOW ENDED ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. A FEW SNOW SHOWERS AND FLURRIES HAD LINGERED ACROSS 
PARTS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA IN WISE COUNTY AND EXTREME NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE THE LAST FEW HOURS. SKIES WERE MOSTLY CLEAR FROM ABOUT 
I-75 AND I-81 WESTWARD WITH SOME LOWER CLOUDS STILL LINGERING FROM 
THE SE TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND FOOTHILLS NE INTO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. 
TEMPERATURES RANGED FROM THE LOWER TO MID TEENS ALONG THE MOUNTAINS 
AND IN SW NORTH CAROLINA TO THE SINGLE DIGITS LOWER ELEVATIONS OF 
THE TN VALLEY TO NEAR ZERO ON THE PLATEAU WHERE SKIES CLEARED 
EARLIER.

FOR TODAY SKIES WILL BE SUNNY AND COLD WITH LIGHT NORTH WINDS 
BECOMING NEAR CALM AS ARCTIC HIGH BUILDS OVERHEAD. TEMPERATURES WILL 
ONLY RISE INTO THE 20S. TONIGHT SURFACE HIGH STAYS OVERHEAD OR 
SHIFTS SLIGHTLY EAST. WITH SNOW COVER EXPECT LOWS TO DROP TO SINGLE 
DIGITS AGAIN MOST LOCATIONS POSSIBLY NEAR ZERO OR SLIGHTLY BELOW IN 
NORMALLY COLDER LOCATIONS. ON THE PLATEAU LOWS MAY BE SLIGHTLY 
WARMER AS READINGS ARE ALREADY NEAR ZERO THIS MORNING BUT STILL 5 TO 
10 DEGREES.    

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY) ...
SURFACE RIDGE SLIDES SOUTHEAST OF THE AREA ALLOWING SOUTHWEST LOW 
LEVEL FLOW AND WARM AIR ADVECTION. DRY CONDITIONS WITH TEMPERATURES 
APPROACHING NORMAL BY LATE FRIDAY. PERSISTENT UPPER FLOW SW TO NE 
WITH JET CORE OVER THE N OH VALLEY. SURFACE FRONT BECOMES 
STATIONARY NW OF MRX CWA. LOW CHANCE FOR RAIN ACROSS WESTERN AREAS 
LATE FRIDAY. UPPER JET AND FRONTAL BOUNDARY SHIFT SE CLOSER TO MRX 
CWA WITH SLIGHT INCREASE IN RAIN CHANCE. TEMPS WARMING TO SLIGHTLY 
ABOVE NORMAL. 

MODEL SOLUTION BEGIN TO SPREAD WITH EVENTUAL COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE 
THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON SUNDAY. LEANED TOWARD A 
SLOWER...WARMER AND WETTER SOLUTION THROUGH SUNDAY. AS SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE AND COOLER TEMPERATURES BUILDS IN SUNDAY UPPER JET AXIS 
REMAINS NW OF AREA. ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL AID IN CONTINUED 
PRECIPITATION CHANCE INTO MONDAY. FREEZING RAIN POTENTIAL WILL NEED 
TO BE MONITORED ESPECIALLY ACROSS N AREAS SUNDAY NIGHT AND POSSIBLE 
MONDAY NIGHT. INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH TAKING SHAPE INTO THE E TN 
VALLEY BY TUESDAY. MODELS TRENDING TO A WETTER FORECAST.

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE 
CENTERED OVER THE WESTERN TN RIVER VALLEY...WITH A VERY COLD AND DRY 
AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AREA RADARS SHOW LIGHT SNOW MAINLY

CAROLINAS AS A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY 
DRIFTS EASTWARD. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS THE CLEARING LINE ALONG 
THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...WHICH SHOULD ALSO CONTINUE GRADUALLY MOVING 
EASTWARD OVERNIGHT.

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO DROP ALL OF THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORIES 
THIS EVENING...AS THE LIGHT SNOW MOVES EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
OTHERWISE...THE REST OF THE FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON 
TRACK...AND NOT NEED TO CHANGE.


626 
FXUS64 KMRX 281941
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
241 PM EST TUE JAN 28 2014

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY/...
AREAS OF LIGHT TO LOCALLY MODERATE SNOW CONTINUE TO MOVE ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND TENNESSEE VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON AS A
BROAD UPPER STORM SYSTEM CONTINUES TO PUSH GULF MOISTURE INTO THE
REGION. THIS MOISTURE...COMBINED WITH THE VERY COLD TEMPERATURES AND
THE SYNOPTIC LIFT PROVIDED BY THE JET HAS HELPED TO GENERATE AND
MAINTAIN THIS PRECIPITATION THROUGHOUT MUCH OF THE DAY. HELPING TO
MAINTAIN IT AS WELL HAS BEEN AN INVERTED TROUGH THAT IS STRETCHING
FROM GEORGIA UP INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. ADDITIONALLY...HIGHER
PWATS HAVE ADVECTED INTO THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON...WHICH HAS
ALLOWED THIS SNOW TO FALL AND ACCUMULATE DESPITE SOME OF THE HIGHER
DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS THAT WERE OBSERVED EARLIER. GENERALLY...
BETWEEN 1 TO 2 INCHES OF SNOW HAS BEEN OBSERVED ALONG THE VALLEYS
AND FOOTHILLS /WITH THE MOUNTAINS LIKELY RECEIVING 1 TO 2 INCHES
MORE/.

MODELS ARE STILL INDICATING THE PRECIPITATION WANING BY LATE EVENING
TO AROUND MIDNIGHT FROM NORTHWEST TO SOUTHEAST AS THE BEST
LIFT/MOISTURE QUICKLY SLIDES TO THE SOUTH. STILL...MODELS ARE
INDICATING THERE WILL BE A WINDOW FOR SOME ADDITIONAL LIGHT
ACCUMULATIONS OF AROUND AN INCH ALONG THE MOUNTAINS AND PORTIONS OF
THE CENTRAL VALLEYS UP INTO NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA.
THUS...HAVE ADJUSTED THE POP AND SNOW GRIDS ACCORDINGLY. STILL THINK
THAT THE ADVISORY FOR 1 TO 3 INCHES IS APPROPRIATE FOR THE VALLEYS
AND FOOTHILLS...WITH 2 TO 4 INCHES ACROSS SOUTHWEST NC AND THE
EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS THROUGH THE LATE EVENING /THOUGH SOME OF
THE PEAKS MAY HAVE SLIGHTLY HIGHER AMOUNTS/.

THEREAFTER...DRY AIR MOVES IN AND CLEARING WILL BEGIN TO OCCUR SO
WILL KEEP THE ADVISORY FOR THE CENTRAL/SOUTHERN VALLEYS THROUGH
03Z AND THE MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST TN/SOUTHWEST VA THROUGH 06Z. BY
EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING...THE COMBINATION OF THE ARCTIC AIR
MASS...THE CLEARING TAKING PLACE...THE FAIRLY LIGHT WINDS AND SNOW
PACK WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO DROP WELL INTO THE SINGLE DIGITS
AREAWIDE. WIND CHILLS WILL DROP INTO A 0 TO -10 DEGREE RANGE LATE
TONIGHT...BUT GIVEN THE LIGHT WINDS HAVE OPTED TO HOLD OFF ON A
WIND CHILL ADVISORY. MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED FOR
WEDNESDAY...BUT WITH AN ARCTIC AIR IN PLACE...HIGHS IN THE UPPER
TEENS TO MID 20S SEEM PLAUSIBLE.

.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY/ ...
TEMPS WILL BE WARMING AT THE BEGINNING OF THE PERIOD AS LOW LEVEL 
WINDS BACK TO SW AHEAD OF A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CROSSING THE GREAT 
LAKES. THIS LOW LEAVES A TRAILING COLD FRONT ACROSS KY...WHICH 
BECOMES ORIENTED PARALLEL TO THE MID-LEVEL FLOW...AND STALLS IN THAT 
AREA. MOST PRECIP FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT WILL BE NORTH OF OUR 
AREA...BUT WILL HAVE A SLIGHT TO LOW CHANCE POP NORTH BOTH PERIODS. 
TEMPS LATE FRIDAY NIGHT COULD DROP TO NEAR OR BELOW FREEZING IN 
NORTHERN AREAS...AND A SHORT PERIOD OF SNOW OR FREEZING RAIN MAY 
OCCUR. FOR NOW WILL JUST MENTION A RAIN/SNOW MIX AS FINER DETAILS OF 
THE THERMAL PROFILE ARE TOO UNCERTAIN TO MENTION FZRA.

A TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE PLAINS TO THE MS VALLEY WILL BEGIN TO 
ADVECT GREATER MOISTURE INTO THE AREA SATURDAY. FAVORABLE JET 
POSITIONING AND THE SOUTHEASTWARD PUSH OF THE FRONT WILL INCREASE 
POPS TO THE LIKELY RANGE SATURDAY NIGHT. THE 12Z GFS AND ECMWF HAVE 
COME INTO GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THIS TIMING. PRECIP EXITS TO THE EAST 
ON SUNDAY.

THE 12Z GFS IS VERY QUICK TO BACK THE LOW LEVEL FLOW TO THE SOUTH 
AND ADVECT ABUNDANT MOISTURE INTO THE AREA FOR MONDAY. THE ECMWF 
SHOWS A SIMILAR PATTERN...BUT SLOWER TIMING OF THE APPROACHING 
TROUGH. THERE IS CONSIDERABLE SPREAD AMONG ENSEMBLE MEMBERS FOR 
MONDAY/MONDAY NIGHT...BUT THEY SEEM TO CONVERGE ON PRECIP FOR 
TUESDAY. THUS WILL KEEP MONDAY DRY...WITH CHANCE POPS MONDAY NIGHT 
AND TUESDAY...WITH TEMPS SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN              9  30  11  41  25 /  30  10   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN   6  25  10  39  24 /  40  10   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                        6  27  10  39  25 /  20  10   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN               3  22   3  38  20 /  50  10   0   0  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 1 AM EST WEDNESDAY FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 10 PM EST /9 PM CST/ THIS EVENING 
     FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: ANDERSON...BLEDSOE...BRADLEY...
     CLAIBORNE...GRAINGER...HAMBLEN...HAMILTON...JEFFERSON...
     KNOX...LOUDON...MARION...MCMINN...MEIGS...NW BLOUNT...NORTH 
     SEVIER...NORTHWEST COCKE...NORTHWEST MONROE...RHEA...
     ROANE...SEQUATCHIE...UNION...WEST POLK.

     WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 1 AM EST WEDNESDAY FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...EAST POLK...HANCOCK...HAWKINS...JOHNSON...

.AVIATION...

AFTERNOON AT ALL SITES...KEEPING VISIBILITIES BETWEEN 1 AND 2
SM...DEPENDING ON LOCALIZED INTENSITY. CEILINGS SHOULD REMAIN
STEADY AROUND 1500-2000 FT. CONDITIONS SHOULD BEGIN TO IMPROVE IN
THE EVENING...MAINLY AFTER 00Z AS THE SNOW DECREASES. VFR
CONDITIONS SHOULD RETURN TO ALL SITES AFTER MIDNIGHT. WINDS WILL
CONTINUE FROM THE N AT 10 KTS OR LESS.

&&

NC...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 1 AM EST WEDNESDAY FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

     FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: ANDERSON...BLEDSOE...BRADLEY...
     CLAIBORNE...GRAINGER...HAMBLEN...HAMILTON...JEFFERSON...

828 
FXUS64 KMRX 281549
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1049 AM EST TUE JAN 28 2014

.DISCUSSION...
AREAS OF LIGHT SNOW CONTINUE TO OVERSPREAD THE REGION TODAY AS AN 
UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM CONTINUES TO DRAW MOISTURE FROM THE 
LOWER-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND GULF OF MEXICO INTO THE REGION THIS 
MORNING. AT THE SURFACE...AN INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH REMAINS 
ORIENTED FROM THE SOUTHEAST ATLANTIC COAST UP THROUGH THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. THIS BOUNDARY...ALONG WITH A STRENGTHENING UPPER-JET 
AND SOME MODEST FRONTOGENESIS ALOFT WILL HELP TO CREATE SOME 
APPRECIABLE LIFT. THIS LIFT...COMBINED WITH THE INCREASED MOISTURE 
AND COLD TEMPERATURES WILL GENERATE A BROAD AREA OF LIGHT TO MODERATE
SNOW THROUGH THE LATE AFTERNOON/EVENING. THE BEST WINDOW APPEARS TO
BE FROM 15Z THROUGH 21-00Z AS THE BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTENS AND
HIGHER PWAT VALUES ADVECT IN /ALLOWING FOR SOME HIGHER RH VALUES
WITHIN THE SNOW GROWTH REGION DURING THE LATE MORNING AND
AFTERNOON/. THE MOST FAVORED AREAS FOR ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL WILL BE
ALONG AND EAST OF THE I-75 CORRIDOR. LOCATIONS ACROSS SOUTHWEST
NORTH CAROLINA AND ALONG THE MOUNTAINS OF EAST TENNESSEE SHOULD SEE
BETWEEN 2 TO 4 INCHES WITH SOME LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS ALONG THE
PEAKS. ANOTHER FAVORED AREA WILL FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA /ESPECIALLY AREAS ALONG AND SOUTHEAST OF THE
I-81 CORRIDOR/...WHERE 1-3 INCHES SEEM PROBABLE BY THIS EVENING.
ELSEWHERE ACROSS THE CENTRAL VALLEY...1 TO 2 INCHES IS POSSIBLE
/WITH HALF AN INCH TO 1 INCH IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY/.

THUS...WILL STICK WITH A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY THROUGH 06Z IN
SOUTHWEST VA...NORTHEAST TN...SOUTHWEST NC AND THE MOUNTAINS
THROUGH 06Z. DO THINK THERE WILL BE SOME LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS
ALONG THE PEAKS...BUT THEY WILL NOT BE WIDESPREAD ENOUGH TO UPGRADE
TO A WARNING. ELSEWHERE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL
VALLEY...THE ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH 03Z.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
633 AM EST TUE JAN 28 2014

.AVIATION...NORTHERLY WINDS WILL CONTINUE TODAY AS SURFACE HIGH
PRESSURE RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE AREA. AN UPPER JET SEGMENT WILL MOVE
EAST INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TODAY. THIS FEATURE WILL DRAW
MOISTURE UP FROM THE SOUTH AS IT STREAMS THROUGH THE TN VALLEY. MID
LEVEL CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO LOWER AS LIGHT SNOW DEVELOPS THIS
MORNING. CIGS WILL LOWER TO NEAR MVFR AS SNOWFALL RATES INCREASE BY
THIS AFTERNOON. THE UPPER JET AXIS WILL SLIDE EAST OF THE SMOKIES
LATE THIS AFTERNOON. THE LAYER WILL DRY AND THE PRECIPITATION WILL
DECREASE AND MOVE OFF TO THE EAST. VFR CONDITIONS OVERNIGHT.

870 
FXUS64 KMRX 280918 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
417 AM EST TUE JAN 28 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
WITH COLD AIR MASS DRIFTING SOUTH THROUGH THE SOUTH CENTRAL U.S. 
THROUGH TONIGHT. INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH EXTENDS THROUGH GA/SC INTO 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TODAY. STRENGTHENING UPPER JET OVER THE 
DEEP SOUTH WILL MOVE INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TODAY WITH GOOD 
LIFT PROVIDED OVER THE AREA BY EARLY AFTERNOON. LAYER INITIALLY 
DRY...ESPECIALLY THE BOUNDARY LAYER...BUT HIGHER PWAT VALUES WAVE NW 
INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TODAY. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN BELOW 
FREEZING TODAY...SO PRECIP TYPE WILL BE ALL SNOW. GOOD RH 
CONCENTRATED IN THE SNOW GROWTH REGION BY THE EARLY AFTERNOON. LARGE 
AREA OF LIGHT SNOW WILL PERSIST OVER THE AREA FOR MUCH OF TODAY. 
UPPER TROUGH AXIS WILL SHIFT EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS EARLY TONIGHT. 
LAYER WILL DRY OUT VERY QUICKLY OVERNIGHT. ANOTHER BURST OF COLD AIR 
ADVECTION WILL COMMENCE TONIGHT AND WIND CHILL ADVISORIES WILL 
LIKELY BE REQUIRED IN AREAS SIMILAR TO THIS MORNING. TEMPERATURES IN 
THE SINGLE DIGITS WILL BE WIDESPREAD TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...COLD ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE 
TO SETTLE OVER THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY WITH BELOW FREEZING 
TEMPERATURES. FORECASTED ON THE COLD SIDE OF GUIDANCE WITH EXPECTED 
SNOW COVER AND WEAK COLD AIR ADVECTION. WINDS STRONGEST IN THE 
NORTHEAST WHERE THEY WILL BE WEST TO NORTHWEST AROUND 10 MILES PER 
HOUR. THERE COULD BE WIND CHILLS BELOW ZERO IN THE MORNING HOURS IN 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE TN MOUNTAINS. CENTER 
OF THE HIGH MOVES OVER REGION WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON SO WINDS BECOME 
LIGHT. WEDNESDAY NIGHT NOT QUITE AS COLD EXCEPT HIGHER VALLEYS OF 
THE NE AND TRI CITIES AIRPORT WHERE COLD AIR DRAINAGE WILL DROP LOWS 
INTO THE SINGLE DIGITS. MOST OTHER LOCATIONS NEAR 10 OR SLIGHTLY 
WARMER. THURSDAY THE WARMING BEGINS IN EARNEST AS WINDS SHIFT TO THE 
SOUTHWEST AND SOUTH BRINGING IN A WARMER AIR MASS. HIGHS THURSDAY 10 
TO 15 DEGREES ABOVE WEDNESDAY. TROUGH BEGINS TO REPLACE RIDGE OVER 
THE WESTERN STATES WITH UPPER FLOW BECOMING MORE ZONAL. HIGH LEVEL 
MOISTURE INCREASES THURSDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF FRONTAL SYSTEM MOVING 
INTO THE OHIO AND MS VALLEYS. LOWS WILL BE MUCH WARMER LOWER TO MID 
20S. PRECIPITATION CHANCES INCREASE FRIDAY AS COLD FRONT APPROACHES. 
THE FRONT SLOWS AND DOES NOT PUSH THROUGH THE REGION UNTIL SATURDAY 
NIGHT OR SUNDAY MORNING. SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES 
MILD THROUGH SUNDAY. MODELS DIVERGE AT THE END OF THE FORECAST 
PERIOD WITH THE GFS SHOWING DRYING BEHIND FRONT SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
MONDAY BEFORE ANOTHER SYSTEM APPROACHES. THE ECMWF TRIES TO BRING 
ANOTHER WAVE OR IMPULSE ALONG THE FRONT KEEPING IT WET THROUGH 
MONDAY. PREFER THE DRIER GFS FOR NOW. BEHIND FRONT TEMPERATURES 
COOLER SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY BUT STILL CLOSE TO NORMAL. 

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       23   6  27  10  39 /  70  10  10   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              20   3  23   3  37 /  80  40  10   0   0

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
950 PM EST MON JAN 27 2014

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT OVER THE CAROLINAS... 
WITH A LARGE DOME OF ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE UPPER MS 
RIVER VALLEY. THIS HIGH WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD SOUTHEASTWARD TOWARDS 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY OVERNIGHT...WITH A ZONAL UPPER-LEVEL FLOW 
CONTINUING TO BRING CLOUDS OVER THE FORECAST AREA FROM THE PLAINS.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT 
WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THIS EVENING TO TWEAK WIND CHILL VALUES IN THE 
SMOKY MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHEAST TN ZONES TO BE MORE IN LINE WITH WIND 
CHILL ADVISORY CRITERIA.

020 
FXUS64 KMRX 272012
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 PM EST MON JAN 27 2014

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT/...
AN ARCTIC FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION THIS EVENING...BRINGING
DANGEROUSLY LOW TEMPERATURES AND WIND CHILLS TO THE REGION TONIGHT
THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...AND SOME LIGHT WINTRY PRECIPITATION ALONG
THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS ON TUESDAY.

ARCTIC AIR HAS ALREADY BEGUN TO OOZE INTO THE REGION THIS
AFTERNOON IN THE NORTHWEST ZONES...AND WILL CONTINUE MAKE ITS WAY
SOUTH AND EAST INTO THE CENTRAL/SOUTHERN VALLEYS AND THE SMOKY MTNS
BY THIS EVENING. THE BRISK NORTHWEST FLOW WILL HELP TO REINFORCE
THIS COLD AIR OVERNIGHT...AND DESPITE SOME CLOUD COVER ALLOW
TEMPERATURES TO DROP INTO THE SINGLE DIGITS TO LOWER TEENS IN MOST
SPOTS BY TUESDAY MORNING. THESE STRONG WINDS COMBINED WITH THE COLD
TEMPERATURES WILL DROP WIND CHILLS TO 5 TO 15 DEGREES BELOW ZERO
LATE TONIGHT ALONG THE PLATEAU...THE EAST TENNESSEE MTNS AND FAR
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE/SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. THUS...A WIND CHILL
ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT FOR THESE LOCATIONS LATE THIS EVENING THROUGH
DAYBREAK AS THE SUBFREEZING WIND CHILLS WILL PERSIST FOR SEVERAL
HOURS. OTHER VALLEY LOCATIONS WILL BE A LITTLE WARMER...BUT IT WILL
STILL BE AND FEEL VERY COLD TONIGHT AND TUESDAY MORNING OVER THE
ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. THUS...PRECAUTIONS SHOULD BE TAKEN BY ANYONE
THAT MUST TO BE OUTSIDE DURING THIS TIME PERIOD.

THE BIG QUESTION WITH THE FORECAST WAS THE AREA OF LIGHT
PRECIPITATION THAT THE NAM AND NOW THE GFS AND ECMWF ARE SHOWING
ALONG THE MOUNTAINS AND BRIEFLY OVER THE VALLEYS ON TUESDAY. GIVEN
THE COLD AIR IN PLACE AND THE DEEP MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS
WAVE...SOME ACCUMULATING SNOW WILL BE POSSIBLE /PRIMARILY OVER THE
HIGHER TERRAIN/. AM THINKING THAT SOME OF THESE QPF SIGNALS
/ESPECIALLY THE WIDESPREAD ONES OVER THE VALLEY/ AND A BIT OVERDONE
AS THERE IS FAIRLY WEEK FRONTOGENESIS TAKING PLACE. HOWEVER...SOME
UPPER-LEVEL SUPPORT IS THERE WITH THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE
JET ROTATING OVER THE REGION DURING THE AFTERNOON. THUS...INCREASED
POPS FOR SOME LIGHT SNOW OVER THE VALLEYS AND SOME ACCUMULATING
SNOW OVER THE EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA
DURING THE AFTERNOON. GIVEN THE UNCERTAINTY OF HOW WIDESPREAD THIS
ACTIVITY WILL BE...HAVE BEEN CONSERVATIVE WITH SNOWFALL AMOUNTS. DO
THINK THAT PERHAPS AN INCH OR TWO WILL BE POSSIBLE ALONG THE HIGH
MTNS GIVEN THE AVAILABLE MOISTURE AND HIGH RATIOS...WITH UP TO A
DUSTING ELSEWHERE IN PARTS OF THE SURROUNDING VALLEYS AS A BULK OF
THE HEAVIEST PRECIPITATION WILL BE WELL TO THE SOUTH AND EAST.

AN EVEN COLDER NIGHT SEEMS LIKELY FOR LATE TUESDAY NIGHT AS THE
SKY CLEARS AND WINDS DECOUPLE...ALLOWING FOR LOWS TO DROP TO
AROUND ZERO IN SOME AREAS ACROSS THE NORTHEAST ZONES...AND IN THE
3-9 DEGREE RANGE IN MOST OTHER AREAS. WIND CHILL VALUES MAY NOT BE
QUITE AS LOW IN SOME SPOTS WITH THE LIGHTER WINDS...BUT IT WILL
CERTAINLY FEEL BITTERLY COLD AS VALUES DROP TO BETWEEN -5 TO -10
DEGREES ACROSS MOST OF THE REGION BY WEDNESDAY MORNING. THUS...A
WIND CHILL ADVISORY SEEMS LIKELY FOR THE SAME AREA ONCE AGAIN AND
PERHAPS MORE OF THE VALLEY AS WELL. AT LEAST ONE MORE VERY COLD
NIGHT WILL BE IN STORE FOR THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS LOWS WILL
BOTTOM OUT IN THE 5 TO 15 DEGREE RANGE BEFORE A GRADUAL WARMING
TREND WILL OCCUR BY LATE WEEK.

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY THROUGH MONDAY/...
HE GENERAL PATTERN THROUGH THE PERIOD WILL BE A NEARLY ZONAL FLOW 
IN THE MID-UPPER LEVELS. THIS SHOULD BRING AN END TO THE VERY COLD 
TEMPS THAT WE HAVE BEEN SEEING. IT MAY ALSO RESULT IN A PERIOD OF 
RAIN THROUGH THE WEEKEND AS A BOUNDARY STALLS E-W NEAR THE AREA. 

LOW LEVEL WARM ADVECTION IS EXPECTED TO BRING WARMER TEMPS THURSDAY 
AND FRIDAY...ALONG WITH INCREASING CLOUD COVER. THE NORTHWARD PUSH 
OF WARMER AIR STALLS ACROSS KY...PRODUCING A BOUNDARY THAT SITS 
PARALLEL TO THE UPPER FLOW. A JET STREAK OVER THE OH VALLEY BRINGS 
SOME PRECIP CHANCES INTO OUR NORTHERN COUNTIES FRIDAY NIGHT. SOME 
WEAK MID-LEVEL AMPLIFICATION ALLOWS THE BOUNDARY TO SAG SOUTH ON 
SATURDAY NIGHT...AND MOVE ACROSS THE AREA SUNDAY. THESE PERIODS LOOK 
LIKE THE BEST CHANCES OF SEEING PRECIP...BUT WILL STAY IN THE CHANCE 
RANGE AS CONFIDENCE IN DETAILS WITH THIS PATTERN IS LACKING. THERE 
IS ALSO A LOT OF SPREAD IN THE GEFS MEMBERS OVER THE WEEKEND. 

A PERIOD OF DRYING IS EXPECTED MONDAY...FOLLOWED BY RETURNING RAIN 
CHANCES MONDAY AS LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS IN THE PLAINS. OVERALL 
CONFIDENCE IS LOW THROUGH THE LONG TERM PERIOD. 

&&

788 
FXUS64 KMRX 271531
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1031 AM EST MON JAN 27 2014

.DISCUSSION...
A STRONG COLD FRONT WILL TRACK THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA LATE THIS
MORNING AND EARLY THIS AFTERNOON...BRINGING MUCH COLDER AIR INTO
THE REGION AND SOME LIGHT PRECIPITATION TO THE REGION. MOST
LOCATIONS HAVE ALREADY EXPERIENCED THEIR HIGH TEMPERATURE THIS
MORNING /IN THE LOW 30S TO AROUND 40 DEGREES/...AND WILL BEGIN TO
FALL OVER THE COURSE OF THE AFTERNOON INTO THE UPPER TEENS AND 20S
BY RUSH HOUR. MOST OF THE INITIAL LIGHT BAND OF RAIN/FREEZING
DRIZZLE HAS CLEARED THE MOUNTAINS...WITH AN ADDITIONAL LIGHT BAND
OF SNOW MOVING INTO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE OVER
THE NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS. UP TO HALF AN INCH OF SNOW WILL POSSIBLE
OVER THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS...BUT OVERALL DUSTING IS ALL THE
VALLEYS WILL EXPERIENCE AT MOST. AS MENTIONED...SOME LIGHT FREEZING
DRIZZLE WAS OBSERVED ALONG SHELTERED VALLEY THE FOOTHILLS OF THE
SMOKIES AND IN SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA RESULTING IN SOME SLICK
ROADS. PRECIPITATION HAS WANED IN THESE AREAS FOR THE MOST
PART...SO HAVE ALLOWED THE ADVISORY TO EXPIRE...BUT HAVE STILL MADE
A MENTION OF SOME PATCHY BLACK ICE IN A NEWLY UPDATED SPS...AS
TEMPERATURES WILL LIKELY NOT REACH MUCH ABOVE FREEZING IN THESE
SPOTS.

719 
FXUS64 KMRX 270840
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EST MON JAN 27 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER JET PUSHING EASTWARD THROUGH 
SOUTHERN OH VALLEY TODAY. STRONG COLD FRONT MOVING SOUTHEAST THROUGH 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS EARLY TODAY. TEMPERATURES WILL FALL 
DRAMATICALLY THROUGHOUT THE DAY. LIGHT PRECIPITATION WILL ACCOMPANY 
THE FRONT AND CONTINUE THIS AFTERNOON IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW UPSLOPE 
REGIONS OF SW VA AND THE TN MOUNTAINS. PWAT VALUES RISE BRIEFLY TO 
NEAR .50 BUT SYSTEM WILL MOVE SWIFTLY THROUGH THE AREA. 
PRECIPITATION MAY BE MIXED BUT WILL CHANGE QUICKLY TO ALL SNOW. 
GROUND TEMPERATURES AT ONSET WILL BE ABOVE FREEZING SO SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE MINIMAL. NORTHWEST WINDS CONTINUE OVERNIGHT 
DRIVING WIND CHILLS TO NEAR OR BELOW ZERO AREA-WIDE. AIR 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE IN THE MID TEENS AND SINGLE DIGITS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...VERY COLD ARCTIC AIR WILL BE 
IN PLACE EARLY IN THE EXTENDED FOR ONE MORE BLAST OF FRIGID 
TEMPERATURES TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  HIGHS TUESDAY WILL 
STRUGGLE TO REACH INTO THE 20S ACROSS MUCH OF EAST TN WITH MANY 
AREAS ONLY SEEING UPPER TEENS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS OF TN.  ADDITIONALLY...A FEW POCKETS OF LIGHT SNOW OR 
FLURRIES ARE POSSIBLE OVER THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS AND PORTIONS OF 
SOUTHWEST NC.  LOWS IN THE SINGLE DIGIT AND EVEN A STRAY BELOW ZERO 
READING IS EXPECTED...ESPECIALLY TUESDAY NIGHT.  MINIMALLY WARMER 
CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED INTO WEDNESDAY.  FLOW ALOFT BECOMES ZONAL ON 
THURSDAY ALLOWING FOR A WARMING TREND TO BEGIN IN EARNEST.  
TEMPERATURE WILL CONTINUE TO WARM THROUGH THE REST OF THE PERIOD.  
HOWEVER...MODELS ARE IN POOR AGREEMENT LATE IN THE EXTENDED IN 
REGARDS TO A COUPLE OF WEAK SYSTEMS MOVING THROUGH.  WILL KEEP LOW 
POPS IN PLACE FRIDAY/FRIDAY NIGHT AND CHANCE POPS FOR THE WEEKEND.


&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 PM EST SUN JAN 26 2014

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED OVER 
MICHIGAN...WITH ITS TRAILING COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHWEST ACROSS 
THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY. THIS COLD FRONT WILL QUICKLY MOVE ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA AROUND SUNRISE...WITH SOME LIGHT PRECIPITATION 
DEVELOPING ALONG IT...AND BEHIND IT ON MONDAY MORNING AS NORTHWEST 
UPSLOPE FLOW DEVELOPS BEHIND THE FRONT. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THAT MOISTURE WILL BE FAIRLY LIMITED WITH THIS COLD FRONT...AND 
GENERALLY CONFINED TO THE MORNING HOURS BEFORE 18 UTC.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...AND 
WILL NOT PLAN TO UPDATE THIS EVENING.

.AVIATION...ANOTHER FIRST HALF AND SECOND HALF TYPE FORECAST WITH

TYS WHERE CEILINGS WILL BE RIGHT AROUND THE TOP OF THE MVFR RANGE.
LIGHT RAIN MAY MIX WITH AND CHANGE TO A FEW SNOW FLAKES ESPECIALLY
AROUND TRI BUT MAY ALSO APPEAR BRIEFLY AT TYS. CEILINGS MAY
CONTINUE TO LOWER THROUGH THE MVFR CATEGORY AT TRI THROUGH THE
LATER AFTERNOON HOURS. WEST TO NORTHWEST WINDS WILL BECOME STRONG
AND GUSTY WITH THE TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT ASSOCIATED WITH SUCH A

974 
FXUS64 KMRX 261955
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EST SUN JAN 26 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...YET ANOTHER IN OUR SERIES OF 
COLD FRONTS WILL PUSH THROUGH THE AREA ON MONDAY.  MOISTURE AND 
FORCING WILL BE LIMITED...SO JUST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS SOUTH...CHANCE 
CENTRAL...AND LOW LIKELY FAR NORTH FOR MAINLY MONDAY MORNING/EARLY 
AFTERNOON.  APPEARS PRECIP MAY START TO MOVE IN LATE TONIGHT AS RAIN 
OR A RAIN SNOW MIX GIVEN WARM AIR ABOVE THE SURFACE AND SURFACE 
TEMPS MAINLY ABOVE FREEZING AT PRECIP ONSET...WITH A GRADUAL 
TRANSITION TO MAINLY SNOW BEFORE ENDING.  NOT MUCH SNOW ACCUMULATION 
EXPECTED...WITH AN INCH OR LESS POSSIBLE OVER SOME OF THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS.  TEMPERATURES WILL LIKELY BE FALLING DURING THE 
AFTERNOON MOST AREAS.  WILL ADJUST SOME MAV TEMPS UP TONIGHT INTO 
EARLY TOMORROW GIVEN EXPECTED LOW LEVEL SOUTHWEST FLOW. 

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...AN ARCTIC FRONT WILL
MOVE THROUGH THE REGION MONDAY NIGHT...BRINGING DANGEROUSLY LOW
TEMPERATURES AND WIND CHILLS TO THE REGION THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF
NEXT WEEK.

BY MONDAY EVENING...ARCTIC AIR WILL BEGIN TO FILTER INTO THE REGION 
AND BE ACCOMPANIED BY SOME BREEZY NORTHWEST WINDS. THESE WINDS... 
COMBINED WITH THE BITTER COLD AIR IN PLACE /WITH TEMPERATURES LIKELY 
IN THE SINGLE DIGITS/ WILL CREATE WIND CHILL VALUES BETWEEN -5 TO 
-15 DEGREES OR LOWER IN MANY LOCATIONS. THIS IS ESPECIALLY TRUE 
ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN...WHERE THESE CONDITIONS WILL LAST FOR 
SEVERAL HOURS. WINDS WILL BEGIN TO RELAX A BIT BY THE AFTERNOON ON 
TUESDAY...BUT WITH THE COLD AIR IN PLACE TEMPERATURES WILL ONLY 
REACH THE MID TEENS TO LOWER 20S. AN EVEN COLDER NIGHT SEEMS LIKELY 
FOR LATE TUESDAY NIGHT AS THE SKY CLEARS AND WINDS DECOUPLE... 
ALLOWING FOR LOWS TO DROP BELOW ZERO IN SOME AREAS ACROSS THE 
NORTHEAST ZONES...AND IN THE 0-5 DEGREE RANGE IN MOST OTHER AREAS. 
THOUGH WIND CHILL VALUES WILL NOT BE QUITE AS LOW WITH THE CALM 
CONDITIONS...IT WILL STILL FEEL BITTERLY COLD AS VALUES DROP TO 
BETWEEN -5 TO -10 ACROSS MOST OF THE REGION BY WEDNESDAY MORNING. 
THUS...A WIND CHILL ADVISORY SEEMS LIKELY FOR THE MOUNTAINS AND AT 
LEAST PORTIONS OF THE VALLEY MONDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. AT LEAST ONE 
MORE VERY COLD NIGHT WILL BE IN STORE FOR THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
AS LOWS WILL BOTTOM OUT IN THE 5 TO 15 DEGREE RANGE BEFORE A GRADUAL 
WARMING TREND WILL OCCUR BY LATE WEEK. 

WINDS WILL EVENTUALLY SHIFT TO THE SOUTH AND WEST BY THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY...ALLOWING SOME WARMER AIR AND MOISTURE TO RETURN. DEPENDING 
ON THE STRENGTH OF SOME PASSING SHORTWAVES...SOME ISOLATED LIGHT  
PRECIPITATION MAY BE POSSIBLE LATE IN THE WORK WEEK /THOUGH THE 
ECMWF FAVORS THIS FAR MORE THAN THE GFS/. DID NOT GO TOO HIGH ON 
POPS FOR NOW...AS DISAGREEMENT EXISTS BETWEEN THE MODELS ON THE 
STRENGTH AND TIMING OF THESE PASSING WAVES. HIGHS WILL RETURN TO THE 
40S AND 50S BY THE WEEKEND AS SOUTHWEST FLOW PERSISTS AND AN 
ADDITIONAL WEAK TROUGH BRINGS A BETTER OPPORTUNITY FOR RAIN 
SHOWERS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EST SUN JAN 26 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH MONDAY)...SHORT WAVE SURFACE RIDGE WILL 
MOVE EAST ACROSS THE AREA TODAY. UPPER FLOW BECOMES ZONAL. TN VALLEY 
POSITIONED BETWEEN NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN JETS. SOME CLOUDS DRIVEN 
BY THE NORTHERN JET WILL STREAM ACROSS FAVORING NORTHERN AREAS 
TODAY. SOUTHWESTERLY RETURN FLOW TAKES SHAPE THIS AFTERNOON. LOW 
LEVEL THICKNESS VALUES RISE SIGNIFICANTLY WITH TEMPERATURE 
APPROACHING NORMAL. MEAN UPPER TROUGH BUILDS SOUTH AGAIN TONIGHT AS 
NORTHERN STREAM DIPS INTO THE NORTHERN TN VALLEY. CLOUDS WILL BE 
INCREASING OVERNIGHT AS LIGHT PRECIPITATION MOVES THROUGH KY. 
OVERNIGHT VALLEY LOWS MAINLY ABOVE FREEZING. LIGHT SNOW WILL MOVE 
INTO THE NORTHERN PLATEAU EARLY MONDAY. THE AREA OF PRECIPITATION 
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA MONDAY MORNING. A MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW OR 
ALL RAIN WILL BE OCCURRING ON THE SOUTHERN END OF THE PRECIPITATION 
AREA AS IT MOVES THROUGH. TEMPERATURES WILL BEGIN TO FALL MONDAY 
MORNING AND CONTINUE FALLING THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. THE 
PRECIPITATION WILL TAPER OFF IN THE AFTERNOON WITH SNOW CONTINUING 
ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF NE TN AND THE SMOKIES.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...VERY COLD ARCTIC AIR 
WILL RAPIDLY PUSH IN AS A STRONG AND COLD SURFACE HIGH DROPS IN 
BEHIND MONDAYS EXITING COLD FRONT.  THE VERY COLD AIR WILL REMAIN IN 
PLACE OVER THE REGION THROUGH WEDNESDAY.  THIS WILL PUT OVERNIGHT 
LOWS AT 0 TO 10 DEGREES ACROSS THE TN VALLEY MONDAY NIGHT...TUESDAY 
NIGHT AND MOST AREAS WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  TUESDAY/S HIGHS WILL STRUGGLE 
TO CLIMB INTO THE 20S IN SOME LOCATION ACROSS THE NORTHERN AND 
CENTRAL VALLEY.  FLOW ALOFT STARTS TO TREND MORE ZONAL THURSDAY 
THROUGH THE REST OF THE EXTENDED ALLOWING A WARMING TREND TO 
DEVELOP.  MODELS AND MODEL RUNS COME INTO POOR AGREEMENT BY THE END 
OF THE PERIOD AND CONFIDENCE IS LOW FOR THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
SATURDAY.  CURRENT GFS IS TRENDING DRIER BUT PRIOR RUNS AND THE 
ECMWF BRINGS IN A COUPLE OF WEAK WAVES THROUGH DURING THIS TIME 
PERIOD.  WILL COMPROMISE AND HAVE MAINLY 20 POPS OVER AT LEAST 
PORTIONS OF THE CWA WITH BEST CHANCE ON SATURDAY.

&&

APPEARS TO BE IN GOOD SHAPE...AND WILL NOT PLAN TO CHANGE.

824 
FXUS64 KMRX 251950
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EST SAT JAN 25 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...A BRIEF SHOT OF COLDER AIR WILL 
PUSH INTO THE AREA EARLY TONIGHT.  EXPECT SOME SNOW SHOWERS AND 
FLURRIES IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW AND COLD ADVECTION MAINLY EARLY 
TONIGHT.  CLOUDS EXPECTED TO DECREASE FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST AS 
THE COLD ADVECTION ENDS TONIGHT.  STILL LOOKS LIKE SOME BORDERLINE 
WIND ADVISORY WIND SPEEDS WILL BE POSSIBLE OVER SOME OF THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN ESPECIALLY FIRST PART OF TONIGHT...SO WILL LEAVE WIND 
ADVISORY IN PLACE THROUGH 4 AM FOR THE E TN MOUNTAINS.  TOMORROW 
WILL BE DRY WITH QUITE A BIT OF SUNSHINE. IT WILL ALSO BE WARMER AS 
HIGH TEMPS SHOULD NOT BE FAR FROM SEASONAL NORMS.  

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)... AN ARCTIC FRONT
WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION ON MONDAY INTO MONDAY
EVENING...BRINGING DANGEROUSLY LOW TEMPERATURES AND WIND CHILLS TO
THE REGION THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK.

AHEAD OF THE INITIAL ARCTIC FRONT...ANOTHER WEAK SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE 
THROUGH THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT/MONDAY MORNING...BRINGING SOME 
SCATTERED AREAS OF LIGHT SNOW TO NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA. MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS WILL RECEIVE A DUSTING TO AROUND 
HALF AN INCH...AND LOCATIONS IN THE MOUNTAINS ABOVE 2500 FEET OR SO 
COULD RECEIVE AN INCH OR TWO OF SNOW THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON. AS 
MENTIONED...BY MONDAY EVENING ARCTIC AIR WILL BEGIN TO FILTER INTO 
THE REGION AND BE ACCOMPANIED BY SOME BREEZY NORTHWEST WINDS. BY 
TUESDAY MORNING...LOW TEMPERATURES BETWEEN 0-5 DEGREES ACROSS MUCH 
OF THE VALLEY /AND SUBZERO TEMPERATURES IN THE MOUNTAINS/...WILL 
COMBINE WITH THESE WINDS TO CREATE DANGEROUSLY COLD WIND CHILLS IN 
THE -10 TO -20 DEGREE RANGE. TEMPERATURES ON TUESDAY WILL ONLY REACH 
THE MID TEENS TO LOWER 20S. AN EVEN COLDER NIGHT SEEMS LIKELY FOR 
LATE TUESDAY NIGHT AS THE SKY CLEARS AND WINDS SUBSIDE...ALLOWING 
FOR LOWS TO DROP BELOW ZERO IN SOME AREAS ACROSS THE NORTHEAST 
ZONES...AND BOTTOM OUT IN THE 0-5 DEGREE RANGE IN MOST OTHER AREAS. 
AT LEAST ONE MORE BITTERLY COLD NIGHT IN THE SINGLE DIGITS SEEMS 
LIKELY FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT BEFORE A GRADUAL WARMING TREND WILL THEN 
OCCUR BY LATE WEEK. A POTENTIAL SHIFT IN THE PATTERN TO A MORE ZONAL 
FLOW ALOFT WILL ALLOW FOR SOME RELIEF AS WINDS VEER TO THE 
SOUTHWEST. HOWEVER...A FEW SHORTWAVES COULD TAP INTO THE INCREASED 
MOISTURE ACROSS THE AREA THIS WEEKEND AND PRODUCE SOME SNOW AND RAIN 
SHOWERS TO CLOSE OUT THE PERIOD. DID NOT GO TOO HIGH ON POPS FOR 
NOW...AS DISAGREEMENT EXISTS BETWEEN THE MODELS ON THE STRENGTH AND 
TIMING OF THESE PASSING WAVES.

ACROSS THE SURROUNDING HIGHER TERRAIN. WINDS TAPER OFF AND LOW AND

348 
FXUS64 KMRX 250844
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EST SAT JAN 25 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER JET MOVING THROUGH THE TN 
VALLEY EARLY TODAY. LARGE AREA OF SURFACE LOW PRESSURE OVER GREAT 
LAKES WITH COLD FRONT EXTENDING SW INTO TX. THIS FRONT WILL MOVE 
RAPIDLY EAST THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY THIS AFTERNOON. 
WINDS WILL INCREASE IN ADVANCE OF FRONT WITH LOW LEVEL JET NEAR 50 
KNOTS. WINDS WILL CONTINUE STRONG THROUGH THE EVENING HOURS AS 
STRONGER WINDS MIX DOWN BEHIND FRONT. WEAK WARM AIR ADVECTION 
UNDERWAY IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT. TEMPERATURE WILL CLIMB WITH 
SOUTHERN AREAS RISING ABOVE FREEZING FOR A FEW HOURS TODAY. SNOW 
BANDS WILL ACCOMPANY THE FRONT. ONCE AGAIN...INITIAL CONDITIONS VERY 
DRY AND AVAILABLE MOISTURE WILL BE LOWERING AS COLD FRONT MOVES
THROUGH TODAY. SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE GENERALLY LIGHT AND 
FAVORING WESTERN FACING SLOPES AS THE EVENT UNFOLDS THIS AFTERNOON. 
POST FRONTAL AIRMASS DRIES CONSIDERABLY THIS EVENING AS BRISK WEST 
WINDS CONTINUE INTO THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. SOME AREAS MAY REQUIRE A 
WIND ADVISORY TODAY. STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION OVERNIGHT WILL RESULT 
IN TEMPERATURE DROPPING FAST. TEMPERATURES COUPLED WITH THE BRISK 
WINDS WILL LIKELY REQUIRE A WIND CHILL ADVISORY FOR MANY AREAS 
OVERNIGHT.   

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...DEEP...BROAD UPPER TROUGH OVER 
THE EASTERN U.S. WILL CONTINUE TO DOMINATE AREA WEATHER THOUGH MUCH 
OF THE EXTENDED.  SUNDAY WILL BE THE WARMEST DAY OF THE EXTENDED AS 
WINDS BECOME SOUTHERLY AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING SYSTEM.  THESE 
SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL BE A BIT BREEZY BUT WILL CARRY IN WARMER AIR.  
HOWEVER...THIS WARMING WILL BE SHORT-LIVED AS THE NEXT SYSTEM MOVES 
IN LATE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY.  WINDS WILL SHIFT TO THE NORTHWEST 
BEHIND A STRONG COLD FRONT.  SCATTERED LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS WILL 
ACCOMPANY THE FRONT WITH SOME ACCUMULATING SNOW POSSIBLE OVER THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN.  HOWEVER...THE MAIN CONCERN WILL BE THE BRISK 
NORTHWEST WINDS BRINGING IN ANOTHER ROUND OF VERY COLD ARCTIC AIR.  
SINGLE DIGIT TEMPERATURES COMBINED WITH THE WINDS MANY CREATE 
DANGEROUS WIND CHILLS...ESPECIALLY OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS MONDAY 
NIGHT.  THE VERY COLD TEMPERATURES WILL STAY OVER THE REGION TUESDAY 
AND TUESDAY NIGHT.  TEMPERATURES WILL SLOWLY MODERATE WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY.  MODELS IN POOR AGREEMENT BY THE END OF THE PERIOD...BUT 
THE NEXT SYSTEM SHOULD MOVE IN AROUND THE FRIDAY TIME FRAME.


&&

894 
FXUS64 KMRX 250145
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
845 PM EST FRI JAN 24 2014

.DISCUSSION...SKIES STILL CLEAR THIS EVENING ALLOWING FOR SOME
RADIATION. A TUG OF WAR OR SORTS AS TO WHICH PROCESS WILL WIN OUT
CONCERNING LOW TEMPERATURES TONIGHT WITH A TIGHTENING PRESSURE
GRADIENT DEVELOPING AHEAD OF THE NEXT CLIPPER SYSTEM. TEMPERATURES
ARE DROPPING PERHAPS NOT QUITE AS RAPIDLY AS ONE WOULD EXPECT DUE
TO THE SURFACE FLOW PICKING UP OUT OF THE SOUTHWEST. IT DOESN'T
APPEAR THAT CLOUDS WILL BE OF ANY HELP THROUGH MOST OF THE
OVERNIGHT PERIOD AS DEEPER MOISTURE DOESN'T BUILD INTO THE
NORTHWESTERN REACHES OF THE FORECAST AREA UNTIL CLOSER TO DAYBREAK.
WILL BANK ON THE INCREASING PRESSURE GRADIENT SLOWING THE FALL IN
TEMPS TO A CERTAIN DEGREE. WILL FRESHEN UP CURRENT TEMP AND DEW POINTS
IN THE GRIDS. SOME LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS STILL IN THE WORKS ACROSS THE
HIGHER TERRAIN AROUND MID DAY INTO THE AFTERNOON ON SATURDAY WITH
THE CLIPPER.

646 PM EST FRI JAN 24 2014

.AVIATION...VFR FLIGHT WILL BE THE NORM FOR THE TERMINALS FOR
POSSIBLY THE FIRST FOURTEEN HOURS OF THE FORECAST.
HOWEVER...ANOTHER CLIPPER WILL DIVE INTO THE REGION BRINGING LOWER

CONDITIONS SHOULD DROP INTO THE MVFR CATEGORY AT TRI AROUND 14Z AND
TYS MAY DESCEND INTO AN MVFR CEILING CATEGORY AROUND MID DAY INTO
THE AFTERNOON AS WELL. VSBY SHOULD DROP INTO AN MVFR RANGE AT TRI
FROM AROUND 14-19Z AS THE DEEPEST MOISTURE AND STRONGEST LIFT
ASSOCIATED WITH THE SHORT WAVE TROUGH BUILD ACROSS THE REGION.
FLIGHT WEATHER COULD IMPROVE AT TYS LATER IN THE DAY BUT CEILINGS
MAY HANG AROUND TRI THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD.

387 
FXUS64 KMRX 241957
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
257 PM EST FRI JAN 24 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...ANOTHER IN OUR SERIES OF 
SHORT WAVES/COLD FRONTS WILL AFFECT THE AREA ON SATURDAY. MOISTURE 
WILL BE LIMITED ONCE AGAIN AS HAS GENERALLY BEEN THE CASE WITH THESE 
SYSTEMS.  12Z NAM A BIT MORE BULLISH WITH THE ISENTROPIC LIFT AND 
MOISTURE...BUT LOOKS A BIT OVERDONE. WILL GENERALLY USE A COMPROMISE 
SOLUTION.  THINK PRECIP AMOUNTS WILL BE LIGHT GIVEN THE LOW LEVEL 
DRY AIR IN PLACE...WHICH WILL ALSO HELP TO DELAY ONSET OF PRECIP 
REACHING THE GROUND.  WILL KEEP TONIGHT DRY...THEN CHANCE POP SOUTH 
TO CAT POPS FAR NORTH FOR SATURDAY.  WILL CARRY POSSIBILITY OF SOME 
LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATION WITH THE INITIAL BAND IN THE MORNING INTO 
VERY EARLY AFTERNOON. SOME SNOW SHOWERS WILL LIKELY LINGER THROUGH 
THE REMAINDER OF THE AFTERNOON ESPECIALLY IN THE NORMALLY FAVORED 
HIGHER ELEVATION AREAS AS THE FLOW TURNS MORE NORTHWEST AND COLD 
ADVECTION BEGINS.  SOME ADDITIONAL LIGHT ACCUMULATION CAN BE 
EXPECTED MAINLY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS IN THE AFTERNOON WITH THESE 
SNOW SHOWERS. MAY END UP NEEDING A SNOW ADVISORY FOR SOME OF OUR 
AREA...ESPECIALLY THE MOUNTAINS OF SW VA AND THE CENTRAL AND 
NORTHERN MOUNTAINS OF E TN.  HOWEVER...CONFIDENCE NOT HIGH ENOUGH TO 
ISSUE AT THIS TIME SO WILL JUST KEEP MENTION IN THE HWO. 

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...A BROAD UPPER-
TROUGH OVER THE GREAT LAKES WILL CONTINUE TO BE THE PREDOMINANT
WEATHER FEATURE OVER THE EASTERN CONUS FOR MUCH OF THE UPCOMING
WEEK...PROMOTING BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES THROUGH MOST OF THE
PERIOD.

A BRIEF SURFACE RIDGE WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA AHEAD OF AN 
APPROACHING UPPER-TROUGH ON SUNDAY. THE SUBSEQUENT CLEARING 
CONDITIONS AND STOUT SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL HELP PUSH TEMPERATURES 
TO THEIR WARMEST LEVELS IN ABOUT A WEEK AS HIGHS WILL PEAK IN THE 
MID TO UPPER 40S IN MOST SPOTS. AS MENTIONED HOWEVER...THIS BOUT OF 
WARMER WEATHER WILL BE SHORT-LIVED AS ANOTHER UPPER-TROUGH WILL 
SWING THROUGH THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT...BRING SOME SCATTERED SNOW 
SHOWERS TO NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA /PARTICULARLY 
ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN ABOVE 2500 FEET WHICH COULD RECEIVE AN INCH 
OR TWO OF ACCUMULATION/. THE BIGGER STORY HOWEVER...WILL BE THE 
BITTER COLD AIR THAT WILL FOLLOW /WHICH COMBINED WITH THE BRISK 
NORTHWEST FLOW WILL CREATE SOME DANGEROUSLY LOW SUBZERO WIND CHILLS/ 
ONCE AGAIN MONDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHTS. LOWS DURING THIS TIME PERIOD 
WILL BOTTOM OUT IN THE SINGLE DIGITS IN MANY AREAS...WHILE HIGHS ON 
WILL STRUGGLE TO CLIMB MUCH ABOVE 20 DEGREES IN MANY PARTS. THOUGH A 
GRADUAL WARMING TREND WILL OCCUR BY MID TO LATE WEEK...THE CHILLY 
AND DRY CONDITIONS WILL LINGER THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD.  




&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EST FRI JAN 24 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAKENING SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
OVER THE MS AND TN RVR VALLEYS WILL SLIDE SE TO THE N GLFMEX COAST 
TONIGHT. UPPER FLOW BECOMES ZONAL THROUGH THE PERIOD. TEMPERATURES 
WILL MODIFY A TAD WITH GOOD MINUTES OF SUNSHINE. SLIGHTLY BETTER 
WARM AIR ADVECTION TONIGHT WITH LIGHT SOUTHWEST FLOW IN THE BOUNDARY 
LAYER. BEST RELATIVE WARM UP WILL BE ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE IN THE 
OVERALL WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE EXTENDED AS A BROAD UPPER TROUGH 
REMAINS OVER THE EASTERN U.S.  THIS WILL TRANSLATE TO CONTINUED 
BOUTS OF VERY COLD AIR AND OCCASIONAL BRIEF WINTER PRECIP AS A 
COUPLE OF WEAK COLD FRONTS MOVE THROUGH.  THE PERIOD BEGINS WITH A 
COLD FRONT MOVING IN ON SATURDAY FOR A CHANCE OF LIGHT SNOW...MAINLY 
NORTH AND ACROSS THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS.  A QUICK PUSH OF COLD AIR 
MOVING IN BEHIND IT.  HOWEVER...TEMPERATURES REBOUND FAIRLY QUICKLY 
ON SUNDAY AS WINDS SHIFT TO THE SOUTH AHEAD OF THE NEXT SYSTEM.  
ANOTHER COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH ON SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY FOR 
ANOTHER ROUND OF LIGHT SNOW AND ANOTHER BLAST OF VERY COLD AIR.  
THIS ROUND OF COLD WILL LINGER OVER THE AREA THROUGH AT LEAST 
WEDNESDAY WITH TEMPERATURES TRYING TO MODERATE A BIT IN THURSDAY.

722 
FXUS64 KMRX 231955
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EST THU JAN 23 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...ARCTIC AIR CONTINUES TO PUSH 
INTO THE AREA...BUT WINDS WILL WEAKEN OVERNIGHT AND COLD ADVECTION 
WILL END BY LATE TONIGHT.  CLOUDS AND ANY LINGERING MOUNTAIN SNOW 
SHOWERS WILL DECREASE OVERNIGHT...AND IT SHOULD BE MAINLY SUNNY FOR 
FRIDAY.  TEMPS TONIGHT WILL BE QUITE COLD...WITH SINGLE DIGITS 
FAIRLY COMMON IN THE VALLEY.  WILL NOT APPROACH RECORDS AS RECORD 
LOWS FOR THE 24TH ARE BELOW ZERO.  WINDS WILL BECOME LIGHTER 
OVERNIGHT.  WINDS MAY BE A BIT ON THE LIGHT SIDE FOR THE WIND SPEED 
PORTION OF THE WIND CHILL ADVISORY CRITERIA ESPECIALLY OVER THE 
PLATEAU LATE TONIGHT...BUT WIND CHILL VALUES WILL BE QUITE LOW SO 
WILL KEEP ADVISORY IN PLACE THROUGH THE NIGHT FOR THE PLATEAU...AND 
THROUGH 11 AM FOR THE MOUNTAINS OF E TN AND SW VA. WILL NOT STRAY 
FAR FROM MAV TEMPS...WHICH LOOK REASONABLE OVERALL.  

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)... A BROAD UPPER-
TROUGH OVER THE GREAT LAKES WILL CONTINUE TO BE THE PREDOMINANT
WEATHER FEATURE OVER THE EASTERN CONUS...PROMOTING BELOW NORMAL
TEMPERATURES AND A FEW OPPORTUNITIES FOR SOME WINTERY PRECIPITATION
ALONG THE MOUNTAINS AND IN NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA. THE FIRST IN A SERIES OF UPPER-LEVEL TROUGHS WILL PASS
THROUGH THE REGION LATE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY NIGHT...
BRINGING SOME SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS TO MUCH OF THE NORTHERN AND
CENTRAL VALLEYS AND THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF EAST TENNESSEE AND
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. VALLEY LOCATIONS ACROSS THESE AREAS MAY RECEIVE
A DUSTING UP TO ONE INCH OF SNOW...ESPECIALLY OVER FAR NORTHEAST
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. UP TO TWO INCHES OF SNOW IS
POSSIBLE ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

AFTER A BRIEF PUSH OF COLDER AIR FILTERS INTO THE AREA SATURDAY 
NIGHT...WINDS WILL QUICKLY BACK TO THE SOUTHWEST AHEAD OF THE NEXT 
WAVE. THIS WILL ALLOW HIGHS TO REACH THE MID 40S TO AROUND 50 
DEGREES OVER MUCH OF THE AREA ON SUNDAY...WITH MOSTLY/PARTLY SUNNY 
CONDITIONS PREVAILING. THE NEXT COLD FRONT WILL PASS ACROSS THE 
REGION SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY...BRINGING SOME ADDITIONAL SCATTERED 
SNOW SHOWERS TO NORTHEAST ZONES AND HIGHER TERRAIN...BUT MORE 
IMPORTANTLY A MORE SIGNIFICANT PUSH OF COLDER AIR TO BEGIN THE NEW 
WORK WEEK. HIGHS ON TUESDAY WILL STRUGGLE TO CLIMB OVER 20-25 
DEGREES IN MOST SPOTS AND LOWS MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY NIGHT WILL 
CRATER INTO THE SINGLE DIGITS IN MANY SPOTS ONCE AGAIN /WITH WIND 
CHILLS AROUND OR BELOW ZERO/. THOUGH A SLIGHT WARM UP WILL OCCUR BY 
LATE WEEK...THE CHILLY AND DRY CONDITIONS WILL LINGER THROUGH THE 
REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD.  



&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN   8  24  17  42  20 /   0   0  10  30  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                        7  25  16  41  20 /   0   0  10  30   0

573 
FXUS64 KMRX 230842
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EST THU JAN 23 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...NO REST FOR THE WEARY WITH YET 
ANOTHER ARCTIC COLD FRONT DUE IN THE REGION TODAY. MORE SUB-FREEZING 
HIGH TEMPERATURES...A GOOD 20 TO 25 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL...IN STORE 
TODAY WITH BONE CHILLING SINGLE DIGIT LOWS EXPECTED TONIGHT. ADDING 
MORE MISERY TO THE MIX WILL BE THE HEALTHY NORTHWEST BREEZE 
GENERATED BY THE TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT AS ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS INTO THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. THE COMBINATION OF WIND AND 
TEMPERATURE WILL BE RATHER UNCOMFORTABLE ACROSS THE ENTIRE REGION 
BUT WILL BE MOST CRITICAL ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN ON THE NORTHERN 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND MOST OF THE TERRAIN 
ALONG THE TENNESSEE-NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. IN THESE AREAS A WIND 
CHILL ADVISORY CONTINUES THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING. THERE WILL BE JUST 
ENOUGH MOISTURE WITH THE ARCTIC SURGE FOR THE PRODUCTION OF SNOW 
SHOWERS ACROSS MUCH OF THIS HIGHER TERRAIN AREA AS OROGRAPHIC LIFT 
STRENGTHENS IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW. WOULD EXPECT SOME ACCUMULATION 
WITH AMOUNTS FROM A DUSTING TO AROUND ONE INCH. SNOW FLURRIES WILL 
BE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE GREAT VALLEY OF NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND THE 
NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. SNOW SHOWERS WILL TAPER OFF ACROSS THE 
MOUNTAINS DURING THE EVENING.    

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO 
THE FORECAST ARE NEEDED THIS PERIOD. A SERIES OF SHORTWAVES MOVE 
THROUGH THE LARGER LONGWAVE TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN SEABOARD. EACH 
ONE WILL BRING A REINFORCING SHOT OF COLD AIR TO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. 

THE BEST CHANCES OF PRECIP APPEAR TO BE ON SATURDAY AS THE POLAR JET 
NOSES INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. THE BEST LIFT WILL BE SATURDAY MORNING 
ACROSS SW VA IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE JET EXIT REGION AND 500 MB VORT 
MAX. IT MOVES THROUGH FAIRLY QUICKLY...WITH MOST POPS ENDING IN THE 
EVENING. WILL LEAN TOWARD THE LOWER POPS OF THE GFS...AND STAY IN 
THE CHANCE RANGE. A QUICK INCH OR TWO OF SNOW ACCUMULATION COULD BE 
POSSIBLE IN SW VA. ANOTHER FAST-MOVING BUT BROAD SHORTWAVE TROUGH 
PASSES TO THE NORTH SUNDAY NIGHT/MONDAY MORNING...AND WILL HAVE JUST 
A SLIGHT CHANCE POP WITH THIS AS MOISTURE IS LACKING. THERE IS 
ANOTHER STRONG SURGE OF ARCTIC AIR FOLLOWING THIS SYSTEM...BRINGING 
LOWS TEMPS INTO THE SINGLE DIGITS MONDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHTS...AND 
HIGHS IN THE TEENS AND 20S TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.

&&

925 PM EST WED JAN 22 2014

.DISCUSSION...OVERALL FORECAST STILL ON TRACK. AN UPPER LEVEL WAVE
WILL BRING COLD AIR INTO THE AREA TONIGHT. MODELS SHOW A SLOWER
PROGRESSION OF THE MOISTURE MAKING IT INTO THE AREA...WITH THE
GREATEST CHANCE FOR SNOW IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS THROUGH THE

THE AREA EXPECTED TO CONTINUE...WITH CLOUDS INCREASE SOUTH OF
KNOXVILLE THROUGH THE NIGHT AND EARLY MORNING. WILL KEEP WIND CHILL
ADVISORY AS IS FOR NOW.

081 
FXUS64 KMRX 222031
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
331 PM EST WED JAN 22 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...THE NEXT IN OUR SERIES OF 
UPPER LEVEL WAVES WILL BE DIGGING IN DURING THE SHORT TERM...ALONG 
WITH ANOTHER SHOT OF VERY COLD AIR.  NOT A LOT OF MOISTURE AVAILABLE 
FOR THIS ONE...SO WILL JUST CARRY CHANCE POPS IN SOME OF OUR 
NORMALLY FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS...WITH SOME FLURRIES MENTIONED 
ELSEWHERE EXCEPT FAR SOUTH.  WINDS WILL COMBINE WITH COLD TEMPS TO 
PRODUCE LOW WIND CHILL VALUES.  WILL ISSUE A WIND CHILL ADVISORY FOR 
LATER TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY FOR NORTHERN PLATEAU...SW VA...AND 
MOST OF OUR TN MOUNTAIN ZONES. WILL ISSUE AN SPS HIGHLIGHTING THE
COLD FOR OTHER AREAS WHERE ADVISORY CRITERIA WILL NOT BE MET.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A DEEP COLD LONGWAVE 
TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN STATES CONTINUES THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD 
KEEPING TEMPERATURES MOSTLY WELL BELOW NORMAL. THURSDAY NIGHT BEHIND 
A REINFORCING SHOT OF COLD AIR FROM CANADA TEMPERATURES WILL DROP 
INTO THE SINGLE DIGITS LOWER ELEVATIONS TO SLIGHTLY BELOW ZERO 
HIGHER MOUNTAINS. WINDS WILL STAY UP OVER NIGHT AND INTO FRIDAY 
MORNING WITH WIND CHILL TEMPERATURES IN THE ADVISORY CATEGORY. THE 
HIGHEST ELEVATIONS OF SW VA AND NE TN INCLUDING THE SMOKIES MAY SEE 
SLIGHTLY LOWER WIND CHILLS SO MAY HAVE TO ISSUE A WARNING FOR THOSE 
AREAS IN LATER SHIFTS. FRIDAY WINDS RELAX AS COLD SURFACE HIGH MOVES 
OVERHEAD HOWEVER TEMPERATURES STAY BELOW FREEZING. FRIDAY NIGHT 
CLOUDS INCREASE AHEAD OF NEXT SHORTWAVE MOVING SOUTHEAST IN NW FLOW. 
TEMPERATURES WARM TO JUST ABOVE FREEZING MOST LOCATIONS. THIS SYSTEM 
BRINGS SOME MORE SNOW SHOWERS AND FLURRIES BUT AMOUNTS WILL BE 
MOSTLY TRACE TO A FEW TENTHS LOWER ELEVATIONS AND AND INCH OR TWO 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. A MORE SIGNIFICANT SURFACE LOW IN THE LONGWAVE 
PATTERN SUNDAY MOVING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN GREAT LAKES WILL CAUSE 
MORE SIGNIFICANT WARMING SUNDAY. THIS WARMING WILL BE SHORT LIVED 
AHEAD OF ANOTHER SHOT OF LIGHT PRECIPITATION SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
MONDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL REACH ABOVE FREEZING WITH MID 30S HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS AND LOWER TO MID 40S LOWER ELEVATIONS. BEHIND THIS SYSTEM 
MONDAY TEMPERATURES FALL BACK BELOW FREEZING WITH A SURGE OF 
BITTERLY COLD ARCTIC AIR. LOWS FALL BACK TO THE SINGLE DIGITS AND 
TEENS MONDAY NIGHT. HIGHS TUESDAY ONLY IN THE 20S. HIGHEST 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES AROUND 40 PERCENT AGAIN IN NORTHERN SECTIONS. 
AMOUNTS LOOK TO BE ABOUT THE SAME AS SATURDAYS SYSTEM. WEDNESDAY THE 
COLD HIGH PRESSURE AREA MOVES OVERHEAD SO HIGHS WILL BE WARMER BUT 
STILL BE UPPER 20S NORTH TO UPPER 30S SOUTH SOME 10 TO 15 DEGREES 
BELOW NORMAL.

FXUS64 KMRX 221605
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1105 AM EST WED JAN 22 2014

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND LIGHT WINDS HAVE SETTLED INTO THE
AREA...SO WIND CHILL ADVISORY FOR PARTS OF THE AREA WAS ALLOWED TO
EXPIRE. STILL COLD WITH TEMPERATURES AT THE MAJORITY OF LOCATIONS
EXPECTED TO STAY BELOW FREEZING FOR THE REST OF THE WEEK. SNOW
COVER CAN BE SEEN ON SATELLITE ON THE PLATEAU AND IN THE EASTERN
MOUNTAINS...AS WELL AS ON THE UPPER PARTS OF I-81. STRATOCU/ALTOCU
SPREADING THIS WAY FROM WEST/MIDDLE TN...THIS LAYER LOOKED TO BE
ERODING FOR A COUPLE OF HOURS...BUT OVER THE LAST HOUR THE CLOUD
TOPS HAVE BEEN COOLING...SUGGESTING A THICKENING ON THE SERN EDGE.
HAVE BUMPED UP THE CLOUD COVER A BIT...MORE NORTH...AND TOOK A
DEGREE OR TWO OFF THE MAX TEMP OVER THE NORTHERN 1/3 OF THE AREA.
WILL MONITOR TO SEE IF MORE ADJUSTMENTS ARE NEEDED.

822 
FXUS64 KMRX 220850
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EST WED JAN 22 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A SURFACE RIDGE WILL BUILD INTO 
THE REGION BEHIND THE DEPARTING CLIPPER SYSTEM TODAY. THE OROGRAPHIC 
SNOW SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE TO DIMINISH THIS MORNING AS DRIER AIR 
BUILDS SOUTHEAST. WIND CHILL VALUES WILL REMAIN IN THE ADVISORY 
RANGE IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN THROUGH MID MORNING SO KEPT THIS PRODUCT 
GOING. SUNSHINE WILL BREAK OUT TODAY BUT TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN 
WELL BELOW NORMAL WITH HIGHS MAINLY IN THE 20S. ANOTHER COLD NIGHT 
IS IN STORE WITH LOWS IN THE TEENS. ANOTHER WEAK CLIPPER WILL BUILD 
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES INTO THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. TONIGHT 
WITH LITTLE IMPACT ON THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS OTHER THAN AN 
INCREASE IN CLOUDS.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...LONGWAVE TROUGH OVER THE 
EASTERN CONUS WILL PERSIST THROUGH THE PERIOD...PROVING TEMPERATURES 
WELL BELOW NORMAL. A FEW EMBEDDED SHORTWAVES MOVE AROUND THE LARGER 
TROUGH...ONE ON THURSDAY...ANOTHER ON SATURDAY...AND YET ANOTHER ON 
SUNDAY NIGHT/MONDAY. 

THE FIRST SHORTWAVE ON THURSDAY IS PRECEDED BY A NW FLOW ALOFT...SO 
THERE WILL BE VERY LITTLE MOISTURE FOR ANY PRECIP...AND SHOULD BE 
DRY. IT WILL BRING A SURGE OF COLDER AIR...WITH LOWS THURSDAY NIGHT 
IN THE SINGLE DIGITS AGAIN. SOME SLIGHT MODERATION IN TEMPS WILL 
OCCUR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY AHEAD OF THE NEXT SHORTWAVE. THIS SYSTEM 
MAY HAVE A BIT MORE MOISTURE TO WORK WITH...AND LIFT LOOKS A LITTLE 
STRONGER WITH BETTER JET PLACEMENT. WILL HAVE SOME CHANCE POPS NORTH 
SATURDAY. THE THIRD SYSTEM LOOKS LIKE THE MOST AMPLIFIED OF THE 
THREE...AND WILL BRING ANOTHER STRONG SURGE OF BITTERLY COLD ARCTIC 
AIR...WITH LOWS IN THE SINGLE DIGITS AND TEENS MONDAY NIGHT...AND 
HIGHS TUESDAY IN THE 20S. AGAIN...MOISTURE LOOKS LIMITED...SO WILL 
JUST HAVE SOME LOW POPS SUNDAY NIGHT/MONDAY IN NORTHERN AREAS. NONE 
OF THESE SYSTEMS LOOKS LIKE IT WILL BRING ANY SIGNIFICANT SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS TO THE AREA.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

668 
FXUS64 KMRX 212347 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
647 PM EST TUE JAN 21 2014

.DISCUSSION...UPDATED TO DROP WARNING FOR THE WASHINGTON AND
RUSSELL COUNTIES OF VIRGINIA TO AN ADVISORY. ALSO...DECIDED TO
INCLUDED THE PLATEAU IN THE ADVISORY. DOWNSLOPE WINDS INTO THE
VALLEYS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA HAS LIMITED SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WITH
REPORTS OF AROUND INCH. ALSO...RADAR...SURFACE OBSERVATIONS AND
LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT HAVE INDICATED THAT SNOW IS LIGHT. HAVE
REDUCED SNOW ACCUMULATIONS TO 1 INCH TO POSSIBLY UP TO 3 INCHES
OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

FOR THE FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND WISE COUNTY VIRGINIA...
NORTHWEST UPSLOPE CONTINUES WITH JOHNSON COUNTY DISPATCH REPORTING
3 INCHES OF SNOWFALL IN THE LIGHT/MODERATE SNOW. THE UPSLOPE WILL
CONTINUE MOST OF THE NIGHT...BUT WILL WEAKEN AS BOUNDARY LAYER
MOISTURE BECOME SHALLOW.

FOR THE PLATEAU...RADAR SHOWS AN AREA OF LIGHT SNOW EXTENDING BACK
INTO MIDDLE TENNESSEE. REPORTS FOR AREA LAW ENFORECEMENT INDICATED
THAT UP TO 1 INCH OF SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WITH TRAVEL PROBLEMS. HAVE
ISSUED A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR THE PLATEAU UNTIL 11 PM. THE
MAIN FORCING IS UPSLOPE...BUT BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE IS BECOMING
QUITE SHALLOW.

UPDATE TO ZFP AND WSW HAVE BEEN ISSUED.

FXUS64 KMRX 212011
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 PM EST TUE JAN 21 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...BANDS OF SNOW WILL CONTINUE TO 
MOVE ACROSS THE VALLEY INTO THE EVENING BEFORE SLOWLY TAPERING OFF 
TO PATCHY FLURRIES THEN END ACROSS THE VALLEY OVERNIGHT.  FOR THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN...WILL BE TRANSITIONING INTO THE UPSLOPE SNOW PORTION 
OF THE EVENT THIS EVENING.  THIS WILL KEEP ACCUMULATION SNOWFALL 
ACROSS NORMALLY FAVORED AREAS OF THE HIGH ELEVATIONS.  THE 
SMOKIES...THE NORTHEAST TN MOUNTAINS AND THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS OF 
SOUTHWEST VA SHOULD PICK UP A FEW MORE INCHES OVERNIGHT.  THE WINTER 
WEATHER ADVISORY FOR LOWER TERRAIN OF NE TN AND SW VA AND THE WINTER 
STORM WARNING FOR THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF VA 
WILL CONTINUE OVERNIGHT.  ALSO OF CONCERN TONIGHT WILL BE THE 
CONTINUE BRISK AND GUSTY WINDS COMBINED WITH VERY COLD TEMPERATURES 
TONIGHT TO CREATE DANGEROUSLY COLD WIND CHILLS ESPECIALLY OVER 
HIGHER TERRAIN.  WIND CHILL READINGS OF ZERO TO MINUS 15 ARE 
EXPECTED IN THOSE LOCATIONS AND A WIND CHILL ADVISORY HAS BRRN 
ISSUED FOR THE OVERNIGHT HOURS.  THE MOUNTAIN SNOW SHOULD END BY 
MORNING AS COLD HIGH PRESSURE SETTLES INTO THE REGION.  THIS WILL 
PROVIDE A DRY BUT COLD DAY ON WEDNESDAY WITH WINDS DECREASE TO 5 TO 
10 MPH.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...PERSISTENT LONGWAVE 
TROUGH ACROSS THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE COUNTRY THROUGH THESE 
PERIODS. THIS WILL EQUATE TO PROLONGED COLD TEMPS BUT VERY LIMITED 
WINTRY PRECIPITATION (PCPN) PROSPECTS...WITH APPEARING TO BE 3 
CHANCES OF WHAT MAY JUST BE ISOLATED SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES AT 
BEST. 

KEPT CONTINUITY WITH THE FIRST FAST SHORTWAVE CLIPPING NRN AREAS ON 
THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT. THE SECOND CHANCE FOR ANY WINTRY PCPN 
COMES IN THE NW FLOW ALOFT ON SATURDAY. THE GFS AND CANADIAN MODELS 
SHOW A SWATH OF MUCH LIGHTER QPF CLIPPING ALL BUT SE TN ON SATURDAY
WHILE THE ECMWF HAS SLIGHTLY HEAVIER QPF...AND EXTENDS THE PCPN 
THROUGH THE ENTIRE SRN APPALACHIANS. TRENDED MORE IN LINE WITH GFS 
AND CANADIAN MODELS FOR NOW. TIMING A 3RD EVENT FOR MONDAY WHICH 
LOOKS TO BE JUST FLURRIES. OTHERWISE...KEEPING FRIDAY/SUNDAY/TUESDAY 
THE DRY PERIODS. 

ANOTHER DAY OF GENERALLY TWEAKING MAX AND MIN TEMPS DOWNWARD IN THE 
EXTENDED AS THE TRAIN OF COLD AIR CONTINUES TO CLIP THE REGION. WIND 
CHILL VALUES WILL DIP AS LOW -5 T0 -15 DEGREES THURSDAY NIGHT THRU 
FRIDAY MORNING OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SW VA AND THE MTNS OF E 
TN. WILL HIGHLIGHT THIS IS THE UPDATED HAZARDOUS WEATHER PRODUCT.

.DISCUSSION...INCOMING COLD FRONT CONTINUES TO TREND A BIT SLOWER...
BUT EVERYTHING STILL ON TRACK FOR A BAND OF SNOW MOVING IN DURING 
THE LATE MORNING/EARLY AFTERNOON TIME FRAME.  RADAR INDICATING SNOW 
ALONG THE PLATEAU AND ALONG THE KY/VA BORDER AND WILL BE MOVING INTO 
THE MRX CWA OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS.  CURRENT FORECAST OF SNOW 
AMOUNTS STILL LOOK REASONABLE WITH AROUND AN INCH EXPECTED ACROSS 
THE CENTRAL VALLEY AND PLATEAU...1 TO 3 ACROSS THE ADVISORY 
LOCATIONS AND 3 TO 6 OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WHERE THE WARNING IS 
IN PLACE.  ADDITIONALLY...WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE TODAY AS 
THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH...PROVIDING BRISK..GUSTY CONDITIONS.  THESE 
WINDS WILL USHER IN ANOTHER BLAST OF COLD AIR AND EXPECT 
TEMPERATURES TO REMAIN STEADY AND EVEN FALL DURING THE AFTERNOON.  
THE WINDS AND COLD WILL COMBINE TO CREATE WIND CHILLS INTO THE TEENS 
FOR THE LATE AFTERNOON.  CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD AND WILL UPDATE 
TO REMOVE MORNING WORDING.

ABOVE MVFR. WOULD EXPECT TYS AND TRI TO SEE CEILINGS DROP INTO MVFR

END MVFR VSBY REDUCTION IN LIGHT SNOW WILL BE AT TRI BUT TYS MAY
ALSO BRIEFLY DIP INTO AN MVFR CATEGORY IN LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS AS THE
COLDER AIR BEGINS BUILDING IN ALOFT INCREASING INSTABILITY. SKIES
MAY CLEAR OUT AT CHA AND TYS DURING THE EVENING BUT TRI SHOULD HOLD
ONTO A LOW MVFR CEILING THROUGH MOST OF THE NIGHT BEHIND DEPARTING
SYSTEM.

089 
FXUS64 KMRX 210902
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST TUE JAN 21 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...THE GFS AND NAM HAVE 
SOME SIGNIFICANT QPF DIFFERENCES EARLY THIS MORNING WITH PRECIP TO 
OUR NORTH. THE GFS APPEARS TO BE CRANKING OUT WAY TOO MUCH SNOWFALL 
ACROSS SERN KY AND SW VA EARLY THIS MORNING THAT IS UNSUPPORTED BY 
OBS...AS MOST OBS SHOW SNOW REACHING THE GROUND FARTHER NORTH. GFS 
SOUNDINGS ALSO APPEAR TO HAVE TOO MUCH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE COMPARED 
TO 00Z OBSERVED SOUNDINGS. THE NAM APPEARS TO HAVE A BETTER HANDLE 
ON THINGS...AND IS THE PREFERRED MODEL FOR THE SHORT TERM. THE 
CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS PRETTY WELL IN LINE WITH THE NAM...SO NO 
SIGNIFICANT CHANGES WILL BE MADE.

PRECIP WILL BE INTENSIFYING OVER NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA LATER 
THIS MORNING AS THE 500 MB VORT MAX MOVES INTO KY. CURRENT TEMPS ARE 
QUITE WARM IN MANY LOCATIONS...IN THE 40S...SO SOME SPOTS WILL START 
AS RAIN. THE PEAK OF PRECIP LOOKS TO COME AROUND 18Z WHEN THE 700-50 
MB TROUGH AXIS SWINGS THROUGH...PROVIDING SOME INSTABILITY IN 
ADDITION TO THE QG FORCING. COLD ADVECTION WILL KICK IN STRONGLY 
AROUND THIS TIME AS THE 850 MB LOW TAKES SHAPE OVER VA...SO ALL 
PRECIP SHOULD BE CHANGED TO SNOW BY THEN. THE EVENT TRANSITIONS INTO 
A NW FLOW PATTERN AFTER 18Z...AFTER WHICH TIME MOST ACCUMULATIONS 
WILL BE IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THIS CONTINUES INTO THE 
EVENING...GRADUALLY TAPERING OFF THROUGH THE NIGHT WITH 
STABILIZATION AND DIMINISHING MOISTURE. 

3 TO 6 INCHES OF SNOW STILL LOOK LIKE THE MOST LIKELY SCENARIO FOR 
THE WINTER STORMS WARNING AREA...WITH 1 TO 3 IN THE ADVISORY AREA. 
WIND CHILL VALUES WILL ALSO BE VERY LOW IN THE MOUNTAINS AND SW VA 
TONIGHT. WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION THIS IN THE WSW FOR NOW...THOUGH 
LATER FORECASTS WILL LIKELY NEED A WIND CHILL ADVISORY. 

VERY COLD TEMPS CONTINUE WEDNESDAY...WITH HIGHS ONLY IN THE 20S TO 
LOWER 30S SOUTH DESPITE MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES. LOWS WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
WILL BE MAINLY IN THE TEENS. LEANED ON THE COLD SIDE OF MOS GUIDANCE 
FOR TEMPS IN AREAS WHERE SNOW COVER IS EXPECTED TO LINGER.


.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...UNFORTUNATELY IT DOESN'T 
APPEAR THAT THERE WILL BE ANY MAJOR WARMING THROUGH THE PERIOD AS
THE BLOCKING PATTERN SHOULD CONTINUE. THE AIRMASS SOURCE REGION
WILL REMAIN OUT OF THE ARCTIC AND A CONVOY OF CLIPPER SYSTEMS WILL 
CONTINUE TO HAUL THE CHILLY AIR INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION. MODELS KEY ON ABOUT THREE SYSTEMS WITH THE FIRST MOVING 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY EVENING. THE SECOND 
BUILDS ACROSS THE REGION SATURDAY INTO SATURDAY NIGHT WHILE THE 
THIRD APPEARS TO AFFECT THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. THERE 
IS SOME LEVEL OF UNCERTAINTY AS TO THE EXACT TIMING AND TRACK OF 
EACH SYSTEM AND HOW MUCH MOISTURE WILL BE AVAILABLE. AT THIS TIME 
THE MODELS INDICATE THAT MAINLY THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST 
AREA WILL BE IMPACTED...WITH EMPHASIS OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN 
FEATURES. WITH THIS IN MIND PLAYED DOWN POPS ACROSS THE VALLEY IN 
CENTRAL EAST TENNESSEE WITH NO MENTION ACROSS THE VALLEY IN 
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE. 
TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE A GOOD TEN TO TWENTY DEGREES BELOW NORMAL 
BOTH THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AS THE NORTHERLY FLOW CONTINUES UNABATED. 
TEMPERATURES WILL MODIFY TO SOME DEGREE SATURDAY AND SUNDAY BUT WILL 
BE TRENDING SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW NORMAL AGAIN BY MONDAY AS CHILLY 
AIR FILLS IN BEHIND THE LATE WEEKEND CLIPPER SYSTEM. IN THIS COLD 
REGIME...ALMOST ALL OF THE PRECIPITATION THAT FALLS DURING THE LONG 
TERM WILL BE IN THE FORM OF SNOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
948 PM EST MON JAN 20 2014

.DISCUSSION...
VERY MINOR TWEAKS MADE TO THE FORECAST AS EVERYTHING APPEARS TO BE
ON TRACK FOR THE OVERNIGHT PERIOD. MADE A SLIGHT ADJUST TO THE SKY
GRIDS TO ACCOUNT FOR THE CLEAR TO MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS EXPECTED
OVER MUCH OF THE REGION BEFORE 06Z. ALSO REMOVED POPS BEFORE
06Z...AND A BULK OF THE CLOUD COVER/LIGHT PRECIPITATION ASSOCIATED
WITH THE FRONT WILL NOT MOVE IN UNTIL LATE TONIGHT. ANY OF THE
LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS THAT MOVE IN SHOULD BE FAIRLY LIGHT BEFORE
SUNRISE...WITH MOST ACCUMULATIONS BEING CONFINED TO THE HIGHER
TERRAIN OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. A LIGHT
DUSTING MAY BE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE NORTHERN VALLEY DURING RUSH
HOUR...BUT AS MENTIONED THE ADVISORY/WARNING LEVEL ACCUMULATIONS
WILL FALL WELL AFTER DAYBREAK. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

LIGHT SW WINDS WILL BECOME VARIABLE AS LOW PRESSURE MOVES ACROSS

TIME HOURS ON TUESDAY. FREEZING LEVEL WILL LOWER TO AROUND 4000 FEET

FRONT.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
214 PM EST MON JAN 20 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...STRONG WINTER STORM 
SYSTEM MOVING IN FOR THE SHORT TERM.  MODELS A BIT SLOWER WITH THE 
APPROACH OF A STRONG COLD FRONT LATE TONIGHT/TUESDAY MORNING.  THIS 
SHOULD KEEP THE BULK FOR THE PRECIP FROM MOVING IN UNTIL VERY LATE 
TONIGHT OR EARLY TUESDAY.  CLOUDS WILL INCREASE OVERNIGHT WITH LOWER 
CLOUDS PUSHING IN LATE.  A FEW SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS MAY WORK INTO 
FAR NORTHERN LOCATIONS TOWARDS SUNRISE.  MAIN BAND OF SNOW WILL PUSH 
IN ON TUESDAY.  ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL IS EXPECTED...ESPECIALLY OVER 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN.  THE FRONT WILL SWING THROUGH RATHER 
QUICKLY...IMMEDIATELY FOLLOWED BY NORTHWEST FLOW AND NORMAL 
ADDITIONAL SNOW ACCUMULATIONS MAINLY OVER HIGHER TERRAIN TUESDAY 
NIGHT.  TOTAL SNOWFALL OVER HIGHER TERRAIN SHOULD BE 3 TO 5 INCHES 
WITH SOME HIGHER AMOUNTS OVER THE HIGHEST PEAKS...1 TO 2 INCHES 
POSSIBLE OVER THE LOWER ELEVATIONS OF NORTHEAST TN AND SW VA.  THE 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN TN VALLEY SHOULD SEE LESS THAN AN INCH.  A 
WINTER STORM WARNING IS IN EFFECT LATE TONIGHT INTO TUESDAY NIGHT 
FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  A SNOW ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT FOR THE 
SAME PERIOD FOR THE LOWER ELEVATIONS OF THE NORTHEAST CWA.  
ADDITIONALLY...MUCH COLDER AIR WILL ONCE AGAIN SLIDE INTO THE AREA.  
TEMPERATURES WILL FALL THROUGHOUT THE DAY TUESDAY AND DROP INTO THE 
TEENS AND SINGLE DIGITS TUESDAY NIGHT.  ALSO...BREEZY TO BRISK WINDS 
WILL ACCOMPANY THE FRONT.  THE WINDS COMBINED WITH THE COLD 
TEMPERATURES WILL CREATE WINDS CHILLS IN NEAR ZERO OR LOWER TUESDAY 
NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...MAIN ADJUSTMENTS MADE FOR 
THESE PERIODS WAS UNFORTUNATELY TO GENERALLY LOWER MAX AND MIN TEMPS 
AS A LONGWAVE TROUGH HOLDS OR RE-DEVELOPS OVER THE ERN 1/3 TO 1/2 OF 
THE NATION THROUGH THESE PERIODS. THESE LOWER TEMPS FROM THE 12Z 
GFSX MOS WERE CLOSER TO ADJACENT NWS GRIDS...AND REASONABLE GIVEN 
PERIODS OF COLD AIR ADVECTION. A WEAK LOW LEVEL SOUTHERLY FLOW NEVER 
GETS ESTABLISHED BEFORE CLOUDS ARRIVE WITH THE NEXT WEAK SHORTWAVE 
IN THE NW FLOW ALOFT. 

WITH THIS SAID...MOISTURE STILL LOOKS VERY LACKING WITH THE NEXT 
WEAK AND FAST MOVING SHORTWAVE LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. 
FEEL THIS IS A TRACE EVENT/FLURRIES AT BEST...SO OPTED TO JUST CARRY 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SW VA AND NE TN ON THURSDAY. ARCTIC HIGH 
SETTLES ACROSS THE REGION FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...THEN A STRONGER 
AND DEEPER SHORTWAVE TROUGH APPROACHES ON SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY.
MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT...EVEN THE CANADIAN MODEL FROM LATEST RUN
FOR THIS SYSTEM. PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS LOOKED GOOD FOR NOW WITH 
SLIGHT CHANCE SATURDAY NIGHT...AND 40 PERCENT CHANCE SW VA/NE TN TO
20 PERCENT CHANCE SE TN ON SUNDAY. INTRODUCING MONDAY AS DRY BUT 
CONTINUED ON THE CHILLY SIDE.
