139 
FXUS64 KMRX 200831
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
331 AM EST MON JAN 20 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
A DRY WESTERLY FLOW ALOFT WILL PROVIDE A SUNNY AND RELATIVELY MILD 
DAY TODAY...WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 40S NORTH TO UPPER 50S SOUTH. 
LEANED ON THE HIGH SIDE OF MOS GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS...AS MOS HAS BEEN 
TOO COOL WITH HIGH TEMPS THE PAST FEW DAYS. 

TONIGHT THE FLOW BEGINS TO AMPLIFY AS A POTENT MIDLEVEL VORT MAX 
MOVES FROM THE NORTHERN PLAINS INTO THE MID MS VALLEY REGION...WHICH 
INDUCES CYCLOGENESIS ON THE NC SIDE THE APPALACHIANS TUESDAY 
MORNING. THE NAM DEVELOPS THIS LOW FARTHER SOUTH THAN THE 
GFS/CMC/SREF SOLUTIONS...AND THUS HAS GREATER QPF ALONG THE SPINE OF 
THE APPALACHIANS. PREFER THE GFS/CMC/SREF DEPICTION TO START THE 
EVENT...WHICH LOOKS TO BE LATE TONIGHT. SYNOPTIC QG FORCING AHEAD OF 
THE VORT MAX LOOKS GREATEST BETWEEN 12Z AND 18Z. STILL...JET 
DYNAMICS AND FRONTOGENESIS ARE LACKING WITH THIS SYSTEM OVER OUR 
AREA...SO QPF AMOUNTS ARE NOT IMPRESSIVE. THIS WILL KEEP SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS LIGHT.

AFTER 18Z...THE SYNOPTIC FORCING EXITS...AND WE WILL SEE A NW FLOW 
PATTERN DEVELOP AS THE SURFACE-850 MB LOW STRENGTHENS TO OUR EAST. 
850-700 MB COLD ADVECTION WILL CAUSE FALLING TEMPS THROUGH THE 
AFTERNOON ON TUESDAY. A 25-30 KT NORTHERLY FETCH IN THE 925-850 MB 
LAYER WILL HAVE A CONNECTION TO THE GREAT LAKES...PROVIDING 
INSTABILITY AND STEEP LAPSE RATES FOR SNOW SHOWERS AND ENHANCED SNOW 
AMOUNTS IN HIGHER TERRAIN. VERY COLD AIR ALOFT MOVING IN WILL LEAD 
TO HIGH SNOW-TO-LIQUID RATIOS IN THE MOUNTAINS. 

IT APPEARS THAT THERE IS THE POTENTIAL TO REACH 4+ INCHES IN THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN OF SW VA AND E TN...SO A WINTER STORM WATCH WILL BE 
ISSUED FOR THESE AREAS BEGINNING AT 09Z TONIGHT. LOWER ELEVATIONS OF 
SW VA AND NE TN APPEAR MORE LIKELY TO BE IN THE 1-3 INCH 
RANGE...WITH AN INCH OR LESS IN THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND CENTRAL 
VALLEY AREAS. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
THE ALBERTA-CLIPPER TYPE SYSTEM AND DEEPENING CYCLOGENESIS OFF THE 
COASTS WILL BE MOVING WELL NORTHEAST OF THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT. 
NORTHWEST FLOW WILL BE WEAKENING TUESDAY EVENING...BUT WILL CONTINUE 
WITH HIGH POPS FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS THROUGH EARLY WEDNESDAY 
MORNING WITH ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATONS OF 1 TO POSSIBLY 2 INCHES. THE 
WATCH WILL CONTINUE INTO TUESDAY NIGHT TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS 
ADDITIONAL SNOWFALL.

MAIN CONCERN/STORY FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY WILL BE ARCTIC-LIKE 
COLD TEMPERATURES. ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE MOVES ACROSS THE GREAT LAKE 
STATES WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH ANOTHER ARCTIC FRONT 
MOVING THROUGH EARLY THURSDAY MORNING. MOISTURE IS VERY LIMITED WITH 
MAIN EFFECTS BEING RE-ENFORCEMENT OF VERY COLD AIR. THE ARCTIC HIGH 
WILL BUILD INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY.

FOR SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT...ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE MOVES THROUGH 
THE NORTHERN GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY WITH A COLD FRONT MOVING 
THROUGH SUNDAY. WILL CONTINUE WITH CHANCE POPS FOR NOW.

&&

849 
FXUS64 KMRX 191949
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EST SUN JAN 19 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT OVER THE CAROLINAS...WITH A DRY AIR MASS 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS INDICATE THAT A SOUTHWESTERLY WIND 
FLOW WILL DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY...AHEAD OF AN 
APPROACHING COLD FRONT FROM THE UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY. AS A 
RESULT...A BRIEF WARMING TREND WILL DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
ON MONDAY WITH HIGHS RISING INTO THE 50S. HOWEVER...ANOTHER SHORT 
WAVE TROUGH IS PROGGED TO DIVE SOUTHEASTWARD THROUGH THE LONG WAVE 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH THAT HAS PERSISTED OVER THE EASTERN PART OF THE 
NATION. THIS SHORT WAVE TROUGH WILL PUSH ANOTHER CLIPPER SYSTEM AND 
ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE LATE 
MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY MORNING TIME PERIOD. NORTHWESTERLY WINDS 
BEHIND THE TROUGH AXIS WILL PRODUCE UPSLOPE FLOW OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA ON TUESDAY...WITH SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS DEVELOPING ESPECIALLY 
OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. MODEL SOUNDINGS 
INDICATE THAT THE LOWER LEVELS WILL BE FAIRLY DRY AFTER THE FRONTAL 
PASSAGE EARLY TUESDAY MORNING...SO IT APPEARS THAT MOST SNOWFALL 
ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE CONFINED TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THIS NEXT 
COLD FRONT ON TUESDAY WILL BRING IN MUCH COLDER AIR...WITH TEMPS 
EXPECTED TO FALL BETWEEN 15 AND 20 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT 
THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME DIFFERENCES 
ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...AS WITH YESTERDAYS 
DISCUSSION...NOT MUCH CHANGE IN OVERALL PATTERN. LONG WAVE TROUGH 
WILL REMAIN OVER OVER THE EASTERN UNITED STATES THROUGH THE LONG 
TERM PROVIDING US WITH A GENERALLY NORTHWEST FLOW. DURING THIS 
FORECAST PERIOD...WE SHOULDN'T HAVE ANY CLIPPER SYSTEMS AFFECTING 
OUR AREA IN TERMS OF SNOWFALL ACCUMULATION...AS THE TWO CLIPPER 
SYSTEMS THAT MOVE THROUGH SHOULD STAY MAINLY TO OUR NORTH. THEY WILL 
HOWEVER BRING MORE ROUNDS OF REINFORCING COLDER AIR. 

EXPECT WEDNESDAY TO BE CHILLY WITH HIGHS IN THE 20S AND 30S WITH 
MORE CLOUDS NORTH THAN SOUTH. ANOTHER WEAK WAVE WILL MOVE THROUGH 
LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY. AS MENTIONED...THE WAVE WILL 
STAY MAINLY TO OUR NORTH AND SHOULD ONLY BRING POSSIBLE FLURRIES TO 
THE SMOKY MTNS...NE TN AND SW VA...ALONG WITH INCREASED CLOUD COVER. 
TEMPS WARM UP SLIGHTLY ON FRIDAY AFTERNOON WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES. 
HIGHS AROUND 40 FOR THE SOUTHERN VALLEY...UPPER 30S CENTRAL 
VALLEY...MID 30S NE TN...AND NEAR 30 TO MID 30S FOR SW VA. WARMER 
LOWS ALSO FOR FRIDAY NIGHT WITH LOW IN THE TEENS TO LOW 20S AREA 
WIDE.  

THE END OF THE LONG TERM STILL HAS A LOT OF DISAGREEMENT BETWEEN THE 
GFS AND ECMWF. GFS STILL SHOWING MOISTURE COMING OUT OF GULF BUT 
LONGWAVE TROUGH KEEPING IT SUPPRESSED TO GULF COAST WHICH WOULD KEEP 
US DRY. THE ECMWF SHOWS THE SAME LONGWAVE TROUGH BUT ALLOWS THE 
MOISTURE TO SPREAD MUCH FURTHER NORTH...UP INTO MID MISSISSIPPI/ 
ALABAMA/AND GEORGIA...AND TRIES TO PHASE IT WITH THE LONGWAVE TROUGH 
WHICH WOULD GIVE US A SHOT AT PRECIP. WILL HAVE TO WAIT AND SEE HOW 
FUTURE MODEL RUNS HANDLE THIS BEFORE TRYING TO NAIL DOWN A FORECAST. 
ALSO...MODELS ARE HINTING AT BREAK IN THE LONGWAVE PATTERN A FEW 
DAYS PAST THE END OF THE LONG TERM. THIS WOULD RESULT IN A RETURN TO 
MORE OF A ZONAL FLOW.

HAVING SAID ALL THAT...MAIN WEATHER STORY WILL BE ARCTIC AIR 
SPILLING INTO THE REGION FOR TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING. WIND 
CHILLS MAY DROP TO NEAR ZERO FOR THE VALLEYS AND 5 TO 15 DEGREES 
BELOW ZERO FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AT TIMES THROUGH THE PERIOD.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   28  56  31  40  16 /   0   0  10  20   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     28  54  30  38  13 /   0   0  30  50  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             28  54  30  38  13 /   0   0  30  40   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    24  50  29  34   9 /   0   0  40  50  10 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

VA...NONE.

FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH A DRY AIR MASS OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF 
CLOUDS LINGERING OVER THE TN AND OHIO RIVER VALLEYS THIS MORNING... 
WITH AREA RADARS SHOWING SOME LIGHT SNOW FLURRIES OVER SOUTHWEST VA 
AND NORTHEAST TN. AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE CAROLINAS IS 
PROGGED TO MOVE EASTWARD OUT OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC OCEAN THIS 
AFTERNOON...WHICH SHOULD RESULT IN A DECREASING CLOUDINESS TREND 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA.

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST LATER THIS MORNING TO 
REMOVE ANY MORNING WORDING...AND TO MENTION DECREASING CLOUDINESS 
EVERYWHERE.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

232 
FXUS64 KMRX 190821
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
321 AM EST SUN JAN 19 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
SHOWERS ON RADAR DO NOT APPEAR TO BE REACHING THE GROUND...AS NO 
SURFACE OBS HAVE REPORTED ANY PRECIP FOR THE PAST SEVERAL 
HOURS...AND THE 00Z OHX SOUNDING IS VERY DRY BELOW 700 MB. WEAK LIFT 
ALOFT WILL NOT LIKELY BE ENOUGH TO OVERCOME THIS DRY AIR...AND SO 
ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL LOOKS UNLIKELY. AT MOST...A DUSTING MAY BE 
POSSIBLE IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL BE 
CANCELLED. 

SATELLITE TRENDS SHOW MIDLEVEL CLOUDS WILL BE CLEARING THE AREA BY 
MID MORNING...BUT SOME LOWER CLOUDS CURRENTLY OVER W KY AND S IL 
WILL KEEP CLOUDS IN NORTHERN AREAS INTO THE EARLY AFTERNOON. TEMPS 
IN NORTHERN AREAS WILL REMAIN IN THE 30S AS A RESULT...WITH CENTRAL 
AND SOUTHERN VALLEY AREAS IN THE LOWER TO MID 40S. BEHIND THE 
EXITING UPPER TROUGH TONIGHT...WE WILL SEE A NEARLY ZONAL FLOW 
PROVIDING DRY AIR AND CLEAR SKIES...BUT PERHAPS BREEZY IN THE 
MOUNTAINS AS A SURFACE LOW TRACKS ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES. LOWS WILL 
BE MAINLY IN THE 20S.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...
THE EXTENDED PERIOD WILL REMAIN UNDER NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT DUE TO A 
LONG-WAVE TROUGH OVER SOUTHEAST CANADA. A SERIES OF ALBERTA-LIKE 
CLIPPERS WILL DIVE SOUTHEAST INTO THE TROUGH...BUT MOISTURE IS 
LIMITED. A WAVE DOES MOVE ACROSS THE AREA LATE MONDAY NIGHT AND 
TUESDAY...THEN ANOTHER FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY.

THE MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY SYSTEM IS THE STRONGEST WITH THE BEST 
MOISTURE. LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ARE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE FAVORED 
NORTHWEST FLOW OROGRAPHIC LIFT. LATEST NAM MODELS DOES SHOW SOME 
LOW-LEVEL INSTABILITY WITH CAPES OF 50-80 J/KG FOR TUESDAY...SO WILL 
LIKELY SEE SOME SNOW SHOWERS ACTIVITY EVEN INTO THE NORTHERN AND 
CENTRAL VALLEYS AND NORTHERN PLATEAU. OVERALL...BESIDES THE 
MOUNTAINS ONLY A DUSTING ANTICIPATED.

THE WEDNESDAY NIGHT/THURSDAY SYSTEM IS FARTHER NORTH AND WEAKER FOR 
OUR AREA. HAVE ONLY INCLUDED FLURRIES.

MAIN WEATHER STORY WILL BE ARCTIC AIR SPILLING INTO THE REGION FOR 
TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING. WIND CHILLS MAY DROP TO NEAR ZERO 
FOR THE VALLEYS AND 5 TO 15 DEGREES BELOW ZERO FOR THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS AT TIMES THROUGH THE PERIOD.

FXUS64 KMRX 190039 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
739 PM EST SAT JAN 18 2014

.DISCUSSION...
THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THE UPDATE THIS EVENING WAS ON THE NEED FOR
AN EXPANDED WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR THE NORTHERN
PLATEAU...SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA AND
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE...WHICH COMPLIMENTS THE EXISTING ADVISORY FOR
THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE SMOKIES. DESPITE SOME DRY AIR PRESENT IN
THE BOUNDARY LAYER...CONDITIONS LOOK FAVORABLE FOR ANOTHER ROUND OF
SNOW SHOWERS AGAIN TONIGHT INTO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING...WHICH COULD
PRODUCE ACCUMULATIONS OF 1 TO 2 INCHES IN THESE AREAS...AND UP TO 4
INCHES ALONG THE SPINE OF THE MOUNTAINS. SOUNDINGS INDICATE VERY
COLD AIR ALOFT /AND COMBINED WITH INCREASED MOISTURE/RH VALUES
LATER TONIGHT AND SOME GOOD FRONTOGENESIS SEEN AT 700 MB/...THE
POTENTIAL FOR BANDING FEATURES AND SOME BURSTS OF LIGHT TO MODERATE
SNOW IN THESE AREAS SEEMS PROBABLE. GIVEN THE COLD AIR
ALOFT...SNOW RATIOS SHOULD BE HIGH ONCE AGAIN...ALLOWING AN INCH
OR TWO OF SNOW TO QUICKLY ACCUMULATE IN THESE AREAS. SNOW SHOWERS
HAVE ALREADY MOVED INTO THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND PORTIONS OF
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...AND WILL EXPAND SOUTH AND EAST OF THE COURSE
OF THE EVENING/NIGHT. THUS THE REASONING FOR EXPANDING THE ADVISORY
FROM 00Z THIS EVENING THROUGH 15Z SUNDAY MORNING. BY MID-SUNDAY
MORNING...THE PRECIPITATION WILL HAVE TAPERED OFF...EXCEPT FOR A FEW
LINGERING SPOTS ALONG THE MOUNTAINS.

&&

.AVIATION...
UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE SE THROUGH THE TN VALLEY TONIGHT. MID LEVEL 
CLOUD DECK WILL LOWER TO MVFR OVERNIGHT WITH LIGHT SNOW AT TRI AND 
TYS. A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE TAF SITES EARLY ON SUNDAY. 
SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL SHIFT SLIGHTLY TO THE WEST AND INCREASE 
BEHIND THE COLD FRONT. CLOUD DECKS WILL CLEAR FROM THE SW ON SUNDAY 
BUT CONTINUE AT TRI UNTIL THE END OF THE PERIOD. SON

&&

170 
FXUS64 KMRX 182004
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EST SAT JAN 18 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED ALONG THE NORTHERN GULF 
COAST...WITH THE NEXT CLIPPER SYSTEM OVER THE UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY. 
THIS CLIPPER SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO QUICKLY MOVE SOUTHEASTWARD TOWARDS 
THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...SPREADING LIGHT PRECIP OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA THIS EVENING. NORTHWESTERLY UPSLOPE FLOW THEN DEVELOPS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA BEHIND THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS AFTER MIDNIGHT...WITH 
SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS EXPECTED. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT LAPSE 
RATES WILL NOT BE AS STEEP WITH THIS SYSTEM (AS COMPARED TO THE LAST 
CLIPPER SYSTEM)...BUT MID LEVEL FORCING APPEARS TO BE A LITTLE 
STRONGER. OVERALL...MODELS INDICATE SIMILAR PRECIP AMOUNTS WITH THIS 
SYSTEM COMPARED TO THE LAST SYSTEM. SINCE A FEW INCHES OF SNOW 
ACCUMULATED OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WITH THE LAST SYSTEM...THINK 
A WINTER WX ADVISORY WILL BE A GOOD IDEA FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
OF SOUTHWEST VA AND EAST TN. THE UPPER LEVELS ARE NOT EXPECTED TO BE 
AS COLD WITH TONIGHT'S SYSTEM (COMPARED TO THE LAST SYSTEM)...SO 
THINK THE LIQUID TO SNOW RATIOS SHOULD NOT BE AS HIGH AS WHAT WAS 
OBSERVED WITH LAST NIGHT'S SYSTEM (WHEN A 1:30 OF 1:40 LIQUID TO 
SNOW RATIO WAS OBSERVED).

YET ANOTHER SHORT WAVE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS PROGGED TO QUICKLY MOVE 
SOUTHEASTWARD ON MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH THE LONG WAVE UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH PATTERN LINGERING OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. WILL 
MENTION SOME LOW CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY NIGHT IN ADVANCE OF THIS 
NEXT SYSTEM. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE 
SOME DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A NEW DAY BUT YET THE SAME 
OLD STORY. NOT MUCH HAS CHANGED FROM THE PREVIOUS FORECAST 
DISCUSSION. A LARGE SCALE UPPER TROUGH WILL REMAIN OVER THE EASTERN 
UNITED STATES DUE TO RIDGING ACROSS THE WESTERN U.S. THROUGHOUT THE 
LONG TERM WE WILL HAVE TWO MORE MORE CLIPPERS SWING DOWN OUT OF 
CANADA AND ACROSS OUR REGION...GIVING US CHANCES FOR LIGHT SNOW WITH 
EACH SYSTEM AND YET MORE SHOTS OF COLDER AIR.

AS WITH THE PAST FEW CLIPPERS...MOISTURE FOR TUESDAYS SYSTEM STILL 
LOOKS RATHER LIMITED WHICH WILL LIMIT ANY SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS 
ACROSS THE LOWER ELEVATIONS. THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS COULD STILL SEE 
SOME MINOR ACCUMULATIONS AS THEY ARE TYPICALLY THE WINNERS WITH 
THESE TYPE OF SYSTEMS...IN TERMS OF ACCUMULATION...DUE TO THE 
OROGRAPHIC LIFT PRODUCED BY THE NORTHWEST FLOW. THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS COULD SEE AN INCH OR TWO BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON.

ANOTHER WEAKER WAVE WILL MOVE THROUGH THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT. 
MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW THE BULK OF THE ENERGY TO OUR NORTH AND HAVE 
EVEN FURTHER LIMITED MOISTURE COMPARED TO THE TUESDAY WAVE. THIS 
WILL LIKELY LIMIT ANY SNOWFALL TO EXTREME NE TN AND INTO SW VA... 
WHICH WILL AGAIN BE ON THE LIGHT SIDE DUE TO LIMITED MOISTURE. NOT 
EXPECTING MUCH IN THE WAY OF ANY ACCUMULATION AT THIS POINT. 

GENERALLY...HIGH TEMPERATURES TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY IN THE 20S/30S 
AND LOWS IN THE SINGLE DIGITS AND TEENS. WIND CHILLS WILL LIKELY 
DROP BELOW ZERO ACROSS MOST OF THE REGION WITH 5 TO 15 BELOW ZERO 
FOR THE MOUNTAINS. MODELS IN DISAGREEMENT ON PATTERN FOR SATURDAY. 
PREVIOUS RUNS WERE SHOWING POTENTIAL LOW AND ASSOCIATED MOISTURE 
COMING UP OUT OF THE GULF WHILE NEW RUNS CONTINUE THE LONGWAVE 
TROUGH AND NORTHWEST FLOW OVER OUR AREA.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     29  42  28  53  29 /  50  40   0   0  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN             29  42  28  53  29 /  50  20   0   0  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    24  40  23  51  26 /  60  50   0   0  30

     SUNDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...
     UNICOI.

532 
FXUS64 KMRX 180809
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
309 AM EST SAT JAN 18 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS AND FLURRIES EARLY THIS MORNING SHOULD EXIT THE 
AREA BY 12Z AS WE SEE MIDLEVEL DRYING AND STABILIZATION. TODAY LOOKS 
TO BE MOSTLY SUNNY WITH BELOW NORMAL TEMPS IN THE 30S TO LOWER 40S 
WITH A SHORTWAVE RIDGE OVERHEAD. 
 
THE NEXT CLIPPER SYSTEM...CURRENTLY OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS...WILL 
BEGIN TO AFFECT THE AREA THIS EVENING. THE FAST MOVEMENT AND WEAK 
LIFT OF THIS SYSTEM SHOULD KEEP PRECIP AMOUNTS LIGHT...BUT TEMPS 
WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW FROM START TO FINISH. SW TO W WINDS 
THROUGH 850 MB ARE NOT FAVORABLE FOR ENHANCED SNOWFALL IN HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS...SO WILL KEEP SNOW AMOUNTS BELOW ADVISORY LEVELS. 2 
INCHES LOOKS TO BE ON THE HIGH END IN THE MOUNTAINS...WITH A DUSTING 
TO 1 INCH POSSIBLE IN NE TN AND SW VA. THE 850 MB THERMAL TROUGH 
MOVES OVERHEAD 12Z-15Z SUNDAY MORNING...SO WILL KEEP SOME SNOW 
SHOWERS AND FLURRIES GOING AFTER 12Z. THIS SHOULD END BY NOON AS 
MOISTURE PULLS OUT. SW WINDS TONIGHT MAY APPROACH ADVISORY CRITERIA 
IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS...BUT WILL STAY JUST BELOW THIS LEVEL FOR NOW. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
A LARGE SCALE UPPER TROUGH WILL REMAIN ACROSS SOUTHEAST CANADA
WITH FLOW NORTHWESTERLY THROUGHOUT MOST OF THE EXTENDED. A SERIES
OF SHORT-WAVES (ALBERT-CLIPPER TYPE SYSTEMS) WILL DIVE SOUTHEAST
INTO THE UPPER TROUGH. AS SHORT-TERM FORECASTER MENTIONED...FIRST
WAVE GOES THROUGH LATE TONIGHT AND SUNDAY WITH THE NEXT ONE FOR
MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. THESE WAVES WILL BRING IN RE-ENFORCEMENT
OF COLDER AIR.

MOISTURE FOR THE TUESDAY SYSTEM REMAINS LIMITED...BUT ENOUGH TO 
SQUEEZE OUT LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS...MAINLY FOR THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS WHERE OROGRAPHIC LIFT WILL ENHANCE SNOWFALL. 

ANOTHER WEAK WAVE WILL MOVE THROUGH THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT. 
THIS WAVE IS QUITE WEAK WITH THE BRUNT OF THE ENERGY STAYING WELL 
NORTH OF THE AREA. HOWEVER...ANOTHER RE-ENFORCEMENT OF COLD AIR 
ANTICIPATED. WILL MENTION ARCTIC-LIKE AIR FOR TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY 
WITH HIGHS IN THE 20S/30S AND LOWS IN THE SINGLE DIGITS AND TEENS. 
WIND CHILLS WILL LIKELY DROP BELOW ZERO ACROSS MOST OF THE REGION 
WITH 5 TO 15 BELOW ZERO FOR THE MOUNTAINS.

&&

442 
FXUS64 KMRX 180224 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
924 PM EST FRI JAN 17 2014

.DISCUSSION...
INCREASED POPS ALONG THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS TO ACCOUNT FOR A GREATER
COVERAGE OF SNOW SHOWERS THIS EVENING. SOME SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS
OF UP TO AN INCH WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THE MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA AND EAST TENNESSEE /PARTICULARLY THROUGH 06Z/...BUT THE
ACTIVITY WILL BEGIN TO WANE BY LATE TONIGHT. A FEW LOCALLY HIGHER
AMOUNTS MAY BE POSSIBLE FOR LOCATIONS UNDERNEATH THE HEAVIER BANDS
AND ALONG THE PEAKS OF THE MOUNTAINS. ADDITIONALLY...HAVE INCREASED
CLOUD COVER TO OVERCAST ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA THROUGH 06Z
AS DECK OF LOW STRATUS HAS MOVED OVER THE REGION FROM THE WRAP-
AROUND MOISTURE ON THE BACKSIDE OF THE LOW. THINK THAT THIS CLOUD
COVER WILL GRADUALLY SHIFT NORTHEASTWARD AND BEGIN TO BREAK UP BY
LATE TONIGHT...ALLOWING FOR AT LEAST A PARTLY CLOUDY SKY OVER MUCH
OF THE REGION BY EARLY THIS MORNING. WITH THE CLOUD AIR ADVECTION
TAKING PLACE...LOWS WILL BOTTOM OUT IN THE TEENS AREAWIDE BY
DAYBREAK. THE SOMEWHAT BREEZY WINDS WILL ALLOW RESULT IN SOME NEAR-
ZERO TO SUBZERO WIND CHILLS ALONG THE MOUNTAINS AFTER 06Z...THOUGH
ALL BUT A FEW SPOTS WILL REMAIN ABOVE ADVISORY CRITERIA.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             20  42  31  46  29 /  10   0  20   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  19  37  30  43  29 /  30   0  50  20   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       19  37  30  43  29 /  30   0  50  10   0

814 
FXUS64 KMRX 171955
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EST FRI JAN 17 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT ALONG THE SPINE OF THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS...WITH TEMPS FALLING QUICKLY OVER MIDDLE TN BEHIND THIS 
FRONT. CURRENT SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS AN AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH OVER THE OHIO AND TN RIVER VALLEYS VERY WELL...WITH ITS SWIRL 
OF CLOUDS CENTERED AROUND SOUTHERN INDIANA. AREA RADARS REVEAL SOME 
LIGHT PRECIP OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND CUMBERLAND MOUNTAINS 
OCCURRING IN ASSOCIATION WITH THIS UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH...BUT THIS 
ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO DECREASE IN COVERAGE AS THE SUN SETS THIS 
EVENING. PERSISTENT WESTERLY WINDS TONIGHT WILL COMBINE WITH COLD 
TEMPS TO PRODUCE VERY COLD WIND CHILL VALUES. IN FACT...IT APPEARS 
THAT WIND CHILL VALUES OVER THE MOUNTAINS COULD FALL TO NEAR -5 
DEGREES (WIND CHILL ADVISORY CRITERIA) LATER TONIGHT...BUT THESE 
ADVISORY VALUES SHOULD BE BRIEF AND LIMITED TO THE HIGHEST MOUNTAIN 
PEAKS. THUS...WILL NOT ISSUE  A WIND CHILL ADVISORY FOR THE 
MOUNTAINS TONIGHT.

MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT ANOTHER UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE 
WILL QUICKLY DIVE SOUTHEASTWARD THROUGH THE LONG WAVE TROUGH OVER 
THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION ON SATURDAY...AND WILL PUSH ANOTHER 
FAST-MOVING COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY MORNING. MODELS ALSO AGREE THAT THIS SYSTEM WILL HAVE LIMITED 
MOISTURE...WITH ONLY LIGHT PRECIP AMOUNTS EXPECTED OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME 
DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...OVERALL WEATHER PATTERN THROUGH 
THE EXTENDED WILL BE AN UPPER TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN U.S. WITH A 
SERIES OF WEAK LOW PRESSURE SYSTEMS AND DISTURBANCES DROPPING IN 
ALONG THE UPPER FLOW. MONDAY SHOULD BE THE MOST PLEASANT DAY OF THE 
EXTENDED WITH GENERALLY DRY AND WARM CONDITIONS. THE FIRST SYSTEM 
MOVING THROUGH WILL BE A WEAK COLD FRONT PUSHING IN MONDAY NIGHT 
INTO TUESDAY. LITTLE MOISTURE WILL ACCOMPANY THE FRONT FOR SCATTERED 
LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES. ALSO ACCOMPANYING THE FRONT WILL BE ANOTHER 
BLAST OF COLDER AIR. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BRIEFLY NOSE IN ON 
WEDNESDAY. A WEAK DISTURBANCE WILL MOVE THROUGH TO OUR NORTH ON 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. THIS MAY GENERATE A MINOR WEAK 
NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW OR FLURRIES. MODELS DIVERGE SIGNIFICANTLY BY THE 
END OF THE PERIOD BUT THE GFS DOES BRING IN ANOTHER SYSTEM FOR 
THURSDAY NIGHT. CONFIDENCE LOW ON THIS BUT DID INTRODUCE 20 TO 30 
POPS.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 AM EST FRI JAN 17 2014

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT ALONG THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU...WITH TEMPS IN THE 30S OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
CURRENT SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS AN AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER 
THE OHIO AND TN RIVER VALLEYS VERY WELL...WITH A SWIRL OF CLOUDS 
CENTERED OVER SOUTHERN INDIANA. AREA RADARS REVEAL SOME LIGHT PRECIP 
OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU OCCURRING IN ASSOCIATION WITH THIS 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AND ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT. THIS UPPER TROUGH 
WILL HELP TO CREATE SOME STEEP LAPSE RATES OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS AFTERNOON...WHICH SHOULD HELP TO GENERATE SOME SCATTERED 
SNOW/RAIN SHOWERS...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. SOUNDINGS REVEAL A VERY DRY AIR MASS BELOW 850 MB... 
WITH ONLY A SHALLOW OF MOISTURE AROUND 850 MB. ALSO...A MID LEVEL 
INVERSION BETWEEN 750 AND 600 MB SHOULD HELP TO LIMIT MUCH VERTICAL 
DEVELOPMENT OF THESE SHOWERS THIS AFTERNOON. THUS...EXPECT PRECIP 
AMOUNTS WITH THESE SHOWERS TO BE LIGHT...AND TEMPS IN THE LOWER 40S 
SHOULD HELP TO LIMIT ANY POSSIBLE SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS IN THE 
LOWER ELEVATIONS BELOW 2500 FEET.

WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO REMOVE ANY MORNING 
WORDING...AND TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.
&&


107 
FXUS64 KMRX 170813
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
313 AM EST FRI JAN 17 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
PRECIP MOVING QUICKLY ACROSS THE AREA THIS MORNING IS ASSOCIATED 
WITH A STRONG 500 MB VORT MAX...WHICH SHOULD BE CLOSE TO EXITING THE 
NE PORTIONS OF OUR AREA AROUND 12Z. WILL KEEP SOME CHANCE POPS IN SW 
VA AND NE TN THROUGH 14Z. THE FAST MOVEMENT OF THIS VORT MAX SHOULD 
MEAN ANY ACCUMULATION WILL BE LIGHT WITH NO NEED FOR AN ADVISORY. 

AFTER THIS VORT MAX EXITS...WE SHOULD SEE A DRY PERIOD WITH CLEARING 
SKIES UNTIL AROUND NOON. FALLING TEMPS ALOFT IN THE AFTERNOON WILL 
GENERATE CONVECTIVE RAIN SHOWERS IN THE VALLEY...AND SNOW SHOWERS IN 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. SOME VALLEY LOCATIONS COULD SEE A BRIEF BURST OF 
SNOW WITH HEAVIER PRECIP...BUT SURFACE TEMPS LOOK TOO WARM FOR ANY 
ACCUMULATION OUTSIDE ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FT. THE SURFACE COLD 
FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH 18-21Z...LOWERING THE FREEZING LEVEL AND 
CHANGING ALL PRECIP TO SNOW SHOWERS BY 00Z. THIS WILL ALSO BRING A 
DECREASE IN INSTABILITY...SO COVERAGE OF SHOWERS WILL BE DECREASING 
AFTER DARK. 

THE 20 KT WESTERLY WINDS UP TO 850 MB WILL NOT BE IDEAL FOR 
SIGNIFICANT UPSLOPE ENHANCEMENT...ALTHOUGH SNOW-LIQUID RATIOS WILL 
BECOME QUITE HIGH OVERNIGHT AS TEMPS DROP QUICKLY. DECREASING 
MOISTURE DEPTH AND INCREASING MIDLEVEL TEMPS WILL END MOST OF THE 
SHOWERS BEFORE 12Z. FORECAST SNOW AMOUNTS IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
OF SW VA AND THE TN MOUNTAINS...MAINLY AT OR ABOVE 2500 FT...WILL BE 
1 TO 2 INCHES. OTHER PARTS OF SW VA ARE EXPECTED TO SEE A DUSTING TO 
1 INCH...WITH A DUSTING POSSIBLE IN THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND NE TN 
VALLEY AREA.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
THROUGHOUT MOST OF THE EXTENDED A DEEP LONG-WAVE UPPER TROUGH WILL 
BE CENTERED ACROSS SOUTHEAST CANADA/FAR NORTHEAST UNITED STATES. A 
SERIES OF SHORT-WAVES WILL DIVE SOUTHEAST INTO THE CENTRAL/SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. FIRST SUCH WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY WITH A CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS/FLURRIES...ESPECIALLY OVER THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN WHERE OROGRAPHIC NORTHWEST FLOW WILL ENHANCE SNOWFALL.
LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN. 

NEXT WAVE COMES INTO THE REGION MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. THIS WAVE 
WILL PULL A VERY COLD ARCTIC FRONT THROUGH THE AREA WITH SNOW 
SHOWERS/FLURRIES ANTICIPATED. AT THIS TIME...MOISTURE IS QUITE 
SHALLOW AND TRAJECTORY IS NOT FAVORABLE FOR GOOD OROGRAPHIC 
NORTHWEST FLOW SNOWFALL. WILL KEEP ONLY LOW POPS FOR NOW.

WAVE NUMBER THREE COMES INTO THE REGION FOR LATE WEDNESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. LATEST GFS AND ECMWF HAVE BIG DIFFERENCES IN AMOUNT 
OF MOISTURE AND DYNAMICS. THE 00Z ECMWF IS THE STRONGEST. NCEP IS 
FAVORING A BLEND OF 00Z GFS AND PREVIOUS 12Z ECMWF...WHICH SUGGEST A 
LIGHTER SNOWFALL. WILL ONLY HAVE LOW POPS AT BEST FOR NOW. HOWEVER...
THIS WAVE WILL BRING EVEN COLDER AIR INTO THE REGION.

OVERALL...MAIN WEATHER STORY FOR THE EXTENDED...ESPECIALLY FOR NEXT 
WEEK...WILL BE THE RETURN OF ARCTIC AIR INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  42  18  34  27  44 /  30  20   0  40  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       39  18  35  27  44 /  30  20   0  30   0

523 
FXUS64 KMRX 161942
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EST THU JAN 16 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH 
ANOTHER SECONDARY COLD FRONT BEHIND IT OVER THE UPPER MS RIVER 
VALLEY. THIS SECONDARY COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO CATCH UP WITH THE 
LEAD COLD FRONT AS IT MOVES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AROUND SUNRISE 
ON FRIDAY MORNING. AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH PUSHING THESE COLD FRONTS 
IS PROGGED TO FURTHER AMPLIFY OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION ON 
FRIDAY...WITH THE TROUGH AXIS SWINGING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
DURING THE LATE FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING HOURS. MODELS ARE 
IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THIS UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL NOT HAVE MUCH 
MOISTURE WITH IT...ESPECIALLY IN THE LOWER LEVELS. THUS...ANY PRECIP 
SHOULD BE LIGHT AND SCATTERED IN NATURE. IN ADDITION...TEMPS SHOULD 
RISE INTO THE MID 30S TO LOWER 40S OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA... 
SO THINK THAT ANY SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE LIGHT AND MAINLY 
CONFINED TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET. NORTHWESTERLY 
UPSLOPE FLOW DOES NOT DEVELOP UNTIL FRIDAY EVENING...WHEN MOST OF 
THE MOISTURE WILL HAVE EXITED THE REGION. SO...NOT SURE THAT THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS WILL SEE MUCH MORE SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS THAN AN 
INCH OR TWO. BECAUSE OF THIS...WILL NOT ISSUE ANY WINTER WEATHER 
ADVISORIES FOR THE MOUNTAINS AT THIS TIME. ANOTHER FAST-MOVING 
CLIPPER SYSTEM WILL RACE INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY SATURDAY NIGHT... 
BUT AGAIN...THIS SYSTEM APPEARS TO HAVE LIMITED MOISTURE WITH ONLY 
LIGHT PRECIP AMOUNTS EXPECTED ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT 
THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME DIFFERENCES 
ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...WILL SEE A SERIES OF WEAK 
SYSTEMS/SHORT WAVES RIDING THROUGH UPPER FLOW THROUGHOUT THE 
EXTENDED. FIRST WILL BE A CONTINUATION OF A WEAK UPSLOPE FLOW EVENT 
SUNDAY MORNING AS THE EXITING WAVE AND UPPER TROUGH PULLS OUT OF THE 
AREA. COLD AIR IN PLACE WILL ALLOW FOR ANY LINGERING SHOWERS PULLING 
OUT TO BE LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES. MONDAY WE WILL BE BETWEEN IMPULSES 
AND SHOULD BE A DRY AND WARM DAY. MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY...A WEAK 
COLD FRONT WILL SLIDE THROUGH. ANOTHER BLAST OF COLDER AIR MOVES IN 
BUT WITH LITTLE MOISTURE ATTACHED AND WILL KEEP POPS 20 TO 30 WITH 
BEST CHANCES NORTH. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE NUDGES IN BRIEFLY FOR 
WEDNESDAY. A SHORT WAVE TRACKING THROUGH TO OUR NORTH WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AND THURSDAY. COULD SEE A MINOR WEAK NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW OR 
FLURRIES. ZONAL FLOW ALOFT AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE EXPECTED FOR 
FRIDAY.
&&

455 
FXUS64 KMRX 160802
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
302 AM EST THU JAN 16 2014

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
CLEARING BEHIND THE SHORTWAVE THAT MOVED THROUGH YESTERDAY WILL
CONTINUE EARLY THIS MORNING...ALLOWING TEMPERATURES TO COOL INTO THE
UPPER TEENS AND LOWER 20S BY DAYBREAK. SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS WILL
INCREASE OVER THE COURSE OF THE MORNING AND INTO THE AFTERNOON
AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING UPPER-TROUGH. THOUGH THERE MAY BE SOME
PASSING CLOUD COVER...PARTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS AND THE SOUTHWEST
FLOW WILL HELP TO PUSH HIGHS BACK INTO THE 40S...BEFORE SOME MORE
DENSE CLOUD COVER AND LIGHT PRECIPITATION MOVE IN AFTER SUNSET.
MODELS /PARTICULARLY THE NAM/ HAVE BEEN TRENDING DRIER...SO HAVE
REMOVED MENTIONABLE POPS FROM THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE CWA BEFORE
06Z. WITH COLDER AIR FILTERING IN...SOME LIGHT ISOLATED TO
SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS ARE EXPECTED /GENERALLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN
HALF OF THE CWA/ AFTER MIDNIGHT. HOWEVER...ONLY MINOR ACCUMULATIONS
ARE EXPECTED AND THEY SHOULD BE CONFINED TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

.LONG TERM /FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
MODELS ARE APPEARING TO BE 
DRIER FOR THE SHORTWAVE AND COLD FRONT APPROACHING ON FRIDAY. OPTED 
TO LOWER POPS FOR FRIDAY MORNING GIVEN THIS DRIER TREND. HOWEVER...
THE LAPSE RATES STEEPEN BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING HOURS
CREATING LOW LEVEL POSITIVE CAPES OF 50 TO 100 J/KG. THE UPSLOPE 
COMPONENT OF SFC-850 MB WINDS IS NOT REAL IMPRESSIVE...BUT FEEL THAT 
THE DAYTIME INSTABILITY AND MODERATE COLD AIR ADVECTION SHOULD 
PRODUCE AT LEAST SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS. PROBABLY GREATER COVERAGE 
AT TIMES FOR SW VA AND EXTREME NE TN COUNTIES...THUS WENT LIKELY FOR 
THOSE AREAS. THIS BLENDED NICELY WITH ADJACENT GRIDS FROM 
JKL/RLX/RNK. DUE TO HIGHER POPS A MENTION OF POSSIBLE LIGHT SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS.

THE PROLONGED UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL KEEP TEMPS BELOW NORMAL AT 
LEAST INTO SUNDAY...BUT MOISTURE LOOKS VERY LIMITED WITH ANY PASSING 
SHORTWAVE ENERGY OVER THE WEEKEND. KEPT POPS LIMITED TO SATURDAY 
NIGHT FOR NOW...MORE IN LINE WITH GFS AND SREF. WARMEST DAY WILL BE 
MONDAY AND MILDEST NIGHT MONDAY NIGHT...THEN HEIGHTS FALL AGAIN AS 
UPPER TROUGH DEEPENS FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...DROPPING TEMPS 
BELOW CLIMO AGAIN. LOW POPS KEPT FOR MONDAY TO WEDNESDAY FOR 
CONTINUITY IN GENERAL...ALTHOUGH AGAIN MOISTURE SHOULD BE LACKING.

FXUS64 KMRX 152009
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EST WED JAN 15 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT OVER THE CAROLINAS...WITH FAIRLY WARM 
TEMPS IN THE MID 30S TO MID 40S LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
AREA RADARS REVEAL ONLY VERY LIGHT PRECIP OVER NORTHEAST TN AND 
SOUTHWEST VA THIS AFTERNOON...WITH NOT MUCH PRECIP OCCURRING OVER 
MIDDLE TN AND CENTRAL KY IN ASSOCIATION WITH AN AMPLIFIED UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH. AS A RESULT...WILL PLAN TO CANCEL THE WINTER WX 
ADVISORY FOR THE MOUNTAINS...SINCE ANY ADDITIONAL SNOW ACCUMULATIONS 
THIS EVENING SHOULD BE ONLY AROUND AN INCH OR LESS. MODELS INDICATE 
THAT ANOTHER UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL QUICKLY AMPLIFY OVER THE 
CENTRAL PART OF THE NATION ON THURSDAY...WHICH WILL PUSH ANOTHER 
COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. 
MODELS HAVE DISAGREEMENTS WITH HOW MUCH MOISTURE WILL BE AVAILABLE 
WITH THIS COLD FRONT...BUT THEY ALL GENERALLY AGREE THAT MOISTURE 
WILL BE FAIRLY LIMITED WITH ONLY LIGHT PRECIP AMOUNTS EXPECTED. WITH 
TEMPS EXPECTED TO RISE INTO THE UPPER 30S TO MID 40S OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY...THINK THAT ANY SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS WITH 
THIS NEXT COLD FRONT WILL BE LIGHT...AND MAINLY CONFINED TO THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT...AND 
LOOK REASONABLE. FOR FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...WILL GENERALLY 
COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO SETS OF GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...BASICALLY WENT CLOSER TO 
THE ECMWF FOR THE PERIOD ALTHOUGH MODELS WERE SIMILAR WITH MUCH OF 
THE LONG TERM EXCEPT FOR DAY SEVEN. ANOTHER FAST MOVING SHORT WAVE 
DROPS SOUTHEAST OUT OF THE CENTRAL CANADIAN PROVINCES DURING THE DAY 
SATURDAY IN TIME TO PRODUCE A BRIEF PERIOD OF SNOW SHOWERS MAINLY IN 
THE MAJOR TERRAIN AREAS SATURDAY NIGHT. DRY NORTHWESTERLY FLOW TAKES 
OVER SUNDAY INTO MONDAY HOWEVER ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH BUILDS INTO AND 
THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY 
NIGHT GENERATING SOME LIGHT PRECIPITATION. DUE TO UNCERTAINTY AT 
THIS TIME RANGE AND THE POSSIBILITY OF BELOW FREEZING 
TEMPERATURES...ESPECIALLY DURING THE OVERNIGHT HOURS INCLUDING THE 
MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY NIGHT PERIODS...KEPT A MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW 
IN THE FORECAST. STAYED CLOSE TO SIMILAR GUIDANCE BLEND FOR 
TEMPERATURES THROUGH MOST OF THE PERIOD WHILE ADJUSTING CLOSER TO 
THE COOLER MEX MOS ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
950 AM EST WED JAN 15 2014

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT OVER THE CAROLINAS... 
WITH TEMPS ABOVE FREEZING STILL LINGERING OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. AREA RADARS REVEAL ONLY VERY LIGHT PRECIP OVER NORTHEAST TN 
AND SOUTHWEST VA...WITH NOT MUCH PRECIP OCCURRING BEHIND THIS 
POST-FRONTAL BAND. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT AN AMPLIFIED 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL SWING ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS 
AFTERNOON...WITH LAPSE RATES STEEPENING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
HOWEVER...MOISTURE APPEARS TO BE LIMITED AND GENERALLY IN A SHALLOW 
LAYER AROUND 850 MB. THUS...SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS WILL STILL BE 
POSSIBLE THIS AFTERNOON WITH THIS UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH...BUT ANY SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS SHOULD BE SCATTERED AND LESS 
THAN AN INCH (ESPECIALLY WITH HIGH TEMPS EXPECTED TO BE AROUND 40 
DEGREES). WITH THIS IN MIND...WILL CANCEL THE WINTER WX ADVISORIES 
EVERYWHERE ACROSS THE LOWER ELEVATIONS...AND WILL DOWNGRADE THE 
WARNINGS IN THE MOUNTAINS TO ADVISORIES. ALTHOUGH UPSLOPE FLOW INTO 
THE MOUNTAINS THIS AFTERNOON WILL LIKELY BE WEAK...THE UNSTABLE AIR 
MASS MAY STILL BE ABLE TO GENERATE ENOUGH SNOW SHOWERS TO SQUEEZE 
OUT SOME LIGHT SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET.

OVERALL...WILL UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO LOWER POPS... 
RAISE TEMPS FOR THIS AFTERNOON...AND TO REMOVE OR CHANGE THE WINTER 
WX HEADLINES.

677 
FXUS64 KMRX 150829
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
329 AM EST WED JAN 15 2014

.SHORT TERM.../TODAY AND TONIGHT/... 
AN UPPER-TROUGH EXTENDING FROM THE GREAT LAKES INTO THE SOUTHERN
TENNESSEE VALLEY WILL PUSH A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE REGION THIS
MORNING. ALONG/AHEAD OF THE BOUNDARY...LIGHT PRECIPITATION HAS
FORMED ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND IS NOW AT THE DOORSTEP OF THE
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU COUNTIES. THERE IS LIMITED MOISTURE AND WEAK
FRONTOGENTIC LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM...WHICH WILL HINDER
THE POTENTIAL FOR MUCH IN THE WAY OF APPRECIABLE PRECIPITATION
TOTALS. COLDER AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE AREA THIS MORNING...WHICH
WILL PUSH LOW TEMPERATURES TO AT OR JUST BELOW FREEZING IN MOST
LOCATIONS BY DAYBREAK. THIS...ALONG WITH THE TIMING OF THIS LIGHT
PRECIPITATION WILL LEAD TO SOME LIGHT SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS OF UP
TO AN INCH ALONG THE PLATEAU...THE CUMBERLAND MOUNTAINS AND FAR
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE/SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...WITH PERHAPS SOME SLIGHTLY
HIGHER AMOUNTS LOCALLY.

GIVEN THE TIMING OF THIS LIGHT PRECIPITATION MOVING IN AROUND
DAYBREAK AND RUSH HOUR...HAVE MAINTAINED THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY
FOR ALL BUT THE SOUTHERN VALLEY TODAY. A WINTER STORM WARNING IS
ALSO IN EFFECT FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE SMOKIES...BUT THINK
THAT TOTALS THERE WILL LIKELY ONLY APPROACH THE FOUR INCH CRITERIA
ALONG THE HIGHEST MOUNTAIN PEAKS. AS MENTIONED...HAVE CANCELLED THE
ADVISORY FOR THE SOUTHERN VALLEY GIVEN THE SLIGHTLY WARMER
TEMPERATURES THERE AND THE VERY MINOR ACCUMULATION POTENTIAL.
LOCATIONS ALONG THE CENTRAL VALLEY MAY RECEIVE A DUSTING TO AROUND
HALF AN INCH THOUGH THIS MORNING...BEFORE IT TAPERS OFF DURING THE
AFTERNOON TO THE MOUNTAINS. CLEARING WILL OCCUR OVERNIGHT AS COOLER
AIR FILTERS INTO THE REGION...ALLOWING LOWS TO DROP BACK INTO THE
UPPER TEENS AND LOWER 20S. 


.LONG TERM.../THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY/...FOCUSED MOST ATTENTION ON
FRIDAY'S GRIDS AS A STRONGER SHORTWAVE TROUGH APPROACHES EARLY
FRIDAY MORNING. THIS SYSTEM ACTUALLY MAY PRODUCE MORE SNOW THAN
TODAY'S CLIPPER SYSTEM. SURFACE TEMPS WILL BE COLDER FRIDAY MORNING
AND MORE SUPPORTIVE OF ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL...WITH STRONG COLD AIR
ADVECTION AT 850 MBS. MOISTURE LOOKS QUITE DEEP WITH TEMPS AT LEAST
-20 DEGS CELSIUS AT TOP OF THE SATURATED LAYER. BETTER LOW LEVEL
W-NW UPSLOPE FLOW INDICATED WITH SURFACE BASED CAPES PROGGED TO BE
60 TO 90 J/KG DURING THE DAYTIME. THUS...I INCREASED POPS TO LIKELY
ACROSS FAVORED AREAS FOR AN UPSLOPE SNOW EVENT AND HIGHER CHANCE
POPS ELSEWHERE. A LIGHT TO MODERATE SNOW ACCUMULATION IS MENTIONED.

OTHERWISE...DRY WEATHER LOOKS GOOD FOR THURSDAY AND ALSO STILL FOR
SUNDAY TO MONDAY. A WEAKER LOOKING SHORTWAVE CLIPS THE REGION
SATURDAY NIGHT IN THE NW FLOW...BUT NOT VERY IMPRESSIVE AND COVERED
ALREADY IN FORECAST GRIDS. KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN FOR TUESDAY. 
TEMPS SHOULD STAY BELOW SEASONAL NORMALS RIGHT INTO THE WEEKEND...
SO I UNDERCUT GFSX MOS IN LINE WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS FOR THOSE DAYS. 
HOWEVER...FOR MOST PERIODS THE GFSX 15/00Z MOS WAS GENERALLY CLOSE
TO 14/12Z TEMPS...AND FOLLOWED.

353 
FXUS64 KMRX 150307 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1007 PM EST TUE JAN 14 2014

.DISCUSSION...
ON RADAR...PRECIP MOVING ACROSS MIDDLE TN LOOKS UNIMPRESSIVE AND
APPEARS TO BE FALLING APART. HOWEVER THE 00Z NAM SHOWS A
STRENGTHENING CONVERGENCE ZONE AND FRONTOGENESIS DEVELOPING AROUND
09Z. IN ADDITION...AS THE UPPER TROUGH DIGS SOUTH AND BECOMES MORE
AMPLIFIED...THE EASTWARD MOVEMENT OF THE LIFT AND MOISTURE SLOWS
DOWN. SO ANY HOPE FOR ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL IS NOT COMPLETELY LOST.
HOWEVER...THE 00Z OHX SOUNDING IS VERY DRY UP TO 700 MB...SO
FALLING PRECIP WILL TAKE SOME TIME TO REACH THE GROUND. ALSO...THE
WINDOW OF ADEQUATE MOISTURE DEPTH FOR ACCUMULATING SNOW IN THE
VALLEY IS NARROW...ABOUT 6 HOURS AT BEST. SURFACE TEMPS IN THE
VALLEY WILL BARELY TOUCH FREEZING...WHICH WILL FURTHER LIMIT ANY
ACCUMULATION.

THE UPDATE WILL LOWER SNOW AMOUNTS SLIGHTLY...WITH A DUSTING TO 2
INCHES IN THE VALLEY AND PLATEAU...2 TO 5 IN THE MOUNTAINS...AND 1
TO 4 IN SW VA. ALTHOUGH WARNING/ADVSIROY SNOW AMOUNTS WILL PROBABLY
NOT BE REACHED IN MOST SPOTS...THE TIMING OF THE PEAK OF SNOW AROUND THE
MORNING COMMUTE IS AN ADDITIONAL CONCERN...AND SO THE CURRENT
WARNING/ADVISORY AREAS WILL BE KEPT IN PLACE.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 6 PM EST WEDNESDAY FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...WINTER STORM WARNING UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST WEDNESDAY NIGHT FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST 
     CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...UNICOI.

     WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 6 PM EST WEDNESDAY FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: ANDERSON...CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...EAST 
     POLK...GRAINGER...HAMBLEN...HANCOCK...HAWKINS...JEFFERSON...
     KNOX...LOUDON...MORGAN...NW BLOUNT...NORTH SEVIER...
     NORTHWEST COCKE...NORTHWEST GREENE...ROANE...SCOTT TN...
     SOUTHEAST MONROE...UNION.

     WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 1 PM EST /NOON CST/ WEDNESDAY FOR 
     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLEDSOE...BRADLEY...HAMILTON...
     MARION...MCMINN...MEIGS...NORTHWEST MONROE...RHEA...
     SEQUATCHIE...WEST POLK.

339 PM EST TUE JAN 14 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...POTENT LITTLE
CLIPPER HEADED TOWARD AREA. NOT GREAT AMOUNTS OF MOISTURE...BUT
GOOD LIFT AND RELATIVELY SLOW MOVEMENT OVER THE AREA. WILL HAVE
ADVISORIES OVER MUCH OF THE AREA AND WARNINGS OVER THE HIGHER
TERRAIN ALONG THE TN/NC BORDER AND IN WISE AND RUSSELL IN VA.
NORTHEASTERN AREAS AND SPINE OF APPALACHIANS WILL RUN TILL
MIDNIGHT...WITH SOUTHWESTERN AREA RUNNING TILL 1PM...AND REST TILL
6PM. MAIN MOTIVATION FOR ADVISORY IN THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL
VALLEY IS THAT THE PRIME TIME FOR THE HEAVIEST SNOWS WILL BE NEAR
THE MORNING RUSH HOUR. LOOKS LIKE ONSET OF PRECIP WILL BE
RAIN...BUT WILL QUICKLY TURN TO SNOW. MOUNTAINS WILL LIKELY LINGER
OVERNIGHT WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(THU THROUGH TUE)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT WITH THE 
OVERALL PATTERN FOR THE LONG TERM...BUT STILL SOME DIFFERENCES IN 
THE DETAILS.  ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH TO DIG IN THUR 
NIGHT/FRIDAY...ALONG WITH ANOTHER COLD FRONT.  MOISTURE WILL BE 
LIMITED...BUT STILL MAY SEE SOME LIGHT SNOW/SNOW SHOWERS LATE THU 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY...WITH SOME LINGERING COLD ADVECTION/NORTHWEST 
FLOW SNOW SHOWERS INTO FRIDAY NIGHT.  WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION THE 
POSSIBLE SNOWFALL IN THE HWO.  ANOTHER WAVE FORECAST TO COME DOWN IN 
THE NORTHWEST FLOW DURING THE WEEKEND...BUT MODELS DO NOT AGREE ON 
HOW MUCH MOISTURE/HOW FAR SOUTH AND TIMING.  FOR NOW WILL CARRY 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS AND CONFINE THEM TO SAT NIGHT.  FLOW STARTS TO 
FLATTEN A BIT LATTER PART OF THE PERIOD.  WILL GO DRY SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY FOR NOW...WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS TUE AS NEXT UPPER 
TROUGH/COLD FRONT FORECAST TO BE MOVING IN.

294 
FXUS64 KMRX 140854
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
354 AM EST TUE JAN 14 2014

.SHORT TERM.../TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
ACTIVE WEATHER CERTAINLY CONTINUES THIS MORNING...AS WE ARE NOT YET
RID OF ONE WEATHER SYSTEM WITH ANOTHER FAST MOVING DISTURBANCE AND
COLD FRONT HEADED OUR WAY BY EARLY TONIGHT.

FOR TODAY...THE BACK EDGE OF THE LIGHT RAIN AND DRIZZLE WON'T CLEAR
FAR NE TN AND SW VA AREAS UNTIL A BIT AFTER 12Z TODAY...SO KEPT
CHANCE POPS IN FOR THOSE AREAS JUST IN THE 12Z TO 15Z PERIOD. 08Z
TEMPS AND DEW POINT TEMPS WERE MUCH HIGHER THAN HOURLY GRIDS...SO
IT WON'T BE HARD TO REACH THE UPPER 40S TO MID OR UPPER 50S THIS
AFTERNOON WITH CLEARING EXPECTED.

MODELS CONSISTENT ON TIMING THE ONSET OF THE NEXT ROUND OF
PRECIPITATION (PCPN) TONIGHT...BRIEFLY RAIN SHOWERS THEN QUICKLY
PRE-DOMINANTLY SNOW SHOWERS AFTER MIDNIGHT. MODELS DIFFER
CONSIDERABLY ON DEPTH OF MOISTURE AND HOW MUCH QPF OCCURS THROUGH
WEDNESDAY. NAM AND CANADIAN WERE THE WETTER SOLUTIONS...WHILE GFS
SREF AND ECMWF WERE MUCH DRIER. MY CONFIDENCE ON GETTING ADVISORY
SNOW AMOUNTS ACROSS AREAS OTHER THAN FAVORED HIGHER TERRAIN IS LOW
AT THIS POINT. EVEN THE NAM MODEL DID NOT SHOW IMPRESSIVE MOISTURE
DEPTH OR W-NW LOW LEVEL UPSLOPE FLOW INTO WEDNESDAY. BASED ON THIS
AND COORDINATION WITH NWS NEIGHBORS...OPTING FOR AN SPS WITH A
MENTION OF POSSIBLE SNOW AMOUNTS ALSO INCLUDED IN THE ZFPMRX
PRODUCT.

MOS TEMPS CLOSE AND REASONABLE FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT REALLY
TOO OPTIMISTIC FOR WEDNESDAY GIVEN THE STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION
AND TUMBLING 850 MB TEMPS. 


.LONG TERM.../WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY/...
A SERIES OF SHORTWAVES WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA DURING THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...BRINGING THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME SCATTERED 
PRECIPITATION /PARTICULARLY ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN/ ON THURSDAY 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY...SATURDAY NIGHT...AND AGAIN ON MONDAY NIGHT. THE 
FIRST SHORTWAVE WILL DEPART THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY...ALLOWING FOR 
SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WEDNESDAY NIGHT ALONG THE EAST 
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA MOUNTAINS. BY THURSDAY...WINDS WILL 
VEER TO THE SOUTHWEST AND ALLOW FOR A BRIEF WARM-UP INTO THE 
40S...BEFORE THE NEXT TROUGH SWINGS THROUGH THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS THAT NIGHT...BRINGING WITH IT A STRONGER SHOT OF COLDER 
AIR. THIS WILL COMBINE WITH THE MOISTURE IN PLACE TO PRODUCE SOME 
SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY 
NIGHT AND FRIDAY...BEFORE TAPERING OFF BY FRIDAY EVENING/NIGHT. 
GIVEN THE COLDER AIR THAT WILL BE IN PLACE BY FRIDAY MORNING...SOME 
LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS MAY BE POSSIBLE FOR THE MORNING COMMUTE ACROSS 
PORTIONS OF THE NORTHERN VALLEY AND THE HIGHER TERRAIN. AFTER SOME 
PARTIAL CLEARING OCCURS ON SATURDAY...ANOTHER SHORTWAVE WILL CLIP 
THE AREA...AND BRING SOME ISOLATED SNOW SHOWERS TO THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN SATURDAY NIGHT. THEREAFTER...WINDS WILL VEER BACK TO THE 
SOUTHWEST AND ALLOW HIGHS TO CLIMB BACK INTO THE 50S ON SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY. ANOTHER TROUGH WILL APPROACH THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT INTO 
TUESDAY OF NEXT WEEK...PERHAPS BRINGING A BETTER OPPORTUNITY FOR 
WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION.

936 
FXUS64 KMRX 131933
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
233 PM EST MON JAN 13 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...LARGE SHIELD OF RAIN NOW 
TRYING TO SPREAD ACROSS THE AREA.  THE AXIS OF THIS SHIELD IS 
FARTHER EAST THAN MODELS HAD DEPICTED...WITH A WEAK DRY SLOT WORKING 
INTO MIDDLE TN.  SHOWERS CONTINUE TO DEVELOP TO THE WEST OF THE DRY 
SLOT.  SO WILL CONTINUE WITH HIGH POPS THROUGH MIDNIGHT.  DID HAVE 
100% ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA THROUGH MIDNIGHT...BUT HAVE NOW TRIMMED 
BACK A BIT OVER THE WESTERN 1/4 OF THE AREA.  AFTER MIDNIGHT HAVE 
POPS TAPERING OFF WEST TO EAST...AND FOR TUESDAY MORNING ONLY HAVE 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF LINGERING SHOWERS IN THE E TN MOUNTAINS...THEN DRY 
AFTER MID MORNING.  THE NEXT SYSTEM WILL BE APPROACHING...BUT 
HOLDING OFF POPS THROUGH THE AFTERNOON TUESDAY.  WENT VERY CLOSE TO 
GUIDANCE TEMPS OVERALL.  LEAVING FOG OUT OF THE GRIDS OVERNIGHT AS 
WIND SHIFT WILL TRY TO START BRINGING SLIGHTLY DRIER AIR INTO THE 
REGION LATE TONIGHT.  UNTIL AFTER DAYBREAK THERE WON'T BE MUCH 
MIXING...SO LIGHT FOG WILL LIKELY LINGER...BUT THINK CHANCES OF 
DENSE FOG LESSEN WITH WINDSHIFT.  FOR QPF...JUST GOING GENERALLY 
BETWEEN 1/10 AND 2/10 INCH.  HEAVIER AMOUNTS HAVE FALLEN WEST OF 
HERE...BUT SYSTEM IS BEGINNING TO MOVE FASTER AND DRY SLOT WILL
LIKELY LIMIT DURATION/AMOUNTS.

.LONG TERM...(TUE NIGHT THROUGH MON)...UNFORTUNATELY MODEL RUN TO 
RUN CONSISTENCY AND INTERMODEL AGREEMENT IS NOT GREAT FOR THE LONG 
TERM PERIOD.  THIS IS ESPECIALLY PROBLEMATIC FOR THE EARLY PART OF 
THE PERIOD WITH THE SHARP UPPER TROUGH AND COLD FRONT THAT MOVES 
THROUGH.  GFS IS QUICKER WITH THE UPPER TROUGH AND ALMOST SHOWS A 
NEGATIVE TILT.  IT ALSO TRIES TO DEVELOP MORE OF A SURFACE WAVE ON 
THE FRONT.  THUS IT SHOWS MORE SIGNIFICANT PRECIP OVER THE 
AREA...WITH THE BULK OF IT LATE TUE NIGHT AND EARLY MONDAY AND MUCH 
OF IT SNOW.  THE NAM AND ECMWF SHOW THE UPPER TROUGH HANGING BACK 
MORE...WITH LESS INTERACTION WITH THE FRONT. THEY SHOW THE PRECIP 
MOVING IN FASTER AND EXITING MORE QUICKLY...AND A HIGHER PERCENTAGE 
OF THE PRECIP MAY BE LIQUID.  HOWEVER...WITH THE UPPER TROUGH 
HANGING BACK IN THE NAM...LAPSE RATES GET QUITE STEEP BY WED 
AFTERNOON GENERATING A BETTER CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS IN THE COLD 
ADVECTION.  WHILE THE GFS SOLUTION CANNOT BE RULED OUT...IT IS A 
CHANGE FROM RECENT RUNS AND IT HAS LITTLE SUPPORT (THE CMC AGREES 
FAIRLY WELL WITH PRECIP AMOUNTS AND TIMING ALTHOUGH IT GETS THERE A 
LITTLE DIFFERENTLY).  WILL USE MORE OF AN ECMWF/NAM/GFS BLEND. WILL 
BRING LIKELY POPS INTO ALL BUT SOUTH TUE NIGHT...AND LIKELY 
NORTHEAST AND MOUNTAINS WED.  PRECIP TYPE SHOULD START AS 
RAIN...WITH A TRANSITION TO SNOW MAINLY AFTER MIDNIGHT.  AT THIS 
TIME...IT APPEARS SOME MINOR ACCUMULATION MAY BE POSSIBLE OVER 
MAINLY THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEYS...WITH HIGHER AMOUNTS 
EXPECTED OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  WILL HAVE AMOUNTS BELOW 24 
HOUR WARNING CRITERIA IN THE MOUNTAINS FOR NOW...SO NO WINTER STORM 
WATCH.  WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION IN THE HWO.  ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH 
FORECAST TO DIG IN THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH ANOTHER 
POSSIBILITY OF SOME MORE SNOW SHOWERS.  WILL GO DRY SATURDAY THROUGH 
MONDAY FOR NOW...AS MODELS SHOW THE NEXT WEAK SYSTEM STAYING NORTH 
FOLLOWED BY A FLATTENING OF THE UPPER FLOW AND DRIER AIR OVER OUR 
AREA.    

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  38  54  32  36  19 / 100  10  60  50  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       38  56  32  36  19 /  90  10  60  50  20

AFTERNOON.

AREAS DUE TO BLANKETING OF THICKER CLOUDS AND MORE WINDS TO STIR UP
THE BOUNDARY LAYER. HOWEVER...THINK THAT TEMPS WILL BE VERY
SLUGGISH TO RISE IN THAT AREA WITH RAINS ON THE DOORSTEP. WILL KEEP
AFTERNOON HIGH TEMPS AS- IS...BUT BUMPED UP HOURLY TEMP GRIDS TO
MATCH CURRENT CONDS.

LOOKING UPSTREAM TOWARD THE GULF...FAIR AMOUNT OF LIGHTNING DOWN
THERE...BUT MODELS SUGGEST THAT WE WON'T GET ENOUGH SURFACE-BASED
NOR ELEVATED INSTABILITY TO GET THUNDER THIS FAR NORTH.

ARE JUST MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS AT THIS POINT. DRY AIR BELOW 700 
MBS SHOULD HOLD OFF ANY SIGNIFICANT RAINS UNTIL 16Z TO 20Z FOR OUR 
TAF SITES. HOWEVER...EXPECT LOW LEVELS TO BE SATURATED BY 13/22Z TO 
14/02Z...THEN LOOK FOR VISBYS AND CEILINGS TO FALL STEADILY DOWN TO 
IFR CONDITIONS BY OR AFTER 14/00Z TO 14/06Z. PRECIPITATION MAY TAPER 
OFF OR END LATE AT CHA...BUT LIKELY TO PERSIST AT TRI THROUGH THIS 
TAF PACKAGE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
414 AM EST MON JAN 13 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH CLOUDS INCREASING EARLY THIS 
MORNING FROM NRN AL AND MIDDLE TN WESTWARD. ISENTROPIC LIFT UNDERWAY 
WAS ALREADY PRODUCING AN INCREASING AREA OF RAIN JUST WEST OF I-65. 
PREVIOUS GRIDS TIME THE ONSET OF RAIN TODAY QUITE WELL...WITH RAIN 
OVERTAKING OUR PLATEAU COUNTIES BEFORE NOON EST...THEN REMAINDER OF 
FORECAST AREA IN THE MID TO LATE AFTERNOON. RAINFALL AMOUNTS NOT 
THAT SIGNIFICANT...BUT COMING IN AFTER A SHORT LIVED DRY PERIOD. 

TEMPS THIS MORNING VARY GREATLY WHERE SKIES REMAIN CLEAR WITH CALM 
WINDS TO AREAS WITH HIGH CLOUDS AND LIGHT SOUTH WINDS. SLIGHTLY 
UNDERCUT GFS MOS MAXES WHERE CLOUDS AND RAIN START THIS MORNING...
BUT ALLOW FOR WARMING INTO THE LOWER TO MID 50S IN ERN MOST AREAS.

A TRAILING WEAK COLD FRONT FOR TONIGHT...BUT SHOWERS SHOULD BE 
ENDING BY OR BEFORE 06Z TO 09Z TUESDAY...WELL BEFORE ANY COLD AIR 
ARRIVES. THE CLOUDS WILL BE RELUCTANT TO DISSIPATE TONIGHT...WINDS 
HOLD AROUND 5 TO 10 MPH...AND COLD AIR ADVECTION IS WEAK. THUS...I 
NUDGED OUR MIN TEMPS UP CLOSER TO THE MILDER/SIMILAR 13/00Z MOS 
MINS. 

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...INITIAL COLD FRONT JUST
EAST OF FORECAST AREA TUESDAY MORNING WITH AIR MASS RAPIDLY DRYING
AS WEAK HIGH PRESSURE TEMPORARILY CLEARS SKIES AND WITH SW WINDS
WARMS TEMPERATURES INTO THE LOWER TO MID 50S. BIG CHANGE TUESDAY
NIGHT AS FLOW BECOMES NW AND BRINGS IN MUCH COLDER AIR MASS INTO
THE TN VALLEY WEDNESDAY. SHOWERS DEVELOP DURING THE EVENING AND
CHANGE TO SNOW LATE IN THE EVENING AND AFTER MIDNIGHT AS FREEZING
LEVELS DROP TO NEAR THE SURFACE. SLIGHT ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE LOWER
VALLEY ELEVATIONS AND LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS HIGHER ELEVATIONS EXCEPT
PREFERRED AREAS IN WISE COUNTY VA AND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE
SMOKY MOUNTAINS AND NE TN COULD GET 3 TO 6 INCHES FOR THE 24 HOUR
PERIOD FROM TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY. STRONG COLD AIR
ADVECTION WEDNESDAY WILL KEEP HIGHS ONLY REACHING THE 30S LOWER
ELEVATIONS AND 20S HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WEST TO NORTH WEST WINDS AT
10 TO 20 MPH WILL MAKE IT FEEL ONLY IN THE TEENS AND TWENTIES.
DEEPENING TROUGH OVER EASTERN STATES WILL RELAX A LITTLE THURSDAY.
TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY WARMER THURSDAY. THEN A NEW SYSTEM DROPS SE
FROM CANADA THURSDAY INTO THE GREAT LAKES AND INTO TN FRIDAY AND
FRIDAY NIGHT. THIS BRINGS A CHANCE OF SNOW AND FLURRIES AND
REINFORCES COLDER AIR MASS OVER THE REGION WHICH CONTINUES THROUGH
THE WEEKEND. ECMWF BRINGS EVEN ANOTHER SYSTEM INTO NORTHERN HALF OF
THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY. RIGHT NOW KEEPING THOSE PERIODS
DRY AS OTHER MODELS KEEP SYSTEM TO THE NORTH.

FXUS64 KMRX 122036
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
321 PM EST SUN JAN 12 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
CONTINUES TO WEAKEN OVER THE AREA TONIGHT. CONDITIONS REMAIN DRY 
WITH LITTLE OR NO CLOUD COVER. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR GOOD COOLING 
OVERNIGHT AND LEANED TOWARD THE COOL SIDE OF MOS GUIDANCE. WEAK WARM 
AIR ADVECTION GETS GOING TONIGHT AND CONTINUES ON MONDAY. SW TO NE 
UPPER JET STRENGTHENS OVER THE SOUTH AND THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
EARLY MONDAY. INCREASED CLOUD COVER WITH SUFFICIENT ISENTROPIC LIFT 
FOR WIDESPREAD RAIN ACROSS THE AREA BY MONDAY AFTERNOON. DESPITE 
CLOUDS AND RAIN...TEMPS WILL RISE INTO THE 50S. UPPER TROUGH MOVES 
EAST THROUGH THE TN VALLEY MONDAY NIGHT WITH A STRONGER JET SEGMENT 
EAST OF THE TROUGH. RAIN WILL CONTINUE OVERNIGHT AND LINGER IN NE 
AREAS TUESDAY MORNING AS JET SEGMENT AND WEAK SURFACE COLD FRONT 
EXITS THE AREA TO THE EAST. POST FRONTAL CONDITIONS FAIR BUT VERY 
SHORT LIVED AND NEXT MAJOR UPPER TROUGH MOVES INTO THE MID MS 
VALLEY.  


.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...DURING THIS 
PERIOD...LOOKS LIKE THERE WILL BE TWO ALBERTA CLIPPERS MOVING 
THROUGH THE AREA.  AT THE FIRST OF THIS PERIOD...CLIPPER #1 IS AT 
THE DOORSTEP TUESDAY EVENING.  THIS SYSTEM EXIT THE MOUNTAINS BY 12Z 
THURSDAY.  THEN CLIPPER #2 WILL BE SWEEPING THROUGH THE AREA AROUND 
FRIDAY. 

CLIPPER #1 WILL HAVE BETTER MOISTURE AND OFFERS A CHANCE OF SOME 
MEASURABLE SNOW AT LOCATIONS IN THE THE UPPER HALF OF THE 
VALLEY...ALBEIT SMALL AMOUNTS.  IN THE MOUNTAINS...THIS SYSTEM 
SHOULD BE ABLE TO GET MEASURABLE SNOW.  THIS SYSTEM WILL BE WET ON 
THE FRONT END HOWEVER...SO THAT WILL AFFECT HOW MUCH SNOW CAN 
ACCUMULATE.  THERE IS ALSO THE ISSUE DURING THE CHANGEOVER PERIOD 
FROM RAIN TO SNOW ABOUT HOW MUCH OF THE PRECIPITATION WILL FALL AS 
RAIN.  LOOKING LIKE MOST OF THE AREA WILL CHANGE OVER BY MIDNIGHT 
TUESDAY NIGHT...THEN ANOTHER PUSH OF MOISTURE AND ENERGY SWEEP 
THROUGH DURING THE DAY ON WEDNESDAY WITH ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR SNOW 
SHOWERS IN THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY AS WELL AS THE 
MOUNTAINS.  UPSLOPE SNOWS IN THE MOUNTAINS SHOULD LINGER AT LEAST 
INTO WEDNESDAY EVENING.

THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT LOOK DRY...THEN CLIPPER #2 SWEEPS IN 
FROM THE NORTHWEST ON FRIDAY.  THIS CLIPPER HAS VERY LIMITED 
MOISTURE...SO MAINLY GOING WITH POPS IN THE NORTHERN SECTIONS AND 
MOUNTAINS.  INITIAL EXPECTATIONS FOR SNOW TOTALS EVEN IN THE 
MOUNTAINS LOOK LIGHT DUE TO LIMITED MOISTURE.

KEEPING END OF FORECAST DRY FOR NOW.  GENERALLY WENT PRETTY CLOSE TO 
GUIDANCE ON TEMPERATURES OVERALL.

REPORTING ANY ICING PROBLEMS.

CLOUDS ARE GONE AFTER MID MORNING WITH PLENTY OF SUNSHINE ON TAP... 
ALONG WITH WEAK WARM AIR ADVECTION ACROSS WRN 2/3RDS OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. THUS...WENT A DEGREE OR SO ABOVE THE GFS MOS MAXES.

DRY THROUGH TONIGHT AND IN FACT THE CLOUDS REALLY DONT ADVANCE MUCH 
OVERNIGHT...SO PARTLY CLOUDY LATE FOR MAINLY SE TN. GFS MOS MINS 
LOOKED REASONABLE AND CLOSELY FOLLOWED...ALLOWING FOR A LIGHT 
SOUTHERLY WIND TO DEVELOP ACROSS PLATEAU COUNTIES AND WISE COUNTY 
VA.

TN VALLEY MONDAY MORNING. SKIES WILL BECOME MOSTLY CLOUDY QUICKLY
FROM SW TO NE. HAVE HIGHEST POPS SW DECREASING NE AS RAIN MOVES IN
LATER NE TN AND SW VA. FRONT WILL APPROACH MONDAY EVENING AND BE
EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA BY EARLY TUESDAY. THERE WILL BE A BREAK
DURING AT LEAST THE FIRST HALF OF TUESDAY WITH SOME SUNSHINE BEFORE
UPPER TROUGH DEEPENS AS SURFACE LOW MOVES EAST INTO THE GREAT
LAKES. A FAST MOVING SHORTWAVE IN THE NW FLOW ALOFT BEHIND THE
FRONT WILL SPREAD MOISTURE INTO THE REGION LATE TUESDAY. WITH COLD
AIR ALOFT PRECIPITATION WILL CHANGE TO SNOW TUESDAY NIGHT AND
WEDNESDAY. A COUPLE INCHES OF SNOW IS POSSIBLE IN THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS AND MOSTLY LESS THAN ONE INCH LOWER ELEVATIONS OVER THE
NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. PRECIPITATION SHOULD END
LATE WEDNESDAY BUT SOME FLURRIES POSSIBLE WEDNESDAY NIGHT. COOL
HIGH PRESSURE THURSDAY AND FRIDAY BUT ANOTHER FAST MOVING CLIPPER
COULD BRUSH NE SECTIONS FRIDAY NIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY. THIS
SYSTEM WILL ALSO REINFORCE THE COLD AND DRY CONDITIONS OVER THE
REGION. TEMPERATURES ABOVE NORMAL MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY AND THEN
DROP TO BELOW NORMAL WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY.

393 
FXUS64 KMRX 112019
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 PM EST SAT JAN 11 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...COLD FRONT IS NOW OFF TO OUR 
EAST. CONTINUED CLEARING OF CLOUDS CAN BE EXPECTED THROUGH THE 
AFTERNOON BEHIND THE FRONTAL PASSAGE. HOWEVER...BASE OF 500MB TROUGH 
HAS YET TO SWING THROUGH AND WILL DO SO LATER THIS EVENING AND 
OVERNIGHT. THIS WILL BRING SOME CLOUD COVER BACK INTO THE AREA AS A 
LITTLE BIT OF MOISTURE AT THE 700MB AND 500MB LEVEL WILL RE-ENTER 
WITH THE TROUGH AND IS EVIDENT ON VISIBLE SATELLITE. DENSER CLOUD 
COVER EXPECTED FROM KNOXVILLE NORTH AND EAST...WITH THE BEST 
COVERAGE UP INTO NETN AND SWVA. ALSO...WITH THE APPROACH OF THE 
TROUGH AND AFOREMENTIONED MOISTURE...KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE AND CHANCE 
POPS ACROSS NETN...SWVA...AND SMOKY MTNS AS SOME LIGHT SPOTTY 
SHOWERS COULD REDEVELOP AS THE TROUGH SWINGS THROUGH. A TRANSITION 
TO A FEW LIGHT FLURRIES COULD BE POSSIBLE EARLY TOMORROW MORNING AS 
TEMPERATURES APPROACH FREEZING. HOWEVER...TEMPS DONT REACH FREEZING 
UNTIL MOISTURE IS ALMOST GONE...SO NO ACCUMULATION IS ANTICIPATED. 
CLOUDS CLEAR TOMORROW AS THE TROUGH LIFTS OFF TO OUR NORTHEAST ALONG 
WITH A BRIEF RETURN TO ZONAL FLOW. TEMPERATURES WILL ARE EXPECTED TO 
BE A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL TOMORROW WITH HIGHS ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN VALLEY IN THE LOW TO MID 50S...LOW 50S FOR THE CENTRAL 
VALLEY...UPPER 40S TO NEAR 50 FOR NETN AND MID TO UPPER 40S FOR SWVA.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...A WEAKENING SHORT-WAVE 
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA MONDAY PRODUCING A BAND OF LIGHT RAIN. 
FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING IS FAIRLY WEAK...SO WILL GO ONLY LIKELY.

FOR TUESDAY...WEAK RIDGING BOTH SURFACE AND ALOFT AHEAD OF A 
STRONGER COLD FRONT LOCATED OVER THE MID-WEST. THIS FRONT WILL MOVE 
SOUTH ACROSS THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY MORNING AS A 
CLIPPER-TYPE SYSTEM MOVES ACROSS THE LOWER GREAT LAKES/UPPER OHIO 
VALLEY INTO THE NORTHEAST UNITED STATES FOR WEDNESDAY. A JET MOVING 
SOUTH ACROSS THE LOWER OHIO/TENNESSEE VALLEYS WILL PROVIDE SOME 
LARGE SCALE LIFT FOR TUESDAY NIGHT. FOR WEDNESDAY...COLD AIR 
ADVECTION ALOFT (ENHANCING LOW-LEVEL INSTABILITY) AND OROGRAPHIC 
LIFT WILL CONTINUE SNOW SHOWERS...ESPECIALLY DURING THE MORNING.

ACCUMULATING SNOWS ARE LIKELY OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS... 
ESPECIALLY NORTHWEST FACING SLOPES WITH LIGHT SNOWFALLS POSSIBLE 
OVER THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY WEDNESDAY MORNING. THIS SYSTEM 
MOVES EAST OF THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH ONLY FLURRIES EXPECTED 
MOUNTAINS/NORTHEAST SECTIONS.

FOR THURSDAY...ANOTHER WEAK RIDGE WILL PRODUCE DRY CONDITIONS AND 
NEAR SEASONAL TEMPERATURES BEFORE ANOTHER COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH 
FRIDAY. A LARGE SCALE UPPER THROUGH WILL BE OVER THE NORTHERN GREAT 
LAKES...BUT MOISTURE WILL BE QUITE LIMITED. AT THIS TIME...ONLY 
FLURRIES EXPECTED FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND DRY 
ELSEWHERE.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...FOLLOWED GFS MOS CLOSELY...EXCEPT FOR THE 
MID-WEEK WHERE CLOUDS...PRECIPITATION AND COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL 
LIKELY KEEP HIGHS DOWN A COUPLE DEGREES FROM MOS VALUES.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       33  53  33  53  34 /   0   0  10  70  30

772 
FXUS64 KMRX 110927
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
427 AM EST SAT JAN 11 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SCATTERED SHOWERS OCCURRING IN 
ADVANCE OF THE APPROACHING COLD FRONT...AND ALSO SEEING A BIT MORE 
THUNDERSTORMS ASSOCIATED WITH THE CONVECTION ALONG THE COLD FRONT. 
MODELS AND SOUNDINGS INDICATE ELEVATED INSTABILITY OVER MUCH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...SO OPTED TO WORD THE TSRA POTENTIAL A 
BIT STRONGER THAN A SLIGHT CHANCE. 500 MB TEMPS ARE ON THE COOL SIDE 
WITH FREEZING LEVEL ALSO FALLING THIS MORNING...SO MIGHT SEE SMALL 
HAIL OCCUR WITH ANY TSRA THAT CAN DEVELOP A DECENT 50 DBZ CORE. ONE 
SUCH CELL BRIEFLY INTENSIFIED OVER POLK COUNTY TN EARLIER...BUT THEN 
WEAKENED. STRONGER STORMS ALONG THE FRONT ARE REACHING OUR SRN
PLATEAU COUNTIES ABOUT NOW.

OTHER ITEM OF CONCERN IS THE STRONG LOW LEVEL JET...AND BASED ON 
AVAILABLE SURFACE OBSERVATIONS...THINK THE WIND ADVISORY AND WARNING 
AREAS LOOK ON TRACK WITH NO CHANGES NEEDED.

MAX TEMP FORECAST FOR TODAY IS CHALLENGING GIVEN THE CURRENT RAIN 
COOLED SPOTS IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT...WITH TEMPS LIKELY TO BE 
STEADY OR FALL A BIT BEHIND PASSAGE OF THE COLD FRONT EARLY IN THE 
AFTERNOON. BLENDED OUT THE MOS DIFFERENCES AND STAYED IN LINE WITH 
ADJACENT NWS GRIDS. MOS MINS TONIGHT WERE CLOSE AND GENERALLY 
FOLLOWED...FAVORING THE SLIGHTLY HIGHER MINS WHERE CLOUDS HOLD IN 
THE LONGEST.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...COLD FRONT AND UPPER TROUGH
NOW EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN FOR
ONLY A 24 HOUR STAY. COOLER TEMPERATURES BUT MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES AND
STILL ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES. SUNDAY NIGHT SKIES STAY MOSTLY
CLEAR AND LOWS DROP TO THE UPPER 20S TO MID 30S. CLOUDS INCREASE
AHEAD OF NEXT DEVELOPING SYSTEM MONDAY. TEMPERATURES WARM INTO THE
50S WITH RAIN BY MONDAY NIGHT. THERE MAY BE A DRY PERIOD FOR PART
OF THE DAY TUESDAY AHEAD OF UPPER LEVEL TROUGH. COLD AIR ADVECTION
WITH THE TROUGH AND SHORTWAVE TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY WITH
SECONDARY FRONT SHOULD PRODUCE SOME SNOW SHOWERS WITH ACCUMULATIONS
IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND POSSIBLY INTO THE VALLEY. HIGHS
WEDNESDAY MUCH COLDER IN THE 30S. WEDNESDAY NIGHT SKIES CLEAR WITH
LOWS DROPPING INTO THE TEENS AND 20S. SKIES BECOME SUNNY AGAIN
THURSDAY. WITH NW FLOW ALOFT ANOTHER WEATHER SYSTEM MOVING EAST
THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY WILL BRING A COLD
FRONT THROUGH FRIDAY. THIS COULD PRODUCE A LITTLE SNOW IN THE NE.
TEMPERATURES STAY A LITTLE BELOW NORMAL THURSDAY AND COLDER AGAIN
FRIDAY.

&&

465 
FXUS64 KMRX 102021
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
321 PM EST FRI JAN 10 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...LONG WAVE TROUGH 
APPROACHES OUR AREA TONIGHT AND SWINGS THROUGH TOMORROW. SHOWERS 
WILL QUICKLY DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING COLD FRONT THIS 
EVENING WITH THE MAIN LINE OF SHOWERS ARRIVING AROUND 09 UTC. LATEST 
SOUNDINGS SHOW A SMALL AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY FROM KNOXVILLE 
SOUTH...SO WILL MENTION A SLIGHT CHANCE OF A THUNDERSTORM. DUE TO 
RISING HEIGHTS AHEAD OF THE FRONT...A BACKWARDS DIURNAL TEMPERATURE 
CURVE WILL BE IN PLACE OVERNIGHT. LOOK FOR THE MIN TEMP TO OCCUR 
AROUND 02 UTC AND TEMPS SLOWLY WARMING AFTER THAT THROUGH TOMORROW 
UNTIL THE FRONT PASSES. 

A STRONG LOW LEVEL JET ARRIVES BY 06 UTC AND PERSISTS THROUGH 17 
UTC. THE NAM IS SHOWING AROUND 70KTS AT 850MB WHILE THE GFS SHOWS 
60KTS. A HIGH WIND WARNING WILL BE IN EFFECT FROM 06 UTC THROUGH 17 
UTC FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WHILE A WIND ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT FOR 
THE FOOTHILLS OF THE EASTERN TN VALLEY...ALONG WITH WISE...RUSSELL 
AND WASHINGTON VA.

GENERALLY...AROUND 1 TO 1.5 INCHES OF RAIN CAN BE EXPECTED WITH THE 
FRONT PASSAGE. SHOWERS WILL END FROM WEST TO EAST TOMORROW AS THE 
FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA.   

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...A RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE BEGINS THE EXTENDED PERIOD WITH DRY CONDITIONS SUNDAY. A 
SHORT-WAVE AND ASSOCIATED UPPER JET MOVES ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY. 
THE DIRECT CIRCULATION ASSOCIATED WITH THE JET WILL ENHANCE THE 
FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING ALONG A FRONTAL BOUNDARY FOR MONDAY AND EARLY 
MONDAY NIGHT. 

THE GFS/ECMWF MODELS SHOW A COMPLICATED UPPER TROUGH MOVING ACROSS 
THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDENSDAY. A 
STRONGER COLD FRONT WILL ALSO MOVE THROUGH THE AREA. MODERATELY 
STRONG LARGE SCALE LIFT FOLLOWED BY OROGRAPHIC NORTHWEST FLOW INTO 
THE MOUNTAINS WILL PRODUCE RAIN/SNOW CHANGING TO ALL SNOW FOR 
WEDNESDAY...ESPECIALLY MOUNTAINS. ACCUMULATING SNOWS ARE 
POSSIBLE...ESPECIALLY OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WILL NEED TO WATCH 
THE EVOLUTION OF THIS SYSTEM CLOSELY. 

FOR THE END OF THE WEEK...A DEEP UPPER TROUGH SETS UP ACROSS THE 
GREAT LAKES WITH ANOTHER COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE AREA. SNOW 
SHOWERS AND FLURRIES ARE POSSIBLE FOR FRIDAY...MAINLY OVER THE 
NORTHEAST SECTIONS.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...WENT CLOSE TO GFS MOS FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY...
BUT WENT SEVERAL DEGREES COLDER FOR MID-WEEK DUE TO THE EXTENSIVE 
CLOUDS/PRECIPITATION AND COLD AIR ADVECTION.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             47  61  34  54  36 / 100  90   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  47  57  33  52  33 / 100 100  10   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       46  56  33  52  33 / 100 100  10   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              46  57  32  48  28 /  90 100  20   0  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
428 AM EST FRI JAN 10 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...SCATTERED AREAS OF LIGHT 
RAIN CONTINUE TO MOVE NE ACROSS THE REGION THIS MORNING...WITH BEST 
COVERAGE ACROSS THE ERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. NUDGED RAIN 
CHANCES UP A BIT IN THOSE AREAS...FOR THE PRE 12Z THROUGH NOON 
PERIODS. MODEL SOUNDINGS AND AREA TEMPS/DEW POINT TEMPS DON'T 
SUPPORT ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANCES FOR LIGHT FREEZING RAIN EARLY THIS 
MORNING...SO JUST WORDED AS A SLIGHT CHANCE.  

SHOWERS WILL QUICKLY DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING COLD FRONT 
THIS EVENING...BUT LEFT OUT ANY MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS GIVEN THE 
LACK OF INSTABILITY. HOWEVER...THE PATTERN SUPPORTS A POSSIBLE 
MOUNTAIN WAVE OVERNIGHT...GIVEN THE STABLE LAYER ALOFT...PLACEMENT 
OF UPPER LEVEL JET AND THE STRENGTHENING LOW LEVEL JET. OPTED TO 
ISSUE A HIGH WIND WATCH FOR THE TYPICAL ERN MTN AND FOOTHILLS 
COUNTIES. 

SHOWERS SHOULD END SLIGHTLY EARLIER FROM THE WEST ON SATURDAY...
BUT JUST MINOR CHANGES MADE FOR BOTH TONIGHT AND SATURDAY FROM 
PREVIOUS GRIDS. 

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...COLD FRONT MOVES
EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT WITH SOME WRAP AROUND
CLOUDINESS AND LIGHT SHOWERS MAINLY NE AND EASTERN MOUNTAINS AS
SHORTWAVE WITH UPPER TROUGH MOVES THROUGH. PRECIPITATION MOSTLY
RAIN BUT A LITTLE SNOW POSSIBLE IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. HIGHER
PRESSURE BUILDS IN EARLY SUNDAY WITH SKIES CLEARING. TEMPERATURES
COOLER BUT STILL A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. THIS SURFACE HIGH
MOVES RAPIDLY EAST WITH NEXT FRONT MOVING INTO MS VALLEY MONDAY
MORNING. A SURFACE LOW IN SOUTHERN CANADA WITH COLD FRONT
EXTENDING SOUTH TO EASTERN TEXAS WILL INCREASE MOISTURE OVER THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY WITH INCREASING CHANCE OF RAIN MONDAY. A LOW MAY
FORM ALONG THE FRONT AND SLOW IT DOWN SOME AS IT MOVES EAST ACROSS
TN. TEMPERATURES WILL BE MILD ENOUGH THAT THE PRECIPITATION SHOULD
BE ALL RAIN. A DEEPENING UPPER TROUGH MOVES IN BEHIND THE FRONT
TUESDAY AND THE RAIN WILL CHANGE TO SNOW TUESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY
WEDNESDAY. TEMPERATURES MUCH COOLER WEDNESDAY. HIGH PRESSURE THAN
BUILDS BACK IN LATE WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.

972 
FXUS64 KMRX 100213
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EST THU JAN 9 2014

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE 
CENTERED OVER THE NORTHEAST...WITH A WARMER AIR MASS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA COMPARED TO LAST NIGHT. A WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN 
WILL CONTINUE OVER THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...WITH SOUTHWESTERLY 
WINDS BRINGING TEMPS WELL ABOVE FREEZING AT 850 MB. THE MAIN 
FORECAST CONCERN FOR TONIGHT WILL BE THE POSSIBILITY OF FREEZING 
RAIN OVER NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA...WHERE CURRENT DEWPOINTS 
REMAIN IN THE 20S. THIS DRY AIR WILL CREATE SOME EVAPORATIVE COOLING 
LATER TONIGHT WITH ANY RAIN THAT SPREADS OVER THE AREA. NAM MODEL 
INDICATES A FAIRLY EXTENSIVE AREA OF LIGHT RAIN SPREADING NORTHWARD 
ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS AFTER MIDNIGHT...BUT THE GFS MODEL KEEPS THIS 
RAIN FARTHER EAST OVER THE CAROLINAS. BOTH MODELS REVEAL SURFACE WET 
BULB TEMPS RISING ABOVE FREEZING TOWARDS SUNRISE...SO IT APPEARS 
THAT ANY ACTUAL TEMPS AT OR BELOW FREEZING WILL BE BRIEF AND MAINLY 
IN THE PROTECTED VALLEYS THAT BLOCK OR DELAY ANY WARMING FROM 
SOUTHWEST WINDS. CONFIDENCE IN WIDESPREAD FREEZING RAIN PROBLEMS IS 
NOT HIGH ENOUGH FOR AN ADVISORY...SO WILL PLAN TO ISSUE A SPECIAL 
WEATHER STATEMENT INSTEAD TO ADDRESS THE POTENTIAL FOR MORE SPOTTY 
PROBLEMS ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA.

OTHERWISE...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK... 
BUT WILL UPDATE THIS EVENING TO REMOVE ANY EVENING PRECIP WORDING.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   37  53  47  59  33 /  20  20 100  90  10

OAK RIDGE, TN             36  52  43  56  32 /  30  20 100 100  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    32  49  42  57  30 /  50  20  90 100  20

FXUS64 KMRX 092042
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
342 PM EST THU JAN 9 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...A WEAK SHORTWAVE WILL 
CONTINUE TO APPROACH THE AREA FROM THE WEST AND BRING INCREASING 
CLOUD COVER. DENSE CLOUD COVER WILL HELP TO KEEP OVERNIGHT LOWS 
ROUGHLY 5 TO 7 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. AS THE SHORTWAVE MOVES 
CLOSER...LIGHT RAIN LOOKS TO MOVE IN AFTER 00Z WHERE A CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS IS IN PLACE AREA WIDE. WILL TAPER POPS BACK TO SLIGHT CHANCE 
FROM SW TO NE THROUGH THE NIGHT AS THE WAVE QUICKLY LIFTS OFF TO THE 
NORTH. AS WITH THE PREVIOUS FORECAST...THE MAIN CONCERN WITH THIS 
SYSTEM WILL BE THE POTENTIAL FOR BRIEF PATCHY LIGHT FREEZING RAIN 
OVER PORTIONS OF NETN...SWVA AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS WHERE OVERNIGHT 
LOWS FALL TO OR BELOW FREEZING. RAINFALL COVERAGE IS EXPECTED TO BE 
MINIMAL AND AMOUNTS LIGHT BUT COULD SEE A FEW SLICK SPOTS DEVELOP 
WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF PATCHY BLACK ICE FORMING ON AREA ROADS. 


WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL BE IN PLACE FRIDAY DUE TO WARM AIR 
ADVECTION AND WILL THEREFORE KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS IN 
PLACE THROUGH THE DAY. HEIGHTS INCREASE FRIDAY AFTERNOON AHEAD OF AN 
APPROACHING TROUGH...THIS WILL INCREASE TEMPS INTO THE LOW 50S 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY AND UPPER 40S TO NEAR 50 FOR 
NETN AND SWVA.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...A SHORT-WAVE TROUGH 
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES-TENNESSEE VALLEY WITH 110-120KT JET 
OVER THE OHIO VALLEY PLACING THE REGION UNDER DIVERGENCE ALOFT. THE 
DIRECT CIRCULATION AROUND THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION WILL HELP 
ENHANCE FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WITH A 
BAND OF RAIN ANTICIPATED FROM SATURDAY 06-18Z. WILL CALL FOR 
WIDESPREAD RAIN AREA-WIDE. A FEW SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE ACROSS THE 
MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST TENNESSEE SATURDAY 
NIGHT/SUNDAY MORNING.

THIS SYSTEM QUICKLY MOVES EAST WITH FLOW BECOMING WEST...THEN 
SOUTHWEST AGAIN BY LATE SUNDAY.  THE ECMWF AND GFS ARE IN BETTER 
AGREEMENT THIS RUN IN PULLING ANOTHER QUICK SHORT-WAVE TROUGH/FRONTO-
GENETIC FORCING THROUGH LATE MONDAY.  AN UPPER THROUGH MOVING INTO 
THE GREAT LAKES HELPS PULL A STRONGER COLD FRONT THROUGH LATE 
TUESDAY WITH RAIN POSSIBLY CHANGING TO SNOW SHOWERS FOR TUESDAY 
NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. ACCUMULATING SNOWS POSSIBLE ACROSS THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. ANOTHER FRONT POSSIBLY MOVES THROUGH AGAIN ON THURSSDAY 
NIGHT. 

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS...EXCEPT FOR MID-WEEK NEXT WEEK. COLD AIR 
ADVECTION AND CLOUDS/PRECIPITATION WILL LIKELY KEEP TEMPERATURES 
COOLER THAN MEX MOS.

&&

944 
FXUS64 KMRX 090747
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
247 AM EST THU JAN 9 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL PULL OUT OF THE AREA TODAY BUT THE WARMING TREND WILL CONTINUE 
AS VALLEY HIGHS REACH INTO THE 40S AND EVEN A FEW LOW 50S SOUTH.  
HOWEVER...AN APPROACHING WEAK DISTURBANCE WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE 
HIGH AND MID LEVEL CLOUDS THROUGHOUT THE DAY.  AFTER 00Z...LOWER 
CLOUDS AND PATCHY LIGHT SHOWERS WILL MOVE IN AS THE DISTURBANCE 
BEGINS TO EFFECT LOCAL WEATHER.  MAIN CONCERN WITH THIS SYSTEM WILL 
BE THE POTENTIAL FOR BRIEF PATCHY LIGHT FREEZING RAIN OVER NORTHERN 
LOCATIONS AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS WHERE OVERNIGHT LOWS FALL TO OR 
BELOW FREEZING.  RAINFALL COVERAGE IS EXPECTED TO BE MINIMAL AND 
AMOUNTS LIGHT BUT COULD SEE A FEW SLICK SPOTS DEVELOP WITH THE 
POSSIBILITY OF PATCHY BLACK ICE FORMING ON AREA ROADS.  THE SHOWERS 
WILL LINGER INTO FRIDAY MORNING BUT TEMPERATURES SHOULD RISE QUICKLY 
AS THE WARMING TREND CONTINUES.  AFTERNOON HIGHS ON FRIDAY SHOULD 
CLIMB INTO THE 50S.  HOWEVER...THIS WARM ADVECTION WILL ALSO CREATE 
WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT AND A FEW SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS WILL AGAIN BE 
POSSIBLE FRIDAY AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT EARLY IN THE PERIOD...ALTHOUGH GFS IS A BIT FASTER THAN 
MOST WITH THE FRONT THAT MOVES THROUGH.  WILL LEAN TOWARD A BLEND 
FOR FRONT TIMING.  RAIN WILL MOVE IN FRIDAY NIGHT AND LINGER INTO 
EARLY SATURDAY BEFORE TAPERING TO JUST A FEW SHOWERS OR SNOW SHOWERS 
SATURDAY NIGHT. FAIRLY STRONG LOW LEVEL JET WILL MOVE IN BRINGING 
QUITE A BIT OF MOISTURE...SO CAT POPS LOOK GOOD WITH THE MAIN BAND.  
MOUNTAIN WAVES STILL CANNOT BE RULED OUT FOR FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT NOT 
LOOKING QUITE AS FAVORABLE AS EARLIER...AS MODELS DISAGREE ON HOW 
MUCH OF A WESTERLY COMPONENT THE LOW LEVEL JET WILL HAVE AND ALSO 
THE STABLE LAYER LOOKS A BIT SHALLOW. FOR NOW WILL KEEP MENTION OF 
STRONG WINDS IN THE HWO...BUT NO HIGH WIND WATCH FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AT 
THIS POINT. SHOULD BE DRY SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT...THEN MODEL RUN 
TO RUN CONSISTENCY AND AGREEMENT IS NOT VERY GOOD FOR THE LATTER 
PERIODS.  GFS QUITE A BIT DRIER THAN ECMWF/CMC WITH THE MONDAY NIGHT 
COLD FRONT.  GIVEN UNCERTAINTY...MORE OF A BLENDED SOLUTION SEEMS 
PRUDENT...WITH LOW POPS FOR MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WED WITH THE 
FRONT FOLLOWED BY COLD ADVECTION/UPPER TROUGH.  FORECAST CONFIDENCE 
A BIT ABOVE AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR EARLY IN THE PERIOD...BUT 
FALLS BELOW AVERAGE LATE.  



&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             48  36  55  48  61 /  10  20  20 100  80 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  44  34  52  45  57 /  10  20  20  90  80 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       44  34  52  45  58 /  10  20  20  90  80 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              42  31  49  41  57 /  10  30  20  70  90

403 
FXUS64 KMRX 082018
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 PM EST WED JAN 8 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE 
OVER THE AREA WILL WEAKEN AND SHIFT EAST. TEMPERATURES HAVE RISEN TO 
NEAR FREEZING AND WILL CONTINUE TO RISE SLIGHTLY THROUGH SUNSET. A 
WEAK SHORT WAVE MOVING EAST THROUGH THE OH AND N TN VALLEYS THIS 
AFTERNOON IS BRINGING A SWATCH OF CIRRUS CLOUDS ACROSS THE REGION. A 
SECOND STRONGER SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE INTO THE TN VALLEY ON THURSDAY. 
CLOUD COVER WILL INCREASE AND LOWER TO THE MID LEVELS BY THE 
AFTERNOON. LOW LEVEL THICKNESS VALLEYS HOLD STEADY OVERNIGHT AND 
BEGIN TO RISE ON THU. TEMPERATURES REMAIN BELOW NORMAL TONIGHT AND 
RISE TO NEAR NORMAL ON THU.  

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
A WEAK SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION LATE THURSDAY 
NIGHT...AND TAP INTO SOME MODEST MOISTURE TO RESULT IN SOME LIGHT 
SHOWERS/DRIZZLE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. WITH LOWS HOVERING AROUND 
OR JUST BELOW THE FREEZING MARK ACROSS FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND 
PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...SOME LIGHT FREEZING DRIZZLE WILL BE 
POSSIBLE AROUND DAYBREAK...PERHAPS RESULTING IN SOME LOCALLY SLICK 
ROADWAYS AROUND RUSH HOUR FRIDAY MORNING. SOUTHEASTERLY WINDS WILL 
THEN PICK UP ON FRIDAY AND FRIDAY EVENING AHEAD OF A DEEP 
UPPER-TROUGH MOVING FROM THE PLAINS INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. GIVEN A 
STRONG UPPER JET...ALONG WITH THE SOUTHEASTERLY COMPONENT OF THE 
WINDS...CONDITIONS WILL BE FAVORABLE FOR MOUNTAIN WAVES ALONG THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN AND FOOTHILLS OF THE MOUNTAINS. THIS MAY WARRANT THE 
NEED FOR A WIND ADVISORY/HIGH WIND WATCH FOR THE TERRAIN/FOOTHILLS 
ON FRIDAY AND FRIDAY EVENING.

RAIN SHOWERS WILL THEN BEGIN TO OVERSPREAD THE AREA OVERNIGHT ON 
FRIDAY. MODELS HAVE BEEN TRENDING A LITTLE FASTER WITH THIS 
SYSTEM...SHOWING THE PRECIPITATION MOVING IN AFTER 06Z SATURDAY 
ALONG THE WESTERN ZONES...AND OVERSPREADING THE ENTIRE AREA BY 12Z. 
THEN AS DRY AIR SWEEPS IN FROM THE WEST...THE PRECIPITATION WILL 
BEGIN TO TAPER OFF FROM WEST TO EAST BY 18Z...BEFORE MOST OF IT 
CLEARS THE REGION 00Z. STILL HAVE SOME LOW-END MENTIONABLE POPS IN 
THE EASTERN HALF/MOUNTAINS PART OF THE CWA SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT 
CONFIDENCE IS INCREASING THAT MOST LOCATIONS WILL PROBABLY STAY DRY 
AS CLEARING OCCURS. HIGHS WILL BE AROUND SEASONABLE LEVELS FOR MUCH 
OF THE FIRST HALF OF THE NEW WEEK AS NO SURGE OF COOLER AIR WILL 
FOLLOW THE FRONT. THE BEST OPPORTUNITY FOR PRECIPITATION APPEARS TO 
BE TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY AS A WEAK TROUGH SWEEPS THROUGH THE 
AREA...GIVING A CHANCE FOR SOME ISOLATED TO SCATTERED LIGHT RAIN AND 
SNOW SHOWERS.
