365 
FXUS64 KMRX 081532
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 AM EST WED JAN 8 2014

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER TROUGH HAS LIFTED OUT OF 
THE AREA WITH FLOW ALOFT BECOMING ZONAL.  COLD SURFACE HIGH PULLING 
OUT AS WELL.  THIS WILL SHIFT WINDS TO THE WEST ...THEN SOUTHWEST 
TODAY...ALLOWING WARMER AIR TO SLOWLY FILTER IN.  THIS PATTERN 
CHANGE WILL USHER IN A WARMING TREND BEGINNING TODAY.  HIGHS SHOULD 
CLIMB TO ABOVE FREEZING ACROSS MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS THIS 
AFTERNOON...WITH VALLEY LOWS ONLY DROPPING INTO THE UPPER TEEN AND 
20S TONIGHT.  

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN PRETTY 
GOOD AGREEMENT FOR MUCH OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD...ALTHOUGH 
SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCES SHOW UP BY LATE IN THE PERIOD.  FORECAST 
CONFIDENCE IS A BIT ABOVE AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR THROUGH DAY 
5...BUT JUST AVERAGE LATE. WARMER AIR WILL BE MOVING IN THURSDAY AND 
THURSDAY NIGHT...AND SOME WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL MOVE ACROSS 
THE AREA THURSDAY NIGHT.  MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED...BUT MAY BE 
ENOUGH SHALLOW ISENTROPIC LIFT FOR SOME LIGHT PRECIP THURSDAY 
NIGHT.  WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THU NIGHT...AND WILL CONTINUE 
TO MENTION POSSIBILITY OF FREEZING RAIN NORTHERN ZONES AS SURFACE 
TEMPS COULD BE BELOW FREEZING. UPPER TROUGH WILL DIG TO OUR WEST 
FRIDAY THEN MOVE ACROSS THE AREA DURING THE WEEKEND...ALONG WITH A 
COLD FRONT.  AFTER A DRY AND MILD DAY FRIDAY...SHOULD SEE RAIN MOVE 
IN FRIDAY NIGHT AND CONTINUE INTO SATURDAY.  APPEARS LOW LEVEL JET 
WILL BE STRONG FRIDAY NIGHT AND DIRECTION MAY BE FAVORABLE FOR 
MOUNTAIN WAVES...SO WILL MENTION POSSIBLE WINDY CONDITIONS IN HWO.  
AIR BEHIND THE FRONT NOT PARTICULARLY COLD...BUT STILL COULD SEE 
RAIN SHOWERS TURN TO SNOW SHOWERS OVER SOME OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN 
BEFORE ENDING SUNDAY NIGHT...BUT AT THIS POINT LOOKS LIKE 
SIGNIFICANT WINTRY PRECIP IS UNLIKELY.  DRY SUNDAY BEHIND THE 
FRONT...THEN BY MONDAY ANOTHER WEAK SYSTEM MAY AFFECT THE AREA.  
QUITE A BIT OF UNCERTAINTY LATE...AS ECMWF SHOWS A WETTER TUESDAY.  
FOR NOW WILL KEEP FORECAST CONTINUITY AND GO DRY TUESDAY. 


&&

901 
FXUS64 KMRX 072007
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EST TUE JAN 7 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE AREA 
THAT HAD MOVED INTO THE GREAT LAKES THE PAST FEW DAYS WAS RETREATING 
BACK NORTH OVER HUDSON BAY AND NE CANADA THIS AFTERNOON. THE COLD 
SURFACE HIGH BEHIND IT THAT USHERED IN THE RECORD BREAKING COLD LAST 
NIGHT AND TODAY WAS NOW CENTERED FROM THE MIDDLE APPALACHIANS 
SOUTHWEST INTO THE LOWER MS VALLEY AND NORTHERN GULF COAST. WINDS 
HAVE BECOME LIGHT BUT STILL ABOUT 5 TO 10 MPH ACROSS SW VA. AS 
SURFACE HIGH SHIFTS TO THE SOUTHEAST STATES TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY 
AND UPPER TROUGH FLATTENS WINDS WILL SHIFT TO THE WEST AND SOUTHWEST 
BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE WILL INCREASE IN THE 
AFTERNOON BUT SHOULD NOT AFFECT WARMING.

SMALL SNOWPACK IN THE VALLEYS AND LARGER SNOWPACK IN THE MOUNTAINS 
MAY AFFECT HIGHS SLIGHTLY THURSDAY SO WENT ON THE COOL SIDE OF 
GUIDANCE...MOSTLY LOWER TO MID 30S NE TN AND SW VA AND UPPER 30S TO 
LOWER 40S FARTHER SOUTH. IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE MOUNTAINS 
HIGHS EXPECTED TO BE NEAR FREEZING. LOWS TONIGHT WARMER THAN LAST 
NIGHT BY ABOUT 5 TO 7 DEGREES MOSTLY 5 TO 10 DEGREES ABOVE ZERO BUT 
LOCALLY NEAR 0 WHERE THERE IS SNOWPACK IN THE HIGHER VALLEYS OF NE 
TN AND SW VA. SOUTHWEST WINDS ALOFT ON WEST SIDE OF ARCTIC HIGH 
TONIGHT WILL LIKELY AFFECT HIGHER SPOTS OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU 
AND MID SLOPE ELEVATIONS OF SW VA AND EASTERN TN MOUNTAINS...WHERE 
LOWS MAY NOT FALL MORE THAN A FEW DEGREES BELOW THIS AFTERNOONS 
HIGHS...THOUGH THIS MAY BE OFFSET WHERE THERE IS SOME SNOW COVER.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE NOW IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGHOUT THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...AND REVEAL A WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN DEVELOPING 
WITH TWO SYSTEMS AFFECTING THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE FRIDAY 
NIGHT/SATURDAY AND SUNDAY/SUNDAY NIGHT TIME PERIODS. SOUTHERLY WINDS 
ON THE BACK SIDE OF A DEPARTING ARCTIC HIGH WILL CONTINUE TO BRING A 
WARMING TREND OVER THE FORECAST AREA INTO THE WEEKEND. IN FACT... 
TEMPS SHOULD RISE ABOVE NORMAL AS EARLY AS FRIDAY...WITH WARM TEMPS 
LINGERING INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. MODELS INDICATE SOME WEAK ISENTROPIC 
LIFT DEVELOPING OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY BEGINNING ON THURSDAY 
NIGHT...DUE TO THE WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN. WITH TEMPS EXPECTED 
TO BE NEAR FREEZING OVER NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA ON FRIDAY 
MORNING...WILL MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME FREEZING RAIN...BUT 
RIGHT NOW IT APPEARS THAT ANY PRECIP AMOUNTS WILL BE VERY LIGHT AND 
SPOTTY. A WEAK COLD FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH A NORTHERN JET STREAM 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY 
LATE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY...BRINGING NUMEROUS SHOWERS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. ANOTHER SOUTHERN JET STREAM LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL 
THEN QUICKLY MOVE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON SUNDAY 
AND SUNDAY NIGHT...BRINGING A GOOD CHANCE FOR ADDITIONAL SHOWERS. AS 
FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND TOWARDS A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS AND THE COOLER ECMWF GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD.

.DISCUSSION...COLD ARCTIC SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE NOW CENTERED OVER

FEBRUARY 1996. MOUNT LECONTES LOW WAS -17. WINDS ARE BEGINNING TO
DECREASE THIS MORNING AND WILL BE LESS THAN 10 MPH AS THE SURFACE
HIGH MOVES OVERHEAD THIS AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES LATE THIS MORNING
ARE IN THE LOWER SINGLE DIGITS TO LOWER TEENS AND EXPECT HIGHS TO
BE ABOUT 10 TO LOWER 20S WHICH IS SIMILAR TO CURRENT FORECAST. SNOW
FLURRIES HAVE ENDED AND SKIES HAVE BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR EXCEPT FOR
SMALL AREAS IN SW VA AND THE NE TN MOUNTAINS. HAVE UPDATED FORECAST
TO REMOVE FLURRIES...AND UPDATE SKY COVER. WILL UPDATE TEXT AGAIN
AT NOON TO REMOVE WIND CHILL ADVISORIES AND WARNING.

905 
FXUS64 KMRX 070804
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 AM EST TUE JAN 7 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD 
OVER THE AREA. IT WILL CONTINUE TO BE QUITE COLD. LINGERING LOW 
CLOUDS AND FLURRIES WILL DIMINISH AS THE COLD ADVECTION WEAKENS AND 
ENDS...WITH MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS EXPECTED ALL ZONES BY THIS 
AFTERNOON. IT WILL BE MOSTLY CLEAR TONIGHT.  THE WIND CHILL ADVISORY 
AND WARNING WILL REMAIN IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AS IMPACT IS CERTAINLY 
THERE...EVEN IF WIND SPEED PART OF THE CRITERIA MAY BE BORDERLINE AT 
BEST IN SOME AREAS.  WILL NOT ARGUE MUCH WITH MAV TEMPS. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...ON WEDNESDAY...AN UPPER 
TROUGH WILL CONTINUE TO PULL OUT OF THE AREA WITH FLOW ALOFT 
BECOMING ZONAL AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN.  THIS WILL BRING 
IN WARM ADVECTION AND BEGIN A STRONG WARMING TREND.  TEMPERATURES 
WILL WARM A BIT EACH DAY OF THE FIRST HALF OF THE EXTENDED WITH 
HIGHS REACHING A BIT ABOVE NORMAL BY FRIDAY.  THE WARM ADVECTION 
WILL ALSO CREATE WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT WHICH MAY GENERATE PATCHY 
LIGHT RAIN LATE THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY NIGHT.  COOLER TEMPERATURES 
OVER NORTH AREAS COULD SEE BRIEF PATCHY FREEZE RAIN OR DRIZZLE 
THOUGH AMOUNTS SHOULD BE QUITE LIGHT.  WILL THEN MOVE INTO A WET 
PATTERN AS A WEAK...BROAD COLD FRONT MOVES IN AROUND THE FRIDAY 
NIGHT/SATURDAY TIME FRAME.  THE FRONT WILL BE HELD UP AS IT MOVES 
EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS AS A SHORT WAVE MOVE ALONG IT AND BRINGS 
ANOTHER ROUND OF PRECIP INTO THE AREA ON SUNDAY INTO SUNDAY 
NIGHT...POSSIBLY LINGERING INTO MONDAY.  AT THIS TIME TEMPERATURES 
SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR AN ALL RAIN EVENT.

&&

WILL FALL TO 15 TO 20 DEGREES BELOW ZERO ACROSS THE TRI-CITIES THE
REST OF THE NIGHT...SO HAVE UPGRADED TO A WIND CHILL WARNING.

RADAR SHOWS SOME VERY LIGHT RETURNS OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE...SO A FEW LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS/FLURRIES REMAIN POSSIBLE...

349 
FXUS64 KMRX 061957
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
257 PM EST MON JAN 6 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...AN ARCTIC AIR MASS WILL
CONTINUE TO PUSH INTO THE REGION TONIGHT. RECORD LOW TEMPERATURES
TONIGHT WILL BE IN THE LOW SINGLE DIGITS...WITH A FEW OF THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS BELOW ZERO. WINDS SHOULD REMAIN GUSTY THROUGH
EVENING...WITH CALM WINDS BY MORNING. DANGEROUS WIND CHILL VALUES
STILL A CONCERN BETWEEN -5 AND -15 IN MOST AREAS...WITH UP TO -25
IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WILL KEEP THE WIND CHILL ADVISORY AND
WARNING GOING THROUGH NOON TUESDAY. TUESDAY...REGION STILL UNDER
THE EFFECTS OF THE ARCTIC AIR MASS WITH RECORD LOW HIGH
TEMPERATURES. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BEGIN TO STRENGTHEN DURING
TUESDAY...WITH CLEARING SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD
AGREEMENT WITH A WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN DEVELOPING FOR THE END
OF THE WEEK...BUT THEN BEGIN TO DIVERGE DURING THE WEEKEND WITH THE
PLACEMENT OF A STALLED FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE SOUTHEAST. A LARGE
DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIAN REGION TUESDAY NIGHT...WITH A WARM AIR ADVECTION
PATTERN DEVELOPING ON WEDNESDAY AS SOUTHERLY WINDS DEVELOP ON THE
BACK SIDE OF THIS EASTWARD-DRIFTING HIGH. GFS AND ECMWF MODELS ARE
IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT PATCHY LIGHT PRECIP WILL BE POSSIBLE DURING
THE THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT TIME PERIOD...AS SOME
ISENTROPIC LIFT DEVELOPS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY DUE TO THE WARM
AIR ADVECTION PATTERN. WITH TEMPS EXPECTED TO BE NEAR FREEZING OVER
NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA ON THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY
MORNING...WILL PLAN TO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF FREEZING
RAIN...BUT RIGHT NOW IT APPEARS THAT PRECIP AMOUNTS WILL BE VERY
LIGHT AND SPOTTY. BOTH THE ECMWF AND GFS MODELS AGREE THAT RAIN
CHANCES WILL INCREASE ON SATURDAY... AS A WEAK COLD FRONT MOVES
ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. HOWEVER...THE ECMWF MODEL REVEALS A
CONTINUED WET PATTERN FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY DUE TO THIS FRONTAL
BOUNDARY STALLING-OUT OVER THE CAROLINAS. WILL PLAN TO TREND
TOWARDS THE ECMWF SOLUTION IN THE LATTER PERIODS... SINCE THE GFS
MODEL APPEARS TO BE TRENDING THAT WAY WITH EACH SUCCESSIVE MODEL
RUN. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND COOLER THEN THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS
THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH IS IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE
ENSEMBLE MEANS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN   2  18  11  40  24 /  10   0   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                        1  18  11  40  24 /  10   0   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN               1  15   7  38  22 /  10  10   0   0  10

100 PM EST MON JAN 6 2014

.AVIATION...
THERE IS ENOUGH LIFT PRESENT IN CENTRAL TENNESSEE AND KENTUCKY THAT
LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS ARE DEVELOPING AND MOVING SOUTHEAST THROUGH EAST
TENNESSEE. VFR CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED THROUGH THE PERIOD AT ALL
THREE TAF SITES...WITH KTRI SEEING A POSSIBLE BRIEF PERIOD OF MVFR
CONDITIONS DUE TO A HEAVIER SNOW SHOWER PASSING OVER THE TAF SITE.
OTHERWISE...SKIES WILL BEGIN TO CLEAR BY 12Z TUESDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1016 AM EST MON JAN 6 2014

.DISCUSSION...
AN ARCTIC AIR MASS WILL CONTINUE TO PUSH INTO THE AREA. AMPLE
MOISTURE IS STILL PRESENT IN THE LOW LEVELS...SO WILL CONTINUE TO
SEE FLURRIES THROUGH THE EARLY AFTERNOON IN NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. UPSLOPE FLOW WILL KEEP SNOW SHOWERS LIKELY IN THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS THROUGH THE EVENING...BUT AM NOT EXPECTING MORE THAN AN
ADDITIONAL INCH TO INCH AND A HALF OF SNOW ACCUMULATION. HIGH
TEMPERATURES FOR THE DAY HAVE ALREADY BEEN REACHED. FROM HERE...TEMPERATURES
WILL STEADILY FALL THROUGH THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. WIND CHILL
VALUES BELOW ZERO ARE BEGINNING TO OCCUR AT SITES ACROSS THE AREA.
VALUES WILL CONTINUE TO DROP TO SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW ZERO THROUGH
THE EVENING AND NIGHT. OTHERWISE...REST OF THE FORECAST IS STILL ON
TRACK.

727 
FXUS64 KMRX 060929
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
429 AM EST MON JAN 6 2014

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MAIN BAND OF PRECIP EXITING 
THE AREA...BUT EXPECT SOME SNOW SHOWERS AND FLURRIES TO LINGER IN 
THE COLD ADVECTION TODAY INTO TONIGHT.  WHILE ADDITIONAL 
ACCUMULATION IN MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS EXPECTED TO RANGE FROM NOTHING 
TO LESS THAN AN INCH...WITH THE FLURRIES/SNOW SHOWERS AND 
POSSIBILITY OF BLACK ICE WILL GO AHEAD AND KEEP THE WINTER WEATHER 
ADVISORIES AS THEY ARE FOR NOW.  VERY HIGH RATIO SNOW WITH THE SNOW 
SHOWERS IN THE MOUNTAINS MAY LEAD TO MORE SUBSTANTIAL ACCUMULATIONS 
THERE...SO WILL KEEP WARNING IN PLACE.  BITTER COLD AIR MOVING IN 
COMBINED WITH THE WINDS WILL BRING DANGEROUS WIND CHILLS THIS 
AFTERNOON INTO TUESDAY MORNING. WILL KEEP WIND CHILL 
ADVISORIES/WARNINGS IN PLACE...BUT WILL MOVE UP START TIME TO NOON 
EST. OBS SHOW WINDS NOT MEETING WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA AND THIS 
TREND IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE...SO WILL CANCEL THE WIND ADVISORY.  
TEMPERATURES EXPECTED TO SLOWLY FALL TODAY...AND RECORD LOWS 
EXPECTED TONIGHT.  STILL QUITE COLD TUESDAY BUT MORE SUNSHINE.  WILL 
MAKE A FEW TWEAKS TO MAV TEMPS BUT OVERALL THEY LOOK REASONABLE.  

RECORD LOW TEMPS FOR TUESDAY MORNING...
CHA...9 IN 1970
TYS...6 IN 1970
TRI...5 IN 1970


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...DEEP EASTERN U.S. UPPER 
TROUGH WILL DEAMPLIFY AS IT MOVES OUT ACROSS THE CANADIAN MARITIMES. 
THIS WILL ALLOW THE AIR MASS SOURCE REGION TO SWITCH FROM THE POLAR 
REGION TO THE PACIFIC OCEAN. IT WILL TAKE A WHILE BUT THE RESULTING 
WARMING TREND WILL FEEL MUCH BETTER THAN THE ARCTIC CHILL. HIGH 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE ABOUT TWENTY DEGREE WARMER ON WEDNESDAY WHICH 
COULD FEEL DOWNRIGHT BALMY COMPARED TO TUESDAY'S MAXES AND HIGHS 
SHOULD BE BACK ABOVE NORMAL FRIDAY INTO THE WEEKEND AS LOW LEVEL 
WIND FLOW RETURNS TO A MORE SOUTHERLY DIRECTION. STILL TUESDAY NIGHT 
LOW TEMPERATURES WILL BE FRIGID TO SAY THE LEAST...RANGING FROM THE 
SINGLE DIGITS NORTH TO THE LOWER TEENS SOUTH. THE RETURN TO WARMER 
AIR WILL BE ACCOMPANIED BY INCREASING MOISTURE. 
UNFORTUNATELY...EXTENDED RANGE MODEL SOLUTIONS CONTINUE TO DIFFER 
THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY WITH DIFFERING DEPICTION OF SHORTER 
WAVELENGTH SYSTEM TIMING/STRENGTH. GENERALLY TRIED TO CUT POPS BACK 
A BIT DURING THE DAY THURSDAY AS A WEAK SHORT WAVE BUILDS ACROSS THE 
MIDWEST INTO THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. WITH THIS FEATURE MOVING AWAY TO 
THE EAST ON FRIDAY...LOWERED POPS BACK TO SLIGHT CHANCE. IT STILL 
APPEARS THAT A MORE AMPLIFIED SYSTEM COULD MOVE INTO THE REGION ON 
SATURDAY SO KEPT HIGHER CHANCE POPS AT THIS TIME STEP AGAIN 
ADJUSTING A LITTLE LOWER ON SUNDAY WHILE AWAITING ANOTHER SYSTEM FOR 
LATER SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. HAD TO APPLY A CHANCE FOR LIGHT 
FREEZING RAIN FOR A BRIEF PERIOD THURSDAY MORNING ON THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU WITH A WARMER...MOIST AIR MASS MOVING IN ALOFT WITH 
SUB-FREEZING LOW TEMPERATURES THURSDAY MORNING. DID THE SAME FOR THE 
NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY 
MORNING WITH A CHANCE FOR THE SAME SCENARIO WITH WARMER AIR MOVING 
IN ALOFT. STILL A FAIR AMOUNT OF UNCERTAINTY WITH THIS PERIOD OF THE 
FORECAST WITH MODELS INDICATING ONLY WEAK LIFT AND THUS ONLY BRIEF 
PERIODS OF LIGHT FREEZING PRECIPITATION POSSIBLE. 


&&

.AVIATION...RAIN RAPIDLY CHANGING TO SNOW AT CHA AND WILL BE
SWITCHING OVER TO SNOW AT TYS/TRI AROUND 08-09Z AS COLD ADVECTION
STRENGTHENS AT THE FRONT EDGE OF THE ARCTIC SURGE. STRONG AND GUSTY
WEST TO NORTHWEST WINDS MAY ALLOW FOR A VARIATION FROM IFR TO MVFR
CATEGORY OVERNIGHT. BETTER SNOWFALL RATES CREATING LOWER VISIBILITY
SHOULD END AROUND 11-14Z TIME FRAME BUT A CONTINUATION OF LIGHT
SNOW SHOWERS AND CEILINGS BETWEEN 2500-3500 FEET AGL SHOULD REMAIN
THE DOMINANT FEATURE THROUGH LATE IN THE FORECAST PERIOD AT TRI AND
TO A LESSER EXTENT AT TYS.

ACROSS THE PLATEAU AND WESTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY AS ARCTIC BOUNDARY

GETTING SEVERAL REPORTS OF ACCUMULATING SNOWS ACROSS THE PLATEAU.
LATEST MODELS SHOW 1 TO 3 INCHES OVER MOST OF THE AREA WITH THE
HEAVIEST ACCUMULATIONS OVER THE NORTHERN PLATEAN AND WESTERN
TENNESSEE VALLEY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
834 PM EST SUN JAN 5 2014

.DISCUSSION...UPDATED TO INCLUDE A WIND ADVISORY FOR TONIGHT AND
MONDAY MORNING. ALSO...MADE CHANGES TO HOURLY TEMPERATURE FORECAST
TO REFLECT TIMING OF FRONTAL PASSAGE.

STRONG PRESSURE RISES (TEMPERATURE GRADIENT) BEHIND PASSAGE OF ARCTIC COLD
FRONT IS PRODUCING BRISK NORTHWEST WINDS BETWEEN 15 AND 30 MPH WITH
GUSTS UP TO 40 MPH. THE STRONG WINDS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE MORNING...
SO HAVE ISSUED A WIND ADVISORY FOR THE ENTIRE AREA. RADAR SHOWS A
FINE LINE WITH THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. LATEST TIMING SHOWS FROPA AT
CHA AROUND 945 PM...TYS AROUND 1030 PM AND TRI AROUND 1245 AM.

EVEN BEFORE FRONTAL PASSAGE...REPORTS OF STRONG WINDS OVER THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS DUE TO A LOW-LEVEL JET OF 40-50 KTS AHEAD OF THE
FRONT.

AS FOR THE SNOW...DURING THE PAST COUPLE HOURS RADAR SHOWS AN
ENHANCEMENT OF PRECIPITATION BACK INTO THE COLDER AIR WITH SNOW
BEING REPORTED ON THE BACK EDGE OF THE INCOMING FRONTAL BAND. WFO
BNA REPORTED 1/2 INCH OF SNOWFALL NEAR ASHLAND CITY..TN (CHEATHAM
COUNTY). LATEST MODEL SOUNDINGS CONTINUE TO SHOW A WINDOW BETWEEN
03-09Z FOR BEST CHANCE OF ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL. CURRENT FORECAST
SNOW ACCUMULATION LOOKS GOOD.

SNOW WILL TAPER TO FLURRIES MONDAY MORNING AS MID-LEVEL MOISTURE
MOVES OUT WITH BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE REMAINING.

CURRENT WSW PRODUCT CONCERNING SNOWFALL AND WIND CHILLS LOOK ON
TRACK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
628 PM EST SUN JAN 5 2014

.AVIATION...LARGE AREA OF RAIN AHEAD OF THE ARCTIC COLD FRONT WILL 
BE SPILLING EASTWARD INTO THE VALLEY LOCATIONS VERY SOON. RAIN WILL 
QUICKLY CHANGE TO SNOW OR SNOW SHOWERS BEHIND THE FAST MOVING FRONT.
EXPECTING CONDITIONS TO FALL INTO MVFR AND POSSIBLY IFR...ALTHO 
BRISK W TO NW WINDS WITH GUSTS TO 25 TO 30 KTS...MAY KEEP CEILINGS 
AND VISBYS FROM BOTTOMING OUT. 

CHA AND TYS WILL IMPROVE TO VFR BY MID MORNING MONDAY...WHILE MVFR 
CONDITIONS AND OCNL SNOW SHOWERS CONTINUE FOR MOST OF THE PERIOD AT 
TRI.

742 
FXUS64 KMRX 051950
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EST SUN JAN 5 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
RAIN MOVING ACROSS MIDDLE TN IS ON PACE TO REACH OUR PLATEAU 
COUNTIES AROUND 00Z. PROJECTING THE CURRENT SPEED OF THE COLD 
FRONT...IT APPEARS TO BE ABOUT THREE HOURS BEHIND THAT...WHICH IS 
SUPPORTED BY THE NAM AND GFS. SO WE SHOULD BEGIN TO SEE A CHANGEOVER 
TO SNOW ARRIVING AROUND 03-04Z. THERE IS ABOUT A 3-4 HOUR WINDOW AS 
THE DEEP MOISTURE AND STRONG LIFT MOVES THROUGH BEHIND THE FRONT 
BEFORE DRYING ALOFT ENDS PRECIP AROUND 09Z. MOST SNOW ACCUMULATIONS 
WILL OCCUR IN THIS TIME FRAME...WITH A DUSTING TO 2 INCHES IS 
EXPECTED FOR THE PLATEAU AND TN VALLEY...WITH UP TO 3 IN HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. PERHAPS THE GREATER IMPACT WILL BE THE RAPID FREEZE THAT 
WILL OCCUR WITH THE GROUND BEING WET. THIS COULD CAUSE ICING 
PROBLEMS ON ROADS AREA WIDE TONIGHT. WITH THE ICING CONCERNS LASTING 
THROUGH MONDAY MORNING...WILL EXTEND THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY TO 
NOON.

A WEST-NORTHWEST UPSLOPE FLOW AND STEEP LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES WILL 
KEEP SNOW SHOWERS GOING IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS MONDAY...WITH FLURRIES 
ELSEWHERE. THIS IS NOT AN IDEAL NW FLOW PATTERN...AS THE FLOW IS 
MAINLY WESTERLY WITHOUT A CONNECTION TO THE GREAT LAKES. SO SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS ARE NOT EXPECTED TO BE 
EXCESSIVE...BETWEEN 3 AND 5 INCHES...JUST ABOVE WARNING CRITERIA. 

ON MONDAY AFTERNOON THE MODELS BRING A SECOND SURGE OF ARCTIC 
AIR...WITH 850 MB TEMPS FALLING BELOW -20C. LOW TEMPS MONDAY NIGHT 
WILL BE BELOW ZERO IN THE MOUNTAINS...WITH LOW SINGLE DIGITS IN THE 
VALLEY...BREAKING RECORD LOWS. WINDS WILL BE 10-20 MPH IN MOST 
SPOTS...UP TO 25 MPH IN THE MOUNTAINS. THE CURRENT WIND CHILL WATCH 
WILL BE CHANGED TO A WARNING...AND A WIND CHILL ADVISORY WILL BE 
ISSUED FOR THE VALLEY FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH NOON TUESDAY. 
LIGHT FLURRIES MAY CONTINUE INTO TUESDAY IN THE MOUNTAINS...BUT WITH 
LITTLE ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATION.

RECORD LOW TEMPS FOR TUESDAY MORNING...
CHA...9 IN 1970
TYS...6 IN 1970
TRI...5 IN 1970

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN OVER THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH
WEDNESDAY. LOW TEMPERATURES TUESDAY NIGHT WILL BE WELL BELOW
NORMAL...AS THIS ARCTIC AIRMASS PERSISTS THROUGH THE NIGHT. MOSTLY
CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS WILL BE PRESENT THOUGH WEDNESDAY. HIGH
PRESSURE WILL SLOWLY MOVE TO THE EAST...WITH FLOW FROM THE
SOUTHWEST SETTING UP OVER THE AREA. TEMPERATURES WILL SLOWLY WARM
WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT...BECOMING CLOSE TO NORMAL FOR THIS
TIME OF THE YEAR.

NEXT CHANCE FOR RAIN WILL MOVE IN ON THURSDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING AS A 
SHORTWAVE MOVES THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY. WARMER MID LEVEL AIR IS 
PRESENT OVER FREEZING TEMPERATURES AT THE SURFACE THURSDAY EVENING
FREEZING RAIN COULD BE POSSIBLE ON THE PLATEAU...BUT TIMING OF 
MOISTURE IN SOME MODELS IS PLACED AFTER THE WARM AIR ADVECTION AT 
THE SURFACE...MAKING THIS THREAT NONEXISTENT.  MODELS DIFFER ON 
TIMING OF ANOTHER SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVING THROUGH THE REST OF THE 
WEEKEND. RAIN CHANCES WILL STAY ELEVATED THROUGH THE REST OF THE 
PERIOD. TEMPERATURES WILL BE ABOVE FREEZING THROUGH THIS TIME...WITH 
LIMITED LIFT...SO EXPECTING ONLY RAIN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1226 PM EST SUN JAN 5 2014

.AVIATION...
RAIN WILL BE SPREADING INTO THE AREA FROM WEST TO EAST BEGINNING
AROUND 23Z. CONDITIONS WILL BE PREDOMINANTLY MVFR ONCE THE RAIN
BEGINS...WITH TEMPORARY IFR CONDITIONS WITH HEAVIER RAINFALL. A
COLD FRONT WILL BRING COLDER AIR TOWARD MIDNIGHT...CHANGING THE
RAIN TO SNOW. MAINLY MVFR CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED BEHIND THE FRONT.
WINDS WILL ALSO SHIFT TO THE WEST AND BECOME GUSTY. VFR CONDITIONS
SHOULD RETURN TO CHA AND TYS BY LATE MORNING...BUT TRI WILL LIKELY
REMAIN MVFR WITH SNOW FLURRIES THROUGH THE MORNING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
955 AM EST SUN JAN 5 2014

.DISCUSSION...
NO CHANGES WILL BE NEEDED TO THE FORECAST THIS MORNING. MOSTLY
CLOUDY SKIES WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE DAY...THEN RAIN WILL BEGIN
MOVING INTO THE AREA FROM THE WEST IN THE LATE AFTERNOON.

COMPARING THE LATEST MODEL RUNS TO YESTERDAY...IT LOOKS LIKE THE
WINDOW FOR ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL LOOKS SMALLER. THE BEST LIFT AND
MOISTURE MOVES THROUGH BETWEEN 00Z AND 06Z...JUST ALONG OR AHEAD
OF THE COLD AIR SURGE...WHEREAS YESTERDAY THE LIFT/MOISTURE WAS A
BIT FURTHER BEHIND THE FRONT. THE TRANSITION TO SNOW REACHES OUR
PLATEAU COUNTIES AROUND 03Z IN THE NAM AND GFS...WHICH MAY ALLOW
FOR ONLY AN INCH OR LESS ACCUMULATION IN THE VALLEY AND POSSIBLY UP
TO 2 IN THE PLATEAU AND LOWER ELEVATIONS OF SW VA. HOWEVER...WITH
THE RAPID SURGE OF COLD AIR AND WET GROUND FROM THE RAIN...ROADS
MAY TURN ICY QUICKLY MONDAY NIGHT.

ALL ADVISORY AND WARNING PRODUCTS LOOK GOOD AND WILL NOT NEED TO BE
CHANGED.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
618 AM EST SUN JAN 5 2014

.AVIATION...A COLD FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH DURING THE PERIOD.
MOISTURE WILL INCREASE...WITH SOME RAIN MOVING IN FOLLOWED BY A
CHANGE OVER TO SNOW BEFORE THE PRECIP TAPERS OFF TO FLURRIES AND
SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS. MVFR CONDITIONS EXPECTED MAJORITY OF THE
PERIOD FOR CHA...WITH MVFR CONDITIONS AT TYS FOR MUCH OF THE PERIOD
AS WELL AND TO A LESSER EXTENT AT TRI. LOWER CONDITIONS CANNOT BE
RULED OUT. WINDS WILL BECOME GUSTY AND BECOME WEST TO NORTHWEST
LATER IN THE PERIOD.   


&&

     FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

     MONDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

     FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE 
     SMOKY MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...
     UNICOI.

     WIND CHILL WATCH FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING 
     FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLEDSOE...BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...EAST POLK...
     JOHNSON...MARION...MORGAN...SCOTT TN...SEQUATCHIE...SEVIER 
     SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...
     SOUTHEAST MONROE...UNICOI.

224 
FXUS64 KMRX 051012
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
512 AM EST SUN JAN 5 2014

.SHORT TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...A COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH 
TODAY AND WILL SWING THROUGH THIS EVEING. BITTER COLD AIR WILL PUSH 
IN BEHIND THE FRONT TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY.  RAIN WILL MOVE IN LATER 
TODAY INTO TONIGHT...AND WILL CHANGE TO SNOW BEFORE ENDING. SNOW 
AMOUNTS ARE EXPECTED TO BE ON THE LIGHT SIDE FOR MOST VALLEY 
LOCATIONS...WITH HEAVIER AMOUNTS OVER SOME OF THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
AS SNOW SHOWERS LINGER IN THE NORTHEST FLOW AND COLD ADVECTION 
MONDAY.  WILL ISSUE A SNOW ADVISORY FOR THE VALLEY AND PLATEAU 
COUNTIES...AND WILL UPGRADE THE CURRENT WATCH TO A WARNING FOR SOME 
OF THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AS WELL AS WISE 
COUNTY VA.  THE WINDS AND COLD TEMPERATURES WILL LEAD TO VERY LOW 
WIND CHILL VALUES...AND APPEARS WE MAY BEGIN TO REACH WIND CHILL 
WARNING CRITERIA DURING THE AFTERNOON MONDAY OVER SOME OF THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS.  WILL ISSUE A WIND CHILL WATCH FOR THE 
PLATEAU...SOUTHWEST VA...SOUTHWEST NC...AND THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS 
THAT WILL CARRY OVER INTO TUE.  A WIND CHILL ADVISORY MAY BE NEEDED 
IN THE VALLEY AS EARLY AS MONDAY...BUT WILL HOLD OFF FOR NOW AS IT 
MAY BE BORDERLINE MONDAY.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...DEEP EASTERN U.S. UPPER 
TROUGH WILL SHIFT SLOWLY EAST THROUGH THE EARLY PART OF THE FORECAST 
PERIOD. BITTER COLD ARCTIC AIR WILL CONTINUE TO SPILL INTO THE 
REGION WELL INTO TUESDAY NIGHT PULLING TEMPERATURES DOWN TO LEVELS 
WHICH WILL BE 25 TO 30 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL WITH RECORD LOWS IN 
JEOPARDY TUESDAY MORNING AS THE COLDEST OF THE AIR BUILDS ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT PRODUCED BY THE 
DENSE COLD AIRMASS WILL KEEP A HEALTHY WESTERLY WIND BLOWING MONDAY 
NIGHT INTO TUESDAY LOWERING WIND CHILL VALUES TO AS LOW AS 10 TO 15 
BELOW ZERO IN THE VALLEY WITH VALUES AROUND 20 TO 30 BELOW IN THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN. THE WESTERLY FLOW WILL ALSO KEEP SNOW SHOWERS GOING 
ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND ALONG THE TENNESSEE 
AND NORTH CAROLINA BORDER WITH SNOW FLURRIES POSSIBLE ACROSS THE 
VALLEY IN NORTHEAST TENNESSEE THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING. THE UPPER 
LEVEL FLOW TRANSITIONS TO SOUTHWESTERLY RELATIVELY QUICKLY WEDNESDAY 
INTO THURSDAY WITH THE ARRIVAL OF YET ANOTHER WEAK SHORT WAVE 
THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY NIGHT AND THIS SHOULD ALLOW FOR A WELCOME 
WARMING TREND WHICH CONTINUES INTO THE WEEKEND. THIS PERIOD OF THE 
FORECAST (THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY) HAS A LITTLE HIGHER LEVEL OF 
UNCERTAINTY THAN USUAL WITH DIVERGENCE OF MODEL SOLUTIONS. ALTHOUGH 
IT APPEARS A LITTLE STRONGER...MORE AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH WITH 
DECENT MOISTURE ADVECTION OFF THE GULF OF MEXICO BUILDS INTO THE 
REGION FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY SO TRIED TO KEEP POPS FOR RAIN LOW WHILE 
INDICATING A TREND TOWARD HIGHER PROBABILITY. ONE FLY IN THE 
OINTMENT WILL BE IF LIGHT PRECIPITATION DEVELOPS OVERNIGHT WEDNESDAY 
INTO THURSDAY MORNING IN AN ENVIRONMENT WHERE THE LOWER LEVELS OF THE 
ATMOSPHERE DON'T WARM SUFFICIENTLY...SOME FREEZING RAIN OR SLEET MAY 
DEVELOP FOR A BRIEF PERIOD ACROSS THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AS 
WELL AS SOME OF THE COLDER VALLEYS IN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND EXTREME 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY MORNING. THIS WILL 
COME INTO BETTER FOCUS IN THE COMING DAYS.

337 
FXUS64 KMRX 042001
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
301 PM EST SAT JAN 4 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
CLOUDS WILL BE INCREASING TONIGHT AS A SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW 
ADVECTS MOISTURE INTO THE AREA. WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES 
EXPECTED...WILL LEAN TOWARD THE WARM SIDE OF MOS FOR LOW TEMPS. THE 
MOISTURE LOOKS TOO SHALLOW TO PRODUCE ANY PRECIP IN OUR AREA. 

A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IN THE PLAINS TONIGHT WILL TRACK 
NORTHEAST TO THE GREAT LAKES BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON. DEEP MOISTURE AND 
ISENTROPIC LIFT ARRIVE LATE IN THE AFTERNOON...WHICH IS LATER THAN 
PREVIOUSLY FORECAST. THE STRONGEST LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH 
FRONTOGENETIC FORCING ARRIVES AFTER 00Z. THE TRICKY PART IS THAT 
THIS IS THE SAME TIME AS THE ARRIVAL OF THE SUB-FREEZING 850 MB 
TEMPS. SO THE TRANSITION FROM RAIN TO SNOW APPEARS TO OCCUR WHEN 
PRECIP IS HEAVIEST. DRYING ALOFT FOLLOWS SOON AFTER. THUS WE COULD 
SEE ABOUT A 3-TO-6 HOUR WINDOW OF MODERATE SNOWFALL RATES WITH A 
QUICK 1-3 INCH ACCUMULATION POSSIBLE. BY 12Z MONDAY...WE TRANSITION 
TO A NW FLOW PATTERN WITH STEEP LAPSE RATES SUPPORTING SNOW SHOWERS. 
MOST ACCUMULATIONS ON MONDAY WILL BE IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS...WITH 
MAINLY FLURRIES IN THE VALLEY. 

A WINTER STORM WATCH WILL BE ISSUED FROM 10 PM SUNDAY TO 7 PM MONDAY 
FOR THE TN MOUNTAINS AND FOR WISE COUNTY VA...WHICH ARE THE AREAS 
THAT WILL RECEIVE GREATER AMOUNTS FROM THE NW FLOW PATTERN ON 
MONDAY. FOR THE REST OF THE AREA...SNOW AMOUNTS ARE EXPECTED TO 
RANGE FROM A DUSTING TO 3 INCHES...BUT THERE IS MUCH UNCERTAINTY AT 
THIS POINT AS AMOUNTS WILL DEPEND ON HOW QUICKLY THE COLD AIR MOVES 
IN BEHIND THE EXITING LIFT/MOISTURE. AS THE CHANGE TO SNOW WILL 
BEGIN SUNDAY EVENING...ABOUT 30 HOURS FROM NOW...AND THERE IS STILL 
MUCH UNCERTAINTY...WILL CONTINUE WITH THE SPS RATHER THAN ISSUING AN 
EARLY ADVISORY. 

WIND CHILL VALUES ON MONDAY COULD DROP INTO THE ADVISORY 
RANGE...BELOW -5...IN THE VALLEY. HIGHER ELEVATIONS COULD SEE WIND 
CHILL WARNING CRITERIA OF -15 OR LOWER. WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION 
THIS THREAT IN THE SPS.

LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
THE COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO PROGRESS EAST OF THE AREA TUESDAY.
UPSLOPE FLOW WILL SET IN BEHIND THE FRONT...WITH LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS
CONTINUING INTO TUESDAY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE SMOKY
MOUNTAINS. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE REMAINS HIGH THROUGH THE DAY SO AREAS
NORTH OF KNOXVILLE WILL BE SLOW TO CLEAR SKIES. DAILY RECORD
BREAKING LOW TEMPERATURES WILL ALSO BE PRESENT THROUGH THE AREA
TUESDAY MORNING. WIND CHILL VALUES WILL BE WELL INTO THE ADVISORY
RANGE AROUND -5 TO -10 DEGREES IN THE VALLEY...WITH VALUES LOWER
THAN -20 POSSIBLE IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WILL CONTINUE TO
MONITOR THIS THREAT AND ISSUE AN ADVISORY AS WARRANTED CLOSER TO
TIME.

OTHERWISE...HIGH PRESSURE MOVES INTO THE REGION FOR TUESDAY 
EVENING AND WEDNESDAY. SKIES WILL BEGIN TO CLEAR AND A GRADUAL 
WARMING TREND WILL BE PRESENT EACH DAY. FLOW THEN SETS UP FROM THE 
GULF...WITH AMPLE MOISTURE ADVECTION. STRATIFORM PRECIP POSSIBLE 
EACH DAY THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. MODELS DIFFER ON COVERAGE OF 
RAIN OVER THE AREA BUT TIMING OF ARRIVAL SEEMS TO BE FAIRLY 
CONSISTENT. SOUNDINGS SHOW A DEEP WARM LAYER ABOVE THE FREEZING 
TEMPERATURES AT THE SURFACE THURSDAY NIGHT. COULD SEE FREEZING 
RAIN...MAINLY ON THE PLATEAU. WOULD NEED TO SEE MORE MODEL RUNS 
BEFORE ISSUING MUCH CONFIDENCE WITH THAT PRECIP TYPE. RAIN SHOWERS 
THROUGH THE REST OF THE WEEKEND.


&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
445 AM EST SAT JAN 4 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE TO OUR EAST 
THAT IS EXTENDING INTO THE AREA WILL DRIFT OFF TO THE EAST AND 
NORTHEAST DURING THE PERIOD.  STRENGTHENING SOUTHWESTERLY LOW LEVEL 
FLOW WILL BRING SOME WARMING TODAY...WITH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
INCREASING OVER THE AREA TONIGHT.  EXPECT SOME LOW CLOUDS TO MOVE IN 
TONIGHT...BUT MOISTURE IS FORECAST TO BE QUITE SHALLOW...SO NO 
PRECIPITATION FORECAST THROUGH TONIGHT. WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM MAV 
TEMPS OVERALL...BUT WILL BUMP SOME MAINLY SOUTH AND CENTRAL SITES UP 
SLIGHTLY ON MINS TONIGHT GIVEN EXPECTED CLOUD COVER.  

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODEL SOLUTIONS ARE RELATIVELY 
CLOSE FOR DEPICTION OF EARLY WEEK CONDITIONS WITH INCREASING 
UNCERTAINTY THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY. THE ARCTIC OUTBREAK WITH RAIN 
CHANGING TO SNOW SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY STILL ON TRACK. THERE IS A 
DECENT CHANCE FOR AT LEAST LIGHT SNOWFALL ACCUMULATION ACROSS THE 
REGION SUNDAY NIGHT WITH EMPHASIS IN THE TERRAIN AROUND 2500 FEET 
AND HIGHER WHERE MODERATE SNOWFALL ACCUMULATION SHOULD DEVELOP. 
OROGRAPHIC SNOWFALL IS LIKELY TO CONTINUE MONDAY INTO TUESDAY WITH A 
STRONG NORTHWEST FLOW IN PLACE...AIDED BY 85H TEMPERATURES AROUND 15 
TO 25 DEGREES BELOW ZERO.

THE ARCTIC AIRMASS WILL NOT RELEASE ITS GRIP ON THE REGION UNTIL 
ABOUT WEDNESDAY WHEN THE EASTERN U.S. TROUGH FINALLY MOVES OFF THE 
CONTINENT. WEST TO SOUTHWEST FLOW SHOULD ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO RISE 
ABOVE FREEZING ON WEDNESDAY WITH UPPER 40 AND LOWER 50 DEGREE MAXES 
POSSIBLE BY FRIDAY.

SOME AIR MASS MODERATION WILL OCCUR THROUGH THIS PERIOD AS THE FLOW 
ALOFT BECOMES W-SW. CLEAR SKIES TONIGHT WITH CALM WINDS WILL DROP 
TEMPS INTO THE TEENS IN MOST SPOTS. CLEAR CONDITIONS SHOULD CONTINUE 
TOMORROW...WITH HIGHS IN THE 40S. SEE NO COMPELLING REASON TO 
DEVIATE FROM A BLEND OF MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS. 

A SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW STRENGTHENS SATURDAY NIGHT WITH HIGH 
PRESSURE OVER THE MID ATLANTIC REGION AND LOW PRESSURE MOVING INTO 
THE PLAINS. THE MODELS ADVECT SOME LOW LEVEL MOISTURE FROM THE SOUTH 
OVERNIGHT. IT REMAINS SHALLOW...BELOW 850 MB...SO WILL ONLY SHOW 
INCREASING CLOUDS WITH NO PRECIP.  

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...
AT THE BEGINNING OF THIS PERIOD THE NEXT SYSTEM IS STEAMING ITS WAY 
TOWARD THE AREA.  LOOKS LIKE SUNDAY MORNING WILL BE MOSTLY 
DRY...THEN THE FRONT WITH THE RAIN/WIND/SNOW WILL MOVE IN LATE IN 
THE DAY SUNDAY AND SWALLOW UP THE AREA IN COLD AIR FOR THE NEXT 
SEVERAL DAYS.  THE CHANGEOVER TO SNOW SHOULD BE PRETTY QUICK AS THE 
TEMPERATURE GRADIENT WILL BE TIGHT AND COLD AIR ADVECTION BEHIND THE 
FRONT WILL BE STRONG.

FOR MONDAY THE VERY COLD AIR MASS WILL SETTLE INTO THE AREA...WITH 
THE DENDRITIC GROWTH TEMPERATURES COMING VERY LOW IN THE TROPOSPHERE 
AND LOW LEVEL MOISTURE LOOKING TO BE ENOUGH TO GET SOME SNOW SHOWERS 
GENERATED.  LOOKS LIKE THE SLIGHTEST LIFT WILL BE ABLE TO GENERATE 
SOME LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS.  THIS ALSO WILL SET THE STAGE FOR A LONG 
DURATION UPSLOPE EVENT FOR THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS FROM SUNDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT--THE MOISTURE IS RELATIVELY 
SHALLOW...BUT WITH THE DENDRITIC GROWTH ZONE SO LOW...IT SHOULD 
ACCUMULATE STEADILY OVER THIS PERIOD.  WILL KEEP POPS IN THE 
MOUNTAINS THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING.  FOR SNOW AMOUNTS...GENERALLY 
KEEPING VALLEY LOCATIONS IN TN 1-2 INCHES...AND 1-3 IN VALLEYS IN 
VA.  CAPPING MOUNTAIN AMOUNTS AT ABOUT 8 INCHES IN THE SMOKIES FOR 
NOW.

THE OTHER ISSUE WITH THIS SYSTEM IS THE EXTREMELY COLD NATURE OF THIS 
AIR MASS.  LOOKS LIKE IT WILL BE BELOW FREEZING OVER MUCH OF THE AREA 
FROM SUNDAY NIGHT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON--60+ HOURS BELOW 
FREEZING.  

GOING WITH DRY CONDITIONS FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT.  THE CLIPPER SYSTEM THAT WILL BE RACING THROUGH THE AREA 
AROUND THURSDAY LOOKS WEAKER IN THE MODELS TODAY AS MORE ENERGY IS 
FOCUSING WEST IN THE NEXT SYSTEM OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS.  JUST 
GOING WITH CHANCE POPS FOR THIS SYSTEM FOR THURSDAY AND THURSDAY 
NIGHT.  WITH COLD SURFACE TEMPS THURSDAY MORNING...HAVING TO MENTION 
FREEZING RAIN...BUT AGAIN POPS WILL BE LIGHT.

KEEPING SOME LIGHT POPS IN FOR FRIDAY SINCE MOISTURE STILL 
HANGING AROUND.
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

007 
FXUS64 KMRX 030941
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 AM EST FRI JAN 3 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SNOW SHOWERS AND FLURRIES STILL 
AFFECTING THE AREA...BUT THESE SHOULD END FAIRLY QUICKLY TODAY AS 
LOW LEVEL FLOW WEAKENS AND TURNS MORE NORTH AND NORTHEAST.  WILL 
KEEP ADVISORIES AND WARNINGS IN PLACE THROUGH 7 AM. ALSO THE COLD 
TEMPERATURES WILL COMBINE WITH THE WIND TO PRODUCE VERY LOW WIND 
CHILL VALUES INTO THIS MORNING...SO WIND CHILL ADVISORY WILL REMAIN 
AS IS OVER PORTIONS OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN THROUGH 15Z.  WILL SEE 
CLEARING TODAY...BUT IT WILL BE QUITE COLD.  CLEAR AND COLD 
TONIGHT.  MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE SO ONLY A FEW TWEAKS.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER FLOW BECOMES 
SOUTHWESTERLY AGAIN BY SATURDAY AS A DEEPENING UPPER LEVEL TROUGH 
BEGINS TO SWING EAST INTO THE PLAINS STATES. THIS WILL CAUSE LOW 
LEVEL WINDS TO SHIFT TO A SOUTHERLY DIRECTION. THE SOUTHERLY FLOW 
AND AN ADEQUATE AMOUNT OF INSOLATION SHOULD HELP TO PULL HIGH 
TEMPERATURES BACK INTO THE 40S ON SATURDAY. THE DEEPENING UPPER 
TROUGH WITH A CLOSED 500 MB...GREAT LAKES TRAVERSING LOW WILL GRIND 
ITS WAY INTO THE EASTERN U.S. AS THE DAY WEARS ON SUNDAY WITH SLOW 
EASTWARD PROGRESSION INTO MONDAY. IN THE LOWER LEVELS OF THE STORM 
SYSTEM A DEEPENING SURFACE LOW WILL DRIVE NORTHEAST FROM THE LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ACROSS THE NORTHERN OHIO VALLEY WHILE DRAGGING 
MUCH COLDER AIR INTO THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. BY SUNDAY EVENING. RAIN 
WILL DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE FRONT ON SUNDAY BUT WILL BE CHANGING OVER 
TO SNOW OVER MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA LATER INTO THE AFTERNOON AND 
EARLY EVENING AS THE ARCTIC AIR SPILLS INTO THE REGION. THIS WILL BE 
THE BEGINNING OF A VERY COLD PERIOD WHERE HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL NOT 
RISE ABOVE FREEZING OVER THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY. MODELS APPEAR TO BE IN AGREEMENT WITH MODERATE TO STRONG 
LIFT DEVELOPING JUST BEHIND THE ARCTIC SURGE SUNDAY NIGHT. WITH THE 
STRONG LIFTING OF DEEP MOISTURE IN THE DENDRITIC GROWTH 
ZONE...ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL LOOKS LIKE A GOOD BET ACROSS THE REGION 
SUNDAY NIGHT. LOOKS LIKE ACCUMULATING SNOW WILL CONTINUE FOR A 
PERIOD ACROSS THE NORTHERN GREAT VALLEY...LOWER ELEVATIONS THROUGH 
MONDAY MORNING BUT SHOULD WRAP UP ACROSS CENTRAL EAST AND SOUTHEAST 
TENNESSEE AS THE MOIST COLUMN BECOMES MORE SHALLOW. HOWEVER HIGHER 
TERRAIN SNOWFALL APPEARS TO CONTINUE FOR A LENGTHY PERIOD ACROSS THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS INCLUDING THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...THE 
MOUNTAINS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND MOST OF THE TERRAIN ALONG 
THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER AS OROGRAPHIC LIFT CONTINUES IN THE 
SEEMINGLY NEVER ENDING NORTHWEST FLOW COMPLIMENTS OF THE DEEP 
EASTERN U.S. TROUGH. OF COURSE...SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL COULD 
ACCUMULATE IN THESE AREAS THROUGH THE 24 TO 36 HOUR PERIOD FOLLOWING 
THE ONSET OF THE "BIG CHILL". THE TROUGH GRADUALLY LIFTS OUT TUESDAY 
INTO WEDNESDAY ALLOWING THE RETURN OF SUNSHINE. HIGH TEMPERATURES 
SHOULD RISE ABOVE FREEZING FOR MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA ON 
WEDNESDAY. ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH WILL BE APPROACHING THE EASTERN U.S. 
DURING THIS TIMEFRAME AND THIS SHOULD BRING A WARMING SOUTHERLY FLOW 
TO THE REGION. THE WARMUP MAY NOT BE QUICK ENOUGH TO KEEP A MIXTURE 
OF RAIN AND SNOW IN THE FORECAST...ESPECIALLY WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS LOW 
TEMPERATURES DROP BELOW FREEZING. HOWEVER...THE PRECIP SHOULD CHANGE 
TO RAIN WITH HIGHS EXPECTED TO BE IN THE 40S ON 
THURSDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 030055
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
755 PM EST THU JAN 2 2014

.DISCUSSION...LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS CURRENTLY ONGOING FOR PORTIONS OF OUR AREA. 
HOWEVER...ADDITIONAL LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE APPROACHING OVER THE 
NEXT FEW HOURS FROM THE NORTHWEST. IR SATELLITE SHOWING MUCH COLDER CLOUD
TOPS...ROUGHLY -20C...NOW ADVANCING INTO OUR AREA OUT OF MIDDLE TN.
THIS COLDER AIR COMBINED WITH A SECONDARY SURGE OF MID AND LOW
LEVEL MOISTURE FROM THE NORTHWEST WILL LEAD TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF
THE AFOREMENTIONED SNOW SHOWERS THAT WILL SPREAD INTO OUR AREA. DECIDED
TO GO AHEAD AND UPDATE FORECAST TO BUMP UP SNOW TOTALS ACROSS THE
PLATEAU AND INCREASE POPS ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY.
WILL KEEP POPS IN FOR ALL AREAS UNTIL 08 UTC. FROM 08 UTC
ONWARD...SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE LIMITED TO NETN AND SWVA AS UPPER
TROUGH BEGINS TO LIFT OUT. ADDED MORGAN...ROANE...AND UNION TO THE
ADVISORY AFTER HAVING TALKED TO DISPATCH WHICH INFORMED US OF
ALREADY SNOW COVERED ROADS. THESE COUNTIES CAN EXPECT 1 TO 2 INCHES
OF SNOWFALL BY MORNING. ISSUED AN SPS FOR THE REST OF THE NON
ADVISORY COUNTIES...EXCLUDING HAMILTON...BRADLEY...MCMINN AND
MEIGS...TO INCLUDE SNOWFALL OF UP TO ONE INCH DUE TO APPROACHING
SNOW SHOWERS ALONG WITH BLACK ICE POTENTIAL OVERNIGHT. OTHER
FORECAST ELEMENTS LOOK TO BE ON TRACK. GUSTY WINDS CONTINUE THROUGH
THE NIGHT DUE TO TROUGH MOVING THROUGH. LOWS IN THE SINGLE DIGITS
AND TEENS DUE TO MUCH COLDER AIR BEHIND FRONT. WILL ISSUE NEW ZONES
SHORTLY.

976 
FXUS64 KMRX 022041
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
341 PM EST THU JAN 2 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
THE COLD FRONT HAS MOVED INTO THE AREA...AND A CHANGE TO SNOW IS 
BEGINNING IN THE PLATEAU COUNTIES. RADAR SHOWS THAT THE PRECIP 
BEHIND THE FRONT IS VERY LIGHT...SO INITIAL SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL 
PROBABLY BE QUITE LOW. HOWEVER THE MODELS ARE SHOWING A RESURGENCE 
OF MOISTURE COMING ACROSS THE NORTHERN PORTION OF THE AREA LATER 
TONIGHT...BETWEEN ABOUT 03Z AND 09Z...WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE 500 MB 
TROUGH AXIS. IR SATELLITE APPEARS TO SUPPORT THIS AS COLDER CLOUD 
TOP TEMPS OVER IL/IN ARE HEADED IN OUR DIRECTION. ALTHOUGH MOISTURE 
IS SHALLOW...IT WILL EXTEND ABOVE THE -10 C LEVEL NEEDED FOR 
DENDRITE GROWTH. THERE WILL BE SOME INSTABILITY FOR SNOW SHOWERS 
BENEATH THE VERY COLD MIDLEVEL THERMAL TROUGH.  UPSLOPE WINDS OF 
25-30 KTS WILL ENHANCE AMOUNTS IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. 
ACCUMULATING SNOW SHOULD END AROUND SUNRISE...WITH ONLY FLURRIES 
LINGERING INTO FRIDAY MORNING.

SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE NUDGED DOWN SLIGHTLY...WITH 1-2 INCH 
AMOUNTS IN THE ADVISORY AREAS...AND 2-5 IN THE WARNING AREAS OF THE 
TN MOUNTAINS AND WISE VA. VERY COLD AIR COMBINED WITH WINDS 15-25 
MPH WILL PRODUCE WIND CHILLS IN THE -5 TO -15 RANGE...MAINLY IN 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WILL ISSUE A WIND CHILL ADVISORY FOR THE TN 
MOUNTAINS AND WISE VA FROM 06Z TO NOON FRIDAY. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
AT THE BEGINNING OF THIS PERIOD WE ARE SQUARELY BETWEEN TWO
SYSTEMS...THE WINTER STORM FROM THURSDAY NIGHT AND THE NEXT SYSTEM
DUE IN ON SUNDAY. AFTER THE ONE ON SUNDAY...WE GO INTO THE DEEP
FREEZE FOR A COUPLE OF DAYS...THEN A QUICK CLIPPER TYPE SHORTWAVE
COMES RACING INTO THE AREA TOWARD THE END OF THE FORECAST.

THE FORECAST LOOKS DRY FOR SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT...THEN RAINS 
MOVE INTO THE AREA ON SUNDAY.  THE MOISTURE FOR THIS FRONTAL PASSAGE 
ON SUNDAY IS PRETTY PAWLTRY...SO NOT EXPECTING STORMS AHEAD OF THIS 
FRONT.  FOR THE RAIN/SNOW ON SUNDAY...IT IS THE PATTERN MUCH LIKE 
TODAY WITH COLDER AIR COMING INTO THE REGION AND CHANGING THE RAIN 
TO SNOW...WEST TO EAST.  THE ONE DIFFERENCE IS THAT THIS SNOW WILL 
LINGER AROUND LONGER--THE DENDRITIC GROWTH TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
COMING VERY LOW IN THE TROPOSPHERE WITH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE LOOKING 
TO BE ENOUGH TO GET SOME SNOW SHOWERS GENERATED.  THIS ISN'T DEEP 
ENOUGH TO GET ANY SIGNIFICANT CAPE IN THE MODELS...BUT IT LOOKS LIKE 
THE SLIGHTEST LIFT WILL BE ABLE TO GENERATE SOME LIGHT SNOW 
SHOWERS.  THIS ALSO WILL SET THE STAGE FOR A LONG DURATION UPSLOPE 
EVENT FOR THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS FROM SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY AND 
MONDAY NIGHT--NOT THE CLASSIC SETUP WITH THE MOISTURE RELATIVELY 
SHALLOW...BUT WITH THE DENTRITIC GROWTH ZONE SO LOW...IT SHOULD 
ACCUMULATE STEADILY OVER THIS PERIOD.  WILL WATCH FURTHER MODEL RUNS 
TO SEE IF THIS PATTERN HOLDS.

THEN THE CONCERN TURNS TO THE EXTRMELY COLD TEMPERATURES.  LOOKS 
LIKE IT WILL BE BELOW FREEZING OVER MUCH OF THE AREA FROM SUNDAY 
NIGHT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON--60+ HOURS BELOW FREEZING.  THE 
CLIPPER SYSTEM THAT IS DUE IN BY THE END OF THIS FORECAST WILL 
DEPEND HEAVILY ON ITS TIMING...IF IT IS FAST...THERE WILL BE A 
BETTER CHANCE OF WINTRY PRECIPITATION...SLOWER WILL MEAN RAIN OR 
POSSIBLY SOME FREEZING RAIN.  THIS SYSTEM DOES NOT LOOK OVERLY 
STRONG AT THIS POINT.


&&

1209 PM EST THU JAN 2 2014

.AVIATION...
A COLD FRONT WILL BE MOVING THROUGH THE AREA IN THE NEXT FEW HOURS.
THE EFFECT OF THIS FRONT WILL BE TO SHIFT WINDS TO THE W-NW AND
BRING WIND GUSTS OF 20-30 KTS. RAIN WILL CHANGE TO SNOW AS COLD AIR
BUILDS IN BEHIND THE FRONT. SOME LIFTING OF CEILINGS WILL ALSO
OCCUR...WITH MVFR CONDITIONS EXPECTED BEHIND THE FRONT. GUSTY
WINDS AND MVFR CEILINGS IN LIGHT SNOW ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUE
OVERNIGHT AT TRI. TYS AND CHA SHOULD RETURN TO VFR CONDITIONS
OVERNIGHT...WITH TRI SEEING VFR CLOSER TO SUNRISE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED

945 AM EST THU JAN 2 2014

.DISCUSSION...
TEMPERATURES HAVE BEEN SLOWLY WARMING IN NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE
AREA THIS MORNING...WITH THE THREAT OF ICING DIMINISHING. WILL
ALLOW THE FZRA ADVISORY TO EXPIRE AT 10 AM. 

THE REST OF THE ADVISORY/WARNING AREA FOR SNOW APPEARS TO BE ON
TRACK...WITH NO COMPELLING EVIDENCE TO MAKE ANY SIGNIFICANT
CHANGES. SMALL TWEAKS WILL BE MADE TO TEMPERATURES TO ALIGN BETTER
WITH CURRENT OBS. TIMING OF THE TRANSITION TO SNOW LOOKS TO BE
AROUND 18Z FOR THE PLATEAU COUNTIES AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS...AND
AROUND 20Z FOR THE VALLEY AREAS FROM TRI-CITIES TO KNOXVILLE. THE
WINDOW FOR SYNOPTIC LIFT AND TEMPS COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW IS VERY
SMALL...BUST A FEW HOURS. THIS WILL LIMIT VALLEY ACCUMULATIONS.
STILL LOOKING AT 1-2 INCHES FOR THE TN COUNTIES ALONG THE KY/VA
BORDER...AND 1-3 IN LOWER ELEVATIONS OF SW VA. THE SYNOPTIC LIFT
MOVES OUT BY 00Z...AND WE TRANSITION TO A NW FLOW SNOW
EVENT...WHICH WILL ADD ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS IN HIGHER
ELEVATIONS. 2 TO 6 INCHES LOOKS TO BE REASONABLE FOR WISE COUNTY
AND THE TN MOUNTAINS.

.AVIATION...AT ALL TAF SITES...FLIGHT CONDTITIONS WILL BECOME IFR

BETWEEN 19-21Z...WINDS WILL BECOME 270-300 DEGREES AND SPEEDS WILL 
INCREASE TO 14-17 KTS WITH GUSTS TO 25 KTS.

IMPROVE TO MVFR BY EVENING. RAIN WILL CHANGE TO SNOW...WITH PERIODS 
OF SNOW EXPECTED AT TRI AND TYS DURING MOST OF THE NIGHT. STRONG 
WEST TO NORTHWEST WINDS WILL CONTINUE OVERNIGHT AT ALL TAF SITES 
WITH SPEEDS BETWEEN 15-18KTS SUSTAINED AND GUSTS TO 26KTS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
537 AM EST THU JAN 2 2014

.DISCUSSION...UPDATED FORECAST TO INCLUDED A FREEZING RAIN ADVISORY
UNTIL 15Z FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE.
TEMPERATURES ACROSS THESE AREAS RANGE FROM THE MIDDLE AND UPPER 20S
ACROSS THE SHELTERED VALLEYS TO THE MIDDLE 30S OVER THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS. EVEN THOUGH SOUTHERLY WINDS JUST OFF THE SURFACE ARE
PULLING WARMER AIR INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...BELOW FREEZING
TEMPERATURES REMAIN TRAPPED IN THE SHELTERED VALLEYS. 

RADAR SHOWS A GOOD DEAL OF RAIN MOVING INTO THESE AREAS WITH
REPORTS OF ICING ALREADY ACROSS LEE COUNTY...VIRGINIA. LATEST MODEL
FORECAST SHOWS TEMPERATURES AT OR BELOW FREEZING REMAINING UNTIL
15Z. ICE ACCUMULATIONS GENERALLY LESS THAN ONE-TENTH INCH IS
EXPECTED.

297 
FXUS64 KMRX 020908
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
408 AM EST THU JAN 2 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A FAST MOVING SHORT-WAVE WILL
MOVE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TODAY.
PLENTY OF SUB-TROPICAL MOISTURE CONTINUES TO STREAM ACROSS THE
SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES. SOME OF THIS MOISTURE KMRXWSWMRXIS BEING PULLED
NORTH INTO THE WAVE AS THE TWO SYSTEM BEGIN TO PHASE TOGETHER. A
STRONG ARCTIC COLD FRONT...CURRENTLY NEXT THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER...WILL
MOVE QUICKLY EAST INTO THE AREA BY THIS AFTERNOON. TWO JETS...ONE
WITH THE UPPER TROUGH AND ANOTHER OVER THE OHIO VALLEY WILL PLACE
THE REGION UNDER MODERATELY STRONG UPPER DIVERGENCE. THE
AGEOSTROPHIC VERTICAL CIRCULATION AROUND THE JET WILL HELP ENHANCE
THE FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING TODAY. THIS FORCING ALONG WITH
ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL CONTINUE TO PRODUCE A BAND OF RAIN...CURRENTLY
OVER MIDDLE TENNESSEE/PLATEAU...OVER THE AREA TODAY.

SOME OF THE RAIN MAY BEGIN AS A BRIEF PERIOD OF LIGHT FREEZING RAIN
OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. THE PERIOD OF FREEZING
RAIN WILL BE BRIEF GIVEN THE STRONG BOUNDARY LAYER WARMING...SO
WILL NOT ISSUE AN ADVISORY.

FOR THIS AFTERNOON...STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION DEVELOPS WITH
TEMPERATURES QUICKLY FALLING INTO THE LOWER 30S BY LATE IN THE DAY.
RAIN WILL CHANGE TO SNOW/SNOW SHOWERS THIS AFTERNOON AND CONTINUE
INTO THE NIGHT...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. HAVE
CONTINUED WARNING/ADVISORIES...HOWEVER...DID EXPAND ADVISORY INTO
THE TRI-CITIES FOR THIS EVENING AND NIGHT.

FOR THE CENTRAL VALLEY...ENOUGH SNOW POSSIBLE TO PRODUCE BETWEEN
ONE-HALF OF AN INCH TO POSSIBLY 1 INCH (HIGHER RIDGES) THIS EVENING/EARLY
TONIGHT.

BESIDES THE SNOW...MUCH COLD TEMPERATURES WITH BRISK NORTHWEST
WINDS BETWEEN 15 AND 30 MPH WILL PRODUCE WIND CHILLS NEAR -5
DEGREES BELOW ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WITH SINGLE DIGITS IN
THE VALLEY.

FOR FRIDAY...CLOUDS DISSIPATE WITH RETURN OF SUNSHINE. HOWEVER...
TEMPERATURES WILL BE UNSEASONABLY COLD.
 
.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS REMAIN IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL A VERY COLD PATTERN WITH A CHANCE FOR 
SNOW ON SUNDAY NIGHT. AFTER A COLD START ON FRIDAY NIGHT...A RAPID 
WARM-UP IS EXPECTED ON SATURDAY AS SOUTHERLY WINDS DEVELOP OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. A LARGE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS PROGGED TO AMPLIFY OVER 
THE CENTRAL PART OF THE NATION THIS WEEKEND...WHICH WILL HELP TO 
TRIGGER CYCLOGENESIS ALONG A FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE TN AND OHIO 
RIVER VALLEYS ON SUNDAY. THE RESULTING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL 
INITIALLY BRING RAIN OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY AFTERNOON... 
BUT THIS RAIN WILL QUICKLY CHANGE TO SNOW SUNDAY NIGHT AS ANOTHER 
COLD ARCTIC AIR MASS PLUNGES INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY. RIGHT NOW... 
IT APPEARS THAT LIGHT SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE POSSIBLE SUNDAY 
NIGHT...MAINLY ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. A VERY COLD AIR MASS 
WILL THEN SETTLE OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...WITH 
TEMPS EXPECTED TO BE AROUND 20 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF 
YEAR ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE 
ENSEMBLE MEANS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
722 PM EST WED JAN 1 2014

.AVIATION...
NOT MUCH CHANGE FROM THE PREVIOUS ISSUANCE. FLIGHT CONDITIONS WILL 
BE BEST FOR THE FIRST SEVERAL HOURS OF THE TAF PERIOD AND THEN START 
TO DETERIORATE BEGINNING AROUND 06 UTC AT CHA AND 09 UTC AT TRI. AN 
APPROACHING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL BRING INCREASING 
CLOUDS...FOLLOWED BY RAIN TOWARD SUNRISE. CEILINGS ARE EXPECTED TO 
DROP INTO THE MVFR RANGE BETWEEN 09Z AND 12Z AT CHA AND TYS AS RAIN 
SPREADS IN FROM THE SW. IFR CONDITIONS CAN BE EXPECTED IN THE 
MORNING WITH HEAVIER PRECIP. RAIN WILL CHANGE OVER TO SNOW TOMORROW 
AFTERNOON AS A COLD FRONT MOVES IN...WHICH SHOULD ALSO HELP RAISE 
CIGS A BIT AND SHIFT WINDS TO THE WEST. CONDITIONS WILL BEGIN TO SLOWLY 
IMPROVE LATE TOMORROW AFTERNOON AND INTO THE EVENING FROM SW TO NE.

419 
FXUS64 KMRX 011947
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
247 PM EST WED JAN 1 2014

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
SUBTROPICAL MOISTURE WILL FEED INTO THE SOUTHEAST REGION TONIGHT.
MEANWHILE A NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH DIGGING SOUTHEAST OVER THE
PLAINS WILL SUPPLY COLD AIR TO THE REGION BEGINNING THURSDAY
AFTERNOON. MODELS ARE SHOWING A DISCONNECT BETWEEN THESE TWO
FEATURES...WHICH SHOULD MEAN LIGHTER LIQUID PRECIP AT THE ONSET
THURSDAY MORNING...AND LIMIT SNOW AMOUNTS OUTSIDE OF HIGHER
ELEVATIONS. 

LOW LEVEL ISENTROPIC LIFT FROM THE SOUTH WILL BRING LIGHT RAIN
AROUND SUNRISE. WARM ADVECTION THROUGH THE DAY WILL KEEP THE PRECIP
AS RAIN. A CHANGE TO SNOW WILL COMMENCE IN THE 18-21Z TIME FRAME AS
A COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE PLATEAU. SYNOPTIC FORCING WILL BE
ASSOCIATED WITH 850-700 MB CONVERGENCE WITH THE FRONT/TROUGH
PASSAGE. HOWEVER THE DEEP SUBTROPICAL MOISTURE PLUME WILL BE
EXITING WHILE THE COLD AIR BUILDS IN...WHICH WILL BE A LIMITING
FACTOR FOR SNOW AMOUNTS IN THE VALLEY DURING THE PERIOD OF SYNOPTIC
LIFT. A DUSTING TO 2 INCHES OF SNOW ARE EXPECTED DURING THE
SYNOPTIC PORTION OF THE EVENT IN THE NORTHERN 2/3 OF THE AREA.

THURSDAY EVENING WILL BE A TRANSITION INTO A NW FLOW
PATTERN...WHICH CONTINUE THROUGH MOST OF THE NIGHT. THIS WILL
BRING ADDITIONAL SNOW ACCUMULATIONS TO THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF SW VA
AND NE TN. THIS IS EXPECTED TO ADD 2-5 INCHES TO SNOW TOTALS ABOVE
2500 FT ELEVATION. WITH THESE AMOUNTS...WILL HAVE A WINTER STORM
WARNING FOR THE TN MOUNTAINS AND WISE COUNTY VA. A WINTER WEATHER
ADVISORY WILL BE IN EFFECT FOR THE REST OF SW VA...AND THE TN
COUNTIES THAT BORDER KY.

WIND CHILL VALUES WILL BE IN THE -5 TO -10 RANGE LATE THURSDAY
NIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING...WITH WINDS NEARING ADVISORY CRITERIA.
ADDITIONAL STATEMENTS MAY BE NEEDED LATER TO ADDRESS THIS...BUT FOR
NOW WILL MENTION AS PART OF THE WSW PRODUCT.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
IMPROVED WEATHER GREETS US ON FRIDAY NOW THAT THE THURSDAY SYSTEM
HAS DEPARTED. BUT THE FAIR WEATHER ONLY LASTS THROUGH SATURDAY...AS
ANOTHER SYSTEM QUITE SIMILAR TO THE THURSDAY SYSTEM COMES INTO THE
AREA...PROBABLY SEEING PRECIP ONSET DURING SUNDAY MAINLY AS
LIQUID...PEAKING SUNDAY NIGHT AND ENDING DURING THE DAY
MONDAY...TRANSITIONING OVER TO A MARGINAL SNOW PROBABLY AFTER
MIDNIGHT SUNDAY NIGHT BEFORE ENDING MONDAY. WITH ITS DEPARTURE WE
WILL RESUME FAIR WEATHER FOR MOST OF THE UPCOMING WORK WEEK.
LOOKING WAY AHEAD...PRECIP MAY RETURN NEXT WEEKEND THE 11TH...IF
YOU LIKE OUR STRING OF DREARY WEEKENDS.

THE OTHER SIGNIFICANT WEATHER ASPECTS DURING THE EXTENDED FORECAST 
WILL BE VERY COLD TEMPERATURES THIS FRI MORN THROUGH SAT MORN WITH 
VALLEY LOWS IN THE MID TEENS...AND HIGHS FRI OF 30 OR SO. AFTER 
THIS WEEKEND/S WEATHER SYSTEM...ANOTHER SHOT OF VERY COLD AIR COMES 
IN FOR MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY WITH VALLEY HIGHS MON/TUES AGAIN 
ONLY NEAR 30 OR SO...AND LOWS TUES/WED MORNS IN THE MID TEENS
AGAIN.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             37  45  21  34  20 /  60  70  10   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  35  43  20  30  17 /  30  90  30   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       33  43  19  31  17 /  30  90  40   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              29  43  19  26  12 /  10  90  70   0   0

826 
FXUS64 KMRX 011604 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1104 AM EST WED JAN 1 2014

.DISCUSSION...
SOME SMALL CHANGES TO CLOUD COVER AND TEMPERATUERS WILL BE MADE
WITH THE MORNING UPDATE. CIRRUS CLOUDS OVER THE AREA THIS MORNING
WILL BE EXITING IN THE EARLY AFTERNOON..LEAVING MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES.
TEMPS WILL BE GENERALLY NUDGED DOWNWARD TO BETTER MATCH CURRENT
OBSERVATIONS. 

AS FOR THE WSW...NO CHANGES ARE NEEDED. ALL APPEARS ON TRACK FOR A
CHANGE FROM RAIN TO SNOW THURDAY AFTERNOON WTIH A PERIOD OF UPSLOPE
SNOW IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS THURSDAY NIGHT.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

     COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
624 AM EST WED JAN 1 2014

.AVIATION...MVFR CONDITIONS DUE TO FOG IS EXPECTED AT CHA THROUGH 
13Z. ALSO...SCATTERED STRATUS AROUND 600 FEET. OTHERWISE...VFR CONDITIONS
WILL BE THE RULE TODAY THROUGH AROUND 06Z TONIGHT. A SHORT-WAVE OVER 
THE CENTRAL-SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL MOVE TOWARD THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE 
VALLEYS FOR THURSDAY. INCREASING SOUTHERLY WINDS AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM
WILL ADVECT MOISTURE BACK INTO EAST TENNESSEE. MVFR CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED
AT CHA BY 06Z...THEN DETEORATE TO NEAR IFR CONDITIONS BY 12Z. 
CONDITIONS AT TYS AND TRI WILL REMAIN VFR.

341 
FXUS64 KMRX 010840
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EST WED JAN 1 2014

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...AN INTERESTING SHORT-TERM
FORECAST WITH ABUNDANT SUB-TROPICAL MOISTURE OVER THE LOWER GULF
COAST STATES AND A NORTHERN STREAM SHORT-WAVE MOVING FROM THE
CENTRAL/SOUTHERN PLAINS INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN
APPALACHAINS FOR THURSDAY. FAIRLY STRONG JETS...ONE OVER THE OHIO
VALLEY AND ANOTHER ASSOCIATED WITH THE SHORT-WAVE TROUGH WILL
INDUCE CYCLO-GENESIS OVER THE WESTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY. THE LOW
WILL RACE NORTHEAST INTO THE EASTERN OHIO VALLEY FOR THURSDAY
PULLING A STRONG COLD FRONT ACROSS THE REGION.

FAIRLY STRONG FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING WILL MOVE ACROSS THE REGION
THURSDAY PRODUCING WIDESPREAD RAIN THURSDAY MORNING. AS FRONT MOVES
ACROSS THE AREA...RAIN WILL CHANGE TO SNOW. FOR THURSDAY
NIGHT...OROGRAPHIC NORTHWEST FLOW WILL CONTINUE SNOW SHOWERS OVERNIGHT.
SIGNIFICANT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE FOR THE NORTHWEST FACING
SLOPES LATE THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT FOR THE FAR EASTERN
TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...SUCH AS
HIGH KNOB. HAVE ISSUED A WINTER STORM WATCH THERE FROM 21Z THURSDAY
TO 12Z FRIDAY. LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ARE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE PLATEAU...
LOWER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...CENTRAL/NORTHERN TENNESSEE
VALLEY AND CHEROKEE AND CLAY COUNTIES OF NORTH CAROLINA.

BESIDES THE SNOW...COLD ARCTIC AIR WILL SPILL INTO THE REGION FOR
LATE THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT. HAVE USED AN A-TYPICAL HOURLY
TEMPERATURE CURVE FOR TONIGHT AND THURSDAY. LOWS TONIGHT WILL
LIKELY BE EARLY...THEN TEMPERATURES EITHER BECOME STEADY OR SLOWLY
RISE AFTER MIDNIGHT. FOR THURSDAY...HIGHS WILL BE EITHER LATE
MORNING OR EARLY AFTERNOON...THEN FALLING.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND 
GENERALLY REVEAL AN UNSEASONABLY COLD PATTERN WITH A CHANCE FOR 
WINTRY PRECIP ON SUNDAY NIGHT. A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE WITH AN 
UNSEASONABLY COLD ARCTIC AIR MASS WILL SETTLE OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
ON FRIDAY...WITH A RAPID WARM-UP EXPECTED ON ITS BACK SIDE ON 
SATURDAY. A LARGE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS PROGGED TO AMPLIFY OVER THE 
CENTRAL PART OF THE NATION THIS WEEKEND...WHICH WILL HELP TO TRIGGER 
CYCLOGENESIS ALONG A FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE TN AND OHIO RIVER 
VALLEYS ON SUNDAY. THE RESULTING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL INITIALLY 
BRING MOSTLY RAIN OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY...BUT THIS RAIN 
WILL QUICKLY CHANGE TO SNOW BY SUNDAY NIGHT AS ANOTHER COLD ARCTIC 
AIR MASS PLUNGES INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY. RIGHT NOW...IT APPEARS 
THAT LIGHT SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE POSSIBLE SUNDAY NIGHT... 
MAINLY ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE 
TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH 
ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             51  39  47  20  31 /   0  50  90  10   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  49  35  46  20  29 /   0  20  80  60   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       50  34  44  19  29 /   0  30  80  50   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              49  28  47  19  25 /   0  10  90  70   0 

&&

     MORNING FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
